collins.tran: （指初次提及或非特指的人或物）一（个）
collins.def: You use a or an when you are referring to someone or something for the first time or when people may not know which particular person or thing you are talking about.

example.ex: A waiter entered with a tray...
example.tran: 侍者端着托盘进来了。

example.ex: He started eating an apple...
example.tran: 他开始吃苹果。

collins.tran: （一类人或事物中非特指的）任何一（个）
collins.def: You use a or an when you are referring to any person or thing of a particular type and do not want to be specific.

example.ex: ...expensive make-up that we saw being advertised by a beautiful model...
example.tran: 我们所见的由一位漂亮模特代言的昂贵化妆品

example.ex: I suggest you leave it to an expert...
example.tran: 我建议你把它留给专家来解决。

collins.tran: （用于前加形容词或后加修饰语的不可数名词之前）一（种）
collins.def: You use a or an in front of an uncount noun when that noun follows an adjective, or when the noun is followed by words that describe it more fully.

example.ex: There was a terrible sadness in her eyes...
example.tran: 她眼神中流露出深深的悲伤。

example.ex: He did have a real knowledge of the country...
example.tran: 他对该国的确知之甚多。

collins.def: You use a or an in front of a mass noun when you want to refer to a single type or make of something.

example.ex: Bollinger 'RD' is a rare, highly prized wine.
example.tran: 博林格RD香槟是一种名贵的备受推崇的葡萄酒。

collins.tran: （用于表示数量的词组中）许多/少许/一点
collins.def: You use a in quantifiers such as a lot ,a little, and a bit.

example.ex: I spend a lot on expensive jewelry and clothing...
example.tran: 我花很多钱购买昂贵的首饰和衣服。

example.ex: I've come looking for a bit of advice.
example.tran: 我特来讨教。

collins.tran: （一类人或事物中典型的）一（个）
collins.def: You use a or an to refer to someone or something as a typical member of a group, class, or type.

example.ex: Some parents believe a boy must learn to stand up and fight like a man.
example.tran: 有些父母认为男孩子必须学会像男子汉一样顶天立地，勇于抗争。

example.ex: ...the operation a patient has had.
example.tran: 病人做过的手术

collins.tran: （用于日子、月份或节日的名称之前以表示特例）一个
collins.def: You use a or an in front of the names of days, months, or festivals when you are referring to one particular instance of that day, month, or festival.

example.ex: The interview took place on a Friday afternoon...
example.tran: 采访是在一个星期五的下午进行的。

example.ex: It was a Christmas when shoppers passed by expensive silks in favor of more practical gifts.
example.tran: 这是一个购物者不理会昂贵的丝绸衣服而热衷于更实用礼物的圣诞节。

collins.def: You use a or an when you are saying what someone is or what job they have.

example.ex: I explained that I was an artist...
example.tran: 我解释说自己是个艺术家。

example.ex: He was now a teacher and a respectable member of the community.
example.tran: 他现在是一位教师，并且是社区内受人尊敬的一员。

collins.tran: （用于不为说话人所知的首次提到的人名前）某一（个）
collins.def: You use a or an in front of the names of people as a way of indicating that you do not know them or anything about them and you are saying their name for the first time.

example.ex: The full address on a stick-on label was that of a Mrs P. R. Slater of Peterborough...
example.tran: 不干胶标签上的完整地址写的是彼得伯勒的一位P. R. 斯莱特太太。

example.ex: A Dr Matthew Owens was reported missing while on an expedition to north-eastern Turkey.
example.tran: 据报道，一位叫马修·欧文斯的博士在前往土耳其东北部考察的途中失踪了。

collins.tran: （用于人名前，表示与该人有相同特性或品质）类似…的一个（或一位）
collins.def: You use a or an in front of the names of people when you want to refer to someone else who has the same qualities or character as the person named.

example.ex: When I listen to her play I can hear a new Nigel Kennedy.
example.tran: 从她的演奏中我听出了新一代的奈杰尔·肯尼迪。

collins.tran: （用于姓氏前，表示某人属于某姓氏家族）一位姓…的人
collins.def: You use a or an in front of a surname when you want to refer to someone who belongs to the family with that surname.

example.ex: As far as I can recall, Patti was a Smith.
example.tran: 我记得帕蒂是姓史密斯的。

collins.tran: （用于艺术家名字前）一幅…的画，一件…的雕塑作品
collins.def: You use a or an in front of the names of artists to refer to one individual painting or sculpture created by them.

example.ex: Most people have very little difficulty in seeing why a Van Gogh is a work of genius.
example.tran: 多数人不难理解为什么凡·高的作品是天才之作。

collins.tran: （代替数字one使用，尤用于hundred，hour和metre等表示度量的单词之前以及half, quarter和third等分数之前）
collins.def: You use a or an instead of the number 'one', especially with words of measurement such as 'hundred', 'hour', and 'metre', and with fractions such as 'half', 'quarter', and 'third'.

example.ex: ...more than a thousand acres of land.
example.tran: 1,000多英亩地

example.ex: ...a quarter of an hour...
example.tran: 一刻钟

collins.tran: （用于表示比率的短语中）每一
collins.def: You use a or an in expressions such as eight hours a day to express a rate or ratio.

example.ex: Prices start at £13.95 a metre for printed cotton...
example.tran: 印花棉布以每米13.95英镑的价格起售。

example.ex: The helicopter can zip along at about 150 kilometres an hour.
example.tran: 该直升机能以每小时150公里左右的速度疾进。

collins.tran: （因具有品质或技能）能做到…的
collins.def: If you are able to do something, you have skills or qualities which make it possible for you to do it.

example.ex: The older child should be able to prepare a simple meal...
example.tran: 那个年纪稍大的孩子应当会做一顿简单的饭菜。

example.ex: The company say they're able to keep pricing competitive...
example.tran: 该公司说他们能够使定价保持竞争力。

collins.tran: （因有足够的自由、权力、时间、财力等而）可以…的，能够…的
collins.def: If you are able to do something, you have enough freedom, power, time, or money to do it.

example.ex: You'll be able to read in peace...
example.tran: 你就能安心地读书了。

example.ex: Have you been able to have any kind of contact?...
example.tran: 你联系上了吗？

collins.tran: 聪明能干的；能力出众的
collins.def: Someone who is able is very clever or very good at doing something.

example.ex: ...one of the brightest and ablest members of the government...
example.tran: 政府里最聪明能干的成员之一

example.ex: They are bright, intelligent, able and confident.
example.tran: 他们聪明又智慧，能干又自信。

collins.def: You use about to introduce who or what something relates to or concerns.

example.ex: She came in for a coffee, and told me about her friend Shona...
example.tran: 她进来喝了杯咖啡，并向我谈起了她的朋友肖纳。

example.ex: She knew a lot about food...
example.tran: 她对食物很在行。

collins.def: When you mention the things that an activity or institution is about, you are saying what it involves or what its aims are.

example.ex: Leadership is about the ability to implement change.
example.tran: 领导才能就是要有实施变革的能力。

collins.def: You use about after some adjectives to indicate the person or thing that a feeling or state of mind relates to.

example.ex: 'I'm sorry about Patrick,' she said...
example.tran: “我为帕特里克感到难过，”她说。

example.ex: I feel so guilty and angry about the whole issue.
example.tran: 我对整件事深感内疚和气愤。

collins.def: If you do something about a problem, you take action in order to solve it.

example.ex: Rachel was going to do something about Jacob...
example.tran: 蕾切尔将对雅各布有所行动。

example.ex: He said he'd ask Nina for a divorce, but he never did anything about it.
example.tran: 他说会跟尼娜提出离婚，可是他却从未付诸实际。

collins.tran: （某人或某事物）具有（某种特性）
collins.def: When you say that there is a particular quality about someone or something, you mean that they have this quality.

example.ex: There was a warmth and passion about him I never knew existed...
example.tran: 他身上有一股我从不知道的热情和激情。

example.ex: I think there's something a little peculiar about the results of your test.
example.tran: 我认为你的化验结果有点不对劲。

collins.def: About is used in front of a number to show that the number is not exact.

example.ex: In my local health centre there's about forty parking spaces...
example.tran: 我们本地的保健中心约有40个停车位。

example.ex: The rate of inflation is running at about 2.7 percent.
example.tran: 通货膨胀率大约为2.7%。

collins.def: If someone or something moves about, they keep moving in different directions.

example.ex: Everyone was running about.
example.tran: 大家都在跑来跑去。

collins.def: If you put something about a person or thing, you put it around them.

example.ex: Helen threw her arms about him...
example.tran: 海伦张开双臂拥抱他。

example.ex: She was elegantly dressed with a double strand of pearls about her neck.
example.tran: 她着装典雅，搭配着一条双层珍珠项链。

collins.tran: 在手头的;现成的;能得到的
collins.def: If someone or something is about, they are present or available.

example.ex: There's lots of money about these days for schemes like this.
example.tran: 近来这类计划资金充足。

collins.def: If you are about to do something, you are going to do it very soon. If something is about to happen, it will happen very soon.

example.ex: I think he's about to leave...
example.tran: 我看他要走了。

example.ex: Argentina has lifted all restrictions on trade and visas are about to be abolished...
example.tran: 阿根廷已经取消所有贸易限制，签证制也将废止。

collins.tran: （尤指一段时间无法自由行动后）四处走动，外出活动
collins.def: If someone is out and about, they are going out and doing things, especially after they have been unable to for a while.

example.ex: Despite considerable pain she has been getting out and about almost as normal...
example.tran: 尽管还很痛，她已经基本上行动如常。

example.ex: The regulations were relaxed and the prisoners could get out and about a bit.
example.tran: 规定有所放宽，犯人可以出去短暂放风。

collins.def: If someone is out and about, they are going to a lot of different places, often as part of their job.

example.ex: They often saw me out and about.
example.tran: 他们经常看见我四处奔波。

collins.def: If you accept something that you have been offered, you say yes to it or agree to take it.

example.ex: Eventually Sam persuaded her to accept an offer of marriage...
example.tran: 最终萨姆说服她接受了求婚。

example.ex: Your old clothes will be gratefully accepted by jumble sale organisers...
example.tran: 旧货义卖的组织者会感激地领受您捐赠的旧衣物。

collins.tran: 相信（观点、陈述、事实等）；认为…正确
collins.def: If you accept an idea, statement, or fact, you believe that it is true or valid.

example.ex: I do not accept that there is any kind of crisis in British science...
example.tran: 我不相信英国科学界有什么危机。

example.ex: I don't think they would accept that view...
example.tran: 我认为他们不会接受那种观点。

collins.def: If you accept a plan or an intended action, you agree to it and allow it to happen.

example.ex: ...Britain's reluctance to accept a proposal for a single European currency...
example.tran: 英国不愿接受单一欧洲货币的建议

example.ex: The Council will meet to decide if it should accept his resignation.
example.tran: 委员会将召开会议决定是否接受他的辞呈。

collins.def: If you accept an unpleasant fact or situation, you get used to it or recognize that it is necessary or cannot be changed.

example.ex: People will accept suffering that can be shown to lead to a greater good...
example.tran: 如果能证明眼前的苦难会带来更大的好处，人们就会愿意承受。

example.ex: Urban dwellers often accept noise as part of city life...
example.tran: 城市居民常将噪音当成城市生活的一部分。

collins.tran: 承兑，认付（单据等）；认可(文件等)
collins.def: If a person, company, or organization accepts something such as a document, they recognize that it is genuine, correct, or satisfactory and agree to consider it or handle it.

example.ex: We advised newspapers not to accept the advertising...
example.tran: 我们建议报社不要承接这项广告。

example.ex: Cheques can only be accepted up to the value guaranteed on the card...
example.tran: 支票的承兑金额不可高于卡上所担保的数额。

collins.tran: 招收，接纳（求职者、会员等)
collins.def: If an organization or person accepts you, you are allowed to join the organization or use the services that are offered.

example.ex: All-male groups will not be accepted.
example.tran: 清一色的男性团体将不被接纳。

example.ex: ...incentives to private landlords to accept young people as tenants.
example.tran: 鼓励私人房东租房给年轻人的措施

collins.def: If a person or a group of people accepts you, they begin to be friendly towards you and are happy with who you are or what you do.

example.ex: My grandparents have never had a problem accepting me...
example.tran: 我的祖父母从来都是无条件地接受我。

example.ex: Many men still have difficulty accepting a woman as a business partner...
example.tran: 许多男性仍然无法接受女性商业伙伴。

collins.def: If you accept the responsibility or blame for something, you recognize that you are responsible for it.

example.ex: The company cannot accept responsibility for loss or damage.
example.tran: 公司不承担丢失或损坏的责任。

collins.def: If you accept someone's advice or suggestion, you agree to do what they say.

example.ex: The army refused to accept orders from the political leadership...
example.tran: 军队拒绝接受政界领导层下达的命令。

example.ex: Don't automatically accept the solicitor recommended by the broker.
example.tran: 别想当然地就接受中间人推荐的诉状律师。

collins.tran: 接受并使（移植器官）发挥正常功能;不排斥
collins.def: If someone's body accepts a transplanted organ, the organ becomes part of the body and starts to function normally.

example.ex: ...drugs which will fool the body into accepting transplants.
example.tran: 能使身体顺利接受移植器官的药物

collins.def: If a machine accepts a particular kind of thing, it is designed to take it and deal with it or process it.

example.ex: The telephone booths accept 10 and 20 pence coins.
example.tran: 电话亭可使用10便士和20便士的硬币。

collins.tran: （国家、团体之间的正式）协定，协议，条约
collins.def: An accord between countries or groups of people is a formal agreement, for example to end a war.

example.ex: ...a fitting way to celebrate the peace accord.
example.tran: 庆祝和平协定的恰当的方式

collins.def: If you are accorded a particular kind of treatment, people act towards you or treat you in that way.

example.ex: His predecessor was accorded an equally tumultuous welcome...
example.tran: 他的前任受到了同样热烈的欢迎。

example.ex: The government accorded him the rank of Colonel...
example.tran: 政府授予他上校军衔。

collins.def: If one fact, idea, or condition accords with another, they are in agreement and there is no conflict between them.

example.ex: Such an approach accords with the principles of socialist ideology.
example.tran: 这种方法与社会主义意识形态的原则相符。

example.ex: ...scientific evidence that did not fully accord with the facts uncovered by the police.
example.tran: 与警方所掌握的情况不完全一致的科学证据

collins.def: If one person, action, or fact is in accord with another, they are in agreement and there is no conflict between them. You can also say that two people or things are in accord.

example.ex: ...this military action, taken in accord with United Nations resolutions...
example.tran: 依据联合国决议而采取的本次军事行动

example.ex: Old enemies can become new friends even if all their national interests are not in complete accord.
example.tran: 即使国家利益不尽相同，他们也可以化敌为友。

collins.def: If something happens of its own accord, it seems to happen by itself, without anyone making it happen.

example.ex: In many cases the disease will clear up of its own accord.
example.tran: 这种病很多情况下会自愈。

collins.def: If you do something of your own accord, you do it because you want to, without being asked or forced.

example.ex: He did not quit as France's prime minister of his own accord.
example.tran: 他辞去法国总理职务并非出于自愿。

collins.def: If a number of people do something with one accord, they do it together or at the same time, because they agree about what should be done.

example.ex: With one accord they turned and walked back over the grass.
example.tran: 他们步调一致地转身走过草坪。

collins.def: If someone says that something is true according to a particular person, book, or other source of information, they are indicating where they got their information.

example.ex: Philip stayed at the hotel, according to Mr Hemming...
example.tran: 据亨明先生所说，菲利普住在旅馆里。

example.ex: He and his father, according to local gossip, haven't been in touch for years.
example.tran: 当地风传，他和父亲已多年未联系了。

collins.def: If something is done according to a particular set of principles, these principles are used as a basis for the way it is done.

example.ex: They both played the game according to the rules...
example.tran: 他们俩都依章行事。

example.ex: They must take their own decision according to their own legal advice.
example.tran: 他们必须根据各自律师的意见自行决定。

collins.def: If something varies according to a changing factor, it varies in a way that is determined by this factor.

example.ex: Prices vary according to the quantity ordered...
example.tran: 价格随订购数量不同而有所变化。

example.ex: The route that the boatmen choose varies according to the water level.
example.tran: 船夫选择的路线会随水位的变化而有所不同。

collins.tran: 按照计划；如同料想的那样
collins.def: If something happens according to plan, it happens in exactly the way that it was intended to happen.

example.ex: If all goes according to plan, the first concert will be Tuesday evening.
example.tran: 如果一切都按计划进行的话，第一场音乐会将在星期二晚上举行。

collins.def: If you have an account with a bank or a similar organization, you have an arrangement to leave your money there and take some out when you need it.

example.ex: Some banks make it difficult to open an account...
example.tran: 一些银行把开户弄得很麻烦。

example.ex: I had two accounts with Natwest, a savings account and a current account.
example.tran: 我在国民威斯敏斯特银行有两个账户，一个储蓄账户和一个活期存款账户。

collins.tran: 固定客户，老主顾（尤指公司）
collins.def: In business, a regular customer of a company can be referred to as an account, especially when the customer is another company.

example.ex: Biggart Donald, the Glasgow-based marketing agency, has won two Edinburgh accounts.
example.tran: 比加特·唐纳德，这家驻格拉斯哥的营销代理公司已赢得了两个爱丁堡的客户。

collins.def: Accounts are detailed records of all the money that a person or business receives and spends.

example.ex: He kept detailed accounts.
example.tran: 他记明细账。

example.ex: ...an account book.
example.tran: 账本

collins.tran: （书面或口头的）记述，描述，陈述，报告
collins.def: An account is a written or spoken report of something that has happened.

example.ex: He gave a detailed account of what happened on the fateful night...
example.tran: 他详细描述了那个灾难性夜晚所发生的事。

example.ex: According to police accounts, Mr and Mrs Hunt were found dead on the floor of their kitchen.
example.tran: 据警方称，亨特夫妇被发现死在家里厨房的地板上。

collins.def: An account of something is a theory which is intended to explain or describe it.

example.ex: This basic utilitarian model gives a relatively unsophisticated account of human behaviour...
example.tran: 这个实用的基础模型较为简略地解释了人类的行为。

example.ex: Science, on Weber's account, is an essentially value-free activity.
example.tran: 按照韦伯的说法，科学在本质上是一种价值无涉的活动。

collins.def: If you say that something is accounted a particular thing, you are reporting someone's judgment or opinion that it is that thing.

example.ex: The opening day of the battle was, nevertheless, accounted a success.
example.tran: 不过，开战的首日仍被认为是成功的。

example.ex: ...homosexuals, whose sexual behaviour is still accounted sinful by the church.
example.tran: 其性行为仍然被教会认为是罪孽深重的同性恋者

collins.def: If you say that something is true by all accounts or from all accounts, you believe it is true because other people say so.

example.ex: He is, by all accounts, a superb teacher.
example.tran: 他是位有口皆碑的好老师。

collins.tran: （尽管未必大获全胜但）出色地表现（自己）
collins.def: If you say that someone gave a good account of themselves in a particular situation, you mean that they performed well, although they may not have been completely successful.

example.ex: The team fought hard and gave a good account of themselves.
example.tran: 这支队伍奋力拼搏，表现出色。

collins.def: If you say that something is of no account or of little account, you mean that it is very unimportant and is not worth considering.

example.ex: These obscure groups were of little account in national politics.
example.tran: 这些名不见经传的团体在国内政界无足轻重。

collins.tran: 以赊账方式;以分期付款方式
collins.def: If you buy or pay for something on account, you pay nothing or only part of the cost at first, and pay the rest later.

example.ex: He bought two bottles of vodka on account.
example.tran: 他挂账买了两瓶伏特加酒。

collins.def: You use on account of to introduce the reason or explanation for something.

example.ex: The President declined to deliver the speech himself, on account of a sore throat...
example.tran: 总统因嗓子不适而婉拒了亲自讲话。

example.ex: A newly-married couple, he thought, on account of their walking so close together.
example.tran: 看俩人走路时挨得这么近，他觉得他们是新婚夫妇。

collins.tran: 从（某人的）角度；（尤指）设想处于（某人的）情况
collins.def: Your feelings on someone's account are the feelings you have about what they have experienced or might experience, especially when you imagine yourself to be in their situation.

example.ex: Mollie told me what she'd done and I was really scared on her account.
example.tran: 莫莉告诉我她的所作所为，我真是替她感到后怕。

collins.def: If you tell someone not to do something on your account, you mean that they should do it only if they want to, and not because they think it will please you.

example.ex: Don't leave on my account.
example.tran: 别因为我就走了。

collins.def: If you say that something should on no account be done, you are emphasizing that it should not be done under any circumstances.

example.ex: On no account should the mixture boil.
example.tran: 切勿让这种混合物沸腾。

collins.def: You can use on that account or on this account when you want to say that something happens for the reason you have just mentioned.

example.ex: Wine is radioactive but few people stop drinking it on that account.
example.tran: 酒是有放射性的，可是很少有人因此而戒酒。

collins.def: If you say that something concerning a particular person is true by his or her own account, you mean that you believe it because that person has said it is true.

example.ex: He was by his own account an ambitious workaholic.
example.tran: 据他自己所言，他是个雄心勃勃的工作狂。

collins.tran: 作为个人地；为自身利益地
collins.def: If you take part in a business activity on your own account, you do it for yourself, and not as a representative or employee of a company.

example.ex: She had plans to set up in business on her own account.
example.tran: 她计划自己创业。

collins.tran: 自主自愿地;责任自负地
collins.def: If you do something on your own account, you do it because you want to and without being asked, and you take responsibility for your own action.

example.ex: I told him if he withdrew it was on his own account.
example.tran: 我告诉他，如果他退出，责任自负。

collins.tran: （与敌人或对手）决战，算账，了结恩怨
collins.def: To settle accounts with an enemy or opponent means to bring your fight or quarrel to an end by defeating them.

example.ex: ...until the great day came when the Germans could finally settle accounts with the British...
example.tran: 直到德国人最终能和英国人清算旧账的重大日子的来临

example.ex: Their sleep is regularly disturbed by the sound of gunfire as criminal gangs settle their nightly accounts.
example.tran: 他们经常被黑帮每晚火拼的枪声所吵醒。

collins.def: If you take something into account, or take account of something, you consider it when you are thinking about a situation or deciding what to do.

example.ex: The defendant asked for 21 similar offences to be taken into account...
example.tran: 被告要求考虑到类似的21起违法行为的情况。

example.ex: Urban planners in practice have to take account of many interest groups in society.
example.tran: 城市规划人员在实际工作中必须把社会各利益集团都考虑在内。

collins.tran: （对所做的错事）被要求解释并遭斥责，被问责
collins.def: If someone is called, held, or brought to account for something they have done wrong, they are made to explain why they did it, and are often criticized or punished for it.

example.ex: Ministers should be called to account for their actions.
example.tran: 部长们应该对他们的行为作出解释。

collins.def: If someone or something goes across a place or a boundary, they go from one side of it to the other.

example.ex: She walked across the floor and lay down on the bed...
example.tran: 她走过地板躺在了床上。

example.ex: He watched Karl run across the street to Tommy.
example.tran: 他看着卡尔向街对面的汤米跑去。

collins.def: If something is situated or stretched across something else, it is situated or stretched from one side of it to the other.

example.ex: ...the floating bridge across Lake Washington in Seattle...
example.tran: 横跨在西雅图华盛顿湖上的浮桥

example.ex: He scrawled his name across the bill...
example.tran: 他在账单上草草地签了名。

collins.def: If something is lying across an object or place, it is resting on it and partly covering it.

example.ex: She found her clothes lying across the chair...
example.tran: 她发现自己的衣服堆放在椅子上。

example.ex: The wind pushed his hair across his face.
example.tran: 他的发丝随风拂面。

collins.def: Something that is across something such as a street, river, or area is on the other side of it.

example.ex: Anyone from the houses across the road could see him...
example.tran: 马路对面房子里的任何一个人都能看见他。

example.ex: When I saw you across the room I knew I'd met you before.
example.tran: 我在房间那头看见你时就知道我曾见过你。

collins.def: If you look across at a place, person, or thing, you look towards them.

example.ex: He glanced across at his sleeping wife...
example.tran: 他朝熟睡的妻子看了一眼。

example.ex: She rose from the chair and gazed across at him.
example.tran: 她从椅子上站起身，远远地看着他。

collins.def: You use across to say that a particular expression is shown on someone's face.

example.ex: An enormous grin spread across his face...
example.tran: 他咧着大嘴笑了。

example.ex: For a moment a shadow seemed to pass across Roy's face.
example.tran: 一瞬间罗伊脸上似乎闪过一丝忧伤。

collins.def: If someone hits you across the face or head, they hit you on that part.

example.ex: Graham hit him across the face with the gun.
example.tran: 格雷厄姆用枪击打他的脸部。

collins.def: When something happens across a place or organization, it happens equally everywhere within it.

example.ex: The film 'Hook' opens across America on December 11...
example.tran: 电影《铁钩船长》12月11日在美国全线上映。

example.ex: Thousands of farmers from across Europe have held a huge demonstration in the centre of Brussels...
example.tran: 来自欧洲各地的数千农民在布鲁塞尔市中心举行了大规模的示威游行。

collins.tran: 超越，跨越（政治、宗教、社会隔阂等）
collins.def: When something happens across a political, religious, or social barrier, it involves people in different groups.

example.ex: ...parties competing across the political spectrum...
example.tran: 政治纷争中的各党派

example.ex: We want to promote cosmetics that appeal across the colour barrier.
example.tran: 我们想推销各种肤色的人都喜欢的化妆品。

collins.def: Across is used in measurements to show the width of something.

example.ex: This hand-decorated plate measures 30cm across...
example.tran: 这个手绘盘子直径为30厘米。

example.ex: The snails are no larger than one centimetre across.
example.tran: 这些蜗牛体宽不超过1厘米。

collins.def: When you act, you do something for a particular purpose.

example.ex: The deaths occurred when police acted to stop widespread looting and vandalism...
example.tran: 警方采取行动制止猖狂的打砸抢行为时有多人丧生。

example.ex: I do not doubt that the bank acted properly.
example.tran: 我毫不怀疑银行的处理方式是妥当的。

collins.def: If you act on advice or information, you do what has been advised or suggested.

example.ex: A patient will usually listen to the doctor's advice and act on it.
example.tran: 患者通常都会遵照医嘱行事。

collins.def: If someone acts in a particular way, they behave in that way.

example.ex: ...a gang of youths who were acting suspiciously...
example.tran: 一伙形迹可疑的年轻人

example.ex: He acted as if he hadn't heard any of it...
example.tran: 他表现得好像对此毫不知情。

collins.def: If someone or something acts as a particular thing, they have that role or function.

example.ex: He acted both as the ship's surgeon and as chaplain for the men.
example.tran: 他在船上为水手们兼作外科医生和牧师。

example.ex: ...the Cunard Princess, which acted as a support ship for American forces.
example.tran: 用作美军支援船的公主号冠达邮轮

collins.def: If someone acts in a particular way, they pretend to be something that they are not.

example.ex: Chris acted astonished as he examined the note...
example.tran: 克里斯检查记录时故作震惊状。

example.ex: Kenworthy had tried not to act the policeman.
example.tran: 肯沃西努力表现得不像个警察。

collins.def: When professionals such as lawyers act for you, or act on your behalf, they are employed by you to deal with a particular matter.

example.ex: ...the law firm that acted for Diana during her marriage split...
example.tran: 在戴安娜婚姻破裂期间为她做代理的法律事务所

example.ex: Because we travelled so much, Sam and I asked a broker to act on our behalf.
example.tran: 由于我们经常游历在外，我和萨姆便请了一位经纪人代表我们处理事务。

collins.def: If a force or substance acts on someone or something, it has a certain effect on them.

example.ex: He's taking a dangerous drug: it acts very fast on the central nervous system...
example.tran: 他正在服用一种危险的药物：这种药物能很快影响到中枢神经系统。

example.ex: A hypnotist can act upon the unconscious mind directly.
example.tran: 催眠师能直接作用于无意识思维。

collins.def: If you act, or act a part in a play or film, you have a part in it.

example.ex: She confessed to her parents her desire to act...
example.tran: 她向父母坦言了自己想演戏的愿望。

example.ex: She acted in her first film when she was 13 years old.
example.tran: 13岁时她出演了她的电影处女作。

collins.def: An act is a single thing that someone does.

example.ex: Language interpretation is the whole point of the act of reading...
example.tran: 阅读行为中关键在于对语言的理解。

example.ex: My insurance excludes acts of sabotage and damage done by weapons of war.
example.tran: 我购买的保险对于蓄意损坏以及战争中武器造成的损坏不予赔偿。

collins.def: If you say that someone's behaviour is an act, you mean that it does not express their real feelings.

example.ex: There were moments when I wondered: did she do this on purpose, was it all just a game, an act?...
example.tran: 有时我很困惑：她这么做是故意的吗？难道一切都只是一场游戏，是逢场作戏？

example.ex: His anger was real. It wasn't an act.
example.tran: 他是真的生气了，不是在摆样子。

collins.def: An Act is a law passed by the government.

example.ex: ...an Act of Parliament.
example.tran: 议会法案

collins.def: An act in a play, opera, or ballet is one of the main parts into which it is divided.

example.ex: Act II contained one of the funniest scenes I have ever witnessed...
example.tran: 第二幕里有我看过的最搞笑的场面之一。

collins.def: An act in a show is a short performance which is one of several in the show.

example.ex: This year numerous bands are playing, as well as comedy acts...
example.tran: 今年除了那些搞笑短剧外，还会有众多乐队登台献艺。

collins.def: If you catch someone in the act, you discover them doing something wrong or committing a crime.

example.ex: The men were caught in the act of digging up buried explosives.
example.tran: 那些人在挖掘掩埋的爆炸物时被逮个正着。

collins.def: If someone who has been behaving badly cleans up their act, they start to behave in a more acceptable or responsible way.

example.ex: The nation's advertisers need to clean up their act.
example.tran: 该国的广告商需要规范自己的行为。

collins.tran: （为了得到好处等）参与，插一手
collins.def: If you get in on the act, you take part in or take advantage of something that was started by someone else.

example.ex: In the 1970s Kodak, anxious to get in on the act, launched its own instant camera.
example.tran: 20世纪70年代，急于分一杯羹的柯达公司推出了自己的拍立得相机。

collins.def: You say that someone was in the act of doing something to indicate what they were doing when they were seen or interrupted.

example.ex: Ken was in the act of paying his bill when Neil came up behind him.
example.tran: 当尼尔从后面走过来时，肯正在付账。

collins.tran: 全力以赴；集中精力；劲儿往一处使
collins.def: If you get your act together, you organize your life or your affairs so that you are able to achieve what you want or to deal with something effectively.

example.ex: The Government should get its act together...
example.tran: 政府应该集中力量。

example.ex: We have to get our act together — we have to organize ourselves.
example.tran: 我们必须把劲儿往一处使——我们得组织起来。

collins.def: Action is doing something for a particular purpose.

example.ex: The government is taking emergency action to deal with a housing crisis...
example.tran: 政府正采取紧急措施解决住房危机。

example.ex: What was needed, he said, was decisive action to halt what he called these savage crimes.
example.tran: 他说，当务之急就是采取果断行动制止他所称的“这些野蛮罪行”。

collins.def: An action is something that you do on a particular occasion.

example.ex: As always, Peter had a reason for his action...
example.tran: 一如往常，彼得对自己的行为总有说辞。

example.ex: Jack was the sort of man who did not like his actions questioned.
example.tran: 杰克是那种不喜欢别人质疑自己行为的人。

collins.def: To bring a legal action against someone means to bring a case against them in a court of law.

example.ex: Two leading law firms are to prepare legal actions against tobacco companies.
example.tran: 两家很有名的律师事务所准备向烟草公司提起诉讼。

example.ex: ...a libel action brought by one of France's bureaucrats.
example.tran: 由法国的一名官员提起的诽谤诉讼

collins.def: The action of a chemical is the way in which it works, or the effects that it has.

example.ex: Her description of the nature and action of poisons is amazingly accurate.
example.tran: 他对一些毒药的性质和作用的描述惊人地准确。

collins.tran: 激动人心（或重要）的大事
collins.def: The action is all the important and exciting things that are happening in a situation.

example.ex: Hollywood is where the action is now.
example.tran: 好莱坞如今风头正盛。

collins.def: The fighting which takes place in a war can be referred to as action .

example.ex: Leaders in America have generally supported military action...
example.tran: 美国领导人普遍支持采取军事行动。

example.ex: 13 soldiers were killed and 10 wounded in action.
example.tran: 战斗中有13名士兵阵亡，10名士兵受伤。

collins.tran: （电影）情节惊险刺激的；动作（片）的；动作片中的
collins.def: An action movie is a film in which a lot of dangerous and exciting things happen. An action hero is the main character in one of these films.

example.ex: Stallone wants to break away from his action-hero image.
example.tran: 史泰龙想要摆脱动作明星的形象。

collins.def: If you action something that needs to be done, you deal with it.

example.ex: Documents can be actioned, or filed immediately.
example.tran: 文件可被立即处理或归档。

collins.tran: （因受伤或损坏）不能工作，失去作用，无法运转
collins.def: If someone or something is out of action, they are injured or damaged and cannot work or be used.

example.ex: He's been out of action for 16 months with a serious knee injury...
example.tran: 由于膝部严重受伤，他已停工16个月。

example.ex: They were trapped after the lifts went out of action.
example.tran: 电梯出现故障，他们被困在里面了。

collins.tran: （通常为了赚钱或提高影响力）插手，参与
collins.def: If someone wants to have a piece of the action or a slice of the action, they want to take part in an exciting activity or situation, usually in order to make money or become more important.

example.ex: Holiday spots have seen a dramatic revival and tourist chiefs are competing for a slice of the action.
example.tran: 各个度假点重又呈现出一派兴旺景象，旅游业的龙头老大们都在争着分一杯羹。

collins.def: If you put an idea or policy into action, you begin to use it or cause it to operate.

example.ex: They have learned the lessons of business management theory, and put them into action.
example.tran: 他们不仅学习了商业管理理论方面的课程，并且学以致用。

collins.def: You use actually to indicate that a situation exists or happened, or to emphasize that it is true.

example.ex: One afternoon, I grew bored and actually fell asleep for a few minutes...
example.tran: 一天下午，我觉得有些无聊，还真的睡着了一小会儿。

example.ex: Interest is only payable on the amount actually borrowed.
example.tran: 利息只能根据实际借款数目给付。

collins.tran: （用于纠正他人或表示反对）实际上，事实上
collins.def: You use actually when you are correcting or contradicting someone.

example.ex: No, I'm not a student. I'm a doctor, actually...
example.tran: 不，我不是学生。实际上我是医生。

example.ex: 'So it's not a family show then?' —'Well, actually, I think that's exactly what it is.'
example.tran: “那么这并不是一次家庭才艺表演了？”——“嗯，事实上我觉得这恰恰就是一次家庭才艺表演。”

collins.tran: (礼貌地表达与他人的期待所不同的观点)说实在的，说真的
collins.def: You can use actually when you are politely expressing an opinion that other people might not have expected from you.

example.ex: 'Do you think it's a good idea to socialize with one's patients?' — 'Actually, I do, I think it's a great idea.'
example.tran: “你认为和自己的病人交朋友的想法好吗？”——“说实在的，我认为很好，这个想法很棒。”

example.ex: I would be surprised, actually, if he left Birmingham.
example.tran: 如果他要离开伯明翰，说真的，我会很惊讶。

collins.def: You use actually to introduce a new topic into a conversation.

example.ex: Well actually, John, I rang you for some advice...
example.tran: 这么说吧，约翰，我给你打电话是想得到些建议。

example.ex: Actually, let's just read this little bit where you've made them bump into each other.
example.tran: 这样吧，我们就只读你让他们偶遇这一小段吧。

collins.def: If something happens after a particular date or event, it happens during the period of time that follows that date or event.

example.ex: After 19 May, strikes were occurring on a daily basis...
example.tran: 5月19日之后，每天都会发生罢工。

example.ex: After breakfast Amy ordered a taxi...
example.tran: 早饭后，埃米预订了一辆出租车。

collins.def: If you do one thing after doing another, you do it during the period of time that follows the other thing.

example.ex: After completing and signing it, please return the form to us in the envelope provided.
example.tran: 填完表格并签名后，请装进所提供的信封里寄还给我们。

example.ex: ...women who have changed their mind after deciding not to have children...
example.tran: 决定不生孩子后又改变主意的女性

collins.def: You use after when you are talking about time. For example, if something is going to happen during the day after or the weekend after a particular time, it is going to happen during the following day or during the following weekend.

example.ex: She's leaving the day after tomorrow.
example.tran: 她打算后天离开。

example.ex: ...the party's annual conference, to be held the week after next.
example.tran: 将在下下周举行的该党的年会

collins.def: If you go after someone, you follow or chase them.

example.ex: He walked out, and Louise went after him.
example.tran: 他走了出去，路易丝也跟着出去了。

example.ex: ...people who were after him for large amounts of money.
example.tran: 为了大笔钱而追随他的人们

collins.def: If you are after something, you are trying to get it.

example.ex: They were after the money...
example.tran: 他们想得到这笔钱。

example.ex: I did eventually find what I was after.
example.tran: 我最终找到了我想要的东西。

collins.tran: 朝着（正离去之人喊叫或注视）
collins.def: If you call, shout, or stare after someone, you call, shout, or stare at them as they move away from you.

example.ex: 'Come back!' he called after me...
example.tran: “回来！”他朝我喊道。

example.ex: Claire stared after him until he disappeared around a corner.
example.tran: 克莱尔一直注视着他，直到他消失在拐角。

collins.def: If you do something after someone, you do it for them, because they cannot or will not do it for themselves.

example.ex: She used to mess up the floor and I had to clean up after her.
example.tran: 她过去常常把地板弄得很脏乱，而我不得不为她清理干净。

collins.def: If you tell someone that one place is a particular distance after another, you mean that it is situated beyond the other place and further away from you.

example.ex: A few kilometres after the village, turn right to Montelabate.
example.tran: 过了村庄之后再前行几公里，向右转前往蒙特拉贝特。

collins.def: If one thing is written after another thing on a page, it is written following it or underneath it.

example.ex: I wrote my name after Penny's.
example.tran: 我把自己的名字写在彭尼的下面。

collins.def: You use after in order to give the most important aspect of something when comparing it with another aspect.

example.ex: After Germany, America is Britain's second-biggest customer...
example.tran: 对于英国来说，美国是仅次于德国的第二大客户。

example.ex: Methane is often regarded as the second most important greenhouse gas after carbon dioxide.
example.tran: 甲烷常被认为是仅次于二氧化碳的重要温室气体。

collins.tran: 依照，按照（某人的名字命名）
collins.def: To be named after someone means to be given the same name as them.

example.ex: Phillimore Island is named after Sir Robert Phillimore...
example.tran: 菲利莫尔岛以罗伯特·菲利莫尔爵士的名字命名。

example.ex: He persuaded Virginia to name the baby after him.
example.tran: 他说服弗吉尼娅以他的名字为婴儿取名。

collins.tran: （走路或出入门口时的礼貌用语）您先请
collins.def: If you say 'after you' to someone, you are being polite and allowing them to go in front of you or through a doorway before you do.

example.ex: 'After you.' — 'Not at all, Mr Bird, after you.'
example.tran: “您先请。”——“别客气，伯德先生，您先请。”

collins.def: After is used when telling the time. If it is, for example, ten after six, the time is ten minutes past six.
If you do something to several things one after the other or one after another, you do it to one, then the next, and so on, with no break between your actions.

example.ex: Sybil ate three biscuits, one after the other...
example.tran: 西比尔接连吃了3块饼干。

example.ex: Caroline was trying on one outfit after another.
example.tran: 卡罗琳一套接一套地试穿衣服。

collins.def: If something happens day after day or year after year, it happens every day or every year, for a long time.

example.ex: I waited for news, day after day, expecting to hear.
example.tran: 我日复一日地等着，期待能听到消息。

example.ex: ...people who'd been coming here year after year.
example.tran: 年复一年到这里来的人们

collins.def: You use again to indicate that something happens a second time, or after it has already happened before.

example.ex: He kissed her again...
example.tran: 他再一次吻了她。

example.ex: Again there was a short silence...
example.tran: 接着又是一阵短暂的沉寂。

collins.def: You use again to indicate that something is now in a particular state or place that it used to be in.

example.ex: He opened his attaché-case, removed a folder, then closed it again...
example.tran: 他打开公文包，拿出一个文件夹后又把它合上了。

example.ex: I started to feel good about myself again.
example.tran: 我又开始感觉良好了。

collins.def: You can use again when you want to point out that there is a similarity between the subject that you are talking about now and a previous subject.

example.ex: Again the pregnancy was very similar to my previous two...
example.tran: 同样，这次怀孕和我前两次的情形非常相似。

example.ex: With the new artists, you see a more dynamic stage show than you used to see. And again, that's probably part of the progress of technology.
example.tran: 有了这些新艺术家，你看到的舞台剧会比你以前看的更富有活力。同样，那也可能是科技进步的一部分。

collins.tran: （用于对比或语气的削弱）不过，然而
collins.def: You can use again in expressions such as but again ,then again, and there again when you want to introduce a remark which contrasts with or weakens something that you have just said.

example.ex: It's easier to take a taxi. But then again you can't always get one...
example.tran: 打出租车要容易些，但也并不总是能打到的。

example.ex: They may, but there again they may not.
example.tran: 他们可能会，但也可能不会。

collins.def: You can add again to the end of your question when you are asking someone to tell you something that you have forgotten or that they have already told you.

example.ex: Sorry, what's your name again?
example.tran: 对不起，再问一次，你叫什么名字?

collins.def: You use again in expressions such as half as much again when you are indicating how much greater one amount is than another amount that you have just mentioned or are about to mention.

example.ex: A similar wine from France would cost you half as much again.
example.tran: 法国类似的一种葡萄酒的价格比这高一半。

example.ex: Sherry is half as strong again as table wine.
example.tran: 雪利酒比佐餐酒酒劲强一半。

collins.def: You can use again and again or time and again to emphasize that something happens many times.

example.ex: He would go over his work again and again until he felt he had it right...
example.tran: 他会反复检查自己的工作直到他认为正确为止。

example.ex: Time and again political parties have failed to tackle this issue.
example.tran: 各个政党处理这个问题时都屡屡失败。

collins.def: If one thing is leaning or pressing against another, it is touching it.

example.ex: She leaned against him...
example.tran: 她紧靠着他。

example.ex: On a table pushed against a wall there were bottles of beer and wine.
example.tran: 在一张靠墙的餐桌上有啤酒和葡萄酒。

collins.def: If you are against something such as a plan, policy, or system, you think it is wrong, bad, or stupid.

example.ex: Taxes are unpopular — it is understandable that voters are against them...
example.tran: 税收不受欢迎——选民们反对是可以理解的。

example.ex: Joan was very much against commencing drug treatment.
example.tran: 琼极力反对进行药物治疗。

collins.def: If you compete against someone in a game, you try to beat them.

example.ex: The tour will include games against the Australian Barbarians...
example.tran: 这次巡回赛将包括和澳大利亚野人队的比赛。

example.ex: Billy Hardy has pulled out of his second fight against Noel Carroll after a training accident.
example.tran: 一次训练事故之后，比利·哈迪退出了和诺埃尔·卡罗尔的第二次比赛。

collins.def: If you take action against someone or something, you try to harm them.

example.ex: Security forces are still using violence against opponents of the government.
example.tran: 安全部队仍然在使用武力镇压反对政府的人。

example.ex: ...an upsurge in racism against immigrants...
example.tran: 对移民的种族歧视的高涨

collins.def: If you take action against a possible future event, you try to prevent it.

example.ex: ...the fight against crime...
example.tran: 打击犯罪

example.ex: They are arguing against hospital closures...
example.tran: 他们据理反对关闭医院。

collins.tran: 违背，违抗（愿望、劝告或命令）
collins.def: If you do something against someone's wishes, advice, or orders, you do not do what they want you to do or tell you to do.

example.ex: He didn't want to go against the wishes of the German government...
example.tran: 他不想违抗德国政府的意愿。

example.ex: He discharged himself from hospital against the advice of doctors.
example.tran: 他不顾医生的劝告自行出院了。

collins.def: If you do something in order to protect yourself against something unpleasant or harmful, you do something which will make its effects on you less serious if it happens.

example.ex: A business needs insurance against risks such as fire and flood...
example.tran: 公司需要上保险以防备火灾、洪灾等风险。

example.ex: It has been claimed that wine helps protect against heart disease.
example.tran: 有人声称葡萄酒有助于预防心脏病。

collins.def: If you have something against someone or something, you dislike them.

example.ex: Have you got something against women, Les?...
example.tran: 你对女性存有芥蒂吗，莱斯？

example.ex: I have nothing against foreigners.
example.tran: 我对外国人并无芥蒂。

collins.def: If something is against the law or against the rules, there is a law or a rule which says that you must not do it.

example.ex: It is against the law to detain you against your will for any length of time...
example.tran: 无论强制扣押多长时间都属违法。

example.ex: We thought cheating was against the rules.
example.tran: 我们认为作弊是违反规定的。

collins.def: If you are moving against a current, tide, or wind, you are moving in the opposite direction to it.

example.ex: ...swimming upstream against the current...
example.tran: 逆流往上游泳

example.ex: They were going to sail around the little island, against the tide.
example.tran: 他们打算绕着小岛逆潮航行。

collins.def: If something happens or is considered against a particular background of events, it is considered in relation to those events, because those events are relevant to it.

example.ex: The Pope has sent a message appealing for unity in his homeland, against a background of divisions in the Solidarity movement...
example.tran: 团结运动中各派搞分裂，在此情况下教皇发出号召，呼吁祖国保持团结。

example.ex: The profits rise was achieved against a backdrop of falling metal prices.
example.tran: 在金属价格下跌的背景下，利润提高了。

collins.def: If something is measured or valued against something else, it is measured or valued by comparing it with the other thing.

example.ex: Our policy has to be judged against a clear test: will it improve the standard of education?...
example.tran: 对我们的政策作出评判必须根据一条明确的准则：它是否会提高教育的水准？

example.ex: Check the operator's productivity against agreed targets...
example.tran: 根据既定目标检验操作员的效率。

collins.def: If you discuss a particular set of facts or figures as against another set, you are comparing or contrasting the two sets of facts or figures.

example.ex: Over 50% of divorced men regretted their divorce, as against 25% of women.
example.tran: 离婚男性中有50%以上后悔离婚，与此相对，女性只有25%。

collins.def: The odds against something happening are the chances or odds that it will not happen.

example.ex: The odds against him surviving are incredible.
example.tran: 他活下来的概率非常小。

means: （吸毒者随年龄增长而主动）戒毒，戒除毒品

collins.def: Your age is the number of years that you have lived.

example.ex: She has a nephew who is just ten years of age...
example.tran: 她有一个才10岁的侄子。

example.ex: At the age of sixteen he qualified for a place at the University of Hamburg...
example.tran: 16岁时，他就有资格进入汉堡大学。

collins.def: The age of a thing is the number of years since it was made.

example.ex: Everything in the room looks in keeping with the age of the building.
example.tran: 房间里的一切看起来都与这栋建筑物的存在年头很相称。

collins.def: Age is the state of being old or the process of becoming older.

example.ex: Perhaps he has grown wiser with age...
example.tran: 可能随着年纪增长，他变聪明了。

example.ex: The fabric was showing signs of age...
example.tran: 这块衣料可以看出岁月留下的痕迹。

collins.def: When someone ages, or when something ages them, they seem much older and less strong or less alert.

example.ex: He had always looked so young, but he seemed to have aged in the last few months...
example.tran: 他原来一直看起来很年轻，但最近几个月他显得老了。

example.ex: He was only in his mid-thirties, but already worry had aged him.
example.tran: 他虽然只有三十五六岁，但忧虑让他很显老。

collins.def: When food or alcohol is aged or when it ages, it is left to get older before being eaten or drunk, so that it develops a better flavour.

example.ex: Balsamic vinegar is aged in wood for at least 10 years and the flavour is wonderful...
example.tran: 意大利香醋在木桶中就经历了至少10年的酝酿期，所以口味极佳。

example.ex: Whisky loses strength as it ages.
example.tran: 存放时间越久，威士忌的口味越淡。

collins.def: An age is a period in history.

example.ex: ...the age of steam and steel.
example.tran: 蒸汽和钢铁时代

example.ex: ...items of Bronze Age pottery.
example.tran: 青铜器时代的陶器

collins.def: You can say an age or ages to mean a very long time.

example.ex: He waited what seemed an age...
example.tran: 他等了似乎很长时间。

example.ex: The bus took absolutely ages to arrive.
example.tran: 公共汽车过了很长时间才来。

collins.def: If someone tells you to act your age, they are telling you to behave in a way that is suitable for someone your age, because they think you are behaving in a childish way.
If something comes of age, it reaches an important stage of development and is accepted by a large number of people.

example.ex: Recycling is an issue that has come of age in Britain in the last decade.
example.tran: 回收利用是上个十年中被英国民众广泛认可的观念。

collins.def: When someone comes of age, they become legally an adult.

example.ex: The company was to be held in trust for Eddie until he came of age.
example.tran: 在埃迪达到法定年龄之前，该公司将委托他人代为经营。

collins.tran: 未到合法年龄的;未成年的
collins.def: Someone who is under age is not legally old enough to do something, for example to buy an alcoholic drink.

example.ex: Because she was under age, her parents were still responsible for her.
example.tran: 因为她还未成年，她的父母仍然应为她负责。

example.ex: ...under age smoking.
example.tran: 未成年吸烟

collins.def: You use ago when you are referring to past time. For example, if something happened one year ago, it is one year since it happened. If it happened a long time ago, it is a long time since it happened.

example.ex: He was killed a few days ago in a skiing accident...
example.tran: 几天前他在一场滑雪事故中丧生。

example.ex: The meeting is the first since the war began 14 years ago...
example.tran: 这是自14年前爆发战争以来的第一次会晤。

collins.def: If people agree with each other about something, they have the same opinion about it or say that they have the same opinion.

example.ex: If we agreed all the time it would be a bit boring, wouldn't it?...
example.tran: 如果我们总是意见一致，就会有点无趣，对吗？

example.ex: Both have agreed on the need for the money...
example.tran: 两个人一致表示需要那笔钱。

collins.def: If you agree to do something, you say that you will do it. If you agree to a proposal, you accept it.

example.ex: He agreed to pay me for the drawings...
example.tran: 他答应向我支付这些画的钱。

example.ex: Donna agreed to both requests...
example.tran: 两个请求唐纳都同意了。

collins.def: If people agree on something, or in British English if they agree something, they all decide to accept or do something.

example.ex: The warring sides have agreed on an unconditional ceasefire...
example.tran: 交战各方已经同意无条件休战。

example.ex: We never agreed a date...
example.tran: 我们从未商定好日期。

collins.tran: 搁置争议;同意各自保留不同意见
collins.def: If two people who are arguing about something agree to disagree or agree to differ, they decide to stop arguing because neither of them is going to change their opinion.

example.ex: You and I are going to have to agree to disagree then.
example.tran: 那你我只能各自保留不同意见了。

collins.def: If you agree with an action or suggestion, you approve of it.

example.ex: I don't agree with what they're doing...
example.tran: 我不赞同他们正在做的事情。

example.ex: In his heart he knew they'd agree with his stand.
example.tran: 他内心明白他们会赞成他的立场。

collins.def: If one account of an event or one set of figures agrees with another, the two accounts or sets of figures are the same or are consistent with each other.

example.ex: His second statement agrees with facts as stated by the other witnesses.
example.tran: 他的第二份供述与其他目击证人所陈述的事实相符。

collins.def: If some food that you eat does not agree with you, it makes you feel ill.

example.ex: I don't think the food here agrees with me.
example.tran: 我觉得这里的食物不对我的胃口。

collins.def: If a place or experience agrees with you, it makes you feel healthy and happy.

example.ex: You look great, Brian. The Bahamas certainly agree with you.
example.tran: 你看上去气色好极了，布赖恩。巴哈马显然很适合你。

collins.def: In grammar, if a word agrees with a noun or pronoun, it has a form that is appropriate to the number or gender of the noun or pronoun. For example, in 'He hates it', the singular verb agrees with the singular pronoun 'he'.
Aid is money, equipment, or services that are provided for people, countries, or organizations who need them but cannot provide them for themselves.

example.ex: ...regular flights carrying humanitarian aid to Cambodia...
example.tran: 向柬埔寨运送人道援助物资的定期航班

example.ex: They have already pledged billions of dollars in aid.
example.tran: 他们已经许诺援助几十亿美元。

collins.def: To aid a country, organization, or person means to provide them with money, equipment, or services that they need.

example.ex: ...US efforts to aid Kurdish refugees.
example.tran: 美国对库尔德难民的援助行动

example.ex: ...a charitable organization that has spent millions aiding pharmaceutical research.
example.tran: 已投入巨资资助药物研究的一家慈善机构

collins.def: To aid someone means to help or assist them.

example.ex: ...a software system to aid managers in advanced decision-making...
example.tran: 帮助经理作出高级决策的软件系统

example.ex: The hunt for her killer will continue, with police aided by the army and air force.
example.tran: 警方将在陆军和空军的帮助下，继续追踪谋杀她的凶手。

collins.def: If you perform a task with the aid of something, you need or use that thing to perform that task.

example.ex: He succeeded with the aid of a completely new method he discovered...
example.tran: 借助于自己发现的一种全新的方法，他获得了成功。

example.ex: Gently raise your upper body to a sitting position, without the aid of your hands.
example.tran: 在不用手扶的前提下，慢慢抬起上身直到坐起。

collins.tran: 辅助物;辅助用具;辅助性技术
collins.def: An aid is an object, device, or technique that makes something easier to do.

example.ex: The new law gives authorities a responsibility to provide aids to the disabled...
example.tran: 新法律规定当局有责任为残疾人提供帮助。

example.ex: The book is an invaluable aid to teachers of literature...
example.tran: 这本书对于教授文学的老师来说帮助非常大。

collins.def: If something aids a process, it makes it easier or more likely to happen.

example.ex: The export sector will aid the economic recovery...
example.tran: 出口产业将促进经济复苏。

example.ex: Calcium may aid in the prevention of colon cancer.
example.tran: 钙可能有助于预防结肠癌。

collins.def: An activity or event in aid of a particular cause or charity is intended to raise money for that cause or charity.

example.ex: ...a charity performance in aid of Great Ormond Street Children's Hospital.
example.tran: 为给大奥蒙德街儿童医院筹资而举办的慈善演出

collins.def: If you come or go to someone's aid, you try to help them when they are in danger or difficulty.

example.ex: We're coming to the aid of the people of Somalia at the request of the United Nations...
example.tran: 我们应联合国的要求前去救援索马里的民众。

example.ex: Horrified neighbours rushed to his aid as he fell.
example.tran: 他摔下来时，惊恐的邻居们赶忙冲过去救他。

collins.def: Air is the mixture of gases which forms the earth's atmosphere and which we breathe.

example.ex: Draughts help to circulate air...
example.tran: 穿堂风有助于空气流通。

example.ex: Keith opened the window and leaned out into the cold air.
example.tran: 基思打开窗户，探出身到冷风中。

collins.def: The air is the space around things or above the ground.

example.ex: Government troops broke up the protest by firing their guns in the air...
example.tran: 政府军队朝天鸣枪驱散了抗议人群。

example.ex: People's cigarette smoke seemed to hang in the air.
example.tran: 人们吸烟的烟雾似乎会长时间滞留在空气中。

collins.def: Air is used to refer to travel in aircraft.

example.ex: Air travel will continue to grow at about 6% per year...
example.tran: 乘飞机旅行的人数将以每年大约6%的速度持续增加。

example.ex: Casualties had to be brought to hospital by air.
example.tran: 伤者不得不用飞机送往医院。

collins.def: An air is a simple tune which can be easily recognized and remembered.

collins.tran: 神态;感觉;总体印象;氛围
collins.def: If you say that someone or something has a particular air, you mean that they give this general impression.

example.ex: Jennifer regarded him with an air of amusement...
example.tran: 珍妮弗觉得他很风趣。

example.ex: The meal gave the occasion an almost festive air.
example.tran: 这一餐使整个场合有了近乎节日般的喜庆氛围。

collins.tran: 矫揉造作；装腔作势；做作
collins.def: If you say that someone is putting on airs or giving themselves airs, you are criticizing them for behaving as if they are better than other people.

example.ex: We're poor and we never put on airs.
example.tran: 我们贫穷但从不装腔作势。

collins.tran: （通过电视或无线电）播送，播放
collins.def: If a broadcasting company airs a television or radio programme, they show it on television or broadcast it on the radio.

example.ex: Tonight PBS will air a documentary called 'Democracy In Action'.
example.tran: 今晚公共广播公司将播放一部名为《民主进行时》的纪录片。

collins.def: If you air your opinions, you make them known to people.

example.ex: They sat for more than six hours, and both sides agreed they had aired all their differences...
example.tran: 他们一起坐了六个多小时，而且双方都认为他们已经表达了所有的不同意见。

example.ex: The whole issue was thoroughly aired at the meeting.
example.tran: 在会上完全公开了整个问题。

collins.def: If you air a room or building, you let fresh air into it.

example.ex: One day a week her mother systematically cleaned and aired each room.
example.tran: 她母亲按部就班地每周一次清扫所有的房间并开窗通风。

collins.def: If you air clothing or bedding, you put it somewhere warm to make sure that it is completely dry.

example.ex: When the shirts were clean, I ironed them myself, aired them and placed them in drawers in his room.
example.tran: 衬衫洗干净之后，我自己将它们熨好、烘干并放在他房间的抽屉里。

collins.def: If you do something to clear the air, you do it in order to resolve any problems or disagreements that there might be.

example.ex: ...an inquiry just to clear the air and settle the facts of the case.
example.tran: 一项只为消除疑团并弄清案件事实而进行的调查

collins.tran: 大模大样;摆架子;装腔作势
collins.def: If you refer to someone's airs and graces, you mean that they behave in a way that shows that they think they are more important than other people.

example.ex: The old cliché of the customer being always right is what gives them airs and graces.
example.tran: “顾客总是对的”这种陈词滥调让他们变得趾高气扬。

collins.def: If something is in the air it is felt to be present, but it is not talked about.

example.ex: There was great excitement in the air...
example.tran: 人人都感到无比激动。

example.ex: She walked away and left the question hanging in the air.
example.tran: 她走开了，将疑问留在人们心里。

collins.tran: 播送（广播、电视节目）；（广播、电视节目）播放/停止播放
collins.def: If someone is on the air, they are broadcasting on radio or television. If a programme is on the air, it is being broadcast on radio or television. If it is off the air, it is not being broadcast.

example.ex: She is going on the air as presenter of a new show...
example.tran: 她即将上电视主持一档新节目。

example.ex: Rockwell hopes the program can be on the air within a year...
example.tran: 罗克韦尔希望该节目能在一年内播出。

collins.tran: （消失得）无影无踪/突然神秘地（出现）
collins.def: If someone or something disappears into thin air, they disappear completely. If someone or something appears out of thin air, they appear suddenly and mysteriously.

example.ex: 'But where could they have gone?' he demanded. 'They can't just vanish into thin air!'...
example.tran: “但是他们可能去哪里呢？”他追问道，“他们不可能就神秘消失了!”

example.ex: He had materialized out of thin air; I had not seen or heard him coming.
example.tran: 他突然间神秘地出现了；我既没看见他来，也没听见他的脚步声。

collins.def: If you say that a decision or a situation is up in the air, you mean that it has not yet been completely settled or planned.

example.ex: He told reporters today that the president's trip to Moscow is up in the air.
example.tran: 今天他告诉记者们总统是否前往莫斯科尚未确定。

collins.def: If you say that you are walking on air or floating on air, you mean that you feel extremely happy about something.

example.ex: As soon as I know I'm in the team it's like I'm walking on air.
example.tran: 一得知我加入了这个队，我高兴得像飞上了天。

means: [常与my, your, his, her等连用]（某人）所有的一切

collins.def: You use all to indicate that you are referring to the whole of a particular group or thing or to everyone or everything of a particular kind.

example.ex: ...the restaurant that Hugh and all his friends go to...
example.tran: 休和他所有的朋友都光顾的餐馆

example.ex: He lost all his money at a blackjack table in Las Vegas.
example.tran: 在拉斯维加斯的21点纸牌桌上，他把钱输得精光。

collins.def: You use all to refer to the whole of a particular period of time.

example.ex: George had to cut grass all afternoon...
example.tran: 乔治整个下午都得割草。

example.ex: She's been feeling bad all week.
example.tran: 她整整一周都感觉很糟糕。

collins.def: You use all to refer to a situation or to life in general.

example.ex: All is silent on the island now...
example.tran: 此时岛上一片沉寂。

example.ex: As you'll have read in our news pages, all has not been well of late.
example.tran: 正如你会从我们的新闻版面中看到的一样，最近一切都不太顺利。

collins.tran: （用于强调真实性或普遍性）完全，遍及，一直
collins.def: You use all to emphasize that something is completely true, or happens everywhere or always, or on every occasion.

example.ex: He loves animals and he knows all about them...
example.tran: 他热爱动物并且对它们了如指掌。

example.ex: Parts for the aircraft will be made all round the world...
example.tran: 这架飞机的部件将在世界各地制造。

collins.tran: （用于句首表示强调某事的唯一重要性）一切，全部
collins.def: You use all at the beginning of a clause when you are emphasizing that something is the only thing that is important.

example.ex: He said all that remained was to agree to a time and venue...
example.tran: 他说剩下的只是商定一个时间和集会地点。

example.ex: All you ever want to do is go shopping!...
example.tran: 你想做的事就只是去购物！

collins.tran: (表示强调）非常真诚/极有可能
collins.def: You use all in expressions such as in all sincerity and in all probability to emphasize that you are being sincere or that something is very likely.

example.ex: In all fairness he had to admit that she was neither dishonest nor lazy...
example.tran: 公正地说，他必须承认她既没有作假也没有偷懒。

example.ex: If the pool was open, we'd in all probability still be swimming in it...
example.tran: 如果游泳池还开着，我们完全可能还在里面游泳。

collins.tran: （用于形容词前，强调暂时的一种特征）
collins.def: You can use all in front of an adjective when you want to emphasize a quality that affects someone or something temporarily.

example.ex: You've gone all chatty...
example.tran: 你变得真唠叨。

example.ex: He came over all dizzy when he stood up.
example.tran: 他一站起身就觉得天旋地转。

collins.tran: （球赛等双方得分相等时）每人，各（如three all为“三平”）
collins.def: You use all when you are talking about an equal score in a game. For example, if the score is three all, both players or teams have three points.

collins.tran: （用于all the more, all the better等结构中）更加，愈加
collins.def: All is used in structures such as all the more or all the better to mean even more or even better than before.

example.ex: The living room is decorated in pale colours that make it all the more airy...
example.tran: 起居室装饰成淡雅的颜色，显得更加宽敞明亮。

example.ex: 'How are you?' —'All the better for seeing you.'
example.tran: “你好吗？”—“好，看见你更好了。”

collins.def: You use all in expressions such as seen it all and done it all to emphasize that someone has had a lot of experience of something.

example.ex: ...women who have it all: career, husband and children...
example.tran: 拥有一切的女性：事业、丈夫和孩子

example.ex: Here's a man who has seen it all, tasted and heard it all.
example.tran: 这是一个已经见闻过世间万象、尝尽人间百味的人。

collins.def: You say above all to indicate that the thing you are mentioning is the most important point.

example.ex: Above all, chairs should be comfortable...
example.tran: 椅子首先应该舒适。

example.ex: Social services departments must accept, above all, the role of the parents.
example.tran: 社会服务部门必须认可的，首先是父母的角色。

collins.def: You use after all when introducing a statement which supports or helps explain something you have just said.

example.ex: I thought you might know somebody. After all, you're the man with connections.
example.tran: 我以为你可能认识某个重要人物。毕竟你交游甚广。

collins.def: You use after all when you are saying that something that you thought might not be the case is in fact the case.

example.ex: I came out here on the chance of finding you at home after all...
example.tran: 我到这儿来就想碰碰运气，没想到你居然真的在家。

example.ex: The Social Democrats say they are ready after all to begin talks on joining a coalition government.
example.tran: 社会民主党人竟然说他们准备开始谈判加入联合政府了。

collins.def: You use and all when you want to emphasize that what you are talking about includes the thing mentioned, especially when this is surprising or unusual.

example.ex: He dropped his sausage on the pavement and someone's dog ate it, mustard and all.
example.tran: 他把香肠丢在人行道上，不知是谁家的狗将香肠甚至连带芥末都吃个了精光。

collins.tran: 总的说来；从各方面来说；总之
collins.def: You use all in all to introduce a summary or general statement.

example.ex: We both thought that all in all it might not be a bad idea...
example.tran: 我们两人都认为总的说来它或许不是个坏主意。

example.ex: All in all, it appeared that a pretty depressing summer awaited Jones.
example.tran: 总之，等待琼斯的似乎是一个相当令人沮丧的夏天。

collins.tran: （用于否定句、条件句、疑问句等的句末）全然，一点，根本，究竟
collins.def: You use at all at the end of a clause to give emphasis in negative statements, conditional clauses, and questions.

example.ex: Robin never really liked him at all...
example.tran: 罗宾从未真正喜欢过他。

example.ex: There were no roads at all...
example.tran: 那儿根本没有公路。

collins.def: All but a particular person or thing means everyone or everything except that person or thing.

example.ex: The general was an unattractive man to all but his most ardent admirers...
example.tran: 除了他那些铁杆崇拜者外，这位将军对于其他人并无吸引力。

example.ex: The plant will stand all but the worst winters out of doors.
example.tran: 除了最严寒的冬季，这种植物都能在户外生长。

collins.def: You use all but to say that something is almost the case.

example.ex: The concrete wall that used to divide this city has now all but gone...
example.tran: 曾经将这座城市分隔开的混凝土墙现在已几乎不复存在。

example.ex: He has been all but forgotten.
example.tran: 他几乎已被人遗忘。

collins.def: You use for all to indicate that the thing mentioned does not affect or contradict the truth of what you are saying.

example.ex: For all its faults, the film instantly became a classic.
example.tran: 尽管有缺陷，这部电影还是迅速成为了一部经典作品。

collins.tran: （用于强调）我可不知道/他才不在乎呢
collins.def: You use for all in phrases such as for all I know, and for all he cares, to emphasize that you do not know something or that someone does not care about something.

example.ex: For all we know, he may even not be in this country...
example.tran: 说不定他或许都已不在这个国家了。

example.ex: You can go right now for all I care.
example.tran: 你可以马上走，我才不在乎呢。

collins.def: If you give your all or put your all into something, you make the maximum effort possible.

example.ex: He puts his all into every game.
example.tran: 每次比赛他都全力以赴。

collins.def: In all means in total.

example.ex: In all some 15 million people live in the selected areas...
example.tran: 总共有大概1,500万人住在所选定的区域内。

example.ex: There was evidence that thirteen people in all had taken part in planning the murder.
example.tran: 有证据表明共计13人参与策划了这起谋杀。

collins.def: If you say that you are all in, you mean that you are extremely tired.

example.ex: 'Have you eaten? — You look all in!'
example.tran: “你吃饭了吗？——你看上去累坏了！”

collins.def: If something such as an activity is a particular price all in, that price includes everything that is offered.

example.ex: Dinner is about £25 all in.
example.tran: 正餐价格什么都算上大约为25英镑。

collins.tran: （用于强调first, last或最高级形容词或副词）最，最为
collins.def: You use of all to emphasize the words 'first' or 'last', or a superlative adjective or adverb.

example.ex: First of all, answer these questions...
example.tran: 首先，回答这些问题。

example.ex: Now she faces her toughest task of all.
example.tran: 现在她面临着最艰巨的任务。

collins.tran: 在所有的人(或事物）中偏偏
collins.def: You use of all in expressions such as of all people or of all things when you want to emphasize someone or something surprising.

example.ex: They met and fell in love in a supermarket, of all places.
example.tran: 那么多地方，他们偏偏就在超市里相遇并相爱了。

collins.tran: （用于对他人的言行表示愤怒或吃惊）真不要脸/运气真好
collins.def: You use all in expressions like of all the cheek or of all the luck to emphasize how angry or surprised you are at what someone else has done or said.

example.ex: Of all the lazy, indifferent, unbusinesslike attitudes to have!
example.tran: 这是多么懒惰、冷漠、不敬业的态度！

collins.def: You use all of before a number to emphasize how small or large an amount is.

example.ex: It took him all of 41 minutes to score his first goal...
example.tran: 足足过了41分钟他才进了第一个球。

example.ex: I'm just checking up on Kim. It'll take me all of five minutes.
example.tran: 我只是要督促一下金，总共也就需要5分钟。

collins.def: One and all means everyone present or everyone in a particular group.

example.ex: Being in charge of the National Health Service reforms did not endear him to one and all.
example.tran: 负责国民医疗服务制度改革并未使得所有人都喜欢他。

collins.tran: （用于否定句中削弱语气）那么
collins.def: You use all that in statements with negative meaning when you want to weaken the force of what you are saying.

example.ex: He wasn't all that older than we were...
example.tran: 他并不真比我们老多少。

example.ex: He said it would not be all that difficult to reach a peaceful conclusion to the conflict.
example.tran: 他说和平解决这一冲突并不会太困难。

collins.tran: 没别的了；就是这么回事
collins.def: You can say that's all at the end of a sentence when you are explaining something and want to emphasize that nothing more happens or is the case.

example.ex: 'Why do you want to know that?' he demanded.—'Just curious, that's all.'
example.tran: “你为什么想知道那件事？”他问道。——“只是好奇，仅此而已。”

example.ex: 'I had no desire to be a mother — I had a child, that's all.'
example.tran: “我不渴望当妈妈，我有一个孩子了，如此而已。”

collins.def: You use all very well to suggest that you do not really approve of something or you think that it is unreasonable.

example.ex: It is all very well to urge people to give more to charity when they have less, but is it really fair?
example.tran: 鼓励那些自身并不富裕的人更多地投身慈善事业固然没错，但这么做真的公平吗？

collins.def: If someone is allowed to do something, it is all right for them to do it and they will not get into trouble.

example.ex: The children are not allowed to watch violent TV programmes...
example.tran: 儿童不准收看含暴力内容的电视节目。

example.ex: The Government will allow them to advertise on radio and television...
example.tran: 政府将准许他们在广播和电视上做广告。

collins.def: If you are allowed something, you are given permission to have it or are given it.

example.ex: Gifts like chocolates or flowers are allowed...
example.tran: 巧克力、鲜花等礼物在允许之列。

example.ex: He should be allowed the occasional treat.
example.tran: 应该准许他偶尔也轻松一下。

collins.def: If you allow something to happen, you do not prevent it.

example.ex: He won't allow himself to fail...
example.tran: 他不会任由自己失败的。

example.ex: If the soil is allowed to dry out the tree could die.
example.tran: 如果听任土壤变干，树木可能会枯死。

collins.def: If one thing allows another thing to happen, the first thing creates the opportunity for the second thing to happen.

example.ex: The compromise will allow him to continue his free market reforms.
example.tran: 妥协将使他得以继续他的自由市场改革。

example.ex: ...an attempt to allow the Moslem majority a greater share of power...
example.tran: 使穆斯林多数派拥有更大权力的尝试

collins.def: If you allow a particular length of time or a particular amount of something for a particular purpose, you include it in your planning.

example.ex: Please allow 28 days for delivery...
example.tran: 请留出28天的送货时间。

example.ex: Allow about 75ml (3fl oz) per six servings.
example.tran: 每6份酌加约75毫升(3液盎司)。

collins.def: If you allow that something is true, you admit or agree that it is true.

example.ex: Warren also allows that capitalist development may, in its early stages, result in increased social inequality.
example.tran: 沃伦也承认资本主义发展初级阶段可能会导致社会不平等现象加剧。

collins.tran: 请允许我（用以礼貌地表示为某人提供服务）
collins.def: Some people say 'Allow me' as a polite way of offering to do something for someone.

example.ex: Allow me to buy you a drink at the bar.
example.tran: 让我来请你喝一杯。

collins.tran: 请允许我（用以引出要说的话）
collins.def: Some people use Allow me to... as a way of introducing something that they want to say or do.

example.ex: Allow me to introduce Dr Amberg.
example.tran: 请允许我介绍安伯格博士。

collins.def: You use almost to indicate that something is not completely the case but is nearly the case.

example.ex: The couple had been dating for almost three years...
example.tran: 这对情侣相恋已近3年。

example.ex: Storms have been hitting almost all of Britain recently...
example.tran: 最近几乎整个英国都受到了暴风雨的侵袭。

collins.def: If you move or look along something such as a road, you move or look towards one end of it.

example.ex: Newman walked along the street alone...
example.tran: 纽曼独自走在街上。

example.ex: The young man led Mark Ryle along a corridor...
example.tran: 那个年轻人领着马克·赖尔沿走廊而去。

collins.def: If something is situated along a road, river, or corridor, it is situated in it or beside it.

example.ex: ...enormous traffic jams all along the roads.
example.tran: 马路上严重的交通阻塞

example.ex: ...houses built on piles along the river...
example.tran: 沿河打桩盖的房子

collins.def: When someone or something moves along, they keep moving in a particular direction.

example.ex: She skipped and danced along...
example.tran: 她蹦蹦跳跳地往前走着。

example.ex: He raised his voice a little, talking into the wind as they walked along...
example.tran: 他们往前走时，他略微提高了嗓音，迎着风说话。

collins.def: If you say that something is going along in a particular way, you mean that it is progressing in that way.

example.ex: ...the negotiations which have been dragging along interminably...
example.tran: 一直在无休止拖延的谈判

example.ex: Everything was coming along fine after all...
example.tran: 一切居然进行得很顺利。

collins.def: If you take someone or something along when you go somewhere, you take them with you.

example.ex: This is open to women of all ages, so bring along your friends and colleagues...
example.tran: 这对所有年龄段的女性开放，所以请带上你的朋友和同事一起光临。

example.ex: Wives will have to bring along their marriage certificate.
example.tran: 已婚妇女必须携带结婚证。

collins.def: If someone or something is coming along or is sent along, they are coming or being sent to a particular place.

example.ex: She invited everyone she knew to come along...
example.tran: 她邀请了每一个她认识的人前来。

example.ex: He had the material tested and sent along the results.
example.tran: 他对材料做了检验并送出了检验结果。

collins.def: You use along with to mention someone or something else that is also involved in an action or situation.

example.ex: The baby's mother escaped from the fire along with two other children...
example.tran: 婴儿的母亲和另外两个孩子一起逃离了火海。

example.ex: There are 32 different kinds of chocolate on sale along with the bread and cakes.
example.tran: 有32种不同的巧克力与面包和蛋糕一起出售。

collins.def: If something has been true or been present all along, it has been true or been present throughout a period of time.

example.ex: I've been fooling myself all along...
example.tran: 我一直在欺骗自己。

example.ex: I think she had been planning all along to leave Hungary.
example.tran: 我想她一直在计划离开匈牙利。

collins.tran: 已经（用already时，英国英语中动词用完成时态，美国英语有时则用一般过去时）
collins.def: You use already to show that something has happened, or that something had happened before the moment you are referring to. Speakers of British English use already with a verb in a perfect tense, putting it after 'have', 'has', or 'had', or at the end of a clause. Some speakers of American English use already with the simple past tense of the verb instead of a perfect tense.

example.ex: They had already voted for him at the first ballot...
example.tran: 在第一次投票选举时，他们已经投票给他了。

example.ex: The group has already shed 10,000 jobs...
example.tran: 该集团已经裁去1万个工作岗位。

collins.tran: 早已（用于be动词或助动词之后，或一般动词之前，表示强调时可置于句首）
collins.def: You use already to show that a situation exists at this present moment or that it exists at an earlier time than expected. You use already after the verb 'be' or an auxiliary verb, or before a verb if there is no auxiliary. When you want add emphasis, you can put already at the beginning of a sentence.

example.ex: The authorities believe those security measures are already paying off...
example.tran: 当局相信那些安全措施已经奏效。

example.ex: He was already rich...
example.tran: 他已经很富有了。

collins.def: You can use also to give more information about a person or thing, or to add another relevant fact.

example.ex: It is the work of Ivor Roberts-Jones, who also produced the statue of Churchill in Parliament Square...
example.tran: 这是艾弗·罗伯茨-琼斯的作品，他还创作了议会广场上的丘吉尔塑像。

example.ex: He is an asthmatic who was also anaemic...
example.tran: 他是个曾患贫血症的哮喘患者。

collins.def: You can use also to indicate that something you have just said about one person or thing is true of another person or thing.

example.ex: His father, also a top-ranking officer, had perished during the war...
example.tran: 他的父亲，也是位高级军官，在战争中牺牲了。

example.ex: We have been working very hard, and our families have also worked hard...
example.tran: 我们一直很努力工作，并且我们的家人也是如此。

collins.def: You use although to introduce a subordinate clause which contains a statement which contrasts with the statement in the main clause.

example.ex: Although he is known to only a few, his reputation among them is very great...
example.tran: 虽然知道他的人不多，但他在这些人中名声却很响。

example.ex: Although the shooting has stopped for now, the destruction left behind is enormous.
example.tran: 虽然枪战目前已停止，但造成的破坏是巨大的。

collins.tran: 虽然（表示惊奇或出乎意料）
collins.def: You use although to introduce a subordinate clause which contains a statement which makes the main clause of the sentence seem surprising or unexpected.

example.ex: Although I was only six, I can remember seeing it on TV...
example.tran: 虽然那时我只有6岁，我依然记得在电视上见过它。

example.ex: Although he was twice as old as us, he became the life and soul of the company.
example.tran: 虽然他的年纪是我们的两倍，但他却成为了公司的灵魂人物。

collins.def: You use although to introduce a subordinate clause which gives some information that is relevant to the main clause but modifies the strength of that statement.

example.ex: He was in love with her, although he did not put that name to it.
example.tran: 他爱着她，虽然他没有将其称为爱。

collins.tran: 尽管;虽然（表示承认所述是事实）
collins.def: You use although when admitting a fact about something which you regard as less important than a contrasting fact.

example.ex: Although they're expensive, they last forever and never go out of style...
example.tran: 尽管价格昂贵，但它们经久耐用，永不过时。

example.ex: Although not ideal, this attitude is not entirely destructive.
example.tran: 这种态度虽然不够理想，但还不至于消极透顶。

collins.tran: 总是；每次都是；无例外地
collins.def: If you always do something, you do it whenever a particular situation occurs. If you always did something, you did it whenever a particular situation occurred.

example.ex: Whenever I get into a relationship, I always fall madly in love...
example.tran: 我每次谈恋爱都深陷其中，无法自拔。

example.ex: She's always late for everything...
example.tran: 她事事都迟到。

collins.def: If something is always the case, was always the case, or will always be the case, it is, was, or will be the case all the time, continuously.

example.ex: We will always remember his generous hospitality...
example.tran: 我们将永远记得他的慷慨好客。

example.ex: He has always been the family solicitor...
example.tran: 他一直做家庭事务律师。

collins.def: If you say that something is always happening, especially something which annoys you, you mean that it happens repeatedly.

example.ex: She was always moving things around.
example.tran: 她老是将东西搬来搬去。

collins.tran: （用于提出建议或提示其他解决方法）总还，总还是
collins.def: You use always in expressions such as can always or could always when you are making suggestions or suggesting an alternative approach or method.

example.ex: If you can't find any decent apples, you can always try growing them yourself...
example.tran: 如果你找不到像样的苹果，你总还可以试着自己种。

example.ex: 'What are you going to do?' — 'I don't know. I could always go back in the Navy or something.'
example.tran: “你打算做什么？”——“不知道，我总还是能回到海军或者什么的。”

collins.def: You can say that someone always was, for example, awkward or lucky to indicate that you are not surprised about what they are doing or have just done.

example.ex: She's going to be fine. She always was pretty strong...
example.tran: 她会好的。她一直都很强壮。

example.ex: You always were a good friend.
example.tran: 你从来都是我的好朋友。

collins.def: Someone or something that is situated or moving among a group of things or people is surrounded by them.

example.ex: ...youths in their late teens sitting among adults...
example.tran: 坐在成人中间的15到19岁之间的小伙子
