example.ex: They walked among the crowds in Red Square.
example.tran: 他们在熙熙攘攘的红场散步。

collins.tran: 与…在一起;在…的集体之中
collins.def: If you are among people of a particular kind, you are with them and having contact with them.

example.ex: Things weren't so bad, after all. I was among friends again...
example.tran: 情况还不是那么糟糕，毕竟我又回到了朋友当中。

example.ex: I was brought up among people who read and wrote a lot.
example.tran: 我周围是些经常读书写文章的人，我是在他们的熏陶下长大的。

collins.def: If someone or something is among a group, they are a member of that group and share its characteristics.

example.ex: A fifteen year old girl was among the injured...
example.tran: 受伤者中有一位15岁的女孩。

example.ex: Also among the speakers was the new American ambassador to Moscow.
example.tran: 发言者当中还有驻莫斯科的新任美国大使。

collins.def: If you want to focus on something that is happening within a particular group of people, you can say that it is happening among that group.

example.ex: Homicide is the leading cause of death among black men...
example.tran: 谋杀是黑人死亡的主要原因。

example.ex: Unemployment is quite high, especially among young people.
example.tran: 失业情况相当严重，特别是在年轻人当中。

collins.def: If something happens among a group of people, it happens within the whole of that group or between the members of that group.

example.ex: The calls for reform come as intense debate continues among the leadership over the next five-year economic plan...
example.tran: 领导层继续在为下一个五年经济计划激烈争论之际，有人发出了改革的呼声。

example.ex: I am sick of all the quarrelling among politicians who should be concentrating on vital issues.
example.tran: 我厌恶政客间的所有那些争吵，他们本应把注意力集中在重大问题上。

collins.tran: 对…中的大多数成员而论；据…的普遍看法
collins.def: If something such as a feeling, opinion, or situation exists among a group of people, most of them have it or experience it.

example.ex: The biggest fear among parents thinking of using the Internet is that their children will be exposed to pornography...
example.tran: 大多数父母认为使用因特网最可怕的是他们的孩子将接触到色情内容。

example.ex: The resort is popular among ski enthusiasts.
example.tran: 这个度假地深受滑雪爱好者的喜爱。

collins.def: You use among before a noun to mention a group when talking about a smaller group within it.

example.ex: Among those 18 and over, 510,000 benefit claimants were not unemployed...
example.tran: 18岁及以上人群当中，有51万救济金申领者并非是失业者。

example.ex: Among the varieties available, my preference stays with the old and lovely pink-flowered variety, 'Apple Blossom'.
example.tran: 可供选择的品种当中，我还是偏好这种老式、可爱、带有粉色花朵的类型，“苹果花”。

collins.def: If something applies to a particular person or thing among others, it also applies to other people or things.

example.ex: ...a news conference attended among others by our foreign affairs correspondent...
example.tran: 由我们的外事记者及其他许多人共同出席的一次新闻发布会

example.ex: She knew many theatrical personalities and had worked, among others, with George Bernard Shaw.
example.tran: 她认识许多戏剧界人物，并与乔治·萧伯纳等很多人共过事。

collins.def: If something is shared among a number of people, some of it is given to all of them.

example.ex: Most of the furniture was left to the neighbours or distributed among friends...
example.tran: 大多数家具留给了邻居或分发给了朋友们。

example.ex: She tried to ensure her affection was equally shared among all three children.
example.tran: 她尽力确保三个孩子从自己这里分享到同等的爱。

collins.tran: 在…内部（谈论、争斗或达成一致）
collins.def: If people talk, fight, or agree among themselves, they do it together, without involving anyone else.

example.ex: European farm ministers disagree among themselves...
example.tran: 欧洲各国的农业部长之间意见不一致。

example.ex: The directors have been arguing among themselves.
example.tran: 经理们内部一直争论不休。

collins.tran: （连接两个以上的单词、词组或子句）和，与，同
collins.def: You use and to link two or more words, groups, or clauses.

example.ex: When he returned, she and Simon had already gone...
example.tran: 他回来时，她和西蒙已经走了。

example.ex: Between 1914 and 1920 large parts of Albania were occupied by the Italians...
example.tran: 在1914年至1920年间阿尔巴尼亚的大部分地区被意大利人占据。

collins.tran: （连接两个相同的单词或短语，以强调某事物的程度、暗示某事继续发生或在一段时间内不断增加）接连，越…越…
collins.def: You use and to link two words or phrases that are the same in order to emphasize the degree of something, or to suggest that something continues or increases over a period of time.

example.ex: Learning becomes more and more difficult as we get older...
example.tran: 随着年龄增长，学习变得越来越难。

example.ex: Day by day I am getting better and better...
example.tran: 我在一天天地好转。

collins.tran: （连接两件相继发生的事件）然后，就
collins.def: You use and to link two statements about events when one of the events follows the other.

example.ex: I waved goodbye and went down the stone harbour steps...
example.tran: 我挥手告别，然后走下港口石阶。

example.ex: He asked for ice for his whiskey and proceeded to get drunk.
example.tran: 他要求给他的威士忌里面加冰，接着喝得大醉。

collins.tran: （连接两句话，第二句话的意思是第一句的延伸）则，而
collins.def: You use and to link two statements when the second statement continues the point that has been made in the first statement.

example.ex: You could only really tell the effects of the disease in the long term, and five years wasn't long enough...
example.tran: 真的，这种病只能在很久以后才能看出它的影响，而5年的时间还不够长。

example.ex: The cure for bad teaching is good teachers, and good teachers cost money.
example.tran: 解决教学质量差的办法就是请好的教师，但请好的教师是需要花钱的。

collins.tran: （连接两个从句，表示因果关系）那么，于是
collins.def: You use and to link two clauses when the second clause is a result of the first clause.

example.ex: All through yesterday crowds have been arriving and by midnight thousands of people packed the square.
example.tran: 昨天陆续有大批人到来，午夜时有几千人聚集在广场上。

collins.tran: （表示停顿，以便对所说的话进行评论）再说，而
collins.def: You use and to interrupt yourself in order to make a comment on what you are saying.

example.ex: As Downing claims, and as we noted above, reading is best established when the child has an intimate knowledge of the language...
example.tran: 如唐宁所说，也正如我们前文所指出的，当孩子对语言非常熟悉时，阅读的效果最佳。

example.ex: Finally — and I really ought to stop in a minute — I wish to make the following recommendations.
example.tran: 最后——我确实应该停一下——我想作以下推荐。

collins.tran: （用于句首，引出补充说明）还有，不过
collins.def: You use and at the beginning of a sentence to introduce something else that you want to add to what you have just said. Some people think that starting a sentence with and is ungrammatical, but it is now quite common in both spoken and written English.

example.ex: Commuter airlines fly to out-of-the-way places. And business travelers are the ones who go to those locations.
example.tran: 支线航空公司航班飞往偏僻地区。商务旅客就是会前往那些地区的人。

collins.tran: （用以引导与某人之谈话有关的问句）那么，还有
collins.def: You use and to introduce a question which follows logically from what someone has just said.

example.ex: 'He used to be so handsome.' — 'And now?'...
example.tran: “他以前是那么英俊。”——“那么现在呢？”

example.ex: 'Well, of course, they haven't won a football game.' — 'And what would you expect?'.
example.tran: “嗯，当然，他们一场足球比赛也没有赢过。”——“那么你所期望的是什么呢？”

collins.tran: （广播员等用以转换话题或讨论刚才提及的话题）也
collins.def: And is used by broadcasters and people making announcements to change a topic or to start talking about a topic they have just mentioned.

example.ex: And now the drought in Sudan...
example.tran: 现在苏丹也有旱情。

example.ex: Football, and Aston Villa will reclaim their lead at the top of the English First Division.
example.tran: 来看足球，阿斯顿维拉队将在英格兰甲级联赛重登榜首。

collins.def: You use and to indicate that two numbers are to be added together.

example.ex: What does two and two make?
example.tran: 2加2等于几？

collins.def: And is used before a fraction that comes after a whole number.

example.ex: McCain spent five and a half years in a prisoner of war camp in Vietnam.
example.tran: 麦凯恩在越南的战俘营里度过了5年半的时间。

example.ex: ...fourteen and a quarter per cent.

collins.tran: （用在大于一百的数字中，置于百位或千位之后，十位及个位之前）
collins.def: You use and in numbers larger than one hundred, after the words 'hundred' or 'thousand' and before other numbers.

example.ex: We printed two hundred and fifty invitations.
example.tran: 我们印了250份请柬。

example.ex: ...three thousand and twenty-six pounds.

collins.def: If you announce something, you tell people about it publicly or officially.

example.ex: He will announce tonight that he is resigning from office...
example.tran: 他将于今晚宣布辞职。

example.ex: She was planning to announce her engagement to Peter...
example.tran: 她正计划宣布她和彼得订婚一事。

collins.tran: 大声宣告，郑重地说（尤指令人不快之事）
collins.def: If you announce a piece of news or an intention, especially something that people may not like, you say it loudly and clearly, so that everyone you are with can hear it.

example.ex: Peter announced that he had no intention of wasting his time at any university...
example.tran: 彼得宣称他无意在任何一所大学浪费时间。

example.ex: 'I'm having a bath and going to bed,' she announced, and left the room.
example.tran: “我要洗个澡然后上床睡觉，”她大声说完便离开了房间。

collins.tran: （机场或火车站工作人员通过扬声器）播报，通知
collins.def: If an airport or railway employee announces something, they tell the public about it by means of a loudspeaker system.

example.ex: Station staff announced the arrival of the train over the tannoy...
example.tran: 车站工作人员通过广播告知火车到站了。

example.ex: They announced his plane was delayed.
example.tran: 广播通知他所乘的航班晚点了。

collins.tran: （以信件、声音、信号等）通知，告知
collins.def: If a letter, sound, or sign announces something, it informs people about it.

example.ex: The next letter announced the birth of another boy...
example.tran: 下一封信通知又一个男孩出生了。

example.ex: His entrance was announced by a buzzer connected to the door.
example.tran: 他刚一进去，与门相连的门铃便嗡嗡作响。

collins.tran: （仆人）通报，宣布（膳食备齐或来宾到达）
collins.def: If a meal or a guest is announced by a servant at a formal party, the servant says clearly that the meal is ready or the guest has arrived.

example.ex: Dinner was announced, and served.
example.tran: 已宣布开饭了，菜都上齐了。

collins.tran: （同类事物中的）另一个，再一个
collins.def: Another thing or person means an additional thing or person of the same type as one that already exists.

example.ex: Mrs. Madrigal buttered another piece of toast...
example.tran: 马德里加尔夫人给另一片烤面包涂上了黄油。

example.ex: We're going to have another baby.
example.tran: 我们又要有一个孩子。

collins.def: You use another when you want to emphasize that an additional thing or person is different to one that already exists.

example.ex: I think he's just going to deal with this problem another day...
example.tran: 我想他改天就会处理这个问题。

example.ex: The counsellor referred her to another therapist.
example.tran: 咨询指导让她去看另一位治疗专家。

collins.def: You use another at the beginning of a statement to link it to a previous statement.

example.ex: Another time of great excitement for us boys was when war broke out...
example.tran: 对我们男孩子来说另一个极度刺激的时刻是战争爆发。

example.ex: Another change that Sue made was to install central heating.
example.tran: 休所作的另一个改变是安装中央供暖系统。

collins.tran: （用在距离、时间段或其他量词之前）又…的，再…的
collins.def: You use another before a word referring to a distance, length of time, or other amount, to indicate an additional amount.

example.ex: Continue down the same road for another 2 kilometres until you reach the church of Santa Maria...
example.tran: 沿同一条路再往前走两公里，直至到达圣马丽亚教堂。

example.ex: He believes prices will not rise by more than another 4 per cent.
example.tran: 他认为物价涨幅不会再超过4个百分点。

collins.tran: （用于有名的人物、地点或事件前表示与其类似的）另一个…，类似…的
collins.def: You use another in front of the name of a well-known person, place, or event to indicate that you think someone or something is just like that person, place, or event.

example.ex: You may never be another Hemingway, but you can learn to write well.
example.tran: 你可能成不了第二个海明威，但你可以练就一手好文笔。

collins.def: You use one another to indicate that each member of a group does something to or for the other members.

example.ex: ...women learning to help themselves and one another...
example.tran: 学着自助和互助的妇女们

example.ex: The two countries do little trade with one another.
example.tran: 两国之间很少有贸易往来。

collins.def: If you talk about one thing after another, you are referring to a series of repeated or continuous events.

example.ex: They had faced one difficulty after another with bravery and dedication...
example.tran: 他们以无畏和无私奉献的精神迎接了一个又一个的困难。

example.ex: They kept going, destroying one store after another.
example.tran: 他们并未停手，摧毁了一家又一家商店。

collins.tran: （表示不确指）各种不同的，各种各样的
collins.def: You use or another in expressions such as one kind or another when you do not want to be precise about which of several alternatives or possibilities you are referring to.

example.ex: ...family members and visiting artists of one kind or another crowding the huge kitchen...
example.tran: 聚集在这个宽敞厨房里的家庭成员和来访的各类艺术家

example.ex: All of these industries have at one time or another been linked to cancer.
example.tran: 所有这些产业都曾在不同时期与癌症有过联系。

collins.def: When you answer someone who has asked you something, you say something back to them.

example.ex: I knew Ben was lying when he answered me...
example.tran: 我知道本回答我时在撒谎。

example.ex: Just answer the question...
example.tran: 只回答问题。

collins.def: An answer is something that you say when you answer someone.

example.ex: Without waiting for an answer, he turned and went in through the door...
example.tran: 未等答复，他就转身进了门。

example.ex: I don't quite know what to say in answer to your question.
example.tran: 我不太清楚如何回答你的问题。

collins.tran: 接受反对意见;接受拒绝
collins.def: If you say that someone will not take no for an answer, you mean that they go on trying to make you agree to something even after you have refused.

example.ex: She is tough, unwilling to take no for an answer...
example.tran: 她很强硬，不达目的誓不罢休。

example.ex: He would never take no for an answer.
example.tran: 他从来都坚持己见。

collins.def: If you answer a letter or advertisement, you write to the person who wrote it.

example.ex: Did he answer your letter?...
example.tran: 他给你回信了吗？

example.ex: She answered an advert for a job as a cook.
example.tran: 她看到一则招聘厨师的广告后写信应征。

collins.def: An answer is a letter that you write to someone who has written to you.

example.ex: I wrote to him but I never had an answer back...
example.tran: 我写了信给他，但一直没收到回信。

example.ex: She wrote to Roosevelt's secretary in answer to his letter of the day before.
example.tran: 她写了信给罗斯福的秘书，回复罗斯福前一天的来信。

collins.def: When you answer the telephone, you pick it up when it rings. When you answer the door, you open it when you hear a knock or the bell.

example.ex: She answered her phone on the first ring...
example.tran: 电话刚一响，她就接了。

example.ex: A middle-aged woman answered the door.
example.tran: 一个中年妇女应声开了门。

collins.def: An answer to a problem is a solution to it.

example.ex: There are no easy answers to the problems facing the economy...
example.tran: 解决经济所面临的问题并非易事。

example.ex: Prison is not the answer for most young offenders...
example.tran: 就大多数年轻的犯法者来说，把他们关进监狱不是解决问题的办法。

collins.def: Someone's answer to a question in a test or quiz is what they write or say in an attempt to give the facts that are asked for. The answer to a question is the fact that was asked for.

example.ex: Simply marking an answer wrong will not help the pupil to get future examples correct...
example.tran: 仅仅在答案上打叉号不会有助于学生做对日后的题目。

example.ex: Below are printed the answers to the Brain of Soccer 1993 quiz.
example.tran: 以下所印的是1993年“脑力足球”小测验的答案。

collins.def: When you answer a question in a test or quiz, you write or say something in an attempt to give the facts that are asked for.

example.ex: To obtain her degree, she answered 81 questions over 10 papers.
example.tran: 为获得学位，她回答了10页纸上的81个问题。

collins.def: Your answer to something that someone has said or done is what you say or do in response to it or in defence of yourself.

example.ex: In answer to speculation that she wouldn't finish the race, she boldly declared her intention of winning it.
example.tran: 为了回应她会中途退赛的猜测，她大胆地宣布她要赢得这场比赛。

collins.def: If you answer something that someone has said or done, you respond to it.

example.ex: He answered her smile with one of his own...
example.tran: 他对她的微笑回以同礼。

example.ex: That statement seemed designed to answer criticism of allied bombing missions.
example.tran: 那份声明似乎是专门就联合轰炸任务的批评作出反击。

collins.tran: （某地）与…相似的东西，相当于…的东西
collins.def: If you say that something is a place's answer to a famous thing, you mean that the first thing is the equivalent of the second in that place.

example.ex: Cachaca is Brazil's answer to tequila.
example.tran: 巴西甜酒相当于是巴西的龙舌兰酒。

collins.tran: 满足，适合，符合（需要、目的）
collins.def: If something answers a need or purpose, it satisfies it, because it has the right qualities.

example.ex: We provide specially designed shopping trolleys to answer the needs of parents with young children.
example.tran: 我们提供特别设计的购物车，以满足带幼儿的父母的需要。

collins.def: If someone or something answers a particular description or answers to it, they have the characteristics described.

example.ex: Two men answering the description of the suspects tried to enter Switzerland...
example.tran: 与描述的疑犯样子相符的两名男子试图进入瑞士。

example.ex: The Japanese never built any aircraft remotely answering to this description.
example.tran: 日本人从未制造过与此描述有丝毫相近的飞机。

collins.tran: （用于否定句）一点，丝毫，若干，任何
collins.def: You use any in statements with negative meaning to indicate that no thing or person of a particular type exists, is present, or is involved in a situation.

example.ex: I never make any big decisions...
example.tran: 我从未作过任何重大决定。

example.ex: I'm not making any promises...
example.tran: 我不会作任何保证。

collins.tran: （用于疑问句或条件从句）若干，一点，什么，任何一个（或一些）
collins.def: You use any in questions and conditional clauses to ask whether there is some of a particular thing or some of a particular group of people, or to suggest that there might be.

example.ex: Do you speak any foreign languages?...
example.tran: 你会说外语吗？

example.ex: Are there any ladies in the audience?...
example.tran: 观众当中有女士吗？

collins.def: You use any in positive statements when you are referring to someone or something of a particular kind that might exist, occur, or be involved in a situation, when their exact identity or nature is not important.

example.ex: Any actor will tell you that it is easier to perform than to be themselves...
example.tran: 每一个演员都会告诉你演戏比做自己容易。

example.ex: I'm prepared to take any advice...
example.tran: 我愿意接受任何忠告。

collins.tran: （用于否定句中强调形容词或副词的比较级）任何，丝毫，略微，多少
collins.def: You can also use any to emphasize a comparative adjective or adverb in a negative statement.

example.ex: I can't see things getting any easier for graduates...
example.tran: 我没看出毕业生的境遇有丝毫好转。

example.ex: Anne's not getting any younger.
example.tran: 安妮一点没有变年轻。

collins.def: If you say that someone or something is not just any person or thing, you mean that they are special in some way.

example.ex: Finzer is not just any East Coast businessman...
example.tran: 芬泽不是个普通的东海岸生意人。

example.ex: It's fashionable for young people to wear trainers, but not just any trainers.
example.tran: 年轻人穿旅游鞋很时尚，但不是说所有的旅游鞋都如此。

collins.def: If something does not happen or is not true any more or any longer, it has stopped happening or is no longer true.

example.ex: I don't want to see her any more...
example.tran: 我不想再见到她。

example.ex: We felt we had no home any more, no family, nothing...
example.tran: 我们觉得我们没有了家，也没有了家人，一无所有。

means: （用于否定句、疑问句中以及 if 或 whether 和 prevent、ban、avoid 等动词后，代替 something）任何东西

collins.tran: （用于否定句）任何事物，什么事情
collins.def: You use anything in statements with negative meaning to indicate in a general way that nothing is present or that an action or event does not or cannot happen.

example.ex: We can't do anything...
example.tran: 我们什么都做不了。

example.ex: Dad sat, not saying anything...
example.tran: 爸爸坐着，一声不吭。

collins.tran: （用于疑问句或条件从句）任何事物，任何事情
collins.def: You use anything in questions and conditional clauses to ask or talk about whether something is present or happening.

example.ex: What happened, is anything wrong?...
example.tran: 怎么了，出什么事了吗？

example.ex: Did you find anything?...
example.tran: 你找到什么了吗？

collins.tran: （用于描述所谈论事物的词语前）…的东西，…的事情
collins.def: You can use anything before words which indicate the kind of thing you are talking about.

example.ex: More than anything else, he wanted to become a teacher...
example.tran: 他最想成为一名教师。

example.ex: Anything that's cheap this year will be even cheaper next year...
example.tran: 今年的便宜货明年会更便宜。

collins.tran: （用于加强语气）无论什么东西，随便什么事情
collins.def: You use anything to emphasize a possible thing, event, or situation, when you are saying that it could be any one of a very large number of things.

example.ex: He is young, fresh, and ready for anything...
example.tran: 他年轻又富有朝气，什么事都愿意做。

example.ex: At that point, anything could happen...
example.tran: 那一刻，什么事都可能发生。

collins.def: You use anything in expressions such as anything near ,anything close to and anything like to emphasize a statement that you are making.

example.ex: Doctors have decided the only way he can live anything near a normal life is to give him an operation...
example.tran: 医生的结论是只有做手术，他才有可能过上基本正常的生活。

example.ex: Only Cowans played anything close to his true form...
example.tran: 只有考恩斯算是发挥出了正常水平。

collins.def: When you do not want to be exact, you use anything to talk about a particular range of things or quantities.

example.ex: Factory farming has turned the cow into a milk machine, producing anything from 25 to 40 litres of milk per day...
example.tran: 集约饲养把奶牛变成了生产牛奶的机器，每天差不多要挤出25升到40升的牛奶。

example.ex: Fights with his father lasted anything between fifteen minutes and an hour.
example.tran: 和他父亲争吵了大约15分钟到一个小时。

collins.tran: （用于形容词后表示强调）非常，十分
collins.def: You use as anything after an adjective to emphasize a quality that someone has.

example.ex: He used to be as smart as anything...
example.tran: 他过去聪明绝顶。

example.ex: She opened the door and jumped out, quick as anything.
example.tran: 她打开门，飞快地跳了出来。

collins.tran: 单单除…之外;根本不;远非
collins.def: You use anything but in expressions such as anything but quiet and anything but attractive to emphasize that something is not the case.

example.ex: I will be anything but quiet on Saturday night!...
example.tran: 星期六的晚上我根本静不下心来！

example.ex: There's no evidence that he told anyone to say anything but the truth...
example.tran: 并无证据表明他让什么人隐瞒真相。

collins.def: You can say that you would not do something for anything to emphasize that you definitely would not want to do or be a particular thing.

example.ex: I wouldn't want to move for anything in the world...
example.tran: 就是天塌了我也不搬走。

example.ex: I wouldn't have missed this summer in England for anything...
example.tran: 我本来说什么也不会错过在英格兰的这个夏季的。

collins.tran: （尤用于否定句后，对所说之事进行补充说明）甚至正相反，甚至还不如说
collins.def: You use if anything, especially after a negative statement, to introduce a statement that adds to what you have just said.

example.ex: I never had to clean up after him. If anything, he did most of the cleaning.
example.tran: 我从来不用跟在他后面打扫卫生。恰恰相反，他包揽了大部分的清洁工作。

collins.tran: 或其他什么的；诸如此类
collins.def: You can add or anything to the end of a clause or sentence in order to refer vaguely to other things that are or may be similar to what has just been mentioned.

example.ex: Listen, if you talk to him or anything make sure you let us know, will you...
example.tran: 听着，如果你和他说话或什么的，一定要让我们知道，好吗？

example.ex: He didn't cry or scream or anything.
example.tran: 他没哭也没喊，什么事也没有。

collins.def: If you say that something appears to be the way you describe it, you are reporting what you believe or what you have been told, though you cannot be sure it is true.

example.ex: There appears to be increasing support for the leadership to take a more aggressive stance...
example.tran: 好像有越来越多的人支持领导层采取更为强势的立场。

example.ex: The aircraft appears to have crashed near Katmandu...
example.tran: 飞机似乎在加德满都附近坠毁了。

collins.def: If someone or something appears to have a particular quality or characteristic, they give the impression of having that quality or characteristic.

example.ex: She did her best to appear more self-assured than she felt...
example.tran: 她竭力让自己表现得比实际更自信。

example.ex: He is anxious to appear a gentleman...
example.tran: 他急于想表现得像个绅士。

collins.def: When someone or something appears, they move into a position where you can see them.

example.ex: A woman appeared at the far end of the street...
example.tran: 一个女人远远出现在街的尽头。

example.ex: Last night some of the prisoners appeared on the roof.
example.tran: 昨晚，其中几个犯人出现在房顶上。

collins.def: When something new appears, it begins to exist or reaches a stage of development where its existence can be noticed.

example.ex: ...small white flowers which appear in early summer...
example.tran: 初夏时绽放的白色小花

example.ex: Slogans have appeared on walls around the city.
example.tran: 标语已出现在全城周围的墙上。

collins.def: When something such as a book appears, it is published or becomes available for people to buy.

example.ex: I could hardly wait for 'Boys' World' to appear each month.
example.tran: 每个月我都翘首期盼着《男孩世界》的出版。

example.ex: ...a poem which appeared in his last collection of verse.
example.tran: 发表在他最后一部诗集中的一首诗

collins.def: When someone appears in something such as a play, a show, or a television programme, they take part in it.

example.ex: Jill Bennett became John Osborne's fourth wife, and appeared in several of his plays...
example.tran: 吉尔·本内特成为了约翰·奥斯本的第四任妻子，并参演过他的几部戏剧。

example.ex: Student leaders appeared on television to ask for calm.
example.tran: 学生领袖出现在电视上请求大家保持冷静。

collins.def: When someone appears before a court of law or before an official committee, they go there in order to answer charges or to give information as a witness.

example.ex: Two other executives appeared at Worthing Magistrates' Court charged with tax fraud...
example.tran: 又有两个经理因偷税漏税指控被传唤到沃辛治安法庭。

example.ex: The American will appear before members of the disciplinary committee at Portman Square.
example.tran: 那个美国人将在波特曼广场接受纪律委员会成员的审问。

collins.def: An area is a particular part of a town, a country, a region, or the world.

example.ex: ...the large number of community groups in the area...
example.tran: 该地区大量的社团

example.ex: 60 years ago half the French population still lived in rural areas.
example.tran: 60年前有一半法国人仍然生活在乡村地区。

collins.def: Your area is the part of a town, country, or region where you live. An organization's area is the part of a town, country, or region that it is responsible for.

example.ex: Local authorities have been responsible for the running of schools in their areas...
example.tran: 地方当局一直负责管理本地区的学校。

example.ex: If there is an election in your area, you should go and vote.
example.tran: 如果你所居住的地区进行选举，你应该去参加投票。

collins.def: A particular area is a piece of land or part of a building that is used for a particular activity.

example.ex: ...a picnic area.
example.tran: 野餐区

example.ex: ...the main check-in area located in Terminal 1.
example.tran: 位于1号候机厅的主检票区

collins.tran: （某一表面或物体上的）区；（身体上的）部分
collins.def: An area is a particular place on a surface or object, for example on your body.

example.ex: You will notice that your baby has two soft areas on the top of his head.
example.tran: 你会注意到你的宝宝头顶上有两处柔软的地方。

collins.def: The area of a surface such as a piece of land is the amount of flat space or ground that it covers, measured in square units.

example.ex: The islands cover a total area of 625.6 square kilometers...
example.tran: 这些岛屿总面积为625.6平方公里。

example.ex: Although large in area, the flat did not have many rooms.
example.tran: 这套公寓虽然面积很大，但并没有太多房间。

collins.def: You can use area to refer to a particular subject or topic, or to a particular part of a larger, more general situation or activity.

example.ex: ...the politically sensitive area of old age pensions.
example.tran: 有关养老金的政治敏感话题

example.ex: ...the internationalization of the economy and all other areas of society...
example.tran: 社会的经济和其他领域的国际化

collins.def: On a football pitch, the area is the same as the penalty area.
Your arms are the two long parts of your body that are attached to your shoulders and that have your hands at the end.

example.ex: She stretched her arms out...
example.tran: 她张开双臂。

example.ex: He had a large parcel under his left arm.
example.tran: 他左胳膊下夹着一个大包裹。

collins.def: The arm of a piece of clothing is the part of it that covers your arm.
The arm of a chair is the part on which you rest your arm when you are sitting down.
An arm of an object is a long thin part of it that sticks out from the main part.

example.ex: ...the lever arm of the machine.
example.tran: 机器的操纵杆

example.ex: ...the arms of the doctor's spectacles.
example.tran: 医生的眼镜腿

collins.def: An arm of land or water is a long thin area of it that is joined to a broader area.

example.ex: At the end of the other arm of Cardigan Bay is Bardsey Island.
example.tran: 在卡迪根湾的另一狭长地段的尾端是巴德西岛。

collins.def: An arm of an organization is a section of it that operates in a particular country or that deals with a particular activity.

example.ex: Millicom Holdings is the British arm of an American company.
example.tran: 米雷康姆控股有限公司是一家美国公司在英国的分支机构。

example.ex: ...the research arm of Congress.
example.tran: 国会的研究部门

collins.def: If two people are walking arm in arm, they are walking together with their arms linked.

example.ex: He walked from the court arm in arm with his wife.
example.tran: 他和妻子挽着胳膊走出法庭。

collins.def: If you say that something costs an arm and a leg, you mean that it is very expensive.

example.ex: A week at a health farm can cost an arm and a leg.
example.tran: 在健身中心呆一个星期的花费会很昂贵。

collins.tran: 一臂之远；在伸手可及处
collins.def: If you hold something at arm's length, you hold it away from your body with your arm straight.

example.ex: He struck a match, and held it at arm's length.
example.tran: 他划亮一根火柴，伸长胳膊举着。

collins.def: If you keep someone at arm's length, you avoid becoming too friendly or involved with them.

example.ex: She had always kept his family at arm's length.
example.tran: 她一直与他的家人保持一定距离。

collins.def: If you say that a list is as long as your arm, you are emphasizing that it is very long.
If you welcome some action or change with open arms, you are very pleased about it. If you welcome a person with open arms, you are very pleased about their arrival.

example.ex: They would no doubt welcome the action with open arms...
example.tran: 他们无疑将热烈欢迎这一举动。

example.ex: Many Panamanians welcomed the troops with open arms.
example.tran: 许多巴拿马人热烈欢迎部队到来。

collins.def: If you twist someone's arm, you persuade them to do something.

example.ex: She had twisted his arm to get him to invite her.
example.tran: 她说服他向自己发出邀请。

collins.def: An army is a large organized group of people who are armed and trained to fight on land in a war. Most armies are organized and controlled by governments.

example.ex: After returning from France, he joined the army...
example.tran: 从法国回来之后，他参了军。

example.ex: The army is about to launch a major offensive.
example.tran: 陆军部队即将发动一次大规模进攻。

collins.def: An army of people, animals, or things is a large number of them, especially when they are regarded as a force of some kind.

example.ex: ...data collected by an army of volunteers.
example.tran: 由大批志愿者收集的资料

example.ex: ...armies of shoppers looking for bargains.
example.tran: 成群的寻找便宜货的购物者

collins.def: To be positioned around a place or object means to surround it or be on all sides of it. To move around a place means to go along its edge, back to your starting point.

example.ex: She looked at the papers around her...
example.tran: 她看了看四周的文件。

example.ex: Today she wore her hair down around her shoulders.
example.tran: 今天她的头发披在肩上。

collins.def: If you move around a corner or obstacle, you move to the other side of it. If you look around a corner or obstacle, you look to see what is on the other side.

example.ex: The photographer stopped clicking and hurried around the corner...
example.tran: 摄影师停止按动快门，匆匆绕过拐角。

example.ex: I peered around the edge of the shed — there was no sign of anyone else.
example.tran: 我仔细察看了棚子周边，没有其他人。

collins.tran: 朝着相反方向；向着对立面
collins.def: If you turn around, you turn so that you are facing in the opposite direction.

example.ex: I turned around and wrote the title on the blackboard...
example.tran: 我转过身，在黑板上写下了题目。

example.ex: He straightened up slowly and spun around on the stool to face us.
example.tran: 他慢慢直起身子，坐在凳子上转过身来面对着我们。

collins.def: If you move around a place, you travel through it, going to most of its parts. If you look around a place, you look at every part of it.

example.ex: I've been walking around Moscow and the town is terribly quiet...
example.tran: 我在莫斯科到处游逛，城里非常安静。

example.ex: He glanced discreetly around the room at the other people.
example.tran: 他谨慎地瞥了一眼房间里的其他人。

collins.def: If someone moves around a place, they move through various parts of that place without having any particular destination.

example.ex: These days much of my time is spent weaving my way around drinks parties...
example.tran: 这些天，我多半都是在酒会上晃悠过去的。

example.ex: They milled around the ballroom with video cameras.
example.tran: 他们扛着摄像机在舞厅里转来转去。

collins.def: If you go around to someone's house, you visit them.

example.ex: She helped me unpack my things and then we went around to see the other girls.
example.tran: 她帮我打开行李，然后我们去看望其他女孩们。

collins.def: You use around in expressions such as sit around and hang around when you are saying that someone is spending time in a place and not doing anything very important.

example.ex: I'm just going to be hanging around twiddling my thumbs...
example.tran: 我只会闲呆着，什么事也不做。

example.ex: After breakfast the next morning they sat around for an hour discussing political affairs.
example.tran: 第二天早饭后，他们闲坐着聊了一个小时政治话题。

collins.def: If you move things around, you move them so that they are in different places.

example.ex: Furniture in the classroom should not be changed around without warning the blind child...
example.tran: 教室中的桌椅如需要挪动，应事先告诉这个盲童。

example.ex: She moved things around so the table was beneath the windows.
example.tran: 她挪动家具使桌子靠在窗边。

collins.def: If a wheel or object turns around, it turns.

example.ex: The boat started to spin around in the water.
example.tran: 船开始在水中打旋。

collins.def: You use around to say that something happens in different parts of a place or area.

example.ex: Police in South Africa say ten people have died in scattered violence around the country...
example.tran: 南非警方称，在全国各地零星发生的暴力事件中，有10人死亡。

example.ex: Elephants were often to be found in swamp in eastern Kenya around the Tana River.
example.tran: 在肯尼亚东部的塔纳河一带经常发现陷入沼泽的大象。

collins.def: If someone or something is around, they exist or are present in a place.

example.ex: The blackbird had a quick, wary look in case the cat was anywhere around...
example.tran: 这只乌鸫迅速警惕地张望了一眼，以防那只猫就在附近。

example.ex: Just having lots of people around that you can talk to is important...
example.tran: 有许多能交谈的人在身边很重要。

collins.def: The people around you are the people who you come into contact with, especially your friends and relatives, and the people you work with.

example.ex: We change our behaviour by observing the behaviour of those around us...
example.tran: 我们通过观察周围人的举止改变自己的行为。

example.ex: Those around her would forgive her for weeping.
example.tran: 她身边的人会原谅她掉眼泪的。

collins.def: If something such as a film, a discussion, or a plan is based around something, that thing is its main theme.

example.ex: ...the gentle comedy based around the Larkin family...
example.tran: 根据拉金一家的故事改编的轻喜剧

example.ex: The discussion centered around four subjects.
example.tran: 讨论围绕4个主题展开。

collins.def: You use around in expressions such as this time around or to come around when you are describing something that has happened before or things that happen regularly.

example.ex: Senator Bentsen has declined to get involved this time around...
example.tran: 这次本特森参议员又拒绝参与。

example.ex: When July Fourth comes around, the residents of Columbia City throw a noisy party.
example.tran: 每逢7月4号美国独立日，哥伦比亚城的居民们都会举行热闹的聚会。

collins.def: When you are giving measurements, you can use around to talk about the distance along the edge of something round.

example.ex: She was 40 inches around the hips.
example.tran: 她臀围40英寸。

collins.def: Around means approximately.

example.ex: My salary was around £9,000 plus a car and expenses...
example.tran: 我的薪水大约是9,000英镑，还有一辆车和业务经费可支配。

example.ex: Rolls Royce produces around 1,000 extremely desirable cars a year.
example.tran: 劳斯莱斯公司每年生产约1,000辆非常吸引人的汽车。

collins.def: Around about means approximately.

example.ex: There is a Green party but it only scored around about 10 percent in the vote...
example.tran: 虽然有一个绿党，但在选举中该党只得到了大约10%的选票。

example.ex: He's charging you around about a hundred pounds an hour for his services.
example.tran: 他提供一小时服务，要价大约100英镑。

collins.def: You say all around to indicate that something affects all parts of a situation or all members of a group.

example.ex: He compared the achievements of the British and the French during 1916 and concluded that the latter were better all around.
example.tran: 他比较了1916年英国人和法国人的成就，结论是法国人在各方面都做得更好。

collins.tran: 见过世面；经验丰富；老于世故
collins.def: If someone has been around, they have had a lot of experience of different people and situations.

example.ex: He knows what to do. He's been around...
example.tran: 他知道该做什么。他阅历很丰富。

example.ex: He's been around a long time and has acquired a number of skills.
example.tran: 长久以来他见过很多世面，学了很多技术。

means: 文艺（包括绘画、雕塑、建筑、音乐、舞蹈、戏剧、文学等）
thou art 即 you are,对一人讲话时用
[口语]（把…）装饰得古色古香，（把…）装饰得古怪而有艺术趣味，把…装饰得有艺术价值
把…加以艺术乔装，使艺术化[仅用于 art up 短语中]

collins.def: Art consists of paintings, sculpture, and other pictures or objects which are created for people to look at and admire or think deeply about.

example.ex: ...the first exhibition of such art in the West.
example.tran: 此类艺术品在西方的首次展览

example.ex: ...contemporary and modern American art.
example.tran: 近现代美洲艺术

collins.tran: （作为活动或教学科目的）美术
collins.def: Art is the activity or educational subject that consists of creating paintings, sculptures, and other pictures or objects for people to look at and admire or think deeply about.

example.ex: ...a painter, content to be left alone with her all-absorbing art.
example.tran: 甘愿独自沉浸于绘画中的画家

example.ex: ...Farnham College of Art and Design.
example.tran: 法纳姆美术设计学院

collins.tran: 艺术（活动）（如音乐、绘画、文学、电影、舞蹈等）
collins.def: The arts are activities such as music, painting, literature, cinema, and dance, which people can take part in for enjoyment, or to create works which express serious meanings or ideas of beauty.

example.ex: Catherine the Great was a patron of the arts and sciences.
example.tran: 叶卡捷琳娜大帝赞助过各种艺术创作和科学研究。

example.ex: ...the Arts Council of Great Britain.
example.tran: 大不列颠艺术委员会

collins.def: At a university or college, arts are subjects such as history, literature, or languages in contrast to scientific subjects.

example.ex: ...arts and social science graduates.
example.tran: 人文和社会科学毕业生

example.ex: ...the Faculty of Arts.
example.tran: 文学院

collins.tran: （用于剧院或电影院的名称中）上演艺术作品的，艺术的
collins.def: Arts or art is used in the names of theatres or cinemas which show plays or films that are intended to make the audience think deeply about the content, and not simply to entertain them.

example.ex: ...the Cambridge Arts Cinema.
example.tran: 剑桥艺术影院

collins.def: If you describe an activity as an art, you mean that it requires skill and that people learn to do it by instinct or experience, rather than by learning facts or rules.

example.ex: Fishing is an art.
example.tran: 钓鱼是一门技术。

example.ex: ...the unscientific arts of seduction and romance.
example.tran: 勾引异性和谈情说爱的不科学的技巧

collins.tran: （be的现在式单数第二人称形式，过时用法）
collins.def: Art is an old-fashioned form of the second person singular of the present tense of the verb be.

example.ex: Father, I know thou art aware of me at all times.
example.tran: 父亲，我知道您无时无刻不在关心着我。

means: 阿斯（古罗马重量单位，约373克）

collins.tran: （表示两件事情同时发生）当…的时候，在…的同时
collins.def: If something happens as something else happens, it happens at the same time.

example.ex: Another policeman has been injured as fighting continued this morning...
example.tran: 今早又有一名警员在冲突中受伤。

example.ex: All the jury's eyes were on him as he continued...
example.tran: 在他继续陈述的时候，全体陪审员的目光都集中在他身上。

collins.def: You use the structure as...as when you are comparing things.

example.ex: I never went through a final exam that was as difficult as that one...
example.tran: 我从来没有碰到过像那次那么难的期末考试。

example.ex: There was no obvious reason why this could not be as good a film as the original.
example.tran: 找不出明显的理由来解释为什么这部片子拍得不如原先的好。

collins.def: You use as...as to emphasize amounts of something.

example.ex: You can look forward to a significant cash return by saving from as little as £10 a month...
example.tran: 只要每个月存下区区10英镑，你就有希望得到相当可观的现金收益。

example.ex: She gets as many as eight thousand letters a month.
example.tran: 她一个月里收到的信件多达8,000封。

collins.def: You use as when you are indicating what someone or something is or is thought to be, or what function they have.

example.ex: He has worked as a diplomat in the US, Sudan and Saudi Arabia...
example.tran: 他曾任驻美国、苏丹和沙特阿拉伯的外交官。

example.ex: The news apparently came as a complete surprise...
example.tran: 这个消息显然让人大吃一惊。

collins.def: If you do something as a child or as a teenager, for example, you do it when you are a child or a teenager.

example.ex: She loved singing as a child and started vocal training at 12.
example.tran: 她从小就喜欢唱歌，12岁开始了声乐训练。

collins.def: You use as to say how something happens or is done, or to indicate that something happens or is done in the same way as something else.

example.ex: I'll behave toward them as I would like to be treated...
example.tran: 我会以希望别人对待我的方式来对待他们。

example.ex: Today, as usual, he was wearing a three-piece suit...
example.tran: 像往常一样，他今天穿的是三件套。

collins.def: You use as in expressions like as a result and as a consequence to indicate how two situations or events are related to each other.

example.ex: As a result of the growing fears about home security, more people are arranging for someone to stay in their home when they're away...
example.tran: 因为越来越担心住宅安全，更多的人在出门的时候会在家中留人。

example.ex: In this changing business environment, different demands are being placed on employees. As a consequence, the education system needs to change.
example.tran: 在当今变幻莫测的商业环境下，员工被提出各种不同的要求。因此，教育体系有必要随之改变。

collins.def: You use as to introduce short clauses which comment on the truth of what you are saying.

example.ex: As you can see, we're still working...
example.tran: 如你所见，我们仍在工作。

example.ex: We were sitting, as I remember, in a riverside restaurant.
example.tran: 我记得我们当时是坐在一个河畔的餐馆里。

collins.def: You can use as to mean 'because' when you are explaining the reason for something.

example.ex: They are regularly sent booklets about personal safety, but they barely read them as they have so much paperwork to deal with...
example.tran: 他们经常会收到关于人身安全问题的宣传册，但因为大量文案工作缠身，他们几乎无暇阅读。

example.ex: Enjoy the first hour of the day. This is important as it sets the mood for the rest of the day.
example.tran: 好好享受每天的第一个小时。这之所以重要是因为它会决定你一整天的心情。

collins.def: You say as it were in order to make what you are saying sound less definite.

example.ex: I'd understood the words, but I didn't, as it were, understand the question.
example.tran: 字面的意思我懂了，但是可以说我并不能理解这个问题。

collins.tran: 事实上，实际上（表示实际情况和可能情况的对比）
collins.def: You use expressions such as as it is ,as it turns out, and as things stand when you are making a contrast between a possible situation and what actually happened or is the case.

example.ex: I want to work at home on a Tuesday but as it turns out sometimes it's a Wednesday or a Thursday.
example.tran: 我想周二在家工作，但实际上有时却是周三或是周四。

collins.def: If you ask someone something, you say something to them in the form of a question because you want to know the answer.

example.ex: 'How is Frank?' he asked...
example.tran: “弗兰克怎么样了？”他问道。

example.ex: I asked him his name...
example.tran: 我询问了他的名字。

collins.def: If you ask someone to do something, you tell them that you want them to do it.

example.ex: We had to ask him to leave...
example.tran: 我们不得不要求他离开。

example.ex: She said she had been asked to take two suitcases to Africa by a man called Sean.
example.tran: 她说有个名叫肖恩的男人要她带两个手提箱去非洲。

collins.def: If you ask to do something, you tell someone that you want to do it.

example.ex: I asked to see the Director.
example.tran: 我要求见主任。

collins.def: If you ask for something, you say that you would like it.

example.ex: I decided to go to the next house and ask for food...
example.tran: 我决定去隔壁那家要点吃的。

example.ex: Who asked for your opinion?
example.tran: 谁问你的意见了？

collins.def: If you ask for someone, you say that you would like to speak to them.

example.ex: There's a man at the gate asking for you.
example.tran: 门口有个人想见你。

collins.tran: 请求，征求（许可、意见、谅解）
collins.def: If you ask someone's permission, opinion, or forgiveness, you try to obtain it by putting a request to them.

example.ex: Please ask permission from whoever pays the phone bill before making your call.
example.tran: 打电话前请先征得话费支付方的同意。

collins.def: If you ask someone to an event or place, you invite them to go there.

example.ex: Couldn't you ask Jon to the party?...
example.tran: 你不能邀请乔恩参加聚会吗？

example.ex: She asked me back to her house.
example.tran: 她又邀请我去了她家。

collins.def: If someone is asking a particular price for something, they are selling it for that price.

example.ex: Mr Pantelaras was asking £6,000 for his collection.
example.tran: 潘特莱拉斯先生为他的藏品要价6,000英镑。

collins.tran: （通常用于表示对询问感到恼怒或惊讶）不要问我
collins.def: You reply 'don't ask me' when you do not know the answer to a question, usually when you are annoyed or surprised that you have been asked.

example.ex: 'She's got other things on her mind, wouldn't you think?' 'Don't ask me,' murmured Chris. 'I've never met her.'
example.tran: “她还有别的心事，你不觉得吗？”“别问我，”克里斯嘀咕道，“我从未见过她。”

collins.tran: 只要开口（便可得到）；唾手可得
collins.def: If something is yours for the asking, you could get it very easily if you wanted to.

example.ex: He knew the nomination was his for the asking.
example.tran: 他知道只要他开口就能得到那项提名。

collins.tran: （强调反对）请问，真是，这还了得
collins.def: If you say 'I ask you', you are emphasizing how much you disapprove of someone or something.

example.ex: That silly old bat. I ask you, who'd she think she was?
example.tran: 那个老蠢货。我倒要问一问，她以为她是谁呀？

collins.tran: （一种正式的询问方式，表示感到困扰或心生疑虑）请问
collins.def: You can say 'may I ask' as a formal way of asking a question, which shows you are annoyed or suspicious about something.

example.ex: May I ask where you're going, sir?
example.tran: 先生，请问您要去哪？

collins.def: You can say 'if you ask me' to emphasize that you are stating your personal opinion.

example.ex: He was nuts, if you ask me.
example.tran: 要我说的话，他是个疯子。

collins.def: If you say that someone is asking for trouble or is asking for it, you mean that they are behaving in a way that makes it very likely that they will get into trouble.

example.ex: To go ahead with the match after such clear advice had been asking for trouble.
example.tran: 都劝说得这么明白了还要继续比赛，这简直就是自讨苦吃。

means: 阿特（老挝辅币单位，100 阿特 = 1 基普）

collins.def: You use at to indicate the place or event where something happens or is situated.

example.ex: We had dinner at a restaurant in Attleborough...
example.tran: 我们在阿特尔伯勒的一家餐厅里吃的饭。

example.ex: He will be at the airport to meet her...
example.tran: 他将去机场接她。

collins.def: If someone is at school or college, or at a particular school or college, they go there regularly to study.

example.ex: He was shy and nervous as a boy, and unhappy at school...
example.tran: 他小时候既害羞又胆怯，在学校过得并不快乐。

example.ex: It was at university that he first encountered Hopkins...
example.tran: 他第一次遇见霍普金斯是在上大学的时候。

collins.def: If you are at something such as a table, a door, or someone's side, you are next to it or them.

example.ex: An assistant sat typing away at a table beside him...
example.tran: 助手坐在他身旁的一张桌子上埋头打字。

example.ex: Graham was already at the door...
example.tran: 格雷厄姆已经在门口了。

collins.tran: 从相隔（一段距离）的地方;呈…角度
collins.def: When you are describing where someone or something is, you can say that they are at a certain distance. You can also say that one thing is at an angle in relation to another thing.

example.ex: The two journalists followed at a discreet distance...
example.tran: 那两个记者谨慎地保持距离跟在后面。

example.ex: The tree was leaning at a low angle from the ground.
example.tran: 那棵树倾斜得非常厉害。

collins.def: If something happens at a particular time, that is the time when it happens or begins to happen.

example.ex: The funeral will be carried out this afternoon at 3.00...
example.tran: 葬礼将在今天下午3点举行。

example.ex: He only sees her at Christmas and Easter.
example.tran: 他只有在圣诞节和复活节时才能见到她。

collins.def: If you do something at a particular age, you do it when you are that age.

example.ex: Blake emigrated to Australia with his family at 13...
example.tran: 布莱克在13岁时随家人移民到了澳大利亚。

example.ex: Mary Martin has died at her home in California at the age of seventy-six.
example.tran: 玛丽·马丁76岁时卒于加利福尼亚家中。

collins.tran: 以，达（某一速度、频率、水平或价格）
collins.def: You use at to express a rate, frequency, level, or price.

example.ex: I drove back down the highway at normal speed...
example.tran: 我以正常车速沿公路返回。

example.ex: Check the oil at regular intervals, and have the car serviced regularly...
example.tran: 定期检查汽油，并对车辆进行定期维护。

collins.def: You use at before a number or amount to indicate a measurement.

example.ex: Weighing in at eighty tons, the B-19 was easily the largest and most sophisticated warplane in the world.
example.tran: B-19重达80吨，无疑是世界上最大、最先进的军用飞机。

example.ex: ...as unemployment stays pegged at three million.
example.tran: 当失业人数维持在300万

collins.tran: 朝（某人或某物看）；向（某人掷物）；冲（某人说话）
collins.def: If you look at someone or something, you look towards them. If you direct an object or a comment at someone, you direct it towards them.

example.ex: He looked at Michael and laughed...
example.tran: 他看着迈克尔笑了。

example.ex: The crowds became violent and threw petrol bombs at the police...
example.tran: 人群变得狂暴起来，并向警察投掷汽油弹。

collins.def: You can use at after verbs such as 'smile' or 'wave' and before nouns referring to people to indicate that you have put on an expression or made a gesture which someone is meant to see or understand.

example.ex: She opened the door and stood there, frowning at me...
example.tran: 她打开门站在那里，朝我皱着眉头。

example.ex: We waved at the staff to try to get the bill.
example.tran: 我们向工作人员招了招手，想要买单。

collins.def: If you point or gesture at something, you move your arm or head in its direction so that it will be noticed by someone you are with.

example.ex: He pointed at the empty bottle and the waitress quickly replaced it...
example.tran: 他指了指空瓶子，女服务员立即重新拿了一瓶。

example.ex: He gestured at the shelves. 'I've bought many books from him.'
example.tran: 他指着书架说，“我已经从他那里买了不少书了”。

collins.tran: 致力于;定位于;期望达到
collins.def: If you are working at something, you are dealing with it. If you are aiming at something, you are trying to achieve it.

example.ex: She has worked hard at her marriage.
example.tran: 她努力维系着她的婚姻。

example.ex: ...a $1.04m grant aimed at improving student performance on placement examinations.
example.tran: 旨在提高学生编班考试成绩的104万美元拨款

collins.def: If something is done at someone's invitation or request, it is done as a result of it.

example.ex: She left the light on in the bathroom at his request...
example.tran: 她按照他的要求将浴室里的灯开着。

example.ex: I visited Japan in 1987 at the invitation of the Foreign Minister.
example.tran: 应日本外相的邀请，我于1987年访问了日本。

collins.def: You use at to say that someone or something is in a particular state or condition.

example.ex: I am afraid we are not at liberty to disclose that information...
example.tran: 恐怕我们无权透露这一信息。

example.ex: Their countries had been at war for nearly six weeks.
example.tran: 他们的国家陷入战争状态已将近6个星期了。

collins.tran: （用于所有格代词和形容词最高级前，表示某人或某物在此时的某一特征最鲜明）
collins.def: You use at before a possessive pronoun and a superlative adjective to say that someone or something has more of a particular quality than at any other time.

example.ex: He was at his happiest whilst playing cricket...
example.tran: 玩板球时他最开心了。

example.ex: Howards End is old fashioned film-making at its best.
example.tran: 《霍华德庄园》是一部经典的老派电影。

collins.def: You use at to say how something is being done.

example.ex: Three people were killed by shots fired at random from a minibus...
example.tran: 3个人被从一辆面包车中发射的乱弹打死了。

example.ex: Mr Martin was taken out of his car at gunpoint.
example.tran: 马丁先生被人用枪指着从车里带了出来。

collins.def: You use at to show that someone is doing something repeatedly.

example.ex: She lowered the handkerchief which she had kept dabbing at her eyes...
example.tran: 她放下了那块一直用来擦眼睛的手帕。

example.ex: Miss Melville took a cookie and nibbled at it.
example.tran: 梅尔维尔小姐拿起一块饼干小口吃起来。

collins.def: You use at to indicate an activity or task when saying how well someone does it.

example.ex: I'm good at my work...
example.tran: 我对自己的工作得心应手。

example.ex: Robin is an expert at cheesemaking...
example.tran: 罗宾是奶酪制作专家。

collins.def: You use at to indicate what someone is reacting to.

example.ex: Eleanor was annoyed at having had to wait so long for him...
example.tran: 埃莉诺为不得不等他这么长时间而感到很恼火。

example.ex: The British team did not disguise their delight at their success...
example.tran: 英国队毫不掩饰他们获胜的喜悦。

collins.def: To attack a person or place means to try to hurt or damage them using physical violence.

example.ex: Fifty civilians in Masawa were killed when government planes attacked the town...
example.tran: 马萨瓦市遭到政府军飞机轰炸，有50名平民丧生。

example.ex: He bundled the old lady into her hallway and brutally attacked her...
example.tran: 他将老妇人推到她家走廊上，并对她一顿暴打。

collins.def: If you attack a person, belief, idea, or act, you criticize them strongly.

example.ex: He publicly attacked the people who've been calling for secret ballot nominations...
example.tran: 他公开抨击了那些主张用不记名投票方式确定任命人选的人。

example.ex: A newspaper ran an editorial attacking him for being a showman.
example.tran: 一家报纸发表社论，批评他善于作秀。

collins.tran: （疾病、化学药品、昆虫等）攻击，侵蚀，破坏
collins.def: If something such as a disease, a chemical, or an insect attacks something, it harms or spoils it.

example.ex: The virus seems to have attacked his throat...
example.tran: 病毒看来已经侵蚀到他喉部了。

example.ex: Several key crops failed when they were attacked by pests.
example.tran: 一些主要农作物由于遭受虫害而歉收。

collins.def: If you attack a job or a problem, you start to deal with it in an energetic way.

example.ex: Any attempt to attack the budget problem is going to have to in some way deal with those issues.
example.tran: 要解决预算问题，在某种程度上就必须解决那些问题。

collins.def: In games such as football, when one team attacks the opponent's goal, they try to score a goal.

example.ex: Now the US is controlling the ball and attacking the opponent's goal...
example.tran: 现在美国队控球，向对方球门展开了进攻。

example.ex: The goal was just reward for Villa's decision to attack constantly in the second half.
example.tran: 在下半场，维拉队持续进攻的打法为他们赢得了这个进球。

collins.def: An attack of an illness is a short period in which you suffer badly from it.

example.ex: It had brought on an attack of asthma.
example.tran: 这引发了哮喘。

collins.tran: 尝试，试图（尤指做困难的事）
collins.def: If you attempt to do something, especially something difficult, you try to do it.

example.ex: The only time that we attempted to do something like that was in the city of Philadelphia...
example.tran: 只有在费城那次我们曾试着做那样的事。

example.ex: Before I could attempt a reply he added over his shoulder: 'Wait there.'
example.tran: 还没等我回答他就回头又说了一句：“在那儿等着。”

collins.tran: （通常指不成功的）尝试，企图，试图
collins.def: If you make an attempt to do something, you try to do it, often without success.

example.ex: ...a deliberate attempt to destabilise the defence...
example.tran: 经过深思熟虑的破坏该防御的尝试

example.ex: It was one of his rare attempts at humour.
example.tran: 那是他极不常见的想要表现幽默的一次。

collins.def: An attempt on some-one's life is an attempt to kill them.

example.ex: ...an attempt on the life of the former Iranian Prime Minister.
example.tran: 试图杀害伊朗前总理

collins.tran: （运动员创造纪录的）尝试，冲击
collins.def: In British English, if a sportsman or sportswoman makes an attempt on a sporting record, they try to beat it. In American English you say that they make an attempt to break it.

example.ex: Everything is almost ready for me to make another attempt on the record.
example.tran: 一切几乎都已准备就绪，就等我向纪录发起再一次冲击了。

collins.def: The authorities are the people who have the power to make decisions and to make sure that laws are obeyed.

example.ex: This provided a pretext for the authorities to cancel the elections...
example.tran: 这给当局取消此次选举提供了借口。

example.ex: The prison authorities have been criticised for not moving more quickly to end the protest by inmates.
example.tran: 监狱当局因没有尽快采取行动制止犯人抗议而受到批评。

collins.def: An authority is an official organization or government department that has the power to make decisions.

example.ex: ...the Health Education Authority...
example.tran: 卫生教育局

example.ex: Any alterations had to meet the approval of the local planning authority.
example.tran: 任何改建都要取得当地规划机构的批准。

collins.def: Authority is the right to command and control other people.

example.ex: Local police chiefs should re-emerge as figures of authority and reassurance in their areas...
example.tran: 各地警察局局长应当重树其维护辖区安定的执法者形象。

example.ex: The judge had no authority to order a second trial.
example.tran: 法官无权进行二次审判。

collins.def: If someone has authority, they have a quality which makes other people take notice of what they say.

example.ex: He had no natural authority and no capacity for imposing his will on others.
example.tran: 他天生缺乏威信，根本没有能力把他的意志强加于人。

collins.def: Authority is official permission to do something.

example.ex: The prison governor has refused to let him go, saying he must first be given authority from his own superiors.
example.tran: 监狱长拒绝释放他，说他首先必须得到上级官员的许可。

collins.def: Someone who is an authority on a particular subject knows a lot about it.

example.ex: He's universally recognized as an authority on Russian affairs.
example.tran: 他是公认的俄罗斯事务专家。

collins.def: If you say you have it on good authority that something is true, you mean that you believe it is true because you trust the person who told you about it.

example.ex: I have it on good authority that there's no way this light can cause skin cancer.
example.tran: 我有来自权威人士的说法，这种光不可能引起皮肤癌。

collins.def: If something you want or need is available, you can find it or obtain it.

example.ex: Since 1978, the amount of money available to buy books has fallen by 17%...
example.tran: 自1978年以来，可用于采购图书的经费已经减少了17％。

example.ex: There are three small boats available for hire...
example.tran: 有3艘小船可供出租。

collins.def: Someone who is available is not busy and is therefore free to talk to you or to do a particular task.

example.ex: Mr Leach is on holiday and was not available for comment.
example.tran: 利奇先生休假了，不方便作出评论。

collins.def: If someone or something moves or is moved away from a place, they move or are moved so that they are no longer there. If you are away from a place, you are not in the place where people expect you to be.

example.ex: An injured policeman was led away by colleagues...
example.tran: 受伤的警察被同伴带走了。

example.ex: He walked away from his car...
example.tran: 他从自己的车边走开了。

collins.def: If you look or turn away from something, you move your head so that you are no longer looking at it.

example.ex: She quickly looked away and stared down at her hands...
example.tran: 她马上将目光移开，低头盯着自己的手。

example.ex: As he stands up, he turns his face away from her so that she won't see his tears.
example.tran: 站起身时，他将脸别过去，以免让她看到眼中的泪水。

collins.def: If you put or tidy something away, you put it where it should be. If you hide someone or something away, you put them in a place where nobody can see them or find them.

example.ex: I put my journal away and prepared for bed...
example.tran: 我把杂志收好，准备睡觉。

example.ex: All her letters were carefully filed away in folders...
example.tran: 她所有的信件都整齐地放在文件夹中。

collins.tran: 离（某人或某地）有一定距离
collins.def: If something is away from a person or place, it is at a distance from that person or place.

example.ex: The two women were sitting as far away from each other as possible...
example.tran: 那两个女人坐在离对方尽可能远的地方。

example.ex: I was anxious to get him here, away from family and friends.
example.tran: 我急于把他带到这儿，远离家人和朋友。

collins.def: You use away to talk about future events. For example, if an event is a week away, it will happen after a week.

example.ex: ...the Washington summit, now only just over two weeks away...
example.tran: 还有两周多时间即召开的华盛顿峰会

example.ex: Peace it seemed might at last be no more than a few months away.
example.tran: 看起来，几个月内也许会最终实现和平。

collins.def: When a sports team plays away, it plays on its opponents' ground.

example.ex: ...a sensational 4-3 victory for the team playing away.
example.tran: 该队在客场以4比3取得的引起轰动的胜利

collins.tran: （表示慢慢消失、变得不重要或慢慢改变）
collins.def: You can use away to say that something slowly disappears, becomes less significant, or changes so that it is no longer the same.

example.ex: So much snow has already melted away...
example.tran: 大片雪都慢慢融化了。

example.ex: His voice died away in a whisper...
example.tran: 他的声音渐渐变为了小声低语。

collins.tran: （表示从一种状态到另一种状态的变化或发展）
collins.def: You use away to show that there has been a change or development from one state or situation to another.

example.ex: British courts are increasingly moving away from sending young offenders to prison...
example.tran: 英国法院渐渐地不再将少年犯送进监狱。

example.ex: There's been a dramatic shift away from traditional careers towards business and commerce.
example.tran: 从传统职业转向商贸领域的巨大转变已然发生了。

collins.def: You can use away to emphasize a continuous or repeated action.

example.ex: He would often be working away on his word processor late into the night...
example.tran: 他经常在文字处理机上一直工作到深夜。

example.ex: She sighed, her heart banging away against her ribs as she opened the door.
example.tran: 她叹了口气，开门时心一直在怦怦直跳。

collins.def: You use away to show that something is removed.

example.ex: If you take my work away I can't be happy anymore...
example.tran: 如果你炒我鱿鱼，我就再也高兴不起来了。

example.ex: The waitress whipped the plate away and put down my bill...
example.tran: 服务员把盘子撤走，放下了我的账单。

collins.def: If you move back, you move in the opposite direction to the one in which you are facing or in which you were moving before.

example.ex: The photographers drew back to let us view the body...
example.tran: 摄影师往后退开，好让我们查看尸体。

example.ex: She stepped back from the door expectantly...
example.tran: 她满怀期待地从门口退了回来。

collins.def: If you go back somewhere, you return to where you were before.

example.ex: I went back to bed...
example.tran: 我回到床上。

example.ex: I'm  due back in London by late afternoon...
example.tran: 我预计下午晚些时候回到伦敦。

collins.tran: 恢复原状；回到原来的状态
collins.def: If someone or something is back in a particular state, they were in that state before and are now in it again.

example.ex: The rail company said it expected services to get slowly back to normal...
example.tran: 铁路公司表示，其运输服务将慢慢恢复正常。

example.ex: Denise hopes to be back at work by the time her daughter is one...
example.tran: 丹尼丝希望等女儿满周岁就回去工作。

collins.def: If you give or put something back, you return it to the person who had it or to the place where it was before you took it. If you get or take something back, you then have it again after not having it for a while.

example.ex: She handed the knife back...
example.tran: 她递还刀子。

example.ex: Put it back in the freezer...
example.tran: 把它放回冰箱。

collins.def: If you put a clock or watch back, you change the time shown on it so that it shows an earlier time, for example when the time changes to winter time or standard time.
If you write or call back, you write to or telephone someone after they have written to or telephoned you. If you look back at someone, you look at them after they have started looking at you.

example.ex: They wrote back to me and they told me that I didn't have to do it...
example.tran: 他们回信告诉我说不必那么做。

example.ex: If the phone rings say you'll  call back after dinner...
example.tran: 如果有电话打来，就说你吃完饭再回电话。

collins.def: You can say that you go or come back to a particular point in a conversation to show that you are mentioning or discussing it again.

example.ex: Can I come back to the question of policing once again?...
example.tran: 我能再回到维护治安的问题上来吗？

example.ex: To come back to what I said in the Introduction, in the nineteenth century Spain was fully a part of Europe...
example.tran: 回到我在导言中所说的，19世纪的西班牙是欧洲整体的一部分。

collins.tran: 再次流行；再度成为潮流
collins.def: If something is or comes back, it is fashionable again after it has been unfashionable for some time.

example.ex: Short skirts are back...
example.tran: 短裙又流行起来了。

example.ex: Consensus politics could easily come back into fashion.
example.tran: 共识政治很可能再度兴起。

collins.def: If someone or something is kept or situated back from a place, they are at a distance away from it.

example.ex: Keep back from the edge of the platform...
example.tran: 请勿靠近站台边缘。

example.ex: I'm  a few miles back from the border...
example.tran: 我距离边境数英里。

collins.def: If something is held or tied back, it is held or tied so that it does not hang loosely over something.

example.ex: Her hair was tied back...
example.tran: 她的头发扎了起来。

example.ex: The curtains were held back by tassels.
example.tran: 窗帘用穗子拢了起来。

collins.def: If you lie or sit back, you move your body backwards into a relaxed sloping or flat position, with your head and body resting on something.

example.ex: She lay back and stared at the ceiling...
example.tran: 她躺下盯着天花板。

example.ex: She leaned back in her chair and smiled.
example.tran: 她靠在椅背上，微笑起来。

collins.def: If you look or shout back at someone or something, you turn to look or shout at them when they are behind you.

example.ex: Nick looked back over his shoulder and then stopped, frowning...
example.tran: 尼克回头看了看，又皱着眉头停了下来。

example.ex: He called back to her.
example.tran: 他转身叫她。

collins.tran: （表示描述场所的转换）在曾提到过的地方
collins.def: You use back in expressions like back in London or back at the house when you are giving an account, to show that you are going to start talking about what happened or was happening in the place you mention.

example.ex: Meanwhile, back in London, Palace Pictures was collapsing...
example.tran: 与此同时，伦敦的皇宫影业公司也正在分崩离析。

example.ex: Later, back at home, the telephone rang.
example.tran: 随后，家里的电话响了。

collins.def: If you talk about something that happened back in the past or several years back, you are emphasizing that it happened quite a long time ago.

example.ex: The story starts back in 1950, when I was five...
example.tran: 故事可以追溯到1950年，那时我才5岁。

example.ex: I was in St. Lucia back in January of this year...
example.tran: 今年1月份我在圣卢西亚。

collins.def: If you think back to something that happened in the past, you remember it or try to remember it.

example.ex: I thought back to the time in 1975 when my son was desperately ill...
example.tran: 我回想起1975年我儿子病得奄奄一息的那段时间。

example.ex: My mind flew back to stories I had heard about Vinnie.
example.tran: 我回想起曾听到过的关于文妮的那些传闻。

collins.def: If someone moves back and forth, they repeatedly move in one direction and then in the opposite direction.

example.ex: He paced back and forth...
example.tran: 他来回踱步。

example.ex: Two boys were in the street, tossing a baseball back and forth.
example.tran: 两个男孩在街上来来回回地投接棒球。

collins.tran: 坏的；令人不快的；不合意的；有害的；糟糕的
collins.def: Something that is bad is unpleasant, harmful, or undesirable.

example.ex: The bad weather conditions prevented the plane from landing...
example.tran: 糟糕的天气使飞机无法降落。

example.ex: We have been going through a bad time...
example.tran: 我们正经历一段困难时期。

collins.def: You use bad to indicate that something unpleasant or undesirable is severe or great in degree.

example.ex: He had a bad accident two years ago and had to give up farming...
example.tran: 他两年前遇到严重的车祸，不得不放弃务农。

example.ex: This was a bad case of dangerous driving...
example.tran: 这是一起严重的危险驾驶案例。

collins.tran: 不明智的；错误的；不对的
collins.def: A bad idea, decision, or method is not sensible or not correct.

example.ex: Economist Jeffrey Faux says a tax cut is a bad idea...
example.tran: 经济学家杰弗里·福克斯认为减税是不明智的。

example.ex: Of course politicians will sometimes make bad decisions...
example.tran: 政治家当然有时也会作出错误的决定。

collins.def: If you describe a piece of news, an action, or a sign as bad, you mean that it is unlikely to result in benefit or success.

example.ex: The closure of the project is bad news for her staff...
example.tran: 项目终止对她的雇员来说是一个不幸的消息。

example.ex: It was a bad start in my relationship with Warr...
example.tran: 我与沃尔的关系开始得不太顺利。

collins.tran: 不合标准的；劣质的；蹩脚的；不足的
collins.def: Something that is bad is of an unacceptably low standard, quality, or amount.

example.ex: She was in rather a bad film about the Mau Mau...
example.tran: 她出演了一部关于茅茅运动（20世纪50年代肯尼亚基库尤人反抗英国殖民者的民族主义运动）的烂片。

example.ex: Many old people in Britain are living in bad housing...
example.tran: 英国有很多老人居住条件恶劣。

collins.def: Someone who is bad at doing something is not skilful or successful at it.

example.ex: He had increased Britain's  reputation for being bad at languages...
example.tran: 他加深了人们对英国人不擅长语言的印象。

example.ex: He was a bad driver...
example.tran: 他是一个技术糟糕的司机。

collins.tran: 难以接受的；令人遗憾的
collins.def: If you say that it is bad that something happens, you mean it is unacceptable, unfortunate, or wrong.

example.ex: Not being able to hear doesn't seem as bad as not being able to see...
example.tran: 看不见比听不到更让人难以忍受。

example.ex: You need at least ten pounds if you go to the cinema nowadays — it's really bad.
example.tran: 现在看场电影至少要花上10英镑——真是太贵了。

collins.tran: （尤表示惊讶）不错的，不坏的，挺好的
collins.def: You can say that something is not bad to mean that it is quite good or acceptable, especially when you are rather surprised about this.

example.ex: 'How much is he paying you?' — 'Oh, five thousand.' —'Not bad.'...
'How are you, mate?' — 'Not bad, mate, how's  yourself?'...
example.tran: “最近怎么样，老兄？”——“还不错，你呢？”

collins.def: A bad person has morally unacceptable attitudes and behaviour.

example.ex: I was selling drugs, but I didn't think I was a bad person...
example.tran: 我贩卖毒品，但我并不觉得自己是个坏人。

example.ex: He does not think that his beliefs make him any worse than any other man.
example.tran: 他觉得自己的信仰并不让他比其他人更邪恶。

collins.tran: 不听话的；调皮的；捣蛋的
collins.def: A bad child disobeys rules and instructions or does not behave in a polite and correct way.

example.ex: You are a bad boy for repeating what I told you...
example.tran: 重复我对你说的话，你真是个捣蛋鬼。

example.ex: Many parents find it hard to discourage bad behaviour.
example.tran: 很多父母觉得要孩子循规蹈矩是件很难的事情。

collins.def: If you are in a bad mood, you are angry and behave unpleasantly to people.

example.ex: She is in a bit of a bad mood because she's just given up smoking.
example.tran: 因为她刚刚戒烟，所以脾气有点大。

collins.def: If you feel bad about something, you feel rather sorry or guilty about it.

example.ex: You don't have to feel bad about relaxing...
example.tran: 你不必为放松感到内疚。

example.ex: I feel bad that he's  doing most of the work...
example.tran: 大部分工作都是他在干，我觉得很过意不去。

collins.def: If you have a bad back, heart, leg, or eye, it is injured, diseased, or weak.

example.ex: Alastair has a bad back so we have a hard bed.
example.tran: 阿拉斯泰尔背部有毛病，所以我们睡硬板床。

collins.def: Food that has gone bad is not suitable to eat because it has started to decay.

example.ex: They bought so much beef that some went bad.
example.tran: 他们买了太多牛肉，有些都变质了。

collins.def: Bad language is language that contains offensive words such as swear words.

example.ex: I don't like to hear bad language in the street...
example.tran: 我不喜欢在街上听见一些污言秽语。

example.ex: I said a bad word.
example.tran: 我说了一句脏话。

collins.def: If you say that it is too bad that something is the case, you mean you are sorry or sad that it is the case.

example.ex: It is too bad that Eleanor had to leave so soon...
example.tran: 埃莉诺不得不这么快就离开，真是太遗憾了。

example.ex: Too bad he used his intelligence for criminal purposes.
example.tran: 他把聪明都用在了犯罪上，太可惜了。

collins.tran: （表示无法改变，亦不觉得抱歉或同情）算…倒霉
collins.def: If you say 'too bad', you are indicating that nothing can be done to change the situation, and that you do not feel sorry or sympathetic about this.

example.ex: Too bad if you missed the bus.
example.tran: 你没有赶上公交车只能算自己倒霉。

collins.def: If someone or something is in a bad way, they are in a bad condition or situation.

example.ex: The economy is in a bad way...
example.tran: 经济陷入困境。

example.ex: 'You look in a bad way,' chuckled Brad.
example.tran: “你看起来糟透了，”布拉德笑着说。

collins.tran: 对…有不好的评价；说…的坏话
collins.def: If nobody has a bad word to say about you, you are liked or admired by everyone.

example.ex: She's got beauty, wealth, and fame, and we still can't find anyone with a bad word to say about her.
example.tran: 她美丽，富有，出名，而且我们还没有发现谁说她不好。

means: 基数（如十进制的10 和二进制的2）

collins.def: The base of something is its lowest edge or part.

example.ex: There was a cycle path running along this side of the wall, right at its base...
example.tran: 在墙的这边，沿着墙根有一条自行车道。

example.ex: Line the base and sides of a 20cm deep round cake tin with paper.
example.tran: 把一个20厘米深的圆形糕饼盒的底部和四周都垫上纸。

collins.def: The base of something is the lowest part of it, where it is attached to something else.

example.ex: The surgeon placed catheters through the veins and arteries near the base of the head.
example.tran: 外科医生在脑根部的静脉和动脉中放置了导管。

collins.def: The base of an object such as a box or vase is the lower surface of it that touches the surface it rests on.

example.ex: Remove from the heat and plunge the base of the pan into a bowl of very cold water.
example.tran: 先把锅从炉子上拿开，然后把锅底浸入一盆冷水中。

collins.def: The base of an object that has several sections and that rests on a surface is the lower section of it.

example.ex: The mattress is best on a solid bed base...
example.tran: 这种床垫最好放在结实的床板上。

example.ex: The clock stands on an oval marble base, enclosed by a glass dome.
example.tran: 钟放在椭圆形的大理石基座上，外罩玻璃罩。

collins.def: A base is a layer of something which will have another layer added to it.

example.ex: Spoon the mixture on to the biscuit base and cook in a preheated oven...
example.tran: 把混合好的糊糊舀到饼干坯上，然后放入已预热的烤箱烘烤。

example.ex: On many modern wooden boats, epoxy coatings will have been used as a base for varnishing.
example.tran: 很多现代的木船将采用环氧涂层作底漆。

collins.def: A position or thing that is a base for something is one from which that thing can be developed or achieved.

example.ex: The post will give him a powerful political base from which to challenge the Kremlin...
example.tran: 这个职位将给他提供一个强有力的政治基点来挑战克里姆林宫。

example.ex: The family base was crucial to my development.
example.tran: 家庭基础对我的发展至关重要。

collins.def: If you base one thing on another thing, the first thing develops from the second thing.

example.ex: He based his conclusions on the evidence given by the captured prisoners.
example.tran: 他根据被俘囚犯提供的证据得出了这个结论。

collins.tran: （公司的）客户基础，主要（客户）群体
collins.def: A company's client base or customer base is the group of regular clients or customers that the company gets most of its income from.

example.ex: The company has been expanding its customer base using trade magazine advertising.
example.tran: 公司一直通过在商业杂志上刊登广告扩展客户群。

collins.def: A military base is a place which part of the armed forces works from.

example.ex: Gunfire was heard at an army base close to the airport.
example.tran: 机场附近的军事基地传出了炮火声。

example.ex: ...a massive air base in eastern Saudi Arabia.
example.tran: 沙特阿拉伯东部的一个大型空军基地

collins.def: Your base is the main place where you work, stay, or live.

example.ex: For most of the spring and early summer her base was her home in Scotland.
example.tran: 春天和初夏的大部分时间，她都是在苏格兰的家里度过的。

collins.def: If a place is a base for a certain activity, the activity can be carried out at that place or from that place.

example.ex: The two hotel-restaurants are attractive bases from which to explore southeast Tuscany...
example.tran: 对于去托斯卡纳东南部探险的人们来说，这两家酒店是很有吸引力的驻扎地。

example.ex: Los Angeles was still my financial base. I was still doing business there.
example.tran: 洛杉矶仍然是我的财务中心。我还在那里做生意。

collins.tran: 基础成分；主要成分；主料
collins.def: The base of a substance such as paint or food is the main ingredient of it, to which other substances can be added.

example.ex: Drain off any excess marinade and use it as a base for a pouring sauce...
example.tran: 先滗出多余的卤汁，把它当作浇汁的主料。

example.ex: Oils may be mixed with a base oil and massaged into the skin.
example.tran: 将油和基础油混合，按摩直至皮肤吸收。

collins.def: A base is a system of counting and expressing numbers. The decimal system uses base 10, and the binary system uses base 2.
A base in baseball, softball, or rounders is one of the places at each corner of the square on the pitch.
Base behaviour is behaviour that is immoral or dishonest.

example.ex: Love has the power to overcome the baser emotions.
example.tran: 爱能够战胜邪念。

collins.def: If you say that someone is off base, you mean that they are wrong.

example.ex: Am I wrong? Am I way off base? Because I want you to set me straight if you think I'm wrong.
example.tran: 我错了吗？我大错特错了吗？因为如果我不对的话，我希望你能纠正我的错误。

collins.tran: （尤指在近期没有联系的情况下与某人）取得联系
collins.def: If you communicate with someone, especially someone you have not communicated with recently, you can say that you touch base with them.

example.ex: Being there gave me a chance to touch base with three friends whom I had not seen for a year.
example.tran: 在那里，让我有机会和一年没见面的三个朋友取得了联系。

collins.tran: 面面俱到；应付各种情况
collins.def: If someone touches all the bases or covers the bases, they deal with everyone or everything involved in a situation.

example.ex: He has managed to touch all the bases necessary, and trade goes on...
example.tran: 他想方设法把所有必要的事情都处理妥当，生意也维持了下来。

example.ex: The boss covers all bases when he sets up a job.
example.tran: 老板设立一个工作岗位时，需要方方面面都考虑到。

means: 以…为基础(base的过去式和过去分词)

collins.tran: 以…为生活（或工作）中心的；以…为基地的；总部设在…的
collins.def: If you are based in a particular place, that is the place where you live or do most of your work. See also base .

example.ex: Both firms are based in Kent...
example.tran: 两个公司的总部都设在肯特市。

example.ex: Based on the edge of Lake Matt, Sunbeam Yachts started boatbuilding in 1870.
example.tran: 总部设在马特湖边的阳光游艇公司于1870年开始造船。

means: 用来表示某人或某物即主语本身，用来表示某人或某物属于某一群体或有某种性质

collins.tran: （和现在分词连用构成动词的进行式）
collins.def: You use be with a present participle to form the continuous tenses of verbs.

example.ex: This is happening in every school throughout the country...
example.tran: 全国各地每所学校都在发生这样的事情。

example.ex: She didn't  always think carefully about what she was doing...
example.tran: 她对自己在做的事情并不总是考虑得很清楚。

collins.tran: （和过去分词连用构成被动语态）
collins.def: You use be with a past participle to form the passive voice.

example.ex: Forensic experts were called in...
example.tran: 法医专家被请来。

example.ex: Her husband was killed in a car crash...
example.tran: 她的丈夫死于车祸。

collins.tran: （和不定式连用表示将来的安排或确定会发生的事情）
collins.def: You use be with an infinitive to indicate that something is planned to happen, that it will definitely happen, or that it must happen.

example.ex: The talks are to begin tomorrow...
example.tran: 谈判将于明天开始。

example.ex: It was to be Johnson's first meeting with the board in nearly a month...
example.tran: 这将是近一个月来约翰逊首次和董事会碰面。

collins.tran: （和不定式连用表示在某种情况下会发生什么事，应该怎样做或应该由谁来做）
collins.def: You use be with an infinitive to say or ask what should happen or be done in a particular situation, how it should happen, or who should do it.

example.ex: What am I to do without him?...
example.tran: 没有他，我该怎么办？

example.ex: Who is to say which of them had more power?...
example.tran: 谁来决定他们之中谁的权力应该更大一些？

collins.tran: （was和were和不定式连用，表示说话时间之后发生的事）
collins.def: You use was and were with an infinitive to talk about something that happened later than the time you are discussing, and was not planned or certain at that time.

example.ex: Then he received a phone call that was to change his life...
example.tran: 然后，他接到一个将改变他一生的电话。

example.ex: A few hours later he was to prove it.
example.tran: 几个小时之后他将证明这一点。

collins.tran: （表示可见到、可听到、可发现等）
collins.def: You can say that something is to be seen, heard, or found in a particular place to mean that people can see it, hear it, or find it in that place.

example.ex: Little traffic was to be seen on the streets...
example.tran: 街上车辆很少。

example.ex: They are to be found all over the world.
example.tran: 它们遍布于世界各地。

means: [常作 B-]“反传统一代”成员的
[口语]（体力或情绪上）疲劳不堪的
