collins.def: If you beat someone or something, you hit them very hard.

example.ex: My wife tried to stop them and they beat her...
example.tran: 我妻子想阻止他们，他们就打了她。

example.ex: They were beaten to death with baseball bats.
example.tran: 他们被人用棒球棒打死了。

collins.tran: （通常指多次或连续地）撞击，猛撞，拍打
collins.def: To beat on, at, or against something means to hit it hard, usually several times or continuously for a period of time.

example.ex: There was dead silence but for a fly beating against the glass...
example.tran: 当时一片寂静，只听见一只苍蝇不停地撞击着玻璃。

example.ex: Nina managed to free herself and began beating at the flames with a pillow...
example.tran: 尼娜好不容易挣脱出来，拿起枕头用力扑打火焰。

collins.def: When your heart or pulse beats, it continually makes regular rhythmic movements.

example.ex: I felt my heart beating faster.
example.tran: 我感觉我的心越跳越快。

collins.def: If you beat a drum or similar instrument, you hit it in order to make a sound. You can also say that a drum beats .

example.ex: When you beat the drum, you feel good.
example.tran: 敲鼓的时候感觉很好。

example.ex: ...drums beating and pipes playing.
example.tran: 敲鼓和吹风笛

collins.def: The beat of a piece of music is the main rhythm that it has.

example.ex: ...the thumping beat of rock music.
example.tran: 摇滚乐强烈的节奏

example.ex: ...the dance beats of the last two decades.
example.tran: 过去20年的舞曲节奏

collins.def: In music, a beat is a unit of measurement. The number of beats in a bar of a piece of music is indicated by two numbers at the beginning of the piece.

example.ex: It's got four beats to a bar.
example.tran: 一个小节有4拍。

collins.def: If you beat eggs, cream, or butter, you mix them thoroughly using a fork or beater.

example.ex: Beat the eggs and sugar until they start to thicken.
example.tran: 把鸡蛋和白糖混在一起搅打至开始变稠。

collins.tran: 拍打，拍动（翅膀）；（翅膀）拍动
collins.def: When a bird or insect beats its wings or when its wings beat, its wings move up and down.

example.ex: Beating their wings they flew off...
example.tran: 它们拍打着翅膀飞走了。

example.ex: Its wings beat slowly.
example.tran: 它的翅膀缓慢拍动着。

collins.def: If you beat someone in a competition or election, you defeat them.

example.ex: In yesterday's games, Switzerland beat the United States two-one...
example.tran: 在昨天的比赛中，瑞士以2比1击败美国。

example.ex: There are men who simply don't like being beaten by a woman...
example.tran: 有些男人就是不想被女人打败。

collins.tran: 打破（纪录等）；超过； 突破
collins.def: If someone beats a record or achievement, they do better than it.

example.ex: He was as eager as his Captain to beat the record.
example.tran: 他和队长一样渴望打破这项纪录。

collins.tran: 战胜（某个组织、问题、疾病等）
collins.def: If you beat something that you are fighting against, for example an organization, a problem, or a disease, you defeat it.

example.ex: It became clear that the Union was not going to beat the government...
example.tran: 情况已然明朗，工会无法和政府抗衡。

example.ex: They recognise that tough action offers the only hope of beating inflation...
example.tran: 他们认识到这一严厉举措是战胜通货膨胀的唯一希望。

collins.def: If an attack or an attempt is beaten off or is beaten back, it is stopped, often temporarily.

example.ex: The rescuers were beaten back by strong winds and currents...
example.tran: 救援人员因风浪太大而被迫中断工作。

example.ex: South Africa's  ruling National Party has beaten off a right-wing challenge.
example.tran: 南非执政的国民党已经击退了右翼分子的一次挑战。

collins.def: If you say that one thing beats another, you mean that it is better than it.

example.ex: Being boss of a software firm beats selling insurance...
example.tran: 当软件公司的老板比卖保险强多了。

example.ex: Nothing quite beats the luxury of soaking in a long, hot bath at the end of a tiring day...
example.tran: 辛苦一天之后美美地泡个热水澡比什么都强。

collins.tran: 没有比…更好的；什么也比不上；最好的莫过于
collins.def: If you say you can't beat a particular thing you mean that it is the best thing of its kind.

example.ex: You can't beat soap and water for cleansing.
example.tran: 做清洁没有比用肥皂和水更好的了。

collins.def: To beat a time limit or an event means to achieve something before that time or event.

example.ex: They were trying to beat the midnight deadline...
example.tran: 他们要努力赶在午夜的最后期限之前完成。

example.ex: Those who shop on Sunday to beat the rush are wasting their time.
example.tran: 那些为了在抢购高峰前下手而在星期天购物的人是在浪费时间。

collins.tran: （警察的）辖区，巡逻区；（记者的）负责采访的区域
collins.def: A police officer's or journalist's beat is the area for which he or she is responsible.

example.ex: The team police get to know the people in their patrol areas better than cops who must cover a larger beat.
example.tran: 小分队的警察比那些负责大片区域的警察更了解自己管片的群众。

collins.tran: 把…难住；使不明白；使无法解释
collins.def: You use beat in expressions such as 'It beats me' or 'What beats me is' to indicate that you cannot understand or explain something.

example.ex: 'What am I doing wrong, anyway?' — 'Beats me, Lewis.'...
example.tran: “不管怎样，我到底做错了什么？”——“这我也不知道，刘易斯。”

example.ex: How you can be so insensitive absolutely beats me.
example.tran: 我真搞不懂你怎么会这么麻木。

collins.def: If you tell someone to beat it, you are telling them to go away.

example.ex: Beat it before it's too late.
example.tran: 趁早滚开。

collins.tran: （表示惊讶或恼怒）竟然有这种事？岂有此理！
collins.def: You can say Can you beat it? or Can you beat that? to show that you are surprised and perhaps annoyed about something.

example.ex: Can you beat it; there was Graham Greene in Freetown and there was I on the other side of Africa.
example.tran: 真是岂有此理！格雷厄姆·格林在弗里敦，而我却在非洲的另一边。

collins.tran: 比…抢先行动；赶在…前面（做某事）
collins.def: If you intend to do something but someone beats you to it, they do it before you do.

example.ex: Don't  be too long about it or you'll find someone has beaten you to it.
example.tran: 别拖得太久，不然就会有人捷足先登了。

collins.def: If you can't beat them, join them means that, if someone is too strong for you to defeat, it is better to be on the same side as them.
If you say or do something without missing a beat, you continue to speak or do it, even though people might have expected you to hesitate or stop.

example.ex: 'Are you jealous?' — 'Only when I'm not in control,' he says, not missing a beat.
example.tran: “你眼红吗？”——“除非我把持不住自己，”他毫不犹豫地说道。

collins.def: If you say that someone never misses a beat, you mean that they always know what is going on and how they can take advantage of it.

example.ex: Skye has scarcely missed a beat as one of the Gold Coast's spectacular models since her marriage.
example.tran: 丝凯作为黄金海岸大红大紫的模特儿，自结婚以后从来就没有错失过任何机会。

collins.def: A police officer on the beat is on duty, walking around the area for which he or she is responsible.

example.ex: The officer on the beat picks up information; hears cries for help; makes people feel safe.
example.tran: 值勤警员注意观察情况，对救援呼叫及时反应，确保让百姓有一种安全感。

collins.def: If you beat time to a piece of music, you move your hand or foot up and down in time with the music. A conductor beats time to show the choir or orchestra how fast they should sing or play the music.

example.ex: He beats time with hands and feet.
example.tran: 他手脚并用地打着拍子。

collins.def: You  use because when stating the reason for something.

example.ex: He is called Mitch, because his name is Mitchell...
example.tran: 人们叫他米奇，因为他大名叫米切尔。

example.ex: Because it is an area of outstanding natural beauty, you can't  build on it...
example.tran: 考虑到这一带自然风光旖旎，你不能建在这里。

collins.def: You use because when stating the explanation for a statement you have just made.

example.ex: Maybe they just didn't want to ask too many questions, because they rented us a room without even asking to see our papers...
example.tran: 也许他们只是懒得问太多的问题，因为他们都没要求看我们的证件就把一个房间租给我们了。

example.ex: The President has played a shrewd diplomatic game because from the outset he called for direct talks with the United States...
example.tran: 总统玩了一场高明的外交游戏，因为从一开始他就要求和美国直接对话。

collins.def: If an event or situation occurs because of something, that thing is the reason or cause.

example.ex: Many families break up because of a lack of money...
example.tran: 许多家庭由于缺钱而破裂。

example.ex: Because of the law in Ireland, we had to work out a way of getting her over to Britain.
example.tran: 由于爱尔兰的法律所限，我们不得不想办法把她弄到英国去。

collins.def: You use just because when you want to say that a particular situation should not necessarily make you come to a particular conclusion.

example.ex: Just because it has a good tune does not mean it is great music...
example.tran: 仅凭旋律优美并不见得就是一首杰出的音乐作品。

example.ex: Just because something has always been done a certain way does not make it right.
example.tran: 仅仅因为老是以某种方式做事并不意味着这么做就是对的。

collins.def: If someone or something becomes a particular thing, they start to change and develop into that thing, or start to develop the characteristics mentioned.

example.ex: I first became interested in Islam while I was doing my nursing training...
example.tran: 我在接受护理培训的时候开始对伊斯兰教产生了兴趣。

example.ex: The cocoa industry dwindled because it became increasingly difficult to cover costs...
example.tran: 由于越来越难以收回成本，可可产业日渐衰落。

collins.def: If something becomes someone, it makes them look attractive or it seems right for them.

example.ex: Does khaki become you?...
example.tran: 卡其布适合你吗？

example.ex: Don't be crude tonight, Bernard, it doesn't  become you.
example.tran: 今晚别说荤话，伯纳德，说荤话可不好。

collins.def: If you wonder what has become of someone or something, you wonder where they are and what has happened to them.

example.ex: She thought constantly about her family; she might never know what had become of them...
example.tran: 她一直挂念着家人；她也许再也听不到他们的消息了。

example.ex: Where will he go to school now he's been thrown out of Eton? What will become of him?
example.tran: 现在他被伊顿公学开除了，他去哪儿上学呢？他将来又会怎样呢？

collins.def: If something happens before a particular date, time, or event, it happens earlier than that date, time, or event.

example.ex: Annie was born a few weeks before Christmas...
example.tran: 安妮出生在圣诞节前几周。

example.ex: Before World War II, women were not recruited as intelligence officers...
example.tran: 在第二次世界大战之前，女性不能当情报人员。

collins.def: If you do one thing before doing something else, you do it earlier than the other thing.

example.ex: He spent his early life in Sri Lanka before moving to England...
example.tran: 在移居英格兰之前，他早年是在斯里兰卡度过的。

example.ex: Before leaving, he went into his office to fill in the daily time sheet.
example.tran: 离开前，他到自己的办公室填写了日常考勤表。

collins.def: You use before when you are talking about time. For example, if something happened the day before a particular date or event, it happened during the previous day.

example.ex: The war had ended only a month or so before.
example.tran: 战争大约一个月前才刚刚结束。

collins.def: If you do something before someone else can do something, you do it when they have not yet done it.

example.ex: Before Gallacher could catch up with the ball, Nadlovu had beaten him to it.
example.tran: 加拉赫还没来得及追上球，纳德洛武就已经抢先一步触到球了。

collins.def: If someone has done something before, they have done it on a previous occasion. If someone has not done something before, they have never done it.

example.ex: I've been here before...
example.tran: 我以前来过这儿。

example.ex: I had met Professor Lown before...
example.tran: 我以前见过劳恩教授。

collins.def: If there is a period of time or if several things are done before something happens, it takes that amount of time or effort for this thing to happen.

example.ex: It was some time before the door opened in response to his ring.
example.tran: 他按完门铃后过了一会儿门才打开。

collins.tran: （必须先具备某一条件）才能；在…之前（必须具备某一条件）
collins.def: If a particular situation has to happen before something else happens, this situation must happen or exist in order for the other thing to happen.

example.ex: There was additional work to be done before all the troops would be ready.
example.tran: 在全军准备就绪之前，还有一些杂事必须处理。

collins.def: If someone is before something, they are in front of it.

example.ex: They drove through a tall iron gate and stopped before a large white villa.
example.tran: 他们开车穿过一个大铁门，在一栋白色的大别墅前面停了下来。

collins.def: If you tell someone that one place is a certain distance before another, you mean that they will come to the first place first.

example.ex: The turn is about two kilometres before the roundabout.
example.tran: 拐弯就在环岛前面约2公里处。

collins.def: If you appear or come before an official person or group, you go there and answer questions.

example.ex: The Governor will appear before the committee next Tuesday.
example.tran: 下周二，州长将接受委员会的质询。

collins.def: If something happens before a particular person or group, it is seen by or happens while this person or this group is present.

example.ex: The game followed a colourful opening ceremony before a crowd of seventy-four thousand.
example.tran: 绚丽多彩的开幕式过后，这场比赛在74,000名观众的瞩目之下开始了。

collins.tran: 摆在…面前；使面对；使面临
collins.def: If you have something such as a journey, a task, or a stage of your life before you, you must do it or live through it in the future.

example.ex: Everyone in the room knew it was the single hardest task before them...
example.tran: 房间里所有人都清楚，摆在他们面前的是最为艰巨的任务。

example.ex: I saw before me an idyllic life.
example.tran: 展现在我眼前的是充满诗情画意的生活。

collins.def: When you want to say that one person or thing is more important than another, you can say that they come before the other person or thing.

example.ex: Her husband, her children, and the Church came before her needs.
example.tran: 丈夫、孩子和教会都比她本人的需求重要。

collins.def: To begin to do something means to start doing it.

example.ex: He stood up and began to move around the room...
example.tran: 他起身开始在屋里来回走动。

example.ex: The weight loss began to look more serious...
example.tran: 体重下降眼看开始变得愈发厉害了。

collins.def: When something begins or when you begin it, it takes place from a particular time onwards.

example.ex: The problems began last November...
example.tran: 问题在去年11月份开始出现。

example.ex: He has just begun his fourth year in hiding...
example.tran: 他东躲西藏的第四个年头刚刚开始。

collins.tran: 从…开始；从…着手；首先做（某事）
collins.def: If you begin with something, or begin by doing something, this is the first thing you do.

example.ex: Could I begin with a few formalities?
example.tran: 请允许我开场先讲几句套话。

example.ex: ...a businessman who began by selling golf shirts from the boot of his car...
example.tran: 靠他的汽车后备箱练摊兜售高尔夫球衫起家的商人

collins.def: You use begin to mention the first thing that someone says.

example.ex: 'Professor Theron,' he began, 'I'm very pleased to see you'...
example.tran: “西伦教授，”他开口说道，“很高兴见到您。”

example.ex: He didn't know how to begin.
example.tran: 他不知从何说起。

collins.def: If one thing began as another, it first existed in the form of the second thing.

example.ex: What began as a local festival has blossomed into an international event.
example.tran: 原先的地方节日已经发展成为一项国际性活动。

collins.def: If you say that a thing or place begins somewhere, you are talking about one of its limits or edges.

example.ex: The fate line begins close to the wrist...
example.tran: 命运线始于接近手腕的地方。

example.ex: Rue Guynemer begins at the front of the Fitzgerald site.
example.tran: 吉内梅街始于菲茨拉德故居前。

collins.def: If a word begins with a particular letter, that is the first letter of that word.

example.ex: The first word begins with an F.
example.tran: 第一个词的首字母为F。

collins.tran: 无法，难以（解释、理解、想象等）
collins.def: If you say that you cannot begin to imagine, understand, or explain something, you are emphasizing that it is almost impossible to explain, understand, or imagine.

example.ex: You can't begin to imagine how much that saddens me.
example.tran: 你都无从想象这让我有多悲伤。

collins.def: You use to begin with when you are talking about the first stage of a situation, event, or process.

example.ex: It was great to begin with but now it's difficult.
example.tran: 一开始非常好，但现在可就难了。

collins.def: You use to begin with to introduce the first of several things that you want to say.

example.ex: 'What do scientists you've spoken with think about that?' — 'Well, to begin with, they doubt it's going to work.'
example.tran: “跟你聊过的科学家是怎么看的？”——“嗯，首先，他们怀疑这能否行得通。”

collins.def: If you believe that something is true, you think that it is true, but you are not sure.

example.ex: Experts believe that the coming drought will be extensive...
example.tran: 专家们认为即将发生的旱灾将侵袭大片地区。

example.ex: I believe you have something of mine...
example.tran: 我想你拿了我什么东西。

collins.def: If you believe someone or if you believe what they say or write, you accept that they are telling the truth.

example.ex: He did not sound as if he believed her...
example.tran: 他听起来似乎并不相信她。

example.ex: Never believe anything a married man says about his wife...
example.tran: 永远不要相信一个已婚男人说的任何有关他妻子的话。

collins.def: If you believe in fairies, ghosts, or miracles, you are sure that they exist or happen. If you believe in a god, you are sure of the existence of that god.

example.ex: I don't believe in ghosts...
example.tran: 我不相信有鬼。

example.ex: Do you believe in magic?
example.tran: 你相信魔法真的存在吗？

collins.tran: 认为…是应该的（或正确的）
collins.def: If you believe in a way of life or an idea, you are in favour of it because you think it is good or right.

example.ex: He believed in marital fidelity.
example.tran: 他认为婚内应该忠诚。

example.ex: ...decent candidates who believed in democracy.
example.tran: 信奉民主政治的正派候选人

collins.def: If you believe in someone or what they are doing, you have confidence in them and think that they will be successful.

example.ex: If you believe in yourself you can succeed.
example.tran: 只要自信，就能成功。

collins.def: Believe is used in expressions such as I can't believe how or it's hard to believe that in order to express surprise, for example because something bad has happened or something very difficult has been achieved.

example.ex: Many officers I spoke to found it hard to believe what was happening around them...
example.tran: 很多和我谈过的官员都觉得发生在他们周围的事情令人难以置信。

example.ex: I was a physical and emotional wreck — I still can't believe how I ever got any work done.
example.tran: 我那时身心俱疲——现在还难以相信我是怎么把一些事情做成的。

collins.tran: （表示对所见所闻惊讶不已）相信自己的眼睛/耳朵
collins.def: If you say that you cannot believe your eyes or cannot believe your ears, you are emphasizing that you are very surprised about something you have seen or heard.

example.ex: I could not believe my eyes. She was far more beautiful than I had imagined.
example.tran: 我简直不敢相信自己的眼睛。她比我想象的漂亮多了。

collins.tran: （强调刚才所述之事令人吃惊）信不信由你
collins.def: You can use believe it or not to emphasize that what you have just said is surprising.

example.ex: That's normal, believe it or not.
example.tran: 那很正常，信不信由你。

collins.tran: （强调对某事感到惊讶）你会相信吗？
collins.def: If you say would you believe it, you are emphasizing your surprise about something.

example.ex: And would you believe it, he's younger than me!
example.tran: 你信吗？他比我年轻！

collins.def: You can use believe you me to emphasize that what you are saying is true.

example.ex: It's absolutely amazing, believe you me.
example.tran: 这太不可思议了，真的。

means: 最好的( good和well的最高级)
最好的东西，最合乎要求的事物

collins.def: Best is the superlative of good .

example.ex: If you want further information the best thing to do is have a word with the driver as you get on the bus...
example.tran: 如果你想了解更多信息，最好的办法是在上公交车时问一问司机。

example.ex: It's not the best place to live if you wish to develop your knowledge and love of mountains.
example.tran: 如果你想增长知识、培养登山爱好的话，这可不是最好的地方。

collins.def: Best is the superlative of well .

example.ex: James Fox is best known as the author of White Mischief.
example.tran: 詹姆斯·福克斯以《欲望城》一书最为出名。

collins.def: The best is used to refer to things of the highest quality or standard.

example.ex: We offer only the best to our clients...
example.tran: 我们只把最好的服务提供给客户。

example.ex: He'll have the best of care.
example.tran: 他会得到最好的照顾。

collins.tran: 最大努力；最高成就；最好水平
collins.def: Someone's best is the greatest effort or highest achievement or standard that they are capable of.

example.ex: Miss Blockey was at her best when she played the piano...
example.tran: 布洛基小姐弹钢琴的时候发挥了她的最好水平。

example.ex: One needs to be a first-class driver to get the best out of that sort of machinery.
example.tran: 只有一流的司机才能让那种机器发挥出最大的功效。

collins.def: If you say that something is the best that can be done or hoped for, you think it is the most pleasant, successful, or useful thing that can be done or hoped for.

example.ex: A draw seems the best they can hope for...
example.tran: 看来他们顶多只能指望打个平局了。

example.ex: The best we can do is try to stay cool and muddle through.
example.tran: 我们能做的顶多就是设法保持冷静，蒙混过关。

collins.def: If you like something best or like it the best, you prefer it.

example.ex: The thing I liked best about the show was the music...
example.tran: 这场演出中我最喜欢的是它的音乐。

example.ex: Mother liked it best when Daniel got money...
example.tran: 丹尼尔拿到钱的时候，母亲是最高兴的。

collins.tran: （用于构成以good和well开头的复合形容词的最高级，如well-known的最高级为best-known）
collins.def: Best is used to form the superlative of compound adjectives beginning with 'good' and 'well'. For example, the superlative of 'well-known' is 'best-known'.

collins.tran: （用于道别或信件末尾）万事如意，一切顺利
collins.def: You can say 'All the best' when you are saying goodbye to someone, or at the end of a letter.

example.ex: Wish him all the best, and tell him we miss him.
example.tran: 祝他一切顺利，告诉他我们想念他。

collins.def: You use best of all to indicate that what you are about to mention is the thing that you prefer or that has most advantages out of all the things you have mentioned.

example.ex: It was comfortable and cheap: best of all, most of the rent was being paid by two American friends.
example.tran: 房子既舒适又便宜：最妙的是，大部分租金是由两位美国朋友支付的。

collins.tran: 尽全力；竭尽所能；尽最大努力
collins.def: If someone does something as best they can, they do it as well as they can, although it is very difficult.

example.ex: The older people were left to carry on as best they could.
example.tran: 年纪大一点的人被留下来，奋力坚持。

collins.def: You use at best to indicate that even if you describe something as favourably as possible or if it performs as well as it possibly can, it is still not very good.

example.ex: This policy, they say, is at best confused and at worst non-existent...
example.tran: 有人说这项政策往好里说是混乱不堪，往坏里说就是形同虚设。

example.ex: At best they were effective as antidepressants for no more than four months.
example.tran: 它们充其量也只能起到4个月的抗抑郁剂的效果。

collins.def: If you do your best or try your best to do something, you try as hard as you can to do it, or do it as well as you can.

example.ex: I'll do my best to find out...
example.tran: 我会尽力查明真相。

example.ex: It wasn't her fault, she was trying her best to help...
example.tran: 这不是她的错，她是尽力帮忙的。

collins.def: If you say that something is for the best, you mean it is the most desirable or helpful thing that could have happened or could be done, considering all the circumstances.

example.ex: In the long run, it was for the best...
example.tran: 长远来说，这是最好的。

example.ex: Whatever the circumstances, parents are supposed to know what to do for the best.
example.tran: 不论在什么情况下，父母都应该知道怎样做才是最好的。

collins.tran: （尤指冰释前嫌后）最好的朋友；知己
collins.def: If two people are the best of friends, they are close friends, especially when they have had a disagreement or fight in the past.

example.ex: Magda is now married to George Callerby and we are the best of friends.
example.tran: 玛格达现在已经和乔治·卡勒比结婚了，我们成了最好的朋友。

collins.tran: 最好（有些人认为此用法不规范）
collins.def: If you say that someone had best do something or that they'd best do it, you mean they ought to do it. Some people consider this to be non-standard.

example.ex: You'd best take a look.
example.tran: 你最好还是看一看。

collins.def: If you say that a particular person knows best, you mean that they have a lot of experience and should therefore be trusted to make decisions for other people.

example.ex: He was convinced that doctors and dentists knew best.
example.tran: 他确信医生和牙医最清楚该怎么做。

collins.tran: 看起来处于自己最迷人的状态
collins.def: If you look your best, you are looking as smart and attractive as you can.

example.ex: I made sure I was very clean and looking my best.
example.tran: 我把自己收拾得十分整洁，美丽动人。

collins.tran: 乐观地尽可能利用（逆境）
collins.def: If you make the best of something, you accept an unsatisfactory situation cheerfully and try to manage as well as you can. In British English, you can also say that you make the best of a bad job .

example.ex: She instilled in the children the virtues of good hard work, and making the best of what you have.
example.tran: 她慢慢给孩子们灌输勤奋工作的品德，教导他们充分利用现有的条件。

collins.def: Better is the comparative of good .
Better is the comparative of well .
If you like one thing better than another, you like it more.

example.ex: I like your interpretation better than the one I was taught...
example.tran: 你的解释比我以前学过的更让我喜欢。

example.ex: I'd like nothing better than to join you girls...
example.tran: 我最喜欢和你们女孩子在一起了。

collins.def: If you are better after an illness or injury, you have recovered from it. If you feel better, you no longer feel so ill.

example.ex: He is much better now, he's fine...
example.tran: 他现在好多了，身体状况不错。

example.ex: The doctors were saying there wasn't  much hope of me getting better.
example.tran: 医生们说我好转的希望不大。

collins.tran: （用于建议、警告、威胁、发表意见等）最好
collins.def: You use had better or 'd  better when you are advising, warning, or threatening someone, or expressing an opinion about what should happen.

example.ex: It's half past two. I think we had better go home...
example.tran: 现在两点半了。我想我们最好还是回家吧。

example.ex: You'd better run if you're going to get your ticket...
example.tran: 想买到票的话，你最好跑几步。

collins.tran: 更大成就；更好行为；更好待遇
collins.def: If you say that you expect or deserve better, you mean that you expect or deserve a higher standard of achievement, behaviour, or treatment from people than they have shown you.

example.ex: We expect better of you in the future...
example.tran: 我们希望将来你有更大的成就。

example.ex: Our long-suffering mining communities deserve better than this.
example.tran: 我们长期受苦受难的采矿群体应该得到比这更好的待遇。

collins.def: Your betters are people who have a higher status or rank than you do.

example.ex: Sit down and be quiet in front of your elders and betters.
example.tran: 在长辈和上级面前要老老实实地坐着。

collins.def: If someone betters a high achievement or standard, they achieve something higher.

example.ex: He recorded a time of 4 minutes 23, bettering the old record of 4-24...
example.tran: 他用时4分23秒，刷新了4分24秒的原纪录。

example.ex: As an account of adolescence it could hardly be bettered.
example.tran: 作为描写青春期的书，它已几臻完美。

collins.def: If you better your situation, you improve your social status or the quality of your life. If you better yourself, you improve your social status.

example.ex: He had dedicated his life to bettering the lot of the oppressed people of South Africa...
example.tran: 他毕生致力于改变南非受压迫人民的命运。

example.ex: Our parents chose to come here with the hope of bettering themselves.
example.tran: 我们的父母选择来到这里，希望能够改善自己的生活。

collins.tran: （用于构成以 good 和 well 开头的复合形容词的比较级，如 well-off 的比较级为 better-off）
collins.def: Better is used to form the comparative of compound adjectives beginning with 'good' and 'well.' For example, the comparative of 'well-off' is 'better-off.'
You can say that someone is better doing one thing than another, or it is better doing one thing than another, to advise someone about what they should do.

example.ex: You are better eating just a small snack than hurrying a main meal...
example.tran: 你最好简单吃点快餐，不要着急着慌地吃正餐。

example.ex: Wouldn't  it be better putting a time-limit on the task?...
example.tran: 是不是给这项任务规定一个时限比较好？

collins.def: If something changes for the better, it improves.

example.ex: Dreams of changing the world for the better.
example.tran: 让世界变得更美好的梦想

collins.tran: （嫉妒、好奇心、愤怒等感情）使不能自制
collins.def: If a feeling such as jealousy, curiosity, or anger gets the better of you, it becomes too strong for you to hide or control.

example.ex: She didn't allow her emotions to get the better of her.
example.tran: 她没有感情用事。

collins.tran: （在比赛、打斗或争论中）战胜，打败
collins.def: If you get the better of someone, you defeat them in a contest, fight, or argument.

example.ex: He is used to tough defenders, and he usually gets the better of them.
example.tran: 他习惯了彪悍的后卫，通常都能战而胜之。

collins.def: If someone knows better than to do something, they are old enough or experienced enough to know it is the wrong thing to do.

example.ex: She knew better than to argue with Adeline...
example.tran: 她不至于和阿德琳发生争执。

example.ex: It's  bad enough to have anyone joke about such a serious matter but a member of the police force should know better.
example.tran: 拿这么严肃的事情开玩笑已经够糟的了，身为一名警察更不应该这样做。

collins.tran: 比…更了解（或更渊博、更有经验）
collins.def: If you know better than someone, you have more information, knowledge, or experience than them.

example.ex: He thought he knew better than I did, though he was much less experienced...
example.tran: 虽然他经验远没有我丰富，但他认为他比我懂行。

example.ex: My sister still claims she cheated on us at cards, but I know better.
example.tran: 我妹妹仍然说她和我们玩牌的时候捣了鬼，其实我心知肚明。

collins.def: If you say that someone would be better off doing something, you are advising them to do it or expressing the opinion that it would benefit them to do it.

example.ex: If you've  got bags you're better off taking a taxi...
example.tran: 你要是大包小包的，不如打的算了。

example.ex: Their stance seems to be that a baby or child is better off in its country of birth.
example.tran: 他们似乎认为婴儿或者小孩还是呆在自己出生的国家为好。

collins.def: If you go one better, you do something better than it has been done before or obtain something better than someone else has.

example.ex: Now General Electric have gone one better than nature and made a diamond purer than the best quality natural diamonds.
example.tran: 现在通用电气公司已经制造出了巧夺天工的钻石，其纯度比最好的天然钻石还要高。

collins.tran: （表示赞成、表扬或鼓励）很好，这就对了
collins.def: You say 'That's  better' in order to express your approval of what someone has said or done, or to praise or encourage them.

example.ex: 'I came to ask your advice — no, to ask for your help.' — 'That's better. And how can I help you?'
example.tran: “我来征求你们的意见——不对，请求你们帮助。”——“这还差不多。我们怎么帮助你？”

collins.def: You can say 'so much the better' or 'all the better' to indicate that it is desirable that a particular thing is used, done, or available.

example.ex: Use strong white flour, and if you can get hold of durum wheat flour, then so much the better...
example.tran: 使用高筋白面粉，如果你能弄到硬粒小麦面粉，那就更好了。

example.ex: If there's good skiing, breathtaking scenery and you don't  need to catch a plane, all the better!
example.tran: 如果有好的滑雪场、令人叹为观止的美景，又不用赶飞机，那就再好不过了。

collins.def: You can use expressions like 'The bigger the better' or 'The sooner the better' to say that you would prefer it if something is big or happens soon.

example.ex: The Irish love a party, the bigger the better...
example.tran: 爱尔兰人喜欢聚会，规模越大越好。

example.ex: The fewer things in the room the better.
example.tran: 房间里的东西越少越好。

collins.tran: 为了更好地…；以便更有效地…
collins.def: If you do something the better to do something else, you do the first thing in order to be able to do the second thing more effectively.

example.ex: She came on every ride herself, the better to instruct her eager pupils.
example.tran: 每一个骑乘项目她都要亲自试一试，以便更好地指导她那些跃跃欲试的小学生。

collins.def: If you intend to do something and then think better of it, you decide not to do it because you realize it would not be sensible.

example.ex: Alberg opened his mouth, as if to protest. But he thought better of it.
example.tran: 阿尔伯格张了张嘴，似乎想要申辩，但想想又放弃了。

collins.tran: 不论好坏；不管结果怎样
collins.def: If you say that something has happened or been done for better or worse, you mean that you are not sure whether the consequences will be good or bad, but they will have to be accepted because the action cannot be changed.

example.ex: I married you for better or worse, knowing all about these problems.
example.tran: 这些问题我都知道，不管怎样我还是嫁给了你。

collins.def: If something is between two things or is in between them, it has one of the things on one side of it and the other thing on the other side.

example.ex: She left the table to stand between the two men...
example.tran: 她离开桌子，站在了那两个男人之间。

example.ex: Charlie crossed between the traffic to the far side of the street.
example.tran: 查利从车流中间穿过，到了街对面。

collins.def: If people or things travel between two places, they travel regularly from one place to the other and back again.

example.ex: I spent a lot of time in the early Eighties travelling between London and Bradford.
example.tran: 八十年代初，我有很多时间穿梭于伦敦和布拉德福德之间。

collins.tran: 在（两个人、群体或事物）之间
collins.def: A relationship, discussion, or difference between two people, groups, or things is one that involves them both or relates to them both.

example.ex: I think the relationship between patients and doctors has got a lot less personal...
example.tran: 我认为医患关系变得越来越缺乏人情味。

example.ex: There have been intensive discussions between the two governments in recent days...
example.tran: 近几天，双方政府一直在进行紧张的磋商。

collins.def: If something stands between you and what you want, it prevents you from having it.

example.ex: His sense of duty often stood between him and the enjoyment of life.
example.tran: 他的责任感经常让他无法好好享受生活。

collins.def: If something is between two amounts or ages, it is greater or older than the first one and smaller or younger than the second one.

example.ex: Increase the amount of time you spend exercising by walking between 15 and 20 minutes...
example.tran: 步行15至20分钟，增加一下你的运动时间。

example.ex: Amsterdam is fun — a third of its population is aged between 18 and 30.
example.tran: 阿姆斯特丹非常有趣——它有1/3的人口年龄介于18到30岁之间。

collins.def: If something happens between or in between two times or events, it happens after the first time or event and before the second one.

example.ex: The canal was built between 1793 and 1797...
example.tran: 运河开凿于1793到1797年间。

example.ex: Berlin was well known for its good living in between the two world wars.
example.tran: 在两次世界大战之间，柏林生活的优裕是众所周知的。

collins.def: If you must choose between two or more things, you must choose just one of them.

example.ex: Students will be able to choose between English, French and Russian as their first foreign language.
example.tran: 学生可以在英语、法语和俄语中间选择一门作为第一外语。

collins.def: If people or places have a particular amount of something between them, this is the total amount that they have.

example.ex: The three sites employ 12,500 people between them...
example.tran: 这三处共雇用了12,500名员工。

example.ex: Between them, they train over fifty horses in Lambourn.
example.tran: 他们在兰伯恩总共驯了五十多匹马。

collins.def: When something is divided or shared between people, they each have a share of it.

example.ex: His company was bought out by Hogg Robinson for £3.5m, divided between five partners...
example.tran: 他的公司被霍格·鲁宾逊公司以350万英镑的价格收购，分给了五位合伙人。

example.ex: There is only one bathroom shared between eight bedrooms.
example.tran: 八间卧室共用一间浴室。

collins.tran: 你我之间（的秘密）；只限于你我之间；我俩私下说说
collins.def: When you introduce a statement by saying 'between you and me' or 'between ourselves', you are indicating that you do not want anyone else to know what you are saying.

example.ex: Between you and me, though, it's been awful for business...
example.tran: 不过你我之间说说，这事儿办得真不怎么样。

example.ex: Between ourselves, I know he wants to marry her.
example.tran: 我们私下说说，我知道他想娶她。

collins.def: A big person or thing is large in physical size.

example.ex: Australia's a big country...
example.tran: 澳大利亚是个幅员辽阔的国家。

example.ex: Her husband was a big man...
example.tran: 她丈夫是个大块头。

collins.def: Something that is big consists of many people or things.

example.ex: The crowd included a big contingent from Ipswich.
example.tran: 人群中有来自伊普斯威奇的一个人数众多的代表团。

example.ex: ...the big backlog of applications.
example.tran: 大量积压的申请表

collins.tran: 严重的；重大的；大幅度的
collins.def: If you describe something such as a problem, increase, or change as a big one, you mean it is great in degree, extent, or importance.

example.ex: Her problem was just too big for her to tackle on her own...
example.tran: 她的问题太严重了，光靠她自己是没法解决的。

example.ex: There could soon be a big increase in unemployment.
example.tran: 失业人数可能很快就会出现大幅增长。

collins.def: A big organization employs many people and has many customers.

example.ex: Exchange is largely controlled by big banks.
example.tran: 货币兑换业务主要由大银行控制。

example.ex: ...one of the biggest companies in Italy.
example.tran: 意大利最大的公司之一

collins.def: If you say that someone is big in a particular organization, activity, or place, you mean that they have a lot of influence or authority in it.

example.ex: Their father was very big in the army...
example.tran: 他们的父亲在军中很有影响力。

example.ex: I'm sure all the big names will come to the club.
example.tran: 我相信所有的大人物都会到这个俱乐部来。

collins.tran: （强调厌恶之深）十足的，突出的
collins.def: If you call someone a big bully or a big coward, you are emphasizing your disapproval of them.
Children often refer to their older brother or sister as their big brother or sister.
Capital letters are sometimes referred to as big letters.

example.ex: ...a big letter J.
example.tran: 大写字母J

collins.def: Big words are long or rare words which have meanings that are difficult to understand.

example.ex: They use a lot of big words.
example.tran: 他们使用很多生僻的词汇。

collins.def: If you make it big, you become successful or famous.

example.ex: We're not just looking at making it big in the UK, we want to be big internationally.
example.tran: 我们不仅想在英国取得成功，还想在国际上扬名立万。

collins.def: If you think big, you make plans on a large scale, often using a lot of time, effort, or money.

example.ex: Maybe we're not thinking big enough.
example.tran: 也许我们的抱负还不够远大。

collins.def: If something is happening in a big way, it is happening on a large scale.

example.ex: I think boxing will take off in a big way here.
example.tran: 我想拳击运动在这儿会有很大的发展。

collins.def: A billion is a thousand million.

example.ex: ...3 billion dollars...
example.tran: 30亿美元

example.ex: This year, almost a billion birds will be processed in the region.
example.tran: 今年将会有近10亿只禽类在这个地区加工。

collins.def: If you talk about billions of people or things, you mean that there is a very large number of them but you do not know or do not want to say exactly how many.

example.ex: Biological systems have been doing this for billions of years...
example.tran: 生物系统亿万年来一直都是这样。

example.ex: He urged US executives to invest billions of dollars in his country.
example.tran: 他力劝美国公司的高管们向他的国家投资数十亿美元。

means: [计] 比特（二进位制信息单位）
[口语]相当，有点儿，或多或少，多少[a bit to的省略]

collins.def: A bit of something is a small amount of it.

example.ex: All it required was a bit of work...
example.tran: 这事儿只需稍费工夫就可以了。

example.ex: I got paid a little bit of money.
example.tran: 我只领到了一点点钱。

collins.def: A bit means to a small extent or degree. It is sometimes used to make a statement less extreme.

example.ex: This girl was a bit strange...
example.tran: 这个女孩有点儿古怪。

example.ex: I think people feel a bit more confident...
example.tran: 我想人们应该觉得稍微自信了一点儿。

collins.def: You can use a bit of to make a statement less forceful. For example, the statement 'It's a bit of a nuisance' is less forceful than 'It's a nuisance'.

example.ex: It's all a bit of a mess...
example.tran: 有点儿乱七八糟。

example.ex: Students have always been portrayed as a bit of a joke...
example.tran: 学生们总是被描述为有点儿可笑的人。

collins.def: Quite a bit means quite a lot.

example.ex: They're worth quite a bit of money...
example.tran: 它们值不少钱。

example.ex: Things have changed quite a bit...
example.tran: 情况发生了相当大的变化。

collins.def: You use a bit before 'more' or 'less' to mean a small amount more or a small amount less.

example.ex: I still think I have a bit more to offer...
example.tran: 我还是认为我能再稍微多付出一点儿。

example.ex: Maybe we'll hear a little bit less noise.
example.tran: 也许我们听到的噪音会稍微少一点儿。

collins.tran: 一会儿，片刻（英国英语中亦用for a bit）
collins.def: If you do something a bit, you do it for a short time. In British English, you can also say that you do something for a bit .

example.ex: Let's wait a bit...
example.tran: 我们等一会儿吧。

example.ex: I hope there will be time to talk a bit...
example.tran: 我希望能有时间谈一谈。

collins.def: A bit of something is a small part or section of it.

example.ex: That's the bit of the meeting that I missed...
example.tran: 那就是会议上我错过的那一小段。

example.ex: Now comes the really important bit...
example.tran: 下面是非常重要的部分。

collins.def: A bit of something is a small piece of it.

example.ex: Only a bit of string looped round a nail in the doorpost held it shut.
example.tran: 仅仅是靠缠在门柱钉子上的一小段细绳把门关紧。

example.ex: ...crumpled bits of paper.
example.tran: 皱皱巴巴的小纸片

collins.tran: （一组事物中的）一个，一项，一件
collins.def: You can use bit to refer to a particular item or to one of a group or set of things. For example, a bit of information is an item of information.

example.ex: There was one bit of vital evidence which helped win the case...
example.tran: 一个关键的证据帮助打赢了这场官司。

example.ex: Not one single bit of work has been started towards the repair of this road.
example.tran: 这条路的修缮工作一丁点儿都还没开始。

collins.tran: （表示不重要）所有相关的零七碎八
collins.def: You use bit in expressions such as the charity bit and the whole marriage bit to refer to everything that is involved in something, when you do not think it is important.

collins.tran: 位，比特（计算机的最小信息量单位）
collins.def: In computing, a bit is the smallest unit of information that is held in a computer's memory. It is either 1 or 0. Several bits form a byte.
A bit is 12 1/2 cents; mainly used in expressions such as two bits, which means 25 cents, or four bits, which means 50 cents.
A bit is a piece of metal that is held in a horse's mouth and is used to control the horse when you are riding.
Bit is the past tense of bite.
If something happens bit by bit, it happens in stages.

example.ex: Bit by bit I began to understand what they were trying to do.
example.tran: 我逐渐明白了他们想要干什么。

collins.tran: 急欲摆脱束缚做事；急于开始
collins.def: If someone is champing at the bit or is chomping at the bit, they are very impatient to do something, but they are prevented from doing it, usually by circumstances that they have no control over.

example.ex: I expect you're champing at the bit, so we'll get things going as soon as we can.
example.tran: 我希望你努力打开局面，这样我们就能尽快把事情做起来。

collins.def: If you do your bit, you do something that, to a small or limited extent, helps to achieve something.

collins.tran: 完全和…一样…；…程度丝毫不逊色于…
collins.def: You say that one thing is every bit as good, interesting, or important as another to emphasize that the first thing is just as good, interesting, or important as the second.

example.ex: My dinner jacket is every bit as good as his.
example.tran: 我的晚礼服和他的一样好。

collins.def: If you say that something is a bit much, you are annoyed because you think someone has behaved in an unreasonable way.

example.ex: It's a bit much expecting me to dump your boyfriend for you.
example.tran: 指望我替你甩掉你的男朋友，有点儿过分了吧？

collins.def: You use not a bit when you want to make a strong negative statement.

example.ex: I'm really not a bit surprised...
example.tran: 我真的一点儿也不觉得惊讶。

example.ex: 'Are you disappointed?'—'Not a bit.'
example.tran: “你失望了吗？”——“一点儿也不。”

collins.tran: 并非如此；根本没有；一点儿没有
collins.def: You say not a bit of it to emphasize that something that you might expect to be the case is not the case.

example.ex: Did he give up? Not a bit of it!
example.tran: 他放弃了吗？根本没有！

collins.tran: 各种零碎东西；七零八碎的东西
collins.def: You can use bits and pieces or bits and bobs to refer to a collection of different things.

collins.tran: （对工作等）满腔热忱，义无反顾
collins.def: If you get the bit between your teeth, or take the bit between your teeth, you become very enthusiastic about a job you have to do.
If something is smashed or blown to bits, it is broken into a number of pieces. If something falls to bits, it comes apart so that it is in a number of pieces.

example.ex: She found a pretty yellow jug smashed to bits.
example.tran: 她发现一个漂亮的黄色小罐被摔得粉碎。

means: 机内测试设备(Built-In Test Equipment)

collins.def: If you bite something, you use your teeth to cut into it, for example in order to eat it or break it. If an animal or person bites you, they use their teeth to hurt or injure you.

example.ex: Both sisters bit their nails as children...
example.tran: 两姐妹都像小孩儿一样咬指甲。

example.ex: He bit into his sandwich...
example.tran: 他咬了一口他的三明治。

collins.def: A bite of something, especially food, is the action of biting it.

example.ex: He took another bite of apple...
example.tran: 他又咬了一口苹果。

example.ex: You cannot eat a bun in one bite.
example.tran: 你不能一口吃下一个面包。

collins.def: If you have a bite to eat, you have a small meal or a snack.

example.ex: It was time to go home for a little rest and a bite to eat.
example.tran: 该回家休息一会儿，吃一点儿东西了。

collins.def: If a snake or a small insect bites you, it makes a mark or hole in your skin, and often causes the surrounding area of your skin to become painful or itchy.

example.ex: When an infected mosquito bites a human, spores are injected into the blood...
example.tran: 感染病毒的蚊子叮咬人之后，孢子便被注入血液中。

example.ex: We were all badly bitten by mosquitoes.
example.tran: 我们都被蚊子咬惨了。

collins.def: A bite is an injury or a mark on your body where an animal, snake, or small insect has bitten you.

example.ex: Any dog bite, no matter how small, needs immediate medical attention.
example.tran: 被狗咬后，不管伤口多小，都必须立即就医。

collins.def: When an action or policy begins to bite, it begins to have a serious or harmful effect.

example.ex: As the sanctions begin to bite there will be more political difficulties ahead...
example.tran: 随着制裁开始产生严重的负面影响，政治上将面临更多的困难。

example.ex: The recession started biting deeply into British industry.
example.tran: 经济萧条开始对英国的工业产生严重影响。

collins.def: If an object bites into a surface, it presses hard against it or cuts into it.

example.ex: There may even be some wire or nylon biting into the flesh...
example.tran: 甚至可能有一些金属丝或者尼龙线勒到肉里。

example.ex: The car's tires bit loudly on the rutted snow in the street.
example.tran: 汽车轮子碾入街道上布满车辙的雪里，发出很大的声响。

collins.tran: （食物或酒的）浓郁味道，辛辣味
collins.def: If you say that a food or drink has bite, you like it because it has a strong or sharp taste.

example.ex: ...the addition of tartaric acid to give the wine some bite.
example.tran: 为增加红酒的口感而加入酒石酸

collins.def: If the air or the wind has a bite, it feels very cold.

example.ex: There was a bite in the air, a smell perhaps of snow.
example.tran: 空气非常寒冷，似乎有雪的味道。

collins.def: If something such as a performance or a piece of writing has bite, it is exciting or effective.

example.ex: The teams have that extra bite when they are playing against their neighbours...
example.tran: 这几支队伍与其邻近地区队伍交手时锐气更盛。

example.ex: The novel seems to lack bite and tension—even passion.
example.tran: 这部小说乏善可陈，没有紧张的情节——甚至缺少激情。

collins.def: If a fish bites when you are fishing, it takes the hook or bait at the end of your fishing line in its mouth.

example.ex: After half an hour, the fish stopped biting and we moved on.
example.tran: 半个小时以后，鱼儿不再咬钩了，我们只好换地方。

collins.def: A bite of something is a small part or amount of it.

example.ex: ...bites of conversation.
example.tran: 谈话的片段

collins.tran: 恩将仇报；以怨报德；忘恩负义
collins.def: If someone bites the hand that feeds them, they behave badly or in an ungrateful way towards someone who they depend on.

example.ex: She may be cynical about the film industry, but ultimately she has no intention of biting the hand that feeds her.
example.tran: 她对电影业可能有些怀疑失望，但终究没有恩将仇报之意。

collins.def: If someone speaks or replies to you angrily, and you think they are being unfair or reacting too strongly, you can say that they bite your head off .

example.ex: Whenever possible, suggest she talks about it but be aware she may bite your head off for your trouble.
example.tran: 找机会建议她谈谈这事儿，但是小心她可能会因为你多事儿而大发雷霆。

collins.def: If you bite your lip or your tongue, you stop yourself from saying something that you want to say, because it would be the wrong thing to say in the circumstances.

example.ex: I must learn to bite my lip...
example.tran: 我必须学会不乱说话。

example.ex: He bit his tongue as he found himself on the point of saying 'follow that car'.
example.tran: 他想说“跟上那辆车”，话到嘴边又咽了回去。

collins.tran: 抽出一部分，拿出一部分（钱）
collins.def: If something takes a bite out of a sum of money, part of the money is spent or taken away in order to pay for it.

example.ex: Local taxes are going to be taking a bigger bite out of people's income than they ever have before.
example.tran: 地方税收在人们收入中的比重将超过以往任何时候。

collins.def: Something that is black is of the darkest colour that there is, the colour of the sky at night when there is no light at all.

example.ex: She was wearing a black coat with a white collar...
example.tran: 她穿着一件白领黑外套。

example.ex: He had thick black hair...
example.tran: 他的头发乌黑浓密。

collins.tran: （人）黑色人种的；（尤指）非洲黑人的
collins.def: A black person belongs to a race of people with dark skins, especially a race from Africa.

example.ex: He worked for the rights of black people...
example.tran: 他为争取黑人权利而工作。

example.ex: Sherry is black, tall, slender and soft-spoken.
example.tran: 谢里是个黑人，身材高挑，细声细语。

collins.def: Black people are sometimes referred to as blacks. This use could cause offence.

example.ex: There are about thirty-one million blacks in the US.
example.tran: 美国大约有3,100万黑人。

collins.def: Black coffee or tea has no milk or cream added to it.

example.ex: A cup of black tea or black coffee contains no calories...
example.tran: 一杯不加牛奶的茶或咖啡不含热量。

example.ex: I drink coffee black.
example.tran: 我喝咖啡不加奶。

collins.tran: 极糟糕的；坏透顶的；黑暗的
collins.def: If you describe a situation as black, you are emphasizing that it is very bad indeed.

example.ex: It was, he said later, one of the blackest days of his political career...
example.tran: 后来他说，这是他政治生涯中最黑暗的日子之一。

example.ex: The future for the industry looks even blacker.
example.tran: 这个产业的前景看起来更加暗淡。

collins.def: If someone is in a black mood, they feel very miserable and depressed.

example.ex: In late 1975, she fell into a black depression...
example.tran: 在1975年底，她陷入了情绪的低谷。

example.ex: Her mood was blacker than ever.
example.tran: 她的心情从未如此低落过。

collins.def: You use black to describe things that you consider to be very cruel or wicked.

example.ex: I think their crime is a blacker one than mere exploitation.
example.tran: 我想他们的罪行比单纯的剥削更残忍。

example.ex: ...the blackest laws in the country's history.
example.tran: 这个国家历史上最严酷的法律

collins.def: Black humour involves jokes about sad or difficult situations.

example.ex: 'So you can all go over there and get shot,' he said, with the sort of black humour common among British troops here...
example.tran: “所以你们都可以到那里去挨枪子儿，”他说道，口吻中透着这里英国部队惯用的黑色幽默。

example.ex: It's a black comedy of racial prejudice, mistaken identity and thwarted expectations.
example.tran: 这是一个关于种族歧视、身份错位和期望落空的黑色喜剧。

collins.def: People who believe in black magic believe that it is possible to communicate with evil spirits.

example.ex: He was also alleged to have conducted black magic ceremonies...
example.tran: 据称他还做了法。

example.ex: The King was unjustly accused of practising the black arts.
example.tran: 国王被诬陷施行妖术。

collins.def: If someone blacks another person's eye, they punch or hit that person in the eye, causing it to bruise and look black.

example.ex: Her husband blacked her eye...
example.tran: 她丈夫把她的眼睛打青了。

example.ex: Their mother was trying to hide her two blacked eyes.
example.tran: 他们的母亲想遮住自己被打青的双眼。

collins.def: If you say that someone is black and blue, you mean that they are badly bruised.

example.ex: Whenever she refused, he'd beat her black and blue...
example.tran: 只要她拒绝他，他就会把她打得青一块紫一块。

example.ex: Bud's nose was still black and blue.
example.tran: 巴德的鼻子还是青一块紫一块的。

collins.def: If a person or an organization is in the black, they do not owe anyone any money.

example.ex: Remington's operations in Japan are now in the black...
example.tran: 雷明顿在日本的业务现在有盈利。

example.ex: Until his finances are in the black I don't want to get married.
example.tran: 在他有银行存款之前，我不想和他结婚。

collins.def: If someone gives you a black look, they look at you in a way that shows that they are very angry about something.

example.ex: Passing my stall, she cast black looks at the amount of stuff still unsold.
example.tran: 她经过我的货摊的时候，怒气冲冲地看了几眼还没有卖出去的东西。

means: [复数]（美国海、陆、空三军穿的）蓝色制服
[the blue(s)][用作单数或复数]布鲁斯（歌曲）（一种伤感的美国黑人民歌）

collins.def: Something that is blue is the colour of the sky on a sunny day.

example.ex: There were swallows in the cloudless blue sky...
example.tran: 燕子在万里无云的蓝天飞翔。

example.ex: She fixed her pale blue eyes on her father's.
example.tran: 她淡蓝色的眼睛紧紧盯着她父亲的双眼。

collins.tran: 蓝调音乐，布鲁斯音乐（源于美国南部黑人音乐家，节奏缓慢，旋律感强）
collins.def: The blues is a type of music which was developed by African American musicians in the southern United States. It is characterized by a slow tempo and a strong rhythm.

example.ex: His singing really does have the depth and the emotional range of the blues.
example.tran: 他的歌声确实颇有布鲁斯音乐的内蕴和情感深度。

example.ex: ...the blues bars of Chicago.
example.tran: 芝加哥的蓝调酒吧

collins.def: If you have got the blues, you feel sad and depressed.

example.ex: Interfering in-laws are the prime sources of the blues.
example.tran: 喜欢指手画脚的姻亲最让人头疼。

collins.def: If you are feeling blue, you are feeling sad or depressed, often when there is no particular reason.

example.ex: There's no earthly reason for me to feel so blue.
example.tran: 我也说不出来为什么这么沮丧。

collins.tran: （剑桥或牛津大学的）校队运动员，蓝色荣誉者
collins.def: A Cambridge blue or an Oxford blue is a man or woman who has played for Cambridge or Oxford University in a particular sport.
Blue films, stories, or jokes are about sex.

example.ex: ...a secret stash of porn mags and blue movies.
example.tran: 偷偷藏起来的一堆色情杂志和黄色影碟

collins.def: If something happens out of the blue, it happens unexpectedly.

example.ex: One of them wrote to us out of the blue several years later.
example.tran: 数年后他们中的一人突然给我们写了一封信。

collins.def: Your body is all your physical parts, including your head, arms, and legs.

example.ex: The largest organ in the body is the liver.
example.tran: 人体最大的器官是肝脏。

collins.tran: 躯干（不包括头和四肢）；躯体
collins.def: You can also refer to the main part of  your body, except for your arms, head, and legs, as your body .

example.ex: Lying flat on the floor, twist your body on to one hip and cross your upper leg over your body.
example.tran: 平躺在地板上，屈体侧躺，把上面的一条腿搭在身上。

collins.def: You can refer to a person's dead body as a body .

example.ex: Officials said they had found no traces of violence on the body of the politician.
example.tran: 官员称他们没有在这位政治家的尸体上发现暴力侵犯的痕迹。

collins.def: A body is an organized group of people who deal with something officially.

example.ex: ...the Chairman of the policemen's representative body, the Police Federation.
example.tran: 警察的代表机构“警察协会”的主席

example.ex: ...the main trade union body, COSATU, Congress of South African Trade Unions.
example.tran: 最大的工会组织COSATU，即南非全国总工会

collins.def: A body of people is a group of people who are together or who are connected in some way.

example.ex: ...that large body of people which teaches other people how to teach.
example.tran: 向别人传授教学方法的那一大批人

collins.tran: （建筑物、文件等的）主体，主要部分
collins.def: The body of something such as a building or a document is the main part of it or the largest part of it.

example.ex: The main body of the church had been turned into a massive television studio...
example.tran: 该教堂的主体部分已被改造成了一个大型电视演播室。

example.ex: Give an introduction, followed by the body of the material, then a brief summary.
example.tran: 首先写序言，接下来是内容的主体部分，然后作简短的总结。

collins.def: The body of a car or aeroplane is the main part of it, not including its engine, wheels, or wings.

example.ex: The only shade was under the body of the plane.
example.tran: 唯一的阴凉处是飞机机身下面。

collins.def: A body of water is a large area of water, such as a lake or a sea.

example.ex: It is probably the most polluted body of water in the world.
example.tran: 这很可能是世界上受污染最严重的一片水域。

collins.def: A body of information is a large amount of it.

example.ex: An increasing body of evidence suggests that all of us have cancer cells in our bodies at times during our lives.
example.tran: 越来越多的证据表明，我们所有人一生中体内时有癌细胞存在。

collins.def: If you say that an alcoholic drink has body, you mean that it has a full and strong flavour.

example.ex: ...a dry wine with good body.
example.tran: 香醇的干葡萄酒

collins.def: A body is the same as a bodysuit .

collins.tran: （用于强调强烈反对）除非我死了，休想
collins.def: You can say over my dead body to emphasize that you feel very strongly that something should not happen, and that you will do everything you can to prevent it.

example.ex: 'We'll have her over for dinner.' — 'Over my dead body!'
example.tran: “我们要请她过来吃饭。”——“休想！”

collins.def: You use body and soul to mean every part of you, including your mind and your emotions.

example.ex: He dedicated himself body and soul to the education of young men...
example.tran: 他全身心地投入到年轻人的教育中。

example.ex: She was now committed to the band, body and soul.
example.tran: 现在，她把全部心思都放到了乐队上面。

collins.def: If you keep body and soul together, you have enough money to provide what you need to live.

example.ex: He at first kept body and soul together by selling cartoons to the humorous papers.
example.tran: 他最初通过向幽默搞笑类报纸出售卡通漫画维持生计。

collins.def: A book is a number of pieces of paper, usually with words printed on them, which are fastened together and fixed inside a cover of stronger paper or cardboard. Books contain information, stories, or poetry, for example.

example.ex: His eighth book came out earlier this year and was an instant best-seller...
example.tran: 他的第8本书在今年早些时候面世，迅速成为了畅销书。

example.ex: 'Robinson Crusoe' is one of the most famous books in the world.
example.tran: 《鲁宾逊漂流记》是一本世界名著。

collins.tran: 一册（邮票）；一纸板（火柴）；一本（票券）
collins.def: A book of something such as stamps, matches, or tickets is a small number of them fastened together between thin cardboard covers.

example.ex: Can I have a book of first class stamps please?
example.tran: 请给我一板第一类邮件的邮票好吗？

collins.def: When you book something such as a hotel room or a ticket, you arrange to have it or use it at a particular time.

example.ex: British officials have booked hotel rooms for the women and children...
example.tran: 英国官员已为妇女和儿童预订了宾馆房间。

example.ex: Laurie revealed she had booked herself a flight home last night.
example.tran: 劳丽透露她昨晚已为自己预订了返家的机票。

collins.tran: （公司或组织机构的）账册，账簿，名册
collins.def: A company's  or organization's books are its records of money that has been spent and earned or of the names of people who belong to it.

example.ex: For the most part he left the books to his managers and accountants...
example.tran: 他通常都把账册交给经理和会计们处理。

example.ex: Around 12 per cent of the people on our books are in the computing industry.
example.tran: 我们的名册中有大约12%的人供职于计算机行业。

collins.tran: （足球裁判）记名警告（严重犯规的球员）
collins.def: When a referee books a football player who has seriously broken the rules of the game, he or she officially writes down the player's name.

example.ex: League referee Keith Cooper booked him in the first half for a tussle with the goalie.
example.tran: 联赛裁判基思·库珀在上半场因他与守门员抢球犯规而对他记名警告。

collins.def: When a police officer books someone, he or she officially records their name and the offence that they may be charged with.

example.ex: They took him to the station and booked him for assault with a deadly weapon.
example.tran: 他们把他带到警察局，把他用致命武器袭击他人的罪行记录在案。

collins.def: In a very long written work such as the Bible, a book is one of the sections into which it is divided.
If you are in someone's bad books, they are annoyed with you. If you are in their good books, they are pleased with you.

example.ex: Sir John was definitely in the Treasury's bad books for incorrect thinking on economic prospects...
example.tran: 约翰爵士肯定不受财政部的待见，因为他对经济前景的预测并不准确。

example.ex: Right from my very first day I seemed to be in everyone's good books.
example.tran: 自打第一天起，我好像就和每个人都很合得来。

collins.def: If you bring someone to book, you punish them for an offence or make them explain their behaviour officially.

example.ex: Police should be asked to investigate so that the guilty can be brought to book soon.
example.tran: 应该要求警方介入调查，以将罪犯早日绳之以法。

collins.tran: 完全不了解的人；一无所知的事物；谜
collins.def: If you say that someone or something is a closed book, you mean that you do not know anything about them.

example.ex: Frank Spriggs was a very able man but something of a closed book...
example.tran: 弗兰克·斯普里格斯是一个很有才干的人，但是有些让人捉摸不透。

example.ex: Economics was a closed book to him.
example.tran: 他对经济学一窍不通。

collins.tran: （旅馆、餐馆、剧院或交通工具）被预订一空，满座，客满
collins.def: If a hotel, restaurant, theatre, or transport service is fully booked, or booked solid, it is booked up.

example.ex: The car ferries from the mainland are often fully booked by February.
example.tran: 从大陆出发的汽车轮渡常常在2月前就被预订一空。

collins.def: In my book means 'in my opinion' or 'according to my beliefs'.

example.ex: The greatest manager there has ever been, or ever will be in my book, is retiring.
example.tran: 这位迄今为止最杰出的，在我看来，也是后人无法超越的经理，就要退休了。

collins.def: If someone in authority throws the book at someone who has committed an offence, they give the offender the greatest punishment that they are allowed to.
You use both when you are referring to two people or things and saying that something is true about each of them.

example.ex: She cried out in fear and flung both arms up to protect her face...
example.tran: 她吓得大叫，并且抡起双臂护住了自己的脸。

example.ex: Put both vegetables into a bowl and crush with a potato masher.
example.tran: 把这两样蔬菜都放进一个碗里，然后用捣土豆器把它们捣碎。

collins.def: You use the structure both...and when you are giving two facts or alternatives and emphasizing that each of them is true or possible.

example.ex: Now women work both before and after having their children...
example.tran: 现在妇女在生孩子前后都要去工作。

example.ex: Any such action would have to be approved by both American and Saudi leaders.
example.tran: 任何这样的行动都必须获得美国和沙特领导人双方的批准。

collins.def: A boy is a child who will grow up to be a man.

example.ex: I knew him when he was a little boy...
example.tran: 他还是个小男孩的时候我就认识他了。

example.ex: He was still just a boy.
example.tran: 他还只是个孩子。

collins.tran: 男青年，小伙子（尤用于指青年男女恋爱关系时）
collins.def: You can refer to a young man as a boy, especially when talking about relationships between boys and girls.

example.ex: ...the age when girls get interested in boys.
example.tran: 姑娘开始对小伙子感兴趣的年龄

collins.def: Someone's  boy is their son.

example.ex: Eric was my cousin Edward's boy...
example.tran: 埃里克是我表兄爱德华的儿子。

example.ex: I have two boys.
example.tran: 我有两个儿子。

collins.tran: 家伙，伙计（尤用于亲切谈论某人时）
collins.def: You can refer to a man as a boy, especially when you are talking about him in an affectionate way.

example.ex: ...the local boy who made President...
example.tran: 当上总统的本地小伙子

example.ex: 'Come on boys', he shouted to the sailors.
example.tran: “加把劲儿，伙计们”，他向船员们喊道。

collins.tran: 家伙，伙计（用于吆喝马或狗时）
collins.def: You can use boy when giving instructions to a horse or dog.

example.ex: Down, boy, down!
example.tran: 趴下，小家伙，趴下！

collins.def: The police are sometimes referred to as the boys in blue .

collins.tran: 好家伙(表示激动、羡慕等情感）
collins.def: Some people say 'boy' or 'oh boy' in order to express feelings of excitement or admiration.

example.ex: Oh Boy! Just think what I could tell him.
example.tran: 哇，好家伙！想想看我会告诉他什么。

collins.tran: 男人总归是男人（用以表示男人的典型行为不会改变）
collins.def: If you say boys will be boys, for example when a group of men are behaving noisily or aggressively, you are suggesting in a light-hearted way that this is typical male behaviour and will never change.
If a man is described as one of the boys, he is accepted by a group of male friends who do things that are thought of as typically masculine.

example.ex: He wants to be accepted as one of the boys.
example.tran: 他想被人看作一个男子汉。

collins.def: When an object breaks or when you break it, it suddenly separates into two or more pieces, often because it has been hit or dropped.

example.ex: He fell through the window, breaking the glass...
example.tran: 他撞破玻璃从窗口摔了下去。

example.ex: The plate broke...
example.tran: 盘子打破了。

collins.def: If you break a part of your body such as your leg, your arm, or your nose, or if a bone breaks, you are injured because a bone cracks or splits.

example.ex: She broke a leg in a skiing accident...
example.tran: 她在一次滑雪事故中摔断了一条腿。

example.ex: Old bones break easily...
example.tran: 老年人容易骨折。

collins.tran: （使）（表层、盖子或密封）破裂；撕开
collins.def: If a surface, cover, or seal breaks or if something breaks it, a hole or tear is made in it, so that a substance can pass through.

example.ex: Once you've broken the seal of a bottle there's no way you can put it back together again...
example.tran: 一旦你撕开瓶子的密封条，你就无法再把它复原。

example.ex: The bandage must be put on when the blister breaks...
example.tran: 水疱一旦破了就必须用绷带包扎起来。

collins.def: When a tool or piece of machinery breaks or when you break it, it is damaged and no longer works.

example.ex: When the clutch broke, the car was locked into second gear...
example.tran: 离合器失灵后，汽车只能在二挡行驶。

example.ex: Tenants do not have to worry about leaking roofs and broken washing machines...
example.tran: 租房者无需担心屋顶漏水和洗衣机出故障。

collins.tran: 破坏，违反（规则、承诺或协议）
collins.def: If you break a rule, promise, or agreement, you do something that you should not do according to that rule, promise, or agreement.

example.ex: We didn't know we were breaking the law.
example.tran: 我们不知道自己在犯法。

example.ex: The company has consistently denied it had knowingly broken arms embargoes.
example.tran: 这家公司一直否认自己是有意违反武器禁运规定。

collins.def: If you break free or loose, you free yourself from something or escape from it.

example.ex: She broke free by thrusting her elbow into his chest.
example.tran: 她用肘猛击他的胸部，挣脱了出来。

example.ex: ...his inability to break free of his marriage.
example.tran: 他无法摆脱婚姻的束缚

collins.tran: 结束（困难或不利局面）；打破（僵局）
collins.def: If someone breaks something, especially a difficult or unpleasant situation that has existed for some time, they end it or change it.

example.ex: The Home Secretary aims to break the vicious circle between disadvantage and crime...
example.tran: 内政大臣力图打破贫困和犯罪之间的恶性循环。

example.ex: New proposals have been put forward to break the deadlock among rival factions...
example.tran: 旨在结束各竞争派别之间僵持局面的新提案已被提交。

collins.def: If someone or something breaks a silence, they say something or make a noise after a long period of silence.

example.ex: Hugh broke the silence. 'Is she always late?' he asked...
example.tran: 休打破了沉默，问道：“她总是迟到吗？”

example.ex: The unearthly silence was broken by a shrill screaming.
example.tran: 一声尖叫打破了这可怕的沉寂。

collins.def: If there is a break in the cloud or weather, it changes and there is a short period of sunshine or fine weather.

example.ex: A sudden break in the cloud allowed rescuers to spot Michael Benson.
example.tran: 天气的突然放晴帮助救援人员找到了迈克尔·本森。

collins.def: If you break with a group of people or a traditional way of doing things, or you break your connection with them, you stop being involved with that group or stop doing things in that way.

example.ex: In 1959, Akihito broke with imperial tradition by marrying a commoner...
example.tran: 明仁天皇在1959年打破皇室传统，娶了一位平民女子为妻。

example.ex: They were determined to break from precedent...
example.tran: 他们决心打破先例。

collins.def: If you break a habit or if someone breaks you of it, you no longer have that habit.

example.ex: If you continue to smoke, keep trying to break the habit...
example.tran: 如果你还在吸烟的话，就尽量戒除这个习惯吧。

example.ex: The professor hoped to break the students of the habit of looking for easy answers.
example.tran: 教授希望改掉学生们不动脑筋就想找到答案的习惯。

collins.tran: 瓦解…的决心；使丧失勇气；毁掉…的前程
collins.def: To break someone means to destroy their determination and courage, their success, or their career.

example.ex: He never let his jailers break him...
example.tran: 他决不会让监狱看守们摧毁他的意志。

example.ex: The newspapers and television can make or break you...
example.tran: 报纸和电视会使你成功，也会将你毁掉。

collins.def: If someone breaks for a short period of time, they rest or change from what they are doing for a short period.

example.ex: They broke for lunch.
example.tran: 他们停下来吃午饭。

collins.def: A break is a short period of time when you have a rest or a change from what you are doing, especially if you are working or if you are in a boring or unpleasant situation.

example.ex: They may be able to help with childcare so that you can have a break...
example.tran: 他们可以帮忙照料孩子，这样你就可以歇一歇了。

example.ex: I thought a 15 min break from his work would do him good...
example.tran: 我想他停下工作休息15分钟对他会有好处。

collins.def: A break is a short holiday.

example.ex: They are currently taking a short break in Spain.
example.tran: 他们目前正在西班牙休短假。

collins.def: If you break your journey somewhere, you stop there for a short time so that you can have a rest.

example.ex: Because of the heat we broke our journey at a small country hotel.
example.tran: 由于天气炎热，我们在一家乡村小旅馆停下来稍作歇息。

collins.def: To break the force of something such as a blow or fall means to weaken its effect, for example by getting in the way of it.

example.ex: He sustained serious neck injuries after he broke someone's fall.
example.tran: 有人坠落压在他身上，致使他颈部受重伤。

collins.tran: （消息在报纸、电视或电台）发布，传播
collins.def: When a piece of news breaks, people hear about it from the newspapers, television, or radio.

example.ex: The news broke that the Prime Minister had resigned...
example.tran: 据报道首相已经辞职。

example.ex: He resigned from his post as Bishop when the scandal broke.
example.tran: 丑闻传开后他辞去了主教职务。

collins.tran: （通常以委婉的方式）透露，告知（坏消息）
collins.def: When you break a piece of bad news to someone, you tell it to them, usually in a kind way.

example.ex: Then Louise broke the news that she was leaving me...
example.tran: 然后路易丝挑明了她要离开我。

example.ex: I worried for ages and decided that I had better break it to her.
example.tran: 我烦恼了很长时间，后来决定还是把这事告诉她。

collins.def: A break is a lucky opportunity that someone gets  to achieve something.

example.ex: He went into TV and got his first break playing opposite Sid James in the series 'Citizen James'.
example.tran: 他进入了电视圈，获得的第一个机会是在连续剧《公民詹姆斯》中与锡德·詹姆斯演对手戏。

collins.def: If you break a record, you beat the previous record for a particular achievement.

example.ex: Carl Lewis has broken the world record in the 100 metres...
example.tran: 卡尔·刘易斯已经打破了百米赛跑的世界纪录。

example.ex: Jurassic Park had broken all box office records.
example.tran: 《侏罗纪公园》打破了所有票房纪录。

collins.def: When day or dawn breaks, it starts to grow light after the night has ended.

example.ex: They continued the search as dawn broke.
example.tran: 天放亮后他们继续搜寻。

collins.def: When a wave breaks, it passes its highest point and turns downwards, for example when it reaches the shore.

example.ex: Danny listened to the waves breaking against the shore.
example.tran: 丹尼聆听着波浪拍岸的声音。

collins.def: If you break a secret code, you work out how to understand it.

example.ex: It was feared they could break the Allies' codes.
example.tran: 恐怕他们会破译盟军的密码。

collins.tran: （因悲伤或害怕嗓音）突变，变调
collins.def: If someone's voice breaks when they are speaking, it changes its sound, for example because they are sad or afraid.

example.ex: Godfrey's voice broke, and halted.
example.tran: 戈弗雷声音都变了，停顿下来。

collins.def: When a boy's voice breaks, it becomes deeper and sounds more like a man's voice.

example.ex: He sings with the strained discomfort of someone whose voice hasn't quite broken.
example.tran: 他唱得很拘谨，声音听起来像是某个还没完全变声的男孩。

collins.def: If the weather breaks or a storm breaks, it suddenly becomes rainy or stormy after a period of sunshine.

example.ex: I've been waiting for the weather to break...
example.tran: 我一直在等待着暴风雨的到来。

example.ex: She hoped she'd be able to reach the hotel before the storm broke.
example.tran: 她希望能够在起风暴前赶到旅馆。

collins.tran: （网球比赛中）破，赢得（对手的发球局）
collins.def: In tennis, if you break your opponent's serve, you win a game in which your opponent is serving.

example.ex: He broke McEnroe's serve.
example.tran: 他破了麦肯罗的发球局。

collins.def: The break of day or the break of dawn is the time when it begins to grow light after the night.

example.ex: 'I,' he finished poetically, 'will watch over you to the break of day.'
example.tran: “我，”他以富有诗意的语言结尾，“将守候着你，直至晨光初露。”

collins.def: You can say 'give me a break' to show that you are annoyed by what someone has said or done.

example.ex: 'I'm a real intellectual-type guy, Tracy,' James joked. 'Oh, give me a break,' Tracy moaned.
example.tran: “我可是个货真价实的高智商小伙儿，特雷西。”詹姆斯开玩笑地说道。“哦，别烦我了，”特雷西抱怨道。

collins.def: If you make a break or make a break for it, you run to escape from something.

example.ex: The moment had come to make a break or die...
example.tran: 那个时候不跑就没命了。

example.ex: Dan made a break for his car only to find the driver's door locked.
example.tran: 丹朝他的汽车跑去，却发现驾驶座位置的门被锁住了。

collins.def: If you bring someone or something with you when you come to a place, they come with you or you have them with you.

example.ex: Remember to bring an apron or an old shirt to protect your clothes...
example.tran: 记得带一个围裙或者一件旧衬衫来，免得弄脏你的衣服。

example.ex: Come to my party and bring a girl with you...
example.tran: 带一个女伴来参加我的聚会吧。

collins.def: If you bring something somewhere, you move it there.

example.ex: Reaching into her pocket, she brought out a cigarette...
example.tran: 她伸手从兜里掏出来一支烟。

example.ex: Her mother brought her hands up to her face.
example.tran: 她母亲拉起她的双手放到自己脸上。

collins.def: If you bring something that someone wants or needs, you get it for them or carry it to them.

example.ex: He went and poured a brandy for Dena and brought it to her...
example.tran: 他走过去为德娜倒了一杯白兰地，端到她跟前。

example.ex: The stewardess kindly brought me a blanket.
example.tran: 女乘务员体贴地给我拿来了毯子。

collins.def: To bring something or someone to a place or position means to cause them to come to the place or move into that position.

example.ex: I told you about what brought me here...
example.tran: 我告诉过你是什么把我带到这儿的。

example.ex: The shock of her husband's arrival brought her to her feet...
example.tran: 丈夫的到来惊得她站了起来。

collins.def: If you bring something new to a place or group of people, you introduce it to that place or cause those people to hear or know about it.

example.ex: ...a brave reporter who had risked death to bring the story to the world.
example.tran: 一位冒着生命危险向世人报道此事的勇敢记者

example.ex: ...the drive to bring art to the public.
example.tran: 将艺术介绍给公众的事业

collins.def: To bring someone or something into a particular state or condition means to cause them to be in that state or condition.

example.ex: He brought the car to a stop in front of the square...
example.tran: 他在广场前把车停了下来。

example.ex: His work as a historian brought him into conflict with the political establishment...
example.tran: 他是一位历史学家，工作的缘故使他处在了和政界的当权者对立的位置上。

collins.def: If something brings a particular feeling, situation, or quality, it makes people experience it or have it.

example.ex: He called on the United States to play a more effective role in bringing peace to the region...
example.tran: 他呼吁美国在实现该地区的和平方面发挥更加富有成效的作用。

example.ex: Kinkel said the attacks had brought disgrace on Germany...
example.tran: 金克尔声称这次袭击使德国蒙羞。

collins.def: If a period of time brings a particular thing, it happens during that time.

example.ex: For Sandro, the new year brought disaster...
example.tran: 对桑德罗来说，新的一年带来的是灾难。

example.ex: We don't know what the future will bring.
example.tran: 我们不知道将来会发生什么。

collins.tran: （对某人）提起（诉讼）；将（某人）送上（法庭）
collins.def: If you bring a legal action against someone or bring them to trial, you officially accuse them of doing something illegal.

example.ex: He campaigned relentlessly to bring charges of corruption against former members of the government...
example.tran: 为了将前政府成员以贪污腐败的罪名送上法庭，他持续不懈地奔走游说。

example.ex: The ship's  captain and crew may be brought to trial and even sent to prison.
example.tran: 这艘船的船长和船员可能会被告上法庭，甚至有可能坐牢。

collins.tran: 提供，制作，播出（电视或广播节目）
collins.def: If a television or radio programme is brought to you by an organization, they make it, broadcast it, or pay for it to be made or broadcast.

example.ex: You're listening to Science in Action, brought to you by the BBC World Service...
example.tran: 您正在收听的是《科学在行动》，由BBC全球广播频道制作播出。

example.ex: We'll  be bringing you all the details of the day's  events.
example.tran: 我们将为您带来今天各项赛事的所有详情。

collins.tran: 把（某人）带到（或引到）（某话题）
collins.def: When you are talking, you can say that something brings you to a particular point in order to indicate that you have now reached that point and are going to talk about a new subject.

example.ex: Which brings me to a delicate matter I should like to raise...
example.tran: 这就把我带到了一个我想提及的敏感问题上。

example.ex: And that brings us to the end of this special report from Germany.
example.tran: 这篇发自德国的特别报道也到此结束。

collins.tran: 强迫（自己）做（令人伤心、窘迫或讨厌的事）
collins.def: If you cannot bring yourself to do something, you cannot do it because you find it too upsetting, embarrassing, or disgusting.

example.ex: It is all very tragic and I am afraid I just cannot bring myself to talk about it at the moment.
example.tran: 这是件很不幸的事，恐怕现在我还无法开口谈论此事。

collins.def: If you bring up a particular subject, you introduce it into a discussion or conversation.

example.ex: He brought up a subject rarely raised during the course of this campaign...
example.tran: 他提出了一个在这次运动中很少被提及的话题。

example.ex: Why are you bringing it up now?
example.tran: 你为什么现在要把这个问题提出来？

collins.def: If someone brings up food or wind, food or air is forced up from their stomach through their mouth.

example.ex: It's hard for the baby to bring up wind.
example.tran: 婴儿不容易打出嗝来。

collins.def: Your brother is a boy or a man who has the same parents as you.

example.ex: Oh, so you're Peter's younger brother...
example.tran: 哦，那么你是彼得的弟弟。

example.ex: Have you got any brothers and sisters?
example.tran: 你有兄弟姐妹吗？

collins.tran: 兄弟；同胞；教友；国人；同行；同志
collins.def: You can describe a man as your brother if he belongs to the same race, religion, country, profession, or trade union as you, or if he has similar ideas to you.

example.ex: He told reporters he'd come to be with his Latvian brothers.
example.tran: 他告诉记者他是来支持拉脱维亚同胞的。

example.ex: ...the Cardinal and his brother bishops.
example.tran: 红衣主教和他的主教们

collins.tran: 教徒，修士，僧侣（用于头衔）
collins.def: Brother is a title given to a man who belongs to a religious community such as a monastery.

example.ex: ...Brother Otto.
example.tran: 奥托修士

example.ex: ...the Christian Brothers community which owns the castle.
example.tran: 拥有这座城堡的公教弟兄会

collins.tran: （用于某些公司或商店的名称中）
collins.def: Brothers is used in the names of some companies and shops.

example.ex: ...the film company Warner Brothers...
example.tran: 华纳兄弟电影公司

example.ex: I went to Brooks Brothers and bought myself a decent shirt.
example.tran: 我去布鲁克斯兄弟专卖店给自己买了一件体面的衬衫。

collins.def: Something that is brown is the colour of earth or of wood.

example.ex: ...her deep brown eyes...
example.tran: 她深褐色的眼睛

example.ex: The stairs are decorated in golds and earthy browns.
example.tran: 楼梯油漆成金色和土褐色。

collins.tran: 皮肤晒成棕色的；皮肤晒黑的
collins.def: You can describe a white-skinned person as brown when they have been sitting in the sun until their skin has become darker than usual.

example.ex: I don't want to be really really brown, just have a nice light golden colour.
example.tran: 我不想晒得黝黑，只想晒成一种漂亮的淡金色。

collins.def: If someone browns in the sun they become brown in colour.

example.ex: Her skin was of the fortunate kind that could brown in the sun without burning...
example.tran: 她的皮肤属于那种很幸运的类型，在阳光下无需长时间晒着就能变黑。

example.ex: There were many gorgeous females busy browning themselves.
example.tran: 有许多漂亮的女性忙着晒黑自己。

collins.def: A brown person is someone who belongs to a race of people who have brown-coloured skins.

example.ex: ...a slim brown man with a speckled turban.
example.tran: 一个戴着花头巾、身材瘦削、棕色皮肤的男子

collins.def: Brown is used to describe grains that have not had their outer layers removed, and foods made from these grains.

example.ex: ...brown bread.
example.tran: 黑面包

example.ex: ...spicy tomato sauce served over a bed of brown rice.
example.tran: 浇在一层糙米上的辣味番茄酱

collins.tran: （用旺火把)(食物)烤得焦黄；（把…）炸成焦黄色
collins.def: When food browns or when you brown food, you cook it, usually for a short time on a high flame.

example.ex: Cook for ten minutes until the sugar browns...
example.tran: 熬煮10分钟，直到糖变成褐色。

example.ex: He browned the chicken in a frying pan.
example.tran: 他用煎锅把鸡肉煎成焦黄色。

collins.def: If you build something, you make it by joining things together.

example.ex: Developers are now proposing to build a hotel on the site...
example.tran: 开发商现在建议在这个地方盖一座宾馆。
