example.ex: The house was built in the early 19th century...
example.tran: 这所房子建于19世纪初期。

collins.def: If you build something into a wall or object, you make it in such a way that it is in the wall or object, or is part of it.

example.ex: If the TV was built into the ceiling, you could lie there while watching your favourite programme.
example.tran: 如果把电视嵌入天花板，你就可以躺在那里欣赏你最喜欢的节目了。

collins.def: If people build an organization, a society, or a relationship, they gradually form it.

example.ex: He and a partner set up on their own and built a successful fashion company...
example.tran: 他和同伴自己创业，创办了一家成功的时装公司。

example.ex: Their purpose is to build a fair society and a strong economy...
example.tran: 他们的目的是要建立一个公平的社会和一个强大的经济体。

collins.tran: 把（组织、系统或产品）建立于
collins.def: If you build an organization, system, or product on something, you base it on it.

example.ex: We will then have a firmer foundation of fact on which to build theories...
example.tran: 那样我们将会获得一个建立理论所需的更为牢固的事实基础。

example.ex: The town's  nineteenth-century prosperity was built on steel.
example.tran: 这个城市19世纪的繁荣是建立在钢铁工业基础上的。

collins.tran: 使成为（政策、系统或产品的）组成部分
collins.def: If you build something into a policy, system, or product, you make it part of it.

example.ex: We have to build computers into the school curriculum...
example.tran: 我们必须把计算机纳入到学校的课程中。

example.ex: How much delay should we build into the plan?
example.tran: 我们应该为这个计划预留多少富余的时间？

collins.def: To build someone's confidence or trust means to increase it gradually. If someone's  confidence or trust builds, it increases gradually.

example.ex: The encouragement that young boys receive builds a greater self-confidence...
example.tran: 小男孩受到的鼓励会增强他们的自信心。

example.ex: Diplomats hope the meetings will build mutual trust...
example.tran: 外交官们希望会议能增进彼此的信任。

collins.def: If you build on the success of something, you take advantage of this success in order to make further progress.

example.ex: Build on the qualities you are satisfied with and work to change those you are unhappy with...
example.tran: 以自己满意的优点为发展基础，努力改变自己不满意的地方。

example.ex: The new regime has no successful economic reforms on which to build.
example.tran: 新政权没有成功实施可赖以为继的经济改革。

collins.tran: （压力、速度、声音或激情）逐渐变大，逐渐增强
collins.def: If pressure, speed, sound, or excitement builds, it gradually becomes greater.

example.ex: Pressure built yesterday for postponement of the ceremony...
example.tran: 要求推迟仪式的压力昨天进一步增大。

example.ex: The last chords of the suite build to a crescendo.
example.tran: 组曲的最后和音部分渐入高潮。

collins.def: Someone's build is the shape that their bones and muscles give to their body.

example.ex: He's described as around thirty years old, six feet tall and of medium build...
example.tran: 他被描述成一个30岁左右、6英尺高、中等身材的人。

example.ex: The authority of his voice is undermined by the smallness of his build.
example.tran: 瘦小的身形削弱了他声音中的权威感。

collins.def: A building is a structure that has a roof and walls, for example a house or a factory.

example.ex: They were on the upper floor of the building...
example.tran: 他们在这座建筑物的楼上。

example.ex: Crowds gathered around the Parliament building.
example.tran: 人群聚集在议会大厦的周围。

collins.def: Business is work relating to the production, buying, and selling of goods or services.

example.ex: ...young people seeking a career in business...
example.tran: 涉足商界的年轻人

example.ex: Jennifer has an impressive academic and business background.
example.tran: 珍妮弗有着让人印象深刻的学术和商务背景。

collins.def: Business is used when talking about how many products or services a company is able to sell. If business is good, a lot of products or services are being sold and if business is bad, few of them are being sold.

example.ex: They worried that German companies would lose business...
example.tran: 他们担心德国公司的业务量会下滑。

example.ex: Business is booming.
example.tran: 生意蒸蒸日上。

collins.tran: 工商企业；公司；商店；商铺
collins.def: A business is an organization which produces and sells goods or which provides a service.

example.ex: The company was a family business...
example.tran: 这家公司是个家族企业。

example.ex: The majority of small businesses go broke within the first twenty-four months...
example.tran: 大多数小企业在开张后的24个月内就倒闭了。

collins.def: Business is work or some other activity that you do as part of your job and not for pleasure.

example.ex: I'm here on business...
example.tran: 我到这儿来办公事。

example.ex: You can't mix business with pleasure.
example.tran: 你不能把工作和娱乐搅在一起。

collins.def: You can use business to refer to a particular area of work or activity in which the aim is to make a profit.

example.ex: May I ask you what business you're  in?
example.tran: 我可否问问你是做什么工作的？

example.ex: ...the music business.
example.tran: 音乐界

collins.tran: 眼前所做之事；手头的事
collins.def: You can use business to refer to something that you are doing or concerning yourself with.

example.ex: ...recording Ben as he goes about his business...
example.tran: 录下本在处理事务时的镜头片断

example.ex: There was nothing left for the teams to do but get on with the business of racing.
example.tran: 这些队除了继续参加赛跑比赛，没有什么别的事可做。

collins.def: You can use business to refer to important matters that you have to deal with.

example.ex: The most important business was left to the last...
example.tran: 最重要的事留到最后来解决。

example.ex: I've got some unfinished business to attend to.
example.tran: 我还有一些未完的事要处理。

collins.def: If you say that something is your business, you mean that it concerns you personally and that other people have no right to ask questions about it or disagree with it.

example.ex: My sex life is my business...
example.tran: 我的性生活是我自己的事。

example.ex: If she doesn't want the police involved, that's her business...
example.tran: 如果她不想让警方介入，那是她自己的事。

collins.def: You can use business to refer in a general way to an event, situation, or activity. For example, you can say something is 'a wretched business' or you can refer to 'this assassination business'.

example.ex: We have sorted out this wretched business at last...
example.tran: 我们最终还是把这件破事儿理顺了。

example.ex: This whole business is very puzzling.
example.tran: 这件事从头到尾都很让人费解。

collins.tran: （令人不快或耗费钱财的）活儿，事情
collins.def: You can use business when describing a task that is unpleasant in some way. For example, if you say that doing something is a costly business, you mean that it costs a lot.

example.ex: Coastal defence is a costly business...
example.tran: 海防事务很耗费资财。

example.ex: Parenting can be a stressful business.
example.tran: 为人父母会是一件压力很大的事。

collins.def: If two people or companies do business with each other, one sells goods or services to the other.

example.ex: I was fascinated by the different people who did business with me.
example.tran: 我对那些跟我做生意的形形色色的人非常感兴趣。

collins.def: If you say that someone has no business to be in a place or to do something, you mean that they have no right to be there or to do it.

example.ex: Really I had no business to be there at all.
example.tran: 真的，我根本没有道理呆在那里。

collins.def: A company that is in business is operating and trading.

example.ex: You can't stay in business without cash.
example.tran: 没有现金，你无法运营。

collins.def: If you say you are in business, you mean you have everything you need to start something immediately.

example.ex: All you need is a microphone, and you're in business.
example.tran: 再来一只麦克风，你就万事俱备了。

collins.def: If you say that someone means business, you mean they are serious and determined about what they are doing.

example.ex: Now people are starting to realise that he means business.
example.tran: 人们现在才开始明白他不是在开玩笑。

collins.def: If you say to someone 'mind your own business' or 'it's none of your business', you are rudely telling them not to ask about something that does not concern them.

example.ex: I asked Laura what was wrong and she told me to mind my own business.
example.tran: 我问劳拉发生了什么事，她让我少管闲事。

collins.def: If you make it your business to do something, you decide to do it, because you are interested in it or because you want to find out something.

example.ex: She made it her business to find out.
example.tran: 她决定要查明真相。

collins.def: If you say that you are not in the business of doing something, you are emphasizing that you do not do it, usually when you are annoyed or surprised that someone thinks you do.

example.ex: We are not in the business of subsidising scroungers.
example.tran: 我们是不会资助那些乞丐的。

collins.def: If a shop or company goes out of business or is put out of business, it has to stop trading because it is not making enough money.

example.ex: Thousands of firms could go out of business.
example.tran: 成千上万个企业可能破产。

collins.def: If you say that someone or something is the business, you mean that they are the best of their kind.

example.ex: When you watch him in training, you realise that this lad is the business.
example.tran: 当你观看他训练时，你就会意识到这个小伙子是最棒的。

collins.def: In a difficult situation, if you say it is business as usual, you mean that people will continue doing what they normally do.

example.ex: The Queen was determined to show it was business as usual.
example.tran: 女王决定表现出一切正常的样子。

means: [关系代词，意义相当于 who…not, which…not]

collins.def: You use but to introduce something which contrasts with what you have just said, or to introduce something which adds to what you have just said.

example.ex: 'You said you'd stay till tomorrow.' —  'I know, Bel, but I think I would rather go back.'...
example.tran: “你说过你要呆到明天的。”——“我知道，贝尔，但我还是想回去。”

example.ex: Place the saucepan over moderate heat until the cider is very hot but not boiling...
example.tran: 把炖锅置于中火上加热，直到苹果酒变得很烫，但不要加热到沸腾。

collins.def: You use but when you are about to add something further in a discussion or to change the subject.

example.ex: They need to recruit more people into the prison service. But another point I'd like to make is that many prisons were built in the nineteenth century.
example.tran: 监狱需要招募更多的工作人员。但我想补充一点，很多监狱都是在19世纪建造的。

collins.def: You use but after you have made an excuse or apologized for what you are just about to say.

example.ex: Please excuse me, but there is something I must say...
example.tran: 不好意思，但有些话我必须说。

example.ex: I'm sorry, but it's nothing to do with you...
example.tran: 对不起，但是这跟你没关系。

collins.tran: （引出下文，表示惊讶、难以置信、拒绝或抗议）但是，可是
collins.def: You use but to introduce a reply to someone when you want to indicate surprise, disbelief, refusal, or protest.

example.ex: 'I don't think I should stay in this house' — 'But why?'...
example.tran: “我觉得我不应该再呆在这所房子里。”——“可是为什么？”

example.ex: 'Somebody wants you on the telephone' — 'But no one knows I'm here!'
example.tran: “有人打电话找你。”——“可没有人知道我在这里啊！”

collins.def: But is used to mean 'except'.

example.ex: Europe will be represented in all but two of the seven races...
example.tran: 除了两项赛事之外，欧洲在其余5项赛事中都有代表参加。

example.ex: He didn't  speak anything but Greek...
example.tran: 他只会说希腊语。

collins.def: But is used to mean 'only'.

example.ex: This is but one of the methods used to try and get alcoholics to give up drink.
example.tran: 这只是为让那些酗酒者戒酒所尝试的方法之一。

example.ex: ...Napoleon and Marie Antoinette, to name but two who had stayed in the great state rooms.
example.tran: 只提两位在贵宾房住过的人，就是拿破仑和玛丽·安托瓦妮特。

collins.def: You use buts in expressions like 'no buts' and 'ifs and buts' to refer to reasons someone gives for not doing something, especially when you do not think that they are good reasons.

example.ex: 'B-b-b-b-but' I stuttered. — 'Never mind the buts,' she ranted...
example.tran: “但——但——但是”，我结结巴巴地说道。——“别跟我讲那些‘但是’了。”她咆哮道。

example.ex: He committed a crime, no ifs or buts about it.
example.tran: 他犯了罪，这是无可争辩的。

collins.def: You use cannot but ,could not but, and cannot help but when you want to emphasize that you believe something must be true and that there is no possibility of anything else being the case.

example.ex: The pistol was positioned where I couldn't help but see it...
example.tran: 手枪放在我抬眼就能看见的地方。

example.ex: She could not but congratulate him.
example.tran: 她只能祝贺他。

collins.def: You use but for to introduce the only factor that causes a particular thing not to happen or not to be completely true.

example.ex: ...the small square below, empty but for a delivery van and a clump of palm trees...
example.tran: 下面的小广场空空荡荡,只有一辆送货车和几棵棕榈树

example.ex: But for you, they might have given us the slip.
example.tran: 要不是你，我们可能已经被他们甩掉了。

collins.tran: （表示与前面说过的话略有矛盾）不过，然而
collins.def: You use but then or but then again before a remark which slightly contradicts what you have just said.

example.ex: My husband spends hours in the bathroom, but then again so do I.
example.tran: 我丈夫常占用浴室好几个小时，不过我也是这样。

collins.tran: （表示前述事情并不奇怪）不过，但是
collins.def: You use but then before a remark which suggests that what you have just said should not be regarded as surprising.

example.ex: He was a fine young man, but then so had his father been...
example.tran: 他年轻有为，不过他父亲也曾经是。

example.ex: Sonia might not speak the English language well, but then who did?
example.tran: 索尼娅的英语也许说得不好，但谁又说得好呢？

collins.def: If you buy something, you obtain it by paying money for it.

example.ex: He could not afford to buy a house...
example.tran: 他买不起房子。

example.ex: They can now be bought fresh in supermarkets...
example.tran: 这些现在可以在超市买到新鲜的了。

collins.def: If you talk about the quantity or standard of goods an amount of money buys, you are referring to the price of the goods or the value of the money.

example.ex: About £35,000 buys a habitable house...
example.tran: 大约花3.5万英镑就能买到一所宜居的房子。

example.ex: If the pound's value is high, British investors will spend their money abroad because the pound will buy them more.
example.tran: 如果英镑升值，英国的投资家们就会向国外投资，因为这样英镑能买到更多的东西。

collins.tran: （争取或付出一定代价以）获得，赢得
collins.def: If you buy something like time, freedom, or victory, you obtain it but only by offering or giving up something in return.

example.ex: It was a risky operation, but might buy more time...
example.tran: 这是一次冒险的行动，但也许能赢得更多的时间。

example.ex: For them, affluence was bought at the price of less freedom in their work environment.
example.tran: 对他们来说，富足是以减少在工作场所的自由为代价才获得的。

collins.def: If you say that a person can be bought, you are criticizing the fact that they will give their help or loyalty to someone in return for money.

example.ex: Once he shows he can be bought, they settle down to a regular payment.
example.tran: 一旦他表现出可以被收买，他们就会定期向他行贿。

collins.def: If you buy an idea or a theory, you believe and accept it.

example.ex: I'm not buying any of that nonsense.
example.tran: 我才不信那些废话呢。

collins.tran: 划算的东西；性价比高的商品
collins.def: If something is a good buy, it is of good quality and not very expensive.

example.ex: This was still a good buy even at the higher price...
example.tran: 即使价格更高一些，这仍然很合算。

example.ex: S & G offers great buys on computer software. S & G
example.tran: 公司可提供性价比很高的电脑软件。

collins.def: If something is done by a person or thing, that person or thing does it.

example.ex: The feast was served by his mother and sisters...
example.tran: 这顿美餐是他母亲和他的姐妹们准备的。

example.ex: I was amazed by their discourtesy and lack of professionalism...
example.tran: 他们的无礼和不专业让我震惊。

collins.tran: （图书、音乐、绘画等）由…（创作），出自
collins.def: If you say that something such as a book, a piece of music, or a painting is by a particular person, you mean that this person wrote it or created it.

example.ex: ...a painting by Van Gogh...
example.tran: 一幅凡·高的画

example.ex: 'Jacob's Ladder', the newest film by Adrian Lyne, is a post-Vietnam horror story.
example.tran: 阿德里安·莱恩的最新电影《雅各的天梯》讲的是一个发生在越战后的恐怖故事。

collins.def: If you do something by a particular means, you do it using that thing.

example.ex: We'll be travelling by car.
example.tran: 我们将开车旅行。

example.ex: ...dinners by candlelight.
example.tran: 烛光晚餐

collins.def: If you achieve one thing by doing another thing, your action enables you to achieve the first thing.

example.ex: Make the sauce by boiling the cream and stock together in a pan...
example.tran: 把奶油和高汤一起放在平底锅里熬煮来制作调味料。

example.ex: The all-female yacht crew made history by becoming the first to sail round the world...
example.tran: 这艘游艇的船员为清一色的女性，她们进行了首次环球航行，创造了历史。

collins.tran: （用于短语中）由于，出于（偶然或意外）
collins.def: You use by in phrases such as 'by chance' or 'by accident' to indicate whether or not an event was planned.

example.ex: I met him by chance out walking yesterday...
example.tran: 我昨天外出散步时碰巧遇见了他。

example.ex: He opened Ingrid's letter by mistake...
example.tran: 他不小心拆了英格丽德的信。

collins.tran: 就（本性、职业或出身）而言
collins.def: If someone is a particular type of person by nature, by profession, or by birth, they are that type of person because of their nature, their profession, or the family they were born into.

example.ex: I am certainly lucky to have a kind wife who is loving by nature...
example.tran: 拥有一个天性仁爱的贤妻，我当然很幸运。

example.ex: She's a nurse by profession and now runs a counselling service for women...
example.tran: 她的职业是护士，现在开办了一个妇女咨询中心。

collins.tran: 根据，按照（法律或某种标准）
collins.def: If something must be done by law, it happens according to the law. If something is the case by particular standards, it is the case according to the standards.

example.ex: Pharmacists are required by law to give the medicine prescribed by the doctor.
example.tran: 法律规定药剂师必须按照医生开的处方配药。

example.ex: ...evening wear that was discreet by his standards.
example.tran: 以他的标准来看相当朴素的晚礼服

collins.def: If you say what someone means by a particular word or expression, you are saying what they intend the word or expression to refer to.

example.ex: Stella knew what he meant by 'start again'...
example.tran: 斯特拉知道他说“重来”是什么意思。

example.ex: 'You're unbelievably lucky.' — 'What do you mean by that?'
example.tran: “你真是太幸运了。”——“你这话是什么意思？”

collins.tran: （用于表示抓住身体某部位或握住物体某部分）
collins.def: If you hold someone or something by a particular part of them, you hold that part.

example.ex: He caught her by the shoulder and turned her around...
example.tran: 他抓住她的肩膀把她的身子转了过来。

example.ex: She was led by the arm to a small room at the far end of the corridor...
example.tran: 她被拉着胳膊带到走廊另一头的一个小房间里。

collins.def: Someone or something that is by something else is beside it and close to it.

example.ex: Judith was sitting in a rocking-chair by the window...
example.tran: 朱迪丝正坐在窗户边的一张摇椅里。

example.ex: Felicity Maxwell stood by the bar and ordered a glass of wine...
example.tran: 费利西蒂·马克斯韦尔站在吧台旁，要了一杯红酒。

collins.def: If a person or vehicle goes by you, they move past you without stopping.

example.ex: A few cars passed close by me...
example.tran: 几辆车贴着我开过去。

example.ex: He kept walking and passed by me on his side of the street.
example.tran: 他一直在街对面走着，并与街这边的我交错而过。

collins.def: If you stop by a place, you visit it for a short time.

example.ex: We had made arrangements to stop by her house in Pacific Grove...
example.tran: 我们已安排好去造访她位于帕西菲克格罗夫的家。

example.ex: Daddy called and asked me to drop by his office.
example.tran: 爸爸打来电话让我去他办公室一趟。

collins.def: If something happens by a particular time, it happens at or before that time.

example.ex: By eight o'clock he had arrived at my hotel...
example.tran: 到8点时，他已经到达我住的宾馆了。

example.ex: We all knew by then that the affair was practically over.
example.tran: 到那时，我们都知道事情实际上已经结束了。

collins.def: If you do something by day, you do it during the day. If you do it by night, you do it during the night.

example.ex: By day a woman could safely walk the streets, but at night the pavements became dangerous...
example.tran: 白天的时候，妇女可以安全地在街上行走，而到了夜晚人行道上会变得很危险。

example.ex: She had no wish to hurry alone through the streets of London by night.
example.tran: 她可不想独自在夜晚匆匆走过伦敦的街道。

collins.def: In arithmetic, you use by before the second number in a multiplication or division sum.

example.ex: ...an apparent annual rate of 22.8 per cent (1.9 multiplied by 12)...
230cm divided by 22cm is 10.45cm.
example.tran: 230厘米除以22厘米等于10.45厘米。

collins.tran: 乘（表示长乘宽得出的居室等的面积）
collins.def: You use by to talk about measurements of area. For example, if a room is twenty feet by fourteen feet, it measures twenty feet in one direction and fourteen feet in the other direction.

example.ex: Three prisoners were sharing one small cell 3 metres by 2 metres.
example.tran: 3个囚犯关在一个3米长2米宽的小牢房里。

collins.def: If something increases or decreases by a particular amount, that amount is gained or lost.

example.ex: Violent crime has increased by 10 percent since last year...
example.tran: 暴力犯罪自去年以来增加了10%。

example.ex: Their pay has been cut by one-third.
example.tran: 他们薪水降低了1/3。

collins.def: Things that are made or sold by the million or by the dozen are made or sold in those quantities.

example.ex: Parcels arrived by the dozen from America...
example.tran: 包裹成打地从美国运来。

example.ex: Liberty fabrics, both for furnishing and for dressmaking, are sold by the metre.
example.tran: 利伯蒂布按米出售，既可用作装饰又可作衣料。

collins.def: You use by in expressions such as 'minute by minute' and 'drop by drop' to talk about things that happen gradually, not all at once.

example.ex: His father began to lose his memory bit by bit, becoming increasingly forgetful.
example.tran: 他的父亲开始一点点地失去记忆，变得越来越健忘。

collins.def: If you are by yourself, you are alone.

example.ex: ...a dark-haired man sitting by himself in a corner.
example.tran: 一个独自坐在角落里的黑发男人

collins.def: If you do something by yourself, you succeed in doing it without anyone helping you.

example.ex: I didn't know if I could raise a child by myself.
example.tran: 我不知道自己是否能够独自养大一个孩子。

collins.tran: 叫;称呼;将…命名;给…起名字
collins.def: If you call someone or something by a particular name or title, you give them that name or title.

example.ex: I always wanted to call the dog Mufty for some reason...
example.tran: 不知怎么的,我老想把这条狗唤作穆夫提。

example.ex: 'Doctor...' — 'Will you please call me Sarah?'...
example.tran: “大夫…”——“就叫我萨拉好了。”

collins.def: If you call someone or something a particular thing, you suggest they are that thing or describe them as that thing.

example.ex: The speech was interrupted by members of the Conservative Party, who called him a traitor...
example.tran: 演说被保守党人士打断,他们称他是叛徒。

example.ex: I wouldn't call it a burden; I call it a responsibility...
example.tran: 我不觉得这是负担;我觉得它是一种责任。

collins.def: If you call something, you say it in a loud voice, because you are trying to attract someone's attention.

example.ex: He could hear the others downstairs in different parts of the house calling his name...
example.tran: 他听到其他人从楼下不同地方喊他的名字。

example.ex: 'Boys!' she called again.
example.tran: “小子们!”她又叫道。

collins.def: If you call someone, you telephone them.

example.ex: Would you call me as soon as you find out?...
example.tran: 你一弄清楚了就给我打电话好吗?

example.ex: A friend of mine gave me this number to call...
example.tran: 一个朋友要我打这个号码。

collins.def: If you call someone such as a doctor or the police, you ask them to come to you, usually by telephoning them.

example.ex: He screamed for his wife to call an ambulance...
example.tran: 他尖叫着让他老婆打电话叫救护车。

example.ex: One night he was called to see a woman with tuberculosis.
example.tran: 一天夜里,有人打来电话,请他去给一位患肺结核的妇女看病。

collins.def: If you call someone, you ask them to come to you by shouting to them.

example.ex: She called her young son: 'Here, Stephen, come and look at this!'...
example.tran: 她喊她的小儿子:“喂,斯蒂芬,过来看看这个!”

example.ex: He called me over the Tannoy.
example.tran: 他用天朗扩音器喊我。

collins.def: When you make a telephone call, you telephone someone.

example.ex: I made a phone call to the United States to talk to a friend...
example.tran: 我打电话给美国的一个朋友。

example.ex: I've had hundreds of calls from other victims...
example.tran: 我已经接到了其他受害人打来的上百个电话。

collins.tran: 召集(会议、排练等);宣布举行(选举等)
collins.def: If someone in authority calls something such as a meeting, rehearsal, or election, they arrange for it to take place at a particular time.

example.ex: The Committee decided to call a meeting of the All India Congress...
example.tran: 委员会决定召开国大党会议。

example.ex: The RSC was calling a press conference to announce the theatre's closure...
example.tran: 皇家莎士比亚剧团要召开新闻发布会,宣布剧院关闭。

collins.def: If someone is called before a court or committee, they are ordered to appear there, usually to give evidence.

example.ex: The child waited two hours before she was called to give evidence...
example.tran: 小女孩等了两个小时才被传唤进去作证。

example.ex: I was called as an expert witness.
example.tran: 我作为专家证人被传唤出庭。

collins.def: If you call somewhere, you make a short visit there.

example.ex: A market researcher called at the house where he was living...
example.tran: 一位市场调查人员造访了他的住处。

example.ex: Andrew now came almost weekly to call.
example.tran: 现在安德鲁几乎每星期都来。

collins.tran: (火车、公共汽车、船舶)停靠,停留
collins.def: When a train, bus, or ship calls somewhere, it stops there for a short time to allow people to get on or off.

example.ex: The steamer calls at several ports along the way.
example.tran: 一路上,汽船在好几个港口停靠。

collins.def: To call a game or sporting event means to cancel it, for example because of rain or bad light.

example.ex: The second game of the series had ended in a 3-3 tie after ten innings when the game was called on account of darkness...
example.tran: 系列赛第二场在十局过后,双方战成3比3平，此时由于天黑,比赛取消。

example.ex: We called the next game.
example.tran: 我们取消了下一场比赛。

collins.def: If there is a call for something, someone demands that it should happen.

example.ex: There have been calls for a new kind of security arrangement...
example.tran: 不少人呼吁出台新的安全措施。

example.ex: Almost all workers heeded a call by the trade unions to stay at home for the duration of the strike.
example.tran: 工会号召工人在罢工期间呆在家里,几乎所有工人都响应了这一号召。

collins.def: If there is little or no call for something, very few people want it to be done or provided.

example.ex: 'Have you got just plain chocolate?' — 'No, I'm afraid there's not much call for that.'
example.tran: “你们有纯巧克力吗?”——“没有,恐怕那东西没几个人要。”

collins.def: The call of something such as a place is the way it attracts or interests you strongly.

example.ex: You must be feeling exhilarated by the call of the new.
example.tran: 新鲜事物的魅力一定让你兴奋不已。

collins.def: The call of a particular bird or animal is the characteristic sound that it makes.

example.ex: ...the plaintive call of a whale.
example.tran: 鲸的哀鸣

example.ex: ...a wide range of animal noises and bird calls.
example.tran: 各种各样的鸟兽叫声

collins.def: If you have first call on something, you will be asked before anyone else whether you want to buy or use it.

example.ex: Why should they get first call on the best property?
example.tran: 凭什么最好的房产尽着他们先挑?

collins.def: If you say that there is no call for someone to behave in a particular way, you are criticizing their behaviour, usually because you think it is rude.

example.ex: There was no call for him to single you out from all the others.
example.tran: 这么多人中，他不该专挑你。

collins.tran: 随时待命的;随叫随到的
collins.def: If someone is on call, they are ready to go to work at any time if they are needed, especially if there is an emergency.

example.ex: In theory I'm on call day and night.
example.tran: 从理论上说,我现在昼夜待命。

example.ex: ...a doctor on call.
example.tran: 随叫随到的医生

collins.def: If you call in sick, you telephone the place where you work to tell them you will not be coming to work because you are ill.

example.ex: 'Shouldn't you be at work today?' — 'I called in sick.'
example.tran: “你今天不是应该上班的吗?”“我打电话请过病假了。”

means: 参加[发起]运动，参加竞选

collins.def: A campaign is a planned set of activities that people carry out over a period of time in order to achieve something such as social or political change.

example.ex: During his election campaign he promised to put the economy back on its feet...
example.tran: 他在竞选时许诺将重振经济。

example.ex: Apacs has launched a campaign to improve the training of staff.
example.tran: 雅拍体育用品公司开展了加强员工培训的活动。

collins.def: If someone campaigns for something, they carry out a planned set of activities over a period of time in order to achieve their aim.

example.ex: We are campaigning for law reform...
example.tran: 我们正在宣传呼吁进行法律改革。

example.ex: Mr Burns has actively campaigned against a hostel being set up here...
example.tran: 伯恩斯先生积极活动,反对在这儿建青年旅舍。

collins.def: In a war, a campaign is a series of planned movements carried out by armed forces.

example.ex: The allies are intensifying their air campaign.
example.tran: 联军部队正加大他们的空战强度。

example.ex: ...a bombing campaign.
example.tran: 轮番轰炸

collins.def: Capital is  a large sum of money which you use to start a business, or which you invest in order to make more money.

example.ex: Companies are having difficulty in raising capital...
example.tran: 各公司融资困难。

example.ex: A large amount of capital is invested in all these branches.
example.tran: 一大笔资金投入了各分公司。

collins.tran: (厂房、机器等)固定资产,资本资产
collins.def: You can use capital to refer to buildings or machinery which are necessary to produce goods or to make companies more efficient, but which do not make money directly.

example.ex: ...capital equipment that could have served to increase production.
example.tran: 本可以用来增加产出的资产设备

example.ex: ...capital investment.
example.tran: 资本投资

collins.def: Capital is the part of an amount of money borrowed or invested which does not include interest.

example.ex: With a conventional repayment mortgage, the repayments consist of both capital and interest.
example.tran: 常规的按揭还款额既包含本金也包括利息。

collins.def: The capital of a country is the city or town where its government or parliament meets.

example.ex: ...Katmandu, the capital of Nepal.
example.tran: 尼泊尔首都加德满都

collins.def: If a place is the capital of a particular industry or activity, it is the place that is most famous for it, because it happens in that place more than anywhere else.

example.ex: Colmar has long been considered the capital of the wine trade.
example.tran: 科尔马长期以来一直被视为葡萄酒贸易中心。

example.ex: ...New York, the fashion capital of the world.
example.tran: 纽约,世界时尚之都

collins.def: Capitals or capital letters are written or printed letters in the form which is used at the beginning of sentences or names. 'T', 'B', and 'F' are capitals.

example.ex: The name and address are written in capitals.
example.tran: 姓名和地址是大写的。

collins.tran: (犯罪)情节严重的,可判处死刑的
collins.def: A capital offence is one that is so serious that the person who commits it can be punished by death.

example.ex: Espionage is a capital offence in this country.
example.tran: 在这个国家,从事间谍活动是死罪。

example.ex: ...Americans wrongly convicted of capital crimes.
example.tran: 被误判死罪的美国人

collins.def: A capital is the top part of a stone column, which is sometimes decorated with stone leaves or other patterns.

collins.tran: 从…中捞取好处;从…中渔利
collins.def: If you say that someone is making capital out of a situation, you disapprove of the way they are gaining an advantage for themselves through other people's efforts or bad luck.

example.ex: He rebuked the President for trying to make political capital out of the hostage situation.
example.tran: 他谴责总统试图利用人质事件捞取政治利益。

collins.tran: (用于强调某一字眼具有特殊意义)地道的，彻头彻尾的
collins.def: You can use phrases such as 'Life with a capital L', to emphasize that a word has a particular significance in the situation you are talking about.

example.ex: She's not feminist with a capital F but she's fairly controversial.
example.tran: 她不是个真正意义上的女权主义者,但却是个颇具争议的人物。

collins.def: A car is a motor vehicle with room for a small number of passengers.

example.ex: He had left his tickets in his car...
example.tran: 他把票忘在车里了。

example.ex: They arrived by car.
example.tran: 他们是坐小汽车来的。

collins.def: A car is one of the separate sections of a train.

example.ex: Tour buses have replaced railway cars.
example.tran: 观光巴士已经取代了火车。

collins.def: Railway carriages are called cars when they are used for a particular purpose.

example.ex: He made his way into the dining car for breakfast.
example.tran: 他来到餐车车厢吃早饭。

collins.def: If you care about something, you feel that it is important and are concerned about it.

example.ex: ...a company that cares about the environment.
example.tran: 注重环保的公司

example.ex: ...young men who did not care whether they lived or died...
example.tran: 不在乎死活的年轻人

collins.def: If you care for someone, you feel a lot of affection for them.

example.ex: He wanted me to know that he still cared for me.
example.tran: 他想要我知道他仍爱着我。

example.ex: ...people who are your friends, who care about you.
example.tran: 关爱你的朋友们

collins.def: If you care for someone or something, you look after them and keep them in a good state or condition.

example.ex: They hired a nurse to care for her.
example.tran: 他们雇了个护士来照顾她。

example.ex: ...these distinctive cars, lovingly cared for by private owners.
example.tran: 这些受到车主们悉心养护、与众不同的私家车

collins.def: Children who are in care are looked after by the state because their parents are dead or unable to look after them properly.

example.ex: ...a home for children in care...
example.tran: 儿童福利院

example.ex: She was taken into care as a baby.
example.tran: 她尚在襁褓中时就被福利院收养。

collins.def: If you say that you do not care for something or someone, you mean that you do not like them.

example.ex: She had met both sons and did not care for either.
example.tran: 两个儿子她都见了,一个都不喜欢。

collins.def: If you say that someone does something when they care to do it, you mean that they do it, although they should do it more willingly or more often.

example.ex: The woman tells anyone who cares to listen that she's going through hell...
example.tran: 只要一有人听她诉说，那个女人就会告诉人家她正在受苦受难。

example.ex: Experts reveal only as much as they care to.
example.tran: 专家们只透露了他们想透露的那些。

collins.tran: 愿意，要（一种有礼貌的询问）
collins.def: You can ask someone if they would care for something or if they would care to do something as a polite way of asking if they would like to have or do something.

example.ex: Would you care for some orange juice?...
example.tran: 来杯橙汁怎么样?

example.ex: He said he was off to the beach and would we care to join him.
example.tran: 他说他要去海滩,问我们愿不愿和他一块儿去。

collins.def: If you do something with care, you give careful attention to it because you do not want to make any mistakes or cause any damage.

example.ex: Condoms are an effective method of birth control if used with care...
example.tran: 如果使用得当,避孕套是很有效的避孕手段。

example.ex: We'd taken enormous care in choosing the location.
example.tran: 在地点的选择上我们格外谨慎。

collins.def: Your cares are your worries, anxieties, or fears.

example.ex: Lean back in a hot bath and forget all the cares of the day...
example.tran: 舒舒服服地躺着泡个热水澡,忘掉白天的一切烦恼。

example.ex: Johnson seemed without a care in the world.
example.tran: 约翰逊似乎无忧无虑。

collins.def: You can use for all I care to emphasize that it does not matter at all to you what someone does.

example.ex: You can go right now for all I care.
example.tran: 你现在就可以走,我才不在乎呢。

collins.tran: 毫不在意;毫不关心（美国英语中亦可用could care less）
collins.def: If you say that you couldn't care less about someone or something, you are emphasizing that you are not interested in them or worried about them. In American English, you can also say that you could care less, with the same meaning.

example.ex: I couldn't care less about the bloody woman...
example.tran: 那个该死的女人关我屁事!

example.ex: Personally, I couldn't have cared less whether the ice-cream came from Italy or England...
example.tran: 就我来说,我根本不在乎冰淇淋是意大利产的,还是英国产的。

collins.def: If someone sends you a letter or parcel care of a particular person or place, they send it to that person or place, and it is then passed on to you. In American English, you can also say in care of .

example.ex: Please write to me care of the publishers...
example.tran: 写给我的信请由出版商收转。

example.ex: I addressed their letters in care of the bars and clubs where I'd known them.
example.tran: 我把写给他们的信寄往我们结识时的酒吧和俱乐部,请它们代为转交。

collins.def: If you take care of someone or something, you look after them and prevent them from being harmed or damaged.

example.ex: There was no one else to take care of their children...
example.tran: 没有别人可以照料他们的孩子。

example.ex: You have to learn to take care of your possessions.
example.tran: 你得学会保管好自己的财物。

collins.def: You can say 'Take care' when saying goodbye to someone.
If you take care to do something, you make sure that you do it.

example.ex: Foley followed Albert through the gate, taking care to close the latch.
example.tran: 福利跟着艾伯特穿过大门,特意将门闩插好。

collins.def: To take care of a problem, task, or situation means to deal with it.

example.ex: They leave it to the system to try and take care of the problem...
example.tran: 他们让系统去设法解决这个问题。

example.ex: 'Do you need clean sheets?' — 'No. Mrs. May took care of that.'
example.tran: “您需要干净床单吗?”——“哦,不用了。梅夫人帮我换好了。”

collins.tran: (表示说话者毫不在乎)谁在乎?
collins.def: You can say 'Who cares?' to emphasize that something does not matter to you at all.

example.ex: Who cares about some stupid vacation?...
example.tran: 谁在乎什么愚蠢的度假?

example.ex: 'But we might ruin the stove.' — 'Who cares?'
example.tran: “可我们会把炉子弄坏的!”——“我才不在乎呢！”

collins.def: If you carry something, you take it with you, holding it so that it does not touch the ground.

example.ex: He was carrying a briefcase...
example.tran: 他提着公文包。

example.ex: He carried the plate through to the dining room...
example.tran: 他端着盘子来到餐厅。

collins.def: If you carry something, you have it with you wherever you go.

example.ex: You have to carry a bleeper so that they can call you in at any time.
example.tran: 你要随身带着寻呼机,以便他们随时呼你。

collins.def: If something carries a person or thing somewhere, it takes them there.

example.ex: Flowers are designed to attract insects which then carry the pollen from plant to plant...
example.tran: 花的作用在于吸引昆虫，然后昆虫再将花粉传到其他植株上。

example.ex: The delegation was carrying a message of thanks to President Mubarak...
example.tran: 代表团向穆巴拉克总统转达了谢意。

collins.def: If a person or animal is carrying a disease, they are infected with it and can pass it on to other people or animals.

example.ex: The official number of people carrying the AIDS virus is low...
example.tran: 艾滋病病毒携带者的官方数字并不高。

example.ex: Frogs eat pests which destroy crops and carry diseases.
example.tran: 青蛙吃破坏庄稼、传播疾病的害虫。

collins.def: If an action or situation has a particular quality or consequence, you can say that it carries it.

example.ex: Check that any medication you're taking carries no risk for your developing baby...
example.tran: 仔细检查,确保你所服用的任何药物不会对胎儿造成危险。

example.ex: Individualism, and the breakdown of social harmony, had a constructive purpose. But they also carried a price.
example.tran: 个人主义以及社会和谐的崩溃具有一定的建设意义,然而这也是有代价的。

collins.tran: 使达到(目标);帮助…渡过(难关)
collins.def: If a quality or advantage carries someone into a particular position or through a difficult situation, it helps them to achieve that position or deal with that situation.

example.ex: He had the ruthless streak necessary to carry him into the Cabinet...
example.tran: 他具有进入内阁所必需的冷酷性格。

example.ex: The warmth and strength of their relationship carried them through difficult times.
example.tran: 他们互相关心,关系牢固,这才熬过了艰难岁月。

collins.def: If you carry an idea or a method to a particular extent, you use or develop it to that extent.

example.ex: It's not such a new idea, but I carried it to extremes...
example.tran: 这虽然不是什么新想法，但是我将它发挥到了极致。

example.ex: We could carry that one step further by taking the same genes and putting them into another crop.
example.tran: 我们可以再进一步：取出相同的基因,并将它们植入另一植株。

collins.def: If a newspaper or poster carries a picture or a piece of writing, it contains it or displays it.

example.ex: Several papers carry the photograph of Mr Anderson.
example.tran: 好几份报纸都刊登了安德森先生的照片。

collins.def: In a debate, if a proposal or motion is carried, a majority of people vote in favour of it.

example.ex: A motion backing its economic policy was carried by 322 votes to 296.
example.tran: 一项支持其经济政策的动议以322票对296票通过。

collins.def: If a crime carries a particular punishment, a person who is found guilty of that crime will receive that punishment.

example.ex: It was a crime of espionage and carried the death penalty.
example.tran: 这是间谍罪,应判死刑。

collins.def: If a sound carries, it can be heard a long way away.

example.ex: Even in this stillness Leaphorn doubted if the sound would carry far.
example.tran: 就是在这样的寂静当中,利普霍恩也怀疑声音不会传很远。

collins.tran: (候选人或党派)在(某州或某选区)获胜
collins.def: If a candidate or party carries a state or area, they win the election in that state or area.

example.ex: George W. Bush carried the state with 56 percent of the vote.
example.tran: 乔治·W. 布什在该州以56%的得票率获胜。

collins.def: If you carry yourself in a particular way, you walk and move in that way.

example.ex: They carried themselves with great pride and dignity.
example.tran: 他们举手投足间透着傲气和高贵。

collins.def: If a woman is carrying a child, she is pregnant.

example.ex: There are many theories that claim to be able to predict whether you're carrying a boy or a girl.
example.tran: 有许多理论声称能够预测胎儿的性别。

collins.tran: 急不可待;喜不自胜;忘乎所以
collins.def: If you get carried away or are carried away, you are so eager or excited about something that you do something hasty or foolish.

example.ex: I got completely carried away and almost cried.
example.tran: 我激动不已,几乎哭了出来。

collins.def: If a person or team carries all before them, they succeed very easily.

example.ex: In the formative years their alliance carried all before it.
example.tran: 在草创阶段,他们的联盟所向披靡。

collins.tran: 分(美元、欧元等的货币单位)
collins.def: A cent is a small unit of money worth one hundredth of some currencies, for example the dollar and the euro.

example.ex: A cup of rice which cost thirty cents a few weeks ago is now being sold for up to one dollar...
example.tran: 几个星期前卖30美分一杯的米饭，如今卖到1美元。

example.ex: We haven't got a cent.
example.tran: 我们身无分文。

collins.def: Something that is central is in the middle of a place or area.

example.ex: ...Central America's Caribbean coast...
example.tran: 中美洲加勒比海沿岸

example.ex: The disruption has now spread and is affecting a large part of central Liberia.
example.tran: 混乱局面已经扩散，正在影响利比里亚中部的大片地区。

collins.tran: 位于中央地带的;处于中心的;四通八达的
collins.def: A place that is central is easy to reach because it is in the centre of a city, town, or particular area.

example.ex: ...a central location in the capital.
example.tran: 首都的中心地带

collins.tran: 中央的;有最高决策权的
collins.def: A central group or organization makes all the important decisions that are followed throughout a larger organization or a country.

example.ex: There is a lack of trust towards the central government in Rome.
example.tran: 人们对罗马的中央政府缺乏信任。

example.ex: ...the central committee of the Cuban communist party.
example.tran: 古巴共产党中央委员会

collins.def: The central person or thing in a particular situation is the most important one.

example.ex: Black dance music has been central to mainstream pop since the early '60s.
example.tran: 自上世纪60年代以来，黑人舞曲一直是主流流行乐的核心。

example.ex: ...a central part of their culture.
example.tran: 他们文化的核心部分

collins.def: A centre is a building where people have meetings, take part in a particular activity, or get help of some kind.

example.ex: We went to a party at the leisure centre...
example.tran: 我们去休闲中心参加一个聚会。

example.ex: She now also does pottery classes at a community centre.
example.tran: 她现在还在社区中心上陶艺课。

collins.def: If an area or town is a centre for an industry or activity, that industry or activity is very important there.

example.ex: London is also the major international insurance centre.
example.tran: 伦敦也是重要的国际保险中心。

collins.def: The centre of something is the middle of it.

example.ex: A large wooden table dominates the centre of the room...
example.tran: 一张大木桌摆在房间正中央。

example.ex: Bake until light golden and crisp around the edges and slightly soft in the centre.
example.tran: 烤至边缘浅黄松脆，中间略软。

collins.tran: (市镇的)商业中心，闹市区，繁华地带
collins.def: The centre of a town or city is the part where there are the most shops and businesses and where a lot of people come from other areas to work or shop.

example.ex: ...the city centre.
example.tran: 市中心

collins.def: If something or someone is at the centre of a situation, they are the most important thing or person involved.

example.ex: ...the man at the centre of the controversy...
example.tran: 处于争论焦点的人

example.ex: At the centre of the inquiry has been concern for the pensioners involved.
example.tran: 调查的核心一直是对于牵涉其中的领取养老金者的关注。

collins.def: If someone or something is the centre of attention or interest, people are giving them a lot of attention.

example.ex: The rest of the cast was used to her being the centre of attention...
example.tran: 她总是人们关注的焦点，其他演职人员对此已经习以为常。

example.ex: The centre of attraction was Pierre Auguste Renoir's oil painting.
example.tran: 最吸引人注意的是皮埃尔·奥古斯特·雷诺阿的油画。

collins.def: In politics, the centre refers to groups and their beliefs, when they are considered to be neither left-wing nor right-wing.

example.ex: The Democrats have become a party of the centre.
example.tran: 民主党成了中立的党派。

example.ex: ...the centre parties.
example.tran: 中间党派

collins.def: If you centre something, you move it so that it is at the centre of something else.

example.ex: Centre the design on the cloth before you start.
example.tran: 在开始前，将图案放在布的正中间。

collins.tran: （使）以…为中心;（使）注意力集中于
collins.def: If something centres or is centred on a particular thing or person, that thing or person is the main subject of attention.

example.ex: ...a plan which centred on academic  achievement and personal motivation...
example.tran: 重点强调学术成就和个人兴趣的计划

example.ex: All his concerns were centred around himself rather than Rachel...
example.tran: 他所关心的全是他自己，而不是雷切尔。

collins.def: If an industry or event is centred in a place, or if it centres there, it takes place to the greatest extent there.

example.ex: The fighting has been centred around the town of Vucovar...
example.tran: 战斗主要集中在武科瓦尔镇周围。

example.ex: The disturbances have centred round the two main university areas...
example.tran: 骚乱主要发生在两所大学附近的区域。

collins.def: A century is a period of a hundred years that is used when stating a date. For example, the 19th century was the period from 1801 to 1900.

example.ex: ...celebrated figures of the late eighteenth century.
example.tran: 18世纪晚期的名人

example.ex: ...a 17th-century merchant's house.
example.tran: 一幢17世纪商宅

collins.def: A century is any period of a hundred years.

example.ex: The drought there is the worst in a century.
example.tran: 这是一百年来最严重的旱灾。

collins.tran: (板球中一名击球手获得的)一百分，一百多分
collins.def: In cricket, a century is a score of one hundred runs or more by one batsman.
If there is a chance of something happening, it is possible that it will happen.

example.ex: Do you think they have a chance of beating Australia?...
example.tran: 你认为他们有可能击败澳大利亚吗？

example.ex: This partnership has a good chance of success...
example.tran: 这个组合获胜的希望很大。

collins.def: If you have a chance to do something, you have the opportunity to do it.

example.ex: The electoral council announced that all eligible people would get a chance to vote...
example.tran: 选举委员会宣布，所有有资格者都将获得投票的机会。

example.ex: Most refugee doctors never get the chance to practice medicine in British hospitals...
example.tran: 多数去避难的医生永远没有机会在英国医院行医。

collins.def: A chance meeting or event is one that is not planned or expected.

example.ex: ...a chance meeting.
example.tran: 偶遇

collins.def: If you chance to do something or chance on something, you do it or find it although you had not planned or tried to.

example.ex: A man I chanced to meet proved to be a most unusual character...
example.tran: 我邂逅了一个人，后来发现他是个极为与众不同的家伙。

example.ex: It was just then that I chanced to look round.
example.tran: 就在那时，我恰好环顾了下四周。

collins.def: If you chance something, you do it even though there is a risk that you may not succeed or that something bad may happen.

example.ex: Andy knew the risks. I cannot believe he would have chanced it...
example.tran: 安迪知道有风险，我不敢相信他竟然甘冒其险。

example.ex: He decided no assassin would chance a shot from amongst that crowd.
example.tran: 他认定，没有刺客会冒险混在人群里开枪。

collins.def: Something that happens by chance was not planned by anyone.

example.ex: He had met Mr Maude by chance.
example.tran: 他曾邂逅过莫德先生。

collins.tran: (用以询问某事是否属实)会不会，可能
collins.def: You can use by any chance when you are asking questions in order to find out whether something that you think might be true is actually true.

example.ex: Are they by any chance related?
example.tran: 他们有可能是亲戚吗？

collins.def: If you say that someone stands a chance of achieving something, you mean that they are likely to achieve it. If you say that someone doesn't stand a chance of achieving something, you mean that they cannot possibly achieve it.

example.ex: Being very good at science subjects, I stood a good chance of gaining high grades...
example.tran: 我理科很棒，所以很有机会拿高分。

example.ex: Neither is seen as standing any chance of snatching the leadership from him.
example.tran: 两人都不被认为有任何可能从他手中夺得领导权。

collins.def: When you take a chance, you try to do something although there is a large risk of danger or failure.

example.ex: You take a chance on the weather if you holiday in the UK...
example.tran: 在英国度假，只有赌天气了。

example.ex: From then on, they were taking no chances...
example.tran: 从那时起，他们就不再冒险了。

collins.def: If there is a change in something, it becomes different.

example.ex: The ambassador appealed for a change in US policy...
example.tran: 大使呼吁美国在政策上作出改变。

example.ex: What is needed is a change of attitude on the part of architects...
example.tran: 现在需要的是建筑师态度的转变。

collins.def: If you say that something is a change or makes a change, you mean that it is enjoyable because it is different from what you are used to.

example.ex: It is a complex system, but it certainly makes a change...
example.tran: 这是个复杂的体系，不过确实有所改变。

example.ex: Do you feel like you could do with a change?
example.tran: 你想不想改变一下？

collins.def: If you change from one thing to another, you stop using or doing the first one and start using or doing the second.

example.ex: His doctor increased the dosage but did not change to a different medication...
example.tran: 他的医生加大了剂量，不过没有换药。

example.ex: He changed from voting against to abstaining.
example.tran: 他原打算投反对票，后来改为弃权了。

collins.def: When something changes or when you change it, it becomes different.

example.ex: We are trying to detect and understand how the climates change...
example.tran: 我们正努力探寻并理解气候是如何变化的。

example.ex: In the union office, the mood gradually changed from resignation to rage...
example.tran: 在工会办公室，情绪慢慢从顺从转变成愤怒。

collins.def: To change something means to replace it with something new or different.

example.ex: I paid £80 to have my car radio fixed and I bet all they did was change a fuse...
example.tran: 我花80英镑让人把我车上的收音机修了修，可我敢肯定，他们只是换了根保险丝。

example.ex: If you want to change your doctor there are two ways of doing it.
example.tran: 你要是想换个医生，办法有两个。

collins.def: When you change your clothes or change, you take some or all of your clothes off and put on different ones.

example.ex: Ben had merely changed his shirt...
example.tran: 本仅仅换了件衬衫。

example.ex: They had allowed her to shower and change...
example.tran: 他们准许她冲个澡，换套衣裳。

collins.def: A change of clothes is an extra set of clothes that you take with you when you go to stay somewhere or to take part in an activity.

example.ex: He stuffed a bag with a few changes of clothing.
example.tran: 他往包里塞了几套换洗衣服。

collins.def: When you change a bed or change the sheets, you take off the dirty sheets and put on clean ones.

example.ex: After changing the bed, I would fall asleep quickly...
example.tran: 换了床单，我很快就能睡着。

example.ex: I changed the sheets on your bed today.
example.tran: 我今天把你的床单换了。

collins.def: When you change a baby or change its nappy or diaper, you take off the dirty one and put on a clean one.

example.ex: She criticizes me for the way I feed or change him...
example.tran: 她批评我不会给他喂奶、不会换尿布。

example.ex: He needs his nappy changed.
example.tran: 他的尿布该换了。

collins.tran: 转乘，换乘(交通工具);转车;转机
collins.def: When you change buses, trains, or planes or change, you get off one bus, train, or plane and get on to another in order to continue your journey.

example.ex: At Glasgow I changed trains for Greenock...
example.tran: 我在格拉斯哥改乘去格里诺克的火车。

example.ex: We were turned off the train at Hanover, where we had to change.
example.tran: 我们在汉诺威站被赶下火车，只好在那儿转车。

collins.def: When you change gear or change into another gear, you move the gear lever on a car, bicycle, or other vehicle in order to use a different gear.

example.ex: The driver tried to change gear, then swerved...
example.tran: 司机试图换挡，接着突然转向。

example.ex: He looked up into the mirror as he changed through his gears.
example.tran: 他一边换挡，一边抬眼看后视镜。

collins.def: Your change is the money that you receive when you pay for something with more money than it costs because you do not have exactly the right amount of money.

example.ex: 'There's your change.' — 'Thanks very much.'...
example.tran: “您的找头。”——“多谢。”

example.ex: They told the shopkeeper to keep the change.
example.tran: 他们告诉店主不用找钱了。

collins.def: Change is coins, rather than paper money.

example.ex: Thieves ransacked the office, taking a sack of loose change...
example.tran: 窃贼洗劫了办公室，拿走了一口袋散币。

example.ex: The man in the store won't give him change for the phone unless he buys something.
example.tran: 店里的人不肯给他换硬币打电话，除非他买点什么。

collins.def: If you have change for larger notes, bills, or coins, you have the same value in smaller notes, bills, or coins, which you can give to someone in exchange.

example.ex: The courier had change for a £10 note.
example.tran: 快递员能破开10英镑的纸币。

collins.def: When you change money, you exchange it for the same amount of money in a different currency, or in smaller notes, bills, or coins.

example.ex: You can expect to pay the bank a fee of around 1% to 2% every time you change money...
example.tran: 每次到银行换币都会要求付1%到2%的手续费。

example.ex: If you travel frequently, find an agency that will change one foreign currency directly into another.
example.tran: 如果经常旅行，找一家能直接兑换外币的旅行社。

collins.def: If you say that you are doing something or something is happening for a change, you mean that you do not usually do it or it does not usually happen, and you are happy to be doing it or that it is happening.

example.ex: Now let me ask you a question, for a change...
example.tran: 现在换我来问你一个问题吧。

example.ex: Liz settled back in her seat, comfortably relaxed, enjoying being driven for a change.
example.tran: 莉兹舒服放松地倚在座位上，享受着换别人开车的惬意。

collins.def: If you charge someone an amount of money, you ask them to pay that amount for something that you have sold to them or done for them.

example.ex: Even local nurseries charge £100 a week...
example.tran: 连本地托儿所每星期都要收费100英镑。

example.ex: The majority of stalls charged a fair price...
example.tran: 多数货摊要价比较公道。

collins.tran: 将…的账单寄给…;把…记在…的账上
collins.def: To charge something to a person or organization means to tell the people providing it to send the bill to that person or organization. To charge something to someone's account means to add it to their account so they can pay for it later.

example.ex: Go out and buy a pair of glasses, and charge it to us...
example.tran: 去买副眼镜，账记在我们头上。

example.ex: All transactions have been charged to your account.
example.tran: 所有交易都记在你的账户上了。

collins.def: A charge is an amount of money that you have to pay for a service.

example.ex: We can arrange this for a small charge...
example.tran: 我们可以将此安排好，只收取很少的费用。

example.ex: Customers who arrange overdrafts will face a monthly charge of £5.
example.tran: 透支的客户每月要缴纳5英镑的费用。

collins.def: A charge is a formal accusation that someone has committed a crime.

example.ex: He may still face criminal charges...
example.tran: 他可能仍然要面临刑事指控。

example.ex: They appeared at court yesterday to deny charges of murder.
example.tran: 他们昨天出庭，否认谋杀的指控。

collins.def: When the police charge someone, they formally accuse them of having done something illegal.

example.ex: They have the evidence to charge him...
example.tran: 他们握有控告他的证据。

example.ex: Police have charged Mr Bell with murder.
example.tran: 警方已经起诉贝尔先生犯有谋杀罪。

collins.def: If you charge someone with doing something wrong or unpleasant, you publicly say that they have done it.

example.ex: He charged the minister with lying about the economy.
example.tran: 他指责部长在经济问题上撒谎。

collins.def: If you take charge of someone or something, you make yourself responsible for them and take control over them. If someone or something is in your charge, you are responsible for them.

example.ex: A few years ago Bacryl took charge of the company...
example.tran: 几年前，巴克里尔接管了该公司。

example.ex: I have been given charge of this class...
example.tran: 我被分配负责这个班。

collins.def: If you are in charge in a particular situation, you are the most senior person and have control over something or someone.

example.ex: Who's in charge here?
example.tran: 这儿谁管事啊？

example.ex: ...the Swiss governess in charge of the smaller children.
example.tran: 负责照管小一些的孩子的瑞士女家庭教师

collins.tran: 被照管的人;所负责的人
collins.def: If you describe someone as your charge, they have been given to you to be looked after and you are responsible for them.

example.ex: The coach tried to get his charges motivated.
example.tran: 教练试图激发队员的积极性。

collins.def: If you charge towards someone or something, you move quickly and aggressively towards them.

example.ex: He charged through the door to my mother's office...
example.tran: 他冲出门，往我母亲的办公室跑去。

example.ex: He ordered us to charge.
example.tran: 他命令我们冲锋。

collins.def: To charge a battery means to pass an electrical current through it in order to make it more powerful or to make it last longer.

example.ex: Alex had forgotten to charge the battery.
example.tran: 亚力克斯忘了给电池充电。

collins.def: An electrical charge is an amount of electricity that is held in or carried by something.

collins.tran: (子弹、炮弹所装填的)火药，炸药;子弹;炮弹
collins.def: The charge in a cartridge or shell is the explosive inside it. You can also refer to the cartridge or shell itself as a charge .
If something is free of charge, it does not cost anything.

example.ex: The leaflet is available free of charge from post offices.
example.tran: 宣传单可以到邮局免费领取。

collins.tran: (组织机构的)负责人，头儿，首领
collins.def: The chief of an organization is the person who is in charge of it.

example.ex: ...a commission appointed by the police chief.
example.tran: 警察局局长任命的委员会

example.ex: ...Putin's chief of security.
example.tran: 普金的安全部长

collins.def: The chief of a tribe is its leader.

example.ex: ...Sitting Bull, chief of the Sioux tribes of the Great Plains.
example.tran: 坐牛，大平原地区苏人部族的酋长

collins.tran: (用于职位头衔)主管的，首席的
collins.def: Chief is used in the job titles of the most senior worker or workers of a particular kind in an organization.

example.ex: ...the chief test pilot.
example.tran: 首席试飞员

collins.def: The chief cause, part, or member of something is the most important one.

example.ex: Financial stress is well established as a chief reason for divorce...
example.tran: 经济压力被确认是导致离婚的首要原因。

example.ex: The job went to one of his chief rivals.
example.tran: 那份工作被他的一个主要对手抢去了。

collins.def: A child is a human being who is not yet an adult.

example.ex: When I was a child I lived in a country village...
example.tran: 我小时候生活在一个小乡村里。

example.ex: He's just a child.
example.tran: 他还只是个孩子。

collins.def: Someone's children are their sons and daughters of any age.

example.ex: How are the children?...
example.tran: 孩子们都好吧？

example.ex: His children have left home...
example.tran: 他的子女都已离家独立生活了。

collins.def: If you say that someone claims that something is true, you mean they say that it is true but you are not sure whether or not they are telling the truth.

example.ex: He claimed that it was all a conspiracy against him...
example.tran: 他声称这一切都是一场针对他的阴谋。

example.ex: A man claiming to be a journalist threatened to reveal details about her private life...
example.tran: 一个自称是记者的人威胁要公开有关她的私生活的细节。

collins.def: A claim is something which someone says which they cannot prove and which may be false.

example.ex: He repeated his claim that the people of Trinidad and Tobago backed his action...
example.tran: 他再次声称，特立尼达和多巴哥的人民支持他的行动。

example.ex: He rejected claims that he had affairs with six women.
example.tran: 他拒不承认他和6个女人有染的说法。

collins.tran: 声称(负有责任或享有功劳)
collins.def: If you say that someone claims responsibility or credit for something, you mean they say that they are responsible for it, but you are not sure whether or not they are telling the truth.

example.ex: An underground organisation has claimed responsibility for the bomb explosion...
example.tran: 一个地下组织已经声称对这起炸弹爆炸事件负责。

example.ex: He was too modest to claim the credit.
example.tran: 他太谦逊，不愿意邀功。

collins.tran: 索取，索要(有权拥有的东西)
collins.def: If you claim something, you try to get it because you think you have a right to it.

example.ex: Now they are returning to claim what was theirs.
example.tran: 如今他们回来索取本属于他们的东西。

collins.def: A claim is a demand for something that you think you have a right to.

example.ex: Rival claims to Macedonian territory caused conflict in the Balkans.
example.tran: 多方主张拥有对马其顿的领土主权，结果在巴尔干地区引发了冲突。

collins.tran: 取得，获得，赢得(纪录、冠军或奖励)
collins.def: If someone claims a record, title, or prize, they gain or win it.

example.ex: Zhuang claimed the record in 54.64 seconds...
example.tran: 庄创下了54.64秒的纪录。

example.ex: Steffi Graf claimed a fourth Wimbledon title in 1992.
example.tran: 施特菲·格拉芙于1992年第4次赢得温布尔登桂冠。

collins.def: If you have a claim on someone or their attention, you have the right to demand things from them or to demand their attention.

example.ex: She'd no claims on him now...
example.tran: 现在他不欠她什么了。

example.ex: He was surrounded by people, all with claims on his attention.
example.tran: 他被人们团团围住，个个都要他把注意力放在自己身上。

collins.tran: 需要，要求(花时间或精力)
collins.def: If something or someone claims your attention, they need you to spend your time and effort on them.

example.ex: There is already a long list of people claiming her attention.
example.tran: 需要她关注的人已经很多了。

collins.def: If you claim money from the government, an insurance company, or another organization, you officially apply to them for it, because you think you are entitled to it according to their rules.

example.ex: Some 25 per cent of the people who are entitled to claim State benefits do not do so...
example.tran: 有权申领政府补贴的人当中，约有25%没有提出申请。

example.ex: John had taken out redundancy insurance but when he tried to claim, he was refused payment...
example.tran: 约翰办理过失业保险，可是当他去索赔时却遭拒付。

collins.tran: (向雇主)索要，索取，讨要(钱、福利)
collins.def: If you claim money or other benefits from your employers, you demand them because you think you deserve or need them.

example.ex: The union claimed a pay rise worth four times the rate of inflation.
example.tran: 工会要求按照通货膨胀率的4倍提高工资。

collins.tran: (战争、疾病、事故)夺去(生命)，导致(死亡)
collins.def: If you say that a war, disease, or accident claims someone's life, you mean that they are killed in it or by it.

example.ex: The civil war claimed the life of a U.N. interpreter yesterday...
example.tran: 昨天，内战夺去了一位联合国译员的生命。

example.ex: Heart disease is the biggest killer, claiming 180,000 lives a year.
example.tran: 心脏病是头号杀手，每年夺去18万条生命。

collins.def: Someone's claim to fame is  something quite important or interesting that they have done or that is connected with them.

example.ex: Barbara Follett's greatest claim to fame is that she taught Labour MPs how to look good on television.
example.tran: 芭芭拉·福利特最出名的事就是她教工党议员如何在电视上拥有良好形象。

collins.def: If you lay claim to something you do not have, you say that it belongs to you.

example.ex: Five Asian countries lay claim to the islands.
example.tran: 5个亚洲国家声称对那些岛屿拥有主权。

means: 把…归入某等级，把…看作（或分类、归类）
属于…类（或等级），被列为某类（或某级）

collins.def: A class is a group of pupils or students who are taught together.

example.ex: He had to spend about six months in a class with younger students...
example.tran: 他不得不和一群比他小的学生在一个班里上了约6个月的课。

example.ex: Reducing class sizes should be a top priority.
example.tran: 削减班级规模应该是首选方案。

collins.def: A class is a course of teaching in a particular subject.

example.ex: He acquired a law degree by taking classes at night...
example.tran: 他通过读夜校获得了法律学位。

example.ex: I go to dance classes here in New York.
example.tran: 我在纽约上舞蹈课。

collins.def: If you do something in class, you do it during a lesson in school.

example.ex: There is lots of reading in class.
example.tran: 课上要进行大量的阅读。

collins.def: The students in a school or university who finish their course in a particular year are often referred to as the class of that year.

example.ex: These two members of Yale's Class of '57 never miss a reunion.
example.tran: 这两个耶鲁大学57届毕业生每次同学聚会都参加。

collins.def: Class refers to the division of people in a society into groups according to their social status.

example.ex: ...the relationship between social classes...
example.tran: 社会阶级关系

example.ex: What it will do is create a whole new ruling class.
example.tran: 它的作用就是创造一个全新的统治阶级。

collins.def: A class of things is a group of them with similar characteristics.

example.ex: Harbour staff noticed that measurements given for the same class of boats often varied.
example.tran: 港口工作人员注意到，对同一类船舶的测量方法常常不一样。

example.ex: ...the division of the stars into six classes of brightness.
example.tran: 按照亮度将恒星分为6个等级

collins.def: If someone or something is classed as a particular thing, they are regarded as belonging to that group of things.

example.ex: Since the birds interbreed they cannot be classed as different species...
example.tran: 由于这些鸟进行杂交繁殖，不能把它们归为不同的物种。

example.ex: I class myself as an ordinary working person...
example.tran: 我把自己当作一个普通的上班族。

collins.def: If you say that someone or something has class, you mean that they are elegant and sophisticated.

example.ex: He's got the same style off the pitch as he has on it — sheer class.
example.tran: 他场上场下都是一个样——极具风度。

collins.def: If you describe someone or something as a class person or thing, you mean that they are very good.

example.ex: Kite is undoubtedly a class player.
example.tran: 凯特绝对是个一流选手。

collins.tran: 出类拔萃的人物(指运动员、演奏者等)
collins.def: If you say that someone such as a sports player or a performer is a class act, you mean that they are very good at what they do.

collins.tran: 独领风骚的;独一无二的;出类拔萃的
collins.def: If someone is in a class of their own, they have more of a particular skill or quality than anyone else. If something is in a class of its own, it is better than any other similar thing.

example.ex: As a player, he was in a class of his own.
example.tran: 作为运动员，他是独一无二的。

collins.def: Something that is clear is easy to understand, see, or hear.

example.ex: The book is clear, readable and adequately illustrated...
example.tran: 这本书明白易懂，可读性强，插图丰富。

example.ex: The space telescope has taken the clearest pictures ever of Pluto...
example.tran: 太空望远镜拍摄到了迄今为止最清晰的冥王星的照片。

collins.tran: 明显的;显然的;明白无误的
collins.def: Something that is clear is obvious and impossible to be mistaken about.

example.ex: It was a clear case of homicide...
example.tran: 这显然是一宗杀人案。

example.ex: The clear message of the scientific reports is that there should be a drastic cut in car use...
example.tran: 那些科学报告清清楚楚地告诉人们应该大幅削减汽车使用量。

collins.tran: 完全了解的;明白的;清楚的
collins.def: If you are clear about something, you understand it completely.

example.ex: It is important to be clear about what Chomsky is doing here...
example.tran: 很有必要搞清乔姆斯基在这儿干什么。

example.ex: He is not entirely clear on how he will go about it...
example.tran: 他还没完全搞清楚该如何处理这件事。

collins.tran: (头脑或思路)清楚的，清晰的，清醒的，不糊涂的
collins.def: If your mind or your way of thinking is clear, you are able to think sensibly and reasonably, and you are not affected by confusion or by a drug such as alcohol.

example.ex: She needed a clear head to carry out her instructions.
example.tran: 她需要一个头脑清醒的人来执行自己的指令。

collins.def: To clear your mind or your head means to free it from confused thoughts or from the effects of a drug such as alcohol.

example.ex: He walked up Fifth Avenue to clear his head...
example.tran: 他沿着第五大道走了走，好让大脑清醒清醒。

example.ex: Our therapists will show you how to clear your mind of worries.
example.tran: 我们的治疗师会教你如何消除心中的忧虑。

collins.def: A clear substance is one which you can see through and which has no colour, like clean water.

example.ex: ...a clear glass panel...
example.tran: 透明的玻璃板

example.ex: ...a clear gel...
example.tran: 透明的凝胶

collins.def: A clear colour is bright and strong.

example.ex: He has clear blue eyes and a dazzling smile.
example.tran: 他有一双明亮的蓝眼睛和一脸灿烂的微笑。

collins.tran: (表面)收拾干净的;(地方)畅通的;(视野)无阻碍的
collins.def: If a surface, place, or view is clear, it is free of unwanted objects or obstacles.

example.ex: The runway is clear — go ahead and land...
example.tran: 跑道畅通无阻，开始着陆吧。

example.ex: All exits must be kept clear in case of fire or a bomb scare...
example.tran: 所有出口必须保持畅通，以防有火灾或炸弹威吓发生。

collins.def: When you clear an area or place or clear something from it, you remove things from it that you do not want to be there.

example.ex: To clear the land and harvest the bananas they decided they needed a male workforce...
example.tran: 为了清理那片地和收割香蕉，他们决定雇请男劳力。

example.ex: Stewart was trying to clear a path for the stretcher...
example.tran: 斯图尔特在努力给担架开路。

collins.def: If something or someone clears the way or the path for something to happen, they make it possible.

example.ex: The Prime Minister resigned today, clearing the way for the formation of a new government...
example.tran: 首相今天的辞职为新政府的组建扫清了道路。

example.ex: A court in Berlin has dropped the charges against him, clearing the way for him to leave Germany.
example.tran: 柏林的一个法庭今天撤销了对他的指控，这样他就可以离开德国了。

collins.def: If it is a clear day or if the sky is clear, there is no mist, rain, or cloud.

example.ex: On a clear day you can see the French coast...
example.tran: 天气晴朗时可以望见法国海岸。

example.ex: The winter sky was clear.
example.tran: 冬天的天空万里无云。

collins.def: When fog or mist clears, it gradually disappears.

example.ex: The early morning mist had cleared.
example.tran: 晨雾散去了。

collins.def: Clear eyes look healthy, attractive, and shining.

example.ex: ...clear blue eyes...
example.tran: 清澈的蓝眼睛

example.ex: Her eyes were clear and steady.
example.tran: 她的眼神清澈而坚定。

collins.def: If your skin is clear, it is healthy and free from spots.
If you say that your conscience is clear, you mean you do not think you have done anything wrong.

example.ex: Mr Garcia said his conscience was clear over the jail incidents...
example.tran: 加西亚先生说他对监狱中发生的事件问心无愧。

example.ex: I can look back on things with a clear conscience. I did everything I could.
example.tran: 我可以问心无愧地回首过去，我已经尽力了。

collins.tran: 不接触的;远离的;在安全距离以外的
collins.def: If something or someone is clear of something else, it is not touching it or is a safe distance away from it.

example.ex: As soon as he was clear of the terminal building he looked round...
example.tran: 他一离开机场大楼，就环顾了一下四周。

example.ex: She placed a towel on a cluster of rocks just clear of the tidemark...
example.tran: 她把一条毛巾放在刚没过涨潮线的一堆石头上。

collins.def: If you drive clear to a place, especially a place that is far away, you go all the way there without delays.

example.ex: After that they drove clear over to St Paul.
example.tran: 之后，他们一口气开到圣保罗。

collins.def: If an animal or person clears an object or clears a certain height, they jump over the object, or over something that height, without touching it.

example.ex: Sotomayor, the Cuban holder of the world high jump record, cleared 2.36 metres.
example.tran: 古巴的世界跳高纪录保持者索托马约尔跳过了2.36米。

collins.def: When a bank clears a cheque or when a cheque clears, the bank agrees to pay the sum of money mentioned on it.

example.ex: Polish banks can still take two or three weeks to clear a cheque...
example.tran: 在波兰，银行兑现支票可能还需要两三个星期。

example.ex: Allow time for the cheque to clear.
example.tran: 留出时间兑现支票。

collins.def: If a course of action is cleared, people in authority give permission for it to happen.

example.ex: Linda Gradstein has this report from Jerusalem, which was cleared by an Israeli censor...
example.tran: 琳达·格拉德斯坦的这份报道来自耶路撒冷，它已经通过了以色列方面的审查。

example.ex: Within an hour, the helicopter was cleared for take-off...
example.tran: 不到一个小时，直升机获准起飞。

collins.def: If someone is cleared, they are proved to be not guilty of a crime or mistake.

example.ex: She was cleared of murder and jailed for just five years for manslaughter...
example.tran: 她被判谋杀罪名不成立，仅以过失杀人罪判处5年监禁。

example.ex: In a final effort to clear her name, Eunice has written a book.
example.tran: 尤妮斯写了本书,最后一次试图证明自己的清白。

collins.tran: (用于确定自己的话被理解以及强调权威性)听懂了吗？我说明白了吗？
collins.def: You can say 'Is that clear?' or 'Do I make myself clear?' after you have told someone your wishes or instructions, to make sure that they have understood you, and to emphasize your authority.

example.ex: We're only going for half an hour, and you're not going to buy anything. Is that clear?
example.tran: 我们只去半个小时，而且你什么都不能买。听清楚了没有？

collins.tran: 没有危险的;不受责备的;不受怀疑的
collins.def: If someone is in the clear, they are not in danger, or are not blamed or suspected of anything.

example.ex: The Audit Commission said that the ministry was in the clear.
example.tran: 审计署称该政府部门没有问题。

collins.def: If you make something clear, you say something in a way that makes it impossible for there to be any doubt about your meaning, wishes, or intentions.

example.ex: Mr O'Friel made it clear that further insults of this kind would not be tolerated...
example.tran: 奥弗里尔先生明确表示，绝不容忍这样的侮辱行为再次发生。

example.ex: The far-right has now made its intentions clear.
example.tran: 极右势力已经清楚地表明了其意图。

collins.tran: 高出，超出，多出（竞争对手）
collins.def: If something or someone is a certain amount clear of a competitor, they are that amount ahead of them in a competition or race.

example.ex: Keegan's team are now seven points clear of West Ham...
example.tran: 基冈率领的球队现在领先西汉姆联队7分。

example.ex: He crossed the line three seconds clear of Tom Snape.
example.tran: 他领先汤姆·斯内普3秒冲过终点线。

collins.def: If you steer clear or stay clear of someone or something, you avoid them.

example.ex: The rabbis try to steer clear of political questions.
example.tran: 拉比们努力避开政治问题。

collins.def: A club is an organization of people interested in a particular activity or subject who usually meet on a regular basis.

example.ex: ...the Chorlton Conservative Club.
example.tran: 升尔顿保守党俱乐部

example.ex: ...a youth club...
example.tran: 青年俱乐部

collins.tran: 俱乐部会所；俱乐部活动场所
collins.def: A club is a place where the members of a club meet.

example.ex: I stopped in at the club for a drink.
example.tran: 我顺路到俱乐部喝了一杯。

collins.def: A club is a team which competes in sporting competitions.

example.ex: ...the New York Yankees baseball club.
example.tran: 纽约扬基职业棒球俱乐部

example.ex: ...Liverpool football club.
example.tran: 利物浦足球俱乐部

collins.def: A club is the same as a nightclub .

example.ex: It's a big dance hit in the clubs.
example.tran: 这支舞曲在夜总会很火。

example.ex: ...the London club scene.
example.tran: 伦敦的夜总会场景

collins.def: A club is a long, thin, metal stick with a piece of wood or metal at one end that you use to hit the ball in golf.

example.ex: ...a six-iron club.
example.tran: 6号铁杆

collins.def: A club is a thick heavy stick that can be used as a weapon.

example.ex: Men armed with knives and clubs attacked his home.
example.tran: 一群手持刀棒的人袭击了他家。

collins.def: To club a person or animal means to hit them hard with a thick heavy stick or a similar weapon.

example.ex: Two thugs clubbed him with baseball bats...
example.tran: 两个暴徒用棒球棒猛击他。

example.ex: Clubbing baby seals to death for their pelts is wrong.
example.tran: 为了获得海豹皮而用棍棒打死幼海豹是不道德的。

collins.def: Clubs is one of the four suits in a pack of playing cards. Each card in the suit is marked with one or more black symbols: ♣.

example.ex: ...the ace of clubs.
example.tran: 梅花A

means: （用于服装、旗帜等代表团队、学校、政党或国家的）色彩

collins.def: The colour of something is the appearance that it has as a result of the way in which it reflects light. Red, blue, and green are colours.

example.ex: 'What colour is the car?' — 'Red.'...
example.tran: “车是什么颜色？”“红色。”

example.ex: Her silk dress was sky-blue, the colour of her eyes...
example.tran: 她的丝绸连衣裙是天蓝色的，和她眼睛的颜色一样。

collins.def: A colour is a substance you use to give something a particular colour. Dyes and make-up are sometimes referred to as colours .

example.ex: ...The Body Shop Herbal Hair Colour...
example.tran: 美体小铺草本染发剂

example.ex: It is better to avoid all food colours.
example.tran: 最好不要吃任何食用色素。

collins.tran: (用染料、颜料等)给…着色(或染色)
collins.def: If you colour something, you use something such as dyes or paint to change its colour.

example.ex: Many women begin colouring their hair in their mid-30s...
example.tran: 很多女人在三十五岁左右开始染发。

example.ex: We'd been making cakes and colouring the posters...
example.tran: 我们一直在做蛋糕，给海报上色。

collins.def: If someone colours, their face becomes redder than it normally is, usually because they are embarrassed.

example.ex: Andrew couldn't help noticing that she coloured slightly.
example.tran: 安德鲁不禁注意到她有点脸红了。

collins.def: Someone's colour is the colour of their skin. People often use colour in this way to refer to a person's race.

example.ex: I don't care what colour she is...
example.tran: 我不在乎她的肤色。

example.ex: He acknowledged that Mr Taylor's colour and ethnic origins were utterly irrelevant in the circumstances.
example.tran: 他承认在这种情况下泰勒先生的肤色和种族出身完全无关紧要。

collins.def: A colour television, photograph, or picture is one that shows things in all their colours, and not just in black, white, and grey.

example.ex: In Japan 99 per cent of all households now have a colour television set.
example.tran: 现在，日本99%的家庭都拥有彩色电视机。

collins.def: Colour is a quality that makes something especially interesting or exciting.

example.ex: She had resumed the travel necessary to add depth and colour to her novels.
example.tran: 她重新开始了旅行，那是增加自己小说的深度和趣味性所必不可少的。

collins.def: If something colours your opinion, it affects the way that you think about something.

example.ex: All too often it is only the negative images of Ireland that are portrayed, colouring opinions and hiding the true nature of the country...
example.tran: 媒体往往描绘的只是爱尔兰的负面形象，影响了大家的看法，掩盖了这个国家的真实面貌。

example.ex: The attitude of the parents toward the usefulness of what is learned must colour the way children approach school.
example.tran: 父母对学知识是否有用的态度必定会影响孩子对待学业的态度。

collins.def: A country's national colours are the colours of its national flag.

example.ex: The Opera House is decorated with the Hungarian national colours: green, red and white.
example.tran: 歌剧院是以匈牙利国旗的颜色——绿、红、白三色装饰的。

collins.def: People sometimes refer to the flag of a particular part of an army, navy, or air force, or the flag of a particular country as its colours .

example.ex: Troops raised the country's colors in a special ceremony.
example.tran: 部队在一个特殊的仪式上升起了国旗。

example.ex: ...the battalion's colours.
example.tran: 营旗

collins.def: A sports team's colours are the colours of the clothes they wear when they play.

example.ex: I was wearing the team's colours.
example.tran: 我穿着该队队衣。

collins.tran: (考试考得)极好地，成绩出色地
collins.def: If you pass a test with flying colours, you have done very well in the test.

example.ex: So far McAllister seemed to have passed all the tests with flying colors.
example.tran: 到目前为止，麦卡利斯特似乎所有的考试都考得非常好。

collins.def: If a film or television programme is in colour, it has been made so that you see the picture in all its colours, and not just in black, white, or grey.

example.ex: Was he going to show the film? Was it in colour?...
example.tran: 他会放那部电影吗？是彩色的吗？

example.ex: You can go home afterwards and watch Inspector Morse in colour.
example.tran: 之后你就可以回家，看彩色版的电视连续剧《摩斯警长》。

collins.def: If someone nails their colours to the mast, they say what they really think about something.

example.ex: I shall nail my colours firmly to the mast on this subject — as a feminist I find movies like this offensive.
example.tran: 我要非常明确地表明自己对这个主题的看法：作为一名女权主义者我认为这类电影是对女性的侮辱。

collins.def: If you nail your colours to someone's mast, or if you nail your colours to a particular mast, you show that you support a particular person or issue.

example.ex: He has nailed his colours firmly to Mr Dobson's mast...
example.tran: 他表示坚决支持多布森先生。

example.ex: Mr Kennedy nailed his colours to the mast of the single currency.
example.tran: 肯尼迪先生表示支持单一货币制。

collins.tran: 看(某人)有没有足够的支付能力
