collins.def: If you say that you want to see the colour of someone's money, you mean that you are not prepared to sell them something or do something for them until they have proved that they have the money to pay for it.

example.ex: He made a mental note never to enter into conversation with a customer until he'd at least seen the colour of his money.
example.tran: 他心里暗暗记住，顾客至少要看上去能付得起钱，他才会去和他们搭话。

collins.def: People of colour are people who belong to a race with dark skins.

example.ex: Black communities spoke up to defend the rights of all people of color.
example.tran: 黑人群体大声疾呼，要求维护有色人种的权利。

collins.tran: (看到)…的真面目;露出…的真面目
collins.def: If you see someone in their true colours or if they show their true colours, you realize what they are really like.

example.ex: The children are seeing him in his true colours for the first time now...
example.tran: 现在，孩子们第一次看到他的真面目。

example.ex: Here, the organization has had time to show its true colours, to show its inefficiency and its bungling.
example.tran: 现在时间一长，这个机构就露出了真面目，效率低下，差错百出。

collins.def: When a person or thing comes to a particular place, especially to a place where you are, they move there.

example.ex: Two police officers came into the hall...
example.tran: 两位警官走进大厅。

example.ex: Come here, Tom...
example.tran: 汤姆，到这儿来。

collins.tran: 来(做某事)(除了用 come to do something 表达此意，英国英语中也用 come and do something，美国英语中也用 come do something，但表示过去动作时一定要用 came and did something)
collins.def: When someone comes to do something, they move to the place where someone else is in order to do it, and they do it. In British English, someone can also come and do something and in American English, someone can come do something. However, you always say that someone came and did something.

example.ex: Eleanor had come to visit her...
example.tran: 埃莉诺来看过她了。

example.ex: Come and meet Roger...
example.tran: 过来认识一下罗杰。

collins.def: When you come to a place, you reach it.

example.ex: He came to a door that led into a passageway.
example.tran: 他来到一扇门前，这扇门通往一条走廊。

collins.def: If something comes up to a particular point or down to it, it is tall enough, deep enough, or long enough to reach that point.

example.ex: The water came up to my chest...
example.tran: 水淹到了我的胸部。

example.ex: I wore a large shirt of Jamie's which came down over my hips.
example.tran: 我穿着杰米的衬衫，衬衫很大，把我的臀部都盖住了。

collins.def: If something comes apart or comes to pieces, it breaks into pieces. If something comes off or comes away, it becomes detached from something else.

example.ex: The pistol came to pieces, easily and quickly...
example.tran: 手枪很快就被拆得七零八落。

example.ex: The door knobs came off in our hands.
example.tran: 我们用手一扭，门把手就掉了下来。

collins.tran: 达到，进入(某种状态或境地)
collins.def: You use come in expressions such as come to an end or come into operation to indicate that someone or something enters or reaches a particular state or situation.

example.ex: The summer came to an end...
example.tran: 夏天结束了。

example.ex: The Communists came to power in 1944...
example.tran: 1944年共产党开始执政。

collins.tran: (经历漫长的过程或时间后)开始(做某事)
collins.def: If someone comes to do something, they do it at the end of a long process or period of time.

example.ex: She said it so many times that she came to believe it...
example.tran: 这件事她说了太多遍，以至自己都开始相信了。

example.ex: Although it was a secret wedding, the press did eventually come to hear about it.
example.tran: 尽管是场秘密的婚礼，媒体最终还是听到了消息。

collins.def: You can ask how something came to happen when you want to know what caused it to happen or made it possible.

example.ex: How did you come to meet him?
example.tran: 你是怎么碰到他的？

collins.def: When a particular event or time comes, it arrives or happens.

example.ex: The announcement came after a meeting at the Home Office...
example.tran: 内政部会议结束后，声明随即发表。

example.ex: The time has come for us to move on...
example.tran: 我们是时候继续前行了。

collins.tran: (用于日期、时间或事件之前)当…到来时
collins.def: You can use come before a date, time, or event to mean when that date, time, or event arrives. For example, you can say come the spring to mean 'when the spring arrives'.

example.ex: Come the election on the 20th of May, we will have to decide...
example.tran: 到5月20日选举的那一天，我们必须作出决定。

example.ex: He's going to be up there again come Sunday.
example.tran: 到星期天他又会上那儿去。

collins.tran: 突然被…意识到;突然被…想起
collins.def: If a thought, idea, or memory comes to you, you suddenly think of it or remember it.

example.ex: He was about to shut the door when an idea came to him...
example.tran: 他正准备关门，突然想到一个主意。

example.ex: Then it came to me that perhaps he did understand.
example.tran: 然后，我突然意识到他可能的确是明白了。

collins.def: If money or property is going to come to you, you are going to inherit or receive it.

example.ex: The fortune will come to you...
example.tran: 这一大笔钱将归你所有。

example.ex: He did have pension money coming to him when the factory shut down.
example.tran: 工厂倒闭的时候，他的确拿到了养老金。

collins.tran: (案件)提交…审理，送交…进行处理
collins.def: If a case comes before a court or tribunal or comes to court, it is presented there so that the court or tribunal can examine it.

example.ex: The membership application came before the Council of Ministers in September...
example.tran: 会员申请书于9月提交部长会议审议。

example.ex: President Cristiani expected the case to come to court within ninety days.
example.tran: 克里斯蒂亚尼总统要求案件在90天内送交法院审理。

collins.def: If something comes to a particular number or amount, it adds up to it.

example.ex: Lunch came to $80.
example.tran: 午餐总共80美元。

collins.def: If someone or something comes from a particular place or thing, that place or thing is their origin, source, or starting point.

example.ex: Nearly half the students come from abroad...
example.tran: 将近一半的学生来自国外。

example.ex: Chocolate comes from the cacao tree...
example.tran: 巧克力出自可可树。

collins.def: Something that comes from something else or comes of it is the result of it.

example.ex: There is a feeling of power that comes from driving fast...
example.tran: 开快车会让人觉得自己有一种主宰之力。

example.ex: Some good might come of all this gloomy business...
example.tran: 生意不景气也未必全是坏事。

collins.def: If someone comes of a particular family or type of family, they are descended from them.

example.ex: She comes of a very good family.
example.tran: 她的家庭出身非常好。

collins.def: If someone or something comes first, next, or last, they are first, next, or last in a series, list, or competition.

example.ex: The two countries have been unable to agree which step should come next...
example.tran: 接下来该走哪一步，这两个国家还未能就此达成一致意见。

example.ex: The alphabet might be more rational if all the vowels came first...
example.tran: 如果把所有的元音列在前面，字母表可能会更为合理一些。

collins.tran: 有，可提供(某种颜色、形状、款式或尺寸)
collins.def: If a type of thing comes in a particular range of colours, forms, styles, or sizes, it can have any of those colours, forms, styles, or sizes.

example.ex: Bikes come in all shapes and sizes...
example.tran: 各种外形和尺寸的自行车都有。

example.ex: The wallpaper comes in black and white only.
example.tran: 这种墙纸只有黑白的。

collins.tran: (用于表示对某事的反应)让人…
collins.def: You use come in expressions such as it came as a surprise when indicating a person's reaction to something that happens.

example.ex: Major's reply came as a complete surprise to the House of Commons...
example.tran: 梅杰的回答让众议院大吃一惊。

example.ex: The arrest has come as a terrible shock.
example.tran: 这次逮捕让人极为震惊。

collins.def: The next subject in a discussion that you come to is the one that you talk about next.

example.ex: Finally in the programme, we come to the news that the American composer and conductor, Leonard Bernstein, has died...
example.tran: 节目的最后，我们来看一则新闻，美国作曲家兼指挥家伦纳德·伯恩斯坦去世。

example.ex: That is another matter altogether. And we shall come to that next.
example.tran: 那完全是另一回事，接下来我们会谈到。

collins.def: People say 'Come' to encourage or comfort someone.

example.ex: 'Come, eat!' the old woman urged.
example.tran: “好了，吃吧！”老太太催促道。

collins.def: To come means to have an orgasm.

collins.tran: 再说一遍？你说什么来着？
collins.def: Some people say 'Come again?' when they want you to repeat what you have just said.
If you say that someone is, for example, as good as they come, or as stupid as they come, you are emphasizing that they are extremely good or extremely stupid.

example.ex: The new finance minister was educated at Oxford and is as traditional as they come.
example.tran: 新财政部长曾就读于牛津大学，是个极为传统的人。

collins.tran: (表示不赞成或不同意)哦，不，别这样
collins.def: People say 'Come, come' to indicate that they disapprove of or disagree with what someone has just said or done.

example.ex: 'You hope for something in Mrs Zuckerman's will?' — 'Come, come, Mr Trethowan. Of course not.'
example.tran: “你希望朱克曼太太在遗嘱里给你留点什么？”“哦，不，特里索恩先生。当然不是。”

collins.def: You can use the expression when it comes down to it or when you come down to it for emphasis, when you are giving a general statement or conclusion.

example.ex: When you come down to it, however, the basic problems of life have not changed...
example.tran: 然而，归根结底，生活中一些基本的问题还是没有变。

example.ex: Few people, when it comes down to it, are so selfless.
example.tran: 说到底，很少有人能这样无私。

collins.def: If you say that someone has it coming to them, you mean that they deserve everything bad that is going to happen to them, because they have done something wrong or are a bad person. If you say that someone got what was coming to them, you mean that they deserved the punishment or bad experience that they have had.

example.ex: He was pleased that Brady was dead because he probably had it coming to him.
example.tran: 他很高兴布雷迪死了，因为他可能纯粹是自找的。

collins.tran: 突然想起来;突然明白过来
collins.def: You use the expression come to think of it to indicate that you have suddenly realized something, often something obvious.

example.ex: He was his distant relative, as was everyone else on the island, come to think of it...
example.tran: 哦，对了，他是他的远亲，岛上的其他人也是。

example.ex: You know, when you come to think of it, this is very odd.
example.tran: 其实你要想一想的话，这还是挺怪的。

collins.tran: (时间或事件)未来的，接下来的
collins.def: When you refer to a time or an event to come or one that is still to come, you are referring to a future time or event.

example.ex: The War will remain a heated topic of debate for some time to come...
example.tran: 这场战争在未来的一段时间内仍将是人们热议的话题。

example.ex: I hope in years to come he will reflect on his decision...
example.tran: 我希望未来的几年里他会反省自己的决定。

collins.def: You can use the expression when it comes to or when it comes down to in order to introduce a new topic or a new aspect of a topic that you are talking about.

example.ex: Most of us know we should cut down on fat. But knowing such things isn't much help when it comes to shopping and eating...
example.tran: 我们大多数人都知道应该减少脂肪的摄入量。但是在购物和吃东西的时候，这些常识就丢到一边去了。

example.ex: However, when it comes down to somebody that they know, they have a different feeling.
example.tran: 然而，涉及他们认识的人，他们的感觉就不同了。

collins.tran: 我明白你的意思/你可以看出她的态度
collins.def: You can use expressions like I know where you're coming from or you can see where she's coming from to say that you understand  someone's attitude or point of view.

example.ex: To understand why they are doing it, it is necessary to know where they are coming from...
example.tran: 要弄清楚他们这样做的原因，必须要了解他们的意图。

example.ex: You see where I'm coming from?
example.tran: 你明白我的意思了吗？

means: 达到（认识、理解或相信的程度）

collins.tran: (事件或时间)即将到来的，即将发生的
collins.def: A coming event or time is an event or time that will happen soon.

example.ex: This obviously depends on the weather in the coming months...
example.tran: 这显然取决于未来几个月的天气。

example.ex: They talk of the coming battle.
example.tran: 他们谈论着即将到来的战斗。

collins.def: A committee is a group of people who meet to make decisions or plans for a larger group or organization that they represent.

example.ex: ...a committee of ministers.
example.tran: 部长委员会

example.ex: ...an elected Management Committee who serve the Association on a voluntary basis.
example.tran: 通过选举产生、自愿为协会服务的管理委员会

collins.def: If something is common, it is found in large numbers or it happens often.

example.ex: His name was Hansen, a common name in Norway...
example.tran: 他的名字叫汉森，在挪威是一个常见的名字。

example.ex: Oil pollution is the commonest cause of death for seabirds...
example.tran: 石油污染是造成海鸟死亡最常见的原因。

collins.def: If something is common to two or more people or groups, it is done, possessed, or used by  them all.

example.ex: Moldavians and Romanians share a common language...
example.tran: 摩尔达维亚人和罗马尼亚人使用同一种语言。

example.ex: Such behaviour is common to all young people.
example.tran: 这种行为在年轻人中司空见惯。

collins.def: When there are more animals or plants of a particular species than there are of related species, then the first species is called common .

example.ex: ...the common house fly.
example.tran: 常见的家蝇

collins.def: Common is used to indicate that someone or something is of the ordinary kind and not special in any way.

example.ex: Democracy might elevate the common man to a position of political superiority...
example.tran: 民主也许能提升普通人的政治地位，让他们产生优越感。

example.ex: Common salt is made up of 40% sodium and 60% chloride.
example.tran: 食盐由40%的钠和60%的氯化物构成。

collins.def: Common decency or common courtesy is the decency or courtesy which most people have. You usually talk about this when someone has not shown these characteristics in their behaviour to show your disapproval of them.

example.ex: It is common decency to give your seat to anyone in greater need...
example.tran: 给更有需要的人让座是最起码的礼貌。

example.ex: He didn't have the common courtesy to ask permission.
example.tran: 他连邀准这种最起码的礼貌都没有。

collins.tran: (知识等)众所周知的，共有的，共识的
collins.def: You can use common to describe knowledge, an opinion, or a feeling that is shared by people in general.

example.ex: It is common knowledge that swimming is one of the best forms of exercise.
example.tran: 大家都知道游泳是最好的锻炼方式之一。

example.ex: ...the common view that acupuncture is only a fringe area of medicine.
example.tran: 针灸仅仅是医学的一个边缘领域的这种普遍看法

collins.def: If you describe someone or their behaviour as common, you mean that they show a lack of taste, education, and good manners.

example.ex: She might be a little common at times, but she was certainly not boring.
example.tran: 她有时候可能有点粗俗，但绝对不会让人生厌。

collins.tran: (通常指村庄、小镇或其附近的)公共草地
collins.def: A common is an area of grassy land, usually in or near a village or small town, where the public is allowed to go.

example.ex: We are warning women not to go out on to the common alone.
example.tran: 我们告诫女性不要独自去公共草地。

example.ex: ...Wimbledon Common.
example.tran: 温布尔登公地

collins.tran: 同 the House of Commons;(亦指)下议员议员们
collins.def: The Commons is the same as the House of Commons. The members of the House of Commons can also be referred to as the Commons .

example.ex: The Prime Minister is to make a statement in the Commons this afternoon...
example.tran: 今天下午首相将在下议院发表声明。

example.ex: The Commons has spent over three months on the bill.
example.tran: 下议院在这项议案上已经花了3个多月的时间。

collins.def: If two or more things have something in common, they have the same characteristic or feature.

example.ex: The oboe and the clarinet have got certain features in common...
example.tran: 双簧管和单簧管有些相似之处。

example.ex: In common with most Italian lakes, access to the shores of Orta is restricted.
example.tran: 和大部分意大利湖泊一样，奥尔塔湖岸不对公众开放。

collins.def: If two or more people have something in common, they share the same interests or experiences.

example.ex: He had very little in common with his sister.
example.tran: 他和姐姐几乎没有什么共同语言。

collins.tran: (同住一地的人所构成的)社区
collins.def: The community is all the people who live in a particular area or place.

example.ex: He's well liked by people in the community...
example.tran: 社区的人都非常喜欢他。

example.ex: 'The community are getting impatient,' said a representative of the Residents' Association...
example.tran: “社区居民开始不耐烦了，”居民协会的一位代表说。

collins.def: A particular community is a group of people who are similar in some way.

example.ex: The police haven't really done anything for the black community in particular.
example.tran: 警方并未真正特意为黑人群体做什么。

example.ex: ...the business community.
example.tran: 商界

collins.tran: (不同人士、团体之间的)友谊，伙伴关系
collins.def: Community is friendship between different people or groups, and a sense of having something in common.

example.ex: A supportive house for eight to ten older people, each with his or her own room, provides privacy and a sense of community...
example.tran: 一幢扶助性住宅可供8至10位老人居住，每个人都有自己单独的房间，在这里，他们既能独处，又有社区归属感。

example.ex: Two of our greatest strengths are diversity and community.
example.tran: 我们最大的两个优势是多样性和团体精神。

collins.def: A company is a business organization that makes money by selling goods or services.

example.ex: Sheila found some work as a secretary in an insurance company.
example.tran: 希拉在一家保险公司找到一份当秘书的工作。

example.ex: ...the Ford Motor Company.
example.tran: 福特汽车公司

collins.def: A company is a group of opera singers, dancers, or actors who work together.

example.ex: ...the Phoenix Dance Company.
example.tran: 凤凰舞蹈团

collins.def: A company is a group of soldiers that is usually part of a battalion or regiment, and that is divided into two or more platoons.

example.ex: The division will consist of two tank companies and one infantry company...
example.tran: 这个师的组成部队将包括两个坦克连和一个步兵连。

example.ex: C Company's sentries were just ahead.
example.tran: C连的哨兵就在前头。

collins.def: Company is having another person or other people with you, usually when this is pleasant or stops you feeling lonely.

example.ex: 'I won't stay long.' — 'No, please. I need the company'...
example.tran: “我不会呆很久。”“别这样，求你了。我需要有人陪。”

example.ex: Ross had always enjoyed the company of women...
example.tran: 罗斯总是喜欢有女人陪伴。

collins.tran: (用于某人的名字之后表示)及其同伴，一伙
collins.def: You can say and company after mentioning a person's name, to refer also to the people who are associated with that person.

example.ex: Keegan and company approached the game with understandable caution.
example.tran: 基根一伙人小心谨慎地对待这场比赛，这是可以理解的。

collins.tran: (不必为错误自责，因为)大人物们也犯过同样的错
collins.def: If you say that someone is in good company, you mean that they should not be ashamed of a mistake or opinion, because some important or respected people have made the same mistake or have the same opinion.

example.ex: Mr Koo is in good company. The prime minister made a similar slip a couple of years back.
example.tran: 库先生的错大人物也犯过。几年前首相就有过类似的疏漏。

collins.def: If you have company, you have a visitor or friend with you.

example.ex: He didn't say he had had company.
example.tran: 他没说当时有客人在。

collins.def: When you are in company, you are with a person or group of people.

example.ex: When they were in company she always seemed to dominate the conversation...
example.tran: 他们在一起的时候，她好像总是操纵着话语权。

example.ex: I feel awkward and shy in company.
example.tran: 跟别人在一起的时候，我觉得很别扭，不好意思。

collins.tran: 和…有同样的想法(或感觉、认识)
collins.def: If you feel, believe, or know something in company with someone else, you both feel, believe, or know it.

example.ex: Saudi Arabia, in company with some other Gulf oil states, is concerned to avoid any repetition of the two oil price shocks of the 1970s.
example.tran: 避免20世纪70年代两次石油价格冲击的情形再次出现，这是沙特阿拉伯和其他一些海湾石油国家一致关心的问题。

collins.def: If you keep someone company, you spend time with them and stop them feeling lonely or bored.

example.ex: Why don't you stay here and keep Emma company?
example.tran: 你为什么不呆在这儿，陪陪埃玛？

collins.def: If you keep company with a person or with a particular kind of person, you spend a lot of time with them.

example.ex: He keeps company with all sorts of lazy characters.
example.tran: 他与形形色色的懒人为伍。

collins.def: If two or more people part company, they go in different directions after going in the same direction together.

example.ex: The three of them parted company at the bus stop.
example.tran: 他们三个在公共汽车站分了手。

collins.def: If you part company with someone, you end your association with them, often because of a disagreement.

example.ex: The tennis star has parted company with his Austrian trainer...
example.tran: 这位网球明星与他的奥地利教练分道扬镳。

example.ex: We have agreed to part company after differences of opinion.
example.tran: 我们道不同不相为谋。

collins.def: If you part company with someone on a particular subject, you disagree with them on it.

example.ex: Where I part company with him, however, is over the link he forges between science and liberalism.
example.tran: 然而，我与他产生分歧的地方是，他把科学与自由主义联系了起来。

collins.def: If you are making a general, unfavourable comment about a particular type of person, and you are with people of that type, you can say 'present company excepted' as a way of making your comment sound more polite.
You use complete to emphasize that something is as great in extent, degree, or amount as it possibly can be.

example.ex: The rebels had taken complete control...
example.tran: 叛乱分子完全控制了局面。

example.ex: It shows a complete lack of understanding by management...
example.tran: 这表明管理层对此完全不了解。

collins.def: You can use complete to emphasize that you are referring to the whole of something and not just part of it.

example.ex: A complete tenement block was burnt to the ground...
example.tran: 整幢公寓大楼被付之一炬。

example.ex: The job sheets eventually filled a complete book.
example.tran: 工作指导卡最终装满了整整一个册子。

collins.def: If something is complete, it contains all the parts that it should contain.

example.ex: The list may not be complete.
example.tran: 这个单子可能不全。

example.ex: ...a complete dinner service...
example.tran: 一整套餐具

collins.def: To complete a set or group means to provide the last item that is needed to make it a full set or group.

example.ex: Children don't complete their set of 20 baby teeth until they are two to three years old.
example.tran: 小孩要到两三岁才会长齐20颗乳牙。

example.ex: ...the stickers needed to complete the collection.
example.tran: 集全一整套所需的贴纸

collins.def: The complete works of a writer are all their books or poems published together in one book or as a set of books.

example.ex: ...the Complete Works of William Shakespeare.
example.tran: 《威廉·莎士比亚全集》

collins.def: If one thing comes complete with another, it has that thing as an extra or additional part.

example.ex: The diary comes complete with a gold-coloured ballpoint pen.
example.tran: 这个日记本配有一支金色的圆珠笔。

collins.def: If something is complete, it has been finished.

example.ex: The work of restoring the farmhouse is complete...
example.tran: 修复农舍的工作已经完成。

example.ex: It'll be two years before the process is complete.
example.tran: 这个过程需要两年才能完成。

collins.def: If you complete something, you finish doing, making, or producing it.

example.ex: Peter Mayle has just completed his first novel.
example.tran: 彼得·梅尔刚刚完成他的第一部小说。

example.ex: ...the rush to get the stadiums completed on time.
example.tran: 为了让各个体育场按时完工进行的匆忙赶工

collins.def: If you complete something, you do all of it.

example.ex: She completed her degree in two years...
example.tran: 她用两年的时间修完了课程，拿到了学位。

example.ex: This book took years to complete.
example.tran: 这本书耗时多年才写完。

collins.def: If you complete a form or questionnaire, you write the answers or information asked for in it.

example.ex: Simply complete the coupon below...
example.tran: 填写下面的订货单即可。

example.ex: We ask candidates to complete a psychometric questionnaire...
example.tran: 我们让候选人填写一份心理测试问卷。

collins.def: You can use complete to emphasize that someone is skilled at all aspects of a particular activity and is therefore the best example of that kind of person.

example.ex: He was the complete all-round journalist.
example.tran: 他是一名全能的记者。

collins.def: Concern is worry about a situation.

example.ex: The group has expressed concern about reports of political violence in Africa...
example.tran: 该团体对有关非洲政治暴力的报道表示关切。

example.ex: The move follows growing public concern over the spread of the disease...
example.tran: 针对公众对该疾病的不断蔓延日益担忧，从而出台了这一举措。

collins.def: If something concerns you, it worries you.

example.ex: The growing number of people seeking refuge in Thailand is beginning to concern Western aid agencies...
example.tran: 到泰国寻求庇护的人日益增多，这开始引起了西方援助机构的不安。

example.ex: It concerned her that Bess was developing a crush on Max.
example.tran: 贝丝迷上了马克斯，这让她很担心。

collins.tran: 令人担忧的事实(或情况)
collins.def: A concern is a fact or situation that worries you.

example.ex: His concern was that people would know that he was responsible...
example.tran: 他担心大家会知道是他的责任。

example.ex: Unemployment was the electorate's main concern.
example.tran: 选民关心的主要是失业问题。

collins.def: Someone's concern with something is their feeling that it is important.

example.ex: ...a story that illustrates how dangerous excessive concern with safety can be.
example.tran: 一个说明过分关心安全问题会招致何等麻烦的故事

collins.def: Someone's concerns are the things that they consider to be important.

example.ex: Feminism must address issues beyond the concerns of middle-class whites.
example.tran: 女权主义解决的问题不能仅仅局限于中产阶级白人妇女所关心的问题。

collins.def: Concern for someone is a feeling that you want them to be happy, safe, and well. If you do something out of concern for someone, you do it because you want them to be happy, safe, and well.

example.ex: Without her care and concern, he had no chance at all...
example.tran: 若非她的关心和照顾，他根本没有机会。

example.ex: He had only gone along out of concern for his two grandsons.
example.tran: 他完全是出于对两个孙子的关心才继续这样做。

collins.def: If you concern yourself with something, you give it attention because you think that it is important.

example.ex: I didn't concern myself with politics...
example.tran: 我不关心政治。

example.ex: He would concern himself solely with the plight of the hostages.
example.tran: 他唯一关心的是人质的危险处境。

collins.def: If something such as a book or a piece of information concerns a particular subject, it is about that subject.

example.ex: The bulk of the book concerns Sandy's two middle-aged children...
example.tran: 书中主要描写桑迪的两个已到中年的孩子。

example.ex: Chapter 2 concerns itself with the methodological difficulties.
example.tran: 第二章讲的是研究方法上的难点。

collins.tran: (情况、事件或活动)对…有影响，与…相关
collins.def: If a situation, event, or activity concerns you, it affects or involves you.

example.ex: It was just a little unfinished business from my past, and it doesn't concern you at all.
example.tran: 这只是我过去的一点未了之事，与你没有任何关系。

collins.def: If a situation or problem is your concern, it is something that you have a duty or responsibility to be involved with.

example.ex: The technical aspects were the concern of the Army...
example.tran: 技术方面由陆军负责。

example.ex: I would be glad to get rid of them myself. But that is not our concern.
example.tran: 如果能亲自动手摆脱他们我会非常高兴，但那不是我们的分内之事。

collins.tran: 公司，企业(通常用于描述其类型)
collins.def: You can refer to a company or business as a concern, usually when you are describing what type of company or business it is.

example.ex: If not a large concern, Queensbury Nursery was at least a successful one.
example.tran: 即使规模不算大，昆斯伯里托儿所至少办得很成功。

collins.def: You can say 'as far as I'm concerned' to indicate that you are giving your own opinion.

example.ex: As far as I'm concerned the officials incited the fight.
example.tran: 在我看来，是官员们煽动了这场争斗。

collins.tran: 就…而言，说到(用于表明所谈论的话题)
collins.def: You can say as far as something is concerned to indicate the subject that you are talking about.

example.ex: As far as starting a family is concerned, the trend is for women having their children later in life.
example.tran: 在要孩子方面，目前的趋势是女性要孩子要得比较晚。

collins.def: If a company is a going concern, it is actually doing business, rather than having stopped trading or not yet having started trading.

example.ex: The receivers will always prefer to sell a business as a going concern.
example.tran: 破产管理人总是希望在公司仍然正常运转的时候将其卖掉。

collins.def: If something is of concern to someone, they find it worrying and unsatisfactory.

example.ex: Any injury to a child is a cause of great concern to us...
example.tran: 孩子受到任何伤害都会让我们非常担心。

example.ex: The survey's findings are a matter of great concern.
example.tran: 这次调查的结果备受关注。

collins.tran: 对…重要的;与…有利害关系的
collins.def: If something is of concern to you, it is important to you.

example.ex: How they are paid should be of little concern to the bank as long as they are paid.
example.tran: 只要肯付款，付款方式对银行来说不是很重要。

means: 保持（头发或皮肤等的）健康

collins.def: If you talk about the condition of a person or thing, you are talking about the state that they are in, especially how good or bad their physical state is.

example.ex: He remains in a critical condition in a California hospital...
example.tran: 他在加州的一家医院里，病情仍然十分危急。

example.ex: I received several compliments on the condition of my skin...
example.tran: 好几个人夸我的皮肤保养得好。

collins.tran: (某事完成或发生的)环境，条件
collins.def: The conditions under which something is done or happens are all the factors or circumstances which directly affect it.

example.ex: This change has been timed under laboratory conditions...
example.tran: 在实验室条件下测得了这一变化所需的时间。

example.ex: The mild winter has created the ideal conditions for an ant population explosion.
example.tran: 暖冬为蚁群数量激增创造了理想的条件。

collins.def: The conditions in which people live or work are the factors which affect their comfort, safety, or health.

example.ex: People are living in appalling conditions...
example.tran: 人们的居住条件极其恶劣。

example.ex: He could not work in these conditions any longer...
example.tran: 他再也不能在这样的条件下工作了。

collins.tran: (某一群人的)生活状况，境况;(尤指)艰难处境
collins.def: The condition of a group of people is their situation in life, especially with regard to the difficulties they have.

example.ex: The condition of the people could be elevated by a programme of social reform...
example.tran: 人们的生活状况可以通过社会改革方案得到改善。

example.ex: The government has encouraged its people to better their condition.
example.tran: 政府鼓励人民改善生活状况。

collins.tran: (尤指写入合同或法律的)条件，条款
collins.def: A condition is something which must happen or be done in order for something else to be possible, especially when this is written into a contract or law.

example.ex: ...economic targets set as a condition for loan payments.
example.tran: 作为贷款偿还条件所设定的经济目标

example.ex: ...terms and conditions of employment...
example.tran: 雇用条款及条件

collins.def: If someone has a particular condition, they have an illness or other medical problem.

example.ex: Doctors suspect he may have a heart condition.
example.tran: 医生怀疑他可能有心脏病。

example.ex: ...a rare condition that causes degeneration of the brain tissue.
example.tran: 引起脑组织变性的罕见疾病

collins.def: If someone is conditioned by their experiences or environment, they are influenced by them over a period of time so that they do certain things or think in a particular way.

example.ex: We are all conditioned by early impressions and experiences...
example.tran: 我们都受到早年印象和经历的影响。

example.ex: You have been conditioned to believe that it is weak to be scared...
example.tran: 你习惯性地认为害怕是软弱的表现。

collins.def: To condition your hair or skin means to put something on it which will keep it in good condition.

example.ex: ...a protein which is excellent for conditioning dry and damaged hair.
example.tran: 对干燥、受损的头发有极佳护理效果的蛋白质

collins.tran: (因病重、烦乱或酒醉而)不能(做某事)
collins.def: If you say that someone is in no condition to do something, you mean that they are too ill, upset, or drunk to do it.

example.ex: She was clearly in no condition to see anyone.
example.tran: 很显然，她谁都不能见。

collins.def: When you agree to do something on condition that something else happens, you mean that you will only do it if this other thing also happens.

example.ex: He spoke to reporters on condition that he was not identified.
example.tran: 在不披露身份的条件下，他接受了记者的采访。

collins.tran: (由于缺乏锻炼而)身体状况不佳
collins.def: If someone is out of condition, they are unhealthy and unfit, because they do not do enough exercise.

example.ex: He was too out of condition to clamber over the top.
example.tran: 他体质太差，爬不到山顶。

collins.tran: (常持续数天的)专题讨论会，研讨会
collins.def: A conference is a meeting, often lasting a few days, which is organized on a particular subject or to bring together people who have a common interest.

example.ex: The President summoned all the state governors to a conference on education.
example.tran: 总统召集各州州长召开了一次教育研讨会。

example.ex: ...the Conservative Party conference...
example.tran: 保守党大会

collins.def: A conference is a meeting at which formal discussions take place.

example.ex: They sat down at the dinner table, as they always did, before the meal, for a conference...
example.tran: 他们在餐桌旁坐下，和平常一样，吃饭之前要开个会。

example.ex: Her employer was in conference with two lawyers and did not want to be interrupted.
example.tran: 她的老板在和两位律师谈事情，不想有人打扰。

means: 把（某人，某事）看作…，认为（某人，某事）如何

collins.def: If you consider a person or thing to be something, you have the opinion that this is what they are.

example.ex: We don't consider our customers to be mere consumers; we consider them to be our friends...
example.tran: 我们没有把客户仅仅看作是消费者;我们还把他们当作朋友。

example.ex: I had always considered myself a strong, competent woman...
example.tran: 一直以来，我始终认为自己是个女强人。

collins.def: If you consider something, you think about it carefully.

example.ex: The government is being asked to consider a plan to fix the date of the Easter break...
example.tran: 人们要求政府考虑确定复活节假期日期的计划。

example.ex: You do have to consider the feelings of those around you...
example.tran: 你的确需要考虑周围人的感受。

collins.def: If you are considering doing something, you intend to do it, but have not yet made a final decision whether to do it.

example.ex: I had seriously considered telling the story from the point of view of the wives...
example.tran: 我认真考虑过从为人妻者的视角来讲述这个故事。

example.ex: Watersports enthusiasts should consider hiring a wetsuit as well as a lifejacket...
example.tran: 除了租救生衣，水上运动爱好者还应该考虑租一套潜水服。

collins.tran: 通盘考虑;从各方面考虑
collins.def: You say all things considered to indicate that you are making a judgment after taking all the facts into account.

example.ex: All things considered, I think you have behaved marvellously in coming here.
example.tran: 从各方面考虑，我认为你来这儿是一个非常明智的举动。

collins.def: If someone or something continues to do something, they keep doing it and do not stop.

example.ex: I hope they continue to fight for equal justice after I'm gone...
example.tran: 我希望我走了以后他们能继续为司法公正而战。

example.ex: Interest rates continue to fall...
example.tran: 利率持续下调。

collins.def: If something continues or if you continue it, it does not stop happening.

example.ex: He insisted that the conflict would continue until conditions were met for a ceasefire...
example.tran: 他坚持认为除非满足停火条件，否则冲突会继续下去。

example.ex: But as the investigation continued, the plot began to thicken...
example.tran: 但是随着调查的继续深入，情况开始变得复杂起来。

collins.def: If you continue with something, you start doing it again after a break or interruption.

example.ex: I went up to my room to continue with my packing...
example.tran: 我走进房间，继续打包。

example.ex: She looked up for a moment, then continued drawing.
example.tran: 她抬头看了一下，然后继续画画。

collins.def: If something continues or if you continue it, it starts again after a break or interruption.

example.ex: He denies 18 charges. The trial continues today...
example.tran: 他否认了18项指控。审判今天继续。

example.ex: Once, he did dive for cover but he soon reappeared and continued his activities.
example.tran: 他确实一度销声匿迹，但是很快就重出江湖，继续他的各种活动。

collins.def: If you continue, you begin speaking again after a pause or interruption.

example.ex: 'You have no right to intimidate this man,' Alison continued...
example.tran: “你没有权利威胁这个人，”艾莉森接着说。

example.ex: Tony drank some coffee before he continued...
example.tran: 托尼喝了点咖啡继续说。

collins.tran: 继续(做某项工作或处于某种状态)
collins.def: If you continue as something or continue in a particular state, you remain in a particular job or state.

example.ex: He had hoped to continue as a full-time career officer...
example.tran: 他曾经希望继续当一名全职的职业事务员。

example.ex: For ten days I continued in this state.
example.tran: 我的这种状况持续了10天。

collins.def: If you continue in a particular direction, you keep walking or travelling in that direction.

example.ex: He continued rapidly up the path, not pausing until he neared the Chapter House.
example.tran: 他匆匆地继续沿着这条路走，一直快到牧师会礼堂时才停下来。

collins.def: If a road or path continues somewhere, it goes there after the place you have mentioned.

example.ex: The main road continues towards Viterbo before turning right to Bolsena.
example.tran: 大路一直延伸到维泰博，之后右转通向博尔塞纳。

means: （对国家、地区、机构等的）管理权

collins.tran: (对机构、地方、体系等的)控制权，支配权
collins.def: Control of an organization, place, or system is the power to make all the important decisions about the way that it is run.

example.ex: The restructuring involves Mr Ronson giving up control of the company...
example.tran: 这次改组涉及龙森先生放弃对公司的控制权。

example.ex: The first aim of his government would be to establish control over the republic's territory.
example.tran: 他这届政府的首要目标是确立对共和国领土的控制权。

collins.def: If you have control of something or someone, you are able to make them do what you want them to do.

example.ex: He lost control of his car...
example.tran: 他的汽车失控了。

example.ex: Some teachers have more control over pupils than their parents have.
example.tran: 有的老师比小学生的父母更能管得住他们。

collins.def: If you show control, you prevent yourself behaving in an angry or emotional way.

example.ex: He had a terrible temper, and sometimes he would completely lose control...
example.tran: 他的脾气很坏，有时会完全失控。

example.ex: He was working hard to keep control of himself.
example.tran: 他正努力克制自己。

collins.def: The people who control an organization or place have the power to take all the important decisions about the way that it is run.

example.ex: He now controls the largest retail development empire in southern California...
example.tran: 他现在掌管着加州南部最大的零售发展企业。

example.ex: Almost all of the countries in Latin America were controlled by dictators...
example.tran: 当时几乎所有的拉丁美洲国家都由独裁者统治。

collins.tran: 控制，操纵(设备、过程、系统等)
collins.def: To control a piece of equipment, process, or system means to make it work in the way that you want it to work.

example.ex: ...a computerised system to control the gates...
example.tran: 控制大门的计算机系统

example.ex: Scientists would soon be able to manipulate human genes to control the ageing process.
example.tran: 科学家们很快将能通过操控人类基因来控制衰老过程。

collins.tran: 管制，限定，控制(价格、工资、活动等)
collins.def: When a government controls prices, wages, or the activity of a particular group, it uses its power to restrict them.

example.ex: The federal government tried to control rising health-care costs.
example.tran: 联邦政府试图控制日益高涨的医疗保健费用。

example.ex: ...measures to control illegal mining.
example.tran: 控制非法采矿的措施

collins.def: If you control yourself, or if you control your feelings, voice, or expression, you make yourself behave calmly even though you are feeling angry, excited, or upset.

example.ex: Jo was advised to learn to control herself...
example.tran: 乔得到的建议是要学会控制自己的情绪。

example.ex: I just couldn't control my temper.
example.tran: 我就是不能克制自己的脾气。

collins.def: To control something dangerous means to prevent it from becoming worse or from spreading.

example.ex: ...the need to control environmental pollution...
example.tran: 控制环境污染的需要

example.ex: One of the biggest tasks will be to control the spread of malaria.
example.tran: 最大的任务之一就是控制疟疾的蔓延。

collins.tran: 控制按钮;控制装置;操纵装置
collins.def: A control is a device such as a switch or lever which you use in order to operate a machine or other piece of equipment.

example.ex: I practised operating the controls.
example.tran: 我练习操作这些控制装置。

example.ex: ...the control box.
example.tran: 控制盒

collins.def: Controls are the methods that a government uses to restrict increases, for example in prices, wages, or weapons.

example.ex: Critics question whether price controls would do any good...
example.tran: 评论家们质疑物价管制措施是否会有用。

example.ex: Their talks are expected to focus on arms control...
example.tran: 他们的会谈预计会集中讨论军备控制问题。

collins.def: Control is used to refer to a place where your documents or luggage are officially checked when you enter a foreign country.

example.ex: He went straight through Passport Control without incident.
example.tran: 他很顺利地通过了护照检查处。

example.ex: ...an agreement to abolish border controls.
example.tran: 关于取消边界检查站的一项协议

collins.def: If something is out of control, no-one has any power over it.

example.ex: The fire is burning out of control...
example.tran: 熊熊燃烧的大火正在失去控制。

example.ex: I'm dealing with customers all the time who have let their debts get out of control.
example.tran: 我成天和那些负债累累、无力偿还的顾客们打交道。

collins.def: If something harmful is under control, it is being dealt with successfully and is unlikely to cause any more harm.

example.ex: The situation is under control...
example.tran: 局势已经得到控制。

example.ex: If the current violence is to be brought under control, the government needs to act.
example.tran: 政府必须采取行动，才能使目前的暴力行为得到控制。

collins.def: The cost of something is the amount of money that is needed in order to buy, do, or make it.

example.ex: The cost of a loaf of bread has increased five-fold...
example.tran: 一条面包的价钱增长了4倍。

example.ex: In 1989 the price of coffee fell so low that in many countries it did not even cover the cost of production...
example.tran: 1989年咖啡的价格跌至低谷，在很多国家甚至连生产成本都收不回来。

collins.def: If something costs a particular amount of money, you can buy, do, or make it for that amount.

example.ex: This course is limited to 12 people and costs £50...
example.tran: 该课程只招收12人，学费为50英镑。

example.ex: Painted walls look much more interesting and doesn't cost much...
example.tran: 彩绘墙壁看上去更有趣而且花费也不高。

collins.def: Your costs are the total amount of money that you must spend on running your home or business.

example.ex: Costs have been cut by 30 to 50 per cent...
example.tran: 成本降低了30%到50%。

example.ex: The company admits its costs are still too high.
example.tran: 该公司承认其成本仍然过高。

collins.def: When something that you plan to do or make is costed, the amount of money you need is calculated in advance.

example.ex: Everything that goes into making a programme, staff, rent, lighting, is now costed.
example.tran: 制作节目的所有成本：人工、租用场地、灯光现在都已经估算了。

example.ex: ...seventy apartments, shops, offices, a restaurant and hotel, costed at around 10 million pounds.
example.tran: 估价约为1,000万英镑的70套公寓、店铺、办公室、一家大饭店

collins.def: If someone is ordered by a court of law to pay costs, they have to pay a sum of money towards the expenses of a court case they are involved in.

example.ex: He was jailed for 18 months and ordered to pay £550 costs.
example.tran: 他被监禁了18个月，还责令他支付550英镑的诉讼费。

collins.def: If something is sold at cost, it is sold for the same price as it cost the seller to buy it.

example.ex: ...a store that provided cigarettes and candy bars at cost.
example.tran: 按成本价出售香烟和糖果的商店

example.ex: ...a practice known as dumping – that is, selling below cost to drive competition out of business.
example.tran: 倾销行为——即通过以低于成本的价格销售产品来挤垮竞争对手

collins.def: The cost of something is the loss, damage, or injury that is involved in trying to achieve it.

example.ex: In March Mr Salinas shut down the city's oil refinery at a cost of $500 million and 5,000 jobs.
example.tran: 3月份，萨利纳斯先生关闭了该市的炼油场，造成5亿美元的损失，并使5,000人失去了工作。

example.ex: ...being so afraid of something that you feel you have to avoid it whatever the cost to your lifestyle.
example.tran: 如此地害怕某事觉得必须避开它，无论自己的生活方式因此受到怎样的影响都在所不惜

collins.def: If an event or mistake costs you something, you lose that thing as the result of it.

example.ex: ...a six-year-old boy whose life was saved by an operation that cost him his sight...
example.tran: 手术救了一名6岁男孩的命，却使他失明了

example.ex: The increase will hurt small business and cost many thousands of jobs.
example.tran: 这种增长会使小企业受损并使成千上万的人失去工作。

collins.def: If you say that something must be avoided at all costs, you are emphasizing that it must not be allowed to happen under any circumstances.

example.ex: They told Jacques Delors a disastrous world trade war must be avoided at all costs.
example.tran: 他们告诉雅克·德洛尔必须不惜任何代价避免一场毁灭性的世界贸易战。

collins.tran: 无论如何;在任何代价下
collins.def: If you say that something must be done at any cost, you are emphasizing that it must be done, even if this requires a lot of effort or money.

example.ex: This book is of such importance that it must be published at any cost...
example.tran: 这本书非常重要，无论如何也要出版。

example.ex: He ordered the army to recapture the camp at any cost.
example.tran: 他命令军队无论如何也要夺回营地。

collins.def: If someone counts the cost of something that has happened or will happen, they consider how the consequences of that action or event affect them.

example.ex: Several countries in eastern Europe are counting the cost of yesterday's earthquake...
example.tran: 东欧的几个国家正在计算昨天的地震带来的损失。

example.ex: Many people act on impulse without counting the cost.
example.tran: 很多人不考虑后果就莽撞行事。

collins.def: If you say that something costs money, you mean that it has to be paid for, and perhaps cannot be afforded.

example.ex: Well-designed clothes cost money.
example.tran: 设计精美的服装价格昂贵。

collins.def: If you know something to your cost, you know it because of an unpleasant experience that you have had.

example.ex: Kathryn knows to her cost the effect of having served a jail sentence...
example.tran: 凯瑟琳吃了苦头才知道服过刑会给一个人带来什么影响。

example.ex: There are very few people he can talk to in total confidence, as he has discovered to his cost.
example.tran: 他吃了亏后才发现自己真正能够交心的人寥寥无几。

means: 用于假设语气的条件句
用于虚拟语气的结论句

collins.def: You use could to indicate that someone had the ability to do something. You use could not or couldn't to say that someone was unable to do something.

example.ex: For my return journey, I felt I could afford the extra and travel first class...
example.tran: 至于回程，我觉得我能多花点钱坐头等舱。

example.ex: I could see that something was terribly wrong...
example.tran: 我能觉察到有什么事很不对头。

collins.def: You use could to indicate that something sometimes happened.

example.ex: Though he had a temper and could be nasty, it never lasted...
example.tran: 虽然他爱发脾气，而且有时还很讨厌，但向来都只是一阵儿。

example.ex: He could be very pleasant when he wanted to.
example.tran: 他想要友好的时候会非常友好。

collins.tran: 本能够，本可以(表示某事本有可能发生但却并未发生)
collins.def: You use could have to indicate that something was a possibility in the past, although it did not actually happen.

example.ex: He could have made a fortune as a lawyer...
example.tran: 他本可以当律师挣大钱的。

example.ex: You could have been killed!...
example.tran: 你差点儿就没命了！

collins.tran: (表示某事可能属实或可能发生)可能
collins.def: You use could to indicate that something is possibly true, or that it may possibly happen.

example.ex: Doctors told him the disease could have been caused by years of working in smokey clubs...
example.tran: 医生们告诉他这种疾病可能是由于多年在烟雾缭绕的俱乐部工作所致。

example.ex: An improvement in living standards could be years away...
example.tran: 可能多年之后生活水平才能得到提高。

collins.def: You use could not or couldn't to indicate that it is not possible that something is true.

example.ex: They argued all the time and thought it couldn't be good for the baby...
example.tran: 他们一直在争论，认为这对孩子肯定不好。

example.ex: Anne couldn't be expected to understand the situation...
example.tran: 别指望安妮能弄明白当前情势。

collins.tran: (表示可能性、能力或机会)可能
collins.def: You use could to talk about a possibility, ability, or opportunity that depends on other conditions.

example.ex: Their hope was that a new and better East Germany could be born...
example.tran: 他们希望能够诞生一个崭新的、更加美好的东德。

example.ex: I knew that if I spoke to Myra, I could get her to call my father.
example.tran: 我知道如果我同迈拉讲一声，就能让她给我父亲打电话。

collins.def: You use could when you are saying that one thing or situation resembles another.

example.ex: The charming characters she draws look like they could have walked out of the 1920s.
example.tran: 她画的那些优雅迷人的人物就好像是从20世纪30年代走出来的一样。

collins.def: You use could, or couldn't in questions, when you are making offers and suggestions.

example.ex: I could call the local doctor...
example.tran: 我可以给当地医生打电话。

example.ex: We need money right? We could go around and ask if people need odd jobs done or something...
example.tran: 咱们需要钱，对不对？咱们可以去周围打听一下看有没有人要找人做零工什么的。

collins.tran: (用于礼貌地提出请求或征得许可。当说话者意识到可能被拒绝时，可以用 couldn't 代替 could)能，可以
collins.def: You use could in questions when you are making a polite request or asking for permission to do something. Speakers sometimes use couldn't instead of 'could' to show that they realize that their request may be refused.

example.ex: Could I stay tonight?...
example.tran: 我今晚可以留下吗？

example.ex: Could I speak to you in private a moment, John?...
example.tran: 约翰，我可以单独跟你说一会儿话吗？

collins.tran: (用以礼貌地打断某人或引出将要说的话)请允许我
collins.def: People sometimes use structures with if I could or could I as polite ways of interrupting someone or of introducing what they are going to say next.

example.ex: Well, if I could just interject...
example.tran: 嗯，请允许我插一句。

example.ex: Could I stop you there?...
example.tran: 我能打断您一下吗？

collins.tran: (用以强调某人应该做所提及的事情，尤用于当说话者因为其没做该事而生气时)
collins.def: You use could to say emphatically that someone ought to do the thing mentioned, especially when you are annoyed because they have not done it. You use why couldn't in questions to express your surprise or annoyance that someone has not done something.

example.ex: We've come to see you, so you could at least stand and greet us properly...
example.tran: 我们都来看你了，你至少应该起身得体地打个招呼。

example.ex: Idiot! You could have told me!...
example.tran: 蠢货！你本应该告诉我！

collins.tran: (表示想要做某事的强烈感情)
collins.def: You use could when you are expressing strong feelings about something by saying that you feel as if you want to do the thing mentioned, although you do not do it.

example.ex: I could kill you! I swear I could!...
example.tran: 我想杀了你！我发誓我真想杀了你！

example.ex: 'Welcome back' was all they said. I could have kissed them!...
example.tran: 他们只是说，“欢迎回来。”我真想亲他们一下！

collins.tran: (用在if后以谈论没有能力或机会做但为考虑可能的结果而设想去做的事)
collins.def: You use could after 'if' when talking about something that you do not have the ability or opportunity to do, but which you are imagining in order to consider what the likely consequences might be.

example.ex: If I could afford it I'd have four television sets...
example.tran: 假如能买得起，我就会有4台电视机。

example.ex: If only I could get some sleep, I would be able to cope.
example.tran: 要是能睡上一会儿，我就能应付了。

collins.tran: (与比较级连用，强调某物或某人具备某种特征的程度)太…，再…不过
collins.def: You use could not or couldn't with comparatives to emphasize that someone or something has as much as is possible of a particular quality. For example, if you say 'I couldn't be happier', you mean that you are extremely happy.

example.ex: The rest of the players are a great bunch of lads and I couldn't be happier...
example.tran: 剩下的选手是一帮很棒的小伙子，我太高兴了。

example.ex: Darling Neville, I couldn't be more pleased for you...
example.tran: 亲爱的内维尔，我真太为你高兴了。

collins.tran: 怎么会(用在疑问句中强调对所发生的不愉快之事的感受)
collins.def: In speech, you use how could in questions to emphasize that you feel strongly about something bad that has happened.

example.ex: How could you allow him to do something like that?...
example.tran: 你怎么会允许他做那样的事？

example.ex: How could I have been so stupid?...
example.tran: 我怎么会那么蠢？

collins.tran: 不用了(谢绝更多的食物或饮品)
collins.def: You say 'I couldn't' to refuse an offer of more food or drink.

example.ex: 'More cake?' — 'Oh no, I couldn't.'
example.tran: “再来点蛋糕？”——“哦不，不用了。”

means: （尤指旧时讨论特定步骤的）协商会议
市政（或地方管理）服务机构

collins.def: A council is a group of people who are elected to govern a local area such as a city or, in Britain, a county.

example.ex: ...Cheshire County Council...
example.tran: 柴郡政务委员会

example.ex: The city council has voted almost unanimously in favour.
example.tran: 市政委员会几乎一致投票表示赞同。

collins.tran: (房屋或公寓)地方政府出租的
collins.def: Council houses or flats are owned by the local council, and people pay rent to live in them.

example.ex: There is a shortage of council housing...
example.tran: 廉租公房房源不足。

example.ex: Council tenants around the country are planning a mass lobby of Parliament.
example.tran: 全国各地的市政住房租户正在计划组建一个大的议会游说团。

collins.def: Council is used in the names of some organizations.

example.ex: ...the National Council for Civil Liberties.
example.tran: 全国公民自由委员会

example.ex: ...the Arts Council.
example.tran: 艺术委员会

collins.def: In some organizations, the council is the group of people that controls or governs it.

example.ex: The permanent council of the Organization of American States meets today here in Washington.
example.tran: 美洲国家组织的常务委员们今天在华盛顿这里会面。

example.ex: ...the Bundesbank's central council.
example.tran: 德意志联邦银行的中央委员会

collins.def: A council is a specially organized, formal meeting that is attended by a particular group of people.

example.ex: President Najibullah said he would call a grand council of all Afghans...
example.tran: 纳吉布拉总统称他将召开阿富汗全民大会。

example.ex: The president also meets ministers at inter-ministerial councils held at the Elysée Palace.
example.tran: 总统还在爱丽舍宫接见了参加部长级会议的各部长。

collins.def: A country is one of the political units which the world is divided into, covering a particular area of land.

example.ex: Indonesia is the fourth most populous country in the world.
example.tran: 印度尼西亚是世界上第四大人口大国。

example.ex: ...that disputed boundary between the two countries...
example.tran: 两国之间存有争议的边境地区

collins.def: The people who live in a particular country can be referred to as the country .

example.ex: The country had confounded the pundits by electing a fourth-term Tory government...
example.tran: 该国国民连续四次选举托利党来执掌政府，这令专家们困惑不已。

example.ex: Seventy per cent of this country is opposed to blood sports.
example.tran: 该国70%的人反对猎兽活动。

collins.def: The country consists of places such as farms, open fields, and villages which are away from towns and cities.

example.ex: ...a healthy life in the country...
example.tran: 乡下的健康生活

example.ex: She was cycling along a country road near Compiegne...
example.tran: 她正骑车行进在贡比涅附近的乡村道路上。

collins.tran: (具有某种特征或与某名人有关的)地区，区域
collins.def: A particular kind of country is an area of land which has particular characteristics or is connected with a particular well-known person.

example.ex: Varese Ligure is a small town in mountainous country east of Genoa.
example.tran: 瓦雷泽古雷是位于热那亚以东山区的一座小城。

example.ex: ...some of the best walking country in the Sierras...
example.tran: 喜艾拉生态保护区内一些最适宜散步的地区

collins.def: Country music is popular music from the southern United States.

example.ex: For a long time I just wanted to play country music.
example.tran: 有很长一段时间我只想弹奏乡村音乐。

example.ex: ...a famous country singer named Katie Cocker.
example.tran: 一位名为凯蒂·科克尔的著名乡村乐歌手

collins.def: If you travel across country, you travel through country areas, avoiding major roads and towns.

example.ex: From here we walked across country to Covington.
example.tran: 我们从这儿走乡间小路去卡温顿。

collins.tran: 长途;长距离;跨越地区地
collins.def: If you travel across country, you travel a long distance, from one part of a country to another.

example.ex: We've just moved all the way across country to begin a new life.
example.tran: 我们刚刚经过长途的搬迁来这里开始一种新生活。

collins.def: If a head of government or a government goes to the country, they hold a general election.

example.ex: The Prime Minister does not have to go to the country for another year.
example.tran: 首相明年也不用举行大选。

collins.tran: 当然(在英语口语中常用于代替 of course)
collins.def: Course is often used in the expression 'of course', or instead of 'of course' in informal spoken English. See 见 of course .

collins.tran: (尤指船或飞机的)航向，航线，路线
collins.def: The course of a vehicle, especially a ship or aircraft, is the route along which it is travelling.

example.ex: Aircraft can avoid each other by going up and down, as well as by altering course to left or right...
example.tran: 飞机可以通过上下升降和左右移动改变航线来避免相撞。

example.ex: The tug was seaward of the Hakai Passage on a course that diverged from the Calvert Island coastline.
example.tran: 托船驶离卡尔弗特岛海岸朝哈凯航道驶去。

collins.def: A course of action is an action or a series of actions that you can do in a particular situation.

example.ex: My best course of action was to help Gill by being loyal, loving and endlessly sympathetic...
example.tran: 我能给吉尔的最大帮助就是对他忠诚、关爱他并且永远满怀同情之心。

example.ex: He must fall on his sword. That's the only course left open to him...
example.tran: 他必须面对失败，他唯有这一条路走。

collins.def: You can refer to the way that events develop as, for example, the course of history or the course of events .

example.ex: ...a series of decisive naval battles which altered the course of history...
example.tran: 改变历史进程的一系列决定性的海战

example.ex: In the natural course of events cows would wish to be milked more than twice a day...
example.tran: 按照事情发展的自然规律，母牛每天应该挤奶两次以上。

collins.def: A course is a series of lessons or lectures on a particular subject.

example.ex: ...a course in business administration...
example.tran: 企业管理课程

example.ex: I'm shortly to begin a course on the modern novel.
example.tran: 我不久将要选修一门现代小说课程。

collins.def: A course of medical treatment is a series of treatments that a doctor gives someone.

example.ex: Treatment is supplemented with a course of antibiotics to kill the bacterium...
example.tran: 治疗期间辅以一个疗程的抗生素注射来杀灭细菌。

example.ex: She went to her doctor, who offered to put her on a course of tranquillizers.
example.tran: 她去看医生，医生建议她服用一个疗程的镇静剂。

collins.def: A course is one part of a meal.

example.ex: The lunch was excellent, especially the first course.
example.tran: 午餐很棒，尤其是第一道菜。

example.ex: ...a three-course dinner.
example.tran: 有3道菜的晚餐

collins.def: In sport, a course is an area of land where races are held or golf is played, or the land over which a race takes place.

example.ex: Only 12 seconds separated the first three riders on the Bickerstaffe course...
example.tran: 比科斯达夫赛场上的前3名骑手之间只差12秒。

example.ex: In July comes the Tour de France, when 200 cyclists cover a course of 2,000 miles.
example.tran: 7月份迎来了环法自行车赛，200名自行车选手要骑行2,000英里的赛程。

collins.def: The course of a river is the channel along which it flows.

example.ex: Romantic chateaux and castles overlook the river's twisting course.
example.tran: 富有浪漫气息的庄园和城堡俯瞰着蜿蜒的河道。

collins.def: If a liquid courses somewhere, it flows quickly.

example.ex: The tears coursed down his cheeks...
example.tran: 他泪如雨下。

example.ex: When you're sitting still, you need less blood coursing through your arteries.
example.tran: 静坐时动脉血液流动较缓。

collins.def: If something happens in the course of a particular period of time, it happens during that period of time.

example.ex: In the course of the 1930s steel production in Britain approximately doubled...
example.tran: 在20世纪30年代，英国的钢铁产量几乎翻了一番。

example.ex: We struck up a conversation, in the course of which it emerged that he was a sailing man.
example.tran: 我们聊了起来，在谈话过程中得知他是一名水手。

collins.def: If you do something as a matter of course, you do it as part of your normal work or way of life.

example.ex: If police are carrying arms as a matter of course then doesn't it encourage criminals to carry them?
example.tran: 如果警察每天理所当然地携带武器，这难道不会促使罪犯也持械吗？

collins.tran: 在正确航道(或航线)上/偏离航道(或航线)
collins.def: If a ship or aircraft is on course, it is travelling along the correct route. If it is off course, it is no longer travelling along the correct route.

example.ex: The ill fated ship was sent off course into shallow waters and rammed by another vessel.
example.tran: 这艘倒霉的船偏离航道误入浅水区，被另外一艘船撞上了。

collins.def: If you are on course for something, you are likely to achieve it.

example.ex: England are well on course for a place at the World Cup Finals...
example.tran: 英格兰队很有可能打进世界杯决赛。

example.ex: The company is on course for profits of £20m in the next financial year.
example.tran: 该公司有望在下一个财年实现2,000万英镑的盈利。

collins.def: If something runs its course or takes its course, it develops naturally and comes to a natural end.

example.ex: They estimated that between 17,000 and 20,000 cows would die before the epidemic had run its course...
example.tran: 他们估计在流行病结束之前会有17,000到20,000头牛死去。

example.ex: As for the imprisoned leaders, he asserted that justice would have to take its course.
example.tran: 他坚称必须对监禁的领导人依法审判。

collins.def: If you stay the course, you finish something that you have started, even though it has become very difficult.

example.ex: The oldest president in American history had stayed the course for two terms.
example.tran: 美国历史上的第一位总统连任两届。

collins.def: If something changes or becomes true in the course of time, it changes or becomes true over a long period of time.

example.ex: In the course of time, many of their myths become entangled.
example.tran: 最后，他们很多荒诞的说法都变得错综复杂了。

collins.def: If you cover something, you place something else over it in order to protect it, hide it, or close it.

example.ex: Cover the casserole with a tight-fitting lid...
example.tran: 用大小合适的盖子盖住砂锅。

example.ex: He whimpered and covered his face...
example.tran: 他掩面抽泣。

collins.def: If one thing covers another, it has been placed over it in order to protect it, hide it, or close it.

example.ex: His finger went up to touch the black patch which covered his left eye...
example.tran: 他伸手去触摸遮住左眼的黑眼罩。

example.ex: His head was covered with a khaki turban.
example.tran: 他头上包着卡其布的穆斯林头巾。

collins.def: If one thing covers another, it forms a layer over its surface.

example.ex: The clouds had spread and nearly covered the entire sky...
example.tran: 云彩扩散开来，几乎遮住了整个天空。

example.ex: Two oil slicks are covering a total area of seven square miles...
example.tran: 两层浮油漂浮在7平方英里的区域上。

collins.def: To cover something with or in something else means to put a layer of the second thing over its surface.

example.ex: The trees in your garden may have covered the ground with apples, pears or plums...
example.tran: 你花园里的果树也许已经落了一地的苹果、梨或李子。

example.ex: She covered the walls with the signs of the zodiac.
example.tran: 她在墙上贴满了十二星座的标志。

collins.def: If you cover a particular distance, you travel that distance.

example.ex: It would not be easy to cover ten miles on that amount of petrol...
example.tran: 就那么点儿汽油很难开10英里。

example.ex: It covered the distance in 28 hours compared with the train's six days.
example.tran: 它走这一段要用28小时，与之相比火车要用6天。

collins.def: To cover someone or something means to protect them from attack, for example by pointing a gun in the direction of people who may attack them, ready to fire the gun if necessary.

example.ex: You go first. I'll cover you.
example.tran: 你先撤，我掩护你。

collins.def: Cover is protection from enemy attack that is provided for troops or ships carrying out a particular operation, for example by aircraft.

example.ex: They said they could not provide adequate air cover for ground operations.
example.tran: 他们声称无法为地面军事行动提供充分的空中掩护。

collins.def: Cover is trees, rocks, or other places where you shelter from the weather or from an attack, or hide from someone.

example.ex: Charles lit the fuses and they ran for cover.
example.tran: 查尔斯点燃了导火索，他们便赶紧四处躲避。

example.ex: ...barren wastes of field with no trees and no cover.
example.tran: 没有树木和其他遮蔽物的荒芜之地

collins.def: An insurance policy that covers a person or thing guarantees that money will be paid by the insurance company in relation to that person or thing.

example.ex: Their insurer paid the £900 bill, even though the policy did not strictly cover it...
example.tran: 虽然严格来讲保险单并不包含这一项，他们的保险公司还是支付了那张900英镑的账单。

example.ex: These items are not covered by your medical insurance...
example.tran: 这些项目不在你的医保范围之内。

collins.def: Insurance cover is a guarantee from an insurance company that money will be paid by them if it is needed.

example.ex: Make sure that the firm's insurance cover is adequate.
example.tran: 确保该公司上了足够的保险。

collins.def: If a law covers a particular set of people, things, or situations, it applies to them.

example.ex: The law covers four categories of experiments...
example.tran: 该法规适用于4类试验。

example.ex: Like any other commodity, pedigree dogs are covered by the Sale of Goods Act.
example.tran: 像其他商品一样，纯种狗的买卖同样受《货物买卖法》的约束。

collins.tran: (在演讲、课程或书中)讨论，涉及
collins.def: If you cover a particular topic, you discuss it in a lecture, course, or book.

example.ex: The Oxford Chemistry Primers aim to cover important topics in organic chemistry...
example.tran: 《牛津化学初级读本》丛书旨在论述有机化学中的重要问题。

example.ex: Other subjects covered included nerves and how to overcome them.
example.tran: 所涉及的其他主题包括焦虑及如何克服。

collins.def: If journalists, newspapers, or television companies cover an event, they report on it.

example.ex: Robinson was sent to Italy to cover the 1990 World Cup...
example.tran: 鲁宾逊被派到意大利报道1990年的世界杯比赛。

example.ex: The US news media will cover the trial closely.
example.tran: 美国新闻媒体将对该审判进行追踪报道。

collins.def: If a sum of money covers something, it is enough to pay for it.

example.ex: Send it to the address given with £1.50 to cover postage and administration...
example.tran: 将它寄到指定地址，并附上1.50英镑以支付邮资和管理费。

example.ex: Those figures might not even cover the cost of breakages.
example.tran: 那笔钱甚至都不够赔偿破损费。

collins.def: A cover is something which is put over an object, usually in order to protect it.

example.ex: ...a family room with washable covers on the furniture.
example.tran: 家具上套有可清洗外罩的家庭娱乐室

example.ex: ...a duvet cover.
example.tran: 羽绒被罩

collins.def: The covers on your bed are the things such as sheets and blankets that you have on top of you.

example.ex: She set her glass down and slid farther under the covers.
example.tran: 她放下杯子，钻进被子里。

collins.def: The cover of a book or a magazine is the outside part of it.

example.ex: A few years ago, David Byrne was on the cover of Time magazine.
example.tran: 几年前，大卫·拜恩曾登上《时代》周刊的封面。

example.ex: ...a small spiral-bound booklet with a green cover...
example.tran: 有绿色封皮的螺旋装订的活页小册子

collins.tran: (对秘密或违法之事的)掩盖，掩饰
collins.def: Something that is a cover for secret or illegal activities seems respectable or normal, and is intended to hide the activities.

example.ex: They set up a spurious temple that was a cover for sexual debauchery...
example.tran: 他们建立起一座为淫秽活动作掩护的假寺庙。

example.ex: As a cover story he generally tells people he is a freelance photographer.
example.tran: 为掩饰身份，他一般对外称自己是一名自由摄影师。

collins.tran: (通过提供假信息或不完全的信息来)遮掩，掩盖，包庇
collins.def: If you cover for someone who is doing something secret or illegal, you give false information or do not give all the information you have, in order to protect them.

example.ex: Why would she cover for someone who was trying to kill her?
example.tran: 她为什么要包庇想要杀她的人呢？

collins.def: If you cover for someone who is ill or away, you do their work for them while they are not there.

example.ex: She did not have enough nurses to cover for those who went ill or took holiday.
example.tran: 她没有足够的护士来顶替那些生病或休假的人工作。

collins.def: To cover a song originally performed by someone else means to record a new version of it.

example.ex: He must make a decent living from other artists covering his songs.
example.tran: 其他艺术家翻唱他的歌曲，一定使他过上了收入颇为可观的生活。

collins.def: A cover is the same as a cover version .

example.ex: The single is a cover of an old Rolling Stones song.
example.tran: 这支单曲是滚石乐队的一首老歌的翻唱。

collins.tran: 揭露，揭示(真实身份或工作的真实性质)
collins.def: To blow someone's cover means to cause their true identity or the true nature of their work to be revealed.

example.ex: Asking those kind of questions could blow my cover...
example.tran: 问那种问题会暴露我的身份。

example.ex: The young man looked embarrassed, as if he were a spy whose cover had been blown.
example.tran: 那个年轻人看起来局促不安，就好像他是一个身份暴露的间谍一样。

collins.tran: (通常为到达另一地点)离开隐蔽处，冲出躲藏处
collins.def: If you break cover, you leave a place where you have been hiding or sheltering from attack, usually in order to run to another place.

example.ex: They began running again, broke cover and dashed towards the road.
example.tran: 他们又开始跑，离开隐蔽处朝公路冲去。

collins.tran: 躲避(炮火、轰炸或坏天气)
collins.def: If you take cover, you shelter from gunfire, bombs, or the weather.

example.ex: Shoppers took cover behind cars as police marksmen returned fire.
example.tran: 警方的射击手开火回击时，购物者们躲在汽车后面。

collins.tran: 在…的遮掩下(躲避炮火轰炸、坏天气等)
collins.def: If you are under cover, you are under something that protects you from gunfire, bombs, or the weather.

example.ex: 'Get under cover!' shouted Billy, and we darted once more for the tables.
example.tran: “躲起来！”比利喊道，我们便又一次冲向桌子。

collins.def: If you do something under cover of a particular situation, you are able to do it without being noticed because of that situation.

example.ex: They move under cover of darkness.
example.tran: 他们在黑暗的掩护下行进。

collins.tran: 保护自己(免受批评、谴责等);辩解
collins.def: If you cover your back or cover your rear, you do something in order to protect yourself, for example against criticism or against accusations of doing something wrong.

example.ex: The canny Premier covered his back by pointing out that he was of Scottish stock.
example.tran: 精明狡猾的首相辩解说自己是苏格兰血统。

collins.def: Cover your ass means the same as cover your back .

example.ex: Just play it safe, cover your ass, keep your head down.
example.tran: 要谨慎行事，保护好自己并保持低调。

collins.def: To create something means to cause it to happen or exist.

example.ex: We set business free to create more jobs in Britain...
example.tran: 我们放开对企业的限制以便在英国创造更多的就业机会。

example.ex: She could create a fight out of anything...
example.tran: 她能无故挑起事端。

collins.def: When someone creates a new product or process, they invent it or design it.

example.ex: It is really great for a radio producer to create a show like this...
example.tran: 电台监制能够制作出这样的节目真是不简单。

example.ex: He's creating a whole new language of painting.
example.tran: 他正在创造一种全新的绘画语言。

collins.def: A cup is a small round container that you drink from. Cups usually have handles and are made from china or plastic.

example.ex: ...cups and saucers.
example.tran: 杯碟

collins.def: Things, or parts of things, that are small, round, and hollow in shape can be referred to as cups .

example.ex: ...the brass cups of the small chandelier.
example.tran: 枝形小吊灯的黄铜灯托儿

collins.def: A cup is a large metal cup with two handles that is given to the winner of a game or competition.

collins.tran: …杯(用于设奖杯的体育比赛名称中)
collins.def: Cup is used in the names of some sports competitions in which the prize is a cup.

example.ex: Sri Lanka's cricket team will play India in the final of the Asia Cup.
example.tran: 斯里兰卡板球队将在亚洲杯的决赛中对阵印度队。

example.ex: ...after his fateful injury in the 1991 FA Cup final.
example.tran: 他在1991年足总杯决赛中受重伤之后

collins.def: If you cup your hands, you make them into a curved shape like a cup.

example.ex: He cupped his hands around his mouth and called out for Diane...
example.tran: 他双手拢在嘴边，大声呼喊黛安娜。

example.ex: David knelt, cupped his hands and splashed river water on to his face...
example.tran: 戴维跪下身，用手捧起河水往脸上撩。

collins.def: If you cup something in your hands, you make your hands into a curved dish-like shape and support it or hold it gently.

example.ex: He cupped her chin in the palm of his hand...
example.tran: 他用手心托着她的下巴。

example.ex: He cradled the baby in his arms, his hands cupping her tiny skull.
example.tran: 他轻轻地抱着婴儿，双手托着她的小脑袋。

collins.def: If someone is in their cups, they are drunk.

example.ex: He talked too freely when, as was too often the case, he was in his cups.
example.tran: 他经常喝醉，而且一喝醉就口无遮拦。

collins.def: A current is a steady and continuous flowing movement of some of the water in a river, lake, or sea.

example.ex: Under normal conditions, the ocean currents of the tropical Pacific travel from east to west...
example.tran: 在正常情况下，太平洋的热带洋流自东向西流。

example.ex: The couple were swept away by the strong current.
example.tran: 这对夫妻被巨大的水流卷走了。

collins.def: A current is a steady flowing movement of air.

example.ex: I felt a current of cool air blowing in my face.
example.tran: 我觉得脸上有一阵冷风吹过。

collins.def: An electric current is a flow of electricity through a wire or circuit.

example.ex: A powerful electric current is passed through a piece of graphite.
example.tran: 给一块石墨通入强电流。

collins.def: A particular current is a particular feeling, idea, or quality that exists within a group of people.

example.ex: Each party represents a distinct current of thought...
example.tran: 每个党派代表一种不同的思潮。

example.ex: A strong current of nationalism runs through ideology and politics in the Arab world.
example.tran: 一股强烈的民族主义思潮涌入阿拉伯世界的思想体系和政治体系。

collins.tran: 现时的;当前的;进行中的
collins.def: Current means happening, being used, or being done at the present time.

example.ex: The current situation is very different to that in 1990...
example.tran: 当前的形势与1990年截然不同。

example.ex: He plans to repeal a number of current policies...
example.tran: 他计划废除一些当前的政策。

collins.def: Ideas and customs that are current are generally accepted and used by most people.

example.ex: Current thinking suggests that toxins only have a small part to play in the build up of cellulite...
example.tran: 目前普遍认为，毒素对皮下脂肪团堆积影响不大。

example.ex: This custom was still current in the late 1960s.
example.tran: 这种习俗在20世纪60年代末仍然很普遍。

collins.def: If you cut something, you use a knife or a similar tool to divide it into pieces, or to mark it or damage it. If you cut a shape or a hole in something, you make the shape or hole by using a knife or similar tool.

example.ex: Mrs. Haines stood nearby, holding scissors to cut a ribbon...
example.tran: 海恩斯夫人站在旁边，手持剪刀准备剪彩。

example.ex: Cut the tomatoes in half vertically...
example.tran: 把西红柿纵向切成两半。

collins.def: If you cut yourself or cut a part of your body, you accidentally injure yourself on a sharp object so that you bleed.

example.ex: Johnson cut himself shaving...
example.tran: 约翰逊刮胡子时刮伤了自己。

example.ex: I started to cry because I cut my finger...
example.tran: 我因为割破手指哭了起来。

collins.def: If you cut something such as grass, your hair, or your fingernails, you shorten them using scissors or another tool.

example.ex: The most recent tenants hadn't even cut the grass...
example.tran: 上一拨房客连草都没有修剪。

example.ex: You have to learn not to cut your toenails in the living room...
example.tran: 你要知道不可以在起居室里剪脚趾甲。

collins.def: The way that clothes are cut is the way they are designed and made.

example.ex: ...badly cut blue suits.
example.tran: 剪裁得很差劲的蓝色套装

collins.def: To cut through something means to move or pass through it easily.

example.ex: I could see long canoes cutting through the waves.
example.tran: 我看见长长的独木舟破浪而行。

collins.def: If you cut across or through a place, you go through it because it is the shortest route to another place.

example.ex: He decided to cut across the Heath, through Greenwich Park.
example.tran: 他决定抄近路走格林尼治公园穿过希思区。

collins.def: If you cut something, you reduce it.

example.ex: The first priority is to cut costs...
example.tran: 当务之急是降低成本。

example.ex: The UN force is to be cut by 90%.
example.tran: 联合国部队将裁减90%。

collins.def: If you cut a text, broadcast, or performance, you shorten it. If you cut a part of a text, broadcast, or performance, you do not publish, broadcast, or perform that part.

example.ex: Branagh has cut the play judiciously...
example.tran: 布拉纳对这部剧进行了高明的删改。

example.ex: The audience wants more music and less drama, so we've cut some scenes.
example.tran: 观众想要多一些音乐，少一些表演，所以我们删掉了一些场景。

collins.def: To cut a supply of something means to stop providing it or stop it being provided.

example.ex: They used pressure tactics to force them to return, including cutting food and water supplies.
example.tran: 他们采用施加压力的策略迫使他们回来，包括切断食物和水的供应。

collins.def: If you cut a pack of playing cards, you divide it into two.

example.ex: Place the cards face down on the table and cut them.
example.tran: 把纸牌正面朝下放在桌子上，然后切牌。

collins.tran: 停(电影导演要求停止拍摄时的用语)
collins.def: When the director of a film says 'cut', they want the actors and the camera crew to stop filming.

collins.tran: 灌制(唱片);制作(激光唱片)
collins.def: When a singer or band cuts a CD, they make a recording of their music.

example.ex: She eventually cut her own album.
example.tran: 她终于录制了自己的专辑。

collins.def: When a child cuts a tooth, a new tooth starts to grow through the gum.

example.ex: Many infants do not cut their first tooth until they are a year old.
example.tran: 很多婴儿到一岁大时才开始长牙。

collins.def: If a child cuts classes or cuts school, they do not go to classes or to school when they are supposed to.

example.ex: Cutting school more than once in three months is a sign of trouble.
example.tran: 3个月内旷课次数超过一次就可能有麻烦了。

collins.tran: (不耐烦地让人停止做某事)别…，不要…
collins.def: If you tell someone to cut something, you are telling them in an irritated way to stop it.

example.ex: 'Cut the euphemisms, Daniel,' Brenda snapped...
example.tran: “丹尼尔，别绕弯子了，”布伦达厉声说道。

example.ex: Why don't you just cut the crap and open the door.
example.tran: 你为什么不能停止废话去把门打开。

collins.tran: (从动物躯体上)割下的一块肉
collins.def: A cut of meat is a piece or type of meat which is cut in a particular way from the animal, or from a particular part of it.

example.ex: Use a cheap cut such as spare rib chops.
example.tran: 用一块便宜点的肉，比如肋排肉。

collins.tran: (尤指通过不诚实手段获得的)份，份额
collins.def: Someone's cut of the profits or winnings from something, especially ones that have been obtained dishonestly, is their share.

example.ex: The lawyers, of course, take their cut of the little guy's winnings.
example.tran: 律师们自然从那个小家伙赢得的钱中分到了他们的一份。

collins.tran: (在山中开凿的公路或铁路)通道，路堑
collins.def: A cut is a narrow valley which has been cut through a hill so that a road or railroad track can pass through.
If you say that someone or something is a cut above other people or things of the same kind, you mean they are better than them.

example.ex: Joan Smith's detective stories are a cut above the rest.
example.tran: 琼·史密斯的侦探小说比其他侦探小说都要出色。

collins.def: If you see someone you know and cut them dead, you ignore them.

collins.tran: 已成定局的;板上钉钉的
collins.def: If you say that a situation or solution is cut and dried, you mean that it is clear and definite.

example.ex: Unfortunately, things cannot be as cut and dried as many people would like...
example.tran: 不幸的是，事情并不像很多人希望的那样确定。

example.ex: We are aiming for guidelines, not cut-and-dried answers.
example.tran: 我们想要的是指导原则，不是固定的答案。

collins.def: If a person or an organization cuts loose or is cut loose, they become free from the influence or authority of other people.

example.ex: He's cut loose from this business except, possibly, where James is concerned...
example.tran: 可能除了詹姆斯外，公司里都没人能管得了他。

example.ex: It's about to be cut loose from the state on which it has so long depended.
example.tran: 它将脱离长期依附的国家，实现独立自主。

collins.def: If someone cuts and runs in a difficult situation, they try to escape from it quickly and gain an advantage for themselves, rather than deal with the situation in a responsible way.

example.ex: ...his cowardly decision to cut and run.
example.tran: 他作出逃跑的懦弱决定

collins.def: If you say that someone can't cut it, you mean that they do not have the qualities needed to do a task or cope with a situation.

example.ex: He doesn't think English-born players can cut it abroad.
example.tran: 他认为出生于英格兰的选手在国外不会取得好成绩。

collins.def: If you talk about the cut and thrust of an activity, you are talking about the aspects of it that make it exciting and challenging.

example.ex: ...cut-and-thrust debate between two declared adversaries.
example.tran: 公然对立的两个对手之间的激烈辩论

collins.tran: 有利有弊;两面都行得通
collins.def: If you say that something cuts both ways, you mean that it can have two opposite effects, or can have both good and bad effects.

example.ex: This publicity cuts both ways. It focuses on us as well as on them.
example.tran: 这种宣传有利也有弊。它使得人们关注我们，同样也关注了他们。

collins.def: To cut off a supply of something means to stop providing it or stop it being provided.

example.ex: The rebels have cut off electricity from the capital...
example.tran: 叛军已经切断了来自首都的供电。

example.ex: His company is preparing to shut down in the event that their water supply is cut off...
example.tran: 假如供水被切断，他所在的公司就准备关闭。

collins.def: If you get cut off when you are on the telephone, the line is suddenly disconnected and you can no longer speak to the other person.

example.ex: When you do get through, you've got to say your piece quickly before you get cut off...
example.tran: 电话接通后，你最好在断线之前尽快把话说完。

example.ex: I'm going to cut you off now because we've got lots of callers waiting.
example.tran: 就谈到这里好吗，因为我们还有很多打来电话的人在等着呢。

collins.def: If you cut someone off when they are speaking, you interrupt them and stop them from speaking.

example.ex: 'But, sir, I'm under orders to —' Clark cut him off. 'Don't argue with me.'
example.tran: “但是，先生，我是奉命——”克拉克打断他说道：“别跟我争辩。”

collins.def: Someone's daughter is their female child.
