example.ex: ...Flora and her daughter Catherine.
example.tran: 弗洛拉和她的女儿凯瑟琳

example.ex: ...the daughter of a university professor...
example.tran: 大学教授的女儿

collins.def: A day is one of the seven twenty-four hour periods of time in a week.
Day is the time when it is light, or the time when you are up and doing things.

example.ex: The weather did not help; hot by day, cold at night...
example.tran: 天气也不肯帮忙：白天很热，晚上很冷。

example.ex: 27 million working days are lost each year due to work accidents and sickness...
example.tran: 每年有 2,700 万个工作日因为工作事故和病假而损失掉了。

collins.def: You can refer to a particular period in history as a particular day or as particular days .

example.ex: He began to talk about the Ukraine of his uncle's day...
example.tran: 他开始讲述他叔叔那个时代的乌克兰。

example.ex: Did you learn anything in your day, as a student?
example.tran: 你在学生时代学到什么东西了吗？

collins.def: If something happens day after day, it happens every day without stopping.

example.ex: The newspaper job had me doing the same thing day after day.
example.tran: 这份报社的工作让我日复一日地做着同样的事。

collins.tran: 如今;在当代;在今天这个时代
collins.def: In this day and age means in modern times.

example.ex: Even in this day and age the old attitudes persist.
example.tran: 即使在今天这个时代，这些陈旧的观念依然存在。

collins.def: If you say that something has seen better days, you mean that it is old and in poor condition.

example.ex: The tweed jacket she wore had seen better days.
example.tran: 她穿的那件粗花呢夹克已经很旧了。

collins.def: If you call it a day, you decide to stop what you are doing because you are tired of it or because it is not successful.

example.ex: Faced with mounting debts, the decision to call it a day was inevitable...
example.tran: 面对着不断增加的债务，最终难免作出将其结束的决定。

example.ex: I want the manager's job when he calls it a day.
example.tran: 等到经理不干了之后，我想接替他的位子。

collins.tran: (在战斗、辩论或体育竞赛中）获胜，取胜
collins.def: If someone carries the day, they are the winner in a contest such as a battle, debate, or sporting competition.

example.ex: For the time being, the liberals seem to have carried the day.
example.tran: 眼下似乎是自由主义者占据了上风。

collins.tran: 已过全盛时期;风光不再;不再流行
collins.def: If you say that something has had its day, you mean that the period during which it was most successful or popular has now passed.

example.ex: Beat music may finally have had its day...
example.tran: 强节奏摇滚乐的黄金时期或许已经终结。

example.ex: Interior decoration by careful coordination seems to have had its day.
example.tran: 精心搭配的室内装饰似乎已不再受欢迎了。

collins.def: If something makes your day, it makes you feel very happy.

example.ex: Come on, Bill. Send Tom a card and make his day...
example.tran: 来吧，比尔。给汤姆寄张卡片让他高兴高兴吧。

example.ex: It was a joy to see. It really made my day.
example.tran: 这太有趣了，真的把我高兴坏了。

collins.def: If something happens day and night or night and day, it happens all the time without stopping.

example.ex: Chantal kept a fire burning night and day...
example.tran: 尚塔尔让一堆火日夜不熄地一直燃着。

example.ex: He would have a nurse in constant attendance day and night.
example.tran: 会有一位护士日夜不间断地陪护着他。

collins.tran: 将来有一天;总有一天;有朝一日
collins.def: One day or some day or one of these days means at some time in the future.

example.ex: I too dreamed of living in London one day...
example.tran: 我也梦想过将来有一天能住在伦敦。

example.ex: I hope some day you will find the woman who will make you happy...
example.tran: 我希望有一天你能找到一个会让你幸福的女人。

collins.def: If you say that something happened the other day, you mean that it happened a few days ago.

example.ex: I phoned your office the other day...
example.tran: 几天前我给你的办公室打过电话。

example.ex: We had lunch the other day at our favorite restaurant.
example.tran: 前两天我们在最喜欢的餐馆吃了午饭。

collins.tran: 挽回局面;扭转败局;转危为安;反败为胜
collins.def: If someone or something saves the day in a situation which seems likely to fail, they manage to make it successful.

example.ex: ...this story about how he saved the day at his daughter's birthday party...
example.tran: 这个关于他如何在女儿的生日聚会上成功挽回局面的故事

example.ex: A last moment election can save the day.
example.tran: 最后一刻举行选举可能会反败为胜。

collins.def: If something happens from day to day or day by day, it happens each day.

example.ex: Your needs can differ from day to day...
example.tran: 你的需要每天可能都会不同。

example.ex: I live for the moment, day by day, not for the past.
example.tran: 我活在当下，过一天算一天，而不是活在过去。

collins.def: If it is a month or a year to the day since a particular thing happened, it is exactly a month or a year since it happened.

example.ex: It was January 19, a year to the day since he had arrived in Singapore...
example.tran: 那天是 1月 19 号，他到新加坡正好一年的日子。

example.ex: Twenty-five years ago, to the day, England reached the sport's pinnacle by winning the World Cup.
example.tran: 恰好是在 25 年前的今天，英格兰队在世界杯上夺冠，到达了足球运动的巅峰。

collins.def: To this day means up until and including the present time.

example.ex: To this day young Zulu boys practise fighting.
example.tran: 直到现在年轻的祖鲁男孩还练习格斗。

collins.def: If a particular person, group, or thing wins the day, they win a battle, struggle, or competition. If they lose the day, they are defeated.

example.ex: His determination and refusal to back down had won the day...
example.tran: 他的坚定和拒不退让使他赢得了胜利。

example.ex: Few in Westminster doubt that the government will win the day.
example.tran: 在英国议会中，几乎没有人对政府将会获胜存有怀疑。

collins.tran: (困难的任务)日常工作一部分的，常有的，难免的
collins.def: If you say that a task is all in a day's work for someone, you mean that they do not mind doing it although it may be difficult, because it is part of their job or because they often do it.

example.ex: For war reporters, dodging snipers' bullets is all in a day's work...
example.tran: 对于战地记者来说，躲避狙击手的子弹是家常便饭。

example.ex: I said: 'How can I ever thank you?' but he waved the question aside. 'It's all in a day's work.'
example.tran: 我说：“我该怎么感谢你才好呢？”但他却没把这当回事，只是说：“这是我该做的。”

collins.def: If you say that you need or have a great deal of or a good deal of a particular thing, you are emphasizing that you need or have a lot of it.

example.ex: ...a great deal of money...
example.tran: 大量的钱

example.ex: I am in a position to save you a good deal of time.
example.tran: 我能够为你节省许多时间。

collins.def: A deal of something is a lot of it.

example.ex: He had a deal of work to do.
example.tran: 他有许多工作要做。

collins.def: If you decide to do something, you choose to do it, usually after you have thought carefully about the other possibilities.

example.ex: She decided to do a secretarial course...
example.tran: 她决定修一门文秘课程。

example.ex: He has decided that he doesn't want to embarrass the movement and will therefore step down...
example.tran: 他已拿定主意：他不想令运动陷入困窘的境地，因此决心辞职。

collins.def: If a person or group of people decides something, they choose what something should be like or how a particular problem should be solved.

example.ex: She was still young, he said, and that would be taken into account when deciding her sentence...
example.tran: 他说，她还年轻，而这一点在对她量刑时将会予以考虑。

example.ex: This is an issue that should be decided by local and metropolitan government.
example.tran: 这个问题应该由当地及大都市政府共同解决。

collins.tran: （事件或事实）决定，确定（某一选择或结果)
collins.def: If an event or fact decides something, it makes it certain that a particular choice will be made or that there will be a particular result.

example.ex: The goal that decided the match came just before the interval...
example.tran: 决定本场比赛结果的进球是在中场休息前一刻打入的。

example.ex: The results will decide if he will win a place at a good university...
example.tran: 这些成绩将决定他能否上一所好大学。

collins.def: If you decide that something is true, you form that opinion about it after considering the facts.

example.ex: He decided Franklin must be suffering from a bad cold...
example.tran: 他断定富兰克林一定是得了重感冒。

example.ex: I couldn't decide whether he was incredibly brave or just insane.
example.tran: 我不能判定他到底是英勇无畏还是精神失常。

collins.def: If something decides you to do something, it is the reason that causes you to choose to do it.

example.ex: The banning of his play decided him to write about censorship...
example.tran: 他的戏剧被禁演，这促使他下定决心就审查制度的问题下笔。

example.ex: I don't know what finally decided her, but she agreed.
example.tran: 我不知道是什么让她最终拿定了主意，但她还是同意了。

collins.def: When you make a decision, you choose what should be done or which is the best of various possible actions.

example.ex: A decision was taken to discipline Marshall...
example.tran: 已作出对马歇尔进行处罚的决定。

example.ex: The president said he'd made no firm decision on whether he would run for a second term in office...
example.tran: 总统说他还没有下定决心是否竞选连任。

collins.def: Decision is the act of deciding something or the need to decide something.

example.ex: The moment of decision cannot be delayed...
example.tran: 作出决定的时刻由不得耽搁。

example.ex: This was a matter for decision by the individual.
example.tran: 这件事需要个人自己决定。

collins.def: Decision is the ability to decide quickly and definitely what to do.

example.ex: He is very much a man of decision and action.
example.tran: 他是一个遇事非常果断、行动极为迅速的人。

collins.def: If you demand something such as information or action, you ask for it in a very forceful way.

example.ex: Mr Byers last night demanded an immediate explanation from the Education Secretary...
example.tran: 昨晚拜尔斯先生要求教育大臣立刻作出解释。

example.ex: Russia demanded that Unita send a delegation to the peace talks...
example.tran: 俄罗斯要求安盟派代表团参加和谈。

collins.def: If one thing demands another, the first needs the second in order to happen or be dealt with successfully.

example.ex: He said the task of reconstruction would demand much patience, hard work and sacrifice...
example.tran: 他说重建任务将需要付出极大的耐心、艰辛和牺牲。

example.ex: There would be fewer international crises demanding his attention...
example.tran: 需要他去关注的国际危机将会减少。

collins.def: A demand is a firm request for something.

example.ex: There have been demands for services from tenants up there...
example.tran: 那里的房客要求提供服务。

example.ex: They consistently rejected the demand to remove US troops...
example.tran: 他们一再拒绝撤走美国部队的要求。

collins.def: If you refer to demand, or to the demand for something, you are referring to how many people want to have it, do it, or buy it.

example.ex: Another flight would be arranged on Saturday if sufficient demand arose...
example.tran: 如果需求量足够大，周六将再安排一趟航班。

example.ex: Demand for coal is down and so are prices...
example.tran: 煤的需求下降了，煤价也相应下跌。

collins.def: The demands of something or its demands on you are the things which it needs or the things which you have to do for it.

example.ex: Researchers wrongly assumed that people were quite clear about the demands of the task.
example.tran: 研究人员错误地认为大家都很清楚该项任务的要求。

example.ex: ...the demands and challenges of a new job...
example.tran: 新工作的要求和挑战

collins.def: If someone or something is in demand or in great demand, they are very popular and a lot of people want them.

example.ex: He was much in demand as a lecturer in the US.
example.tran: 他的讲座在美国很受欢迎。

collins.def: If someone or something makes demands on you, they require you to do things which need a lot of time, energy, or money.

example.ex: I had no right to make demands on his time.
example.tran: 我无权占用他的时间。

collins.def: If something is available or happens on demand, you can have it or it happens whenever you want it or ask for it.

example.ex: ...a national commitment to providing treatment on demand for drug abusers.
example.tran: 承诺在全国范围内为提出请求的吸毒者提供治疗

collins.tran: (政府的)部，司，局，处;(企业的)部门，科;(大学的)系，所;(大型商店的)货品区
collins.def: A department is one of the sections in an organization such as a government, business, or university. A department is also one of the sections in a large shop.

example.ex: ...the U.S. Department of Health, Education and Welfare...
example.tran: 美国卫生、教育和福利部

example.ex: He moved to the sales department.
example.tran: 他转到了销售部。

collins.tran: 不是…的职责（或知识）范围;并非…的专长
collins.def: If you say that a task or area of knowledge is not your department, you mean that you are not responsible for it or do not know much about it.

example.ex: 'I'm afraid the name means nothing to me,' he said. 'That's not my department.'
example.tran: “恐怕这个名字对我来说毫无意义，”他说，“我对此并不熟悉。”

collins.def: If you describe a person, object, event, or situation, you say what they are like or what happened.

example.ex: We asked her to describe what kind of things she did in her spare time...
example.tran: 我们请她描述一下她业余时间都在做什么。

example.ex: She broke down describing how she was arrested for refusing a breath test...
example.tran: 她在叙述自己如何因为拒绝接受呼吸测试而被捕时再也控制不住情绪。

collins.def: If a person describes someone or something as a particular thing, he or she believes that they are that thing and says so.

example.ex: He described it as an extraordinarily tangled and complicated tale...
example.tran: 他说那是一个非常曲折复杂的故事。

example.ex: Eriksson described him as 'the best player on the pitch'...
example.tran: 埃里克森称他是“场上最好的球员”。

collins.tran: 描画，画出(图形);形成…的形状
collins.def: If something describes a particular shape, it forms that shape or makes a movement that follows the line of that shape.

example.ex: His pass described a perfect arc through the leaden sky.
example.tran: 他的传球在阴沉的天空中划出了一道完美的弧线。

collins.def: When someone designs a garment, building, machine, or other object, they plan it and make a detailed drawing of it from which it can be built or made.

example.ex: They wanted to design a machine that was both attractive and practical.
example.tran: 他们想设计一种既美观又实用的机械。

example.ex: ...men wearing specially designed boots.
example.tran: 脚踏特制皮靴的男子

collins.tran: 设计(调查问卷);规划;制订
collins.def: When someone designs a survey, policy, or system, they plan and prepare it, and decide on all the details of it.

example.ex: We may be able to design a course to suit your particular needs...
example.tran: 我们或许可以专门设计一门课程以满足你的特殊需求。

example.ex: Computer security systems will be designed by independent technicians...
example.tran: 计算机安全系统将由独立的技师来设计。

collins.def: Design is the process and art of planning and making detailed drawings of something.

example.ex: He was a born mechanic with a flair for design...
example.tran: 他生来就是个有设计天赋的机械师。

example.ex: Most mobile robots are still in the design stage...
example.tran: 大多数移动机器人仍处在设计阶段。

collins.def: The design of something is the way in which it has been planned and made.

example.ex: These machines are constantly updated by improving the design of the computers.
example.tran: 通过改善计算机的设计，这些机器不断得到更新。

example.ex: ...a new design of clock...
example.tran: 新款时钟

collins.def: A design is a drawing which someone produces to show how they would like something to be built or made.

example.ex: They drew up the design for the house in a week.
example.tran: 他们在一周内就画出了房子的图样。

collins.def: A design is a pattern of lines, flowers, or shapes which is used to decorate something.

example.ex: Their range of tableware is decorated with a blackberry design...
example.tran: 他们的整套餐具上都饰有黑莓图案。

example.ex: Many pictures have been based on simple geometric designs.
example.tran: 许多画都是基于简单的几何图案。

collins.def: A design is a general plan or intention that someone has in their mind when they are doing something.

example.ex: Is there some design in having him in the middle?...
example.tran: 让他呆在中间是不是有什么目的？

example.ex: The intelligence service conceived a grand design to assassinate the War Minister.
example.tran: 情报机构策划了一项暗杀陆军部长的重大计划。

collins.def: If something is designed for a particular purpose, it is intended for that purpose.

example.ex: This project is designed to help landless people...
example.tran: 这一项目旨在帮助那些没有土地的人。

example.ex: It's not designed for anyone under age eighteen.
example.tran: 它不是为18岁以下者设计的。

collins.def: If something happens or is done by design, someone does it deliberately, rather than by accident.

example.ex: The pair met often — at first by chance but later by design.
example.tran: 这两个人经常见面——开始是偶然的，后来就是有意的了。

collins.def: If someone has designs on something, they want it and are planning to get it, often in a dishonest way.

example.ex: His colonel had designs on his wife...
example.tran: 他的上校在打他妻子的主意。

example.ex: Greece has always stressed that it had no designs on the territory.
example.tran: 希腊一直强调它对这片领土没有任何企图。

collins.def: When something develops, it grows or changes over a period of time and usually becomes more advanced, complete, or severe.

example.ex: As children develop, some of the most important things they learn have to do with their sense of self...
example.tran: 在成长过程中，孩子学到的一些最重要的东西与他们的自我意识有关。

example.ex: It's hard to say at this stage how the market will develop...
example.tran: 在现阶段，很难说市场将会如何发展。

collins.def: If a problem or difficulty develops, it begins to occur.

example.ex: A huge row has developed about the pollution emanating from a chemical plant.
example.tran: 一家化工厂造成的污染已经引发了激烈争论。

example.ex: ...blood clots in his lungs, a problem which developed from a leg injury.
example.tran: 由腿伤引起的他肺部的血块

collins.tran: (国家从贫穷的农业国向富有的工业国)发展
collins.def: If you say that a country develops, you mean that it changes from being a poor agricultural country to being a rich industrial country.

example.ex: All countries, it was predicted, would develop and develop fast.
example.tran: 据预测，所有国家都会实现发展而且发展速度会很快。

collins.tran: （使）（企业或行业）发展；（使）扩展；（使）壮大
collins.def: If you develop a business or industry, or if it develops, it becomes bigger and more successful.

example.ex: She won a grant to develop her own business...
example.tran: 她赢得了一笔拨款，用以扩展自己的企业。

example.ex: Over the last few years tourism here has developed considerably.
example.tran: 在过去几年里，这里的旅游业获得了相当大的发展。

collins.def: To develop land or property means to make it more profitable, by building houses or factories or by improving the existing buildings.

example.ex: Entrepreneurs developed fashionable restaurants and bars in the area.
example.tran: 实业家在这一地区建起了许多时尚的餐馆和酒吧。

example.ex: ...the cost of acquiring or developing property.
example.tran: 获得或开发地产的成本

collins.tran: 养成(习惯);获得(名声);形成(信仰)
collins.def: If you develop a habit, reputation, or belief, you start to have it and it then becomes stronger or more noticeable.

example.ex: She later developed a taste for expensive nightclubs...
example.tran: 她后来逐渐变得喜欢去消费高昂的夜总会。

example.ex: Mr Robinson has developed the reputation of a ruthless cost-cutter.
example.tran: 大家都知道鲁宾逊先生在降低成本上毫不手软。

collins.def: If you develop a skill, quality, or relationship, or if it develops, it becomes better or stronger.

example.ex: Now you have an opportunity to develop a greater understanding of each other...
example.tran: 现在你们有一个好机会，可以大大增进对彼此的了解。

example.ex: ...weekly workshops that are designed to develop acting and theatre skills...
example.tran: 为了提高表演和舞台技巧而设的每周一次的培训班

collins.def: If you develop an illness, or if it develops, you become affected by it.

example.ex: The test should identify which smokers are most prone to develop lung cancer...
example.tran: 这项检查应该可以确认哪些吸烟者更容易得肺癌。

example.ex: A sharp ache developed in her back muscles.
example.tran: 她后背的肌肉疼得厉害。

collins.def: If a piece of equipment develops a fault, it starts to have the fault.

example.ex: The aircraft made an unscheduled landing after developing an electrical fault.
example.tran: 飞机由于发生电力故障而作了临时降落。

collins.def: If someone develops a new product, they design it and produce it.

example.ex: He claims that several countries have developed nuclear weapons secretly.
example.tran: 他声称有几个国家已经秘密研制出了核武器。

example.ex: ...a computer system specially developed for the Coastguard service.
example.tran: 专为海岸警卫队研发的计算机系统

collins.tran: 阐释(想法、理论、故事或主题)；（使）展开；（使）完善
collins.def: If you develop an idea, theory, story, or theme, or if it develops, it gradually becomes more detailed, advanced, or complex.

example.ex: I would like to thank them for allowing me to develop their original idea...
example.tran: 我想感谢他们允许我深入完善他们最初的想法。

example.ex: This point is developed further at the end of this chapter...
example.tran: 这一点在本章结尾处有进一步阐释。

collins.def: To develop photographs means to make negatives or prints from a photographic film.

example.ex: ...after developing one roll of film.
example.tran: 冲洗了一卷胶卷后

collins.tran: 发展;成长;发育;生长;形成
collins.def: Development is the gradual growth or formation of something.

example.ex: ...an ideal system for studying the development of the embryo...
example.tran: 研究胎儿发育过程的理想方法

example.ex: First he surveys Islam's development.
example.tran: 首先他回顾了伊斯兰教的发展过程。

collins.tran: (企业、行业等的)发展，扩展，壮大
collins.def: Development is the growth of something such as a business or an industry.

example.ex: Education is central to a country's economic development...
example.tran: 教育对一个国家的经济发展至关重要。

example.ex: What are your plans for the development of your company?
example.tran: 你打算怎样来发展壮大自己的公司？

collins.def: Development is the process or result of making a basic design gradually better and more advanced.

example.ex: We are spending $850m on research and development.
example.tran: 我们在研发上的投入是 8.5 亿美元。

example.ex: ...the development of new and innovative telephone services.
example.tran: 新型电话服务的开发

collins.tran: (地区的)发展;(土地、水域的)开发
collins.def: Development is the process of making an area of land or water more useful or profitable.

example.ex: The talks will focus on economic development of the region.
example.tran: 会谈将着重讨论该地区的经济发展。

example.ex: ...the fostering of development in the rural areas...
example.tran: 对农村地区发展的促进

collins.def: A development is an event or incident which has recently happened and is likely to have an effect on the present situation.

example.ex: Police said there had been a significant development in the case.
example.tran: 警方说此案已经有了重大进展。

example.ex: ...the latest developments in Moscow...
example.tran: 莫斯科的最新动态

collins.tran: 新建住宅区;新开发的楼盘
collins.def: A development is an area of houses or buildings which have been built by property developers.
When people, animals, and plants die, they stop living.

example.ex: A year later my dog died...
example.tran: 一年后我的狗死了。

example.ex: Sadly, both he and my mother died of cancer...
example.tran: 非常不幸的是，他和我母亲都死于癌症。

collins.def: If a person, animal, or plant is dying, they are so ill or so badly injured that they will not live very much longer.

example.ex: The elm trees are all dying...
example.tran: 那些榆树全都奄奄一息了。

example.ex: Every working day I treat people who are dying from lung diseases caused by smoking.
example.tran: 每天上班我都要医治那些因吸烟患上肺病的垂危患者。

collins.def: If someone dies a violent, unnatural, or painful death, they die in a violent, unnatural, or painful way.

example.ex: He watched helplessly as his mother died an agonizing death...
example.tran: 他无助地看着母亲痛苦地死去。

example.ex: I'm no expert, but I don't think Tracy died a natural death.
example.tran: 我不是什么专家，但我不认为特蕾西是自然死亡。

collins.def: If a machine or device dies, it stops completely, especially after a period of working more and more slowly or inefficiently.

example.ex: Then suddenly, the engine coughed, spluttered and died.
example.tran: 然后，发动机突然咔咔地响着，发出一阵噼啪声，接着就彻底熄火了。

collins.def: If a fire or light dies, it stops burning or shining.

example.ex: Her cigarette glowed brightly, then died.
example.tran: 她的香烟燃起一阵亮光，然后就熄灭了。

collins.def: If an emotion or facial expression dies, it disappears completely, usually after a period of gradually becoming weaker and less noticeable.

example.ex: My love for you will never die...
example.tran: 我对你的爱永不止息。

example.ex: Kathryn looked down at the floor and the smile died on her lips.
example.tran: 凯瑟琳低头看向地板，笑容从她的嘴角消失了。

collins.tran: (渴、饿、闷或好奇)得要命;…得要死
collins.def: You can say that you are dying of thirst, hunger, boredom, or curiosity to emphasize that you are very thirsty, hungry, bored, or curious.

example.ex: Order me a pot of tea, I'm dying of thirst.
example.tran: 给我来一壶茶，我快要渴死了。

collins.def: You can say that you are dying for something or are dying to do something to emphasize that you very much want to have it or do it.

example.ex: I'm dying for a breath of fresh air...
example.tran: 我非常渴望能呼吸到新鲜空气。

example.ex: She was dying to talk to Frank.
example.tran: 她很想同弗兰克谈谈。

collins.tran: (用于强调震惊、不安、窘迫或好笑等)我差点要死/（如果发生某事）我会死的
collins.def: You can use die in expressions such as 'I almost died' or 'I'd die if anything happened' where you are emphasizing your feelings about a situation, for example to say that it is very shocking, upsetting, embarrassing, or amusing.

example.ex: I nearly died when I learned where I was ending up...
example.tran: 得知自己到了哪里时，我简直要晕过去了。

example.ex: I nearly died of shame...
example.tran: 我羞愧难当。

collins.def: A die is a specially shaped or patterned block of metal which is used to press or cut other metal into a particular shape.
You can say that the die is cast to draw attention to the importance of an event or decision which is going to affect your future and which cannot be changed or avoided.

example.ex: It was too late and too urgent to turn back. The die was cast.
example.tran: 现在为时已晚，来不及回头。事情已成定局了。

collins.tran: (习惯或观念)难以改掉，很难摆脱
collins.def: If you say that habits or attitudes die hard, you mean that they take a very long time to disappear or change, so that it may not be possible to get rid of them completely.

example.ex: Old habits die hard...
example.tran: 积习难改。

example.ex: Such prejudices die hard.
example.tran: 这些偏见很难消除。

collins.def: If two people or things are different, they are not like each other in one or more ways.

example.ex: London was different from most European capitals...
example.tran: 伦敦同大多数欧洲国家的首都都有所不同。

example.ex: If he'd attended music school, how might things have been different?...
example.tran: 如果他上过音乐学校，事情会有怎样的不同呢？

collins.def: You use different to indicate that you are talking about two or more separate and distinct things of the same kind.

example.ex: Different countries specialised in different products...
example.tran: 不同国家专门生产不同的产品。

example.ex: The number of calories in different brands of drinks varies enormously.
example.tran: 不同牌子的饮料所含的卡路里数大不相同。

collins.tran: 不同寻常的;与众不同的
collins.def: You can describe something as different when it is unusual and not like others of the same kind.

example.ex: This recipe is certainly interesting and different.
example.tran: 这种烹饪法的确很有意思而且与众不同。

collins.def: Something that is difficult is not easy to do, understand, or deal with.

example.ex: Hobart found it difficult to get her first book published...
example.tran: 霍巴特发现要出版自己的第一本书很不容易。

example.ex: The lack of childcare provisions made it difficult for single mothers to get jobs...
example.tran: 由于缺乏保育服务，单身母亲很难找到工作。

collins.tran: 难相处的;难取悦的;不随和的
collins.def: Someone who is difficult behaves in an unreasonable and unhelpful way.

example.ex: I had a feeling you were going to be difficult about this.
example.tran: 我有种感觉：你会在这件事上找别扭。

means: （用建议、指示、有益的情报等）指导

collins.def: Direct means moving towards a place or object, without changing direction and without stopping, for example in a journey.

example.ex: They'd come on a direct flight from Athens.
example.tran: 他们是搭乘从雅典直飞这里的航班过来的。

example.ex: ...the direct route from Amman to Bombay.
example.tran: 从安曼到孟买的直达线路

collins.tran: (光或热)直接照射的，直接接触的
collins.def: If something is in direct heat or light, it is strongly affected by the heat or light, because there is nothing between it and the source of heat or light to protect it.

example.ex: Medicines should be stored away from direct sunlight...
example.tran: 药品的储放应避免阳光直射。

example.ex: Direct illumination is harsh and unflattering.
example.tran: 直射光照明既刺目又呆板。

collins.tran: (经验、活动或系统)直接的，亲身的
collins.def: You use direct to describe an experience, activity, or system which only involves the people, actions, or things that are necessary to make it happen.

example.ex: He has direct experience of the process of privatisation...
example.tran: 他对私有化过程有着切身体会。

example.ex: He seemed to be in direct contact with the Boss...
example.tran: 他似乎直接和老板联系。

collins.def: You use direct to emphasize the closeness of a connection between two things.

example.ex: They were unable to prove that she died as a direct result of his injection...
example.tran: 他们无法证明她的死是由于他的注射直接引起的。

example.ex: His visit is direct evidence of the improvement in their relationship...
example.tran: 他的到访是他们之间关系已有所改善的明证。

collins.tran: 坦率的;率直的;直截了当的
collins.def: If you describe a person or their behaviour as direct, you mean that they are honest and open, and say exactly what they mean.

example.ex: He avoided giving a direct answer...
example.tran: 他避免作出正面回答。

example.ex: The new songs are more direct...
example.tran: 这些新歌听起来更直入人心。

collins.def: If you direct something at a particular thing, you aim or point it at that thing.

example.ex: I directed the extinguisher at the fire without effect...
example.tran: 我把灭火器对准了火焰，但没起作用。

example.ex: He directed the tiny beam of light at the roof.
example.tran: 他把那一小束光对准了屋顶。

collins.tran: 使(注意力、情感、行为等)转向;使…指向;把…引向
collins.def: If your attention, emotions, or actions are directed at a particular person or thing, you are focusing them on that person or thing.

example.ex: The learner's attention needs to be directed to the significant features...
example.tran: 需要将学习者的注意力引向那些着重点上。

example.ex: Do not be surprised if, initially, she directs her anger at you...
example.tran: 如果一上来她就冲你发火，不必惊讶。

collins.tran: 使(话语或眼神)针对，指向，冲…而来
collins.def: If a remark or look is directed at you, someone says something to you or looks at you.

example.ex: She could hardly believe the question was directed towards her...
example.tran: 她很难相信这个问题是冲她来的。

example.ex: The abuse was directed at the TV crews...
example.tran: 这些辱骂是冲着电视台的工作人员来的。

collins.def: If you direct someone somewhere, you tell them how to get there.

example.ex: Could you direct them to Dr Lamont's office, please?...
example.tran: 你能告诉他们去拉蒙特医生的办公室怎么走吗？

example.ex: Inside, a guard directed them to the right.
example.tran: 进去后，一名警卫把他们引向了右边。

collins.def: When someone directs a project or a group of people, they are responsible for organizing the people and activities that are involved.

example.ex: Christopher will direct day-to-day operations.
example.tran: 克里斯托弗将管理日常的运营。

example.ex: ...his coolness in directing the rescue of nine hostages.
example.tran: 在组织解救9名人质的过程中他所表现出的冷静

collins.tran: 导演，执导(电影、戏剧或电视节目)
collins.def: When someone directs a film, play, or television programme, they are responsible for the way in which it is performed and for telling the actors and assistants what to do.

example.ex: He directed various TV shows...
example.tran: 他执导过多种题材的电视节目。

example.ex: The film was directed by Howard Hawks.
example.tran: 该影片是由霍华德·霍克斯导演的。

collins.def: If you are directed to do something, someone in authority tells you to do it.

example.ex: They have been directed to give special attention to the problem of poverty...
example.tran: 他们得到指示要特别关注贫困问题。

example.ex: The Bishop directed the faithful to stay at home.
example.tran: 主教要求信徒们呆在家中。

collins.def: If you are a direct descendant of someone, you are related to them through your parents and your grandparents and so on.

example.ex: She is a direct descendant of Queen Victoria.
example.tran: 她是维多利亚女王的嫡系后代。

collins.def: The director of a play, film, or television programme is the person who decides how it will appear on stage or screen, and who tells the actors and technical staff what to do.
In some organizations and public authorities, the person in charge is referred to as the director .

example.ex: ...the director of the intensive care unit at Guy's Hospital.
example.tran: 盖伊医院重症护理病房的主任

example.ex: ...the Director of Public Prosecutions...
example.tran: (英格兰以及威尔士的)检察官

collins.def: The directors of a company are its most senior managers, who meet regularly to make important decisions about how it will be run.

example.ex: He served on the board of directors of a local bank.
example.tran: 他是当地一家银行的董事会成员之一。

example.ex: ...Karl Uggerholt, the financial director of Braun UK.
example.tran: 卡尔·乌格洛尔特，贝朗英国分公司的财务经理

collins.def: The director of an orchestra or choir is the person who is conducting it.

collins.tran: 元(美国、加拿大、澳大利亚等国的货币单位)
collins.def: The dollar is the unit of money used in the USA, Canada, Australia, and some other countries. It is represented by the symbol $. A dollar is divided into one hundred smaller units called cents.

example.ex: She gets paid seven dollars an hour...
example.tran: 她的报酬是每小时 7元。

example.ex: The government is spending billions of dollars on new urban rail projects.
example.tran: 政府正把数十亿元花在新城市铁路项目上。

collins.def: If you pay top dollar for something, you pay a lot of money for it.

example.ex: Japanese investors once paid top dollar for the most glamorous hotels in the United States.
example.tran: 日本投资者曾为投资美国高档酒店一掷千金。

collins.def: A door is a piece of wood, glass, or metal, which is moved to open and close the entrance to a building, room, cupboard, or vehicle.

example.ex: I knocked at the front door, but there was no answer...
example.tran: 我敲了敲前门，没有人应。

example.ex: The policeman opened the door and looked in...
example.tran: 警察打开门朝里面看。

collins.def: A door is the space in a wall when a door is open.

example.ex: She looked through the door of the kitchen. Her daughter was at the stove.
example.tran: 她从厨房门口朝里看，发现女儿站在炉子旁。

collins.tran: (商店、宾馆、戏院等的)进口，入口
collins.def: The door is the entrance to a large building such as a shop, hotel, or theatre.

example.ex: He entered Harrods by the main door...
example.tran: 他从正门进入了哈罗德商场。

example.ex: The queues at the door wound around the building.
example.tran: 门口的队伍绕了大楼一圈。

collins.def: Doors is used in expressions such as a few doors down or three doors up to refer to a place that is a particular number of buildings away from where you are.

example.ex: Mrs Cade's house was only a few doors down from her daughter's apartment.
example.tran: 凯德夫人的房子和她女儿的公寓就隔了几户人家。

collins.def: When you answer the door, you go and open the door because a visitor has knocked on it or rung the bell.

example.ex: Carol answered the door as soon as I knocked.
example.tran: 我一敲门，卡萝尔就来开了。

collins.tran: 偷偷摸摸地;背地里地;不正当地
collins.def: If you say that someone gets or does something by the back door or through the back door, you are criticizing them for doing it secretly and unofficially.

example.ex: The government would not allow anyone to sneak in by the back door and seize power by force...
example.tran: 政府不会允许任何人偷偷混进来并用暴力攫取政权。

example.ex: They claim the Government is privatising dentistry through the back door.
example.tran: 他们声称政府正通过不正当的手段将牙医业私有化。

collins.tran: 不再想;不再做;拒…于门外
collins.def: If someone closes the door on something, they stop thinking about it or dealing with it.

example.ex: We never close the door on a successful series.
example.tran: 我们从不把成功的系列节目拒之门外。

collins.def: If people have talks and discussions behind closed doors, they have them in private because they want them to be kept secret.

example.ex: ...decisions taken in secret behind closed doors.
example.tran: 背地里秘密作出的决定

collins.def: If someone goes from door to door or goes door to door, they go along a street calling at each house in turn, for example selling something.

example.ex: They are going from door to door collecting money from civilians.
example.tran: 他们挨家挨户地向百姓收钱。

example.ex: ...a door-to-door salesman...
example.tran: 上门推销员

collins.def: If you talk about a distance or journey from door to door or door to door, you are talking about the distance from the place where the journey starts to the place where it finishes.

example.ex: ...tickets covering the whole journey from door to door...
example.tran: 全程票

example.ex: Flying out on Friday from Gatwick it took seven hours door-to-door.
example.tran: 星期五从盖特威克起飞全程需要 7 个小时。

collins.tran: （通常指难以成功的领域中）迈向目标的第一步，成功的开端
collins.def: If you say that something helps someone to get their foot in the door or their toe in the door, you mean that it gives them an opportunity to start doing something new, usually in an area that is difficult to succeed in.

example.ex: The bondholding may help the firm get its foot in the door to win the business...
example.tran: 债券的持有可能是有助于该公司赢得业务的第一步。

example.ex: The Philips deal also gives Sparc a foot in the door of a new market — consumer electronics.
example.tran: 与飞利浦公司的交易也使斯巴克得以进入一个新市场——消费类电子产品。

collins.tran: 拒绝同…谈话;拒绝向…透露信息
collins.def: If someone shuts the door in your face or slams the door in your face, they refuse to talk to you or give you any information.

example.ex: Did you say anything to him or just shut the door in his face?
example.tran: 你跟他说什么了吗，还是直接给了他个闭门羹？

collins.def: If you lay something at someone'sdoor, you blame them for an unpleasant event or situation.

example.ex: I'm notsure his death can be laid at medicine's door alone...
example.tran: 我不确信他的死亡单单是药物所致。

example.ex: The blame is generally laid at the door of the government.
example.tran: 通常谴责的矛头都会指向政府。

collins.tran: 介绍(新思想或新情况);使…成为可能
collins.def: If someone or something opens the door to a good new idea or situation, they introduce it or make it possible.

example.ex: This book opens the door to some of the most exciting findings in solid-state physics...
example.tran: 这本书介绍了固态物理中一些最激动人心的发现。

example.ex: Researchers are pushing back the frontiers and opening doors to reveal why things happen and how things work.
example.tran: 研究者们拓展了其研究领域，介绍并揭示了事物发生的原因和机理。

collins.def: When you are out of doors, you are not inside a building, but in the open air.

example.ex: The weather was fine enough for working out of doors.
example.tran: 天气太好了，适合户外工作。

collins.def: If you see someone to the door, you go to the door with a visitor when they leave.
If someone shows you the door, they ask you to leave because they are angry with you.

example.ex: Would they forgive and forget — or show him the door?
example.tran: 他们会既往不咎吗——还是会对他下逐客令呢？

collins.def: When you draw, or when you draw something, you use a pencil or pen to produce a picture, pattern, or diagram.

example.ex: She would sit there drawing with the pencil stub...
example.tran: 她会坐在那儿用铅笔头画画。

example.ex: Draw a rough design for a logo...
example.tran: 画一个公司标志的草图。

collins.def: When a vehicle draws somewhere, it moves there smoothly and steadily.

example.ex: Claire had seen the taxi drawing away...
example.tran: 克莱尔看到出租车缓缓开走了。

example.ex: A carriage door struck him as a train drew into Basildon station.
example.tran: 当火车驶进巴斯尔登站时，一节车厢的门撞到他了。

collins.def: If you draw somewhere, you move there slowly.

example.ex: She drew away and did not smile...
example.tran: 她慢慢走开了，脸上没有笑容。

example.ex: When we drew level, he neither slowed down nor accelerated.
example.tran: 当我们齐头并进时，他既没有慢下来也没有加速。

collins.def: If you draw something or someone in a particular direction, you move them in that direction, usually by pulling them gently.

example.ex: He drew his chair nearer the fire...
example.tran: 他把椅子拉到离炉火更近的位置。

example.ex: He put his arm around Caroline's shoulders and drew her close to him...
example.tran: 他一只手臂搂住卡罗琳的肩膀，将她拉近自己。

collins.def: When you draw a curtain or blind, you pull it across a window, either to cover or to uncover it.

example.ex: After drawing the curtains, she lit a candle...
example.tran: 拉上窗帘后，她点燃了蜡烛。

example.ex: Mother was lying on her bed, with the blinds drawn.
example.tran: 母亲正躺在床上，百叶窗已经拉了下来。

collins.tran: 拔出，抽出，掏出(枪、刀等武器)
collins.def: If someone draws a gun, knife, or other weapon, they pull it out of its container and threaten you with it.

example.ex: He drew his dagger and turned to face his pursuers.
example.tran: 他拔出匕首转身面向追他的人。

collins.def: If an animal or vehicle draws something such as a cart, carriage, or another vehicle, it pulls it along.

example.ex: ...a slow-moving tractor, drawing a trailer.
example.tran: 拖着一辆挂车的移动缓慢的拖拉机

example.ex: ...a chariot drawn by six black mules.
example.tran: 6 匹黑色骡子拉着的一辆双轮敞篷马车

collins.def: If you draw a deep breath, you breathe in deeply once.

example.ex: He paused, drawing a deep breath.
example.tran: 他停了下来，深深地吸了口气。

collins.def: If you draw on a cigarette, you breathe the smoke from it into your mouth or lungs.

example.ex: He drew on an American cigarette...
example.tran: 他抽着一根美国产的香烟。

example.ex: Her cheeks hollowed as she drew smoke into her lungs.
example.tran: 当她把烟吸进肺里时，她的双颊瘪了下去。

collins.def: To draw something such as water or energy from a particular source means to take it from that source.

example.ex: Villagers still have to draw their water from wells.
example.tran: 村民们仍然要从井里打水。

collins.def: If something that hits you or presses part of your body draws blood, it cuts your skin so that it bleeds.

example.ex: Any practice that draws blood could increase the risk of getting the virus.
example.tran: 任何引起出血的做法都可能会增加感染病毒的危险。

collins.def: If you draw money out of a bank, building society, or savings account, you get it from the account so that you can use it.

example.ex: She was drawing out cash from a cash machine...
example.tran: 她正从自动提款机中取钱。

example.ex: Companies could not draw money from bank accounts as cash.
example.tran: 公司不能从银行账户中提取现金。

collins.def: If you draw a salary or a sum of money, you receive a sum of money regularly.

example.ex: For the first few years I didn't draw any salary at all...
example.tran: 在开始的几年里我分文未取。

example.ex: He is moving ever closer to drawing his pension.
example.tran: 他就要领取养老金了。

collins.tran: (在比赛等中)抽(签);(在摸彩中)抽(奖)
collins.def: To draw something means to choose it or to be given it, as part of a competition, game, or lottery.

example.ex: We delved through a sackful of letters to draw the winning name...
example.tran: 我们把手探进一袋信件中抽取获奖者。

example.ex: Aston Villa have drawn a Czech team in the first round of the UEFA Cup.
example.tran: 欧洲联盟杯首轮阿斯顿维拉队抽到了一支捷克球队。

collins.def: A draw is a competition where people pay money for numbered or named tickets, then some of those tickets are chosen, and the owners are given prizes.
To draw something from a particular thing or place means to take or get it from that thing or place.

example.ex: I draw strength from the millions of women who have faced this challenge successfully...
example.tran: 我从数百万成功面对这种挑战的女性身上汲取力量。

example.ex: The students are drawn from a cross-section of backgrounds.
example.tran: 这些学生是从成长背景具代表性的候选群体中选取出来的。

collins.def: If you draw a particular conclusion, you decide that that conclusion is true.

example.ex: He draws two conclusions from this...
example.tran: 他从这件事中得出两个结论。

example.ex: He says he cannot yet draw any conclusions about the murders.
example.tran: 他说他还不能对几起谋杀下结论。

collins.tran: 作(比较或对比)；加以(区别)
collins.def: If you draw a comparison, parallel, or distinction, you compare or contrast two different ideas, systems, or other things.

example.ex: ...literary critics drawing comparisons between George Sand and George Eliot...
example.tran: 将乔治·桑德和乔治·艾略特进行比较的文学评论家

example.ex: Interesting distinctions can be drawn between the two populations.
example.tran: 比较两类人可以发现有趣的差异。

collins.def: If you draw someone's attention to something, you make them aware of it or make them think about it.

example.ex: He was waving his arms to draw their attention...
example.tran: 他正挥手以引起他们的注意。

example.ex: He just wants to draw attention to the plight of the unemployed.
example.tran: 他仅仅是想引起人们对失业者困境的关注。

collins.def: If someone or something draws a particular reaction, people react to it in that way.

example.ex: Such a policy would inevitably draw fierce resistance from farmers.
example.tran: 这种政策必然会招致农场主的强烈抵制。

example.ex: ...an official tour to South Africa which drew angry political reactions.
example.tran: 引起政治上的愤怒反应的一次官方的南非之行

collins.def: If something such as a film or an event draws a lot of people, it is so interesting or entertaining that a lot of people go to it.

example.ex: The game is currently drawing huge crowds.
example.tran: 这个游戏现在吸引了很多人。

collins.tran: 使倾心;使动心;强烈吸引
collins.def: If someone or something draws you, it attracts you very strongly.

example.ex: He drew and enthralled her...
example.tran: 他令她动心，让她着迷。

example.ex: What drew him to the area was its proximity to central London.
example.tran: 吸引他到该地区的原因是那里靠近伦敦市中心。

collins.tran: 使回答;使透露消息;使说出意见
collins.def: If someone will not be drawn or refuses to be drawn, they will not reply to questions in the way that you want them to, or will not reveal information or their opinion.

example.ex: The ambassador would not be drawn on questions of a political nature...
example.tran: 大使不会对政治问题发表意见。

example.ex: 'Did he say why?' — 'No, he refuses to be drawn.'
example.tran: “他说为什么了吗？”——“没有,他拒绝透露任何消息。”

collins.def: In a game or competition, if one person or team draws with another one, or if two people or teams draw, they have the same number of points or goals at the end of the game.

example.ex: Holland and the Republic of Ireland drew one-one...
example.tran: 荷兰队和爱尔兰队打成了一比一平。

example.ex: We drew with Ireland in the first game...
example.tran: 在第一场比赛中我们和爱尔兰队打平了。

collins.def: When an event or period of time draws to a close or draws to an end, it finishes.

example.ex: Another celebration had drawn to its close.
example.tran: 又一场庆典结束了。

collins.def: If an event or period of time is drawing closer or is drawing nearer, it is approaching.

example.ex: And all the time next spring's elections are drawing closer...
example.tran: 明年春天的选举即将来临。

example.ex: As the day set for departure drew near, I told my wife that I could not accompany them.
example.tran: 起程的日子就要到了,我告诉妻子我不能陪他们了。

collins.def: When you drive somewhere, you operate a car or other vehicle and control its movement and direction.

example.ex: I drove into town and went to a restaurant for dinner...
example.tran: 我驱车到市里一家餐馆就餐。

example.ex: He put the bags in the car and drove off...
example.tran: 他把袋子放进车里，然后驾车离去。

collins.def: If you drive someone somewhere, you take them there in a car or other vehicle.

example.ex: His daughter Carly drove him to the train station.
example.tran: 他女儿卡莉开车将他送到火车站。

collins.def: A drive is a journey in a car or other vehicle.

example.ex: I thought we might go for a drive on Sunday.
example.tran: 我想星期天我们可以驱车旅行。

collins.tran: (从马路通往住宅的宽阔)车道
collins.def: A drive is a wide piece of hard ground, or sometimes a private road, that leads from the road to a person's house.
If something drives a machine, it supplies the power that makes it work.

example.ex: The current flows into electric motors that drive the wheels.
example.tran: 电流流入了驱动车轮的电动机。

collins.def: Drive is the power supplied by the engine to particular wheels in a car or other vehicle to make the vehicle move.

example.ex: He put the jeep in four-wheel drive and splashed up the slope.
example.tran: 他将吉普车切换为四轮驱动模式后涉水爬上了坡。

collins.def: You use drive to refer to the mechanical part of a computer which reads the data on disks and tapes, or writes data onto them.

example.ex: ...equipment such as terminals, tape drives or printers.
example.tran: 诸如电脑终端、磁带驱动器或打印机等的设备

collins.def: If you drive something such as a nail into something else, you push it in or hammer it in using a lot of effort.

example.ex: I used a sledgehammer to drive the pegs into the ground...
example.tran: 我用一把大锤子把短桩打进地里。

example.ex: I held it still and drove in a nail.
example.tran: 我稳稳地拿着它将钉子钉了进去。

collins.def: In games such as cricket, golf, or football, if a player drives a ball somewhere, they kick or hit it there with a lot of force.

example.ex: Armstrong drove the ball into the roof of the net.
example.tran: 阿姆斯特朗将球打入球门网顶。

collins.def: In golf, a drive is the first stroke a player makes from the tee.

example.ex: Woosnam sliced his drive into the bushes.
example.tran: 伍斯纳姆的开杆球打进了灌木丛中。

collins.tran: (风、雨或雪朝某个方向)吹,卷,刮,冲
collins.def: If the wind, rain, or snow drives in a particular direction, it moves with great force in that direction.

example.ex: Rain drove against the window.
example.tran: 雨敲打着窗户。

collins.def: If you drive people or animals somewhere, you make them go to or from that place.

example.ex: The last offensive drove thousands of people into Thailand...
example.tran: 最后一次进攻将成千上万的人赶到了泰国。

example.ex: Every summer the shepherds drive the sheep up to pasture...
example.tran: 每年夏天牧羊人都将羊群赶到牧场去。

collins.def: To drive someone into a particular state or situation means to force them into that state or situation.

example.ex: The recession and hospital bills drove them into bankruptcy...
example.tran: 经济衰退和医疗账单逼得他们破产了。

example.ex: He nearly drove Elsie mad with his fussing.
example.tran: 他的小题大做简直快把埃尔茜逼疯了。

collins.tran: 驱使，迫使(某人做出极端的事情)
collins.def: The desire or feeling that drives a person to do something, especially something extreme, is the desire or feeling that causes them to do it.

example.ex: More than once, depression drove him to attempt suicide...
example.tran: 抑郁症使他不止一次地企图自杀。

example.ex: Jealousy drives people to murder...
example.tran: 嫉妒驱使人们去杀人。

collins.def: If you say that someone has drive, you mean they have energy and determination.

example.ex: John will be best remembered for his drive and enthusiasm.
example.tran: 约翰的魄力和热情最令人难忘。

collins.tran: 强烈欲望;强烈需求;本能需求
collins.def: A drive is a very strong need or desire in human beings that makes them act in particular ways.

example.ex: ...compelling, dynamic sex drives.
example.tran: 强烈而旺盛的性欲

collins.tran: (为达到某目的而进行的)努力,运动
collins.def: A drive is a special effort made by a group of people for a particular purpose.

example.ex: The ANC is about to launch a nationwide recruitment drive...
example.tran: 非洲国民大会打算在全国范围内发起招募运动。

example.ex: The Church in Haiti has played an important role in the drive towards democracy.
example.tran: 海地的教会在争取民主的运动中扮演了重要的角色。

collins.def: Drive is used in the names of some streets.

example.ex: ...23 Queen's Drive, Malvern, Worcestershire.
example.tran: 伍斯特郡,莫尔文市,女王大道 23 号

collins.def: If you ask someone what they are driving at, you are asking what they are trying to say or what they are saying indirectly.

example.ex: It was clear Cohen didn't understand what Millard was driving at.
example.tran: 看得出科恩并不明白米勒德想说什么。

means: （在食物或饮料中）投放麻醉药，下麻醉药
使服麻醉药，用药麻醉，使服兴奋剂

collins.def: A drug is a chemical which is given to people in order to treat or prevent an illness or disease.

example.ex: The drug will be useful to hundreds of thousands of infected people.
example.tran: 这种药将惠及成千上万的感染者。

example.ex: ...the drug companies.
example.tran: 制药公司

collins.def: Drugs are substances that some people take because of their pleasant effects, but which are usually illegal.

example.ex: His mother was on drugs, on cocaine...
example.tran: 他母亲吸毒，吸可卡因。

example.ex: She was sure Leo was taking drugs...
example.tran: 她确定利奥在吸毒。

collins.def: If you drug a person or animal, you give them a chemical substance in order to make them sleepy or unconscious.

example.ex: They drugged the guard dog with doped meatballs...
example.tran: 他们用掺了麻醉药的肉丸子麻醉了看门狗。

example.ex: She was drugged and robbed.
example.tran: 她被人下了药，然后遭到抢劫。

collins.tran: 往（食物或饮料中）投放麻醉药
collins.def: If food or drink is drugged, a chemical substance is added to it in order to make someone sleepy or unconscious when they eat or drink it.

example.ex: I wonder now if that drink had been drugged...
example.tran: 我现在想那饮料是否被人动过手脚。

example.ex: Anyone could have drugged that wine.
example.tran: 指不定谁在那酒里下了药。

collins.def: If something happens during a period of time or an event, it happens continuously, or happens several times between the beginning and end of that period or event.

example.ex: Sandstorms are common during the Saudi Arabian winter...
example.tran: 在沙特阿拉伯,冬季里沙尘暴很常见。

example.ex: Plants need to be looked after and protected during bad weather.
example.tran: 天气恶劣时要留意照看好植物。

collins.def: If something develops during a period of time, it develops gradually from the beginning to the end of that period.

example.ex: Wages have fallen by more than twenty percent during the past two months...
example.tran: 在过去的两个月里，薪资降幅超过 20%。

example.ex: American business in Britain during the 1950s grew much faster than British business.
example.tran: 20 世纪 50 年代，美国企业在英国的发展速度要比英国本土企业快得多。

collins.def: An event that happens during a period of time happens at some point or moment in that period.

example.ex: The attack is believed to have been carried out during the early morning hours...
example.tran: 据信进攻是在清晨时发起的。

example.ex: During his visit, the Pope will also bless the new hospital.
example.tran: 在访问期间,教皇还将为新医院祈福。

collins.def: If you refer to each thing or  each person in a group, you are referring to every member of the group and considering them as individuals.

example.ex: Each book is beautifully illustrated...
example.tran: 每本书都配有精美的插图。

example.ex: Each year, hundreds of animals are killed in this way...
example.tran: 每年都有数百只动物被这样杀掉。

collins.def: If you refer to each one of the members of a group, you are emphasizing that something applies to every one of them.

example.ex: He picked up forty of these publications and read each one of them.
example.tran: 他从这些出版物中挑选了40本，逐一阅读。

collins.def: You can refer to each and every member of a group to emphasize that you mean all the members of that group.

example.ex: Each and every person responsible for his murder will be brought to justice...
example.tran: 所有参与谋杀他的人都会被绳之以法。

example.ex: They can't destroy truth without destroying each and every one of us.
example.tran: 除非他们将我们赶尽杀绝，否则真理不灭。

collins.def: You use each other when you are saying that each member of a group does something to the others or has a particular connection with the others.

example.ex: We looked at each other in silence...
example.tran: 我们相顾无言。

example.ex: Both sides are willing to make allowances for each other's political sensitivities...
example.tran: 双方都愿意体谅彼此的政治敏感问题。

collins.tran: （指在通常的时间之前）早,提早,提前
collins.def: Early means before the usual time that a particular event or activity happens.

example.ex: I knew I had to get up early...
example.tran: 我知道我得早起。

example.ex: Why do we have to go to bed so early?
example.tran: 为什么我们那么早就得上床睡觉？

collins.def: Early means near the beginning of a day, week, year, or other period of time.

example.ex: ...in the 1970s and the early 1980s.
example.tran: 在20世纪70年代以及80年代早期

example.ex: ...a few weeks in early summer...
example.tran: 初夏的几个星期

collins.tran: （指在原定或预计的时间之前）早，提早,提前
collins.def: Early means before the time that was arranged or expected.

example.ex: She arrived early to secure a place at the front...
example.tran: 为了能占个靠前的位置，她提早到了。

example.ex: The first snow came a month earlier than usual.
example.tran: 第一场雪比往年提早了一个月。

collins.tran: （历史时期或事物存续期）早期的,初期的
collins.def: Early means near the beginning of a period in history, or in the history of something such as the world, a society, or an activity.

example.ex: ...the early stages of pregnancy.
example.tran: 怀孕初期

example.ex: ...Fassbinder's early films...
example.tran: 法斯宾德的早期影片

collins.def: Early means near the beginning of something such as a piece of work or a process.

example.ex: ...the book's early chapters.
example.tran: 书的开头几章

collins.def: Early refers to plants which flower or crop before or at the beginning of the main season.

example.ex: ...these early cabbages and cauliflowers.
example.tran: 这些早熟卷心菜和花椰菜

collins.def: Early reports or indications of something are the first reports or indications about it.

example.ex: The early indications look encouraging...
example.tran: 开初的迹象看起来令人鼓舞。

example.ex: Earlier reports that troops opened fire are now being denied.
example.tran: 有关军队开火的最初传闻现在遭到了否认。

collins.def: You can use as early as to emphasize that a particular time or period is surprisingly early.

example.ex: Inflation could fall back into single figures as early as this month.
example.tran: 通货膨胀率最早有可能在本月就回落至个位数。

example.ex: ...as early as 1838.
example.tran: 早在1838年

collins.def: If you say about something that might be true that it is early days, you mean that it is too soon for you to be completely sure about it.

example.ex: The chances of Francis eventually becoming manager of England are perhaps higher. It is early days, of course, and he has yet to win anything.
example.tran: 弗朗西斯最终成为英格兰队主教练的几率可能更高。当然，现在这样说为时尚早，他还没赢过呢。

means: 向（水手或划手）发出停划命令

collins.def: If a job or action is easy, you can do it without difficulty or effort, because it is not complicated and causes no problems.

example.ex: The shower is easy to install...
example.tran: 这种淋浴器安装起来很简单。

example.ex: It's easy to get a seat at the best shows in town...
example.tran: 很容易搞到城里顶级演出的票。

collins.tran: 轻而易举的;自如的;不拘束的
collins.def: If you describe an action or activity as easy, you mean that it is done in a confident, relaxed way. If someone is easy  about something, they feel relaxed and confident about it.

example.ex: She is laughing and joking and making easy conversation with people she has never met before...
example.tran: 她谈笑风生，和那些素未谋面的人毫不拘束地聊着。

example.ex: He was an easy person to talk to.
example.tran: 和他谈话很轻松。

collins.tran: 舒适的；安逸的;无忧无虑的
collins.def: If you say that someone has an easy life, you mean that they live comfortably without any problems or worries.

example.ex: She has not had an easy life.
example.tran: 她一直没有过上过安逸的生活。

collins.tran: （用于批评）不费力的，轻而易举的
collins.def: If you say that something is easy or too easy, you are criticizing someone because they have done the most obvious or least difficult thing, and have not considered the situation carefully enough.

example.ex: That's easy for you to say...
example.tran: 你说起来轻松。

example.ex: It was all too easy to believe it.
example.tran: 这太容易令人相信了。

collins.tran: 好听的;悦耳的/好看的;悦目的
collins.def: You use easy in expressions such as easy on the ear or easy on the eye when you are describing things that are pleasant and that do not need much effort to be enjoyed or done.

example.ex: The music sounds like an advert—easy on the ear but bland and forgettable...
example.tran: 这音乐听起来像是广告——悦耳但是毫无特点，听过就忘。

example.ex: The layout should be clear and easy on the eye.
example.tran: 版式应该清晰悦目。

collins.tran: 易受攻击的;易遭批评的
collins.def: If you describe someone or something as easy prey or as an easy target, you mean that they can easily be attacked or criticized.

example.ex: Tourists have become easy prey...
example.tran: 游客成了易遭袭击的目标。

example.ex: The World Bank, with its poor environmental record, is an easy target for blame.
example.tran: 世界银行由于在环境保护方面表现不佳而常常遭受诟病。

collins.def: You use easy come, easy go to indicate that the person you are talking about does not care much about money and possessions.

example.ex: My attitude to money is slightly easy come, easy go.
example.tran: 我对金钱并不太在乎。

collins.tran: （尤用于他人搬动重物时）悠着点，小心点
collins.def: If you say 'Easy does it', you are telling someone to be careful and not to use too much effort, especially when they are moving something large and awkward.
If you tell someone to go easy on something, you are telling them to use only a small amount of it.

example.ex: Go easy on the alcohol.
example.tran: 少喝点酒。

collins.def: If you tell someone to go easy on, or be easy on, a particular person, you are telling them not to punish or treat that person very severely.

example.ex: 'Go easy on him,' Sam repeated, opening the door...
example.tran: “对他宽容点，”萨姆开门的时候重复道。

example.ex: Be a little easier on yourself and enjoy yourself more...
example.tran: 对自己别太苛刻，让自己更快乐些。

collins.def: If you say that something is easier said than done, you are emphasizing that although it sounds like a good idea in theory, you think it would be difficult to actually do it.

example.ex: Avoiding mosquito bites is easier said than done.
example.tran: 防蚊叮咬好说难做。

collins.def: If someone tells you to take it easy or take things easy, they mean that you should relax and not do very much at all.

example.ex: It is best to take things easy for a week or two.
example.tran: 最好放松一两周。

collins.def: Economic means concerned with the organization of the money, industry, and trade of a country, region, or society.

example.ex: ...Poland's radical economic reforms...
example.tran: 波兰彻底的经济改革

example.ex: The pace of economic growth is picking up.
example.tran: 经济增长的步伐正在加快。

collins.def: If something is economic, it produces a profit.

example.ex: The new system may be more economic but will lead to a decline in programme quality.
example.tran: 新系统可能更合算，但是会降低程序质量。

collins.tran: （国家或地区的）经济，经济体制
collins.def: An economy is the system according to which the money, industry, and trade of a country or region are organized.

example.ex: Zimbabwe boasts Africa's most industrialised economy.
example.tran: 津巴布韦是非洲工业化程度最高的经济体。

collins.def: A country's economy is the wealth that it gets from business and industry.

example.ex: The Japanese economy grew at an annual rate of more than 10 per cent.
example.tran: 日本经济以年增长率超过10%的速度增长。

collins.def: Economy is the use of the minimum amount of money, time, or other resources needed to achieve something, so that nothing is wasted.

example.ex: ...improvements in the fuel economy of cars...
example.tran: 汽车节油方面的改进

example.ex: There was mostly silence. I have never known such economy with words.
example.tran: 大部分时候都是沉默，我还从未见过如此惜字如金的情形。

collins.def: If you make economies, you try to save money by not spending money on unnecessary things.

example.ex: They will make economies by hiring fewer part-time workers.
example.tran: 他们将通过减少雇用兼职工人来节省开支。

collins.def: Economy services such as travel are cheap and have no luxuries or extras.
Economy is used to describe large packs of goods which are cheaper than normal sized packs.

example.ex: ...an economy pack containing 150 assorted screws.
example.tran: 内含150枚各种螺丝的经济装

collins.tran: 假节约;看似省钱的做法
collins.def: If you describe an attempt to save money as a false economy, you mean that you have not saved any money as you will have to spend a lot more later.

example.ex: A cheap bed can be a false economy...
example.tran: 便宜的床看似省钱，其实可能不然。

example.ex: It seems a false economy to me to cut down on libraries.
example.tran: 在我看来，减少图书馆的数量并不是真正的节约。

collins.def: The effect of one thing on another is the change that the first thing causes in the second thing.

example.ex: Parents worry about the effect of music on their adolescent's behavior...
example.tran: 父母担心音乐对青春期孩子的行为所产生的影响。

example.ex: The austerity measures will have little immediate adverse effect on the average Moroccan...
example.tran: 财政紧缩政策不会对普通的摩洛哥人产生直接的负面影响。

collins.def: An effect is an impression that someone creates deliberately, for example in a place or in a piece of writing.

example.ex: The whole effect is cool, light and airy.
example.tran: 整体效果很酷，轻松而随意。

collins.def: A person's effects are the things that they have with them at a particular time, for example when they are arrested or admitted to hospital, or the things that they owned when they died.

example.ex: His daughters were collecting his effects.
example.tran: 他的女儿们当时正在整理他的遗物。

collins.def: The effects in a film are the specially created sounds and scenery.
If you effect something that you are trying to achieve, you succeed in causing it to happen.

example.ex: Prospects for effecting real political change seemed to have taken a major step backwards.
example.tran: 实现真正政治变革的机会似乎变得更加渺茫了。

collins.tran: 为了给人印象;为了吸引注意力
collins.def: If you say that someone is doing something for effect, you mean that they are doing it in order to impress people and to draw attention to themselves.

example.ex: Jock paused for effect, his eyes glinting over his glass as he took another drink...
example.tran: 乔克为了制造效果停下来又喝了口酒，他的眼睛在酒杯上方光芒闪烁。

example.ex: The Cockney accent was put on for effect.
example.tran: 这伦敦腔是为了给人以深刻印象而故意装出来的。

collins.def: You add in effect to a statement or opinion that is not precisely accurate, but which you feel is a reasonable description or summary of a particular situation.

example.ex: That deal would create, in effect, the world's biggest airline.
example.tran: 事实上，这一协议将促成世界最大航空公司的成立。

collins.def: If you put ,bring, or carry a plan or idea into effect, you cause it to happen in practice.

example.ex: These and other such measures ought to have been put into effect in 1985.
example.tran: 这些以及其他类似的措施在1985年就应该开始实施了。

example.ex: ...a decree bringing into effect the political reforms adopted last month.
example.tran: 上个月正式通过的实施政治改革的法令

collins.def: If a law or policy takes effect or comes into effect at a particular time, it officially begins to apply or be valid from that time. If it remains in effect, it still applies or is still valid.

example.ex: ...the ban on new logging permits which will take effect from July...
example.tran: 将于7月生效的禁止颁发新伐木许可证的禁令

example.ex: The decision was taken yesterday and will remain in effect until further government instructions.
example.tran: 该决定于昨天作出，在政府未有进一步指示前将一直有效。

collins.def: You can say that something takes effect when it starts to produce the results that are intended.

example.ex: The second injection should only have been given once the first drug had taken effect...
example.tran: 只有第一剂药见效后才可进行第二次注射。

example.ex: International sanctions were beginning to take effect.
example.tran: 国际制裁开始起作用了。

collins.tran: 产生良好效果/毫无成效
collins.def: You use effect in expressions such as to good effect and to no effect in order to indicate how successful or impressive an action is.

example.ex: Mr Morris feels the museum is using advertising to good effect...
example.tran: 莫里斯先生认为博物馆作的广告卓有成效。

example.ex: Mr Charles complained, to no effect.
example.tran: 查尔斯先生投诉无果。

collins.def: You use to this effect ,to that effect, or to the effect that to indicate that you have given or are giving a summary of something that was said or written, and not the actual words used.

example.ex: A circular to this effect will be issued in the next few weeks...
example.tran: 接下来的几周内将发布一份大意如此的通告。

example.ex: Legislation to that effect created fierce controversy both in Parliament and outside...
example.tran: 那类立法在议会内外都引起了激烈的争论。

collins.def: If you say that something will happen with immediate effect or with effect from a particular time, you mean that it will begin to apply or be valid immediately or from the stated time.

example.ex: We are now resuming relations with Syria with immediate effect...
example.tran: 我们即刻起与叙利亚恢复关系。

example.ex: The price of the Saturday edition is going up with effect from 3 November.
example.tran: 自11月3日起，周六版价格将上调。

collins.def: If you make an effort to do something, you try very hard to do it.

example.ex: He made no effort to hide his disappointment...
example.tran: 他毫不掩饰失望之情。

example.ex: Finding a cure requires considerable time and effort.
example.tran: 找到治疗的办法需要大量的时间和精力。

collins.def: If you say that someone did something with effort or with an effort, you mean it was difficult for them to do.

example.ex: She took a deep breath and sat up slowly and with great effort...
example.tran: 她深吸一口气，费力地慢慢坐起身来。

example.ex: With an effort she contained her irritation.
example.tran: 她努力强压住了怒火。

collins.tran: （为达到某一目的的）有组织的行动，一系列活动
collins.def: An effort is a particular series of activities that is organized by a group of people in order to achieve something.

example.ex: ...a famine relief effort in Angola.
example.tran: 在安哥拉进行的饥荒救济行动

collins.tran: 费力的事;困难的事;劳神的事
collins.def: If you say that something is an effort, you mean that an unusual amount of physical or mental energy is needed to do it.

example.ex: Even carrying the camcorder while hiking in the forest was an effort.
example.tran: 在森林中徒步旅行时，即便带的是便携式摄像机也非常费力。

collins.def: If you make the effort to do something, you do it, even though you need extra energy to do it or you do not really want to.

example.ex: I don't get lonely now because I make the effort to see people.
example.tran: 我现在不觉得孤独了，因为我尝试着与人交往。

collins.def: If you do something difficult or painful by an effort of will, you manage to make yourself do it.

example.ex: It was only by a supreme effort of will and courage that he was able to pull himself together.
example.tran: 他全凭超凡的决心和勇气才使自己振作起来。

collins.def: If you say that something is worth the effort, you mean that it will justify the energy that you have spent or will spend on it.

example.ex: Fortunately, the chore of leaf sweeping is well worth the effort.
example.tran: 幸运的是，干清扫落叶这个活儿是值得的。

collins.def: Eight is the number 8.

example.ex: So far eight workers have been killed.
example.tran: 到目前为止，已经有8名工人被杀。

collins.def: Eighteen is the number 18.

example.ex: He was employed by them for eighteen years.
example.tran: 他为他们工作了18年。

collins.def: Eighty is the number 80.

example.ex: Eighty horses trotted up.
example.tran: 80匹马小跑起来。

collins.def: When you talk about the eighties, you are referring to numbers between 80 and 89. For example, if you are in your eighties, you are aged between 80 and 89. If the temperature is in the eighties, the temperature is between 80 and 89 degrees.

example.ex: He was in his late eighties and had become the country's most respected elder statesman.
example.tran: 他年近九旬，已成为该国最受尊崇的政界元老。

collins.def: The eighties is the decade between 1980 and 1989.

example.ex: He ran a property development business in the eighties.
example.tran: 他在20世纪80年代经营着一家房地产开发公司。

means: 非此即彼的，两者择一的
[用于否定句或否定词组后]也（不…），亦，而且
[口语] [用于否定句或否定词组后以加强语气]根本
[通常用于“either…or…”结构中]或者，要么[在“either…or…”结构中，动词的人称和数一般与离得最近的主动响应，但有时用第三人称单数，在口语中也有把两个主语合在一起用作复数的]

collins.tran: （表示在两者或多者中择其一）或者，要么
collins.def: You use either in front of the first of two or more alternatives, when you are stating the only possibilities or choices that there are. The other alternatives are introduced by 'or'.

example.ex: They gave money to the Conservative Party either personally or through their companies...
example.tran: 他们要么以个人名义要么通过他们的公司捐钱给了保守党。

example.ex: Sightseeing is best done either by tour bus or by bicycles...
example.tran: 最好是乘坐旅游巴士或骑自行车观光。

collins.tran: （用于否定句中）两者都（不），既（不）
collins.def: You use either in a negative statement in front of the first of two alternatives to indicate that the negative statement refers to both the alternatives.

example.ex: ...music that fails to be either funny or funky...
example.tran: 既无趣又没有强烈节奏的音乐

example.ex: There had been no indication of either breathlessness or any loss of mental faculties right until his death.
example.tran: 他去世前并未出现呼吸困难或意识不清的迹象。

collins.def: You can use either to refer to one of two things, people, or situations, when you want to say that they are both possible and it does not matter which one is chosen or considered.

example.ex: There were glasses of champagne and cigars, but not many of either were consumed...
example.tran: 这里有香槟和雪茄，但两样东西都没怎么动。

example.ex: If either were killed, delicate negotiations would be seriously disrupted.
example.tran: 二人中任意一个遇害，都会严重扰乱本已非常棘手的谈判。

collins.def: You use either in a negative statement to refer to each of two things, people, or situations to indicate that the negative statement includes both of them.

example.ex: She warned me that I'd never marry or have children.—'I don't want either.'
example.tran: 她告诫我千万不要结婚，也别要孩子。——“这两样我都不想要。”

collins.def: You use either by itself in negative statements to indicate that there is a similarity or connection with a person or thing that you have just mentioned.

example.ex: He did not even say anything to her, and she did not speak to him either...
example.tran: 他甚至一句话也没跟她说，她也没跟他说话。

example.ex: 'I'm afraid I've never been there.'—'Well, of course, I haven't myself either.'
example.tran: “恐怕我没去过那里。”——“嗯，那当然，我也没有去过。”

collins.tran: （用于两个连续否定句的第二句之后，强调两种观点同样重要）而且，还
collins.def: When one negative statement follows another, you can use either at the end of the second one to indicate that you are adding an extra piece of information, and to emphasize that both are equally important.

example.ex: Don't agree, but don't argue either...
example.tran: 别同意，但是也别争辩。

example.ex: I can't manage that by myself and I don't see why it should be expected of me either.
example.tran: 我一个人没法做那事，我也不明白为什么得要我去做。

collins.def: You can use either to introduce a noun that refers to each of two things when you are talking about both of them.

example.ex: The basketball nets hung down from the ceiling at either end of the gymnasium...
example.tran: 篮筐分别从体育馆两头的天花板上悬吊下来。

example.ex: I suddenly realized that I didn't have a single intelligent thing to say about either team.
example.tran: 我突然意识到我对两队都没有一句称得上有见地的话可讲。

collins.def: An election is a process in which people vote to choose a person or group of people to hold an official position.

example.ex: ...the first fully free elections for more than fifty years...
example.tran: 50多年来第一次完全自由的选举

example.ex: During his election campaign he promised to put the economy back on its feet...
example.tran: 在竞选活动中，他承诺恢复经济活力。

collins.def: The election of a particular person or group of people is their success in winning an election.

example.ex: ...the election of the Labour government in 1964.
example.tran: 1964年工党政府当选

example.ex: ...his election as president...
example.tran: 他当选总统

collins.def: Eleven is the number 11.

example.ex: ...the Princess and her eleven friends.
example.tran: 公主和她的11位朋友

collins.def: You use else after words such as 'anywhere', 'someone', and 'what', to refer in a vague way to another person, place, or thing.

example.ex: If I can't make a living at painting, at least I can teach someone else to paint...
example.tran: 如果我不能靠画画谋生，至少我可以教别人画画。

example.ex: We had nothing else to do on those long trips...
example.tran: 在那些漫长的旅程中我们没有别的事情可做。

collins.def: You use else after words such as 'everyone', 'everything', and 'everywhere' to refer in a vague way to all the other people, things, or places except the one you are talking about.

example.ex: As I try to be truthful, I expect everyone else to be truthful...
example.tran: 既然我努力做到诚实，我希望其他所有人也能诚实。

example.ex: Cigarettes are in short supply, like everything else here.
example.tran: 和其他所有东西一样，这里的香烟也供应不足。

collins.def: You use or else after stating a logical conclusion, to indicate that what you are about to say is evidence for that conclusion.

example.ex: He must be a good plumber, or else he wouldn't be so busy...
example.tran: 他肯定是个不错的管子工，要不然他不会那么忙。

example.ex: Evidently no lessons have been learnt or else the government would not have handled the problem so sloppily.
example.tran: 政府显然没有吸取教训，不然不会把问题处理得那么草率。

collins.tran: （引出不好的结果）否则，要不然
collins.def: You use or else to introduce a statement that indicates the unpleasant results that will occur if someone does or does not do something.

example.ex: This time we really need to succeed or else people will start giving us funny looks...
example.tran: 这次我们真的需要成功，否则人们会开始用异样的眼光看我们。

example.ex: Make sure you are strapped in very well, or else you will fall out.
example.tran: 一定要系好安全带，否则会摔出去。

collins.tran: （表示另外一种可能性）或者，还是，要不
collins.def: You use or else to introduce the second of two possibilities when you do not know which one is true.

example.ex: You are either a total genius or else you must be absolutely raving mad...
example.tran: 你要么是个不折不扣的天才，要么就是完全疯了。

example.ex: It's likely someone gave her a lift, or else that she took a taxi.
example.tran: 可能有人开车捎了她一程，要不就是她打了辆出租车。

collins.def: Above all else is used to emphasize that a particular thing is more important than other things.

example.ex: Above all else I hate the cold.
example.tran: 我最讨厌寒冷。

example.ex: You can say 'if nothing else' to indicate that what you are mentioning is, in your opinion, the only good thing in a particular situation.
example.tran: (表示唯一的好情况)起码，至少

example.ex: If nothing else, you'll really enjoy meeting them.
example.tran: 至少你一定会很高兴见到他们。

collins.tran: (表示威胁)否则的话，要不然的话
collins.def: You say 'or else' after a command to warn someone that if they do not obey, you will be angry and may harm or punish them.

example.ex: Behave, or else!...
example.tran: 规矩点，否则的话，哼！

example.ex: He told us to put it right, or else.
example.tran: 他让我们纠正错误，否则后果自负。

collins.def: The end of something such as a period of time, an event, a book, or a film is the last part of it or the final point in it.

example.ex: The £5 banknote was first issued at the end of the 18th century...
example.tran: 五英镑面值的钞票最早在18世纪末发行。

example.ex: The report is expected by the end of the year...
example.tran: 预期年底提交报告。

collins.def: When a situation, process, or activity ends, or when something or someone ends it, it reaches its final point and stops.

example.ex: The meeting quickly ended and Steve and I left the room...
example.tran: 会议很快结束了，我和史蒂夫离开了房间。

example.ex: Talks have resumed to try to end the fighting...
example.tran: 会谈重新开始，以期结束战斗。

collins.def: An end to something or the end of it is the act or result of stopping it so that it does not continue any longer.

example.ex: The French government today called for an end to the violence...
example.tran: 今天法国政府呼吁结束暴力行为。

example.ex: I was worried she would walk out or bring the interview to an end...
example.tran: 我担心她会离场或者终止采访。

collins.def: If you say that someone or something ends a period of time in a particular way, you are indicating what the final situation was like. You can also say that a period of time ends in a particular way.

example.ex: The markets ended the week on a quiet note...
example.tran: 全球股市波澜不惊地结束了一周的交易。

example.ex: British Gas shares ended the day 1p up at 287p...
example.tran: 英国天然气公司股价上涨1便士，以287便士收盘。

collins.def: If a period of time ends, it reaches its final point.

example.ex: Its monthly reports on program trading usually come out about three weeks after each month ends...
example.tran: 程式交易月度报告通常在每月结束3周后出来。

example.ex: The first figure shows sales for week ending July 27.
example.tran: 第一组数据显示截至7月27日的周销售量。

collins.tran: (书、演说、表演等)以…为结尾，以…结束
collins.def: If something such as a book, speech, or performance ends with a particular thing or the writer or performer ends it with that thing, its final part consists of the thing mentioned.

example.ex: His statement ended with the words: 'Pray for me.'...
example.tran: 他的声明以“为我祈祷”结束。

example.ex: The book ends on a lengthy description of Hawaii...
example.tran: 这本书以对夏威夷的冗长描述为结尾。

collins.def: If a situation or event ends in a particular way, it has that particular result.

example.ex: The incident could have ended in tragedy...
example.tran: 这起事件本会以悲剧收场。

example.ex: The match ended in a draw...
example.tran: 那场比赛以平局收场。

collins.def: The two ends of something long and narrow are the two points or parts of it that are furthest away from each other.

example.ex: The company is planning to place surveillance equipment at both ends of the tunnel...
example.tran: 该公司计划在隧道两端安装监视设备。

example.ex: A typical fluorescent lamp is a tube with metal electrodes at each end.
example.tran: 日光灯通常是一根两端装有金属电极的管子。

collins.def: The end of a long, narrow object such as a finger or a pencil is the tip or smallest edge of it, usually the part that is furthest away from you.

example.ex: He tapped the ends of his fingers together...
example.tran: 他同时轻轻地叩击着几根指尖。

example.ex: She let the long cone of ash hang at the end of her cigarette.
example.tran: 她让长长的烟灰留在烟头上。

collins.def: If an object ends with or in a particular thing, it has that thing on its tip or point, or as its last part.

example.ex: It has three pairs of legs, each ending in a large claw.
example.tran: 它有3对腿，每条腿上都有一只巨爪。

collins.def: A journey, road, or river that ends at a particular place stops there and goes no further.

example.ex: The road ended at a T-junction...
example.tran: 道路的尽头是一个丁字路口。

example.ex: The journey ends in the ancient city of Marrakesh.
example.tran: 旅行的终点是马拉喀什古城。

collins.def: End is used to refer to either of the two extreme points of a scale, or of something that you are considering as a scale.

example.ex: At the other end of the social scale was the grocer, the village's only merchant...
example.tran: 社会等级的另一端是杂货店老板，村里唯一的商人。

example.ex: The agreement has been criticised by extremist groups on both ends of the political spectrum.
example.tran: 协议遭到了极左翼和极右翼极端团体的批评。

collins.tran: (联系、旅行等的)一端，一方，一头
collins.def: The other end is one of two places that are connected because people are communicating with each other by telephone or writing, or are travelling from one place to the other.

example.ex: When he answered the phone, Ferguson was at the other end...
example.tran: 他接电话时，电话那一端是弗格森。

example.ex: There was silence at the other end of the line...
example.tran: 电话那头没有声音。

collins.def: If you refer to a particular end of a project or piece of work, you mean a part or aspect of it, for example a part of it that is done by a particular person or in a particular place.
