example.ex: You take care of your end, kid, I'll take care of mine...
example.tran: 你管好你的事，孩子，我会管好我的。

example.ex: Let's go up to the office and settle the business end of things.
example.tran: 咱们上楼到办公室去把公事搞定。

collins.def: An end is the purpose for which something is done or towards which you are working.

example.ex: The police force is being manipulated for political ends...
example.tran: 有人为了政治目的在操纵警方。

example.ex: Now the government is trying another policy designed to achieve the same end.
example.tran: 现在政府正在尝试实现殊途同归的另一项政策。

collins.tran: 只存在于，仅限于（某一点）
collins.def: If you say that something ends at a particular point, you mean that it is applied or exists up to that point, and no further.

example.ex: Helen is also 25 and from Birmingham, but the similarity ends there...
example.tran: 海伦也是25岁，也来自伯明翰，但是相同之处仅此而已。

example.ex: Does responsibility end at the fitting of car seats?
example.tran: 只负责安装好汽车座椅吗？

collins.def: You can refer to someone's death as their end, especially when you are talking about the way that they died or might die.

example.ex: Soon after we had spoken to this man he had met a violent end.
example.tran: 我们和这个人谈话之后没多久，他就死于非命了。

collins.def: If you end by doing something or end in a particular state, you do that thing or get into that state even though you did not originally intend to.

example.ex: They ended by making themselves miserable...
example.tran: 结果是他们自找苦头。

example.ex: They'll probably end back on the streets.
example.tran: 他们最后可能又会流落街头。

collins.def: If someone ends it all, they kill themselves.

example.ex: He grew suicidal, thinking up ways to end it all.
example.tran: 他萌生了自杀的念头，想出各种自我了断的办法。

collins.def: If you describe something as, for example, the deal to end all deals or the film to end all films, you mean that it is very important or successful, and that compared to it all other deals or films seem second-rate.

example.ex: It was going to be a party to end all parties.
example.tran: 这将成为最棒的聚会。

example.ex: ...the sale to end all sales at Harrods.
example.tran: 哈罗兹最大的一次特价促销

collins.def: If something is at an end, it has finished and will not continue.

example.ex: The court has passed sentence and the matter is now at an end...
example.tran: 法庭已经作出了判决，现在这件事已经告一段落。

example.ex: The recession is definitely at an end.
example.tran: 经济衰退无疑已经告终。

collins.def: If something comes to an end, it stops.

example.ex: The cold war came to an end.
example.tran: 冷战结束了。

collins.def: You say at the end of the day when you are talking about what happens after a long series of events or what appears to be the case after you have considered the relevant facts.

example.ex: At the end of the day it's up to the Germans to decide...
example.tran: 最终得由德国人来作决定。

example.ex: At the end of the day, the board's not going to be too concerned with three or four more dollars.
example.tran: 到头来，董事会不会太操心多花了几个钱。

collins.tran: 变得神志不清;变得不正常
collins.def: If you say that someone has gone off the deep end, you mean that their mind has stopped working in a normal way and their behaviour has become very strange as a result.

example.ex: I'm not sure she believes me. She probably just thinks I've gone off the deep end.
example.tran: 我不确定她是不是相信我。她可能只是觉得我神志不清了。

collins.tran: (使)落入一无所知的无助境地
collins.def: If you are thrown in at the deep end, you are put in a completely new situation without any help or preparation. If you jump in at the deep end, you go into a completely new situation without any help or preparation.

example.ex: It's a superb job. You get thrown in at the deep end and it's all down to you...
example.tran: 那是一份绝好的工作。你就像被抛到了泳池的深水区，一切都要靠自己。

example.ex: The reason many people fail on diets is that they jump in at the deep end, making a complete change to their eating habits.
example.tran: 很多人节食失败的原因是他们对节食一窍不通，一下子完全改变了饮食习惯。

collins.def: If you do something to the bitter end or to the very end, you continue to do it for as long as you can, although it may be very unpleasant or dangerous.

example.ex: We will fight to the bitter end to ensure our children get what is rightfully theirs.
example.tran: 我们会斗争到底，确保我们的孩子得到理应属于他们的东西。

collins.def: You say in the end when you are saying what is the final result of a series of events, or what is your final conclusion after considering all the relevant facts.

example.ex: I toyed with the idea of calling the police, but in the end I didn't...
example.tran: 我拿不定主意是否报警，但最后还是没报。

example.ex: Benny thought the president was sincere and sensitive, but, in the end, that's not what counts.
example.tran: 本尼认为总统很诚恳，会体谅人，但归根结底那些都没有用。

collins.def: If you consider something to be an end in itself, you do it because it seems desirable and not because it is likely to lead to something else.

example.ex: While he had originally traveled in order to study, traveling had become an end in itself.
example.tran: 尽管他原本是为了学习而旅行，但旅行过程本身也是一种享受。

collins.tran: 坚持下去；尽自己的本分;做好自己的本职工作
collins.def: If you have to keep your end up, or to keep up your end of something, you have to do something as well as other people, or as well as you are expected to do it.

example.ex: I had to keep my end up with other professors in the faculty...
example.tran: 我得和系里其他教授一起做好自己的本职工作。

example.ex: He had trouble keeping up his end of a technical discussion.
example.tran: 他没能在一场技术探讨中坚持自己的立场。

collins.tran: 使收支相抵;勉强维持生计
collins.def: If you find it difficult to make ends meet, you can only just manage financially because you hardly have enough money for the things you need.

example.ex: With Betty's salary they barely made ends meet.
example.tran: 加上贝蒂的薪水，他们仅能勉强维持生计。

collins.def: No end means a lot.

example.ex: The problem was causing the poor woman no end of misery...
example.tran: 那个问题给这个可怜的女人带来了很多痛苦。

example.ex: Teachers inform me that Tracey's behaviour has improved no end.
example.tran: 老师们告诉我特雷西的行为大有改善。

collins.def: When something happens for hours, days, weeks, or years on end, it happens continuously and without stopping for the amount of time that is mentioned.

example.ex: He is a wonderful companion and we can talk for hours on end...
example.tran: 他是个非常好的同伴，我们可以连续聊上好几个小时。

example.ex: I spend days on end in this studio.
example.tran: 我一连几天呆在这个工作室里。

collins.def: Something that is on end is upright, instead of in its normal or natural position, for example lying down, flat, or on its longest side.
To put an end to something means to cause it to stop.

example.ex: Only a political solution could put an end to the violence.
example.tran: 只有政治解决方案才能终结暴力。

collins.def: If a process or person has reached the end of the road, they are unable to progress any further.

example.ex: Given the results of the vote, is this the end of the road for the hardliners in Congress?
example.tran: 从选举结果来看，这是不是国会中强硬派的末日？

collins.def: If you say that something will happen or be true until the end of time or to the end of time, you are emphasizing that it will always happen or always be true.

example.ex: We can assume that the moon will continue to go around the earth until the end of time...
example.tran: 我们可以认定月亮会一直不停地继续围绕地球旋转。

example.ex: I'll love her till the end of time.
example.tran: 我会爱她直到永远。

collins.tran: 不是世界末日;没那么可怕
collins.def: If you say that something bad is not the end of the world, you are trying to stop yourself or someone else being so upset by it, by suggesting that it is not the worst thing that could happen.

example.ex: Obviously I'd be disappointed if we don't make it, but it wouldn't be the end of the world.
example.tran: 显然，如果我们做不到我会失望，但这也不会是世界末日。

collins.def: Enough means as much as you need or as much as is necessary.

example.ex: They had enough cash for a one-way ticket...
example.tran: 他们有足够的钱买单程票。

example.ex: There aren't enough tents to shelter them all.
example.tran: 没有足够的帐篷供他们容身。

collins.def: If you say that something is enough, you mean that you do not want it to continue any longer or get any worse.

example.ex: I met him only the once, and that was enough...
example.tran: 我就见过他那一次，那就让我受够了。

example.ex: I think I have said enough...
example.tran: 我想我已经说得够多了。

collins.def: You can use enough to say that something is the case to a moderate or fairly large degree.

example.ex: Winter is a common enough German surname...
example.tran: 温特是一个非常普通的德国姓氏。

example.ex: I got this phone call from a gentleman, who seemed sincere enough...
example.tran: 这个电话是一位绅士打来的，他似乎非常诚恳。

collins.def: You use enough in expressions such as strangely enough and interestingly enough to indicate that you think a fact is strange or interesting.

example.ex: Strangely enough, the last thing he thought of was his beloved Tanya...
example.tran: 说来也怪，他最后想到的才是他心爱的塔尼娅。

example.ex: Her latest conquest is an Italian who, interestingly enough, doesn't speak a word of his native language.
example.tran: 她新搭上了个意大利人。有意思的是，那个意大利人一句意大利语都不会说。

collins.def: If you say 'enough is enough', you mean that you want something that is happening to stop.

example.ex: Stop asking questions! You should know when enough is enough.
example.tran: 别问问题了！你应该知道什么时候该适可而止。

collins.def: If you say that you have had enough, you mean that you are unhappy with a situation and you want it to stop.

example.ex: I've had enough—there are limits even for the patience of a saint!...
example.tran: 我已经受够了——即使是圣人忍耐也是有限的！

example.ex: I had had enough of other people for one night.
example.tran: 我已经受够了别人搞一夜情。

collins.tran: 讲得够清楚了;不必再多说了
collins.def: If you say 'enough said', you mean that what you have just said is enough to make a point clear, and that there is no need to say any more.

example.ex: My husband is a jazz musician. Enough said.
example.tran: 我丈夫是位爵士音乐家，透露这一点就够了。

collins.tran: （尤指对孩子说）别再闹了，够了
collins.def: You say 'that's enough' to tell someone, especially a child, to stop behaving in a silly, noisy, or unpleasant way.

collins.tran: 事件;（尤指）特殊事件，重大事件
collins.def: An event is something that happens, especially when it is unusual or important. You can use events to describe all the things that are happening in a particular situation.

example.ex: ...the events of Black Wednesday...
example.tran: “黑色星期三”事件

example.ex: ...in the wake of recent events in Europe...
example.tran: 紧随欧洲最近发生的大事之后

collins.tran: （社交聚会、体育比赛等有计划、有组织的）活动
collins.def: An event is a planned and organized occasion, for example a social gathering or a sports match.

example.ex: The cross-country section of the three-day event was held here yesterday.
example.tran: 3日比赛中的越野项目昨天在这里举行。

example.ex: ...major sporting events.
example.tran: 重大体育赛事

collins.def: An event is one of the races or competitions that are part of an organized occasion such as a sports meeting.

example.ex: A solo piper opens Aberdeen Highland Games at 10am and the main events start at 1pm.
example.tran: 上午10点，一位风笛独奏家揭开了阿伯丁高地运动会的序幕，下午1点主要比赛项目开始。

collins.tran: 万一发生…；如果是那样子的话；假若…
collins.def: You use in the event of ,in the event that, and in that event when you are talking about a possible future situation, especially when you are planning what to do if it occurs.

example.ex: The bank has agreed to give an immediate refund in the unlikely event of an error being made...
example.tran: 万一出现错误——虽然这种几率微乎其微，银行同意立即退款。

example.ex: In the event that any part of the deal may be blocked, the rest would go ahead.
example.tran: 万一交易的某一部分受阻，其他部分将继续进行。

collins.def: You say in any event after you have been discussing a situation, in order to indicate that what you are saying is true or possible, in spite of anything that has happened or may happen.

example.ex: In any event, the bowling alley restaurant proved quite acceptable.
example.tran: 无论如何，那个保龄球场的餐厅证明还是很不错的。

collins.def: You say in the event after you have been discussing what could have happened in a particular situation, in order to indicate that you are now describing what actually did happen.

example.ex: 'Don't underestimate us', Norman Willis warned last year. There was, in the event, little danger of that.
example.tran: “别低估了我们，”诺曼·威利斯去年警告说。结果，什么事也没有。

collins.tran: （用于否定句和疑问句）在任何时候，从来
collins.def: Ever means at any time. It is used in questions and negative statements.

example.ex: I'm not sure I'll ever trust people again...
example.tran: 我不确定自己是否还会再相信任何人。

example.ex: Neither of us had ever skied...
example.tran: 我们两个都从未滑过雪。

collins.tran: （表示惊讶、震惊，尤用于希望别人赞同时）曾否，可曾
collins.def: You use ever in expressions such as 'did you ever' and 'have you ever' to express surprise or shock at something you have just seen, heard, or experienced, especially when you expect people to agree with you.

example.ex: Have you ever seen anything like it?...
example.tran: 你可曾见过像它这样的东西？

example.ex: Did you ever hear anyone sound so peculiar?
example.tran: 你可曾听过谁的声音如此奇特？

collins.tran: （用于比较级和最高级后表示强调）以往任何时候，曾经
collins.def: You use ever after comparatives and superlatives to emphasize the degree to which something is true or when you are comparing a present situation with the past or the future.

example.ex: She's got a great voice and is singing better than ever...
example.tran: 她的嗓音非常好，现在的唱功比以往任何时候都要好。

example.ex: Japan is wealthier and more powerful than ever before...
example.tran: 日本比以往任何时候都更加富有和强大。

collins.def: You use ever to indicate that a person is showing a particular quality that is typical of them.

example.ex: He was ever careful to check his scripts...
example.tran: 他一向都认真检查剧本。

example.ex: Mother, ever the peacemaker, pointed her finger at my little brother and said, 'See? Now stop!'
example.tran: 一向充当和事佬的妈妈用手指着弟弟说：“看到了没？快住手！”

collins.def: You use ever to say that something happens more all the time.

example.ex: They grew ever further apart...
example.tran: 他们变得越来越疏远了。

example.ex: I think the amount of work will increase and that it will become ever more complex.
example.tran: 我想工作会越来越多，而且更加复杂。

collins.def: You can use ever for emphasis after 'never'.

example.ex: I can never, ever, forgive myself...
example.tran: 我永远无法原谅我自己。

example.ex: Felix has never, ever confided in me.
example.tran: 费利克斯从来都未向我倾诉过。

collins.tran: （用于以why，when，who等开头的疑问句中表示强调）究竟，到底
collins.def: You use ever in questions beginning with words such as 'why', 'when', and 'who' when you want to emphasize your surprise or shock.

example.ex: Why ever didn't you tell me?...
example.tran: 你究竟为什么不告诉我？

example.ex: When ever am I going to see you again?...
example.tran: 我到底什么时候再见到你？

collins.def: If something has been the case ever since a particular time, it has been the case all the time from then until now.

example.ex: He's been there ever since you left!...
example.tran: 自从你离开后他就一直在那里！

example.ex: Ever since we moved last year, I worry a lot about whether I can handle this new job...
example.tran: 自从去年我们搬家，我就一直非常担心能否做好这份新工作。

collins.tran: （尤用于表示非常感兴趣或感激时）非常，太
collins.def: You use ever in the expressions ever such and ever so to emphasize that someone or something has a particular quality, especially when you are expressing enthusiasm or gratitude.

example.ex: When I met Derek he was ever such a good dancer...
example.tran: 我认识德里克时，他是个非常出色的舞者。

example.ex: This is in ever such good condition...
example.tran: 它保存得非常好。

collins.def: You use the expression all someone ever does when you want to emphasize that they do the same thing all the time, and this annoys you.

example.ex: All she ever does is whinge and complain...
example.tran: 她就会发牢骚抱怨。

example.ex: All he ever does is discuss the same boring list of medications.
example.tran: 他就会翻来覆去讨论同一个无聊的药品单。

collins.def: You say as ever in order to indicate that something or someone's behaviour is not unusual because it is like that all the time or very often.

example.ex: As ever, the meals are primarily fish-based...
example.tran: 像往常一样，饭菜主要是鱼。

example.ex: He was by himself, alone, as ever.
example.tran: 他独自一人，一如往常。

collins.tran: （用于书信结尾署名之前）你永远的朋友
collins.def: You can write 'Yours ever' or 'Ever yours' at the end of a letter before you sign your name, as an affectionate way of ending the letter.
You use every to indicate that you are referring to all the members of a group or all the parts of something and not only some of them.

example.ex: Every village has a green, a church, a pub and a manor house...
example.tran: 每个村庄都有一片绿地、一座教堂、一间酒馆和一座庄园宅第。

example.ex: Record every expenditure you make.
example.tran: 记下你的每一笔花销。

collins.def: You use every in order to say how often something happens or to indicate that something happens at regular intervals.

example.ex: We were made to attend meetings every day...
example.tran: 我们每天都得参加会议。

example.ex: A burglary occurs every three minutes in London...
example.tran: 伦敦每3分钟就会发生一起入室抢劫案。

collins.def: You use every in front of a number when you are saying what proportion of people or things something happens to or applies to.

example.ex: Two out of every three Britons already own a video recorder...
example.tran: 每3个英国人中就有两个已经有了录像机。

example.ex: About one in every 20 people have clinical depression...
example.tran: 大约每20个人中有1个患有临床抑郁症。

collins.tran: （用于名词前表示强调）充足的，完全的
collins.def: You can use every before some nouns, for example 'sign', 'effort', 'reason', and 'intention' in order to emphasize what you are saying.

example.ex: The Congressional Budget Office says the federal deficit shows every sign of getting larger...
example.tran: 国会预算办公室说有种种的迹象表明联邦赤字正在增加。

example.ex: I think that there is every chance that you will succeed...
example.tran: 我想你取得成功的机会很大。

collins.tran: （幻想、愿望、欲望等）所有的，全部的
collins.def: If you say that someone's every whim, wish, or desire will be satisfied, you are emphasizing that everything they want will happen or be provided.

example.ex: Dozens of servants had catered to his every whim.
example.tran: 几十个仆人迎合他所有稀奇古怪的念头。

collins.def: You use every in the expressions every now and then ,every now and again ,every once in a while, and every so often in order to indicate that something happens occasionally.

example.ex: Stir the batter every now and then to keep it from separating...
example.tran: 不时搅动面糊，防止其成分散开。

example.ex: Every so often the horse's heart and lungs are checked.
example.tran: 不时检查那匹马的心脏和肺。

collins.def: If something happens every other day or every second day, for example, it happens one day, then does not happen the next day, then happens the day after that, and so on. You can also say that something happens every third week ,every fourth year, and so on.

example.ex: I went home every other week...
example.tran: 我隔周回一趟家。

example.ex: It has been snowing, roughly every third day, for as long as I've had the flu.
example.tran: 自从我得了流感以来，这段时间一直在下雪，大约每三天一场。

collins.def: You use everything to refer to all the objects, actions, activities, or facts in a particular situation.

example.ex: He'd gone to Seattle long after everything else in his life had changed...
example.tran: 他生活中的其他一切都改变了，很久之后他去了西雅图。

example.ex: Early in the morning, hikers pack everything that they will need for the day's hike...
example.tran: 一大早，徒步旅行者们把当天旅行所需的一切都装进包里。

collins.def: You use everything to refer to all possible or likely actions, activities, or situations.

example.ex: 'This should have been decided long before now.' —'We can't think of everything.'...
example.tran: “这个在此之前早该决定了。”——“我们不可能考虑得面面俱到。”

example.ex: Cathy thought that she had the answer to everything...
example.tran: 凯茜觉得她能够处理一切。

collins.def: You use everything to refer to a whole situation or to life in general.

example.ex: She says everything is going smoothly...
example.tran: 她说一切进展顺利。

example.ex: Is everything all right?...
example.tran: 一切都好吗？

collins.tran: （生命中）最重要的东西，最有价值的东西
collins.def: If you say that someone or something is everything, you mean you consider them to be the most important thing in your life, or the most important thing that there is.

example.ex: I love him. He is everything to me...
example.tran: 我爱他，他是我的一切。

example.ex: Crime cases were something that agents solved, and to him the case was everything...
example.tran: 犯罪案件是执法人员要解决的事情，对于他而言，案件就是一切。

collins.def: If you say that someone or something has everything, you mean they have all the things or qualities that most people consider to be desirable.

example.ex: She has everything: beauty, talent, children...
example.tran: 她拥有一切：美貌、才干和子女。

example.ex: It was a garden that had everything. It was rich and wild and beautiful, and exciting.
example.tran: 那个花园里一切尽有，景物丰富多彩、自然、美丽，令人激动。

collins.def: You say 'and everything' after mentioning a particular thing or list of things to indicate that they are only examples and that other things are also involved.

example.ex: He had a bed and a fireplace and everything...
example.tran: 他家里有一张床、一个壁炉及其他物品。

example.ex: We become friends and everything, and we call each other on the phone all the time.
example.tran: 我们成了非常要好的朋友，一直互通电话。

collins.def: An example of something is a particular situation, object, or person which shows that what is being claimed is true.

example.ex: The doctors gave numerous examples of patients being expelled from hospital...
example.tran: 医生们列举了大量病人被逐出医院的实例。

example.ex: Listed below are just a few examples of some of the family benefits available.
example.tran: 下面仅例举了家庭可享受的几种福利。

collins.def: An example of a particular class of objects or styles is something that has many of the typical features of such a class or style, and that you consider clearly represents it.

example.ex: Symphonies 103 and 104 stand as perfect examples of early symphonic construction...
example.tran: 第103和104号交响曲是早期交响乐结构的典型代表。

example.ex: The plaque illustrated in Figure 1 is an example of his work at this time.
example.tran: 图1中的匾额是他这个时期的代表作。

collins.def: You use for example to introduce and emphasize something which shows that something is true.

example.ex: ...'educational toys' that are designed to promote the development of, for example, children's spatial ability...
example.tran: 旨在促进儿童发展，诸如空间能力发展的“教学玩具”

example.ex: Take, for example, the simple sentence: 'The man climbed up the hill'...
example.tran: 以The man climbed up the hill这个简单句为例。

collins.def: If you refer to a person or their behaviour as an example to other people, you mean that he or she behaves in a good or correct way that other people should copy.

example.ex: He is a model professional and an example to the younger lads...
example.tran: 他是个模范的专业人士，是年轻人的榜样。

example.ex: Their example shows us what we are all capable of.
example.tran: 他们作为榜样向我们展示了我们都能做些什么。

collins.def: In a dictionary entry, an example is a phrase or sentence which shows how a particular word is used.

example.ex: The examples are unique to this dictionary.
example.tran: 这些例证是这部词典独有的。

collins.tran: （尤指出于敬意而）学习…的榜样，以…为榜样
collins.def: If you follow someone's example, you behave in the same way as they did in the past, or in a similar way, especially because you admire them.

example.ex: Following the example set by her father, she has fulfilled her role and done her duty...
example.tran: 她以父亲为榜样，完成了任务，履行了职责。

example.ex: She should remember that she is a mother and a public figure and that others may follow her example.
example.tran: 她应该记住自己是位母亲，也是位公众人物，别人可能会以她为榜样。

collins.tran: 惩罚…以警戒他人;杀一儆百
collins.def: To make an example of someone who has done something wrong means to punish them severely as a warning to other people not to do the same thing.

example.ex: Let us at least see our courts make an example of these despicable criminals.
example.tran: 至少让我们看到法庭惩罚这些十恶不赦的罪犯以儆效尤。

collins.def: If you set an example, you encourage or inspire people by your behaviour to behave or act in a similar way.

example.ex: An officer's job was to set an example...
example.tran: 军官的职责就是树立榜样。

example.ex: He is setting an example which other aristocrats and leading Britons should follow.
example.tran: 他为其他贵族和伦敦要人们树立了榜样。

collins.def: If you expect something to happen, you believe that it will happen.

example.ex: ...a council workman who expects to lose his job in the next few weeks...
example.tran: 预计自己在接下来的几周里会丢掉工作的市政工人

example.ex: They no longer expect corporate profits to improve...
example.tran: 他们不再期待公司利润会增长。

collins.def: If you are expecting something or someone, you believe that they will be delivered to you or come to you soon, often because this has been arranged earlier.

example.ex: I am expecting several important letters but nothing has arrived...
example.tran: 我正在等几封重要的信件，可是一封都没到。

example.ex: I wasn't expecting a visitor...
example.tran: 我没想到会有人来访。

collins.tran: 要求；认为应当得到;指望
collins.def: If you expect something, or expect a person to do something, you believe that it is your right to have that thing, or the person's duty to do it for you.

example.ex: He wasn't expecting our hospitality...
example.tran: 他没有指望我们会盛情款待。

example.ex: I do expect to have some time to myself in the evenings...
example.tran: 我确实希望晚上能有些属于自己的时间。

collins.def: If you tell someone not to expect something, you mean that the thing is unlikely to happen as they have planned or imagined, and they should not hope that it will.

example.ex: Don't expect an instant cure...
example.tran: 别指望立即治愈。

example.ex: You cannot expect to like all the people you will work with...
example.tran: 不要指望你会喜欢所有和你共事的人。

collins.def: If you say that a woman is expecting a baby, or that she is expecting, you mean that she is pregnant.

example.ex: She was expecting another baby...
example.tran: 她又怀孕了。

example.ex: I hear Dawn's expecting again.
example.tran: 我听说唐又怀孕了。

collins.def: You say 'I expect' to suggest that a statement is probably correct, or a natural consequence of the present situation, although you have no definite knowledge.

example.ex: I expect you can guess what follows...
example.tran: 我想你能猜出接下来发生了什么。

example.ex: I expect you're tired...
example.tran: 我想你累了。

collins.tran: 你还想指望什么；那有什么大惊小怪的
collins.def: You can say 'What can you expect?' or 'What do you expect?' to emphasize that there is nothing surprising about a situation or a person's behaviour, especially if you find this disappointing.

example.ex: It tastes artificial, but at that price what can you expect?...
example.tran: 尝起来像是假的，但是就这个价格你还想指望什么？

example.ex: If a guy hunts and owns guns, what do you expect?
example.tran: 如果一个人打猎而且还有自己的枪，你还想指望什么？

collins.def: Experience is knowledge or skill in a particular job or activity, which you have gained because you have done that job or activity for a long time.

example.ex: He has also had managerial experience on every level...
example.tran: 他还有各个层级的管理经验。

example.ex: He's counting on his mother to take care of the twins for him; she's had plenty of experience with them.
example.tran: 他靠母亲帮忙照顾他的双胞胎;她在这方面很有经验。

collins.tran: （组成个人生活或形成个性的）经历，阅历
collins.def: Experience is used to refer to the past events, knowledge, and feelings that make up someone's life or character.

example.ex: I should not be in any danger here, but experience has taught me caution...
example.tran: 我在这里应该不会有任何危险，但是经验告诉我要小心。

example.ex: She had learned from experience to take little rests in between her daily routine...
example.tran: 经验告诉她在日常生活中要不时休息一下。

collins.def: An experience is something that you do or that happens to you, especially something important that affects you.

example.ex: Moving had become a common experience for me...
example.tran: 搬家对我而言已经成了常事。

example.ex: His only experience of gardening so far proved immensely satisfying...
example.tran: 到目前为止他唯一的一次园艺经历非常令人满意。

collins.def: If you experience a particular situation, you are in that situation or it happens to you.

example.ex: We had never experienced this kind of holiday before and had no idea what to expect...
example.tran: 我们以前从未有过这样的假期，不知道会怎么样。

example.ex: British business is now experiencing a severe recession.
example.tran: 英国商业现在正经历严重的衰退。

collins.def: If you experience a feeling, you feel it or are affected by it.

example.ex: Widows seem to experience more distress than do widowers.
example.tran: 寡妇似乎比鳏夫更痛苦。

collins.def: Your eyes are the parts of your body with which you see.

example.ex: I opened my eyes and looked...
example.tran: 我睁开眼睛看了看。

example.ex: Maria's eyes filled with tears.
example.tran: 玛丽亚的眼中噙满了泪水。

collins.def: If you eye someone or something in a particular way, you look at them carefully in that way.

example.ex: Sally eyed Claire with interest...
example.tran: 萨莉饶有兴趣地打量着克莱尔。

example.ex: We eyed each other thoughtfully...
example.tran: 我们若有所思地打量着对方。

collins.def: You use eye when you are talking about a person's ability to judge things or about the way in which they are considering or dealing with things.

example.ex: William was a man of discernment, with an eye for quality...
example.tran: 威廉是个有鉴赏力的人，对于品质的优劣很有眼光。

example.ex: Their chief negotiator turned his critical eye on the United States...
example.tran: 他们的首席谈判代表以批判的眼光看美国。

collins.def: An electric eye or infrared eye is a device which can recognize the presence of people or objects by detecting the light or heat coming from them.

example.ex: An infra-red eye is said to detect the movement of any animal within an angle of 110 degrees at up to 10 metres.
example.tran: 据说红外眼能够探测到110度角范围内远至10米的任何动物的活动。

collins.def: People sometimes talk about the eye of the camera when they are talking about something being filmed or photographed, or the way something appears in a photograph or film.

example.ex: I was again using the cold, unflinching eye of the camera to probe a sick society.
example.tran: 我再次通过照相机冷漠、坚定的镜头去探究这个病态的社会。

collins.def: An eye on a potato is one of the dark spots from which new stems grow.
An eye is a small metal loop which a hook fits into, as a fastening on a piece of clothing.
The eye of a needle is the small hole at one end which the thread passes through.
The eye of a storm, tornado, or hurricane is the centre of it.

example.ex: The eye of the hurricane hit Florida just south of Miami.
example.tran: 飓风的风眼袭击了佛罗里达州迈阿密正南部。

collins.def: If you say that something happens before your eyes ,in front of your eyes, or under your eyes, you are emphasizing that it happens where you can see it clearly and often implying that it is surprising or unpleasant.

example.ex: A lot of them died in front of our eyes...
example.tran: 他们中有很多人就死在我们眼前。

example.ex: We are under the eyes of both sides all the time.
example.tran: 我们一直都在双方的密切监视下。

collins.def: If you cast your eye or run your eye over something, you look at it or read it quickly.

example.ex: I would be grateful if he could cast an expert eye over it and tell me what he thought of it...
example.tran: 如果他能够以专家的眼光浏览一下，告诉我他的想法，我将非常感激。

example.ex: If you run your eye up and down these columns you will see that the value of some of them declined.
example.tran: 你把这几列上下扫视一遍，就会发现其中有些贬值了。

collins.tran: 闯入眼帘；突然引起…的注意
collins.def: If something catches your eye, you suddenly notice it.

example.ex: As she turned back, a movement across the lawn caught her eye.
example.tran: 她转过身，瞥见有个东西从草地上穿了过去。

collins.def: If you catch someone's eye, you do something to attract their attention, so that you can speak to them.

example.ex: I tried to catch Chrissie's eye to find out what she was playing at.
example.tran: 我努力吸引克丽茜的注意，想知道她在搞什么名堂。

collins.def: To clap eyes on someone or something, or set or lay eyes on them, means to see them.

example.ex: That's probably the most bare and bleak island I've ever had the misfortune to clap eyes on...
example.tran: 那可能是我不幸看到的最光秃、最荒凉的岛屿。

example.ex: What was he doing when you last set eyes on him?
example.tran: 你上次见到他时他在做什么？

collins.tran: 与…目光交流/躲避…的目光
collins.def: If you make eye contact with someone, you look at them at the same time as they look at you, so that you are both aware that you are looking at each other. If you avoid eye contact with someone, you deliberately do not look straight at them because you feel awkward or embarrassed.

example.ex: She was looking at me across the room, and we made eye contact several times...
example.tran: 她从房间的另一头看着我，我们有几次目光交汇。

example.ex: I spent a fruitless ten minutes walking up and down the high street, desperately avoiding eye contact with passers-by.
example.tran: 我在大街上一无所获来回走了10分钟，其间还要拼命地躲避路人的目光。

collins.def: If you close your eyes to something bad or if you shut your eyes to it, you ignore it.

example.ex: Most governments must simply be shutting their eyes to the problem.
example.tran: 大多数政府肯定会索性对那个问题视而不见。

collins.def: If you cry your eyes out, you cry very hard.

collins.tran: 以眼还眼;以牙还牙;一报还一报
collins.def: You say 'an eye for an eye' or 'an eye for an eye and a tooth for a tooth' to refer to the idea that people should be punished according to the way in which they offended, for example if they hurt someone, they should be hurt equally badly in return.

example.ex: ...a very simple punishment code based on an-eye-for-an-eye.
example.tran: 非常简单的以眼还眼的惩罚法则

collins.def: If there is something as far as the eye can see, there is a lot of it and you cannot see anything else beyond it.

example.ex: Here, massive dunes stretched in every direction as far as the eye could see...
example.tran: 在这里，巨大的沙丘向四面八方延绵不绝，一望无垠。

example.ex: There are pine trees as far as the eye can see.
example.tran: 放眼望去，除了松树还是松树。

collins.def: If you say that someone has an eye for something, you mean that they are good at noticing it or making judgments about it.

example.ex: Susan has a keen eye for detail, so each dress is beautifully finished off.
example.tran: 苏珊对细节精益求精，所以每件衣裙都做得非常漂亮。

collins.def: You use expressions such as in his eyes or to her eyes to indicate that you are reporting someone's opinion and that other people might think differently.

example.ex: The other serious problem in the eyes of the new government is communalism...
example.tran: 在新政府看来，另一个严重问题是社群主义。

example.ex: Richard Dorrington was, in their eyes, a very sensible and reliable man...
example.tran: 在他们眼中，理查德·多林顿是个非常可靠的明白人。

collins.tran: 留意;瞪大眼睛;密切注意
collins.def: If you keep your eyes open or keep an eye out for someone or something, you watch for them carefully.

example.ex: I ask the mounted patrol to keep their eyes open...
example.tran: 我让骑警瞪大眼睛。

example.ex: You and your friends keep an eye out—if there's any trouble we'll make a break for it.
example.tran: 你和你的朋友要留意——一有问题，我们就跑。

collins.def: If you tell someone to keep their eyes peeled for something, you are telling them to watch very carefully for it.
If you keep an eye on something or someone, you watch them carefully, for example to make sure that they are satisfactory or safe, or not causing trouble.

example.ex: I'm sure you will appreciate that we must keep a careful eye on all our running costs...
example.tran: 我们必须密切关注所有的运营成本，这一点我想您肯定会赞同。

example.ex: I went for a run there, keeping an eye on the children the whole time...
example.tran: 我去那里跑步，期间一直留意着孩子们。

collins.tran: 含情脉脉地看着；向…抛媚眼
collins.def: If you make eyes at someone, you look at them in a way which shows that you find them attractive and which is intended to get their attention.
You say 'there's more to this than meets the eye' when you think a situation is not as simple as it seems to be.

example.ex: This whole business is very puzzling. There is a lot more to it than meets the eye.
example.tran: 整件事非常令人费解，远比看起来复杂。

collins.tran: （尤指令人吃惊的或印象深刻的事情）映入…的眼帘，呈现在…眼前
collins.def: If something, especially something surprising or impressive, meets your eyes, you see it.

example.ex: The first sight that met my eyes on reaching the front door was the church enveloped in flames.
example.tran: 赶到前门时，我第一眼看到的就是被大火吞没的教堂。

collins.tran: 所有目光都聚集在…上；所有人都在关注
collins.def: If you say that all eyes are on something or that the eyes of the world are on something, you mean that everyone is paying careful attention to it and what will happen.

example.ex: All eyes will be on tomorrow's vote...
example.tran: 所有目光都将聚集在明天的投票上。

example.ex: The eyes of the world were now on the police.
example.tran: 这时所有的目光都聚焦在警方。

collins.def: If someone has their eye on you, they are watching you carefully to see what you do.

example.ex: As the boat plodded into British waters and up the English Channel, Customs had their eye on her.
example.tran: 那艘船缓慢驶入英国水域，沿英吉利海峡向北时，海关一直密切关注着它。

collins.def: If you have your eye on something, you want to have it.

example.ex: ...if you're saving up for a new outfit you've had your eye on.
example.tran: 如果你在攒钱买一套你看中的新衣服

collins.def: If you say that you did something with your eyes open or with your eyes wide open, you mean that you knew about the problems and difficulties that you were likely to have.

example.ex: We want all our members to undertake this trip responsibly, with their eyes open.
example.tran: 我们希望所有成员都能够负责地开始这次旅程，做到心中有数。

collins.def: If something opens your eyes, it makes you aware that something is different from the way that you thought it was.

example.ex: Watching your child explore the world about her can open your eyes to delights long forgotten.
example.tran: 看着孩子探索她身边的世界能让你体会到早已忘记的快乐。

collins.def: If you see eye to eye with someone, you agree with them and have the same opinions and views.

example.ex: Yuriko saw eye to eye with Yul on almost every aspect of the production...
example.tran: 百合子和尤尔几乎在生产的每个方面都看法一致。

example.ex: We've never seen eye to eye.
example.tran: 我们的看法从来就没有一致过。

collins.def: If you say that someone or something is at the eye of the storm, you mean they are the main subject of a public disagreement.

example.ex: The bowlers at the eye of the storm were nowhere in evidence.
example.tran: 处于风口浪尖的那些投手不见了踪影。

example.ex: ...the minister in the eye of the storm.
example.tran: 备受指责的那位部长

collins.def: When you take your eyes off the thing you have been watching or looking at, you stop looking at it.

example.ex: She took her eyes off the road to glance at me...
example.tran: 她把视线从公路上移开，扫了我一眼。

example.ex: Nina couldn't take her eyes off Philip.
example.tran: 尼娜无法将她的视线从菲利普身上移开。

collins.def: If someone sees or considers something through your eyes, they consider it in the way that you do, from your point of view.

example.ex: She tried to see things through his eyes...
example.tran: 她尽力从他的视角看问题。

example.ex: The story is told through the eyes of Inspector Simon Potter.
example.tran: 这个故事是从西蒙·波特巡官的视角讲述的。

collins.tran: 深陷于…中；（常指）忙得不可开交
collins.def: If you say that you are up to your eyes in something, you are emphasizing that you have a lot of it to deal with, and often that you are very busy.

example.ex: I am up to my eyes in work...
example.tran: 我工作忙得不可开交。

example.ex: The women are just up to their eyes in debt.
example.tran: 那些女人债台高筑。

collins.def: Your face is the front part of your head from your chin to the top of your forehead, where your mouth, eyes, nose, and other features are.

example.ex: He rolled down his window and stuck his face out...
example.tran: 他摇下车窗，把头探了出去。

example.ex: A strong wind was blowing right in my face...
example.tran: 一阵劲风迎面吹来。

collins.def: If your face is happy, sad, or serious, for example, the expression on your face shows that you are happy, sad, or serious.

example.ex: He was walking around with a sad face...
example.tran: 他四处走着，神色哀伤。

example.ex: The priest frowned into the light, his face puzzled.
example.tran: 神父在亮光下皱起了眉头，一脸疑惑。

collins.tran: 崖面;山侧;(建筑物的)墙面
collins.def: The face of a cliff, mountain, or building is a vertical surface or side of it.

example.ex: ...the north face of the Eiger...
example.tran: 艾格尔山北坡

example.ex: He scrambled 200 feet up the cliff face.
example.tran: 他沿着崖面向上攀登了200英尺。

collins.def: The face of a clock or watch is the surface with the numbers or hands on it, which shows the time.

collins.tran: (地区、机构或活动领域的)外观，面貌
collins.def: If you say that the face of an area, institution, or field of activity is changing, you mean its appearance or nature is changing.

example.ex: ...the changing face of the British countryside...
example.tran: 英国乡村的日新月异

example.ex: This would change the face of Malaysian politics.
example.tran: 这将改变马来西亚的政治面貌。

collins.def: If you refer to something as the particular face of an activity, belief, or system, you mean that it is one particular aspect of it, in contrast to other aspects.

example.ex: Brothels, she insists, are the acceptable face of prostitution...
example.tran: 她坚持认为，妓院是卖淫可为人接受的一种形式。

example.ex: Who ever thought people would see Arsenal as the acceptable face of football?
example.tran: 谁会想到人们会认为足球之道可如阿森纳队呢？

collins.def: If you lose face, you do something which makes you appear weak and makes people respect or admire you less. If you do something in order to save face, you do it in order to avoid appearing weak and losing people's respect or admiration.

example.ex: England doesn't want a war but it doesn't want to lose face...
example.tran: 英格兰不想打仗，但也不想丢面子。

example.ex: To cancel the airport would mean a loss of face for the present governor...
example.tran: 撤销机场对现任州长来说将是件丢脸的事情。

collins.tran: (计划之事出乎意料地)告吹，砸锅，泡汤
collins.def: If something that you have planned blows up in your face, it goes wrong unexpectedly, with the result that you suffer.

example.ex: Can't you see this could blow up in your face?
example.tran: 你难道看不出这事会砸锅？

collins.tran: 徒劳拼命地干;徒劳无功
collins.def: If you say that someone can do something until they are blue in the face, you are emphasizing that however much they do it, it will not make any difference.

example.ex: You can criticise him until you're blue in the face, but you'll never change his personality.
example.tran: 即使你苦口婆心地批评他，也改变不了他的个性。

collins.def: If someone or something is face down, their face or front points downwards. If they are face up, their face or front points upwards.

example.ex: All the time Stephen was lying face down and unconscious in the bath tub...
example.tran: 斯蒂芬一直脸朝下趴在浴缸里，不省人事。

example.ex: Charles laid down his cards face up.
example.tran: 查尔斯将手中的牌摊了出来。

collins.def: You can use the expression 'on the face of the earth' to mean 'in the whole world', when you are emphasizing a statement that you are making or making a very exaggerated statement.

example.ex: No human being on the face of the earth could do anything worse than what he did.
example.tran: 世界上再没有人能做出比他更坏的事情来。

collins.def: If you say that something will be wiped off the face of the earth or disappear from the face of the earth, you mean that it will stop existing.

example.ex: If a nuclear war breaks out, every living thing will be wiped off the face of the Earth.
example.tran: 如果爆发核战争，地球上的所有生物都将灭绝。

collins.def: If you come face to face with someone, you meet them and can talk to them or look at them directly.

example.ex: We were strolling into the town when we came face to face with Jacques DuBois...
example.tran: 我们信步向镇子走去，迎面碰上雅克·杜波依斯。

example.ex: It was the first face-to-face meeting between the two men.
example.tran: 这是两人首次当面会晤。

collins.def: If you come face to face with a difficulty or reality, you cannot avoid it and have to deal with it.

example.ex: Eventually, he came face to face with discrimination again...
example.tran: 最终，他又一次遭遇歧视。

example.ex: I was gradually being brought face to face with the fact that I had very little success.
example.tran: 我渐渐开始面对这个事实，那就是我几乎一事无成。

collins.tran: 完全违背;与(公认的观念或规则)相冲突
collins.def: If an action or belief flies in the face of accepted ideas or rules, it seems to completely oppose or contradict them.

example.ex: ...scientific principles that seem to fly in the face of common sense...
example.tran: 似乎有悖常识的科学原理

example.ex: He said that the decision flew in the face of natural justice.
example.tran: 他说这个决定有悖天理。

collins.def: If you take a particular action or attitude in the face of a problem or difficulty, you respond to that problem or difficulty in that way.

example.ex: The Prime Minister has called for national unity in the face of the violent anti-government protests...
example.tran: 面对强烈的反政府抗议，首相呼吁全国团结一致。

example.ex: Roosevelt was defiant in the face of the bad news.
example.tran: 对这个坏消息，罗斯福毫不理会。

collins.def: If someone laughs in your face, they are openly disrespectful towards you.

example.ex: With juveniles under eighteen, there's little we can do. We can't keep them in custody. They just laugh in your face.
example.tran: 对18岁以下的青少年，我们几乎无计可施。我们不能拘留他们。他们只会公然嘲笑你。

collins.tran: 不高兴的神情;严肃的神情;板起的脸
collins.def: If you have a long face, you look very unhappy or serious.

example.ex: He came to me with a very long face.
example.tran: 他拉长了脸来找我。

collins.tran: 做鬼脸,扮鬼脸（英国英语中亦使用pull a face）
collins.def: If you make a face, you show a feeling such as dislike or disgust by putting an exaggerated expression on your face, for example by sticking out your tongue. In British English, you can also say pull a face .

example.ex: Opening the door, she made a face at the musty smell...
example.tran: 她打开门后闻到一股难闻的霉味，不禁做了个鬼脸。

example.ex: Kathryn pulled a face at Thomas behind his back.
example.tran: 凯瑟琳在托马斯身后冲他做了个鬼脸。

collins.def: You say on the face of it when you are describing how something seems when it is first considered, in order to suggest that people's opinion may change when they know or think more about the subject.

example.ex: On the face of it that seems to make sense. But the figures don't add up...
example.tran: 乍一看,似乎讲得通，但这些数字对不起来。

example.ex: It is, on the face of it, difficult to see how the West could radically change its position.
example.tran: 初看起来，很难理解西方为何会立场突变。

collins.tran: （对坏情况）显得满不在乎，做出无所谓的样子(美国英语中亦作 put on a good face)
collins.def: If you put a brave face on a bad situation or put on a brave face, you try not to show how disappointed or upset you are about the situation. In American English you can also say put on a good face.

example.ex: Friends will see you are putting on a brave face and might assume you've got over your grief...
example.tran: 朋友们看到你一脸轻松，也许会以为你已经走出悲伤。

example.ex: Scientists are putting a good face on the troubles.
example.tran: 科学家们对这些困难似乎不以为意。

collins.def: You can say that someone has set their face against something to indicate that they are opposed to it, especially when you want to suggest that they are wrong.

example.ex: This Government has set its face against putting up income tax.
example.tran: 这届政府执意反对提高所得税。

collins.tran: (不受欢迎地、不情愿地或再次)露面，到场
collins.def: If you show your face somewhere, you go there and see people, although you are not welcome, are rather unwilling to go, or have not been there for some time.

example.ex: If she shows her face again back in Massachusetts she'll find a warrant for her arrest waiting...
example.tran: 如果她重又在马萨诸塞州露面，等待她的将是一纸拘捕令。

example.ex: I felt I ought to show my face at her father's funeral.
example.tran: 我觉得我应该去参加她父亲的葬礼。

collins.def: If you manage to keep a straight face, you manage to look serious, although you want to laugh.

example.ex: What went through Tom's mind I can't imagine, but he did manage to keep a straight face...
example.tran: 不知道汤姆想到了啥，但他确实忍住没笑。

example.ex: You have to wonder how anyone could say that seriously and with a straight face.
example.tran: 你一定会惊奇怎么会有人能绷着脸、一本正经地说出那些话。

collins.def: If you say something to someone's face you say it openly in their presence.

example.ex: Her opponent called her a liar to her face.
example.tran: 她的对手当着她面说她是撒谎精。

collins.def: If a feeling is written all over your face or is written across your face, it is very obvious to other people from your expression.

example.ex: Relief and gratitude were written all over his face...
example.tran: 他一脸释然与感激。

example.ex: I could just see the pain written across her face.
example.tran: 我都可以看出他脸上写满了痛苦。

collins.def: You use the fact that after some verbs or prepositions, especially in expressions such as in view of the fact that ,apart from the fact that, and despite the fact that, to link the verb or preposition with a clause.

example.ex: His chances do not seem good in view of the fact that the Chief Prosecutor has already voiced his public disapproval...
example.tran: 鉴于检察长已公开表示反对，他的机会看来不大了。

example.ex: Despite the fact that the disease is so prevalent, treatment is still far from satisfactory...
example.tran: 尽管疾病肆虐，治疗却远不尽如人意。

collins.tran: (用于强调或当从句为句子主语时)
collins.def: You use the fact that instead of a simple that-clause either for emphasis or because the clause is the subject of your sentence.

example.ex: My family now accepts the fact that I don't eat sugar or bread...
example.tran: 我的家人现在都接受了我不吃糖和面包这件事。

example.ex: The fact that he had left her of his own accord proved to me that everything he'd said was true.
example.tran: 他主动离开她这件事向我证明了他所言句句属实。

collins.def: You use in fact ,in actual fact, or in point of fact to indicate that you are giving more detailed information about what you have just said.

example.ex: We've had a pretty bad time while you were away. In fact, we very nearly split up this time...
example.tran: 你不在的时候我们相处得很不愉快，确切地说这次我们差点就分手了。

example.ex: He apologised as soon as he realised what he had done. In actual fact he wrote a nice little note to me...
example.tran: 意识到自己的所作所为后他马上就道歉了，而且还给我写了一张温馨的小条儿。

collins.tran: (用于修正、引出相反意见或对比等)事实上，其实
collins.def: You use in fact ,in actual fact, or in point of fact to introduce or draw attention to a comment that modifies, contradicts, or contrasts with a previous statement.

example.ex: That sounds rather simple, but in fact it's very difficult...
example.tran: 那听来简单，但实际上很难。

example.ex: They complained that they had been trapped inside the police station, but in fact most were seen escaping over the adjacent roofs to safety in nearby buildings...
example.tran: 他们抱怨说被困在了警察局里，但实际上，有人看见他们大多数人通过毗邻的屋顶，安全地逃到了附近的建筑物内。

collins.def: When you refer to something as a fact or as fact, you mean that you think it is true or correct.

example.ex: ...a statement of verifiable historical fact...
example.tran: 对有据可查的史实的讲述

example.ex: How much was fact and how much fancy no one knew.
example.tran: 几多虚实，无人知晓。

collins.def: Facts are pieces of information that can be discovered.

example.ex: There is so much information you can almost effortlessly find the facts for yourself...
example.tran: 资料这么多，你几乎可以毫不费力地找到事实真相。

example.ex: His opponent swamped him with facts and figures...
example.tran: 他的对手抛出精确的资料和数据，使他难以招架。

collins.tran: 确切地说;事实上;恰恰相反
collins.def: You use as a matter of fact to introduce a statement that gives more details about what has just been said, or an explanation of it, or something that contrasts with it.

example.ex: It's not that difficult. As a matter of fact, it's quite easy...
example.tran: 这并不那么困难，实际上，容易得很。

example.ex: 'I guess you haven't eaten yet.' — 'As a matter of fact, I have,' said Hunter.
example.tran: “我想你还没吃吧？”“正好相反，我已经吃了。”亨特说道。

collins.tran: (强调对真实性确信无疑)确确实实，的的确确
collins.def: If you say that you know something for a fact, you are emphasizing that you are completely certain that it is true.

example.ex: I know for a fact that baby corn is very expensive in Europe...
example.tran: 我知道玉米笋在欧洲的确价格不菲。

example.ex: I know for a fact that Graham has kept in close touch with Alan.
example.tran: 我知道格雷厄姆确实与艾伦保持着密切的联系。

collins.tran: (用于引出对所说重点的概括或陈述，或引起注意)总而言之，最重要的是，关键是
collins.def: You use the fact is or the fact of the matter is to introduce and draw attention to a summary or statement of the most important point about what you have been saying.

example.ex: The fact is blindness hadn't stopped the children doing many of the things that sighted children enjoy...
example.tran: 实际上，失明并没有妨碍这些孩子去做健全孩子喜欢做的事情。

example.ex: The fact of the matter is that student finances are stretched.
example.tran: 关键是奖学金有限。

collins.tran: (用于强调必须接受某种情况)必须承认，无可否认
collins.def: You say the fact remains that something is the case when you want to emphasize that the situation must be accepted.

example.ex: The fact remains that inflation, however you measure it, is unacceptably high...
example.tran: 必须承认，无论怎么衡量，通货膨胀率都高得难以接受。

example.ex: His admirers claim that he came to power perfectly legally, but the fact remains that he did so by exploiting an illegal situation.
example.tran: 他的崇拜者称他的上台是完全合法的，但必须承认，他是利用了一次非法事件上台的。

collins.tran: (用以强调所说内容的真实性或正确性)事实就是如此，本来就是这样，说得一点不错
collins.def: You say and that's a fact to emphasize the truth or correctness of a statement that you have just made.

example.ex: We aren't playing well as a team, and that's a fact...
example.tran: 我们作为一个球队打得并不好，事实就是如此。

example.ex: He is a dull writer and that's a fact.
example.tran: 他写的东西很没意思，真的。

collins.def: You say is that a fact? as a response to a statement which you find surprising, interesting, or unlikely.

example.ex: 'I'm still staff colonel.' — 'Is that a fact?'
example.tran: “我还是参谋上校。”——“不会吧？”

collins.def: If you fail to do something that you were trying to do, you are unable to do it or do not succeed in doing it.

example.ex: The Workers' Party failed to win a single governorship...
example.tran: 劳工党连一个州长职位也未能赢得。

example.ex: He failed in his attempt to take control of the company...
example.tran: 他试图掌控公司，但以失败告终。

collins.tran: (活动、尝试、计划等)失败，不成功
collins.def: If an activity, attempt, or plan fails, it is not successful.

example.ex: We tried to develop plans for them to get along, which all failed miserably...
example.tran: 我们试图计划让他们好好相处，但均以惨败告终。

example.ex: He was afraid the revolution they had started would fail...
example.tran: 他担心他们发起的大变革会遭遇失败。

collins.def: If someone or something fails to do a particular thing that they should have done, they do not do it.

example.ex: Some schools fail to set any homework...
example.tran: 有些学校没有布置任何作业。

example.ex: He failed to file tax returns for 1982...
example.tran: 他没有呈报 1982 年的纳税申报单。

collins.def: If something fails, it stops working properly, or does not do what it is supposed to do.

example.ex: The lights mysteriously failed, and we stumbled around in complete darkness...
example.tran: 灯不知怎么地不亮了，我们在一片黑暗中跌跌撞撞地走着。

example.ex: In fact many food crops failed because of the drought.
example.tran: 实际上，因为干旱，很多粮食作物歉收。

collins.tran: (企业)倒闭，破产;(机构)解体;(体系)崩溃
collins.def: If a business, organization, or system fails, it becomes unable to continue in operation or in existence.

example.ex: So far this year, 104 banks have failed.
example.tran: 今年到目前为止，已有 104 家银行倒闭。

example.ex: ...a failed hotel business...
example.tran: 破产的酒店

collins.tran: (健康状况、体质等)衰弱，虚弱，衰退
collins.def: If something such as your health or a physical quality is failing, it is becoming gradually weaker or less effective.

example.ex: He was 58, and his health was failing rapidly...
example.tran: 他 58 岁，身体正在迅速衰老。

example.ex: Here in the hills, the light failed more quickly...
example.tran: 在山区这儿，天黑得更快。

collins.def: If someone fails you, they do not do what you had expected or trusted them to do.

example.ex: We waited twenty-one years, don't fail us now.
example.tran: 我们等了 21 年了，如今不要让我们失望。

example.ex: ...communities who feel that the political system has failed them.
example.tran: 对此套政治体制感到失望的群体

collins.def: If someone fails in their duty or fails in their responsibilities, they do not do everything that they have a duty or a responsibility to do.

example.ex: Lawyers are accused of failing in their duties to advise clients of their rights...
example.tran: 律师们被控未尽到告知当事人其正当权利的职责。

example.ex: If we did not report what was happening in the country, we would be failing in our duty.
example.tran: 如果我们没有报道这个国家正在发生的事情，我们就没有尽到自己的责任。

collins.tran: (品质或能力)有负于;(使)不如愿;不够
collins.def: If a quality or ability that you have fails you, or if it fails, it is not good enough in a particular situation to enable you to do what you want to do.

example.ex: For once, the artist's fertile imagination failed him...
example.tran: 这位画家丰富的想象力曾一度枯竭。

example.ex: Their courage failed a few steps short and they came running back.
example.tran: 还差几步他们却胆怯了，又跑回来了。

collins.def: If someone fails a test, examination, or course, they perform badly in it and do not reach the standard that is required.

example.ex: I lived in fear of failing my end-of-term exams.
example.tran: 我总是担心期末考试不及格。

collins.def: If someone fails you in a test, examination, or course, they judge that you have not reached a high enough standard in it.

example.ex: ...the two men who had failed him during his first year of law school.
example.tran: 在法学院一年级时让他不及格的两个人

collins.tran: 如果其他一切都不奏效的话;假如其他都行不通
collins.def: You say if all else fails to suggest what could be done in a certain situation if all the other things you have tried are unsuccessful.

example.ex: If all else fails, I could always drive a truck.
example.tran: 如果其他都不行，我总还可以开卡车。

collins.tran: (用以表示不赞成)不明白，看不出
collins.def: You can use I fail to see or I fail to understand in order to introduce a statement which indicates that you do not agree with what someone has said or done.

example.ex: That's how it was in my day and I fail to see why it should be different now.
example.tran: 我那时候就是这样的，我搞不懂为什么现在非要弄得不一样。

collins.def: You use without fail to emphasize that something always happens.

example.ex: He attended every meeting without fail.
example.tran: 他逢会必到。

collins.tran: (用以强调命令或承诺)一定，必须
collins.def: You use without fail to emphasize an order or a promise.

example.ex: On the 30th you must without fail hand in some money for Alex...
example.tran: 30 日那天你必须替亚历克斯交一些钱。

example.ex: Tomorrow without fail he would be at the old riverside warehouse.
example.tran: 明天他一定会在河边的旧仓库里。

collins.def: If someone or something falls, they move quickly downwards onto or towards the ground, by accident or because of a natural force.

example.ex: Her father fell into the sea after a massive heart attack...
example.tran: 她父亲在一次严重的心脏病发作后坠入海中。

example.ex: Prince Charles has again fallen from his horse...
example.tran: 查尔斯王子又一次从马上摔了下来。

collins.def: If a person or structure that is standing somewhere falls, they move from their upright position, so that they are then lying on the ground.

example.ex: The woman gripped the shoulders of her man to stop herself from falling...
example.tran: 这个女人抓住丈夫的肩膀，以免摔倒。

example.ex: We watched buildings fall on top of people and pets...
example.tran: 我们看到一幢幢大楼倒塌，砸在人和宠物身上。

collins.def: When rain or snow falls, it comes down from the sky.

example.ex: Winds reached up to 100mph in some places with an inch of rain falling within 15 minutes.
example.tran: 风力在一些地方达到了每小时 100 英里，15 分钟内降雨量达一英寸。

collins.tran: (常因疲乏)一头倒下，一下躺倒
collins.def: If you fall somewhere, you allow yourself to drop there in a hurried or disorganized way, often because you are very tired.

example.ex: Totally exhausted, he tore his clothes off and fell into bed...
example.tran: 他疲惫至极，扯下衣服，一头倒在床上。

example.ex: In the morning I got as far as the sofa and fell on to it.
example.tran: 早晨，我只走到沙发那儿，就一下子倒在上面。

collins.tran: (数量)减少;(价值)下降;(力量)减弱
collins.def: If something falls, it decreases in amount, value, or strength.

example.ex: Output will fall by 6%...
example.tran: 产量将减少 6％。

example.ex: Her weight fell to under seven stones...
example.tran: 她的体重减到了 7 英石以下。

collins.def: If a powerful or successful person falls, they suddenly lose their power or position.

example.ex: There's a danger of the government falling because it will lose its majority...
example.tran: 政府将因失去其占多数的优势而有倒台的危险。

example.ex: The moment Mrs Thatcher fell from power has left a lasting imprint on the world's memory.
example.tran: 撒切尔夫人倒台的那一刻在世人的记忆中留下了永久的印痕。

collins.def: If a place falls in a war or election, an enemy army or a different political party takes control of it.

example.ex: Croatian army troops retreated from northern Bosnia and the area fell to the Serbs...
example.tran: 克罗地亚军队从波斯尼亚北部撤军后，该地区落入塞尔维亚人手里。

example.ex: With the announcement 'Paphos has fallen!' a cheer went up from the assembled soldiers.
example.tran: 随着一声宣告：“帕福斯陷落啦！”，聚集在一起的士兵爆发出一阵欢呼声。

collins.def: If someone falls in battle, they are killed.

example.ex: Another wave of troops followed the first, running past those who had fallen.
example.tran: 又一批士兵跟着第一批士兵从阵亡者身边跑过。

collins.def: You can use fall to show that someone or something passes into another state. For example, if someone falls ill, they become ill, and if something falls into disrepair, it is then in a state of disrepair.

example.ex: It is almost impossible to visit Florida without falling in love with the state...
example.tran: 去佛罗里达观光而不爱上这个州几乎不可能。

example.ex: 'Business to Business' was taken over by another company after it fell into debt...
example.tran: 《致富》债务缠身，被另一家公司收购。

collins.def: If you say that something or someone falls into a particular group or category, you mean that they belong in that group or category.

example.ex: The problems generally fall into two categories...
example.tran: 问题大致分成两类。

example.ex: Both women fall into the highest-risk group.
example.tran: 两个女人都属于高危人群。

collins.def: If the responsibility or blame for something falls on someone, they have to take the responsibility or the blame for it.

example.ex: That responsibility falls on the local office of the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees...
example.tran: 那由联合国高级难民署的地方分部负责。

example.ex: A vastly disproportionate burden falls on women for child care...
example.tran: 照料孩子的重担落在了女性身上。

collins.def: If silence or a feeling of sadness or tiredness falls on a group of people, they become silent, sad, or tired.

example.ex: The bus was stopped and silence fell on the passengers as the police checked identity cards.
example.tran: 公交车被拦住了，警察检查身份证时，乘客们鸦雀无声。

collins.tran: (庆典或特别事件)在，适逢(某日)
collins.def: If a celebration or other special event falls on a particular day or date, it happens to be on that day or date.

example.ex: ...the oddly named Quasimodo Sunday which falls on the first Sunday after Easter.
example.tran: 适逢复活节后第一个星期天的名字古怪的“卸白衣主日”

collins.def: When light or shadow falls on something, it covers it.

example.ex: Nancy, out of the corner of her eye, saw the shadow that suddenly fell across the doorway.
example.tran: 南希从眼角的余光里看见突然有个影子落在门道上。

collins.def: If someone's hair or a garment falls in a certain way, it hangs downwards in that way.

example.ex: ...a slender boy with black hair falling across his forehead.
example.tran: 一个身材颀长的男孩儿，黑发垂在额上

collins.def: If you say that someone's eyes fell on something, you mean they suddenly noticed it.

example.ex: As he laid the flowers on the table, his eye fell upon a note in Grace's handwriting.
example.tran: 他把花放在桌上时，目光落在一张写有格雷斯笔迹的字条上。

collins.def: When night or darkness falls, night begins and it becomes dark.

example.ex: As darkness fell outside, they sat down to eat at long tables.
example.tran: 屋外夜幕降临，他们坐到长桌旁开始吃饭。

collins.def: You can refer to a waterfall as the falls .

example.ex: ...panoramic views of the falls.
example.tran: 瀑布的全景

example.ex: ...Niagara Falls.
example.tran: 尼亚加拉瀑布

collins.def: Fall is the season between summer and winter when the weather becomes cooler.

example.ex: He was elected judge in the fall of 1991...
example.tran: 1991 年秋他当选为法官。

example.ex: The Supreme Court will not hear the case until next fall.
example.tran: 最高法院将于明年秋开始审理此案。

collins.tran: 人类堕落(基督教中指亚当、夏娃违反戒律，被上帝逐出伊甸园)
collins.def: In the Christian religion, the Fall was the occasion when Adam and Eve sinned and God made them leave the Garden of Eden.

collins.tran: (摔跤中)双肩着地;(柔道中)体落
collins.def: In some sports such as judo and wrestling, a fall is the act of throwing or forcing your opponent to the floor.

collins.tran: (板球中，三柱门)失陷(指击球员出局)
collins.def: In cricket, when a wicket falls, the team who are fielding get one of the batsmen out.

example.ex: The last seven wickets fell for ten runs.
example.tran: 最后 7 次三柱门失陷得了10分。

collins.def: If something falls open, it opens accidentally.

example.ex: By chance the book beside him fell open to St. Paul's warning to the Romans...
example.tran: 他身旁的书偶然翻开到写着圣保罗对罗马人的告诫那页。

example.ex: The basket that she was carrying fell open.
example.tran: 她提着的篮子忽然打开了。

collins.tran: 卖力;煞费苦心;不遗余力
collins.def: If you say that people are falling over themselves to do something, you mean that they are very enthusiastic about doing it, and often that you disapprove of this.

example.ex: Within days of his death those same people were falling over themselves to denounce him.
example.tran: 他尸骨未寒，还是那些人又大肆谴责起他来。

collins.tran: fall to pieces (英国英语中作 fall to bits) 同 fall apart
collins.def: To fall to pieces, or in British English to fall to bits, means the same as to fall apart .

example.ex: At that point the radio handset fell to pieces.
example.tran: 就在那一刻，无线电遥控器摔得粉碎。

collins.def: If something falls apart, it breaks into pieces because it is old or badly made.

example.ex: The work was never finished and bit by bit the building fell apart.
example.tran: 工程一直没有完工，于是楼一点点地坍塌了。

collins.def: If an organization or system falls apart, it becomes disorganized or unable to work effectively, or breaks up into its different parts.

example.ex: Europe's monetary system is falling apart...
example.tran: 欧洲货币体系正在走向瓦解。

example.ex: I've tried everything to stop our marriage falling apart.
example.tran: 我已竭尽所能去维系我们的婚姻。

collins.def: If you say that someone is falling apart, you mean that they are becoming emotionally disturbed and are unable to think calmly or to deal with the difficult or unpleasant situation that they are in.

example.ex: I was falling apart. I wasn't getting any sleep.
example.tran: 我要崩溃了，我一直都没合眼。

collins.def: If something falls away from the thing it is attached to, it breaks off.

example.ex: Officials say that one or two engines fell away from the plane shortly after takeoff.
example.tran: 官员们说飞机起飞后不久就有一两台引擎脱落了。

collins.def: If you say that land falls away, you mean it slopes downwards from a particular point.

example.ex: On either side of the tracks the ground fell away sharply.
example.tran: 跑道两侧都是很陡的斜坡。

collins.tran: (程度)降低，减弱;(数量、规模)减少，减小
collins.def: If the degree, amount, or size of something falls away, it decreases.

example.ex: His coalition may hold a clear majority but this could quickly fall away...
example.tran: 他的联盟也许会占绝对多数，但这种优势可能会很快丧失。

example.ex: Demand began to fall away.
example.tran: 需求开始减少。

collins.def: If you fall back, you move backwards a short distance away from someone or something.

example.ex: He fell back in embarrassment when he saw that Ross had no hair at all...
example.tran: 看见罗斯的光头，他尴尬地后退了几步。

example.ex: The congregation fell back from them slightly as they entered.
example.tran: 教堂会众在他们进来时稍稍往后退了退。

collins.def: If an army falls back during a battle or war, it withdraws.

example.ex: The Prussian garrison at Charleroi was falling back.
example.tran: 普鲁士驻沙勒罗瓦的部队正在撤退。

collins.def: If you fall behind, you do not make progress or move forward as fast as other people.

example.ex: Evans had rheumatic fever, missed school and fell behind...
example.tran: 伊万斯得了风湿热，没去上课，功课也落下了。

example.ex: Boris is falling behind all the top players.
example.tran: 鲍里斯落后于所有顶级选手。

collins.def: If you fall behind with something or let it fall behind, you do not do it or produce it when you should, according to an agreement or schedule.

example.ex: He faces losing his home after falling behind with the payments...
example.tran: 他没能按时付款，面临着失去房子的危险。

example.ex: Thousands of people could die because the relief effort has fallen so far behind...
example.tran: 因救援工作远远没有跟上，数千人可能面临死亡。

collins.def: If an argument, organization, or person falls down on a particular point, they are weak or unsatisfactory on that point.

example.ex: Service was outstandingly friendly and efficient, falling down on only one detail...
example.tran: 服务态度极佳，效率也蛮高，仅在一个小地方不尽人意。

example.ex: That is where his argument falls down.
example.tran: 这是他论点的薄弱之处。

collins.def: If you fall for someone, you are strongly attracted to them and start loving them.

example.ex: He was fantastically handsome — I just fell for him right away.
example.tran: 他帅极了——我一下子就爱上了他。

collins.tran: 上…的当;受…的骗;对…信以为真
collins.def: If you fall for a lie or trick, you believe it or are deceived by it.

example.ex: It was just a line to get you out here, and you fell for it!
example.tran: 那不过是为了骗你到这儿来的一句谎言，你居然信了！

example.ex: I told him I would think about it and asked for his telephone number. He didn't fall for that one.
example.tran: 我告诉他我会考虑，然后跟他要电话号码。他并没有上当。

collins.def: If a roof or ceiling falls in, it collapses and falls to the ground.

example.ex: Part of my bedroom ceiling has fallen in.
example.tran: 我卧室的天花板有些地方塌下来了。

collins.def: If you fall in behind or beside someone who is walking along, you start walking behind them or beside them.

example.ex: Prentice saw Goss fall in behind the informer.
example.tran: 普伦蒂斯看见戈斯走在密探身后。

collins.tran: 赞成，接受(思想、计划、体系)
collins.def: If you fall in with an idea, plan, or system, you accept it and do not try to change it.

example.ex: Carmen's reluctance to fall in with Driver's plans led to trouble.
example.tran: 卡门不愿接受德赖弗的计划，由此引来了麻烦。

collins.def: If you fall in with someone, you become friends with them and start seeing them a lot.

example.ex: At university, Taylor had fallen in with a small clique of literature students.
example.tran: 在大学里，泰勒曾经频繁参与一个文学小团体的活动。

collins.def: If something falls off, it separates from the thing to which it was attached and moves towards the ground.

example.ex: When your exhaust falls off, you have to replace it.
example.tran: 如果你的排气管脱落，应将其更换。

collins.tran: (程度)降低，减弱;(数量、规模)减少
collins.def: If the degree, amount, or size of something falls off, it decreases.

example.ex: Unemployment is rising again and retail buying has fallen off.
example.tran: 失业率再次上升，零售品购买量下降。

collins.def: If something such as a person's hair or a tooth falls out, it comes out.

example.ex: Her hair started falling out as a result of radiation treatment.
example.tran: 由于放疗，她开始掉头发。

collins.def: If you fall out with someone, you have an argument and stop being friendly with them. You can also say that two people fall out .

example.ex: She fell out with her husband...
example.tran: 她与丈夫闹翻了。

example.ex: Mum and I used to fall out a lot.
example.tran: 我和妈妈过去经常争吵。

collins.tran: (责任、职责、机会)落到…的头上;应由…做
collins.def: If a responsibility, duty, or opportunity falls to someone, it becomes their responsibility, duty, or opportunity.

example.ex: He's been very unlucky that no chances have fallen to him.
example.tran: 他很不走运，机会一次也没有落到他头上。

example.ex: It fell to me to get rid of them.
example.tran: 由我来负责摆脱他们。

collins.def: If someone falls to doing something, they start doing it.

example.ex: When she had departed, they fell to fighting among themselves.
example.tran: 她走后，他们便互相打了起来。

collins.def: A family is a group of people who are related to each other, especially parents and their children.

example.ex: There's room in there for a family of five...
example.tran: 那儿能住下五口之家。

example.ex: His family are completely behind him, whatever he decides...
example.tran: 他无论作出什么决定，家人都全力支持。

collins.def: When people talk about a family, they sometimes mean children.

example.ex: They decided to start a family.
example.tran: 他们决定要孩子。

example.ex: ...couples with large families.
example.tran: 儿女成群的夫妇

collins.def: When people talk about their family, they sometimes mean their ancestors.

example.ex: Her family came to Los Angeles at the turn of the century.
example.tran: 她的祖先在世纪之交时来到洛杉矶。

example.ex: ...homes where their families had lived for generations.
example.tran: 祖祖辈辈生活过的家

collins.def: You can use family to describe things that belong to a particular family.

example.ex: He returned to the family home...
example.tran: 他回到自己家里。

example.ex: I was working in the family business.
example.tran: 我在自家的企业工作。

collins.tran: 全家共用的;全家共享的
collins.def: You can use family to describe things that are designed to be used or enjoyed by both parents and children.

example.ex: It had been designed as a family house...
example.tran: 这房子的设计适合一家老小共同居住。

example.ex: A wedding is a family event.
example.tran: 婚礼是全家人的庆典。

collins.def: A family of animals or plants is a group of related species.

example.ex: ...foods in the cabbage family, such as Brussels sprouts.
example.tran: 抱子甘蓝之类的十字花科食物

means: （问到或谈及距离时说）有多远

collins.def: If one place, thing, or person is far away from another, there is a great distance between them.

example.ex: I know a nice little Italian restaurant not far from here...
example.tran: 我知道有家不错的意大利小餐馆离这儿不远。

example.ex: They came from as far away as Florida...
example.tran: 他们来自遥远的佛罗里达州。

collins.tran: (用于问及距离或位置)有多远，远至
collins.def: If you ask how far a place is, you are asking what distance it is from you or from another place. If you ask how far someone went, you are asking what distance they travelled, or what place they reached.

example.ex: How far is Pawtucket from Providence?...
example.tran: 波塔基特离普罗维登斯有多远？

example.ex: How far is it to Malcy?...
example.tran: 这儿离马尔锡有多远？

collins.tran: (同一处的两物)离得较远的，那一边的
collins.def: When there are two things of the same kind in a place, the far one is the one that is a greater distance from you.

example.ex: He had wandered to the far end of the room...
example.tran: 他转到屋子的那一头。

example.ex: A narrow steep path leads down into a valley and up the far side.
example.tran: 一条狭窄陡峭的小径向下伸进山谷，又从山谷的那一边向上延伸。

collins.def: You can use far to refer to the part of an area or object that is the greatest distance from the centre in a particular direction. For example, the far north of a country is the part of it that is the greatest distance to the north.

example.ex: I've spent a lot of time walking around Britain from the far north of Scotland down to Cornwall...
example.tran: 我花了很长时间在英国徒步漫游，从苏格兰的最北端一直走到康沃尔。

example.ex: I wrote the date at the far left of the blackboard.
example.tran: 我把日期写在黑板的最左边。

collins.def: A time or event that is far away in the future or the past is a long time from the present or from a particular point in time.

example.ex: ...hidden conflicts whose roots lie far back in time...
example.tran: 很久以前就埋下祸根的潜在冲突

example.ex: I can't see any farther than the next six months...
example.tran: 6个月以后的事情我就无法预见了。

collins.tran: (用于谈及程度或范围)到…程度(或范围)
collins.def: You can use far to talk about the extent or degree to which something happens or is true.

example.ex: How far did the film tell the truth about Barnes Wallis?...
example.tran: 影片讲述的巴恩斯·沃利斯的故事有多少真实的成分？

example.ex: But it is not clear how far they could help with the work on a power plant.
example.tran: 但他们在电厂工程中能给予多少帮助尚不清楚。

collins.tran: (用于谈及进展)到…程度，到…阶段
collins.def: You can talk about how far someone or something gets to describe the progress that they make.

example.ex: Discussions never progressed very far...
example.tran: 讨论一直没多大进展。

example.ex: Think of how far we have come in a little time...
example.tran: 想想我们在短短的时间内取得如此大的进展。

collins.tran: (用于谈论行为)过分到，过分得
collins.def: You can talk about how far a person or action goes to describe the degree to which someone's behaviour or actions are extreme.

example.ex: It's still not clear how far the Russian parliament will go to implement its own plans...
example.tran: 俄罗斯议院在实施自己的计划时到底会采取怎样的极端措施尚不明了。

example.ex: Competition can be healthy, but if it is pushed too far it can result in bullying...
example.tran: 竞争可以是良性的，但如果太过火，就可能造成以强凌弱。

collins.tran: (用于表示在多大程度上赞成)我可不那样认为/我这样认为
collins.def: You can use far in expressions like 'I wouldn't go that far' and 'I would go so far' to indicate to what extent you agree with something.

example.ex: 'Does it sound like music?' — 'I wouldn't go that far.'...
example.tran: “这听上去像音乐吗？”——“我可不那样认为。”

example.ex: I would go so far as to say it's positively neurotic.
example.tran: 我可以这么说，这绝对是神经过敏。

collins.tran: (比较时用作强调)…得多，非常，太
collins.def: You can use far to mean 'very much' when you are comparing two things and emphasizing the difference between them. For example, you can say that something is far better or far worse than something else to indicate that it is very much better or worse. You can also say that something is, for example, far too big to indicate that it is very much too big.

example.ex: Women who eat plenty of fresh vegetables are far less likely to suffer anxiety or depression...
example.tran: 吃新鲜蔬菜多的女性患焦虑症或抑郁症的几率要小很多。

example.ex: The police say the response has been far better than expected...
example.tran: 警方称反应比预期好很多。

collins.def: You can describe people with extreme left-wing or right-wing political views as the far left or the far right.

example.ex: The far right is now a greater threat than the extreme left...
example.tran: 现在极右派比极左派威胁更大。

example.ex: Anti-racist campaigners are urging the Government to ban all far-Right groups.
example.tran: 反种族主义活动家正在力促政府取缔所有极右组织。

collins.tran: (用于表示不太确信)据我所知/就我记得的
collins.def: You can use far in expressions like 'as far as I know' and 'so far as I remember' to indicate that you are not absolutely sure of the statement you are about to make or have just made, and you may be wrong.

example.ex: It only lasted a couple of years, as far as I know...
example.tran: 据我所知，它仅仅维持了两三年。

example.ex: So far as I am aware, no proper investigation has ever been carried out into the subject.
example.tran: 据我了解，目前对该问题尚未进行过正规的调查。

collins.tran: (比较时用作强调)显然,…得多，大大地
collins.def: You use the expression far and away when you are comparing something or someone with others of the same kind, in order to emphasize how great the difference is between them. For example, you can say that something is far and away the best to indicate that it is definitely the best.

example.ex: He's still far and away the best we have.
example.tran: 他仍然是我们最最优秀的人才。

collins.tran: (比较时用作强调)显然,…得多，大大地
collins.def: You use the expression by far when you are comparing something or someone with others of the same kind, in order to emphasize how great the difference is between them. For example, you can say that something is by far the best or the best by far to indicate that it is definitely the best.

example.ex: By far the most important issue for them is unemployment...
example.tran: 对他们来说最重要的无疑就是失业问题。

example.ex: It was better by far to be clear-headed.
example.tran: 保持头脑清醒要好得多。

collins.def: If you say that something is far from a particular thing or far from being the case, you are emphasizing that it is not that particular thing or not at all the case, especially when people expect or assume that it is.

example.ex: It was obvious that much of what they recorded was far from the truth...
example.tran: 显然，他们所记录的很多根本不是事实。

example.ex: Far from being relaxed, we both felt so uncomfortable we hardly spoke...
example.tran: 我们两人非但没有放松，反而都感觉很不自在，几乎没有说话。

collins.tran: (用于加强否定)远非如此，绝非这样
collins.def: You can use the expression 'far from it' to emphasize a negative statement that you have just made.

example.ex: Being dyslexic does not mean that one is unintelligent. Far from it.
example.tran: 患有诵读困难症并不意味着智力低下。两者相差甚远。

collins.tran: (表示委婉地反对或批评)不是我要，不是我想
collins.def: You say far be it from me to disagree, or far be it from me to criticize, when you are disagreeing or criticizing and you want to appear less hostile.

example.ex: Far be it from me to criticise, but shouldn't their mother take a share of the blame?
example.tran: 不是我要挑理，他们的母亲难道就不应该负点责任吗？

collins.tran: 在一定程度上，在有限程度上(不错或正确)
collins.def: If you say that something is good as far as it goes or true so far as it goes, you mean that it is good or true only to a limited extent.

example.ex: His plan for tax relief is fine as far as it goes but will not be sufficient to get the economy moving again.
example.tran: 他的减税方案还算不错，但并不足以促使经济再次发展。

collins.def: If you say that someone will go far, you mean that they will be very successful in their career.

example.ex: I was very impressed with the talent of Michael Ball. He will go far.
example.tran: 我对迈克尔·鲍尔的才华印象非常深刻，他将来会前途无量。

collins.tran: 病入膏肓的;无可救药的;积重难返的
collins.def: Someone or something that is far gone is in such a bad state or condition that not much can be done to help or improve them.

example.ex: In his last few days the pain seemed to have stopped, but by then he was so far gone that it was no longer any comfort...
example.tran: 在他弥留人世的最后几天里，疼痛似乎止住了，但那时他已奄奄一息，不再感到丝毫安慰。

example.ex: Many of the properties are in a desperate state but none is too far gone to save.
example.tran: 很多地产情况都很糟糕，但都还不至于无法挽救。

collins.tran: 几近正确;相差无几;仅差毫厘
collins.def: Someone or something that is not far wrong ,not far out, or not far off is almost correct or almost accurate.

example.ex: I hadn't been far wrong in my estimate...
example.tran: 我过去的估计大致正确。

example.ex: Robertson is not far off her target.
example.tran: 罗伯逊离她的目标不远了。
