collins.def: You can use the expression 'as far as I can see' when you are about to state your opinion of a situation, or have just stated it, to indicate that it is your personal opinion.

example.ex: That's the problem as far as I can see...
example.tran: 在我看来，那就是问题所在。

example.ex: As far as I can see there are only two reasons for such an action.
example.tran: 就我看来，采取这个行动只有两个原因。

collins.def: If you say that something only goes so far or can only go so far, you mean that its extent, effect, or influence is limited.

example.ex: Their loyalty only went so far...
example.tran: 他们的忠诚只能到这个程度。

example.ex: The church can only go so far in secular matters.
example.tran: 教会在世俗事务上只能做这么多。

collins.def: If you tell or ask someone what has happened so far, you are telling or asking them what has happened up until the present point in a situation or story, and often implying that something different might happen later.

example.ex: It's been quiet so far...
example.tran: 到现在为止还算安静。

example.ex: So far, they have met with no success...
example.tran: 迄今为止，他们还从未成功过。

collins.tran: 目前情况良好;现在还算不错
collins.def: You can say so far so good to express satisfaction with the way that a situation or activity is progressing, developing, or happening.

example.ex: Of course, it's a case of so far, so good, but it's only one step.
example.tran: 当然，目前情况还算不错，但这也只是一步而已。

collins.tran: (故事)说到这儿;(情势)到这一刻
collins.def: Thus far means up until the present point in a situation or story.

example.ex: Thus far, the two prime ministers have achieved no concrete results.
example.tran: 到目前为止，两位首相还没有取得实质性成果。

collins.def: If people come from far and wide, they come from a large number of places, some of them far away. If things spread far and wide, they spread over a very large area or distance.

example.ex: Volunteers came from far and wide...
example.tran: 志愿者来自四面八方。

example.ex: His fame spread far and wide.
example.tran: 他远近闻名。

collins.def: If you say that someone won't go far wrong or can't go far wrong with a particular thing or course of action, you mean that it is likely to be successful or satisfactory.

example.ex: If you remember these three golden rules you won't go far wrong.
example.tran: 记住这三条金律，就不会错到哪儿。

means: （尤指天主教和东正教的）神父

collins.def: Your father is your male parent. You can also call someone your father if he brings you up as if he was this man.

example.ex: His father was a painter...
example.tran: 他父亲是个画家。

example.ex: He would be a good father to my children.
example.tran: 对我的孩子们来说，他会是个好父亲。

collins.def: When a man fathers a child, he makes a woman pregnant and their child is born.

example.ex: She claims Mark fathered her child...
example.tran: 她宣称马克是孩子的父亲。

example.ex: He fathered at least three children by the wives of other men.
example.tran: 他跟别人的老婆至少生了 3 个孩子。

collins.tran: 发明者;鼻祖;创始人;奠基人
collins.def: The man who invented or started something is sometimes referred to as the father of that thing.

example.ex: ...Max Dupain, regarded as the father of modern photography.
example.tran: 被视为现代摄影之父的马克斯·杜培

example.ex: ...Mahatma Gandhi, the founding father of independent India.
example.tran: 圣雄甘地，引领印度实现独立的国父

collins.def: In some Christian churches, priests are addressed or referred to as Father .

example.ex: I would like your advice on a matter of conscience, Father.
example.tran: 我想就一件有关良心的事征求您的建议，神父。

example.ex: ...Father William.
example.tran: 威廉神父

collins.def: Christians often refer to God as our Father or address him as Father .

example.ex: ...Our Father in Heaven.
example.tran: 我们的天父

collins.def: Fear is the unpleasant feeling you have when you think that you are in danger.

example.ex: I was sitting on the floor shivering with fear.
example.tran: 我坐在地板上，吓得发抖。

example.ex: ...boyhood memories of sickness and fear of the dark...
example.tran: 儿时记忆中的病痛和对黑暗的恐惧

collins.def: If you fear someone or something, you are frightened because you think that they will harm you.

example.ex: Many people fear change because they do not like the old ways to be disrupted.
example.tran: 很多人惧怕变化，因为他们不喜欢旧有的生活方式遭到破坏。

collins.def: A fear is a thought that something unpleasant might happen or might have happened.

example.ex: These youngsters are motivated not by a desire to achieve, but by fear of failure...
example.tran: 激发这些年轻人的不是对成就的渴望，而是对失败的担心。

example.ex: Then one day his worst fears were confirmed...
example.tran: 后来有一天，他最担心的事终于发生了。

collins.def: If you fear something unpleasant or undesirable, you are worried that it might happen or might have happened.

example.ex: She had feared she was going down with pneumonia or bronchitis...
example.tran: 她担心会得肺炎或支气管炎。

example.ex: More than two million refugees have fled the area, fearing attack by loyalist forces.
example.tran: 两百多万难民担心受到效忠旧政府的势力的攻击而逃离该地区。

collins.tran: (坏事发生的)可能性，机会，几率
collins.def: If you say that there is a fear that something unpleasant or undesirable will happen, you mean that you think it is possible or likely.

example.ex: There was no fear that anything would be misunderstood...
example.tran: 并无引起误会的可能性。

example.ex: There is a fear that the freeze on bank accounts could prove a lasting deterrent to investors.
example.tran: 人们担心冻结银行账户可能会长期阻碍投资。

collins.def: If you fear for someone or something, you are very worried because you think that they might be in danger.

example.ex: Carla fears for her son...
example.tran: 卡拉为儿子担心。

example.ex: He fled on Friday, saying he feared for his life.
example.tran: 他星期五逃走了，说是担心自己有生命危险。

collins.def: If you have fears for someone or something, you are very worried because you think that they might be in danger.

example.ex: He also spoke of his fears for the future of his country's culture.
example.tran: 他也谈到了对祖国文化前途的担忧。

example.ex: ...fear for her own safety.
example.tran: 对她自己安全的担心

collins.def: If you fear to do something, you are afraid to do it or you do not wish to do it.

example.ex: She pursed her lips together, as though fearing to betray her news...
example.tran: 她闭紧双唇，仿佛害怕透露出她的消息。

example.ex: Old people fear to leave their homes.
example.tran: 老年人都不愿背井离乡。

collins.def: You say that you fear that a situation is the case when the situation is unpleasant or undesirable, and when you want to express sympathy, sorrow, or regret about it.

example.ex: I fear that a land war now looks very probable...
example.tran: 恐怕陆地战爆发的可能性很大。

example.ex: 'Is anything left at all?' — 'I fear not.'
example.tran: “留下什么东西了吗?” ——“恐怕没有。”

collins.tran: 在对…的担心之中;在对…的恐惧之中
collins.def: If you are in fear of doing or experiencing something unpleasant or undesirable, you are very worried that you might have to do it or experience it.

example.ex: The elderly live in fear of assault and murder.
example.tran: 老人们生活在对袭击和谋杀的恐惧之中。

collins.def: If you take a particular course of action for fear of something, you take the action in order to prevent that thing happening.

example.ex: She was afraid to say anything to them for fear of hurting their feelings...
example.tran: 她什么都不敢对他们说，以免伤害他们的感情。

example.ex: No one dared shoot for fear of hitting Pete.
example.tran: 没人敢开枪，怕伤着皮特。

collins.def: You say 'fear not' or 'never fear' to someone when you are telling them not to worry or be frightened.

example.ex: Fear not, Darlene will protect me...
example.tran: 别担心，达琳会保护我的。

example.ex: You'll get the right training, never fear.
example.tran: 你会受到正规训练的，别担心。

collins.def: You use 'no fear' to emphasize that you do not want to do something.

example.ex: When I asked him if he wanted to change his mind, William said 'No fear.'
example.tran: 我问威廉是否想改主意，他说：“绝不会。”

collins.def: If someone or something puts the fear of God into you, they frighten or worry you, often deliberately.

example.ex: At some time or other Eve had obviously put the fear of God into her.
example.tran: 显然伊芙时不时有意吓唬她一下。

collins.def: If you feel a particular emotion or physical sensation, you experience it.

example.ex: I am feeling very depressed...
example.tran: 我觉得非常沮丧。

example.ex: I will always feel grateful to that little guy...
example.tran: 我会永远感激那个小伙子。

collins.tran: (经历或事件)给人…感觉，令人有…感觉
collins.def: If you talk about how an experience or event feels, you talk about the emotions and sensations connected with it.

example.ex: It feels good to have finished a piece of work...
example.tran: 完成一项工作后感觉很好。

example.ex: The speed at which everything moved felt strange...
example.tran: 一切进展如此之快让人感觉不对劲。

collins.def: If you talk about how an object feels, you talk about the physical quality that you notice when you touch or hold it. For example, if something feels soft, you notice that it is soft when you touch it.

example.ex: The metal felt smooth and cold...
example.tran: 这种金属摸起来冰冷而光滑。

example.ex: The ten-foot oars felt heavy and awkward...
example.tran: 10 英尺长的桨拿起来感觉很笨重。

collins.def: If you talk about how the weather feels, you describe the weather, especially the temperature or whether or not you think it is going to rain or snow.

example.ex: It felt wintry cold that day.
example.tran: 那天感觉像冬天一样寒冷。

collins.def: If you feel an object, you touch it deliberately with your hand, so that you learn what it is like, for example what shape it is or whether it is rough or smooth.

example.ex: The doctor felt his head...
example.tran: 医生摸了摸他的头。

example.ex: When dry, feel the surface and it will no longer be smooth...
example.tran: 晾干之后，表面摸上去就不再光滑了。

collins.def: If you can feel something, you are aware of it because it is touching you.

example.ex: Through several layers of clothes I could feel his muscles...
example.tran: 透过好几层衣服，我能感觉到他的肌肉。

example.ex: He felt her leg against his.
example.tran: 他感觉到她的腿贴着自己的腿。

collins.def: If you feel something happening, you become aware of it because of the effect it has on your body.

example.ex: She felt something being pressed into her hands...
example.tran: 她感觉有什么东西塞到了她手里。

example.ex: He felt something move beside him...
example.tran: 他感觉身边有什么东西在动。

collins.def: If you feel yourself doing something or being in a particular state, you are aware that something is happening to you which you are unable to control.

example.ex: I felt myself blush...
example.tran: 我不觉脸红了。

example.ex: If at any point you feel yourself becoming tense, make a conscious effort to relax...
example.tran: 如果什么时候感到紧张，就有意识地放松。

collins.def: If you feel the presence of someone or something, you become aware of them, even though you cannot see or hear them.

example.ex: He felt her eyes on him...
example.tran: 他感觉到她在看着他。

example.ex: Suddenly, I felt a presence behind me...
example.tran: 突然，我感觉身后有什么东西。

collins.def: If you feel that something is the case, you have a strong idea in your mind that it is the case.

example.ex: I feel that not enough is being done to protect the local animal life...
example.tran: 我觉得对当地野生动物的保护力度不够。

example.ex: I feel certain that it will all turn out well...
example.tran: 我觉得最后肯定会皆大欢喜。

collins.def: If you feel that you should do something, you think that you should do it.

example.ex: I feel I should resign...
example.tran: 我觉得自己应该辞职。

example.ex: He felt that he had to do it...
example.tran: 他觉得他必须去做。

collins.def: If you talk about how you feel about something, you talk about your opinion, attitude, or reaction to it.

example.ex: We'd like to know what you feel about abortion...
example.tran: 我们想知道你对堕胎是怎么看的。

example.ex: How do you feel about going back to the neighborhood?...
example.tran: 对回到这个街区你有何感想？

collins.def: If you feel like doing something or having something, you want to do it or have it because you are in the right mood for it and think you would enjoy it.

example.ex: Neither of them felt like going back to sleep...
example.tran: 他俩都不想回去睡觉。

example.ex: Could we take a walk? I feel like a little exercise.
example.tran: 我们去散散步好吗？我想活动一下。

collins.tran: 感受，体会，承受(某种后果或影响)
collins.def: If you feel the effect or result of something, you experience it.

example.ex: The charity is still feeling the effects of revelations about its one-time president...
example.tran: 这家慈善机构仍受到其前主席被检举带来的影响。

example.ex: The real impact will be felt in the developing world.
example.tran: 发展中国家将会受到真正的影响。

collins.def: The feel of something, for example a place, is the general impression that it gives you.

example.ex: The room has a warm, cosy feel.
example.tran: 这个房间有一种温暖舒适的感觉。

example.ex: ...a book that takes on the feel of an epic.
example.tran: 一本史诗般的书

collins.def: If you feel for something, for example in the dark, you try to find it by moving your hand around until you touch it.

example.ex: I felt for my wallet and papers in my inside pocket...
example.tran: 我在里兜里摸钱包和证件。

example.ex: I slumped down in my usual armchair and felt around for the newspaper.
example.tran: 我一屁股坐在常坐的椅子上，摸索着找报纸。

collins.def: If you feel for someone, you have sympathy for them.

example.ex: She cried on the phone and was very upset and I really felt for her.
example.tran: 她在电话里哭了，非常难过，我很同情她。

means: （与复数名词和复数动词连用）有些

collins.def: You use a few to indicate that you are talking about a small number of people or things. You can also say a very few .

example.ex: I gave a dinner party for a few close friends...
example.tran: 我为几个密友办了晚宴。

example.ex: We had a few drinks afterwards...
example.tran: 后来我们喝了几杯。

collins.tran: (用于形容词和限定词后)几个，少数的
collins.def: You use few after adjectives and determiners to indicate that you are talking about a small number of things or people.

example.ex: The past few weeks of her life had been the most pleasant she could remember...
example.tran: 过去几周是她记忆中平生最愉快的日子。

example.ex: The leaders are expected to fly to Mecca in the next few days to seal the agreement.
example.tran: 领导人将在接下来的几天中飞往麦加签署协议。

collins.tran: (前面可用 so，too，very 修饰)极少的,几乎没有
collins.def: You use few to indicate that you are talking about a small number of people or things. You can use 'so', 'too', and 'very' in front of few .

example.ex: She had few friends, and was generally not very happy...
example.tran: 她几乎没什么朋友，总的来说不怎么开心。

example.ex: Few members planned to vote for him...
example.tran: 几乎没什么成员打算投他的票。

collins.tran: (尤指享有某种机遇等的)少数派，少数
collins.def: The few means a small set of people considered as separate from the majority, especially because they share a particular opportunity or quality that the others do not have.

example.ex: This should not be an experience for the few.
example.tran: 这不应是少数几个人的经历。

example.ex: ...a system built on academic excellence for the few.
example.tran: 建立在面向少数人的精英教育上的体制

collins.def: You use as few as before a number to suggest that it is surprisingly small.

example.ex: One study showed that even as few as ten cigarettes a day can damage fertility...
example.tran: 一项研究显示，一天只抽 10 支烟也会损害生育能力。

example.ex: The factory may make as few as 1,500 cars this year.
example.tran: 今年，工厂生产的小轿车可能只有 1,500 辆。

collins.def: Things that are few and far between are very rare or do not happen very often.

example.ex: Successful women politicians are few and far between...
example.tran: 成功的女政治家凤毛麟角。

example.ex: In this economic climate new ideas were few and far between.
example.tran: 在这种经济环境下，新想法极为罕见。

collins.tran: 不少,相当多(a good few 主要用于英国英语)
collins.def: You use not a few when you are referring to quite a lot of things or people. You can also use a good few in this way, mainly in British English.

example.ex: I've made this argument, and not a few people would disagree with me...
example.tran: 我提出了此论点，而这会是相当多的人都不同意的。

example.ex: I think a good few of the others were like me, a bit confused.
example.tran: 我觉得其他人中不少都像我一样，有点迷惑不解。

collins.def: If you say that someone has had a few too many or has had a few, you mean that they have drunk too many alcoholic drinks.

example.ex: A breathalyzer tells you you've a had a few too many.
example.tran: 呼吸分析器显示你饮酒过量。

collins.def: You use no fewer than to emphasize that a number is surprisingly large.

example.ex: No fewer than thirteen foreign ministers attended the session.
example.tran: 至少有 13 国外长出席了这届会议。

means: 十五个人组成的橄榄球队

collins.def: Fifteen is the number 15.

example.ex: In India, there are fifteen official languages.
example.tran: 印度有 15 种官方语言。

collins.def: A rugby-union team can be referred to as a fifteen .
Fifty is the number 50.

collins.tran: 五十几(指 50 到 59 之间的数字)
collins.def: When you talk about the fifties, you are referring to numbers between 50 and 59. For example, if you are in your fifties, you are aged between 50 and 59. If the temperature is in the fifties, the temperature is between 50 and 59 degrees.

example.ex: I probably look as if I'm in my fifties rather than my seventies.
example.tran: 我大概看上去像 50 多岁而不是 70 多岁。

collins.def: The fifties is the decade between 1950 and 1959.

example.ex: He began performing in the early fifties.
example.tran: 他20世纪50年代初开始从事表演。

collins.def: If you fight something unpleasant, you try in a determined way to prevent it or stop it happening.

example.ex: Mother Teresa is an elderly nun who has devoted her life to fighting poverty...
example.tran: 德肋撒嬷嬷是一位毕生致力于消除贫困事业的年迈修女。

example.ex: More units to fight forest fires are planned...
example.tran: 计划设立更多单位防控森林火灾。

collins.def: If you fight for something, you try in a determined way to get it or achieve it.

example.ex: Our Government should be fighting for an end to food subsidies...
example.tran: 我们政府应该努力废止食物补贴。

example.ex: Lee had to fight hard for his place on the expedition...
example.tran: 李不得不为在考察队中获得一席之地而苦苦争取。

collins.def: If an army or group fights a battle with another army or group, they oppose each other with weapons. You can also say that two armies or groups fight a battle.

example.ex: The two men fought a battle over land and water rights...
example.tran: 这两个男人为土地和水的使用权发生了争斗。

example.ex: In the latest incident at the weekend police fought a gun battle with a gang which used hand grenades against them...
example.tran: 在周末发生的最近一起暴力事件中，警方与向他们投掷手榴弹的一伙匪徒展开了枪战。

collins.def: If a person or army fights in a battle or a war, they take part in it.

example.ex: He fought in the war and was taken prisoner by the Americans...
example.tran: 他参了战，后被美国人俘虏。

example.ex: If I were a young man I would sooner go to prison than fight for this country...
example.tran: 如果我是个年轻人，我宁愿进监狱也不愿为这个国家打仗。

collins.def: If one person fights with another, or fights them, the two people hit or kick each other because they want to hurt each other. You can also say that two people fight .

example.ex: As a child she fought with her younger sister...
example.tran: 她小时候会和妹妹打架。

example.ex: I did fight him, I punched him but it was like hitting a wall...
example.tran: 我确实和他打了起来，我挥拳向他猛击，但就像打在墙上一样。

collins.def: If one person fights with another, or fights them, they have an angry disagreement or quarrel. You can also say that two people fight .

example.ex: She was always arguing with him and fighting with him...
example.tran: 她总是跟他争辩吵嘴。

example.ex: Gwendolen started fighting her teachers...
example.tran: 格温德琳开始同老师争执起来。

collins.def: If you fight your way to a place, you move towards it with great difficulty, for example because there are a lot of people or obstacles in your way.

example.ex: I fought my way into a carriage just before the doors closed...
example.tran: 我刚挤进车厢，车门就关上了。

example.ex: Peter fought his way through a blizzard to save one of the chickens.
example.tran: 彼得为了救其中一只鸡在暴风雪中艰难前行。

collins.def: A fight is a boxing match.

example.ex: This was Hyer's last fight, for no one else challenged him...
example.tran: 这是海尔的最后一场比赛，因为再没有人向他发起挑战。

example.ex: The referee stopped the fight.
example.tran: 裁判叫停了比赛。

collins.def: To fight means to take part in a boxing match.

example.ex: In a few hours' time one of the world's most famous boxers will be fighting in Britain for the first time...
example.tran: 几个小时后，世界最著名的拳击手之一将开始其在英国的首场比赛。

example.ex: I'd like to fight him because he's undefeated and I want to be the first man to beat him...
example.tran: 我想和他对阵，因为他从没有输过，而我想成为打败他的第一人。

collins.def: If you fight an election, you are a candidate in the election and try to win it.

example.ex: The former party treasurer helped raise almost £40 million to fight the election campaign.
example.tran: 该党的前任财政部长帮助筹集了近 4,000 万英镑用于竞选。

collins.def: You can use fight to refer to a contest such as an election or a sports match.

example.ex: ...the fight for power between the two parties.
example.tran: 两党间的权力之争

collins.tran: 进行(诉讼、辩护等);打(官司)
collins.def: If you fight a case or a court action, you make a legal case against someone in a very determined way, or you put forward a defence when a legal case is made against you.

example.ex: Watkins sued the Army and fought his case in various courts for 10 years...
example.tran: 沃特金斯将军队诉至法院，并在各级法庭打了 10 年的官司。

example.ex: The newspaper is fighting a damages action brought by the actress.
example.tran: 这家报纸正和提起损害赔偿诉讼的女演员对簿公堂。

collins.def: Fight is the desire or ability to keep fighting.

example.ex: I thought that we had a lot of fight in us.
example.tran: 我觉得我们斗志高昂。

collins.tran: 努力克制，竭力抑制(感情或欲望)
collins.def: If you fight an emotion or desire, you try very hard not to feel it, show it, or act on it, but do not always succeed.

example.ex: I desperately fought the urge to giggle...
example.tran: 我拼命地想忍住笑。

example.ex: He fought with the urge to smoke one of the cigars he'd given up awhile ago...
example.tran: 他努力克制自己的烟瘾，不去抽一支戒掉没多久的雪茄。

collins.def: If you fight for breath, you try to breathe but find it very difficult.

collins.tran: 经过努力才能成功的机会;需要极大好运的机会
collins.def: If you have a fighting chance of doing or achieving something, it is possible that you will do or achieve it, but only if you make a great effort or are very lucky.

example.ex: When they didn't shoot at me right away, I figured I had a fighting chance.
example.tran: 当他们没有立即向我开枪时，我估摸自己还有一线生机。

collins.def: If you describe someone as fighting fit, you are emphasizing that they are very fit or healthy.

example.ex: After a good night's sleep I feel fighting fit again.
example.tran: 昨夜睡得很香，我又觉得自己精力充沛了。

collins.tran: 与死神殊死搏斗;奋力求生
collins.def: Someone who is fighting for their life is making a great effort to stay alive, either when they are being physically attacked or when they are very ill.

example.ex: He is still fighting for his life in hospital.
example.tran: 他仍在医院与死神搏斗。

collins.def: If you fight back against someone or something that is attacking or harming you, you resist them actively or attack them.

example.ex: The teenage attackers fled when the two men fought back...
example.tran: 当那两名男子还击时，袭击他们的少年逃之夭夭。

example.ex: We should take some comfort from the ability of the judicial system to fight back against corruption.
example.tran: 司法制度有能力惩治腐败，这应使我们感到些许欣慰。

collins.tran: 强忍住，抑制住(感情或欲望)
collins.def: If you fight back an emotion or a desire, you try very hard not to feel it, show it, or act on it.

example.ex: She fought back the tears.
example.tran: 她强忍住眼泪。

collins.tran: 强忍住，抑制住(感情或欲望)
collins.def: If you fight down an emotion or a desire, you try very hard not to feel it, show it, or act on it.

example.ex: Meg fought down the desire to run...
example.tran: 梅格极力忍住不跑。

example.ex: He looked at the telephone, fighting down first the despair and then the anger.
example.tran: 他看着电话，把绝望和愤怒一一压下。

collins.tran: 抵抗，战胜(疾病);摆脱(不快)
collins.def: If you fight off something, for example an illness or an unpleasant feeling, you succeed in getting rid of it and in not letting it overcome you.

example.ex: Unfortunately these drugs are quite toxic and hinder the body's ability to fight off infection...
example.tran: 可惜的是，这些药物毒性很大，会削弱身体对感染的抵抗力。

example.ex: All day she had fought off the impulse to telephone Harry.
example.tran: 她一整天都在克制自己想给哈里打电话的冲动。

collins.def: If you fight off someone who has attacked you, you fight with them, and succeed in making them go away or stop attacking you.

example.ex: The woman fought off the attacker.
example.tran: 这名女子打跑了袭击她的人。

collins.tran: 在…上一争高下;通过比出胜负解决
collins.def: If two people or groups fight something out, they fight or argue until one of them wins.

example.ex: Instead of retaliating, he walks away leaving his team-mates to fight it out...
example.tran: 他没有以牙还牙，而是径直走开，让队友去争出个结果。

example.ex: Malcolm continued to fight it out with Julien from his self-imposed exile in Paris.
example.tran: 马尔科姆自我放逐到了巴黎，但他继续要和朱利恩斗到底。

collins.def: A figure is a particular amount expressed as a number, especially a statistic.

example.ex: It would be very nice if we had a true figure of how many people in this country haven't got a job...
example.tran: 如果我们能得到该国失业人口的真实数字就好了。

example.ex: It will not be long before the inflation figure starts to fall...
example.tran: 过不了多久，通货膨胀率就会开始下降。

collins.tran: (0 到 9 的)数字符号，数目字
collins.def: A figure is any of the ten written symbols from 0 to 9 that are used to represent a number.

An amount or number that is in single figures is between zero and nine. An amount or number that is in double figures is between ten and ninety-nine. You can also say, for example, that an amount or number is in three figures when it is between one hundred and nine hundred and ninety-nine.

example.ex: Inflation, which has usually been in single figures, is running at more than 12%...
example.tran: 通常保持在个位数的通货膨胀率现在已超过了 12％。

example.ex: Crawley, with 14, was the only other player to reach double figures...
example.tran: 克劳利拿到 14 分,是仅有的另外一个得分达两位数的球员。

collins.def: You refer to someone that you can see as a figure when you cannot see them clearly or when you are describing them.

example.ex: Alistair saw the dim figure of Rose in the chair...
example.tran: 阿利斯泰尔看见了坐在椅子里的罗丝的模糊身影。

example.ex: She waited, standing on the bridge, until his figure vanished against the grey backdrop of the Palace...
example.tran: 她站在桥上，一直等到他的身影消失在宫殿灰色的阴影中。

collins.tran: (绘画作品中的)人物;雕像;塑像
collins.def: In art, a figure is a person in a drawing or a painting, or a statue of a person.

example.ex: ...a life-size bronze figure of a brooding, hooded woman.
example.tran: 一个戴着兜帽作沉思状的真人大小青铜女子雕像

collins.def: Your figure is the shape of your body.

example.ex: Take pride in your health and your figure...
example.tran: 为自己的健康和体形感到骄傲吧。

example.ex: Janet was a natural blonde with a good figure.
example.tran: 珍妮特天生一头金发，身材曼妙。

collins.def: Someone who is referred to as a figure of a particular kind is a person who is well-known and important in some way.

example.ex: The movement is supported by key figures in the three main political parties.
example.tran: 这个运动受到三大政党关键人物的支持。

collins.def: If you say that someone is, for example, a mother figure or a hero figure, you mean that other people regard them as the type of person stated or suggested.

example.ex: Sometimes young lads just need to turn to a mother figure for a bit of a chat and reassurance.
example.tran: 有时候年轻小伙子只是需要找一个母亲式的人物聊一聊，从中获得安慰。

example.ex: Daniel Boone, the great hero figure of the frontier...
example.tran: 丹尼尔·布恩——西部伟大的英雄形象

collins.def: In books and magazines, the diagrams which help to show or explain information are referred to as figures .

example.ex: If you look at a world map (see Figure 1) you can identify the major wine-producing regions...
example.tran: 查一查世界地图(见图1)，就能找到主要的葡萄酒产区。

example.ex: Figure 1.15 shows which provinces lost populations between 1910 and 1920.
example.tran: 表 1.15 显示出哪些省份在 1910 至 1920 年间人口减少了。

collins.def: In geometry, a figure is a shape, especially a regular shape.

example.ex: Draw a pentagon, a regular five-sided figure.
example.tran: 画个五边形，一个规则的五边形。

collins.def: If you figure that something is the case, you think or guess that it is the case.

example.ex: She figured that both she and Ned had learned a lot from the experience.
example.tran: 她觉得自己和内德都从这一经历中学到了很多东西。

collins.tran: 不奇怪;很正常;合乎情理
collins.def: If you say 'That figures' or 'It figures', you mean that the fact referred to is not surprising.

example.ex: When I finished, he said, 'Yeah. That figures'...
example.tran: 等我说完，他说道：“是啊，那是预料中事。”

example.ex: Work it out and you'll find it figures.
example.tran: 弄明白了你就会觉得这合情合理。

collins.def: If a person or thing figures in something, they appear in or are included in it.

example.ex: Human rights violations figured prominently in the report.
example.tran: 有关侵犯人权的部分在报告中占据了显要地位。

collins.def: If you say that someone cuts a particular figure, you mean that they appear to other people in the way described.

example.ex: Today she cuts a lonely figure.
example.tran: 今天她看起来十分孤独。

collins.def: If you describe someone as a figure of fun, you mean that people think they are ridiculous.

example.ex: The man has become an unlikely figure of fun.
example.tran: 令人想象不到的是，这个男人已经成为了笑谈。

collins.def: If you keep your figure, you stay thin. If you lose your figure, you become rather fat.

example.ex: You'll lose your girlish figure if you don't watch out.
example.tran: 如果不多加注意，你就会失去女孩般的苗条身段。

collins.tran: 说出…的确切数量(或数目)
collins.def: When you put a figure on an amount, you say exactly how much it is.

example.ex: No one will put a figure on the final cost of this reconstruction.
example.tran: 谁也不愿确切地说明这一重建最后总共的花费是多少。

collins.def: If you figure on something, you plan that it will happen or assume that it will happen when making your plans.

example.ex: Jack worked as hard as he could to build his business, but he hadn't figured on a few obstacles.
example.tran: 杰克竭尽全力发展自己的公司，但有几个障碍是他始料不及的。

collins.def: If you figure out a solution to a problem or the reason for something, you succeed in solving it or understanding it.

example.ex: It took them about one month to figure out how to start the equipment...
example.tran: 他们花了大约1个月的时间才搞清楚如何启动设备。

example.ex: They're trying to figure out the politics of this whole situation...
example.tran: 他们正试图弄明白整个情形背后的权术争斗。

collins.def: If you figure up a cost or amount, you add numbers together to get the total.

example.ex: He figured up the balance in their checking account.
example.tran: 他算出了他们活期存款账户上的余额总和。

collins.def: A film consists of moving pictures that have been recorded so that they can be shown at the cinema or on television. A film tells a story, or shows a real situation.

example.ex: Everything about the film was good. Good acting, good story, good fun.
example.tran: 这部片子各个方面都很不错：表演出色，故事精彩，情节有趣。

example.ex: ...a government health film about the dangers of smoking.
example.tran: 有关吸烟危害的公益健康教育影片

collins.tran: 拍摄;把…拍成电影(或电视)
collins.def: If you film something, you use a camera to take moving pictures which can be shown on a screen or on television.

example.ex: He had filmed her life story...
example.tran: 他把她一生的经历拍成了电影。

example.ex: Considering the restrictions under which she filmed, I think she did a commendable job.
example.tran: 考虑到她拍摄时所受的各种限制，我觉得她交出的答卷值得嘉许。

collins.def: Film of something is moving pictures of a real event that are shown on television or on a screen.

example.ex: They have seen news film of families queueing in Russia to buy a loaf of bread.
example.tran: 他们已经看过那段俄罗斯许多家庭为买面包排起长队的新闻画面。

collins.def: A film is the narrow roll of plastic that is used in a camera to take photographs.

example.ex: The photographers had already shot a dozen rolls of film.
example.tran: 摄影师们已经拍光了一打胶卷。

collins.def: The making of cinema films, considered as a form of art or a business, can be referred to as film or films .

example.ex: Film is a business with limited opportunities for actresses...
example.tran: 电影行业对女演员来说机会有限。

example.ex: She wanted to set up her own company to invest in films.
example.tran: 她想成立自己的公司投资电影。

collins.def: A film of powder, liquid, or oil is a very thin layer of it.

example.ex: The sea is coated with a film of raw sewage.
example.tran: 海面上漂浮着一层未经处理的污水。

collins.def: Plastic film is a very thin sheet of plastic used to wrap and cover things.

example.ex: Cover with plastic film and refrigerate for 24 hours.
example.tran: 覆上保鲜膜，冷藏 24 小时。

collins.def: In a series of events, things, or people, the final one is the last one.

example.ex: Astronauts will make a final attempt today to rescue a communications satellite from its useless orbit...
example.tran: 今天宇航员将会做最后一次尝试,力图把一颗通信卫星从无效的轨道上抢救下来。

example.ex: This is the fifth and probably final day of testimony before the Senate Judiciary Committee...
example.tran: 今天是在参议院司法委员会作证的第5天，很可能也是最后一天。

collins.def: Final means happening at the end of an event or series of events.

example.ex: You must have been on stage until the final curtain...
example.tran: 你肯定在台上一直呆到了演出结束。

example.ex: The countdown to the Notting Hill Carnival is in its final hours.
example.tran: 诺丁山狂欢节已经进入了最后几个小时的倒计时。

collins.def: You can use final to emphasize that a situation has a particular quality to a very great or severe degree.

example.ex: Only a few go through the final humiliation of meeting the bailiff at the door.
example.tran: 很少有人经受执达官上门的奇耻大辱。

collins.tran: (决定)不可更改的;(权威)毋庸置疑的
collins.def: If a decision or someone's authority is final, it cannot be changed or questioned.

example.ex: The judges' decision is final...
example.tran: 法官的判决不可更改。

example.ex: The White House has the final say...
example.tran: 白宫掌握着最后决定权。

collins.def: The final is the last game or contest in a series and decides who is the winner.

example.ex: ...the Scottish Cup Final...
example.tran: 苏格兰杯的决赛

example.ex: Pakistan's Jansher Khan has won the men's final at the Singapore Open.
example.tran: 巴基斯坦的詹谢尔汗取得了新加坡公开赛男子决赛的胜利。

collins.def: The finals of a sporting tournament consist of a smaller tournament that includes only players or teams that have won earlier games. The finals decide the winner of the whole tournament.

example.ex: Poland know they have a chance of qualifying for the World Cup Finals.
example.tran: 波兰队知道他们有机会获得参加世界杯决赛的资格。

collins.tran: (大学或学院的)课程终结考试，期终考试
collins.def: When a student takes his or her finals, he or she takes the last and most important examinations in a university or college course.

example.ex: Anna sat her finals in the summer.
example.tran: 安娜在夏天参加了课程终结考试。

collins.def: Financial means relating to or involving money.

example.ex: The company is in financial difficulties.
example.tran: 公司目前财政困难。

example.ex: ...the government's financial advisers.
example.tran: 政府的财政顾问

collins.def: If you find someone or something, you see them or learn where they are.

example.ex: The police also found a pistol...
example.tran: 警方还发现了一把手枪。

example.ex: They have spent ages looking at the map and can't find a trace of anywhere called Darrowby...
example.tran: 他们对着地图细看了许久也没能找到那个叫达罗比的地方的影踪。

collins.def: If you find something that you need or want, you succeed in achieving or obtaining it.

example.ex: Many people here cannot find work...
example.tran: 这里很多人都找不到工作。

example.ex: So far they have not found a way to fight the virus...
example.tran: 迄今为止，他们还没有找到一种对抗该病毒的方法。

collins.def: If something is found in a particular place or thing, it exists in that place.

example.ex: Two thousand of France's 4,200 species of flowering plants are found in the park...
example.tran: 法国的 4,200 种开花植物中有 2,000种可见于这个公园。

example.ex: Fibre is found in cereal foods, beans, fruit and vegetables.
example.tran: 谷类食品、豆类、水果和蔬菜中含有纤维素。

collins.tran: 发现…处于某种状态;遇见;碰见
collins.def: If you find someone or something in a particular situation, they are in that situation when you see them or come into contact with them.

example.ex: They found her walking alone and depressed on the beach...
example.tran: 他们碰见她独自一人神色忧郁地走在海滩上。

example.ex: She returned to her east London home to find her back door forced open...
example.tran: 她回到在伦敦东区的住所时发现后门被撬开了。

collins.tran: (不知不觉中)发现(自己在做某事)
collins.def: If you find yourself doing something, you are doing it without deciding or intending to do it.

example.ex: It's not the first time that you've found yourself in this situation...
example.tran: 你陷入这种状况已经不是第一次了。

example.ex: I found myself having more fun than I had had in years...
example.tran: 我发现自己这些年来从未像现在这样开心过。

collins.tran: (某一时刻或事件)把…置于某种情形中
collins.def: If a time or event finds you in a particular situation, you are in that situation at the time mentioned or when the event occurs.

example.ex: Daybreak found us on a cold, clammy ship...
example.tran: 天亮时我们发现自己呆在一条冰冷黏湿的船上。

example.ex: His lunch did not take long to arrive and found him poring over a notepad covered with scrawls.
example.tran: 不久午餐就送来了，当时他正埋头于一本满是潦草字迹的记事簿。

collins.def: If you find that something is the case, you become aware of it or realize that it is the case.

example.ex: The two biologists found, to their surprise, that both groups of birds survived equally well...
example.tran: 这两位生物学家惊奇地发现，两组鸟都很好地存活了下来。

example.ex: At my age I would find it hard to get another job...
example.tran: 到了我这个年纪自己就会发觉很难再找到一份工作了。

collins.def: When a court or jury decides that a person on trial is guilty or innocent, you say that the person has been found guilty or not guilty.

example.ex: She was found guilty of manslaughter and put on probation for two years...
example.tran: 她被裁定过失杀人罪名成立，缓刑两年。

example.ex: When they found us guilty, I just went blank.
example.tran: 当他们判定我们有罪时，我的脑子顿时一片空白。

collins.def: You can use find to express your reaction to someone or something.

example.ex: I find most of the young men of my own age so boring...
example.tran: 我觉得和我同龄的年轻人大多都很无聊。

example.ex: We're sure you'll find it exciting!...
example.tran: 我们保证你一定会认为这很刺激的！

collins.tran: 感受到(愉快、安慰等情感)
collins.def: If you find a feeling such as pleasure or comfort in a particular thing or activity, you experience the feeling mentioned as a result of this thing or activity.

example.ex: How could anyone find pleasure in hunting and killing this beautiful creature?...
example.tran: 怎么会有人以猎杀这种美丽的动物为乐呢？

example.ex: I was too tired and frightened to find comfort in that familiar promise.
example.tran: 我既疲惫又恐惧，就连那熟悉的承诺都无法让我感到安慰。

collins.def: If you find the time or money to do something, you succeed in making or obtaining enough time or money to do it.

example.ex: I was just finding more time to write music...
example.tran: 我刚刚找到了更多时间来作曲。

example.ex: My sister helped me find the money for a private operation.
example.tran: 姐姐帮我筹集资金开办了一家私人企业。

collins.tran: (有价值的)发现;(有用的)发现物
collins.def: If you describe someone or something that has been discovered as a find, you mean that they are valuable, interesting, good, or useful.

example.ex: Another of his lucky finds was a pair of candle-holders...
example.tran: 他的另一个幸运发现是一对烛台。

example.ex: His discovery was hailed as the botanical find of the century.
example.tran: 他的发现被誉为本世纪植物学的最重大发现。

collins.tran: 找到正确的路(去某处);成功地到达
collins.def: If you find your way somewhere, you successfully get there by choosing the right way to go.

example.ex: He was an expert at finding his way, even in strange surroundings...
example.tran: 他是认路的行家，即使在陌生的环境中也是如此。

example.ex: After a while I pulled myself to my feet and found my way to the street.
example.tran: 过了一会儿我费力地站起身来，找到了那条大街。

collins.def: If something finds its way somewhere, it comes to that place, especially by chance.

example.ex: It is one of the very few Michelangelos that have found their way out of Italy...
example.tran: 这是少数几件流传到意大利境外的米开朗琪罗作品之一。

example.ex: The most unlikely objects found their way into his design and look absolutely right where he placed them.
example.tran: 那些最不可能的东西出现于他的设计中，并且在他的安排下显得恰得其所。

collins.tran: (尤指特意通过努力)发现，找出，查明
collins.def: If you find something out, you learn something that you did not already know, especially by making a deliberate effort to do so.

example.ex: It makes you want to watch the next episode to find out what's going to happen...
example.tran: 这让人想要看下一集，弄清紧接着会发生什么事。

example.ex: I was relieved to find out that my problems were due to a genuine disorder...
example.tran: 得知我的问题确实是由于病症引起的，我松了口气。

collins.tran: 查出…的不轨行为;揭发出
collins.def: If you find someone out, you discover that they have been doing something dishonest.

example.ex: Her face was so grave, I wondered for a moment if she'd found me out.
example.tran: 她的表情如此严肃，我一时怀疑她是不是已经知道了我干的事。

collins.def: A firm is an organization which sells or produces something or which provides a service which people pay for.

example.ex: The firm's employees were expecting large bonuses.
example.tran: 这家公司的雇员期待着发放大笔奖金。

example.ex: ...a firm of heating engineers.
example.tran: 供暖工程公司

collins.def: If something is firm, it does not change much in shape when it is pressed but is not completely hard.

example.ex: Fruit should be firm and in excellent condition...
example.tran: 水果应该硬实完好。

example.ex: Choose a soft, medium or firm mattress to suit their individual needs.
example.tran: 针对他们各人不同的需要挑选柔软、软硬适中或者坚硬的床垫。

collins.def: If something is firm, it does not shake or move when you put weight or pressure on it, because it is strongly made or securely fastened.

example.ex: If you have to climb up, use a firm platform or a sturdy ladder.
example.tran: 如果非要爬上去，就踩在一个稳固的台子上或者找把结实的梯子。

collins.tran: (抓握或动作)强有力的，使上劲的
collins.def: If someone's grip is firm or if they perform a physical action in a firm way, they do it with quite a lot of force or pressure but also in a controlled way.

example.ex: The quick handshake was firm and cool...
example.tran: 短暂的握手有力沉稳。

example.ex: He managed to grasp the metal, get a firm grip of it and heave his body upwards.
example.tran: 他设法牢牢抓住了那个金属物，把整个身子往上提。

collins.def: If you describe someone as firm, you mean they behave in a way that shows that they are not going to change their mind, or that they are the person who is in control.

example.ex: She had to be firm with him. 'I don't want to see you again.'...
example.tran: 她不得不对他狠下心来：“我不想再见到你。”

example.ex: Perhaps they need the guiding hand of a firm father figure.
example.tran: 也许他们需要一个父亲般严格的指引者。

collins.tran: (决定或意见)确定的,不会更改的
collins.def: A firm decision or opinion is definite and unlikely to change.

example.ex: He made a firm decision to leave Fort Multry by boat...
example.tran: 他打定主意乘船离开穆尔特里堡。

example.ex: It is my firm belief that an effective partnership approach between police and the public is absolutely necessary.
example.tran: 我坚信警民之间进行有效合作是绝对必要的。

collins.tran: (证据或信息)确切的，确实的，确凿的
collins.def: Firm evidence or information is based on facts and so is likely to be true.

example.ex: This man may have killed others but unfortunately we have no firm evidence...
example.tran: 这名男子可能还杀害过其他人，只可惜我们没有确凿的证据。

example.ex: There's unlikely to be firm news about the convoy's progress for some time.
example.tran: 一段时间内都不大可能会有关于车队行进情况的确切消息。

collins.tran: (控制、基础、位置等)坚实的，不可动摇的
collins.def: You use firm to describe control or a basis or position when it is strong and unlikely to be ended or removed.

example.ex: Although the Yakutians are a minority, they have firm control of the territory...
example.tran: 尽管雅库特人是少数民族，但他们却牢牢地掌控着这块版图。

example.ex: The company, a household name in the States, has a firm foothold in the British market.
example.tran: 这家美国国内家喻户晓的公司在英国市场上站稳了脚跟。

collins.def: If people are firm friends, they have been close friends for a long time and their friendship is likely to continue.

example.ex: The couple met about two years ago and soon became firm friends.
example.tran: 这对夫妇大约两年前相遇，很快就成了知交。

collins.tran: (价格、价值、货币等)坚挺的，稳定的，居高不下的
collins.def: If a price, value, or currency is firm, it is not decreasing in value or amount.

example.ex: Cotton prices remain firm and demand is strong...
example.tran: 棉花价格始终保持坚挺，需求旺盛。

example.ex: The shares held firm at 280p...
example.tran: 股价稳稳地维持在280便士。

collins.def: If you firm soil around a plant, you press it so that it is fairly solid rather than loose.

example.ex: Firm more soil over the roots and water thoroughly.
example.tran: 在根上再多培些土，用水浇透。

collins.tran: 坚定不移;坚持己见;拒不让步
collins.def: If someone stands firm, they refuse to change their mind about something.

example.ex: The council is standing firm against the barrage of protest...
example.tran: 委员会面对接二连三的抗议拒不让步。

example.ex: The President has appealed to his European partners to stand firm on the issue.
example.tran: 总统已经呼吁其欧洲伙伴在此问题上站稳立场。

collins.tran: (使)更坚固;(使)更坚硬;(使)更结实
collins.def: If you firm up something or if it firms up, it becomes firmer and more solid.

example.ex: This treatment helps tone the body, firm up muscles and tighten the skin...
example.tran: 该治疗有助于强身健体、紧致皮肤。

example.ex: I now go swimming five times a week, which helps firm me up...
example.tran: 我现在每周游5次泳，这对强身健体很有益处。

collins.def: If you firm something up or if it firms up, it becomes clearer, stronger, or more definite.

example.ex: Looking to the future, the Government will firm up their plans for a cleaner, greener, safer Britain...
example.tran: 展望未来，政府将更加明确其计划，建设一个更清洁、更环保、更安全的英国。

example.ex: The ground rules have been firmed up...
example.tran: 基本原则已得到进一步强化。

collins.tran: 使(价格、价值等)保持坚挺(或稳定)
collins.def: If a financial institution firms up the price or value of something, they take action to protect and maintain its price or value.

example.ex: OPEC has agreed to freeze its global oil production slightly in order to firm up crude prices.
example.tran: 石油输出国组织已同意对全球石油生产稍加冻结，以稳定原油价格。

collins.tran: 最早的;最先的;第一位的
collins.def: The first thing, person, event, or period of time is the one that happens or comes before all the others of the same kind.

example.ex: She lost 16 pounds in the first month of her diet.
example.tran: 她节食的头一个月就减掉了16磅。

example.ex: ...the first few flakes of snow...
example.tran: 初落的几片雪花

collins.def: If you do something first, you do it before anyone else does, or before you do anything else.

example.ex: I do not remember who spoke first, but we all expressed the same opinion...
example.tran: 我不记得是谁最先发言的，但我们全都表达了相同的看法。

example.ex: First, tell me what you think of my products...
example.tran: 先谈谈你觉得我的产品怎么样吧。

collins.def: When something happens or is done for the first time, it has never happened or been done before.

example.ex: This is the first time she has experienced disappointment...
example.tran: 这是她第一次感受到失望。

example.ex: It was the first occasion when they had both found it possible to keep a rendezvous.
example.tran: 他们两人都能赴约，这还是头一遭。

collins.def: An event that is described as a first has never happened before and is important or exciting.

example.ex: It is a first for New York. An outdoor exhibition of Fernando Botero's sculpture on Park Avenue.
example.tran: 在公园大道上露天展出费尔南多·博特罗的雕塑，这在纽约还是破天荒的事。

collins.def: The first you hear of something or the first you know about it is the time when you first become aware of it.

example.ex: We heard it on the TV last night — that was the first we heard of it...
example.tran: 昨晚我们在电视上听到了这件事——那是我们头回听说。

example.ex: When Mark arrived home that afternoon, it was the first he knew for sure of the surprise party.
example.tran: 马克那天下午回到家时是他第一次确切知道有惊喜派对这回事。

collins.def: You use first when you are talking about what happens in the early part of an event or experience, in contrast to what happens later.

example.ex: When he first came home he wouldn't say anything about what he'd been doing.
example.tran: 刚回到家时，他只字不提自己一直在做什么。

collins.tran: (强调不愿意做某事)宁可，宁愿
collins.def: In order to emphasize your determination not to do a particular thing, you can say that rather than do it, you would do something else first .

example.ex: Marry that fat son of a fat cattle dealer? She would die first!
example.tran: 嫁给那个大腹便便的牛贩子的胖儿子？她宁愿去死！

collins.def: You use first when you are about to give the first in a series of items.

example.ex: Certain guidelines can be given. First, have a heating engineer check the safety of the system.
example.tran: 可以提供一些指导原则：第一，找位供暖工程师检查系统的安全性。

collins.tran: (一列中)离得最近的，最前面的
collins.def: The first thing, person, or place in a line is the one that is nearest to you or nearest to the front.

example.ex: Before him, in the first row, sat the President...
example.tran: 在他面前第一排坐着总统。

example.ex: First in the queue were two Japanese students.
example.tran: 队伍最前面是两个日本学生。

collins.def: You use first to refer to the best or most important thing or person of a particular kind.

example.ex: The first duty of any government must be to protect the interests of the taxpayers...
example.tran: 任何政府的首要职责都必须是保护纳税人的利益。

example.ex: Imagine winning the local lottery first prize of £5,000.
example.tran: 想象一下中个5,000英镑的当地彩票头奖吧。

collins.tran: (用于工作或职位的头衔中)最高的
collins.def: First is used in the title of the job or position of someone who has a higher rank than anyone else with the same basic job title.

example.ex: ...the First Lord of the Admiralty.
example.tran: 海军大臣

example.ex: ...the first mate of a British tanker.
example.tran: 一艘英国油轮的大副

collins.tran: (英国大学的)优等学位，一级荣誉学位
collins.def: In British universities, a first is an honours degree of the highest standard.

example.ex: ...an Oxford Blue who took a First in Constitutional History.
example.tran: 获得宪法史优等学位的牛津大学校队运动员

collins.def: You use first of all to introduce the first of a number of things that you want to say.

example.ex: The cut in the interest rates has not had very much impact in California for two reasons. First of all, banks are still afraid to loan.
example.tran: 降息在加利福尼亚并未产生多大影响，原因有二。首先，银行仍然不敢放贷。

collins.def: You use at first when you are talking about what happens in the early stages of an event or experience, or just after something else has happened, in contrast to what happens later.

example.ex: At first, he seemed surprised by my questions...
example.tran: 起初，他似乎对我的问题感到惊讶。

example.ex: I had some difficulty at first recalling why we were there.
example.tran: 刚开始回想我们为什么会在那儿时我有些费劲。

collins.tran: 居于首要地位;占据头等位置
collins.def: If you say that someone or something comes first for a particular person, you mean they treat or consider that person or thing as more important than anything else.

example.ex: There's no time for boyfriends, my career comes first.
example.tran: 我没时间交男朋友，事业对我来说是第一位的。

collins.tran: 先到先接待;先到先供应;按先来后到对待
collins.def: You say 'first come first served' to indicate that a group of people or things will be dealt with or given something in the order in which they arrive.

example.ex: There will be five buses, first come first served.
example.tran: 会有5辆巴士，先到先上。

collins.def: From the first means ever since something started.

example.ex: You knew about me from the first, didn't you?...
example.tran: 从一开始你就知道我，对吧？

example.ex: I thought from the first that she was a little unsure about that marriage.
example.tran: 从一开始我就觉得她对那桩婚事心里没底。

collins.def: If you learn or experience something at first hand, you experience it yourself or learn it directly rather than being told about it by other people.

example.ex: He arrived in Natal to see at first hand the effects of the recent heavy fighting.
example.tran: 他来到纳塔尔亲自了解最近发生的激烈冲突造成的后果。

collins.tran: 对…一无所知;对…毫不知晓
collins.def: If you say that you do not know the first thing about something, you are emphasizing that you know absolutely nothing about it.

example.ex: You don't know the first thing about farming.
example.tran: 你对种地一窍不通。

collins.def: You use first off to introduce the first of a number of things that you want to say.

example.ex: First off, huge apologies for last month's confusing report.
example.tran: 首先，要对上个月那篇交代不清的报道表示深深的歉意。

collins.tran: 视…为最重要;把…放在首位
collins.def: If you put someone or something first, you treat or consider them as more important than anything else.

example.ex: Somebody has to think for the child and put him first.
example.tran: 必须有人替孩子着想，把他放在第一位。

collins.tran: 最重要的先做;最要紧的先处理
collins.def: You say 'first things first' when you are talking about something that should be done or dealt with before anything else because it is the most important.

example.ex: Let's see if we can't find something to set the mood. First things first; some music.
example.tran: 看看我们能不能找点什么烘托一下气氛。当务之急：来点音乐吧。

means: 与某人击掌问候（或庆祝胜利）

collins.def: Five is the number 5.

example.ex: Eric Edward Bullus was born in Peterborough, the second of five children.
example.tran: 埃里克·爱德华·布勒斯出生于彼得伯勒，是 5 个孩子中的老二。

collins.tran: 墙手球(一种英式球类运动，球小而硬，戴手套或用球拍向场地的三面墙上击球)
collins.def: Fives is a British ball game in which you hit a small hard ball with a glove or bat against three walls of a court.
A fly is a small insect with two wings. There are many kinds of flies, and the most common are black in colour.
When something such as a bird, insect, or aircraft flies, it moves through the air.

example.ex: The planes flew through the clouds...
example.tran: 飞机穿越云层。

example.ex: The bird flew away.
example.tran: 鸟儿飞走了。

collins.def: If you fly somewhere, you travel there in an aircraft.

example.ex: He flew to Los Angeles...
example.tran: 他飞往洛杉矶。

example.ex: He flew back to London...
example.tran: 他飞回了伦敦。

collins.def: When someone flies an aircraft, they control its movement in the air.

example.ex: Parker had successfully flown both aircraft...
example.tran: 两架飞机帕克均成功驾驶过。

example.ex: He flew a small plane to Cuba...
example.tran: 他驾驶一架小型飞机飞往古巴。

collins.def: To fly someone or something somewhere means to take or send them there in an aircraft.

example.ex: It may be possible to fly the women and children out on Thursday...
example.tran: 周四可能会将妇女和儿童空运出去。

example.ex: The relief supplies are being flown from a warehouse in Pisa.
example.tran: 救济物资正从比萨的一个仓库空运过来。

collins.def: If something such as your hair is flying about, it is moving about freely and loosely in the air.

example.ex: His long, uncovered hair flew back in the wind...
example.tran: 他那露在外面的长发随风向后飞舞。

example.ex: She was running down the stairs, her hair flying.
example.tran: 她从楼上跑下来，长发飘动着。

collins.def: If you fly a flag or if it is flying, you display it at the top of a pole.

example.ex: They flew the flag of the African National Congress...
example.tran: 他们升起非洲人国民大会的旗帜。

example.ex: A flag was flying on the new military HQ.
example.tran: 一面旗帜在新的军事指挥部上空飘扬着。

collins.def: If you say that someone or something flies in a particular direction, you are emphasizing that they move there with a lot of speed or force.

example.ex: She flew to their bedsides when they were ill...
example.tran: 在他们生病的时候她飞奔至他们身边。

example.ex: I flew downstairs...
example.tran: 我飞奔到楼下。

collins.def: If you tell someone that you must fly, you are indicating that you have to leave in a great hurry.

example.ex: I must fly or I'll miss my plane...
example.tran: 我必须赶快走了否则就会误机。

example.ex: I'll have to fly.
example.tran: 我得赶紧走了。

collins.def: If stories or rumours are flying around a place, they are being discussed a great deal and by a lot of people within a short period of time.

example.ex: Rumours had been flying around the workrooms all morning...
example.tran: 整个早上流言在各工作间传来传去。

example.ex: Rumours were flying about possible deals.
example.tran: 关于可能的交易的传闻在满天飞。

collins.def: The front opening on a pair of trousers is referred to as the fly, or in British English the flies. It usually consists of a zip or row of buttons behind a band of cloth.
In fishing, a fly is a model of a small winged insect that is used as a bait.
If you say that someone wouldn't hurt a fly or wouldn't harm a fly, you are emphasizing that they are very kind and gentle.

example.ex: Ray wouldn't hurt a fly.
example.tran: 雷心肠很软。

example.ex: ...a lovely girl, who would not have harmed a fly.
example.tran: 连一只苍蝇都不肯伤害的可爱女孩

collins.def: If you let fly, you attack someone, either physically by hitting them, or with words by insulting them.

example.ex: A simmering row ended with her letting fly with a stream of obscenities.
example.tran: 激烈的争吵最后以她一连串的污言秽语而告结束。

collins.def: If you do something on the fly, you do it quickly without thinking about it or planning it in advance, especially while something else is happening.

example.ex: It was all pretty much done on the fly.
example.tran: 那几乎都是匆忙之中完成的。

collins.tran: (把…)打翻在地;(使)重重地摔在地上
collins.def: If you send someone or something flying or if they go flying, they move through the air and fall down with a lot of force.

example.ex: The blow sent the young man flying.
example.tran: 这一拳把那个年轻人打翻在地。

collins.def: If you say that you would like to be a fly on the wall in a situation that does not involve you, you mean that you would like to see or hear what happens in that situation.

example.ex: What I'd give to be a fly on the wall when Davis finds out what's happened to his precious cargo.
example.tran: 我多么希望能够看到戴维斯发现他珍贵的货物出事时的样子啊。

collins.def: If you fly at someone, you attack them, either physically by hitting them, or with words by insulting them.

example.ex: She flew at him for making a very anti-British remark.
example.tran: 她攻击他激烈的反英言论。

collins.tran: 突然爆发(坏脾气);突然陷入(恐慌)
collins.def: If you fly into a bad temper or a panic, you suddenly become very angry or anxious and show this in your behaviour.

example.ex: Losing a game would cause him to fly into a rage.
example.tran: 输掉一场比赛会让他暴跳如雷。

means: [台球]推球，跟球打法（使竿击的球在击中目的球后继续滚动的打法）

collins.def: If you follow someone who is going somewhere, you move along behind them because you want to go to the same place.

example.ex: We followed him up the steps into a large hall...
example.tran: 我们跟着他上楼来到一个很大的大厅。

example.ex: Please follow me, madam...
example.tran: 请跟我来，夫人。

collins.def: If you follow someone who is going somewhere, you move along behind them without their knowledge, in order to catch them or find out where they are going.

example.ex: She realized that the Mercedes was following her...
example.tran: 她意识到那辆奔驰在跟踪她。

example.ex: I think we're being followed.
example.tran: 我想我们被跟踪了。

collins.def: If you follow someone to a place where they have recently gone and where they are now, you go to join them there.

example.ex: He followed Janice to New York, where she was preparing an exhibition.
example.tran: 他追随贾尼丝到了纽约，她正在那里准备一个展览。

collins.def: An event, activity, or period of time that follows a particular thing happens or comes after that thing, at a later time.

example.ex: ...the rioting and looting that followed the verdict...
example.tran: 判决宣布之后发生的暴乱和抢劫

example.ex: I remember nothing else about the days following Daddy's death...
example.tran: 父亲去世之后那几天我不记得有什么其他事了。

collins.def: If you follow one thing with another, you do or say the second thing after you have done or said the first thing.

example.ex: Her first major role was in Martin Scorsese's 'Goodfellas' and she followed this with a part in Spike Lee's 'Jungle Fever'.
example.tran: 她主演的第一部影片是马丁·斯科塞斯的《好家伙》，之后接拍了斯派克·李的《丛林热》。

collins.def: If it follows that a particular thing is the case, that thing is a logical result of something else being true or being the case.

example.ex: Just because a bird does not breed one year, it does not follow that it will fail the next...
example.tran: 不能因为一只鸟某一年没有繁殖就断定它第二年也不会繁殖。

example.ex: If the explanation is right, two things follow...
example.tran: 如果解释是正确的，可以推断出两件事。

collins.tran: (文章或讲演)接下来是,后面的是，下面是
collins.def: If you refer to the words that follow or followed, you are referring to the words that come next or came next in a piece of writing or speech.

example.ex: What follows is an eyewitness account...
example.tran: 接下来的是目击者的陈述。

example.ex: There followed a list of places where Hans intended to visit...
example.tran: 下面列出的是汉斯打算游览的地点。

collins.def: If you follow a path, route, or set of signs, you go somewhere using the path, route, or signs to direct you.

example.ex: If they followed the road, they would be certain to reach a village...
example.tran: 如果他们沿着这条路走，就一定会到达一个村庄。

example.ex: All we had to do was follow the map...
example.tran: 我们所要做的就是按照地图走。

collins.def: If something such as a path or river follows a particular route or line, it goes along that route or line.

example.ex: Our route follows the Pacific coast through densely populated neighbourhoods...
example.tran: 我们的路线沿着太平洋海岸，途经人口稠密的街区。

example.ex: The Lot river follows a winding and tortuous course.
example.tran: 洛特河的河道蜿蜒曲折。

collins.tran: 注视(运动物体);(眼睛)跟随着
collins.def: If you follow something with your eyes, or if your eyes follow it, you watch it as it moves or you look along its route or course.

example.ex: Ann's eyes followed a police car as it drove slowly past.
example.tran: 安注视着一辆缓缓驶过的警车。

collins.tran: 按照…方式发展;以…方式发生
collins.def: Something that follows a particular course of development happens or develops in that way.

example.ex: His release turned out to follow the pattern set by that of the other six hostages.
example.tran: 最终他的获释方式也和其他 6名人质的获释如出一辙。

collins.tran: 接受，遵循(建议、指示等);按(菜谱)进行
collins.def: If you follow advice, an instruction, or a recipe, you act or do something in the way that it indicates.

example.ex: Take care to follow the instructions carefully...
example.tran: 注意严格按照说明进行。

example.ex: No two chefs follow the same recipe.
example.tran: 每个厨师都有不同的烹饪方式。

collins.def: If you follow what someone else has done, you do it too because you think it is a good thing or because you want to copy them.

example.ex: His admiration for the athlete did not extend to the point where he would follow his example in taking drugs...
example.tran: 他对于这个运动员的崇拜还没有达到要学他吸毒的程度。

example.ex: Where eastern Germany goes the rest will surely follow.
example.tran: 东德怎样做，其他地方一定会效仿。

collins.def: If you follow someone in what you do, you do the same thing or job as they did previously.

example.ex: He followed his father and became a surgeon...
example.tran: 他子承父业，成为了一名外科医生。

example.ex: Anni-Frid's son has followed her into the music business.
example.tran: 安妮-弗瑞德的儿子子承母业，也进入了音乐圈。

collins.tran: 理解，跟得上(解释或故事情节)
collins.def: If you are able to follow something such as an explanation or the story of a film, you understand it as it continues and develops.

example.ex: Can you follow the plot so far?...
example.tran: 目前为止剧情你能看得懂吗？

example.ex: I'm afraid I don't follow.
example.tran: 恐怕我没明白。

collins.def: If you follow something, you take an interest in it and keep informed about what happens.

example.ex: ...the millions of people who follow football because they genuinely love it...
example.tran: 数以百万计的人关注足球，因为他们发自内心地热爱足球

example.ex: She was following Laura's progress closely.
example.tran: 她密切关注着劳拉的进展。

collins.def: A story, film, or television programme that follows someone or something is about their experiences over a particular period of time.

example.ex: The film follows the fortunes of two women.
example.tran: 这部电影讲述了两个女人的命运。

collins.tran: (欣赏节目的同时)对照看(脚本或乐谱)
collins.def: If you follow a score or written copy of a play, you read it while you listen to it being performed.

example.ex: ...an annotated version of Mozart's opera that allows the listener to follow the score.
example.tran: 使听者能够一边欣赏一边对照着看的莫扎特歌剧的注释乐谱

collins.def: If you follow a particular religion or political belief, you have that religion or belief.

example.ex: 'Do you follow any particular religion?' — 'Yes, we're all Hindus.'
example.tran: “你们有自己的宗教信仰吗？”——“是的，我们都是印度教徒。”

collins.def: You use as follows in writing or speech to introduce something such as a list, description, or explanation.

example.ex: The winners are as follows: E. Walker; R. Foster; R. Gates; A. Mackintosh...
example.tran: 优胜者分别是：E.沃克、R.福斯特、R.盖茨和A.麦金托什。

example.ex: This can be done if you proceed as follows.
example.tran: 按照如下操作即可完成。

collins.def: You use followed by to say what comes after something else in a list or ordered set of things.

example.ex: Potatoes are still the most popular food, followed by white bread.
example.tran: 马铃薯仍然是最受欢迎的食物，其次是白面包。

collins.def: After mentioning one course of a meal, you can mention the next course by saying what you will have to follow or what there will be to follow .

example.ex: He decided on roast chicken and vegetables, with apple pie to follow.
example.tran: 他决定点烤鸡配蔬菜，然后是苹果派。

collins.def: If you follow through an action, plan, or idea or follow through with it, you continue doing or thinking about it until you have done everything possible.

example.ex: The leadership has been unwilling to follow through the implications of these ideas...
example.tran: 领导层不愿意对这些想法的含意进行深入探究。

example.ex: I was trained to be an actress but I didn't follow it through...
example.tran: 我接受过演员培训，但是我没有坚持下去。

collins.tran: 追查;将…深入下去;对…采取进一步行动
collins.def: If you follow up something that has been said, suggested, or discovered, you try to find out more about it or take action about it.

example.ex: State security police are following up several leads...
example.tran: 国家安全警察正在追查几条线索。

example.ex: An officer took a statement from me, but no one's bothered to follow it up.
example.tran: 一位警官收集了我的供述，但却没有人愿意追查下去。

collins.def: Food is what people and animals eat.

example.ex: Enjoy your food.
example.tran: 用餐愉快。

example.ex: ...supplies of food and water.
example.tran: 食物和水的供给

collins.tran: (常指因生病)不想吃东西，厌食
collins.def: If you are off your food, you do not want to eat, usually because you are ill.

example.ex: It's not like you to be off your food.
example.tran: 胃口不好，这可不像你了。

collins.def: If you give someone food for thought, you make them think carefully about something.

example.ex: Lord Fraser's speech offers much food for thought...
example.tran: 弗雷泽勋爵的讲演发人深省。

example.ex: Developments in your career may give you food for thought.
example.tran: 事业上的发展可能会引发你很多的思考。

means: 英尺(=12 英寸或 30。48 厘米)

collins.def: Your feet are the parts of your body that are at the ends of your legs, and that you stand on.

example.ex: She stamped her foot again.
example.tran: 她又跺了跺脚。

example.ex: ...a foot injury.
example.tran: 足伤

collins.def: The foot of something is the part that is farthest from its top.

example.ex: David called to the children from the foot of the stairs...
example.tran: 戴维在楼梯下面喊孩子们。

example.ex: ...the foot of Highgate Hill...
example.tran: 海格特山脚下

collins.def: The foot of a bed is the end nearest to the feet of the person lying in it.

example.ex: Friends stood at the foot of the bed, looking at her with serious faces.
example.tran: 朋友们站在床脚处，神情严肃地看着她。

collins.tran: 英尺(相当于 12 英寸或 30.48 厘米)
collins.def: A foot is a unit for measuring length, height, or depth, and is equal to 12 inches or 30.48 centimetres. When you are giving measurements, the form 'foot' is often used as the plural instead of the plural form 'feet'.

example.ex: This beautiful and curiously shaped lake lies at around fifteen thousand feet...
example.tran: 这个形状奇特的美丽湖泊周长约有15,000英尺。

example.ex: ...a shopping and leisure complex of one million square feet...
example.tran: 占地100万平方英尺的购物休闲中心

collins.tran: (刹车或泵)用脚操作的，脚踏的
collins.def: A foot brake or foot pump is operated by your foot rather than by your hand.

example.ex: I tried to reach the foot brakes but I couldn't.
example.tran: 我试图去够脚刹，但是没能踩到。

collins.def: A foot patrol or foot soldiers walk rather than travelling in vehicles or on horseback.

example.ex: Paratroopers and foot-soldiers entered the building on the government's behalf.
example.tran: 伞兵和步兵代表政府进入大楼。

collins.def: In poetry, a foot is one of the basic units of rhythm into which a line is divided.
If you get cold feet about something, you become nervous or frightened about it because you think it will fail.

example.ex: The Government is getting cold feet about the reforms.
example.tran: 政府对改革缩手缩脚。

collins.tran: 站稳脚跟;变得自信;能独立行动
collins.def: If you say that someone is finding their feet in a new situation, you mean that they are starting to feel confident and to deal with things successfully.

example.ex: I don't know anyone in England but I am sure I will manage when I find my feet...
example.tran: 我在英格兰不认识什么人，但是我相信自己一旦站稳脚跟就可以独当一面。

example.ex: Once he had found his feet he was able to deal with any problem.
example.tran: 他一旦变得自信了就能够处理任何问题。

collins.def: If you say that someone has their feet on the ground, you approve of the fact that they have a sensible and practical attitude towards life, and do not have unrealistic ideas.

example.ex: In that respect he needs to keep his feet on the ground and not get carried away...
example.tran: 在那一方面他需要脚踏实地，不能飘飘然。

example.ex: Kevin was always level-headed with both feet on the ground.
example.tran: 凯文总是头脑冷静，脚踏实地。

collins.def: If you go somewhere on foot, you walk, rather than using any form of transport.

example.ex: We rowed ashore, then explored the island on foot for the rest of the day.
example.tran: 我们划船到了岸边，之后余下的时间步行在岛上探险。

collins.def: If you are on your feet, you are standing up.

example.ex: Everyone was on their feet applauding wildly.
example.tran: 每个人都站起身来热烈鼓掌。

collins.def: If you say that someone or something is on their feet again after an illness or difficult period, you mean that they have recovered and are back to normal.

example.ex: You need someone to take the pressure off and help you get back on your feet...
example.tran: 你需要有人为你分担压力，帮你恢复元气。

example.ex: He said they all needed to work together to put the country on its feet again.
example.tran: 他说他们都需要通力协作以使国家恢复元气。

collins.def: If you say that someone always falls or lands on their feet, you mean that they are always successful or lucky, although they do not seem to achieve this by their own efforts.

example.ex: He has good looks and charm, and always falls on his feet...
example.tran: 他长得很帅，也有魅力，总是走好运。

example.ex: While I struggle through life, she lands on her feet.
example.tran: 在我挣扎过活的时候，她却运气亨通。

collins.tran: 一只脚踏进了坟墓;行将就木
collins.def: If you say that someone has one foot in the grave, you mean that they are very old or very ill and will probably die soon.

collins.tran: 情况完全逆转;事实恰恰相反
collins.def: If you say, in British English, the boot is on the other foot or, mainly in American English, the shoe is on the other foot, you mean that a situation has been reversed completely, so that the person who was in the better position before is now in the worse one.

example.ex: You're not in a position to remove me. The boot is now on the other foot.
example.tran: 你没有权力开除我。相反，我现在可以开除你。

collins.def: If you put your best foot forward, you act in a cheerful, determined way.

example.ex: Put your best foot forward and work on the assumption that there is an acceptable solution to every problem you are likely to face.
example.tran: 要尽力而为，要相信你可能遇到的每一个问题都会有一个适当的解决方案。

collins.tran: 拿定主意阻止;执意反对
collins.def: If someone puts their foot down, they use their authority in order to stop something happening.

example.ex: He had planned to go skiing on his own in March but his wife had decided to put her foot down.
example.tran: 他原本打算在 3 月独自去滑雪，但是他的太太决定让他打消这个念头。

collins.def: If someone puts their foot down when they are driving, they drive as fast as they can.

example.ex: I asked the driver to put his foot down for Nagchukha.
example.tran: 我要求司机加大油门去那曲。

collins.tran: (行为或言语)使人尴尬,冒犯别人
collins.def: If someone puts their foot in it or puts their foot in their mouth, they accidentally do or say something which embarrasses or offends people.

example.ex: Our chairman has really put his foot in it, poor man, though he doesn't know it.
example.tran: 我们的主席真的让人很尴尬，可怜的人，尽管他自己没意识到。

collins.tran: (尤指架起双脚)坐下(或躺下)休息，放松
collins.def: If you put your feet up, you relax or have a rest, especially by sitting or lying with your feet supported off the ground.

example.ex: After supper he'd put his feet up and read. It was a pleasant prospect.
example.tran: 晚饭后他会支起双腿，歇一歇，看看书。那真是件很惬意的事情。

collins.def: If you never put a foot wrong, you never make any mistakes.

example.ex: When he's around, we never put a foot wrong...
example.tran: 他在的时候，我们从来不会出错。

example.ex: He hardly put a foot wrong in defence and was fine in attack.
example.tran: 他防守的时候几乎滴水不漏，进攻也很出色。

collins.def: If you say that someone sets foot in a place, you mean that they enter it or reach it, and you are emphasizing the significance of their action. If you say that someone never sets foot in a place, you are emphasizing that they never go there.

example.ex: ...the day the first man set foot on the moon...
example.tran: 人类首次登上月球的那一天

example.ex: A little later I left that place and never set foot in Texas again.
example.tran: 之后没多久我离开了那个地方，从此再也没有回过得克萨斯。

collins.def: If someone has to stand on their own two feet, they have to be independent and manage their lives without help from other people.

example.ex: My father didn't mind whom I married, so long as I could stand on my own two feet and wasn't dependent on my husband.
example.tran: 只要我能够自食其力，不依附于自己的丈夫，嫁给谁我父亲倒是并不介意。

collins.def: If you get or rise to your feet, you stand up.

example.ex: Malone got to his feet and followed his superior out of the suite...
example.tran: 马隆站起身来，跟在他的上司后面走出了套房。

example.ex: The delegates cheered and rose to their feet...
example.tran: 代表们欢呼着站起身来。

collins.def: If you say that someone is under your feet, you are annoyed because they are with you or near you, and are bothering you.

example.ex: The children were running about under everybody's feet.
example.tran: 孩子们在周围乱跑，让所有人都很烦。

collins.tran: 一开始就不对;出师不利
collins.def: If someone gets off on the wrong foot in a new situation, they make a bad start by doing something in completely the wrong way.

example.ex: Even though they called the election and had been preparing for it for some time, they got off on the wrong foot.
example.tran: 尽管他们召集了选举，也为此做了一段时间的准备，但是一开始就走错了。

collins.def: If something is for someone, they are intended to have it or benefit from it.

example.ex: Isn't that enough for you?...
example.tran: 那对你来说不够吗？

example.ex: I have some free advice for you.
example.tran: 我可以为你提供免费咨询。

collins.def: If you work or do a job for someone, you are employed by them.

example.ex: I knew he worked for a security firm...
example.tran: 我知道他在一家保安公司工作。

example.ex: Have you had any experience writing for radio?
example.tran: 你有给电台写稿子的经验吗？

collins.def: If you speak or act for a particular group or organization, you represent them.

example.ex: She appears nightly on the television news, speaking for the State Department.
example.tran: 她作为国务院的发言人，每晚都会出现在电视新闻中。

example.ex: ...the spokesman for the Democrats.
example.tran: 民主党发言人

collins.def: If someone does something for you, they do it so that you do not have to do it.

example.ex: If your pharmacy doesn't stock the product you want, have them order it for you...
example.tran: 如果药店没有你想要的药品，让他们为你订购。

example.ex: I hold a shop door open for an old person...
example.tran: 我帮一位老人把住店门。

collins.def: If you feel a particular emotion for someone, you feel it on their behalf.

example.ex: This is the best thing you've ever done – I am so happy for you!...
example.tran: 这是你做得最棒的一件事——我为你感到高兴！

example.ex: He felt a great sadness for this little girl.
example.tran: 他为这个小女孩深感悲哀。

collins.def: If you feel a particular emotion for someone or something, they are the object of that emotion, and you feel it when you think about them.

example.ex: John, I'm sorry for Steve, but I think you've made the right decisions...
example.tran: 约翰，我为史蒂夫感到难过，但是我想你的决定是正确的。

example.ex: Mack felt a pitiless contempt for her.
example.tran: 麦克对她没有同情，只有鄙夷。

collins.def: You use for after words such as 'time', 'space', 'money', or 'energy' when you say how much there is or whether there is enough of it in order to be able to do or use a particular thing.

example.ex: Many new trains have space for wheelchair users...
example.tran: 许多新型列车为坐轮椅者留有空间。

example.ex: It would take three to six hours for a round trip...
example.tran: 往返行程需要 3 到 6 个小时。

collins.def: If something is for sale, hire, or use, it is available to be sold, hired, or used.

example.ex: ...fishmongers displaying freshwater fish for sale...
example.tran: 摆摊卖淡水鱼的鱼贩

example.ex: Skis are available for hire on a daily basis.
example.tran: 雪橇可以按天租用。

collins.def: You use for when you state or explain the purpose of an object, action, or activity.

example.ex: ...drug users who use unsterile equipment for injections of drugs...
example.tran: 使用未经消毒的注射器注射毒品的吸毒者

example.ex: The knife for cutting sausage was sitting in the sink.
example.tran: 切香肠用的刀放在水槽里。

collins.def: You use for after nouns expressing reason or cause.

example.ex: He's soon to make a speech in parliament explaining his reasons for going...
example.tran: 他很快要在议会发表讲话，说明他辞职的原因。

example.ex: The county hospital could find no physical cause for Sumner's problems...
example.tran: 关于萨姆纳的问题，县医院查不出任何生理上的原因。

collins.def: You can use for to introduce a clause which gives the reason why you made the statement in the main clause.

example.ex: He had a great desire to have a home of his own for he had always lived with my grandmother.
example.tran: 他强烈渴望拥有一个属于自己的家，因为他一直和我祖母住在一起。

collins.def: You can use for to introduce the cause of the fact that you have just mentioned.

example.ex: ...doing jobs that others turn down for lack of skill...
example.tran: 做别人不愿意做的没有技术含量的工作

example.ex: They cannot sleep for hunger.
example.tran: 他们饿得睡不着。

collins.tran: (用于条件句中)如果不是为了，要不是
collins.def: For is used in conditional sentences, in expressions such as 'if not for' and 'were it not for', to introduce the only thing which prevents the main part of the sentence from being true.

example.ex: If not for John, Brian wouldn't have learned the truth...
example.tran: 要不是因为约翰，布赖恩也不可能知道真相。

example.ex: The earth would be a frozen ball if it were not for the radiant heat of the sun...
example.tran: 如果没有太阳辐射的热量，地球就会变成一个冰球。

collins.def: You use for to say how long something lasts or continues.

example.ex: The toaster remained on for more than an hour...
example.tran: 烤面包机持续开了一个多小时。

example.ex: For a few minutes she sat on her bed watching the clock...
example.tran: 她坐在床上盯着时钟看了几分钟。

collins.def: You use for to say how far something extends.

example.ex: We drove on for a few miles...
example.tran: 我们继续往前开了几公里。

example.ex: Great clouds of black smoke were rising for several hundred feet or so.
example.tran: 大片的黑色烟云升至大约几百英尺的空中。

collins.def: If something is bought, sold, or done for a particular amount of money, that amount of money is its price.

example.ex: We got the bus back to Tange for 30 cents...
example.tran: 我们花了 30 美分坐公共汽车回到坦格。

example.ex: The Martins sold their house for about 1.4 million pounds...
example.tran: 马丁夫妇把他们的房子卖了 140 万英镑。

collins.def: If something is planned for a particular time, it is planned to happen then.

example.ex: ...the Welsh Boat Show, planned for July 30–August 1...
example.tran: 预定于 7 月 30 日至 8 月 1 日期间举办的威尔士船展

example.ex: Marks & Spencer will be unveiling its latest fashions for autumn and winter...
example.tran: 玛莎百货的最新款秋冬季时装即将亮相。

collins.def: If you do something for a particular occasion, you do it on that occasion or to celebrate that occasion.

example.ex: He asked his daughter what she would like for her birthday...
example.tran: 他问女儿过生日想要什么。

example.ex: I'll be home for Christmas.
example.tran: 我会回家过圣诞节。

collins.def: If you leave for a particular place or if you take a bus, train, plane, or boat for a place, you are going there.

example.ex: They would be leaving for Rio early the next morning.
example.tran: 他们第二天一早要去里约。

collins.def: You use for when you make a statement about something in order to say how it affects or relates to someone, or what their attitude to it is.

example.ex: What matters for most scientists is money and facilities...
example.tran: 对多数科学家来说，资金和设备是至关重要的。

example.ex: For her, books were as necessary to life as bread...
example.tran: 对她来说，书就像面包一样，是生活必需品。

collins.tran: (用于形容词、名词和动词短语后，引出其后动词不定式的主语)
collins.def: After some adjective, noun, and verb phrases, you use for to introduce the subject of the action indicated by the following infinitive verb.

example.ex: It might be possible for a single woman to be accepted as a foster parent...
example.tran: 有可能会接受单身女子作为领养人。

example.ex: I had made arrangements for my affairs to be dealt with by one of my children...
example.tran: 我已经安排我的一个孩子处理我的事务。

collins.tran: 就…而言(表示相对来说不寻常)
collins.def: You use for when you say that an aspect of something or someone is surprising in relation to other aspects of them.

example.ex: He was tall for an eight-year-old...
example.tran: 对一个 8 岁的孩子而言，他长得很高。

example.ex: He had too much money for a young man.
example.tran: 对于一个年轻人来说，他太有钱了。

collins.def: If you say that you are for a particular activity, you mean that this is what you want or intend to do.

example.ex: Right, who's for a toasted sandwich then?...
example.tran: 好吧，谁想要吐司三明治？

example.ex: 'What'll it be?' Paul said. —'I'm for halibut.'
example.tran: “要吃什么？”保罗说。——“我要吃大比目鱼。”

collins.def: If you say that something is not for you, you mean that you do not enjoy it or that it is not suitable for you.
