example.ex: Wendy decided the sport was not for her...
example.tran: 温迪认定这项运动不适合她。

example.ex: Not for me the settled life...
example.tran: 安定的生活并不适合我。

collins.tran: (表示负有责任或享有权利)由…
collins.def: If it is for you to do something, it is your responsibility or right to do it.

example.ex: I wish you would come back to Washington with us, but that's for you to decide...
example.tran: 我希望你能和我们一起回华盛顿，但是这由你决定。

example.ex: It is not for me to arrange such matters.
example.tran: 我无权安排这些事情。

collins.def: If you are for something, you agree with it or support it.

example.ex: Are you for or against public transport?...
example.tran: 你是支持还是反对公共交通？

example.ex: I'm for a government that the people respect and that respects the people...
example.tran: 我拥护一个受到人民尊重并且尊重人民的政府。

collins.tran: (用于 argue, case, evidence, vote 等词后，引出所支持或被证明之事)
collins.def: You use for after words such as 'argue', 'case', 'evidence', or 'vote' in order to introduce the thing that is being supported or proved.

example.ex: Another union has voted for industrial action in support of a pay claim...
example.tran: 另一个工会已经投票赞成采取要求加薪的劳工行动。

example.ex: The case for nuclear power is impressive...
example.tran: 这个支持核能的案例令人印象深刻。

collins.tran: (置于某些名词、形容词或动词后，引出更多信息或与某性质、事物或行为相关的事物)
collins.def: For is the preposition that is used after some nouns, adjectives, or verbs in order to introduce more information or to indicate what a quality, thing, or action relates to.

example.ex: Reduced-calorie cheese is a great substitute for cream cheese...
example.tran: 低卡路里干酪是奶油干酪的极佳替代品。

example.ex: Car park owners should be legally responsible for protecting vehicles...
example.tran: 停车场场主有保护停放车辆的法律责任。

collins.def: To be named for someone means to be given the same name as them.

example.ex: The Brady Bill is named for former White House Press Secretary James Brady...
example.tran: 布雷迪法案是以前白宫新闻秘书詹姆斯·布雷迪的名字命名的。

example.ex: Ayer started N. W. Ayer & Son in 1869, naming the firm for his father.
example.tran: 艾尔在1869 年成立了 N. W. 艾尔父子公司，公司以他父亲的名字命名。

collins.tran: (与 every 连用，引出比率)每…(就有…)
collins.def: You use for with 'every' when you are stating a ratio, to introduce one of the things in the ratio.

example.ex: For every farm job that is lost, two or three other jobs in the area are put at risk...
example.tran: 在该地区每有一个农民失去工作，另外两到三个从事其他工作的人就会面临失业的危险。

example.ex: Where there had been one divorce for every 100 marriages before the war, now there were five.
example.tran: 战前每100对夫妇中有一对离婚，现在则是 5 对。

collins.tran: (用于比较)每镑对每镑/每英里对每英里
collins.def: You can use for in expressions such as pound for pound or mile for mile when you are making comparisons between the values or qualities of different things.

example.ex: ...the Antarctic, mile for mile one of the planet's most lifeless areas...
example.tran: 南极洲的每一寸土地和世界上其他地方相比都是最荒芜的

example.ex: He insists any tax cut be matched dollar-for-dollar with cuts in spending.
example.tran: 他坚持每一项减税都要和支出削减一一对应。

collins.def: If a word or expression has the same meaning as another word or expression, you can say that the first one is another word or expression for the second one.

example.ex: The technical term for sunburn is erythema...
example.tran: 晒斑的专业术语是红斑。

example.ex: Cancer is derived from the Greek word for crab, karkinos.
example.tran: cancer 这个词派生自希腊语中表示螃蟹的 karkinos 一词

collins.tran: (引出可在其他地方找到的信息)至于，对于
collins.def: You use for in a piece of writing when you mention information which will be found somewhere else.

example.ex: For further information on the life of William James Sidis, see Amy Wallace, 'The Prodigy'.
example.tran: 想了解关于威廉·詹姆斯·西迪斯生平的更多信息，请参阅埃米·华莱士所著《神童》。

collins.tran: (尽管有不同意见或实际困难)完全赞成,坚信
collins.def: If you say that you are all for doing something, you agree or strongly believe that it should be done, but you are also often suggesting that other people disagree with you or that there are practical difficulties.

example.ex: I am all for cutting carbon dioxide emissions, but that would be much more easily achieved by giving subsidies to windpower, than with nuclear power...
example.tran: 我完全赞成减少二氧化碳的排放，但是，相比发展核能，对发展风能提供补贴更容易实现这一目标。

example.ex: He is all for players earning what they can while they are in the game...
example.tran: 他完全赞成现役运动员尽可能多赚钱。

collins.def: If you are in for it or, in British English, if you are for it, you are likely to get into trouble because of something you have done.
You use expressions such as for the first time and for the last time when you are talking about how often something has happened before.

example.ex: He was married for the second time, this time to a Belgian...
example.tran: 他第二次结婚，这一次是和一个比利时人。

example.ex: For the first time in my career, I was failing.
example.tran: 我职业生涯中第一次经历失败。

collins.def: If someone forces you to do something, they make you do it even though you do not want to, for example by threatening you.

example.ex: He was charged with abducting a taxi driver and forcing him to drive a bomb to Downing Street...
example.tran: 他被控劫持一名出租车司机并强迫他开车把一颗炸弹送到唐宁街。

example.ex: He was forced to resign by Russia's conservative parliament...
example.tran: 他在俄罗斯保守议会的压力下被迫辞职。

collins.def: If a situation or event forces you to do something, it makes it necessary for you to do something that you would not otherwise have done.

example.ex: A back injury forced her to withdraw from Wimbledon...
example.tran: 背部受伤使她不得不退出温布尔登赛事。

example.ex: He turned right, down a dirt road that forced him into four-wheel drive...
example.tran: 他右转弯，开到了一条土路上，不得不以四轮驱动行进。

collins.def: If someone forces something on or upon you, they make you accept or use it when you would prefer not to.

example.ex: To force this agreement on the nation is wrong.
example.tran: 把这份协定强加给这个国家是错误的。

collins.def: If you force something into a particular position, you use a lot of strength to make it move there.

example.ex: They were forcing her head under the icy waters, drowning her.
example.tran: 他们用力把她的头按到冰冷的水中，想淹死她。

collins.def: If someone forces a lock, a door, or a window, they break the lock or fastening in order to get into a building without using a key.

example.ex: That evening police forced the door of the flat and arrested Mr Roberts...
example.tran: 那一晚，警察强行打开公寓大门，逮捕了罗伯茨先生。

example.ex: He tried to force the window open but it was jammed shut.
example.tran: 他试图破窗而入，但是窗户卡死了。

collins.def: If someone uses force to do something, or if it is done by force, strong and violent physical action is taken in order to achieve it.

example.ex: The government decided against using force to break-up the demonstrations.
example.tran: 政府决定不使用暴力驱散示威人群。

example.ex: ...the guerrillas' efforts to seize power by force.
example.tran: 游击队使用武力夺取政权的努力

collins.def: Force is the power or strength which something has.

example.ex: The force of the explosion shattered the windows of several buildings...
example.tran: 爆炸的冲力震碎了几栋楼房的玻璃窗。

example.ex: It looked as though the storm had an awful lot of force.
example.tran: 看上去暴风雨来势汹汹。

collins.def: If you refer to someone or something as a force in a particular type of activity, you mean that they have a strong influence on it.

example.ex: For years the army was the most powerful political force in the country...
example.tran: 多年来，军队一直是这个国家最强大的政治力量。

example.ex: The band are still as innovative a force in British music as they were when they started...
example.tran: 这支乐队一如他们刚刚组建时那样是英国音乐界的一支创新力量。

collins.def: The force of something is the powerful effect or quality that it has.

example.ex: He changed our world through the force of his ideas...
example.tran: 他通过自己观念的力量改变了我们的世界。

example.ex: Perhaps your force of argument might have made some difference.
example.tran: 或许是你的雄辩使情况发生了变化。

collins.def: You can use forces to refer to processes and events that do not appear to be caused by human beings, and are therefore difficult to understand or control.

example.ex: ...the protection of mankind against the forces of nature: epidemics, predators, floods, hurricanes...
example.tran: 保护人类抵御自然力——传染病、食肉动物、洪水和飓风

example.ex: The principle of market forces was applied to some of the country's most revered institutions...
example.tran: 市场运作的规律被应用到该国某些最具影响力的机构。

collins.def: In physics, a force is the pulling or pushing effect that something has on something else.

example.ex: ...the earth's gravitational force.
example.tran: 地球的重力

example.ex: ...protons and electrons trapped by magnetic forces in the Van Allen belts.
example.tran: 范艾伦辐射带的磁力俘获的质子和电子

collins.tran: (置于数字前表示风力的)级数
collins.def: Force is used before a number to indicate a wind of a particular speed or strength, especially a very strong wind.

example.ex: The airlift was conducted in force ten winds...
example.tran: 空运在 10 级大风中进行。

example.ex: Northerly winds will increase to force six by midday.
example.tran: 到中午时分北风会加强到 6 级。

collins.def: If you force a smile or a laugh, you manage to smile or laugh, but with an effort because you are unhappy.

example.ex: Joe forced a smile, but underneath he was a little disturbed...
example.tran: 乔强颜欢笑，但内心里感到有些不安。

example.ex: 'Why don't you offer me a drink?' he asked, with a forced smile.
example.tran: “为什么不请我喝一杯？”他问道，勉强笑了笑。

collins.def: Forces are groups of soldiers or military vehicles that are organized for a particular purpose.

example.ex: ...the deployment of American forces in the region.
example.tran: 美国武装力量在这一地区的部署

collins.tran: 军队(指陆海空三军之一或三军)
collins.def: The forces means the army, the navy, or the air force, or all three.

example.ex: The more senior you become in the forces, the more likely you are to end up in a desk job.
example.tran: 在部队里级别越高，最后就越有可能去做文职工作。

collins.def: The force is sometimes used to mean the police force.

example.ex: It was hard for a police officer to make friends outside the force.
example.tran: 警官很难与警队外面的人交朋友。

collins.def: If something happens by force of a particular quality, action, or set of circumstances, it happens because of the nature or intensity of that quality, action, or set of circumstances.

example.ex: ...converting the sceptics by force of argument.
example.tran: 通过辩论说服提出质疑者

example.ex: ...its promise to free Kuwait by force of arms.
example.tran: 通过武力解放科威特的承诺

collins.def: If you do something from force of habit, you do it because you have always done it in the past, rather than because you have thought carefully about it.

example.ex: He looked around from force of habit, but nobody paid any attention to him...
example.tran: 他出于习惯环顾四周，但是没人注意他。

example.ex: Unconsciously, by force of habit, she plugged the coffee pot in.
example.tran: 下意识地，她习惯性地把咖啡壶的插头插上了。

collins.tran: (法律、规定或体系)在实施，生效
collins.def: A law, rule, or system that is in force exists or is being used.

example.ex: Although the new tax is already in force, you have until November to lodge an appeal.
example.tran: 尽管新的税法已经生效，你需要等到 12 月才能提出上诉。

collins.def: When people do something in force, they do it in large numbers.

example.ex: Voters turned out in force for their first taste of multi-party elections.
example.tran: 大批选民前来参加他们的第一次多党选举。

collins.def: If you join forces with someone, you work together in order to achieve a common aim or purpose.

example.ex: Both groups joined forces to persuade voters to approve a tax break for the industry...
example.tran: 两个团体联合游说投票者赞成给予这个行业税收优惠。

example.ex: William joined forces with businessman Nicholas Court to launch the new vehicle.
example.tran: 威廉和企业家尼古拉斯·考特联手推出这款新车。

collins.def: If you force your way through or into somewhere, you have to push or break things that are in your way in order to get there.

example.ex: The miners were armed with clubs as they forced their way through a police cordon...
example.tran: 矿工们手持棍棒冲过了警戒线。

example.ex: He forced his way into a house shouting for help.
example.tran: 他冲进一幢房子呼喊求救。

collins.def: If you force back an emotion or desire, you manage, with an effort, not to experience it.

example.ex: Nancy forced back tears. She wasn't going to cry in front of all those people.
example.tran: 南希强忍泪水。她不会在那些人面前哭的。

collins.def: Something or someone that is foreign comes from or relates to a country that is not your own.

example.ex: ...in Frankfurt, where a quarter of the population is foreign...
example.tran: 在有四分之一的人口是外来移民的法兰克福

example.ex: She was on her first foreign holiday without her parents.
example.tran: 她第一次在没有父母陪伴的情况下自己去国外度假。

collins.def: In politics and journalism, foreign is used to describe people, jobs, and activities relating to countries that are not the country of the person or government concerned.

example.ex: ...the German foreign minister...
example.tran: 德国外交部长

example.ex: I am the foreign correspondent in Washington of La Tribuna newspaper of Honduras.
example.tran: 我是洪都拉斯《论坛报》驻华盛顿的记者。

collins.def: A foreign object is something that has got into something else, usually by accident, and should not be there.

example.ex: The patient's immune system would reject the transplanted organ as a foreign object.
example.tran: 病人的免疫系统会对移植器官产生异质排斥反应。

collins.tran: 陌生的;不熟悉的;非典型的
collins.def: Something that is foreign to a particular person or thing is not typical of them or is unknown to them.

example.ex: The very notion of price competition is foreign to many schools...
example.tran: 价格竞争这个概念对于许多学校都很陌生。

example.ex: The whole thing is foreign to us.
example.tran: 我们对整件事不了解。

collins.def: A form of something is a type or kind of it.

example.ex: He contracted a rare form of cancer...
example.tran: 他得了一种罕见的癌症。

example.ex: Doctors are willing to take some form of industrial action...
example.tran: 医生们愿意采取某种形式的劳工行动。

collins.def: When something can exist or happen in several possible ways, you can use form to refer to one particular way in which it exists or happens.

example.ex: Valleys often take the form of deep canyons...
example.tran: 山谷经常以深峡谷的形态存在。

example.ex: They received a benefit in the form of a tax reduction...
example.tran: 他们获得了减税优惠。

collins.tran: 形成;(使)排列成;组成…形状
collins.def: When a particular shape forms or is formed, people or things move or are arranged so that this shape is made.

example.ex: A queue forms outside Peter's study...
example.tran: 彼得书房外面排起了队。

example.ex: They formed a circle and sang 'Auld Lang Syne'...
example.tran: 他们围成一个圆圈，唱起了《友谊地久天长》。

collins.def: The form of something is its shape.

example.ex: ...the form of the body.
example.tran: 体形

collins.def: You can refer to something that you can see as a form if you cannot see it clearly, or if its outline is the clearest or most striking aspect of it.

example.ex: She thought she'd never been so glad to see his bulky form.
example.tran: 她想她从来没有因看到他那肥胖的身躯而如此高兴。

collins.def: If something is arranged or changed so that it becomes similar to a thing with a particular structure or function, you can say that it forms that thing.

example.ex: These panels folded up to form a screen some five feet tall...
example.tran: 这些嵌板折起来组成了一个约 5 英尺高的屏风。

example.ex: All the buildings have names and form a half circle.
example.tran: 所有的建筑都有名称，连在一起构成了一个半圆。

collins.def: If something consists of particular things, people, or features, you can say that they form that thing.

example.ex: ...the articles that formed the basis of Randolph's book...
example.tran: 构成伦道夫此书的基础的那些文章

example.ex: Cereals form the staple diet of an enormous number of people around the world.
example.tran: 谷类是世界范围内很大一部分人的主要食物。

collins.def: If you form an organization, group, or company, you start it.

example.ex: They tried to form a study group on human rights...
example.tran: 他们试图组建一个人权问题研究小组。

example.ex: They formed themselves into teams.
example.tran: 他们组成了几个队。

collins.def: When something natural forms or is formed, it begins to exist and develop.

example.ex: The stars must have formed 10 to 15 billion years ago...
example.tran: 这些恒星一定是形成于 100 到 150 亿年前。

example.ex: Huge ice sheets were formed.
example.tran: 巨大的冰层形成了。

collins.tran: (使)(关系、习惯或想法)形成;(使)产生
collins.def: If you form a relationship, a habit, or an idea, or if it forms, it begins to exist and develop.

example.ex: This should help him form lasting relationships...
example.tran: 这应该能帮助他建立持久的关系。

example.ex: She had formed the habit of giving herself freely to men...
example.tran: 她已经养成了对男人投怀送抱的习惯。

collins.def: If you say that something forms a person's character or personality, you mean that it has a strong influence on them and causes them to develop in a particular way.

example.ex: Anger at injustice formed his character.
example.tran: 对不公正现象的愤怒塑造了他的性格。

collins.tran: (运动员或参赛动物的)竞技状态,表现状态
collins.def: In sport, form refers to the ability or success of a person or animal over a period of time.

example.ex: His form this season has been brilliant...
example.tran: 他这一赛季状态非常不错。

example.ex: Leconte showed good form.
example.tran: 勒孔特表现出良好的状态。

collins.def: A form is a paper with questions on it and spaces marked where you should write the answers. Forms usually ask you to give details about yourself, for example when you are applying for a job or joining an organization.

example.ex: You will be asked to fill in a form with details of your birth and occupation.
example.tran: 你将需要填写一张有关生日和职业详情的表格。

example.ex: ...application forms.
example.tran: 申请表

collins.tran: 讨厌的行为;不礼貌的行为
collins.def: If you say that it is bad form to behave in a particular way, you mean that it is rude and impolite.

example.ex: It was thought bad form to discuss business on social occasions.
example.tran: 在社交场合讨论生意被认为是不礼貌的。

collins.tran: 身体健康;情况良好;心情愉悦
collins.def: If you say that someone is in good form, you mean that they seem healthy and cheerful.
If you say that someone is off form, you think they are not performing as well as they usually do.

collins.tran: 状态良好;表现出色;发挥正常
collins.def: If you say that someone is on form, you think that they are performing their usual activity very well.

example.ex: Robert Redford is back on form in his new movie 'Sneakers'.
example.tran: 罗伯特·雷德福在新片《通天神偷》中恢复了表演水准。

collins.def: When something takes form, it develops or begins to be visible.

example.ex: As plans took form in her mind, she realized the need for an accomplice...
example.tran: 随着计划在脑海里逐渐成形，她意识到需要找一个帮手。

example.ex: The face of Mrs Lisbon took form in the dimness.
example.tran: 昏暗中，里斯本夫人的脸慢慢变得清晰起来。

collins.def: If someone or something behaves true to form, they do what is expected and is typical of them.

example.ex: Before the train had left the outskirts of London he behaved true to form and began a conversation...
example.tran: 一如往常，列车还没驶出伦敦郊区，他就开始和别人聊起天来。

example.ex: My luck was running true to form...
example.tran: 我的运气和往常一样。

collins.def: Former is used to describe someone who used to have a particular job, position, or role, but no longer has it.

example.ex: The unemployed executives include former sales managers, directors and accountants.
example.tran: 被解雇的管理人员包括前销售经理、主管和会计。

example.ex: ...former President Richard Nixon...
example.tran: 前总统理查德·尼克松

collins.def: Former is used to refer to countries which no longer exist or whose boundaries have changed.

example.ex: ...the former Soviet Union.
example.tran: 前苏联

example.ex: ...the former Yugoslavia.
example.tran: 前南斯拉夫

collins.def: Former is used to describe something which used to belong to someone or which used to be a particular thing.

example.ex: ...the former home of Sir Christopher Wren.
example.tran: 克里斯托弗·雷恩爵士的旧居

example.ex: ...a former monastery.
example.tran: 昔日的修道院

collins.def: Former is used to describe a situation or period of time which came before the present one.

example.ex: He would want you to remember him as he was in former years.
example.tran: 他可能会希望你记住他早年的样子。

collins.def: When two people, things, or groups have just been mentioned, you can refer to the first of them as the former .

example.ex: Given the choice between a pure white T-shirt and a more expensive, dirty cream one, most people can be forgiven for choosing the former...
example.tran: 如果要在一件纯白的 T 恤和一件更贵的脏兮兮的米色 T 恤之间选择的话，多数人都会选前者，这是无可厚非的。

example.ex: If the family home and joint pension rights are of equal value, the wife may choose the former and the husband the latter.
example.tran: 如果家庭住房和共同养老金具有同样的价值，妻子可能会选前者，而丈夫会选后者。

collins.def: Forty is the number 40.

collins.tran: 四十多，四十几(指从40至49的数字)
collins.def: When you talk about the forties, you are referring to numbers between 40 and 49. For example, if you are in your forties, you are aged between 40 and 49. If the temperature is in the forties, the temperature is between 40 and 49 degrees.

example.ex: He was a big man in his forties, smartly dressed in a suit and tie.
example.tran: 他是一个四十多岁的高大男子，穿西装打领带，看上去很精神。

collins.tran: 二十世纪四十年代(指从 1940 年至 1949 年)
collins.def: The forties is the decade between 1940 and 1949.

example.ex: Steel cans were introduced sometime during the forties.
example.tran: 钢罐是 20 世纪 40 年代时开始使用的。

collins.def: Four is the number 4.

example.ex: Judith is married with four children.
example.tran: 朱迪丝已经结婚了，有四个孩子。

collins.def: In cricket, if a player hits a four, they score four runs by hitting the ball along the ground so that it crosses the boundary at the edge of the playing area.

example.ex: Taylor hit 13 fours and batted for 140 minutes.
example.tran: 泰勒打了 13 个 4 分球，击球时间为 140 分钟。

collins.def: A four is a narrow racing boat that is rowed by a team of four people.
If you are on all fours, your knees, feet, and hands are on the ground.

example.ex: She crawled on all fours over to the window.
example.tran: 她爬到窗边。

collins.def: Fourteen is the number 14.

example.ex: I'm fourteen years old.
example.tran: 我14岁。

collins.def: If something is free, you can have it or use it without paying for it.

example.ex: The seminars are free, with lunch provided.
example.tran: 研讨会不收会务费，而且还提供午餐。

example.ex: ...a free brochure with details of gift vouchers.
example.tran: 内有礼券详情的免费宣传册

collins.tran: 自由的;不受约束的;没有限制的
collins.def: Someone or something that is free is not restricted, controlled, or limited, for example by rules, customs, or other people.

example.ex: The government will be free to pursue its economic policies...
example.tran: 政府将可不受限制地实行其经济政策。

example.ex: The elections were free and fair...
example.tran: 选举是自由公正的。

collins.def: If you free someone of something that is unpleasant or restricting, you remove it from them.

example.ex: It will free us of a whole lot of debt...
example.tran: 它会使我们摆脱巨额债务。

example.ex: The 30-year-old star is trying to free himself from his recording contract.
example.tran: 这位30 岁的明星正试图从他的唱片合约中脱身。

collins.tran: (人身)自由的;不受监禁(或奴役)的
collins.def: Someone who is free is no longer a prisoner or a slave.

example.ex: He walked from the court house a free man...
example.tran: 他以自由之身走出了法院。

example.ex: More than ninety prisoners have been set free so far under a government amnesty.
example.tran: 目前已有 90 多名犯人因为一项政府特赦获得自由。

collins.def: To free a prisoner or a slave means to let them go or release them from prison.

example.ex: Israel is set to free more Lebanese prisoners...
example.tran: 以色列准备释放更多的黎巴嫩犯人。

example.ex: The act had a specific intent, to protect freed slaves from white mobs.
example.tran: 这项法案有明确的目的，即保护被解放的奴隶免受白人暴民的伤害。

collins.def: If someone or something is free of or free from an unpleasant thing, they do not have it or they are not affected by it.

example.ex: ...a future far more free of fear...
example.tran: 远远摆脱恐惧的未来

example.ex: She retains her slim figure and is free of wrinkles...
example.tran: 她保持着苗条的身材，脸上也没有皱纹。

collins.def: A sum of money or type of goods that is free of tax or duty is one that you do not have to pay tax on.
To free someone or something means to make them available for a task or function that they were previously not available for.

example.ex: Toolbelts free both hands and lessen the risk of dropping hammers...
example.tran: 工具腰带解放了双手，还减少了锤子掉落的风险。

example.ex: His deal with Disney will run out shortly, freeing him to pursue his own project...
example.tran: 他和迪斯尼的协议很快就要到期，这样他就可以腾出身来发展自己的项目了。

collins.tran: 空闲的;有空的;不上班的;不在忙的
collins.def: If you have a free period of time or are free at a particular time, you are not working or occupied then.

example.ex: She spent her free time shopping...
example.tran: 她空闲的时候就去购物。

example.ex: I used to write during my free periods at school...
example.tran: 过去我经常在课余时间写作。

collins.tran: 不在用的;无人使用的;未被占用的
collins.def: If something such as a table or seat is free, it is not being used or occupied by anyone, or is not reserved for anyone to use.

example.ex: There was only one seat free on the train...
example.tran: 列车上只剩下一个空座。

example.ex: They took the only free table, which was just inside the door.
example.tran: 他们在刚进门处的唯一一张空桌子边坐下。

collins.tran: 松开的;脱开的;未缚住的;未固定的
collins.def: If you get something free or if it gets free, it is no longer trapped by anything or attached to anything.

example.ex: The severe conditions hampered attempts to pull the vessel free of the rig...
example.tran: 恶劣的天气情况使得把那艘船拉离钻塔的努力很难奏效。

example.ex: He pulled his arm free, and strode for the door...
example.tran: 他抽出胳膊，大步朝门走去。

collins.tran: 松开;解开;使不再缚住(或固定)
collins.def: If you free someone or something, you remove them from the place in which they have been trapped or become fixed.

example.ex: It took firemen two hours to cut through the drive belt to free him...
example.tran: 消防员花了两个小时才把传动带切断，把他救了出来。

example.ex: He managed to free one hand to ward off a punch.
example.tran: 他设法挣脱出一只手来挡住了一拳。

collins.def: When someone is using one hand or arm to hold or move something, their other hand or arm is referred to as their free one.

example.ex: He snatched up the receiver and his free hand groped for the switch on the bedside lamp...
example.tran: 他一只手抓起电话听筒，另一只手去摸床头灯的开关。

example.ex: She checked her fall with her free arm.
example.tran: 多亏了她还有一只手空着才没让自己倒下去。

collins.tran: 慷慨的;大手大脚的;过分给予的
collins.def: If you say that someone is free with something such as advice or money, you mean that they give a lot of it, sometimes when it is not wanted.

example.ex: They weren't always so free with their advice...
example.tran: 他们并不是一直都如此好为人师。

example.ex: They would often be free with criticism, some of it unjustified.
example.tran: 他们经常会大肆批评，而且其中有些并无道理。

collins.def: You say 'feel free' when you want to give someone permission to do something, in a very willing way.

example.ex: Go right ahead. Feel free...
example.tran: 开始吧。请便。

example.ex: If you have any questions at all, please feel free to ask me.
example.tran: 如果有任何问题，请随意提问。

collins.def: If you do something or get something for free, you do it without being paid or get it without having to pay for it.

example.ex: I wasn't expecting you to do it for free...
example.tran: 我并没有指望你白干。

example.ex: Why waste £50 when you could get it for free?
example.tran: 能够免费得到为什么还要浪费50英镑呢？

collins.tran: (表达批评意见时用于强调)不管怎样
collins.def: You say that you will express a critical opinion about something for free when you want to emphasize how strongly you feel about it.

example.ex: I'll tell you one thing for free: I can't stand him.
example.tran: 不管怎样我都要说：我受不了他。

collins.tran: 开放，放开(市场、经济或体系)
collins.def: To free up a market, economy, or system means to make it operate with fewer restrictions and controls.

example.ex: ...policies for freeing up markets and extending competition.
example.tran: 开放市场、扩大竞争的政策

collins.def: A friend is someone who you know well and like, but who is not related to you.

example.ex: I had a long talk about this with my best friend...
example.tran: 我和我最好的朋友就此事进行了长谈。

example.ex: She never was a close friend of mine.
example.tran: 她从来就不是我的密友。

collins.def: If you are friends with someone, you are their friend and they are yours.

example.ex: I still wanted to be friends with Alison...
example.tran: 我还是想和艾莉森做朋友。

example.ex: We remained good friends...
example.tran: 我们一直是好朋友。

collins.def: The friends of a country, cause, organization, or a famous politician are the people and organizations who help and support them.

example.ex: ...the friends of Israel.
example.tran: 以色列的支持者

example.ex: ...The Friends of Birmingham Royal Ballet.
example.tran: 伯明翰皇家芭蕾舞团赞助者协会

collins.def: If one country refers to another as a friend, they mean that the other country is not an enemy of theirs.

example.ex: The president said that Japan is now a friend and international partner.
example.tran: 总统说日本现在是盟友和国际合作伙伴。

collins.def: If you make friends with someone, you begin a friendship with them. You can also say that two people make friends .

example.ex: He has made friends with the kids on the street...
example.tran: 他和流浪街头的孩子交上了朋友。

example.ex: Dennis made friends easily...
example.tran: 丹尼斯很容易就能交到朋友。

collins.def: If something comes from a particular person or thing, or if you get something from them, they give it to you or they are the source of it.

example.ex: He appealed for information from anyone who saw the attackers.
example.tran: 他呼吁任何看见袭击者的人提供信息。

example.ex: ...an anniversary present from his wife...
example.tran: 他妻子送的纪念日礼物

collins.def: Someone who comes from a particular place lives in that place or originally lived there. Something that comes from a particular place was made in that place.

example.ex: ...an art dealer from Zurich...
example.tran: 来自苏黎世的艺术品商人

example.ex: Katy Jones is nineteen and comes from Birmingham.
example.tran: 凯蒂·琼斯 19 岁，是伯明翰人。

collins.def: A person from a particular organization works for that organization.

example.ex: ...a representative from the Israeli embassy.
example.tran: 以色列大使馆的代表

example.ex: ...Colonel Milan Gvero, who is from the federal Defense Ministry in Belgrade.
example.tran: 在贝尔格莱德的联邦国防部工作的米兰·格韦罗上校

collins.def: If someone or something moves or is moved from a place, they leave it or are removed, so that they are no longer there.

example.ex: The guests watched as she fled from the room.
example.tran: 客人们看着她逃离了房间。

collins.def: If you take one thing or person from another, you move that thing or person so that they are no longer with the other or attached to the other.

example.ex: In many bone transplants, bone can be taken from other parts of the patient's body...
example.tran: 在许多骨移植手术中，可以从病人身体的其他部位取骨。

example.ex: Remove the bowl from the ice and stir in the cream.
example.tran: 从冰里把碗取出，搅入奶油。

collins.def: If you take something from an amount, you reduce the amount by that much.

example.ex: The £103 is deducted from Mrs Adams' salary every month...
example.tran: 这 103 英镑每月从亚当斯夫人的工资里扣掉。

example.ex: Three from six leaves three.
example.tran: 6 减去 3 得 3。

collins.def: From is used in expressions such as away from or absent from to say that someone or something is not present in a place where they are usually found.

example.ex: Her husband worked away from home a lot...
example.tran: 她丈夫经常离家在外工作。

example.ex: Jo was absent from the house all the next day.
example.tran: 乔第二天一整天都不在家。

collins.def: If you return from a place or an activity, you return after being in that place or doing that activity.

example.ex: My son Colin has just returned from Amsterdam.
example.tran: 我儿子科林刚从阿姆斯特丹回来。

example.ex: ...a group of men travelling home from a darts match.
example.tran: 一群参加完飞镖比赛正在返家途中的男人

collins.def: If you are back from a place or activity, you have left it and have returned to your former place.

example.ex: Our economics correspondent, James Morgan, is just back from Germany...
example.tran: 我们的财经记者詹姆斯·摩根刚刚从德国回来。

example.ex: One afternoon when I was home from school, he asked me to come to see a movie with him.
example.tran: 一天下午我放了学在家的时候，他邀请我去和他一起看电影。

collins.def: If you see or hear something from a particular place, you are in that place when you see it or hear it.

example.ex: Visitors see the painting from behind a plate glass window...
example.tran: 参观者隔着平板玻璃橱窗欣赏那幅画。

example.ex: Viewed from above, the valleys form the shape of a man.
example.tran: 从上往下俯瞰，山谷呈现出人形轮廓。

collins.def: If something hangs or sticks out from an object, it is attached to it or held by it.

example.ex: Hanging from his right wrist is a heavy gold bracelet.
example.tran: 他的右腕上戴着一只沉甸甸的金手镯。

example.ex: ...large fans hanging from ceilings...
example.tran: 吊挂在天花板上的大风扇

collins.def: You can use from when giving distances. For example, if a place is fifty miles from another place, the distance between the two places is fifty miles.

example.ex: The centre of the town is 4 kilometres from the station...
example.tran: 市中心距离车站 4 公里远。

example.ex: ...a small park only a few hundred yards from Zurich's main shopping centre...
example.tran: 距离苏黎世主要购物中心只有几百码远的一个小公园

collins.def: If a road or railway line goes from one place to another, you can travel along it between the two places.

example.ex: ...the road from St Petersburg to Tallinn.
example.tran: 从圣彼得堡到塔林的路

collins.def: From is used, especially in the expression made from, to say what substance has been used to make something.

example.ex: ...bread made from white flour.
example.tran: 精白面粉做的面包

example.ex: ...a luxurious resort built from the island's native coral stone.
example.tran: 用岛上天然的珊瑚石建造的豪华度假村

collins.def: You can use from when you are talking about the beginning of a period of time.

example.ex: She studied painting from 1926 and also worked as a commercial artist...
example.tran: 她从 1926 年起开始学画，同时还从事着商业艺术家的工作。

example.ex: Breakfast is available to fishermen from 6 a.m...
example.tran: 从早上 6 点开始向渔民提供早餐。

collins.def: You say from one thing to another when you are stating the range of things that are possible, or when saying that the range of things includes everything in a certain category.

example.ex: There are 94 countries represented in Barcelona, from Algeria to Zimbabwe...
example.tran: 包括从阿尔及利亚到津巴布韦的 94 个国家在巴塞罗那设有代表处。

example.ex: Over 150 companies will be there, covering everything from finance to fixtures and fittings.
example.tran: 将有超过150 家公司出席，涉及领域从金融到室内设备，应有尽有。

collins.def: If something changes from one thing to another, it stops being the first thing and becomes the second thing.

example.ex: The expression on his face changed from sympathy to surprise...
example.tran: 他脸上的表情从同情变为惊讶。

example.ex: Unemployment has fallen from 7.5% to 7.2%...
example.tran: 失业率从 7.5％降到7.2％。

collins.def: You use from after some verbs and nouns when mentioning the cause of something.

example.ex: The problem simply resulted from a difference of opinion...
example.tran: 这个问题仅仅是由于意见分歧引起的。

example.ex: He is suffering from eye ulcers, brought on by the intense light in Australia...
example.tran: 他眼部溃疡，是因澳大利亚强烈的日光照射造成的。

collins.def: You use from when you are giving the reason for an opinion.

example.ex: She knew from experience that Dave was about to tell her the truth...
example.tran: 经验告诉她戴夫就要对她说出实情了。

example.ex: He sensed from the expression on her face that she had something to say...
example.tran: 从她脸上的表情他感觉到她有话要说。

collins.tran: (用于 protect, free, keep, prevent 等动词后)免于
collins.def: From is used after verbs with meanings such as 'protect', 'free', 'keep', and 'prevent' to introduce the action that does not happen, or that someone does not want to happen.

example.ex: Such laws could protect the consumer from harmful or dangerous remedies...
example.tran: 这样的法规可以保护消费者免受有害或者危险药品的威胁。

example.ex: 300 tons of Peruvian mangoes were kept from entering France.
example.tran: 300吨秘鲁芒果被禁止进入法国。

collins.def: The front of something is the part of it that faces you, or that faces forward, or that you normally see or use.

example.ex: One man sat in an armchair, and the other sat on the front of the desk...
example.tran: 一个男人坐在扶手椅里，另一个坐在桌子前面。

example.ex: Stand at the front of the line...
example.tran: 站在队伍前头。

collins.def: The front of a building is the side or part of it that faces the street.

example.ex: Attached to the front of the house, there was a large veranda.
example.tran: 房子的正面有一条宽大的游廊。

collins.tran: (人或动物的)身体前部，前身,胸部
collins.def: A person's or animal's front is the part of their body between their head and their legs that is on the opposite side to their back.

example.ex: If you lie your baby on his front, he'll lift his head and chest up.
example.tran: 如果让宝宝俯卧，他会把头和胸抬起。

collins.tran: 前面的;前部的;正面的;(位置)在前的
collins.def: Front is used to refer to the side or part of something that is towards the front or nearest to the front.

example.ex: I went out there on the front porch...
example.tran: 我出来走到前廊上。

example.ex: She was only six and still missing her front teeth...
example.tran: 她才 6 岁，门牙还没长出来。

collins.def: The front page of a newspaper is the outside of the first page, where the main news stories are printed.

example.ex: The Guardian's front page carries a photograph of the two foreign ministers...
example.tran: 《卫报》的头版刊登了两国外交部长的一张合影。

example.ex: The violence in the Gaza Strip makes the front page of most of the newspapers.
example.tran: 加沙地带的暴力事件成为大多数报纸的头版新闻。

collins.def: The front is a road next to the sea in a seaside town.

example.ex: ...a stroll on the front...
example.tran: 漫步于海滨道

example.ex: Amy went out for a last walk along the sea front.
example.tran: 埃米出了门，最后一次沿着海滨道散步。

collins.def: In a war, the front is a line where two opposing armies are facing each other.

example.ex: Sonja's husband is fighting at the front.
example.tran: 索尼娅的丈夫正在前线打仗。

collins.def: If you say that something is happening on a particular front, you mean that it is happening with regard to a particular situation or field of activity.

example.ex: ...research across a wide academic front...
example.tran: 跨多个学术领域的研究

example.ex: We're moving forward on a variety of fronts.
example.tran: 我们正在多个方面向前推进。

collins.def: If someone puts on a particular kind of front, they pretend to have a particular quality.

example.ex: Michael kept up a brave front both to the world and in his home...
example.tran: 迈克尔对外界和家人都表现出一副勇敢的样子。

example.ex: His laugh-a-minute image is just a front to hide his deep unhappiness.
example.tran: 他滑稽可笑的形象只是用来掩饰内心深处痛苦的假面具。

collins.tran: (非法或秘密的组织或活动的)掩护，幌子
collins.def: An organization or activity that is a front for one that is illegal or secret is used to hide it.

example.ex: ...a firm later identified by the police as a front for crime syndicates...
example.tran: 后经警方确认为犯罪集团幌子的一家公司

example.ex: He said the present civilian government is just a front for the old military regime.
example.tran: 他说现今的平民政府只不过是先前军事政权的一个幌子。

collins.def: In relation to the weather, a front is a line where a mass of cold air meets a mass of warm air.

example.ex: The snow signaled the arrival of a front, and a high-pressure area seemed to be settling in...
example.tran: 下雪预示着冷热空气的交锋，而一个高气压区似乎也将到来并可能持续。

example.ex: A very active cold front brought dramatic weather changes to Kansas on Wednesday.
example.tran: 一股强冷空气前锋周三使堪萨斯的天气发生了剧变。

collins.tran: (常用于政治组织名称中)阵线
collins.def: Front is often used in the titles of political organizations with a particular aim.

example.ex: ...the People's Liberation Front.
example.tran: 人民解放阵线

collins.def: A building or an area of land that fronts a particular place or fronts onto it is next to it and faces it.

example.ex: ...real estate, which includes undeveloped land fronting the city convention center...
example.tran: 包括城市会议中心对面未开发土地的房地产

example.ex: There are some delightful Victorian houses fronting onto the pavement.
example.tran: 面对人行道有一些漂亮的维多利亚时代的房子。

collins.def: The person who fronts an organization is the most senior person in it.

example.ex: He fronted a formidable band of fighters...
example.tran: 他率领着一队可畏的斗士。

example.ex: The commission, fronted by Sir Isaac Hayatali, was set up in June 1992.
example.tran: 由艾萨克·哈亚塔利爵士领导的这个委员会建立于 1992 年 6月。

collins.def: The person who fronts a pop group or rock band is the main singer.

example.ex: He also fronted a group called Haircuts That Kill.
example.tran: 他还是一个叫做“酷炫发式”乐队的主唱。

example.ex: ...the debut single from the new five-piece fronted by singer Melissa Heathcoate.
example.tran: 以歌手梅利莎·希思科特为主唱的新5人组合的首支单曲

collins.def: If a person or thing is in front, they are ahead of others in a moving group, or further forward than someone or something else.

example.ex: Officers will crack down on lunatic motorists who speed or drive too close to the car in front...
example.tran: 警察将会严厉打击超速或是紧贴前车行驶的疯狂司机。

example.ex: 'What's with this guy?' demanded an American voice in the row in front.
example.tran: “这人怎么了?”前排有个美国人问道。

collins.tran: (在竞赛或比赛中)处于领先位置
collins.def: Someone who is in front in a competition or contest at a particular point is winning at that point.

example.ex: Richard Dunwoody is in front in the jockeys' title race...
example.tran: 理查德·邓伍迪在职业赛马骑师冠军赛中领先其他选手。

example.ex: Some preliminary polls show him out in front.
example.tran: 一些初步民意调查显示他处于领先位置。

collins.def: If someone or something is in front of a particular thing, they are facing it, ahead of it, or close to the front part of it.

example.ex: She sat down in front of her dressing-table mirror to look at herself...
example.tran: 她在梳妆台的镜子前面坐下端详自己。

example.ex: Something darted out in front of my car, and my car hit it...
example.tran: 有什么东西突然冲到我的车前，我的车撞到它了。

collins.tran: 在…面前(做或说);当着…的面
collins.def: If you do or say something in front of someone else, you do or say it when they are present.

example.ex: They never argued in front of their children...
example.tran: 他们从来不当着孩子的面争吵。

example.ex: He has been brought up not to swear in front of women.
example.tran: 他从小就被教育不要在女性面前说脏话。

collins.def: On the home front or on the domestic front means with regard to your own country rather than foreign countries.

example.ex: Its present economic ills on the home front are largely the result of overspending...
example.tran: 它目前国内方面的经济弊病主要源自支出过度。

example.ex: On the domestic front, the president got his way with his budget proposals.
example.tran: 国内方面，总统提出的预算案获得了通过。

collins.def: If something is full, it contains as much of a substance or as many objects as it can.

example.ex: Once the container is full, it stays shut until you turn it clockwise.
example.tran: 容器一旦装满它会保持关闭，想要打开须按顺时针方向转动。

example.ex: ...a full tank of petrol.
example.tran: 一满箱汽油

collins.def: If a place or thing is full of things or people, it contains a large number of them.

example.ex: The case was full of clothes...
example.tran: 箱子里塞满了衣服。

example.ex: The streets are still full of debris from two nights of rioting.
example.tran: 街道上仍到处可见连续两晚的骚乱留下的残迹。

collins.tran: 充满(某一情感或特质)的
collins.def: If someone or something is full of a particular feeling or quality, they have a lot of it.

example.ex: I feel full of confidence and so open to possibilities...
example.tran: 我感到信心十足，愿意考虑各种可能。

example.ex: Mom's face was full of pain.
example.tran: 妈妈的脸上写满了痛苦。

collins.tran: 满员的;没有空位(或空间)的
collins.def: You say that a place or vehicle is full when there is no space left in it for any more people or things.

example.ex: The main car park was full when I left about 10.45...
example.tran: 我 10 点 45 分左右离开时，主停车场已经没有车位了。

example.ex: They stay here a few hours before being sent to refugee camps, which are now almost full...
example.tran: 他们在这儿呆了几个小时后被送往难民营，而那里现在几乎已经满员了。

collins.tran: (手或胳膊)占着的，拿满了的，挂满了的
collins.def: If your hands or arms are full, you are carrying or holding as much as you can carry.

example.ex: Sylvia entered, her arms full of packages...
example.tran: 西尔维娅走了进来，怀里抱满了包裹。

example.ex: People would go into the store and come out with their arms full.
example.tran: 人们到这家商店来总是满载而归。

collins.def: If you feel full, you have eaten or drunk so much that you do not want anything else.

example.ex: It's healthy to eat when I'm hungry and to stop when I'm full.
example.tran: 饿了就吃，饱了就停，这样很健康。

collins.def: You use full before a noun to indicate that you are referring to all the details, things, or people that it can possibly include.

example.ex: Full details will be sent to you once your application has been accepted...
example.tran: 所有细节会在申请接受后马上寄出。

example.ex: May I have your full name?...
example.tran: 请问您的全名是什么？

collins.tran: (声音、光线、力气等)最大(强度)的
collins.def: Full is used to describe a sound, light, or physical force which is being produced with the greatest possible power or intensity.

example.ex: From his study came the sound of Mahler, playing at full volume...
example.tran: 从他的书房里传出马勒的乐曲，音量开到了最大。

example.ex: Officials say the operation will be carried out in full daylight...
example.tran: 官员们说行动将在大白天进行。

collins.def: You use full to emphasize the completeness, intensity, or extent of something.

example.ex: We should conserve oil and gas by making full use of other energy sources...
example.tran: 我们应该通过充分利用其他能源来节省石油和天然气。

example.ex: Television cameras are carrying the full horror of this war into homes around the world...
example.tran: 电视摄像机把这场战争彻头彻尾的恐怖传送到全世界的千家万户。

collins.def: A full statement or report contains a lot of information and detail.

example.ex: Mr Primakov gave a full account of his meeting with the President.
example.tran: 普里马科夫先生详细叙述了他和总统的会面。

example.ex: ...the enormous detail in this very full document.
example.tran: 在这份内容十分全面的文件里包含的海量细节

collins.def: If you say that someone has or leads a full life, you approve of the fact that they are always busy and do a lot of different things.

example.ex: You will be successful in whatever you do and you will have a very full and interesting life.
example.tran: 你不管做什么都会成功，并且会过着非常充实有趣的生活。

collins.def: You use full to emphasize the force or directness with which someone or something is hit or looked at.

example.ex: The burning liquid hit him full in the right eye...
example.tran: 滚烫的液体正好溅进了他的右眼。

example.ex: She kissed him full on the mouth...
example.tran: 她直接吻上了他的嘴唇。

collins.tran: (所拥有的权利、地位或重要性)完整的，正式的
collins.def: You use full to refer to something which gives you all the rights, status, or importance for a particular position or activity, rather than just some of them.

example.ex: How did the meeting go, did you get your full membership?...
example.tran: 面谈进行得怎么样，你成为正式成员了吗？

example.ex: She sent her provisional licence with the test certificate to have it upgraded to a full licence.
example.tran: 她将临时执照连同考试证书一起提交上去以申请升级为正式执照。

collins.def: A full flavour is strong and rich.

example.ex: Italian plum tomatoes have a full flavour, and are best for cooking.
example.tran: 意大利李形番茄味道很重，最适合烹饪。

collins.tran: (身体某一部位)丰满的，圆润的
collins.def: If you describe a part of someone's body as full, you mean that it is rounded and rather large.

example.ex: The Juno Collection specialises in large sizes for ladies with a fuller figure.
example.tran: 朱诺系列专门针对身材较为丰满的女士推出大号女装。

example.ex: ...his strong chin, his full lips, his appealing mustache.
example.tran: 他坚挺的下巴、饱满的双唇和迷人的八字胡

collins.def: A full skirt or sleeve is wide and has been made from a lot of fabric.

example.ex: My wedding dress has a very full skirt.
example.tran: 我结婚礼服的裙摆很宽松。

collins.def: When there is a full moon, the moon appears as a bright, complete circle.
You say that something has been done or described in full when everything that was necessary has been done or described.

example.ex: The medical experts have yet to report in full...
example.tran: 医学专家尚未提出完整的报告。

example.ex: We guarantee to reply in full within 10 working days.
example.tran: 我们保证在 10 个工作日内悉数回复。

collins.tran: (尤指对令人不快的事)很清楚地知道(或了解)，一清二楚
collins.def: If you say that a person knows full well that something is true, especially something unpleasant, you are emphasizing that they are definitely aware of it, although they may behave as if they are not.

example.ex: He knew full well he'd be ashamed of himself later.
example.tran: 他很清楚地知道自己过后会无地自容。

collins.tran: 尽量;在最大程度上;充分地;彻底地
collins.def: Something that is done or experienced to the full is done to as great an extent as is possible.

example.ex: She probably has a good mind, which should be used to the full...
example.tran: 她可能很有头脑，应该充分运用。

example.ex: There's only one thing we should do with love; experience it to the full for as long as it lasts.
example.tran: 对于爱情我们只应有一种态度：趁其尚未消失时尽情享受。

collins.def: If you say to someone 'you're full of yourself', you disapprove of them because they appear very pleased with themselves, thinking that they are very clever, special, or important.

example.ex: He's full of himself, sharp and aggressive and sometimes he comes over badly.
example.tran: 他是个自以为是的家伙，说话尖酸又爱挑衅，有时会给人留下极差的印象。

means: 提供资金偿付（债款等）的本息
把（短期借款）转为有固定利息的长期借款

collins.tran: (尤指为某一特定目的给予的)资金，钱款
collins.def: Funds are amounts of money that are available to be spent, especially money that is given to an organization or person for a particular purpose.

example.ex: The concert will raise funds for research into Aids.
example.tran: 这场音乐会将为艾滋病研究筹款。

example.ex: ...government funds.
example.tran: 政府资金

collins.def: A fund is an amount of money that is collected or saved for a particular purpose.

example.ex: ...a pension fund.
example.tran: 养老基金

example.ex: ...a scholarship fund for undergraduate engineering students.
example.tran: 提供给工程学本科生的奖学金基金

collins.def: When a person or organization funds something, they provide money for it.

example.ex: The Bush Foundation has funded a variety of faculty development programs...
example.tran: 布什基金会已经资助了许多教员发展项目。

example.ex: The airport is being privately funded by a construction group.
example.tran: 该机场是由一个建筑集团私人出资兴建的。

collins.def: If you have a fund of something, you have a lot of it.

example.ex: He is possessed of an extraordinary fund of energy.
example.tran: 他的精力异常充沛。

collins.tran: 进一步地;在更大程度上;在更大范围内
collins.def: Further means to a greater extent or degree.

example.ex: Inflation is below 5% and set to fall further...
example.tran: 通货膨胀率在 5%以下，而且还将进一步下降。

example.ex: The rebellion is expected to further damage the country's image...
example.tran: 预计叛乱将会进一步破坏这个国家的形象。

collins.tran: (发展中)进一步地，向前推进地
collins.def: If you go or get further with something, or take something further, you make some progress.

example.ex: They lacked the scientific personnel to develop the technical apparatus much further.
example.tran: 他们缺少能够进一步研发这一技术装置的科研人员。

collins.tran: (讨论中)进一步地，更极端地，更彻底地
collins.def: If someone goes further in a discussion, they make a more extreme statement or deal with a point more thoroughly.

example.ex: On February 7th the Post went further, claiming that Mr Wood had grabbed and kissed another 13 women...
example.tran: 2 月 7 日的《邮报》走得更远，声称伍德先生还强行抓住亲吻过另外 13 名女性。

example.ex: To have a better comparison, we need to go further and address such issues as repairs and insurance.
example.tran: 为了更好地作出比较，我们需要深入考虑维修、保险等问题。

collins.def: A further thing, number of things, or amount of something is an additional thing, number of things, or amount.

example.ex: His speech provides further evidence of his increasingly authoritarian approach...
example.tran: 他的讲话更加证明了他变得越来越独裁。

example.ex: They believed there were likely to be further attacks...
example.tran: 他们认为很可能会有更多的袭击。

collins.def: Further means a greater distance than before or than something else.

example.ex: Now we live further away from the city centre...
example.tran: 现在我们住得离市中心更远了。

example.ex: He came to a halt at a crossroads fifty yards further on...
example.tran: 他在往前 50 码远的十字路口停了下来。

collins.def: Further is used in expressions such as 'further back' and 'further ahead' to refer to a point in time that is earlier or later than the time you are talking about.

example.ex: Looking still further ahead, by the end of the next century world population is expected to be about ten billion.
example.tran: 再往前看，到下个世纪末世界人口预计将达约 100 亿。

collins.def: If you further something, you help it to progress, to be successful, or to be achieved.

example.ex: In return, they are themselves accused of furthering their own (leftist) political interests...
example.tran: 作为回应，他们自己也被指责推动自己的(左翼)政治利益。

example.ex: Education needn't only be about furthering your career.
example.tran: 受教育并不一定只是要推进一个人的事业。

collins.def: You use further to introduce a statement that relates to the same general topic and that gives additional information or makes an additional point.

example.ex: Dodd made no appeal of his death sentence and, further, instructed his attorney to sue anyone who succeeds in delaying his execution.
example.tran: 多德没有对自己的死刑判决提起上诉，而且他还要求自己的律师起诉任何成功使得这一死刑暂缓执行的人。

collins.tran: (用于书信中)关于贵方信中所提/关于我们所谈到的
collins.def: Further to is used in letters in expressions such as 'further to your letter' or 'further to our conversation', in order to indicate what you are referring to in the letter.

example.ex: Further to your letter, I agree that there are some presentational problems, politically speaking.
example.tran: 正如贵方信中所提到的，我也认为从政治角度来说，有一些词语表意上的问题。

collins.tran: 未来;将来;将来发生的事
collins.def: The future is the period of time that will come after the present, or the things that will happen then.

example.ex: The spokesman said no decision on the proposal was likely in the immediate future...
example.tran: 发言人说近期不会就这项提案作出决议。

example.ex: He was making plans for the future...
example.tran: 他正在为将来制订计划。

collins.def: Future things will happen or exist after the present time.

example.ex: She said if the world did not act conclusively now, it would only bequeath the problem to future generations...
example.tran: 她说如果人类现在不采取决定性的行动，那就只会把问题留给子孙后代。

example.ex: Meanwhile, the domestic debate on Denmark's future role in Europe rages on.
example.tran: 与此同时，国内也展开了有关丹麦未来在欧洲扮演何种角色的激烈争论。

collins.def: Someone's future, or the future of something, is what will happen to them or what they will do after the present time.

example.ex: His future as prime minister depends on the outcome of the elections...
example.tran: 他能否继续坐在首相的位子上取决于选举的结果。

example.ex: Graeme remains a supremely talented cricketer and must still have a splendid future in the game.
example.tran: 格雷姆依然是一个极有天赋的板球运动员，在这项运动中一定仍可拥有辉煌的前程。

collins.tran: 成功的可能;未来的希望
collins.def: If you say that someone or something has a future, you mean that they are likely to be successful or to survive.

example.ex: These abandoned children have now got a future...
example.tran: 这些被抛弃的孩子现在有了希望。

example.ex: There's no future in this relationship.
example.tran: 这段感情不可能有结果。

collins.def: When people trade in futures, they buy stocks and shares, commodities such as coffee or oil, or foreign currency at a price that is agreed at the time of purchase for items which are delivered some time in the future.

example.ex: This report could spur some buying in corn futures when the market opens today...
example.tran: 这一报告可能会在今天开市后刺激一些人买进玉米期货。

example.ex: Futures prices recovered from sharp early declines to end with moderate losses.
example.tran: 期货价格在早盘深幅下跌后出现反弹，收盘时未见严重损失。

collins.def: In grammar, the future tense of a verb is the one used to talk about things that are going to happen. In English, this applies to verb groups consisting of 'will' or 'shall' and the base form of a verb. The future perfect tense of a verb is used to talk about things that will have happened at some time in the future.

collins.tran: 今后，从今以后(有时亦作 in the future，尤用于美国英语中)
collins.def: You use in future when saying what will happen from now on, which will be different from what has previously happened. The form in the future is sometimes used instead, especially in American English.

example.ex: In future the President will be chosen by the people instead of by the National Assembly...
example.tran: 今后总统将由人民选举产生，而非国民议会选出。

example.ex: I asked her to be more careful in future...
example.tran: 我要她以后要更加小心。

collins.tran: 未来将发生…;将来会发生…
collins.def: If you wonder what the future holds, you wonder what will happen in the future.

example.ex: We wondered what the future would hold for our baby son.
example.tran: 我们不知道宝贝儿子长大了会怎样。

collins.def: If you say that someone's future lies in a particular place or activity, you think they will be most successful or happy in that place or doing that activity.

example.ex: Armstrong is uncertain where his long-term future lies...
example.tran: 阿姆斯特朗拿不准自己的人生远景在何方。

example.ex: He came back because he believed his future lay with her.
example.tran: 他回来是因为他相信自己的未来是和她在一起。

collins.def: A game is an activity or sport usually involving skill, knowledge, or chance, in which you follow fixed rules and try to win against an opponent or to solve a puzzle.

example.ex: ...the wonderful game of football.
example.tran: 精彩的足球比赛

example.ex: ...a playful game of hide-and-seek.
example.tran: 有趣的捉迷藏游戏

collins.def: A game is one particular occasion on which a game is played.

example.ex: It was the first game of the season...
example.tran: 这是本赛季的首场比赛。

example.ex: He regularly watched our games from the stands...
example.tran: 他一般在看台上观看我们的比赛。

collins.tran: （网球、桥牌等比赛中的）一局，一盘，一场
collins.def: A game is a part of a match, for example in tennis or bridge, consisting of a fixed number of points.

example.ex: She won six games to love in the second set.
example.tran: 第二盘她以6比0获胜。

example.ex: ...the last three points of the second game.
example.tran: 第二局的最后3分

collins.def: Games are an organized event in which competitions in several sports take place.

example.ex: ...the 2000 Olympic Games at Sydney.
example.tran: 2000年悉尼奥运会

collins.def: Games are organized sports activities that children do at school.

example.ex: At his grammar school he is remembered for being bad at games but good in debates.
example.tran: 在文法学校里，他因拙于体育但擅长辩论而让人印象深刻。

collins.tran: （某人比赛或游戏时的）手法，技巧，风格
collins.def: Someone's game is the degree of skill or the style that they use when playing a particular game.

example.ex: Once I was through the first set my game picked up.
example.tran: 我打完第一局之后就进入了状态。

collins.tran: 玩笑；儿戏；不认真对待的事情
collins.def: You can describe a situation that you do not treat seriously as a game .

example.ex: Many people regard life as a game: you win some, you lose some...
example.tran: 许多人视人生如同一场游戏：有输也有赢。

example.ex: It's  a cat-and-mouse game to him, and I'm the mouse.
example.tran: 在他看来，这是个猫捉老鼠的把戏，而我就是老鼠。

collins.def: You can use game to describe a way of behaving in which a person uses a particular plan, usually in order to gain an advantage for himself or herself.

example.ex: When the uncertainties become greater than the certainties, we end up in a game of bluff...
example.tran: 情况愈发难以确定，我们最终陷入一个唬人的把戏中。

example.ex: Until now, the Americans have been playing a very delicate political game.
example.tran: 直到现在，美国人一直玩着精心设计的政治把戏。

collins.def: Wild animals or birds that are hunted for sport and sometimes cooked and eaten are referred to as game .

example.ex: ...men who shot game for food.
example.tran: 靠捕猎获取食物的人

collins.tran: 甘愿尝试（新鲜或不平常事物）的；有冒险精神的
collins.def: If you are game for something, you are willing to do something new, unusual, or risky.

example.ex: After all this time he still had new ideas and was game to try them...
example.tran: 过了这么久，他依然不乏新点子并敢于去尝试。

example.ex: He said he's game for a similar challenge next year.
example.tran: 他说他明年还愿意接受类似的挑战。

collins.def: If someone or something gives the game away, they reveal a secret or reveal their feelings, and this puts them at a disadvantage.

example.ex: The faces of the two conspirators gave the game away.
example.tran: 这两个共谋者的表情泄漏了秘密。

collins.def: If you are new to a particular game, you have not done a particular activity or been in a particular situation before.

example.ex: Don't  forget that she's new to this game and will take a while to complete the task.
example.tran: 别忘了她缺乏这方面的经验，完成任务还需要一些时间。

collins.def: If a man or woman is on the game, he or she is working as a prostitute.

collins.tran: 将计就计；以其人之道还治其人之身
collins.def: If you beat someone at their own game, you use the same methods that they have used, but more successfully,  so that you gain an advantage over them.

example.ex: He must anticipate the maneuvers of the other lawyers and beat them at their own game...
example.tran: 他必须预见到其他律师的策略，并以其人之道还治其人之身，从而打败他们。

example.ex: The police knew that to trap the killer they had to play him at his own game.
example.tran: 警方清楚他们必须将计就计才能逮住那个杀人凶手。

collins.tran: （某种情况下）常有的事，司空见惯的事
collins.def: If you say that something is all part of the game, you are telling someone not to be surprised or upset by something, because it is a normal part of the situation that they are in.

example.ex: For investors, risks are part of the game.
example.tran: 对投资者而言,风险不足为奇。

collins.tran: 不认真对待；耍花招；玩把戏
collins.def: If you say that someone is playing games or playing silly games, you mean that they are not treating a situation seriously and you are annoyed with them.

example.ex: 'Don't  play games with me!' he thundered...
example.tran: “别跟我耍把戏!”他怒吼道。

example.ex: From what I know of him he doesn't play silly games.
example.tran: 凭我对他的了解，他不会耍滑头的。

collins.tran: （通常在压力下）开始更好表现，干得更出色
collins.def: If you say that someone has raised their game, you mean that they have begun to perform better, usually because they were under pressure to do so.

example.ex: The world No. 9 had to raise his game to see off a strong challenge from Dale...
example.tran: 这位世界排名第九的选手必须有更出色的表现才能击退戴尔强有力的挑战。

example.ex: As it expands its services around the continent, the competition it offers should force the other airlines to raise their game.
example.tran: 这家航空公司在整个大陆拓展业务所带来的竞争会迫使其他航空公司有更好的表现。

collins.tran: 戏该收场了，别再演戏了（指所从事的秘密计划或活动被揭穿）
collins.def: If you say the game is up, you mean that someone's  secret plans or activities have been revealed and therefore must stop because they cannot succeed.

example.ex: Some thought they would hold out until Sunday. The realists knew that the game was already up.
example.tran: 有些人以为他们还能撑到星期天，务实的人却很清楚，这一切都已结束了。

collins.def: A general is a high-ranking officer in the armed forces, usually in the army.

example.ex: The General's visit to Sarajevo is part of preparations for the deployment of extra troops.
example.tran: 将军造访萨拉热窝是在为增加兵力部署做准备。

collins.def: If you talk about the general situation somewhere or talk about something in general terms, you are describing the situation as a whole rather than considering its details or exceptions.

example.ex: The figures represent a general decline in employment.
example.tran: 这些数字显示就业人数总体在下降。

example.ex: ...the general deterioration of English society.
example.tran: 英国社会的普遍堕落

collins.def: You use general to describe several items or activities when there are too many of them or when they are not important enough to mention separately.

example.ex: £2,500 for software is soon swallowed up in general costs...
example.tran: 用于软件方面的2,500英镑很快就被一般性费用耗光了。

example.ex: His firm took over the planting and general maintenance of the park last March.
example.tran: 他的公司去年3月接管了公园的绿化和日常维护工作。

collins.def: You use general to describe something that involves or affects most people, or most people in a particular group.

example.ex: The project should raise general awareness about bullying.
example.tran: 这个项目将会提高民众对恃强凌弱行径的认识。

collins.def: If you describe something as general, you mean that it is not restricted to any one thing or area.

example.ex: ...a general ache radiating from the back of the neck.
example.tran: 从后颈部扩散到全身的疼痛

example.ex: ...a general sense of well-being.
example.tran: 总体上的幸福感

collins.def: A general business offers a variety of services or goods rather than just one particular kind.

example.ex: They ran the general store and the farm dairy.
example.tran: 他们经营着杂货店和农场的乳品店。

collins.tran: （常用于头衔中）首席的，总管的，级别最高的
collins.def: General is used to describe a person's  job, usually as part of their title, to indicate that they have complete responsibility for the administration of an organization or business.

example.ex: He joined Sanders Roe, moving on later to become General Manager.
example.tran: 他加入了桑德斯·罗公司，后来一路晋升至总经理。

collins.tran: （员工）普通的，非专业的，一般的
collins.def: General workers do a variety of jobs which require no special skill or training.

example.ex: The farm employed a tractor driver and two general labourers.
example.tran: 农场雇用了一名拖拉机手和两名杂工。

collins.tran: （对某方面的知识或兴趣）一般的，泛泛的
collins.def: General is used to describe a person who has an average amount of knowledge or interest in a particular subject.

example.ex: This book is intended for the general reader rather than the student.
example.tran: 这本书面向一般读者而非学生。

collins.tran: 总的来说；总体上来看；大体上
collins.def: You use in general to indicate that you are talking about something as a whole, rather than about part of it.

example.ex: I think we need to improve our educational system in general...
example.tran: 我认为有必要从整体上改进我们的教育体系。

example.ex: She had a confused idea of life in general.
example.tran: 总的来说，她对生活非常困惑。

collins.tran: （指某一群体的大多数）总的来说，总体上
collins.def: You say in general to indicate that you are referring to most people or things in a particular group.

example.ex: People in general will support us...
example.tran: 总体而言，人们会支持我们的。

example.ex: She enjoys a sterling reputation in law enforcement circles and among the community in general.
example.tran: 总的说来，她在执法界和老百姓当中口碑甚佳。

collins.def: You say in general to indicate that a statement is true in most cases.

example.ex: In general, it was the better-educated voters who voted Yes in the referendum.
example.tran: 通常是那些受教育程度较高的人在全民公决中投赞成票。

collins.def: You use get with adjectives to mean 'become'. For example, if someone gets cold, they become cold, and if they get angry, they become angry.

example.ex: The boys were getting bored...
example.tran: 男孩子们开始感到厌烦。

example.ex: There's no point in getting upset...
example.tran: 苦恼是无谓的。

collins.tran: （用于表示状况或处境的表达中）陷入，处于
collins.def: Get is used with expressions referring to states or situations. For example, to get into trouble means to start being in trouble.

example.ex: Half the pleasure of an evening out is getting ready...
example.tran: 晚上外出时一半的乐趣在于出门前的准备。

example.ex: Perhaps I shouldn't say that — I might get into trouble...
example.tran: 也许我不该讲那些话——我可能会惹来麻烦。

collins.tran: 使陷入，使处于（某种状况或处境）
collins.def: To get someone or something into a particular state or situation means to cause them to be in it.

example.ex: I don't  know if I can get it clean...
example.tran: 我不知道自己是否能把它清理干净。

example.ex: What got me interested was looking at an old New York Times...
example.tran: 我感兴趣的是看一份旧的《纽约时报》。

collins.def: If you get someone to do something, you cause them to do it by asking, persuading, or telling them to do it.

example.ex: ...a long campaign to get US politicians to take the Aids epidemic more seriously...
example.tran: 旨在使美国政界人士更加重视艾滋病流行的长期运动

example.ex: How did you get him to pose for this picture?
example.tran: 你想了什么办法让他摆姿势照了这张照片？

collins.def: If you get something done, you cause it to be done.

example.ex: I might benefit from getting my teeth fixed...
example.tran: 补牙可能对我有好处。

example.ex: It was best to get things done quickly.
example.tran: 最好是赶快把事情弄完。

collins.def: To get somewhere means to move there.

example.ex: I got off the bed and opened the door...
example.tran: 我下床把门打开了。

example.ex: How can I get past her without her seeing me?...
example.tran: 我怎样才能从她身边经过而又不被她发现呢？

collins.def: When you get to a place, you arrive there.

example.ex: Generally I get to work at 9.30am...
example.tran: 我通常上午9点半到单位。

example.ex: It was dark by the time she got home.
example.tran: 她回到家时天已经黑了。

collins.def: To get something or someone into a place or position means to cause them to move there.

example.ex: Mack got his wallet out...
example.tran: 麦克掏出钱包。

example.ex: Go and get your coat on...
example.tran: 去把你的外套穿上。

collins.tran: （常用作助动词，代替be构成被动语态）
collins.def: Get is often used in place of 'be' as an auxiliary verb to form passives.

example.ex: Does she ever get asked for her autograph?...
example.tran: 有人向她索要过签名吗？

example.ex: A pane of glass got broken.
example.tran: 一块玻璃碎了。

collins.def: If you get to do something, you eventually or gradually reach a stage at which you do it.

example.ex: Miller and Ferlinghetti got to be friends...
example.tran: 米勒和费林盖蒂渐渐成了朋友。

example.ex: No one could figure out how he got to be so wealthy.
example.tran: 谁也不知道他怎么会变得如此富有。

collins.def: If you get to do something, you manage to do it or have the opportunity to do it.

example.ex: How do these people get to be the bosses of major companies?...
example.tran: 这些人是怎样成为大公司的老总的？

example.ex: Do you get to see him often?...
example.tran: 你经常能见到他吗？

collins.tran: （让…）迅速行动起来/干起来/工作起来
collins.def: You can use get in expressions like get moving ,get going, and get working when you want to tell people to begin moving, going, or working quickly.

example.ex: I aim to be off the lake before dawn, so let's get moving...
example.tran: 我计划黎明前从湖畔出发，大家马上行动起来吧。

example.ex: We need to get thinking, talking and acting on this before it is too late.
example.tran: 我们得赶紧就此事开动脑筋，展开讨论，并采取行动，否则就来不及了。

collins.tran: 到达（人生、事业的某一阶段）
collins.def: If you get to a particular stage in your life or in something you are doing, you reach that stage.

example.ex: We haven't got to the stage of a full-scale military conflict...
example.tran: 我们还未到全面军事冲突的地步。

example.ex: If she gets that far, Jane may get legal aid to take her case to court...
example.tran: 如果走到那个地步，简也许能得到法律援助去打官司。

collins.tran: （用于谈论进展情况）（使…）取得进展/不会有进展
collins.def: You can use get to talk about the progress that you are making. For example, if you say that you are getting somewhere, you mean that you are making progress, and if you say that something won't get you anywhere, you mean it will not help you to progress at all.

example.ex: Radical factions say the talks are getting nowhere and they want to withdraw...
example.tran: 激进派宣称谈判没有进展，他们打算退出。

example.ex: My perseverance was getting me somewhere.
example.tran: 我锲而不舍，总算有了一些进展。

collins.def: When it gets to a particular time, it is that time. If it is getting towards a particular time, it is approaching that time.

example.ex: It got to after 1am and I was exhausted...
example.tran: 已是凌晨一点多了，我累得筋疲力尽。

example.ex: It was getting towards evening when we got back...
example.tran: 我们回来的时候已经快到晚上了。

collins.def: If something that has continued for some time gets to you, it starts causing you to suffer.

example.ex: That's the first time I lost my cool in 20 years in this job. This whole thing's getting to me.
example.tran: 干这份工作20年来，我头一次失去了冷静，这一切让我大伤脑筋。

collins.def: If something gets you, it annoys you.

example.ex: What gets me is the attitude of so many of the people.
example.tran: 让我恼怒的是这么多人都是这样的态度。

collins.def: A girl is a female child.

example.ex: ...an eleven year old girl...
example.tran: 11岁的女孩

example.ex: I must have been a horrid little girl.
example.tran: 我一定是个人见人烦的小女孩。

collins.def: You can refer to someone's daughter as a girl .

example.ex: We had a little girl.
example.tran: 我们有一个小女儿。

collins.tran: 年轻女子，小妞儿（可能具冒犯意味）
collins.def: Young women are often referred to as girls. This use could cause offence.

example.ex: ...a pretty twenty-year-old girl.
example.tran: 20岁的漂亮姑娘

collins.def: Some people refer to a man's girlfriend as his girl.

example.ex: I've been with my girl for nine years.
example.tran: 我同我女朋友交往9年了。

means: （为购买某物或做某事而）支付

collins.tran: （与表示身体动作的名词连用，表示该动作）
collins.def: You can use give with nouns that refer to physical actions. The whole expression refers to the performing of the action. For example, She gave a smile means almost the same as 'She smiled'.

example.ex: She stretched her arms out and gave a great yawn...
example.tran: 她伸了个懒腰，打了个大哈欠。

example.ex: Giving a sigh, she fell to her knees at my feet...
example.tran: 她叹了一口气，跪倒在我脚边。

collins.def: You use give to say that a person does something for another person. For example, if you give someone a lift, you take them somewhere in your car.

example.ex: I gave her a lift back out to her house...
example.tran: 我让她搭我的便车回家。

example.ex: He was given mouth-to-mouth resuscitation...
example.tran: 对他进行了口对口的人工呼吸。

collins.tran: （与表示信息、意见、问候等的名词连用）提供，给出，传递，告诉
collins.def: You use give with nouns that refer to information, opinions, or greetings to indicate that something is communicated. For example, if you give someone some news, you tell it to them.

example.ex: He gave no details...
example.tran: 他未透露细节。

example.ex: Would you like to give me your name?...
example.tran: 我能知道您的姓名吗？

collins.def: You use give to say how long you think something will last or how much you think something will be.

example.ex: A BBC poll gave the Labour Party a 12 per cent lead...
example.tran: 英国广播公司的一项民意调查预计工党将领先12个百分点。

example.ex: Ted and his lawyers gave the company 11 months to sell off everything.
example.tran: 特德和他的律师们预计这家公司在11个月的时间内将变卖所有东西。

collins.def: People use give in expressions such as I don't give a damn to show that they do not care about something.

example.ex: They don't give a damn about the country.
example.tran: 他们对这个国家毫不关心。

collins.tran: 使产生（某种想法或印象）
collins.def: If someone or something gives you a particular idea or impression, it causes you to have that idea or impression.

example.ex: They gave me the impression that they were doing exactly what they wanted in life...
example.tran: 他们给我的印象是，他们正在做自己人生中想做的事情。

example.ex: The examiner's final report does not give an accurate picture.
example.tran: 这位核查员的最终报告没有准确反映事实。

collins.tran: 使身体感到…；使产生（某种情绪）
collins.def: If someone or something gives you a particular physical or emotional feeling, it makes you experience it.

example.ex: He gave me a shock...
example.tran: 他使我大吃一惊。

example.ex: It will give great pleasure to the many thousands of children who visit the hospital each year.
example.tran: 这将为每年成千上万来医院求诊的儿童带来很大快乐。

collins.def: If you give a performance or speech, you perform or speak in public.

example.ex: Kotto gives a stupendous performance...
example.tran: 科托的表演令人惊叹。

example.ex: I am sure you remember Mrs Butler who gave us such an interesting talk last year.
example.tran: 我相信你一定还记得巴特勒夫人，去年她给我们作了一次非常有意思的演讲。

collins.def: If you give something thought or attention, you think about it, concentrate on it, or deal with it.

example.ex: I've been giving it some thought...
example.tran: 这件事我已经考虑了一阵子。

example.ex: Priority will be given to those who apply early.
example.tran: 早申请者将获优先考虑。

collins.def: If you give a party or other social event, you organize it.

example.ex: That evening, I gave a dinner party for a few close friends.
example.tran: 那天晚上，我设宴招待几位好朋友。

collins.def: When you go somewhere, you move or travel there.

example.ex: We went to Rome...
example.tran: 我们去了罗马。

example.ex: Gladys had just gone into the kitchen...
example.tran: 格拉迪丝刚进厨房。

collins.def: When you go, you leave the place where you are.

example.ex: Let's go...
example.tran: 我们走吧。

example.ex: She's  going tomorrow.
example.tran: 她明天走。

collins.def: You use go to say that someone leaves the place where they are and does an activity, often a leisure activity.

example.ex: We went swimming very early...
example.tran: 我们很早就去游泳了。

example.ex: Maybe they've just gone shopping...
example.tran: 或许他们刚去购物了。

collins.tran: 去做…（可用go to do, 也可用go and do，美国英语中还可用go do，然而一般说 went and did）
collins.def: When you go to do something, you move to a place in order to do it and you do it. You can also go and do something, and in American English, you can go do something. However, you always say that someone went and did something.

example.ex: His second son, Paddy, had gone to live in Canada...
example.tran: 他的二儿子帕迪去加拿大生活了。

example.ex: I must go and see this film...
example.tran: 我一定要去看这部电影。

collins.def: If you go to school, work, or church, you attend it regularly as part of your normal life.

example.ex: She will have to go to school...
example.tran: 她将不得不去上学。

example.ex: His son went to a top university in America.
example.tran: 他的儿子上了美国的一所顶级大学。

collins.def: When you say where a road or path goes, you are saying where it begins or ends, or what places it is in.

example.ex: There's a mountain road that goes from Blairstown to Millbrook Village.
example.tran: 有一条山路从布莱尔斯敦通向米尔布鲁克村。

collins.tran: （用于否定表达中，表示对所提到行为不赞成或不允许某人有这种行为）
collins.def: You can use go in expressions such as 'don't go telling everybody', in order to express disapproval of the kind of behaviour you mention, or to tell someone not to behave in that way.

example.ex: You don't have to go running upstairs every time she rings...
example.tran: 用不着她一来电话你就往楼上跑。

example.ex: Don't you go thinking it was your fault.
example.tran: 别觉得是你的错。

collins.tran: （与further,beyond等词连用，表示某事的进展或程度）
collins.def: You can use go with words like 'further' and 'beyond' to show the degree or extent of something.

example.ex: He went even further in his speech to the conference...
example.tran: 他在大会发言中作了更进一步的阐述。

example.ex: Some physicists have gone so far as to suggest that the entire Universe is a sort of gigantic computer.
example.tran: 一些物理学家竟然提出整个宇宙就像一台巨型计算机。

collins.def: If you say that a period of time goes quickly or slowly, you mean that it seems to pass quickly or slowly.

example.ex: The weeks go so quickly!
example.tran: 这几周过得真快！

collins.def: If you say where money goes, you are saying what it is spent on.

example.ex: Most of my money goes on bills...
example.tran: 我的钱大部分用来支付各种账单。

example.ex: The money goes to projects chosen by the wider community.
example.tran: 这笔钱将用于由更广泛的社会群体所选出的项目。

collins.def: If you say that something goes to someone, you mean that it is given to them.

example.ex: A lot of credit must go to the chairman and his father...
example.tran: 很大一部分功劳应归于主席和他的父亲。

example.ex: The job went to Yuri Skokov, a capable administrator.
example.tran: 尤里·斯科科夫得到了这份工作，他是一位能干的管理人员。

collins.tran: 上，参加（电视或电台节目）
collins.def: If someone goes on television or radio, they take part in a television or radio programme.

example.ex: The Turkish president has gone on television to defend stringent new security measures...
example.tran: 土耳其总统上电视为严格的新安全措施进行辩护。

example.ex: We went on the air, live, at 7.30.
example.tran: 我们上了7点30分进行的现场直播。

collins.def: If something goes, someone gets rid of it.

example.ex: The Institute of Export now fears that 100,000 jobs will go...
example.tran: 现在出口协会担心将失去10万个工作机会。

example.ex: If people stand firm against the tax, it is only a matter of time before it has to go.
example.tran: 如果人们坚决抵制这项税收，它的废止就仅仅是个时间问题。

collins.def: If someone goes, they leave their job, usually because they are forced to.

example.ex: He had made a humiliating tactical error and he had to go.
example.tran: 他犯了一个让他颜面尽失的战术错误，只得引咎辞职。

collins.def: If something goes into something else, it is put in it as one of the parts or elements that form it.

example.ex: ...the really interesting ingredients that go into the dishes that we all love to eat.
example.tran: 我们都爱吃的菜肴里所放入的十分有趣的原料

collins.def: If something goes in a particular place, it fits in that place or should be put there because it is the right size or shape.

example.ex: He was trying to push it through the hole and it wouldn't go.
example.tran: 他想将它从这个洞里推过去，但却怎么也过不去。

example.ex: ...This knob goes here.
example.tran: 这个拉手要装在这里。

collins.def: If something goes in a particular place, it belongs there or should be put there, because that is where you normally keep it.

example.ex: The shoes go on the shoe shelf...
example.tran: 鞋子放在鞋架上。

example.ex: 'Where does everything go?'
example.tran: “东西都到哪儿去了？”

collins.def: If you say that one number goes into another number a particular number of times, you are dividing the second number by the first.

example.ex: Six goes into thirty five times.

collins.def: If one of a person's senses, such as their sight or hearing, is going, it is getting weak and they may soon lose it completely.

example.ex: His eyes are going; he says he has glaucoma...
example.tran: 他的视力在下降，他说自己得了青光眼。

example.ex: Lately he'd been making mistakes; his nerve was beginning to go.
example.tran: 他近来老犯错误，胆子也开始变小了。

collins.tran: （灯泡、引擎等)损坏，报废，无法正常运转
collins.def: If something such as a light bulb or a part of an engine is going, it is no longer working properly and will soon need to be replaced.

example.ex: I thought it looked as though the battery was going.
example.tran: 我看电池好像该换了。

collins.def: If you say that someone is going or has gone, you are saying in an indirect way that they are dying or are dead.

example.ex: 'Any hope?' — 'No, he's gone.'
example.tran: “还有希望吗？”——“没有，他已经死了。”

collins.def: If you say that something is going to happen, you mean that it will happen in the future, usually quite soon.

example.ex: I think it's going to be successful...
example.tran: 我认为这事会成功。

example.ex: You're going to enjoy this...
example.tran: 你会喜欢上这个的。
