collins.def: You say that you are going to do something to express your intention or determination to do it.

example.ex: I'm going to go to bed...
example.tran: 我要睡觉了。

example.ex: He announced that he's  going to resign...
example.tran: 他宣布他即将辞职。

collins.def: You use the going to talk about how easy or difficult it is to do something. You can also say that something is, for example, hard going or tough going .

example.ex: He has her support to fall back on when the going gets tough...
example.tran: 他在进展困难的时候可以求助于她。

example.ex: Though the talks had been hard going at the start, they had become more friendly.
example.tran: 虽然会谈在初期进行得很艰难，但是后来气氛变得友好些了。

collins.def: In horse racing and horse riding, when you talk about the going, you are talking about the condition of the surface the horses are running on.

example.ex: The going was soft; some horses found it hard work.
example.tran: 这块场地偏软，有一些马跑得很费劲。

collins.def: The going rate or the going salary is the usual amount of money that you expect to pay or receive for something.

example.ex: She says that's the going rate for a house this big...
example.tran: 她说这么大的房子现在就是这个价。

example.ex: That's about half the going price on world oil markets.
example.tran: 那大约相当于目前国际石油市场价格的一半。

collins.def: If someone or something has a lot going for them, they have a lot of advantages.

example.ex: This area has a lot going for it...
example.tran: 该地区占据很多优势。

example.ex: I wish I could show you the things you've got going for you.
example.tran: 我希望能让你看到自己的优势所在。

collins.def: When you get going, you start doing something or start a journey, especially after a delay.

example.ex: Now what about that shopping list? I've got to get going.
example.tran: 那张购物清单呢？我得出发了。

collins.def: If you say that someone should do something while the going is good, you are advising them to do it while things are going well and they still have the opportunity, because you think it will become much more difficult to do.

example.ex: People are leaving in their thousands while the going is good.
example.tran: 成千上万的人趁着局势稳定赶紧撤离。

collins.def: If you keep going, you continue doing things or doing a particular thing.

example.ex: I like to keep going. I hate to sit still.
example.tran: 我喜欢一直有事情做，讨厌一动不动地坐着。

collins.def: If you can keep going with the money you have, you can manage to live on it.

example.ex: Things were difficult, and we needed her wages to keep going.
example.tran: 日子很艰难，我们要靠她的工资来维持生活。

collins.def: If you say that something that has been achieved is good going or not bad going, you mean that it is better than usual or than expected.

example.ex: 4,000 copies of Wuthering Heights went in two days. That's not bad going for a book that has been on the market for 145 years.
example.tran: 4,000册《呼啸山庄》在两天内销售一空，对于一本已经面市145年的书而言，这是一个不错的成绩。

collins.def: If you say that something is enough to be going on with, you mean that it is enough for your needs at the moment, although you will need something better at some time in the future.

example.ex: It was a good enough description for Mattie to be going on with.
example.tran: 这个描述对玛蒂来说暂时还不错。

collins.def: You can use going on before a number to say that something has almost reached that number. For example, you can say that someone is going on 40 to indicate that they are nearly 40.

example.ex: We've been married for going on two years...
example.tran: 我们结婚快两年了。

example.ex: This is 1980 going on 1981.
example.tran: 现在是1980年,快到1981年了。

collins.tran: 愉快的；有趣的；令人愉快的
collins.def: Good means pleasant or enjoyable.

example.ex: We had a really good time together...
example.tran: 我们一起玩得真痛快。

example.ex: I know they would have a better life here...
example.tran: 我知道他们在这里会生活得更好。

collins.tran: 好的；高品质的；高水准的
collins.def: Good means of a high quality, standard, or level.

example.ex: Exercise is just as important to health as good food...
example.tran: 锻炼与合理膳食对健康同等重要。

example.ex: His parents wanted Raymond to have the best possible education...
example.tran: 父母想让雷蒙德接受最好的教育。

collins.def: If you are good at something, you are skilful and successful at doing it.

example.ex: He was very good at his work...
example.tran: 他工作非常出色。

example.ex: I'm not very good at singing...
example.tran: 我不太擅长唱歌。

collins.def: If you describe a piece of news, an action, or an effect as good, you mean that it is likely to result in benefit or success.

example.ex: On balance biotechnology should be good news for developing countries...
example.tran: 总的来说，生物技术对发展中国家应该是有利的。

example.ex: I had the good fortune to be selected...
example.tran: 我有幸被选中。

collins.tran: 合情理的；理由充足的；有根据的
collins.def: A good idea, reason, method, or decision is a sensible or valid one.

example.ex: They thought it was a good idea to make some offenders do community service...
example.tran: 他们认为让一些违法者去社区做义工是个好主意。

example.ex: There is good reason to doubt this...
example.tran: 有充分理由对此提出质疑。

collins.tran: 令人满意的；合适的；正确的
collins.def: If you say that it is good that something should happen or good to do something, you mean it is desirable, acceptable, or right.

example.ex: I think it's good that some people are going...
example.tran: 我认为一些人要去是好事情。

example.ex: It is always best to choose organically grown foods if possible.
example.tran: 如果可能，最好还是挑选有机食品。

collins.def: A good estimate or indication of something is an accurate one.

example.ex: We have a fairly good idea of what's going on...
example.tran: 我们对正在发生的事有着相当清楚的认识。

example.ex: This is a much better indication of what a school is really like...
example.tran: 这是显示学校真面貌的一个更加精确的指标。

collins.def: If you get a good deal or a good price when you buy or sell something, you receive a lot in exchange for what you give.

example.ex: Whether such properties are a good deal will depend on individual situations...
example.tran: 这样的地产是否可获得大笔收益还要视具体情形而定。

example.ex: The merchandise is reasonably priced and offers exceptionally good value.
example.tran: 这些商品定价合理，很是划算。

collins.def: If something is good for a person or organization, it benefits them.

example.ex: Rain water was once considered to be good for the complexion...
example.tran: 雨水曾一度被认为可以滋养皮肤。

example.ex: Nancy chose the product because it is better for the environment.
example.tran: 南希选择这种产品是因为它更环保。

collins.def: If something is done for the good of a person or organization, it is done in order to benefit them.

example.ex: Furlaud urged him to resign for the good of the country...
example.tran: 弗劳德敦促他为了国家的利益辞职。

example.ex: Victims want to see justice done not just for themselves, but for the greater good of society...
example.tran: 受害者希望正义得到伸张，这不仅是为了他们自己，也是为了社会的更广泛的利益。

collins.def: If someone or something is no good or is not any good, they are not satisfactory or are of a low standard.

example.ex: If the weather's no good then I won't take any pictures...
example.tran: 如果天气不好，我就不拍照了。

example.ex: I was never any good at maths.
example.tran: 我数学向来就不好。

collins.def: If you say that doing something is no good or does not do any good, you mean that doing it is not of any use or will not bring any success.

example.ex: It's no good worrying about it now...
example.tran: 现在就为此发愁根本没用。

example.ex: We gave them water and kept them warm, but it didn't do any good...
example.tran: 我们给他们水喝，为他们驱寒，但是都不管用。

collins.tran: 善行；美德；合乎道德的行为
collins.def: Good is what is considered to be right according to moral standards or religious beliefs.

example.ex: Good and evil may co-exist within one family.
example.tran: 善与恶可能并存于一体。

collins.tran: 正直的；高尚的；品行好的
collins.def: Someone who is good is morally correct in their attitudes and behaviour.

example.ex: The president is a good man...
example.tran: 总统是个品行端正的人。

example.ex: For me to think I'm  any better than a homeless person on the street is ridiculous.
example.tran: 在我看来，认为我自己比街上的无家可归者要更加高尚是很可笑的。

collins.tran: （尤指小孩）乖的，恭顺的，有礼貌的
collins.def: Someone, especially a child, who is good obeys rules and instructions and behaves in a socially correct way.

example.ex: The children were very good...
example.tran: 孩子们非常听话。

example.ex: I'm going to be a good boy now...
example.tran: 我现在要做个乖孩子了。

collins.def: Someone who is good is kind and thoughtful.

example.ex: You are good to me...
example.tran: 你对我很体贴。

example.ex: Her good intentions were thwarted almost immediately...
example.tran: 她的好心几乎马上被人拒绝了。

collins.def: Someone who is in a good mood is cheerful and pleasant to be with.

example.ex: People were in a pretty good mood...
example.tran: 人们的心情十分舒畅。

example.ex: He exudes natural charm and good humour...
example.tran: 他表现出一种与生俱来的魅力和很强的幽默感。

collins.def: If people are good friends, they get on well together and are very close.

example.ex: She and Gavin are good friends...
example.tran: 她与加文是好朋友。

example.ex: She's  my best friend, and I really love her.
example.tran: 她是我最好的朋友，我真的很喜欢她。

collins.tran: （身体部位或器官）健全的，强健的
collins.def: A person's good eye, arm, or leg is the one that is healthy and strong, if the other one is injured or weak.

example.ex: He turned his good eye on me and laughed.
example.tran: 他用那只健全的眼睛看着我笑了。

collins.def: You use good to emphasize the great extent or degree of something.

example.ex: We waited a good fifteen minutes...
example.tran: 我们等了足足15分钟。

example.ex: This whole thing's  got a good bit more dangerous.
example.tran: 整件事情变得更加危险了。

collins.def: You say 'Good' or 'Very good' to express pleasure, satisfaction, or agreement with something that has been said or done, especially when you are in a position of authority.

example.ex: 'Are you all right?' —  'I'm fine.' — 'Good. So am I.'...
example.tran: “你还好吗？”——“我挺好。”——“那就好。我也还不错。”

example.ex: Oh good, Tom's just come in...
example.tran: 哦，太好了，汤姆刚巧进来了。

collins.def: 'As good as' can be used to mean 'almost.'

example.ex: His career is as good as over...
example.tran: 他的事业差不多完蛋了。

example.ex: The vote as good as kills the chance of real reform.
example.tran: 这次投票几乎是扼杀了一次真正改革的机会。

collins.def: If you do something for the common good, you do it for the benefit or advantage of everyone.

example.ex: ...communities working together  for the common good...
example.tran: 为共同利益而团结协作的社区

example.ex: Many of them placed self-interest before the common good.
example.tran: 他们中的许多人置一己私利于集体利益之上。

collins.def: If you say that something will do someone good, you mean that it will benefit them or improve them.

example.ex: The outing will do me good...
example.tran: 这次远足对我会有所助益。

example.ex: It's  probably done you good to get away for a few hours...
example.tran: 离开几小时或许对你有好处。

collins.def: If something changes or disappears for good, it never changes back or comes back as it was before.

example.ex: The days of big-time racing at Herne Hill had gone for good...
example.tran: 在赫恩山举行盛大赛马会的日子早已一去不复返了。

example.ex: A few shots of this drug cleared up the disease for good.
example.tran: 注射几次这种药物就根除了这种疾病。

collins.def: People say 'Good for you' to express approval of your actions.

example.ex: 'He has a girl now, who he lives with.' — 'Good for him.'
example.tran: “他现在有女朋友了，他们住在一起。”——“他可真行啊。”

collins.def: If someone is good for something, you can rely on them to provide that thing.

example.ex: Joe was always good for a colorful quote...
example.tran: 乔总能绘声绘色地旁征博引。

example.ex: She heard her father shouting that her mother was stupid, useless, and good for nothing but her money.
example.tran: 她听到父亲叫嚷说母亲愚蠢无能，除了有点钱外一无是处。

collins.tran: 庆幸的是，幸运的是（英国英语中作 it's a good job, that）
collins.def: If you say it's a good thing, or in British English it's a good job ,that something is the case, you mean that it is fortunate.

example.ex: It's a good thing you aren't married...
example.tran: 幸好你没有结婚。

example.ex: It's a good job it happened here rather than on the open road.
example.tran: 庆幸的是事故发生在这里而不是在公路上。

collins.def: If you make good some damage, a loss, or a debt, you try to repair the damage, replace what has been lost, or repay the debt.

example.ex: It may cost several billion roubles to make good the damage.
example.tran: 也许要花上几十亿卢布才能赔偿这一损失。

collins.def: If someone makes good a threat or promise or makes good on it, they do what they have threatened or promised to do.

example.ex: Certain that he was going to make good his threat to kill her, she lunged for the gun...
example.tran: 他曾威胁要杀了她，而她确定他这次就要向她索命，便冲上前去拿枪。

example.ex: He was confident the allies would make good on their pledges.
example.tran: 他相信盟友们会履行他们的承诺。

collins.def: If someone makes good, they become successful, famous, or rich.

example.ex: Both men are poor boys made good.
example.tran: 两人都是出身贫穷，最终干出了一番事业。

collins.tran: （尤指在康复或修复后）同以前一样好
collins.def: If you say that something or someone is as good as new, you mean that they are in a very good condition or state, especially after they have been damaged or ill.

example.ex: I only ever use that on special occasions so it's as good as new...
example.tran: 我只在特别的场合下才使用它，所以它跟新的一样。

example.ex: In a day or so he will be as good as new.
example.tran: 他大概一天工夫就会恢复过来。

collins.tran: （用于人名、地名或事物名前表示喜爱）亲爱的，可爱的
collins.def: You use good old before the name of a person, place, or thing when you are referring to them in an affectionate way.

example.ex: Good old Harry. Reliable to the end...
example.tran: 亲爱的哈里。永远值得信赖。

example.ex: There is nothing wrong with good old cauliflower cheese.
example.tran: 这道令人喜爱的芝士菜花没有什么问题。

collins.tran: 优裕的生活；奢华安逸的生活
collins.def: If you say that someone is living the good life, you mean that they are living in comfort and luxury with few problems or worries.

means: 得到(get的过去式和过去分词)

collins.def: Got is the past tense and past participle of get.

collins.tran: 拥有，具有（美国英语的非正式语体中有时用got）
collins.def: You use have got to say that  someone has a particular thing, or to mention a quality or characteristic that someone or something has. In informal American English, people sometimes just use 'got'.

example.ex: I've got a coat just like this...
example.tran: 我有一件衣服同这件一模一样。

example.ex: She hasn't got a work permit...
example.tran: 她还没有拿到工作许可证。

collins.tran: 必须，不得不（美国英语的非正式语体中have有时可省略）
collins.def: You use have got to when you are saying that something is necessary or must happen in the way stated. In informal American English, the 'have' is sometimes omitted.

example.ex: I'm not happy with the situation, but I've just got to accept it...
example.tran: 我对这一局面并不满意，但又不得不接受。

example.ex: There has got to be a degree of flexibility...
example.tran: 得有一点灵活性才行。

collins.tran: 必定（强调某事的真实性，在美国英语的非正式语体中have有时可省略）
collins.def: People sometimes use have got to in order to emphasize that they are certain that something is true, because of the facts or circumstances involved. In informal American English, the 'have' is sometimes omitted.

example.ex: We'll do what we got to do.
example.tran: 我们该做的一定会做到。

collins.def: The government of a country is the group of people who are responsible for governing it.

example.ex: The Government has insisted that confidence is needed before the economy can improve.
example.tran: 政府坚持认为只有坚定信心经济才会有起色。

example.ex: ...democratic governments in countries like Britain and the US.
example.tran: 诸如英美等国的民主政府

collins.def: Government consists of the activities, methods, and principles involved in governing a country or other political unit.

example.ex: The first four years of government were completely disastrous.
example.tran: 政府前4年的执政彻底失败。

example.ex: ...our system of government.
example.tran: 我们的政府体制

means: 令人满意地，成功地，顺利地

collins.def: You use great to describe something that is very large. Great is more formal than big .

example.ex: The room had a great bay window.
example.tran: 这间房有一扇巨大的凸窗。

example.ex: ...a great hall as long and high as a church.
example.tran: 长度和高度与教堂相当的大厅

collins.tran: （数量或程度）大的，巨大的，超乎寻常的
collins.def: Great means large in amount or degree.

example.ex: I'll take great care of it...
example.tran: 我会加倍爱惜它的。

example.ex: Benjamin Britten did not live to a great age.
example.tran: 本杰明·布里顿并未活到很大的年纪。

collins.tran: 重大的；闻名的；令人激动的
collins.def: You use great to describe something that is important, famous, or exciting.

example.ex: ...the great cultural achievements of the past...
example.tran: 昔日辉煌的文化成就

example.ex: America can be great again.
example.tran: 美国会再度崛起。

collins.tran: 伟大的；著名的； 卓越的；优秀的
collins.def: You can describe someone who is successful and famous for their actions, knowledge, or skill as great .

example.ex: Wes Hall was once one of the West Indies' great cricketers.
example.tran: 韦斯·霍尔曾经是西印度群岛伟大的板球运动员之一。

example.ex: ...the great George Padmore.
example.tran: 伟大的乔治·帕德莫尔

collins.def: The greats in a particular subject or field of activity are the people who have been most successful or famous in it.

example.ex: ...all the greats of Hollywood.
example.tran: 所有的好莱坞名流

example.ex: ...cycling's all-time greats.
example.tran: 空前杰出的自行车运动员

collins.def: The greats of popular modern music are records that have been successful and that continue to be popular.

example.ex: ...a medley of rock'n'roll greats.
example.tran: 摇滚金曲大联唱

collins.tran: 美妙的；好极了的；了不起的
collins.def: If you describe someone or something as great, you approve of them or admire them.

example.ex: Arturo has this great place in Cazadero...
example.tran: 阿图罗在卡扎德罗威望极高。

example.ex: They're a great bunch of guys...
example.tran: 他们是一群很棒的小伙子。

collins.tran: 十分健康的；精力旺盛的；充满热情的
collins.def: If you feel great, you feel very healthy, energetic, and enthusiastic.

example.ex: I feel just great.
example.tran: 我感觉好极了。

collins.def: You use great in order to emphasize the size or degree of a characteristic or quality.

example.ex: ...a great big Italian wedding.
example.tran: 场面盛大的意大利式婚礼

example.ex: ...her sense of colour and great eye for detail.
example.tran: 她对颜色的感觉和捕捉细节的非凡眼力

collins.def: You say great in order to emphasize that you are pleased or enthusiastic about something.

example.ex: Oh great! That'll be good for Fergus.
example.tran: 哦，太棒了！那将对弗格斯很有利。

collins.tran: 哼，这倒好（表示气愤、恼火等）
collins.def: You say great in order to emphasize that you are angry or annoyed about something.

example.ex: 'Oh great,' I thought. 'Just what I need.'
example.tran: “哼，”我想，“正合我心。”

collins.tran: （用于同类动植物中较大者的名称前）大
collins.def: Great is used as part of the name of a species of plant or animal when there is another species of the same plant or animal which is smaller and has different characteristics.

example.ex: ...the great white shark.
example.tran: 大白鲨

means: 绿化，使重视环境保护问题

collins.def: Green is the colour of grass or leaves.

example.ex: ...shiny red and green apples...
example.tran: 红红绿绿、富有光泽的苹果

example.ex: Yellow and green together make a pale green.
example.tran: 黄色与绿色混合能调配出淡绿色。

collins.tran: 长满青草的；绿油油的；碧绿的
collins.def: A place that is green is covered with grass, plants, and trees and not with houses or factories.

example.ex: Cairo has only thirteen square centimetres of green space for each inhabitant.
example.tran: 开罗居民的人均绿地面积仅13平方厘米。

collins.tran: 环境保护的；主张环境保护的
collins.def: Green issues and political movements relate to or are concerned with the protection of the environment.

example.ex: The power of the Green movement in Germany has made that country a leader in the drive to recycle more waste materials.
example.tran: 德国环保运动的影响力使得该国率先发起了回收利用更多废品的运动。

collins.tran: 有利于环境的；环保的；绿色的
collins.def: If you say that someone or something is green, you mean they harm the environment as little as possible.

example.ex: ...trying to persuade governments to adopt greener policies...
example.tran: 试图说服政府采取更为环保的政策

example.ex: Our children are being educated to be green in everything they do.
example.tran: 我们的孩子所受的教育是凡事都要注重环保。

collins.tran: 绿党成员（主张环境保护）
collins.def: Greens are members of green political movements.

example.ex: The Greens see themselves as a radical alternative to the two major British political parties.
example.tran: 绿党人士认为他们与英国的两个主要政党截然不同。

collins.def: A green is a smooth, flat area of grass around a hole on a golf course.

example.ex: ...the 18th green.
example.tran: 第18洞轻击区

collins.tran: （尤指城市或村庄中心的）草坪，绿地
collins.def: A green is an area of land covered with grass, especially in a town or in the middle of a village.

example.ex: ...the village green.
example.tran: 村子里的草坪

collins.tran: （用于有绿地或过去有绿地的地方中）
collins.def: Green is used in the names of places that contain or used to contain an area of grass.

example.ex: ...Bethnal Green.
example.tran: 贝斯纳尔格林区

collins.def: You can refer to the cooked leaves of vegetables such as spinach or cabbage as greens .

example.ex: Eat your greens.
example.tran: 把青菜吃掉。

collins.def: You can describe fruit and vegetables as green when they are unripe and not ready to be eaten.

example.ex: Pick and ripen any green fruits in a warm dark place.
example.tran: 摘些还没有熟的水果然后在温暖阴暗的地方放熟。

collins.tran: 缺乏经验的；不成熟的；幼稚的
collins.def: If you say that someone is green, you mean that they have had very little experience of life or a particular job.

example.ex: He was a young lad, very green, very immature.
example.tran: 他还是个毛头小子，幼稚得很，一点都不成熟。

collins.def: If you say that someone is green with envy, you mean that they are very envious indeed.
If someone has green fingers, they are very good at gardening and their plants grow well.

example.ex: You don't need green fingers to fill your home with lush leaves.
example.tran: 不是园艺大师也可以把自己的家里装点得绿意盎然。

collins.def: The ground is the surface of the earth.

example.ex: Forty or fifty women were sitting cross-legged on the ground...
example.tran: 四五十个女人盘腿坐在地上。

example.ex: We slid down the roof and dropped to the ground.
example.tran: 我们沿着屋顶滑了下来，落到地上。

collins.def: If you say that something takes place on the ground, you mean it takes place on the surface of the earth and not in the air.

example.ex: Coordinating airline traffic on the ground is as complicated as managing the traffic in the air.
example.tran: 协调地面的航空交通与管理空中交通一样复杂。

collins.def: The ground is the soil and rock on the earth's surface.

example.ex: The ground had eroded.
example.tran: 这片土壤遭到侵蚀。

example.ex: ...the marshy ground of the river delta.
example.tran: 河流三角洲的沼泽地

collins.tran: （尤指建筑物极少或具有某种特性的）土地
collins.def: You can refer to land as ground, especially when it has very few buildings or when it is considered to be special in some way.

example.ex: ...a stretch of waste ground...
example.tran: 一块荒地

example.ex: This memorial stands on sacred ground.
example.tran: 这块纪念碑屹立于圣地之上。

collins.def: You can use ground to refer to an area of land, sea, or air which is used for a particular activity.

example.ex: ...Indian hunting grounds...
example.tran: 印第安人的狩猎场

example.ex: The best fishing grounds are around the islands.
example.tran: 最好的渔场在这些岛屿周围。

collins.tran: 运动场，…场（美国英语中亦作grounds）
collins.def: A ground is an area of land which is specially designed and made for playing sport or for some other activity. In American English grounds is also used.

example.ex: ...the city's football ground.
example.tran: 该市的足球场

example.ex: ...a parade ground.
example.tran: 阅兵场

collins.tran: （大型或重要建筑周围的）场地，庭院，花园
collins.def: The grounds of a large or important building are the garden or area of land which surrounds it.

example.ex: ...the palace grounds.
example.tran: 皇家花园

example.ex: ...the grounds of the University.
example.tran: 大学校区

collins.tran: （适于方法、思想等发展的）地方
collins.def: You can use ground to refer to a place or situation in which particular methods or ideas can develop and be successful.

example.ex: The company has maintained its reputation as the developing ground for new techniques...
example.tran: 该公司一直享有新技术研发基地的美誉。

example.ex: Seattle is fertile ground for small businesses.
example.tran: 西雅图是适合小型企业发展的沃土。

collins.def: You can use ground in expressions such as on shaky ground and the same ground to refer to a particular subject, area of experience, or basis for an argument.

example.ex: Sensing she was on shaky ground, Marie changed the subject...
example.tran: 感到自己的观点站不住脚，玛丽于是换了个话题。

example.ex: The French are on solid ground when they argue that competitiveness is no reason for devaluation...
example.tran: 法国人认为不能以提高竞争力为由进行贬值，他们是有道理的。

collins.def: Ground is used in expressions such as gain ground ,lose ground, and give ground in order to indicate that someone gets or loses an advantage.

example.ex: There are signs that the party is gaining ground in the latest polls...
example.tran: 有迹象表明该党在最新一轮投票中正逐渐领先。

example.ex: The US dollar lost more ground.
example.tran: 美元失去了更多的优势。

collins.def: If something is grounds for a feeling or action, it is a reason for it. If you do something on the grounds of a particular thing, that thing is the reason for your action.

example.ex: In the interview he gave some grounds for optimism...
example.tran: 他接受采访时阐述了持乐观态度的理由。

example.ex: The court overturned that decision on the grounds that the Prosecution had withheld crucial evidence...
example.tran: 法庭以检控方拒绝出示关键证据为由撤销了那项判决。

collins.tran: 以…为根据；建立在…基础上
collins.def: If an argument, belief, or opinion is grounded in something, that thing is used to justify it.

example.ex: Her argument was grounded in fact...
example.tran: 她的观点有事实根据。

example.ex: They believe the soul is immortal, grounding this belief on the Divine nature of the human spirit.
example.tran: 基于对人类精神神圣性的信仰，他们认为灵魂是永恒的。

collins.def: If an aircraft or its passengers are grounded, they are made to stay on the ground and are not allowed to take off.

example.ex: The civil aviation minister ordered all the planes to be grounded...
example.tran: 民航部长下令所有飞机不得起飞。

example.ex: A hydrogen leak forced NASA to ground the space shuttle.
example.tran: 氢气泄漏迫使美国国家航空航天局停止了航天飞机的发射。

collins.def: When parents ground a child, they forbid them to go out and enjoy themselves for a period of time, as a punishment.

example.ex: Thompson grounded him for a month, and banned television.
example.tran: 汤普森罚他一个月不能出门，并禁止看电视。

collins.def: If a ship or boat is grounded or if it grounds, it touches the bottom of the sea, lake, or river it is on, and is unable to move off.

example.ex: Residents have been told to stay away from the region where the ship was grounded...
example.tran: 居民们被告知不要靠近船只搁浅的区域。

example.ex: The boat finally grounded on a soft, underwater bank.
example.tran: 那条船最终在松软的水下浅滩搁浅了。

collins.def: The ground in an electric plug or piece of electrical equipment is the wire through which electricity passes into the ground and which makes the equipment safe.
Ground meat has been cut into very small pieces in a machine.

example.ex: ...ground beef.
example.tran: 绞碎的牛肉

example.ex: ...The sausages are made of coarsely ground pork.
example.tran: 这些香肠用切得较粗的猪肉制成。

collins.def: Ground is the past tense and past participle of grind .

collins.tran: 开辟新领域；开创新方法
collins.def: If you break new ground, you do something completely different or you do something in a completely different way.

example.ex: Gellhorn may have broken new ground when she filed her first report on the Spanish Civil War.
example.tran: 当盖尔霍恩发出她第一篇关于西班牙内战的报道时，她也许已经开辟了一片新的天地。

collins.def: If you say that a town or building is burnt to the ground or is razed to the ground, you are emphasizing that it has been completely destroyed by fire.

example.ex: The town was razed to the ground after the French Revolution.
example.tran: 该镇在法国大革命后被夷为平地。

collins.def: If two people or groups find common ground, they agree about something, especially when they do not agree about other things.
If you go to ground, you hide somewhere where you cannot easily be found.

example.ex: Citizens of East Beirut went to ground in basements and shelters.
example.tran: 东贝鲁特的市民们躲进了地下室和掩体中。

collins.def: The middle ground between two groups, ideas, or plans involves things which do not belong to either of these groups, ideas, or plans but have elements of each, often in a less extreme form.

example.ex: She seems to have found a middle ground in which mutual support, rather than complete dependency, is possible.
example.tran: 她似乎已经找到了实现相互支持而非完全依赖其中一方的中间立场。

collins.def: If something such as a project gets off the ground, it begins or starts functioning.

example.ex: We help small companies to get off the ground.
example.tran: 我们帮助一些小公司顺利起步。

collins.tran: 在自己熟悉的领域里；在自己的地盘
collins.def: If you are on your own ground, you are in a place or situation in which you feel confident because you are very familiar with it.

example.ex: On her own ground she knows exactly what she's doing.
example.tran: 她在自己熟悉的领域里对自己的行为有十足的把握。

collins.def: If you prepare the ground for a future event, course of action, or development, you make it easier for it to happen.

example.ex: ...a political initiative which would prepare the ground for war.
example.tran: 为战争埋下了伏笔的政治倡议

collins.def: If you shift your ground or change your ground, you change the basis on which you are arguing.
If you stand your ground or hold your ground, you continue to support a particular argument or to have a particular opinion when other people are opposing you or trying to make you change your mind.

example.ex: The spectacle of Sakharov standing his ground and speaking his mind gave me hope.
example.tran: 萨哈罗夫坚持立场、坦率直言的样子让我看到了希望。

collins.def: If you stand your ground or hold your ground, you do not run away from a situation, but face it bravely.

example.ex: She had to force herself to stand her ground when she heard someone approaching.
example.tran: 听到有人走近，她只好强迫自己鼓起勇气，绝不退缩。

collins.def: If you say that something such as a job or piece of clothing suits someone down to the ground, you mean that it is completely suitable or right for them.
If people or things of a particular kind are thin on the ground, there are very few of them.

example.ex: Good managers are often thin on the ground.
example.tran: 优秀的经理人常常寥寥无几。

collins.def: A group of people or things is a number of people or things which are together in one place at one time.

example.ex: The trouble involved a small group of football supporters...
example.tran: 这次骚乱涉及一小撮足球迷。

example.ex: The students work in groups on complex problems.
example.tran: 学生们分组研究复杂的问题。

collins.def: A group is a set of people who have the same interests or aims, and who organize themselves to work or act together.

example.ex: ...the Minority Rights Group...
example.tran: 少数民族权益团体

example.ex: Members of an environmental group are staging a protest inside a chemical plant.
example.tran: 一个环保组织的成员正在一家化工厂里举行抗议活动。

collins.tran: （具有共同点而被放在一起考虑的）组，群，类
collins.def: A group is a set of people, organizations, or things which are considered together because they have something in common.

example.ex: She is among the most promising players in her age group...
example.tran: 她是所在年龄组中最有前途的选手之一。

example.ex: As a group, today's  old people are still relatively deprived.
example.tran: 整体而言，当今的老年人依然相对贫困。

collins.def: A group is a number of separate commercial or industrial firms which all have the same owner.

example.ex: The group made a pre-tax profit of £11.05 million.
example.tran: 该集团的税前利润为1,105万英镑。

example.ex: ...a French-based insurance group.
example.tran: 总部位于法国的保险集团

collins.tran: （尤指流行乐的）乐队,乐团,组合
collins.def: A group is a number of musicians who perform together, especially ones who play popular music.

example.ex: At school he played bass in a pop group called The Urge.
example.tran: 他上学的时候在一个叫“冲动”的流行乐队中担任贝司手。

example.ex: ...Billy Bragg's  backing group.
example.tran: 比利·布拉格的伴奏乐队

collins.def: If a number of things or people are grouped together or group together, they are together in one place or within one organization or system.

example.ex: The fact sheets are grouped into seven sections...
example.tran: 这些资料被分成了7部分。

example.ex: The G-7 organization groups together the world's seven leading industrialized nations...
example.tran: 七国集团将世界上7个最主要的工业国家归在一起。

collins.def: When people, animals, and plants grow, they increase in size and change physically over a period of time.

example.ex: We stop growing at maturity.
example.tran: 我们成年之后不再长个儿。

collins.def: If a plant or tree grows in a particular place, it is alive there.

example.ex: The station had roses growing at each end of the platform.
example.tran: 车站月台的两头种着玫瑰花。

collins.def: If you grow a particular type of plant, you put seeds or young plants in the ground and look after them as they develop.

example.ex: I always grow a few red onions...
example.tran: 我总是喜欢种一些红洋葱。

example.ex: Lettuce was grown by the Ancient Romans.
example.tran: 古罗马人最先种植莴苣。

collins.def: When someone's hair grows, it gradually becomes longer. Your nails also grow.

example.ex: Then the hair began to grow again and I felt terrific.
example.tran: 然后，头发又长起来了，我感觉棒极了。

collins.tran: 留长（头发或指甲）；蓄（胡须）
collins.def: If someone grows their hair, or grows a beard or moustache, they stop cutting their hair or shaving so that their hair becomes longer. You can also grow your nails.

example.ex: I'd better start growing my hair.
example.tran: 我最好开始留头发。

collins.def: If someone grows mentally, they change and develop in character or attitude.

example.ex: They began to grow as persons.
example.tran: 他们开始长大成人了。

collins.def: You use grow to say that someone or something gradually changes until they have a new quality, feeling, or attitude.

example.ex: I grew a little afraid of the guy next door...
example.tran: 我开始有些害怕隔壁的那个家伙。

example.ex: He's growing old...
example.tran: 他渐渐变老了。

collins.def: If an amount, feeling, or problem grows, it becomes greater or more intense.

example.ex: The number of unemployed people in Poland has grown by more than a quarter in the last month...
example.tran: 上个月，波兰的失业人数增长超过了1/4。

example.ex: Opposition grew and the government agreed to negotiate.
example.tran: 反对的声音越来越高，政府只好同意进行谈判。

collins.def: If one thing grows into another, it develops or changes until it becomes that thing.

example.ex: The boys grew into men...
example.tran: 这些男孩子长成了男子汉。

example.ex: This political row threatens to grow into a full blown crisis.
example.tran: 这场政治争端有可能演化成一场全面爆发的危机。

collins.def: If something such as an idea or a plan grows out of something else, it develops from it.

example.ex: The idea for this book grew out of conversations with Philippa Brewster.
example.tran: 创作这本书的想法来源于跟菲莉帕·布鲁斯特的谈话。

collins.def: If the economy or a business grows, it increases in wealth, size, or importance.

example.ex: The economy continues to grow.
example.tran: 经济持续发展。

example.ex: ...a fast growing business.
example.tran: 迅速发展的企业

collins.def: If someone grows a business, they take actions that will cause it to increase in wealth, size, or importance.

example.ex: To grow the business, he needs to develop management expertise and innovation across his team.
example.tran: 为了拓展业务，他需要提高整个团队的管理技能和创新能力。

collins.def: If a crystal grows, or if a scientist grows it, it forms from a solution.

example.ex: ...crystals that grow in cavities in the rock...
example.tran: 岩石洞穴中形成的水晶

example.ex: We tried to grow some copper sulphate crystals with our children.
example.tran: 我们想跟孩子们一起制作硫酸铜晶体。

collins.def: Half of an amount or object is one of two equal parts that together make up the whole number, amount, or object.

example.ex: They need an extra two and a half thousand pounds to complete the project...
example.tran: 他们还需要2,500英镑才能完成该项目。

example.ex: More than half of all households report incomes above £35,000...
example.tran: 半数以上的家庭申报收入超过35,000英镑。

collins.tran: 部分地;在某种程度上;有点
collins.def: You use half to say that something is only partly the case or happens to only a limited extent.

example.ex: His eyes were half closed...
example.tran: 他双眼半闭。

example.ex: His refrigerator frequently looked half empty...
example.tran: 他的冰箱里经常半空着。

collins.tran: （足球、橄榄球、篮球比赛等的）半场，半时，半局
collins.def: In games such as football, rugby, and basketball, matches are divided into two equal periods of time which are called halves.

example.ex: The only goal was scored by Jakobsen early in the second half.
example.tran: 唯一的一粒进球是由雅各布森在下半场刚开始时打进的。

collins.def: A half is half a pint of a drink such as beer or cider.

example.ex: ...a half of lager and a sandwich.
example.tran: 半品脱淡啤酒和一份三明治

collins.tran: (儿童乘坐公共汽车或火车时的）半（价）票
collins.def: A half is a half-price bus or train ticket for a child.
You use half to say that someone has parents of different nationalities. For example, if you are half German, one of your parents is German but the other is not.

example.ex: She was half Italian and half English.
example.tran: 她是半意大利半英国血统。

collins.def: You use half past to refer to a time that is thirty minutes after a particular hour.

example.ex: 'What time were you planning lunch?'—'Half past twelve, if that's convenient.'...
example.tran: “你打算什么时候吃午饭？”“如果方便的话，12点半。”

example.ex: I think I got there about four and left about half past.
example.tran: 我想我是4点钟左右到达那里，大约半个小时后离开的。

collins.def: Half means the same as half past .

example.ex: They are supposed to be here at about half four.
example.tran: 他们应该在4点半左右到达这里。

collins.tran: （用于形容词前，表示强调或夸张）非常，极其
collins.def: You can use half before an adjective describing an extreme quality, as a way of emphasizing and exaggerating something.

example.ex: He felt half dead with tiredness...
example.tran: 他已经累得半死不活了。

example.ex: All this time I've been half sick about you and why you wouldn't write.
example.tran: 我一直非常担心你，一直在想你为什么不来信。

collins.tran: （有时用在否定句中，表示非常肯定的意思）
collins.def: Half is sometimes used in negative statements, with a positive meaning, to emphasize a particular fact or quality. For example, if you say 'he isn't half lucky', you mean that he is very lucky.

example.ex: You don't half sound confident...
example.tran: 你听起来非常有信心。

example.ex: I didn't half get into trouble...
example.tran: 我遇到了大麻烦。

collins.def: You use not half or not half as to show that you do not think something is as good or impressive as it is meant to be.

example.ex: You're not half the man you think you are...
example.tran: 你根本不是你自己想象的那种人。

example.ex: Poor old Henry, and not half as clever as he'd thought.
example.tran: 可怜的老亨利，以为自己多聪明。

collins.tran: 非常…的;更…的;非同寻常的
collins.def: When you use an expression such as a problem and a half or a meal and a half, you are emphasizing that your reaction to it is either very favourable or very unfavourable.

example.ex: It becomes clear that Montgomerie has a job and half on his hands.
example.tran: 很显然，蒙哥马利手头有一大堆事情要做。

collins.def: If you talk about your better half or your other half you mean your wife, your husband, or the person of the opposite sex that you live with.

example.ex: I was worried that my career, my children and my other half might become too much to cope with.
example.tran: 我担心我的事业、我的孩子们和我的那口子可能会让我应付不过来。

collins.def: If you increase something by half, half of the original amount is added to it. If you decrease it by half, half of the original amount is taken away from it.

example.ex: The number of 7 year olds who read poorly has increased by half over the past 5 years...
example.tran: 不识字的7岁儿童的人数在过去5年里增加了一半。

example.ex: Cutting food intake by half is an incredibly difficult thing for anyone to do.
example.tran: 将进食量减半对任何人来说都是件非常难的事。

collins.def: If you say that someone never does things by halves, you mean that they always do things very thoroughly.

example.ex: In Italy they rarely do things by halves. Designers work thoroughly, producing the world's most wearable clothes in the most beautiful fabrics.
example.tran: 在意大利，人们很少马虎从事。设计师们精益求精，用最美丽的布料制造出世界上最适合穿着的衣服。

collins.def: If two people go halves, they divide the cost of something equally between them.

example.ex: He's constantly on the phone to his girlfriend. We have to go halves on the phone bill which drives me mad.
example.tran: 他总和女友煲电话粥。令我抓狂的是电话费可是我们俩平摊的。

collins.def: Something that happens occurs or is done without being planned.

example.ex: We cannot say for sure what will happen...
example.tran: 我们无法确定会发生什么事。

example.ex: The accident happened close to Martha's Vineyard.
example.tran: 事故发生在玛莎葡萄园附近。

collins.def: If something happens, it occurs as a result of a situation or course of action.

example.ex: She wondered what would happen if her parents found her...
example.tran: 她不知道如果父母找到自己会有什么结果。

example.ex: He trotted to the truck and switched on the ignition. Nothing happened.
example.tran: 他匆匆走向卡车并转动点火开关，结果没有任何反应。

collins.tran: （尤指不愉快的事）发生（在…身上）;(某人)遭到;遇到
collins.def: When something, especially something unpleasant, happens to you, it takes place and affects you.

example.ex: If we had been spotted at that point, I don't know what would have happened to us...
example.tran: 如果当时我们被发现了，我不知道会有什么后果。

example.ex: It's the best thing that ever happened to me.
example.tran: 这是我所遇到的最好的事情了。

collins.def: If you happen to do something, you do it by chance. If it happens that something is the case, it occurs by chance.

example.ex: We happened to discover we had a friend in common...
example.tran: 我们凑巧发现我们有一个共同的朋友。

example.ex: I looked in the nearest paper, which happened to be the Daily Mail...
example.tran: 我仔细看了一下离自己最近的那份报纸，正巧是份《每日邮报》。

collins.tran: 碰巧，恰恰（尤引出令人意外的事）
collins.def: You use as it happens in order to introduce a statement, especially one that is rather surprising.

example.ex: She called Amy to see if she had any idea of her son's whereabouts. As it happened, Amy had.
example.tran: 她打电话给埃米，看她是否知道自己儿子的行踪。埃米还真就知道。

collins.def: Something that is hard is very firm and stiff to touch and is not easily bent, cut, or broken.

example.ex: He shuffled his feet on the hard wooden floor...
example.tran: 他拖着脚在硬木地板上走动。

example.ex: Something cold and hard pressed into the back of his neck.
example.tran: 一个冰冷梆硬的东西顶在了他的脖梗儿上。

collins.def: Something that is hard is very difficult to do or deal with.

example.ex: It's hard to tell what effect this latest move will have...
example.tran: 很难说最近这次行动会有什么结果。

example.ex: She found it hard to accept some of the criticisms directed towards her and her work...
example.tran: 她发现某些针对自己和自己工作的批评意见很难接受。

collins.def: If you work hard doing something, you are very active or work intensely, with a lot of effort.

example.ex: I'll work hard. I don't want to let him down...
example.tran: 我会努力工作，我不想让他失望。

example.ex: Am I trying too hard?
example.tran: 我是不是努力过头了？

collins.def: Hard work involves a lot of activity and effort.

example.ex: Coping with three babies is very hard work...
example.tran: 照顾3个宝宝是非常累人的活儿。

example.ex: ...a hard day's work...
example.tran: 一天的辛苦工作

collins.def: If you look, listen, or think hard, you do it carefully and with a great deal of attention.

example.ex: He looked at me hard...
example.tran: 他使劲盯着我看。

example.ex: You had to listen hard to hear the old man breathe...
example.tran: 你要仔细听才能听见老人的呼吸声。

collins.def: If you strike or take hold of something hard, you strike or take hold of it with a lot of force.

example.ex: I kicked a dustbin very hard and broke my toe.
example.tran: 我狠狠地踢了一脚垃圾箱，结果脚趾骨折了。

collins.tran: 强烈地;猛烈的;长时间地
collins.def: You can use hard to indicate that something happens intensely and for a long time.

example.ex: I've never seen Terry laugh so hard...
example.tran: 我从未见过特里如此放声大笑。

example.ex: It was snowing hard by then.
example.tran: 当时雪下得很大。

collins.def: If a person or their expression is hard, they show no kindness or sympathy.

example.ex: His father was a hard man...
example.tran: 他的父亲是个冷酷无情的人。

example.ex: Kate realized that the previous hard look on Maggie's face had been a mask.
example.tran: 凯特意识到玛吉原先的那副冷酷表情其实是装出来的。

collins.tran: 苛刻的;严厉的;不友善的
collins.def: If you are hard on someone, you treat them severely or unkindly.

example.ex: Don't be so hard on him.
example.tran: 别对他太苛刻了。

collins.def: If you say that something is hard on a person or thing, you mean it affects them in a way that is likely to cause them damage or suffering.

example.ex: The grey light was hard on the eyes...
example.tran: 光线暗淡对眼睛不利。

example.ex: These last four years have been hard on them.
example.tran: 过去的这四年里他们吃了不少苦。

collins.tran: （生活、一段日子）艰难的，艰苦的
collins.def: If you have a hard life or a hard period of time, your life or that period is difficult and unpleasant for you.

example.ex: It had been a hard life for her...
example.tran: 对她而言，那是一段非常艰苦的生活。

example.ex: Those were hard times.
example.tran: 那些岁月是非常艰难的。

collins.def: A hard winter or a hard frost is a very cold one.

example.ex: ...a prolonged period of hard frost...
example.tran: 漫长的强霜冻期

example.ex: I am expecting a long, hard winter.
example.tran: 我估计冬天会漫长而寒冷。

collins.tran: （颜色）刺目的，晃眼的;（声音）刺耳的，难听的
collins.def: Hard colours or sounds are harsh or bright and unpleasant to see or hear.

example.ex: The sea was a hard blue.
example.tran: 大海呈一片耀眼的蓝色。

collins.def: Hard evidence or facts are definitely true and do not need to be questioned.

example.ex: He wanted more hard evidence...
example.tran: 他想要更多确凿的证据。

example.ex: There are probably fewer hard facts about the life of Henry Purcell than that of any other great composer since the Renaissance.
example.tran: 有关亨利·普赛尔生平的可靠资料可能比任何其他文艺复兴以来的伟大作曲家都要少。

collins.tran: （水质）硬的（指含钙化合物较多）
collins.def: Hard water contains a lot of calcium compounds that stop soap making bubbles and sometimes appear as a deposit in kettles and baths.
Hard drugs are very strong illegal drugs such as heroin or cocaine.
In phonetics, a hard sound is one such as 'c' or 'g' as pronounced in the words 'cat' or 'give', and not as in the words 'cinema' or 'general'.
If one thing is hard by another, it is very close to it.

example.ex: Paradise Street was a short, crowded street near the railway station and hard by the factory.
example.tran: 天堂街是火车站附近一条拥挤的小街道，离该工厂很近。

collins.tran: 受到不公平待遇的;委屈的
collins.def: If you feel hard done by, you feel that you have not been treated fairly.

example.ex: The hall porter was feeling hard done by at having to extend his shift.
example.tran: 酒店行李搬运工因为被迫延长当班时间而愤愤不平。

collins.def: If you say that something is hard going, you mean it is difficult and requires a lot of effort.

example.ex: The talks had been hard going at the start.
example.tran: 会谈从一开始就举步维艰。

collins.tran: 受到沉重打击的;受严重影响的
collins.def: To be hard hit by something means to be affected very severely by it.

example.ex: California's been particularly hard hit by the recession.
example.tran: 加利福尼亚受经济衰退的影响尤为严重。

collins.tran: 佯装不感兴趣;故意摆谱
collins.def: If someone plays hard to get, they pretend not to be interested in another person or in what someone is trying to persuade them to do.

example.ex: I wanted her and she was playing hard to get.
example.tran: 我想得到她，但她却故意装出不感兴趣的样子。

collins.tran: 十分困难的;处于困境的
collins.def: If someone is hard put to do something or, in British English if they are hard pushed to do something, they have great difficulty doing it.

example.ex: Mr Morton is undoubtedly cleverer than Mr Kirkby, but he will be hard put to match his popularity.
example.tran: 莫顿先生无疑比柯克比先生更聪明，但他将很难像柯克比先生那样受人欢迎。

collins.tran: 为…而非常苦恼（或难受）；因…而沮丧
collins.def: If you take something hard, you are very upset or depressed by it.

example.ex: Maybe I just took it too hard.
example.tran: 可能我真的对此事太过耿耿于怀。

means: 用以构成完成式及完成式的不定式，表示已经…

collins.tran: (have 和 has 与过去分词连用构成动词的现在完成时)
collins.def: You use the forms have and has with a past participle to form the present perfect tense of verbs.

example.ex: Alex has already gone...
example.tran: 亚历克斯已经走了。

example.ex: I've just seen a play that I can highly recommend...
example.tran: 我刚看了一场话剧，我强烈推荐。

collins.tran: (had 与过去分词连用构成动词的过去完成时)
collins.def: You use the form had with a past participle to form the past perfect tense of verbs.

example.ex: When I met her, she had just returned from a job interview...
example.tran: 我遇见她时，她刚参加完一场求职面试回来。

example.ex: By Friday at 5:30 p.m., I still hadn't heard from Lund...
example.tran: 直到周五下午5点半，我仍未收到伦德的消息。

collins.def: Have is used in question tags.

example.ex: You haven't sent her away, have you?...
example.tran: 你还没有把她送走，是吗？

example.ex: It's happened, hasn't it?...
example.tran: 这事儿已经发生了，是吗？

collins.tran: (用于对带有 have,has 或 had 的句子作肯定或否定回答)
collins.def: You use have when you are confirming or contradicting a statement containing 'have', 'has', or 'had', or answering a question.

example.ex: 'You'd never seen the Marilyn Monroe film?' — 'No I hadn't.'...
example.tran: “你从未看过玛丽莲·梦露的电影？”“对，没有。”

example.ex: 'Have you been to York before?' — 'Yes we have.'
example.tran: “你们以前去过约克吗？”“是的，去过。”

collins.tran: （having 和过去分词连用，所引导的分句中提到的动作发生在另一个动作开始之前）
collins.def: The form having with a past participle can be used to introduce a clause in which you mention an action which had already happened before another action began.

example.ex: He arrived in San Francisco, having left New Jersey on January 19th...
example.tran: 1月19日离开新泽西后，他到了旧金山。

example.ex: Having been told by his doctor that he was overweight, he's eating all the fibre and fruit he can.
example.tran: 被医生告知超重后，他一直拼命地吃高纤维食物和水果。

collins.def: Your head is the top part of your body, which has your eyes, mouth, and brain in it.

example.ex: She turned her head away from him...
example.tran: 她把头别过去，不再看他。

example.ex: He took a puff on his pipe and shook his head.
example.tran: 他抽了口烟斗，摇了摇头。

collins.def: You can use head to refer to your mind and your mental abilities.

example.ex: I can't get that song out of my head.
example.tran: 那首歌在我脑海中挥之不去。

example.ex: ...an exceptional analyst who could do complex maths in his head.
example.tran: 会心算复杂数学题的杰出分析家

collins.tran: （队伍中的）领头位置;队首;排头
collins.def: The head of a line of people or vehicles is the front of it, or the first person or vehicle in the line.

example.ex: ...the head of the queue...
example.tran: 队首

example.ex: We took our place at the head of the convoy.
example.tran: 我们排在护送队伍的最前面。

collins.def: If someone or something heads a line or procession, they are at the front of it.

example.ex: The parson, heading the procession, had just turned right towards the churchyard.
example.tran: 走在行进队伍最前面的教区牧师刚刚向右转弯，朝着教堂墓地走去。

collins.def: If something heads a list or group, it is at the top of it.

example.ex: Running a business heads the list of ambitions among the 1,000 people interviewed by Good Housekeeping magazine.
example.tran: 在《好管家》杂志采访过的1,000人中，创立自己的公司在理想抱负中列在首位。

collins.def: The head of something is the highest or top part of it.

example.ex: ...the head of the stairs...
example.tran: 楼梯的顶部

example.ex: Every day a different name was placed at the head of the chart.
example.tran: 每天都有一个不同的名字被列在这张表的最上端。

collins.def: The head of something long and thin is the end which is wider than or a different shape from the rest, and which is often considered to be the most important part.

example.ex: There should be no exposed screw heads...
example.tran: 螺钉顶端不应该外露。

example.ex: Keep the head of the club the same height throughout the swing.
example.tran: 整个挥杆过程中要使杆头始终保持在同一高度。

collins.def: The head of a school is the teacher who is in charge.

example.ex: She is full of admiration for the head and teachers.
example.tran: 她对校长和教师们满心钦佩。

collins.tran: （公司、组织的）负责人，领导人，首脑，长，主任
collins.def: The head of a company or organization is the person in charge of it and in charge of the people in it.

example.ex: Heads of government from more than 100 countries gather in Geneva tomorrow.
example.tran: 来自100多个国家的政府首脑明日将齐聚日内瓦。

example.ex: ...the head waiter.
example.tran: 侍者领班

collins.def: If you head a department, company, or organization, you are the person in charge of it.

example.ex: ...Michael Williams, who heads the department's Office of Civil Rights.
example.tran: 负责该部民权处的迈克尔·威廉斯

example.ex: ...the ruling Socialist Party, headed by Dr Franz Vranitzky.
example.tran: 由弗朗兹·弗拉尼兹基博士领导的执政社会党

collins.def: The head of an infected spot is its white or yellow centre.
The head on a glass of beer is the layer of small bubbles that form on the top of the beer.
You can use head to say how many animals of a particular type a farmer has. For example, if they have fifty head of cattle, they have fifty cows.
If you have a bad head, you have a headache.

example.ex: I had a terrible head and was extraordinarily drunk.
example.tran: 我头很痛，已经酩酊大醉。

collins.tran: （硬币的）有人头像的一面，正面
collins.def: If you toss a coin and it comes down heads, you can see the side of the coin which has a picture of a head on it.

example.ex: 'We might toss up for it,' suggested Ted. 'If it's heads, then we'll talk.'...
example.tran: “我们可以掷硬币来决定。”特德建议道，“如果是正面，我们就谈谈。”

example.ex: Heads or tails?
example.tran: 你猜是正面还是反面？

collins.tran: 朝着（某一地点）行进（美国英语中亦作 are headed）
collins.def: If you are heading for a particular place, you are going towards that place. In American English, you can also say that you are headed for a particular place.

example.ex: He headed for the bus stop...
example.tran: 他朝着公共汽车站走去。

example.ex: ...an Iraqi vessel heading for the port of Basra...
example.tran: 开往巴士拉港的一艘伊拉克船

collins.tran: 很可能要遭受，会招致（美国英语中亦作 is headed for）
collins.def: If something or someone is heading for a particular result, the situation they are in is developing in a way that makes that result very likely. In American English, you can also say that something or someone is headed for a particular result.

example.ex: The latest talks aimed at ending the civil war appear to be heading for deadlock...
example.tran: 为结束内战而进行的最新谈判好像要陷入僵局。

example.ex: He said anyone giving orders without respecting the wishes of his people is heading for disaster...
example.tran: 他说任何不尊重人民意愿而发号施令的人都注定会走向灭亡。

collins.def: If a piece of writing is headed a particular title, it has that title written at the beginning of it.

example.ex: One chapter is headed, 'Beating the Test'.
example.tran: 有一章的标题为“战胜考试”。

collins.def: If you head a ball in football, you hit it with your head in order to make it go in a particular direction.

example.ex: He headed the ball across the face of the goal.
example.tran: 他一个头球，球从球门前横飞而过。

collins.def: You use a head or per head after stating a cost or amount in order to indicate that that cost or amount is for each person in a particular group.

example.ex: This simple chicken dish costs less than £1 a head...
example.tran: 这道简单的鸡肉菜肴每人的花费还不到1英镑。

example.ex: Ethiopia, for instance uses the equivalent of just twenty kilos of oil per head a year.
example.tran: 比如说，埃塞俄比亚每年的人均消费支出仅相当于20公斤的石油。

collins.def: If something or someone does your head in, they make you angry or frustrated.

example.ex: Living with my parents is doing my head in.
example.tran: 和父母住在一起让我很沮丧。

collins.def: From head to foot means all over your body.

example.ex: Colin had been put into a bath and been scrubbed from head to foot.
example.tran: 科林被放进浴缸，从头到脚仔仔细细洗了个干净。

collins.def: If you have a head for something, you can deal with it easily. For example, if you have a head for figures, you can do arithmetic easily, and if you have a head for heights, you can climb to a great height without feeling afraid.

example.ex: I don't have a head for business.
example.tran: 我没有生意头脑。

example.ex: ...an extraordinarily effective organiser with a remarkable head for figures.
example.tran: 很有算术头脑、工作效率极高的组织者

collins.tran: 充分理解并接受;打定（主意）
collins.def: If you get a fact or idea into your head, you suddenly realize or think that it is true and you usually do not change your opinion about it.

example.ex: Once they get an idea into their heads, they never give up.
example.tran: 一旦接受了一个想法，他们就永远不会放弃。

collins.def: If you say that someone has got something into their head, you mean that they have finally understood or accepted it, and you are usually criticizing them because it has taken them a long time to do this.

example.ex: Managers have at last got it into their heads that they can no longer accept inefficient operations.
example.tran: 管理者们终于意识到自己不能再安于低效率的运营了。

collins.tran: 让…自由行动;对…不加约束
collins.def: If you give someone their head, you allow them to do what they want to do, without trying to advise or stop them.

example.ex: He recognised ability and gave people their heads.
example.tran: 他发现别人的才能，并且让他们自由发挥。

collins.def: If alcoholic drink goes to your head, it makes you feel drunk.

example.ex: That wine was strong, it went to your head.
example.tran: 那酒劲儿很大，喝了会上头。

collins.tran: （赞扬或成功）冲昏…的头脑，使…骄傲自满
collins.def: If you say that something such as praise or success goes to someone's head, you are criticizing them because you think that it makes them too proud or confident.

example.ex: Ford is definitely not a man to let a little success go to his head.
example.tran: 福特绝对不是那种会被一点点成功冲昏头脑的人。

collins.def: If you are head over heels or head over heels in love, you are very much in love.

example.ex: I was very attracted to men and fell head over heels many times.
example.tran: 我很容易被男性吸引，曾多次深陷情网。

collins.def: If you keep your head, you remain calm in a difficult situation. If you lose your head, you panic or do not remain calm in a difficult situation.

example.ex: She was able to keep her head and not panic...
example.tran: 她设法保持镇静，没有陷入恐慌。

example.ex: She lost her head and started screaming at me.
example.tran: 她惊慌失措，开始向我大声尖叫。

collins.def: If you knock something on the head, you stop it.

example.ex: When we stop enjoying ourselves we'll knock it on the head.
example.tran: 等玩够了，我们就会结束。

collins.def: Phrases such as laugh your head off and scream your head off can be used to emphasize that someone is laughing or screaming a lot or very loudly.

example.ex: He carried on telling a joke, laughing his head off.
example.tran: 他继续讲笑话，自己笑得前仰后合。

collins.tran: （吸毒后）昏头昏脑的，神志不清的
collins.def: If you say that someone is off their head, you mean that they have taken so many drugs that they do not know what they are doing.
If you say that someone is off their head, you think that their ideas or behaviour are very strange, foolish, or dangerous.

example.ex: He's gone completely off his head.
example.tran: 他已经完全昏了头了。

collins.tran: 倒过来想;从全新的角度理解
collins.def: If you stand an idea or argument on its head or turn it on its head, you think about it or treat it in a completely new and different way.

example.ex: Their relationship turned the standard notion of marriage on its head.
example.tran: 他们的关系完全颠覆了传统的婚姻观念。

collins.def: If something such as an idea, joke, or comment goes over someone's head, it is too difficult for them to understand.

example.ex: I admit that a lot of the ideas went way over my head.
example.tran: 我承认那些想法中有很多远远超出了我的理解力。

collins.def: If someone does something over another person's head, they do it without asking them or discussing it with them, especially when they should do so because the other person is in a position of authority.

example.ex: He was reprimanded for trying to go over the heads of senior officers.
example.tran: 他因试图越过高层官员自作主张而受到斥责。

collins.tran: （不好的事情）再次出现，重新抬头
collins.def: If you say that something unpleasant or embarrassing rears its ugly head or raises its ugly head, you mean that it occurs, often after not occurring for some time.

example.ex: There was a problem which reared its ugly head about a week after she moved back in...
example.tran: 她搬回来大约一周之后，一个问题又重新出现了。

example.ex: The scourge of racial tyranny should never again be allowed to raise its ugly head.
example.tran: 永远不能让种族主义暴政的祸患重新抬头。

collins.def: If you stand on your head, you balance upside down with the top of your head and your hands on the ground.
If you say that you cannot make head nor tail of something or you cannot make head or tail of it, you are emphasizing that you cannot understand it at all.

example.ex: I couldn't make head nor tail of the damn film.
example.tran: 这部该死的影片我一点儿都看不懂。

collins.tran: 突然决定（做某事，尤指古怪或愚蠢的事）；心血来潮
collins.def: If somebody takes it into their head to do something, especially something strange or foolish, they suddenly decide to do it.

example.ex: He suddenly took it into his head to go out to Australia to stay with his son.
example.tran: 他突然心血来潮，打算去澳大利亚和儿子一起住。

collins.tran: 到了危急关头;到达关键点
collins.def: If a problem or disagreement comes to a head or is brought to a head, it becomes so bad that something must be done about it.

example.ex: These problems came to a head in September when five of the station's journalists were sacked.
example.tran: 这些问题在9月变得十分尖锐，当时该台有5名记者遭到辞退。

collins.def: If you bang peoples' heads together or knock their heads together, you tell them off severely for doing something wrong or for not doing something they were asked to do.

example.ex: It is now high time he banged his colleagues' heads together.
example.tran: 现在该是他敲打敲打同事们的时候了。

collins.def: If two or more people put their heads together, they talk about a problem they have and try to solve it.

example.ex: So everyone put their heads together and eventually an amicable arrangement was reached.
example.tran: 因此大家集思广益，最终作出了妥善的安排。

collins.tran: （尤指在生意方面）勉强逃脱困境
collins.def: If you keep your head above water, you just avoid getting into difficulties; used especially to talk about business.

example.ex: We are keeping our head above water, but our cash flow position is not too good.
example.tran: 我们正努力避免陷入困境，但我们的现金流动情况不太好。

collins.tran: 有人会遭殃，有人会（因此）受到惩罚（尤指被解雇）
collins.def: If you say that heads will roll as a result of something bad that has happened, you mean that people will be punished for it, especially by losing their jobs.

example.ex: The group's problems have led to speculation that heads will roll.
example.tran: 已经有人猜测，该集团的问题会导致一些人被解雇。

collins.def: A person's health is the condition of their body and the extent to which it is free from illness or is able to resist illness.

example.ex: Caffeine is bad for your health.
example.tran: 咖啡因对人体健康有害。

collins.def: Health is a state in which a person is not suffering from any illness and is feeling well.

example.ex: In hospital they nursed me back to health.
example.tran: 在医院里他们对我进行治疗及护理，使我恢复了健康。

collins.def: When you drink to someone's health or drink their health, you have a drink as a sign of wishing them health and happiness.

example.ex: In the village pub, regulars drank the health of John and his father.
example.tran: 在村子的酒馆里，老顾客们举杯祝愿约翰和他的父亲身体健康。

collins.def: The health of something such as an organization or a system is its success and the fact that it is working well.

example.ex: There's no way to predict the future health of the banking industry.
example.tran: 银行业未来是否会兴旺发达根本无法预测。

collins.def: When you hear a sound, you become aware of it through your ears.

example.ex: She heard no further sounds...
example.tran: 她再没有听到别的声音了。

example.ex: The trumpet can be heard all over their house...
example.tran: 喇叭声整栋房子都能听见。

collins.def: If you hear something such as a lecture or a piece of music, you listen to it.

example.ex: You can hear commentary on the match in about half an hour's time...
example.tran: 大约半小时后就能听到这场比赛的解说了。

example.ex: I don't think you've ever heard Doris talking about her emotional life before...
example.tran: 我想你以前从未听过多丽丝谈自己的感情生活。

collins.def: If you say that you can hear someone saying something, you mean that you are able to imagine hearing it.

example.ex: Can't you just hear John Motson now?...
example.tran: 你脑海里现在没有响起约翰·莫特森的声音吗？

example.ex: 'I was hot,' I could still hear Charlotte say with her delicious French accent.
example.tran: “我很热，”夏洛特那带有甜美法国口音的话语仍在我的脑际盘旋。

collins.tran: （法官或法庭）审理（案件），听取（证词）
collins.def: When a judge or a court of law hears a case, or evidence in a case, they listen to it officially in order to make a decision about it.

example.ex: The jury have heard evidence from defence witnesses...
example.tran: 陪审团已经听取了辩方证人的证词。

example.ex: He had to wait months before his case was heard.
example.tran: 等了数月后，他的案子才得到审理。

collins.def: If you hear from someone, you receive a letter or telephone call from them.

example.ex: Drop us a line, it's always great to hear from you...
example.tran: 给我们写封短信，能收到你的信总是让人很高兴。

example.ex: The police are anxious to hear from anyone who may know her.
example.tran: 警方急切地希望任何可能认识她的人打电话来。

collins.tran: （辩论或讨论中）倾听（意见或情况）
collins.def: In a debate or discussion, if you hear from someone, you listen to them giving their opinion or information.

example.ex: What are you hearing from people there?
example.tran: 你在那里都听到人们说了些什么？

collins.def: If you hear some news or information about something, you find out about it by someone telling you, or from the radio or television.

example.ex: My mother heard of this school through Leslie...
example.tran: 我母亲是从莱斯利那里知道这所学校的。

example.ex: ...the rumours I've been hearing about for years...
example.tran: 多年来我一直听说的一些谣言

collins.def: If you have heard of something or someone, you know about them, but not in great detail.

example.ex: Many people haven't heard of reflexology.
example.tran: 很多人没听说过反射学。

example.ex: ...people who, maybe, had hardly heard the word till a year or two ago.
example.tran: 那些可能直到一两年前才听说这个词的人们

collins.def: If you say that you have heard something before, you mean that you are not interested in it, or do not believe it, or are not surprised about it, because you already know about it or have experienced it.

example.ex: Furness shrugs wearily. He has heard it all before...
example.tran: 弗内斯疲倦地耸了耸肩。这事他早就全知道了。

example.ex: 'How many times have I heard that before?' Merchant complained angrily.
example.tran: “我听过有多少次了？”麦钱特生气地抱怨道。

collins.tran: “听见没有？”“你听到我的话了吗？”（要求对方注意听自己的话）
collins.def: If you say 'Do you hear?' or 'Did you hear me?' to someone, you are telling them in an angry or forceful way to pay attention to what you are saying.

example.ex: If you don't get out I'll call the police. Do you hear?...
example.tran: 如果你不出去，我就要报警了。听见没有？

example.ex: Leave her alone! Do you hear me?
example.tran: 别惹她！听见了吗？

collins.tran: 说得对！说得好！（政治辩论或公众大会上对讲话人表示赞同的喝彩声）
collins.def: During political debates and public meetings, people sometimes say 'Hear hear!' to express their agreement with what the speaker is saying.
If you say that you can't hear yourself think, you are complaining and emphasizing that there is a lot of noise, and that it is disturbing you or preventing you from doing something.

example.ex: For God's sake shut up. I can't hear myself think!...
example.tran: 看在老天爷的份上，闭嘴吧。吵死我了！

example.ex: If you're sitting in the front yard, you can't hear yourself think because the traffic is getting very, very bad.
example.tran: 如果你坐在前院，就会被吵死，因为外面交通太混乱了。

collins.def: If you say that you won't hear of someone doing something, you mean that you refuse to let them do it.

example.ex: I've always wanted to be an actor but Dad wouldn't hear of it...
example.tran: 我一直想当个演员，但爸爸不同意。

example.ex: He even thought about moving from the village. But his friends wouldn't hear of it.
example.tran: 他甚至考虑要从村子里搬出去。但他的朋友们不答应。

means: （在餐桌旁）招待，侍应，作仆人（或店员、服务员等）

collins.def: If you help someone, you make it easier for them to do something, for example by doing part of the work for them or by giving them advice or money.

example.ex: He has helped to raise a lot of money...
example.tran: 他帮着筹集了很多钱。

example.ex: My mum used to help cook the meals for the children...
example.tran: 我妈妈过去常帮忙给孩子做饭。

collins.def: If you say that something helps, you mean that it makes something easier to do or get, or that it improves a situation to some extent.

example.ex: The right style of swimsuit can help to hide, minimise or emphasise what you want it to...
example.tran: 款式选择得当的泳装有助于按照意愿掩饰、缩小或突出某些部位。

example.ex: Building more motorways and bypasses will help the environment by reducing pollution and traffic jams in towns and cities...
example.tran: 建造更多的高速公路和绕城道路能够减少城镇中的污染和交通堵塞，有利于改善环境。

collins.def: If you help someone go somewhere or move in some way, you give them support so that they can move more easily.

example.ex: Martin helped Tanya over the rail...
example.tran: 马丁扶着塔尼娅越过栏杆。

example.ex: I allowed her to help me to my feet...
example.tran: 我允许她扶我站起来。

collins.def: If you help yourself, you try to get yourself out of a difficult situation rather than accept it and think you can do nothing to change it.

example.ex: He tries to help people with problems, but firmly believes they should do more to help themselves.
example.tran: 他尽力帮助有困难的人，但仍坚信他们应该更加努力自救。

collins.tran: 帮助解决困难的人（或事物）
collins.def: If you say that someone or something has been a help or has been some help, you mean that they have helped you to solve a problem.

example.ex: Thank you. You've been a great help already.
example.tran: 谢谢你。你已经帮了大忙了。

example.ex: ...a quality which will be a help rather than a hindrance to them...
example.tran: 会对他们有所助益而非阻碍的一种品质

collins.def: Help is action taken to rescue a person who is in danger. You shout 'help!' when you are in danger in order to attract someone's attention so that they can come and rescue you.

example.ex: He was screaming for help...
example.tran: 他高呼求救。

example.ex: 'Help!' I screamed, turning to run.
example.tran: “救命！”我尖叫道，转身就跑。

collins.def: In computing, help, or the help menu, is a file that gives you information and advice, for example about how to use a particular program.

example.ex: If you get stuck, click on Help.
example.tran: 如果碰到疑难，就点击“帮助”。

collins.def: If you help yourself to something, you serve yourself or you take it for yourself. If someone tells you to help yourself, they are telling you politely to serve yourself anything you want or to take anything you want.

example.ex: There's bread on the table. Help yourself...
example.tran: 桌上有面包。你自己拿吧。

example.ex: Just help yourself to leaflets.
example.tran: 请自取传单材料。

collins.def: If someone helps themselves to something, they steal it.

example.ex: Has somebody helped himself to some film star's diamonds?
example.tran: 有人偷了某个影星的钻石了吗？

collins.def: If you can't help the way you feel or behave, you cannot control it or stop it happening. You can also say that you can't help yourself .

example.ex: I can't help feeling sorry for the poor man...
example.tran: 我不禁为这个可怜的男人感到难过。

example.ex: 'Please don't cry.' — 'I can't help it.'...
example.tran: “别哭了。”——“我忍不住。”

collins.tran: （用于委婉地表示观点）不免，禁不住（想）
collins.def: If you say you can't help thinking something, you are expressing your opinion in an indirect way, often because you think it seems rude.

example.ex: I can't help feeling that this may just be another of her schemes...
example.tran: 我不免觉得这可能只是她的又一个诡计。

example.ex: I could not help but think this is a very queer life.
example.tran: 我忍不住会认为这是一种非常怪异的生活。

collins.def: If someone or something is of help, they make a situation easier or better.

example.ex: Can I be of help to you?
example.tran: 我能帮上你吗？

collins.def: You use her to refer to a woman, girl, or female animal.

example.ex: I went in the room and told her I had something to say to her...
example.tran: 我走进房间，告诉她我有话要和她说。

example.ex: Catherine could not give her the advice she most needed...
example.tran: 凯瑟琳无法给她最亟需的建议。

collins.tran: （书面英语中不区分性别地泛指人）他或她（一些人不喜欢这种用法，更倾向于使用 him or her 或 them）
collins.def: In written English, her is sometimes used to refer to a person without saying whether that person is a man or a woman. Some people dislike this use and prefer to use 'him or her' or 'them'.

example.ex: Talk to your baby, play games, and show her how much you enjoy her company.
example.tran: 和你的宝宝说话，做游戏，让他（她）知道你很喜欢和他（她）在一起。

collins.def: Her is sometimes used to refer to a country or nation.
People sometimes use her to refer to a car, machine, or ship.

example.ex: Kemp got out of his car. 'Just fill her up, thanks.'
example.tran: 肯普下了车。“给它加满油，谢谢。”

means: （给某人东西或指出某物时说）

collins.def: You use here when you are referring to the place where you are.

example.ex: I'm here all by myself and I know I'm going to get lost...
example.tran: 这里只有我一个人，我知道我会迷路的。

example.ex: Well, I can't stand here chatting all day.
example.tran: 好了，我不能一整天就站在这里闲聊。

collins.tran: 在此处（指所指向的地方）
collins.def: You use here when you are pointing towards a place that is near you, in order to draw someone else's attention to it.

example.ex: ...if you will just sign here...
example.tran: 请在这里签字

example.ex: Come and sit here, Lauren...
example.tran: 过来坐这里，劳伦。

collins.def: You use here in order to indicate that the person or thing that you are talking about is near you or is being held by you.

example.ex: My friend here writes for radio...
example.tran: 我这位朋友是个电台撰稿人。

example.ex: I have here at my side Mr. Glenn Williams...
example.tran: 我身边这位是格伦·威廉斯先生。

collins.def: You use here to refer to people in general and their life on Earth.

example.ex: ...where we have come from, where we are going to, or what our purpose here is, if any...
example.tran: 我们从哪里来，到哪里去，或者倘若我们活在人世间有何目的的话，这个目的是什么

example.ex: Who are we? What are we doing here?
example.tran: 我们是谁？我们在人世间做什么？

collins.def: If you say that you are here to do something, that is your role or function.

example.ex: I'm here to help you...
example.tran: 我是来帮你的。

example.ex: I'm not here to listen to your complaints.
example.tran: 我不是来听你抱怨的。

collins.def: You use here in order to draw attention to something or someone who has just arrived in the place where you are, or to draw attention to the place you have just arrived at.

example.ex: 'Here's the taxi,' she said politely...
example.tran: “出租车来了，”她礼貌地说。

example.ex: 'Mr Cummings is here,' she said, holding the door open...
example.tran: “卡明斯先生来了，”她把门敞着说道。

collins.tran: 在这一点上;在这一阶段;在这一方面
collins.def: You use here to refer to a particular point or stage of a situation or subject that you have come to or that you are dealing with.

example.ex: Both sides will have to sell the agreement to their people. It's here that the real test will come...
example.tran: 双方都必须要让各自的民众接受这项协议。真正的考验就在这里。

example.ex: It's here that we come up against the difference of approach...
example.tran: 我们就是在这一点上面临方法上的分歧。

collins.def: You use here to refer to a period of time, a situation, or an event that is present or happening now.

example.ex: Here comes the summer...
example.tran: 夏天到了。

example.ex: Economic recovery is here...
example.tran: 经济开始复苏。

collins.tran: （用在句首以引起注意或引出介绍）下面，以下
collins.def: You use here at the beginning of a sentence in order to draw attention to something or to introduce something.

example.ex: From Nairobi here's our East Africa correspondent, Colin Blane...
example.tran: 以下是我们来自内罗毕的东非记者科林·布兰的报道。

example.ex: Here is a summer soup that is almost a meal in itself...
example.tran: 接下来是一道几乎可以抵作一餐的夏季汤品。

collins.def: You use here when you are offering or giving something to someone.

example.ex: You know you can phone me — here's my mother's number...
example.tran: 你可以给我打电话——给你，这是我母亲的电话号码。

example.ex: Here's your coffee, just the way you like it...
example.tran: 给你的咖啡，按你的口味冲的。

collins.tran: （表示接下来对某人性格或处境的描述出人意料）看看，瞧瞧
collins.def: You say 'here we are' or 'here you are' when the statement that you are making about someone's character or situation is unexpected.

example.ex: Here you are, saying these terrible things...
example.tran: 看看你，说这些难听的话。

example.ex: Here we are, pretending we're winning.
example.tran: 瞧瞧我们，装出一副胜利者的姿态。

collins.def: You say 'here we are' when you have just found something that you have been looking for.

example.ex: I rummaged through the drawers and came up with Amanda's folder. 'Here we are.'
example.tran: 我翻遍了抽屉，找出了阿曼达的文件夹。“找到了。”

collins.tran: （表示即将开始做或说困难或令人不快的事）这就开始
collins.def: You say 'here goes' when you are about to do or say something difficult or unpleasant.

example.ex: Dr Culver nervously muttered 'Here goes,' and gave the little girl an injection.
example.tran: 卡尔弗医生紧张地嘟囔了一句“要打了啊”，然后就给小女孩打了一针。

collins.tran: （尤指令人不快的事）又发生了，又来了
collins.def: You use expressions such as 'here we go' and 'here we go again' in order to indicate that something is happening again in the way that you expected, especially something unpleasant.

example.ex: 'Police! Open up!' — 'Oh well,' I thought, 'here we go.'...
example.tran: “警察！开门！”——“哎呀。”我想，“又来了。”

example.ex: At first, he was told he was too young and I thought, 'Oh, boy, here we go again.'...
example.tran: 起先，他被告知他太年轻了，我心想，“哎，又是老一套。”

collins.def: You use here and now to emphasize that something is happening at the present time, rather than in the future or past, or that you would like it to happen at the present time.

example.ex: I'm a practicing physician trying to help people here and now...
example.tran: 我是一名此时此刻只想治病救人的执业医师。

example.ex: Instead of staying in the here and now, you bring up similar instances from the past.
example.tran: 你没有紧扣眼前所发生的事，而是只提出了一些过去的类似事例。

collins.def: If something happens here and there, it happens in several different places.

example.ex: I do a bit of teaching here and there...
example.tran: 我零零散散地到处教些课。

example.ex: He could only understand a word here and there.
example.tran: 他只能零星地听懂一两个单词。

collins.tran: （祝酒词）为我们干杯/为你的新工作干杯
collins.def: You use expressions such as 'here's to us' and 'here's to your new job' before drinking a toast in order to wish someone success or happiness.

example.ex: He raised his glass. 'Here's to neighbors.'...
example.tran: 他举起杯子： “各位高邻，干了这杯！”

example.ex: Tony smiled and lifted his glass. 'Here's to you, Amy.'
example.tran: 托尼微笑着举起杯子。“为你干一杯，埃米。”

means: （用以加强语气）她亲自，她本人

collins.tran: 她自己（指女性或雌性动物）
collins.def: You use herself to refer to a woman, girl, or female animal.

example.ex: She let herself out of the room...
example.tran: 她走出了房间。

example.ex: Jennifer believes she will move out on her own when she is financially able to support herself...
example.tran: 珍妮弗相信，当自己有钱养活自己时，就会搬出去单住。

collins.tran: （书面英语中泛指人）他自己，她自己（有些人不喜欢这种用法，更倾向于使用 himself or herself 或 themselves）
collins.def: In written English, herself is sometimes used to refer to a person without saying whether that person is a man or a woman. Some people dislike this use and prefer to use 'himself or herself' or 'themselves'.

example.ex: How can anyone blame her for actions for which she feels herself to be in no way responsible?
example.tran: 她认为自己对这些行动不负有责任，别人怎么还能因此而责备她呢？

collins.tran: （指国家或民族）她自己，它自己
collins.def: Herself is sometimes used to refer to a country or nation.

example.ex: Britain's dream of herself began to fade.
example.tran: 不列颠民族的梦想开始渐渐幻灭。

collins.tran: （指汽车、机器或船）她自己，它自己
collins.def: People sometimes use herself to refer to a car, machine, or ship.

example.ex: The ship adjusted herself to the roll and rhythm of the sea.
example.tran: 船随着海水的起伏节奏时起时落。

collins.tran: （用于加强语气，有时代替 her 作动词或介词的宾语）她本人，它本身
collins.def: You use herself to emphasize the person or thing that you are referring to. Herself is sometimes used instead of 'her' as the object of a verb or preposition.

example.ex: She's so beautiful herself...
example.tran: 她本人是如此美丽。

example.ex: Has anyone thought of consulting Bethan herself?...
example.tran: 有人想过咨询一下贝唐本人的意见吗？

collins.tran: 高的（不用于形容人或动植物）
collins.def: Something that is high extends a long way from the bottom to the top when it is upright. You do not use high to describe people, animals, or plants.

example.ex: ...a house, with a high wall all around it...
example.tran: 四周围着高墙的房子

example.ex: Mount Marcy is the highest mountain in the Adirondacks.
example.tran: 马西山是阿迪朗达克山脉中最高的山。

collins.def: You use high to talk or ask about how much something upright measures from the bottom to the top.

example.ex: ...an elegant bronze horse only nine inches high...
example.tran: 只有9英寸高的精致青铜马雕塑

example.ex: The grass in the yard was waist high...
example.tran: 院子里的草有齐腰高。

collins.tran: （相对地面、海平面、其他人或物）高的
collins.def: If something is high, it is a long way above the ground, above sea level, or above a person or thing.

example.ex: I looked down from the high window...
example.tran: 我从高高的窗口往下看。

example.ex: The bridge was high, jacked up on wooden piers...
example.tran: 桥很高，被几个大木墩托起。

collins.def: You can use high to indicate that something is great in amount, degree, or intensity.

example.ex: The European country with the highest birth rate is Ireland...
example.tran: 人口出生率最高的欧洲国家是爱尔兰。

example.ex: Official reports said casualties were high...
example.tran: 官方报告称死伤惨重。

collins.def: If a food or other substance is high in a particular ingredient, it contains a large amount of that ingredient.

example.ex: Don't indulge in rich sauces, fried food and thick pastry as these are high in fat.
example.tran: 不要吃太多浓酱汁、油炸食品和甜腻的油酥点心，因为这些食品的脂肪含量很高。

example.ex: ...a superb compost, high in calcium.
example.tran: 富含钙的优质堆肥

collins.def: If something reaches a high of a particular amount or degree, that is the greatest it has ever been.

example.ex: Traffic from Jordan to Iraq is down to a dozen loaded lorries a day, compared with a high of 200 a day...
