collins.def: If you keep off something or keep away from it, you avoid it. If you keep out of something, you avoid getting involved in it. You can also say that you keep someone off ,away from or out of something.

example.ex: I managed to stick to the diet and keep off sweet foods...
example.tran: 我努力做到了只吃规定饮食，不沾甜食。

example.ex: He's going to be a fantastic player if he keeps away from booze and women...
example.tran: 如果能不近酒色，他将成为一名出色的运动员。

collins.def: If someone or something keeps you from a particular action, they prevent you from doing it.

example.ex: Embarrassment has kept me from doing all sorts of things...
example.tran: 我总是害怕受窘，什么事都不敢去做。

example.ex: He kept her from being lonely...
example.tran: 他不让她感到孤独。

collins.def: If you try to keep from doing something, you try to stop yourself from doing it.

example.ex: She bit her lip to keep from crying...
example.tran: 她咬住嘴唇不哭。

example.ex: He had to lean on Dan to keep from falling.
example.tran: 他不得不靠在丹身上以免摔倒。

collins.def: If you keep something from someone, you do not tell them about it.

example.ex: She knew that Gabriel was keeping something from her.
example.tran: 她知道加布里埃尔有事瞒着她。

collins.def: If you keep doing something, you do it repeatedly or continue to do it.

example.ex: I keep forgetting it's December...
example.tran: 我总是忘了现在是12月了。

example.ex: I turned back after a while, but he kept walking...
example.tran: 我过了一会就往回走了，但他还接着走。

collins.tran: （与某些名词连用，表示持续一段时间或继续做某事）持续，继续（持有或控制）
collins.def: Keep is used with some nouns to indicate that someone does something for a period of time or continues to do it. For example, if you keep a grip on something, you continue to hold or control it.

example.ex: Until last year, the regime kept a tight grip on the country...
example.tran: 直到去年，那个国家还处于该政权的严密控制之下。

example.ex: One of them would keep a look-out on the road behind to warn us of approaching vehicles...
example.tran: 他们中会有一人看着后面的路，提醒我们注意过来的车辆。

collins.def: If you keep something, you continue to have it in your possession and do not throw it away, give it away, or sell it.

example.ex: 'I like this dress,' she said. 'Keep it. You can have it,' said Daphne...
example.tran: “我喜欢这件连衣裙，”她说。“留下吧。给你了，”达夫妮说道。

example.ex: Lathan had to choose between marrying her and keeping his job.
example.tran: 莱森不得不在娶她和保住工作之间作出选择。

collins.def: If you keep something in a particular place, you always have it or store it in that place so that you can use it whenever you need it.

example.ex: She kept her money under the mattress...
example.tran: 她把钱放在床垫下。

example.ex: She remembered where she kept the gun...
example.tran: 她记得放枪的地方。

collins.def: When you keep something such as a promise or an appointment, you do what you said you would do.

example.ex: I'm hoping you'll keep your promise to come for a long visit...
example.tran: 我希望你遵守诺言来这儿多呆几天。

example.ex: He had again failed to keep his word.
example.tran: 他又食言了。

collins.def: If you keep a record of a series of events, you write down details of it so that they can be referred to later.

example.ex: Eleanor began to keep a diary...
example.tran: 埃莉诺开始记日记了。

example.ex: The volunteers kept a record of everything they ate for a week.
example.tran: 志愿者记录下他们一周所吃的所有食物。

collins.def: If you keep yourself or keep someone else, you support yourself or the other person by earning enough money to provide food, clothing, money, and other necessary things.

example.ex: She could just about afford to keep her five kids...
example.tran: 她勉勉强强能养得起自己的5个孩子。

example.ex: I just cannot afford to keep myself...
example.tran: 我难以维持生计。

collins.def: Someone's keep is the cost of food and other things that they need in their daily life.

example.ex: Ray will earn his keep on local farms while studying...
example.tran: 雷求学期间会在当地的农场干活赚取生活费。

example.ex: I need to give my parents money for my keep.
example.tran: 我需要付给父母我的生活费。

collins.def: If you keep animals, you own them and take care of them.

example.ex: I've brought you some eggs. We keep chickens...
example.tran: 我给你带了些鸡蛋。我们养鸡。

example.ex: This mad writer kept a lobster as a pet.
example.tran: 这个疯狂的作家把龙虾当宠物养。

collins.def: If you keep a business such as a small shop or hotel, you own it and manage it.

example.ex: His father kept a village shop.
example.tran: 他父亲经营一家乡村商店。

collins.def: If someone or something keeps you, they delay you and make you late.

example.ex: Sorry to keep you, Jack...
example.tran: 很抱歉让你久等了，杰克。

example.ex: 'What kept you?' — 'I went in the wrong direction.'
example.tran: “你为什么晚了？”——“我走错了方向。”

collins.def: If food keeps for a certain length of time, it stays fresh and suitable to eat for that time.

example.ex: Whatever is left over may be put into the refrigerator, where it will keep for 2-3 weeks.
example.tran: 剩下的东西都可以放进冰箱，可以保持两到三个星期不坏。

collins.tran: （用于询问健康状况）保持健康
collins.def: You can say or ask how someone is keeping as a way of saying or asking whether they are well.

example.ex: She hasn't been keeping too well lately...
example.tran: 她最近身体不太好。

example.ex: How are you keeping these days?
example.tran: 你这些天身体怎么样？

collins.def: A keep is the main tower of a medieval castle, in which people lived.
If you keep at it, you continue doing something that you have started, even if you are tired and would prefer to stop.

example.ex: It may take a number of attempts, but it is worth keeping at it...
example.tran: 可能要试几次，但还是值得坚持的。

example.ex: 'Keep at it!' Thade encouraged me.
example.tran: “坚持下去！”萨德鼓励我道。

collins.def: Something that is for keeps is permanent and will not change.

example.ex: Ensure that whatever you gain now will be for keeps...
example.tran: 确保你现在所获得的一切永远不会失去。

example.ex: He advised them to leave town for keeps.
example.tran: 他建议他们离开镇子，永远别再回来。

collins.def: If you keep going, you continue moving along or doing something that you have started, even if you are tired and would prefer to stop.

example.ex: She forced herself to keep going...
example.tran: 她强迫自己继续下去。

example.ex: I was shouting: 'Keep going, keep going!'
example.tran: 我喊着：“坚持，坚持！”

collins.tran: 协调/不协调;一致/不一致
collins.def: If one thing is in keeping with another, it is suitable in relation to that thing. If one thing is out of keeping with another, it is not suitable in relation to that thing.

example.ex: His office was in keeping with his station and experience...
example.tran: 他的办公室与其身份和阅历相称。

example.ex: In keeping with tradition, the Emperor and Empress did not attend the ceremony...
example.tran: 按照传统，皇帝和皇后未参加该仪式。

collins.def: If you keep it up, you continue working or trying as hard as you have been in the past.

example.ex: There are fears that he will not be able to keep it up when he gets to the particularly demanding third year...
example.tran: 有人担心他到了要求极其严格的第3年时会坚持不下去。

example.ex: You're doing a great job! Keep it up!
example.tran: 你们干得非常棒！继续好好干吧！

collins.tran: 把…秘而不宣；不将…说出去
collins.def: If you keep something to yourself, you do not tell anyone else about it.

example.ex: I have to tell someone. I can't keep it to myself...
example.tran: 我得找人说说。我心里憋不住。

example.ex: There's one thing you can do for me. But keep it to yourself.
example.tran: 有件事你能帮我做。但你要保密。

collins.def: If you keep yourself to yourself or keep to yourself, you stay on your own most of the time and do not mix socially with other people.

example.ex: He was a quiet man who kept himself to himself...
example.tran: 他是个喜欢安静、不爱与人来往的人。

example.ex: Since she knows little Italian, she keeps to herself.
example.tran: 因为不怎么懂意大利语，她很少和人交往。

means: 使笑得前仰后合，使笑死了

collins.def: If a person, animal, or other living thing is killed, something or someone causes them to die.

example.ex: More than 1,000 people have been killed by the armed forces...
example.tran: 1,000多人被武装部队杀死。

example.ex: He had attempted to kill himself on several occasions...
example.tran: 他好几次试图自杀。

collins.def: The act of killing an animal after hunting it is referred to as the kill .

example.ex: After the kill the men and old women collect in an open space and eat a meal of whale meat.
example.tran: 捕杀过后，男人们和老年妇女们聚集到一片空地上吃了一顿鲸鱼肉。

collins.def: If someone or something kills a project, activity, or idea, they completely destroy or end it.

example.ex: His objective was to kill the space station project altogether...
example.tran: 他的目的是使空间站项目全面停止。

example.ex: Public opinion may yet kill the proposal.
example.tran: 舆论可能最终会扼杀这个提议。

collins.def: If something kills pain, it weakens it so that it is no longer as strong as it was.

example.ex: He was forced to take opium to kill the pain.
example.tran: 他被迫服用鸦片来止痛。

collins.def: If you say that something is killing you, you mean that it is causing you physical or emotional pain.

example.ex: My feet are killing me.
example.tran: 我的脚疼死了。

collins.def: If you say that you kill yourself to do something, you are emphasizing that you make a great effort to do it, even though it causes you a lot of trouble or suffering.

example.ex: You shouldn't always have to kill yourself to do well.
example.tran: 你不该总是为了做到尽善尽美而累坏自己。

collins.def: If you say that you will kill someone for something they have done, you are emphasizing that you are extremely angry with them.

example.ex: Tell Richard I'm going to kill him when I get hold of him.
example.tran: 告诉理查德，一旦抓住他，我要杀了他。

collins.def: If you say that something will not kill you, you mean that it is not really as difficult or unpleasant as it might seem.

example.ex: Three or four more weeks won't kill me!
example.tran: 再过3周或4周不会要了我的命！

collins.def: If you are killing time, you are doing something because you have some time available, not because you really want to do it.

example.ex: I'm just killing time until I can talk to the other witnesses...
example.tran: 在和其他目击者交谈前我只是在打发时间。

example.ex: To kill the hours while she waited, Ann worked in the garden.
example.tran: 为了打发等待的那几个小时，安在菜园里干些活。

collins.tran: (表示强调)即使很难，即便很费力
collins.def: If you say that you will do something if it kills you, you are emphasizing that you are determined to do it even though it is extremely difficult or painful.

example.ex: I'll make this marriage work if it kills me.
example.tran: 再难我也要努力使这桩婚姻幸福美满。

collins.tran: 使笑得前仰后合；使笑死了
collins.def: If you say that you killed yourself laughing, you are emphasizing that you laughed a lot because you thought something was extremely funny.
If you move in for the kill or if you close in for the kill, you take advantage of a changed situation in order to do something that you have been preparing to do.

example.ex: Seeing his chance, Dennis moved in for the kill.
example.tran: 看到机会来了，丹尼斯开始采取行动。

collins.def: If you know a fact, a piece of information, or an answer, you have it correctly in your mind.

example.ex: I don't know the name of the place...
example.tran: 我不知道那个地方的名字。

example.ex: I know that you led a rifle platoon during the Second World War...
example.tran: 我知道你在二战期间率领一个步枪排。

collins.def: If you know someone, you are familiar with them because you have met them and talked to them before.

example.ex: Gifford was a friend. I'd known him for nine years...
example.tran: 吉福德是我的一位朋友。我和他认识9年了。

example.ex: Do you two know each other?...
example.tran: 你们俩互相认识吗？

collins.def: If you say that you know of something, you mean that you have heard about it but you do not necessarily have a lot of information about it.

example.ex: We know of the incident but have no further details...
example.tran: 我们听说过这件事，但对详情不是很清楚。

example.ex: The president admitted that he did not know of any rebels having surrendered so far...
example.tran: 总统承认据他所知迄今为止还没有反叛者投降。

collins.def: If you know about a subject, you have studied it or taken an interest in it, and understand part or all of it.

example.ex: Hire someone with experience, someone who knows about real estate...
example.tran: 雇佣有经验、了解房地产业的人。

example.ex: She didn't know anything about music but she liked to sing.
example.tran: 虽然她对音乐一无所知，但却爱唱歌。

collins.def: If you know a language, you have learned it and can understand it.

example.ex: It helps to know French and Creole if you want to understand some of the lyrics...
example.tran: 如果你想读懂一些抒情诗，学点法语和克里奥尔语是有帮助的。

example.ex: Rachel already knows as many words in German as she does in English...
example.tran: 雷切尔掌握的德语词汇已经和她掌握的英语词汇一样多了。

collins.def: If you know something such as a place, a work of art, or an idea, you have visited it, seen it, read it, or heard about it, and so you are familiar with it.

example.ex: No matter how well you know Paris, it is easy to get lost...
example.tran: 不管你对巴黎多么熟悉，也很容易迷路。

example.ex: I don't know the play, I've just come to see it.
example.tran: 我不了解这部剧，只是来看看。

collins.def: If you know how to do something, you have the necessary skills and knowledge to do it.

example.ex: The health authorities now know how to deal with the disease...
example.tran: 卫生部门现在知道如何对付这种病了。

example.ex: We know what to do to make it work.
example.tran: 我们知道如何让它起作用。

collins.def: You can say that someone knows that something is happening when they become aware of it.

example.ex: Then I saw a gun under the hall table so I knew that something was wrong...
example.tran: 后来我看到大厅的桌子下有一把枪，我就意识到有些不对劲儿。

example.ex: The first I knew about it was when I woke up in the ambulance.
example.tran: 当我从救护车中苏醒过来时才知道发生了什么事。

collins.def: If you know something or someone, you recognize them when you see them or hear them.

example.ex: Would she know you if she saw you on the street?...
example.tran: 如果她在大街上看到你，能认出你吗？

example.ex: I thought I knew the voice.
example.tran: 我觉得在哪里听过这声音。

collins.def: If someone or something is known as a particular name, they are called by that name.

example.ex: The disease is more commonly known as Mad Cow Disease...
example.tran: 这种疾病更通俗的名称是疯牛病。

example.ex: He was born as John Birks Gillespie, but everyone knew him as Dizzy...
example.tran: 他本名为约翰·伯克斯·吉莱斯皮，但人人都叫他“小迷糊”。

collins.def: If you know someone or something as a person or thing that has particular qualities, you consider that they have those qualities.

example.ex: Lots of people know her as a very kind woman...
example.tran: 很多人认为她是个非常善良的女人。

example.ex: We know them as inaccurate and misleading property descriptions...
example.tran: 我们认为对性状的这些描述是不准确的，且会使人产生误解。

collins.def: If you know someone as a person with a particular job or role, you are familiar with them in that job or role, rather than in any other.

example.ex: Most of us know her as the woman who used to present the television news...
example.tran: 我们大多数人认识她是因为她曾主持过电视新闻节目。

example.ex: The soldiers — all of whom we knew as neighbours — stood around pointing guns at us.
example.tran: 那些士兵——我们都视之为邻居的人——站在四周用枪指着我们。

collins.tran: 现行的；我们熟悉的；我们熟知的
collins.def: If you talk about a thing or system as we know it, you are referring to the form in which it exists now and which is familiar to most people.

example.ex: He planned to end the welfare system as we know it.
example.tran: 他计划终止现行的福利制度。

example.ex: ...those values of our culture that are essential to civilisation as we know it.
example.tran: 我们文化中那些构成我们所熟悉的文明社会之根基的价值观

collins.def: If you get to know someone, you find out what they are like by spending time with them.

example.ex: The new neighbours were getting to know each other...
example.tran: 新邻居之间正在互相了解。

example.ex: I'd really like to see you again and get to know you better.
example.tran: 我很愿意再次见到你并且更多地了解你。

collins.def: People use expressions such as goodness knows ,Heaven knows, and God knows when they do not know something and want to suggest that nobody could possibly know it.

example.ex: 'Who's he?' — 'God knows.'
example.tran: “他是谁？”——“天晓得。”

example.ex: Old Gunga spoke God knows how many languages...
example.tran: 老贡嘎会说很多种语言，天晓得有多少种。

collins.tran: （表示同意）我理解，我有同感，我知道
collins.def: You say 'I know' to show that you agree with what has just been said.

example.ex: 'This country is so awful.' — 'I know, I know.'
example.tran: “这个国家太糟糕了。”——“的确是，的确是。”

collins.def: You say 'I know' to show that you accept that something is true, but think that it is not very important or relevant.

example.ex: 'There are trains straight from Cambridge.' — 'I know, but it's no quicker.'
example.tran: “有直接从剑桥开出的列车。”——“我知道，但也不快。”

collins.tran: （表示同情和理解）我理解，我知道
collins.def: You use 'I know' to express sympathy and understanding towards someone.

example.ex: I'm sorry, George. I know how you feel...
example.tran: 我很遗憾，乔治。我理解你的感受。

example.ex: I know what you're going through.
example.tran: 我知道你正在经受什么样的煎熬。

collins.tran: 不知道，不认为（表示不完全同意或不认为是真的）
collins.def: You can use I don't know to indicate that you do not completely agree with something or do not really think that it is true.

example.ex: 'He should quite simply resign.' — 'I don't know about that.'
example.tran: “他就该辞职。”——“我不知道。”

example.ex: I don't know that it's made the decision any easier.
example.tran: 我不认为这对作出决定有丝毫帮助。

collins.tran: 我不知道你（们）怎么想（表示将表达自己想法并想知道他人的看法）
collins.def: You can say 'I don't know about you' to indicate that you are going to give your own opinion about something and you want to find out if someone else feels the same.

example.ex: I don't know about the rest of you, but I'm hungry...
example.tran: 我不知道你们怎么样，但我是饿了。

example.ex: I don't know about you, but I've had just about enough of this.
example.tran: 我不知道你怎么想，但我已经受够了。

collins.tran: （表示批评某人的行为）真想不到，真不知道
collins.def: You use I don't know in expressions which indicate criticism of someone's behaviour. For example, if you say that you do not know how someone can do something, you mean that you cannot understand or accept them doing it.

example.ex: I don't know how he could do this to his own daughter...
example.tran: 真想不到他竟对自己的女儿这样。

example.ex: I don't know how you can say that...
example.tran: 真想不到你竟说那话。

collins.tran: 我要是知道就好了；我根本不知道
collins.def: People sometimes use expressions such as I'm blessed if I know or damned if I know to emphasize the fact that they do not know something.

example.ex: 'What was that all about?' — 'Damned if I know.'
example.tran: “那都是关于什么的？”——“我要知道就好了。”

example.ex: I'm damned if I know what plans he has in that direction.
example.tran: 我压根不知道他在那方面有什么计划。

collins.tran: 知情；（尤指）熟悉内幕，掌握内情
collins.def: If you are in the know about something, especially something that is not known about or understood by many people, you have information about it.

example.ex: It was gratifying to be in the know about important people...
example.tran: 了解重要人物的一些内幕真令人高兴。

example.ex: He takes crucial decisions without consulting people in the know.
example.tran: 他没有咨询相关知情人士就作了重要的决定。

collins.tran: （表示所说的话对方理解）你是知道的，你知道我的意思
collins.def: You can use expressions such as you know what I mean and if you know what I mean to suggest that the person listening to you understands what you are trying to say, and so you do not have to explain any more.

example.ex: None of us stayed long. I mean, the atmosphere wasn't — well, you know what I mean...
example.tran: 我们都没呆太久。我的意思是，气氛并不是——唔，你知道我的意思。

example.ex: She was a bit stuck up, know what I mean?
example.tran: 她有点自命不凡，你明白我的意思吧?

collins.tran: （指可能会发生好事）很难说，很难预料
collins.def: You say 'You never know' or 'One never knows' to indicate that it is not definite or certain what will happen in the future, and to suggest that there is some hope that things will turn out well.

example.ex: You never know, I might get lucky...
example.tran: 很难说，我也许会交好运呢。

example.ex: There might be an even bigger one — I doubt it, but you never know.
example.tran: 可能还有个比这还要大的——我觉得有点悬，但也很难说。

collins.def: You say 'Not that I know of' when someone has asked you whether or not something is true and you think the answer is 'no' but you cannot be sure because you do not know all the facts.

example.ex: 'Is he married?' — 'Not that I know of.'
example.tran: “他结婚了吗？”——“据我所知没有。”

collins.def: You can say 'How was I to know?', or in British English 'I wasn't to know', to mean that you cannot be blamed or criticized for something you did, because you did not have enough information to realize that it was wrong.

example.ex: How was I to know you'd return so suddenly?...
example.tran: 我怎么知道你会这么突然就回来?

example.ex: You weren't to know — in fact, I think I'm the only person who does know.
example.tran: 你不会知道——实际上，我想我是唯一真正知道的人。

collins.tran: （某人）知道什么，懂什么（表示其没有资格评论）
collins.def: You can use expressions such as What does she know? and What do they know? when you think that someone has no right to comment on a situation because they do not understand it.

example.ex: Don't listen to him, what does he know?...
example.tran: 别听他的，他知道什么？

example.ex: I always felt his attitude was, 'What do you know about it?'
example.tran: 我感觉他总是那种“你懂什么？”的态度。

collins.tran: （表示惊讶）你看怪不怪，真没想到
collins.def: People sometimes say 'What do you know!' when they are very surprised about something.

example.ex: Well, what do you know!
example.tran: 哎呀，真没想到！

collins.tran: （加强语气或引起注意）你要知道
collins.def: You use you know to emphasize or to draw attention to what you are saying.

example.ex: The conditions in there are awful, you know...
example.tran: 你要知道，那里的条件很艰苦。

example.ex: You know, it does worry me.
example.tran: 你要知道，这实在让我担心。

collins.tran: （表示不确定要说的话或考虑接着说什么）你知道
collins.def: People use you know when they are uncertain about what they are saying or what they are going to say next.

example.ex: He's generous and, you know, very nice, very polite...
example.tran: 他很大方而且，你知道，很友善，很有礼貌。

example.ex: I thought I'd, you know, have a chat with you.
example.tran: 我想我应该，呃，和你谈谈。

collins.tran: （表示进一步解释）你是知道的，你难道不知道
collins.def: You use you know when you are trying to explain more clearly what you mean, by referring to something that the person you are talking to knows about.

example.ex: Wear the white dress, you know, the one with all the black embroidery.
example.tran: 穿那件白裙，你知道的，上面有黑色刺绣的那件。

collins.tran: （加强语气）你不知道，你都想不到
collins.def: You can say 'You don't know' in order to emphasize how strongly you feel about the remark you are going to make.

example.ex: You don't know how good it is to speak to somebody from home.
example.tran: 你不知道和家乡来的人说说话感觉有多好。

collins.tran: （辛苦的）劳动，劳作；（通常指）体力劳动
collins.def: Labour is very hard work, usually physical work.

example.ex: ...the labour of seeding, planting and harvesting...
example.tran: 播种、种植和收割的辛勤劳作

example.ex: The chef at the barbecue looked up from his labours; he was sweating.
example.tran: 正在烧烤台上忙活的厨师抬起头来；他的脸上直冒汗。

collins.def: Someone who labours works hard using their hands.

example.ex: ...peasants labouring in the fields...
example.tran: 在地里劳作的农民

example.ex: Her husband laboured at the plant for 17 years.
example.tran: 她丈夫在厂里辛勤工作了17年。

collins.def: If you labour to do something, you do it with difficulty.

example.ex: For twenty-five years now he has laboured to build a religious community.
example.tran: 他呕心沥血地建立一个宗教社区，至今已有25个年头。

example.ex: ...a young man who's labouring under all kinds of other difficulties.
example.tran: 在其他各种困难下艰苦工作的小伙子

collins.def: Labour is used to refer to the workers of a country or industry, considered as a group.

example.ex: Latin America lacked skilled labour...
example.tran: 拉丁美洲缺乏熟练工人。

example.ex: ...the struggle between capital and labour...
example.tran: 劳资斗争

collins.def: The work done by a group of workers or by a particular worker is referred to as their labour .

example.ex: Every man should receive a fair price for the product of his labour...
example.tran: 每个人的劳动成果都应该获得合理的回报。

example.ex: The unemployed cannot withdraw their labour — they have no power.
example.tran: 失业者没法罢工——他们没有这种实力。

collins.def: In Britain, people use Labour to refer to the Labour Party.

example.ex: He believes that, historically, Labour has been most successful as the party that helped people get on in life...
example.tran: 他相信一直以来工党在帮助人民改善生活方面表现最为出色。

example.ex: They all vote Labour.
example.tran: 他们都投工党的票。

collins.def: A Labour politician or voter is a member of a Labour Party or votes for a Labour Party.

example.ex: ...a Labour MP...
example.tran: 工党下院议员

example.ex: Millions of Labour voters went unrepresented.
example.tran: 数以百万计的工党支持者没有议员代表。

collins.def: If you labour under a delusion or  misapprehension, you continue to believe something which is not true.

example.ex: She laboured under the illusion that I knew what I was doing...
example.tran: 她有一个错觉，以为我知道自己在做什么。

example.ex: You seem to be labouring under considerable misapprehensions.
example.tran: 你似乎存在相当大的误解。

collins.def: If you labour a point or an argument, you keep making the same point or saying the same thing, although it is unnecessary.

example.ex: I don't  want to labour the point but there it is.
example.tran: 我不想反复重申，但还是不得不说。

collins.def: Labour is the last stage of pregnancy, in which the baby is gradually pushed out of the womb by the mother.

example.ex: I thought the pains meant I was going into labour.
example.tran: 我还以为这些疼痛意味着我要生了呢。

example.ex: Some women prefer to move about during labour.
example.tran: 有些女人喜欢在分娩期间下床走动。

collins.tran: 土地；田地；（尤指）耕作用地，建筑用地
collins.def: Land is an area of ground, especially one that is used for a particular purpose such as farming or building.

example.ex: Good agricultural land is in short supply.
example.tran: 良田短缺。

example.ex: ...160 acres of land.
example.tran: 160英亩土地

collins.def: You can refer to an area of land which someone owns as their land or their lands.

example.ex: Their home is on his father's land...
example.tran: 他们的家建在他父亲拥有的地皮上。

example.ex: His lands were poorly farmed.
example.tran: 他的田地耕种不当。

collins.def: If you talk about the land, you mean farming and the way of life in farming areas, in contrast to life in the cities.

example.ex: Living off the land was hard enough at the best of times.
example.tran: 即使在年景最好的时候，务农为生也是相当艰辛的。

collins.def: Land is the part of the world that consists of ground, rather than sea or air.

example.ex: It isn't clear whether the plane went down over land or sea.
example.tran: 不清楚飞机是坠毁在陆地上还是海里。

example.ex: ...a stretch of sandy beach that was almost inaccessible from the land.
example.tran: 从陆路几乎难以到达的一片沙滩

collins.def: You can use land to refer to a country in a poetic or emotional way.

example.ex: Her husband's  body lies buried 2,000 miles away in a strange land.
example.tran: 她丈夫的遗体埋葬在两千英里外一个陌生的国度。

example.ex: ...blessed lands of sun and sea and olive trees.
example.tran: 有着阳光、海水和橄榄树的美丽国度

collins.def: When someone or something lands, they come down to the ground after moving through the air or falling.

example.ex: He was sent flying into the air and landed 20ft away...
example.tran: 他被抛到空中，落在20英尺外的地方。

example.ex: Three mortar shells had landed close to a crowd of people.
example.tran: 3枚迫击炮弹落在人群旁。

collins.def: When someone lands a plane, ship, or spacecraft, or when it lands, it arrives somewhere after a journey.

example.ex: The jet landed after a flight of just under three hours...
example.tran: 这架喷气式飞机在飞行了将近3小时后降落了。

example.ex: He landed his troops on the western shore...
example.tran: 他率部队在西岸登陆。

collins.def: To land goods somewhere means to unload them there at the end of a journey, especially by ship.

example.ex: The vessels will have to land their catch at designated ports.
example.tran: 船只必须在指定的港口把捕到的鱼卸下。

example.ex: ...a five-man gang which landed the huge shipment on the Cornwall coast.
example.tran: 在康沃尔海岸卸下这一大批货的五人团伙

collins.def: If you land in an unpleasant situation or place or if something lands you in it, something causes you to be in it.

example.ex: He landed in a psychiatric ward...
example.tran: 他被关进了精神病房。

example.ex: This is not the first time his exploits have landed him in trouble.
example.tran: 这已经不是他第一次因自己的冒险行为而惹上麻烦了。

collins.def: If someone or something lands you with a difficult situation, they cause you to have to deal with the difficulties involved.

example.ex: The other options simply complicate the situation and could land him with more expense.
example.tran: 其他办法只会使情况复杂化，而且可能给他带来更大花销。

collins.def: If something lands somewhere, it arrives there unexpectedly, often causing problems.

example.ex: Two days later the book had already landed on his desk...
example.tran: 两天后那本书竟然已经摆在了他的书桌上。

example.ex: This was the weekend that the war finally landed on their doorstep.
example.tran: 在这个周末，战火终于烧到了他们的家门口。

collins.def: If you land a fish, you succeed in catching it and getting it out of the water.

example.ex: One angler landed fish of 10 lb and 9 lb on the same day.
example.tran: 一名垂钓者在同一天分别钓到了10磅和9磅重的鱼。

collins.def: If you land something that is difficult to get and that many people want, you are successful in getting it.

example.ex: He landed a place on the graduate training scheme...
example.tran: 他在毕业生培训计划中赢得了一个位置。

example.ex: His flair with hair soon landed him a part-time job at his local barbers.
example.tran: 他的美发天赋令他很快在当地一家发廊找到一份兼职工作。

collins.def: If someone lands a blow or punch or if their blow or punch lands, they hit someone.

example.ex: De Leon landed a punch on the Italian's mouth after the end of the eleventh round...
example.tran: 11个回合过后，德莱昂一拳击在那个意大利人的嘴巴上。

example.ex: I could hear the blows landing as he appealed for help.
example.tran: 在他求救的同时我能听到拳头落下的声音。

collins.def: A large thing or person is greater in size than usual or average.

example.ex: The Pike lives mainly in large rivers and lakes...
example.tran: 狗鱼主要生活在大江大湖中。

example.ex: In the largest room about a dozen children and seven adults are sitting on the carpet...
example.tran: 在最大那间房里，地毯上坐了约12个小孩和7个大人。

collins.def: A large amount or number of people or things is more than the average amount or number.

example.ex: The gang finally fled with a large amount of cash and jewellery...
example.tran: 该团伙最后携大量现金和珠宝逃之夭夭。

example.ex: There are a large number of centres where you can take full-time courses...
example.tran: 有很多中心提供全日制课程。

collins.def: A large organization or business does a lot of work or commercial activity and employs a lot of people.

example.ex: ...a large company in Chicago...
example.tran: 芝加哥一家大公司

example.ex: Many large organizations run courses for their employees.
example.tran: 许多大企业为旗下员工开办课程。

collins.def: Large is used to indicate that a problem or issue which is being discussed is very important or serious.

example.ex: ...the already large problem of under-age drinking...
example.tran: 已经很严重的未成年人饮酒问题

example.ex: There's a very large question about the viability of the newspaper.
example.tran: 报纸能否办下去是一个重大问题。

collins.def: You use at large to indicate that you are talking in a general way about most of the people mentioned.

example.ex: I think the chances of getting reforms accepted by the community at large remain extremely remote...
example.tran: 我看要使改革方案得到社会的广泛认可，机会还很渺茫。

example.ex: Amongst the population at large the support for the present regime is virtually zero.
example.tran: 在一般大众中，支持现政权的人数几乎是零。

collins.def: If you say that a dangerous person, thing, or animal is at large, you mean that they have not been captured or made safe.

example.ex: The man who tried to have her killed is still at large.
example.tran: 那个企图雇凶杀她的男子仍然在逃。

collins.tran: 大致上；总体上；总的说来
collins.def: You use by and large to indicate that a statement is mostly but not completely true.

example.ex: By and large, the papers greet the government's  new policy document with a certain amount of scepticism.
example.tran: 总体上，报界对政府的新政策文件将信将疑。

means: 足够维持（尤指某段时间）

collins.tran: （表示最近过去的）刚过去的星期五/昨晚/去年
collins.def: You use last in expressions such as last Friday ,last night, and last year to refer, for example, to the most recent Friday, night, or year.

example.ex: I got married last July...
example.tran: 我在刚过去的7月里结了婚。

example.ex: He never made it home at all last night...
example.tran: 他昨晚根本没回家。

collins.def: The last event, person, thing, or period of time is the most recent one.

example.ex: Much has changed since my last visit...
example.tran: 从我上次去到现在，很多事情已经变了。

example.ex: At the last count inflation was 10.9 per cent...
example.tran: 最近一次统计显示通胀率为10.9%。

collins.def: If something last happened on a particular occasion, that is the most recent occasion on which it happened.

example.ex: When were you there last?...
example.tran: 你上次去是什么时候？

example.ex: The house is a little more dilapidated than when I last saw it...
example.tran: 那房子比我上次见到时更破旧了些。

collins.def: The last thing, person, event, or period of time is the one that happens or comes after all the others of the same kind.

example.ex: This is his last chance as prime minister.
example.tran: 这是他作为首相的最后机会。

example.ex: ...the last three pages of the chapter...
example.tran: 该章最后3页

collins.def: If you do something last, you do it after everyone else does, or after you do everything else.

example.ex: I testified last...
example.tran: 我最后一个作证。

example.ex: I was always picked last for the football team at school...
example.tran: 在学校里分队踢足球时，我总是最后被挑的那一个。

collins.def: If you are the last to do or know something, everyone else does or knows it before you.

example.ex: She was the last to go to bed...
example.tran: 她最后一个上床。

example.ex: Riccardo and I are always the last to know what's going on.
example.tran: 我和里卡尔多总是最后才知道发生什么事情。

collins.def: Last is used to refer to the only thing, person, or part of something that remains.

example.ex: Jed nodded, finishing off the last piece of pizza.
example.tran: 杰德点点头，把最后一块比萨饼吃完。

example.ex: ...the freeing of the last hostage.
example.tran: 最后一名人质的获释

collins.tran: （竞赛中）最后留下的，排位在前的
collins.def: You use last before numbers to refer to a position that someone has reached in a competition after other competitors have been knocked out.

example.ex: Sampras reached the last four at Wimbledon.
example.tran: 桑普拉斯杀入了温布尔登四强。

example.ex: ...the only woman among the authors making it through to the last six.
example.tran: 进入最后6人名单的唯一一位女作家

collins.tran: 最不想要的；最不可能的
collins.def: You can use last to indicate that something is extremely undesirable or unlikely.

example.ex: The last thing I wanted to do was teach...
example.tran: 我最不想干的事情就是教书。

example.ex: He would be the last person who would do such a thing.
example.tran: 他最不可能干这种事情。

collins.def: The last you see of someone or the last you hear of them is the final time that you see them or talk to them.

example.ex: She disappeared shouting, 'To the river, to the river!' And that was the last we saw of her...
example.tran: 她高喊着“往河里去，往河里去！”然后就消失了。那是我们最后一次看到她的情形。

example.ex: I had a feeling it would be the last I heard of him.
example.tran: 我有一种感觉，这将是我最后一次听到他的消息。

collins.tran: 持续，延续，维持（一段时间）
collins.def: If an event, situation, or problem lasts for a particular length of time, it continues to exist or happen for that length of time.

example.ex: The marriage had lasted for less than two years...
example.tran: 这段婚姻维持了不到两年。

example.ex: The games lasted only half the normal time...
example.tran: 比赛只持续了通常时间的一半。

collins.tran: 够用，保持可用状态（一段时间）
collins.def: If something lasts for a particular length of time, it continues to be able to be used for that time, for example because there is some of it left or because it is in good enough condition.

example.ex: You only need a very small blob of glue, so one tube lasts for ages...
example.tran: 每次只需一点点胶水而已，因此一管可以用很长时间。

example.ex: The repaired sail lasted less than 24 hours...
example.tran: 修好的帆支撑了不到24小时。

collins.def: You can use last in expressions such as last the game ,last the course, and last the week, to indicate that someone manages to take part in an event or situation right to the end, especially when this is very difficult for them.

example.ex: They wouldn't  have lasted the full game...
example.tran: 他们本不可能撑完整场比赛的。

example.ex: I almost lasted the two weeks. I only had a couple of days to do.
example.tran: 我几乎撑过了这两个星期。我只有几天时间去做。

collins.def: If you say that something has happened at last or at long last you mean it has happened after you have been hoping for it for a long time.

example.ex: I'm  so glad that we've found you at last!...
example.tran: 我们终于找到你了，我真是太高兴了！

example.ex: Here, at long last, was the moment he had waited for...
example.tran: 他等待已久的时刻终于到来。

collins.tran: 前天晚上／ 上上次选举／上上任领导人
collins.def: You use expressions such as the night before last ,the election before last and the leader before last to refer to the period of time, event, or person that came immediately before the most recent one in a series.

example.ex: It was the dog he'd heard the night before last...
example.tran: 他前晚听到的是狗叫声。

example.ex: In the budget before last a tax penalty on the mobile phone was introduced.
example.tran: 上上次的预算案中对移动电话引入了惩罚性税收。

collins.def: If someone breathes their last, they die.

collins.tran: 倒数第二／倒数第三／ 倒数第四
collins.def: You can use phrases such as the last but one, the last but two, or the last but three, to refer to the thing or person that is, for example, one, two, or three before the final person or thing in a group or series.

example.ex: It's the last but one day in the athletics programme...
example.tran: 那是田径比赛结束的前一天。

example.ex: The British team finished last but one.
example.tran: 英国队位列倒数第二。

collins.def: You use every last to emphasize that you are talking about all the people or things in a group or all the parts of something.

example.ex: I'd spent all I had, every last penny...
example.tran: 我把钱全部花光了，一分不剩。

example.ex: You'll never quite get rid of every last bit of grit...
example.tran: 无法把所有的沙砾都清除干净。

collins.tran: （需要裁员时首先解雇新员工的）“后进先出”原则
collins.def: The expression last in, first out is used to say that the last person who started work in an organization should be the first person to leave it, if fewer people are needed.

example.ex: Workers will go on a 'last in, first out' basis.
example.tran: 对工人的裁员原则是“后进先出”。

collins.tran: 我/她最近一次听到有关…的消息；最新消息
collins.def: You can use expressions such as the last I heard and the last she heard to introduce a piece of information that is the most recent that you have on a particular subject.

example.ex: The last I heard, Joe and Irene were still happily married.
example.tran: 我最近一次听说时，乔和艾琳仍然是一对快乐的夫妻。

collins.def: If you leave something or someone until last, you delay using, choosing, or dealing with them until you have used, chosen, or dealt with all the others.

example.ex: I have left my best wine until last...
example.tran: 我把最好的酒留到了最后。

example.ex: I picked first all the people who usually were left till last.
example.tran: 我先挑出了所有通常留到最后的人。

collins.def: If you see the last of someone, you do not expect to see them or deal with them again.

example.ex: I honestly thought I'd seen the last of you.
example.tran: 老实说我以为再也不用见到你了。

collins.tran: 贯穿（全书、整部电影或整件事情）
collins.def: If you say that something goes on happening to the last, you mean that it happens throughout the whole of a book, film, or event.

example.ex: ...a highly readable political thriller with plenty of twists of plot to keep you guessing to the last.
example.tran: 一部可读性极强的政治惊悚小说，情节峰回路转，不到最后一刻绝对猜不中结局

collins.def: If you say that someone is a particular kind of person to the last, you are emphasizing that they continue to be that kind of person.

example.ex: A gentleman to the last, he did not run, but merely attempted to stroll away...
example.tran: 他始终保持绅士风度，没有拔脚就跑，只是试图移步走开。

example.ex: Armstrong was tall and handsome to the last.
example.tran: 阿姆斯特朗从来都是这么高大、英俊。

collins.tran: （表示全部包括在内）任何一丝细节/ 每一个人
collins.def: You use expressions such as to the last detail and to the last man to indicate that a plan, situation, or activity includes every single person, thing, or part involved.

example.ex: Every movement, no matter how casual and spontaneous, needs to be worked out to the last detail...
example.tran: 对每一个动作，无论它显得多么随意和无意识，都不能放过一丝细节。

example.ex: Our troops are being used up to the last man.
example.tran: 我们的部队已人尽其用。

collins.def: Late means near the end of a day, week, year, or other period of time.

example.ex: It was late in the afternoon...
example.tran: 那是下午近黄昏的时候。

example.ex: She had to work late at night...
example.tran: 她不得不深夜工作。

collins.tran: 近日暮的；近深夜的；时间不早的
collins.def: If it is late, it is near the end of the day or it is past the time that you feel something should have been done.

example.ex: It was very late and the streets were deserted...
example.tran: 时间已很晚，街上空空荡荡。

example.ex: We've got to go now. It's getting late.
example.tran: 我们得走了。时候不早了。

collins.def: Late means after the time that was arranged or expected.

example.ex: Steve arrived late...
example.tran: 史蒂夫迟到了。

example.ex: The talks began some fifteen minutes late...
example.tran: 会谈晚了大概15分钟才开始。

collins.def: Late means after the usual time that a particular event or activity happens.

example.ex: We went to bed very late...
example.tran: 我们很晚才睡。

example.ex: He married late.
example.tran: 他结婚晚。

collins.tran: 已故的；已逝的；（尤指）新近去世的
collins.def: You use late when you are talking about someone who is dead, especially someone who has died recently.

example.ex: ...my late husband.
example.tran: 我已故的丈夫

example.ex: ...the late Mr Parkin.
example.tran: 已故的帕金先生

collins.tran: 在…居住（或工作）直至最近的
collins.def: Someone who is late of a particular place or institution lived or worked there until recently.

example.ex: ...Cousin Zachary, late of Bellevue Avenue.
example.tran: 直到不久前还住在贝尔邬大道的表兄扎卡里

example.ex: ...Strobe Talbott, late of Time magazine.
example.tran: 刚离开《时代》杂志不久的斯特罗布·塔尔博特

collins.tran: 迟到好过没到；晚做好过不做
collins.def: If you say better late than never when someone has done something, you think they should have done it earlier.

example.ex: It's been a long time coming but better late than never.
example.tran: 早就该如此了。不过，也总比没有的强。

collins.def: If you say that someone is doing something late in the day, you mean that their action or behaviour may not be fully effective because they have waited too long before doing it.

example.ex: I'd left it all too late in the day to get anywhere with these strategies.
example.tran: 我按兵不动时间太长，致使这些策略都不管用了。

collins.def: You use of late to refer to an event or state of affairs that happened or began to exist a short time ago.

example.ex: His life has changed of late...
example.tran: 他的生活近来发生了变化。

example.ex: The dollar has been stronger of late.
example.tran: 美元近来走势强劲。

collins.def: If an action or event is too late, it is useless or ineffective because it occurs after the best time for it.

example.ex: It was too late to turn back...
example.tran: 回头已经太晚了。

example.ex: We realized too late that we were caught like rats in a trap.
example.tran: 等我们发觉自己已成瓮中之鳖时已经太晚了。

collins.def: Later is the comparative of late.
You use later to refer to a time or situation that is after the one that you have been talking about or after the present one.

example.ex: He resigned ten years later...
example.tran: 10年后他辞了职。

example.ex: I'll join you later...
example.tran: 我呆会儿和你会合。

collins.def: You use later to refer to an event, period of time, or other thing which comes after the one that you have been talking about or after the present one.

example.ex: At a later news conference, he said differences should not be dramatized...
example.tran: 在后来的新闻发布会上，他说不应夸大分歧。

example.ex: The competition should have been rescheduled for a later date...
example.tran: 比赛本应另择日期。

collins.def: You use later to refer to the last part of someone's life or career or the last part of a period of history.

example.ex: He found happiness in later life...
example.tran: 他在晚年找到了幸福。

example.ex: In his later years he wrote very little...
example.tran: 晚年他甚少动笔。

means: （特别表示因成功而）处于有利地位
以笑表示，以笑感动[影响]

collins.def: When you laugh, you make a sound with your throat while smiling and show that you are happy or amused. People also sometimes laugh when they feel nervous or are being unfriendly.

example.ex: He was about to offer an explanation, but she was beginning to laugh...
example.tran: 他正要解释，她却笑起来了。

example.ex: He laughed with pleasure when people said he looked like his dad...
example.tran: 人们说他长得像父亲时，他乐得大笑起来。

collins.def: If people laugh at someone or something, they mock them or make jokes about them.

example.ex: I thought they were laughing at me because I was ugly...
example.tran: 我觉得他们嘲笑我是因为我长得丑。

example.ex: She wanted to laugh at the melodramatic way he was acting.
example.tran: 他戏剧化的夸张架势使她忍不住想笑。

collins.def: If you do something for a  laugh or for laughs, you do it as a joke or for fun.

example.ex: They were persuaded onstage for a laugh by their mates...
example.tran: 他们被同伴们说服，上台一乐。

example.ex: It's a project she's  doing for laughs.
example.tran: 这个项目是她图好玩儿才做的。

collins.def: If a person or their comment gets a laugh or raises a laugh, they make the people listening to them laugh.

example.ex: If you can get a laugh by wearing a silly hat, you must have been born a comic...
example.tran: 如果你戴一顶傻傻的帽子就能让人发笑，那你一定是天生的笑匠。

example.ex: The joke got a big laugh, which encouraged me to continue.
example.tran: 我的笑话引来哄堂大笑，这使我深受鼓舞，继续往下讲。

collins.tran: 好玩/ 开心/有点意思
collins.def: If you describe a situation as a laugh ,a good laugh, or a bit of a laugh, you think that it is fun and do not take it too seriously.

example.ex: Working there's great. It's quite a good laugh actually...
example.tran: 在那儿工作挺不错。说实在的，蛮好玩儿的。

example.ex: It was a good laugh there!
example.tran: 那儿可真是好玩！

collins.def: If you describe someone as a laugh or a good laugh, you like them because they are amusing and fun to be with.

example.ex: Mickey was a good laugh and great to have in the dressing room.
example.tran: 米基是个活宝，在更衣室里总是逗人笑个不停。

collins.tran: （尤指经历了最初的苦恼不快后）觉得…可笑，对…一笑置之
collins.def: If you have a good laugh about something, you find it amusing and realize that it is funny, especially when the situation was at first upsetting.

example.ex: We've both had a good laugh about the accident despite what's happened.
example.tran: 虽然出了意外，但我俩事后都一笑置之。

collins.tran: 笑到最后；取得最后胜利
collins.def: If you say that you have the last laugh, you mean that you become successful at something so that people who criticize or oppose you look foolish.

example.ex: Des  O'Connor is expecting to have the last laugh on his critics by soaring to the top of the Christmas hit parade.
example.tran: 德斯·奥康纳预计会飙升至圣诞畅销唱片排行榜的榜首，这将让他的批评者都笑不出来。

collins.tran: 别让我笑掉大牙了；别逗了
collins.def: Some people reply to other people's comments or opinions by saying 'Don't make me laugh' when they disagree with them and think they are foolish or inaccurate.

example.ex: Claire, a poisoner? Don't make me laugh — She was just a lousy cook.
example.tran: 克莱尔投毒？别逗了。她只不过厨艺很差罢了。

collins.tran: （对于困境或令人失望的境况）何妨一笑，还有可笑之处
collins.def: If you say 'you've got to laugh' or 'you have to laugh', you are trying to see the amusing side of a difficult or disappointing situation rather than being sad or angry about it.

example.ex: The bikers have shown enough contempt of the law to ride their machines over police cars. 'You've got to laugh at their audacity,' said Mr Starkey.
example.tran: 摩托车党藐视法律，竟对警车玩起凌空飞车来。“牛气可嘉呀，”斯塔基先生说道。

means: [口语、方言]诉诸法律，对…起诉，控告

collins.def: The law is a system of rules that a society or government develops in order to deal with crime, business agreements, and social relationships. You can also use the law to refer to the people who work in this system.

example.ex: Obscene and threatening phone calls are against the law...
example.tran: 猥亵和恐吓电话都是违法的。

example.ex: They are seeking permission to begin criminal proceedings against him for breaking the law on financing political parties...
example.tran: 他们正寻求取得对他提起刑事诉讼的许可令，以控告他违反了有关政党资助的法律。

collins.tran: （用于指某一种法律）刑法/公司法
collins.def: Law is used to refer to a particular  branch of the law, such as criminal law or company law.

example.ex: He was a professor of criminal law at Harvard University law school...
example.tran: 他是哈佛大学法学院的刑法学教授。

example.ex: Under international law, diplomats living in foreign countries are exempt from criminal prosecution...
example.tran: 根据国际法，驻外外交官员免受刑事检控。

collins.tran: （针对某种协议、关系或罪行的）法律，法
collins.def: A law is one of the rules in a system of law which deals with a particular type of agreement, relationship, or crime.

example.ex: ...the country's  liberal political asylum law...
example.tran: 该国开明的政治庇护法

example.ex: The law was passed on a second vote.
example.tran: 此法在第二次表决时通过。

collins.tran: （组织或活动的）规则，规章，条例
collins.def: The laws of an organization or activity are its rules, which are used to organize and control it.

example.ex: ...the laws of the Church of England...
example.tran: 英国国教会的教规

example.ex: Match officials should not tolerate such behaviour but instead enforce the laws of the game.
example.tran: 赛事官员不应纵容这种行为，而应严格执行比赛规则。

collins.def: A law is a rule or set of rules for good behaviour which is considered right and important by the majority of people for moral, religious, or emotional reasons.

example.ex: ...inflexible moral laws.
example.tran: 不容改变的道德准则

collins.def: A law is a natural process in which a particular event or thing always leads to a particular result.

example.ex: The laws of nature are absolute.
example.tran: 自然法则至高无上。

collins.def: A law is a scientific rule that someone has invented to explain a particular natural process.

example.ex: ...the law of gravity.
example.tran: 万有引力定律

collins.def: Law or the law is all the professions which deal with Advising people about the law, representing people in court, or giving decisions and punishments.

example.ex: A career in law is becoming increasingly attractive to young people...
example.tran: 法律行业对年轻人的吸引力越来越大。

example.ex: Nearly 100 law firms are being referred to the Solicitors' Disciplinary Tribunal.
example.tran: 近百家律师事务所被送上律师纪律法庭。

collins.def: Law is the study of systems of law and how laws work.

example.ex: He came to Oxford and studied law...
example.tran: 他来到牛津学习法律。

example.ex: He holds a law degree from Bristol University.
example.tran: 他拥有布里斯托尔大学的法律学位。

collins.tran: 凌驾于法律之上；高于法律
collins.def: If you accuse someone of thinking they are above the law, you criticize them for thinking that they are so clever or important that they do not need to obey the law.

example.ex: One opposition member of parliament accuses the government of wanting to be above the law...
example.tran: 议会一名反对党议员指责政府意图凌驾于法律之上。

example.ex: He considered himself above the law.
example.tran: 他自以为比法还大。

collins.def: The law of averages is the idea that something is sure to happen at some time, because of the number of times it generally happens or is expected to happen.

example.ex: On the law of averages we just can't go on losing.
example.tran: 根据平均律，我们不会再输下去了。

collins.def: If you have to do something by law or if you are not allowed to do something by law, the law states that you have to do it or that you are not allowed to do it.

example.ex: By law all restaurants must display their prices outside...
example.tran: 根据法律，所有餐厅都必须在店外明示用餐价格。

example.ex: Minicabs are prohibited by law from touting passers-by for business.
example.tran: 无标志的预约型出租车沿街拉客是非法的。

collins.tran: 诉诸法律；提起诉讼；打官司
collins.def: If you go to law, you go to court in order to get a legal judgment on a dispute.

example.ex: He went to law and did not succeed in his claim against us.
example.tran: 他告上了法庭，但没有告赢我们。

collins.def: If you say that someone lays down the law, you are critical of them because they give other people orders and they think that they are always right.

example.ex: ...traditional parents, who believed in laying down the law for their offspring.
example.tran: 认为应对子女发号施令的传统的家长们

collins.tran: 不通过法律自行解决，以暴代法（以惩罚他人或摆平某事）
collins.def: If someone takes the law into their own hands, they punish someone or do something to put a situation right, instead of waiting for the police or the legal system to take action.

example.ex: The speeding motorist was pinned to the ground by angry locals who took the law into their own hands until police arrived.
example.tran: 愤怒的当地人以暴代法——将超速司机强行按在地上，直至警察赶来。

collins.tran: （无视法律或惯例而）我行我素，自行其是
collins.def: If you say that someone is a law unto himself or herself, you mean that they behave in an independent way, ignoring laws, rules, or conventional ways of doing things.

example.ex: Some of the landowners were a law unto themselves. There was nobody to check their excesses and they exploited the people.
example.tran: 某些土地所有者目无法纪。他们横行霸道，鱼肉乡民。

collins.def: The leader of a group of people or an organization is the person who is in control of it or in charge of it.

example.ex: We now need a new leader of the party and a new style of leadership...
example.tran: 我们现在需要一位新的政党领袖和一种新的领导作风。

example.ex: We are going to hold a rally next month to elect a new leader.
example.tran: 我们打算下月举行集会，选举一位新的领导人。

collins.tran: （比赛或竞赛中的）领先者，占先者
collins.def: The leader at a particular point in a race or competition is the person who is winning at that point.

example.ex: The leaders came in two minutes clear of the field...
example.tran: 优胜者较其他参赛者快两分钟。

example.ex: The world drivers' championship leader crossed the line ahead of the Swede.
example.tran: 在世界车手锦标赛上，领先选手比瑞典人快一步冲线。

collins.tran: （产品或公司中的）首屈一指者，佼佼者
collins.def: The leader among a range of products or companies is the one that is most successful.

example.ex: Procter & Gamble is the leader in the mass market cosmetics industry.
example.tran: 宝洁是大众化妆品行业中的领头羊。

collins.def: The leader of an orchestra is the most senior violin player, who acts as a deputy to the conductor.
The leader of an orchestra is the conductor.
A leader in a newspaper is a piece of writing which gives the editor's opinion on an important news item.
A leader in a newspaper is the most important story in it.
If you learn something, you obtain knowledge or a skill through studying or training.

example.ex: Their children were going to learn English...
example.tran: 他们的小孩会学英语。

example.ex: He is learning to play the piano.
example.tran: 他在学钢琴。

collins.def: If you learn of something, you find out about it.

example.ex: It was only after his death that she learned of his affair with Betty...
example.tran: 一直到他死后她才知道他和贝蒂有染。

example.ex: It didn't  come as a shock to learn that the fuel and cooling systems are the most common causes of breakdown...
example.tran: 燃油和冷却系统是造成故障的最常见的原因，这一点不奇怪。

collins.tran: 学会（以某种方式行事或反应）
collins.def: If people learn to behave or react in a particular way, they gradually start to behave in that way as a result of a change in attitudes.

example.ex: You have to learn to face your problem...
example.tran: 你要学会面对自己的问题。

example.ex: We are learning how to confront death instead of avoiding its reality.
example.tran: 我们在学习如何直面死亡，而非回避死亡这一现实。

collins.def: If you learn from an unpleasant experience, you change the way you behave so that it does not happen again or so that, if it happens again, you can deal with it better.

example.ex: I am convinced that he has learned from his mistakes...
example.tran: 我深信他已从错误中吸取了教训。

example.ex: The company failed to learn any lessons from this experience.
example.tran: 公司未能从这次经历中吸取任何教训。

collins.def: If you learn something such as a poem or a role in a play, you study or repeat the words so that you can remember them.

example.ex: He learned this song as an inmate at a Texas prison.
example.tran: 他在得克萨斯监狱服刑时学会了这首歌。

means: 最不重要的，地位最低的

collins.def: You use at least to say that a number or amount is the smallest that is possible or likely and that the actual number or amount may be greater. The forms at the least and at the very least are also used.

example.ex: ...a dinner menu featuring at least 15 different sorts of fish...
example.tran: 至少列有15道不同做法的鱼的菜单

example.ex: Aim to have at least half a pint of milk each day...
example.tran: 目标是每天至少喝半品脱的牛奶。

collins.tran: （表示真实性或可能性）至少，最不济
collins.def: You use at least to say that something is the minimum that is true or possible. The forms at the least and at the very least are also used.

example.ex: She could take a nice holiday at least...
example.tran: 最不济她也可以去过一个愉快的假期。

example.ex: He is at least content that there will be no immediate use of force...
example.tran: 至少他对不会即时使用暴力感到满意。

collins.tran: （表示相对于不利条件或糟糕情形）起码，不管怎样
collins.def: You use at least to indicate an advantage that exists in spite of the disadvantage or bad situation that has just been mentioned.

example.ex: We've no idea what his state of health is but at least we know he is still alive...
example.tran: 我们不清楚他的健康情况如何，但起码知道他仍然活着。

example.ex: If something awful happens to you at least you can write about it.
example.tran: 如果你遭遇了不幸，至少你有东西可写。

collins.tran: （表示更正或改变自己刚说过的话）至少，起码
collins.def: You use at least to indicate that you are correcting or changing something that you have just said.

example.ex: It's not difficult to get money for research or at least it's  not always difficult...
example.tran: 争取到研究资金并不难，起码不总是那么难。

example.ex: The police say his death was an accident, officially at least...
example.tran: 警方说他的死是个意外，起码官方消息如此。

collins.def: You use the least to mean a smaller amount than anyone or anything else, or the smallest amount possible.

example.ex: I try to offend the least amount of people possible...
example.tran: 我尽量少得罪人。

example.ex: If you like cheese, go for the ones with the least fat.
example.tran: 要是喜欢吃奶酪，就吃脂肪含量最少的。

collins.def: Least is also a pronoun.

example.ex: On education funding, Japan performs best but spends the least per student.
example.tran: 在教育投资方面，日本花在每位学生身上的钱最少，但却做得最好。

collins.def: You use least to indicate that someone or something has less of a particular quality than most other things of its kind.

example.ex: The least experienced athletes had caused a great many false-starts through the day's proceedings...
example.tran: 那天的比赛中，经验最浅的运动员抢跑无数次。

example.ex: He was one of the least warm human beings I had ever met.
example.tran: 他是我见过的最冷漠的人之一。

collins.def: You use the least to emphasize the smallness of something, especially when it hardly exists at all.

example.ex: I don't have the least idea of what you're talking about...
example.tran: 我一点儿都不知道你在说什么。

example.ex: They neglect their duty at the least hint of fun elsewhere...
example.tran: 别处哪怕发生一丁点儿乐事，他们便会忘记自己的职责。

collins.def: You use least to indicate that something is true or happens to a smaller degree or extent than anything else or at any other time.

example.ex: He had a way of throwing her off guard with his charm when she least expected it.
example.tran: 他往往趁她最没有心理准备时发动魅力攻势，令她措手不及。

collins.tran: 无足轻重的；微乎其微的
collins.def: You use least in structures where you are emphasizing that a particular situation or event is much less important or serious than other possible or actual ones.

example.ex: Having to get up at three o'clock every morning was the least of her worries...
example.tran: 她发愁的事多着呢，相比之下，每天早上3点就要起床根本就不算什么。

example.ex: Although three days isn't very long, shortage of time was the least of his problems...
example.tran: 虽然3天时间不算长，但对他来说，这已经是最不成问题的问题了。

collins.def: You use the least in structures where you are stating the minimum that should be done in a situation, and suggesting that more should really be done.

example.ex: Well, the least you can do, if you won't  help me yourself, is to tell me where to go instead...
example.tran: 你自己要是不帮我，好歹也告诉我该上哪儿去呀。

example.ex: The least they could have given me was half a day to rest...
example.tran: 他们本应该起码给我半天时间休息。

collins.def: You can use in the least and the least bit to emphasize a negative.

example.ex: I'm not like that at all. Not in the least...
example.tran: 我哪里是那种人。绝对不是。

example.ex: I'm not in the least bit touched by the Marilyn Monroe kind of beauty...
example.tran: 我对玛丽莲·梦露那种美一点儿都不动心。

collins.tran: 最后不能不提；最后但同样重要的是
collins.def: You use last but not least to say that the last person or thing to be mentioned is as important as all the others.

example.ex: ...her four sons, Christopher, twins Daniel and Nicholas, and last but not least 2-year-old Jack.
example.tran: 她的4个儿子，克里斯托弗、双胞胎丹尼尔和尼古拉斯，还有不能不提的两岁大的杰克

collins.tran: （用于否定句后）（多者之中）尤其，尤数
collins.def: You can use least of all after a negative statement to emphasize that it applies especially to the person or thing mentioned.

example.ex: No one ever reads these articles, least of all me...
example.tran: 从没有人读这些文章，我就更不用说了。

example.ex: Such a speech should never have been made, least of all by a so-called responsible politician.
example.tran: 这种话本来就不应该说，尤其是不应出自一个所谓负责任的政客之口。

collins.tran: （强调某一例证或原因）尤其是，特别是，相当重要地
collins.def: You can use not least to emphasize a particularly important example or reason.

example.ex: Dieting can be bad for you, not least because it is a cause of stress...
example.tran: 节食可能不利于健康，相当重要的原因是它会引起精神压力。

example.ex: Everyone is more reluctant to travel these days, not least the Americans.
example.tran: 这段时间大家都减少了出游的欲望，美国人尤其如此。

collins.tran: 轻则；往轻里说；客气点说
collins.def: You can use to say the least to suggest that a situation is actually much more extreme or serious than you say it is.

example.ex: Accommodation was basic to say the least...
example.tran: 往轻里说是住宿条件简陋。

example.ex: Some members of the public can be a bit abusive to say the least.
example.tran: 有些民众客气点说是嘴里不大干净。

collins.def: If you leave a place or person, you go away from that place or person.

example.ex: He would not be allowed to leave the country...
example.tran: 他可能会被禁止离开该国。

example.ex: I simply couldn't bear to leave my little girl...
example.tran: 我就是受不了要离开我的小女儿。

collins.def: If you leave an institution, group, or job, you permanently stop attending that institution, being a member of that group, or doing that job.

example.ex: He left school with no qualifications...
example.tran: 他没有获得任何学历证书便离开了学校。

example.ex: I am leaving to concentrate on writing fiction.
example.tran: 我辞职是为了专心写小说。

collins.tran: 抛下，离弃（配偶）；离开（关系亲密的人）
collins.def: If you leave your husband, wife, or some other person with whom you have had a close relationship, you stop living with them or you finish the relationship.

example.ex: He'll never leave you. You need have no worry...
example.tran: 他不会离开你的，你不用担心。

example.ex: I would be insanely jealous if Bill left me for another woman.
example.tran: 要是比尔为了别的女人离开我，我会醋意大发。

collins.def: If you leave something or someone in a particular place, you let them remain there when you go away. If you leave something or someone with a person, you let them remain with that person so they are safe while you are away.

example.ex: I left my bags in the car...
example.tran: 我把包放在车里了。

example.ex: Don't  leave your truck there...
example.tran: 别把货车停在那儿。

collins.def: If you leave a message or an answer, you write it, record it, or give it to someone so that it can be found or passed on.

example.ex: You can leave a message on our answering machine...
example.tran: 您可以在我们的答录机上留言。

example.ex: Decide whether the ball is in square A, B, C, or D, then call and leave your answer...
example.tran: 选定球放在A、B、C、D哪个方格，然后打电话来，留下您的答案。

collins.def: If you leave someone doing something, they are doing that thing when you go away from them.

example.ex: Salter drove off, leaving Callendar surveying the scene.
example.tran: 索尔特开车走了，剩下卡伦德勘查现场。

collins.tran: 听任（某人做某事）；听（某人）自便
collins.def: If you leave someone to do something, you go away from them so that they do it on their own. If you leave someone to himself or herself, you go away from them and allow them to be alone.

example.ex: I'd better leave you to get on with it, then...
example.tran: 那我还是让你一个人接着干吧。

example.ex: Diana took the hint and left them to it...
example.tran: 戴安娜会意，任由他们自己去解决。

collins.def: To leave an amount of something means to keep it available after the rest has been used or taken away.

example.ex: He always left a little food for the next day...
example.tran: 他总是留下一点儿食物第二天吃。

example.ex: Double rooms at any of the following hotels should leave you some change from £150.
example.tran: 以下任何一间酒店的双人房价格都不到150英镑。

collins.def: If you take one number away from another, you can say that it leaves the number that remains. For example, five take away two leaves three.

collins.tran: （尤指把令人不快或困难的事）留给，扔给（某人）
collins.def: To leave someone with something, especially when that thing is unpleasant or difficult to deal with, means to make them have it or make them responsible for it.

example.ex: ...a crash which left him with a broken collarbone...
example.tran: 造成他锁骨骨折的车祸

example.ex: He left me with a child to support.
example.tran: 他扔下我独自拉扯一个孩子。

collins.def: If an event leaves people or things in a particular state, they are in that state when the event has finished.

example.ex: ...violent disturbances which have left at least ten people dead...
example.tran: 造成至少10人死亡的暴乱

example.ex: The documentary left me in a state of shock...
example.tran: 那部纪录片使我大为震惊。

collins.tran: （常指因不喜欢而）不碰（食物或饮料）
collins.def: If you leave food or drink, you do not eat or drink it, often because you do not like it.

example.ex: If you don't like the cocktail you ordered, just leave it and try a different one.
example.tran: 你要是不喜欢你要的鸡尾酒，就别喝了，要点别的吧。

collins.def: If something leaves a mark, effect, or sign, it causes that mark, effect, or sign to remain as a result.

example.ex: A muscle tear will leave a scar after healing...
example.tran: 肌肉撕裂复原后会留下疤痕。

example.ex: She left a lasting impression on him.
example.tran: 她给他留下了难以忘怀的印象。

collins.tran: 使处于（某个状态或位置）
collins.def: If you leave something in a particular state, position, or condition, you let it remain in that state, position, or condition.

example.ex: He left the album open on the table...
example.tran: 他把相册摊在桌上没收。

example.ex: I've  left the car lights on...
example.tran: 我没把车灯关掉。

collins.def: If you leave a space or gap in something, you deliberately make that space or gap.

example.ex: Leave a gap at the top and bottom so air can circulate.
example.tran: 上下各留一个口子通风。

collins.tran: 把（工作）交托；把（决定或选择权）留交
collins.def: If you leave a job, decision, or choice to someone, you give them the responsibility for dealing with it or making it.

example.ex: Affix the blue airmail label and leave the rest to us...
example.tran: 贴上蓝色的空邮标签，其余的事情交给我们。

example.ex: The judge should not have left it to the jury to decide...
example.tran: 法官本不该把案子交给陪审团来裁定。

collins.tran: （安排、协议等很大程度上）视乎，取决于
collins.def: If you say that something such as an arrangement or an agreement leaves a lot to another thing or person, you are critical of it because it is not adequate and its success depends on the other thing or person.

example.ex: The ceasefire leaves a lot to the goodwill of the forces involved...
example.tran: 停火协议的执行很大程度取决于各方武装力量的意愿。

example.ex: It's  a vague formulation that leaves much to the discretion of local authorities.
example.tran: 这只是个模糊的构想，许多方面还要由地方当局来定夺。

collins.tran: 限制（某人于某一行动或机会）
collins.def: To leave someone with a particular course of action or the opportunity to do something means to let it be available to them, while restricting them in other ways.

example.ex: This left me only one possible course of action...
example.tran: 这样我只有一条路可走。

example.ex: He was left with no option but to resign.
example.tran: 他除了辞职外别无选择。

collins.def: If you leave something until a particular time, you delay doing it or dealing with it until then.

example.ex: Don't leave it all until the last minute.
example.tran: 不要把什么都拖到最后一分钟。

collins.def: If you leave a particular subject, you stop talking about it and start discussing something else.

example.ex: I think we'd better leave the subject of Nationalism...
example.tran: 我看我们最好还是搁下民族主义这个话题吧。

example.ex: He suggested we get together for a drink sometime. I said I'd like that, and we left it there.
example.tran: 他建议我们找个时间出来喝一杯。我说好，然后我们就换了个话题。

collins.def: If you leave property or money to someone, you arrange for it to be given to them after you have died.

example.ex: He died two and a half years later, leaving everything to his wife.
example.tran: 他于两年半后去世，把所有遗产都留给了妻子。

collins.def: If you say that someone leaves a wife, husband, or a particular number of children, you mean that the wife, husband, or children remain alive after that person has died.

example.ex: It is for his humanity as much as his music that his numerous friends and pupils will remember him. He leaves a wife, son and daughter.
example.tran: 他的仁爱精神，以及他的音乐，都将长留在无数友人和学生的记忆里。他身后遗下妻子和一对儿女。

collins.def: Leave is a period of time when you are not working at your job, because you are on holiday or vacation, or for some other reason. If you are on leave, you are not working at your job.

example.ex: Why don't you take a few days' leave?
example.tran: 你为什么不休几天假？

example.ex: ...maternity leave...
example.tran: 产假

collins.def: If you ask for leave to do something, you ask for permission to do it.

example.ex: ...an application for leave to appeal against the judge's order.
example.tran: 不服法官指令的上诉申请

collins.def: If you leave someone or something alone, or if you leave them be, you do not  pay them any attention or bother them.

example.ex: Some people need to confront a traumatic past; others find it better to leave it alone...
example.tran: 有人需要直面过去的创伤，有人则觉得不去想它为妙。

example.ex: Why can't you leave him be?
example.tran: 你就不能不管他？

collins.def: You use leaving aside or leaving to one side when mentioning a fact or detail that you want to ignore when making a general statement.

example.ex: Leaving aside the question of privacy, constant surveillance can be remarkably convenient.
example.tran: 如果不去管隐私问题的话，实施不间断监视其实是非常便利的。

collins.def: When you take your leave or take leave of someone, you say goodbye and go.

example.ex: He thanked them for the pleasure of their company and took his leave.
example.tran: 他感谢他们的愉快陪伴，然后道别走了。

collins.tran: 不要弄巧成拙；不要没事找事
collins.def: If someone tells you to leave  well alone, they are telling you not to interfere in something, because it is all right as it is and you might only make it worse.

example.ex: He knew when to leave well alone and when to interfere.
example.tran: 他知道什么时候该适可而止，什么时候该插手干预。

collins.def: If something continues from where it left off, it starts happening again at the point where it had previously stopped.

example.ex: As soon as the police disappear the violence will take up from where it left off.
example.tran: 警察一走，暴力事件就会死灰复燃。

means: 离开( leave的过去式和过去分词)

collins.def: Left is the past tense and past participle of leave .
If there is a certain amount of something left, or if you have a certain amount of it left, it remains when the rest has gone or been used.

example.ex: Is there any gin left?...
example.tran: 还有杜松子酒吗？

example.ex: He's got plenty of money left...
example.tran: 他还剩有大把的钱。

collins.tran: （数量）较小（或少）的；更小（或少）的（前面可用a little，a lot，a bit，far和much等修饰）
collins.def: You use less to indicate that there is a smaller amount of something than before or than average. You can use 'a little', 'a lot',  'a bit', 'far', and 'much' in front of less.

example.ex: People should eat less fat to reduce the risk of heart disease.
example.tran: 人们应该减少脂肪摄入，以降低患心脏病的危险。

example.ex: ...a dishwasher that uses less water and electricity than older machines...
example.tran: 较旧式机器省水省电的洗碗机

collins.tran: （用在数字或数量前）少于，低于，比…少
collins.def: You use less than before a number or amount to say that the actual number or amount is smaller than this.

example.ex: Motorways actually cover less than 0.1 percent of the countryside...
example.tran: 高速公路的实际覆盖面积还不到农村地区的0.1%。

example.ex: Less than a half hour later he returned upstairs.
example.tran: 不到半个小时，他又跑上楼来。

collins.tran: （某一特性的程度与以往或一般情况相比）较轻地，较差地
collins.def: You use less to indicate that something or someone has a smaller amount of a quality than they used to or than is average or usual.

example.ex: I often think about those less fortunate than me...
example.tran: 我经常想到那些没我这么幸运的人。

example.ex: Other amenities, less commonly available, include a library and exercise room...
example.tran: 还有一些不太常有的设施，包括图书馆和健身房。

collins.tran: 不像…（更像…）；与其说…（倒不如说…）
collins.def: If you say that something is less one thing than another, you mean that it is like the second thing rather than the first.

example.ex: At first sight it looked less like a capital city than a mining camp...
example.tran: 乍看上去，它不像是首府，更像是矿工村。

example.ex: Trades union leadership in those days was less a career than a vocation.
example.tran: 那时候的工会领导与其说是一份职业，倒不如说是一种使命。

collins.def: If you do something less than before or less than someone else, you do it to a smaller extent or not as often.

example.ex: We are eating more and exercising less...
example.tran: 我们吃得多了，锻炼却少了。

example.ex: I see less of any of my friends than I used to.
example.tran: 我见所有朋友都比以前少了。

collins.tran: （用于否定句后）遑论，更何况，更不用说
collins.def: You use the expressions still less ,much less, and even less after a negative statement in order to introduce and emphasize a further statement, and to make it negative too.

example.ex: I never talked about it, still less about her...
example.tran: 我从来没说起过这事，更没有提起过她。

example.ex: The boy didn't have a girlfriend, much less a wife.
example.tran: 这小伙子连女朋友都没有，更不用提老婆了。

collins.tran: （用在数字或数量前）扣除，减去
collins.def: When you are referring to amounts, you use less in front of a number or quantity to indicate that it is to be subtracted from another number or quantity already mentioned.

example.ex: ...Boyton Financial Services Fees: £750, less £400...
example.tran: 博伊顿金融服务费：750英镑，扣除400英镑

example.ex: Company car drivers will pay between ten and twenty five percent, less tax.
example.tran: 公司的司机要支付10%到25%，从中扣除税款。

collins.def: You use less and less to say that something is becoming smaller all the time in degree or amount.

example.ex: The couple seem to spend less and less time together...
example.tran: 两口子在一起的时间似乎越来越少。

example.ex: She sounded less and less eager to return to Ireland...
example.tran: 听她话音，她回爱尔兰的热情似乎日渐消退。

collins.def: You use less than to say that something does not have a particular quality. For example, if you describe something as less than perfect, you mean that it is not perfect at all.

example.ex: Her greeting was less than enthusiastic...
example.tran: 她的问候一点都不热情。

example.ex: Her advice has frequently been less than wholly helpful.
example.tran: 她的建议往往毫无帮助。

collins.tran: （对某事物或某人的重要性表示惊讶或钦佩）竟然，居然
collins.def: You can use no less as a way of expressing surprise or admiration at the importance of something or someone.

example.ex: He had returned to England in an aircraft carrier no less...
example.tran: 他竟然坐航空母舰回的英格兰。

example.ex: Who wrote the screenplay from Patricia Highsmith's book? Raymond Chandler, no less.
example.tran: 帕特里夏·海史密斯那本书是谁改编成剧本的？雷蒙德·钱德勒呀，厉害。

collins.tran: （对某一数目之大表示惊奇）多达
collins.def: You use no less than before an amount to indicate that the amount is larger than you expected.

example.ex: No less than 35 per cent of the country is protected in the form of parks and nature sanctuaries...
example.tran: 该国多达35%的地区以公园和自然保护区的形式受到保护。

example.ex: He is lined up for no less than four US television interviews.
example.tran: 多达4家美国电视媒体排期邀请他上节目接受采访。

collins.def: If you let something happen, you allow it to happen without doing anything to stop or prevent it.

example.ex: People said we were interfering with nature, and that we should just let the animals die...
example.tran: 人们说我们是在干涉自然界，还说我们应该任由动物死去。

example.ex: Thorne let him talk...
example.tran: 索恩让他畅所欲言。

collins.tran: 允许，准许，同意（某人做某事）
collins.def: If you let someone do something, you give them your permission to do it.

example.ex: I love sweets but Mum doesn't let me have them very often...
example.tran: 我爱吃糖，可妈妈不让我常吃。

example.ex: The Americans won't let her leave the country...
example.tran: 美国人不允许她出境。

collins.tran: （开门、让路等）允许（…进、出或通过）
collins.def: If you let someone into, out of, or through a place, you allow them to enter, leave, or go through it, for example by opening a door or making room for them.

example.ex: I had to get up at seven o'clock this morning to let them into the building because they had lost their keys...
example.tran: 今天早上我不得不7点钟就起床开门让他们进楼，因为他们把钥匙弄丢了。

example.ex: I let myself into the flat...
example.tran: 我自己开门进了公寓。

collins.tran: （用于引出要说的话）让我，我来
collins.def: You use let me when you are introducing something you want to say.

example.ex: Let me say it again. I despised Wade's life...
example.tran: 我再说一遍。我厌恶韦德的生活方式。

example.ex: Let me tell you what I saw last night...
example.tran: 我来告诉你我昨晚见到了什么。

collins.tran: （用于礼貌地表示愿意提供帮助）让我，我来
collins.def: You use let me when you are offering politely to do something.

example.ex: Let me take your coat...
example.tran: 我来帮您拿外套。

example.ex: Let me get you something to drink.
example.tran: 我给你拿杯喝的来。

collins.tran: （用于将他人的注意力引向下面的话题）让我们
collins.def: You say let's or, in more formal English, let us, to direct the attention of the people you are talking to towards the subject that you want to consider next.

example.ex: Let's consider ways of making it easier...
example.tran: 咱们来想想办法把它变得更容易些吧。

example.ex: Let us look at these views in more detail.
example.tran: 我们来具体研究一下这些观点。

collins.tran: （用于提出建议或表示赞同）让我们
collins.def: You say let's  or, in formal English, let us, when you are making a suggestion that involves both you and the person you are talking to, or when you are agreeing to a suggestion of this kind.

example.ex: I'm bored. Let's go home...
example.tran: 我觉得好无聊。我们回家吧。

example.ex: 'Shall we go in and have some supper?' — 'Yes, let's.'
example.tran: “我们要不要进去吃点晚饭？”——“好啊，走吧。”

collins.tran: （用于委婉地发出指令）让我们
collins.def: Someone in authority, such as a teacher, can use let's or, in more formal English, let us, in order to give a polite instruction to another person or group of people.

example.ex: Let's have some hush, please...
example.tran: 请大家安静一下。

example.ex: 'Let us pray,' said the Methodist chaplain.
example.tran: “我们来祈祷吧，”那个循道宗牧师说。

collins.tran: （表示犹豫或思考）让我看看/让我想想
collins.def: People often use let in expressions such as let me see or let me think when they are hesitating or thinking of what to say next.

example.ex: Now, let's see. Where did I leave my bag?...
example.tran: 嗯，我想想。我把包放哪儿了？

example.ex: 'How long you been living together then?' — 'Erm, let me think. It's about four years now.'
example.tran: “那你们住在一起有多久了？”——“呃，我想想。到现在差不多4年了。”

collins.def: You can use let to say that you do not care if someone does something, although you think it is unpleasant or wrong.

example.ex: If he wants to do that, let him do it...
example.tran: 他要做，就让他做好了。

example.ex: Let them talk about me; I'll be dead, anyway...
example.tran: 随他们怎么说我吧；我反正是要死的。

collins.tran: （表示认为某人应该做某事）让
collins.def: You can use let when you are saying what you think someone should do, usually when they are behaving in a way that you think is unreasonable or wrong.

example.ex: Let him get his own cup of tea...
example.tran: 自己的茶让他自己端。

example.ex: If they value these data, let them pay for them.
example.tran: 他们要是看重这些数据，就让他们出钱买。

collins.def: You can use let when you are praying or hoping very much that something will happen.

example.ex: Please God, let him telephone me.
example.tran: 上帝啊，求你让他打电话给我吧。

collins.def: You can use let to introduce an assumption on which you are going to base a theory, calculation, or story.

example.ex: Let x equal 5 and y equal 3...
example.tran: 设x等于5，y等于3。

example.ex: The new man in my life (let's call him Dave) had a very jealous ex-girlfriend.
example.tran: 我生命中这个新男人（就叫他戴夫吧），他的前女友是个醋坛子。

collins.def: If you let your house or land to someone, you allow them to use it in exchange for money that they pay you regularly.

example.ex: She is thinking of letting her house to an American serviceman...
example.tran: 她正考虑把房子租给一个美国军人。

example.ex: The reasons for letting a house, or part of one, are varied.
example.tran: 把整套房子或其中一部分租出去，其原因是多种多样的。

collins.tran: （网球或羽毛球发球时的）擦网球，触网重发
collins.def: In tennis or badminton, if you serve a let, the ball or shuttlecock touches the net but lands in the correct part of the court. You then serve again.

collins.tran: （通常用在否定句后）遑论，更别提，更不用说
collins.def: Let alone is used after a statement, usually a negative one, to indicate that the statement is even more true of the person, thing, or situation that you are going to mention next.

example.ex: It is incredible that the 12-year-old managed to even reach the pedals, let alone drive the car.
example.tran: 12岁的孩子能踩到踏板已经是不可思议，就更不用说开车了。

collins.def: To let someone be means to leave them alone and not interfere in what they are doing.

example.ex: If your child is really sick and needs sleep and quiet, let him be.
example.tran: 如果孩子真的病了，需要睡眠和静养的话，就不要去打扰他。
