example.tran: 库蒂不但没暂避风头，而且较以往更加直言不讳。

collins.def: The main thing is the most important one of several similar things in a particular situation.

example.ex: ...one of the main tourist areas of Amsterdam...
example.tran: 阿姆斯特丹的主要旅游区之一

example.ex: My main concern now is to protect the children...
example.tran: 我现在最关心的就是要保护好孩子们。

collins.def: If you say that something is true in the main, you mean that it is generally true, although there may be exceptions.

example.ex: Tourists are, in the main, sympathetic people...
example.tran: 大体说来，游客们都富有同情心。

example.ex: In the main, children are taboo in the workplace.
example.tran: 工作场所基本上禁止儿童进入。

collins.tran: (室内煤气、自来水或污水的)总管道，主管道
collins.def: The mains are the pipes which supply gas or water to buildings, or which take sewage away from them.

example.ex: ...the water supply from the mains...
example.tran: 总管道的自来水供应

example.ex: The capital has been without mains water since Wednesday night.
example.tran: 从周三晚上开始，首都就停水了。

collins.def: The mains are the wires which supply electricity to buildings, or the place where the wires end inside the building.

example.ex: ...amplifiers which plug into the mains...
example.tran: 接通电源的扩音器

example.ex: Make sure plugs are disconnected from the mains...
example.tran: 确保插头与电源断开。

collins.tran: 较重要的;较重大的;主要的
collins.def: You use major when you want to describe something that is more important, serious, or significant than other things in a group or situation.

example.ex: The major factor in the decision to stay or to leave was usually professional...
example.tran: 职业上的考虑往往是决定去留的主要因素。

example.ex: Drug abuse has long been a major problem for the authorities there...
example.tran: 长久以来，吸毒一直是那里的当局面临的一个大难题。

collins.tran: (英国)陆军(或海军陆战队)少校;(美国)陆军(或空军、海军陆战队)少校
collins.def: A major is an officer who is one rank above captain in the British army or the United States army, air force, or marines.

example.ex: I was a major in the war, you know.
example.tran: 你知道，战争期间我是一名陆军少校。

example.ex: ...Major Alan Bulman.
example.tran: 艾伦·布尔曼少校

collins.tran: (美国大学中的)主修课程，专业
collins.def: At a university or college in the United States, a student's major is the main subject that they are studying.

example.ex: English majors would be asked to explore the roots of language.
example.tran: 英语专业的学生会被要求探究语言的根源。

collins.tran: (美国大学中)主修…的学生，…专业的学生
collins.def: At a university or college in the United States, if a student is, for example, a geology major, geology is the main subject they are studying.

example.ex: She was named the outstanding undergraduate history major at the University of Oklahoma.
example.tran: 她被评选为俄克拉何马大学历史专业的优等生。

collins.def: If a student at a university or college in the United States majors in a particular subject, that subject is the main one they study.

example.ex: He majored in finance at Claremont Men's College in California.
example.tran: 他在加利福尼亚州的克莱尔蒙特男子学院主修金融专业。

collins.def: In music, a major scale is one in which the third note is two tones higher than the first.

example.ex: ...Mozart's Symphony No 35 in D Major.
example.tran: 莫扎特D大调第35号交响曲

collins.def: A major is a large or important company.

example.ex: Oil majors need not fear being unable to sell their crude.
example.tran: 大型石油公司无需担心原油销售不出去。

collins.tran: 职业体育总会;(尤指美国)职业棒球联合总会，职业棒球大联盟
collins.def: The majors are groups of professional sports teams that compete against each other, especially in American baseball.

example.ex: I knew what I could do in the minor leagues, I just wanted a chance to prove myself in the majors.
example.tran: 我知道自己在职业棒球小联合会中实力如何，我只是想有个机会能在职业棒球大联盟中证明一下自己。

collins.tran: 大型体育比赛;(尤指高尔夫球或网球)大赛
collins.def: A major is an important sporting competition, especially in golf or tennis.

example.ex: Sarazen became the first golfer to win all four majors.
example.tran: 萨拉岑成为了首位高尔夫四大满贯赛冠军。

collins.tran: (与大量名词连用，表示做动作、说某事等)做出，作出
collins.def: You can use make with a wide range of nouns to indicate that someone performs an action or says something. For example, if you make a suggestion, you suggest something.

example.ex: I'd just like to make a comment...
example.tran: 我只想稍加评论。

example.ex: I made a few phone calls...
example.tran: 我打了几个电话。

collins.tran: (与某些名词连用)把…做(好)，把…搞(糟)
collins.def: You can use make with certain nouns to indicate that someone does something well or badly. For example, if you make a success of something, you do it successfully, and if you make a mess of something, you do it very badly.

example.ex: Apparently he made a mess of his  audition...
example.tran: 看样子他把试镜搞砸了。

example.ex: Are you really going to make a better job of it this time?
example.tran: 这一次你真的能做得更好吗？

collins.tran: 摆出…的姿态;做出…的样子
collins.def: If you make as if to do something or make to do something, you behave in a way that makes it seem that you are just about to do it.

example.ex: Mary made as if to protest, then hesitated...
example.tran: 玛丽好像要抗议，却又犹豫了。

example.ex: He made to chase Davey, who ran back laughing.
example.tran: 他假装要去追赶一边往回跑一边大笑的戴维。

collins.tran: (在板球、棒球、橄榄球比赛中)得(分)
collins.def: In cricket, if a player makes a particular number of runs, they score that number of runs. In baseball or American football, if a player makes a particular score, they achieve that score.

example.ex: He made 1,972 runs for the county.
example.tran: 他为本郡赢得了1,972分。

collins.def: If you make do with something, you use or have it instead of something else that you do not have, although it is not as good.

example.ex: Why make do with a copy if you can afford the genuine article?...
example.tran: 要是买得起真品，为什么还要拿复制品来凑合呢？

example.ex: We're a bit low on bed linen. You'll have to make do.
example.tran: 我们的床单有些次，您将就着用吧。

collins.def: If you make like you are doing something, you act as if you are doing it, and if you make like someone, you act as if you are that person.

example.ex: Bob makes like he's a fish blowing bubbles.
example.tran: 鲍勃装成一条吐泡泡的鱼。

collins.def: A man is an adult male human being.

example.ex: He had not expected the young man to reappear before evening...
example.tran: 他没想到这位年轻男子会在黄昏前再次出现。

example.ex: I have always regarded him as a man of integrity.
example.tran: 我一向认为他是个正直的人。

collins.tran: 人，人类（此用法仍有争议）
collins.def: Man and men are sometimes used to refer to all human beings, including both males and females. Some people dislike this use.

example.ex: The chick initially has no fear of man...
example.tran: 小鸡天生并不怕人。

example.ex: Anxiety is modern man's natural state.
example.tran: 焦虑是现代人的自然状态。

collins.def: If you say that a man is, for example, a gambling man or an outdoors man, you mean that he likes gambling or outdoor activities.

example.ex: Are you a gambling man, Mr Graham?...
example.tran: 格雷厄姆先生，你是好赌的人吗?

example.ex: He is a keen outdoors man with a great interest in photography and walking.
example.tran: 他非常喜欢户外运动，酷爱摄影和徒步旅行。

collins.tran: （来自某地的）人；（在某地上过学的）人
collins.def: If you say that a man is, for example, a London man or an Oxford man, you mean that he comes from London or Oxford, or went to university there.

example.ex: ...as the Stockport man collected his winnings...
example.tran: 在那名来自斯托克波特的人收拢他赢的钱的时候

example.ex: Attlee was an  Oxford man.
example.tran: 艾德礼是名牛津学子。

collins.tran: (某公司或组织的男性)职员，代表
collins.def: If you refer to a particular company's or organiza-tion's man, you mean a man who works for or represents that company or organization.

example.ex: ...the Daily Telegraph's man in Abu Dhabi.
example.tran: 《每日电讯报》驻阿布扎比的记者

example.ex: ...America's man at the United Nations.
example.tran: 美国驻联合国人员

collins.def: If you say that a man is someone's man, you mean that he always supports that person or does what they want.

example.ex: At the time he was said to be very much Rajiv Gandhi's man.
example.tran: 据说他当时是拉吉夫·甘地的铁杆支持者。

collins.def: Some people refer to a woman's husband, lover, or boyfriend as her man .

example.ex: ...if they see your man cuddle you in the kitchen or living room.
example.tran: 假如他们看见你的男朋友在厨房或起居室里搂着你的话

collins.def: In the armed forces, the men are soldiers, sailors, marines, or airmen of lower  rank, as opposed to the officers.

example.ex: 150 officers and men had to be taken straight to hospital.
example.tran: 不得不将150名官兵直接送往了医院。

example.ex: ...a drill sergeant who would work with the men at least one hour every morning.
example.tran: 每天早晨至少和士兵操练一小时的操练中士

collins.tran: （尤指从事体力劳动或为上级工作的）男工，男雇员，男下属
collins.def: Male workers are sometimes referred to as men, especially if they do physical work or work for a more senior person.

example.ex: The men voted by a four-to-one majority to accept the pay offer...
example.tran: 男雇员以4比1的多数票接受了工资条件。

example.ex: After the talks, the leader of the Workers' Council said his men would be going back down the mines.
example.tran: 会谈之后，工人委员会的领袖说他手下的工人们会重回井下工作。

collins.tran: (对男子的称呼，表示生气或不耐烦)老兄，老弟，小伙子
collins.def: One man sometimes addresses another as 'man' when he is angry or impatient with him.

example.ex: I told you, man! It'll be sometime after eight o'clock.
example.tran: 老兄，我告诉过你了，时间是八点以后。

collins.tran: （在非正式场合中用以称呼男子）老弟,老兄
collins.def: In very informal social situations, man is sometimes used as a greeting or form of address to a man.

example.ex: Hey wow, man! Where d'you get those boots?
example.tran: 哎哟，老弟，哪里搞来的靴子？

collins.tran: 在…岗位上工作;操作(机器等)
collins.def: If you man something such as a place or machine, you operate it or are in charge of it.

example.ex: French soldiers manned roadblocks in the capital city.
example.tran: 法国士兵把守着首都的各路关卡。

example.ex: ...the person manning the phone at the complaints department...
example.tran: 投诉部的接线生

collins.def: If you say that a man is man enough to do something, you mean that he has the necessary courage or ability to do it.

example.ex: I told him that he should be man enough to admit he had done wrong...
example.tran: 我对他说，他应该勇于承认错误。

example.ex: You can search me if you think you're man enough.
example.tran: 有胆的话，你可以搜我的身。

collins.tran: 更受男人（而非女人）欢迎的男人
collins.def: If you describe a man as a man's man, you mean that he has qualities which make him popular with other men rather than with women.
People sometimes address a man as my man .

example.ex: 'Get the guy in the purple shirt.' — 'All right, my man.'
example.tran: “把那个穿紫衬衫的家伙叫过来。”——“好的，老兄。”

collins.tran: 我的老兄，我的老弟(对地位比自己低的人的友好称呼，但略带屈尊俯就之意)
collins.def: people sometimes address a man as my man ,my dear man, or my good man. This form of address is often friendly, but can also suggest that the speaker feels superior to the person being addressed.

example.ex: My dear man, you are welcome to stay...
example.tran: 我的老弟，欢迎你留下来。

example.ex: It's not for you to say so, my man!
example.tran: 你不该这么说，老弟！

collins.tran: 能自己做主;无须听命于他人
collins.def: If you say that a man is his own man, you approve of the fact that he makes his decisions and his plans himself, and does not depend on other people.

example.ex: Be your own man. Make up your own mind...
example.tran: 要有主见，你自己做主吧。

example.ex: He'll be his own man and won't be dictated to.
example.tran: 他要自己做决定，不会被他人左右。

collins.def: If you say that a group of men are, do, or think something to a man, you are emphasizing that every one of them is, does, or thinks that thing.

example.ex: To a man, the surveyors blamed the government...
example.tran: 调查员们无一例外地都指责政府。

example.ex: They died, to a man, when they tried to break out...
example.tran: 他们企图逃走的时候全都丢掉了性命。

collins.tran: 私下的;一对一的;开诚布公的
collins.def: A man-to-man conversation or meeting takes place between two men, especially two men who meet to discuss a serious personal matter.

example.ex: He called me to his office for a man-to-man talk...
example.tran: 他把我叫到他的办公室私下谈了谈。

example.ex: Me and Ben should sort this out man to man.
example.tran: 我和本应该把这件事坦率地说清楚。

collins.def: You use many to indicate that you are talking about a large number of people or things.

example.ex: I don't think many people would argue with that...
example.tran: 我认为多数人不会对此有异议。

example.ex: Not many films are made in Finland...
example.tran: 芬兰出品的电影并不多。

collins.def: You use many in expressions such as 'not many', 'not very many', and 'too many' when replying to questions about numbers of things or people.

example.ex: 'How many of the songs that dealt with this theme became hit songs?' — 'Not very many.'...
example.tran: “有多少关于这个主题的歌曲风靡一时呢？”“并不很多。”

example.ex: How many years is it since we've seen each other? Too many, anyway.
example.tran: 我们多少年没有见面了？反正有年头了。

collins.tran: (用于 a + 单数名词之前表示强调)许多，很多
collins.def: You use many followed by 'a' and a noun to emphasize that there are a lot of people or things involved in something.

example.ex: Many a mother tries to act out her unrealized dreams through her daughter...
example.tran: 有许多母亲都试图在女儿身上实现自己未竟的梦想。

example.ex: I have spent many a morning with my wife gathering mussels along the rocky beaches of Little Compton.
example.tran: 我和妻子好几个上午都在小康普顿的岩石滩上采拾贻贝。

collins.def: You use many after 'how' to ask questions about numbers or quantities. You use many after 'how' in reported clauses to talk about numbers or quantities.

example.ex: How many years have you been here?...
example.tran: 你在这里有多少年了？

example.ex: No-one knows how many people have been killed since the war began.
example.tran: 没有人知道自开战以来有多少人丧生。

collins.tran: (用于比较物或人的数量，与 as 连用)
collins.def: You use many with 'as' when you are comparing numbers of things or people.

example.ex: I've always entered as many photo competitions as I can...
example.tran: 我总是尽可能多地参加摄影比赛。

example.ex: We produced ten times as many tractors as the United States.
example.tran: 我们生产的拖拉机的数量是美国的10倍。

collins.def: You use many to mean 'many  people'.

example.ex: Not many expected Ferdinand to be such a success this season...
example.tran: 预料到费迪南德在本赛季如此成功的人并不多。

example.ex: Iris Murdoch was regarded by many as a supremely good and serious writer.
example.tran: 许多人都视艾丽丝·默多克为极其优秀和严肃的作家。

collins.def: The many means a large group of people, especially the ordinary people in society, considered as separate from a particular small group.

example.ex: The printing press gave power to a few to change the world for the many...
example.tran: 印刷机赋予少数人为多数人改变世界的力量。

example.ex: He wanted to create a society of opportunity where benefits became available to the many.
example.tran: 他想建立一个充满机遇的社会，在这个社会里多数人都可以享受到社会福利。

collins.tran: (用于数字之前表示数目极大)多达…
collins.def: You use as many as before a number to suggest that it is surprisingly large.

example.ex: As many as four and a half million people watched today's parade.
example.tran: 观看今天游行的人多达450万。

collins.def: You use a good many or a great many to emphasize that you are referring to a large number of things or people.

example.ex: We've both had a good many beers...
example.tran: 我俩都喝了很多啤酒。

example.ex: For a great many men and women, romance can be a most important part of marriage.
example.tran: 对于无数男女而言，浪漫是婚姻中极其重要的一部分。

collins.def: A market is a place where goods are bought and sold, usually outdoors.

example.ex: He sold boots on a market stall.
example.tran: 他在集市上摆摊卖靴子。

collins.tran: 需求量;市场需求;顾客群;行销地区
collins.def: The market for a particular type of thing is the number of people who want to buy it, or the area of the world in which it is sold.

example.ex: The foreign market was increasingly crucial.
example.tran: 国外市场越来越重要了。

example.ex: ...the Russian market for personal computers...
example.tran: 俄罗斯的个人电脑市场

collins.tran: （尤用于谈论同行业竞争时）年销售量，市场总额
collins.def: The market refers to the total amount of a product that is sold each year, especially when you are talking about the competition between the companies who sell that product.

example.ex: The two big companies control 72% of the market.
example.tran: 两大公司控制了72%的市场份额。

collins.def: If you talk about a market economy, or the market price of something, you are referring to an economic system in which the prices of things depend on how many are available and how many people want to buy them, rather than prices being fixed by governments.

example.ex: Their ultimate aim was a market economy for Hungary...
example.tran: 他们最终的目标是为匈牙利建立起市场经济体制。

example.ex: He must sell the house for the current market value.
example.tran: 他必须以目前的市价出售这座房子。

collins.tran: 营销;推销；进行市场推广
collins.def: To market a product means to organize its sale, by deciding on its price, where it should be sold, and how it should be advertised.

example.ex: ...if you marketed our music the way you market pop music...
example.tran: 要是你用了推广流行音乐的方式宣传我们的音乐的方式

example.ex: Touch-tone telephones have been marketed in America since 1963.
example.tran: 按键式电话从1963年起就开始在美国销售。

collins.def: The job market or the labour market refers to the people who are looking for work and the jobs available for them to do.

example.ex: Every year, 250,000 people enter the job market.
example.tran: 每年有25万人进入就业市场。

example.ex: ...the changes in the labour market during the 1980s.
example.tran: 20世纪80年代劳动力市场的变化

collins.def: The stock market is sometimes referred to as the market .

example.ex: The market collapsed last October.
example.tran: 去年10月股市崩盘。

collins.tran: 买方市场/ 卖方市场
collins.def: If you say that it is a buyer's market, you mean that it is a good time to buy a particular thing, because there is a lot of it available, so its price is low. If you say that it is a seller's market, you mean that very little of it is available, so its price is high.

example.ex: Don't be afraid to haggle: for the moment, it's a buyer's market...
example.tran: 别怕还价，现在是买方市场。

example.ex: Housing became a seller's market, and prices zoomed up.
example.tran: 房地产成了卖方市场，房价急剧上升。

collins.def: If you are in the market for something, you are interested in buying it.

example.ex: If you're in the market for a new radio, you'll see that the latest models are very different.
example.tran: 如果你打算买一台新收音机，你会发现最新型号的收音机变化非常大。

collins.tran: 在出售;待售/上市;投入市场
collins.def: If something is on the market, it is available for people to buy. If it comes onto the market, it becomes available for people to buy.

example.ex: ...putting more empty offices on the market.
example.tran: 出售更多的闲置办公室

example.ex: ...new medicines that have just come onto the market.
example.tran: 刚刚上市的新药

collins.def: If you price yourself out of the market, you try to sell goods or services at a higher price than other people, with the result that no one buys them from you.

example.ex: At £150,000 for a season, he really is pricing himself out of the market.
example.tran: 他居然一个赛季要价15万英镑，真让人不敢问津。

collins.def: A match is an organized game of football, tennis, cricket, or some other sport.

example.ex: He was watching a football match...
example.tran: 他正在观看一场足球比赛。

example.ex: France won the match 28-19.
example.tran: 法国队以28比19赢得了这场比赛。

collins.def: A match is a small wooden stick with a substance on one end that produces a flame when you rub it along the rough side of a matchbox.

example.ex: ...a packet of cigarettes  and a box of matches.
example.tran: 一包香烟和一盒火柴

collins.def: If something of a particular colour or design matches another thing, they have the same colour or design, or have a pleasing appearance when they are used together.

example.ex: Her nails were painted bright red to match her dress...
example.tran: 她的指甲涂成了大红色，为的是与裙子相配。

example.ex: All the chairs matched...
example.tran: 所有椅子都是配套的。

collins.tran: （数量或质量）比得上,与…不相上下,使一致
collins.def: If something such as an amount or a quality matches with another amount or quality, they are both the same or equal. If you match two things, you make them the same or equal.

example.ex: Their strengths in memory and spatial skills matched...
example.tran: 他们在记忆力和空间技能方面势均力敌。

example.ex: Our value system does not match with their value system.
example.tran: 我们的价值体系和他们的并不相同。

collins.def: If one thing matches another,  they are connected or suit each other  in some way.

example.ex: The students are asked to match the books with the authors...
example.tran: 要求学生把书籍与作者对应起来。

example.ex: We will try to match you to employers with the vacancies you are looking for...
example.tran: 我们会争取为你找到提供你所需职位的用人单位。

collins.def: If a combination of things or people is a good match, they have a pleasing effect when placed or used together.

example.ex: Helen's choice of lipstick was a good match for her skin-tone...
example.tran: 海伦选择的唇膏很适合她的肤色。

example.ex: Moira was a perfect match for him.
example.tran: 莫伊拉和他简直是绝配。

collins.def: If you match something, you are as good as it or equal to it, for example in speed, size, or quality.

example.ex: They played some fine attacking football, but I think we matched them in every respect...
example.tran: 他们的攻势足球踢得不错，不过我认为我们各方面和他们比起来都不逊色。

example.ex: His record has never been matched.
example.tran: 他的纪录尚无人能及。

collins.def: In a sport or other contest, if you match one person or team against another, in sports or other contests, you make them compete with each other to see which one is better.

example.ex: The finals of the Championship begin today, matching the United States against France...
example.tran: 锦标赛决赛于今天打响，由美国队对法国队。

example.ex: Lewis is matched against the WBO's heavyweight champion, Tommy Morrison.
example.tran: 刘易斯对决世界拳击组织的重量级拳王汤米·莫里森。

collins.tran: 遇到强劲的对手;棋逢对手
collins.def: If you meet your match, you find that you are competing or fighting against someone who you cannot beat because they are as good as you, or better than you.

example.ex: I had finally met my match in power and intellect.
example.tran: 我终于遇上了与我在力量与智力上不相上下的劲敌。

collins.def: If one person or thing is no match for another, they are unable to compete successfully with the other person or thing.

example.ex: I was no match for a man with such power...
example.tran: 我根本不是这样强大的男人的对手。

example.ex: Hand-held guns proved no match for heavy armor.
example.tran: 结果证明，手持枪械无法同重型装甲抗衡。

collins.def: A matter is a task, situation, or event which you have to deal with or think about, especially one that involves problems.

example.ex: It was clear that she wanted to discuss some private matter...
example.tran: 很明显，她想谈些私事。

example.ex: Until the matter is resolved the athletes will be ineligible to compete...
example.tran: 除非这个问题得以解决，否则这些运动员没有资格参加比赛。

collins.def: You use matters to refer to the situation you are talking about, especially when something is affecting the  situation in some way.

example.ex: If your ordinary life is out of control, then retreating into a cosy ritual will not improve matters...
example.tran: 如果正常生活都一团糟了，那么再讲究小情调根本无济于事。

example.ex: If it would facilitate matters, I would be happy to come to New York...
example.tran: 如果对事态发展有利，我很乐意来纽约。

collins.tran: (是…的)问题;取决于…的问题;关乎…的问题
collins.def: If you say that a situation is a matter of a particular thing, you mean that that is the most important thing to be done or considered when you are involved in the situation or explaining it.

example.ex: History is always a matter of interpretation...
example.tran: 历史总是一种阐释角度的问题。

example.ex: Observance of the law is a matter of principle for us...
example.tran: 守法是我们的一个原则问题。

collins.def: Printed matter consists of books, newspapers, and other texts that are printed. Reading matter consists of things that are suitable for reading, such as books and newspapers.

example.ex: ...the Government's plans to levy VAT on printed matter.
example.tran: 政府对印刷品征收增值税的计划

example.ex: ...a rich variety of reading matter.
example.tran: 种类繁多的阅读材料

collins.def: Matter is the physical part of the universe consisting of solids, liquids, and gases.

example.ex: A proton is an elementary particle of matter.
example.tran: 质子是物质的基本粒子。

example.ex: He has spent his career studying how matter behaves at the fine edge between order and disorder.
example.tran: 他从事研究物质在有序与无序的细微临界处的行为变化。

collins.def: You use matter to refer to a particular type of substance.

example.ex: They feed mostly on decaying vegetable matter.
example.tran: 它们大多以腐烂的蔬菜为食。

example.ex: ...waste matter from industries.
example.tran: 工业废料

collins.def: You use matter in expressions such as 'What's the matter?' or 'Is anything the matter?' when you think that someone has a problem and you want to know what it is.

example.ex: Carole, what's the matter? You don't seem happy...
example.tran: 卡萝尔，出什么事了？你好像不开心。

example.ex: What's the matter with your office?...
example.tran: 你们部门出什么事了吗？

collins.def: You use matter in expressions such as 'a matter of weeks' when you are emphasizing how small an amount is or how short a period of time is.

example.ex: Within a matter of days she was back at work...
example.tran: 仅仅几天后，她又回去上班了。

example.ex: He expected to be at East Grinstead station in a matter of hours...
example.tran: 他希望几个小时内可以到达东格林斯特德站。

collins.def: If you say that something does not matter, you mean that it is not important to you because it does not have an effect on you or on a particular situation.

example.ex: A lot of the food goes on the floor but that doesn't matter...
example.tran: 许多食品掉在地板上，不过也没什么关系。

example.ex: As for Laura and me, the colour of our skin has never mattered...
example.tran: 至于我和劳拉，肤色根本不是问题。

collins.tran: 另一码事；另一回事;不同情形
collins.def: If you say that something is another matter or a different matter, you mean that it is very different from the situation that you  have just discussed.

example.ex: Being responsible for one's own health is one thing, but being responsible for another person's health is quite a different matter...
example.tran: 对自己的健康负责是一回事，对他人的健康负责就完全是另一回事了。

example.ex: You have no business going into such places all by yourselves. If your parents take you, of course, that's another matter.
example.tran: 你们不该自己去这些地方。不过如果是父母带你们去的，那就另当别论了。

collins.tran: 出于（时间）的考虑;作为（紧急）事件（处理）
collins.def: If you are going to do something as a matter of urgency or priority, you are going to do it as soon as possible, because it is important.

example.ex: Your doctor and health visitor can help a great deal and you need to talk about it with them as a matter of urgency.
example.tran: 你的医生和家访护士会帮很大的忙。你应该和他们谈一谈，这是当务之急。

collins.def: If something is no easy matter, it is  difficult to do it.

example.ex: Choosing the colour for the drawing-room walls was no easy matter.
example.tran: 选择客厅墙壁的颜色绝非易事。

collins.tran: 此事已定;(事情)到此为止，到此结束
collins.def: If someone says that's the end of the matter or that's an end to the matter, they mean that a decision that has been taken must not be changed or discussed any more.

example.ex: 'He's moving in here,' Maria said. 'So that's the end of the matter.'
example.tran: “他就要搬来住了，”玛丽亚说，“那么就这么定了。”

collins.tran: 事实真相是;真实情况是
collins.def: You use the fact of the matter is or the truth of the matter is to introduce a fact which supports what you are saying or which is not widely known, for example because it is a secret.

example.ex: The fact of the matter is that most people consume far more protein than they actually need...
example.tran: 真实的情况是，大多数人摄入的蛋白质比他们实际所需的多出许多。

example.ex: The truth of the matter is that he was having an identity crisis when he met Carina.
example.tran: 实际情况是，他认识卡丽娜时正在迷失自我。

collins.def: You can use for that matter to emphasize that the remark you are making is true in the same way as your previous, similar remark.

example.ex: The irony was that Shawn had not seen her. Nor for that matter had anyone else...
example.tran: 具有讽刺意味的是，肖恩并没有见过她，别人也同样如此。

example.ex: A great deal of hard work was done and, for that matter, is continuing.
example.tran: 大量艰苦的工作已经完成，同样，大量艰苦的工作也仍在继续。

collins.def: You say 'it doesn't matter' to tell someone who is apologizing to you that you are not angry or upset, and that they should not worry.

example.ex: 'Did I wake you?' — 'Yes, but it doesn't matter.'
example.tran: “我把你吵醒了？”——“是的，不过没关系。”

collins.def: You say 'it doesn't matter' when someone offers you a choice between two or more things and you do not mind which is chosen.

example.ex: 'Steve, what do you want?' — 'Coke, Pepsi, it doesn't matter.'
example.tran: “史蒂夫，你要喝点什么？”——“可口可乐，百事，随便啦。”

collins.def: If you say that something is no laughing matter, you mean that it is very serious and not something that you should laugh or joke about.

example.ex: Their behaviour is an offence. It's no laughing matter.
example.tran: 他们这么做是犯罪，这可不是开玩笑的。

collins.def: If you say that something makes matters worse, you mean that it makes a difficult situation even more difficult.

example.ex: Don't let yourself despair; this will only make matters worse...
example.tran: 不要想不开，这样只能使情况变得更糟。

example.ex: To make matters worse, it started to rain again.
example.tran: 更糟的是，又开始下雨了。

collins.def: You say 'no matter' after you have just asked a question or mentioned an idea or doubt and you have decided that it is not really important, interesting, or worth discussing.

example.ex: 'Didn't you ever read the book?' Keating shook his head. 'Well, no matter.'...
example.tran: “你从没看过这本书？”基廷摇了摇头。“嗯，没关系。”

example.ex: 'Shoddy workmanship these days,' he remarked. 'No matter, it will still bear my weight.'
example.tran: “现如今的做工实在是差劲，”他说，“无所谓了，好歹还撑得住我的体重。”

collins.def: You use no matter in expressions such as 'no matter how' and 'no matter what' to say that something is true or happens in all circumstances.

example.ex: No matter what your age, you can lose weight by following this program...
example.tran: 不论年龄多大，都可以按这套方案来减肥。

example.ex: No matter how often they were urged, they could not bring themselves to join in...
example.tran: 就算别人说破了嘴皮，他们就是不加入。

collins.def: If you say that you are going to do something no matter what, you are emphasizing that you are definitely going to do it, even if there are obstacles or difficulties.

example.ex: He had decided to publish the manuscript no matter what...
example.tran: 他决定无论如何都要出版那部手稿。

example.ex: I vowed then, no matter what, I would never be like those people.
example.tran: 于是我发誓，无论如何，我和他们那种人都不会成为一丘之貉。

collins.tran: 看法问题;看法因人而异的事情
collins.def: If you say that a statement is a matter of opinion, you mean that it is not a fact, and that other people, including yourself, do not agree  with it.

example.ex: 'We're not that contrived. We're not that theatrical.' — 'That's a matter of opinion.'
example.tran: “我们没那么造作，也没那么夸张。”——“见仁见智喽。”

collins.tran: (只是)时间的问题（用于说明某事必定发生）
collins.def: If you say that something is just a matter of time, you mean that it is certain to happen at some time in the future.

example.ex: It would be only a matter of time before he went through with it.
example.tran: 他完成这件事只是时间问题。

means: 猎狐运动（尤其英式英语）

collins.def: If you meet someone, you happen to be in the same place as them and start talking to them. You may know the other person, but be surprised to see them, or you may not know them at all.

example.ex: I have just met the man I want to spend the rest of my life with...
example.tran: 我刚刚遇到了我想与之共度余生的男人。

example.ex: He's the kindest and sincerest person I've ever met...
example.tran: 他是我所见过的最友善、最真诚的人。

collins.def: If two or more people meet, they go to the same place, which they have earlier arranged to do, so that they can talk or do something together.

example.ex: We could meet for a drink after work...
example.tran: 下班后我们可以见面喝上一杯。

example.ex: Meet me down at the beach tomorrow, at 6am sharp.
example.tran: 明天早上6点整在海滩上跟我见面。

collins.def: If you meet someone, you are introduced to them and begin talking to them and getting to know them.

example.ex: Hey, Terry, come and meet my Dad.
example.tran: 嗨，特里，过来认识一下我爸爸。

collins.def: You use meet in expressions such as 'Pleased to meet you' and 'Nice to have met you' when you want to politely say hello or goodbye to someone you have just met for the first time.

example.ex: 'Jennifer,' Miss Mallory said, 'this is Leigh Van-Voreen.' — 'Pleased to meet you,' Jennifer said...
example.tran: “珍妮弗，”马洛里小姐说，“这位是利·范沃林。”——“见到您很高兴，”珍妮弗说。

example.ex: I have to leave. Nice to have met you.
example.tran: 我得走了。认识您很高兴。

collins.tran: (到火车站、飞机场或公共汽车站)迎接
collins.def: If you meet someone off their train, plane, or bus, you go to the station, airport, or bus stop in order to be there when they arrive.

example.ex: Mama met me at the station...
example.tran: 妈妈在车站接我。

example.ex: Lili and my father met me off the boat...
example.tran: 莉莉和我父亲在码头迎接我。

collins.def: When a group of people such as a committee meet, they gather together for a particular purpose.

example.ex: Officials from the two countries will meet again soon to resume negotiations...
example.tran: 两国官员不久将再度会晤以重启谈判。

example.ex: The commission met 14 times between 1988 and 1991.
example.tran: 1988至1991年间，该委员会举行了14次会议。

collins.def: If you meet with someone, you have a meeting with them.

example.ex: Most of the lawmakers who met with the president yesterday said they backed the mission.
example.tran: 大多数昨天与总统会晤的立法者说他们支持这个行动。

collins.def: If something such as a suggestion, proposal, or new book meets with or is met with a particular reaction, it gets that reaction from people.

example.ex: The idea met with a cool response from various quarters...
example.tran: 这个想法遭到了各方人士的冷遇。

example.ex: We hope today's offer will meet with your approval too...
example.tran: 我们希望今天的提议也能够得到您的首肯。

collins.def: If something meets a need, requirement, or condition, it is good enough to do what is required.

example.ex: The current arrangements for the care of severely mentally ill people are inadequate to meet their needs...
example.tran: 目前对严重精神病患者的护理安排不足以满足他们的需要。

example.ex: Out of the original 23,000 applications, 16,000 candidates meet the entry requirements.
example.tran: 最初的2.3万份申请中有1.6万份满足入选的要求。

collins.def: If you meet something such as a problem or challenge, you deal with it satisfactorily or do what is required.

example.ex: British manufacturing failed to meet the crisis of the 1970s...
example.tran: 英国制造业未能经受住20世纪70年代危机的考验。

example.ex: It is an enormous challenge but we hope to meet it within a year or 18 months...
example.tran: 这是一个巨大的挑战，但是我们希望在1年或18个月之内能够战胜它。

collins.def: If you meet the cost of something, you provide the money that is needed for it.

example.ex: The government said it will help meet some of the cost of the damage...
example.tran: 政府说将帮助支付损害造成的部分费用。

example.ex: As your income increases you will find less difficulty in finding the money to meet your monthly repayments.
example.tran: 随着收入的增加，你会发现筹钱支付每月的还款没那么难了。

collins.tran: 碰上，遇到，遭遇(情况、态度、问题等)
collins.def: If you meet a situation, attitude, or problem, you experience it or become aware of it.

example.ex: I honestly don't know how I will react the next time I meet a potentially dangerous situation...
example.tran: 我真不知道下次再碰上有潜在危险的情况时会作何反应。

example.ex: Never had she met such spite and pettiness.
example.tran: 她从未遭遇过如此恶毒和狭隘的事情。

collins.def: You can say that someone meets with success or failure when they are successful or unsuccessful.

example.ex: Attempts to find civilian volunteers have met with embarrassing failure...
example.tran: 寻找平民志愿者的种种尝试都遭遇了令人难堪的失败。

example.ex: Efforts to commercialise the Russian space programme have met with little success.
example.tran: 为使俄罗斯太空项目走向商业化而作出的种种努力几乎没有取得什么成功。

collins.def: When a moving object meets another object, it hits or touches it.

example.ex: You sense the stresses in the hull each time the keel meets the ground...
example.tran: 每次龙骨触地的时候你都能感受到船体所受的压力。

example.ex: Nick's head bent slowly over hers until their mouths met.
example.tran: 尼克慢慢向她低下头去，直到他们的嘴唇碰在了一起。

collins.def: If your eyes meet someone else's, you both look at each other at the same time.

example.ex: Nina's eyes met her sisters' across the table...
example.tran: 尼娜与桌子对面的姐妹们目光相遇。

example.ex: I found myself smiling back instinctively when our eyes met.
example.tran: 我发现当我们的目光相遇时，我本能地还以微笑。

collins.tran: (两片区域,尤指两片陆地或海洋)相接，汇合,相邻
collins.def: If two areas meet, especially two areas of land or sea, they are next to one another.

example.ex: It is one of the rare places in the world where the desert meets the sea.
example.tran: 世界上沙漠与大海相接的地方非常少见，这里就是一处。

example.ex: ...the southernmost point of South America where the Pacific and Atlantic oceans meet.
example.tran: 南美洲最南端、太平洋与大西洋的汇合处

collins.def: The place where two lines meet is the place where they join together.

example.ex: Parallel lines will never meet no matter how far extended...
example.tran: 无论延伸多长，平行线永不相交。

example.ex: The track widened as it met the road.
example.tran: 小路在和公路相交的地方变宽了。

collins.tran: (两个运动员、球队或军队)比赛,较量,交锋
collins.def: If two sportsmen, teams, or armies meet, they compete or fight against one another.

example.ex: The two women will meet tomorrow in the final...
example.tran: 这两位女选手将在明天的决赛里决一胜负。

example.ex: The unevenly matched armies met at Guilford on 15 March 1781...
example.tran: 1781年3月15日，力量悬殊的两支队伍在吉尔福德狭路相逢。

collins.def: A meet is an event in which athletes come to a particular place in order to take part in a race or races.

example.ex: John Pennel became the first person to pole-vault 17 ft., at a meet in Miami, Florida.
example.tran: 约翰·佩内尔在佛罗里达迈阿密的一次运动会上成为撑竿越过17英尺的第一人。

collins.def: A meet is when riders and dogs gather somewhere before they set off on a fox hunt.

collins.tran: 迎着(或直视)(某人的)目光
collins.def: If you do not meet someone's eyes or meet someone's gaze, you do not look at them although they are looking at you, for example because you are ashamed.

example.ex: He hesitated, then shook his head, refusing to meet her eyes.
example.tran: 他犹豫起来，然后摇摇头，避开了她的目光。

collins.def: If someone meets their death or meets their end, they die, especially in a violent or suspicious way.

example.ex: Jacob Sinclair met his death at the hands of a soldier...
example.tran: 雅各布·辛克莱在一名士兵的手里送了命。

example.ex: No one knows exactly how or where he met his end.
example.tran: 没有人知道他究竟是如何或在何处丢掉性命的。

collins.def: A meeting is  an event in which a group of people come together to discuss things or make decisions.

example.ex: Can we have a meeting to discuss that?
example.tran: 我们可以开会来讨论那件事吗？

example.ex: ...business meetings.
example.tran: 商业会议

collins.def: When you meet someone, either by chance or by arrangement, you can refer to this event as a meeting .

example.ex: In January, 37 years after our first meeting, I was back in the studio with Denis...
example.tran: 那是1月，在我们初次相遇37年之后，我和丹尼斯一同回到了工作室。

example.ex: Her life was changed by a chance meeting with her former art master a few years ago.
example.tran: 她的生活因几年前同她以前的美术老师的偶遇改变了。

means: 身体部位（尤指胳膊或腿）

collins.def: A member of a group is one of the people, animals, or things belonging to that group.

example.ex: He refused to name the members of staff involved...
example.tran: 他拒绝说出所涉及员工的姓名。

example.ex: Their lack of training could put members of the public at risk.
example.tran: 他们缺乏训练，这有可能会使民众面临风险。

collins.def: A member of an organization such as a club or a political party is a person who has officially joined the organization.

example.ex: The support of our members is of great importance to the Association...
example.tran: 会员的支持对于我们协会来说非常重要。

example.ex: Britain is a full member of NATO.
example.tran: 英国是北大西洋公约组织的正式成员国。

collins.tran: (某国际组织的)会员国，成员国
collins.def: A member country or member state is one of the countries that has joined an international organization or group.

example.ex: ...the member countries of the European Free Trade Association.
example.tran: 欧洲自由贸易联盟的成员国

example.ex: ...a co-ordinated approach, with each member state doing what it could.
example.tran: 各成员国尽其所能的协作方式

collins.def: A member or Member is a person who has been elected to a  parliament or legislature.

example.ex: He was elected to Parliament as the Member for Leeds.
example.tran: 他当选为利兹市议员而进入了议会。

example.ex: ...the Conservative member for Billericay.
example.tran: 代表比勒里基的保守党议员

collins.def: The middle of something is the part of it that is furthest from its edges, ends, or outside surface.

example.ex: Howard stood in the middle of the room sipping a cup of coffee...
example.tran: 霍华德站在房间中央，小口抿着一杯咖啡。

example.ex: Hyde accelerated away from the kerb, swerving out into the middle of the street...
example.tran: 海德加速驶离路边，突然向街道中央一个急转弯。

collins.def: The middle object in a row of objects is the one that has an equal number of  objects on each side.

example.ex: The middle button of his uniform jacket was strained over his belly.
example.tran: 制服上装中间的纽扣在他的肚子上绷得紧紧的。

example.ex: ...the middle finger of her left hand.
example.tran: 她左手的中指

collins.def: Your middle is the part of your body around your stomach.

example.ex: At age fifty-three, he now has a few extra pounds around his middle...
example.tran: 53岁的他腰间长了几磅赘肉。

example.ex: The cook's apron covered her middle.
example.tran: 厨用围裙裹着她的腰部。

collins.def: The middle of an event or period of time is the part that comes after the first part and before the last part.

example.ex: I woke up in the middle of the night and could hear a tapping on the window...
example.tran: 我半夜里醒来，听见有敲窗户的声音。

example.ex: It was now the middle of November, cold and often foggy...
example.tran: 现在是11月中旬，天气寒冷而且经常有雾。

collins.def: If someone is in their middle thirties, for example, they are aged somewhere approximately between thirty-four and thirty-six.

example.ex: She knew he was in his middle fifties, although he looked much younger...
example.tran: 尽管他看上去年轻得多，她知道他在55岁左右。

example.ex: I went on competing till I was in my middle forties.
example.tran: 我继续参赛，直到45岁左右。

collins.tran: (兄弟姐妹中)年龄居中的，排行居中的
collins.def: The middle child in a family has equal numbers of younger and older brothers and sisters.

example.ex: His middle son died in a drowning accident five years back.
example.tran: 他排行居中的那个儿子5年前意外溺水身亡。

collins.tran: 折中的;中庸之道的;不走极端的
collins.def: The middle course or way is a moderate course of action that lies between two opposite and extreme courses.

example.ex: He favoured a middle course between free enterprise and state intervention...
example.tran: 他更倾向于在自由经营与国家干预之间走一条中庸之道。

example.ex: The Mayor of Jerusalem has tried to minimise conflict by maintaining a middle way between the various religions.
example.tran: 耶路撒冷市市长对各宗教采取折中的态度，力图使冲突最小化。

collins.def: If you divide or split something down the middle, you divide or split it into two equal halves or groups.

example.ex: They agreed to split the bill down the middle...
example.tran: 他们同意均摊费用。

example.ex: If the conservatives are not removed, then the party will almost certainly split down the middle.
example.tran: 如果不除掉保守势力，那么这个党几乎肯定会分裂成两派。

collins.def: If you are in the middle of doing something, you are busy doing it.

example.ex: It's a bit hectic. I'm in the middle of cooking for nine people...
example.tran: 我正忙着为9个人做饭呢，有点儿忙不过来。

example.ex: He was always in the middle of a business transaction.
example.tran: 他总是忙着做生意。

collins.def: Military means relating to the armed forces of a country.

example.ex: Military action may become necessary...
example.tran: 也许有必要采取军事行动。

example.ex: The president is sending in almost 20,000 military personnel to help with the relief efforts.
example.tran: 总统将派出近2万名军事人员协助救灾工作。

collins.def: Military means relating to or belonging to the army, rather than to the navy or the air force.

example.ex: The attack has caused severe damage to American naval and military forces.
example.tran: 这次攻击给美国的海军和陆军都造成了重创。

collins.tran: 军队;军人;(尤指)高级军官
collins.def: The military are the armed forces of a country, especially officers of high rank.

example.ex: The bombing has been far more widespread than the military will admit...
example.tran: 轰炸的范围远远大于军方愿意承认的范围。

example.ex: Did you serve in the military?
example.tran: 你当过兵吗？

collins.def: Military means well-organized, controlled, or neat, in a way that is typical of a soldier.

example.ex: Your working day will need to be organized with military precision.
example.tran: 需要对你的工作日进行精确有序的安排。

example.ex: He has a military bearing, never failing to carry himself erect.
example.tran: 他有一种军人的风姿，身板总是挺得笔直。

collins.def: A million or one million is the number 1,000,000.

example.ex: Up to five million people a year visit the county...
example.tran: 每年参观这个县的人多达500万。

example.ex: Profits for 1999 topped £100 million.
example.tran: 1999年的利润超过了1亿英镑。

collins.tran: 数百万的；大量的；数不清的;不计其数的
collins.def: If you talk about millions of people or things, you mean that there is a very large number of them but you do not know or do not want to say exactly how many.

example.ex: The programme was viewed on television in millions of homes.
example.tran: 无数家庭通过电视收看了这个节目。

collins.def: In Britain and some other countries, a minister is a person who is in charge of a particular government department.

example.ex: When the government had come to power, he had been named minister of culture...
example.tran: 这届政府开始执政的时候，他被任命为文化部部长。

example.ex: The new Defence Minister is Senator Robert Ray.
example.tran: 新任国防部部长是参议员罗伯特·雷。

collins.tran: (比大使低一级的)公使，外交使节
collins.def: A minister is a person who officially represents their government in a foreign country and has a lower rank than an ambassador.

example.ex: He concluded a deal with the Danish minister in Washington.
example.tran: 他与驻华盛顿的丹麦公使签订了一项协议。

collins.def: A minister is a member of the clergy, especially in Protestant churches.

example.ex: His father was a Baptist minister.
example.tran: 他的父亲是浸礼会牧师。

collins.def: If you minister to people or to their needs, you serve them or help them, for example by making sure that they have everything they need or want.

example.ex: For 44 years he had ministered to the poor, the sick, the neglected and the deprived.
example.tran: 44年来，他一直致力于帮助那些穷人、病人、无人照料的人和失去生活依靠的人。

collins.def: You can refer to a very short period of time, for example a few seconds, as a moment or moments .

example.ex: In a moment he was gone...
example.tran: 一转眼他就不见了。

example.ex: She stared at him a moment, then turned away...
example.tran: 她凝视他片刻，然后转过脸去。

collins.def: A particular moment is the point in time at which something happens.

example.ex: At this moment a car stopped at the house...
example.tran: 就在这时，一辆轿车在房前停下了。

example.ex: Many people still remember the moment when they heard that President Kennedy had been assassinated.
example.tran: 很多人仍然记得听到肯尼迪总统遇刺的那一刻。

collins.def: If you say that something will or may happen at any moment or any moment now, you are emphasizing that it is likely to happen very soon.

example.ex: They ran the risk of being shot at any moment...
example.tran: 他们冒着随时会中弹的危险。

example.ex: He'll be here to see you any moment now.
example.tran: 他马上就会来这儿看你。

collins.def: You use expressions such as at the moment ,at this moment, and at the present moment to indicate that a particular situation exists at the time when you are speaking.

example.ex: At the moment, no one is talking to me...
example.tran: 此刻没人跟我说话。

example.ex: This is being planned at the present moment...
example.tran: 目前这件事正在计划中。

collins.def: If you say that you do not believe for a moment or for one moment that something is true, you are emphasizing that you do not believe that it could possibly be true.

example.ex: I don't for a moment think there'll be a divorce.
example.tran: 我从来没想过将来会离婚。

collins.def: You use for the moment to indicate that something is true now, even if it will not be true in the future.

example.ex: For the moment, however, the government is happy to live with it.
example.tran: 不过目前政府对此还乐于容忍。

collins.tran: 有成功(或得意)的时刻；有吸引人的时刻
collins.def: If you say that someone or something has their moments, you are indicating that there are times when they are successful or interesting, but that this does not happen very often.

example.ex: The film has its moments...
example.tran: 这部电影有其吸引人之处。

example.ex: He's not the thoroughly outgoing character you'd predict, although he has his moments.
example.tran: 虽然他也有活泼的时候，但他并非如你所想的那么外向。

collins.def: If someone does something at the last moment, they do it at the latest time possible.

example.ex: They changed their minds at the last moment and refused to go.
example.tran: 他们在最后一刻改变主意，决定不去了。

collins.tran: 下一刻，一会儿，紧接着（尤指突然发生很大变化）
collins.def: You use the expression the next moment, or expressions such as 'one moment he was there, the next he was gone', to emphasize that something happens suddenly, especially when it is very different from what was happening before.

example.ex: The next moment there was an almighty crash...
example.tran: 接着发生了剧烈的撞击。

example.ex: He is unpredictable, weeping one moment, laughing the next.
example.tran: 他喜怒无常，一会儿哭，一会儿笑。

collins.def: You use of the moment to describe someone or something that is or was especially popular at a particular time, especially when you want to suggest that their popularity is unlikely to last long or did not last long.

example.ex: He's the man of the moment, isn't he?
example.tran: 他现在很红，不是吗？

example.ex: He calls it a 'contraption', using his favourite word of the moment.
example.tran: 他用了眼下他最喜欢说的“玩意儿”一词来称呼它。

collins.def: If you say that something happens the moment something else happens, you are emphasizing that it happens immediately after the other thing.

example.ex: The moment I closed my eyes, I fell asleep.
example.tran: 我闭上眼睛就睡着了。

collins.def: Money is the coins or bank notes that you use to buy things, or the sum that you have in a bank account.

example.ex: A lot of the money that you pay at the cinema goes back to the film distributors...
example.tran: 你在电影院消费的一大部分钱都会回到电影发行商手里。

example.ex: Players should be allowed to earn money from advertising...
example.tran: 应该允许运动员拍广告挣钱。

collins.def: Monies is used to refer to several separate sums of money that form part of a larger amount that is received or spent.

example.ex: We drew up a schedule of payments for the rest of the monies owed.
example.tran: 我们起草了一份剩余欠款的还款计划。

example.ex: ...the investment and management of monies by pension funds.
example.tran: 养老基金对资金的投资与管理

collins.tran: 有花不完的钱;钱多得烫手;钱多得烧包
collins.def: If you say that someone has  money to burn, you mean that they have more money than they need or that they spend their money on things that you think are unnecessary.

example.ex: He was a high-earning broker with money to burn.
example.tran: 他是高收入的经纪人，有花不完的钱。

collins.tran: 非常有钱的;手头宽裕的
collins.def: If you are in the money, you have a lot of money to spend.

example.ex: If you are one of the lucky callers chosen to play, you could be in the money.
example.tran: 如果你有幸成为其中一个被选中参加表演的来电者，就可能会赚大钱。

collins.def: If you make money, you obtain money by earning it or by making a profit.

example.ex: They couldn't find work or make money in the cities.
example.tran: 他们在城市找不到工作，也赚不到钱。

example.ex: ...the only bit of the firm that consistently made money.
example.tran: 公司唯一一直赚钱的一小块业务

collins.tran: 用行动证明自己的话；说到做到;说给钱就给钱
collins.def: If you say that you want someone to put their money where their mouth is, you want them to spend money to improve a bad situation, instead of just talking about improving it.

example.ex: The government might be obliged to put its money where its mouth is to prove its commitment.
example.tran: 政府也许会被迫付出行动，以兑现承诺。

collins.tran: (因掌握内情而下的)高明赌注
collins.def: If you say that the smart money is on a particular person or thing, you mean that people who know a lot about it think that this person will be successful, or this thing will happen.

example.ex: With England not playing, the smart money was on the Germans...
example.tran: 英格兰队没有参赛，所以人们看好德国队应该会赢。

collins.tran: 金钱万能;有钱能使鬼推磨
collins.def: If you say that money talks, you mean that if someone has a lot of money, they also have a lot of power.

example.ex: The formula in Hollywood is simple—money talks.
example.tran: 好莱坞的生存规则很简单，就是金钱万能。

collins.def: If you say that someone is throwing money at a problem, you are critical of them for trying to improve it by spending money on it, instead of doing more thoughtful and practical things to  improve it.

example.ex: The Australian government's answer to the problem has been to throw money at it.
example.tran: 澳大利亚政府对这个问题的解决方案一直就是大把往里扔钱。

collins.tran: 花钱填无底洞;继续砸钱
collins.def: If you say that someone is throwing good money after bad, you are critical of them for trying to improve a bad situation by spending more money on it, instead of doing more thoughtful or practical things to improve it.

example.ex: Further heavy intervention would be throwing good money after bad.
example.tran: 进一步加大干预的力度只会是继续白扔钱。

collins.tran: 钱花得值;物有所值；没白忙活
collins.def: If you get your money's worth, you get something which is worth the money that it costs or the effort you have put in.

example.ex: The fans get their money's worth.
example.tran: 粉丝们的钱没白花。

collins.def: A month is one of the twelve periods of time that a year is divided into, for example January or February.

example.ex: The trial is due to begin next month.
example.tran: 审判将于下个月开始。

example.ex: ...an exhibition which opens this month at London's Design Museum...
example.tran: 这个月在伦敦设计博物馆开办的展览

collins.def: A month is a period of about four weeks.

example.ex: She was here for a month...
example.tran: 她在这儿呆了一个月。

example.ex: Over the next several months I met most of her family...
example.tran: 在后来的几个月里，我见到了她的大部分家人。

means: 达到或处于更大的范围或程度
更多的或附加的人或事物

collins.tran: 更多;较多(该词前可使用 a little，a lot，a bit，far和much)
collins.def: You use more to indicate that there is a greater amount of something than before or than average, or than something else. You can use 'a little', 'a lot', 'a bit', 'far', and 'much' in front of more .

example.ex: More and more people are surviving heart attacks...
example.tran: 越来越多的心脏病患者存活下来。

example.ex: He spent more time perfecting his dance moves instead of gym work.
example.tran: 他把更多的时间用于完善舞蹈动作，而不是健身训练。

collins.def: You use more than before a number or amount to say that the actual number or amount is even greater.

example.ex: The Afghan authorities say the airport had been closed for more than a year.
example.tran: 阿富汗当局称，该机场已经关闭一年多了。

example.ex: ...classy leather and silk jackets at more than £250.
example.tran: 价格在250英镑以上的时髦皮革和丝绸夹克

collins.def: You use more to indicate that something or someone has a greater amount of a quality than they used to or than is average or usual.

example.ex: Prison conditions have become more brutal...
example.tran: 监狱条件变得更加严酷。

example.ex: We can satisfy our basic wants more easily than in the past.
example.tran: 现在我们的基本需求可以比过去更容易得到满足。

collins.tran: 更像（前者）地;与其说（是）…，倒不如说（是）
collins.def: If you say that something is more one thing than another, you mean that it is like the first thing rather than the second.

example.ex: The exhibition at Boston's Museum of Fine Arts is more a production than it is a museum display...
example.tran: 波士顿美术博物馆的展览与其说是一次博物馆展出，倒不如说是一场精心设计的展演活动。

example.ex: He's more like a film star than a lifeguard, really...
example.tran: 真的，与其说他像救生员，不如说他更像电影明星。

collins.def: If you do something more than before or more than someone else, you do it to a greater extent or more often.

example.ex: When we are tired, tense, depressed or unwell, we feel pain much more...
example.tran: 当我们劳累、紧张、沮丧或生病时，疼痛感更明显。

example.ex: What impressed me more was that she knew Tennessee Williams.
example.tran: 让我印象更深的是她认识田纳西·威廉斯。

collins.def: You can use more to indicate that something continues to happen for a further period of time.

example.ex: Things might have been different if I'd talked a bit more.
example.tran: 如果当时我再多说一点的话，结果或许会不一样。

collins.def: You use more to indicate that something is repeated. For example, if you do something 'once more', you do it again once.

example.ex: This train would stop twice more in the suburbs before rolling southeast toward Munich...
example.tran: 火车向东南驶往慕尼黑前，会在郊区再停两站。

example.ex: The breathing exercises should be repeated several times more.
example.tran: 呼吸练习应该再多重复几次。

collins.tran: 另外的;附加的(该词前可使用 a little，a lot，a bit，far 和 much)
collins.def: You use more to refer to an additional thing or amount. You can use 'a little', 'a lot', 'a bit', 'far' and 'much' in front of more .

example.ex: They needed more time to consider whether to hold an inquiry.
example.tran: 他们需要更多的时间来考虑是否进行调查。

collins.tran: (用于 no more，no less, neither more nor less 等短语中，表示所说完全无误)多了的部分
collins.def: You can use more in expressions like 'no more, no less' and 'neither more nor less' to indicate that what you are saying is exactly true or correct.

example.ex: I told him the truth. No more, no less...
example.tran: 我告诉了他真相，未加任何演绎。

example.ex: I'm sixty-two. I feel sixty-two, neither more nor less.
example.tran: 我现在62岁了，感觉自己也确实到这把年纪了。

collins.def: You use more in conversations when you want to draw someone's attention to something interesting or important that you are about to say.

example.ex: Europe's economies have converged in several areas. More interestingly, there has been convergence in economic growth rates...
example.tran: 欧洲的经济已在多个领域互相趋同;更有意思的是，各国经济增长率也渐趋一致。

example.ex: More seriously for him, there are members who say he is wrong on this issue.
example.tran: 对他来说更严重的是，有成员说他在这个问题上错了。

collins.def: You can use more and more to indicate that something is becoming greater in amount, extent, or degree all the time.

example.ex: Her life was heading more and more where she wanted it to go...
example.tran: 她的生活越来越接近她理想的目标。

example.ex: Bob became more and more furious...
example.tran: 鲍勃火气越来越大。

collins.def: If something is more or less true, it is true in a general way, but is not completely true.

example.ex: The Conference is more or less  over...
example.tran: 会议快结束了。

example.ex: He more or less started the firm...
example.tran: 他基本上启动了公司的业务。

collins.def: If something is more than a particular thing, it has greater value or importance than this thing.

example.ex: He's more than a coach, he's a friend.
example.tran: 他不只是教练，更是朋友。

collins.def: You use more than to say that something is true to a greater degree than is necessary or than average.

example.ex: Lithuania produces more than enough food to feed itself.
example.tran: 立陶宛的粮食生产供大于求。

example.ex: ...accommodation which is roomy and offers more than generous stowage.
example.tran: 住宿宽敞，储藏空间绰绰有余

collins.def: You use no more than or not more than when you want to emphasize how small a number or amount is.

example.ex: Each box requires no more than a few hours of labor to build...
example.tran: 做成一个盒子不超过几个小时。

example.ex: He was a kid really, not more than eighteen or nineteen.
example.tran: 他实际上还是个孩子，最多不过十八九岁。

collins.def: If you say that someone or something is nothing more than a particular thing, you are emphasizing that they are only that thing, and nothing more interesting or important.

example.ex: The newly discovered notes are nothing more than Lang's personal journal.
example.tran: 新发现的笔记只不过是朗的个人日志。

collins.tran: 更有甚者;更为重要的是;此外
collins.def: You can use what is more or what's more to introduce an extra piece of information which supports or emphasizes the point you are making.

example.ex: Many more institutions, especially banks, were allowed to lend money for mortgages, and what was more, banks could lend out more money than they actually held...
example.tran: 允许更多的机构，尤其是银行推出抵押贷款;此外，银行发放的贷款可以超过其实际持有资金。

example.ex: You should remember it, and what's more, you should get it right.
example.tran: 你应该记住它，更重要的是，应该正确理解它。

collins.tran: 早晨;上午(从人们通常醒来到中午或午餐前的一段时间)
collins.def: The morning is the part of each day between the time that people usually wake up and 12 o'clock noon or lunchtime.

example.ex: During the morning your guide will take you around the city...
example.tran: 导游上午会带你们游览全城。

example.ex: On Sunday morning Bill was woken by the telephone...
example.tran: 星期天早晨，比尔被电话铃声吵醒了。

collins.tran: 凌晨，早晨，上午(从子夜到中午的这段时间)
collins.def: If you refer to a particular time in the morning, you mean a time between 12 o'clock midnight and 12 o'clock noon.

example.ex: I often stayed up until two or three in the morning...
example.tran: 我经常凌晨两三点才睡。

example.ex: The attack happened in the early hours of the morning.
example.tran: 在凌晨发起了进攻。

collins.def: If you say that something will happen in the morning, you mean that it will happen during the morning of the following day.

example.ex: I'll fly it to London in the morning...
example.tran: 我明天上午会把它用航空快件寄到伦敦。

example.ex: Melanie promised that she would call them in the morning.
example.tran: 梅拉妮许诺第二天上午给他们打电话。

collins.tran: 日日夜夜;夜以继日；一直
collins.def: If you say that something happens morning, noon and night, you mean that it happens all the time.

example.ex: You get fit by playing the game, day in, day out, morning, noon and night.
example.tran: 从早到晚都坚持做这项运动，日复一日，你就能强壮起来。

collins.def: You use most to refer to the majority of a group of things or people or the largest part of something.

example.ex: Most of the houses in the capital don't have piped water...
example.tran: 首都的大部分房屋没有自来水。

example.ex: By stopping smoking you are undoing most of the damage smoking has caused...
example.tran: 通过戒烟可以消除吸烟造成的大部分危害。

collins.def: You use the most to mean a larger amount than anyone or anything else, or the largest amount possible.

example.ex: The President himself won the most votes...
example.tran: 总统本人获得最多选票。

example.ex: The skippers get the most money, and after them the cooks...
example.tran: 船长拿到的钱最多，其次是厨师。

collins.def: You use most to indicate that something is true or happens to a greater degree or extent than anything else.

example.ex: What she feared most was becoming like her mother...
example.tran: 她最怕的就是变得像她妈妈那样。

example.ex: What they wanted most from the president was a leader who at least would try to educate the country.
example.tran: 他们对总统最大的期待是，至少他应尽力教诲国民。

collins.def: You use most to indicate that someone or something has a greater amount of a particular quality than most other things of its kind.

example.ex: Her children had the best, most elaborate birthday parties in the neighborhood...
example.tran: 她的孩子们的生日聚会在街坊四邻里是最好、最讲究的。

example.ex: He was one of the most influential performers of modern jazz...
example.tran: 他是现代爵士乐最有影响力的表演者之一。

collins.tran: 最大限度地;最频繁地;最多地
collins.def: If you do something the most, you do it to the greatest extent possible or with the greatest frequency.

example.ex: What question are you asked the most?...
example.tran: 你们被问及最多的问题是什么？

example.ex: Inevitably those who suffer the most are the mothers and children...
example.tran: 妇女和儿童必然是最遭罪的。

collins.tran: (在谈话中用于引起注意)最…，极其…
collins.def: You use most in conversations when you want to draw someone's attention to something very interesting or important that you are about to say.

example.ex: Most surprisingly, quite a few said they don't intend to vote at all...
example.tran: 最让人吃惊的是，相当多的人说他们根本不打算参加投票。

example.ex: Most interestingly, they are  demanding that a national working party on crimes against women and children be established.
example.tran: 最令人关注的是，他们要求针对侵害妇女和儿童的犯罪成立全国专案组。

collins.def: You use most to emphasize an adjective or adverb.

example.ex: I'll be most pleased to speak to them...
example.tran: 能跟他们谈谈我会十分高兴。

example.ex: I believe he is most painfully anxious about Diana.
example.tran: 我相信他肯定非常担心黛安娜。

collins.def: You use at most or at the most to say that a number or amount is the maximum that is possible and that the actual number or amount may be smaller.

example.ex: Poach the pears in apple juice for perhaps ten minutes at most.
example.tran: 把梨放入苹果汁中，最多煮10分钟左右。

example.ex: ...staying on at school for two extra years to study only three, or at the most four subjects...
example.tran: 在学校再多呆两年学习仅仅三门、至多四门课程

collins.def: If you make the most of something, you get the maximum use or advantage from it.

example.ex: Happiness is the ability to make the most of what you have...
example.tran: 幸福就是有能力充分享受你拥有的一切。

example.ex: Making the most of your hair means getting the cut and shape right.
example.tran: 让头发达到最佳效果意味着要修剪得当，并选择合适的发型。

collins.def: Your mother is the woman who gave birth to you. You can also call someone your mother if she brings you up as if she was this woman.

example.ex: She sat on the edge of her mother's bed...
example.tran: 她坐在母亲床边。

example.ex: She's an English teacher and a mother of two children...
example.tran: 她是英语教师，还是两个孩子的母亲。

collins.def: If a woman mothers a child, she looks after it and brings it up, usually because she is its mother.

example.ex: Colleen had dreamed of mothering a large family.
example.tran: 科琳曾梦想抚养一群孩子。

collins.def: If you mother someone, you treat them with great care and affection, as if they were a small child.

example.ex: She felt a great need to mother him...
example.tran: 她迫切地感到要细心照料他。

example.ex: Stop mothering me.
example.tran: 别再宠我了。

collins.def: When you move something or when it moves, its position changes and it does not remain still.

example.ex: She moved the sheaf of papers into position...
example.tran: 她把那捆报纸挪到合适的地方。

example.ex: You can move the camera both vertically and horizontally...
example.tran: 你可以上下左右移动摄像机。

collins.def: When you move, you change your position or go to a different place.

example.ex: She waited for him to get up, but he didn't move...
example.tran: 她等他起床，但他没动弹。

example.ex: There was so much furniture you could hardly move without bumping into something...
example.tran: 家具太多，稍挪步就会撞到什么东西上。

collins.def: If you move, you act or you begin to do something.

example.ex: Industrialists must move fast to take advantage of new opportunities in Eastern Europe.
example.tran: 实业家们必须尽快采取行动，抓住东欧的新机遇。

collins.def: A move is an action that you take in order to achieve something.

example.ex: The one point cut in interest rates was a wise move...
example.tran: 将利率降低一个点是明智的举措。

example.ex: It may also be a good move to suggest she talks things over...
example.tran: 建议她把事情谈开了也许是不错的做法。

collins.def: If a person or company moves, they leave the building where they have been living or working, and they go to live or work in a different place, taking their possessions with  them.

example.ex: My family home is in York-shire and they don't want to move...
example.tran: 我家人住在约克郡，他们不打算搬家。

example.ex: She had often considered moving to London...
example.tran: 她过去常想搬到伦敦去住。

collins.def: If people in authority move someone, they make that person go from one place or job to another one.

example.ex: His superiors moved him to another parish...
example.tran: 上级把他派往另一个教区。

example.ex: Ms Clark is still in position and there are no plans to move her...
example.tran: 克拉克女士仍然在位，没有要调动她的计划。

collins.def: If you move from one job or interest to another, you change to it.

example.ex: He moved from being an extramural tutor to being a lecturer in social history...
example.tran: 他原先是一名校外辅导老师，后调入学校讲授社会史。

example.ex: In the early days Christina moved jobs to get experience.
example.tran: 起初克里斯蒂娜更换不同的工作来积累经验。

collins.tran: 改变(谈话内容);转到（新的话题）
collins.def: If you move to a new topic in a conversation, you start talking about something different.

example.ex: Let's move to another subject, Dan.
example.tran: 丹，我们换个话题吧。

collins.def: If you move an event or the date of an event, you change the time at which  it happens.

example.ex: The club has moved its meeting to Saturday, January 22nd...
example.tran: 俱乐部把会议日期改到1月22号，星期六。

example.ex: The band have moved forward their Leeds date to October 27.
example.tran: 乐队已把去利兹的日期提前至10月27号。

collins.def: If you move towards a particular state, activity, or opinion, you start to be in that state, do that activity, or have that opinion.

example.ex: The Labour Party has moved to the right and become like your Democrat Party...
example.tran: 工党已右倾化了，变得像你们民主党。

example.ex: It is already possible to start moving toward the elimination of nuclear weapons...
example.tran: 已有可能朝着消除核武器的目标努力。

collins.def: If a situation or process is moving, it is developing or progressing, rather than staying still.

example.ex: Events are moving fast...
example.tran: 事件进展迅速。

example.ex: Someone has got to get things moving.
example.tran: 应该有人牵头把事情做起来。

collins.def: If you say that you will not be moved, you mean that you have come to a decision and nothing will change your mind.

example.ex: Everyone thought I was mad to go back, but I wouldn't be moved.
example.tran: 大家都认为我回去是很不明智的，但我不会动摇。

collins.def: If something moves you to do something, it influences you and causes you to do it.

example.ex: It was punk that first moved him to join a band seriously...
example.tran: 最初是朋克摇滚乐促使他正式加入了乐队。

example.ex: The president was moved to come up with these suggestions after the hearings.
example.tran: 听证会促使总统想出了这些建议。

collins.def: If something moves you, it has an effect on your emotions and causes you to feel sadness or sympathy for another person.

example.ex: These stories surprised and moved me...
example.tran: 这些故事让我吃惊，也让我感动。

example.ex: His prayer moved me to tears.
example.tran: 他的祈祷把我感动得热泪盈眶。

collins.tran: 活跃，出入，涉足(于某团体、领域或圈子)
collins.def: If you say that someone moves in a particular society, circle, or world, you mean that they know people in a particular social class or group and spend most of their time with them.

example.ex: She moves in high-society circles in London...
example.tran: 她时常出入伦敦的上流社会。

example.ex: They moved in a world where hostility to racists was natural.
example.tran: 他们出没在一个对种族主义者的敌视习以为常的世界里。

collins.def: At a meeting, if you move a motion, you formally suggest it so that everyone present can vote on it.

example.ex: Labour quickly moved a closure motion to end the debate...
example.tran: 工党很快提出终止辩论的动议。

example.ex: I move that the case be dismissed.
example.tran: 我提议对该案不予受理。

collins.def: A move is an act of putting a chess piece or other counter in a different position on a board when it is your turn to do so in a game.

example.ex: With no idea of what to do for my next move, my hand hovered over the board.
example.tran: 我举着棋子，不知下一步该怎么走。

collins.def: If you say that one false move will cause a disaster, you mean that you or someone else must not make any mistakes because the situation is so difficult or dangerous.

example.ex: He knew one false move would end in death.
example.tran: 他明白稍有差池就会被置于死地。

collins.def: If you tell someone to get a move on, you are telling them to hurry.
If you make a move, you prepare or begin to leave one place and go somewhere else.

example.ex: He glanced at his wristwatch. 'I suppose we'd better make a move.'
example.tran: 他看一眼手表说：“我想我们最好动身吧。”

example.ex: He made a move to leave.
example.tran: 他起身离开。

collins.def: If you make a move, you take a course of action.

example.ex: The week before the deal was supposed to close, fifteen Japanese banks made a move to pull out...
example.tran: 在预定交易就要结束的前一周，15家日本银行采取行动撤离。

example.ex: Don't wait for others to make the first move: invite friends to visit you.
example.tran: 别等别人先主动，要先邀请朋友到家来。

collins.def: If you are on the move, you are going from one place to another.

example.ex: Jack never wanted to stay in one place for very long, so they were always on the move.
example.tran: 杰克从不想在一个地方呆太久，所以他们总在奔波辗转。

means: （与不可数名词连用，尤用于否定句，或与 how 连用以询问数量，也可与 as、so 和 too 连用）许多

collins.tran: (表示行动、感情或变化的强烈程度，通常和 so，too，very 一起用于否定句中)很多，非常
collins.def: You use much to indicate the great intensity, extent, or degree of something such as an action, feeling, or change. Much is usually used with 'so', 'too', and 'very', and in negative clauses with this meaning.

example.ex: She laughs too much...
example.tran: 她笑得太多了。

example.ex: Thank you very much...
example.tran: 非常感谢。

collins.def: If something does not happen much, it does not happen very often.

example.ex: He said that his father never talked much about the war...
example.tran: 他说他父亲从来不多谈那场战争。

example.ex: Gwen had not seen her Daddy all that much, because mostly he worked on the ships...
example.tran: 格温一直不常见到她父亲，因为他大部分时间在船上工作。

collins.tran: (置于比较级或 too 前，表示强调)太，很
collins.def: You use much in front of 'too' or comparative adjectives and adverbs in order to emphasize that there is a large amount of a particular quality.

example.ex: The skin is much too delicate...
example.tran: 皮肤太娇嫩了。

example.ex: You'd be so much happier if you could see yourself the way I see you...
example.tran: 如果你能像我看你那样看待自己，你会快乐得多。

collins.def: If one thing is much the same as another thing, it is very similar to it.

example.ex: The day ended much as it began...
example.tran: 这一天的开始和结束几乎是一样的。

example.ex: Sheep's milk is produced in much the same way as goat's milk.
example.tran: 绵羊奶和山羊奶的生产过程差不多。

collins.def: You use much to indicate that you are referring to a large amount of a substance or thing.

example.ex: They are grown on the hillsides in full sun, without much water...
example.tran: 它们被种植在阳光充足、土壤水分不多的山坡上。

example.ex: Japan has been reluctant to offer much aid to Russia...
example.tran: 日本一直不愿意向俄罗斯提供太多的援助。

collins.tran: (用于回答关于数量的提问)不多/不太多/太多
collins.def: You use much in expressions such as not much ,not very much, and too much when replying to questions about amounts.

example.ex: 'Can you hear it where you live?' He shook his head. 'Not much.'...
example.tran: “你住的地方听得到吗？”他摇摇头说：“很少听到。”

example.ex: 'Do you care very much about what other people think?' — 'Too much.'
example.tran: “你对别人的看法很在意吗？”——“太在意了。”

collins.def: If you do not see much of someone, you do not see them very often.

example.ex: I don't see much of Tony nowadays...
example.tran: 我现在见托尼的次数不多。

example.ex: We won't be seeing much of each other for a while.
example.tran: 我们会有一段时间不常见面。

collins.tran: 多少(用于对数量的询问或说明)
collins.def: You use much in the expression how much to ask questions about amounts or degrees, and also in reported clauses and statements to give information about the amount or degree of something.

example.ex: How much money can I afford?...
example.tran: 我能出得起多少钱？

example.ex: See just how much fat and cholesterol you're eating...
example.tran: 看看你究竟摄入了多少脂肪和胆固醇。

collins.def: You use much in the expression as much when you are comparing amounts.

example.ex: I shall try, with as much patience as is possible, to explain yet again...
example.tran: 我会尽可能耐心地试着再解释一遍。

example.ex: Their aim will be to produce as much milk as possible...
example.tran: 他们的目标是尽可能提高牛奶产量。

collins.def: You use much as to introduce a fact which makes something else you have just said or will say rather surprising.

example.ex: Much as they hope to go home tomorrow, they're resigned to staying on until the end of the year.
example.tran: 虽然他们希望明天就回家，但还是准备耐心地继续呆到年底。

collins.tran: 我想/ 我猜也是这样
collins.def: You use as much in expressions such as 'I thought as much' and 'I guessed as much' after you have just been told something and you want to say that you already believed or expected it to be true.

example.ex: You're waiting for a woman — I thought as much.
example.tran: 你在等一位女士——我也这么想的。

collins.def: You use as much as before an amount to suggest that it is surprisingly large.

example.ex: The organisers hope to raise as much as £6m for charity.
example.tran: 组织者希望能募集到高达600万英镑的善款。

collins.def: You use much less after a statement, often a negative one, to indicate that the statement is more true of the person, thing, or situation that you are going to mention next.

example.ex: They are always short of water to drink, much less to bathe in...
example.tran: 他们的饮用水一直短缺，更别提洗澡水了。

example.ex: But we must not think of Chekhov as a leftist, much less a revolutionary.
example.tran: 但是我们绝不应把契科夫看成是个左派人物，他更不是革命者。

collins.def: You say nothing much to refer to something that is not very interesting or important.

example.ex: 'What was stolen?' — 'Oh, nothing much.'...
example.tran: “什么被偷了？”——“噢，不是什么重要的东西。”

example.ex: Nothing much interesting seemed to be happening.
example.tran: 看来不会发生什么有趣的事。

collins.def: If you describe something as not much of a particular type of thing, you mean that it is small or of poor quality.

example.ex: It hasn't been much of a holiday...
example.tran: 这简直不像是假日。

example.ex: It's not much of a career, you may think.
example.tran: 你可能想这根本算不上是一份职业。

collins.def: So much for is used to indicate that you have finished talking about a subject.

example.ex: Well, so much for the producers. But what of the con-sumers?
example.tran: 好吧，关于生产商就讲这么多，那关于消费者呢？

collins.def: If you say so much for a particular thing, you mean that it has not been successful or helpful.

example.ex: He has spent 19 million pounds, lost three cup finals and been relegated. So much for money.
example.tran: 他已花了1,900万英镑，输掉了三场杯赛决赛，球队也降级了。钱也不是万能的。

collins.def: If you say that something is not so much one thing as another, you mean that it is more like the second thing than the first.

example.ex: I don't really think of her as a daughter so much as a very good friend...
example.tran: 与其说我把她当作女儿，不如说把她当作好朋友。

example.ex: She told me she was not so much leaving her job as it was leaving her.
example.tran: 她告诉我，与其说是她辞了工作，不如说是工作辞了她。

collins.def: If you say that someone did not do so much as perform a particular action, you are emphasizing that they did not even do that, when you were expecting them to do more.

example.ex: I didn't so much as catch sight of him all day long...
example.tran: 我一整天都没见他人影。

example.ex: Laura had not reproached him, never so much as mentioned it...
example.tran: 劳拉没责备他，甚至提都没提那件事。

collins.def: You use so much so to indicate that your previous statement is true to a very great extent, and therefore it has the result mentioned.

example.ex: He himself believed in freedom, so much so that he would rather die than live without it.
example.tran: 他非常崇尚自由，不自由，毋宁死。

collins.tran: 非…力所能及的;非…应付得了的
collins.def: If a situation or action is too much for you, it is so difficult, tiring, or upsetting that you cannot cope with it.

example.ex: His inability to stay at one job for long had finally proved too much for her.
example.tran: 他没有哪份工作能干长，这一点最终让她难以忍受。

collins.def: You use very much to emphasize that someone or something has a lot of a particular quality, or that the description you are about to give is particularly accurate.

example.ex: ...a man very much in charge of himself...
example.tran: 自制力很强的人

example.ex: Yorkshire is still very much a farming community with good meat, good dairy produce and eggs...
example.tran: 约克郡在很大程度上仍以农业为主，出产优质肉类、奶制品和蛋类。

collins.def: Music is the pattern of sounds produced by people singing or playing instruments.

example.ex: ...classical music.
example.tran: 古典音乐

example.ex: ...the music of George Gershwin.
example.tran: 乔治·格什温的音乐作品

collins.def: Music is the art of creating or performing music.

example.ex: He went on to study music, specialising in the clarinet.
example.tran: 他继续学习音乐，主攻单簧管。

example.ex: ...a music lesson.
example.tran: 音乐课

collins.def: Music is the symbols written on paper which represent musical sounds.

example.ex: He's never been able to read music.
example.tran: 他一直都不识谱。

collins.tran: 悦耳的声音;佳音;中听的话
collins.def: If something that you hear is music to your ears, it makes you feel very happy.

example.ex: Popular support—it's music to the ears of any politician.
example.tran: 大众的支持对任何一名政界人士来说都是佳音。

collins.tran: 承担自己行为的后果;接受批评（或惩罚）
collins.def: If you face the music, you put yourself in a position where you will be criticized or punished for something you have done.

example.ex: Sooner or later, I'm going to have to face the music.
example.tran: 迟早我得自己承担后果。

means: 必须做的事，必不可少的事物
（表示很可能或符合逻辑）一定

collins.def: You use must to indicate that you think it is very important or necessary for something to happen. You use must not or mustn't to indicate that you think it is very important or necessary for something not to happen.

example.ex: What you wear should be stylish and clean, and must definitely fit well...
example.tran: 你的穿着应该整洁漂亮，而且必须非常合身。

example.ex: You are going to have to take a certain amount of criticism, but you must cope with it...
example.tran: 你肯定会遭到一些批评，但你必须去面对。

collins.tran: (通常因为规定或法律)必须，应当
collins.def: You use must to indicate that it is necessary for something to happen, usually because of a rule or law.

example.ex: Candidates must satisfy the general conditions for admission...
example.tran: 候选人必须满足参选的总体条件。

example.ex: Mr Allen must pay Mr Farnham's legal costs...
example.tran: 艾伦先生应当支付法纳姆先生的诉讼费。

collins.tran: (用于表示肯定推测)一定，谅必
collins.def: You use must to indicate that you are fairly sure that something is the case.

example.ex: At 29 Russell must be one of the youngest ever Wembley referees...
example.tran: 29岁的拉赛尔一定是有史以来温布利球场上的裁判员中最年轻的一个。

example.ex: Reggae must be the only music that's got its own country — Jamaica...
