example.tran: 雷盖音乐得到了一整个国家人民的支持，这个国家就是牙买加——这一点上它无疑是独一无二的。

collins.tran: (用于表示据已知情况推测)很可能是，想必是，肯定是
collins.def: You use must, or must have with a past participle, to indicate that you believe that something is the case, because of the available evidence.

example.ex: 'You must be Emma,' said the visitor...
example.tran: 来客说：“你肯定是埃玛。”

example.ex: Miss Holloway had a weak heart. She must have had a heart attack...
example.tran: 霍洛韦小姐心脏不好，她肯定得过心脏病。

collins.tran: (用于表示前者为后者的前提)应该已经(发生)
collins.def: If you say that one thing must have happened in order for something else to happen, you mean that it is necessary for the first thing to have happened before the second thing can happen.

example.ex: In order to take that job, you must have left another job...
example.tran: 为得到那份工作，你肯定已辞去了另一份工作。

example.ex: In order to start reading this book you must have had some idea that the physical symptoms you were experiencing were due to anxiety.
example.tran: 开始读这本书之前，你一定已经了解到：你身体的不适症状是源于焦虑。

collins.tran: (用于表示意图)一定要，坚持要
collins.def: You use must to express your intention to do something.

example.ex: I must be getting back...
example.tran: 我一定要回来。

example.ex: I must have a whiskey...
example.tran: 我要喝杯威士忌。

collins.tran: (用于表示建议或邀请)务必，一定要
collins.def: You use must to make suggestions or invitations very forcefully.

example.ex: You must see a doctor, Frederick...
example.tran: 弗雷德里克，你一定得去看医生。

example.ex: You must see the painting Paul has given me as a wedding present...
example.tran: 你一定要看看保罗送给我作结婚礼物的那幅画。

collins.def: You use must in remarks and comments where you are expressing sympathy.

example.ex: This must be a very difficult job for you...
example.tran: 对你来说，这份工作想必很难。

example.ex: You must be very worried by now...
example.tran: 你现在一定非常担心。

collins.def: You use must in conversation in expressions such as 'I must say' and 'I must admit' in order to emphasize a point that you are making.

example.ex: This came as a surprise, I must say...
example.tran: 我得说这真是个意外。

example.ex: I must admit I like looking feminine...
example.tran: 我得承认我喜欢看起来淑女一些。

collins.tran: (用于引起读者或听众的注意)一定要注意/一定记住
collins.def: You use must in expressions such as 'it must be noted' and 'it must be remembered' in order to draw the reader's or listener's attention to what you are about to say.

example.ex: It must be noted, however, that not all British and American officers carried out orders...
example.tran: 然而，一定要注意不是所有的英国和美国军官都执行了命令。

example.ex: It must be stated that this illness is one of the most complex conditions known to man.
example.tran: 必须声明，这种疾病是人类已知的最为复杂的疾病之一。

collins.tran: (用于问句中表示生气)偏偏，非要
collins.def: You use must in questions to express your anger or irritation about something that someone has done, usually because you do not understand their behaviour.

example.ex: Why must you do everything as if you have to win?...
example.tran: 你为什么做每件事情都跟你非要赢似的？

example.ex: Why must she inter-rupt?...
example.tran: 她为什么非要插嘴？

collins.tran: (用于感叹句，表示惊讶或震惊)一定是，准是
collins.def: You use must in exclamations to express surprise or shock.

example.ex: 'Go! Please go.' — 'You must be joking!'...
example.tran: “走吧！请走吧。”——“你一定是在开玩笑吧！”

example.ex: I really must be quite mad!...
example.tran: 真的，我一定是气坏了！

collins.tran: 必不可少的事物;一定要做的事
collins.def: If you refer to something as a must, you mean that it is absolutely necessary.

example.ex: The new 37th issue of National Savings Certificates is a must for any taxpayer...
example.tran: 新发行的第37期国家储蓄债券是任何一个纳税人的必然之选。

example.ex: A must is a visit to the fascinating and world-renowned Motor Museum.
example.tran: 一定要去参观一下那个举世闻名且精彩有趣的汽车博物馆。

collins.tran: 如果你一定要(这样做的话)
collins.def: You say 'if you must' when you know that you cannot stop someone doing something that you think is wrong or stupid.

example.ex: If you must be in the sunlight, use the strongest filter cream you can get...
example.tran: 如果一定要呆在太阳底下的话，就擦上你能买到的防晒系数最高的防晒霜。

example.ex: 'Could I have a word?' — 'Oh dear, if you must.'...
example.tran: “我能说一句吗？”——“亲爱的，如果你非说不可的话，好吧。”

collins.tran: 如果你一定想要知道的话
collins.def: You say 'if you must know' when you tell someone something that you did not want them to know and you want to suggest that you think they were wrong to  ask you about it.

example.ex: 'Why don't you wear your jogging shorts Mum?' — 'Well, my legs are too skinny, if you must know.'
example.tran: “妈妈，为什么不穿你的慢跑短裤呢？”——“哦，如果你非要问的话，因为我的腿太瘦了。”

example.ex: 'You told him you'd been there that night.' — 'If you must know, yes.'
example.tran: “你跟他说过你那天夜里去过那儿了。”——“是的，如果你非要问的话。”

collins.def: A speaker or writer uses my to indicate that something belongs or relates to himself or herself.

example.ex: I invited him back to my flat for a coffee...
example.tran: 我邀请他回我的公寓喝杯咖啡。

example.ex: John's my best friend...
example.tran: 约翰是我最好的朋友。

collins.tran: (用于对话或书信中，表示亲昵)我的
collins.def: In conversations or in letters, my is used in front of a word like 'dear' or 'darling' to show affection.

example.ex: My sweet Freda...
example.tran: 我亲爱的弗蕾达

example.ex: Yes, of course, my darling.
example.tran: 是，当然了，亲爱的。

collins.tran: (用于表示惊讶或震惊)哎呀，天哪
collins.def: My is used in phrases such as 'My God' and 'My goodness' to express surprise or shock.

example.ex: My God, I've never seen you so nervous...
example.tran: 天哪，我从没见你这么紧张过。

example.ex: My goodness, Tim, you have changed!
example.tran: 我的天，蒂姆，你变了！

collins.def: The name of a person, place, or thing is the word or group of words that is used to identify them.

example.ex: 'What's his name?'—'Peter.'...
example.tran: “他叫什么？”——“彼得。”

example.ex: I don't even know if Sullivan's his real name...
example.tran: 我甚至不知道沙利文是否是他的真名。

collins.def: When you name someone or something, you give them a name, usually at the beginning of their life.

example.ex: My mother insisted on naming me Horace.
example.tran: 我母亲坚持给我取名叫霍勒斯。

example.ex: ...a man named John T. Benson...
example.tran: 名叫约翰·T.本森的男人

collins.def: If you name someone or something after another person or thing, you give them the same name as that person or thing.

example.ex: Why have you not named any of your sons after yourself?
example.tran: 为什么没让哪个儿子用你的名字呢？

collins.tran: 叫出…的名称;说出…的名字
collins.def: If you name someone, you identify them by stating their name.

example.ex: It's nearly thirty years since a journalist was jailed for refusing to name a source...
example.tran: 一名记者因拒绝说出消息来源而入狱已经是近30年前的事了。

example.ex: One of the victims of the weekend's snowstorm has been named as twenty-year-old John Barr.
example.tran: 周末暴风雪中的一名罹难者已确认是20岁的约翰·巴尔。

collins.tran: 提出，说出，指出(价格、时间、地点等)
collins.def: If you name something such as a price, time, or place, you say what you want it to be.

example.ex: Call Marty, tell him to name his price.
example.tran: 给马蒂打电话，让他出个价儿。

collins.def: If you name the person for a particular job, you say who you want to have the job.

example.ex: The England manager will be naming a new captain, to replace the injured David Beckham...
example.tran: 英格兰队主教练将任命新队长，接替受伤的大卫·贝克汉姆。

example.ex: When the chairman of Campbell's retired, McGovern was named as his successor...
example.tran: 坎贝尔公司的总裁退休后，麦戈文被选定为继任者。

collins.def: You can refer to the reputation of a person or thing as their name .

example.ex: He had a name for good judgement...
example.tran: 他以判断准确而闻名。

example.ex: She's never had any drug problems or done anything to give jazz a bad name.
example.tran: 她从没有吸过毒，也没做过任何有损爵士乐名声的事。

collins.def: You can refer to someone as, for example, a famous name or a great name when they are well-known.

example.ex: ...some of the most famous names in modelling and show business.
example.tran: 模特和时装界一些最知名的红人

example.ex: ...top names such as Nike, Levi's, Calvin Klein and Tommy Hilfiger.
example.tran: 耐克、李维斯、CK和汤米·希尔费格之类的顶级名牌

collins.def: If something is in someone's name, it officially belongs to them or is reserved for them.

example.ex: The house is in my husband's name...
example.tran: 房子是我丈夫名下的。

example.ex: A double room had been reserved for him in the name of Muller.
example.tran: 已用穆勒的名字为他预订了一个双人间。

collins.def: If someone does something in the name of a group of people, they do it as the representative of that group.

example.ex: In the United States the majority governs in the name of the people...
example.tran: 在美国，多数派代表民众执政。

example.ex: She accepted the gift in the name of the Save the Children Fund.
example.tran: 她代表“拯救儿童基金会”接受了礼物。

collins.def: If you do something in the name of an ideal or an abstract thing, you do it in order to preserve or promote that thing.

example.ex: ...one of those rare occasions in history when a political leader risked his own power in the name of the greater public good...
example.tran: 历史上少有的例子之一，政治领袖为更大的公共利益，甘冒丢官弃职的风险

example.ex: There had been times when she had felt sickened by the things people did in the name of business.
example.tran: 有时人们打着做生意的幌子所做的事情让她感到恶心。

collins.tran: (加强提问或要求的语气)看在(上帝、人道等)的份儿上
collins.def: People sometimes use expressions such as 'in the name of heaven' or 'in the name of humanity' to add emphasis to a question or request.

example.ex: What in the name of heaven's going on?...
example.tran: 看在上帝份儿上，这到底是怎么回事？

example.ex: In the name of humanity I ask the government to reappraise this important issue.
example.tran: 我以人道的名义请求政府重新评估这一重大问题。

collins.tran: 有实无名的;未被认可的
collins.def: If you say that a situation exists in all but name, you mean that it is not officially recognized even though it exists.

example.ex: ...the group, which is now a political party in all but name...
example.tran: 这一团体，现在是有实无名的政党

example.ex: It's the end of the doctrine in all but name.
example.tran: 这实际上已是该学说的终结，只是未被道明罢了。

collins.def: When you mention someone or something by name, or address someone by name, you use their name.

example.ex: He greets customers by name and enquires about their health.
example.tran: 他跟顾客打招呼时直呼其名，并问他们身体可好。

collins.def: You can use by name or by the name of when you are saying what someone is called.

example.ex: ...a young Australian, Harry Busteed by name...
example.tran: 名叫哈里·巴斯蒂德的澳大利亚年轻人

example.ex: This guy, Jack Smith, does he go by the name of Jackal?
example.tran: 这个叫杰克·史密斯的家伙是不是还有个名字叫杰凯尔？

collins.def: If someone calls you names, they insult you by saying unpleasant things to you or about you.

example.ex: At my last school they called me names because I was so slow...
example.tran: 在之前的学校，因为我反应慢，他们骂过我。

example.ex: They had called her rude names.
example.tran: 他们用粗鲁的言语谩骂她。

collins.def: If you say that something is the name of the game, you mean that it is the most important aspect of a situation.

example.ex: Family values are suddenly the name of the game...
example.tran: 家庭价值观突然变得重要起来。

example.ex: The name of the game is survival.
example.tran: 重要的是活下去。

collins.def: If you lend your name to something such as a cause or project, you support it.

example.ex: He had political points of view and lent his name to a lot of causes.
example.tran: 他很有政治见解，对很多事业都予以支持。

collins.def: If you make a name for yourself or make your name as something, you become well-known for that thing.

example.ex: She was beginning to make a name for herself as a portrait photographer...
example.tran: 她开始成为一个小有名气的人像摄影师。

example.ex: He made his name with several collections of short stories.
example.tran: 他是以几部短篇小说集成名的。

collins.tran: 点出(或指出)(做错事者)的名字
collins.def: If you name names, you identify the people who have done something, often something wrong.

example.ex: Nobody was prepared to risk prosecution by actually naming names.
example.tran: 没有人愿意冒着被起诉的风险去真正指认别人。

collins.tran: (指报纸或官方机构)曝光，点名，指名(业绩差或犯错的人)
collins.def: If something such as a newspaper or an official body names and shames people who have performed badly or who have done something wrong, it identifies those people by name.

example.ex: The government will also name and shame the worst performing airlines.
example.tran: 政府还将曝光业绩最差的航空公司。

collins.def: If you say that a situation exists in name only, you mean that it does not have the status or position that it claims to have.

example.ex: Many of the groups exist in name only...
example.tran: 许多团体实际上是有名无实。

example.ex: He is commander-in-chief in name only.
example.tran: 他只是名义上的总司令。

collins.tran: 凡是你说得出的，凡是你能想到的(应有尽有)
collins.def: You say you name it, usually after or before a list, to indicate that you are talking about a very wide range of things.

example.ex: Pickled cucumbers, jam, pickled berries, tomatoes; you name it, they've got it...
example.tran: 酸黄瓜、果酱、腌浆果、西红柿，凡是你说得出的，他们都有。

example.ex: I also enjoy windsurfing, tennis, racquetball, swimming, you name it.
example.tran: 我也喜欢帆板、网球、短柄墙球、游泳等等，不一而足。

collins.def: A nation is an individual country considered together with its social and political structures.

example.ex: Such policies would require unprecedented cooperation between nations...
example.tran: 这样的政策要求国家间进行空前的合作。

example.ex: The Arab nations agreed to meet in Baghdad.
example.tran: 阿拉伯各国同意在巴格达会晤。

collins.def: The nation is sometimes used to refer to all the people who live in a particular country.

example.ex: It was a story that touched the nation's heart.
example.tran: 这是一个感动了全体国民的故事。

collins.def: National means relating to the whole of a country or nation rather than to part of it or to other nations.

example.ex: Ruling parties have lost ground in national and local elections.
example.tran: 执政党在全国和地区选举中均败北。

example.ex: ...major national and international issues.
example.tran: 国内和国际重大问题

collins.def: National means typical of the people or customs of a particular country or nation.

example.ex: ...the national characteristics and history of the country...
example.tran: 这个国家的民族特征和历史

example.ex: Baseball is the national pastime.
example.tran: 棒球是全民性的休闲运动。

collins.def: You can refer to someone who is legally a citizen of a country as a national of that country.

example.ex: ...a Sri-Lankan-born British national.
example.tran: 出生于斯里兰卡的英国国民

collins.def: If something is near a place, thing, or person, it is a short distance from them.

example.ex: Don't come near me...
example.tran: 别靠近我。

example.ex: Her children went back every year to stay in a farmhouse near the cottage...
example.tran: 她的孩子们每年都回去，住在小屋边的农舍里。

collins.tran: 接近(某一状态);几乎;差不多
collins.def: If someone or something is near to a particular state, they have almost reached it.

example.ex: After the war, The House of Hardie came near to bankruptcy...
example.tran: 战后，哈迪家族濒于破产。

example.ex: The repairs to the Hafner machine were near to completion...
example.tran: 对哈夫纳机器的修理即将结束。

collins.def: If something is similar to something else, you can say that it is near to it.

example.ex: ...a sickening sensation that was near to nausea.
example.tran: 近乎恶心的难受感觉

collins.tran: (与…)最相似的;(和…)几乎差不多的
collins.def: You describe the thing most similar to something as the nearest thing to it when there is no example of the thing itself.

example.ex: It would appear that the legal profession is the nearest thing to a recession-proof industry...
example.tran: 司法行业看来是最不易受经济萧条影响的领域了。

example.ex: He is the nearest to a dead cert that Britain has in Albertville.
example.tran: 他是英国在阿尔贝维尔冬奥会上最有希望夺取金牌的选手。

collins.def: If a time or event draws near, it will happen soon.

example.ex: The time for my departure from Japan was drawing nearer every day.
example.tran: 我离开日本的日子一天天近了。

collins.def: If something happens near a particular time, it happens just before or just after that time.

example.ex: Performance is lowest between 3 a.m. and 5 a.m., and reaches a peak near midday...
example.tran: 凌晨3点至5点表现最差，近中午时分最好。

example.ex: 'Since I retired to this place,' he wrote near the end of his life, 'I have never been out of these mountains.'...
example.tran: “自从隐居到这里，”他在生命即将结束时写道，“我一直没有离开过这些大山。”

collins.tran: (指数量或数字)接近于，左右，上下
collins.def: You use near to say that something is a little more or less than an amount or number stated.

example.ex: ...to increase manufacturing from about 2.5 million cars a year to nearer 4.75 million...
example.tran: 将轿车年产量从250万辆左右增加到接近475万辆

example.ex: The pound, which ended last year near its annual low, is expected to come under renewed pressure today.
example.tran: 英镑去年年终降到了接近全年最低点的水平，预计今天将再度面临汇价下跌的压力。

collins.def: You can say that someone will not go near a person or thing when you are emphasizing that they refuse to see them or go there.

example.ex: He will absolutely not go near a hospital...
example.tran: 他绝对不会去医院。

example.ex: I'm so annoyed with her that I haven't been near her for a week.
example.tran: 我很生她的气,有一个星期没见她了。

collins.def: The near one of two things is the one that is closer.

example.ex: ...a mighty beech tree on the near side of the little clearing...
example.tran: 矗立在林间小块空地近侧的一棵高大的山毛榉树

example.ex: Jane put one foot in the near stirrup and turned to look at the stranger.
example.tran: 简一只脚就近蹬上马镫，转脸看着陌生人。

collins.def: You use near to indicate that something is almost the thing mentioned.

example.ex: She was believed to have died in near poverty on the French Riviera.
example.tran: 据信她在法国里维埃拉去世时几乎身无分文。

example.ex: ...the 48-year-old who was brought in to rescue the bank from near collapse.
example.tran: 被调来帮助银行摆脱濒临破产困境的48岁的新任

collins.tran: (在竞赛中)实力接近的，旗鼓相当的
collins.def: In a contest, your nearest rival or challenger is the person or team that is most likely to defeat you.

example.ex: He completed the lengthy course some three seconds faster than his nearest rival, Jonathon Ford...
example.tran: 他比劲敌乔纳森·福特少用了大概3秒钟完成了漫长的赛程。

example.ex: That victory put the Ukrainians beyond the reach of their nearest challengers, Dynamo Moscow.
example.tran: 本场胜利使乌克兰人甩开了最强有力的对手，莫斯科迪那摩队。

collins.def: When you near a place, you get quite near to it.

example.ex: As he neared the stable, he slowed the horse and patted it on the neck...
example.tran: 接近马厩时，他勒马缓行，轻拍它的脖颈。

example.ex: We were nearing the top of the pass to Tsagochen Thang when the van spluttered and died.
example.tran: 我们在驶近通往 Tsagochen Thang 的垭口时，货车噼啪几声熄火了。

collins.tran: 接近，临近(某一阶段或某一点)
collins.def: When someone or something nears a particular stage or point, they will soon reach that stage or point.

example.ex: His age was hard to guess — he must have been nearing fifty...
example.tran: 很难猜测他的年龄，他一定快50了。

example.ex: You are nearing the end of your training and you haven't attempted any assessments yet...
example.tran: 培训快结束了，你还没有参加任何评估测试。

collins.def: You say that an important time or event nears when it is going to occur quite soon.

example.ex: As half time neared, Hardyman almost scored twice...
example.tran: 临近中场休息时，哈迪曼差点梅开二度。

example.ex: This factor will come increasingly to the fore as election day nears.
example.tran: 随着选举日的临近，这一因素将愈发重要。

collins.tran: 最亲近的人;最亲密的人;至亲
collins.def: People sometimes refer to their close relatives and friends as their nearest and dearest .

example.ex: ...that English convention of not showing your feelings, even to your nearest and dearest.
example.tran: 甚至不向最亲近的人流露自己情感的英国社会习俗

collins.def: You use near and far to indicate that you are referring to a very large area or distance.

example.ex: People would gather from near and far...
example.tran: 人们会从四面八方聚到一起。

example.ex: Within months his reputation spread near and far.
example.tran: 没几个月他就远近闻名了。

collins.def: If you say that something will happen in the near future, you mean that it will happen quite soon.

example.ex: The controversy regarding vitamin C is unlikely to be resolved in the near future.
example.tran: 关于维生素C的争议短期内不可能平息。

collins.tran: 一点儿也不;完全不;远不
collins.def: You use nowhere near and not anywhere near to emphasize that something is not the case.

example.ex: They are nowhere near good enough...
example.tran: 他们还远不够好。

example.ex: It was nowhere near as painful as David had expected...
example.tran: 这远不如戴维所料想的那么痛苦。

collins.tran: 几乎丝毫不差地，几乎一样地(英国英语中亦作 as near as dammit)
collins.def: If you want to indicate that something is almost true, you can use the expressions near enough and damned near. In British English, you can also say as near as dammit.

example.ex: I bought them for a pound apiece, near enough...
example.tran: 我几乎是以一英镑一件的价钱买下了它们。

example.ex: They are as near as dammit new...
example.tran: 它们几乎是新的。

collins.tran: 差点，险些(发生某事)(英国英语中亦作 as near as dammit)
collins.def: If you want to indicate that something almost happened, you can use the expression damned near. In British English, you can also say as near as dammit .

example.ex: He damned near fooled me...
example.tran: 他险些把我骗了。

example.ex: As he was to tell Miranda later, he as near as dammit left it there.
example.tran: 像他随后告诉米兰达的那样，他几乎没碰它。

means: （表示应该或不得不做）有必要

collins.tran: (为做成某事或正常生活)要求有，必须有，需要
collins.def: If you need something, or need to do something, you cannot successfully achieve what you want or live properly without it.

example.ex: He desperately needed money...
example.tran: 他迫切需要钱。

example.ex: These diets provide everything your body needs...
example.tran: 这些饮食提供了你身体需要的所有营养。

collins.tran: (表示某一做法对某事物或地方有益)应该，应当，需要
collins.def: If an object or place needs something doing to it, that action should be done to improve the object or place. If a task needs doing, it should be done to improve a particular situation.

example.ex: The building needs quite a few repairs.
example.tran: 该建筑有好几处应该修缮。

example.ex: ...a garden that needs tidying...
example.tran: 应该清整的花园

collins.def: If there is a need for something, that thing would improve a situation or something cannot happen without it.

example.ex: Mr Forrest believes there is a need for other similar schools throughout Britain...
example.tran: 福里斯特先生认为全英国都需要有类似的学校。

example.ex: 'I think we should see a specialist.' — 'I don't think there's any need for that.'...
example.tran: “我想我们应该见见专家。”——“我认为没有任何必要。”

collins.tran: 不必，没有必要(用于告知或建议)
collins.def: If you say that someone needn't do something, you are telling them not to do it, or advising or suggesting that they should not do it.

example.ex: 'I'll put the key in the window.' — 'You needn't bother,' he said gruffly...
example.tran: “我会把钥匙放在窗户里。”——“不必麻烦了，”他粗声说道。

example.ex: Look, you needn't shout...
example.tran: 嗨，你不必大喊大叫。

collins.tran: (与否定词连用)不必，没有必要
collins.def: If you tell someone that they needn't do something, or that something needn't happen, you are telling them that that thing is not necessary, in order to make them feel better.

example.ex: You needn't worry...
example.tran: 你不必担心。

example.ex: This needn't take long, Simon...
example.tran: 西蒙，这花不了多长时间。

collins.tran: (与否定词连用)准许不做，可以不做
collins.def: You use needn't when you are giving someone permission not to do something.

example.ex: You needn't come again, if you don't want to...
example.tran: 如果你不想来，可以不用再来。

example.ex: Well, you needn't tell me anything if you don't want to.
example.tran: 好吧，如果你不想告诉我，可以什么也不说。

collins.def: If something need not be true, it is not necessarily true or not always true.

example.ex: What is right for us need not be right for others...
example.tran: 对我们来说是对的东西，对别人来说未必正确。

example.ex: Freedom need not mean independence.
example.tran: 自由不一定意味着独立。

collins.tran: (与否定词连用)本来不必，本来不需要
collins.def: If someone needn't have done something, it was not necessary or useful for them to do it, although they did it.

example.ex: She could have made the sandwich herself; her mum needn't have bothered to do anything...
example.tran: 她本来可以自己做三明治的;她妈妈原本不必费心做任何事情。

example.ex: I was a little nervous when I announced my engagement to Grace, but I needn't have worried...
example.tran: 我宣布和格雷丝订婚时有点紧张，但我本不必担心的。

collins.tran: (与否定词连用)无需说，不必说
collins.def: You use need in expressions such as I need hardly say and I needn't add to emphasize that the person you are talking to already knows what you are going to say.

example.ex: I needn't add that if you fail to do as I ask, you will suffer the consequences.
example.tran: 如果你没按我的要求做的话，后果请自负——这话我就不必再说了吧。

collins.tran: 还需要再说吗;还要我继续说吗
collins.def: You can use need in expressions such as 'Need I say more' and 'Need I go on' when you want to avoid stating an obvious consequence of something you have just said.

example.ex: Mid-fifties, short black hair, grey moustache, distinctive Russian accent. Need I go on?
example.tran: 五十四五岁，黑色短发，灰色八字胡，明显的俄国口音，还需要我继续说吗？

collins.def: People in need do not have enough of essential things such as money, food, or good health.

example.ex: The education authorities have to provide for children in need...
example.tran: 教育主管部门得救助贫困儿童。

example.ex: Remember that when both of you were in need, I was the one who loaned you money.
example.tran: 记住，在你们两个都有困难的时候，是我借钱给你们的。

collins.def: If you are in need of something, you need it or ought to have it.

example.ex: I was all right but in need of rest...
example.tran: 我没事，就是需要休息一下。

example.ex: He was badly in need of a shave...
example.tran: 他早就应该刮一下胡子了。

collins.tran: 需要的话;如有必要(英国英语中亦作 if needs be)
collins.def: If you say that you will do something, especially an extreme action, if need be, you mean that you will do if it is necessary. In British English, you can also say if needs be .

example.ex: They will now seek permission to take their case to the House of Lords, and, if need be, to the European Court of Human Rights.
example.tran: 他们现在将争取获准将案件呈交上议院审理，并且，如有必要，会上诉到欧洲人权法院。

collins.def: You can tell someone that there's no need for them to do something as a way of telling them not to do it or of telling them to stop doing it, for example because it is unnecessary.

example.ex: There's no need to call a doctor...
example.tran: 没有必要叫医生。

example.ex: There's no need for that kind of language in this magazine...
example.tran: 这份杂志没必要出现那种语言。

collins.def: You can say 'Who needs something?' as a way of emphasizing that you think that this thing is unnecessary or not useful.

example.ex: With apologies to my old history teacher, who needs history lessons?...
example.tran: 这话对不住我亲爱的历史老师，不过有谁需要历史课呢？

example.ex: Cigarettes, who needs them?
example.tran: 香烟，谁会要呀？

collins.def: Never means at no time in the past or at no time in the future.

example.ex: I have never lost the weight I put on in my teens...
example.tran: 我十几岁时增加的体重一直没有减下去。

example.ex: Never had he been so free of worry...
example.tran: 他从未如此无忧无虑过。

collins.def: Never means 'not in any circumstances at all'.

example.ex: I would never do anything to hurt him...
example.tran: 我决不会做任何伤害他的事情。

example.ex: Even if you are desperate to get married, never let it show...
example.tran: 即使你想结婚想得发狂，也决不要表现出来。

collins.tran: 永不，永无，从未(never的强调说法)
collins.def: Never ever is an emphatic way of saying 'never'.

example.ex: I never, ever sit around thinking, 'What shall I do next?'...
example.tran: 我从不闲坐着琢磨：“我接下来做什么呢？”

example.ex: He's vowed never ever to talk about anything personal in public, ever again.
example.tran: 他已发誓再也不当众谈论任何个人的事情，永远不。

collins.def: Never is used to refer to the past and means 'not'.

example.ex: He never achieved anything...
example.tran: 他从没有取得任何成就。

example.ex: He waited until all the luggage was cleared, but Paula's never appeared...
example.tran: 他一直等到所有的行李都拿走了，但始终没看见葆拉的。

collins.def: You say 'never!' to indicate how surprised or shocked you are by something that someone has just said.

collins.tran: (表示惊讶)我真没看到(或发现、想到)过
collins.def: You say 'Well, I never' to indicate that you are very surprised about something that you have just seen or found out.

example.ex: 'What were you up to there?' — 'I was head of the information department.' — 'Well I never!'
example.tran: “你在那儿干什么？”——“我是信息部的负责人。”——“啊，真没想到!”

collins.tran: (经常为幽默地表示)不好，不行，不合适
collins.def: If you say that something will never do or would never do, you are saying, often humorously, that you think it is not appropriate or not suitable in some way.

example.ex: It would never do to have Henry there in her apartment...
example.tran: 亨利呆在她的公寓里怎么也不合适。

example.ex: I don't think it is an example of bad writing myself, otherwise I'd be agreeing with Leavis, and that would never do.
example.tran: 我本人不认为这是篇糟糕的文章，否则我就和利维斯看法一样了，那可不行。

collins.tran: 新的;刚出现的;新做的;新建的
collins.def: Something that is new has been recently created, built, or invented or is in the process of being created, built, or invented.

example.ex: They've just opened a new hotel in the Stoke area...
example.tran: 他们刚在斯托克地区开了一家新宾馆。

example.ex: The new invention ensures the beer keeps a full, frothy head.
example.tran: 这项新发明能保证啤酒始终保持丰富的泡沫。

collins.def: Something that is new has not been used or owned by anyone.

example.ex: That afternoon she went out and bought a new dress...
example.tran: 那天下午她出门买了一件新裙子。

example.ex: There are many boats, new and used, for sale...
example.tran: 有很多新旧不一的船待售。

collins.def: You use new to describe something which has replaced another thing, for example because you no longer have the old one, or it no longer exists, or it is no longer useful.

example.ex: Under the new rules, some factories will cut emissions by as much as 90 percent...
example.tran: 按照新规定，一些工厂的减排量要高达90%。

example.ex: I had been in my new job only a few days...
example.tran: 我到新的工作岗位只有几天的时间。

collins.def: New is used to describe something that has only recently been discovered or noticed.

example.ex: The new planet is about ten times the size of the earth.
example.tran: 新发现的行星大约是地球的10倍那么大。

collins.tran: (一天或一年)新开始的，初始的
collins.def: A new day or year is the beginning of the next day or year.

example.ex: The start of a new year is a good time to reflect on the many achievements of the past...
example.tran: 新年伊始是反思过去一年诸多成就的好时机。

example.ex: The next election is for the government to take us into the new century.
example.tran: 下次选举要选出带领我们进入新世纪的政府。

collins.def: New is used to describe someone or something that has recently acquired a particular status or position.

example.ex: ...the usual exhaustion of a new mother...
example.tran: 刚做妈妈的人通常会有的疲惫感

example.ex: The Association gives a free handbook to all new members.
example.tran: 协会给新成员人手一本免费手册。

collins.def: If you are new to a situation or place, or if the situation or place is new to you, you have not previously seen it or had any experience of it.

example.ex: She wasn't new to the company...
example.tran: 公司对她早有耳闻。

example.ex: His name was new to me then and it stayed in my mind...
example.tran: 当时我是第一次听到他的名字，就记住了。

collins.tran: (土豆、胡萝卜、豆子等)时鲜的，早的
collins.def: New potatoes, carrots, or peas are produced early in the season for such vegetables and are usually small with a sweet flavour.
News is information about a recently changed situation or a recent event.

example.ex: We waited and waited for news of him...
example.tran: 我们左等右等，盼着他的消息。

example.ex: They still haven't had any news about when they'll be able to go home...
example.tran: 他们仍然没有何时能回家的消息。

collins.def: News is information that is published in newspapers and broadcast on radio and television about recent events in the country or world or in a particular area of activity.

example.ex: Foreign News is on Page 16...
example.tran: 国外新闻在16版。

example.ex: We'll also have the latest sports news...
example.tran: 我们也会收到最新的体育新闻。

collins.def: The news is a television or radio broadcast which consists of information about recent events in the country or the world.

example.ex: I heard all about the bombs on the news.
example.tran: 我从新闻广播里得知了关于炸弹的全部消息。

example.ex: ...the six o'clock news.
example.tran: 6点钟的新闻

collins.def: News is sometimes used in the names of newspapers.

example.ex: ...the New York Daily News.
example.tran: 《纽约每日新闻》

collins.def: If you say that someone or something is news, you mean that they are considered to be interesting and important at the moment, and that people want to hear about them on the radio and television and in newspapers.

example.ex: A murder was big news...
example.tran: 谋杀案是重大新闻事件。

example.ex: If you are a celebrity, you are headline news.
example.tran: 如果你是名人，你就是头条新闻。

collins.def: If you say that something is bad news, you mean that it will cause you trouble or problems. If you say that something is good news, you mean that it will be useful or helpful to you.

example.ex: The drop in travel is bad news for the airline industry...
example.tran: 旅游热降温对航空业来说是个坏消息。

example.ex: This new attitude is good news to AIDS activists.
example.tran: 这种新态度对艾滋病活动家来说是件好事。

collins.def: If you say that something is news to you, you mean that you did not previously know what you have just been told, especially when you are surprised or annoyed about it.

example.ex: I'd certainly tell you if I knew anything, but I don't. What you're saying is news to me.
example.tran: 如果我真知道什么的话，我肯定会告诉你，可我不知道。你现在说的我都没听过。

collins.def: The next period of time, event, person, or thing is the one that comes immediately after the present one or after the previous one.

example.ex: I got up early the next morning.
example.tran: 第二天早晨我早早地起床了。

example.ex: ...the next available flight...
example.tran: 下一趟可搭乘的航班

collins.def: You use next in expressions such as next Friday ,next day and next year to refer, for example, to the first Friday, day, or year that comes after the present or previous one.

example.ex: Let's plan a big night next week...
example.tran: 我们下周组织一次盛大的晚会吧。

example.ex: He retires next January...
example.tran: 他明年一月退休。

collins.def: The next place or person is the one that is nearest to you or that is the first one that you come to.

example.ex: Grace sighed so heavily that Trish could hear it in the next room...
example.tran: 格雷斯重重的叹息声连隔壁房间的特里斯都能听见。

example.ex: The man in the next chair was asleep...
example.tran: 邻座的男士睡着了。

collins.def: The thing that happens next is the thing that happens immediately after something else.

example.ex: Next, close your eyes then screw them up tight...
example.tran: 接着，合上双眼，然后再用力闭紧。

example.ex: I don't know what to do next...
example.tran: 我不知道接着该干什么了。

collins.def: When you next do something, you do it for the first time since you last did it.

example.ex: I next saw him at his house in Berkshire...
example.tran: 我在伯克郡他的家中再次见到了他。

example.ex: When we next met, he was much more jovial.
example.tran: 我们再次见面时，他愉快多了。

collins.def: You use next to say that something has more of a particular quality than all other things except one. For example, the thing that is next best is the one that is the best except for one other thing.

example.ex: The one thing he didn't have was a son. I think he's felt that a grandson is the next best thing...
example.tran: 他唯一缺的就是个儿子，我想他觉得有个外孙也不错。

example.ex: At least three times more daffodils are grown than in Holland, the next largest grower.
example.tran: 水仙花的栽培量至少是第二种植大国荷兰的3倍。

collins.def: You use after next in expressions such as the week after next to refer to a period of time after the next one. For example, when it is May, the month after next is July.

example.ex: ...the party's annual conference, to be held in Bournemouth the week after next.
example.tran: 下下周在伯恩茅斯举行的该党年会

collins.def: If you say that you do something or experience something as much as the next person, you mean that you are no different from anyone else in the respect mentioned.

example.ex: I enjoy pleasure as much as the next person...
example.tran: 我和别人一样愉快。

example.ex: I'm as ambitious as the next man. I'd like to manage at the very highest level.
example.tran: 我和别人一样雄心勃勃，想进入最高管理层。

collins.tran: 接下来(我)所知道的;出乎意料的是
collins.def: You can say the next thing I knew to suggest that a new situation which you are describing was surprising because it happened very suddenly.

example.ex: I had leaned over to pick up some change, and the next thing I knew I felt this terrible pain in my ankle.
example.tran: 我俯身去拿那些零钱，接下来就突然感到脚踝剧痛。

collins.def: If one thing is next to another thing, it is at the other side of it.

example.ex: She sat down next to him on the sofa.
example.tran: 她紧挨着他在沙发上坐下了。

example.ex: ...at the southern end of the Gaza Strip next to the Egyptian border...
example.tran: 在紧靠埃及边境的加沙地带南端

collins.def: You use next to in order to give the most important aspect of something when comparing it with another aspect.

example.ex: Her children were the number two priority in her life next to her career...
example.tran: 对她而言，孩子们的重要性仅次于她的事业。

example.ex: Next to the expense of cashiers, pricing items is one of the costliest labor costs of grocery retailers.
example.tran: 对食品杂货零售商来说，给货物贴价签也是劳动力成本中最为昂贵的一个部分，仅次于雇佣收银员的费用。

collins.def: You use next to before a negative, or a word that suggests something negative, to mean almost, but not completely.

example.ex: Johnson still knew next to nothing about tobacco...
example.tran: 约翰逊仍然对烟草几乎一无所知。

example.ex: Most pre-prepared weight loss products are next to useless.
example.tran: 大多数预制减肥产品几乎都没有什么功效。

collins.def: The night is the part of each day when the sun has set and it is dark outside, especially the time when people are sleeping.

example.ex: He didn't sleep a wink all night...
example.tran: 他一夜没合眼。

example.ex: The fighting began in the late afternoon and continued all night...
example.tran: 战斗在傍晚时分打响，持续了一夜。

collins.tran: 晚间，晚上(尤指睡觉前放松的时间)
collins.def: The night is the period of time between the end of the afternoon and the time that you go to bed, especially the time when you relax before going to bed.

example.ex: So whose party was it last night?...
example.tran: 那么，昨晚的聚会是谁办的？

example.ex: Demiris took Catherine to dinner the following night.
example.tran: 第二天晚上，德米里斯请凯瑟琳共进晚餐。

collins.tran: (演出等的)夜场，夜间活动，…之夜
collins.def: A particular night is a particular evening when a special event takes place, such as a show or a play.

example.ex: The first night crowd packed the building.
example.tran: 第一个夜场演出爆满。

example.ex: ...election night.
example.tran: 选举之夜

collins.def: If it is a particular time at night, it is during the time when it is dark and is before midnight.

example.ex: It's eleven o'clock at night in Moscow...
example.tran: 现在是莫斯科晚间11点。

example.ex: He works obsessively from 7.15 am to 9 or 10 at night.
example.tran: 他工作极为投入，会从早上七点一刻一直干到晚上九十点。

collins.def: If something happens at night, it happens regularly during the evening or night.

example.ex: He was going to college at night, in order to become an accountant...
example.tran: 为了成为会计师，他上夜校学习。

example.ex: The veranda was equipped with heavy wooden rain doors that were kept closed at night.
example.tran: 阳台装有厚重的木制防雨门，夜里是关着的。

collins.def: If something happens day and night or night and day, it happens all the time without stopping.

example.ex: Dozens of doctors and nurses have been working day and night for weeks...
example.tran: 很多医生和护士已经夜以继日地工作数周了。

example.ex: He was at my door night and day, demanding my attention.
example.tran: 他日日夜夜呆在我门口，想引起我的注意。

collins.def: If you have an early night, you go to bed early. If you have a late night, you go to bed late.

example.ex: I've had a hell of a day, and all I want is an early night...
example.tran: 这一天糟透了，我就想早点上床睡觉。

example.ex: In spite of the travelling and the late night, she did not feel tired.
example.tran: 尽管旅途劳顿，而且睡得很晚，她并没觉得累。

collins.def: Nine is the number 9.

example.ex: We still sighted nine yachts.
example.tran: 我们还是看见了9艘游艇。

example.ex: ...nine hundred pounds.

collins.tran: 打扮得绝顶漂亮;着装非常优雅
collins.def: If you say that someone is dressed up to the nines or dressed to the nines, you mean that they are wearing very smart or elegant clothes.

example.ex: They have nineteen days to make up their minds.
example.tran: 他们有19天时间去作决定。

collins.def: Ninety is the number 90.

example.ex: It was decided she had to stay another ninety days.
example.tran: 已经决定了，她不得不再呆90天。

collins.def: When you talk about the nineties, you are referring to numbers between 90 and 99. For example, if you are in your nineties, you are aged between 90 and 99. If the temperature is in the nineties, the temperature is between 90 and 99 degrees.

example.ex: By this time she was in her nineties and needed help more and more frequently.
example.tran: 到这个时候她已经90多岁了，越来越频繁地需要帮助。

collins.def: The nineties is the decade between 1990 and 1999.

example.ex: These trends only got worse as we moved into the nineties.
example.tran: 我们步入20世纪90年代时，这些潮流变得更糟了。

means: [用以表示否定、否认、拒绝、禁止等]不是
未必，没有[用于否定后面的词或短语]

collins.tran: (与动词连用构成否定句)不，非，没有
collins.def: You use not with verbs to form negative statements.

example.ex: The sanctions are not working the way they were intended...
example.tran: 制裁没有发挥预期的作用。

example.ex: I was not in Britain at the time...
example.tran: 当时我不在英国。

collins.tran: (构成期望得到肯定回答的疑问句)
collins.def: You use not to form questions to which you expect the answer 'yes'.

example.ex: Haven't they got enough problems there already?...
example.tran: 难道他们那儿的问题还少吗？

example.ex: Didn't I see you at the party last week?...
example.tran: 我在上周的聚会上见过你，对不对？

collins.tran: (通常以 n't 的形式出现在问句中，用于推断某人应已做某事或表示惊讶)
collins.def: You use not, usually in the form n't, in questions which imply that someone should have done something, or to express surprise that something is not the case.

example.ex: Why didn't you do it months ago?...
example.tran: 几个月以前你为什么不做呢？

example.ex: Why couldn't  he listen to her?...
example.tran: 他为什么不能听她的呢？

collins.tran: (通常用 n't 的形式，用于肯定陈述后的附加疑问句)是吗? 不是吗?
collins.def: You use not, usually in the form n't, in question tags after a positive statement.

example.ex: 'It's a nice piece of jewellery though, isn't it?'...
example.tran: “可这是一件漂亮的首饰，不是吗?”

example.ex: I've been a great husband, haven't I?...
example.tran: 我一直是个很不错的丈夫，不是吗？

collins.tran: (通常以 n't 的形式，表示礼貌的建议)
collins.def: You use not, usually in the form n't, in polite suggestions.

example.ex: Actually we do have a position in mind. Why don't you fill out our application?...
example.tran: 实际上我们的确在考虑一个职位，你先填一下我们的求职表好吗？

example.ex: Couldn't they send it by train?
example.tran: 他们不能用火车运过来吗？

collins.tran: (用于表示对刚提及的单词、词组或从句的否定)不，没有
collins.def: You use not to represent the negative of a word, group, or clause that has just been used.

example.ex: 'Have you found Paula?'—'I'm afraid not, Kate.'...
example.tran: “你找到葆拉了吗？”——“很遗憾，没有，凯特。”

example.ex: At first I really didn't care whether he came or not.
example.tran: 起先我真的不在乎他是否会来。

collins.tran: (用于 all 或 every 前，表示部分否定)并非，不是
collins.def: You can use not in front of 'all' or 'every' when you want to say something that applies only to some members of the group that you are talking about.

example.ex: Not all the money, to put it mildly, has been used wisely...
example.tran: 说得好听些，不是所有的钱都花得是地方。

example.ex: Not every applicant had a degree.
example.tran: 不是所有的求职者都有学位。

collins.def: If something is not always the case, you mean that sometimes it is the case and sometimes it is not.

example.ex: He didn't always win the arguments, but he often was right...
example.tran: 他并非在争辩中总是能赢，但他经常是对的。

example.ex: She couldn't always afford a babysitter...
example.tran: 她并不是总能请得起临时保姆。

collins.tran: (用于 a 或 one 前加强语气)(一个…)也不，(一个…)也没有
collins.def: You can use not or not even in front of 'a' or 'one' to emphasize that there is none at all of what is being mentioned.

example.ex: The houses are beautiful, but there's no shop, not even a pub to go into...
example.tran: 这些房子很漂亮，但周围没有商店，甚至连一个酒馆都没有。

example.ex: I sent report after report. But not one word was published...
example.tran: 我寄了一篇又一篇的报告，但一个字都没有发表。

collins.tran: (用于表示距离、时间或其他数量的词前)不到，少于
collins.def: You can use not in front of a word referring to a distance, length of time, or other amount to say that the actual distance, time, or amount is less than the one mentioned.

example.ex: The tug crossed our stern not fifty yards away...
example.tran: 拖船擦着我们的船尾开了过去，距离不到50码。

example.ex: ...a large crowd not ten yards away waiting for a bus...
example.tran: 不到10码远的地方有一大群等公共汽车的人

collins.tran: (用于对比真实和不真实的情况，尤用于可能使人产生误解的陈述)不是
collins.def: You use not when you are contrasting something that is true with something that is untrue. You use this especially to indicate that people might think that the untrue statement is true.

example.ex: He has his place in the Asian team not because he is white but because he is good...
example.tran: 他在这支亚洲球队中占有一席之地，不是因为他是白人，而是因为他确实出色。

example.ex: Training is an investment not a cost...
example.tran: 培训是一种投资，而不是花费。

collins.tran: (用于not only，not just, not simply 等短语中，强调某事物的真实性，但不是全部事实)
collins.def: You use not in expressions such as 'not only', 'not just', and 'not simply' to emphasize that something is true, but it is not the whole truth.

example.ex: These movies were not only making money; they were also perceived to be original...
example.tran: 这些电影不仅赚钱，而且被视为具有原创性。

example.ex: There is always a 'black market' not just in Britain but in Europe as a whole...
example.tran: 黑市一直存在，不只是在英国，整个欧洲也是。

collins.tran: (用于引出否定从句)并不是说，并非
collins.def: You use not that to introduce a negative clause that contradicts something that the previous statement implies.

example.ex: His death took me a year to get over; not that you're ever really over it...
example.tran: 我用一年时间慢慢接受了他去世的事实，但其实你永远不会真正完全忘掉。

example.ex: It occurred to Tom to wonder whether Jane was quite trustworthy. Not that he thought she was in any way politically active.
example.tran: 汤姆突然想到简是不是值得信任，并不是说他认为简有些热衷于政治。

collins.tran: (用于表示强调)一点不，根本没有
collins.def: Not at all is an emphatic way of saying 'No' or of agreeing that the answer to a question is 'No'.

example.ex: 'Sorry. I sound like Abby, don't I?' — 'No. Not at all.'...
example.tran: “抱歉，我讲起话来像阿比，是不是？”——“不，一点不像。”

example.ex: 'You don't  think that you've betrayed your country.' — 'No I don't. No, not at all.'
example.tran: “你认为你没有背叛自己的国家。”——“我没有，根本没有。”

collins.def: Not at all is a polite way of acknowledging a person's thanks.

example.ex: 'Thank you very much for speaking with us.' — 'Not at all.'
example.tran: “非常感谢您能和我们交谈。”——“不客气。”

collins.tran: 没有什么;没有一件(东西);没有一点
collins.def: Nothing means not a single thing, or not a single part of something.

example.ex: I've done nothing much since coffee time...
example.tran: 咖啡时间过后，我什么都没干。

example.ex: Mr Pearson said he knew nothing of his wife's daytime habits...
example.tran: 皮尔逊先生说，他对妻子白天的生活习惯一无所知。

collins.tran: 无关紧要的事物(或人);微不足道的事物(或人)
collins.def: You use nothing to indicate that something or someone is not important or significant.

example.ex: Because he had always had money it meant nothing to him...
example.tran: 因为他一直不缺钱，所以这对他来说不算什么。

example.ex: While the increase in homicides is alarming, it is nothing compared to what is to come in the rest of the decade...
example.tran: 虽然凶杀案的增加令人担忧，但和这个十年里接下来的几年将要发生的事相比却是小巫见大巫了。

collins.tran: 极低的价格;相当于免费
collins.def: If you say that something cost nothing or is worth nothing, you are indicating that it cost or is worth a surprisingly small amount of money.

example.ex: The furniture was threadbare; he'd obviously picked it up for nothing...
example.tran: 这件家具很破旧，显然他是白捡来的了。

example.ex: Homes in this corner of Mantua that once went for $350,000 are now worth nothing.
example.tran: 曼图亚市这个位置的房子曾一度卖到35万美元，现在不值几个钱了。

collins.tran: (用于形容词或带 to 的不定式前表示事物或人不具备所说的性质)没有什么，不是什么
collins.def: You use nothing before an adjective or 'to'-infinitive to say that something or someone does not have the quality indicated.

example.ex: Around the lake the countryside generally is nothing special...
example.tran: 湖四周的乡村总的来说没有什么特别的。

example.ex: There was nothing remarkable about him...
example.tran: 他没有什么特别之处。

collins.tran: (用于 so + 形容词、副词前或比较级前表示强调)没有别的东西，没有别的事情
collins.def: You can use nothing before 'so' and an adjective or adverb, or before a comparative, to emphasize how strong or great a particular quality is.

example.ex: Youngsters learn nothing so fast as how to beat the system...
example.tran: 年轻人对如何钻制度的空子学得最快。

example.ex: I consider nothing more important in my life than songwriting...
example.tran: 我想我的生活中没什么比写歌更重要了。

collins.tran: 要么彻底干完，要么根本不干
collins.def: You can use all or nothing to say that either something must be done fully and completely or else it cannot be done at all.

example.ex: Either he went through with this thing or he did not; it was all or nothing.
example.tran: 他要么把这件事做完，要么就不做，只有这两种选择。

collins.def: If you say that something is better than nothing, you mean that it is not what is required, but that it is better to have that thing than to have nothing at all.

example.ex: After all, 15 minutes of exercise is better than nothing.
example.tran: 毕竟，锻炼15分钟比不锻炼好。

collins.tran: (用于名词、不带 to 的不定式或 -ing 形式前)只有，仅仅
collins.def: You use nothing but in front of a noun, an infinitive without 'to', or an '-ing' form to mean 'only'.

example.ex: All that money brought nothing but sadness and misery and tragedy...
example.tran: 钱带来的只是悲伤、痛苦和灾难。

example.ex: It did nothing but make us ridiculous...
example.tran: 这只是让我们显得很滑稽。

collins.def: You can say 'Nothing doing' when you want to say that something is not happening or cannot be done.

example.ex: Pay now, or nothing doing...
example.tran: 现在付钱，否则不行。

example.ex: 'I could take the subway and have David pick me up at the station.' — 'Nothing doing.'
example.tran: “我可以坐地铁，然后让戴维到车站接我。”——“不行。”

collins.def: If you say that there is nothing for it but to take a particular action, you mean that it is the only possible course of action that you can take, even though it might be unpleasant.

example.ex: Much depends on which individual ingredients you choose. There is nothing for it but to taste and to experiment for yourself...
example.tran: 很大程度上取决于你选择哪种配料。除了亲口品尝和动手尝试外，没有别的方法。

example.ex: He wished he was not in a room so far from the bathroom. There was nothing for it but a long trudge through the house.
example.tran: 他真希望自己的房间离卫生间不那么远，没别的办法，只能走上长长的一段穿过屋子。

collins.def: You use nothing if not in front of an adjective to indicate that someone or something clearly has a lot of the particular quality mentioned.

example.ex: Professor Fish has been nothing if not professional...
example.tran: 菲什教授一贯表现出很高的职业水准。

example.ex: Hollywood is nothing if not creative, especially if someone else will pick up the bills.
example.tran: 好莱坞是极有创造力的地方，尤其是如果有人肯埋单的话。

collins.def: People sometimes say 'It's nothing' as a polite response after someone has thanked them for something they have done.

example.ex: 'Thank you for the wonderful dinner.' — 'It's nothing,' Sarah said...
example.tran: “谢谢你招待了这么美味的晚餐。”——“这没什么，”萨拉说。

example.ex: 'I'll be on my way. I can't thank you enough, Alan.' — 'It was nothing, but take care.'
example.tran: “艾伦，我要走了。真不知该怎么感谢你。”——“小事情，多保重。”

collins.def: If you say about a story or report that there is nothing in it or nothing to it, you mean that it is untrue.

example.ex: It's all rubbish and superstition, and there's nothing in it.
example.tran: 这都是废话和迷信，不是真的。

collins.def: If you say about an activity that there is nothing to it or nothing in it, you mean that it is extremely easy.

example.ex: This device has a gripper that electrically twists off the jar top. Nothing to it...
example.tran: 这个装置有一个能拧开瓶盖的电动钳子，并不复杂。

example.ex: If you've shied away from making pancakes in the past, don't be put off — there's really nothing in it!
example.tran: 如果你过去不敢做烤薄饼的话，现在别迟疑了，真是一点儿都不费事!

collins.tran: (比赛或竞争中)水平不相上下，势均力敌
collins.def: If you say about a contest or competition that there is nothing in it, you mean that two or more of the competitors are level and have an equal chance of winning.

collins.tran: (用于强调，表示事情让人吃惊或重要)简直，全然
collins.def: You can use nothing less than to emphasize your next words, often indicating that something seems very surprising or important.

example.ex: What he had in mind amounted to nothing less than a total reversal of the traditional role of the executive...
example.tran: 他头脑中所想的简直就是对管理人员传统角色的彻底颠覆。

example.ex: You're nothing less than a murderer!
example.tran: 你简直就是凶手！

collins.tran: 并非没有道理;事出有因
collins.def: If you say that it was not for nothing that something happened, you are emphasizing that there was a very good reason for it to happen.

example.ex: Not for nothing was the plane called 'The widow-maker'...
example.tran: 这种飞机被称作“寡妇机”是事出有因的。

example.ex: It's not for nothing that interior decorators the world over look to the English country garden for glorious inspiration.
example.tran: 全世界的室内设计师都希望从英国乡村花园汲取美妙的灵感，这并非没有道理。

collins.tran: 不付代价的收益;不劳而获
collins.def: If you say that someone is getting something for nothing, you disapprove of the fact that they are getting what they want without doing or giving anything in return.

example.ex: What's wrong with you is that you think you can get something for nothing.
example.tran: 你的问题是你认为自己可以不劳而获。

collins.def: Nothing of the sort is used when strongly contradicting something that has just been said.

example.ex: 'We're going to talk this over in my office.'—'We're going to do nothing of the sort.'...
example.tran: “我们打算到我办公室把这件事谈个明白。”——“我们决不同意这么做。”

example.ex: Mrs Adamson said that she was extremely sorry, in tones that made it clear that she was nothing of the sort.
example.tran: 亚当森夫人说她深感抱歉，但她的语气清楚地让人感到她毫无歉意。

means: （改变话题或要对方做某事前，引起对方注意）喂

collins.def: You use now to refer to the present time, often in contrast to a time in the past or the future.

example.ex: She's a widow now...
example.tran: 她现在是寡妇。

example.ex: But we are now a much more fragmented society...
example.tran: 但我们现在所处的是一个更加四分五裂的社会。

collins.def: If you do something now, you do it immediately.

example.ex: I'm sorry, but I must go now...
example.tran: 很抱歉我得马上走了。

example.ex: I fear that if I don't write now I shall never have another opportunity to do so.
example.tran: 我担心如果我不立即开始写作的话，就永远都不会再有机会了。

collins.def: You use now or now that to indicate that an event has occurred and as a result something else may or will happen.

example.ex: Now you're settled, why don't you take up some serious study?...
example.tran: 既然你已经安顿下来了，为什么不开始正经地学点东西呢？

example.ex: Now that she was retired she lived with her sister.
example.tran: 现在她已经退休了，和姐姐一起住。

collins.def: You use now to indicate that a particular situation is the result of something that has recently happened.

example.ex: Mrs Chandra has received one sweater for each of her five children and says that the winter will not be so hard now...
example.tran: 钱德拉夫人已经收到了5个孩子每人一件的毛衣，她说这下冬天就不那么难挨了。

example.ex: She told me not to repeat it, but now I don't suppose it matters...
example.tran: 她曾告诉我不要再重蹈覆辙，但这下我认为已经无关紧要了。

collins.tran: (用于讲述故事或过去的事情)这时，这会儿
collins.def: In stories and accounts of past events, now is used to refer to the particular time that is being written or spoken about.

example.ex: She felt a little better now...
example.tran: 这时她觉得好点儿了。

example.ex: It was too late now for Blake to lock his room door...
example.tran: 这会儿布莱克再锁房门已太晚了。

collins.def: You use now in statements which specify the length of time up to the present that something has lasted.

example.ex: They've been married now for 30 years...
example.tran: 到现在他们已经结婚30年了。

example.ex: They have been missing for a long time now...
example.tran: 现在他们已失踪很长一段时间了。

collins.tran: (引起听者的注意或改变话题)喂，喏，好
collins.def: You say 'Now' or 'Now then' to indicate to the person or people you are with that you want their attention, or that you are about to change the subject.

example.ex: 'Now then,' Max said, 'to get back to the point.'...
example.tran: “好吧”，马克斯说,“回到正题上来。”

example.ex: She stays at school for drama and doesn't get back till nine. Now, what's everyone drinking?...
example.tran: 她留在学校排戏，要到9点才回来。喂，大家要喝什么？

collins.tran: (用于考虑接下来想说的内容)哦，嗯
collins.def: Some people say 'Now' when they are thinking of what to say next.

example.ex: Now, er, dogs can live to fifteen...
example.tran: 哦，狗能活15年。

example.ex: Now, erm, obviously some of our listeners may have some ideas.
example.tran: 嗯，对了，显然我们的一些听众可能会有些想法。

collins.tran: (用于委婉地强调请求或命令)好，行
collins.def: You use now to give a slight emphasis to a request or command.

example.ex: Come on now. You know you must be hungry...
example.tran: 好，来吧，你肯定已经饿了。

example.ex: Come and sit down here, now...
example.tran: 好，来，坐在这儿。

collins.tran: (引出与已讲述内容有关的信息及继续讲述之前需要了解的信息)你看，喏
collins.def: You can say 'Now' to introduce information which is relevant to the part of a story or account that you have reached, and which needs to be known before you can continue.

example.ex: My son went to Almeria in Southern Spain. Now he and his wife are people who love a quiet holiday...
example.tran: 我儿子去了西班牙南部的阿尔梅里亚，你看，他和妻子是喜欢过安静假期的那种人。

example.ex: Now, I hadn't told him these details, so he must have done some research on his own.
example.tran: 你看，我没有告诉他这些细节，因此他一定是自己作了一些调查。

collins.def: You say 'Now' to introduce something which contrasts with what you have just said.

example.ex: Now, if it was me, I'd want to do more than just change the locks...
example.tran: 不过，如果是我，我要做的就不仅仅是换锁了。

example.ex: Now, as for the Democrats, they've been able to use this issue quite effectively to portray the president as insensitive.
example.tran: 然而，对民主党人来说，他们成功利用了这个问题来渲染总统的麻木不仁。

collins.def: If you say that something happens now and then or every now and again, you mean that it happens sometimes but not very often or regularly.

example.ex: My father has a collection of magazines to which I return every now and then...
example.tran: 我爸爸收藏了很多杂志，我有时会翻看一下。

example.ex: Now and again he'd join in when we were playing video games.
example.tran: 我们玩电子游戏时，他偶尔会和我们一起玩。

collins.def: If you say that something will happen any day now ,any moment now, or any time now, you mean that it will happen very soon.

example.ex: Jim expects to be sent to Europe any day now...
example.tran: 吉姆预计随时会被派到欧洲去。

example.ex: Any moment now the silence will be broken.
example.tran: 寂静随时会被打破。

collins.tran: (用于转换话题或播报新活动)下面
collins.def: People such as television presenters sometimes use now for when they are going to start talking about a different subject or presenting a new activity.

example.ex: And now for something completely different...
example.tran: 下面是完全不同的事情。

example.ex: Now for a quick look at some of the other stories in the news.
example.tran: 下面我们快速浏览一下其他新闻报道。

collins.def: Just now means a very short time ago.

example.ex: You looked pretty upset just now...
example.tran: 你刚才看上去挺难过的。

example.ex: I spoke just now of being in love...
example.tran: 我刚才说起坠入爱河的事。

collins.def: You use just now when you want to say that a particular situation exists at the time when you are speaking, although it may change in the future.

example.ex: I'm pretty busy just now...
example.tran: 我现在特别忙。

example.ex: Mr Goldsworth is not available just now.
example.tran: 戈兹沃斯先生这会儿没时间。

collins.tran: 机不可失;勿失良机;错过这村没这店
collins.def: If you say 'It's now or never', you mean that something must be done immediately, because if it is not done immediately there will not be another chance to do it.

example.ex: It's now or never, so make up your mind...
example.tran: 机不可失，下决心吧。

example.ex: Much as I hate to go, it's now or never.
example.tran: 虽然我很讨厌去，但也就此一回了。

collins.tran: (用于劝慰他人)好啦，好啦;得啦，得啦
collins.def: You can say 'now, now' as a friendly way of trying to comfort someone who is upset or distressed.

example.ex: 'I figure it's all over.'—'Now, now. You did just fine.'
example.tran: “我想都过去了。”——“好啦，好啦，你做得还不错。”

example.ex: 'I want to go with you, Daddy.'—'Now, now, sweetheart.'
example.tran: “爸爸，我想和你一起去。”——“好吧，好吧，小宝贝。”

collins.tran: (用于友好地告诫别人)算了，算了;好了，好了
collins.def: You can say 'Now, then' or 'Now, now' when you want to give someone you know well a friendly warning not to behave in a particular way.

example.ex: Now then, no unpleasantness, please...
example.tran: 好了，别争了，好吗?

example.ex: Now, now Roger, I'm sure you didn't  mean it but that remark was in very poor taste.
example.tran: 算了，罗杰，我肯定你不是那个意思，但那话太难听了。

collins.def: A number is a word such as 'two', 'nine', or 'twelve', or a symbol such as 1, 3, or 47. You use numbers to say how many things you are referring to or where something comes in a series.

example.ex: No, I don't know the room number...
example.tran: 不，我不知道房间号。

example.ex: Stan Laurel was born at number 3, Argyll Street...
example.tran: 斯坦·劳雷尔出生在阿盖尔街3号。

collins.tran: (同 large 或 small 连用，表示约数)数量，数目
collins.def: You use number with words such as 'large' or 'small' to say approximately how many things or people there are.

example.ex: Quite a considerable number of interviews are going on...
example.tran: 大量的采访在继续。

example.ex: I have had an enormous number of letters from single parents...
example.tran: 我已经收到了大量单亲家长的来信。

collins.def: If there are a number of things or people, there are several of them. If there are any number of things or people, there is a large quantity of them.

example.ex: I seem to remember that Sam told a number of lies...
example.tran: 我好像记得萨姆说过不少谎话。

example.ex: There must be any number of people in my position.
example.tran: 一定有很多人处在我这种境况。

collins.def: You can refer to someone's  or something's position in a list of the most successful or most popular of a particular type of thing as, for example, number one or number two.

example.ex: ...the world number one, Tiger Woods...
example.tran: 世界排名第一的泰格·伍兹

example.ex: Before you knew it, the single was at Number 90 in the US singles charts...
example.tran: 转眼之间这张单曲唱片已在美国单曲唱片排行榜上排名第90位了。

collins.def: If a group of people or things numbers a particular total, that is how many there are.

example.ex: They told me that their village numbered 100...
example.tran: 他们告诉我他们村子有100人。

example.ex: This time the dead were numbered in hundreds, not dozens.
example.tran: 这次死亡人数是数以百计，而非几十人。

collins.def: A number is the series of numbers that you dial when you are making a telephone call.

example.ex: Sarah sat down and dialled a number.
example.tran: 萨拉坐下来拨了一个电话号码。

example.ex: ...a list of names and telephone numbers...
example.tran: 姓名和电话号码表

collins.tran: 一段音乐;一首歌曲;一支舞
collins.def: You can refer to a short piece of music, a song, or a dance as a number .

example.ex: ...'Unforgettable', a number that was written and performed in 1951...
example.tran: 《难以忘怀》，一首1951年创作并演唱的歌曲

example.ex: Responsibility for the dance numbers was split between Robert Alton and the young George Balanchine.
example.tran: 舞蹈节目分别由罗伯特·奥尔顿和年轻的乔治·巴兰钦负责。

collins.def: If someone or something is numbered among a particular group, they are believed to belong in that group.

example.ex: The Leicester Swannington Railway is numbered among Britain's railway pioneers...
example.tran: 莱斯特—斯旺宁顿铁路被看作是英国最早的铁路之一。

example.ex: He numbered several Americans among his friends.
example.tran: 他把几个美国人看成朋友。

collins.def: If you number something, you mark it with a number, usually starting at 1.

example.ex: He cut his paper up into tiny squares, and he numbered each one...
example.tran: 他把纸剪成了小方块，然后逐一编号。

example.ex: Each factor has been numbered.
example.tran: 每个要素都编了号。

collins.def: If you say that someone's or something's days are numbered, you mean that they will not survive or be successful for much longer.

example.ex: Critics believe his days are numbered because audiences are tired of watching him.
example.tran: 批评家猜想他走红的时间不会长了，因为观众现在厌倦了他的表演。

collins.def: One of your number is a member of your group.

example.ex: Scientists like the idea that one of their number is close to the seat of power...
example.tran: 科学家们欢迎他们中的一员接近权力中心的想法。

example.ex: One of our number has made a very interesting design of flooring, which has won a prize.
example.tran: 我们中的一名成员设计出了非常有趣的地板图案，还获了奖。

collins.def: If you refer to the numbers game ,the numbers racket, or the numbers, you are referring to an illegal lottery or illegal betting.

means: 助动词  [非标准用语、方言] =have [主用于虚拟语气]

collins.tran: （用于连接两个名词，其中前者表示后者的特定方面）
collins.def: You use of to combine two nouns when the first noun identifies the feature of the second noun that you want to talk about.

example.ex: The average age of the women interviewed was only 21.5.
example.tran: 参加面试的女性平均年龄才21.5岁。

example.ex: ...the population of this town...
example.tran: 该镇的人口

collins.tran: （用于连接两个名词或名词与现在分词，其中后者对前者进行界定或补充信息）
collins.def: You use of to combine two nouns, or a noun and a present participle, when the second noun or present participle defines or gives more information about the first noun.

example.ex: Would you say what you felt was a feeling of betrayal?...
example.tran: 你是否觉得有一种被人出卖的感觉？

example.ex: She let out a little cry of pain.
example.tran: 她疼得轻呼了一声。

collins.tran: （用于指称动作的名词后说明该动作的对象或主体）
collins.def: You use of after nouns referring to actions to specify the person or thing that is affected by the action or that performs the action. For example, 'the kidnapping of the child' refers to an action affecting a child; 'the arrival of the next train' refers to an action performed by a train.

example.ex: ...the reduction of trade union power inside the party.
example.tran: 党内工会权力的削弱

example.ex: ...the assessment of future senior managers.
example.tran: 对未来高级经理的评估

collins.tran: （用于指称数量或组群的词和短语后表示计量的对象）
collins.def: You use of after words and phrases referring to quantities or groups of things to indicate the substance or thing that is being measured.

example.ex: ...7.6 litres of pure alcohol.
example.tran: 7.6升纯酒精

example.ex: ...a few kilometres of new roads.
example.tran: 几公里新修道路

collins.tran: （用于人或事物的名称后引出其所属或相关的机构或地方）
collins.def: You use of after the name of someone or something to introduce the institution or place they belong to or are connected with.

example.ex: ...the Prince of Wales.
example.tran: 威尔士亲王

example.ex: ...the Finance Minister of Bangladesh.
example.tran: 孟加拉国财政部长

collins.tran: （用于指称容器的名词后，说明容器及其所含物）
collins.def: You use of after a noun referring to a container to form an expression referring to the container and its contents.

example.ex: We could all do with a cup of tea...
example.tran: 要是能给我们都来杯茶就好了。

example.ex: Conder opened another bottle of wine...
example.tran: 康德又开了一瓶酒。

collins.tran: （用在可数名词后、不可数名词前表示某一单个物品）
collins.def: You use of after a count noun and before an uncount noun when you want to talk about an individual piece or item.

example.ex: ...a blade of grass...
example.tran: 一片草叶

example.ex: Marina ate only one slice of bread...
example.tran: 玛丽娜只吃了一片面包。

collins.tran: （表示材料或成分）由…制成（或组成）的
collins.def: You use of to indicate the materials or things that form something.

example.ex: ...local decorations of wood and straw.
example.tran: 用木头和稻草制成的本地饰品

example.ex: ...loose-fitting garments of linen.
example.tran: 宽松的亚麻布衣服

collins.tran: （用于名词后表示其为某事物的一部分）
collins.def: You use of after a noun which specifies a particular part of something, to introduce the thing that it is a part of.

example.ex: ...the other side of the square...
example.tran: 广场另一侧

example.ex: We had almost reached the end of the street.
example.tran: 我们几乎到了街的尽头。

collins.tran: （用于某些动词后表示动作所涉及的人或事物）关于，由于
collins.def: You use of after some verbs to indicate someone or something else involved in the action.

example.ex: He'd been dreaming of her...
example.tran: 他一直梦见她。

example.ex: Listen, I shall be thinking of you always...
example.tran: 听着，我会永远记得你的。

collins.tran: （用于某些形容词后表示与情感或特性相关的事物）对，为
collins.def: You use of after some adjectives to indicate the thing that a feeling or quality relates to.

example.ex: I have grown very fond of Alec...
example.tran: 我越来越喜欢亚力克。

example.ex: His father was quite naturally very proud of him...
example.tran: 他父亲自然为他感到无比骄傲。

collins.tran: （用于指称施动者的单词前说明对该动作的看法）出自…，在…一方
collins.def: You use of before a word referring to the person who performed an action when saying what you think about the action.

example.ex: This has been so nice, so terribly kind of you...
example.tran: 您这么做真是太好心，太令我们感激不尽了。

example.ex: I suppose it's stupid of us not to be able to make up our own minds...
example.tran: 我们自己都没办法拿定主意，这真是太傻了。

collins.tran: （用于描述名词后引出所指的人或事物）
collins.def: You use of after a noun which describes someone or something, to introduce the person or thing you are talking about.

example.ex: ...an awkward, slow-moving giant of a man.
example.tran: 举止笨拙、行动迟缓的巨人般的男子

collins.tran: （表示程度）更大/较小程度上的…
collins.def: If something is more of or less of a particular thing, it is that thing to a greater or smaller degree.

example.ex: Your extra fat may be more of a health risk than you realize...
example.tran: 多余的脂肪对健康的威胁可能比你意识到的要大。

example.ex: As time goes by, sleeping becomes less of a problem.
example.tran: 随着时间的推移，睡眠逐渐不再成为问题。

collins.tran: （表示某人或某事物具有的特点或特性）
collins.def: You use of to indicate a characteristic or quality that someone or something has.

example.ex: ...the worth of their music.
example.tran: 他们音乐的价值

example.ex: ...the creaminess of her skin...
example.tran: 她皮肤的光滑细腻

collins.tran: （用于be动词后表示某人或某事物具有的特点或特性）
collins.def: You use of after the verb 'be' to indicate a characteristic or quality that someone or something has.

example.ex: The crisis faced over the next few months is of an entirely different scale...
example.tran: 接下来几个月内将要面临的危机规模将是无法相比的。

example.ex: Both world wars were of unquestionable importance as economic events.
example.tran: 两次世界大战都是重要性无可置疑的经济事件。

collins.def: You use of to specify an amount, value, or age.

example.ex: Last Thursday, Nick announced record revenues of $3.4 billion...
example.tran: 上个星期四，尼克宣布公司收入创下34亿美元的纪录。

example.ex: He has been sentenced to a total of 21 years in prison since 1973...
example.tran: 自1973年以来，他已总共被判21年监禁。

collins.tran: （用于年、月等名词后表示状态或活动的持续时间）
collins.def: You use of after a noun such as 'month' or 'year' to indicate the length of time that some state or activity continues.

example.ex: ...eight bruising years of war...
example.tran: 艰苦卓绝的8年战争

example.ex: The project has gone through nearly a dozen years of planning.
example.tran: 该项目已历经近12年的规划。

collins.tran: （表示时间离某一钟点差几分）在…之前
collins.def: You can use of to say what time it is by indicating how many minutes there are before the hour mentioned.

example.ex: At about a quarter of eight in the evening Joe Urber calls...
example.tran: 大约晚上8点差一刻的时候，乔·乌尔贝尔打来电话。

example.ex: We got to the beach at five of one in the afternoon.
example.tran: 我们下午1点差5分的时候到达海滩。

collins.def: If something is taken off something else or moves off it, it is no longer touching that thing.

example.ex: He took his feet off the desk...
example.tran: 他把脚从桌上移开。

example.ex: I took the key for the room off a rack above her head...
example.tran: 我从她头上方的架子上拿走了房门钥匙。

collins.def: When you get off a bus, train, or plane, you come out of it or leave it after you have been travelling on it.

example.ex: Don't try to get on or off a moving train!...
example.tran: 火车运行时请勿上下车！

example.ex: As he stepped off the aeroplane, he was shot dead.
example.tran: 他一走下飞机便中枪身亡。

collins.def: If you keep off a street or piece of land, you do not step on it or go there.

example.ex: Locking up men does nothing more than keep them off the streets...
example.tran: 把这些人关起来只是做到了不让他们上街而已。

example.ex: The local police had warned visitors to keep off the beach at night.
example.tran: 当地警方告诫游客不要在夜间去海滩。

collins.def: If something is situated off a place such as a coast, room, or road, it is near to it or next to it, but not exactly in it.

example.ex: The boat was anchored off the northern coast of the peninsula...
example.tran: 这艘船停泊在离该半岛北部海岸不远的地方。

example.ex: Lily lives in a penthouse just off Park Avenue...
example.tran: 莉莉住在公园大道附近的一套顶层豪华公寓里。

collins.def: If you go off, you leave a place.

example.ex: He was just about to drive off when the secretary came running out...
example.tran: 他正打算驾车离开，这时秘书跑了出来。

example.ex: She gave a hurried wave and set off across the grass...
example.tran: 她匆匆地挥了挥手便穿过草地离开了。

collins.tran: （用于非正式及有时具冒犯性的短语动词）（走）开，（滚）开
collins.def: Off is used in a number of informal and sometimes offensive phrasal verbs, such as buzz off ,clear off, or in British English bugger off, which are used to tell someone angrily to go away.
When you take off clothing or jewellery that you are wearing, you remove it from your body.

example.ex: He took off his spectacles and rubbed frantically at the lens...
example.tran: 他摘下眼镜，疯狂地擦着镜片。

example.ex: He hastily stripped off his old uniform and began pulling on the new one.
example.tran: 他匆匆地脱下旧制服，开始穿上新的那件。

collins.tran: （因生病、放假等等）休息，不工作
collins.def: If you have time off or a particular day off, you do not go to work or school, for example because you are ill or it is a day when you do not usually work.

example.ex: The rest of the men had the day off...
example.tran: 其他人这天没上班。

example.ex: You can even snatch a few hours off, and perhaps negotiate the occasional night off too...
example.tran: 你甚至可以抽空休息几小时，商量一下的话没准还能偶尔不用上晚班。

collins.def: If you keep off a subject, you deliberately avoid talking about it.

example.ex: Keep off the subject of politics...
example.tran: 勿谈政治。

example.ex: Keep the conversation off linguistic matters.
example.tran: 避谈语言学问题。

collins.def: If something such as an agreement or a sporting event is off, it is cancelled.

example.ex: Until Pointon is completely happy, however, the deal's off...
example.tran: 但是，在波因顿完全满意之前，这一协议不再作数。

example.ex: The vacant W.B.C. junior-lightweight title has been called off...
example.tran: 空缺的世界拳击理事会次轻量级头衔被取消了。

collins.def: If someone is off something harmful such as a drug, they have stopped taking or using it.

example.ex: She felt better and the psychiatrist took her off drug therapy...
example.tran: 她感觉好些了，那位精神科医生让她停止了药物治疗。

example.ex: Most pregnant women remain off cigarettes while carrying the child.
example.tran: 大多数孕妇都在孕期戒了烟。

collins.def: If you are off something, you have stopped liking it.

example.ex: I'm off coffee at the moment...
example.tran: 我眼下不再嗜咖啡了。

example.ex: Diarrhoea can make you feel weak, as well as putting you off your food.
example.tran: 腹泻会让人感到乏力，而且没有胃口。

collins.tran: （机器、电灯等）关掉，停掉，不再运转
collins.def: When something such as a machine or electric light is off, it is not functioning or in use. When you switch it off, you stop it functioning.

example.ex: As he pulled into the driveway, he saw her bedroom light was off...
example.tran: 当他把车开进车道时，他看到她卧室的灯已经熄了。

example.ex: We used sail power and turned the engine off to save our fuel...
example.tran: 我们借助风帆的动力航行，且关掉了发动机以节省燃油。

collins.def: If there is money off something, its price is reduced by the amount specified.

example.ex: ...Simons Leatherwear, 37 Old Christchurch Road. 20 per cent off all jackets this Saturday.
example.tran: 本周六老基督堂路37号的西蒙斯皮衣店所有夹克降价20％。

example.ex: ...discounts offering thousands of pounds off the normal price of a car.
example.tran: 比平时车价低几千英镑的折扣

collins.def: If something is a long way off, it is a long distance away from you.

example.ex: Florida was a long way off...
example.tran: 佛罗里达离这儿很远。

example.ex: ...animals that from a long way off look like flies...
example.tran: 远看像苍蝇的动物

collins.def: If something is a long time off, it will not happen for a long time.

example.ex: An end to the crisis seems a long way off...
example.tran: 这场危机看来远未结束。

example.ex: The required technology is probably still two years off.
example.tran: 所需技术可能还要两年才能开发出来。

collins.def: If you get something off someone, you obtain it from them.

example.ex: I don't really get a lot of information, and if I do I get it off Mark...
example.tran: 我得到的信息其实不多，即使有也是马克告诉我的。

example.ex: I can't find the boys' shampoo. I can't think where I put it when I took it off them...
example.tran: 我找不到那帮家伙的洗发水了，从他们那里拿来后我就忘了搁在什么地方。

collins.tran: （与well,badly,worse等副词连用构成形容词）表示“处于…境况的”
collins.def: Off combines with adverbs such as 'well', 'badly', and 'worse' to form adjectives that indicate how poor or rich someone is.

example.ex: Most of these people aren't very well off...
example.tran: 这些人大都不算太富裕。

example.ex: Surely you can't be that badly off?...
example.tran: 你肯定没那么穷吧？

collins.def: If food has gone off, it tastes and smells bad because it is no longer fresh enough to be eaten.

example.ex: Don't eat that! It's mouldy. It's gone off!
example.tran: 别吃那个！它已经发霉变质了！

collins.def: If you live off a particular kind of food, you eat it in order to live. If you live off a particular source of money, you use it to live.

example.ex: Her husband's memories are of living off roast chicken and drinking whisky...
example.tran: 她丈夫只记得过去吃烤鸡、喝威士忌的日子。

example.ex: Antony had been living off the sale of his own paintings.
example.tran: 安东尼一直靠卖自己的画为生。

collins.tran: （机器）靠（某种燃料或动力运转）
collins.def: If a machine runs off a particular kind of fuel or power, it uses that power in order to function.

example.ex: The Auto Compact Disc Cleaner can run off batteries or mains.
example.tran: 这种光盘自动清洗机可用电池或电源两种方式驱动。

collins.tran: （行为）过头的，不当的，无法接受的
collins.def: If you say that someone's behaviour is a bit off, you mean that you find it unacceptable or wrong.

example.ex: ...coming home with make-up all over his clothes — it's a bit off isn't it...
example.tran: 衣服上到处沾着化妆品回到家——他这样有点过分了，是不是。

example.ex: Some of the dialogue is slightly off.
example.tran: 部分对话有些不太得体。

collins.def: If something happens on and off, or off and on, it happens occasionally, or only for part of a period of time, not in a regular or continuous way.

example.ex: I was still working on and off as a waitress to support myself...
example.tran: 我为了糊口仍然间或去做服务员。

example.ex: We lived together, off and on, for two years.
example.tran: 我们断断续续在一起生活了两年。

collins.def: If you offer something to someone, you ask them if they would like to have it or use it.

example.ex: He has offered seats at the conference table to the Russian leader and the president of Kazakhstan...
example.tran: 他已邀请俄罗斯领导人和哈萨克斯坦总统参加会谈。

example.ex: The number of companies offering them work increased...
example.tran: 越来越多的公司向他们提供工作机会。

collins.def: If you offer to do something, you say that you are willing to do it.

example.ex: Peter offered to teach them water-skiing...
example.tran: 彼得主动提出教他们滑水。

example.ex: 'Can I get you a drink,' she offered.
example.tran: “想要喝点什么吗，”她提议道。

collins.def: An offer is something that someone says they will give you or do for you.

example.ex: The offer of talks with Moscow marks a significant change from the previous western position...
example.tran: 提议与莫斯科举行会谈标志着西方立场的重大转变。

example.ex: 'I ought to reconsider her offer to move in,' he mused...
example.tran: “我该重新考虑她让我搬去和她一起住的提议，”他思忖着。

collins.tran: 提供（信息、建议等）；作出（表扬）
collins.def: If you offer someone information, advice, or praise, you give it to them, usually because you feel that they need it or deserve it.

example.ex: They manage a company offering advice on mergers and acquisitions...
example.tran: 他们经营着一家为兼并收购业务提供咨询的公司。

example.ex: She offered him emotional and practical support in countless ways...
example.tran: 她以数不清的方式给予了他情感上和实质上的支持。

collins.def: If you offer someone something such as love or friendship, you show them that you feel that way towards them.

example.ex: The President has offered his sympathy to the Georgian people...
example.tran: 总统对格鲁吉亚人民表示了同情。

example.ex: It must be better to be able to offer them love and security...
example.tran: 要是能给予他们关爱和安全感肯定会更好。

collins.tran: （向上帝或神）奉献（祈祷、赞美），祭献（牺牲）
collins.def: If people offer prayers, praise, or a sacrifice to God or a god, they speak to or give something to their god.

example.ex: Church leaders offered prayers and condemned the bloodshed...
example.tran: 教会领袖向上帝祈祷并谴责流血事件。

example.ex: He will offer the first harvest of rice to the sun goddess.
example.tran: 他将把收获的第一束稻子献给太阳女神。

collins.tran: （机构等）提供，给予（服务、产品等）
collins.def: If an organization offers something such as a service or product, it provides it.

example.ex: We have been successful because we are offering a quality service...
example.tran: 我们因提供的服务水准一流一直经营得很成功。

example.ex: Sainsbury's is offering customers 1p for each shopping bag reused...
example.tran: 塞恩斯伯里超市为重复利用购物袋的顾客提供每只1便士的奖励。

collins.def: An offer in a shop is a specially low price for a specific product or something extra that you get if you buy a certain product.

example.ex: This month's offers include a shirt, trousers and bed covers...
example.tran: 本月的特价商品包括一款衬衫、裤子和多种床罩。

example.ex: Today's special offer gives you a choice of three destinations...
example.tran: 今天推出的特价线路有3个目的地可供选择。

collins.def: If you offer a particular amount of money for something, you say that you will pay that much to buy it.

example.ex: Whitney has offered $21.50 a share in cash for 49.5 million Prime shares...
example.tran: 惠特尼公司开出每股21.50美元的现金价收购4,950 万股普赖姆公司的股票。

example.ex: They are offering farmers $2.15 a bushel for corn...
example.tran: 他们向农民出价每蒲式耳2.15美元收购玉米。
