collins.def: An offer is the amount of money that someone says they will pay to buy something or give to someone because they have harmed them in some way.

example.ex: The lawyers say no one else will make me an offer...
example.tran: 律师说不会再有人给我出价了。

example.ex: He has dismissed an offer of compensation.
example.tran: 他拒绝接受赔偿金。

collins.def: If you have something to offer, you have a quality or ability that makes you important, attractive, or useful.

example.ex: In your free time, explore all that this incredible city has to offer.
example.tran: 您可以在闲暇时间探索这座美妙城市的各种风情。

collins.tran: 提供的；供使用的；待售的
collins.def: If there is something on offer, it is available to be used or bought.

example.ex: Savings schemes are the best retail investment products on offer.
example.tran: 储蓄方案是现有的最佳零售投资产品。

example.ex: ...country cottages on offer at bargain prices.
example.tran: 低价出售的乡村别墅

collins.tran: 愿意考虑买方出价；愿意接受合理报价
collins.def: If you are open to offers, you are willing to do something if someone will pay you an amount of money that you think is reasonable.

example.ex: It seems that while the Kiwis are keen to have him, he is still open to offers.
example.tran: 看来尽管新西兰几维队很想与他签约，他仍然欢迎其他球队开价。

collins.def: An office is a room or a part of a building where people work sitting at desks.

example.ex: He had an office big enough for his desk and chair, plus his VDU...
example.tran: 他有一间足以容纳书桌、椅子和视频显示器的办公室。

example.ex: At about 4.30 p.m. Audrey arrived at the office...
example.tran: 大约下午4点30分，奥德丽到了办公室。

collins.def: An office is a department of an organization, especially the government, where people deal with a particular kind of administrative work.

example.ex: Thousands have registered with unemployment offices.
example.tran: 已有数千人在失业管理处作了登记。

example.ex: ...Downing Street's press office.
example.tran: 唐宁街新闻办公室

collins.tran: （问询、购票或提供服务的）处，所
collins.def: An office is a small building or room where people can go for information, tickets, or a service of some kind.

example.ex: The tourist office operates a useful room-finding service.
example.tran: 这家旅游办事处提供十分实用的住宿查询服务。

example.ex: ...the airline ticket offices.
example.tran: 航空公司售票处

collins.def: A doctor's or dentist's office is a place where a doctor or dentist sees their patients.
If someone holds office in a government, they have an important job or position of authority.

example.ex: The events to mark the President's ten years in office went ahead as planned...
example.tran: 总统任职10周年的庆祝活动按计划进行。

example.ex: They are fed up with the politicians and want to vote them out of office...
example.tran: 他们再也无法忍受这些政客，希望通过选举把他们赶下台。

collins.def: Someone's good offices are the help that they give to other people who are trying to achieve something.

example.ex: She sought the good offices of the President for the smooth passage of the Bill.
example.tran: 为了使该法案顺利通过，她寻求总统的帮助。

collins.def: In the armed forces, an officer is a person in a position of authority.

example.ex: ...a retired British army officer...
example.tran: 退役的英国陆军军官

example.ex: Her husband served during the Civil War as an officer in the White Army.
example.tran: 她的丈夫在内战时期是一名白军的军官。

collins.tran: （机构的）高级职员；（尤指政府机构的）官员，公务员
collins.def: An officer is a person who has a responsible position in an organization, especially a government organization.

example.ex: ...a local authority education officer.
example.tran: 当地政府的教育官员

collins.def: Members of the police force can be referred to as officers .

example.ex: ...senior officers in the West Midlands police force...
example.tran: 西米德兰兹郡警队的高级警官

example.ex: Thank you, Officer.
example.tran: 谢谢你，警官。

collins.def: Official means approved by the government or by someone in authority.

example.ex: According to the official figures, over one thousand people died during the revolution...
example.tran: 根据官方数字，1,000多人在这场革命中丧生。

example.ex: An official announcement is expected in the next few days...
example.tran: 预计过几天会发布一项正式声明。

collins.def: Official activities are carried out by a person in authority as part of their job.

example.ex: The President is in Brazil for an official two-day visit.
example.tran: 总统正在巴西进行为期两天的正式访问。

collins.def: Official things are used by a person in authority as part of their job.

example.ex: ...the official residence of the Head of State.
example.tran: 国家元首的官邸

collins.tran: （解释、理由等）冠冕堂皇的，桌面上的
collins.def: If you describe someone's explanation or reason for something as the official explanation, you are suggesting that it is probably not true, but is used because the real explanation is embarrassing.

example.ex: The official explanation for the cancellation of the party conference is that there are no premises available...
example.tran: 官方对取消此次政党会议作出的解释是没有场地。

example.ex: The official reason given for the President's absence was sickness.
example.tran: 对外公布的总统未到场原因是身体有恙。

collins.tran: 官员；行政人员；高级职员
collins.def: An official is a person who holds a position of authority in an organization.

example.ex: A senior UN official hopes to visit Baghdad this month.
example.tran: 一位联合国高级官员希望于本月访问巴格达。

collins.tran: （体育比赛中的）裁判员，执法人
collins.def: An official at a sports event is a referee, umpire, or other person who checks that the players follow the rules.
If something often happens, it happens many times or much of the time.

example.ex: They often spent Christmas at Prescott Hill...
example.tran: 他们经常在普雷斯科特山过圣诞节。

example.ex: Early American weathervanes were most often cut from flat wooden boards...
example.tran: 美国早期的风向标大多截自平直的木板。

collins.tran: （用于询问或说明某事发生的频率）（多）常
collins.def: You use how often to ask questions about frequency. You also use often in reported clauses and other statements to give information about the frequency of something.

example.ex: How often do you brush your teeth?...
example.tran: 你多久刷一次牙？

example.ex: I don't know how often I heard the same awful jokes...
example.tran: 这种千篇一律的烂笑话我不知道听过多少回了。

collins.def: If something happens every so often, it happens regularly, but with fairly long intervals between each occasion.

example.ex: She's going to come back every so often...
example.tran: 她会偶尔回来的。

example.ex: Every so often he would turn and look at her.
example.tran: 他会时不时回头看她一眼。

collins.def: If you say that something happens as often as not, or more often than not, you mean that it happens fairly frequently, and that this can be considered as typical of the kind of situation you are talking about.

example.ex: Yet, as often as not, they find themselves the target of persecution rather than praise...
example.tran: 然而，他们发现自己往往不是被赞扬而是遭刁难。

example.ex: Although sometimes I feel like bothering, as often as not I don't...
example.tran: 虽然我有时会觉得这是在找麻烦，但是通常并不会这样。

collins.def: Oil is a smooth, thick liquid that is used as a fuel and for making the parts of machines move smoothly. Oil is found underground.

example.ex: The company buys and sells about 600,000 barrels of oil a day.
example.tran: 该公司每天买卖约60万桶石油。

example.ex: ...the rapid rise in prices for oil and petrol.
example.tran: 石油与汽油价格的急剧上涨

collins.def: If you oil something, you put oil onto or into it, for example to make it work smoothly or to protect it.

example.ex: A crew of assistants oiled and adjusted the release mechanism until it worked perfectly...
example.tran: 一班助手给排放装置加润滑油并作调试，直到其达至理想工作状态。

example.ex: The leather may need to be oiled every two to three weeks in order to retain its suppleness.
example.tran: 为了保持皮革的柔韧性，可能两三周就要上一次油。

collins.def: Oil is a smooth, thick liquid made from plants and is often used for cooking.

example.ex: Combine the beans, chopped mint and olive oil in a large bowl...
example.tran: 将菜豆、切碎的薄荷和橄榄油放在大碗里搅拌。

example.ex: Drop the slices into the oil and fry until golden brown.
example.tran: 将切片倒进油里，煎至金棕色。

collins.def: Oil is a smooth, thick liquid, often with a pleasant smell, that you rub into your skin or add to your bath.

example.ex: Try a hot bath with some relaxing bath oil...
example.tran: 用舒缓沐浴油洗个热水澡吧。

example.ex: My sister smeared herself with suntan oil and slept by the swimming pool all day.
example.tran: 我姐姐抹了些防晒油，一整天睡在游泳池边。

collins.def: Oils are oil paintings .

example.ex: Her colourful oils and works on paper have a naive, dreamlike quality.
example.tran: 她那些色彩斑斓的油画与纸上作品给人一种天真、梦幻般的感觉。

collins.def: When an artist paints in oils, he or she uses oil paints.

example.ex: When she paints in oils she always uses the same range of colours.
example.tran: 她创作油画时总是使用同一组色彩。

collins.def: If you pour oil on troubled waters, you try to calm down a difficult situation.

collins.tran: 使…顺利进行；使…正常运作
collins.def: If someone or something oils the wheels of a process or system, they help things to run smoothly and successfully.

example.ex: On all such occasions, the king stands in the wings, oiling the wheels of diplomacy.
example.tran: 在所有这样的场合，国王总是身处幕后确保外交活动的顺利进行。

means: （用于指称被替代的东西）原来的

collins.tran: 年老的；年纪大的；不年轻的
collins.def: Someone who is old has lived for many years and is no longer young.

example.ex: ...a white-haired old man...
example.tran: 白发老人

example.ex: He was considered too old for the job.
example.tran: 他被认为年纪太大,不适合做这份工作。

collins.def: You use old to talk about how many days, weeks, months, or years someone or something has lived or existed.

example.ex: He was abandoned by his father when he was three months old...
example.tran: 他3个月大的时候被父亲遗弃了。

example.ex: The paintings in the chapel were perhaps a thousand years old...
example.tran: 小教堂里的这些画可能有1,000年的历史了。

collins.tran: 古老的；长久的；历史悠久的
collins.def: Something that is old has existed for a long time.

example.ex: She loved the big old house...
example.tran: 她喜欢这幢古老的大房子。

example.ex: These books must be very old.
example.tran: 这些书肯定有好些年头了。

collins.def: Something that is old is no longer in good condition because of its age or because it has been used a lot.

example.ex: He took a bunch of keys from the pocket of his old corduroy trousers.
example.tran: 他从破旧的灯芯绒裤子口袋里掏出一串钥匙。

example.ex: ...an old toothbrush.
example.tran: 一把旧牙刷

collins.tran: 旧时的；过去的；从前的；过时的
collins.def: You use old to refer to something that is no longer used, that no longer exists, or that has been replaced by something else.

example.ex: The old road had disappeared under grass and heather...
example.tran: 从前的那条路已经消失在杂草和欧石南丛中。

example.ex: Although the old secret police have been abolished, the military police still exist...
example.tran: 虽然旧时的秘密警察业已废除，但宪兵队依然存在。

collins.tran: 原来（属于自己）的；原先（生活中）的
collins.def: You use old to refer to something that used to belong to you, or to a person or thing that used to have a particular role in your life.

example.ex: I'll make up the bed in your old room...
example.tran: 我会把你原来房间的床铺整理好。

example.ex: I still have affection for my old school...
example.tran: 我依然眷恋着母校。

collins.tran: （朋友）相识已久的；（敌人）结有宿怨的；（对手）长期竞争的
collins.def: An old friend, enemy, or rival is someone who has been your friend, enemy, or rival for a long time.

example.ex: I called my old friend John Horner...
example.tran: 我给老朋友约翰·霍纳打了电话。

example.ex: Mr Brownson, I assure you King's an old enemy of mine...
example.tran: 布朗森先生，我向你保证金是我的老冤家。

collins.def: You can use old to express affection when talking to or about someone you know.

example.ex: Are you all right, old chap?...
example.tran: 你还好吗，老家伙？

example.ex: Good old Bergen would do him the favor.
example.tran: 好心肠的老伯根会帮他这个忙的。

collins.tran: 随便哪个/不是随便哪个
collins.def: You use any old to emphasize that the quality or type of something is not important. If you say that a particular thing is not any old thing, you are emphasizing how special or famous it is.

example.ex: Any old paper will do...
example.tran: 随便一张旧报纸就行。

example.ex: The portraits and sumptuous ornaments, and the gold clock, show that this is not just any old front room.
example.tran: 墙上挂的画像、奢华的装饰和那座金钟都表明这可不是一间普普通通的客厅。

collins.def: In the old days means in the past, before things changed.

example.ex: In the old days we got a visit from the vet maybe once a year.
example.tran: 以前，兽医大概每年来我们这里出诊一次。

collins.tran: 往昔的好日子；过去的好时光
collins.def: When people refer to the good old days, they are referring to a time in the past when they think that life was better than it is now.

example.ex: He remembers the good old days when everyone in his village knew him and you could leave your door open at night.
example.tran: 他还记得村里人互相熟识、可以夜不闭户的美好往昔。

collins.def: If you talk about people or things of old, you are referring to people or things that existed long ago but which no longer exist, or no longer exist in the same form.

example.ex: ...the warrior knights of old.
example.tran: 旧时骁勇善战的骑士

example.ex: ...a programme of work to recreate the Sherwood Forest of old.
example.tran: 重现古时舍伍德森林的工程

collins.def: If someone or something is on a surface or object, the surface or object is immediately below them and is supporting their weight.

example.ex: He is sitting beside her on the sofa...
example.tran: 他挨着她坐在沙发上。

example.ex: On top of the cupboards are vast straw baskets which Pat uses for dried flower arrangements...
example.tran: 橱柜顶上摆着帕特用来插干花的大草篮。

collins.def: If something is on a surface or object, it is stuck to it or attached to it.

example.ex: I admired the peeling paint on the ceiling...
example.tran: 我“观赏”着天花板上正在剥落的油漆。

example.ex: The clock on the wall showed one minute to twelve...
example.tran: 墙上的钟指向11点59分。

collins.def: If you put, throw, or drop something on a surface, you move it or drop it so that it is then supported by the surface.

example.ex: He got his winter jacket from the closet and dropped it on the sofa...
example.tran: 他从衣橱里取出冬天穿的夹克，把它扔到沙发上。

example.ex: He threw a folded dollar on the counter.
example.tran: 他将折起的1美元钞票扔到柜台上。

collins.def: You use on to say what part of your body is supporting your weight.

example.ex: He continued to lie on his back and look at clouds...
example.tran: 他仍旧仰卧着，望着天上的云彩。

example.ex: He raised himself on his elbows, squinting into the sun...
example.tran: 他用胳膊肘支起身子，眯着眼睛看了看太阳。

collins.tran: （表示接触到身体某部位）在…上
collins.def: You use on to say that someone or something touches a part of a person's body.

example.ex: He leaned down and kissed her lightly on the mouth...
example.tran: 他俯下身去，在她嘴唇上轻轻一吻。

example.ex: His jaw was broken after he was hit on the head.
example.tran: 他的头部受重击之后下颌骨折了。

collins.def: If someone has a particular expression on their face, their face has that expression.

example.ex: The maid looked at him, a nervous smile on her face...
example.tran: 女服务员看着他，脸上带着一丝局促不安的微笑。

example.ex: She looked at him with a hurt expression on her face.
example.tran: 她望着他，脸上流露出受伤的表情。

collins.def: When you put a piece of clothing on, you place it over part of your body in order to wear it. If you have it on, you are wearing it.

example.ex: He put his coat on while she opened the front door...
example.tran: 她打开前门时，他穿上了大衣。

example.ex: I had a hat on.
example.tran: 我戴了顶帽子。

collins.def: You can say that you have something on you if you are carrying it in your pocket or in a bag.

example.ex: I didn't have any money on me...
example.tran: 我身上一分钱也没有。

example.ex: I have those numbers, but not on me at the moment, they're at home.
example.tran: 我有这些号码，但眼下没带在身上，搁在家里了。

collins.def: If someone's eyes are on you, they are looking or staring at you.

example.ex: Everyone's eyes were fixed on him...
example.tran: 每个人都盯着他看。

example.ex: It's as if all eyes are focused on me...
example.tran: 好像所有的目光都聚集在我身上似的。

collins.def: If you hurt yourself on something, you accidentally hit a part of your body against it and that thing causes damage to you.

example.ex: Mr Pendle hit his head on a wall as he fell...
example.tran: 彭德尔先生摔倒时头磕到了墙上。

example.ex: One day when my wife was doing the dishes she cut her hand on a broken glass.
example.tran: 一天，我妻子洗碗碟时，被一只破玻璃杯割破了手。

collins.def: If you are on an area of land, you are there.

example.ex: He was able to spend only a few days at a time on the island...
example.tran: 他每次去岛上都只能呆几天。

example.ex: You lived on the farm until you came back to America?
example.tran: 你回美国之前一直生活在农场吗？

collins.tran: 是（道路、海岸等）的一部分；在…边上
collins.def: If something is situated on a place such as a road or coast, it forms part of it or is by the side of it.

example.ex: Bergdorf Goodman has opened a men's store on Fifth Avenue...
example.tran: 波道夫·古德曼在第五大道上开了一家男装店。

example.ex: The hotel is on the coast...
example.tran: 这家饭店在海边。

collins.tran: 上，乘（公共汽车、火车或飞机）
collins.def: If you get on a bus, train, or plane, you go into it in order to travel somewhere. If you are on it, you are travelling in it.

example.ex: We waited till twelve and we finally got on the plane...
example.tran: 我们一直等到12点才终于上了飞机。

example.ex: I never go on the bus into the town...
example.tran: 我从不坐公共汽车去城里。

collins.def: If there is something on a piece of paper, it has been written or printed there.

example.ex: The writing on the back of the card was cramped but scrupulously neat...
example.tran: 这张卡片的背面写满了密密麻麻但却十分工整的字。

example.ex: The numbers she put on the chart were 98.4, 64, and 105...
example.tran: 她在图表上写的数字是98.4，64和105。

collins.def: If something is on a list, it is included in it.

example.ex: I've seen your name on the list of deportees...
example.tran: 我看见你的名字在被驱逐出境者名单之列。

example.ex: The Queen now doesn't even appear on the list of the 40 richest people in Britain.
example.tran: 如今女王甚至连英国首富榜的前40名都挤不进去。

collins.def: Books, discussions, or ideas on a particular subject are concerned with that subject.

example.ex: The longest chapter in almost any book on baby care is on feeding...
example.tran: 几乎所有关于婴儿护理的书籍中内容最多的一章都是喂养。

example.ex: They offer a free counselling service which can offer help and advice on legal matters...
example.tran: 他们提供免费咨询服务，给予法律问题的援助和建议。

collins.tran: 以，凭，靠（某一方法、原则或系统）
collins.def: You use on to introduce the method, principle, or system which is used to do something.

example.ex: ...a television that we bought on credit two months ago.
example.tran: 我们两个月前赊购的电视机

example.ex: ...a levelling system which acts on the same principle as a spirit level...
example.tran: 工作原理与气泡水准仪相同的水准测量系统

collins.tran: 通过，借助于（某一器械或机器）
collins.def: If something is done on an instrument or a machine, it is done using that instrument or machine.

example.ex: ...songs that I could just sit down and play on the piano...
example.tran: 我坐下来就可以在钢琴上弹出的歌曲

example.ex: I could do all my work on the computer...
example.tran: 我所有的工作都能在计算机上完成。

collins.def: If information is, for example, on tape or on computer, that is the way that it is stored.

example.ex: 'I thought it was a load of rubbish.' — 'Right we've got that on tape.'...
example.tran: “我觉得那是一派胡言。”——“没错，我们已经把它录在磁带上了。”

example.ex: Descriptions of the pieces have been logged on computer by the Art Loss Register...
example.tran: 艺术品失窃登记处已经将这些艺术品的描述信息输入到计算机里。

collins.def: If something is being broadcast, you can say that it is on the radio or television.

example.ex: Every sporting event on television and satellite over the next seven days is listed...
example.tran: 未来7天通过电视和卫星转播的每一项体育赛事都列在节目预告单上。

example.ex: Here, listen, they're talking about it on Radio-Paris right now.
example.tran: 嘿，听，巴黎电台正在谈论这事呢。

collins.def: When an activity is taking place, you can say that it is on .

example.ex: There's a marvellous match on at Wimbledon at the moment...
example.tran: 此刻在温布尔登正进行着一场精彩的比赛。

example.ex: Every year they put a play on at Saint Holy Cross Church...
example.tran: 他们每年在圣十字教堂上演一出剧目。

collins.tran: （表示某人忙碌程度）忙得很/没什么可忙
collins.def: You use on in expressions such as 'have a lot on' and 'not have very much on' to indicate how busy someone is.

example.ex: I have a lot on in the next week.
example.tran: 我下周特别忙。

collins.tran: （引出所进行的活动，特别是旅行）处于…情况中，在从事…中
collins.def: You use on to introduce an activity that someone is doing, particularly travelling.

example.ex: I've always wanted to go on a cruise...
example.tran: 我一直想坐游轮旅游。

example.ex: They look happy and relaxed as they stroll in the sunshine on a shopping trip...
example.tran: 他们漫步于阳光下购物，看上去悠然惬意。

collins.tran: （机器、电灯等）开着，工作着，使用中
collins.def: When something such as a machine or an electric light is on, it is functioning or in use. When you switch it on, it starts functioning.

example.ex: The light was on and the door was open...
example.tran: 灯亮着，门也敞开着。

example.ex: The central heating's been turned off. I've turned it on again...
example.tran: 中央供暖系统已经关上。我又将它打开了。

collins.def: If you are on a committee or council, you are a member of it.

example.ex: Claire and Beryl were on the organizing committee...
example.tran: 克莱尔和贝丽尔是组委会成员。

example.ex: He was on the Council of Foreign Relations.
example.tran: 他任职于外交关系委员会。

collins.tran: 在（某一日子或日期）（发生）
collins.def: You can indicate when something happens by saying that it happens on a particular day or date.

example.ex: This year's event will take place on June 19th, a week earlier than usual...
example.tran: 今年的活动将于6月19日举行，比往年提前一周。

example.ex: She travels to Korea on Monday...
example.tran: 她周一前往韩国。

collins.def: You use on when mentioning an event that was followed by another one.

example.ex: She waited in her hotel to welcome her children on their arrival from London...
example.tran: 她在宾馆里等候，准备第一时间迎接孩子们从伦敦过来。

example.ex: On reaching Dubai the evacuees are taken straight to Dubai international airport.
example.tran: 撤离人员一抵达迪拜就径直被送往迪拜国际机场。

collins.def: You use on to say that someone is continuing to do something.

example.ex: They walked on in silence for a while...
example.tran: 他们继续默默无语地走了一会儿。

example.ex: If the examination shows your company enjoys basically good health, read on...
example.tran: 要是审查表明你们公司的运营状况基本良好，请继续往下读。

collins.def: If you say that someone goes on at you, you mean that they continually criticize you, complain to you, or ask you to do something.

example.ex: She's been on at me for weeks to show her round the stables...
example.tran: 她缠了我好几个星期了，要我带她去马厩看看。

example.ex: He used to keep on at me about the need to win...
example.tran: 他以前总是跟我唠叨必须获胜才行。

collins.def: You use on in expressions such as from now on and from then on to indicate that something starts to happen at the time mentioned and continues to happen afterwards.

example.ex: Perhaps it would be best not to see much of you from now on...
example.tran: 也许从现在起我们最好少见面。

example.ex: We can expect trouble from this moment on...
example.tran: 从此刻起，我们将会麻烦缠身。

collins.tran: （常用在副词early，late，far及其比较级之后，尤置于句首、句尾或介词之前）
collins.def: You often use on after the adverbs 'early', 'late', 'far', and their comparative forms, especially at the beginning or end of a sentence, or before a preposition.

example.ex: The market square is a riot of colour and animation from early on in the morning...
example.tran: 从大清早起这个市集广场就色彩缤纷，生机勃勃。

example.ex: Later on I learned how to read music...
example.tran: 后来我学会了识谱。

collins.def: Someone who is on a drug takes it regularly.

example.ex: She was on antibiotics for an eye infection that wouldn't go away...
example.tran: 由于眼睛感染一直不见好，她在服用抗生素。

example.ex: Many of the elderly are on medication.
example.tran: 许多老年人都需按时服药。

collins.tran: 以…（为食）；（机器）用（某种动力或燃料运转）
collins.def: If you live on a particular kind of food, you eat it. If a machine runs on a particular kind of power or fuel, it uses it in order to function.

example.ex: The caterpillars feed on a wide range of trees, shrubs and plants...
example.tran: 毛虫以各类树木、灌木和植物为食。

example.ex: He lived on a diet of water and tinned fish...
example.tran: 他仅靠喝水、吃鱼罐头过活。

collins.def: If you are on a particular income, that is the income that you have.

example.ex: ...young people who are unemployed or on low wages...
example.tran: 失业或低收入的年轻人

example.ex: He's on three hundred a week...
example.tran: 他的周薪为300块。

collins.def: Taxes or profits that are obtained from something are referred to as taxes or profits on it.

example.ex: ...a general strike to protest a tax on food and medicine last week...
example.tran: 上周抗议对食品和药品征税的大罢工

example.ex: The Church was to receive a cut of the profits on every record sold...
example.tran: 每卖出一张唱片就会有一部分利润捐给教会。

collins.def: When you buy something or pay for something, you spend money on it.

example.ex: I resolved not to waste money on a hotel...
example.tran: 我决心不在住旅馆方面浪费钱。

example.ex: He spent more on feeding the dog than he spent on feeding himself...
example.tran: 他喂狗花的钱比自己的饮食开销还多。

collins.def: When you spend time or energy on a particular activity, you spend time or energy doing it.

example.ex: People complain about how children spend so much time on computer games...
example.tran: 人们常抱怨孩子花太多时间玩电脑游戏。

example.ex: You all know why I am here. So I won't waste time on preliminaries.
example.tran: 你们都知道我来这里的目的。所以我就闲话少说了。

collins.def: If you say that something is not on or is just not on, you mean that it is unacceptable or impossible.

example.ex: I'm not having children who don't like cheese. It's not on...
example.tran: 我可不要不爱吃奶酪的孩子，那可不行。

example.ex: We shouldn't use the police in that way. It's just not on.
example.tran: 我们不该那样动用警力，那根本不可接受。

collins.def: If you say that something happens on and on, you mean that it continues to happen for a very long time.

example.ex: ...designers, builders, fitters — the list goes on and on...
example.tran: 设计师、建筑工人、装配工——这个单子可以没完没了

example.ex: Lobell drove on and on through the dense and blowing snow.
example.tran: 洛贝尔冒着纷飞的大雪不停地往前开。

collins.def: If you ask someone what they are on about or what they are going on about, you are puzzled because you cannot understand what they are talking about.

example.ex: What on earth are you going on about?...
example.tran: 你到底在说些什么呀？

example.ex: Honest, Kate, I don't know what you're on about.
example.tran: 说真的，凯特，我不知道你在说些什么。

collins.tran: （表示有信心）知道自己在说些什么，了解情况
collins.def: If you say that someone knows what they are on about, you are confident that what they are saying is true or makes sense, for example because they are an expert.

example.ex: It looks like he knows what he's on about.
example.tran: 他看起来很在行。

collins.tran: 掌握不利于（某人）的证据；抓住（某人）的把柄
collins.def: If someone has something on you, they have evidence that you have done something wrong or bad. If they have nothing on you, they cannot prove that you have done anything wrong or bad.

example.ex: He may have something on her. He may have supplied her with drugs, and then threatened to tell if she didn't do this...
example.tran: 他或许抓住了她的什么把柄。可能是给她提供了毒品，然后威胁她如果不这样做的话就告发她。

example.ex: You've got nothing on me and you know it. Your theory would never stand up in a court of law.
example.tran: 你手里没有对我不利的证据，这一点你很清楚。你的揣测在法庭上是绝对站不住脚的。

collins.def: If something happens once, it happens one time only.

example.ex: I met Wilma once, briefly...
example.tran: 我曾经和威尔玛有过短短的一面之缘。

example.ex: Since that evening I haven't once slept through the night...
example.tran: 从那天晚上之后，我没有睡过一次安稳觉。

collins.tran: （与后接day, week, month等的a连用）（每…）一次，（每…）一回
collins.def: You use once with 'a' and words like 'day', 'week', and 'month' to indicate that something happens regularly, one time in each day, week, or month.

example.ex: Lung cells die and are replaced about once a week...
example.tran: 肺细胞约每周新老更替一次。

example.ex: We arranged a special social event once a year to which we invited our major customers.
example.tran: 我们每年举办一次专门的社交活动，邀请重要客户出席。

collins.tran: （与后接day, week, year等的every连用）（每隔…）一次，（每隔…）一回
collins.def: You use once with 'every' and words like 'day', 'week', and 'year' to indicate that something happens a specified number of times and on a regular basis.

example.ex: The patient was seen for follow-up visits once every three months...
example.tran: 这位病人每三个月接受一次随访就诊。

example.ex: My daughter comes to visit me once every fortnight.
example.tran: 我女儿每两周来看我一次。

collins.def: If something was once true, it was true at some time in the past, but is no longer true.

example.ex: The culture minister once ran a theatre...
example.tran: 这位文化部长曾经经营过一家剧院。

example.ex: I lived there once myself, before I got married...
example.tran: 我结婚前曾独自在那儿住过。

collins.def: If someone once did something, they did it at some time in the past.

example.ex: I once went camping at Lake Darling with a friend...
example.tran: 我曾和一位朋友在达令湖畔露营。

example.ex: We once walked across London at two in the morning...
example.tran: 我们曾在凌晨两点步行穿过伦敦。

collins.def: If something happens once another thing has happened, it happens immediately afterwards.

example.ex: The decision had taken about 10 seconds once he'd read a market research study...
example.tran: 在他看过一份市场调研报告后大概10秒钟就作出了决定。

example.ex: Once customers come to rely on these systems they almost never take their business elsewhere...
example.tran: 顾客一旦依赖上这些系统，几乎就不会光顾其他商家。

collins.def: If something happens all at once, it happens suddenly, often when you are not expecting it to happen.

example.ex: I feel terribly sleepy all at once...
example.tran: 我突然觉得特别困。

example.ex: All at once there was someone knocking on the door.
example.tran: 忽然有人敲门。

collins.def: If you do something at once, you do it immediately.

example.ex: I have to go, I really must, at once...
example.tran: 我得走了，我真的必须马上就走。

example.ex: Remove from the heat, add the parsley, toss and serve at once...
example.tran: 端离炉子，加上欧芹，颠起翻面后就立刻上桌。

collins.def: If a number of different things happen at once or all at once, they all happen at the same time.

example.ex: You can't be doing two things at once...
example.tran: 不能一心二用。

example.ex: No bank could ever pay off its creditors if they all demanded their money at once...
example.tran: 如果所有的储户同时要求提取存款，没有哪家银行能办得到。

collins.def: For once is used to emphasize that something happens on this particular occasion, especially if it has never happened before, and may never happen again.

example.ex: For once, dad is not complaining...
example.tran: 爸爸这次破天荒地没有抱怨。

example.ex: His smile, for once, was genuine.
example.tran: 只有这一次，他真诚地笑了。

collins.def: If something happens once again or once more, it happens again.

example.ex: Amy picked up the hairbrush and smoothed her hair once more...
example.tran: 埃米拿起发梳，再次将头发梳理整齐。

example.ex: Once again an official inquiry has spoken of weak management and ill-trained workers.
example.tran: 官方调查又一次提到了管理不力与工人缺乏训练的问题。

collins.def: If something happens once and for all, it happens completely or finally.

example.ex: We have to resolve this matter once and for all...
example.tran: 我们必须彻底解决这一问题。

example.ex: If we act fast, we can once and for all prevent wild animals in Britain from suffering terrible cruelty.
example.tran: 如果我们迅速采取行动，就可以一劳永逸地使英国的野生动物免受残忍的虐待。

collins.def: If something happens once in a while, it happens sometimes, but not very often.

example.ex: Earrings need to be taken out and cleaned once in a while.
example.tran: 耳环要偶尔取出来清洗一下。

example.ex: Once in a while she phoned him.
example.tran: 她间或会给他打个电话。

collins.def: If you have done something once or twice, you have done it a few times, but not very often.

example.ex: I popped my head round the door once or twice...
example.tran: 我有几次头撞到了门上。

example.ex: Once or twice she had caught a flash of interest in William's eyes...
example.tran: 有那么一两次，她发现威廉的眼睛里流露出一丝感兴趣的神色。

collins.tran: （常用于儿童故事的开头）从前，很久以前
collins.def: Once upon a time is used to indicate that something happened or existed a long time ago or in an imaginary world. It is often used at the beginning of children's stories.

example.ex: 'Once upon a time,' he began, 'there was a man who had everything.'...
example.tran: “很久很久以前，”他开始说道，“有这么一个人，他应有尽有。”

example.ex: Once upon a time, asking a woman if she has a job was quite a straightforward question.
example.tran: 从前，问一位女性是否有工作是个相当简单直接的问题。

collins.def: One is the number 1.

example.ex: They had three sons and one daughter.
example.tran: 他们有3个儿子，1个女儿。

example.ex: ...one thousand years ago...

collins.def: If you say that someone or something is the one person or thing of a particular kind, you are emphasizing that they are the only person or thing of that kind.

example.ex: They had alienated the one man who knew the business...
example.tran: 他们弄僵了同那个唯一懂行的人之间的关系。

example.ex: His one regret is that he has never learned a language.
example.tran: 他唯一的遗憾是从未学过一门外语。

collins.tran: （用于代替a以强调之后的名词）
collins.def: One can be used instead of 'a' to emphasize the following noun.

example.ex: There is one thing I would like to know—What is it about Tim that you find so irresistible?...
example.tran: 有一件事我很想知道——蒂姆到底哪一点让你对他如此倾心？

example.ex: One person I hate is Russ.
example.tran: 让我讨厌的一个人是拉斯。

collins.tran: （用于代替a以强调之后的形容词或短语）
collins.def: You can use one instead of 'a' to emphasize the following adjective or expression.

example.ex: If we ever get married we'll have one terrific wedding...
example.tran: 如果我们哪一天结婚的话，一定会有一个棒极了的婚礼。

example.ex: It's like one enormous street carnival here.
example.tran: 这就像是一场盛大的街头狂欢节。

collins.tran: （用于人名前，表示未曾相识或听闻的）某一个
collins.def: You can use one in front of someone's name to indicate that you have not met them or heard of them before.

example.ex: It seems that the fifth man is one John Cairncross.
example.tran: 第五位好像是一个名叫约翰·凯恩克罗斯的人。

collins.tran: （表示与其他的作比较）这一个
collins.def: You can use one to refer to the first of two or more things that you are comparing.

example.ex: Prices vary from one shop to another...
example.tran: 各家商店价格不同。

example.ex: The road hugs the coast for hundreds of miles, the South China Sea on one side, jungle on the other.
example.tran: 这条路依傍海岸绵延数百英里，一边是南中国海，另一边则是丛林。

collins.tran: （用于代替名词，指代某类明确的人或事物）
collins.def: You can use one or ones instead of a noun when it is clear what type of thing or person you are referring to and you are describing them or giving more information about them.

example.ex: They are selling their house to move to a smaller one...
example.tran: 他们正打算卖掉房子，然后搬到一个小一点的住处。

example.ex: We test each one to see that it flies well.
example.tran: 我们对每架飞机都会进行测试，以确保其飞行性能良好。

collins.def: You use ones to refer to people in general.

example.ex: We are the only ones who know.
example.tran: 我们是唯一的知情者。

collins.tran: （用于代替名词词组，表示刚提到过的事物）
collins.def: You can use one instead of a noun group when you have just mentioned something and you want to describe it or give more information about it.

example.ex: His response is one of anger and frustration...
example.tran: 他的回答充满了愤怒和懊丧。

example.ex: The issue of land reform was one that dominated Hungary's parliamentary elections.
example.tran: 土地改革是左右匈牙利议会选举的主要问题。

collins.tran: （特指一群人或事物中的）一人，一个
collins.def: You can use one when you have been talking or writing about a group of people or things and you want to say something about a particular member of the group.

example.ex: 'A college degree isn't enough', said one honors student.
example.tran: “光有一个大学学位还不够，”一位优等生说。

collins.def: You use one in expressions such as 'one of the biggest airports' or 'one of the most experienced players' to indicate that something or someone is bigger or more experienced than most other things or people of the same kind.

example.ex: Subaru is one of the smallest Japanese car makers.
example.tran: 斯巴鲁是日本最小的汽车制造商之一。

collins.def: You can use one when referring to a time in the past or in the future. For example, if you say that you did something one day, you mean that you did it on a day in the past.

example.ex: How would you like to have dinner one night, just you and me?...
example.tran: 哪天晚上一起吃饭怎么样？就咱俩。

example.ex: Then one evening Harry phoned, asking me to come to their flat as soon as possible.
example.tran: 后来一天晚上哈里打电话来，叫我尽快到他们的公寓去。

collins.tran: （指代问题、笑话、评论、讨论的主题等）一个
collins.def: You can use one to refer to a question, joke, remark, or subject of discussion.

example.ex: This is a tricky one to answer...
example.tran: 这是个难以回答的问题。

example.ex: Have you heard the one about the Irishman, the Englishman and the American?...
example.tran: 你听过那个关于爱尔兰人、英国人和美国人的笑话吗？

collins.def: You can use one to refer to an alcoholic drink.

example.ex: Other members of the committee drifted in for a quick one before closing time.
example.tran: 委员会的其他成员陆续走了进来，想要趁关门前喝上一杯。

collins.tran: （泛指包括自己的人，可作句子的主语或宾语）一个人，任何人
collins.def: You use one to make statements about people in general which also apply to themselves. One can be used as the subject or object of a sentence.

example.ex: If one looks at the longer run, a lot of positive things are happening...
example.tran: 如果把目光放长远些，就会发现很多积极的事情正在发生。

example.ex: Where does one go from there?...
example.tran: 从那里可以去什么地方？

collins.def: If a group of people does something as one, all the people do the same thing at the same time or in the same way.

example.ex: The 40,000 crowd rose as one.
example.tran: 40,000人全体起立。

collins.def: If you say that someone is one for or is a one for something, you mean that they like or approve of it or enjoy doing it.

example.ex: I'm not one for political discussions...
example.tran: 我不是个热衷于谈论政治的人。

example.ex: She was a real one for flirting with the boys.
example.tran: 她是个情场高手。

collins.tran: （强调某人与众不同的反应或行为方式）举个例说
collins.def: You can use for one to emphasize that a particular person is definitely reacting or behaving in a particular way, even if other people are not.

example.ex: I, for one, hope you don't get the job.
example.tran: 就我而言，我并不希望你得到那份工作。

collins.def: You can use expressions such as a hundred and one ,a thousand and one, and a million and one to emphasize that you are talking about a large number of things or people.

example.ex: There are a hundred and one ways in which you can raise money.
example.tran: 筹钱的办法有很多。

collins.tran: 集（若干部分或功能）为一体
collins.def: You can use in one to indicate that something is a single unit, but is made up of several different parts or has several different functions.

example.ex: ...a love story and an adventure all in one...
example.tran: 集爱情和冒险于一体的故事

example.ex: This cream moisturises and repairs in one.
example.tran: 这种护肤霜兼具滋润和修复功能。

collins.tran: 三三两两地；零零落落地
collins.def: You can use in ones and twos to indicate that people do things or something happens gradually and in small groups.

example.ex: They lose interest and start drifting away in ones and twos.
example.tran: 他们没了兴趣，开始三三两两地走开了。

collins.tran: 一个接一个地；接连地；陆续地
collins.def: You use one after the other or one after another to say that actions or events happen with very little time between them.

example.ex: My three guitars broke one after the other...
example.tran: 我的3把吉他陆续都坏了。

example.ex: One after another, people described how hard it is for them to get medical care.
example.tran: 人们一个接一个地讲述获得医疗保健服务对于他们是何其困难。

collins.tran: （用于节目中介绍演员、歌手或其他名人）绝无仅有的，独一无二的
collins.def: The one and only can be used in front of the name of an actor, singer, or other famous person when they are being introduced on a show.

example.ex: ...one of the greatest ever rock performers, the one and only Tina Turner.
example.tran: 史上最伟大的摇滚乐手之一，举世无双的蒂娜·特纳

collins.def: You can use one by one to indicate that people do things or that things happen in sequence, not all at the same time.

example.ex: We went into the room one by one...
example.tran: 我们挨个儿走进房间。

example.ex: One by one the houses burst into flames.
example.tran: 房子一幢接一幢地燃起熊熊大火。

collins.tran: （一组事物或人之中的）或者这个或者那个，有一个
collins.def: You use one or other to refer to one or more things or people in a group, when it does not matter which particular one or ones are thought of or chosen.

example.ex: One or other of the two women was wrong.
example.tran: 这两个女人当中有一个人错了。

collins.def: One or two means a few.

example.ex: We may make one or two changes...
example.tran: 我们可以作一两处改动。

example.ex: I've also sold one or two to an American publisher...
example.tran: 我还卖了几本给一位美国出版商。

collins.def: If you say that someone is not one to do something, you think that it is very unlikely that they would do it because it is not their normal behaviour.

example.ex: I'm not one to waste time on just anyone.
example.tran: 我可不是个随便浪费时间在任何人身上的人。

collins.def: If you try to get one up on someone, you try to gain an advantage over them.

example.ex: ...the competitive kind who will see this as the opportunity to be one up on you.
example.tran: 具有竞争意识、将此视作占据上风的契机的那种人

collins.tran: （表示比较而言唯一真实、恰当或必要的情况）只，只有
collins.def: You use only to indicate the one thing that is true, appropriate, or necessary in a particular situation, in contrast to all the other things that are not true, appropriate, or necessary.

example.ex: Only the President could authorize the use of the atomic bomb...
example.tran: 只有总统才能授权使用原子弹。

example.ex: ...the guidance and discipline that can be provided only by a strong male...
example.tran: 只有强有力的男性才能给予的指导和训练

collins.tran: （引出发生的必要条件）只有…（才）
collins.def: You use only to introduce the thing which must happen before the thing mentioned in the main part of the sentence can happen.

example.ex: The lawyer is paid only if he wins...
example.tran: 只有官司赢了才支付律师费。

example.ex: The Bank of England insists that it will cut interest rates only when it is ready...
example.tran: 英格兰银行坚持只有条件成熟才会降息。

collins.def: If you talk about the only person or thing involved in a particular situation, you mean there are no others involved in it.

example.ex: She was the only woman in Shell's legal department...
example.tran: 她是壳牌公司法律事务部唯一的女性。

example.ex: My cat Gustaf was the only thing I had—the only company.
example.tran: 我的猫古斯塔夫是我所有的一切——我唯一的伴侣。

collins.def: An only child is a child who has no brothers or sisters.

collins.tran: (尤用于想要纠正错误观点时)只不过，仅…而已
collins.def: You use only to indicate that something is no more important, interesting, or difficult, for example, than you say it is, especially when you want to correct a wrong idea that someone may get or has already got.

example.ex: At the moment it is only a theory...
example.tran: 眼下这只不过是个推测而已。

example.ex: 'I'm only a sergeant,' said Clements...
example.tran: “我只是一名中士，”克莱门茨说道。

collins.tran: （强调数量少或时间短）才，仅仅
collins.def: You use only to emphasize how small an amount is or how short a length of time is.

example.ex: Child car seats only cost about £10 a week to hire.
example.tran: 儿童汽车坐椅一周的租金才10英镑。

example.ex: ...spacecraft guidance systems weighing only a few grams...
example.tran: 仅有几克重的宇宙飞船导航系统

collins.tran: （强调是其中的一小部分，而非全部）只，仅仅
collins.def: You use only to emphasize that you are talking about a small part of an amount or group, not the whole of it.

example.ex: These are only a few of the possibilities...
example.tran: 这些仅仅是其中几种可能。

example.ex: Only a minority of the people supported the Revolution.
example.tran: 只有少数人支持这场革命。

collins.tran: （用于 can 或 could 之后，强调除此以外别无可为）只（能）
collins.def: Only is used after 'can' or 'could' to emphasize that it is impossible to do anything except the rather inadequate or limited action that is mentioned.

example.ex: For a moment I could say nothing. I could only stand and look...
example.tran: 我有那么一会儿一句话都说不出来，只能站在那里看着。

example.ex: The police can only guess at the scale of the problem.
example.tran: 警方只能猜测问题的严重性。

collins.def: You can use only in the expressions I only wish or I only hope in order to emphasize what you are hoping or wishing.

example.ex: I only wish he were here now that things are getting better for me...
example.tran: 现在我的境况好转了，我真希望他能在这里。

example.ex: We can only hope that the elephants can recover.
example.tran: 我们唯有希望这些大象能够康复。

collins.tran: （用于表示稍加改动或限定）只是，不过
collins.def: Only can be used to add a comment which slightly changes or limits what you have just said.

example.ex: It's just as dramatic as a film, only it's real...
example.tran: 这就像电影一样充满戏剧性，不过这是真实发生的。

example.ex: It's a bit like my house, only nicer...
example.tran: 这有点像我的房子，只是更为漂亮。

collins.tran: （用于含有 would 的从句后，引出未做某事的原因）要不是，若非
collins.def: Only can be used after a clause with 'would' to indicate why something is not done.

example.ex: I'd invite you to come with me, only it's such a long way...
example.tran: 要不是路太远，我一定会邀你一同前往。

example.ex: I'd be quite happy to go. Only I don't know what my kids would say about living there.
example.tran: 我是很乐意去的，只是不知道孩子们会不会喜欢住在那里。

collins.def: You can use only before an infinitive to introduce an event which happens immediately after one you have just mentioned, and which is rather surprising or unfortunate.

example.ex: Ryle tried the Embassy, only to be told that Hugh was in a meeting...
example.tran: 赖尔试着找了大使馆，却被告知休正在开会。

example.ex: He raced through the living room, only to find the front door closed.
example.tran: 他飞快地跑过起居室，却发现前门锁上了。

collins.tran: （强调行动或行为恰当）完全，真正
collins.def: You can use only to emphasize how appropriate a certain course of action or type of behaviour is.

example.ex: It's only fair to let her know that you intend to apply...
example.tran: 告诉她你打算申请，这才算公平嘛。

example.ex: She appeared to have changed considerably, which was only to be expected.
example.tran: 她看起来变化很大，不过这完全是在意料之中的。

collins.tran: （用于动词前，表示结果令人遗憾或不受欢迎）愈加，只（会）
collins.def: You can use only in front of a verb to indicate that the result of something is unfortunate or undesirable and is likely to make the situation worse rather than better.

example.ex: The embargo would only hurt innocent civilians...
example.tran: 禁运只会殃及无辜的百姓。

example.ex: She says that legalising prostitution will only cause problems.
example.tran: 她说卖淫合法化只会引发问题。

collins.def: If you say you only have to or have only to do one thing in order to achieve or prove a second thing, you are emphasizing how easily the second thing can be achieved or proved.

example.ex: Any time you want a babysitter, dear, you only have to ask...
example.tran: 亲爱的，你什么时候需要人帮忙照看孩子，只要开口说一声就行。

example.ex: We have only to read the labels to know what ingredients are in foods.
example.tran: 我们只要看一下标签即可知道食品的成分。

collins.def: You can say that something has only just happened when you want to emphasize that it happened a very short time ago.

example.ex: I've only just arrived...
example.tran: 我刚到。

example.ex: The signs of an economic revival are only just beginning...
example.tran: 经济复苏的迹象刚刚开始显现。

collins.def: You use only just to emphasize that something is true, but by such a small degree that it is almost not true at all.

example.ex: For centuries farmers there have only just managed to survive...
example.tran: 几个世纪以来，那里的农民只能勉强维持生计。

example.ex: I am old enough to remember the Blitz, but only just...
example.tran: 伦敦空袭那阵我已开始记事，但也只是仅仅有些模糊的印象。

collins.def: You can use only too to emphasize that something is true or exists to a much greater extent than you would expect or like.

example.ex: I know only too well that plans can easily go wrong...
example.tran: 计划很容易出岔子，我太清楚这点了。

example.ex: When the new baby comes along it is only too easy to shut out the others.
example.tran: 新生儿出世后，其他孩子极容易受到冷落。

collins.def: You can say that you are only too happy to do something to emphasize how willing you are to do it.

example.ex: I'll be only too pleased to help them out with any queries.
example.tran: 我非常乐意为他们答疑解惑。

collins.def: If you open something such as a door, window, or lid, or if it opens, its position is changed so that it no longer covers a hole or gap.

example.ex: He opened the window and looked out...
example.tran: 他打开窗户往外看。

example.ex: The church doors would open and the crowd would surge out.
example.tran: 教堂的门会打开，人群会蜂拥而出。

collins.tran: 将（瓶、盒等）开封；拆开（包裹、信封等）
collins.def: If you open something such as a bottle, box, parcel, or envelope, you move, remove, or cut part of it so you can take out what is inside.

example.ex: The Inspector opened the packet of cigarettes...
example.tran: 检查员撕开了那包香烟。

example.ex: The capsules are fiddly to open.
example.tran: 这些胶囊得小心翼翼地打开。

collins.def: If you open something such as a book, an umbrella, or your hand, or if it opens, the different parts of it move away from each other so that the inside of it can be seen.

example.ex: He opened the heavy Bible...
example.tran: 他翻开那本厚厚的《圣经》。

example.ex: She opens her umbrella, and walks up River Street...
example.tran: 她撑开伞，沿着河街向前走。

collins.def: If you open a computer file, you give the computer an instruction to display it on the screen.

example.ex: Double click on the icon to open the file.
example.tran: 双击图标打开文件。

collins.def: When you open your eyes or your eyes open, you move your eyelids upwards, for example when you wake up, so that you can see.

example.ex: When I opened my eyes I saw a man with an axe standing at the end of my bed...
example.tran: 我睁开眼睛时，看见一个手持斧头的男人站在床尾。

example.ex: His eyes were opening wide.
example.tran: 他双眼圆睁。

collins.def: If you open your arms, you stretch them wide apart in front of you, usually in order to put them round someone.

example.ex: She opened her arms and gave me a big hug.
example.tran: 她张开双臂，紧紧地拥抱了我。

collins.def: If you stand or sit in an open way, the front of your body is fully exposed and you are not bending forward or at an angle to someone.

example.ex: Good listeners even sit in an open way: relaxed, arms loose...
example.tran: 善于倾听的人甚至坐姿也很坦荡端正：身体放松，双臂自然下垂。

example.ex: I play normal bunker shots with an open stance.
example.tran: 我打一般的沙坑球采取开立击球姿势。

collins.tran: 坦率的；诚恳的；不作伪的
collins.def: If you describe a person or their character as open, you mean they are honest and do not want or try to hide anything or to deceive anyone.

example.ex: He had always been open with her and she always felt she would know if he lied...
example.tran: 他对她总是坦诚相待，她也一直觉得如果他说谎，自己一定能察觉。

example.ex: She has an open, trusting nature.
example.tran: 她天性坦诚，对人信赖。

collins.def: If you describe a situation, attitude, or way of behaving as open, you mean it is not kept hidden or secret.

example.ex: The action is an open violation of the Vienna Convention...
example.tran: 该行为公然违背了《维也纳公约》。

example.ex: Hearing the case in open court is only one part of the judicial process.
example.tran: 公开审理这一案件只是司法程序的一部分。

collins.tran: 愿意接受（建议、观点等）的；虚怀若谷的
collins.def: If you are open to suggestions or ideas, you are ready and willing to consider or accept them.

example.ex: They are open to suggestions on how working conditions might be improved.
example.tran: 他们愿意就如何改善工作条件听取各种意见。

collins.tran: 容易招致（滥用、批评等）的；易受（攻击）的
collins.def: If you say that a system, person, or idea is open to something such as abuse or criticism, you mean they might receive abuse or criticism because of their qualities, effects, or actions.

example.ex: The system, though well-meaning, is open to abuse...
example.tran: 该制度动机虽好，却易遭滥用。

example.ex: They left themselves wide open to accusations of double standards and hypocrisy.
example.tran: 他们使自己陷于被人指责搞双重标准和虚伪不实的境地。

collins.tran: 悬而未决的；尚未决定的
collins.def: If you say that a fact or question is open to debate, interpretation, or discussion, you mean that people are uncertain whether it is true, what it means, or what the answer is.

example.ex: The truth of the facts produced may be open to doubt...
example.tran: 所摆出事实的真实性仍然值得怀疑。

example.ex: It is an open question how long that commitment can last.
example.tran: 这一承诺能维持多久还不确定。

collins.tran: 开放（被封的道路、边界等）；开通
collins.def: If people open something such as a blocked road or a border, or if it opens, people can then pass along it or through it.

example.ex: The rebels have opened the road from Monrovia to the Ivory Coast...
example.tran: 叛乱分子已经开放了从蒙罗维亚到象牙海岸的道路。

example.ex: The solid rank of police officers lining the courtroom opened to let them pass.
example.tran: 把法庭围得水泄不通的一队警察让开一条路让他们通过。

collins.def: If a place opens into another, larger place, you can move from one directly into the other.

example.ex: The corridor opened into a low smoky room.
example.tran: 这条走廊通向一间烟雾弥漫的低矮房间。

collins.def: An open area is a large area that does not have many buildings or trees in it.

example.ex: Officers will also continue their search of nearby open ground.
example.tran: 警察还将继续在附近的开阔地带搜寻。

collins.tran: 敞开的；无遮盖的；无围挡的
collins.def: An open structure or object is not covered or enclosed.

example.ex: Don't leave a child alone in a room with an open fire.
example.tran: 房间里有裸露的明火时，不要让孩子独处其中。

example.ex: ...open sandwiches.
example.tran: 单片三明治

collins.def: An open wound is one from which a liquid such as blood is coming.

collins.tran: 把（衣服）解开；把…的拉链拉开
collins.def: If you open your shirt or coat, you undo the buttons or pull down the zip.

example.ex: I opened my coat and let him see the belt.
example.tran: 我解开外衣，让他看那条皮带。

collins.def: When a shop, office, or public building opens or is opened, its doors are unlocked and the public can go in.

example.ex: Banks closed on Friday afternoon and did not open again until Monday morning.
example.tran: 银行星期五下午关门，直到星期一上午才营业。

example.ex: ...a gang of three who'd apparently been lying in wait for him to open the shop.
example.tran: 显然一直潜伏着等待他打开店门营业的3人团伙

collins.tran: 为（大楼、工厂、公司等）举行揭幕典礼；开设；开办；开张
collins.def: When a public building, factory, or company opens or when someone opens it, it starts operating for the first time.

example.ex: The original station opened in 1754...
example.tran: 最初的车站于1754年落成。

example.ex: The complex opens to the public tomorrow...
example.tran: 这幢综合大楼将于明天对公众开放。

collins.def: If something such as a meeting or series of talks opens, or if someone opens it, it begins.

example.ex: ...an emergency session of the Russian Parliament due to open later this morning...
example.tran: 将于今天上午晚些时候召开的俄罗斯议会紧急会议

example.ex: They are now ready to open negotiations.
example.tran: 他们现在已经准备好开始谈判。

collins.def: If an event such as a meeting or discussion opens with a particular activity or if a particular activity opens an event, that activity is the first thing that happens or is dealt with. You can also say that someone such as a speaker or singer opens by doing a particular thing.

example.ex: The service opened with a hymn...
example.tran: 礼拜仪式从唱圣歌开始。

example.ex: She opened with an impressive version of 'I Still Haven't Found What I'm Looking For'...
example.tran: 她以一首优美动人的《我仍在寻找》开场。

collins.def: On the stock exchange, the price at which currencies, shares, or commodities open is their value at the start of that day's trading.

example.ex: Gold declined $2 in Zurich to open at 385.50...
example.tran: 苏黎世的金价下挫2美元，以385.50元开盘。

example.ex: In Paris and Milan, the dollar opened almost unchanged.
example.tran: 在巴黎和米兰，美元开市时几乎没有变化。

collins.def: When a film, play, or other public event opens, it begins to be shown, be performed, or take place for a limited period of time.

example.ex: A photographic exhibition opens at the Royal College of Art on Wednesday...
example.tran: 星期三一个摄影展在皇家艺术学院开幕。

example.ex: This show, too, was virtually sold out before it opened.
example.tran: 这场演出的门票也是几乎在开演前就销售一空了。

collins.def: If you open an account with a bank or a commercial organization, you begin to use their services.

example.ex: He tried to open an account at the branch of his bank nearest to his workplace.
example.tran: 他想在自己银行离工作单位最近的网点开一个账户。

collins.tran: （机会、选择等）可利用的，可得到的
collins.def: If an opportunity or choice is open to you, you are able to do a particular thing if you choose to.

example.ex: There are a wide range of career opportunities open to young people.
example.tran: 年轻人有各种职业选择机会。

collins.tran: （使）（机会、可能性等）出现;（使）产生
collins.def: To open opportunities or possibilities means the same as to open them up.

example.ex: The chief of naval operations wants to open opportunities for women in the Navy...
example.tran: 美国海军作战部长希望能为女兵提供机会。

example.ex: A series of fortunate opportunities opened to him.
example.tran: 很多好机会陆续向他招手。

collins.tran: 人人可以参加（或接受）的；开放的
collins.def: You can use open to describe something that anyone is allowed to take part in or accept.

example.ex: A recent open meeting of College members revealed widespread dissatisfaction...
example.tran: 最近的一次学会成员公开会上，大家普遍流露出不满情绪。

example.ex: A portfolio approach would keep entry into the managerial profession open and flexible.
example.tran: 项目组合的方法会使成为管理人员的机会公开灵活。

collins.tran: （提议等）有效的；（职位等）空缺的，可申请的
collins.def: If something such as an offer or job is open, it is available for someone to accept or apply for.

example.ex: The offer will remain open until further notice.
example.tran: 该提议仍然有效，直到另行通知。

collins.def: If you do something in the open, you do it out of doors rather than in a house or other building.

example.ex: Many are sleeping in the open because they have no shelter.
example.tran: 很多人因为没有栖身之所，只好露宿在外。

collins.def: If an attitude or situation is in the open or out in the open, people know about it and it is no longer kept secret.

example.ex: The medical service had advised us to keep it a secret, but we wanted it in the open.
example.tran: 这家医疗机构建议我们保密，而我们却想公开此事。

collins.tran: 大开的；敞开的；（眼睛）睁大的
collins.def: If something is wide open, it is open to its full extent.

example.ex: The child had left the inner door wide open.
example.tran: 这个孩子将里面的门大敞着。

collins.tran: （比赛、选举等）结果不确定的，胜负难定的
collins.def: If you say that a competition, race, or election is wide open, you mean that anyone could win it, because there is no competitor who seems to be much better than the others.

example.ex: The competition has been thrown wide open by the absence of the world champion.
example.tran: 由于世界冠军缺阵，这场比赛变得胜负难定。

collins.def: If you operate a business or organization, you work to keep it running properly. If a business or organization operates, it carries out its work.

example.ex: Until his death in 1986 Greenwood owned and operated an enormous pear orchard.
example.tran: 到他1986年去世前，格林伍德一直拥有并管理着一片面积广阔的梨园。

example.ex: ...allowing commercial banks to operate in the country...
example.tran: 允许商业银行在该国开展业务

collins.def: The way that something operates is the way that it works or has a particular effect.

example.ex: Ceiling and wall lights can operate independently...
example.tran: 吊灯和壁灯可单独开关。

example.ex: How do accounting records operate?...
example.tran: 账目是如何记录的？

collins.tran: 操作，控制，使用（机器、设备等）；（机器等）运转，运行
collins.def: When you operate a machine or device, or when it operates, you make it work.

example.ex: A massive rock fall trapped the men as they operated a tunnelling machine...
example.tran: 这些工人在操作隧道挖掘机时被大量的落石困住了。

example.ex: The number of fax machines operating around the world has now reached ten million.
example.tran: 现在全球使用的传真机数量已达到了1,000万台。

collins.def: When surgeons operate on a patient in a hospital, they cut open a patient's body in order to remove, replace, or repair a diseased or damaged part.

example.ex: The surgeon who operated on the King released new details of his injuries...
example.tran: 为国王动手术的外科医生通报了其伤势的最新详情。

example.ex: You examine a patient and then you decide whether or not to operate.
example.tran: 先为病人作检查，然后再决定是否做手术。

collins.def: If military forces are operating in a particular region, they are in that place in order to carry out their orders.

example.ex: Up to ten thousand Zimbabwean soldiers are operating in Mozambique...
example.tran: 多达1万名津巴布韦士兵正在莫桑比克执行任务。

example.ex: This freed the Austrian army to operate against the French.
example.tran: 这使得奥地利军队可以对法军作战。

collins.tran: （由大量人员参与、具有高度组织性的）活动，行动，工作
collins.def: An operation is a highly organized activity that involves many people doing different things.

example.ex: The rescue operation began on Friday afternoon...
example.tran: 救援行动于星期五下午开始。

example.ex: The soldiers were engaged in a military operation close to the Ugandan border.
example.tran: 这些士兵参加了乌干达边境附近的一次军事行动。

collins.def: A business or company can be referred to as an operation .

example.ex: Thorn's electronics operation employs around 5,000 people...
example.tran: 索恩的电子公司雇用了约5,000名员工。

example.ex: The two parent groups now run their business as a single combined operation.
example.tran: 这两个母公司现在合并为一家企业经营业务。

collins.def: When a patient has an operation, a surgeon cuts open their body in order to remove, replace, or repair a diseased or damaged part.

example.ex: Charles was at the clinic recovering from an operation on his arm.
example.tran: 查尔斯的胳膊动了手术，正在这家诊所进行康复治疗。

collins.def: If a system is in operation, it is being used.

example.ex: Until the rail links are in operation, passengers can only travel through the tunnel by coach.
example.tran: 在铁路连线开通之前，乘客只能乘坐长途客车穿越隧道。

example.ex: ...the free banking system that has been in operation since the early eighties.
example.tran: 从80年代初就开始实行的自由银行制度

collins.def: If a machine or device is in operation, it is working.

example.ex: There are three ski lifts in operation.
example.tran: 有3台滑雪缆车在运行。

collins.def: When a rule, system, or plan comes into operation or you put it into operation, you begin to use it.

example.ex: The Financial Services Act came into operation four years ago...
example.tran: 《金融服务法》于4年前开始实施。

example.ex: Cheaper energy conservation techniques have been put into operation in the developed world.
example.tran: 更经济的节能技术在发达国家已经投入使用。

collins.tran: （连接两个或两个以上选择的可能性）或，或者，还是
collins.def: You use or to link two or more alternatives.

example.ex: 'Tea or coffee?' John asked...
example.tran: “喝茶还是喝咖啡？”约翰问道。

example.ex: Was she blonde or brunette?...
example.tran: 她的头发是金色还是深褐色？

collins.tran: （与 either 或 whether 连用，给出另一个选择项）或，还是，就是
collins.def: You use or to give another alternative, when the first alternative is introduced by 'either' or 'whether'.

example.ex: Items like bread, milk and meat were either unavailable or could be obtained only on the black market...
example.tran: 像面包、牛奶和肉之类的东西要么是买不到，要么就是只能去黑市买。

example.ex: Either you can talk to him, or I will...
example.tran: 要么你跟他谈，要么我去。

collins.tran: （用于两个数字之间表示概数）或，大约
collins.def: You use or between two numbers to indicate that you are giving an approximate amount.

example.ex: Everyone benefited from limiting their intake of tea to just three or four cups a day...
example.tran: 每天只喝三四杯茶对身体有益。

example.ex: When I was nine or ten someone explained to me that when you are grown up you have to work...
example.tran: 我大概9岁或10岁的时候，有人跟我说人长大了就得工作。

collins.tran: （用于对刚说过的话进行更正或补充）或者说
collins.def: You use or to introduce a comment which corrects or modifies what you have just said.

example.ex: The man was a fool, he thought, or at least incompetent...
example.tran: 他想道，那人是个傻瓜，或者说，至少很无能。

example.ex: There was nothing more he wanted, or so he thought...
example.tran: 他再无所求，或者说他是这么想的。

collins.def: If you say that someone should do something or something unpleasant will happen, you are warning them that if they do not do it, the unpleasant thing will happen.

example.ex: She had to have the operation, or she would die.
example.tran: 她必须动手术，要不然就没命了。

collins.tran: （用于证明刚刚所作陈述的真实性）否则，要不然
collins.def: You use or to introduce something which is evidence for the truth of a statement you have just made.

example.ex: He must have thought Jane was worth it or he wouldn't have wasted time on her, I suppose.
example.tran: 我想，他一定认为简值得他这么做，否则他不会在她身上浪费时间。

collins.tran: （表示某事物对即将发生的事没有影响）不管是不是…
collins.def: You use or no or or not to emphasize that a particular thing makes no difference to what is going to happen.

example.ex: Chairman or no, if I want to stop the project, I can...
example.tran: 不管我是不是主席，只要我想停止这个项目，我就能做到。

example.ex: The first difficulty is that, old-fashioned or not, it is very good.
example.tran: 首要的难题是，过时也好，不过时也罢，它很不错。

collins.tran: （用于重复的同一名词之间，表示某事物是否真实对情形没有影响）不管是否有…，无论有没有…
collins.def: You use or no between two occurrences of the same noun in order to say that whether something is true or not makes no difference to a situation.

example.ex: The next day, rain or no rain, it was business as usual...
example.tran: 第二天是否下雨都没有差别，一切照常进行。

example.ex: Oil or no oil, Serbia has troubles.
example.tran: 不管是否有石油，塞尔维亚的困难都会存在。

means: （指两个人或事物中的第二个）那个
（指一组中其余的人或事物）其余的
（指与说话人所在位置等相反的方向或地点）另一边

collins.tran: （表示在与已提及或已知的人或事物同一类中）别的，其他的，另外的，额外的
collins.def: You use other to refer to an additional thing or person of the same type as one that has been mentioned or is known about.

example.ex: They were just like any other young couple...
example.tran: 他们同别的年轻夫妇没什么两样。

example.ex: The communique gave no other details.
example.tran: 这份公报并未透露其他细节。

collins.tran: （表示与已提及的人或事物不同）别的，其他的
collins.def: You use other to indicate that a thing or person is not the one already mentioned, but a different one.

example.ex: The authorities insist that the discussions must not be linked to any other issue...
example.tran: 当局坚持此次讨论不得涉及其他任何问题。

example.ex: Calls cost 36p per minute cheap rate and 48p per minute at all other times...
example.tran: 话费在优惠时段为每分钟36便士，其他时段一律为每分钟48便士。

collins.def: You use the other to refer to the second of two things or people when the identity of the first is already known or understood, or has already been mentioned.

example.ex: The Captain was at the other end of the room...
example.tran: 船长在房间的另一头。

example.ex: You deliberately went in the other direction...
example.tran: 你故意朝另一个方向走。

collins.def: You use other at the end of a list or a group of examples, to refer generally to people or things like the ones just mentioned.

example.ex: Queensway Quay will incorporate shops, restaurants and other amenities...
example.tran: 女王道码头将会融商店、餐馆以及其他生活便利设施为一体。

example.ex: Place them in a jam jar, porcelain bowl, or other similar container.
example.tran: 将它们装入果酱罐、瓷碗或其他类似容器中。

collins.tran: （一组人或事物中）其余的，剩下的
collins.def: You use the other to refer to the rest of the people or things in a group, when you are talking about one particular person or thing.

example.ex: When the other pupils were taken to an exhibition, he was left behind.
example.tran: 当其余学生被带去参观展览时，他被留了下来。

collins.def: Other people are people in general, as opposed to yourself or a person you have already mentioned.

example.ex: The suffering of other people appals me...
example.tran: 人们的苦难让我无比震惊。

example.ex: She likes to be with other people.
example.tran: 她喜欢与人交往。

collins.def: You use other in informal expressions of time such as the other day ,the other evening, or the other week to refer to a day, evening, or week in the recent past.

example.ex: I rang her the other day and she said she'd like to come round...
example.tran: 我前几天给她打电话，她说想过来玩。

example.ex: The other evening we had a party.
example.tran: 前不久的某个晚上我们搞了一次聚会。

collins.tran: 除了别的以外；其中；包括
collins.def: You use expressions like among other things or among others to indicate that there are several more facts, things, or people like the one or ones mentioned, but that you do not intend to mention them all.

example.ex: He moved to England in 1980 where, among other things, he worked as a journalist...
example.tran: 他1980年移居英格兰，期间从事过包括记者在内的很多工作。

example.ex: His travels took him to Dublin, among other places...
example.tran: 他游历过很多地方，其中包括都柏林。

collins.def: If something happens, for example, every other day or every other month, there is a day or month when it does not happen between each day or month when it happens.

example.ex: Their food is adequate. It includes meat at least every other day, vegetables and fruit...
example.tran: 他们的伙食足够丰富了，有蔬菜、水果，而且至少每隔一天吃一次肉。

example.ex: Now that their children have grown up she joins Paddy in London every other week.
example.tran: 他们的孩子都长大了，她便每隔一周就到伦敦帕迪那里。

collins.tran: （用于强调，表示一组人或事物中）其余的，剩下的
collins.def: You use every other to emphasize that you are referring to all the rest of the people or things in a group.

example.ex: The same will apply in every other country.
example.tran: 这也适用于其他任何国家。

collins.def: You use none other than and no other than to emphasize the name of a person or thing when something about that person or thing is surprising in a particular situation.

example.ex: He called together all his employees and announced that the manager was none other than his son.
example.tran: 他把所有的员工召集到一起，宣布经理不是别人，正是他的儿子。

collins.def: You use nothing other than and no other than when you are going to mention a course of action, decision, or description and emphasize that it is the only one possible in the situation.

example.ex: Nothing other than an immediate custodial sentence could be justified...
example.tran: 只有判决即时监禁才算合理。

example.ex: The rebels would not be happy with anything other than the complete removal of the current regime...
example.tran: 叛乱分子只有彻底推翻了现政权才肯罢休。

collins.tran: （表示无法或不想确切说明）某一，某些
collins.def: You use or other in expressions like somehow or other and someone or other to indicate that you cannot or do not want to be more precise about the information that you are giving.

example.ex: I was going to have him called away from the house on some pretext or other...
example.tran: 我准备找个什么借口把他从屋里支出去。

example.ex: The Foundation is holding a dinner in honour of something or other...
example.tran: 基金会正举办某个纪念宴会。

collins.def: You use other than after a negative statement to say that the person, item, or thing that follows is the only exception to the statement.

example.ex: She makes no reference to any feminist work other than her own...
example.tran: 除了自己的之外，她没有提及其他女权主义著作。

example.ex: The journey by road to Wolverhampton is not recommended to anyone other than the most experienced cyclist.
example.tran: 除了经验非常丰富的自行车手外，建议其他人不要走去伍尔弗汉普顿的那条路。

collins.def: You use our to indicate that something belongs or relates both to yourself and to one or more other people.

example.ex: We're expecting our first baby...
example.tran: 我们怀上了第一个孩子。

example.ex: I locked myself out of our apartment and had to break in...
example.tran: 我把自己锁在了我们的公寓外面，不得不破门而入。

collins.def: A speaker or writer sometimes uses our to indicate that something belongs or relates to people in general.

example.ex: The quality of our life depends on keeping well...
example.tran: 我们的生活质量取决于健康状况。

example.ex: We are all entirely responsible for our actions, and for our reactions.
example.tran: 我们都对自己的行为和反应负全责。

collins.tran: （与家庭成员的姓名连用）我家的
collins.def: Speakers sometimes use our with the name of a member of their family.

example.ex: Our Barry had a habit of doing that sort of thing.
example.tran: 我家巴里就习惯干那种事。

collins.def: When something is in a particular place and you take it out, you remove it from that place.

example.ex: Carefully pull out the centre pages...
example.tran: 小心翼翼地抽出中间的几页。

example.ex: He took out his notebook and flipped the pages...
example.tran: 他掏出笔记本，飞快地翻着。

collins.def: You can use out to indicate that you are talking about the situation outside, rather than inside buildings.

example.ex: It's hot out — very hot, very humid.
example.tran: 外面很热——非常炎热而且非常潮湿。

collins.def: If you are out, you are not at home or not at your usual place of work.

example.ex: I tried to get in touch with you yesterday evening, but I think you were out...
example.tran: 我昨晚想要和你联系，但好像你不在家里。

example.ex: She had to go out.
example.tran: 她得出趟门。

collins.def: If you say that someone is out in a particular place, you mean that they are in a different place, usually one far away.

example.ex: The police tell me they've finished their investigations out there...
example.tran: 警方告诉我他们已完成了在那儿的调查工作。

example.ex: Rosie's husband was now out East.
example.tran: 罗茜的丈夫现在远在东部。

collins.def: When the sea or tide goes out, the sea moves away from the shore.

example.ex: The tide was out and they walked among the rock pools.
example.tran: 潮水已经退去，他们走过岩石区的潮水潭。

collins.tran: 缺少，不足，损失（某一数量的钱）
collins.def: If you are out a particular amount of money, you have that amount less than you should or than you did.

example.ex: Me and my friends are out ten thousand dollars, with nothing to show for it!
example.tran: 我和朋友亏了1万美金，还一无所得！

collins.def: The outside of something is the part which surrounds or encloses the rest of it.

example.ex: ...the outside of the building...
example.tran: 建筑物的外部

example.ex: Cook over a fairly high heat until the outsides are browned.
example.tran: 用大火烹调至表面焦黄。

collins.tran: 在外面；在室外；在建筑物近旁
collins.def: If you are outside, you are not inside a building but are quite close to it.

example.ex: 'Was the car inside the garage?' — 'No, it was still outside.'...
example.tran: “车在车库里吗？”——“不，还在外面。”

example.ex: I stepped outside and pulled up my collar against the cold mist...
example.tran: 我走出门，竖起衣领抵御冷雾。

collins.def: If you are outside a room, you are not in it but are in the passage or area next to it.

example.ex: She'd sent him outside the classroom...
example.tran: 她让他到教室外面去。

example.ex: He stood in the narrow hallway just outside the door.
example.tran: 他就站在门外狭窄的走廊里。

collins.def: When you talk about the outside world, you are referring to things that happen or exist in places other than your own home or community.

example.ex: ...a side of Morris's character she hid carefully from the outside world...
example.tran: 莫里斯小心隐藏不让外人知晓的性格中的一面

example.ex: It's important to have outside interests.
example.tran: 培养一些业余爱好很重要。

collins.def: People or things outside a country, town, or region are not in it.

example.ex: ...an old castle outside Budapest...
example.tran: 布达佩斯城外的古堡

example.ex: The number of warships stationed outside European waters roughly doubled.
example.tran: 部署在欧洲水域之外的战舰数量差不多增加了一倍。

collins.tran: （车道）靠近路中间的，快车道的
collins.def: On a road with two separate carriageways, the outside lanes are the ones which are closest to its centre.

example.ex: It was travelling in the outside lane at 78mph.
example.tran: 它正以78英里的时速在快车道上疾驶。

collins.def: Outside people or organizations are not part of a particular organization or group.

example.ex: The company now makes much greater use of outside consultants.
example.tran: 该公司现在对外聘顾问的利用更加充分。

example.ex: ...church services given on Sundays by outside chaplains.
example.tran: 外请牧师主持的星期天礼拜仪式

collins.def: Outside a particular institution or field of activity means in other fields of activity or in general life.

example.ex: The condition is practically unknown outside psychiatry clinics.
example.tran: 除了医院的精神病科外，这种病几乎不为人知。

example.ex: ...the largest merger ever to take place outside the oil industry.
example.tran: 石油行业之外发生的一起有史以来规模最大的并购

collins.def: Something that is outside a particular range of things is not included within it.

example.ex: She is a beautiful boat, but way, way outside my price range...
example.tran: 这条船很漂亮，但价格却远远超出我能承受的范围。

example.ex: When Cathy sings about love, you feel that she's singing about something outside her experience.
example.tran: 凯茜在唱情歌的时候，你能感觉到她没有这方面的体验。

collins.def: Something that happens outside a particular period of time happens at a different time from the one mentioned.

example.ex: They are open outside normal daily banking hours.
example.tran: 它们在银行正常营业时间以外开放。

example.ex: ...nor does it help if your job involves working outside normal office hours.
example.tran: 工作需要加班也会有害。

collins.def: Outside of is used to introduce the only thing or person that prevents your main statement from being completely true.

example.ex: Every single relationship I've had with a man, outside of my husband, has ended in disaster.
example.tran: 除了我丈夫之外，我与所有男人的感情都以悲剧收场。

collins.def: You use at the outside to say that you think that a particular amount is the largest possible in a particular situation, or that a particular time is the latest possible time for something to happen.

example.ex: Give yourself forty minutes at the outside.
example.tran: 最多给自己留40分钟。

collins.tran: 在…的上方；在…的上面；在…的上空
collins.def: If one thing is over another thing or is moving over it, the first thing is directly above the second, either resting on it, or with a space between them.

example.ex: He looked at himself in the mirror over the table.
example.tran: 他对着桌子上方的镜子照了照。

example.ex: ...a bridge over the river Danube.
example.tran: 多瑙河上的一座桥

collins.def: If one thing is over another thing, it is supported by it and its ends are hanging down on each side of it.

example.ex: A grey mackintosh was folded over her arm...
example.tran: 她胳膊上搭着一件灰色雨衣。

example.ex: Joe's clothing was flung over the back of a chair.
example.tran: 乔的衣服扔在椅背上。

collins.tran: （部分或完全地）覆盖在…的上面
collins.def: If one thing is over another thing, it covers part or all of it.

example.ex: His hair fell over his brow instead of being brushed straight back...
example.tran: 他的头发没有整齐地往后梳，而是搭在前额。

example.ex: Mix the ingredients and pour over the mushrooms...
example.tran: 将配料搅拌均匀浇在蘑菇上。

collins.def: If you lean over an object, you bend your body so that the top part of it is above the object.

example.ex: They stopped to lean over a gate...
example.tran: 他们停下来，身子探过一扇栅栏门。

example.ex: Everyone in the room was bent over her desk.
example.tran: 房间里的每一个人都弯腰围在她的办公室桌前。

collins.tran: 从…上面（看过去）；隔着…（交谈）
collins.def: If you look over or talk over an object, you look or talk across the top of it.

example.ex: I went and stood beside him, looking over his shoulder.
example.tran: 我走过去站在他身边，从他的肩头望过去。

example.ex: ...conversing over the fence with your friend...
example.tran: 与你的朋友隔着围栏交谈

collins.def: If a window has a view over an area of land or water, you can see the land or water through the window.

example.ex: ...a light and airy bar with a wonderful view over the River Amstel...
example.tran: 可将阿姆斯特尔河美景尽收眼底的明亮通风的酒吧

example.ex: His rooms looked out over a narrow lane behind the college.
example.tran: 从他的房间可以看见学院后面一条狭窄的小巷。

collins.def: If someone or something goes over a barrier, obstacle, or boundary, they get to the other side of it by going across it, or across the top of it.

example.ex: Policemen jumped over the wall of the Spanish Embassy in pursuit...
example.tran: 警察在追捕中跳过西班牙大使馆的围墙。

example.ex: I stepped over a broken piece of wood...
example.tran: 我跨过一块破木头。

collins.def: If someone or something moves over an area or surface, they move across it, from one side to the other.

example.ex: She ran swiftly over the lawn to the gate...
example.tran: 她一溜烟穿过草地跑到了大门口。

example.ex: Joe passed his hand over his face and looked puzzled.
example.tran: 乔用手摸了一把脸，看上去疑惑不解。

collins.def: If something is on the opposite side of a road or river, you can say that it is over the road or river.

example.ex: ...Richard Garrick, who lived in the house over the road.
example.tran: 住在马路对面那所房子里的理查德·加里克

example.ex: ...a fashionable neighbourhood, just over the river from Manhattan.
example.tran: 与曼哈顿隔河相望的时尚街区

collins.def: If you go over to a place, you go to that place.

example.ex: I got out the car and drove over to Dervaig...
example.tran: 我把车开出来，驶向德韦格。

example.ex: I thought you might have invited her over.
example.tran: 我以为你可能已经邀请她过来了。

collins.def: You can use over to indicate a particular position or place a short distance away from someone or something.

example.ex: He noticed Rolfe standing silently over by the window...
example.tran: 他注意到罗尔夫一声不吭地站在窗户旁边。

example.ex: John reached over and took Joanna's hand...
example.tran: 约翰伸手握住乔安娜的手。

collins.def: You use over to say that someone or something falls towards or onto the ground, often suddenly or violently.

example.ex: If he drinks more than two glasses of wine he falls over...
example.tran: 他喝酒超过两杯就会醉倒在地。

example.ex: He was knocked over by a bus and broke his leg...
example.tran: 他被一辆公共汽车撞倒，一条腿折了。

collins.def: If something rolls over or is turned over, its position changes so that the part that was facing upwards is now facing downwards.

example.ex: His car rolled over after a tyre was punctured...
example.tran: 一只轮胎被扎破后，他的车翻了个底朝天。

example.ex: The alarm did go off but all I did was yawn, turn over and go back to sleep.
example.tran: 闹钟确实响了，但我只是打了个哈欠，翻个身又接着睡着了。

collins.def: All over a place means in every part of it.

example.ex: ...doctors who work all over the country.
example.tran: 在全国各地工作的医生

example.ex: ...the letters she received from people all over the world.
example.tran: 她收到的来自世界各地的信件

collins.tran: 在这边；到这边；在身处国
collins.def: Over here means near you, or in the country you are in.

example.ex: Why don't you come over here tomorrow evening...
example.tran: 你明天晚上过来吧。

example.ex: My father was in the U.S. army over here.
example.tran: 我父亲在这里的美国陆军服役。

collins.tran: 在那边；到那边；在另一国
collins.def: Over there means in a place a short distance away from you, or in another country.

example.ex: The cafe is just across the road over there...
example.tran: 咖啡馆就在那边马路对面。

example.ex: She'd married some American and settled down over there.
example.tran: 她嫁给了一位美国人，并在那边定居了。

collins.def: You use own to indicate that something belongs to a particular person or thing.

example.ex: My wife decided I should have my own shop...
example.tran: 我妻子决定让我自己开店。

example.ex: ...another group of patients who were taught to change their own dressings...
example.tran: 另一组被教会自己换药的病人

collins.tran: 自己所用的；具有自己特点的；特有的
