collins.def: You use own to indicate that something is used by, or is characteristic of, only one person, thing, or group.

example.ex: Jennifer insisted on her own room...
example.tran: 珍妮弗坚持要有自己的房间。

example.ex: I let her tell me about it in her own way...
example.tran: 我让她用自己的方式告诉我那件事。

collins.tran: 自己做的；单独干的；独立完成的
collins.def: You use own to indicate that someone does something without any help from other people.

example.ex: They enjoy making their own decisions...
example.tran: 他们喜欢自己作决定。

example.ex: Tony also built his own house from his own plans...
example.tran: 托尼还自己设计并盖好了房子。

collins.def: If you own something, it is your property.

example.ex: His father owns a local pub...
example.tran: 他父亲在当地有一家酒馆。

example.ex: At least three British golf courses are now owned by the Japanese.
example.tran: 现在英国至少有3家高尔夫球场为日本人所有。

collins.def: If you have something you can call your own, it belongs only to you, rather than being controlled by or shared with someone else.

example.ex: They don't yet have a country to call their own...
example.tran: 他们还没有自己的国家。

example.ex: I would like a place I could call my own.
example.tran: 我想要一个自己的窝儿。

collins.tran: （因情况适宜而）开始取得成功，开始进入（良好）状态
collins.def: If someone or something comes into their own, they become very successful or start to perform very well because the circumstances are right.

example.ex: The goalkeeper came into his own with a series of brilliant saves...
example.tran: 守门员开始进入状态，作出了一连串精彩的扑救。

example.ex: This is when geraniums and petunias come into their own.
example.tran: 这是天竺葵和矮牵牛盛开的时节。

collins.def: If you get your own back on someone, you have your revenge on them because of something bad that they have done to you.

example.ex: Renshaw reveals 20 bizarre ways in which women have got their own back on former loved ones.
example.tran: 伦肖揭示了20种女性用来报复旧情人的离奇手段。

collins.tran: 使只与自己相关；使为自己所有
collins.def: If you make something your own, you become involved in it in such a way that people think of it as being related only to you or belonging only to you, rather than to anyone else.

example.ex: Here again is the song that Pavarotti has made his own.
example.tran: 下面再次为您播放这首帕瓦罗蒂的标志性歌曲。

collins.tran: 属于自己的；关于自己的
collins.def: If you say that someone has a particular thing of their own, you mean that that thing belongs or relates to them, rather than to other people.

example.ex: You see, we have a problem of our own...
example.tran: 你知道，我们也有自己的问题。

example.ex: He set out in search of ideas for starting a company of his own.
example.tran: 他开始寻求思路创办自己的公司。

collins.def: If someone or something has a particular quality or characteristic of their own, that quality or characteristic is especially theirs, rather than being shared by other things or people of that type.

example.ex: Groups have a personality of their own...
example.tran: 每支乐队都有自己独特的风格。

example.ex: The cries of the seagulls gave this part of the harbour a fascinating character all of its own.
example.tran: 海鸥的鸣叫声给这片海港带来了迷人的独特气息。

collins.def: When you are on your own, you are alone.

example.ex: He lives on his own...
example.tran: 他独自一人生活。

example.ex: I told him how scared I was of being on my own...
example.tran: 我告诉他我有多害怕自己一个人。

collins.def: If you do something on your own, you do it without any help from other people.

example.ex: I work best on my own.
example.tran: 我独立工作的时候效果最好。

example.ex: ...the jobs your child can do on her own.
example.tran: 孩子能独立完成的事情

collins.tran: 傲慢；目中无人；颐指气使
collins.def: If you say that someone does something as if they own the place or like they own the place, you are critical of them because they do it in a very arrogant way.

example.ex: He struts around town like he owns the place.
example.tran: 他大摇大摆地在镇上四处晃悠，好像这是他的地盘。

collins.def: A page is one side of one of the pieces of paper in a book, magazine, or newspaper. Each page usually has a number printed at the top or bottom.

example.ex: Where's your book? Take it out and turn to page 4.
example.tran: 你的书呢？拿出来，翻到第4页。

example.ex: ...the front page of the Guardian.
example.tran: 《卫报》的头版

collins.def: The pages of a book, magazine, or newspaper are the pieces of paper it consists of.

example.ex: He turned the pages of his notebook...
example.tran: 他翻着笔记本。

example.ex: Over the page you can read all about the six great books on offer.
example.tran: 在下一页上，你可以看到有关6本在售好书的全部信息。

collins.tran: （历史的）一页（指重大事件或重要时期）
collins.def: You can refer to an important event or period of time as a page of history.

example.ex: ...a new page in the country's political history.
example.tran: 该国政治史上崭新的一页

collins.def: If someone who is in a public place is paged, they receive a message, often over a speaker, telling them that someone is trying to contact them.

example.ex: He was paged repeatedly as the flight was boarding...
example.tran: 航班登机时，广播里反复呼叫他。

example.ex: I'll have them paged and tell them you're here.
example.tran: 我会叫人呼他们，告诉他们你在这儿。

collins.tran: （婚礼上新娘的）男伴童，小男傧相
collins.def: A page is a small boy who accompanies the bride at a wedding.

collins.tran: （美国国会或州立法会的）青年助理
collins.def: A page is a young person who takes messages or does small jobs for members of the United States Congress or state legislatures.

collins.tran: （旧时做骑士侍从的）实习骑士
collins.def: In former times, a page was a young boy who was a knight's servant and was learning to be a knight.
Paper is a material that you write on or wrap things with. The pages of this book are made of paper.

example.ex: He wrote his name down on a piece of paper for me...
example.tran: 他把他的名字写在一张纸上交给我。

example.ex: She sat at the table with pen and paper.
example.tran: 她拿着纸笔坐在桌旁。

collins.def: A paper is a newspaper.

example.ex: I might get a paper in the village...
example.tran: 我或许能在村子里找到一份报纸。

example.ex: I'll cook and you read the paper.
example.tran: 我做饭，你看报纸。

collins.def: You can refer to newspapers in general as the paper or the papers .

example.ex: You can't believe everything you read in the paper...
example.tran: 报纸上看到的东西不能全信。

example.ex: There's been a lot in the papers about the problems facing stepchildren.
example.tran: 报纸上有很多关于继子女所面临的问题的报道。

collins.def: Your papers are sheets of paper with writing or information on them, which you might keep in a safe place at home.

example.ex: Her papers included unpublished articles and correspondence.
example.tran: 她的资料包括未发表的文章和信件。

collins.def: Your papers are official documents, for example your passport or identity card, which prove who you are or which give you official permission to do something.

example.ex: A young Moroccan stopped by police refused to show his papers...
example.tran: 一位被警察拦下的摩洛哥青年拒绝出示他的证件。

example.ex: They have arrested four people who were trying to leave the country with forged papers.
example.tran: 他们已经逮捕了4名企图利用伪造证件离境的人。

collins.def: A paper is a long, formal piece of writing about an academic subject.

example.ex: He just published a paper in the journal Nature analyzing the fires.
example.tran: 他刚刚在《自然》杂志上发表了一篇分析火灾的论文。

collins.def: A paper is an essay written by a student.

example.ex: ...the ten common errors that appear most frequently in student papers.
example.tran: 学生论文中最常见的10个错误

collins.def: A paper is a part of a written examination in which you answer a number of questions in a particular period of time.

example.ex: We sat each paper in the Hall...
example.tran: 我们每一场考试都是在大厅里考的。

example.ex: She finished the exam paper.
example.tran: 她答完了考卷。

collins.tran: （政府或委员会发表的关于重大问题的）文件，报告
collins.def: A paper prepared by a government or a committee is a report on a question they have been considering or a set of proposals for changes in the law.

example.ex: ...a new government paper on European policy.
example.tran: 有关欧洲政策的新政府文件

collins.def: Paper agreements, qualifications, or profits are ones that are stated by official documents to exist, although they may not really be effective or useful.

example.ex: They expressed deep mistrust of the paper promises...
example.tran: 他们对书面承诺表现出极度的不信任。

example.ex: We're looking for people who have experience rather than paper qualifications.
example.tran: 我们要找有经验的人，而不是有文凭的人。

collins.def: If you paper a wall, you put wallpaper on it.

example.ex: We papered all four bedrooms...
example.tran: 我们把4个卧室都贴了墙纸。

example.ex: We have papered this bedroom in softest grey...
example.tran: 我们给这个卧室贴上了极柔和的灰色壁纸。

collins.def: If you put your thoughts down on paper, you write them down.

example.ex: It is important to get something down on paper...
example.tran: 把一些东西写在纸上很重要。

example.ex: It was the first time I had put it all down on paper. I found it helped.
example.tran: 这是我第一次把所有的东西都写在纸上，我觉得这有帮助。

collins.def: If something seems to be the case on paper, it seems to be the case from what you read or hear about it, but it may not really be the case.

example.ex: On paper, I am the healthiest man alive, yet I feel permanently unwell.
example.tran: 理论上，我是活着的最健康的人，但是我总感觉不舒服。

example.ex: The family is estimated to have been worth, on paper at least, more than £1.1billion.
example.tran: 据估计，这个家族理论上至少拥有11亿英镑以上的财富。

collins.def: If you say that a promise, an agreement, or a guarantee is not worth the paper it's written on, you mean that although it has been written down and seems to be official, it is in fact worthless because what has been promised will not be done.
Your parents are your mother and father.

example.ex: Children need their parents...
example.tran: 孩子们需要父母。

example.ex: This is where a lot of parents go wrong...
example.tran: 这正是很多父母犯错的地方。

collins.tran: 创始的；母公司的；总公司的
collins.def: An organization's parent organization is the organization that created it and usually still controls it.

example.ex: Each unit including the parent company has its own, local management.
example.tran: 包括母公司在内，每个单位都有自己的地方管理层。

example.ex: ...the zoo's parent body, the Zoological Society of London.
example.tran: 该动物园的创始组织，伦敦动物学会

collins.tran: （动物、植物或有机体）亲本的，亲代的
collins.def: The parent animal, plant, or organism of a particular animal, plant or organism is the one that it comes from or is produced by.

example.ex: Parent birds began to hunt for food for their young.
example.tran: 亲鸟开始为幼鸟寻找食物。

collins.def: A party is a political organization whose members have similar aims and beliefs. Usually the organization tries to get its members elected to the government of a country.

example.ex: ...a member of the Labour party.
example.tran: 工党党员

example.ex: ...India's ruling party.
example.tran: 印度执政党

collins.def: A party is a social event, often in someone's home, at which people enjoy themselves doing things such as eating, drinking, dancing, talking, or playing games.

example.ex: The couple met at a party...
example.tran: 那对情侣是在一个派对上认识的。

example.ex: We threw a huge birthday party...
example.tran: 我们举办了盛大的生日聚会。

collins.def: If you party, you enjoy yourself doing things such as going out to parties, drinking, dancing, and talking to people.

example.ex: They come to eat and drink, to swim, to party. Sometimes they never go to bed...
example.tran: 他们来吃喝、游泳、狂欢，有时都不睡觉。

example.ex: After a long evening of partying he looked tired.
example.tran: 纵情狂欢了一夜后，他看起来累了。

collins.def: A party of people is a group of people who are doing something together, for example travelling together.

example.ex: They became separated from their party.
example.tran: 他们和伙伴们分开了。

example.ex: ...a party of sightseers.
example.tran: 一群观光客

collins.def: One of the people involved in a legal agreement or dispute can be referred to as a particular party.

example.ex: It has to be proved that they are the guilty party.
example.tran: 必须证明他们是过错方。

example.ex: ...he was the injured party.
example.tran: 他是受害方。

collins.def: Someone who is a party to or is party to an action or agreement is involved in it, and therefore partly responsible for it.

example.ex: Crook had resigned his post rather than be party to such treachery.
example.tran: 克鲁克已经辞职了，不愿参与这种背信弃义的行为。

collins.def: The past is the time before the present, and the things that have happened.

example.ex: In the past, about a third of the babies born to women with diabetes were lost...
example.tran: 过去，患有糖尿病的女性生下的孩子中约有1/3夭折了。

example.ex: He should learn from the mistakes of the past. We have been here before...
example.tran: 他应该从过去的错误中吸取教训。我们有过同样的经历。

collins.def: Your past consists of all the things that you have done or that have happened to you.

example.ex: ...revelations about his past.
example.tran: 曝光他的过去

example.ex: ...Germany's recent past.
example.tran: 德国不久前的过去

collins.def: Past events and things happened or existed before the present time.

example.ex: I knew from past experience that alternative therapies could help...
example.tran: 根据过去的经验，我知道替代疗法可能有用。

example.ex: ...a return to the turbulence of past centuries...
example.tran: 回到过去几个世纪的动荡状态

collins.def: You use past to talk about a period of time that has just finished. For example, if you talk about the past five years, you mean the period of five years that has just finished.

example.ex: Most shops have remained closed for the past three days.
example.tran: 过去3天大多数商店一直都没有营业。

example.ex: ...the momentous events of the past few days.
example.tran: 过去几天的重大事件

collins.def: If a situation is past, it has ended and no longer exists.

example.ex: Many economists believe the worst of the economic downturn is past.
example.tran: 很多经济学家认为经济衰退最糟糕的时期已经过去了。

example.ex: ...images from years long past...
example.tran: 很多年以前的形象

collins.def: In grammar, the past tenses of a verb are the ones used to talk about things that happened at some time before the present. The simple past tense uses the past form of a verb, which for regular verbs ends in '-ed', as in 'They walked back to the car'.
You use past when you are stating a time which is thirty minutes or less after a particular hour. For example, if it is twenty past six, it is twenty minutes after six o'clock.

example.ex: It's ten past eleven...
example.tran: 现在是11点过10分。

example.ex: I arrived at half past ten.
example.tran: 我10点半到的。

collins.def: If it is past a particular time, it is later than that time.

example.ex: It was past midnight...
example.tran: 午夜已过。

example.ex: It's past your bedtime.
example.tran: 你的就寝时间已经过了。

collins.def: If you go past someone or something, you go near them and keep moving, so that they are then behind you.

example.ex: I dashed past him and out of the door...
example.tran: 我从他身边跑过，夺门而出。

example.ex: A steady procession of people filed past the coffin...
example.tran: 人们排成一队，一个接一个地从灵柩旁走过。

collins.def: If you look or point past a person or thing, you look or point at something behind them.

example.ex: She stared past Christine at the bed.
example.tran: 她的目光越过克里斯蒂娜盯着床。

collins.def: If something is past a place, it is on the other side of it.

example.ex: Go north on I-15 to the exit just past Barstow...
example.tran: 沿着15号州际公路一直向北，一过巴斯托就从出口驶出。

example.ex: Just past the Barlby roundabout there's temporary traffic lights.
example.tran: 在刚过巴尔比环岛的地方，有一个临时红绿灯。

collins.tran: 超过，超出（某一点或阶段）
collins.def: If someone or something is past a particular point or stage, they are no longer at that point or stage.

example.ex: He was well past retirement age...
example.tran: 他早过了退休年龄。

example.ex: They felt that, at 69 or so, Mr Peters was past his prime.
example.tran: 他们觉得69岁左右的彼得斯先生已经风光不再了。

collins.def: If you are past doing something, you are no longer able to do it. For example, if you are past caring, you do not care about something any more because so many bad things have happened to you.

example.ex: She was past caring about anything by then and just wanted the pain to end...
example.tran: 那时，她已经什么都不在乎了，只盼着疼痛能够止住。

example.ex: Often by the time they do accept the truth they are past being able to put words to feelings.
example.tran: 往往等他们真正接受事实时，他们已无法用语言形容自己的感情了。

collins.def: If you say that you would not put it past someone to do something bad, you mean that you would not be surprised if they did it because you think their character is bad.

example.ex: You know what she's like. I wouldn't put it past her to call the police and say I stole them.
example.tran: 你知道她是个什么样的人。要是她打电话报警说我偷了它们，一点儿也不奇怪。

collins.def: When you pay an amount of money to someone, you give it to them because you are buying something from them or because you owe it to them. When you pay something such as a bill or a debt, you pay the amount that you owe.

example.ex: Accommodation is free — all you pay for is breakfast and dinner...
example.tran: 住宿免费——你只需付早餐和正餐的钱。

example.ex: We paid £35 for each ticket...
example.tran: 我们每张票付了35英镑。

collins.def: When you are paid, you get your wages or salary from your employer.

example.ex: The lawyer was paid a huge salary...
example.tran: 那位律师薪酬很高。

example.ex: I get paid monthly...
example.tran: 我按月领工资。

collins.def: Your pay is the money that you get from your employer as wages or salary.

example.ex: ...their complaints about their pay and conditions.
example.tran: 他们对薪水和工作条件的不满

example.ex: ...the workers' demand for a twenty per cent pay rise.
example.tran: 工人要求加薪20%

collins.def: If you are paid to do something, someone gives you some money so that you will help them or perform some service for them.

example.ex: Students were paid substantial sums of money to do nothing all day but lie in bed...
example.tran: 学生们得到了一大笔钱，而所要做的就是整天躺在床上什么也不做。

example.ex: If you help me, I'll pay you anything.
example.tran: 如果你帮我，你要多少钱我都给。

collins.tran: （政府或机构通过提高价格、税率等使某人）为…买单
collins.def: If a government or organization makes someone pay for something, it makes them responsible for providing the money for it, for example by increasing prices or taxes.

example.ex: ...a legally binding international treaty that establishes who must pay for environmental damage...
example.tran: 规定谁该为环境破坏买单的有法律约束力的国际条约

example.ex: If you don't subsidize ballet and opera, seat prices will have to go up to pay for it.
example.tran: 如果你不为芭蕾和歌剧提供补贴，就得提高剧场票价来为此买单。

collins.tran: （工作、交易或投资）有…报酬，产生…利润
collins.def: If a job, deal, or investment pays a particular amount, it brings you that amount of money.

example.ex: We're stuck in jobs that don't pay very well...
example.tran: 我们深陷在工资低廉的工作中。

example.ex: The account does not pay interest on a credit balance.
example.tran: 这个账户的贷方余额没有利息。

collins.tran: （工作、交易或投资）有收益，盈利
collins.def: If a job, deal, or investment pays, it brings you a profit or earns you some money.

example.ex: There are some agencies now specialising in helping older people to find jobs which pay...
example.tran: 现在有些机构专门帮助年龄较大的人找有报酬的工作。

example.ex: They owned land; they made it pay.
example.tran: 他们拥有土地；他们让土地生钱。

collins.def: When you pay money into a bank account, you put the money in the account.

example.ex: He paid £20 into his savings account...
example.tran: 他往自己的储蓄账户上存了20英镑。

example.ex: There is nothing more annoying than queueing when you only want to pay in a few cheques.
example.tran: 没有比你只想存几张支票还得排队更令人恼火的了。

collins.def: If a course of action pays, it results in some advantage or benefit for you.

example.ex: It pays to invest in protective clothing...
example.tran: 在防护服上投资是值得的。

example.ex: He talked of defending small nations, of ensuring that aggression does not pay.
example.tran: 他谈到了保卫小国家，绝不让侵略得逞。

collins.def: If you pay for something that you do or have, you suffer as a result of it.

example.ex: Britain was to pay dearly for its lack of resolve...
example.tran: 英国将为缺乏决心付出惨痛的代价。

example.ex: Why should I pay the penalty for somebody else's mistake?...
example.tran: 为什么我要代人受过？

collins.tran: （与某些名词连用，表示施予某物或做某事）进行（访问）/给予（注意）
collins.def: You use pay with some nouns, for example in the expressions pay a visit and pay attention, to indicate that something is given or done.

example.ex: Do pay us a visit next time you're in Birmingham...
example.tran: 下次你来伯明翰一定要来看看我们。

example.ex: He felt a heavy bump, but paid no attention to it...
example.tran: 他觉得起了个大包，但是没有理会。

collins.def: Pay television consists of programmes and channels which are not part of a public broadcasting system, and for which people have to pay.

example.ex: The company has set up joint-venture pay-TV channels in Belgium, Spain, and Germany.
example.tran: 该公司已在比利时、西班牙和德国设立了合资付费电视频道。

collins.def: If something that you buy or invest in pays for itself after a period of time, the money you gain from it, or save because you have it, is greater than the amount you originally spent or invested.

example.ex: ...investments in energy efficiency that would pay for themselves within five years.
example.tran: 将在5年内收回成本的能效投资

collins.def: If you say that someone is in the pay of a certain person or group, you disapprove of the fact that they are being paid by and are working for that person or group, often secretly or illegally.

example.ex: He was murdered at a presidential rally by gunmen in the pay of drug traffickers.
example.tran: 他在一场总统竞选集会上被毒品贩子雇用的枪手谋杀了。

collins.def: If you pay your way, you have or earn enough money to pay for what you need, without needing other people to give or lend you money.

example.ex: I went to college anyway, as a part-time student, paying my own way...
example.tran: 总之我上了大学，半工半读，自食其力。

example.ex: The British film industry could not pay its way without a substantial export market.
example.tran: 没有广阔的出口市场，英国电影工业无以为继。

collins.def: If countries or groups involved in a war or violent conflict are discussing peace, they are talking to each other in order to try to end the conflict.

example.ex: Peace talks involving other rebel leaders and government representatives broke up without agreement last week, but are due to resume shortly...
example.tran: 上个星期，其他叛军领导人和政府代表之间的和谈没能达成协议，宣告破裂，但是和谈不久会重开。

example.ex: Leaders of some rival factions signed a peace agreement last week...
example.tran: 上周，一些敌对派系领导人签订了和平协议。

collins.def: If there is peace in a country or in the world, there  are no wars or violent conflicts going on.

example.ex: The President spoke of a shared commitment to world peace and economic development.
example.tran: 总统提到了共同致力于世界和平和经济发展。

example.ex: ...the Nobel Peace Prize.
example.tran: 诺贝尔和平奖

collins.tran: 和平运动；裁军运动（尤指核裁军运动）
collins.def: If you disapprove of weapons, especially nuclear weapons, you can use peace to refer to campaigns and other activities intended to reduce their numbers or stop their use.

example.ex: ...two peace campaigners accused of causing damage to an F1-11 nuclear bomber...
example.tran: 被控破坏一架F1-11核轰炸机的两名和平运动者

example.ex: He campaigned for peace and against the spread of nuclear weapons.
example.tran: 他为裁军运动和反对核武器扩散而奔走。

collins.def: If you have peace, you are not being disturbed, and you are in calm, quiet surroundings.

example.ex: All I want is to have some peace and quiet and spend a couple of nice days with my grandchildren...
example.tran: 我就想清静一下，和孙子孙女们一起好好呆几天。

example.ex: One more question and I'll leave you in peace.
example.tran: 再问一个问题，我就不打扰你了。

collins.def: If you have a feeling of peace, you feel contented and calm and not at all worried. You can also say that you are at peace.

example.ex: I had a wonderful feeling of peace and serenity when I saw my husband...
example.tran: 看到我丈夫时，我有一种异常平静安详的奇妙感觉。

example.ex: The peace of the Lord be always with you...
example.tran: 愿主的平和与你永在。

collins.def: If there is peace among a group of people, they live or work together in a friendly way and do not quarrel. You can also say that people live or work in peace with each other.

example.ex: ...a period of relative peace in the country's industrial relations...
example.tran: 该国劳资关系相对和睦的一段时期

example.ex: If you can't live in peace with your little brother then get out of the house.
example.tran: 如果你没法和你弟弟和睦相处，就滚出这座房子。

collins.def: The Peace of a particular place is a treaty or an agreement that was signed there, bringing an end to a war.

example.ex: The Peace of Ryswick was signed in September 1697.
example.tran: 《里斯维克和约》签订于1697年9月。

collins.def: If you hold or keep your peace, you do not speak, even though there is something you want or ought to say.

example.ex: ...people who knew about this evil man but held their peace...
example.tran: 了解这个恶棍却默不作声的人们

example.ex: I felt it politic to keep my peace and play the part of the attentive listener.
example.tran: 我觉得保持沉默、做一名专心的听众比较明智。

collins.def: If someone in authority, such as the army or the police, keeps the peace, they make sure that people behave and do not fight or quarrel with each other.

example.ex: ...the first UN contingent assigned to help keep the peace in Cambodia...
example.tran: 派往柬埔寨协助维持治安的第一批联合国分遣队

example.ex: How did your mother succeed in keeping the peace between these two very different men?
example.tran: 你母亲是如何做到让这两个性格迥异的男人相安无事的？

collins.def: If the law requires you to keep the peace, you must behave well and not cause any trouble in public.

example.ex: The demonstrators were bound over to keep the peace.
example.tran: 示威者一定要遵纪守法。

collins.def: If you make peace with someone or make your peace with them, you put an end to your quarrel with them, often by apologizing.

example.ex: The President ought to seize this opportunity to make his peace with political parties and negotiate a speedy return to democracy...
example.tran: 总统应该抓住这个机会与各政党握手言好，协商尽快恢复民主。

example.ex: All of a sudden she seemed to want to make peace and patch up our quarrel.
example.tran: 突然她似乎想要和好，结束我们之间的争吵。

collins.def: If something gives you peace of mind, it stops you from worrying about a particular problem or difficulty.

example.ex: The main appeal these bonds hold for individual investors is the safety and peace of mind they offer...
example.tran: 这些债券对个人投资者的主要吸引力在于其安全性，令人放心。

example.ex: He began to insist upon a bullet-proof limousine, just for peace of mind.
example.tran: 他开始坚持要防弹豪华轿车，仅仅是为了安心而已。

collins.def: If you express the wish that a dead person may rest in peace, you are showing respect and sympathy for him or her. 'Rest in peace' is also sometimes written on gravestones.
If you are at peace with yourself or at peace with the world, you feel calm and contented, and you have no emotional conflicts within yourself or with other people.

example.ex: Once I knew I was forgiven I could be at peace with myself at last...
example.tran: 一旦我知道自己得到了宽恕，便可以心平气和了。

example.ex: They make you relax. They make you feel at peace with the world.
example.tran: 他们令你放松，让你觉得与世无争。

collins.tran: 人，人们（通常用作person的复数）
collins.def: People are men, women, and children. People is normally used as the plural of person, instead of 'persons'.

example.ex: Millions of people have lost their homes.
example.tran: 数百万人流离失所。

example.ex: ...the people of Angola.
example.tran: 安哥拉人

collins.tran: （与政府或上流社会相对的）人民，民众，大众
collins.def: The people is sometimes used to refer to ordinary men and women, in contrast to the government or the upper classes.

example.ex: ...the will of the people.
example.tran: 人民的意愿

example.ex: ...a tremendous rift between the people and their leadership.
example.tran: 民众和领导层之间的巨大裂痕

collins.def: A people is all the men, women, and children of a particular country or race.

example.ex: ...the native peoples of Central and South America...
example.tran: 中南美洲的土著民族

example.ex: It's a triumph for the American people.
example.tran: 这是美国人民的胜利。

collins.def: If a place or country is peopled by a particular group of people, that group of people live there.

example.ex: It was peopled by a fiercely independent race of peace-loving Buddhists.
example.tran: 那里住着一个与世隔绝的种族，人们都是爱好和平的佛教徒。

example.ex: ...a small town peopled by lay workers and families.
example.tran: 普通工人和家庭居住的小镇

collins.tran: （某种类型的人）出现，存在，充斥于（故事或历史时期）
collins.def: If something such as a story or a time in history is peopled with people of a particular kind, those people occur or exist in it.

example.ex: Grass's novels are peopled with outlandish characters...
example.tran: 格拉斯的小说里都是些稀奇古怪的人物。

example.ex: British history of the 19th century is peopled by energetic reformers...
example.tran: 19世纪英国史上积极改革者层出不穷。

means: （表示比率）（尤指数量，价格，时间）每

collins.tran: （用来表示比率、比例等）每，每一
collins.def: You use per to express rates and ratios. For example, if something costs £50 per year, you must pay £50 each year for it. If a vehicle is travelling at 40 miles per hour, it travels 40 miles each hour.

example.ex: Social Security refused to pay her more than £17 per week...
example.tran: 社会保障部门拒绝每周向她支付17英镑以上的钱。

example.ex: Buses and trains use much less fuel per person than cars.
example.tran: 公共汽车和火车的人均燃料耗费量比轿车小得多。

collins.def: If something happens as per a particular plan or suggestion, it happens in the way planned or suggested.

example.ex: When they reach here they complain that they are not being paid as per the agreement...
example.tran: 来到这里后，他们抱怨工资没有依照协议发放。

example.ex: I approached an Intourist official, as per instructions.
example.tran: 我按照指示接洽了一位苏联国际旅行社官员。

means: （表示勉强同意或其实不赞成）也许

collins.def: You use perhaps to express uncertainty, for example, when you do not know that something is definitely true, or when you are mentioning something that may possibly happen in the future in the way you describe.

example.ex: Millson regarded her thoughtfully. Perhaps she was right...
example.tran: 米尔森若有所思地注视着她。或许她是对的。

example.ex: In the end they lose millions, perhaps billions...
example.tran: 最后他们输掉几百万，或许是几十亿。

collins.tran: （用以缓和语气或表示礼貌）也许，可能
collins.def: You use perhaps in opinions and remarks to make them appear less definite or more polite.

example.ex: Perhaps the most important lesson to be learned is that you simply cannot please everyone...
example.tran: 也许最应吸取的教训就是懂得众口难调。

example.ex: His very last paintings are perhaps the most puzzling...
example.tran: 他去世前的最后一批画作也许是最让人困惑的。

collins.tran: （用于给出建议或在正式语体中提出请求）也许，或者
collins.def: You use perhaps when you are making suggestions or giving advice. Perhaps is also used in formal English to introduce requests.

example.ex: Perhaps I may be permitted a few suggestions...
example.tran: 也许我可以提几条建议。

example.ex: Well, perhaps you'll come and see us at our place?...
example.tran: 嗯，或者你到我们家来见我们如何？

collins.tran: （委婉地表示不赞同或不接受）也许，大概
collins.def: You can say perhaps as a response to a question or remark, when you do not want to agree or accept, but think that it would be rude to disagree or refuse.

example.ex: 'You know it doesn't make sense for you.' — 'Perhaps. I don't know. Maybe it does maybe it doesn't.'...
example.tran: “你知道它对你来说没有意义。”——“也许吧，我不知道。可能有意义，也可能没意义。”

example.ex: 'I'm sure we can make it,' he says. Perhaps, but it will not be easy.
example.tran: “我确信我们能成功。”他说。也许吧，但是不会轻而易举。

collins.def: A person is a man, woman, or child.

example.ex: At least one person died and several others were injured...
example.tran: 至少一人死亡，还有几个人受伤。

example.ex: Everyone knows he's the only person who can do the job...
example.tran: 人人都知道他是唯一能做这项工作的人。

collins.tran: （person的复数形式，用于正式、法律、技术文体中）
collins.def: Persons is used as the plural of person in formal, legal, and technical writing.

example.ex: ...removal of the right of accused persons to remain silent...
example.tran: 剥夺被告人保持沉默的权利

example.ex: Persons who wish to adopt a child may contact their local social services department.
example.tran: 想收养孩子的人可以与当地社会公益部门联系。

collins.def: If you talk about someone as a person, you are considering them from the point of view of their real nature.

example.ex: I've a lot of time for him as a person now...
example.tran: 现在我有充分的时间去了解他的人品。

example.ex: Robin didn't feel good about herself as a person.
example.tran: 罗宾不喜欢自己的为人。

collins.def: If someone says, for example, 'I'm an outdoor person ' or 'I'm not a coffee person', they are saying whether or not they like that particular activity or thing.

example.ex: I am not a country person at all. I prefer the cities.
example.tran: 我根本不喜欢乡村生活，我喜欢城市。

collins.def: If you do something in person, you do it yourself rather than letting someone else do it for you.

example.ex: You must collect the mail in person and take along some form of identification...
example.tran: 你必须携带本人身份证明亲自来取邮件。

example.ex: She went to New York to receive the award in person.
example.tran: 她亲自前往纽约领奖。

collins.def: If you meet, hear, or see someone in person, you are in the same place as them, rather than, for example, speaking to them on the telephone, writing to them, or seeing them on television.

example.ex: It was the first time she had seen him in person.
example.tran: 这是她第一次见到他本人。

example.ex: ...a trip to Hollywood to meet his favorite actor in person...
example.tran: 去好莱坞亲自面见他最喜欢的演员的旅程

collins.def: Your person is your body.

example.ex: The suspect had refused to give any details of his identity and had carried no documents on his person.
example.tran: 嫌疑犯拒绝说出他的具体身份，而且身上没有携带任何身份证明。

collins.def: You can use in the person of when mentioning the name of someone you have just referred to in a more general or indirect way.

example.ex: We had a knowledgeable guide in the person of George Adams.
example.tran: 我们有一位见识广博的导游乔治·亚当斯。

collins.def: In grammar, we use the term first person when referring to 'I' and 'we', second person when referring to 'you', and third person when referring to 'he', 'she', 'it', 'they', and all other noun groups. Person is also used like this when referring to the verb forms that go with these pronouns and noun groups.
A photo is the same as a photograph .

example.ex: We must take a photo!...
example.tran: 我们一定要拍张照片！

example.ex: I've got a photo of him on the wall.
example.tran: 我在墙上挂了一张他的照片。

collins.def: A plan is a method of achieving something that you have worked out in detail beforehand.

example.ex: The three leaders had worked out a peace plan...
example.tran: 3位领导人已制订出了一个和平方案。

example.ex: The project is part of a United Nations plan for refugees.
example.tran: 该项目是联合国难民计划的一部分。

collins.def: If you plan what you are going to do, you decide in detail what you are going to do, and you intend to do it.

example.ex: If you plan what you're going to eat, you reduce your chances of overeating...
example.tran: 如果计划一下要吃什么，就有可能不会吃得过多。

example.ex: He planned to leave Baghdad on Monday...
example.tran: 他计划周一离开巴格达。

collins.tran: （有做某一特定事的）计划，打算，意向
collins.def: If you have plans, you are intending to do a particular thing.

example.ex: 'I'm sorry,' she said. 'I have plans for tonight.'
example.tran: “抱歉，”她说，“我今晚有安排了。”

example.ex: The government is making plans to evacuate more than two hundred of its citizens from the troubled area.
example.tran: 政府打算疏散200多名留在骚乱地区的公民。

collins.tran: 设计；绘制…的图样（或图表）
collins.def: When you plan something that you are going to make, build, or create, you decide what the main parts of it will be and do a drawing of how it should be made.

example.ex: We are planning a new kitchen.
example.tran: 我们在设计新厨房。

collins.def: A plan of something that is going to be built or made is a detailed diagram or drawing of it.

example.ex: ...when you have drawn a plan of the garden.
example.tran: 当你画出花园的平面图后

collins.def: A plant is a living thing that grows in the earth and has a stem, leaves, and roots.

example.ex: Water each plant as often as required.
example.tran: 按要求经常给每一株植物浇水。

example.ex: ...exotic plants.
example.tran: 异域植物

collins.def: When you plant a seed, plant, or young tree, you put it into the ground so that it will grow there.

example.ex: He says he plans to plant fruit trees and vegetables.
example.tran: 他说他打算种植果树和蔬菜。

collins.def: When someone plants land with a particular type of plant or crop, they put plants, seeds, or young trees into the land to grow them there.

example.ex: They plan to plant the area with grass and trees...
example.tran: 他们计划在这一地区种草植树。

example.ex: Recently much of their energy has gone into planting a large vegetable garden.
example.tran: 最近他们把很多精力投在种植大菜园上了。

collins.def: A plant is a factory or a place where power is produced.

example.ex: ...Ford's British car assembly plants...
example.tran: 福特公司在英国的汽车装配厂

example.ex: The plant provides forty per cent of the country's electricity.
example.tran: 全国总电量的40%是这家发电厂提供的。

collins.tran: 成套机械；成套设备；成套装置
collins.def: Plant is large machinery that is used in industrial processes.

example.ex: ...investment in plant and equipment.
example.tran: 对机械设备的投资

collins.def: If you plant something somewhere, you put it there firmly.

example.ex: She planted her feet wide and bent her knees slightly.
example.tran: 她双脚宽分站稳，膝盖微屈。

example.ex: ...with his enormous feet  planted heavily apart.
example.tran: 他的大脚重重地分开站好

collins.def: To plant something such as a bomb means to hide it somewhere so that it explodes or works there.

example.ex: So far no one has admitted planting the bomb.
example.tran: 到目前为止，还没有人承认是自己放了炸弹。

collins.tran: 把（武器、毒品等）栽赃（于某人）
collins.def: If something such as a weapon or drugs is planted on someone, it is put among their possessions or in their house so that they will be wrongly accused of a crime.

example.ex: He claimed that the drugs had been planted to incriminate him.
example.tran: 他声称毒品是有人栽赃陷害他。

collins.def: If an organization plants someone somewhere, they send that person there so that they can get information or watch someone secretly.

example.ex: Journalists informed police who planted an undercover detective to trap Smith.
example.tran: 记者通知了警方，后者于是为诱捕史密斯而安插了一名卧底侦探。

collins.def: If you plant a kiss on someone, you give them a kiss.

example.ex: She planted a kiss on each of his leathery cheeks.
example.tran: 她在他粗糙的面颊上左右各吻了一下。

collins.def: If you plant an idea in someone's mind, they begin to accept the idea without realizing that it has originally come from you and not from them.

example.ex: He hoped that he could plant the idea in such a way that Abramov would believe it was his own.
example.tran: 他希望能把这个想法注入阿布拉莫夫的头脑，但要让他相信这是他自己的念头。

collins.def: When children, animals, or perhaps adults play, they spend time doing enjoyable things, such as using toys and taking part in games.

example.ex: ...invite the children round to play...
example.tran: 邀请孩子们来玩

example.ex: They played in the little garden...
example.tran: 他们在小花园里玩耍。

collins.def: When you play a sport, game, or match, you take part in it.

example.ex: While the twins played cards, Francis sat reading...
example.tran: 那对双胞胎玩扑克牌的时候，弗朗西斯坐着看书。

example.ex: Alain was playing cards with his friends...
example.tran: 阿兰正和朋友打扑克牌。

collins.def: When one person or team plays another or plays against them, they compete against them in a sport or game.

example.ex: Northern Ireland will play Latvia...
example.tran: 北爱尔兰队将对阵拉脱维亚队。

example.ex: I've played against him a few times.
example.tran: 我已多次和他交手。

collins.def: When you play the ball or play a shot in a game or sport, you kick or hit the ball.

example.ex: Think first before playing the ball...
example.tran: 踢出球前先想一想。

example.ex: Sikander Bakht played a bad shot...
example.tran: 西坎德尔·巴克特击出一记坏球。

collins.tran: 开（玩笑）；耍（花招）；搞（恶作剧）
collins.def: If you play a joke or a trick on someone, you deceive them or give them a surprise in a way that you think is funny, but that often causes problems for them or annoys them.

example.ex: Someone had played a trick on her, stretched a piece of string at the top of those steps...
example.tran: 有人搞恶作剧整她，在最高的台阶上拉了一根绳子。

example.ex: I thought: 'This cannot be happening, somebody must be playing a joke'.
example.tran: 我想：“这不可能发生，肯定是谁在开玩笑。”

collins.def: If you play with an object or with your hair, you keep moving it or touching it with your fingers, perhaps because you are bored or nervous.

example.ex: She stared at the floor, idly playing with the strap of her handbag.
example.tran: 她眼睛盯着地板，漫不经心地摆弄着手提包的带子。

collins.def: A play is a piece of writing which is performed in a theatre, on the radio, or on television.

example.ex: The company put on a play about the homeless...
example.tran: 这家剧团上演了一出讲述无家可归者的戏。

example.ex: It's my favourite Shakespeare play.
example.tran: 它是我最喜欢的一部莎士比亚戏剧。

collins.def: If an actor plays a role or character in a play or film, he or she performs the part of that character.

example.ex: ...Dr Jekyll and Mr Hyde, in which he played Hyde...
example.tran: 他在其中饰演海德一角的《化身博士》

example.ex: His ambition is to play the part of Dracula.
example.tran: 他渴望扮演德拉库拉。

collins.def: You can use play to describe how someone behaves, when they are deliberately behaving in a certain way or like a certain type of person. For example, to play the innocent, means to pretend to be innocent, and to play deaf means to pretend not to hear something.

example.ex: Hill tried to play the peacemaker...
example.tran: 希尔想要充当和事佬。

example.ex: She was just playing the devoted mother...
example.tran: 她只是装得像个尽心尽责的母亲似的。

collins.def: You can describe how someone deals with a situation by saying that they play it in a certain way. For example, if someone plays it cool, they keep calm and do not show much emotion, and if someone plays it straight, they behave in an honest and direct way.

example.ex: Investors are playing it cautious, and they're playing it smart.
example.tran: 投资者审慎精明地行事。

collins.def: If you play a musical instrument or play a tune on a musical instrument, or if a musical instrument plays, music is produced from it.

example.ex: Nina had been playing the piano...
example.tran: 尼娜一直都在弹钢琴。

example.ex: Two people played jazz on a piano...
example.tran: 两人联手在一架钢琴上演奏爵士乐。

collins.def: If you play a record, a CD, or a tape, you put it into a machine and sound is produced. If a record, CD, or tape is playing, sound is being produced from it.

example.ex: She played her records too loudly...
example.tran: 她播放唱片时音量太大了。

example.ex: Every evening in those days the BBC played 'God Save The King'...
example.tran: 那些日子里，英国广播公司每天晚上都会播放《天佑吾王》。

collins.tran: （音乐家、乐队等）表演；举办（音乐会）
collins.def: If a musician or group of musicians plays or plays a concert, they perform music for people to listen or dance to.

example.ex: A band was playing...
example.tran: 乐队在表演。

example.ex: He will play concerts in Amsterdam and Paris.
example.tran: 他将在阿姆斯特丹和巴黎举办音乐会。

collins.def: When light plays somewhere, it moves about on a surface in an unsteady way.

example.ex: The sun played on the frosty roofs.
example.tran: 阳光在结霜的屋顶上闪烁变幻。

collins.tran: 搞什么名堂；干什么蠢事
collins.def: If you ask what someone is playing at, you are angry because you think they are doing something stupid or wrong.

example.ex: What the hell are you playing at?
example.tran: 你究竟在搞什么名堂？

collins.tran: （使）开始活动；（使）投入使用； （使）开始起作用
collins.def: When something comes into play or is brought into play, it begins to be used or to have an effect.

example.ex: The real existence of a military option will come into play...
example.tran: 存在选择军事手段的切实可能这一点将会起到作用。

example.ex: Breathing brings many muscles into play.
example.tran: 呼吸使很多肌肉活动起来。

collins.def: If something or someone plays a part or plays a role in a situation, they are involved in it and have an effect on it.

example.ex: They played a part in the life of their community...
example.tran: 他们参与到了自己社区的生活中。

example.ex: The UN would play a major role in monitoring a ceasefire.
example.tran: 联合国在监督停火方面会发挥重要作用。

collins.tran: 运动员；选手；参加运动者
collins.def: A player in a sport or game is a person who takes part, either as a job or for fun.

example.ex: ...his greatness as a player...
example.tran: 他作为运动员的伟大之处

example.ex: She was a good golfer and tennis player.
example.tran: 她是一名高尔夫球和网球好手。

collins.def: You can use player to refer to a musician. For example, a piano player is someone who plays the piano.

example.ex: ...a professional trumpet player.
example.tran: 职业小号手

collins.def: If a person, country, or organization is a player in something, they are involved in it and important in it.

example.ex: Big business has become a major player in the art market...
example.tran: 大公司已成为艺术市场上的重要力量。

example.ex: America is not a party to the negotiations, yet it is a key player...
example.tran: 美国不是谈判的一方，但却扮演着关键的角色。

collins.def: A player is an actor.

example.ex: ...a company of players...
example.tran: 一群演员

example.ex: Oscar nominations went to all five leading players.
example.tran: 5名主演均获得了奥斯卡提名。

collins.def: You use point to refer to something that someone has said or written.

example.ex: We disagree with every point Mr Blunkett makes...
example.tran: 布伦基特先生提出的观点我们一个都不同意。

example.ex: Dave Hill's article makes the right point about the Taylor Report...
example.tran: 戴夫·希尔的文章对《泰勒报告》的看法是正确的。

collins.def: If you say that someone has a point, or if you take their point, you mean that you accept that what they have said is important and should be considered.

example.ex: 'If he'd already killed once, surely he'd have killed Sarah?' She had a point there...
example.tran: “如果他杀过一次人，那他一定已经杀了萨拉吧？”她说得有道理。

example.ex: Oh I take your point, John, about that.
example.tran: 噢，约翰，关于那一点，我觉得你说得对。

collins.def: The point of what you are saying or discussing is the most important part that provides a reason or explanation for the rest.

example.ex: 'Did I ask you to talk to me?' — 'That's not the point.'...
example.tran: “我请你跟我谈了吗？”——“问题不在这儿。”

example.ex: The American Congress and media mostly missed the point about all this.
example.tran: 美国国会和媒体大都没搞清这一切的核心问题。

collins.def: If you ask what the point of something is, or say that there is no point in it, you are indicating that a particular action has no purpose or would not be useful.

example.ex: What was the point of thinking about him?...
example.tran: 想他有什么用呢？

example.ex: There was no point in staying any longer.
example.tran: 再留下来就没有意义了。

collins.def: A point is a detail, aspect, or quality of something or someone.

example.ex: Many of the points in the report are correct...
example.tran: 报告中的很多细节是正确的。

example.ex: The most interesting point about the village was its religion...
example.tran: 这个村庄最有意思的地方就是它的宗教。

collins.tran: 地点；地方；（表示位置的）点，处
collins.def: A point is a particular place or position where something happens.

example.ex: As a mark of respect the emperor met him at a point several weeks' march from the capital...
example.tran: 出于尊重，皇帝在离首都还有几个星期路程的地方迎接了他。

example.ex: The pain originated from a point in his right thigh.
example.tran: 疼痛是从他右大腿的某处开始的。

collins.def: You use point to refer to a particular time, or to a particular stage in the development of something.

example.ex: We're all going to die at some point...
example.tran: 我们都将在某个时间死去。

example.ex: At one point, around 70,000 members had failed to pay...
example.tran: 一度曾有约7万名成员没有支付费用。

collins.def: The point of something such as a pin, needle, or knife is the thin, sharp end of it.
In spoken English, you use point to refer to the dot or mark in a decimal number that separates the whole numbers from the fractions.

example.ex: This is FM stereo one oh three point seven...
example.tran: 这里是调频立体声103.7。

example.ex: Inflation at nine point four percent is the worst for eight years.
example.tran: 9.4%的通货膨胀率是8年来最糟的。

collins.tran: （用作某些体育运动等计分单位的）点，分
collins.def: In some sports, competitions, and games, a point is one of the single marks that are added together to give the total score.

example.ex: They lost the 1977 World Cup final to Australia by a single point...
example.tran: 他们在1977年的世界杯决赛中仅以一分之差输给了澳大利亚队。

example.ex: Chamberlain scored 50 or more points four times in the season.
example.tran: 张伯伦在赛季中有4次得分不低于50。

collins.def: The points of the compass are directions such as North, South, East, and West.

example.ex: Sightseers arrived from all points of the compass.
example.tran: 观光者来自四面八方。

collins.def: On a railway track, the points are the levers and rails at a place where two tracks join or separate. The points enable a train to move from one track to another.

example.ex: ...the rattle of the wheels across the points.
example.tran: 驶过道岔的车轮发出的哐啷哐啷声

collins.def: A point is an electric socket.

example.ex: ...too far away from the nearest electrical point.
example.tran: 离最近的电掣位也太远

collins.def: If you point at a person or thing, you hold out your finger towards them in order to make someone notice them.

example.ex: I pointed at the boy sitting nearest me...
example.tran: 我指了指坐得离我最近的男孩。

example.ex: He pointed at me with the stem of his pipe...
example.tran: 他用烟斗柄指着我。

collins.def: If you point something at someone, you aim the tip or end of it towards them.

example.ex: David Khan pointed his finger at Mary...
example.tran: 戴维·卡恩用手指指着玛丽。

example.ex: A man pointed a gun at them and pulled the trigger.
example.tran: 一名男子用手枪指着他们，扣动了扳机。

collins.def: If something points to a place or points in a particular direction, it shows where that place is or it faces in that direction.

example.ex: An arrow pointed to the toilets...
example.tran: 箭头指向卫生间。

example.ex: You can go anywhere and still the compass points north or south...
example.tran: 无论走到哪里，罗盘仍然指向北或南。

collins.def: If something points to a particular situation, it suggests that the situation exists or is likely to occur.

example.ex: Earlier reports pointed to pupils working harder, more continuously, and with enthusiasm...
example.tran: 早些时候的报告显示学生学习更为刻苦、持久，并且怀有学习热情。

example.ex: Private polls and embassy reports pointed to a no vote.
example.tran: 私人民意调查和使馆报告表明投票结果将会是否决。

collins.tran: 着重指出；强调；以…为证明
collins.def: If you point to something that has happened or that is happening, you are using it as proof that a particular situation exists.

example.ex: George Fodor points to other weaknesses in the way the campaign has progressed...
example.tran: 乔治·福多尔以运动开展过程中的其他不足为证。

example.ex: Gooch last night pointed to their bowling as the key to World Cup success.
example.tran: 古奇昨晚指出，他们的投球是在世界杯上取得成功的关键。

collins.tran: （用水泥等）勾嵌（砖或石墙的砌缝）
collins.def: When builders point a wall, they put a substance such as cement into the gaps between the bricks or stones in order to make the wall stronger and seal it.
If you say that something is beside the point, you mean that it is not relevant to the subject that you are discussing.

example.ex: Brian didn't like it, but that was beside the point.
example.tran: 布赖恩不喜欢它，但那并不重要。

collins.tran: 谈到正题；讲到关键问题
collins.def: When someone comes to the point or gets to the point, they start talking about the thing that is most important to them.

example.ex: He came to the point at once. 'You did a splendid job on this case.'...
example.tran: 他立刻切入正题道：“这件案子你处理得很棒。”

example.ex: Was she ever going to get to the point?
example.tran: 她到底还会不会讲到重点？

collins.def: If you make your point or prove your point, you prove that something is true, either by arguing about it or by your actions or behaviour.

example.ex: I think you've made your point, dear...
example.tran: 亲爱的，我想你已证明你的观点了。

example.ex: Dr David McCleland, of Boston University, studied one-hundred people, aged eighteen to sixty, to prove the point...
example.tran: 为证明这一点，波士顿大学的戴维·麦克莱兰博士对100名年龄在18至60岁之间的人进行了研究。

collins.def: If you make a point of doing something, you do it in a very deliberate or obvious way.

example.ex: She made a point of spending as much time as possible away from Osborne House.
example.tran: 她特意尽可能地不呆在奥斯本庄园。

collins.def: If you are on the point of doing something, you are about to do it.

example.ex: He was on the point of saying something when the phone rang...
example.tran: 他正要说话时电话铃响了。

example.ex: She looked on the point of tears.
example.tran: 她看起来就要哭了。

collins.def: Something that is to the point is relevant to the subject that you are discussing, or expressed neatly without wasting words or time.

example.ex: Mr. Baker was smiling and to the point...
example.tran: 贝克先生微笑着，说得很中肯。

example.ex: The description which he had been given was brief and to the point.
example.tran: 给他的描述言简意赅。

collins.def: If you say that something is true up to a point, you mean that it is partly but not completely true.

example.ex: 'Was she good?' — 'Mmm. Up to a point.'
example.tran: “她行不行？”——“嗯，某种程度上来说还可以。”

example.ex: It worked up to a point.
example.tran: 它起了一定作用。

collins.tran: 警察部门；警察机关；警方
collins.def: The police are the official organization that is responsible for making sure that people obey the law.

example.ex: The police are also looking for a second car...
example.tran: 警方也在寻找另一辆车。

example.ex: Police say they have arrested twenty people following the disturbances...
example.tran: 警方说骚乱发生后他们已逮捕了20人。

collins.def: Police are men and women who are members of the official organization that is responsible for making sure that people obey the law.

example.ex: More than one hundred police have ringed the area.
example.tran: 这一地区已被上百名警察包围。

collins.def: If the police or military forces police an area or event, they make sure that law and order is preserved in that area or at that event.

example.ex: ...the tiny UN observer force whose job it is to police the border...
example.tran: 承担守卫边界职责的一小支联合国观察员部队

example.ex: The march was heavily policed.
example.tran: 出动了大批警察维持游行示威的秩序。

collins.def: If a person or group in authority polices a law or an area of public life, they make sure that what is done is fair and legal.

example.ex: ...IMRO, the self-regulatory body that polices the investment management business.
example.tran: 投资管理监管组织，监督投资管理业务的自律机构

collins.tran: （尤指政治、经济或商业方面的）政策，方针，策略
collins.def: A policy is a set of ideas or plans that is used as a basis for making decisions, especially in politics, economics, or business.

example.ex: ...plans which include changes in foreign policy and economic reforms.
example.tran: 包括转变外交政策和改革经济的计划

example.ex: ...the UN's policy-making body.
example.tran: 联合国决策机构

collins.tran: （针对某一问题或某国的）政策，态度，行动
collins.def: An official organization's policy on a particular issue or towards a country is their attitude and actions regarding that issue or country.

example.ex: ...the organisation's future policy towards South Africa.
example.tran: 该组织未来对南非的政策

example.ex: ...the government's policy on repatriation.
example.tran: 有关遣返的政府态度

collins.def: An insurance policy is a document which shows the agreement that you have made with an insurance company.

example.ex: You are advised to read the small print of household and motor insurance policies.
example.tran: 建议阅读家庭财产和汽车保险单中的附属细则。

collins.def: Political means relating to the way power is achieved and used in a country or society.

example.ex: All other political parties there have been completely banned...
example.tran: 那里其他所有政党已被彻底取缔。

example.ex: The Canadian government is facing another political crisis.
example.tran: 加拿大政府面临着又一场政治危机。

collins.tran: 对政治感兴趣的；从事政治的
collins.def: Someone who is political is interested or involved in politics and holds strong beliefs about it.

example.ex: Oh I'm not political, I take no interest in politics...
example.tran: 噢，我不关心政治，对政治一点也不感兴趣。

example.ex: This play is very political.
example.tran: 这部戏政治味太浓。

collins.def: The position of someone or something is the place where they are in  relation to other things.

example.ex: The ship was identified, and its name and position were reported to the coastguard...
example.tran: 那艘船已找到，其名字和位置已报告给海岸警卫队。

example.ex: This conservatory enjoys an enviable position overlooking a leafy expanse.
example.tran: 这个温室位置绝佳，放眼望去，草木繁茂，郁郁葱葱。

collins.def: When someone or something is in a particular position, they are sitting, lying, or arranged in that way.

example.ex: Hold the upper back and neck in an erect position to give support for the head...
example.tran: 挺直上背部和脖子来支撑头部

example.ex: Ensure the patient is turned into the recovery position...
example.tran: 确保使患者处于复苏体位。

collins.def: If you position something somewhere, you put it there carefully, so that it is in the right place or position.

example.ex: Position trailing plants near the edges and in the sides of the basket to hang down...
example.tran: 把蔓生植株靠边放，使其从篮子的四面垂下。

example.ex: Place the pastry circles on to a baking sheet and position one apple on each circle.
example.tran: 把油酥面圈放到烘烤盘上，每个上面放一个苹果。

collins.def: Your position in society is the role and the importance that you have in it.

example.ex: ...the position of older people in society.
example.tran: 老年人在社会中的地位

collins.def: A position in a company or organization is a job.

example.ex: He left a career in teaching to take up a position with the Arts Council...
example.tran: 他辞去教学工作到艺术委员会任职。

example.ex: Hyundai said this week it is scaling back its U.S. operations by eliminating 50 positions.
example.tran: 现代公司本周表示其美国分公司准备裁掉50个职位以缩小经营规模。

collins.def: Your position in a race or competition is how well you did in relation to the other competitors or how well you are doing.

example.ex: Agassi and Sampras resumed their battle for the world's No. 1 position, both winning their opening matches...
example.tran: 阿加西和桑普拉斯继续他们对世界第一宝座的争夺，两人在首场比赛中均获得胜利。

example.ex: By the ninth hour the car was running in eighth position.
example.tran: 到第9个小时的时候，这辆车位列第8。

collins.def: You can describe your situation at a particular time by saying that you are in a particular position .

example.ex: He's going to be in a very difficult position indeed if things go badly for him...
example.tran: 如果事情进展不顺利的话，他的处境将非常艰难。

example.ex: Companies should be made to reveal more about their financial position...
example.tran: 应该要求公司使其财务状况更为透明化。

collins.def: Your position on a particular matter is your attitude towards it or your opinion of it.

example.ex: He could be depended on to take a moderate position on most of the key issues...
example.tran: 他应该会在大部分关键问题上采取中间立场。

example.ex: Mr Howard is afraid to state his true position on the republic, which is that he is opposed to it.
example.tran: 霍华德先生不敢表明自己对共和体制持反对态度的真实立场。

collins.def: If you are in a position to do something, you are able to do it. If you are in no position to do something, you are unable to do it.

example.ex: The UN system will be in a position to support the extensive relief efforts needed...
example.tran: 联合国将能满足全面救济需求。

example.ex: I am not in a position to comment.
example.tran: 我不便发表评论。

collins.def: If someone or something is in position, they are in their correct or usual place or arrangement.

example.ex: This second door is an extra security measure and can be locked in position during the day...
example.tran: 这第二道门是又一项安全措施，白天可以上锁。

example.ex: Some 28,000 US troops are moving into position.
example.tran: 约2.8万人的美国军队即将部署到位。

means: 可能的人物，可能有的事

collins.def: If it is possible to do something, it can be done.

example.ex: If it is possible to find out where your brother is, we shall...
example.tran: 如果能找出你兄弟在哪儿，我们就会去找。

example.ex: Everything is possible if we want it enough...
example.tran: 只要我们有足够的信念，任何事情都是有可能的。

collins.def: A possible event is one that might happen.

example.ex: He referred the matter to the Attorney General for possible action against several newspapers...
example.tran: 他把对几家报纸可能提起诉讼的事宜提交首席检察官来处理。

example.ex: Her family is discussing a possible move to America...
example.tran: 她的家人在讨论移居美国的可能。

collins.def: If you say that it is possible that something is true or correct, you mean that although you do not know whether it is true or correct, you accept that it might be.

example.ex: It is possible that there's an explanation for all this...
example.tran: 也许，对于所有这一切，会有一种解释。

example.ex: It was possible that Harry himself did not know what he had intended to do.
example.tran: 可能哈里本人都不清楚自己意欲何为。

collins.def: If you do something as soon as possible, you do it as soon as you can. If you get as much as possible of something, you get as much of it as you can.

example.ex: Please make your decision as soon as possible...
example.tran: 请尽快作决定。

example.ex: I want to learn as much as possible about the industry so that I'm better prepared...
example.tran: 我想尽可能多学一些关于这个行业的知识，让自己更有备无患。

collins.tran: （与形容词最高级连用，表示强调）最…的
collins.def: You use possible with superlative adjectives to emphasize that something has more or less of a quality than anything else of its kind.

example.ex: They have joined the job market at the  worst possible time...
example.tran: 他们在最不景气的时候进入了就业市场。

example.ex: We expressed in the clearest possible way our disappointment, hurt and anger...
example.tran: 我们清楚明白地表达了我们的失望、伤心和愤怒。

collins.tran: 如果可能的话；要是有可能的话
collins.def: You use possible in expressions such as 'if possible' and 'if at all possible' when stating a wish or intention, to show that although this is what you really want, you may have to accept something different.

example.ex: I need to see you, right away if possible.
example.tran: 我要见你，如果可能，马上。

example.ex: ...the moral duty to uphold peace if at all possible.
example.tran: 只要有可能就应维护和平的道义责任

collins.def: If you describe someone as, for example, a possible Prime Minister, you mean that they may become Prime Minister.

example.ex: Government sources are now openly speculating about a possible successor for Dr Lawrence...
example.tran: 官方消息人士在公开推测谁有可能成为接任劳伦斯博士的人选。

example.ex: Bradley has been considered a possible presidential contender himself.
example.tran: 布拉德利本人就被认为是总统职位的有力竞争者。

collins.def: The possible is everything that can be done in a situation.

example.ex: He is a democrat with the skill, nerve, and ingenuity to push the limits of the possible.
example.tran: 他是一个手腕高超、富有胆识、足智多谋的民主党人，能够让不可能的事成为可能。

collins.tran: 英镑（英国货币单位，等于100便士）；镑（埃及等国的货币单位）
collins.def: The pound is the unit of money which is used in Britain. It is represented by the symbol £. One British pound is divided into a hundred pence. Some other countries, for example Egypt, also have a unit of money called a pound .

example.ex: Beer cost three pounds a bottle...
example.tran: 啤酒每瓶3英镑。

example.ex: A thousand pounds worth of jewellery and silver has been stolen.
example.tran: 价值1,000英镑的珠宝和银饰被盗。

collins.def: The pound is used to refer to the British currency system, and sometimes to the currency systems of other countries which use pounds.

example.ex: The pound is expected to continue to increase against most other currencies.
example.tran: 英镑对大多数其他货币的汇率有望继续升高。

collins.tran: 磅（英美等一些讲英语的国家的重量单位，合0.454千克）
collins.def: A pound is a unit of weight used mainly in Britain, America, and other countries where English is spoken. One pound is equal to 0.454 kilograms. A pound of something is a quantity of it that weighs one pound.

example.ex: Her weight was under ninety pounds.
example.tran: 她的体重不足90磅。

example.ex: ...a pound of cheese.
example.tran: 一磅奶酪

collins.def: A pound is a place where dogs and cats found wandering in the street are taken and kept until they are claimed by their owners.
A pound is a place where cars that have been parked illegally are taken by the police and kept until they have been claimed by their owners.

collins.tran: 用力击打；连续砰砰地猛击
collins.def: If you pound something or pound on it, you hit it with great force, usually loudly and repeatedly.

example.ex: He pounded the table with his fist...
example.tran: 他用拳头猛击桌子。

example.ex: Somebody began pounding on the front door...
example.tran: 有人开始不停地猛敲前门。

collins.def: If you pound something, you crush it into a paste or a powder or into very small pieces.

example.ex: She paused as she pounded the maize grains.
example.tran: 她捣玉米粒时停了一下。

collins.tran: （常因恐惧而心脏）剧烈跳动，怦怦地跳
collins.def: If your heart is pounding, it is beating with an unusually strong and fast rhythm, usually because you are afraid.

example.ex: I'm sweating, my heart is pounding. I can't breathe.
example.tran: 我浑身冒汗，心脏狂跳，呼吸困难。

collins.tran: （不顾别人痛苦而坚决要求的）应得的东西
collins.def: If you say that someone demands their pound of flesh, you mean that they insist on getting something they are entitled to, even though it may cause distress to the person it is demanded from.

example.ex: Banks are quick to demand their pound of flesh when overdrafts run a little over the limit.
example.tran: 透支稍微超出限额时，银行便会很快要求归还欠款。

collins.def: If someone has power, they have a lot of control over people and activities.

example.ex: She interviewed six women who have reached positions of great power and influence...
example.tran: 她采访了6名身居高位，并且颇具影响力的女士。

example.ex: In a democracy, power must be divided.
example.tran: 在民主政体中，权力必须分制。

collins.def: Your power to do something is your ability to do it.

example.ex: Human societies have the power to solve the problems confronting them...
example.tran: 人类社会有能力解决面临的问题。

example.ex: Fathers have the power to dominate children and young people...
example.tran: 父辈们有能力支配孩子们和年轻人的生活。

collins.def: If it is in or within your power to do something, you are able to do it or you have the resources to deal with it.

example.ex: Your debt situation is only temporary, and it is within your power to resolve it...
example.tran: 你的债务情况只是暂时的，你有能力解决好。

example.ex: Although it is not in his power to do so, he said he would rebuild the Air Base...
example.tran: 虽然这超出了他的能力范围，他还是说他会重建空军基地。

collins.tran: （法律赋予当权者的）权力，权限，职权
collins.def: If someone in authority has the power to do something, they have the legal right to do it.

example.ex: The Prime Minister has the power to dismiss and appoint senior ministers...
example.tran: 首相有权任免高级部长。

example.ex: The police have the power of arrest...
example.tran: 警方有权拘捕。

collins.def: If people take power or come to power, they take charge of a country's affairs. If a group of people are in power, they are in charge of a country's affairs.

example.ex: In 1964 Labour came into power...
example.tran: 工党于1964年上台。

example.ex: He first assumed power in 1970...
example.tran: 他于1970年首次执政。

collins.def: You can use power to refer to a country that is very rich or important, or has strong military forces.

example.ex: In Western eyes, Iraq is a major power in an area of great strategic importance.
example.tran: 在西方人眼里，伊拉克是位于具有重要战略意义的地区的一个重要强国。

example.ex: ...the emergence of the new major economic power, Japan.
example.tran: 新兴重要经济强国日本的崛起

collins.def: The power of something is the ability that it has to move or affect things.

example.ex: The Roadrunner had better power, better tyres, and better brakes.
example.tran: “路行者”汽车的性能、轮胎和刹车都更好。

example.ex: ...massive computing power.
example.tran: 强大的计算能力

collins.def: Power is energy, especially electricity, that is obtained in large quantities from a fuel source and used to operate lights, heating, and machinery.

example.ex: Nuclear power is cleaner than coal...
example.tran: 核能比煤清洁。

example.ex: Power has been restored to most parts that were hit last night by high winds...
example.tran: 大部分昨晚遭大风袭击的地区已恢复供电。

collins.def: The device or fuel that powers a machine provides the energy that the machine needs in order to work.

example.ex: The 'flywheel' battery, it is said, could  power an electric car for 600 miles on a single charge...
example.tran: 据说“飞轮”电池充电一次就能驱动电动汽车行驶600英里。

example.ex: The planes are powered by Rolls Royce engines.
example.tran: 这些飞机由劳斯莱斯公司制造的发动机提供动力。

collins.def: Power tools are operated by electricity.

example.ex: ...large power tools, such as chainsaws.
example.tran: 大型电动工具，如链锯

example.ex: ...a power drill.
example.tran: 电钻

collins.def: In mathematics, power is used in expressions such as 2 to the power of 4 or 2 to the 4th power to indicate that 2 must be multiplied by itself 4 times. This is written in numbers as 24, or 2 x 2 x 2 x 2, which equals 16.

example.ex: Any number to the power of nought is equal to one.
example.tran: 任何数的0次方等于1。

collins.tran: 当权者，当局（尤指对其不赞同或不能理解其言行）
collins.def: You can refer to people in authority as the powers that be, especially when you want to say that you disagree with them or do not understand what they say or do.

example.ex: The powers that be, in this case the independent Television Association, banned the advertisement altogether...
example.tran: 掌权的，在这件事中即独立的电视协会，干脆禁播了那则电视广告。

example.ex: The powers that be may keep us from building a house just where we want to.
example.tran: 当局可能会阻止我们随意建房屋。

collins.def: The president of a country that has no king or queen is the person who is the head of state of that country.

example.ex: ...President Mubarak...
example.tran: 穆巴拉克总统

example.ex: The White House says the president would veto the bill.
example.tran: 白宫称总统将否决这项议案。

collins.tran: 院长；校长；会长；总裁；董事长
collins.def: The president of an organization is the person who has the highest position in it.

example.ex: Research and marketing operations will be Mr. Furlaud's job as president of the new company.
example.tran: 作为新公司的总裁，弗劳德先生将负责调研和市场运作。

example.ex: ...Alexandre de Merode, the president of the medical commission.
example.tran: 药物委员会主席亚历山大·德梅罗德

collins.def: If you press something somewhere, you push it firmly against something else.

example.ex: He pressed his back against the door...
example.tran: 他后背紧紧靠在门上。

example.ex: They pressed the silver knife into the cake.
example.tran: 他们拿银制餐刀切入蛋糕。

collins.def: If you press a button or switch, you push it with your finger in order to make a machine or device work.

example.ex: Drago pressed a button and the door closed...
example.tran: 德拉戈按了一个按钮，然后门就关上了。

example.ex: There was no-one at the reception desk, so he pressed a bell for service.
example.tran: 接待处一个人也没有，于是他按了服务铃。

collins.tran: 用力按；用力挤压；用力踩
collins.def: If you press something or press down on it, you push hard against it with your foot or hand.

example.ex: The engine stalled. He pressed the accelerator hard...
example.tran: 发动机熄火了。他用力踩油门。

example.ex: She stood up and leaned forward with her hands pressing down on the desk.
example.tran: 她站起来，双手撑在桌子上，身体向前倾。

collins.def: If you press for something, you try hard to persuade someone to give it to you or to agree to it.

example.ex: Police might now press for changes in the law...
example.tran: 警方现在可能竭力要求修改法律。

example.ex: They had pressed for their children to be taught French.
example.tran: 他们极力要求给他们的孩子教授法语。

collins.def: If you press someone, you try hard to persuade them to do something.

example.ex: Trade unions are pressing him to stand firm...
example.tran: 各工会正在竭力劝说他坚定立场。

example.ex: Mr King seems certain to be pressed for further details...
example.tran: 看来人们一定会竭力要求金先生提供进一步的细节。

collins.def: If someone presses their claim, demand, or point, they state it in a very forceful way.

example.ex: The protest campaign has used mass strikes and demonstrations to press its demands...
example.tran: 抗议活动通过大规模罢工和示威游行来向当局提出诉求。

example.ex: His officials have visited Washington to press their case for economic aid.
example.tran: 他的官员们已经访问了华盛顿，竭力要求得到经济援助。

collins.def: If an unpleasant feeling or worry presses on you, it affects you very much or you are always thinking about it.

example.ex: The weight of irrational guilt pressed on her...
example.tran: 无端的负罪感压得她喘不过气来。

example.ex: Right now, I've got other problems that are pressing on me.
example.tran: 现在又有其他一些问题困扰着我。

collins.def: If you press something on someone, you give it to them and insist that they take it.

example.ex: All I had was money, which I pressed on her reluctant mother...
example.tran: 我就只有钱了，她母亲虽然不愿接受，我还是硬塞给了她。

example.ex: Food and cigarettes were pressed on him.
example.tran: 别人硬塞给他一些食品和香烟。

collins.def: If you press clothes, you iron them in order to get rid of the creases.

example.ex: Vera pressed his shirt...
example.tran: 薇拉把他的衬衫熨平了。

example.ex: There's a couple of dresses to be pressed.
example.tran: 还有几件衣服要熨。

collins.tran: 榨取，压榨，挤压（水果或蔬菜）
collins.def: If you press fruits or vegetables, you squeeze them or crush them, usually in order to extract the juice.

example.ex: The grapes are hand-picked and pressed...
example.tran: 这些葡萄是精心挑选用来榨汁的。

example.ex: I pressed the juice of half a lemon into a glass of water.
example.tran: 我用手将半个柠檬的汁挤入一杯水中。

collins.def: Newspapers are referred to as the press .

example.ex: Today the British press is full of articles on India's new prime minister...
example.tran: 今天英国的报纸上登满了关于印度新任总理的文章。

example.ex: ...freedom of the Press...
example.tran: 新闻自由

collins.def: Journalists are referred to as the press .

example.ex: Christie looked relaxed and calm as he faced the press afterwards...
example.tran: 后来面对记者的时候，克里斯蒂显得放松而镇静。

example.ex: A meeting was promised, but the Press was not admitted.
example.tran: 承诺将召开一次会议，但是不允许记者到场。

collins.def: A press or a printing press is a machine used for printing things such as books and newspapers.

example.ex: ...the invention of the printing press...
example.tran: 印刷机的发明

example.ex: He was writing the book up to the moment the presses rolled.
example.tran: 直到付梓的那一刻他才完稿。

collins.tran: （尤指在报纸、电视或广播上）受到批评/得到好评
collins.def: If someone or something gets a bad press, they are criticized, especially in the newspapers, on television, or on radio. If they get a good press, they are praised.

example.ex: ...the bad press that career women consistently get in this country...
example.tran: 该国职业女性一直受到的舆论上的苛评

example.ex: Men get more bad press in her new novel.
example.tran: 在她的新小说中，男人受到了更多的谴责。

collins.def: If you press charges against someone, you make an official accusation against them which has to be decided in a court of law.

example.ex: I could have pressed charges against him...
example.tran: 我本可以起诉他。

example.ex: Police have announced they will not be pressing charges.
example.tran: 警方已宣布不会提起诉讼。

collins.def: When a newspaper or magazine goes to press, it starts being printed.

example.ex: We check prices at the time of going to press...
example.tran: 我们会在付印的时候核对价格。

example.ex: As this column went to press, I learnt that the man had died.
example.tran: 当这个专栏开印的时候，我才知道那个人已经死了。

collins.def: To press someone or something into service means to use them temporarily for a particular purpose.

example.ex: The local bar has been pressed into service as a school...
example.tran: 当地的酒吧被暂时用作学校。

example.ex: Kenny had been pressed into service to guard the door.
example.tran: 肯尼被临时雇来看门。

means: 气压（或血压）（的缩略形式）

collins.def: Pressure is force that you produce when you press hard on something.

example.ex: She kicked at the door with her foot, and the pressure was enough to open it...
example.tran: 她用脚踢门，力气之大足以把门踹开。

example.ex: The pressure of his fingers had relaxed...
example.tran: 他手指按压的力道减轻了。

collins.def: The pressure in a place or container is the force produced by the quantity of gas or liquid in that place or container.

example.ex: The window in the cockpit had blown in and the pressure dropped dramatically...
example.tran: 驾驶舱的窗户突然向内破裂，气压急剧降低。

example.ex: Warm air is now being drawn in from another high pressure area over the North Sea.
example.tran: 暖气流正从北海上空的另一个高气压带移动过来。

collins.def: If there is pressure on a person, someone is trying to persuade or force them to do something.

example.ex: He may have put pressure on her to agree...
example.tran: 他可能向她施加了压力，迫使她同意。

example.ex: Its government is under pressure from the European Commission...
example.tran: 其政府承受着来自欧盟委员会的压力。

collins.def: If you are experiencing pressure, you feel that you must do a lot of tasks or make a lot of decisions in very little time, or that people expect a lot from you.

example.ex: Can you work under pressure?...
example.tran: 你能在压力下工作吗？

example.ex: Even if I had the talent to play tennis I couldn't stand the pressure...
example.tran: 即使我有打网球的天赋，我也无法承受这种压力。

collins.def: If you pressure someone to do something, you try forcefully to persuade them to do it.

example.ex: He will never pressure you to get married...
example.tran: 他永远不会强迫你结婚。

example.ex: The Government should not be pressured into making hasty decisions...
example.tran: 政府不应该迫于压力仓促作出决定。

collins.def: The price of something is the amount of money that you have to pay in order to buy it.

example.ex: ...a sharp increase in the price of petrol...
example.tran: 汽油价格猛涨

example.ex: They expected house prices to rise...
example.tran: 他们盼望着房价上升。

collins.def: The price that you pay for something that you want is an unpleasant thing that you have to do or suffer in order to get it.

example.ex: Slovenia will have to pay a high price for independence...
example.tran: 斯洛文尼亚将为独立付出巨大的代价。

example.ex: There may be a price to pay for such relentless activity, perhaps ill health or even divorce...
example.tran: 这样没命地工作可能要付出代价，也许是健康受损，甚至是离婚。

collins.def: If something is priced at a particular amount, the price is set at that amount.

example.ex: The shares are expected to be priced at about 330p...
example.tran: 这些股票的价格可能会定在330便士左右。

example.ex: Digital priced the new line at less than half the cost of comparable mainframes...
example.tran: Digital公司新产品的定价比同类主机的一半还要低。

collins.tran: 不惜任何代价；不计后果
collins.def: If you want something at any price, you are determined to get it, even if unpleasant things happen as a result.

example.ex: If they wanted a deal at any price, they would have to face the consequences...
example.tran: 如果他们无论如何都想达成交易，他们就得承担其后果。

example.ex: We obviously want to see the hostages home, but not at any price.
example.tran: 我们显然也希望看到人质回家，但并不是不惜任何代价。

collins.def: If you can buy something that you want at a price, it is for sale, but it is extremely expensive.

example.ex: Most goods are available, but at a price.
example.tran: 大多数商品都有售，但是价格极高。

collins.def: If you get something that you want at a price, you get it but something unpleasant happens as a result.

example.ex: Fame comes at a price...
example.tran: 出名是有代价的。

example.ex: Theismann's precious information came at a price, however.
example.tran: 不过，泰斯曼付出了代价才得到这些宝贵的信息。

collins.def: If there is a price on someone's head, an amount of money has been offered for the capture or killing of that person.

example.ex: He remains at large despite the high price put on his head by the authorities.
example.tran: 尽管当局悬赏重金缉拿他，他仍旧逍遥法外。

collins.def: If you say that you cannot put a price on something, you mean that it is very valuable.

example.ex: You can't put a price on friendship...
example.tran: 友谊无价。

example.ex: You can't put a price on the value of the work done by our nurses.
example.tran: 不能用金钱来衡量护士的工作。

collins.def: You use what price in front of a word or expression that refers to something happening when you want to ask how likely it is to happen. You usually do this to emphasize either that it is very likely or very unlikely.

example.ex: What price a glorious repeat of last week's triumph?
example.tran: 还有可能再次上演上周的辉煌胜利吗？

collins.def: You use 'at what price ?' to comment on the fact that the consequences of doing something are unpleasant.

example.ex: Yes, they are free of him, but at what price to themselves, their families, those left behind?...
example.tran: 是的，他们离开了他，但是对他们自己、他们的家人以及那些留下来的人又有什么用呢？

example.ex: What price success!
example.tran: 成功了又如何？

collins.def: The leader of the government in some countries is called the Prime Minister .

example.ex: ...the former Prime Minister of Pakistan, Miss Benazir Bhutto...
example.tran: 巴基斯坦前总理贝娜齐尔·布托女士

example.ex: This had been a disastrous week for Prime Minister Major.
example.tran: 这对于梅杰首相来说是灾难性的一周。

collins.def: If you say that something is probably the case, you think that it is likely to be the case, although you are not sure.

example.ex: The White House probably won't make this plan public until July...
example.tran: 白宫可能要等到7月份才会公开这个计划。

example.ex: Van Gogh is probably the best-known painter in the world.
example.tran: 凡·高可能是世界上最知名的画家。

collins.tran: （用于缓和语气）大概，或许，可能
collins.def: You can use probably when you want to make your opinion sound less forceful or definite, so that you do not offend people.

example.ex: He probably thinks you're both crazy!
example.tran: 他可能认为你们两个人都疯了！

collins.def: A problem is a situation that is unsatisfactory and causes difficulties for people.

example.ex: ...the economic problems of the inner city...
example.tran: 内城区的经济问题

example.ex: The main problem is unemployment...
example.tran: 主要的问题是失业。

collins.tran: （通过逻辑思考或数学运算解决的）问题，习题，题
collins.def: A problem is a puzzle that requires logical thought or mathematics to solve it.

example.ex: With mathematical problems, you can save time by approximating.
example.tran: 对于数学题，可以用取近似值的办法节约时间。

collins.tran: （儿童或家庭）有严重问题的，引起严重问题的
collins.def: Problem children or problem families have serious problems or cause serious problems for other people.

example.ex: In some cases a problem child is placed in a special school...
example.tran: 有时，问题儿童被放在特殊的学校。

example.ex: She is afraid to contact the social services in case they are labelled a problem family.
example.tran: 她不敢联系社会服务部门，以免被当作问题家庭。

collins.def: You say 'no problem' to show that you are willing to do what you have been asked.

example.ex: 'Can you repair it?' — 'No problem'...
