example.tran: “你能修好它吗？”——“没问题。”

example.ex: If the property needs a new dishwasher, no problem, just put it on a credit card.
example.tran: 如果住所需要一个新的洗碗机，没问题，用信用卡买一个就可以了。

collins.def: You say 'no problem' to let someone know that you do not mind them doing something they have said they are going to do.

example.ex: 'I ought to think about going actually. If that's all right with you.' — 'Yeah. No problem.'...
example.tran: “事实上，我应该考虑去，如果你不介意的话。”——“嗯，没关系。”

example.ex: If they don't want to speak to me, fine. No problem.
example.tran: 如果他们不想和我讲话，好的。我不介意。

means: 经过特殊加工（或处理）的

collins.def: A process is a series of actions which are carried out in order to achieve a particular result.

example.ex: There was total agreement to start the peace process as soon as possible...
example.tran: 全体一致同意尽快开始和平进程。

example.ex: They decided to spread the building process over three years...
example.tran: 他们决定用3年时间建成。

collins.def: A process is a series of things which happen naturally and result in a biological or chemical change.

example.ex: It occurs in elderly men, apparently as part of the ageing process...
example.tran: 这种情况出现在老年人当中，显然是衰老过程的一部分。

example.ex: The regularity with which this occurs suggests that the process is genetically determined.
example.tran: 这种现象出现的规律性表明这个过程是由基因决定的。

collins.def: When raw materials or foods are processed, they are prepared in factories before they are used or sold.

example.ex: ...fish which are processed by freezing, canning or smoking...
example.tran: 经过冷冻、罐装或熏制处理的鱼

example.ex: The material will be processed into plastic pellets.
example.tran: 这些材料将会被加工成塑料小球。

collins.def: When people process information, they put it through a system or into a computer in order to deal with it.

example.ex: ...facilities to process the data, and the right to publish the results...
example.tran: 处理数据的设备和公开其结果的权利

example.ex: The information gathered by the telescopes will be processed by computers.
example.tran: 通过望远镜获得的信息将由计算机进行处理。

collins.tran: 审核；审议；检查；使接受处理
collins.def: When people are processed by officials, their case is dealt with in stages and they pass from one stage of the process to the next.

example.ex: Patients took more than two hours to be processed through the department.
example.tran: 病人在这个科看病需要两个多小时的时间。

collins.def: If you are in the process of doing something, you have started to do it and are still doing it.

example.ex: The administration is in the process of drawing up a peace plan...
example.tran: 政府正在起草和平计划。

example.ex: Her novel is in the process of being turned into a television series.
example.tran: 她的小说正被拍成电视连续剧。

collins.def: If you are doing something and you do something else in the process, you do the second thing as part of doing the first thing.

example.ex: He finished ahead of the Spaniard, and in the process picked up his first time trial win as a pro...
example.tran: 他领先那个西班牙人到达终点，同时也首次作为职业选手获得计时赛的胜利。

example.ex: You have to let us struggle for ourselves, even if we must die in the process.
example.tran: 你得让我们为自己拼搏，哪怕我们会在这个过程中死去。

collins.def: To produce something means to cause it to happen.

example.ex: The drug is known to produce side-effects in women...
example.tran: 据悉，这种药会对女性产生副作用。

example.ex: Talks aimed at producing a new world trade treaty have been under way for six years.
example.tran: 旨在制定出一个新的世界贸易条约的谈判已经进行了6年。

collins.def: If you produce something, you make or create it.

example.ex: The company produced circuitry for communications systems...
example.tran: 该公司为通信系统生产电路。

example.ex: I'm quite pleased that we do have the capacity to produce that much food.
example.tran: 我很高兴我们确实有能力生产这么多粮食。

collins.def: When things or people produce something, it comes from them or slowly forms from them, especially as the result of a biological or chemical process.

example.ex: These plants are then pollinated and allowed to mature and produce seed.
example.tran: 然后，这些植物就被授粉，从而成熟结籽。

example.ex: ...gases produced by burning coal and oil.
example.tran: 煤和油燃烧时产生的气体

collins.def: If you produce evidence or an argument, you show it or explain it to people in order to make them agree with you.

example.ex: They challenged him to produce evidence to support his allegations...
example.tran: 他们要他拿出证据证明自己的主张。

example.ex: Scientists have produced powerful arguments against his ideas.
example.tran: 科学家们提出了有力论据反驳他的观点。

collins.def: If you produce an object from somewhere, you show it or bring it out so that it can be seen.

example.ex: To hire a car you must produce a passport and a current driving licence...
example.tran: 租车必须出示护照和有效驾驶执照。

example.ex: She produced the knife during arguments with her friends.
example.tran: 在和朋友争吵的时候，她掏出了刀。

collins.tran: 上演（戏剧）；制作（电影、电视节目）；灌制（唱片）
collins.def: If someone produces something such as a film, a magazine, or a CD, they organize it and decide how it should be done.

example.ex: He has produced his own sports magazine called Yes Sport...
example.tran: 他推出了自己的体育杂志，叫做《是的，体育》。

example.ex: He produced 'A Chorus Line', Broadway's longest running show.
example.tran: 他制作推出了《歌舞线上》这一百老汇经久不衰的剧目。

collins.def: Produce is food or other things that are grown in large quantities to be sold.

example.ex: We manage to get most of our produce in Britain...
example.tran: 我们设法在英国搞到我们所需的大部分农产品。

example.ex: Winter produce will cost more for the next few weeks.
example.tran: 在未来几周，冬季农产品会更贵。

collins.def: A product is something that is produced and sold in large quantities, often as a result of a manufacturing process.

example.ex: Try to get the best product at the lowest price...
example.tran: 尽量以最低的价格买到最好的产品。

example.ex: South Korea's imports of consumer products jumped 33% in this year.
example.tran: 今年，韩国消费产品的进口激增了33%。

collins.def: If you say that someone or something is a product of a situation or process, you mean that the situation or process has had a significant effect in making them what they are.

example.ex: We are all products of our time...
example.tran: 我们都是这个时代的产物。

example.ex: The bank is the product of a 1971 merger of two Japanese banks.
example.tran: 这家银行是由两家日本银行于1971年合并而成。

collins.def: A programme of actions or events is a series of actions or events that are planned to be done.

example.ex: The general argued that the nuclear programme should still continue...
example.tran: 将军认为核计划应该继续进行。

example.ex: The programme of sell-offs has been implemented by the new chief executive.
example.tran: 新任总裁已经执行了抛售方案。

collins.def: A television or radio programme is something that is broadcast on television or radio.

example.ex: ...a series of TV programmes on global environment.
example.tran: 有关全球环境的一系列电视节目

example.ex: ...local news programmes.
example.tran: 地方新闻节目

collins.def: A theatre or concert programme is a small book or sheet of paper which gives information about the play or concert you are attending.

collins.tran: 为（机器或系统）设定程序
collins.def: When you programme a machine or system, you set its controls so that it will work in a particular way.

example.ex: Parents can programme the machine not to turn on at certain times.
example.tran: 父母可以设定这台机器的程序，使它在特定时间段无法开启。

collins.def: If a living creature is programmed to behave in a particular way, they are likely to behave in that way because of social or biological factors that they cannot control.

example.ex: We are all genetically programmed to develop certain illnesses.
example.tran: 基因决定了我们都会患上某些疾病。

collins.def: If you provide something that someone needs or wants, or if you provide them with it, you give it to them or make it available to them.

example.ex: I'll be glad to provide a copy of this...
example.tran: 我很愿意提供它的一个副本。

example.ex: They would not provide any details...
example.tran: 他们不愿提供任何细节。

collins.def: If a law or agreement provides that something will happen, it states that it will happen.

example.ex: The treaty provides that, by the end of the century, the United States must have removed its bases...
example.tran: 条约规定，到本世纪末，美国必须撤除其基地。

example.ex: The Act provides that only the parents of a child have a responsibility for that child's financial support.
example.tran: 法令规定只有孩子的父母才有责任为孩子提供经济支持。

collins.def: You can refer to people in general, or to all the people in a particular country or community, as the public .

example.ex: Lauderdale House is now open to the public...
example.tran: 劳德代尔艺术教育中心现已向公众开放。

example.ex: Pure alcohol is not for sale to the general public...
example.tran: 纯酒精不向大众出售。

collins.tran: 志趣相投（或从事同一类活动、具有共同特征）的群体
collins.def: You can refer to a set of people in a country who share a common interest, activity, or characteristic as a particular kind of public .

example.ex: Market research showed that 93% of the viewing public wanted a hit film channel.
example.tran: 市场调查表明93%的观众希望有一个播放热门影片的频道。

example.ex: ...the American voting public.
example.tran: 美国选民

collins.def: Public means relating to all the people in a country or community.

example.ex: The President is attempting to drum up public support for his economic program.
example.tran: 总统正竭力争取公众对他的经济计划予以支持。

collins.tran: 政府的；国家的；公共事务的
collins.def: Public means relating to the government or state, or things that are done for the people by the state.

example.ex: The social services account for a substantial part of public spending.
example.tran: 社会福利事业占了一大部分的公共支出。

collins.def: Public buildings and services are provided for everyone to use.

example.ex: ...the New York Public Library...
example.tran: 纽约公立图书馆

example.ex: The new museum must be accessible by public transport.
example.tran: 新博物馆必须能乘坐公共交通工具到达。

collins.def: A public place is one where people can go about freely and where you can easily be seen and heard.

example.ex: ...the heavily congested public areas of international airports...
example.tran: 国际机场人潮涌动的公共场所

example.ex: I avoid working in places which are too public.
example.tran: 我避免在过于抛头露面的地方工作。

collins.def: If someone is a public figure or in public life, many people know who they are because they are often mentioned in newspapers and on television.

example.ex: The Archbishop of Canterbury yesterday hit out at public figures who commit adultery...
example.tran: 昨天坎特伯雷大主教严厉抨击了几位与人通奸的公众人物。

example.ex: I'd like to see more women in public life, especially Parliament.
example.tran: 我希望看到更多女性参与公众事务，尤其是能在议会中工作。

collins.tran: （声明、事件等）公开的，公之于众的
collins.def: Public is used to describe statements, actions, and events that are made or done in such a way that any member of the public can see them or be aware of them.

example.ex: The National Heritage Committee has conducted a public inquiry to find the answer...
example.tran: 国家遗产委员会进行了公开调查以寻找答案。

example.ex: The comments were the ministry's first detailed public statement on the subject...
example.tran: 这些评论是该部委第一次就此事所作的详细公开声明。

collins.tran: 公之于众的；公开的；人人皆知的
collins.def: If a fact is made public or becomes public, it becomes known to everyone rather than being kept secret.

example.ex: Blair wants any new evidence on IRA pub bombs made public...
example.tran: 布莱尔希望将任何关于爱尔兰共和军制造的酒馆爆炸事件的新证据都公之于众。

example.ex: The facts could cause embarrassment if they ever became public.
example.tran: 一旦披露出去，真相会让人非常尴尬。

collins.tran: 出现在公众视线中；为公众熟知的；广为人知
collins.def: If someone is in the public eye,  many people know who they are, because they are famous or because they are often mentioned on television or in the newspapers.

example.ex: One expects people in the public eye to conduct their personal lives with a certain decorum...
example.tran: 人们期望公众人物的私生活能检点些。

example.ex: He has kept his wife and daughter out of the public eye.
example.tran: 他一直让妻子和女儿远离公众视线。

collins.def: If a company goes public, it starts selling its shares on the stock exchange.

example.ex: In 1951 AC went public, having achieved an average annual profit of more than £50,000.
example.tran: AC公司于1951年上市，当时平均年利润为5万多英镑。

collins.def: If you say or do something in public, you say or do it when a group of people are present.

example.ex: Bylaws are to make it illegal to smoke in public.
example.tran: 地方法规将规定在公共场合抽烟为非法。

collins.def: When you put something in a particular place or position, you move it into that place or position.

example.ex: Leaphorn put the photograph on the desk...
example.tran: 利普霍恩把照片放在书桌上。

example.ex: She hesitated, then put her hand on Grace's arm...
example.tran: 她犹豫了一下，然后把手放到格雷斯的胳膊上。

collins.def: If you put someone somewhere, you cause them to go there and to stay there for a period of time.

example.ex: Rather than put him in the hospital, she had been caring for him at home...
example.tran: 她没有让他住在医院，而是一直在家里照顾他。

example.ex: I'd put the children to bed.
example.tran: 我会安顿孩子们上床睡觉。

collins.tran: 使处于特定状态（或境地）
collins.def: To put someone or something in a particular state or situation means to cause them to be in that state or situation.

example.ex: This is going to put them out of business...
example.tran: 这将会使他们破产。

example.ex: He was putting himself at risk...
example.tran: 他在使自己处于危险的境地。

collins.def: To put something on people or things means to cause them to have it, or to cause them to be affected by it.

example.ex: The ruling will put extra pressure on health authorities to change working practices and shorten hours...
example.tran: 该判决将给卫生部门施加更多的压力促使其改变工作惯例，缩短工作时间。

example.ex: Be aware of the terrible strain it can put on a child when you expect the best reports...
example.tran: 在期待孩子能取得最好成绩时，要当心这会给他们带来可怕的压力。

collins.def: If you put your trust, faith, or confidence in someone or something, you trust them or have faith or confidence in them.

example.ex: He had decided long ago that he would put his trust in socialism when the time came...
example.tran: 很久以前他就决定时机成熟时会寄希望于社会主义。

example.ex: How much faith should we put in anti-ageing products?
example.tran: 我们对抗衰老产品应该抱有多少信心？

collins.tran: 投入，花费（时间、体力或精力）
collins.def: If you put time, strength, or energy into an activity, you use it in doing that activity.

example.ex: We're not saying that activists should put all their effort and time into party politics...
example.tran: 我们并不是说活动家应该把所有的精力和时间都用到政党政治上。

example.ex: Eleanor did not put much energy into the discussion.
example.tran: 埃莉诺没有为这次讨论花费太多精力。

collins.def: If you put money into a business or project, you invest money in it.

example.ex: Investors should consider putting some money into an annuity...
example.tran: 投资者们应当考虑存一些年金。

example.ex: Put $10,000 into this investment and in 10 years, you'll have almost $18,000.
example.tran: 在这项投资上投入1万美元，10年后就会得到近18,000美元。

collins.def: When you put an idea or remark in a particular way, you express it in that way. You can use expressions like to put it simply and to put it bluntly before saying something when you want to explain how you are going to express it.

example.ex: I had already met Pete a couple of times through — how should I put it — friends in low places...
example.tran: 我已经见过皮特几次了，是通过——怎么说呢——一些社会下层的朋友见的。

example.ex: He doesn't, to put it very bluntly, give a damn about the woman or the baby...
example.tran: 直白地说，他根本不在乎那个女人和那个小孩。

collins.def: When you put a question to someone, you ask them the question.

example.ex: Is this fair? Well, I put that question today to Deputy Counsel Craig Gillen...
example.tran: 这公平吗？我今天向副顾问克雷格·吉伦提出这个问题。

example.ex: He thinks that some workers may be afraid to put questions publicly.
example.tran: 他认为一些工人可能害怕公开提问。

collins.tran: 对（事件）作出说明；提出（意见、建议）
collins.def: If you put a case, opinion, or proposal, you explain it and list the reasons why you support or believe it.

example.ex: He always put his point of view with clarity and with courage...
example.tran: 他总是清楚而勇敢地提出自己的观点。

example.ex: He put the case to the Saudi Foreign Minister...
example.tran: 他把这起事件向沙特外长作了说明。

collins.def: If you put something at a particular value or in a particular category, you consider that it has that value or that it belongs in that category.

example.ex: I would put her age at about 50 or so...
example.tran: 我认为她的年龄在50岁上下。

example.ex: All the more technically advanced countries put a high value on science...
example.tran: 所有技术上较先进的国家都高度重视科学。

collins.def: If you put written information somewhere, you write, type, or print it there.

example.ex: Mary's family were so pleased that they put an announcement in the local paper to thank them...
example.tran: 玛丽的家人很高兴，就在当地的报纸上登了一则启事来感谢他们。

example.ex: I think what I put in that book is now pretty much the agenda for this country...
example.tran: 我认为我在书中写的正是目前该国亟待解决的问题。

collins.def: If someone puts one over on you, they make you do or believe something by telling you things that are not true.

example.ex: He considered himself a crafty man — a man would have to get up very early in the morning to put one over on Alf Tandy.
example.tran: 他觉得自己太狡猾了——为了愚弄一下阿尔夫·坦迪通常得早上很早起床。

collins.def: If you put it to someone that something is true, you suggest that it is true, especially when you think that they will be unwilling to admit this.

example.ex: But I put it to you that they're useless...
example.tran: 但是我告诉你它们是没用的。

example.ex: I put this to Kenyon. 'Absolutely untrue,' he said.
example.tran: 我向凯尼恩指出了这一点。他说：“绝对不是真的。”

collins.def: If you say that something is bigger or better than several other things put together, you mean that it is bigger or has more good qualities than all of those other things if they are added together.

example.ex: London has more pubs and clubs than the rest of the country put together.
example.tran: 伦敦的酒馆和俱乐部比英国其他地区所有的加在一起还要多。

collins.tran: （表示同意、祝贺等的用语）握个手吧
collins.def: You say 'Put it there!' to someone when you are asking them to shake hands with you, because you agree with them or want to congratulate them.

example.ex: Put it there, Pal, put it there!
example.tran: 握个手，老弟，祝贺你！

means: 对（某事物）表示[感到]怀疑

collins.def: A question is something that you say or write in order to ask a person about something.

example.ex: They asked a great many questions about England...
example.tran: 他们问了一大堆有关英格兰的问题。

example.ex: The President refused to answer further questions on the subject...
example.tran: 总统拒绝就这个话题再回答问题。

collins.def: If you question someone, you ask them a lot of questions about something.

example.ex: This led the therapist to question Jim about his parents and their marriage...
example.tran: 这让治疗专家问起了吉姆有关他父母及他们婚姻的情况。

example.ex: A man is being questioned by police in connection with an attack on a disabled woman.
example.tran: 警方正在询问一名涉嫌袭击一位残疾女性的男子。

collins.def: If you question something, you have or express doubts about whether it is true, reasonable, or worthwhile.

example.ex: It never occurs to them to question the doctor's decisions...
example.tran: 他们从未想过要怀疑医生的决定。

example.ex: Weber is challenging his audience to question their own beliefs.
example.tran: 韦伯正要求观众们反思质疑各自的信仰。

collins.def: If you say that there is some question about something, you mean that there is doubt or uncertainty about it. If something is in question or has been called into question, doubt or uncertainty has been expressed about it.

example.ex: There's no question about their success...
example.tran: 他们一定会成功。

example.ex: There's some question as to whether he will sign this resolution...
example.tran: 他是否会签署这项决议还不能确定。

collins.def: A question is a problem, matter, or point which needs to be considered.

example.ex: But the whole question of aid is a tricky political one...
example.tran: 但是整个援助问题是个非常复杂的政治问题。

example.ex: That decision raised questions about the secretary of state's powers and the fairness of his procedure.
example.tran: 那个决定引起人们对国务卿的权力及其做法的公平性的质疑。

collins.def: The questions in an examination are the problems which are set in order to test your knowledge or ability.

example.ex: He'd heard somewhere that the questions in economics examination papers stayed the same from year to year...
example.tran: 他从某处听说经济学考试的考题年年都一样。

example.ex: That question did come up in the examination.
example.tran: 那道题确实在考试中出现了。

collins.tran: 问得好，问得真有水平(用于问题难以回答、不便回答或不知道答案时)
collins.def: If you say 'Good question' in reply to a question, you mean that it is a difficult question to answer, or perhaps that you are embarrassed about the answer or do not know the answer.

example.ex: 'Why didn't you appoint Ron twelve months ago?'—'Good question.'
example.tran: “你为什么12个月前不任命罗恩呢？”——“问得好。”

collins.tran: 被提及的;讨论中的;相关的
collins.def: The person, thing, or time in question is one which you have just been talking about or which is relevant.

example.ex: The player in question is Mark Williams...
example.tran: 我们所说的那个选手是马克·威廉斯。

example.ex: Add up all the income you've received over the period in question.
example.tran: 把那个时期里你拿到的所有收入加在一起。

collins.tran: 不可能;办不到;无法接受
collins.def: If you say that something is out of the question, you are emphasizing that it is completely impossible or unacceptable.

example.ex: For the homeless, private medical care is simply out of the question...
example.tran: 对于无家可归的人而言，私人医疗纯粹是天方夜谭。

example.ex: Is a tax increase still out of the question?
example.tran: 增加税收仍然是不可能的事吗？

collins.def: If you pop the question, you ask someone to marry you.

example.ex: Stuart got serious quickly and popped the question six months later.
example.tran: 斯图尔特很快认真起来，6个月之后便求婚了。

collins.def: If you say there is no question of something happening, you are emphasizing that it is not going to happen.

example.ex: As far as he was concerned there was no question of betraying his own comrades...
example.tran: 就他而言，背叛自己的同志是不可能的。

example.ex: There is no question of the taxpayer picking up the bill for the party.
example.tran: 要纳税人为该党买单是不可能的。

collins.tran: 毫无疑问地;毫无异议地
collins.def: If you do something without question, you do it without arguing or asking why it is necessary.

example.ex: ...military formations, carrying out without question the battle orders of superior officers.
example.tran: 毫无异议地执行上级军官的战斗命令的部队编队

collins.tran: 毫无疑问(表示强调自己的观点)
collins.def: You use without question to emphasize the opinion you are expressing.

example.ex: He was our greatest storyteller, without question.
example.tran: 毫无疑问，他是我们最会讲故事的人。

means: 感情的中枢，感觉最敏锐的地方

collins.def: Someone or something that is quick moves or does things with great speed.

example.ex: You'll have to be quick. The flight leaves in about three hours...
example.tran: 你得快点了，飞机大约3小时后起飞。

example.ex: I think I'm a reasonably quick learner...
example.tran: 我认为我是一个学东西还算快的人。

collins.tran: (quicker 有时表示“以更快的速度”，quickest表示“以最快的速度”，quick有时表示“以很快的速度”，但有些人认为这种用法并不规范)
collins.def: Quicker is sometimes used to mean 'at a greater speed', and quickest to mean 'at the greatest speed'. Quick is sometimes used to mean 'with great speed'. Some people consider this to be non-standard.

example.ex: Warm the sugar slightly first to make it dissolve quicker...
example.tran: 先将糖稍稍加热，以使其溶解得更快些。

example.ex: Prost went quickest.
example.tran: 普罗斯特走得最快。

collins.tran: 短暂的;持续时间很短的
collins.def: Something that is quick takes or lasts only a short time.

example.ex: He took one last quick look about the room...
example.tran: 他朝房间匆匆扫了最后一眼。

example.ex: I just popped in for a quick drink...
example.tran: 我只是顺路过来小酌一杯。

collins.tran: 立刻发生的;很快发生的
collins.def: Quick means happening without delay or with very little delay.

example.ex: Officials played down any hope for a quick end to the bloodshed...
example.tran: 官员们让迅速结束这场流血冲突的希望变得渺茫起来。

example.ex: These investors feel the need to make quick profits.
example.tran: 这些投资者觉得收益必须立竿见影。

collins.tran: 迅速发生地;很快发生地
collins.def: Quick is sometimes used to mean 'with very little delay'.

example.ex: I got away as quick as I could...
example.tran: 我尽快离开了。

example.ex: Quick! John! It's Carmela. I think she's taken an overdose...
example.tran: 快来！约翰！卡梅拉出事了，我想她用药过量了。

collins.def: If you are quick to do something, you do not hesitate to do it.

example.ex: Mark says the ideas are Katie's own, and is quick to praise her talent...
example.tran: 马克说这些都是凯蒂自己的想法，并随即称赞起她的天赋来。

example.ex: Furthermore, as Gervaise was quick to point out, Mr Scully was not a detective.
example.tran: 而且，正如热尔韦斯毫不犹豫地指出来的那样，斯库利先生并不是一名侦探。

collins.tran: 性情急躁的;容易发怒的
collins.def: If someone has a quick temper, they are easily made angry.

collins.tran: 咬到了指甲肉；咬秃指甲
collins.def: If someone bites their nails to the quick, they bite off all the white part at the end of each nail.

example.ex: Her fingernails are bitten to the quick.
example.tran: 她的手指甲都被咬秃了。

collins.tran: 触及（…）痛处;极大伤害；令…伤透了心
collins.def: If something cuts you to the quick, it makes you feel very upset.

example.ex: I once heard her weeping in her bedroom, which cut me to the quick.
example.tran: 有一次，我听见她在卧室里哭泣，这深深地刺痛了我的心。

collins.def: You use quite to indicate that something is the case to a fairly great extent. Quite is less emphatic than 'very' and 'extremely'.

example.ex: I felt quite bitter about it at the time...
example.tran: 当时我对这件事感到相当怨愤。

example.ex: I was doing quite well, but I wasn't earning a lot of money...
example.tran: 我干得还算不错，可是挣的钱却不算多。

collins.def: You use quite to emphasize what you are saying.

example.ex: It is quite clear that we were firing in self defence...
example.tran: 事实很清楚，我们开枪是出于自卫。

example.ex: That's a general British failing. In the USA it's quite different...
example.tran: 那是英国人的普遍缺点。在美国，情况就大不一样了。

collins.tran: (与否定词连用，表示语气较弱或不确定)
collins.def: You use quite after a negative to make what you are saying weaker or less definite.

example.ex: Something here is not quite right...
example.tran: 这里有什么地方不太对劲。

example.ex: After treatment he was able to continue but he was never quite the same...
example.tran: 治疗之后他又可以继续下去了，可是再也恢复不到从前的状态了。

collins.tran: （用于名词词组前，表示强调）出众的，了不起的，不同寻常的
collins.def: You use quite in front of a noun group to emphasize that a person or thing is very impressive or unusual.

example.ex: 'Oh, he's quite a character,' Sean replied...
example.tran: “喔，他真是个了不起的人，”肖恩回答说。

example.ex: It's quite a city, Boston.
example.tran: 波士顿，真是一座伟大的城市。

collins.def: You can say 'quite' to express your agreement with someone.

example.ex: 'And if you buy the record it's your choice isn't it.' — 'Quite'...
example.tran: “如果你买这张唱片，那是你的选择，不是吗？”——“可不是嘛。”

example.ex: 'I won't say over the air who it is.' — 'No, quite.'
example.tran: “我不会在电话里说出那个人是谁。”——“对，的确应该这样。”

collins.def: A race is a competition to see who is the fastest, for example in running, swimming, or driving.

example.ex: The women's race was won by the American, Patti Sue Plumer.
example.tran: 女子赛跑的冠军被美国人帕蒂·休·普卢默夺得。

collins.def: If you race, you take part in a race.

example.ex: In the 10 years I raced in Europe, 30 drivers were killed...
example.tran: 在我10年的欧洲赛车生涯中，有30名车手丧生。

example.ex: They may even have raced each other — but not regularly.
example.tran: 他们甚至可能曾经相互比试过，只不过不是经常性的。

collins.def: The races are a series of horse races that are held in a particular place on a particular day. People go to watch and to bet on which horse will win.

example.ex: The high point of this trip was a day at the races.
example.tran: 此行的高潮是去看赛马会的那一天。

collins.def: A race is a situation in which people or organizations compete with each other for power or control.

example.ex: The race for the White House begins in earnest today...
example.tran: 入主白宫的角逐今天正式开始。

example.ex: The race is on to build up membership fast.
example.tran: 举办这次竞赛是为了迅速招募成员。

collins.def: A race is one of the major groups which human beings can be divided into according to their physical features, such as the colour of their skin.

example.ex: The College welcomes students of all races, faiths, and nationalities...
example.tran: 学院欢迎所有的学生，无论其种族、宗教信仰和国籍是什么。

example.ex: Discrimination by employers on the grounds of race and nationality was illegal.
example.tran: 雇主以种族或国籍为由歧视员工是非法的。

collins.def: If you race somewhere, you go there as quickly as possible.

example.ex: He raced across town to the State House building...
example.tran: 他快速穿过市区赶往州议会大厦。

example.ex: The hares raced away out of sight.
example.tran: 野兔飞奔而去，很快就看不见了。

collins.tran: （向某种状态或位置）急速发展，快速移动
collins.def: If something races towards a particular state or position, it moves very fast towards that state or position.

example.ex: Do they realize we are racing towards complete economic collapse?...
example.tran: 他们意识到我们的经济马上要彻底崩溃了吗？

example.ex: American economic growth raced ahead.
example.tran: 美国的经济飞速增长。

collins.def: If you race a vehicle or animal, you prepare it for races and make it take part in races.

example.ex: He still raced sports cars as often as he could.
example.tran: 他仍然尽可能经常地参加赛车比赛。

collins.tran: （尤指在面临困难或危险时大脑）飞速运转
collins.def: If your mind races, or if thoughts race through your mind, you think very fast about something, especially when you are in a difficult or dangerous situation.

example.ex: I made sure I sounded calm but my mind was racing...
example.tran: 我确保自己听上去很镇定，但脑筋却飞快地转着。

example.ex: Already her mind was racing ahead to the hundred and one things she had to do...
example.tran: 她的脑子已经急速地转动起来，思考自己必须做的那一大堆事。

collins.tran: （心脏因兴奋或害怕）快速搏动，剧烈跳动
collins.def: If your heart races, it beats very quickly because you are excited or afraid.

example.ex: Her heart raced uncontrollably.
example.tran: 她控制不住地心跳加速。

collins.def: You describe a situation as a race against time when you have to work very fast in order to do something before a particular time, or before another thing happens.

example.ex: An air force spokesman said the rescue operation was a race against time.
example.tran: 一名空军发言人说这次营救行动是在和时间赛跑。

collins.def: Radio is the broadcasting of programmes for the public to listen to, by sending out signals from a transmitter.

example.ex: The last 12 months have been difficult ones for local radio...
example.tran: 对于当地广播台来说，过去的12个月很艰难。

example.ex: The announcement was broadcast on radio and television.
example.tran: 通知已在广播和电视上发布。

collins.def: You can refer to the programmes broadcast by radio stations as the radio .

example.ex: A lot of people tend to listen to the radio in the mornings...
example.tran: 许多人喜欢在早上听广播。

example.ex: He's been on the radio a lot recently...
example.tran: 最近总能在广播节目中听到他的声音。

collins.def: A radio is the piece of equipment that you use in order to listen to radio programmes.

example.ex: He sat down in the armchair and turned on the radio.
example.tran: 他在扶手椅中坐下，打开了收音机。

collins.def: Radio is a system of sending sound over a distance by transmitting electrical signals.

example.ex: They are in twice daily radio contact with the rebel leader.
example.tran: 他们每天用无线电和叛军首领联系两次。

example.ex: ...radio waves.
example.tran: 无线电波

collins.def: A radio is a piece of equipment that is used for sending and receiving messages.

example.ex: ...the young constable who managed to raise the alarm on his radio...
example.tran: 通过无线电设备发出警报的年轻警官

example.ex: The radio message was brief.
example.tran: 无线电报消息很简短。

collins.def: If you radio someone, you send a message to them by radio.

example.ex: The officer radioed for advice...
example.tran: 军官发来无线电报请求指示。

example.ex: A few minutes after take-off, the pilot radioed that a fire had broken out.
example.tran: 起飞几分钟后，飞行员用无线电报告说飞机内突然起火。

collins.def: If you raise something, you move it so that it is in a higher position.

example.ex: He raised his hand to wave...
example.tran: 他举手挥动起来。

example.ex: She went to the window and raised the blinds...
example.tran: 她走到窗前，拉起了百叶窗。

collins.def: If you raise a flag, you display it by moving it up a pole or into a high place where it can be seen.

example.ex: They had raised the white flag in surrender...
example.tran: 他们举白旗投降了。

example.ex: At midnight, the German flag will be raised over the Reichstag.
example.tran: 半夜时，德国国旗将在德国国会大厦升起。

collins.def: If you raise yourself, you lift your body so that you are standing up straight, or so that you are no longer lying flat.

example.ex: He raised himself into a sitting position...
example.tran: 他坐了起来。

example.ex: She raised herself on one elbow.
example.tran: 她用一只胳膊肘撑起身体。

collins.def: If you raise the rate or level of something, you increase it.

example.ex: The Republic of Ireland is expected to raise interest rates...
example.tran: 爱尔兰共和国预计会提高利率。

example.ex: Two incidents in recent days have raised the level of concern.
example.tran: 最近发生的两起事件引发了更多人的关注。

collins.def: To raise the standard of something means to improve it.

example.ex: ...a new drive to raise standards of literacy in Britain's schools.
example.tran: 提高英国学校文化水平的新运动

collins.def: If you raise your voice, you speak more loudly, usually because you are angry.

example.ex: Don't you raise your voice to me, Henry Rollins!...
example.tran: 别冲我叫嚷，亨利·罗林斯！

example.ex: Anne raised her voice in order to be heard.
example.tran: 为了让人能听得见，安妮提高了嗓门。

collins.def: A raise is an increase in your wages or salary.

example.ex: Within two months Kelly got a raise.
example.tran: 不到两个月，凯利就获得了加薪。

collins.tran: （为慈善组织、机构等）募捐，筹（款）
collins.def: If you raise money for a charity or an institution, you ask people for money which you collect on its behalf.

example.ex: ...events held to raise money for Help the Aged...
example.tran: 为“帮助老年人”活动而发起的募捐活动

example.ex: All funds raised will be used by Children With Leukaemia.
example.tran: 所有募集到的资金都将用于“白血病患儿”组织。

collins.def: If a person or company raises money that they need, they manage to get it, for example by selling their property or by borrowing.

example.ex: They raised the money to buy the house and two hundred acres of grounds.
example.tran: 他们筹钱来购买房屋及200英亩的土地。

collins.def: If an event raises a particular emotion or question, it makes people feel the emotion or consider the question.

example.ex: The agreement has raised hopes that the war may end soon...
example.tran: 那项协议使人们感到战争有望很快结束。

example.ex: The accident again raises questions about the safety of the plant.
example.tran: 这起事故再一次引发了人们对于工厂安全性的质疑。

collins.def: If you raise a subject, an objection, or a question, you mention it or bring it to someone's attention.

example.ex: In the meeting Mrs. Ashrawi raised the three main concerns that the Palestinians had...
example.tran: 会议上，阿什拉维夫人提出了巴勒斯坦人最为关注的三个问题。

example.ex: He had been consulted and had raised no objections.
example.tran: 事先征求了他的意见，他并没有提出异议。

collins.def: Someone who raises a child looks after it until it is grown up.

example.ex: My mother was an amazing woman. She raised four of us kids virtually singlehandedly.
example.tran: 我的母亲是位了不起的女性。她几乎是一个人把我们4个孩子带大的。

example.ex: ...the house where she was raised.
example.tran: 她在其间长大的那幢房子

collins.def: If someone raises a particular type of animal or crop, they breed that type of animal or grow that type of crop.

example.ex: He raises 2,000 acres of wheat and hay.
example.tran: 他种植了2,000英亩的小麦和牧草。

example.ex: ...a perfectly cooked farm-raised chicken.
example.tran: 精心烹制的农场养的鸡

collins.def: The rate at which something happens is the speed with which it happens.

example.ex: The rate at which hair grows can be agonisingly slow...
example.tran: 头发生长的速度可能极其缓慢。

example.ex: The world's tropical forests are disappearing at an even faster rate than experts had thought.
example.tran: 世界上热带森林消失的速度比专家们预想的还要快。

collins.def: The rate at which something happens is the number of times it happens over a period of time.

example.ex: New diet books appear at a rate of nearly one a week...
example.tran: 新的饮食类书籍差不多一周出一本。

example.ex: His heart rate was 30 beats per minute slower...
example.tran: 他的心率每分钟慢了30次。

collins.def: A rate is the amount of money that is charged for goods or services.

example.ex: Calls cost 36p per minute cheap rate and 48p at all other times.
example.tran: 优惠时段的话费是每分钟36便士，其他时段是48便士。

example.ex: ...specially reduced rates for travellers using Gatwick Airport...
example.tran: 为在盖特威克机场进出港的乘客提供的优惠价格

collins.def: The rate of taxation or interest is the amount of tax or interest that needs to be paid. It is expressed as a percentage of the amount that is earned, gained as profit, or borrowed.

example.ex: The government insisted that it would not be panicked into interest rate cuts.
example.tran: 政府坚称不会陷入恐慌而匆忙降息。

collins.tran: （英国）地方税，不动产税，房地产税
collins.def: In Britain, the rates were a local tax which you paid if you owned property or if you rented property without furniture.

example.ex: Soldiers were exempt from paying rates...
example.tran: 士兵免缴地方税。

example.ex: The new council tax combines elements of both the community charge and the rates.
example.tran: 新的家庭税合并了人头税和地方税两个税种。

collins.def: If you rate someone or something as good or bad, you consider them to be good or bad. You can also say that someone or something rates as good or bad.

example.ex: Of all the men in the survey, they rate themselves the least fun-loving and the most responsible...
example.tran: 在所有参加调查的人中，他们认为自己最不贪玩、最负责任。

example.ex: The film was rated excellent by 90 per cent of children...
example.tran: 90%的孩子都表示这部电影很精彩。

collins.def: If you rate someone or something, you think that they are good.

example.ex: It's flattering to know that other clubs have shown interest and seem to rate me...
example.tran: 得知其他俱乐部对我感兴趣并看好我令我受宠若惊。

example.ex: Its artistic value failed to move Paddy Clegg. 'I don't know what all the fuss is about. I didn't rate it at all,' he said.
example.tran: 它的艺术价值没能打动帕迪·克莱格。“我不知道这样大惊小怪是为什么。我一点儿也不看好它，”他说道。

collins.tran: 把…评为;把…认定为;把…列为
collins.def: If someone or something is rated at a particular position or rank, they are calculated or considered to be in that position on a list.

example.ex: He is generally rated Italy's No. 3 industrialist...
example.tran: 他被公认为意大利第三大实业家。

example.ex: He came here rated 100th on the tennis computer.
example.tran: 他以网坛排名第100名的身份来到这里。

collins.def: If you say that someone or something rates a particular reaction, you mean that this is the reaction you consider to be appropriate.

example.ex: This is so extraordinary, it rates a medal and a phone call from the President...
example.tran: 这简直不可思议，应该得到一枚奖章以及总统的电话祝贺。

example.ex: In those crowded streets her attire did not rate a second glance.
example.tran: 在那些拥挤的街道她的穿着并未引起注意。

collins.def: You use at any rate to indicate that what you have just said might be incorrect or unclear in some way, and that you are now being more precise.

example.ex: She modestly suggests that 'sex, or at any rate gender, may account for the difference'...
example.tran: 她谨慎地提出“性别，至少是男女的性征，也许能解释这个差异”。

example.ex: He is the least appealing character, to me at any rate.
example.tran: 他是其中最没有吸引力的角色，至少对我来说是这样。

collins.tran: 不管怎样，无论如何（表示现在所说的话更为重要、而非之前所言）
collins.def: You use at any rate to indicate that the important thing is what you are saying now, and not what was said before.

example.ex: At any rate, Pankin said that relations between the two nations will be restored before the conference...
example.tran: 不管怎样，潘金说两国之间的关系将在会谈之前恢复。

example.ex: Well, at any rate, let me thank you for all you did.
example.tran: 好吧，不管怎样，还是要感谢你所做的一切。

collins.tran: 这样下去；长此以往；如此一来
collins.def: If you say that at this rate something bad or extreme will happen, you mean that it will happen if things continue to develop as they have been doing.

example.ex: At this rate, she would be almost seven feet tall by then...
example.tran: 这样下去，她到时将有7英尺高了。

example.ex: At this rate they'd be lucky to get home before eight-thirty or nine.
example.tran: 这样看来他们能在8点半或是9点以前到家就算幸运了。

collins.def: You use rather than when you are contrasting two things or situations. Rather than introduces the thing or situation that is not true or that you do not want.

example.ex: The problem was psychological rather than physiological...
example.tran: 问题是心理方面的而不是生理方面的。

example.ex: Sedge is similar in appearance to grass but has a solid rather than a hollow stem...
example.tran: 莎草看上去和普通的草没什么两样，但其草茎是实芯的而不是空芯的。

collins.tran: 而是；更确切地说；还不如说；相反
collins.def: You use rather when you are correcting something that you have just said, especially when you are describing a particular situation after saying what it is not.

example.ex: Twenty million years ago, Idaho was not the arid place it is now. Rather, it was warm and damp, populated by dense primordial forest...
example.tran: 2,000万年前，爱达荷州并不像现在这样干旱。相反，那时的爱达荷州温暖潮湿，有大片的原始森林。

example.ex: But there must be no talk of final victory; rather, the long, hard slog to a solution...
example.tran: 但是这还谈不上是最后的胜利；而是长期、艰难地寻找解决方法的过程。

collins.def: If you say that you would rather do something or you'd rather do it, you mean that you would prefer to do it. If you say that you would rather not do something, you mean that you do not want to do it.

example.ex: If it's all the same to you, I'd rather work at home...
example.tran: 如果对你来说没什么差别，我宁愿在家中工作。

example.ex: Which programme would you rather appear on?...
example.tran: 你更愿意在哪个节目中露面？

collins.def: You use rather to indicate that something is true to a fairly great extent, especially when you are talking about something unpleasant or undesirable.

example.ex: I grew up in rather unusual circumstances...
example.tran: 我在非同寻常的环境下长大。

example.ex: It had made some rather bad mistakes which I thought should be corrected...
example.tran: 它犯了一些相当严重的错误，我觉得应该加以纠正。

collins.def: You use rather before verbs that introduce your thoughts and feelings, in order to express your opinion politely, especially when a different opinion has been expressed.

example.ex: I rather think he was telling the truth...
example.tran: 我倒觉得他讲的是真话。

example.ex: I rather like the decorative effect.
example.tran: 我倒很喜欢装饰的效果。

collins.def: People sometimes say rather to express agreement or acceptance.

example.ex: 'Well, he did have a sort of family connection with it, didn't he.' — 'Oh yes. Rather.'
example.tran: “那么，他的确和它有些家族渊源，是不是？”——“噢，是的，的确如此。”

means: 影响的范围，管辖的范围

collins.def: When someone or something reaches a place, they arrive there.

example.ex: He did not stop until he reached the door...
example.tran: 他走到门边才停下。

example.ex: When the bus reached High Holborn, Tony rang the bell and they jumped off together...
example.tran: 当公交车到达海霍尔本站时，托尼摇响了铃，他们一起跳下了车。

collins.tran: 达到，到达（一定阶段、程度或数量）
collins.def: If someone or something has reached a certain stage, level, or amount, they are at that stage, level, or amount.

example.ex: The process of political change in South Africa has reached the stage where it is irreversible...
example.tran: 南非的政治变革已达到不可逆转的地步。

example.ex: The Belgian player Eduardo Masso has reached the final of the Dutch Open in Hilversum...
example.tran: 比利时选手爱德华多·马索进入了在希尔弗瑟姆举行的荷兰公开赛的决赛。

collins.def: If you reach somewhere, you move your arm and hand to take or touch something.

example.ex: Judy reached into her handbag and handed me a small printed leaflet...
example.tran: 朱蒂把手伸进提包，拿出一张小的印刷传单给我。

example.ex: I reached across the table and squeezed his hand...
example.tran: 我把手伸到桌子的另一边，捏住他的手。

collins.def: If you can reach something, you are able to touch it by stretching out your arm or leg.

example.ex: Can you reach your toes with your fingertips?
example.tran: 你能用手指尖碰到你的脚趾吗？

collins.def: If you try to reach someone, you try to contact them, usually by telephone.

example.ex: Has the doctor told you how to reach him or her in emergencies?...
example.tran: 医生有没有告诉你发生紧急情况时怎样与其取得联系？

example.ex: If I see her, I'll tell her you've been trying to reach her.
example.tran: 如果见到她，我会告诉她你一直在尝试联系她。

collins.def: If something reaches a place, point, or level, it extends as far as that place, point, or level.

example.ex: ...a nightshirt which reached to his knees...
example.tran: 长及他膝盖的睡衣

example.ex: The water level in Lake Taihu has reached record levels...
example.tran: 太湖水位达到了历史最高值。

collins.tran: 取得（一致意见）；达成（协议）；作出（决定）
collins.def: When people reach an agreement or a decision, they succeed in achieving it.

example.ex: A meeting of agriculture ministers in Luxembourg today has so far failed to reach agreement over farm subsidies...
example.tran: 今天参加卢森堡会议的各国农业部长目前尚未就农业补贴问题达成一致意见。

example.ex: They are meeting in Lusaka in an attempt to reach a compromise.
example.tran: 他们在卢萨卡举行会谈试图达成妥协。

collins.tran: 可达到的距离；所能及的限度
collins.def: Someone's or something's reach is the distance or limit to which they can stretch, extend, or travel.

example.ex: Isabelle placed a wine cup on the table within his reach.
example.tran: 伊莎贝尔把酒杯放在桌上他伸手可及的地方。

example.ex: ...a heavyweight who possesses a longer reach and more strength.
example.tran: 出拳更远且更有力量的重量级拳击手

collins.tran: （伸手）可及之距离;(可接受的)范围
collins.def: If a place or thing is within reach, it is possible to have it or get to it. If it is out of reach, it is not possible to have it or get to it.

example.ex: It is located within reach of many important Norman towns, including Bayeux...
example.tran: 它邻近许多重要的诺曼城镇，包括贝叶。

example.ex: The clothes they model for Littlewoods are all within easy reach of every woman...
example.tran: 他们为利特尔伍兹服装店展示的那些服装每个女人都穿得起。

collins.def: When you read something such as a book or article, you look at and understand the words that are written there.

example.ex: Have you read this book?...
example.tran: 你看过这本书吗？

example.ex: I read about it in the paper...
example.tran: 我在报纸上看到了这件事。

collins.def: When you read a piece of writing to someone, you say the words aloud.

example.ex: Jay reads poetry so beautifully...
example.tran: 杰伊朗读诗歌很动听。

example.ex: I like it when she reads to us...
example.tran: 我很喜欢她读书给我们听。

collins.def: People who can read have the ability to look at and understand written words.

example.ex: He couldn't read or write...
example.tran: 他不会读写。

example.ex: He could read words at 18 months.
example.tran: 他18个月大的时候就认字了。

collins.def: If you can read music, you have the ability to look at and understand the symbols that are used in written music to represent musical sounds.

example.ex: Later on I learned how to read music.
example.tran: 后来我学会了怎么识乐谱。

collins.def: When a computer reads a file or a document, it takes information from a disk or tape.

example.ex: How can I read a Microsoft Excel file on a computer that only has Works installed?
example.tran: 我怎样在只安装了Works软件的电脑上读取微软的Excel文件呢？

collins.def: You can use read when saying what is written on something or in something. For example, if a notice reads 'Entrance', the word 'Entrance' is written on it.

example.ex: The sign on the bus read 'Private: Not In Service'.
example.tran: 巴士的标牌上写着“私家车：不对外出租”。

collins.def: If you refer to how a piece of writing reads, you are referring to its style.

example.ex: The book reads like a ballad...
example.tran: 这本书读起来像歌谣。

example.ex: It reads very awkwardly.
example.tran: 它读起来很拗口。

collins.tran: 令人愉快的读物；好书（或杂志）
collins.def: If you say that a book or magazine is a good read, you mean that it is very enjoyable to read.

example.ex: Ben Okri's latest novel is a good read.
example.tran: 本·奥克里的最新小说很精彩。

collins.def: If something is read in a particular way, it is understood or interpreted in that way.

example.ex: The play is being widely read as an allegory of imperialist conquest...
example.tran: 这部剧被广泛解读为对帝国主义征服的讽喻。

example.ex: South Africans were praying last night that he has read the situation correctly...
example.tran: 昨晚南非人在祈祷他对形势的解读是正确的。

collins.tran: 看得出，读懂，看透（想法或心思）
collins.def: If you read someone's mind or thoughts, you know exactly what they are thinking without them telling you.

example.ex: As if he could read her thoughts, Benny said, 'You're free to go any time you like.'
example.tran: 班尼仿佛看出了她的心思，说道：“你随时都可以自由离开。”

collins.def: If you can read someone or you can read their gestures, you can understand what they are thinking or feeling by the way they behave or the things they say.

example.ex: If you have to work in a team you must learn to read people...
example.tran: 如果要在一个团队中工作你必须学会了解他人。

example.ex: Under the shaded light her expression was difficult to read.
example.tran: 她的表情隐在阴影中，很难读懂。

collins.def: If someone who is trying to talk to you with a radio transmitter says, 'Do you read me?', they are asking you if you can hear them.

example.ex: Alpha-Bravo-Zulu 643 to Saltezar, do you read me? Over...
example.tran: 阿尔法－布拉沃－祖鲁643呼叫萨德扎，能听到我的声音吗？完毕。

example.ex: We read you loud and clear. Over.
example.tran: 我们能够清楚地听到你的声音。完毕。

collins.tran: 读（表）；记下（仪表上的数字）
collins.def: When you read a measuring device, you look at it to see what the figure or measurement on it is.

example.ex: When officials like gas and electricity men call to read the meter, ask for identification...
example.tran: 当有燃气或电力公司的职员来抄表时，要请他们出示身份证件。

example.ex: It is essential that you are able to read a thermometer.
example.tran: 最基本的是要能看懂温度计。

collins.def: If a measuring device reads a particular amount, it shows that amount.

example.ex: The thermometer read 105 degrees Fahrenheit...
example.tran: 温度计显示华氏105度。

example.ex: The fuel gauge reads below zero.
example.tran: 燃油表显示油量在零以下。

collins.def: If you read a subject at university, you study it.

example.ex: She read French and German at Cambridge University...
example.tran: 她在剑桥大学学习法语和德语。

example.ex: He is now reading for a maths degree at Surrey University.
example.tran: 他现在就读于萨里大学，攻读数学学位。

collins.def: If you take something as read, you accept it as true or right and therefore feel that it does not need to be discussed or proved.

example.ex: We took it as read that he must have been a KGB agent...
example.tran: 我们完全相信他曾经是一名克格勃特工。

example.ex: The case for aid to eastern Europe is taken as read.
example.tran: 援助东欧的主张被认为完全正确。

collins.def: Something that is real actually exists and is not imagined, invented, or theoretical.

example.ex: No, it wasn't a dream. It was real...
example.tran: 不，它不是一个梦，它是真实的。

example.ex: Legends grew up around a great many figures, both real and fictitious.
example.tran: 围绕着许多人物都有传说流传开，有真实的也有虚构的。

collins.tran: 身临其境的;亲身经历的
collins.def: If something is real to someone, they experience it as though it really exists or happens, even though it does not.

example.ex: Whitechild's life becomes increasingly real to the reader.
example.tran: 怀特蔡尔德的生活在读者面前显得越来越真实。

collins.tran: 天然的；真材实料的；非仿制的；非人工合成的
collins.def: A material or object that is real is natural or functioning, and not artificial or an imitation.

example.ex: ...the smell of real leather...
example.tran: 真皮的气味

example.ex: Who's to know if they're real guns or not?...
example.tran: 谁能知道它们是不是真枪呢？

collins.tran: 真正的；完全的；不掺假的；货真价实的
collins.def: You can use real to describe someone or something that has all the characteristics or qualities that such a person or thing typically has.

example.ex: ...his first real girlfriend...
example.tran: 他第一个真正的女友

example.ex: He's not a real alcoholic...
example.tran: 他并非货真价实的酒鬼。

collins.def: You can use real to describe something that is the true or original thing of its kind, in contrast to one that someone wants you to believe is true.

example.ex: This was the real reason for her call...
example.tran: 这才是她打电话的真正原因。

example.ex: Her real name had been Miriam Pinckus.
example.tran: 她的真名叫米丽娅姆·平卡斯。

collins.def: You can use real to describe something that is the most important or typical part of a thing.

example.ex: When he talks, he only gives glimpses of his real self...
example.tran: 当他讲话时，他只流露少许个人的真实想法。

example.ex: The smart executive has people he can trust doing all the real work.
example.tran: 这个精明的主管所有重要的工作都有信得过的人来做。

collins.def: You can use real when you are talking about a situation or feeling to emphasize that it exists and is important or serious.

example.ex: Global warming is a real problem...
example.tran: 全球变暖是个严重的问题。

example.ex: The prospect of civil war is very real...
example.tran: 发生内战的可能性是真实存在的。

collins.def: You can use real to emphasize a quality that is genuine and sincere.

example.ex: You've been drifting from job to job without any real commitment...
example.tran: 你从一个工作跳到另一个工作，从没有真正投入进去。

example.ex: Germany has shown real determination to come to terms with the anti-Semitism of its past.
example.tran: 德国表现出正视自己反犹主义历史的诚意。

collins.def: You can use real before nouns to emphasize your description of something or someone.

example.ex: 'It's a fabulous deal, a real bargain.'
example.tran: “这桩买卖真让人难以置信，绝对合算。”

example.ex: 'You must think I'm a real idiot.'
example.tran: “你一定觉得我简直是个白痴.”

collins.tran: （成本或价值）实际的，净的，实的
collins.def: The real cost or value of something is its cost or value after other amounts have been added or subtracted and when factors such as the level of inflation have been considered.

example.ex: ...the real cost of borrowing.
example.tran: 借款的实际成本

collins.tran: （用于形容词或副词前表示强调）非常，真正
collins.def: You can use real to emphasize an adjective or adverb.

example.ex: He is finding prison life 'real tough'...
example.tran: 他发现监狱生活“确实难熬”。

example.ex: I don't think you are trying real hard.
example.tran: 我觉得你并没有真正努力尝试。

collins.tran: 真实地;真正地;不是假装
collins.def: If you say that someone does something for real, you mean that they actually do it and do not just pretend to do it.

example.ex: The sex scenes were just good acting. We didn't do it for real.
example.tran: 床戏只是逼真的表演。我们没有来真的。

collins.tran: 来真的，真是这样（表示令人吃惊）
collins.def: If you think that someone or something is very surprising, you can ask if they are for real .

example.ex: Is this guy for real?
example.tran: 这家伙是来真的吗？

collins.tran: 真品；非仿冒品；真实事件
collins.def: If you say that a thing or event is the real thing, you mean that it is the thing or event itself, rather than an imitation or copy.

example.ex: The counterfeits sell for about $20 less than the real thing...
example.tran: 赝品比真货便宜大约20美元。

example.ex: The Blairgowrie Highland Games, on the other hand, are the real thing rather than a media event.
example.tran: 另一方面，布莱尔高里高地赛确实是真正的比赛，而不单是媒体盛事。

collins.def: You can use really to emphasize a statement.

example.ex: I'm very sorry. I really am...
example.tran: 我很抱歉。真的。

example.ex: It really is best to manage without any medication if you possibly can...
example.tran: 如果你不服用任何药物就能挺过去的话，最好不过了。

collins.tran: （放在形容词或副词前表示强调）极其，非常
collins.def: You can use really to emphasize an adjective or adverb.

example.ex: It was really good...
example.tran: 好极了。

example.ex: They were really nice people...
example.tran: 他们是极好的人。

collins.def: You use really when you are discussing the real facts about something, in contrast to the ones someone wants you to believe.

example.ex: My father didn't really love her...
example.tran: 我父亲实际上并不爱她。

example.ex: What was really going on?...
example.tran: 到底怎么了？

collins.tran: （用于问句或否定句中引出否定回答）真的，说实在的
collins.def: People use really in questions and negative statements when they want you to answer 'no'.

example.ex: Do you really think he would be that stupid?...
example.tran: 你真的认为他会那么蠢吗？

example.ex: You can't really expect me to believe you didn't know him.
example.tran: 你不会真的觉得我会相信你不认识他吧。

collins.def: If you refer to a time when something really begins to happen, you are emphasizing that it starts to happen at that time to a much greater extent and much more seriously than before.

example.ex: That's when the pressure really started...
example.tran: 那就是真正开始有压力的时候。

example.ex: He only really started going out with girls at college.
example.tran: 他上大学的时候才真正开始和女孩子约会。

collins.tran: （放在否定陈述句中减轻语气）真的，真正，其实
collins.def: People sometimes use really to slightly reduce the force of a negative statement.

example.ex: I'm not really surprised...
example.tran: 我其实并不惊讶。

example.ex: 'Did they hurt you?' — 'Not really'...
example.tran: “他们伤害你了吗？”“其实并没有。”

collins.tran: （放在句中表示不那么确定）真的，还是
collins.def: People sometimes add really to statements in order to make them less definite and more uncertain.

example.ex: She is a quiet girl really...
example.tran: 她算得上是个蛮安静的女孩。

example.ex: I'm happy most of the time, really.
example.tran: 我多数时候还是挺快乐的。

collins.def: People use really to show that they are surprised or that the person they are speaking to may be surprised about something.

example.ex: Actually it was quite good really...
example.tran: 事实上那还真的不错呢。

example.ex: I was really rather fond of Arthur.
example.tran: 我还真的很喜欢阿瑟。

collins.tran: （对某人所说的话表示怀疑或不相信）真的，是吗
collins.def: You can say really to express surprise or disbelief at what someone has said.

example.ex: 'We discovered it was totally the wrong decision.' — 'Really?'...
example.tran: “我们发现那完全是个错误的决定。”——“真的吗？”

example.ex: 'We saw a very bright shooting star.'—'Did you really?'
example.tran: “我们看到了一颗很明亮的流星。”——“真的吗？”

collins.tran: （用在对话中表示对对方所说的内容感兴趣）是吗，真的吗
collins.def: You can say 'really' in a conversation to show that you are interested in what someone is saying.

example.ex: 'We had a very interesting chat.' — 'Really? About what?'
example.tran: “我们相谈甚欢。”——“是吗？谈了些什么？”

collins.tran: （表示有些恼怒或厌烦）说真的，坦白讲
collins.def: Some people say really when they are slightly annoyed or offended by something.

example.ex: Really, Mr Riss, I expected better of you.
example.tran: 坦白讲，里斯先生，我没想到你会那样。

collins.def: The reason for something is a fact or situation which explains why it happens or what causes it to happen.

example.ex: There is a reason for every important thing that happens...
example.tran: 每件重要事情的发生都有原因。

example.ex: Who would have a reason to want to kill her?
example.tran: 谁会有杀她的动机呢？

collins.def: If you say that you have reason to believe something or to have a particular emotion, you mean that you have evidence for your belief or there is a definite cause of your feeling.

example.ex: They had reason to believe there could be trouble...
example.tran: 他们有理由相信可能会遇到麻烦。

example.ex: He had every reason to be upset...
example.tran: 他完全有理由生气。

collins.def: The ability that people have to think and to make sensible judgments can be referred to as reason .

example.ex: ...a conflict between emotion and reason...
example.tran: 情感和理智的冲突

example.ex: Mike is my voice of reason. He thinks logically and points out where I'm going wrong.
example.tran: 迈克帮我保持理智。他的思维很有逻辑性，可以指出我的错误。

collins.def: If you reason that something is true, you decide that it is true after thinking carefully about all the facts.

example.ex: I reasoned that changing my diet would lower my cholesterol level...
example.tran: 我推断改变自己的饮食可以降低我的胆固醇水平。

example.ex: 'Listen,' I reasoned, 'it doesn't take a genius to figure out what Adam's up to.'
example.tran: “听着，”我分析道，“要弄清楚亚当想要干什么很容易。”

collins.tran: （常用来暗指不赞成某人的所作所为）只有自己知道为什么，出于自身的理由
collins.def: If you do not know why someone did something, you can say that they did it for reasons best known to themselves. You usually use this expression when you do not agree with what they did.

example.ex: For reasons best known to himself, Algie changed his name.
example.tran: 不知是出于什么原因，阿尔吉改了名字。

collins.tran: 因为；由于；由…引起；以…为理由
collins.def: If one thing happens by reason of another, it happens because of it.

example.ex: The boss retains enormous influence by reason of his position...
example.tran: 老板由于自身的地位而一直有极大的影响力。

example.ex: He pleaded innocent by reason of insanity.
example.tran: 他以精神不健全为由申辩无罪。

collins.def: If you try to make someone listen to reason, you try to persuade them to listen to sensible arguments and be influenced by them.

example.ex: The company's top executives had refused to listen to reason.
example.tran: 公司的高层管理人员拒绝理智行事。

collins.tran: 无缘无故；莫名其妙；没有理由
collins.def: If you say that something happened or was done for no reason ,for no good reason, or for no reason at all, you mean that there was no obvious reason why it happened or was done.

example.ex: The guards, he said, would punch them for no reason...
example.tran: 他说警卫会无缘无故殴打他们。

example.ex: For no reason at all the two men started to laugh.
example.tran: 两个人莫名其妙地开始大笑。

collins.tran: 活着的理由；生存的原因
collins.def: If a person or thing is someone's reason for living or their reason for being, they are the most important thing in that person's life.

example.ex: Chloe is my reason for living.
example.tran: 克洛艾是我活着的理由。

collins.tran: 不知为何;不知什么原因
collins.def: If you say that something happened or is true for some reason, you mean that you know it happened or is true, but you do not know why.

example.ex: For some reason, the curtains were shut...
example.tran: 不知什么原因，窗帘拉着。

example.ex: For some inexplicable reason she was attracted to Patrick.
example.tran: 因为某些无法解释的原因，她被帕特里克所吸引。

collins.tran: 正当的;合乎情理的;理智范围内的
collins.def: If you say that you will do anything within reason, you mean that you will do anything that is fair or reasonable and not too extreme.

example.ex: I will take any job that comes along, within reason...
example.tran: 我会接受任何给我的工作，只要是正当的。

example.ex: It means working, within reason, for whatever time is necessary.
example.tran: 这意味着在合理的范围内花费所有必要的时间工作。

collins.def: When you receive something, you get it after someone gives it to you or sends it to you.

example.ex: They will receive their awards at a ceremony in Stockholm...
example.tran: 他们会在斯德哥尔摩举行的仪式上接受颁奖。

example.ex: I received your letter of November 7.
example.tran: 我收到了你11月7日的来信。

collins.def: You can use receive to say that certain kinds of thing happen to someone. For example if they are injured, you can say that they received an injury.

example.ex: He received more of the blame than anyone when the plan failed to work...
example.tran: 计划失败后，他受到了比别人更多的指责。

example.ex: She was suffering from whiplash injuries received in a car crash.
example.tran: 她在车祸中颈部扭伤。

collins.def: When you receive a visitor or a guest, you greet them.

example.ex: The following evening the duchess was again receiving guests...
example.tran: 第二天晚上公爵夫人又在会客。

example.ex: The shop assistant received me indifferently while leaning on a counter.
example.tran: 商店售货员靠在柜台上漫不经心地招呼我。

collins.def: If you say that something is received in a particular way, you mean that people react to it in that way.

example.ex: The resolution had been received with great disappointment within the PLO...
example.tran: 巴解组织内部对决议表现出极大失望。

example.ex: The proposals have been well received by many deputies.
example.tran: 这些提议在许多代表中反响不错。

collins.def: When a radio or television receives signals that are being transmitted, it picks them up and converts them into sound or pictures.

example.ex: The reception was a little faint but clear enough for him to receive the signal.
example.tran: 接收到的信号有点弱，但对他来说已够清晰，可以接收到。

collins.def: If someone receives stolen goods, they buy or are given things that have been stolen.

example.ex: He went to prison for receiving stolen scrap iron...
example.tran: 他因为收购偷来的废铁而入狱。

example.ex: He received the shoes when stolen, and then passed them on to the men who would sell them.
example.tran: 他接收偷盗的鞋子，然后把它们再转给那些销赃者。

collins.tran: 经历（不愉快的事情）；成为受害者
collins.def: If you are on the receiving end or at the receiving end of something unpleasant, you are the person that it happens to.

example.ex: You saw hate in their eyes and you were on the receiving end of that hate...
example.tran: 你在他们的眼睛里看到仇恨，而且你就是他们仇恨的对象。

example.ex: Bullying can indeed be distressing and frightening for those at the receiving end.
example.tran: 受到欺凌的人会真实地感到痛苦和害怕。

collins.def: A recent event or period of time happened only a short while ago.

example.ex: In the most recent attack one man was shot dead and two others were wounded...
example.tran: 在最近的一次袭击中，一名男子遇袭身亡，另外两人受伤。

example.ex: Sales have fallen by more than 75 percent in recent years.
example.tran: 近几年来销售额下降了75%以上。

collins.def: If you keep a record of something, you keep a written account or photographs of it so that it can be referred to later.

example.ex: Keep a record of all the payments...
example.tran: 所有付款都要作记录。

example.ex: There's no record of any marriage or children...
example.tran: 没有任何有关婚姻或子女的记载。

collins.tran: （用文字、照片或电脑）记录，记载
collins.def: If you record a piece of information or an event, you write it down, photograph it, or put it into a computer so that in the future people can refer to it.

example.ex: ...software packages which record the details of your photographs.
example.tran: 记录你的照片的各种细节的软件包

example.ex: ...a place which has rarely suffered a famine in its recorded history.
example.tran: 在历史记载中很少发生饥荒的地方

collins.tran: （用磁带或胶片）记录，录制，记下
collins.def: If you record something such as a speech or performance, you put it on tape or film so that it can be heard or seen again later.

example.ex: There is nothing to stop viewers recording the films on videotape...
example.tran: 没有什么办法可以阻止观众用录像机把电影录下来。

example.ex: The call was answered by a recorded message saying the company had closed early.
example.tran: 电话被转入录音信息，称公司早些时候已经下班。

collins.tran: 录制（音乐、电视或广播节目）
collins.def: If a musician or performer records a piece of music or a television or radio show, they perform it so that it can be put onto CD, tape, or film.

example.ex: It took the musicians two and a half days to record their soundtrack for the film...
example.tran: 乐师们花了两天半的时间为电影录制配乐。

example.ex: She has recently recorded a programme for television.
example.tran: 她最近录制了一档电视节目。

collins.def: A record is a round, flat piece of black plastic on which sound, especially music, is stored, and which can be played on a record player. You can also refer to the music stored on this piece of plastic as a record.

example.ex: This is one of my favourite records.
example.tran: 这是我最喜欢的唱片之一。

example.ex: ...the biggest and best-known record company in England.
example.tran: 英格兰最大、最知名的唱片公司

collins.tran: 记录，表明（某种测量结果或数值）
collins.def: If a dial or other measuring device records a certain measurement or value, it shows that measurement or value.

example.ex: The test records the electrical activity of the brain...
example.tran: 试验记录下了脑电活动。

example.ex: The index of the performance of leading shares recorded a 16 per cent fall.
example.tran: 龙头股指数录得16个百分点的跌幅。

collins.tran: （体育运动或活动的）纪录，最好成绩
collins.def: A record is the best result that has ever been achieved in a particular sport or activity, for example the fastest time, the furthest distance, or the greatest number of victories.

example.ex: Roger Kingdom set the world record of 12.92 seconds...
example.tran: 罗杰·金德姆创造了12.92秒的世界纪录。

example.ex: The painting was sold for £665,000 — a record for the artist.
example.tran: 这幅画卖了665,000英镑，是这个艺术家最贵的一幅了。

collins.def: You use record to say that something is higher, lower, better, or worse than has ever been achieved before.

example.ex: Profits were at record levels...
example.tran: 利润创下新高。

example.ex: She won the race in record time.
example.tran: 她以破纪录的成绩赢得了这场比赛。

collins.def: Someone's record is the facts that are known about their achievements or character.

example.ex: His record reveals a tough streak...
example.tran: 他的履历显示他性格强悍。

example.ex: He had a distinguished record as a chaplain...
example.tran: 作为一个牧师他成就卓著。

collins.def: If someone has a criminal record, it is officially known that they have committed crimes in the past.

example.ex: ...a heroin addict with a criminal record going back 15 years...
example.tran: 15年前留有案底的海洛因瘾君子

example.ex: Where the accused has a record of violence, they should always be kept in custody.
example.tran: 要是被告有暴力犯罪记录，必须予以拘留。

collins.tran: 供记录（表示将公开申明某事）
collins.def: If you say that what you are going to say next is for the record, you mean that you are saying it publicly and officially and you want it to be written down and remembered.

example.ex: We're willing to state for the record that it has enormous value.
example.tran: 我们愿意郑重声明那是有极大价值的。

collins.tran: 供记录在案；作为记录（备用）
collins.def: If you give some information for the record, you give it in case people might find it useful at a later time, although it is not a very important part of what you are talking about.

example.ex: For the record, most Moscow girls leave school at about 18...
example.tran: 需要指出的是，多数莫斯科女孩18岁从学校毕业。

example.ex: Perhaps you'd like to tell me what you were doing Monday. Just for the record.
example.tran: 也许你不介意告诉我你周一在做些什么。只是顺便问问。

collins.def: If something that you say is off the record, you do not intend it to be considered as official, or published with your name attached to it.

example.ex: May I speak off the record?...
example.tran: 我可以私下说说吗，不要发表？

example.ex: At the end of the lunch, I said I had some off-the-record comments.
example.tran: 午餐快结束的时候，我说我有一些想私下谈的看法。

collins.tran: 公开宣布的；记录在案的
collins.def: If you are on record as saying something, you have said it publicly and officially and it has been written down.

example.ex: The Chancellor is on record as saying that the increase in unemployment is 'a price worth paying' to keep inflation down.
example.tran: 财政大臣公开宣称失业率上升是遏制通货膨胀“值得付出的代价”。

collins.def: If you keep information on record, you write it down or store it in a computer so that it can be used later.

example.ex: The practice is to keep on record any analysis of samples.
example.tran: 习惯上要把所有的样品分析记录在案。

collins.def: If something is the best, worst, or biggest on record, it is the best, worst, or biggest thing of its kind that has been noticed and written down.

example.ex: It's the shortest election campaign on record...
example.tran: 这是史上为期最短的一次竞选活动。

example.ex: The 1980s were the hottest decade on record.
example.tran: 20世纪80年代是有史以来最热的十年。

collins.def: If you set the record straight or put the record straight, you show that something which has been regarded as true is in fact not true.

example.ex: Let me set the record straight on the misconceptions contained in your article.
example.tran: 我来纠正一下你文章里的错误认识。

collins.def: Something that is red is the colour of blood or fire.

example.ex: ...a bunch of red roses...
example.tran: 一束红玫瑰

example.ex: She had small hands with nails painted bright red.
example.tran: 她的手很小，指甲涂成了鲜红色。

collins.tran: （因为尴尬、生气或气短）脸红的
collins.def: If you say that someone's face is red, you mean that it is redder than its normal colour, because they are embarrassed, angry, or out of breath.

example.ex: With a bright red face I was forced to admit that I had no real idea...
example.tran: 我的脸涨得通红，被迫承认自己实际上没什么想法。

example.ex: She was red with shame.
example.tran: 她羞愧地红了脸。

collins.def: You describe someone's hair as red when it is between red and brown in colour.

example.ex: ...a girl with red hair...
example.tran: 红褐色头发的女孩

example.ex: He is still vain enough to dye his hair red.
example.tran: 他还是很虚荣，把头发染成了红褐色。

collins.def: Your red blood cells or red corpuscles are the cells in your blood which carry oxygen around your body.
You can refer to red wine as red .

example.ex: The spicy flavours in these dishes call for reds rather than whites.
example.tran: 这些菜的味道辛辣，应该配红酒而不是白葡萄酒。

collins.tran: 共产党员;社会主义者;左翼思想者
collins.def: If you refer to someone as a red or a Red, you mean that they are a communist, a socialist, or have left-wing ideas.

example.ex: They're all so terrified of Reds.
example.tran: 他们所有人都非常害怕红色人士。

collins.def: If a person or company is in the red or if their bank account is in the red, they have spent more money than they have in their account and therefore they owe money to the bank.

example.ex: The theatre is £500,000 in the red...
example.tran: 这座电影院亏空50万英镑。

example.ex: If you do go into the red you get charged 30p for each transaction.
example.tran: 如果你真的出现透支，那你每笔交易要支付30便士的费用。

collins.def: If you see red, you suddenly become very angry.

example.ex: I didn't mean to break his nose. I just saw red.
example.tran: 我不是故意要打断他的鼻梁。我只是一时气急。

means: 公映的新影片，发布的新闻[消息]

collins.def: If a person or animal is released from somewhere where they have been locked up or looked after, they are set free or allowed to go.

example.ex: He was released from custody the next day...
example.tran: 第二天他被从拘留所里放了出来。

example.ex: He is expected to be released from hospital today...
example.tran: 他有望今天出院。

collins.def: When someone is released, you refer to their release .

example.ex: He called for the immediate release of all political prisoners.
example.tran: 他要求立即释放所有政治犯。

example.ex: ...the secret negotiations necessary to secure hostage releases...
example.tran: 为确保人质释放而要进行的秘密谈判

collins.def: If someone or something releases you from a duty, task, or feeling, they free you from it.

example.ex: Divorce releases both the husband and wife from all marital obligations to each other...
example.tran: 离婚解除了夫妻双方相互之间所有的婚姻义务。

example.ex: This releases the teacher to work with individuals who are having extreme difficulty.
example.tran: 这使得教师可以专门辅导学习特别吃力的学生。

collins.tran: 发泄，释放(情感);展示(能力)
collins.def: To release feelings or abilities means to allow them to be expressed.

example.ex: Becoming your own person releases your creativity...
example.tran: 保持自己的本色才有助于发挥自身创造力。

example.ex: I personally don't want to release my anger on anyone else...
example.tran: 我个人并不想把自己的愤怒发泄在别人身上。

collins.def: If someone in authority releases something such as a document or information, they make it available.

example.ex: They're not releasing any more details yet...
example.tran: 他们还未公布更多细节。

example.ex: Figures released yesterday show retail sales were down in March.
example.tran: 昨天公布的数据显示零售额在3月份有所下滑。

collins.def: If you release someone or something, you stop holding them.

example.ex: He stopped and faced her, releasing her wrist.
example.tran: 他停下来面对着她，放开了她的手腕。

example.ex: ...the twisting action before a bowler releases the ball.
example.tran: 投球手掷球前的屈身动作

collins.tran: 打开，放开，松开(制动装置)
collins.def: If you release a device, you move it so that it stops holding something.

example.ex: Wade released the hand brake and pulled away from the curb.
example.tran: 韦德松开手刹驶离路边。

collins.tran: 释放，放出，排放(气体、热量或某种物质)
collins.def: If something releases gas, heat, or a substance, it causes it to leave its container or the substance that it was part of and enter the surrounding atmosphere or area.

example.ex: ...a weapon which releases toxic nerve gas...
example.tran: 释放神经毒气的武器

example.ex: The contraction of muscles uses energy and releases heat...
example.tran: 肌肉的收缩消耗能量并且释放热量。

collins.tran: 发行，推出(唱片、碟片或电影)
collins.def: When an entertainer or company releases a new CD, video, or film, it becomes available so that people can buy it or see it.

example.ex: He is releasing an album of love songs.
example.tran: 他即将推出一张情歌专辑。

collins.tran: 新发行的影片;新片;新碟;发行物
collins.def: A new release is a new CD, video, or film that has just become available for people to buy or see.

example.ex: Which of the new releases do you think are really good?
example.tran: 在这些新片中你觉得哪些真的不错？

collins.tran: (影片的)上映，公映；（录像带的）发行
collins.def: If a film or video is on release or on general release, it is available for people to see in public cinemas or for people to buy.

example.ex: The video has sold three million copies in its first three weeks on release.
example.tran: 影碟推出的前3周就卖出了300万张。

collins.def: If someone or something remains in a particular state or condition, they stay in that state or condition and do not change.

example.ex: The three men remained silent...
example.tran: 这3个人保持着沉默。

example.ex: The situation remains tense...
example.tran: 形势持续紧张。

collins.def: If you remain in a place, you stay there and do not move away.

example.ex: He will have to remain in hospital for at least 10 days...
example.tran: 他至少得在医院里呆10天。

example.ex: From time to time, James remained at home with his family.
example.tran: 詹姆斯偶尔留在家里陪家人。

collins.def: You can say that something remains when it still exists.

example.ex: Many of the differences in everyday life remain...
example.tran: 日常生活中的许多差异仍然存在。

example.ex: The wider problem remains...
example.tran: 更普遍的问题仍未解决。

collins.def: If something remains to be done, it has not yet been done and still needs to be done.

example.ex: Major questions remain to be answered about his work...
example.tran: 关于他工作的许多重要问题仍然悬而未决。

example.ex: Huge amounts of weapons remain to be collected.
example.tran: 大量的武器仍有待收缴。

collins.def: The remains of something are the parts of it that are left after most of it has been taken away or destroyed.

example.ex: They were tidying up the remains of their picnic.
example.tran: 他们正在收拾野餐后剩下的东西。

example.ex: ...the charred remains of a tank.
example.tran: 烧焦的坦克残骸

collins.def: The remains of a person or animal are the parts of their body that are left after they have died, sometimes after they have been dead for a long time.

example.ex: The unrecognizable remains of a man had been found...
example.tran: 一具无法辨认的男性尸体被发现了。

example.ex: More human remains have been unearthed in the north of the country.
example.tran: 在该国北部挖出了更多的人类遗骨。

collins.def: Historical remains are things that have been found from an earlier period of history, usually buried in the ground, for example parts of buildings and pieces of pottery.

example.ex: There are Roman remains all around us.
example.tran: 我们周围都是古罗马的遗迹。

collins.tran: （事实、问题等)仍然是(表示强调)
collins.def: You can use remain in expressions such as the fact remains that or the question remains whether to introduce and emphasize something that you want to talk about.

example.ex: The fact remains that inflation is unacceptably high...
example.tran: 事实是通货膨胀率仍高得离谱。

example.ex: The question remains whether he was fully aware of the claims.
example.tran: 问题是他是否完全意识到了这些要求。

collins.def: If you say that it remains to be seen whether something will happen, you mean that nobody knows whether it will happen.

example.ex: It remains to be seen whether her parliamentary colleagues will agree.
example.tran: 她的国会同僚是否同意，现在还无从知晓。

collins.def: If you remember people or events from the past, you still have an idea of them in your mind and you are able to think about them.

example.ex: You wouldn't remember me. I was in another group...
example.tran: 你不会记得我。我那时在另外一组。

example.ex: I certainly don't remember talking to you at all...
example.tran: 我当然完全不记得和你讲过话。

collins.tran: (经过一段时间后)忆起，回忆起
collins.def: If you remember that something is the case, you become aware of it again after a time when you did not think about it.

example.ex: She remembered that she was going to the social club that evening...
example.tran: 她记起来那晚她正要去社交俱乐部。

example.ex: Then I remembered the cheque, which cheered me up.
example.tran: 然后我想起了那张支票，这让我精神大振。

collins.def: If you cannot remember something, you are not able to bring it back into your mind when you make an effort to do so.

example.ex: If you can't remember your number, write it in code in a diary...
example.tran: 如果你记不住你的号码，用代码把它记在记事本上。

example.ex: I couldn't remember ever having felt so safe and secure...
example.tran: 我从未有过如此安全的感觉。

collins.def: If you remember to do something, you do it when you intend to.

example.ex: I did remember to take the present...
example.tran: 我的确记得拿了礼物。

example.ex: Please remember to enclose a stamped addressed envelope when writing.
example.tran: 请记得写信时在信封里放一个贴好邮票、写明地址的信封。

collins.def: You tell someone to remember that something is the case when you want to emphasize its importance. It may be something that they already know about or a new piece of information.

example.ex: It is important to remember that each person reacts differently...
example.tran: 重要的是要记住每个人的反应不同。

example.ex: It is worth remembering that children tend to copy their parents in this respect...
example.tran: 值得记住的是孩子们在这一方面往往会效仿父母。

collins.def: If you say that someone will be remembered for something that they have done, you mean that people will think of this whenever they think about the person.

example.ex: At his grammar school he is remembered for being bad at games...
example.tran: 在文法学校他因不善于玩游戏为大家所熟知。

example.ex: He will always be remembered as one of the great Chancellors of the Exchequer.
example.tran: 作为最伟大的财政大臣之一他将永远被铭记。

collins.def: If you ask someone to remember you to a person who you have not seen for a long time, you are asking them to pass your greetings on to that person.

example.ex: 'Remember me to Lyle, won't you?' I said...
example.tran: “代我问候莱尔，好吗？”我说。

example.ex: She asked to be remembered to you.
example.tran: 她要我转达对你的问候。

collins.def: If you make a celebration an occasion to remember, you make it very enjoyable for all the people involved.

example.ex: We'll give everyone a night to remember...
example.tran: 我们将带给大家一个难忘的夜晚。

example.ex: I'll make it a birthday to remember.
example.tran: 我将使这成为一个难忘的生日。

collins.def: If you report something that has happened, you tell people about it.

example.ex: They had been called in to clear drains after local people reported a foul smell...
example.tran: 当地居民举报闻到恶臭气味后，他们被叫来清理排水沟。

example.ex: I reported the theft to the police...
example.tran: 我向警方报告了这起盗窃案。

collins.tran: (就某个事件或主题)报告情况，报道
collins.def: If you report on an event or subject, you tell people about it, because it is your job or duty to do so.
