example.ex: Many journalists enter the country to report on political affairs...
example.tran: 许多记者进入该国对政治事件进行报道。

example.ex: I'll now call at the vicarage and report to you in due course.
example.tran: 我现在要去教区牧师家拜访，然后适时向你汇报情况。

collins.def: A report is a news article or broadcast which gives information about something that has just happened.

example.ex: ...a report in London's Independent newspaper...
example.tran: 伦敦《独立报》的报道

example.ex: With a report on these developments, here's Jim Fish in Belgrade...
example.tran: 这里是吉姆·菲什在贝尔格莱德发来的关于事件进展的报道。

collins.def: A report is an official document which a group of people issue after investigating a situation or event.

example.ex: After an inspection, the inspectors must publish a report.
example.tran: 在视察之后，视察者必须发表一份报告。

example.ex: A report by the Association of University Teachers finds that only 22 per cent of lecturers in our universities are women.
example.tran: 大学教师联合会发表的报告发现只有22%的大学讲师为女性。

collins.def: If you give someone a report on something, you tell them what has been happening.

example.ex: She came back to give us a progress report on how the project is going...
example.tran: 她回来给我们作了关于项目进程的报告。

example.ex: It seemed obvious from his report of that meeting that you were trying to focus suspicion on Mr Hirsch.
example.tran: 从他对那次会面的报告中可以明显看出你正把怀疑的焦点转向赫希先生。

collins.def: If you say that there are reports that something has happened, you mean that some people say it has happened but you have no direct evidence of it.

example.ex: There are unconfirmed reports that two people have been shot in the neighbouring town of Lalitpur...
example.tran: 据报道有两人在勒利德布尔城附近被枪杀，但尚未得到证实。

example.ex: There were no reports of casualties.
example.tran: 没有人员死伤的报道。

collins.def: If someone reports you to a person in authority, they tell that person about something wrong that you have done.

example.ex: His ex-wife reported him to police a few days later...
example.tran: 他的前妻几天后向警方告发了他。

example.ex: The Princess was reported for speeding twice on the same road within a week.
example.tran: 这位公主一周之内在同一路段上两次因超速行驶被告发。

collins.def: If you report to a person or place, you go to that person or place and say that you are ready to start work or say that you are present.

example.ex: According to protocol, he first reported to the Director of the hospital...
example.tran: 根据礼节，他先向医院院长报到。

example.ex: Mr Ashwell has to surrender his passport and report to the police every five days...
example.tran: 阿什维尔先生不得不交出他的护照，并且每隔5天到警察局报到一次。

collins.def: If you say that one employee reports to another, you mean that the first employee is told what to do by the second one and is responsible to them.

example.ex: He reported to a section chief, who reported to a division chief, and so on up the line.
example.tran: 他由组长领导，组长由部门主管领导，如此逐级向上。

collins.def: A school report is an official written account of how well or how badly a pupil has done during the term or year that has just finished.

example.ex: And now she was getting bad school reports.
example.tran: 现在她的学习成绩越来越差。

collins.def: A report is a sudden loud noise, for example the sound of a gun being fired or an explosion.

example.ex: Soon afterwards there was a loud report as the fuel tanks exploded.
example.tran: 不久之后就听到燃料箱爆炸的巨响。

means: （从市场调研中）得出所预测的结果
从事…的研究，为…而做研究

collins.def: Research is work that involves studying something and trying to discover facts about it.

example.ex: 65 percent of the 1987 budget went for nuclear weapons research and production.
example.tran: 1987年65％的预算经费被用于核武器的研究和生产。

example.ex: ...cancer research.
example.tran: 癌症研究

collins.def: If you research something, you try to discover facts about it.

example.ex: She spent two years in South Florida researching and filming her documentary...
example.tran: 她花了两年时间在佛罗里达州南部做研究，拍摄纪录片。

example.ex: So far we haven't been able to find anything, but we're still researching.
example.tran: 目前我们还没有任何发现，但是我们仍在研究。

collins.def: A result is something that happens or exists because of something else that has happened.

example.ex: Compensation is available for people who have developed asthma as a direct result of their work...
example.tran: 直接因工作原因患上哮喘的人会获得赔偿。

example.ex: A real pizza oven gives better results than an ordinary home oven.
example.tran: 专门的比萨烤箱比普通家用烤箱效果更好。

collins.def: If something results in a particular situation or event, it causes that situation or event to happen.

example.ex: Fifty per cent of road accidents result in head injuries...
example.tran: 50％的道路交通事故都会导致头部损伤。

example.ex: Regular trips back to her adopted motherland have resulted in her first book, Tiger Balm.
example.tran: 经常返回她移居的国家让她写出了她的第一本书《万金油》。

collins.def: If something results from a particular event or action, it is caused by that event or action.

example.ex: Many hair problems result from what you eat...
example.tran: 很多头发问题都是由饮食引起的。

example.ex: Ignore the early warnings and illness could result.
example.tran: 忽略早期征兆可能会导致疾病。

collins.def: A result is the situation that exists at the end of a contest.

example.ex: 'What was the result?' — 'One-nil to Leeds.'...
example.tran: “比赛结果怎样？”——“利兹队以1比0获胜。”

example.ex: The final election results will be announced on Friday.
example.tran: 选举的最终结果将在周五宣布。

collins.def: A result is the number that you get when you do a calculation.

example.ex: They found their computers producing different results from exactly the same calculation.
example.tran: 他们发现他们的计算机进行完全相同的计算会得出不同的结果。

collins.def: Your results are the marks or grades that you get for examinations you have taken.

example.ex: Kate's exam results were excellent.
example.tran: 凯特的考试成绩非常出色。

collins.def: When you return to a place, you go back there after you have been away.

example.ex: Blair will return to London tonight...
example.tran: 今晚布莱尔将返回伦敦。

example.ex: Our correspondent Stephen Sackur has just returned from the camps on the border...
example.tran: 我们的通讯记者斯蒂芬·萨克刚从边境的营地回来。

collins.def: Your return is your arrival back at a place where you had been before.

example.ex: Ryle explained the reason for his sudden return to London.
example.tran: 赖尔解释了他突然返回伦敦的原因。

collins.def: If you return something that you have borrowed or taken, you give it back or put it back.

example.ex: I enjoyed the book and said so when I returned it...
example.tran: 我喜欢这本书，并且在还书时也这样说了。

example.ex: The car was not returned on time, then was reported stolen.
example.tran: 这辆车没有按时归还，然后就报失了。

collins.def: If you return something somewhere, you put it back where it was.

example.ex: He returned the notebook to his jacket.
example.tran: 他把笔记本放回到他的夹克里。

collins.def: If you return someone's action, you do the same thing to them as they have just done to you. If you return someone's feeling, you feel the same way towards them as they feel towards you.

example.ex: Back at the station the Chief Inspector returned the call...
example.tran: 探长回到警察局后回了电话。

example.ex: She will be disappointed if her feelings are not returned.
example.tran: 如果她的感情得不到回报，她会感到非常失望。

collins.def: If a feeling or situation returns, it comes back or happens again after a period when it was not present.

example.ex: Official reports in Algeria suggest that calm is returning to the country...
example.tran: 阿尔及利亚的官方报告表明这个国家正在恢复往日的平静。

example.ex: The pain returned in waves.
example.tran: 疼痛又如潮水般阵阵袭来。

collins.def: If you return to a state that you were in before, you start being in that state again.

example.ex: Life has improved and returned to normal.
example.tran: 生活已经改善并恢复了正常。

collins.def: If you return to a subject that you have mentioned before, you begin talking about it again.

example.ex: The power of the Church is one theme all these writers return to.
example.tran: 所有这些作家都回归到了教会权力这个主题上。

collins.tran: 重新开始，继续（某项活动）
collins.def: If you return to an activity that you were doing before, you start doing it again.

example.ex: At that stage he will be 52, young enough to return to politics if he wishes to do so.
example.tran: 那时他将会是52岁，还很年轻，如果他希望的话，仍可重返政坛。

collins.def: When a judge or jury returns a verdict, they announce whether they think the person on trial is guilty or not.

example.ex: They returned a verdict of not guilty.
example.tran: 他们宣布了无罪的判决。

collins.def: A return ticket is a ticket for a journey from one place to another and then back again.

example.ex: He bought a return ticket and boarded the next train for home.
example.tran: 他买了往返票，并登上了下一趟回家的火车。

collins.def: The return trip or journey is the part of a journey that takes you back to where you started from.

example.ex: Buy an extra ticket for the return trip.
example.tran: 多买一张返程票。

collins.def: The return on an investment is the profit that you get from it.

example.ex: Profits have picked up this year but the return on capital remains tiny...
example.tran: 今年的利润已经回升，但是资本收益仍然很少。

example.ex: Higher returns and higher risk usually go hand in hand.
example.tran: 更高的收益通常伴随着更高的风险。

collins.def: A tax return is an official form that you fill in with details about your income and personal situation, so that the income tax you owe can be calculated.

example.ex: He was convicted of filing false income tax returns...
example.tran: 他因为在纳税申报表上作假而被定罪。

example.ex: Anyone with slight complications in their tax affairs is likely to be asked to fill in a return.
example.tran: 任何在税务方面情况稍微复杂的人都可能要填写税收申报表。

collins.def: Returns are the results of votes after an election.

example.ex: Early returns show Bulgaria's opposition party may have won.
example.tran: 早期的选举结果表明保加利亚的反对党可能已获胜。

collins.tran: (生日祝词)生日快乐，长命百岁
collins.def: When it is someone's birthday, people sometimes say 'Many happy returns' to them as a way of greeting them.
If you do something in return for what someone else has done for you, you do it because they did that thing for you.

example.ex: You pay regular premiums and in return the insurance company will pay out a lump sum.
example.tran: 你定期支付保险费，而保险公司则会一次性给你一笔钱作为回报。

example.ex: The deal offers an increase in policy value in return for giving up guarantees.
example.tran: 作为放弃担保的交换，这笔交易将提高保单价值。

collins.tran: 不能回头的地步;无路可退
collins.def: If you say that you have reached the point of no return, you mean that you now have to continue with what you are doing and it is too late to stop.

example.ex: The release of Mr Nelson Mandela marked the point of no return in South Africa's movement away from apartheid.
example.tran: 纳尔逊·曼德拉先生的释放标志着南非种族隔离政策一去不复返。

collins.def: If something rises, it moves upwards.

example.ex: He watched the smoke rise from his cigarette...
example.tran: 他注视着烟雾从香烟上升起。

example.ex: The powdery dust rose in a cloud around him.
example.tran: 一团粉尘在他周围扬起。

collins.def: When you rise, you stand up.

example.ex: Luther rose slowly from the chair...
example.tran: 卢瑟慢慢地从椅子上站起来。

example.ex: He looked at Livy and Mark, who had risen to greet him.
example.tran: 他看着站起来跟他打招呼的莉薇和马克。

collins.def: When you rise, you get out of bed.

example.ex: Tony had risen early and gone to the cottage to work.
example.tran: 托尼很早就起来去小屋干活了。

collins.def: When the sun or moon rises, it appears in the sky.

example.ex: He wanted to be over the line of the ridge before the sun had risen.
example.tran: 他想在太阳升起以前翻过山脊。

collins.def: You can say that something rises when it appears as a large tall shape.

example.ex: The building rose before him, tall and stately...
example.tran: 那座高大宏伟的建筑耸立在他面前。

example.ex: The towers rise out of a concrete podium.
example.tran: 这些塔楼耸立在一个混凝土墩座上。

collins.def: If the level of something such as the water in a river rises, it becomes higher.

example.ex: The waters continue to rise as more than 1,000 people are evacuated.
example.tran: 水面持续上涨，已经有1,000多人被疏散了。

example.ex: ...the tides rise and fall.
example.tran: 潮水时涨时落。

collins.def: If land rises, it slopes upwards.

example.ex: He looked up the slope of land that rose from the house...
example.tran: 他抬头看了看屋后的斜坡。

example.ex: The ground begins to rise some 20 yards away...
example.tran: 地面在20码开外的地方开始升高。

collins.def: A rise is an area of ground that slopes upwards.

example.ex: The pub itself was on a rise, commanding views across the countryside...
example.tran: 酒吧本身就建在一个斜坡上，可以俯眺乡村风光。

example.ex: I climbed to the top of a rise overlooking the ramparts.
example.tran: 我爬到了一个可以俯瞰护城墙的坡顶。

collins.def: If an amount rises, it increases.

example.ex: Pre-tax profits rose from £842,000 to £1.82m...
example.tran: 税前利润从84.2万英镑上升到了182万英镑。

example.ex: Tourist trips of all kinds in Britain rose by 10.5% between 1977 and 1987...
example.tran: 英国各种旅游项目在1977至1987年间增多了10.5%。

collins.def: A rise in the amount of something is an increase in it.

example.ex: ...the prospect of another rise in interest rates...
example.tran: 利率可能会再次上涨

example.ex: Foreign nationals have begun leaving because of a sharp rise in violence.
example.tran: 因为暴力活动的急剧增加，外国人已经开始离开这个国家。

collins.def: A rise is an increase in your wages or your salary.

example.ex: He will get a pay rise of nearly £4,000.
example.tran: 他的工资将会上涨将近4,000英镑。

collins.tran: (运动或活动的)兴起,抬头，高涨
collins.def: The rise of a movement or activity is an increase in its popularity or influence.

example.ex: ...the rise of racism in America.
example.tran: 美国种族主义的抬头

example.ex: ...the rise of home ownership.
example.tran: 购房者的增多

collins.def: If the wind rises, it becomes stronger.

example.ex: The wind was still rising, approach-ing a force nine gale.
example.tran: 风力仍在增强，接近9级大风。

collins.def: If a sound rises or if someone's voice rises, it becomes louder or higher.

example.ex: 'Bernard?' Her voice rose hysterically...
example.tran: “伯纳德？”她歇斯底里地提高了嗓门。

example.ex: His voice rose almost to a scream.
example.tran: 他提高了嗓门，几乎在尖叫。

collins.def: If a sound rises from a group of people, it comes from them.

example.ex: There were low, muffled voices rising from the hallway.
example.tran: 从走廊里隐约传来了低沉的说话声。

collins.def: If an emotion rises in someone, they suddenly feel it very intensely so that it affects their behaviour.

example.ex: A tide of emotion rose and clouded his judgement...
example.tran: 心头涌起一阵强烈的感情，模糊了他的判断力。

example.ex: The thought made anger rise in him and he went into a bar and had a double whisky.
example.tran: 这个想法让他怒火直冒，于是他去了一家酒吧，要了双份的威士忌。

collins.tran: (因为生气、尴尬或兴奋)脸红，涨红脸
collins.def: If your colour rises or if a blush rises in your cheeks, you turn red because you feel angry, embarrassed, or excited.

example.ex: Amy felt the colour rising in her cheeks at the thought.
example.tran: 埃米一想到这件事，就觉得脸红。

collins.def: When the people in a country rise, they try to defeat the government or army that is controlling them.

example.ex: The National Convention has promised armed support to any people who wish to rise against armed oppression.
example.tran: 国民议会承诺向所有想要反抗武装压迫的人提供武装支持。

collins.tran: 升职;升迁;地位提高;变得更成功
collins.def: If someone rises to a higher position or status, they become more important, successful, or powerful.

example.ex: She is a strong woman who has risen to the top of a deeply sexist organisation...
example.tran: 她是一个女强人，已经升至一个性别歧视意识根深蒂固的组织的最高层。

example.ex: From an unlikely background he has risen rapidly through the ranks of government.
example.tran: 虽然没有什么背景，但他在政府中的地位仍然迅速提高。

collins.tran: 升迁;日益成功;地位的提高
collins.def: The rise of someone is the process by which they become more important, successful, or powerful.

example.ex: Haig's rise was fuelled by an all-consuming sense of patriotic duty...
example.tran: 黑格非常强烈的爱国主义责任感使他的地位大大提高了。

example.ex: The group celebrated the regime's rise to power in 1979.
example.tran: 这个集团庆祝该政府于1979年上台执政。

collins.def: If something gives rise to an event or situation, it causes that event or situation to happen.

example.ex: Low levels of choline in the body can give rise to high blood-pressure...
example.tran: 体内胆碱水平过低会引起高血压。

example.ex: The picture gave rise to speculation that the three were still alive and being held captive.
example.tran: 这张照片让人们猜测这3个人还活着，而且被囚禁起来了。

collins.def: A road is a long piece of hard ground which is built between two places so that people can drive or ride easily from one place to the other.

example.ex: There was very little traffic on the roads...
example.tran: 这些公路上车辆稀少。

example.ex: We just go straight up the Bristol Road...
example.tran: 我们就沿着布里斯托尔大道直走。

collins.def: The road to a particular result is the means of achieving it or the process of achieving it.

example.ex: We are bound to see some ups and downs along the road to recovery.
example.tran: 在经济复苏的过程中，我们一定会经历一些曲折起伏。

collins.def: If you hit the road, you set out on a journey.

example.ex: I was relieved to get back in the car and hit the road again.
example.tran: 回到车里重新上路后，我松了一口气。

collins.def: If you are on the road, you are going on a long journey or a series of journeys by road.

example.ex: He hoped to get a new truck and go back on the road.
example.tran: 他希望能有一辆新的卡车，重新上路。

collins.def: If you say that someone is on the road to something, you mean that they are likely to achieve it.

example.ex: The government took another step on the road to political reform.
example.tran: 政府在实现政治改革的路上又迈进了一步。

example.ex: ...the stunning fashion pictures which launched unknown teenager Jane March on the road to stardom.
example.tran: 让名不见经传的少女简·马奇走向成名之路的惊艳的时装照片

collins.def: If you have a role in a situation or in society, you have a particular position and function in it.

example.ex: ...the drug's role in preventing more serious effects of infection...
example.tran: 这种药物在防止感染加重方面的作用

example.ex: Both sides have roles to play.
example.tran: 双方都各有自己的角色。

collins.def: A role is one of the characters that an actor or singer can play in a film, play, or opera.

example.ex: She has just landed the lead role in The Young Vic's latest production...
example.tran: 她刚刚获得在小维克剧院上演的最新作品中出演女主角的机会。

example.ex: Shakespearean women's roles were originally written to be played by men.
example.tran: 莎士比亚笔下的女性角色在创作之初是打算由男性来扮演的。

collins.tran: 房间;屋子;室;房间里的所有人
collins.def: A room is one of the separate sections or parts of the inside of a building. Rooms have their own walls, ceilings, floors, and doors, and are usually used for particular activities. You can refer to all the people who are in a room as the room .

example.ex: A minute later he excused himself and left the room...
example.tran: 一分钟之后，他说了声抱歉就离开了房间。

example.ex: Downstairs are two small rooms: a kitchen and a sitting room...
example.tran: 楼下是两个小房间：一个厨房和一个起居室。

collins.tran: 私人房间（尤指卧室或办公室）
collins.def: If you talk about your room, you are referring to the room that you alone use, especially your bedroom at home or your office at work.

example.ex: If you're running upstairs, go to my room and bring down my sweater, please.
example.tran: 如果你上楼，麻烦到我的房间把我的毛衣拿下来。

collins.def: A room is a bedroom in a hotel.

example.ex: Toni booked a room in an hotel not far from Arzfeld.
example.tran: 托妮在离阿茨费尔德不远的一家宾馆订了一个房间。

collins.def: If you room with someone, you share a rented room, apartment, or house with them, for example when you are a student.

example.ex: I had roomed with him in New Haven when we were both at Yale Law School.
example.tran: 我和他都在耶鲁法学院读书的时候，在纽黑文合租了一个房间。

collins.def: If there is room somewhere, there is enough empty space there for people or things to be fitted in, or for people to move freely or do what they want to.

example.ex: There is usually room to accommodate up to 80 visitors...
example.tran: 那里通常可以住得下80位来客。

example.ex: There wasn't enough room in the baggage compartment for all the gear...
example.tran: 行李舱没有足够的空间放下所有的工具。

collins.def: If there is room for a particular kind of behaviour or action, people are able to behave in that way or to take that action.

example.ex: The intensity of the work left little room for personal grief or anxiety...
example.tran: 高强度的工作使人几乎没空去悲伤或者忧虑。

example.ex: Once the plaster was dry there was no room for correction...
example.tran: 一旦灰泥一干，就没有机会修改了。

collins.tran: 作出改变的机会;回旋的余地
collins.def: If you have room for manoeuvre, you have the opportunity to change your plans if it becomes necessary or desirable.

example.ex: With an election looming, he has little room for manoeuvre.
example.tran: 随着大选临近，他几乎没有什么回旋的余地了。

collins.def: Rules are instructions that tell you what you are allowed to do and what you are not allowed to do.

example.ex: ...a thirty-two-page pamphlet explaining the rules of basketball...
example.tran: 说明篮球规则的32页的小册子

example.ex: Sikhs were expected to adhere strictly to the religious rules concerning appearance...
example.tran: 锡克教徒应当严格遵守该教对外表的规定。

collins.tran: 行事准则;指导方针;应做的事
collins.def: A rule is a statement telling people what they should do in order to achieve success or a benefit of some kind.

example.ex: An important rule is to drink plenty of water during any flight...
example.tran: 一条重要的原则就是每次坐飞机都要多喝水。

example.ex: By and large, the rules for healthy eating are the same during pregnancy as at any other time.
example.tran: 总的来说，怀孕期间健康饮食的原则和其他时期是一致的。

collins.def: The rules of something such as a language or a science are statements that describe the way that things usually happen in a particular situation.

example.ex: It is a rule of English that adjectives generally precede the noun they modify.
example.tran: 形容词一般放在所修饰名词的前面是英语中的一条规律。

example.ex: ...according to the rules of quantum theory.
example.tran: 根据量子论的原理

collins.def: If something is the rule, it is the normal state of affairs.

example.ex: However, for many Americans today, weekend work has unfortunately become the rule rather than the exception.
example.tran: 然而，现在对于很多美国人来说，周末工作不幸已经成为了一种普遍情况，而非例外。

collins.def: The person or group that rules a country controls its affairs.

example.ex: For four centuries, he says, foreigners have ruled Angola...
example.tran: 他说，外来者统治安哥拉的时间已长达4个世纪。

example.ex: He ruled for eight months.
example.tran: 他统治了8个月的时间。

collins.def: If something rules your life, it influences or restricts your actions in a way that is not good for you.

example.ex: Scientists have always been aware of how fear can rule our lives and make us ill.
example.tran: 科学家一直都很清楚恐惧会影响我们的生活，引起我们身体的不适。

collins.def: When someone in authority rules that something is true or should happen, they state that they have officially decided that it is true or should happen.

example.ex: The court ruled that laws passed by the assembly remained valid...
example.tran: 法院裁定议会通过的法律仍然有效。

example.ex: The Israeli court has not yet ruled on the case...
example.tran: 以色列法院尚未对此案作出裁决。

collins.def: If you rule a straight line, you draw it using something that has a straight edge.

example.ex: ...a ruled grid of horizontal and vertical lines.
example.tran: 由水平线和垂直线画成的格子

collins.def: If you say that something happens as a rule, you mean that it usually happens.

example.ex: As a rule, however, such attacks have been aimed at causing damage rather than taking life.
example.tran: 然而，通常此类袭击只是为了造成破坏，并非要人性命。

example.ex: As a general rule, burglars are wary about gaining entry from the front or side of a building.
example.tran: 通常来说，窃贼对从房屋的正面或侧面潜入会比较谨慎。

collins.tran: 变通规则;放松规定;通融
collins.def: If someone in authority bends the rules or stretches the rules, they do something even though it is against the rules.

example.ex: There is a particular urgency in this case, and it would help if you could bend the rules.
example.tran: 这次碰巧有紧急情况，如果您能通融一下就好了。

collins.tran: (根据实际经验的)粗略估算;经验之谈
collins.def: A rule of thumb is a rule or principle that you follow which is not based on exact calculations, but rather on experience.

example.ex: A good rule of thumb is that a broker must generate sales of ten times his salary if his employer is to make a profit...
example.tran: 根据经验来看，如果雇主要获得利润，那么其代理商必须卖出相当于其工资10倍的销售额。

example.ex: As a rule of thumb, a cup of filter coffee contains about 80mg of caffeine.
example.tran: 凭经验估计，一杯过滤咖啡约含80毫克咖啡因。

collins.def: If workers work to rule, they protest by working according to the rules of their job without doing any extra work or taking any new decisions.

example.ex: Nurses are continuing to work to rule.
example.tran: 护士们还在消极怠工。

collins.def: When you run, you move more quickly than when you walk, for example because you are in a hurry to get somewhere, or for exercise.

example.ex: I excused myself and ran back to the telephone...
example.tran: 我说了声抱歉，跑回到电话机旁。

example.ex: Police believe the gunmen ran off into the woods...
example.tran: 警方认为持枪的歹徒逃到树林里去了。

collins.def: When someone runs in a race, they run in competition with other people.

example.ex: ...when I was running in the New York Marathon...
example.tran: 当我参加纽约的马拉松比赛时

example.ex: Phyllis Smith ran a controlled race to qualify in 51.32 sec.
example.tran: 菲莉丝·史密斯控制好速度，用51.32秒跑完了比赛，获得了参赛资格。

collins.def: When a horse runs in a race or when its owner runs it, it competes in a race.

example.ex: The owner insisted on Cool Ground running in the Gold Cup...
example.tran: 主人坚持要让“酷地”参加金杯赛马会。

example.ex: If we have a wet spell, Cecil could also run Armiger in the Derby.
example.tran: 如果我们遇上持续下雨，塞西尔也能让“扈从”参加德比马赛。

collins.def: If you say that something long, such as a road, runs in a particular direction, you are describing its course or position. You can also say that something runs the length or width of something else.

example.ex: ...the sun-dappled trail which ran through the beech woods.
example.tran: 穿过山毛榉林的阳光斑驳的小路

example.ex: ...a gas-filled glass tube with a thin wire running down the centre...
example.tran: 中部有一根延展的细金属丝的充满气体的玻璃管

collins.tran: 安装(电线、管道等);布线;使（电线、管道等）通过
collins.def: If you run a wire or tube somewhere, you fix it or pull it from, to, or across a particular place.

example.ex: Our host ran a long extension cord out from the house and set up a screen and a projector.
example.tran: 我们的主人从房里牵出一根延长电线，架起屏幕和投影仪。

collins.def: If you run your hand or an object through something, you move your hand or the object through it.

example.ex: He laughed and ran his fingers through his hair...
example.tran: 他笑了，用手指拢了拢他的头发。

example.ex: I ran the brush through my hair and dashed out...
example.tran: 我用刷子刷了一下头发，冲了出去。

collins.tran: 使通过(机器、过程或测试)
collins.def: If you run something through a machine, process, or series of tests, you make it go through the machine, process, or tests.

example.ex: They have gathered the best statistics they can find and run them through their own computers.
example.tran: 他们已经尽力搜集了数据，并将它们输入了自己的计算机。

collins.def: If someone runs for office in an election, they take part as a candidate.

example.ex: It was only last February that he announced he would run for president...
example.tran: 去年2月，他才宣布自己将参加总统竞选。

example.ex: It is no easy job to run against John Glenn, Ohio's Democratic senator...
example.tran: 和俄亥俄州的民主党参议员约翰·格伦竞选绝非易事。

collins.def: A run for office is an attempt to be elected to office.

example.ex: He was already preparing his run for the presidency.
example.tran: 他已经开始为参选总统做准备了。

collins.def: If you run something such as a business or an activity, you are in charge of it or you organize it.

example.ex: His stepfather ran a prosperous paint business...
example.tran: 他的继父经营着一家生意红火的涂料公司。

example.ex: Is this any way to run a country?...
example.tran: 这是治国之道吗？

collins.def: If you talk about how a system, an organization, or someone's life is running, you are saying how well it is operating or progressing.

example.ex: Officials in charge of the camps say the system is now running extremely smoothly.
example.tran: 负责这些营地的官员们说现在这一体系运转得非常顺利。

example.ex: ...the staff who have kept the bank running.
example.tran: 保证银行正常运营的员工

collins.def: If you run an experiment, computer program, or other process, or start it running, you start it and let it continue.

example.ex: He ran a lot of tests and it turned out I had an infection called mycoplasma...
example.tran: 他进行了多项检查，最后证明我感染了支原体。

example.ex: You can check your program one command at a time while it's running.
example.tran: 你可以在程序运行期间，逐条输入命令以对程序进行检查。

collins.def: When you run a cassette or video tape or when it runs, it moves through the machine as the machine operates.

example.ex: He pushed the play button again and ran the tape...
example.tran: 他又按下了播放键播放磁带。

example.ex: The tape had run to the end but recorded nothing.
example.tran: 磁带已经转到头了，但是什么也没录上。

collins.def: When a machine is running or when you are running it, it is switched on and is working.

example.ex: He had failed to realise that the tape recorder was still running...
example.tran: 他没有意识到录音机还在录。

example.ex: We told him to wait out front with the engine running.
example.tran: 我们告诉他在外边等着，不要熄火。

collins.tran: (机器或设备靠某种能源)运转，开动
collins.def: A machine or equipment that runs on or off a particular source of energy functions using that source of energy.

example.ex: Black cabs run on diesel...
example.tran: 黑色的出租车使用柴油。

example.ex: Rows of stalls are given over to restaurants running off gas cylinders.
example.tran: 数排摊位都让位给了使用煤气罐的饭店。

collins.def: If you run a car or a piece of equipment, you have it and use it.

example.ex: I ran a 1960 Rover 100 from 1977 until 1983.
example.tran: 我从1977年到1983年一直开着一辆1960年产的罗孚100。

collins.tran: (火车、公交车等沿固定路线)行驶
collins.def: When you say that vehicles such as trains and buses run from one place to another, you mean they regularly travel along that route.

example.ex: A shuttle bus runs frequently between the Inn and the Country Club.
example.tran: 一辆区间公交车频繁地往返于这家旅馆和那个乡村俱乐部。

example.ex: ...a government which can't make the trains run on time.
example.tran: 不能让火车准点运行的政府

collins.def: If you run someone somewhere in a car, you drive them there.

example.ex: Could you run me up to Baltimore?
example.tran: 你能开车送我到巴尔的摩吗？

collins.def: If you run over or down to a place that is quite near, you drive there.

example.ex: I'll run over to Short Mountain and check on Mrs Adams.
example.tran: 我会开车去肖特山看看亚当斯夫人。

collins.def: A run is a journey somewhere.

example.ex: A run to Southampton showed the car was capable of a reasonable journey.
example.tran: 南安普敦之行表明这辆车还是挺能跑的。

example.ex: ...doing the morning school run.
example.tran: 早上去学校

collins.def: If a liquid runs in a particular direction, it flows in that direction.

example.ex: Tears were running down her cheeks...
example.tran: 泪水滑过她的脸庞。

example.ex: There were cisterns to catch rainwater as it ran off the castle walls...
example.tran: 雨水顺着城堡的墙壁流下时会流入蓄水池。

collins.def: If you run water, or if you run a tap or a bath, you cause water to flow from a tap.

example.ex: She went to the sink and ran water into her empty glass...
example.tran: 她走到水槽边，把空玻璃杯灌上水。

example.ex: They heard him running the kitchen tap...
example.tran: 他们听见他打开了厨房里的水龙头。

collins.def: If a tap or a bath is running, water is coming out of a tap.

example.ex: You must have left a tap running in the bathroom...
example.tran: 你肯定忘了关浴室的龙头了。

example.ex: He came fully awake to hear the bath running.
example.tran: 他完全清醒了，听见浴缸里的水在流。

collins.def: If your nose is running, liquid is flowing out of it, usually because you have a cold.

example.ex: Timothy was crying, mostly from exhaustion, and his nose was running.
example.tran: 蒂莫西正在哭泣，主要是因为太累了，而且他还流着鼻涕。

collins.def: If a surface is running with a liquid, that liquid is flowing down it.

example.ex: After an hour he realised he was completely running with sweat...
example.tran: 一个小时后，他发现自己已经大汗淋漓了。

example.ex: The window panes were running with condensation.
example.tran: 凝结的水珠在窗玻璃上流动。

collins.def: If the dye in some cloth or the ink on some paper runs, it comes off or spreads when the cloth or paper gets wet.

example.ex: The ink had run on the wet paper.
example.tran: 墨迹在湿纸上浸开了。

collins.def: If a feeling runs through your body or a thought runs through your mind, you experience it or think it quickly.

example.ex: She felt a surge of excitement run through her...
example.tran: 她突然觉得浑身激动。

example.ex: All sorts of thoughts were running through my head.
example.tran: 各种各样的想法在我的脑海里闪过。

collins.tran: （感觉或吵闹声）扩散，弥漫，传遍
collins.def: If a feeling or noise runs through a group of people, it spreads among them.

example.ex: A buzz of excitement ran through the crowd.
example.tran: 一时间群情激昂。

collins.def: If a theme or feature runs through something such as someone's actions or writing, it is present in all of it.

example.ex: Another thread running through this series is the role of doctors in the treatment of the mentally ill...
example.tran: 另一条贯穿这部连续剧的主线是医生在治疗精神病患者中起到的作用。

example.ex: ...the theme running through the book...
example.tran: 贯穿全书始终的主题

collins.def: When newspapers or magazines run a particular item or story or if it runs, it is published or printed.

example.ex: The newspaper ran a series of four editorials entitled 'The Choice of Our Lives.'
example.tran: 这份报纸刊登了4篇社论连载，题为《我们生活的选择》。

example.ex: ...an editorial that ran this weekend entitled 'Mr. Cuomo Backs Out.'
example.tran: 本周末刊登的题为《科莫先生退出了》的社论

collins.def: You can use run to indicate that you are quoting someone else's words or ideas.

example.ex: 'Whoa, I'm goin' to Barbay-dos!' ran the jaunty lyrics of a 1970s hit song.
example.tran: “喔，我要去巴巴多斯!”一首20世纪70年代流行歌曲这样欢快地唱道。

collins.def: If an amount is running at a particular level, it is at that level.

example.ex: Today's RPI figure shows inflation running at 10.9 per cent...
example.tran: 今天的零售物价指数显示通货膨胀率为10.9％。

example.ex: The deficit is now running at about 300 million dollars a year.
example.tran: 现在，每年的赤字约达3亿美元。

collins.def: If a play, event, or legal contract runs for a particular period of time, it lasts for that period of time.

example.ex: It pleased critics but ran for only three years in the West End...
example.tran: 它得到了评论家们的好评，但只在伦敦西区上映了3年的时间。

example.ex: The contract was to run from 1992 to 2020...
example.tran: 这份合同在1992年至2020年间有效。

collins.tran: 占用(多于、等于或少于预定的时间)
collins.def: If someone or something is running late, they have taken more time than had been planned. If they are running to time or ahead of time, they have taken the time planned or less than the time planned.

example.ex: Tell her I'll call her back later, I'm running late again...
example.tran: 告诉她我过会儿会给她回电话，我又要晚了。

example.ex: The steward will be able to tell you whether the event is running to time or is ahead of schedule.
example.tran: 组织者会告诉你活动是如期举行还是会提前。

collins.def: If you are running a temperature or a fever, you have a high temperature because you are ill.

example.ex: The little girl is running a fever and she needs help.
example.tran: 这个小女孩发烧了，需要帮助。

collins.tran: (演出或电视节目的)上映期，放映期
collins.def: A run of a play or television programme is the period of time during which performances are given or programmes are shown.

example.ex: The show will transfer to the West End on October 9, after a month's run in Birmingham...
example.tran: 演出在伯明翰上映一个月后，将于10月9日转到伦敦西区。

example.ex: Meanwhile, Dusty Springfield's new TV series began a run on BBC 1.
example.tran: 同时，达斯蒂·斯普林菲尔德的电视剧新作开始在BBC1台播放。

collins.tran: 一系列，一连串(成功或失败等)
collins.def: A run of successes or failures is a series of successes or failures.

example.ex: The England skipper is haunted by a run of low scores...
example.tran: 英格兰队的队长得了一连串的低分。

example.ex: The Scottish Tories' run of luck is holding.
example.tran: 苏格兰保守党人一直好运连连。

collins.tran: 额定产量;单次生产数额
collins.def: A run of a product is the amount that a company or factory decides to produce at one time.

example.ex: Wayne plans to increase the print run to 1,000...
example.tran: 韦恩打算将印量增加到1,000册。

example.ex: Their defense markets are too small to sustain economically viable production runs.
example.tran: 他们的国防市场太小，就经济可行性而言不足以维持生产。

collins.tran: (板球或棒球运动中击球后跑动得到的)一分
collins.def: In cricket or baseball, a run is a score of one, which is made by players running between marked places on the field after hitting the ball.

example.ex: At 20 he became the youngest player to score 2,000 runs in a season.
example.tran: 他20岁时就成为了在一个赛季中获得2,000分的最年轻的选手。

collins.tran: 自由出入的权力;随意使用的权力
collins.def: If someone gives you the run of a place, they give you permission to go where you like in it and use it as you wish.

example.ex: He had the run of the house and the pool.
example.tran: 他可以随意使用这座房子和游泳池。

collins.def: If you say that someone or something is different from the average run or common run of people or things, you mean that they are different from ordinary people or things.

example.ex: ...a man who was outside the common run of professional athletes at the time.
example.tran: 当时非同寻常的专业运动员

example.ex: ...trying to accomplish the usual run of maintenance jobs and write a column too.
example.tran: 努力做好维修工的同时还写一个专栏

collins.def: If there is a run on something, a lot of people want to buy it or get it at the same time.

example.ex: A run on sterling has killed off hopes of a rate cut...
example.tran: 对英镑的抢购已经完全扼杀了降低汇率的希望。

example.ex: Loss of confidence could trigger a run on Citibank that would threaten the entire financial system.
example.tran: 民众信心的丧失可能导致花旗银行出现挤兑，从而威胁到整个金融体系。

collins.def: A ski run or bobsleigh run is a course or route that has been designed for skiing or for riding in a bobsleigh.

collins.tran: 爆冷门;逆转局势;出乎意料
collins.def: If something happens against the run of play or against the run of events, it is different from what is generally happening in a game or situation.

example.ex: The decisive goal arrived against the run of play...
example.tran: 这个决定性的得分逆转了场上的局势。

example.ex: Against the run of the polls, the Socialist Workers' Party won Sunday's general election by an unexpectedly large margin.
example.tran: 工人社会党逆转乾坤，出乎意料地以较大优势获得了星期天大选的胜利。

collins.tran: （比赛或竞争中）几乎击败，和…相差无几
collins.def: If you run someone close ,run them a close second, or run a close second, you almost beat them in a race or competition.

example.ex: The Under-21 team has defeated Wales and Scotland this season, and ran England very close...
example.tran: 在这个赛季中，21岁以下代表队已经打败了威尔士队和苏格兰队，和英格兰队的比分也非常接近。

example.ex: The party won at least one county, and ran a close second in several others.
example.tran: 该党派至少在一个郡获胜，而在其他几个郡也和第一名相距甚微。

collins.def: If a river or well runs dry, it no longer has any water in it. If an oil well runs dry, it no longer produces any oil.

example.ex: Streams had run dry for the first time in memory.
example.tran: 记忆中，小溪第一次干涸了。

collins.tran: (信息或金钱的来源)枯竭，用完
collins.def: If a source of information or money runs dry, no more information or money can be obtained from it.

example.ex: Three days into production, the kitty had run dry.
example.tran: 才投产3天凑集的钱就用光了。

collins.def: If a characteristic runs in someone's family, it often occurs in members of that family, in different generations.

example.ex: The insanity which ran in his family haunted him.
example.tran: 家族遗传的精神错乱困扰着他。

collins.def: If you make a run for it or if you run for it, you run away in order to escape from someone or something.

example.ex: A helicopter hovered overhead as one of the gang made a run for it...
example.tran: 当其中一个匪徒逃跑的时候，一架直升机在空中盘旋。

example.ex: Cody, get out, run for it.
example.tran: 科迪，快出去，快跑。

collins.def: If people's feelings are running high, they are very angry, concerned, or excited.

example.ex: Feelings there have been running high in the wake of last week's killing.
example.tran: 上周的谋杀案发生后，那里的人们群情激愤。

collins.tran: 从长远来看/从短期来看
collins.def: If you talk about what will happen in the long run, you are saying what you think will happen over a long period of time in the future. If you talk about what will happen in the short run, you are saying what you think will happen in the near future.

example.ex: Sometimes expensive drugs or other treatments can be economical in the long run...
example.tran: 有时昂贵的药物或其他治疗方法从长远来看可能是比较划算的。

example.ex: In fact, things could get worse in the short run.
example.tran: 事实上，事情在短期内可能会变得更加糟糕。

collins.tran: （因害怕而）躲得远远的，极力逃避
collins.def: If you say that someone would run a mile if faced with something, you mean that they are very frightened of it and would try to avoid it.

example.ex: Yasmin admits she would run a mile if Mark asked her out.
example.tran: 亚丝明承认如果马克约她出去的话，她会极力躲避。

collins.def: If you say that someone could give someone else a run for their money, you mean you think they are almost as good as the other person.

example.ex: ...a youngster who even now could give Meryl Streep a run for her money.
example.tran: 当下甚至能和梅丽尔·斯特里普媲美的一位年轻人

collins.def: If someone is on the run, they are trying to escape or hide from someone such as the police or an enemy.

example.ex: Fifteen-year-old Danny is on the run from a local authority home.
example.tran: 15岁的丹尼从地方当局的收容所逃跑了。

collins.tran: (在比赛中)彻底落败，遭受挫败
collins.def: If someone is on the run, they are being severely defeated in a contest or competition.

example.ex: His opponents believe he is definitely on the run...
example.tran: 对手认为他必败无疑。

example.ex: I knew I had him on the run.
example.tran: 我知道我彻底打败了他。

collins.def: If you say that a person or group is running scared, you mean that they are frightened of what someone might do to them or what might happen.

example.ex: The administration is running scared.
example.tran: 管理部门的人吓坏了。

collins.def: If you are running short of something or running low on something, you do not have much of it left. If a supply of something is running short or running low, there is not much of it left.

example.ex: Government forces are running short of ammunition and fuel...
example.tran: 政府军队的弹药和燃料都所剩无几了。

example.ex: We are running low on drinking water...
example.tran: 我们的饮用水不多了。

collins.def: The sale of goods is the act of selling them for money.

example.ex: Efforts were made to limit the sale of alcohol.
example.tran: 过去曾采取措施限制酒的销售。

example.ex: ...a proposed arms sale to Saudi Arabia...
example.tran: 拟议对沙特阿拉伯出售武器

collins.def: The sales of a product are the quantity of it that is sold.

example.ex: The newspaper has sales of 1.72 million.
example.tran: 该报纸有 172 万份的销量。

example.ex: ...the huge Christmas sales of computer games.
example.tran: 电脑游戏在圣诞期间的巨额销量

collins.def: The part of a company that deals with sales deals with selling the company's products.

example.ex: Until 1983 he worked in sales and marketing...
example.tran: 1983 年之前，他一直在市场营销部工作。

example.ex: She was their Dusseldorf sales manager.
example.tran: 她是他们驻杜塞尔多夫的销售部经理。

collins.def: A sale is an occasion when a shop sells things at less than their normal price.

example.ex: ...a pair of jeans bought half-price in a sale...
example.tran: 打折时半价买的一条牛仔裤

example.ex: Many stores have started their January sales a month early.
example.tran: 许多商店提前一个月就开始了一月份的特价促销活动。

collins.def: A sale is an event when goods are sold to the person who offers the highest price.

example.ex: The painting was bought by dealers at the Christie's sale.
example.tran: 这幅油画在佳士得的拍卖会上被交易商拍走。

collins.def: If something is for sale, it is being offered to people to buy.

example.ex: His former home is for sale at £495,000...
example.tran: 他的旧居要以 49.5 万英镑的价格出售。

example.ex: There was a Leica camera for sale in the window...
example.tran: 橱窗里有架莱卡相机待售。

collins.def: Products that are on sale can be bought in shops.

example.ex: English textbooks and dictionaries are on sale everywhere...
example.tran: 英语教材和词典到处都有卖的。

example.ex: All tickets go on sale this Friday.
example.tran: 所有票在本星期五开始销售。

collins.def: If products in a shop are on sale, they can be bought for less than their normal price.

example.ex: He bought a sports jacket on sale at Gowings Men's Store.
example.tran: 他在高英斯男装店买了一件打折的运动上衣。

collins.def: If a property or company is up for sale, its owner is trying to sell it.

example.ex: The castle has been put up for sale.
example.tran: 该城堡已经对外出售。

collins.def: If two or more things, actions, or qualities are the same, or if one is the same as another, they are very like each other in some way.

example.ex: The houses were all the same — square, close to the street, needing paint...
example.tran: 房子都一模一样——方方正正、临近街道、需要粉刷。

example.ex: In essence, all computers are the same...
example.tran: 所有的电脑其实都一样。

collins.def: If something is happening the same as something else, the two things are happening in a way that is similar or exactly the same.

example.ex: I mean, it's a relationship, the same as a marriage is a relationship...
example.tran: 我的意思是它是一种人际关系，就如同婚姻也是一种人际关系一样。

example.ex: I want to go home having won a game of football the same as you leave the ground and you want to go away with your team having won...
example.tran: 你希望离开赛场的时候自己的球队取得了胜利，同样我也想赢了一场球赛再回家。

collins.def: You use same to indicate that you are referring to only one place, time, or thing, and not to different ones.

example.ex: Bernard works at the same institution as Arlette...
example.tran: 伯纳德和阿莱特在同一家机构工作。

example.ex: It's impossible to get everybody together at the same time...
example.tran: 让所有人同时聚在一起是不可能的。

collins.tran: 无变化的;一成不变的;千篇一律的
collins.def: Something that is still the same has not changed in any way.

example.ex: Taking ingredients from the same source means the beers stay the same...
example.tran: 取材自同一原材料意味着啤酒的口味始终如一。

example.ex: Only 17% said the economy would improve, but 25% believed it would stay the same.
example.tran: 仅 17% 的人说经济状况会改善，却有25% 的人认为经济会维持老样子。

collins.def: You use the same to refer to something that has previously been mentioned or suggested.

example.ex: We made the decision which was right for us. Other parents must do the same...
example.tran: 我们作出了对于我们而言正确的决定。其他父母也必须这么做。

example.ex: In the United States small specialised bookshops survive quite well. The same applies to small publishers...
example.tran: 美国的小型专业书店经营状况不错。小型出版社也是如此。

collins.tran: (用于商业信件、法案等文件中)上述事物，上述情况
collins.def: You use same to refer to something that has already been mentioned in a document such as a business letter or bill.

example.ex: Wrist watches: £100. Inscription of same: £15.
example.tran: 腕表: 100英镑。在其上刻字: 15英镑。

collins.def: You say 'same here' in order to suggest that you feel the same way about something as the person who has just spoken to you, or that you have done the same thing.

example.ex: 'Nice to meet you,' said Michael. 'Same here,' said Mary Ann...
example.tran: “很高兴见到你，”迈克尔说。“我也是，”玛丽·安说。

example.ex: 'I hate going into stores.' — 'Same here,' said William.
example.tran: “我讨厌进商店。”——“我也一样，”威廉说。

collins.tran: 你也一样，你也是(用于致以同样的祝愿)
collins.def: You say 'same to you' in response to someone who wishes you well with something.

example.ex: 'Have a nice Easter.' — 'And the same to you Bridie.'
example.tran: “复活节快乐。”——“你也一样，布赖迪。”

example.ex: 'Goodbye, then, and thanks. Good luck.' — 'The same to you.'
example.tran: “那么，再见，谢谢。祝你好运。”——“也祝你好运。”

collins.def: You say 'same again' when you want to order another drink of the same kind as the one you have just had.

example.ex: Give Roger another pint, Imogen, and I'll have the same again.
example.tran: 再给罗杰来一杯，伊莫金，我也再来一份同样的。

collins.def: You can say all the same or just the same to introduce a statement which indicates that a situation or your opinion has not changed, in spite of what has happened or what has just been said.

example.ex: I arranged to pay him the dollars when he got there, a purely private arrangement. All the same, it was illegal...
example.tran: 我准备等他到那儿时付给他美元，纯属私人安排。不过同样也是非法的。

example.ex: He was unable to pay attention to the papers on his desk. Just the same, he pulled over the stack of papers and started to examine them...
example.tran: 他的心不在桌子上的那一摞试卷上，尽管如此，他还是拽过来开始评阅。

collins.tran: 对我完全一样;对我毫无区别;我都无所谓
collins.def: If you say 'It's all the same to me', you mean that you do not care which of several things happens or is chosen.

example.ex: Whether I've got a moustache or not it's all the same to me...
example.tran: 我留不留胡子都无所谓。

example.ex: What's the difference between a white lie and a lie? I mean, it's all the same to me.
example.tran: 善意的谎言和谎言之间有什么不同？我是说，对于我而言二者完全一样。

collins.def: When two or more people or things are thought to be separate and you say that they are one and the same, you mean that they are in fact one single person or thing.

example.ex: Luckily, Nancy's father and her attorney were one and the same person...
example.tran: 幸运的是，南希的父亲就是她的律师。

example.ex: I'm willing to work for the party because its interests and my interests are one and the same.
example.tran: 我愿意为该党效力，因为它的利益和我的利益完全一致。

collins.tran: 正是这个;同一个人(或事物)
collins.def: You say 'the same' or 'the very same' in reply to someone's question when you are saying that they have identified a person or thing correctly.

example.ex: 'This Sawtry guy, he is John Sawtry?' — 'Yes, sir. The very same.'
example.tran: “这个叫索特里的小伙子，他是约翰·索特里吗？”——“是的，先生。正是他。”

collins.def: When you say something, you speak words.

example.ex: 'I'm sorry,' he said...
example.tran: “对不起，”他说。

example.ex: She said they were very impressed...
example.tran: 她说他们被深深打动了。

collins.tran: (表达观点或陈述事实，否定用法表示婉转暗示某事并非事实)说，表示
collins.def: You use say in expressions such as I would just like to say to introduce what you are actually saying, or to indicate that you are expressing an opinion or admitting a fact. If you state that you can't say something or you wouldn't say something, you are indicating in a polite or indirect way that it is not the case.

example.ex: I would just like to say that this is the most hypocritical thing I have ever heard in my life...
example.tran: 我只想说这是我这辈子听说过的最虚伪的事情。

example.ex: I have to say I didn't even know Fox Lane Police Station existed till about four or five years ago...
example.tran: 我必须承认直到四五年前我才知道有福克斯巷警察局 。

collins.def: You can mention the contents of a piece of writing by mentioning what it says or what someone says in it.

example.ex: The report says there is widespread and routine torture of political prisoners in the country...
example.tran: 这份报告称该国一直普遍存在折磨政治犯的现象。

example.ex: Auntie Winnie wrote back saying Mam wasn't well enough to write...
example.tran: 温妮姨妈回信说妈妈身体尚未康复，无法写信。

collins.def: If you say something to yourself, you think it.

example.ex: Perhaps I'm still dreaming, I said to myself...
example.tran: 也许我还在做梦，我心里想。

example.ex: 'Keep your temper,' he said to himself.
example.tran: “别生气，”他暗暗告诉自己。

collins.def: If you have a say in something, you have the right to give your opinion and influence decisions relating to it.

example.ex: You can get married at sixteen, and yet you haven't got a say in the running of the country...
example.tran: 你 16 岁时可以结婚，但还无权参与国家政事。

example.ex: The students wanted more say in the government of the university.
example.tran: 学生们想更多地参与大学的管理。

collins.tran: (钟、刻度盘、地图等)表明，指向，显示
collins.def: You indicate the information given by something such as a clock, dial, or map by mentioning what it says .

example.ex: The clock said four minutes past eleven...
example.tran: 钟显示时间是 11 点 4 分。

example.ex: The map says there's six of them.
example.tran: 地图上显示共有六处。

collins.def: If something says something about a person, situation, or thing, it gives important information about them.

example.ex: I think that says a lot about how well Seles is playing...
example.tran: 我认为那很能说明塞勒斯表现得有多出色。

example.ex: The appearance of the place and the building says something about the importance of the project.
example.tran: 从周边环境和这幢大楼的外观可以看出这个项目的举足轻重。

collins.def: If something says a lot for a person or thing, it shows that this person or thing is very good or has a lot of good qualities.

example.ex: It says a lot for him that he has raised his game to the level required...
example.tran: 他将比赛技能提至所要求的水平，这说明他颇有能耐。

example.ex: It says much for Brookner's skill that the book is sad, but never depressing.
example.tran: 这本书笔调忧伤，却并不令人沮丧，这很能说明布鲁克纳超群的写作技巧。

collins.tran: (通常表示说话者认为某人优点不多)我会这样形容他们/你可以这样形容他们
collins.def: You use say in expressions such as I'll say that for them and you can say this for them after or before you mention a good quality that someone has, usually when you think they do not have many good qualities.

example.ex: He's usually smartly-dressed, I'll say that for him...
example.tran: 我能说的是，至少他通常穿着入时。

example.ex: At the very least, he is devastatingly sure of himself, you can say that.
example.tran: 至少还可以说，他对自己是深信不疑的。

collins.def: You can use say when you want to discuss something that might possibly happen or be true.

example.ex: Say you could change anything about the world we live in, what would it be?
example.tran: 假定你能对我们所生活的这个世界作出任意改变，你会改变什么呢？

collins.def: You can use say or let's say when you mention something as an example.

example.ex: To see the problem here more clearly, let's look at a different biological system, say, an acorn...
example.tran: 为更清晰地理解此处的问题，我们来看一种不同的生物系统，比如说，橡子。

example.ex: Someone with, say, between 300 and 500 acres could be losing thousands of pounds a year.
example.tran: 比方说，拥有 300 到 500 英亩地的人，可能每年会损失几千英镑。

collins.tran: (用以唤起注意或表示惊讶、高兴、崇敬)嘿，喂，哎呀，啊
collins.def: Say is used to attract someone's attention or to express surprise, pleasure, or admiration.

example.ex: Say, Leo, how would you like to have dinner one night, just you and me?
example.tran: 哎，利奥，找个晚上一起吃顿饭如何，就你和我？

collins.tran: 清楚说明事实;明确表达(…的)感觉
collins.def: If you say that something says it all, you mean that it shows you very clearly the truth about a situation or someone's feelings.

example.ex: This is my third visit in a week, which says it all.
example.tran: 这是我一周内第3次拜访，这说明了一切。

collins.tran: (表示吃惊)不会吧;(亦常表示事实上并不吃惊)我一点也不觉得奇怪，用不着你说也知道
collins.def: You can use 'You don't say' to express surprise at what someone has told you. People often use this expression to indicate that in fact they are not surprised.

example.ex: 'I'm a writer.' — 'You don't say. What kind of book are you writing?'
example.tran: “我是作家。”——“不会吧。你写哪方面的书？”

collins.def: If you say there is a lot to be said for something, you mean you think it has a lot of good qualities or aspects.

example.ex: There's a lot to be said for being based in the country.
example.tran: 把总部设在该国有很多优势。

collins.def: If you say that someone doesn't have much to say for himself or herself, you mean that they are not speaking very much during a conversation.

example.ex: He's never got much to say for himself.
example.tran: 他向来寡言少语。

collins.tran: 你有什么好说的;你有什么要辩解的
collins.def: If someone asks what you have to say for yourself, they are asking what excuse you have for what you have done.

example.ex: 'Well,' she said eventually, 'what have you to say for yourself?'
example.tran: “那么”，她最后说，“你有什么好说的？”

collins.tran: 显而易见;不言而喻;不用说
collins.def: If something goes without saying, it is obvious.

example.ex: It goes without saying that if someone has lung problems they should not smoke.
example.tran: 不用说，有肺病的人不应吸烟。

collins.def: When one of the people or groups involved in a discussion has their say, they give their opinion.

example.ex: The Football Association have had their say.
example.tran: 足协已经发表了意见。

collins.tran: (用于对很多人不喜欢的人或事物表示赞赏时)随你怎么说,不管你怎么认为
collins.def: You use 'Say what you like about someone or something' when you are about to mention one good thing about a person or thing that many people do not like.

example.ex: Say what you like about them, but they did love their Mum.
example.tran: 随你怎么说，但他们确实爱自己的妈妈。

collins.tran: (尤指乐于接受他人刚刚提出要给予自己的东西)我不反对，我没意见，好哇
collins.def: You use 'I wouldn't say no' to indicate that you would like something, especially something that has just been offered to you.

example.ex: I wouldn't say no to a drink.
example.tran: 我倒想喝一杯。

collins.tran: (引出语气更重或更极端的描述)即使不说是…,虽不能说…
collins.def: You can use not to say when adding a stronger or more extreme description than the one you have just used.

example.ex: To those who've never received million dollar royalty cheques, this sounded a little odd, not to say offensive.
example.tran: 对于那些从没有收到过上百万美元版权费的人来说，这听起来就算不令人反感，至少也让人觉得有点儿怪。

collins.def: You use to say nothing of when you mention an additional thing which gives even more strength to the point you are making.

example.ex: Unemployment leads to a sense of uselessness, to say nothing of financial problems.
example.tran: 失业会让人觉得自己一无是处，更何况还会带来经济问题。

collins.tran: (用于提醒别人所说话可能会具有冒犯性或令人震惊)可以说
collins.def: You use shall I say and shall we say in order to warn someone that what you are about to say may cause offence or be surprising.

example.ex: ...whereas when you get older you're rather set in your ways, shall I say...
example.tran: 然而随着年纪渐长，可以说，你的大局已定了。

example.ex: My involvement has not been altogether, shall we say, ethical.
example.tran: 可以说，我的参与还不是完全合乎道德。

collins.tran: 亦即;也就是说;换句话说
collins.def: You use that is to say or that's to say to indicate that you are about to express the same idea more clearly or precisely.

example.ex: ...territories that were occupied in 1967, that is to say, in the West Bank and Gaza.
example.tran: 1967年被占的领土，也就是约旦河西岸和加沙地带的被占领土

collins.tran: 让你说对了;一点没错;我同意;说得太对了
collins.def: You can use 'You can say that again' to express strong agreement with what someone has just said.

example.ex: 'Must have been a fiddly job.' — 'You can say that again.'
example.tran: “那一定是件精细活。”——“说得太对了。”

collins.def: A school is a place where children are educated. You usually refer to this place as school when you are talking about the time that children spend there and the activities that they do there.

example.ex: ...a boy who was in my class at school...
example.tran: 上学时和我一个班的男孩

example.ex: Even the good students say homework is what they most dislike about school...
example.tran: 就连好学生都说上学最讨厌的就是要写家庭作业。

collins.def: A school is the pupils or staff at a school.

example.ex: Deirdre, the whole school's going to hate you.
example.tran: 戴尔德丽，学校里所有人都会恨你的。

example.ex: ...a children's writing competition open to schools or individuals.
example.tran: 可以以学校或个人名义参加的儿童写作比赛

collins.def: A privately-run place where a particular skill or subject is taught can be referred to as a school .

example.ex: ...a riding school and equestrian centre near Chepstow.
example.tran: 在切普斯托附近的一所骑术学校兼马术中心

example.ex: ...the Kingsley School of English.
example.tran: 金斯利英语学校

collins.def: A university, college, or university department specializing in a particular type of subject can be referred to as a school .

example.ex: ...a lecturer in the school of veterinary medicine at the University of Pennsylvania...
example.tran: 宾夕法尼亚大学兽医学系的一名讲师

example.ex: Stella, 21, is at art school training to be a fashion designer.
example.tran: 斯特拉，21 岁，就读于艺术系，正接受时装设计师的培训。

collins.def: School is used to refer to university or college.

example.ex: Moving rapidly through school, he graduated Phi Beta Kappa from the University of Kentucky at age 18.
example.tran: 他连续跳级, 18 岁时就以全美优等生联谊会成员的身份从肯塔基大学毕业。

collins.def: A particular school of writers, artists, or thinkers is a group of them whose work, opinions, or theories are similar.

example.ex: ...the Chicago school of economists...
example.tran: 芝加哥经济学派

example.ex: O'Keeffe was influenced by various painters and photographers, but she was never a member of any school.
example.tran: 欧姬芙受多位画家和摄影家的影响，但她从未加入过任何学派。

collins.def: A school of fish or dolphins is a large group of them moving through water together.
If you school someone in something, you train or educate them to have a certain skill, type of behaviour, or way of thinking.

example.ex: Many mothers schooled their daughters in the myth of female inferiority...
example.tran: 许多母亲把男尊女卑的错误观念传给了她们的女儿。

example.ex: He is schooled to spot trouble.
example.tran: 他受过训练，能够迅速发现问题。

collins.def: To school a child means to educate him or her.

example.ex: She's been schooling her kids herself.
example.tran: 她一直在自己教育孩子。

collins.def: If you school a horse, you train it so that it can be ridden in races or competitions.

example.ex: She bought him as a £1,000 colt of six months and schooled him.
example.tran: 在它还是 6 个月的小马驹时，她用 1,000 英镑将它买下，并训练它。

collins.def: If you approve of someone because they have good qualities that used to be more common in the past, you can describe them as one of the old school .

example.ex: He is one of the old school who still believes in honour in public life.
example.tran: 他思想传统，在别人面前仍然讲究体面。

example.ex: ...an elderly gentleman of the old school.
example.tran: 年长的老派绅士

collins.def: The seasons are the main periods into which a year can be divided and which each have their own typical weather conditions.

example.ex: Autumn's my favourite season.
example.tran: 秋天是我最喜欢的季节。

example.ex: ...the only region of Brazil where all four seasons are clearly defined.
example.tran: 巴西唯一一个四季分明的地区

collins.tran: (一年中某项活动或某一事件发生的)节期，时期
collins.def: You can use season to refer to the period during each year when a particular activity or event takes place. For example, the planting season is the period when a particular plant or crop is planted.

example.ex: ...birds arriving for the breeding season...
example.tran: 飞来准备度过繁殖季节的鸟群

example.ex: For law students, autumn brings the recruiting season.
example.tran: 对学法律的学生来说，秋季是招聘旺季。

collins.tran: (水果、蔬菜等的)当令期，上市期
collins.def: You can use season to refer to the period when a particular fruit, vegetable, or other food is ready for eating and is widely available.

example.ex: The plum season is about to begin...
example.tran: 快到吃李子的季节了。

example.ex: Now British asparagus is in season.
example.tran: 现在英国芦笋正当令。

collins.def: You can use season to refer to a fixed period during each year when a particular sport is played.

example.ex: ...the baseball season...
example.tran: 棒球赛季

example.ex: It is his first race this season.
example.tran: 这是他本赛季的第一场比赛。

collins.tran: (戏剧、表演的)上演期，会演期，献演期
collins.def: A season is a period in which a play or show, or a series of plays or shows, is performed in one place.

example.ex: ...a season of three new plays.
example.tran: 3 部新戏剧的上演期

example.ex: ...the Royal Ballet's summer season.
example.tran: 皇家芭蕾舞团的夏季献演期

collins.def: A season of films is several of them shown as a series because they are connected in some way.

example.ex: ...a brief season of films in which Artaud appeared.
example.tran: 阿尔托出演的系列影片的短暂上映期

collins.def: The holiday or vacation season is the time when most people have their holiday.

example.ex: ...the peak holiday season...
example.tran: 休假高峰期

example.ex: There are discos and clubs but these are often closed out of season.
example.tran: 那里有迪斯科舞厅和夜总会，但是通常只在度假旺季营业。

collins.def: If you season food with salt, pepper, or spices, you add them to it in order to improve its flavour.

example.ex: Season the meat with salt and pepper...
example.tran: 用盐和胡椒粉给肉调味。

example.ex: I believe in seasoning food before putting it on the table.
example.tran: 我认为在把食物端上餐桌前应该先调味。

collins.tran: 对(木材)作干燥处理;风干，晒干(木材)
collins.def: If wood is seasoned, it is made suitable for making into furniture or for burning, usually by being allowed to dry out gradually.

example.ex: Ensure that new wood has been seasoned.
example.tran: 确保新木材已经风干。

collins.def: If a female animal is in season, she is in a state where she is ready to have sex.
A secretary is a person who is employed to do office work, such as typing letters, answering phone calls, and arranging meetings.

collins.tran: (工会、政党、俱乐部等的)干事,书记员
collins.def: The secretary of an organization such as a trade union, a political party, or a club is its official manager.

example.ex: My grandfather was secretary of the Scottish Miners' Union.
example.tran: 我的祖父是苏格兰矿工工会干事。

collins.def: The secretary of a company is the person who has the legal duty of keeping the company's records.
Secretary is used in the titles of ministers and officials who are in charge of main government departments.

example.ex: ...the British Foreign Secretary.
example.tran: 英国外交大臣

example.ex: ...Defense Secretary Caspar Weinberger.
example.tran: 国防部长卡斯珀·温伯格

collins.tran: 防卫;保安措施;安全工作
collins.def: Security refers to all the measures that are taken to protect a place, or to ensure that only people with permission enter it or leave it.

example.ex: They are now under a great deal of pressure to tighten their airport security...
example.tran: 他们现在承受着加强机场安保措施的巨大压力。

example.ex: Strict security measures are in force in the capital.
example.tran: 首都采取了严密的安全措施。

collins.def: A feeling of security is a feeling of being safe and free from worry.

example.ex: He loves the security of a happy home life...
example.tran: 他喜欢幸福家庭生活所带来的安全感。

example.ex: If an alarm gives you that feeling of security, then it's worth carrying.
example.tran: 如果带着闹钟让你感到心里踏实，那就值得携带。

collins.def: If something is security for a loan, you promise to give that thing to the person who lends you money, if you fail to pay the money back.

example.ex: The central bank will provide special loans, and the banks will pledge the land as security.
example.tran: 中央银行会提供特殊贷款，而这些银行会以土地作为抵押。

collins.def: Securities are stocks, shares, bonds, or other certificates that you buy in order to earn regular interest from them or to sell them later for a profit.

example.ex: National banks can package their own mortgages and underwrite them as securities.
example.tran: 国家银行能够合并自己的抵押贷款并以证券形式包销。

example.ex: ...US government securities and bonds.
example.tran: 美国政府证券和债券

collins.def: When you see something, you notice it using your eyes.

example.ex: You can't see colours at night...
example.tran: 晚上看不见颜色。

example.ex: I saw a man making his way towards me...
example.tran: 我看到一名男子向我走来。

collins.def: If you see someone, you visit them or meet them.

example.ex: I saw him yesterday...
example.tran: 我昨天见到他了。

example.ex: Mick wants to see you in his office right away...
example.tran: 米克要你马上去他的办公室见他。

collins.def: If you see an entertainment such as a play, film, concert, or sports game, you watch it.

example.ex: He had been to see a Semi-Final of the FA Cup...
example.tran: 他看过一场足总杯半决赛。

example.ex: It was one of the most amazing films I've ever seen.
example.tran: 这是我看过的最精彩的电影之一。

collins.def: If you see that something is true or exists, you realize by observing it that it is true or exists.

example.ex: I could see she was lonely.
example.tran: 我能看出她很寂寞。

example.ex: ...a lot of people saw what was happening but did nothing about it...
example.tran: 很多人都看出发生了什么事却袖手旁观。

collins.def: If you see what someone means or see why something happened, you understand what they mean or understand why it happened.

example.ex: Oh, I see what you're saying...
example.tran: 哦，我明白你的意思了。

example.ex: I don't see why you're complaining...
example.tran: 我不明白你有什么可抱怨的。

collins.def: If you see someone or something as a certain thing, you have the opinion that they are that thing.

example.ex: She saw him as a visionary, but her father saw him as a man who couldn't make a living...
example.tran: 她认为他是一个有眼光的人，但是她父亲却认为他没有谋生的能力。

example.ex: They have a normal body weight but see themselves as being fat...
example.tran: 他们体重正常，但自认为偏胖。

collins.tran: 看出;看上，欣赏(某种特质)
collins.def: If you see a particular quality in someone, you believe they have that quality. If you ask what someone sees in a particular person or thing, you want to know what they find attractive about that person or thing.

example.ex: Frankly, I don't know what Paul sees in her...
example.tran: 坦白地说，我不知道保罗看上她什么了。

example.ex: Young and old saw in him an implacable opponent of apartheid.
example.tran: 无论老少都看出他是种族隔离制度的坚决反对者。

collins.def: If you see something happening in the future, you imagine it, or predict that it will happen.

example.ex: A good idea, but can you see Taylor trying it?...
example.tran: 主意不错，不过你认为泰勒会尝试它吗？

example.ex: We can see a day where all people live side by side.
example.tran: 我们可以想象有那么一天所有人都和睦地生活在一起。

collins.def: If a period of time or a person sees a particular change or event, it takes place during that period of time or while that person is alive.

example.ex: Yesterday saw the resignation of the acting Interior Minister...
example.tran: 昨天代理内政部长辞职了。

example.ex: He had worked with the General for three years and was sorry to see him go...
example.tran: 他与将军共事了 3 年，看他离去觉得很难过。

collins.def: You can use see in expressions to do with finding out information. For example, if you say 'I'll see what's happening', you mean that you intend to find out what is happening.

example.ex: Let me just see what the next song is...
example.tran: 我来看看下一首歌是什么。

example.ex: Every time we asked our mother, she said, 'Well, see what your father says.'...
example.tran: 每次我们问母亲，她总是说：“噢，看你爸爸怎么说。”

collins.def: You can use see to promise to try and help someone. For example, if you say 'I'll see if I can do it', you mean that you will try to do the thing concerned.

example.ex: I'll see if I can call her for you...
example.tran: 我会尽力帮你把她叫来。

example.ex: We'll see what we can do, miss.
example.tran: 我们会尽量想办法，小姐。

collins.def: If you see that something is done or if you see to it that it is done, you make sure that it is done.

example.ex: See that you take care of him...
example.tran: 一定要照顾好他。

example.ex: Catherine saw to it that the information went directly to Walter.
example.tran: 凯瑟琳确保这条消息直接传达给了沃尔特。

collins.def: If you see someone to a particular place, you accompany them to make sure that they get there safely, or to show politeness.

example.ex: He didn't offer to see her to her car...
example.tran: 他没有提出要陪她去取车。

example.ex: 'Goodnight.' — 'I'll see you out.'
example.tran: “晚安。”——“我送你出去。”

collins.def: If you see a lot of someone, you often meet each other or visit each other.

example.ex: We used to see quite a lot of his wife, Carolyn...
example.tran: 我们以前经常见到他的妻子卡罗琳。

example.ex: We didn't see much of each other after that because he was touring.
example.tran: 从那之后我们没怎么见过面，因为他去旅行了。

collins.def: If you are seeing someone, you spend time with them socially, and are having a romantic or sexual relationship.

example.ex: My husband was still seeing her and he was having an affair with her.
example.tran: 我的丈夫仍在和她来往，而且两人还搞婚外情。

collins.def: Some writers use see in expressions such as we saw and as we have seen to refer to something that has already been explained or described.

example.ex: We saw in Chapter 16 how annual cash budgets are produced...
example.tran: 在第 16 章我们了解了年度现金预算是怎样制订的。

example.ex: Using the figures given above, it can be seen that machine A pays back the initial investment in two years...
example.tran: 从以上的数字我们可以看出，机器A在两年后就收回了最初的投资。

collins.def: See is used in books to indicate to readers that they should look at another part of the book, or at another book, because more information is given there.

example.ex: Surveys consistently find that men report feeling safe on the street after dark. See, for example, Hindelang and Garofalo (1978)...
example.tran: 多项调查一致显示，男性认为天黑后在大街上行走是安全的。比如，参见欣德朗和加罗法洛(1978)。

example.ex: See Chapter 7 below for further comments on the textile industry.
example.tran: 有关纺织业的更多评论请参看下面第 7 章。

collins.def: You can use seeing that or seeing as to introduce a reason for what you are saying.

example.ex: He is in the marriage bureau business, which is mildly ironic seeing that his dearest wish is to get married himself...
example.tran: 他从事婚姻介绍工作，这多少有点讽刺意味，因为他最大的愿望就是自己能结婚。

example.ex: Seeing as Mr Moreton is a doctor, I would assume he has a modicum of intelligence.
example.tran: 既然莫尔顿先生是位医生，我想他应该有点聪明才智。

collins.def: You can say 'I see' to indicate that you understand what someone is telling you.

example.ex: 'He came home in my car.' — 'I see.'
example.tran: “他坐我的车回家来的。”——“哦，是这样。”

collins.tran: (表示暂不作决定)看看吧，再说吧
collins.def: People say 'I'll see' or 'We'll see' to indicate that they do not intend to make a decision immediately, and will decide later.

example.ex: We'll see. It's a possibility.
example.tran: 再说吧，可能会的。

collins.tran: (表示试图记起某事或找到某物)让我想一想，让我看看
collins.def: People say 'let me see' or 'let's see' when they are trying to remember something, or are trying to find something.

example.ex: Let's see, they're six — no, make that five hours ahead of us...
example.tran: 让我想一想，他们比我们早 6 个——不，就算是早 5 个小时完成。

example.ex: Now let me see, who's the man we want?
example.tran: 现在让我看一看，谁是我们要找的人？

collins.def: If you try to make someone see sense or see reason, you try to make them realize that they are wrong or are being stupid.

example.ex: He was hopeful that by sitting together they could both see sense and live as good neighbours...
example.tran: 他希望他们坐到一起，彼此能清醒理智，和睦为邻。

example.ex: He tried again to get her to see reason.
example.tran: 他再次试图让她明白自己错了。

collins.tran: (用于向某人解释某事物并鼓励其倾听和理解)你瞧，你知道，看吧
collins.def: You can say 'you see' when you are explaining something to someone, to encourage them to listen and understand.

example.ex: Well, you see, you shouldn't really feel that way about it...
example.tran: 好了，知道吗，对那件事你真的不应该那么想。

example.ex: She was a prime target for blackmail, don't you see?
example.tran: 她是敲诈的主要目标。你难道看不出来吗？

collins.def: 'See you', 'be seeing you', and 'see you later' are ways of saying goodbye to someone when you expect to meet them again soon.

example.ex: 'Talk to you later.' — 'All right. See you love.'
example.tran: “ 回头再跟你谈。”——“好的。再见，亲爱的。”

example.ex: 'No time for chattering now.' — 'Be seeing you, then.'
example.tran: “现在没空闲聊。”——“那么回见。”

collins.tran: 到时候你就知道了;你等着瞧吧
collins.def: You can say 'You'll see' to someone if they do not agree with you about what you think will happen in the future, and you believe that you will be proved right.

example.ex: The thrill wears off after a few years of marriage. You'll see.
example.tran: 婚后几年这种兴奋感就会逐渐消逝。你等着瞧吧。

collins.def: You use seem to say that someone or something gives the impression of having a particular quality, or of happening in the way you describe.

example.ex: We heard a series of explosions. They seemed quite close by...
example.tran: 我们听到一连串的爆炸声，似乎就在附近。

example.ex: Everyone seems busy except us...
example.tran: 除了我们，大家好像都很忙碌。

collins.tran: (在描述自己的感觉、想法、经历时用于缓和语气)好像，似乎
collins.def: You use seem when you are describing your own feelings or thoughts, or describing something that has happened to you, in order to make your statement less forceful.

example.ex: I seem to have lost all my self-confidence...
example.tran: 我好像已经自信全无。

example.ex: I seem to remember giving you very precise instructions...
example.tran: 我好像记得给过你非常明确的指示。

collins.def: If you say that you cannot seem or could not seem to do something, you mean that you have tried to do it and were unable to.

example.ex: No matter how hard I try I cannot seem to catch up on all the bills...
example.tran: 无论怎么努力，我好像就是无法付清所有的账单。

example.ex: Kim's mother couldn't seem to stop crying.
example.tran: 金的母亲似乎要哭个没完。

collins.def: If you sell something that you own, you let someone have it in return for money.

example.ex: I sold everything I owned except for my car and my books...
example.tran: 我把我所有的东西都卖掉了，只剩下汽车和书。

example.ex: His heir sold the painting to the London art dealer Agnews...
example.tran: 他的继承人把这幅画卖给了伦敦艺术品经销商阿格纽斯。

collins.def: If a shop sells a particular thing, it is available for people to buy there.

example.ex: It sells everything from hair ribbons to oriental rugs...
example.tran: 这里出售各种商品，从发带到东方小地毯应有尽有。

example.ex: Bean sprouts are also sold in cans.
example.tran: 也有罐装豆芽出售。

collins.def: If something sells for a particular price, that price is paid for it.

example.ex: Unmodernised property can sell for up to 40 per cent of its modernised market value.
example.tran: 没有装备现代化设施的房地产能够卖到它配置了现代化设施情况下的市价的 40%。

example.ex: ... grain sells at 10 times usual prices.
example.tran: 粮食售价是平常的 10 倍。

collins.def: If something sells, it is bought by the public, usually in fairly large quantities.

example.ex: Even if this album doesn't sell and the critics don't like it, we wouldn't ever change...
example.tran: 即使这张专辑得不到市场和评论家的青睐，我们也不会作出任何改变。

example.ex: The company believes the products will sell well in the run-up to Christmas.
example.tran: 这个公司相信这些产品在圣诞节前夕一定会畅销。

collins.def: Something that sells a product makes people want to buy the product.

example.ex: It is only the sensational that sells news magazines.
example.tran: 只有轰动性的事件才能促进新闻杂志的销售。

example.ex: ...car manufacturers' long-held maxim that safety doesn't sell.
example.tran: 汽车生产商长期奉行的座右铭——安全性并不意味着畅销

collins.def: If you sell someone an idea or proposal, or sell someone on an idea, you convince them that it is a good one.

example.ex: She tried to sell me the idea of buying my own paper shredder...
example.tran: 她努力说服我买一台自己的碎纸机。

example.ex: She is hoping she can sell the idea to clients...
example.tran: 她希望能让客户们接受这个想法。

collins.def: If someone sells their body, they have sex for money.

example.ex: 85 per cent said they would rather not sell their bodies for a living.
example.tran: 85%的人说如果存在其他选择，他们不会出卖肉体谋生。

collins.tran: (为获得个人利益或好处而)出卖，背叛
collins.def: If someone sells you down the river, they betray you for some personal profit or advantage.

example.ex: He has been sold down the river by the people who were supposed to protect him.
example.tran: 他被那些本应该保护他的人出卖了。

collins.def: If you sell someone short, you do not point out their good qualities as much as you should or do as much for them as you should.

example.ex: They need to improve their image — they are selling themselves short...
example.tran: 他们需要提升自己的形象——他们是在自贬身价。

example.ex: Selling their fans short in such a shabby way is not acceptable.
example.tran: 如此过分地怠慢他们的崇拜者令人无法接受。

collins.def: If you talk about someone selling their soul in order to get something, you are criticizing them for abandoning their principles.

example.ex: ...a man who would sell his soul for political viability.
example.tran: 为了升官晋爵甘愿出卖良心的人

means: 用无线电波发送，发出信息

collins.def: When you send someone something, you arrange for it to be taken and delivered to them, for example by post.

example.ex: Myra Cunningham sent me a note thanking me for dinner...
example.tran: 迈拉·坎宁安给我寄了张便笺感谢我招待的晚餐。

example.ex: I sent a copy to the minister for transport...
example.tran: 我给交通部长发送了一份副本。

collins.def: If you send someone somewhere, you tell them to go there.

example.ex: Inspector Banbury came up to see her, but she sent him away...
example.tran: 班伯里巡官过来看她，却被她打发走了。

example.ex: He had been sent here to keep an eye on Benedict.
example.tran: 他被派到这儿监视贝内迪克特。

collins.tran: 把…送进(学校或监狱);安排…去
collins.def: If you send someone to an institution such as a school or a prison, you arrange for them to stay there for a period of time.

example.ex: It's his parents' choice to send him to a boarding school, rather than a convenient day school...
example.tran: 把他送到寄宿学校而非一家就近的走读学校是他父母的决定。

example.ex: You're saying they are sending too many people to prison?
example.tran: 你是说他们把太多人关进了监狱？

collins.tran: (通过无线电波或电流)发射，发送,传送(信号)
collins.def: To send a signal means to cause it to go to a place by means of radio waves or electricity.

example.ex: The transmitters will send a signal automatically to a local base station...
example.tran: 发射台会自动将信号发射到地方基站。

example.ex: ...in 1989, after a 12-year journey to Neptune, the space probe Voyager sent back pictures of Triton, its moon.
example.tran: 太空探测器“旅行者”号在历经 12 年的飞行后于 1989 年飞临海王星，发回了其卫星海卫一的照片。

collins.def: If something sends things or people in a particular direction, it causes them to move in that direction.

example.ex: The explosion sent shrapnel flying through the sides of cars on the crowded highway...
example.tran: 爆炸后飞溅出的炸弹碎片洞穿了拥堵在公路上的车辆车身。

example.ex: He let David go with a thrust of his wrist that sent the lad reeling...
example.tran: 他手腕猛一用力推开戴维，让这小伙子打了个踉跄。

collins.def: To send someone or something into a particular state means to cause them to go into or be in that state.

example.ex: My attempt to fix it sent Lawrence into fits of laughter.
example.tran: 我试着修理它，却让劳伦斯乐得前仰后合。

example.ex: ...before civil war and famine sent the country plunging into anarchy...
example.tran: 在内战和饥荒让这个国家陷入一片混乱之前

collins.tran: 感觉官能(即视觉、嗅觉、听觉、触觉、味觉)
collins.def: Your senses are the physical abilities of sight, smell, hearing, touch, and taste.

example.ex: She stared at him again, unable to believe the evidence of her senses.
example.tran: 她再度盯着他看，无法相信自己的眼睛和耳朵。

example.ex: ...a keen sense of smell.
example.tran: 灵敏的嗅觉

collins.def: If you sense something, you become aware of it or you realize it, although it is not very obvious.

example.ex: She probably sensed that I wasn't telling her the whole story...
example.tran: 她可能意识到了我并没有对她全盘托出。

example.ex: He looks about him, sensing danger...
example.tran: 他四下看了看，感觉到有危险。

collins.def: If you have a sense that something is the case, you think that it is the case, although you may not have firm, clear evidence for this belief.
