example.ex: Suddenly you got this sense that people were drawing themselves away from each other...
example.tran: 突然间你就有这样一种感觉：人们正在彼此疏远。

example.ex: There is no sense of urgency on either side.
example.tran: 两边都没有紧迫感。

collins.def: If you have a sense of guilt or relief, for example, you feel guilty or relieved.

example.ex: When your child is struggling for life, you feel this overwhelming sense of guilt...
example.tran: 当你的孩子在挣扎求生时，你会感到非常内疚。

example.ex: Lulled into a false sense of security, we eagerly awaited their return.
example.tran: 我们被一种虚假的安全感所麻痹，急切地等着他们回来。

collins.def: If you have a sense of something such as duty or justice, you are aware of it and believe it is important.

example.ex: My sense of justice was offended...
example.tran: 我的正义感被激了起来。

example.ex: We must keep a sense of proportion about all this...
example.tran: 我们对所有的这些都要有轻重缓急之分。

collins.def: Someone who has a sense of timing or style has a natural ability with regard to timing or style. You can also say that someone has a bad sense of timing or style.

example.ex: He has an impeccable sense of timing...
example.tran: 他有着无可挑剔的节奏感。

example.ex: Her dress sense is appalling.
example.tran: 她穿衣打扮的品位实在糟透了。

collins.tran: 理智;头脑;良好的判断力
collins.def: Sense is the ability to make good judgments and to behave sensibly.

example.ex: ...when he was younger and had a bit more sense...
example.tran: 在他年纪更轻一些而且还有点头脑的时候

example.ex: When that doesn't work they sometimes have the sense to seek help...
example.tran: 那种方法不奏效的时候，他们有时会想到要寻求帮助。

collins.def: If you say that there is no sense or little sense in doing something, you mean that it is not a sensible thing to do because nothing useful would be gained by doing it.

example.ex: There's no sense in pretending this doesn't happen...
example.tran: 假装这件事没有发生毫无意义。

example.ex: There's little sense in trying to outspend a competitor with a much larger service factory.
example.tran: 试图比竞争对手花更多的钱建一个大得多的维修厂没有什么意义。

collins.def: A sense of a word or expression is one of its possible meanings.

example.ex: ...a noun which has two senses...
example.tran: 有两个意思的名词

example.ex: Then she remembered that they had no mind in any real sense of that word.
example.tran: 然后她想起来他们对那个词的真正意思一无所知。

collins.tran: 从某种意义上说/总的来说。
collins.def: Sense is used in several expressions to indicate how true your statement is. For example, if you say that something is true in a sense, you mean that it is partly true, or true in one way. If you say that something is true in a general sense, you mean that it is true in a general way.

example.ex: In a sense, both were right...
example.tran: 从某种意义上来说，两者都对。

example.ex: In one sense, the fact that few new commercial buildings can be financed does not matter...
example.tran: 从某种意义上说，只有少数新建商业大厦可以融到资金的情况其实并不重要。

collins.def: If something makes sense, you can understand it.

example.ex: He was sitting there saying, 'Yes, the figures make sense.'
example.tran: 他坐在那儿说：“是的，这些数字可以理解。”

example.ex: It all makes sense now.
example.tran: 现在就都讲得通了。

collins.def: When you make sense of something, you succeed in understanding it.

example.ex: Provided you didn't try to make sense of it, it sounded beautiful...
example.tran: 只要不非得弄懂它的意思，它听上去还是很美的。

example.ex: This is to help her to come to terms with her early upbringing and make sense of past experiences.
example.tran: 这旨在帮助她认可自己早先所受的教育，并让她了解自己过去的经历。

collins.def: If a course of action makes sense, it seems sensible.

example.ex: It makes sense to look after yourself...
example.tran: 自己应该照顾自己。

example.ex: The project should be reappraised to see whether it made sound economic sense...
example.tran: 该项目应重新评估，以确定其是否可以产生良好的经济效益。

collins.tran: 恢复理性;清醒过来;醒悟过来
collins.def: If you say that someone has come to their senses or has been brought to their senses, you mean that they have stopped being foolish and are being sensible again.

example.ex: Eventually the world will come to its senses and get rid of them...
example.tran: 最终这世界会清醒过来，将它们全部丢弃。

example.ex: May her death bring these people to their senses.
example.tran: 但愿她的死能让这些人醒悟。

collins.tran: 发疯;失去理智;精神失常
collins.def: If you say that someone seems to have taken leave of their senses, you mean that they have done or said something very foolish.

example.ex: They looked at me as if I had taken leave of my senses.
example.tran: 他们看着我，就像我已经疯了一样。

collins.def: If you say that someone talks sense, you mean that what they say is sensible.
If you have a sense that something is true or get a sense that something is true, you think that it is true.

example.ex: Do you have the sense that you are loved by the public?
example.tran: 你认为自己深受民众喜爱吗？

example.ex: I get a sense that people are feeling better about themselves.
example.tran: 我觉得现在人们的自我感觉更好了。

collins.def: to see sense

collins.tran: 严重的;危急的;令人担忧的
collins.def: Serious problems or situations are very bad and cause people to be worried or afraid.

example.ex: Crime is an increasingly serious problem in Russian society...
example.tran: 犯罪猖獗是俄罗斯社会面临的一个日益严重的问题。

example.ex: The government still face very serious difficulties...
example.tran: 政府仍然面临着非常严峻的困难。

collins.tran: 重要的;需要认真考虑的;严肃的
collins.def: Serious matters are important and deserve careful and thoughtful consideration.

example.ex: I regard this as a serious matter...
example.tran: 我认为这件事很重要。

example.ex: Don't laugh boy. This is serious.
example.tran: 小伙子，别笑，这很严肃。

collins.def: When important matters are dealt with in a serious way, they are given careful and thoughtful consideration.

example.ex: My parents never really faced up to my drug use in any serious way...
example.tran: 我父母从未认真地正视过我的吸毒问题。

example.ex: It was a question which deserved serious consideration.
example.tran: 这是一个值得认真考虑的问题。

collins.tran: (音乐、文学作品)严肃的，非供消遣(或娱乐)的
collins.def: Serious music or literature requires concentration to understand or appreciate it.

example.ex: ...serious classical music...
example.tran: 严肃的古典音乐

example.ex: There is no point reviewing a blockbuster as you might review a serious novel.
example.tran: 为一部大片写影评时，没必要像为一部严肃小说写书评那样认真谨慎。

collins.tran: 认真的;当真的;真心的;郑重其事的
collins.def: If someone is serious about something, they are sincere about what they are saying, doing, or intending to do.

example.ex: You really are serious about this, aren't you?...
example.tran: 你这话的确是发自内心的，是不是？

example.ex: I hope you're not serious.
example.tran: 我希望你不是认真的。

collins.tran: (人)若有所思的，庄重的，严肃的
collins.def: Serious people are thoughtful and quiet, and do not laugh very often.

example.ex: He's quite a serious person...
example.tran: 他是一个非常一本正经的人。

example.ex: She looked at me with big, serious eyes.
example.tran: 她睁大眼睛若有所思地看着我。

collins.def: Serious money is a very large amount of money.

example.ex: He started earning serious money only in the sixties.
example.tran: 他在 60 年代才开始挣大钱。

collins.tran: 公共服务事业;公共服务系统
collins.def: A service is something that the public needs, such as transport, communications facilities, hospitals, or energy supplies, which is provided in a planned and organized way by the government or an official body.

example.ex: Britain still boasts the cheapest postal service...
example.tran: 英国仍拥有最便宜的邮政服务系统。

example.ex: We have started a campaign for better nursery and school services...
example.tran: 我们已发起一场要求改善幼儿园和中小学教育服务的运动。

collins.def: You can sometimes refer to an organization or private company as a particular service when it provides something for the public or acts on behalf of the government.

example.ex: ...the BBC World Service.
example.tran: 英国广播公司国际广播台

example.ex: ...Careers Advisory Services.
example.tran: 职业咨询服务

collins.tran: (机构或公司提供的某一)服务
collins.def: If an organization or company provides a particular service, they can do a particular job or a type of work for you.

example.ex: The kitchen maintains a twenty-four hour service and can be contacted via Reception...
example.tran: 厨房提供24小时餐饮服务，可通过前台进行联系。

example.ex: The larger firm was capable of providing a better range of services.
example.tran: 较大的公司能够提供一系列更好的服务。

collins.def: Services are activities such as tourism, banking, and selling things which are part of a country's economy, but are not concerned with producing or manufacturing goods.

example.ex: Mining rose by 9.1%, manufacturing by 9.4% and services by 4.3%.
example.tran: 采矿业增长了 9.1%, 制造业增长了 9.4%，服务业增长了 4.3%。

example.ex: ...the doctrine that a highly developed service sector was the sign of a modern economy.
example.tran: 高度发展的服务业是现代经济标志的学说

collins.tran: 服务内容;服务(质量);服务态度
collins.def: The level or standard of service provided by an organization or company is the amount or quality of the work it can do for you.

example.ex: Taking risks is the only way employees can provide effective and efficient customer service...
example.tran: 员工能够为客户提供有价值、高效的服务的唯一途径就是敢于冒险。

example.ex: The current level of service will be maintained except that the evening 'Network Express' trains will be withdrawn.
example.tran: 除了“铁网特快”夜班列车将会停开外，目前的运营线路会保持下去。

collins.tran: (公共汽车或火车的)路线，行程车次，班车
collins.def: A bus or train service is a route or regular journey that is part of a transport system.

example.ex: A bus service operates between Bolton and Salford.
example.tran: 博尔顿和索尔福德之间有一班公共汽车往返。

collins.def: Your services are the things that you do or the skills that you use in your job, which other people find useful and are usually willing to pay you for.

example.ex: I have obtained the services of a top photographer to take our pictures...
example.tran: 我已请到了一位顶级摄影师来给我们拍照。

example.ex: The performers have all offered their services free of charge.
example.tran: 演员们都愿意免费出演。

collins.tran: (为某组织或活动所做的)工作，服务，效劳
collins.def: If you refer to someone's service or services to a particular organization or activity, you mean that they have done a lot of work for it or spent a lot of their time on it.

example.ex: You've given a lifetime of service to athletics...
example.tran: 你为田径运动贡献了一生。

example.ex: More than half his long service in parliament has been as a cabinet minister.
example.tran: 他长期在议会任职，其中大半时间担任内阁部长。

collins.def: The Services are the army, the navy, and the air force.

example.ex: In June 1945, Britain still had forty-five per cent of its workforce in the Services and munitions industries.
example.tran: 1945 年 6 月，英国仍然有45％的劳动力在部队服役或就职于军火工业。

collins.def: Service is the work done by people or equipment in the army, navy, or air force, for example during a war.

example.ex: The regiment was recruited from the Highlands specifically for service in India.
example.tran: 该军团是专门为在印度作战而从苏格兰高地征募来的。

example.ex: ...an aircraft carrier that saw service in World War II.
example.tran: 曾在二战中服役的航空母舰

collins.def: When you receive service in a restaurant, hotel, or shop, an employee asks you what you want or gives you what you have ordered.

example.ex: A five-course meal including coffee, service and VAT is £30.
example.tran: 包括咖啡、服务费及增值税在内，一顿五道菜正餐的价格为 30 英镑。

example.ex: ...clean stores with respectful service and fair prices.
example.tran: 服务态度良好、价格公道、干净整洁的店铺

collins.def: A service is a religious ceremony that takes place in a church.

example.ex: After the hour-long service, his body was taken to a cemetery in the south of the city.
example.tran: 在长达一小时的悼念仪式结束后，他的遗体被抬到了城南的一所公墓。

example.ex: ...the church in which the President was attending morning service.
example.tran: 总统做晨祷的教堂

collins.def: A dinner service or a tea service is a complete set of plates, cups, saucers, and other pieces of china.

example.ex: ...a 60-piece dinner service.
example.tran: 一套六十件套的餐具

collins.tran: (高速公路边可加油、购物或用餐的)服务站
collins.def: A services is a place beside a motorway where you can buy petrol and other things, or have a meal.

example.ex: They had to pull up, possibly go to a motorway services or somewhere like that...
example.tran: 他们只好停车，可能得去高速公路服务站之类的地方。

example.ex: We have repeatedly told planners that services are vital on a motorway like the M40.
example.tran: 我们一再告知城市规划者在诸如M40 之类的高速公路旁建服务站是必不可少的。

collins.tran: (网球、羽毛球等的)发球权，开球局
collins.def: In tennis, badminton, and some other sports, when it is your service, it is your turn to serve.

example.ex: She conceded just three points on her service during the first set.
example.tran: 她在第一盘自己的发球局仅失了 3 分。

collins.tran: (大楼、建筑中的设施）员工专用的，后勤专用的
collins.def: Service is used to describe the parts of a building or structure that are used by the staff who clean, repair, or look after it, and are not usually used by the public.

example.ex: He wheeled the trolley down the corridor and disappeared with it into the service lift.
example.tran: 他推着小推车走过走廊，之后进了员工专用电梯不见了。

example.ex: ...the bigger tunnels, which run either side of the service tunnel.
example.tran: 后勤隧道两边更大的隧道

collins.def: If someone is in service, they are working as a servant.

example.ex: If a young woman did not have a dowry, she went into domestic service.
example.tran: 如果一个年轻女子没有嫁妆，她就要做家政服务赚钱。

collins.tran: 维修，检修,维护(机器、车辆)
collins.def: If you have a vehicle or machine serviced, you arrange for someone to examine, adjust, and clean it so that it will keep working efficiently and safely.

example.ex: I had had my car serviced at the local garage...
example.tran: 我已经把我的车送到当地汽修厂检修了。

example.ex: Make sure that all gas fires and central heating boilers are serviced annually.
example.tran: 确保所有的煤气取暖器和中央供暖的锅炉每年都检修一次。

collins.def: If a country or organization services its debts, it pays the interest on them.

example.ex: Almost a quarter of the country's export earnings go to service a foreign debt of $29 billion.
example.tran: 该国几乎 1/4 的出口收入都用来支付 290 亿美元外债的利息了。

collins.tran: 为…提供服务;满足…的需求
collins.def: If someone or something services an organization, a project, or a group of people, they provide it with the things that it needs in order to function properly or effectively.

example.ex: There are now 400 staff at headquarters, servicing our regional and overseas work...
example.tran: 现在总部有 400 名职员负责地区和海外事务。

example.ex: Fossil fuels such as coal, oil and gas will service our needs for some considerable time to come.
example.tran: 诸如煤、石油和天然气之类的矿物燃料会在以后很长一段时间里满足我们的需求。

collins.tran: 随时可供…使用;随时为…提供帮助
collins.def: To be at the service of a person or organization means to be available to help or be used by that person or organization.

example.ex: The intellectual and moral potential of the world's culture must be put at the service of politics.
example.tran: 世界文化潜在的知识和道德力量一定要为政治所用。

collins.tran: 随时为您效劳;随时听您的吩咐
collins.def: You can use 'at your service' after your name as a formal way of introducing yourself to someone and saying that you are willing to help them in any way you can.

example.ex: She bowed dramatically. 'Anastasia Krupnik, at your service,' she said.
example.tran: 她夸张地鞠了个躬。“阿纳斯塔西娅·克鲁布尼克，随时为您效劳，”她说。

collins.def: If you do someone a service, you do something that helps or benefits them.

example.ex: You are doing me a great service, and I'm very grateful to you...
example.tran: 你帮了我一个大忙，非常感激。

example.ex: 'You don't feel that you've betrayed your country?' — 'Not at all, I think I've done a service to my country.'
example.tran: “你不觉得你背叛了你的祖国吗？”——“一点也不，我认为我帮了我的国家。”

collins.tran: (车辆、设备)在使用中,可以使用/(通常因发生故障而)未在使用
collins.def: If a piece of equipment or type of vehicle is in service, it is being used or is able to be used. If it is out of service, it is not being used, usually because it is not working properly.

example.ex: Cuts in funding have meant that equipment has been kept in service long after it should have been replaced...
example.tran: 资金的削减意味着早该换掉的设备一直在长期运转。

example.ex: In 1882, London's first electric tram cars went into service...
example.tran: 1882 年，伦敦第一辆有轨电车投入使用。

collins.def: If someone or something is of service to you, they help you or are useful to you.

example.ex: That is, after all, the primary reason we live — to be of service to others.
example.tran: 别忘了，那是我们活着的主要原因——帮助他人。

collins.def: A set of things is a number of things that belong together or that are thought of as a group.

example.ex: There must be one set of laws for the whole of the country...
example.tran: 整个国家必须要有一套统一的法律。

example.ex: I might need a spare set of clothes...
example.tran: 我可能需要一套备用的衣服。

collins.def: In tennis, a set is one of the groups of six or more games that form part of a match.

example.ex: Graf was leading 5-1 in the first set.
example.tran: 格拉芙第一盘以 5 比 1 领先。

collins.def: In mathematics, a set is a group of mathematical quantities that have some characteristic in common.

collins.tran: (一场音乐会中所演唱或演奏的)一组歌曲(或乐曲)
collins.def: A band's or musician's set is the group of songs or tunes that they perform at a concert.

example.ex: The band continued with their set after a short break...
example.tran: 短暂的休息后，乐队继续演奏他们的曲目。

example.ex: He plays a solo acoustic set.
example.tran: 他伴着原声乐器独唱了一组歌曲。

collins.tran: (经常碰面或趣味相同的)一伙(或一帮、一群)人
collins.def: You can refer to a group of people as a set if they meet together socially or have the same interests and lifestyle.

example.ex: He belonged to what the press called 'The Chelsea Set'.
example.tran: 他属于媒体所称的“切尔西圈子”里的人。

collins.tran: (话剧的)布景;(电影的)摄影棚，拍片现场
collins.def: The set for a play, film, or television show is the furniture and scenery that is on the stage when the play is being performed or in the studio where filming takes place.

example.ex: From the first moment he got on the set, he wanted to be a director too...
example.tran: 自从进入摄影棚的第一刻起，他就希望自己也能成为一名导演。

example.ex: ...his stage sets for the Folies Bergeres.
example.tran: 他为牧女游乐园剧院设计的舞台布景

collins.def: The set of someone's face or part of their body is the way that it is fixed in a particular expression or position, especially one that shows determination.

example.ex: Matt looked at Hugh and saw the stubbornness in the set of his shoulders...
example.tran: 马特看着休，从他坚挺的肩膀中看出了他的倔强。

example.ex: Artist Richard Stone has captured in her eyes and the set of her face her steely determination.
example.tran: 画家理查德·斯通在她的眼神和面部表情中捕捉到了她的坚毅和决绝。

collins.def: A set is an appliance. For example, a television set is a television.

example.ex: Children spend so much time in front of the television set...
example.tran: 孩子们花在看电视上的时间太多了。

example.ex: We got our first set — black and white — in 1963.
example.tran: 1963 年我们买了我们的第一台电视机——黑白的。

collins.def: Seven is the number 7.

example.ex: Sarah and Ella have been friends for seven years.
example.tran: 萨拉和埃拉已经有7年的交情了。

collins.def: Seventeen is the number 17.

example.ex: Jenny is seventeen years old.
example.tran: 珍妮 17 岁了。

means: 从七十到七十九的数目、年数或温度

collins.def: Seventy is the number 70.

example.ex: Seventy people were killed.
example.tran: 70 人丧生。

collins.tran: 七十几(指 70 至 79 之间的数字)
collins.def: When you talk about the seventies, you are referring to numbers between 70 and 79. For example, if you are in your seventies, you are aged between 70 and 79. If the temperature is in the seventies, it is between 70 and 79.

example.ex: It's a long way to go for two people in their seventies.
example.tran: 对于两个七十几岁的人来说,这段路太远了。

collins.tran: 七十年代(指 1970 年至 1979 年)
collins.def: The seventies is the decade between 1970 and 1979.

example.ex: In the late Seventies, things had to be new, modern, revolutionary.
example.tran: 20 世纪 70 年代晚期，一切都要新奇、时髦、标新立异。

collins.def: Several is used to refer to an imprecise number of people or things that is not large but is greater than two.

example.ex: I had lived two doors away from this family for several years...
example.tran: 我和这家人是好几年的邻居了，中间就隔着两家。

example.ex: Several blue plastic boxes under the window were filled with record albums...
example.tran: 窗下的几个蓝色塑料盒里装满了唱片。

collins.def: A company's shares are the many equal parts into which its ownership is divided. Shares can be bought by people as an investment.

example.ex: This is why Sir Colin Marshall, British Airways' chairman, has been so keen to buy shares in US-AIR...
example.tran: 这就是为什么英国航空公司主席科林·马歇尔爵士一直如此热衷于购买美国航空公司的股票。

example.ex: For some months the share price remained fairly static.
example.tran: 有那么几个月，股票价格一直非常地稳定。

collins.def: If you share something with another person, you both have it, use it, or occupy it. You can also say that two people share something.

example.ex: ...the small income he had shared with his brother from his father's estate...
example.tran: 他兄弟二人从父亲那里继承的一小笔遗产

example.ex: Two Americans will share this year's Nobel Prize for Medicine...
example.tran: 两名美国人将共同摘得今年的诺贝尔医学奖。

collins.tran: 共同承担，分担，分摊(任务、责任等)
collins.def: If you share a task, duty, or responsibility with someone, you each carry out or accept part of it. You can also say that two people share something.

example.ex: You can find out whether they are prepared to share the cost of the flowers with you...
example.tran: 你可以弄清楚他们是否愿意和你一起分担买花的费用。

example.ex: The republics have worked out a plan for sharing control of nuclear weapons.
example.tran: 一些共和国已经制订出共同控制核武器的计划。

collins.tran: 分享，共同拥有(同样的经历)
collins.def: If you share an experience with someone, you have the same experience, often because you are with them at the time. You can also say that two people share something.

example.ex: Yes, I want to share my life with you...
example.tran: 是的，我想和你共度一生。

example.ex: I felt we both shared the same sense of loss, felt the same pain.
example.tran: 我觉得我们两个有着共同的失落感，经受着同样的痛苦。

collins.def: If you share someone's opinion, you agree with them.

example.ex: We share his view that business can be a positive force for change...
example.tran: 我们同意他的观点，认为商业可以是促进变革的一种积极力量。

example.ex: Prosperity and economic success remain popular and broadly shared goals.
example.tran: 经济繁荣昌盛一直是各国普遍追求的共同目标。

collins.tran: 共同具有(某种品质和特点);和…有共同之处
collins.def: If one person or thing shares a quality or characteristic with another, they have the same quality or characteristic. You can also say that two people or things share something.

example.ex: ...newspapers which share similar characteristics with certain British newspapers.
example.tran: 和英国的某些报纸风格相似的一些报纸

example.ex: ...two groups who share a common language.
example.tran: 说同一种语言的两个人群

collins.def: If you share something that you have with someone, you give some of it to them or let them use it.

example.ex: The village tribe is friendly and they share their water supply with you...
example.tran: 村里的部落很友善，他们会和你一起分享水源。

example.ex: Scientists now have to compete for funding, and do not share information among themselves...
example.tran: 科学家们现在为了资金不得不相互竞争，互相之间也不会共享信息。

collins.tran: 向…诉说,与…分享(想法、消息等)
collins.def: If you share something personal such as a thought or a piece of news with someone, you tell them about it.

example.ex: It can be beneficial to share your feelings with someone you trust...
example.tran: 向自己信任的人倾诉感情是很有益处的。

example.ex: Film critic Bob Mondello shares his thoughts on the movie 'City of Hope'.
example.tran: 影评家鲍勃·蒙德洛和大家分享他对电影《希望之城》的看法。

collins.def: If something is divided or distributed among a number of different people or things, each of them has, or is responsible for, a share of it.

example.ex: Sara also pays a share of the gas, electricity and phone bills...
example.tran: 萨拉也分摊燃气费、电费和电话费。

example.ex: He is counting on winning seats and perhaps a share in the new government of Macedonia.
example.tran: 他正期望着能赢得一些席位，或许还能成为马其顿新政府的一员。

collins.tran: 应得的一份;应做的一份
collins.def: If you have or do your share of something, you have or do an amount that seems reasonable to you, or to other people.

example.ex: Women must receive their fair share of training for good-paying jobs...
example.tran: 女性必须获得她们理应得到的高薪工作培训。

example.ex: I have had more than my full share of adventures.
example.tran: 我已经有了太多丰富多彩的历险。

collins.def: You use should when you are saying what would be the right thing to do or the right state for something to be in.

example.ex: I should exercise more...
example.tran: 我应该多锻炼一些。

example.ex: The diet should be maintained unchanged for about a year...
example.tran: 这样的饮食应保持约一年不变。

collins.tran: (表示给出指示或公布官方命令)应该，必须
collins.def: You use should to give someone an order to do something, or to report an official order.

example.ex: All visitors should register with the British Embassy...
example.tran: 所有游客都必须到英国大使馆登记。

example.ex: The European Commission ruled that British Aerospace should pay back tens of millions of pounds.
example.tran: 欧洲委员会裁定英国航空航天公司应该偿还数千万英镑。

collins.tran: (表示与说话者的意愿相反)本应
collins.def: If you say that something should have happened, you mean that it did not happen, but that you wish it had. If you say that something should not have happened, you mean that it did happen, but that you wish it had not.

example.ex: I should have gone this morning but I was feeling a bit ill...
example.tran: 今天早晨我本应该走的，但是我觉得有点不舒服。

example.ex: I should have been in the shade like all the other tourists, then I wouldn't have got burned...
example.tran: 我本应该像其他旅游者一样呆在阴凉处的，那么我就不会晒伤了。

collins.tran: (表示预期或可能性)应该会，可能
collins.def: You use should when you are saying that something is probably the case or will probably happen in the way you are describing. If you say that something should have happened by a particular time, you mean that it will probably have happened by that time.

example.ex: You should have no problem with reading this language...
example.tran: 阅读这种语言你应该没问题。

example.ex: The voters should by now be in no doubt what the parties stand for...
example.tran: 选民们现在应该确切知道各党派的主张了。

collins.tran: (用于疑问句中表示征求意见、同意或咨询情况)可以，应该
collins.def: You use should in questions when you are asking someone for advice, permission, or information.

example.ex: Should I or shouldn't I go to university?...
example.tran: 我该不该去上大学呢？

example.ex: What should I do?...
example.tran: 我应该怎么做？

collins.tran: (通过假设自己处于对方立场会怎么做来提出建议)应该，可以，会
collins.def: You say 'I should', usually with the expression 'if I were you', when you are giving someone advice by telling them what you would do if you were in their position.

example.ex: I should look out if I were you!
example.tran: 如果我是你，我会小心的。

example.ex: James, I should refuse that consultancy with Shapiro, if I were you...
example.tran: 詹姆斯，如果我是你，我就会拒绝向夏皮罗咨询。

collins.tran: (用在条件从句中表示事件发生的可能性)将要，假定要
collins.def: You use should in conditional clauses when you are talking about things that might happen.

example.ex: If you should be fired, your health and pension benefits will not be automatically cut off...
example.tran: 如果你被解雇，你的医疗和养老保险金不会自动中断。

example.ex: Should you buy a home from Lovell, the company promises to buy it back at the same price after three years...
example.tran: 如果你从洛弗尔公司买房子，该公司承诺3年后以同样的价格再购回。

collins.tran: (用在由 that引导的从句中，放在某些动词、名词和形容词之后，表示将来的事件或情况)应该，能够，竟然会
collins.def: You use should in 'that' clauses after certain verbs, nouns, and adjectives when you are talking about a future event or situation.

example.ex: He raised his glass and indicated that I should do the same...
example.tran: 他举起了杯子并且示意我也应该这样做。

example.ex: I insisted that we should have a look at every car...
example.tran: 我坚持我们每辆车都应该看一下。

collins.tran: (与第一人称连用，表示没有把握)会，可能
collins.def: You use should in expressions such as I should think and I should imagine to indicate that you think something is true but you are not sure.

example.ex: I should think it's going to rain soon...
example.tran: 我想可能马上要下雨了。

example.ex: 'I suppose that was the right thing to do.' — 'I should imagine so.'...
example.tran: “我认为那样做是对的。”——“我想是吧。”

collins.tran: (与第一人称连用表示客气的请求等)想要，将会
collins.def: You use should in expressions such as I should like and I should be happy to show politeness when you are saying what you want to do, or when you are requesting, offering, or accepting something.

example.ex: I should be happy if you would bring them this evening...
example.tran: 如果今晚你将他们带来的话，我会很高兴。

example.ex: 'I should like to know anything you can tell me,' said Kendal...
example.tran: “只要是你能告诉我的，我都会洗耳恭听，”肯德尔说。

collins.tran: (强调所经历的事有趣、令人震惊等)实在该，真该，真应当
collins.def: You use should in expressions such as You should have seen us and You should have heard him to emphasize how funny, shocking, or impressive something that you experienced was.

example.ex: You should have heard him last night!
example.tran: 昨晚你真该听听他所说的。

example.ex: You should have seen him when he first came out — it was so sad...
example.tran: 你真应该看看他第一次出现时的样子，真让人难过。

collins.tran: (用在由who，what等引导的疑问结构中，后接but，强调某件事令人惊讶或震惊)居然
collins.def: You use should in question structures which begin with words like 'who' and 'what' and are followed by 'but' to emphasize how surprising or shocking a particular event was.

example.ex: I'm making these plans and who should I meet but this blonde guy and John.
example.tran: 我正在制订这些计划，没想到这时候居然遇上这个金发的家伙和约翰。

means: 被人看见，显现，显而易见

collins.def: If something shows that a state of affairs exists, it gives information that proves it or makes it clear to people.

example.ex: Research shows that a high-fibre diet may protect you from bowel cancer...
example.tran: 研究表明高纤维饮食可预防肠癌。

example.ex: He was arrested at his home in Southampton after a breath test showed he had drunk more than twice the legal limit for driving...
example.tran: 呼吸测醉检测显示其饮酒量是法定驾车饮酒限量的两倍多，他随即在南安普顿的家中被捕。

collins.tran: (图画、图表、影像或文章)描绘，描述，展示，说明
collins.def: If a picture, chart, film, or piece of writing shows something, it represents it or gives information about it.

example.ex: Figure 4.1 shows the respiratory system...
example.tran: 图表 4.1 所示为呼吸系统。

example.ex: ...a coin showing Cleopatra...
example.tran: 刻有克娄巴特拉头像的硬币

collins.tran: 给…看;向…出示(或展示);指给…看
collins.def: If you show someone something, you give it to them, take them to it, or point to it, so that they can see it or know what you are referring to.

example.ex: Cut out this article and show it to your bank manager...
example.tran: 将这篇文章剪下来，拿给你的银行经理看。

example.ex: He showed me the flat he shares with Esther...
example.tran: 他带我看了他和埃丝特合住的公寓。

collins.def: If you show someone to a room or seat, you lead them there.

example.ex: Let me show you to my study...
example.tran: 我带你去我的书房。

example.ex: Milton was shown into the office...
example.tran: 米尔顿被领到了办公室。

collins.def: If you show someone how to do something, you do it yourself so that they can watch you and learn how to do it.

example.ex: Claire showed us how to make a chocolate roulade...
example.tran: 克莱尔给我们示范了如何做巧克力卷。

example.ex: There are seasoned professionals who can teach you and show you what to do...
example.tran: 有经验丰富的专家教你，并向你演示怎么做。

collins.def: If something shows or if you show it, it is visible or noticeable.

example.ex: He showed his teeth in a humourless grin...
example.tran: 他一本正经地咧嘴笑了笑。

example.ex: His beard was just beginning to show signs of grey...
example.tran: 他的胡子才刚有点泛白。

collins.tran: 表现，体现，流露出(态度、品质或情感);(态度等)体现，流露
collins.def: If you show a particular attitude, quality, or feeling, or if it shows, you behave in a way that makes this attitude, quality, or feeling clear to other people.

example.ex: Elsie has had enough time to show her gratitude...
example.tran: 埃尔茜有足够的时间来表达她的感激之情。

example.ex: She showed no interest in her children...
example.tran: 她对自己的孩子毫无兴趣。

collins.tran: 显示出，表露出，流露出(某种品质或特征);(品质或特征)表露，显示
collins.def: If something shows a quality or characteristic or if that quality or characteristic shows itself, it can be noticed or observed.

example.ex: The story shows a strong narrative gift and a vivid eye for detail...
example.tran: 这个故事显示了作者较强的叙事能力和对细节的观察入微。

example.ex: Middle East peace talks in Washington showed signs of progress yesterday...
example.tran: 昨天在华盛顿举行的中东和谈有了取得进展的迹象。

collins.tran: (情感、品质等的)流露，表露，体现
collins.def: A show of a feeling or quality is an attempt by someone to make it clear that they have that feeling or quality.

example.ex: Miners gathered in the centre of Bucharest in a show of support for the government...
example.tran: 矿工们聚集在布加勒斯特市中心以表示对政府的支持。

example.ex: A crowd of more than 10,000 has gathered in a show of strength...
example.tran: 已经有 10,000 多人聚集起来以显示他们的力量。

collins.def: If you say that something is for show, you mean that it has no real purpose and is done just to give a good impression.

example.ex: The change in government is more for show than for real...
example.tran: 政府的转变更多的是装装样子，而不是真的。

example.ex: 'It's all show,' said Linus. 'The girls don't take it seriously.'
example.tran: “全是装的，”莱纳斯说。“女孩子们不会拿它当真的。”

collins.def: If a company shows a profit or a loss, its accounts indicate that it has made a profit or a loss.

example.ex: It is the only one of the three companies expected to show a profit for the quarter...
example.tran: 那是3个公司中唯一一家预计会在本季度盈利的公司。

example.ex: Lonrho's mining and minerals businesses showed some improvement.
example.tran: 朗荷公司的采矿及矿产业务有了些起色。

collins.def: If a person you are expecting to meet does not show, they do not arrive at the place where you expect to meet them.

example.ex: There was always a chance he wouldn't show.
example.tran: 他总是有可能不出现。

collins.def: A television or radio show is a programme on television or radio.

example.ex: I had my own TV show...
example.tran: 我有自己的电视节目。

example.ex: This is the show in which Loyd Grossman visits the houses of the famous.
example.tran: 这就是劳埃德·格罗斯曼拜访名人家庭的那档节目。

collins.tran: (尤指包括音乐、舞蹈、滑稽剧等不同内容的)演出，表演
collins.def: A show in a theatre is an entertainment or concert, especially one that includes different items such as music, dancing, and comedy.

example.ex: How about going shopping and seeing a show in London?...
example.tran: 去伦敦购物再看场演出怎么样？

example.ex: He has earned a reputation as the man who can close a show with a bad review...
example.tran: 他因可以用一则恶评毙掉一场演出而闻名。

collins.def: If someone shows a film or television programme, it is broadcast or appears on television or in the cinema.

example.ex: The BBC World Service Television news showed the same film clip...
example.tran: 英国广播公司对外电视频道的新闻节目播放了同样的电影剪辑片段。

example.ex: The drama will be shown on American TV next year...
example.tran: 明年这部剧将在美国电视台播出。

collins.def: A show is a public exhibition of things, such as works of art, fashionable clothes, or things that have been entered in a competition.

example.ex: The venue for the show is Birmingham's National Exhibition Centre Hall...
example.tran: 展览地点在伯明翰国家展览中心大厅。

example.ex: Gucci will be holding fashion shows to present their autumn collection...
example.tran: 古奇将举办时装发布会推出他们的秋装系列。

collins.def: To show things such as works of art means to put them in an exhibition where they can be seen by the public.

example.ex: 50 dealers will show oils, watercolours, drawings and prints from 1900 to 1992.
example.tran: 50 名艺术品经销商将展出 1900 年到1992 年间的油画、水彩画、素描和版画。

example.ex: ...one of East Village's better-known galleries, where he showed and sold his work.
example.tran: 他曾在那儿展销作品的东村著名的美术馆之一

collins.tran: (赛马比赛中赛马)名列前三甲
collins.def: In a horse race, if a horse shows, it finishes first, second, or third.
A show home, house, or flat is one of a group of new homes. The building company decorates it and puts furniture in it, and people who want to buy one of the homes come and look round it.
If a question is decided by a show of hands, people vote on it by raising their hands to indicate whether they vote yes or no.

example.ex: Parliamentary leaders agreed to take all such decisions by a show of hands...
example.tran: 议会领导人同意所有这样的决定都要举手表决。

example.ex: Russell then asked for a show of hands concerning each of the targets.
example.tran: 拉塞尔然后要求对每个目标进行举手表决。

collins.tran: 在…方面做出了成绩;在…方面有结果
collins.def: If you have something to show for your efforts, you have achieved something as a result of what you have done.

example.ex: I'm nearly 31 and it's about time I had something to show for my time in my job...
example.tran: 我快 31 岁了,是该在工作上做出一番成绩的时候了。

example.ex: It always amazed her how little she had to show for the amount she spent.
example.tran: 她的付出那么多，收获却那样少，这一直让她惊诧不已。

collins.tran: (用来威胁或警告别人)我要让你看看，你就等着瞧吧
collins.def: You can say 'I'll show you' to threaten or warn someone that you are going to make them admit that they are wrong.

example.ex: She shook her fist. 'I'll show you,' she said...
example.tran: 她挥了挥拳头，“我要让你看看，”她说。

example.ex: I'll show him, leave it to me.
example.tran: 我会让他好看的，交给我好了。

collins.tran: 这恰恰证明;这正好表明
collins.def: If you say it just goes to show or it just shows that something is the case, you mean that what you have just said or experienced demonstrates that it is the case.

example.ex: This just goes to show that getting good grades in school doesn't mean you're clever...
example.tran: 这恰恰证明了在学校得高分并不意味着聪明。

example.ex: It's crazy and just shows the inconsistency of refereeing.
example.tran: 这太荒唐了，不过恰恰证明了裁判的前后矛盾。

collins.def: If you say that someone is running the show, you mean that they are in control or in charge of a situation.

example.ex: They made it clear who is now running the show...
example.tran: 他们清楚地表明了现在是谁在掌控一切。

example.ex: There's some serious problems with the way the state's leadership has been running the show.
example.tran: 国家领导班子的治国方式存在一些严重的问题。

collins.def: If you say that someone steals the show, you mean that they get a lot of attention or praise because they perform better than anyone else in a show or other event.

example.ex: It was Chinese women who stole the show on the first day of competition...
example.tran: 比赛的第一天中国女队表现抢眼。

example.ex: Brad Pitt steals the show as the young man doomed by his zest for life.
example.tran: 布拉德·皮特扮演一名因对生命怀有极大热情而注定在劫难逃的年轻人，抢尽了镜头。

collins.def: The side of something is a position to the left or right of it, rather than in front of it, behind it, or on it.

example.ex: On one side of the main entrance there's a red plaque.
example.tran: 大门口的一侧有块红色的匾额。

example.ex: ...a photograph with me in the centre and Joe and Ken on each side of me.
example.tran: 我居中、乔和肯分别在我两侧的一张照片

collins.def: The side of an object, building, or vehicle is any of its flat surfaces which is not considered to be its front, its back, its top, or its bottom.

example.ex: We put a notice on the side of the box.
example.tran: 我们在箱子的一侧贴了警示标。

example.ex: ...a van bearing on its side the name of a company...
example.tran: 一辆侧面印有公司名称的小货车

collins.tran: (洞或容器垂直的)内侧面，内壁
collins.def: The sides of a hollow or a container are its inside vertical surfaces.

example.ex: The rough rock walls were like the sides of a deep canal...
example.tran: 凸凹不平的石墙就像一条很深的运河的河岸。

example.ex: Line the base of the dish with greaseproof paper and lightly grease the sides.
example.tran: 在餐盘底部垫一层防油纸，再在里侧涂少许的油。

collins.def: The sides of an area or surface are its edges.

example.ex: Park on the side of the road.
example.tran: 靠路边停车。

example.ex: ...a small beach on the north side of the peninsula...
example.tran: 半岛北侧的一个小海滩

collins.tran: (某地区、表面或物体一分为二的)一边，一侧
collins.def: The two sides of an area, surface, or object are its two halves.

example.ex: She turned over on her stomach on the other side of the bed...
example.tran: 她翻了个身趴在了床的另一边。

example.ex: The major centre for language is in the left side of the brain.
example.tran: 语言中枢位于左半脑。

collins.tran: (有车流来往的道路的)方向，侧
collins.def: The two sides of a road are its two halves on which traffic travels in opposite directions.

example.ex: It had gone on to the wrong side of the road and hit a car coming in the other direction.
example.tran: 它驶上了逆行车道，撞上了对面驶来的一辆汽车。

collins.tran: (城镇或世界的)另一端，遥远的地方
collins.def: If you talk about the other side of a town or of the world, you mean a part of the town or of the world that is very far from where you are.

example.ex: He lives the other side of London...
example.tran: 他住在伦敦的另一端。

example.ex: He saw the ship that was to transport them to the other side of the world...
example.tran: 他见到了那艘要将他们运往世界另一端的轮船。

collins.tran: (人体自腋下至臀部的)体侧,肋部
collins.def: Your sides are the parts of your body between your front and your back, from under your arms to your hips.

example.ex: His arms were limp at his sides...
example.tran: 他的双臂无力地垂在身体两侧。

example.ex: They had laid him on his side.
example.tran: 他们让他侧身躺下。

collins.tran: (在…)身边，(在…)旁边(给予支持或安慰)
collins.def: If someone is by your side or at your side, they stay near you and give you comfort or support.

example.ex: He was constantly at his wife's side...
example.tran: 他对他的妻子始终不离不弃。

example.ex: He calls me 20 times a day and needs me by his side in the evening...
example.tran: 他一天给我打了 20 次电话，晚上还要我陪在他身边。

collins.def: The two sides of something flat, for example a piece of paper, are its two flat surfaces. You can also refer to one side of a piece of paper filled with writing as one side of writing.

example.ex: The new copiers only copy onto one side of the paper...
example.tran: 新复印机只能单面复印。

example.ex: Fry the chops until brown on both sides...
example.tran: 将排骨煎至两面呈棕黄色。

collins.def: One side of a tape or record is what you can hear or record if you play the tape or record from beginning to end without turning it over.

example.ex: We want to hear side A...
example.tran: 我们想听 A 面。

example.ex: In those days symphonies were recorded on both sides of four twelve-inch records.
example.tran: 那时候交响乐都是灌录在4 张 12 英寸唱片的双面上。

collins.tran: (牛肉、猪肉等沿脊骨劈开的)一边，半只，一扇
collins.def: A side of beef, bacon, or other meat consists of the meat from half the animal cut along its backbone.
Side is used to describe things that are not the main or most important ones of their kind.

example.ex: She slipped in and out of the theatre by a side door.
example.tran: 她从剧院的侧门溜进溜出。

example.ex: ...a prawn curry with a lentil side dish.
example.tran: 有扁豆做配菜的咖喱虾

collins.def: The different sides in a war, argument, or negotiation are the groups of people who are opposing each other.

example.ex: Both sides appealed for a new ceasefire...
example.tran: 双方都呼吁达成新的停火协议。

example.ex: Any solution must be acceptable to all sides.
example.tran: 任何解决办法都必须能为各方所接受。

collins.tran: (争论或交易中)一方的观点(或立场)
collins.def: The different sides of an argument or deal are the different points of view or positions involved in it.

example.ex: His words drew sharp reactions from people on both sides of the issue.
example.tran: 他的话引起了争论双方的强烈反响。

example.ex: ...those with the ability to see all sides of a question...
example.tran: 能看到问题方方面面的人

collins.def: If one person or country sides with another, they support them in an argument or a war. If people or countries side against another person or country, they support each other against them.

example.ex: There has been much speculation that America might be siding with the rebels...
example.tran: 有很多猜测认为美国会支持叛乱者。

example.ex: You need to confront those who have sided against you.
example.tran: 你要直面那些联合反对你的人。

collins.def: In sport, a side is a team.

example.ex: Italy were definitely a better side than Germany...
example.tran: 意大利队明显比德国队要强。

example.ex: The captain made the decision to include four men in their 40s in his side.
example.tran: 队长决定将 4 名 40 多岁的男子招入队中。

collins.def: A particular side of something such as a situation or someone's character is one aspect of it.

example.ex: He is in charge of the civilian side of the UN mission...
example.tran: 他在联合国使团中负责平民方面的事务。

example.ex: It shows that your child can now see the funny side of things...
example.tran: 这表明你的孩子现在可以领会事情有趣的一面了。

collins.def: The mother's side and the father's side of your family are your mother's relatives and your father's relatives.

example.ex: So was your father's side more well off?
example.tran: 那么你父亲那边更富有一些了？

example.ex: ...a relative on the maternal side of his family.
example.tran: 他母亲那边的一位亲戚

collins.def: If two people or things are side by side, they are next to each other.

example.ex: We sat side by side on two wicker seats...
example.tran: 我们在两把柳条椅上肩并肩坐着。

example.ex: Put the eggplants side by side in a serving dish.
example.tran: 将茄子码齐放在上菜用的盘子里。

collins.def: If people work or live side by side, they work or live closely together in a friendly way.

example.ex: ...areas where different nationalities have lived side by side for centuries...
example.tran: 不同民族和睦相处了几个世纪的地区

example.ex: We're usually working side by side with the men.
example.tran: 通常我们和男性一起并肩工作。

collins.tran: 令(家人或朋友)失望(或难堪)
collins.def: If you say that someone has let the side down, you mean that they have embarrassed their family or friends by behaving badly or not doing well at something.

example.ex: Brown was constantly letting the side down.
example.tran: 布朗不断让家人失望。

collins.def: If something moves from side to side, it moves repeatedly to the left and to the right.

example.ex: She was shaking her head from side to side.
example.tran: 她摇头晃脑。

collins.def: If you are on someone's side, you are supporting them in an argument or a war.

example.ex: He has the Democrats on his side...
example.tran: 他有民主党人的支持。

example.ex: Get that employee on your side and then work together towards a solution...
example.tran: 设法让那名雇员站到你这边，然后你们共同找出解决方法。

collins.def: If something is on your side or if you have it on your side, it helps you when you are trying to achieve something.

example.ex: The weather is rather on our side...
example.tran: 天气对我们非常有利。

example.ex: The law is not on their side.
example.tran: 法律并不站在他们那边。

collins.def: If you get on the wrong side of someone, you do something to annoy them and make them dislike you. If you stay on the right side of someone, you try to please them and avoid annoying them.

example.ex: I wouldn't like to get on the wrong side of him...
example.tran: 我不想激怒他。

example.ex: You'll need to get on the right side of Carmela.
example.tran: 你得讨卡梅拉的欢心。

collins.def: If you say that something is on the small side, you are saying politely that you think it is slightly too small. If you say that someone is on the young side, you are saying politely that you think they are slightly too young.

example.ex: He's quiet and a bit on the shy side.
example.tran: 他很安静，略有点害羞。

collins.tran: 兼职;在正事之外;作为副业
collins.def: If someone does something on the side, they do it in addition to their main work.

example.ex: ...ways of making a little bit of money on the side.
example.tran: 兼职挣点钱的方法

collins.def: If you have one type of food with another food on the side, you have an amount of the second food served with the first.

example.ex: Serve a bowl of warm tomato sauce on the side for dipping, if desired.
example.tran: 如果你喜欢，可以上一碗热番茄调味汁来蘸着吃。

collins.tran: 暂且不管;把…暂搁置一边
collins.def: If you put something to one side or put it on one side, you temporarily ignore it in order to concentrate on something else.

example.ex: In order to maintain profit margins health and safety regulations are often put to one side.
example.tran: 为了保持利润率，常置卫生和安全规章于不顾。

collins.tran: 把…拉到一边去(私下交谈)
collins.def: If you take someone to one side or draw them to one side, you speak to them privately, usually in order to give them advice or a warning.

example.ex: He took Sabrina to one side and told her about the safe.
example.tran: 他将萨布丽娜拉到一旁，悄悄告诉她关于保险箱的事。

collins.tran: (在争论或战争中)支持一方，站在…一边
collins.def: If you take sides or take someone's side in an argument or war, you support one of the sides against the other.

example.ex: We cannot take sides in a civil war...
example.tran: 内战中我们不能支持任何一方。

example.ex: See? You're taking his side again.
example.tran: 看到了吧？你又在帮他了。

collins.tran: 在（某一日期或事件）之前
collins.def: If you say that something will not happen this side of a date or event, you mean that it will not happen before that date or event.

example.ex: A race between the two is now unlikely to take place this side of the world championships.
example.tran: 现在看来，本届世界锦标赛之前两人之间不太可能展开较量了。

collins.def: A sign is a mark or shape that always has a particular meaning, for example in mathematics or music.

example.ex: Equations are generally written with a two-bar equals sign.
example.tran: 等式通常用两道横的等号来表示。

collins.def: A sign is a movement of your arms, hands, or head which is intended to have a particular meaning.

example.ex: They gave Lavalle the thumbs-up sign...
example.tran: 他们对拉瓦列竖起了大拇指。

example.ex: The priest made the sign of the cross over him.
example.tran: 神父在他上方画了个十字。

collins.tran: 打手势语;为(节目或表演)配手语
collins.def: If you sign, you communicate with someone using sign language. If a programme or performance is signed, someone uses sign language so that deaf people can understand it.

example.ex: All programmes will be either 'signed' or subtitled...
example.tran: 所有节目要么要配手语要么要打字幕。

collins.tran: 招牌;标牌;指示牌;告示牌;标志
collins.def: A sign is a piece of wood, metal, or plastic with words or pictures on it. Signs give you information about something, or give you a warning or an instruction.

example.ex: ...a sign saying that the highway was closed because of snow.
example.tran: 声明公路因大雪而关闭的告示牌

example.ex: ...a cardboard sign, which stated 'No to Poll Tax'...
example.tran: 写有“反对人头税”的硬纸板抗议牌

collins.def: If there is a sign of something, there is something which shows that it exists or is happening.

example.ex: They are prepared to hand back a hundred prisoners of war a day as a sign of good will...
example.tran: 他们准备每日遣返100名战俘以示友好。

example.ex: His face and movements rarely betrayed a sign of nerves...
example.tran: 他的表情和行为几乎没有流露出紧张的迹象。

collins.tran: 在…上签名;在…上签字;签署
collins.def: When you sign a document, you write your name on it, usually at the end or in a special space. You do this to indicate that you have written the document, that you agree with what is written, or that you were present as a witness.

example.ex: World leaders are expected to sign a treaty pledging to increase environmental protection...
example.tran: 世界各国首脑预计会签署一份承诺加强环境保护的协定。

example.ex: Before an operation the patient will be asked to sign a consent form.
example.tran: 手术前患者将被要求在同意书上签字。

collins.def: If an organization signs someone or if someone signs for an organization, they sign a contract agreeing to work for that organization for a specified period of time.

example.ex: The Minnesota Vikings signed Herschel Walker from the Dallas Cowboys...
example.tran: 明尼苏达维京人队签下了来自达拉斯牛仔队的赫舍尔·沃克。

example.ex: The band then signed to Slash Records.
example.tran: 随后乐队和伤痕唱片公司签约。

collins.def: In astrology, a sign or a sign of the zodiac is one of the twelve areas into which the heavens are divided.

example.ex: The New Moon takes place in your opposite sign of Libra on the 15th.
example.tran: 15 日新月会移至你对面的天秤宫。

collins.def: If you say that there is no sign of someone, you mean that they have not yet arrived, although you are expecting them to come.

example.ex: The London train was on time, but there was no sign of my Finnish friend.
example.tran: 伦敦的火车准点到达，却不见我那芬兰朋友的踪影。

collins.tran: 已签字盖章的;已成定局的
collins.def: If you say that an agreement is signed and sealed, or signed, sealed and delivered, you mean that it is absolutely definite because everyone involved has signed all the legal documents.

example.ex: The Chancellor had been hoping to have an agreement signed and sealed by the end of this week...
example.tran: 财政大臣一直期望这周末前能敲定一份协议。

example.ex: A government spokesman said the bill must be signed, sealed and delivered by tomorrow.
example.tran: 一名政府发言人称议案明天必须定下来。

collins.tran: (表示某情况自过去某时间点或某个事件以来一直持续到现在)自…以后，从…以来
collins.def: You use since when you are mentioning a time or event in the past and indicating that a situation has continued from then until now.

example.ex: Jacques Arnold has been a member of parliament since 1987...
example.tran: 雅克·阿诺德自 1987 年以来一直是议会议员。

example.ex: She had a sort of breakdown some years ago, and since then she has been very shy...
example.tran: 几年前她得了神经衰弱，自那以后就变得十分腼腆。

collins.tran: (表示某事件或情况从过去某时间或某个事件之后一直发生)自…以来,在…之后
collins.def: You use since to mention a time or event in the past when you are describing an event or situation that has happened after that time.

example.ex: The percentage increase in reported crime in England and Wales this year is the highest since the war...
example.tran: 今年英格兰和威尔士报道的犯罪增长率是战后以来最高的。

example.ex: He turned out to have more battles with the Congress than any president since Andrew Johnson.
example.tran: 结果他是自安德鲁·约翰逊以来和国会斗争最多的一任总统。

collins.tran: (表示过去某事或某情况发生后不久又发生了另一件事)此后，后来
collins.def: When you are talking about an event or situation in the past, you use since to indicate that another event happened at some point later in time.

example.ex: About six thousand people were arrested, several hundred of whom have since been released...
example.tran: 约 6,000 人被捕，后来其中的几百人又被释放了。

example.ex: His style of leadership has attracted increasing criticism among his supporters, many of whom have since left Central Office.
example.tran: 他的领导风格已经在他的拥趸中引起了越来越多的批评，很多人后来离开了总局。

collins.def: If you say that something has long since happened, you mean that it happened a long time ago.

example.ex: Even though her parents have long since died, she still talks about them in the present tense.
example.tran: 尽管双亲早已离世，她谈论起他们时好像他们至今健在。

collins.def: You use since to introduce reasons or explanations.

example.ex: I'm forever on a diet, since I put on weight easily...
example.tran: 我永远都在减肥，因为我很容易长胖。

example.ex: Since she did not make enough money to live in her own house, she went back to live with her mother.
example.tran: 她挣的钱不够自己一个人住，于是搬回去和她妈妈一起住了。

means: [复数]（高尔夫球一对一的）二人对抗赛
[常用复数][美国、加拿大英语]未婚（或单身）男子（或女子）

collins.def: You use single to emphasize that you are referring to one thing, and no more than one thing.

example.ex: A single shot rang out...
example.tran: 传来一声响亮的枪声。

example.ex: Over six hundred people were wounded in a single day...
example.tran: 仅一天中就有 600 多人受伤。

collins.def: You use single to indicate that you are considering something on its own and separately from other things like it.

example.ex: Every single house in town had been damaged...
example.tran: 镇上每栋房子都遭到了破坏。

example.ex: The Middle East is the world's single most important source of oil.
example.tran: 中东是世界上最为重要的一个产油地。

collins.def: Someone who is single is not married. You can also use single to describe someone who does not have a girlfriend or boyfriend.

example.ex: Is it difficult being a single mother?...
example.tran: 做单身妈妈难吗？

example.ex: I now have to face the rest of my life as a single person...
example.tran: 我现在不得不孤单一人度过余生。

collins.def: A single room is a room intended for one person to stay or live in.

example.ex: A single room at the Astir Hotel costs £56 a night.
example.tran: 阿斯蒂尔酒店的单人间价格是 56 英镑一晚。

collins.def: A single bed is wide enough for one person to sleep in.
A single ticket is a ticket for a journey from one place to another but not back again.

example.ex: The price of a single ticket is thirty-nine pounds.
example.tran: 单程票的价格是 39 英镑。

collins.tran: (只录几首短歌的)单曲唱片;(激光唱片上的)主打歌曲，单曲
collins.def: A single or a CD single is a CD which has a few short songs on it. You can also refer to the main song on a CD as a single .

example.ex: Kids today don't buy singles...
example.tran: 现在的孩子都不买单曲唱片了。

example.ex: The winners will get a chance to release their own single.
example.tran: 获胜者将有机会发行自己的单曲唱片。

collins.def: Singles is a game of tennis or badminton in which one player plays another. The plural singles can be used to refer to one or more of these matches.

example.ex: Boris Becker of Germany won the men's singles...
example.tran: 德国的鲍里斯·贝克尔赢得男单冠军。

example.ex: She is equally at home on the singles or doubles court.
example.tran: 她单打和双打都能得心应手。

collins.tran: (板球中的)一分打;(棒球中的)一垒打
collins.def: In cricket, a single is a hit from which one run is scored. In baseball, a single is a hit by which a batter reaches first base.
Your sister is a girl or woman who has the same parents as you.

example.ex: His sister Sarah helped him.
example.tran: 他姐姐萨拉帮助了他。

example.ex: ...Vanessa Bell, the sister of Virginia Woolf...
example.tran: 弗吉尼娅·伍尔夫的姐姐瓦妮莎·贝尔

collins.def: Sister is a title given to a woman who belongs to a religious community.

example.ex: Sister Francesca entered the chapel.
example.tran: 弗朗西丝卡修女走进了小教堂。

example.ex: ...the Hospice of the Sisters of Charity at Lourdes.
example.tran: 卢尔德仁爱修女会的安养院

collins.def: A sister is a senior female nurse who supervises part of a hospital.

example.ex: Ask to speak to the sister on the ward...
example.tran: 请求和病房里的护士长说话。

example.ex: Sister Middleton followed the coffee trolley.
example.tran: 护士长米德尔顿跟在送咖啡的推车后面。

collins.tran: (同一种族、宗教、国家或职业的)姐妹;同道中的女性;志同道合的女士
collins.def: You can describe a woman as your sister if you feel a connection with her, for example because she belongs to the same race, religion, country, or profession.

example.ex: Modern woman has been freed from many of the duties that befell her sisters in times past.
example.tran: 现代女性已经从许多压在旧时女性身上的责任中解放出来了。

example.ex: ...our Jewish brothers and sisters.
example.tran: 我们犹太教的兄弟姐妹们

collins.tran: 同类型的;相关联的;如同姐妹的
collins.def: You can use sister to describe something that is of the same type or is connected in some way to another thing you have mentioned. For example, if a company has a sister company, they are connected.

example.ex: ...the International Monetary Fund and its sister organisation, the World Bank.
example.tran: 国际货币基金组织及其姊妹机构——世界银行

example.ex: ...Voyager 2 and its sister ship, Voyager 1.
example.tran: “旅行者 2 号”太空探测器及其姊妹探测器——“旅行者 1 号”

collins.def: If you are sitting somewhere, for example in a chair, your bottom is resting on the chair and the upper part of your body is upright.

example.ex: Mother was sitting in her chair in the kitchen...
example.tran: 妈妈坐在厨房里的椅子上。

example.ex: They sat there in shock and disbelief...
example.tran: 他们吃惊地坐在那里，不敢相信这是真的。

collins.def: When you sit somewhere, you lower your body until you are sitting on something.

example.ex: He set the cases against a wall and sat on them...
example.tran: 他把箱子靠墙放好，然后坐在上面。

example.ex: Eva pulled over a chair and sat beside her husband...
example.tran: 伊娃拽过一把椅子，坐到丈夫的身边。

collins.def: If you sit someone somewhere, you tell them to sit there or put them in a sitting position.

example.ex: He used to sit me on his lap...
example.tran: 他过去常常让我坐在他的腿上。

example.ex: He'll sit you in front of his computer and give you a glimpse of the problem.
example.tran: 他会让你坐到电脑前，大致了解一下这个问题。

collins.def: If you sit for an artist or photographer, you place yourself in a sitting position so you can be painted or photographed.

example.ex: A person may well have been sitting for the artist for eight hours at a stretch.
example.tran: 为了让画家给自己画像，一个人很有可能连续坐上 8 个钟头。

collins.def: If you sit an examination, you do it.

example.ex: June and July are the traditional months for sitting exams.
example.tran: 6 月和 7 月是传统的考试月份。

collins.def: If you sit on a committee or other official group, you are a member of it.

example.ex: He was asked to sit on numerous committees...
example.tran: 他受邀担任过许多委员会的委员。

example.ex: I know of no professional person who has ever sat on a jury...
example.tran: 据我所知，陪审团的成员中从未有过专业人员。

collins.def: When a parliament, legislature, court, or other official body sits, it officially carries out its work.

example.ex: Parliament sits for only 28 weeks out of 52...
example.tran: 在一年 52 周当中只有 28 周是议会开会的时间。

example.ex: The court would sit all night.
example.tran: 法庭将要通宵庭审。

collins.def: If a building or object sits in a particular place, it is in that place.

example.ex: Our new house sat next to a stream...
example.tran: 我们的新房子坐落在一条小溪旁。

example.ex: On the table sat a box decorated with little pearl triangles.
example.tran: 桌上有一只用珠子串成的小三角形作装饰的盒子。

collins.tran: 代人临时照看小孩;当临时保姆
collins.def: To sit for someone means the same as to babysit for them.

example.ex: I've asked Mum to sit for us next Saturday.
example.tran: 我已经拜托妈妈下周六为我们临时照看一下孩子。

collins.tran: 呆在原处不动;不轻举妄动
collins.def: If you sit tight, you remain in the same place or situation and do not take any action, usually because you are waiting for something to happen.

example.ex: Sit tight. I'll be right back...
example.tran: 你留在这儿别动，我马上就回来。

example.ex: Life would continue to be hard but if they sat tight and trusted him things would get better.
example.tran: 生活依然会很艰辛，但是如果他们能静观其变，并且信任他，一切会慢慢好起来的。

collins.def: You use situation to refer generally to what is happening in a particular place at a particular time, or to refer to what is happening to you.

example.ex: Army officers said the situation was under control...
example.tran: 陆军军官称局面已经得到了控制。

example.ex: And now for a look at the travel situation in the rest of the country...
example.tran: 现在再来看一下该国家其他地方的旅游情况。

collins.def: The situation of a building or town is the kind of surroundings that it has.

example.ex: The garden is in a beautiful situation on top of a fold in the rolling Hampshire landscape.
example.tran: 这座花园位于地势连绵起伏的汉普郡的一处山岗上，环境十分优美。

collins.tran: (报纸上的招聘广告栏或招聘页标题)招聘
collins.def: Situations Vacant is the title of a column or page in a newspaper where jobs are advertised.
Six is the number 6.

example.ex: ...a glorious career spanning more than six decades.
example.tran: 延续 60 余载的辉煌事业

collins.tran: (板球中)得 6 分的击球，以 6 分记的击球
collins.def: In cricket, if a player hits a six, they score six runs by hitting the ball so that it crosses the boundary at the edge of the playing area before it touches the ground.

collins.tran: 使颇为不安;使受严重影响
collins.def: If someone or something is hit for six or knocked for six, they are very upset or badly affected by an experience or piece of news.

example.ex: The loss of my wife hit me for six; it took me months to recover...
example.tran: 丧妻之痛令我彻底崩溃，几个月之后才恢复过来。

example.ex: Many areas in the North were knocked for six by that first recession.
example.tran: 北部的许多地区在第一次大萧条中损失惨重。

collins.tran: 困惑的;混乱的;杂乱无章的
collins.def: If you say that someone or something is at sixes and sevens, you mean that they are confused or disorganized.

example.ex: The government is at sixes and sevens over the issue of domestic security.
example.tran: 在国内安全问题上，政府一片混乱。

collins.def: Sixteen is the number 16.

example.ex: ...exams taken at the age of sixteen...
example.tran: 16 岁时参加的考试

example.ex: He worked sixteen hours a day...
example.tran: 他每天工作 16 个小时。

collins.def: Sixty is the number 60.

example.ex: ...the sunniest April in Britain for more than sixty years.
example.tran: 英国 60 多年以来阳光最灿烂的4月

collins.tran: 六十几(指 60 至 69 之间的数字)
collins.def: When you talk about the sixties, you are referring to numbers between 60 and 69. For example, if you are in your sixties, you are aged between 60 and 69. If the temperature is in the sixties, it is between 60 and 69 degrees.

example.ex: ...a lively widow in her sixties.
example.tran: 一位年过花甲、精神矍铄的寡妇

collins.tran: 二十世纪六十年代(指1960年至1969年)
collins.def: The sixties is the decade between 1960 and 1969.

example.ex: In the sixties there were the deaths of the two Kennedy brothers and Martin Luther King.
example.tran: 20 世纪 60 年代，肯尼迪兄弟和马丁·路德·金先后去世。

collins.def: A small person, thing, or amount of something is not large in physical size.

example.ex: She is small for her age...
example.tran: 她看上去比同龄人个头小。

example.ex: The window was far too small for him to get through...
example.tran: 窗户对他来说实在太小，他钻不过去。

collins.def: A small group or quantity consists of only a few people or things.

example.ex: A small group of students meets regularly to learn Japanese...
example.tran: 一小组学生定期聚在一起学习日语。

example.ex: Guns continued to be produced in small numbers.
example.tran: 枪支继续被小批量地制造出来。

collins.def: A small child is a very young child.

example.ex: I have a wife and two small children...
example.tran: 我有一个妻子和两个年幼的孩子。

example.ex: What were you like when you were small?
example.tran: 你小的时候是什么样子？

collins.tran: 不重要的;无足轻重的;程度小的
collins.def: You use small to describe something that is not significant or great in degree.

example.ex: It's quite easy to make quite small changes to the way that you work...
example.tran: 对工作方式作一些小的改变会比较容易。

example.ex: No detail was too small to escape her attention...
example.tran: 再小的细节都逃不过她的眼睛。

collins.tran: (企业或公司)小规模的，小型的
collins.def: Small businesses or companies employ a small number of people and do business with a small number of clients.

example.ex: ...shops, restaurants and other small businesses...
example.tran: 商店、饭馆以及其他小企业

example.ex: Tool companies here are generally small.
example.tran: 这里制造工具的公司普遍规模不大。

collins.def: If someone speaks in a small voice, they speak in a quiet, high voice because they are frightened or ashamed.

example.ex: 'I'm scared,' she said in a very small voice.
example.tran: 她非常小声地说：“我很害怕。”

collins.def: If someone makes you look or feel small, they make you look or feel stupid or ashamed.

example.ex: This may just be another of her schemes to make me look small...
example.tran: 这也许是她处心积虑要让我自惭形秽的另一步棋。

example.ex: When your children misbehave tell them without making them feel small.
example.tran: 孩子表现不佳时要让他们知道，但不能让他们自惭形秽。

collins.def: The small of your back is the bottom part of your back that curves in slightly.

example.ex: Place your hands on the small of your back and breathe in.
example.tran: 双手置于腰部，吸气。

means: （认为某事无关紧要，尤用于反驳他人的指责时）（口语）
[表示同意、赞成等] 好啦，就这样吧！停下！（停住）别动！

collins.tran: 如此，这样(指已经提到的事)
collins.def: You use so to refer back to something that has just been mentioned.

example.ex: 'Do you think that made much of a difference to the family?' — 'I think so.'...
example.tran: “你认为那会给这个家庭带来很大的变化吗?”——“我认为是这样的。”

example.ex: If you can't play straight, then say so...
example.tran: 要是你无法做到诚实坦率，就直说吧。

collins.tran: 同样，也一样(指后者跟前者一样)
collins.def: You use so when you are saying that something which has just been said about one person or thing is also true of another one.

example.ex: I enjoy Ann's company and so does Martin...
example.tran: 我喜欢和安在一起，马丁也一样。

example.ex: They had a wonderful time and so did I...
example.tran: 他们玩得很开心，我也一样。

collins.tran: (表示两个事件或情况在某方面相似)正如…，也…
collins.def: You use the structures as...so and just as...so when you want to indicate that two events or situations are similar in some way.

example.ex: As computer systems become even more sophisticated, so too do the methods of those who exploit the technology...
example.tran: 正如计算机系统变得越来越先进，开发计算机技术的人所用的方法也日益先进了。

example.ex: Just as John has changed, so has his wife...
example.tran: 约翰变了，他的妻子也变了。

collins.tran: (指某一情况)就是这样，事实如此
collins.def: If you say that a state of affairs is so, you mean that it is the way it has been described.

example.ex: Gold has been a poor investment over the past 20 years, and will continue to be so...
example.tran: 最近 20 年来投资黄金的收益很差，今后仍会如此。

example.ex: In those days English dances as well as songs were taught at school, but that seems no longer to be so...
example.tran: 那时学校里教授英国舞蹈和英语歌曲，可是现在的情形似乎不再是这样了。

collins.tran: (向别人示范)这样，像这样;(用手势比划大小、高度或长度)这么，那么
collins.def: You can use so with actions and gestures to show a person how to do something, or to indicate the size, height, or length of something.

example.ex: Clasp the chain like so.
example.tran: 像这样扣上链子。

example.ex: ...holding the champagne glass with long red nails positioned just so.
example.tran: 手指指甲又长又红，就这样握着香槟酒杯

collins.def: You use so and so that to introduce the result of the situation you have just mentioned.

example.ex: I am not an emotional type and so cannot bring myself to tell him I love him...
example.tran: 我不是一个感情外露的人，因此不会主动告诉他我爱他。

example.ex: People are living longer than ever before, so even people who are 65 or 70 have a surprising amount of time left...
example.tran: 人们的寿命比以前任何时候都长了，所以即便到了 65 岁或 70 岁，余下的光阴也还很长。

collins.def: You use so ,so that, and so as to introduce the reason for doing the thing that you have just mentioned.

example.ex: Come to my suite so I can tell you all about this wonderful play I saw in Boston...
example.tran: 到我的套房来吧，这样我就可以跟你好好讲讲我在波士顿看的这部非常棒的戏了。

example.ex: He took her arm and hurried her upstairs so that they wouldn't be overheard...
example.tran: 他挽起她的手臂，带她匆匆上了楼，这样别人就听不见他们说的话了。

collins.tran: (在叙述过程中引出一系列事件中的下一件或说明两件事情之间的联系)此后，于是
collins.def: You can use so in stories and accounts to introduce the next event in a series of events or to suggest a connection between two events.

example.ex: The woman asked if he could perhaps mend her fences, and so he stayed...
example.tran: 女人问他能否给她修一修篱笆，于是他留了下来。

example.ex: She was free for five whole days, from Christmas Eve. And so she would be going to Charles, to join her family...
example.tran: 她从圣诞夜开始有整整 5 天的自由时间，于是她准备去查尔斯跟家人呆在一起。

collins.tran: (表示开始新话题、引入新问题或对刚说过的问题进行评论)那么，这么
collins.def: You can use so in conversations to introduce a new topic, or to introduce a question or comment about something that has been said.

example.ex: So how was your day?...
example.tran: 那么，你今天过得怎么样？

example.ex: So you're a runner, huh?...
example.tran: 这么说，你是个跑步爱好者喽？

collins.tran: (谈话中表示接受别人的说法)的确，确实
collins.def: You can use so in conversations to show that you are accepting what someone has just said.

example.ex: 'It makes me feel, well, important.' — 'And so you are.'...
example.tran: “这使我觉得自己，嗯，很重要。”——“的确如此。”

example.ex: 'You can't possibly use this word.' — 'So I won't.'...
example.tran: “你绝不会使用这样的字眼。”——“我的确不会。”

collins.tran: (表示某人说的话无关紧要)那又怎样呢？
collins.def: You say 'So?' and 'So what?' to indicate that you think that something that someone has said is unimportant.

example.ex: 'My name's Bruno.' — 'So?'...
example.tran: “我是布鲁诺。”——“那又怎样?”

example.ex: 'You take a chance on the weather if you holiday in the UK.' — 'So what?'...
example.tran: “如果到英国度假，天气好不好得要碰运气。”——“那又如何？”

collins.tran: (用于形容词和副词之前强调所描述的特性)如此，这么，多么，太
collins.def: You can use so in front of adjectives and adverbs to emphasize the quality that they are describing.

example.ex: 'I am so afraid,' Francis thought...
example.tran: 弗朗西斯心想：“我害怕极了。”

example.ex: He was surprised they had married — they had seemed so different...
example.tran: 他俩居然结婚了——这让他非常惊讶，因为他们实在是太不一样了。

collins.tran: 如此…(以致…);到…的程度(以致…)
collins.def: You can use so...that and so...as to emphasize the degree of something by mentioning the result or consequence of it.

example.ex: The tears were streaming so fast she could not see...
example.tran: 眼泪哗哗地流下来，她的视线一下子就模糊了。

example.ex: The deal seems so attractive it would be ridiculous to say no...
example.tran: 这笔交易看上去太诱人了，要是拒绝它简直是笑话。

collins.def: You use and so on or and so forth at the end of a list to indicate that there are other items that you could also mention.

example.ex: ...the Government's policies on such important issues as health, education, tax and so on...
example.tran: 政府在卫生、教育、税收等等重大问题上的政策

example.ex: The patient can have apples, apple juice, apple sauce, and so forth.
example.tran: 病人可以食用苹果、苹果汁、苹果酱等。

collins.tran: (指某事有一定限度，但未言明具体限度)这么多，这么些，到这种程度
collins.def: You use so much and so many when you are saying that there is a definite limit to something but you are not saying what this limit is.

example.ex: There is only so much time in the day for answering letters...
example.tran: 白天回复信件的时间只有这么多。

example.ex: There is only so much fuel in the tank and if you burn it up too quickly you are in trouble...
example.tran: 油箱里面的油只有这么多了，你要是太快把油耗光可就麻烦了。

collins.def: You use the structures not...so much and not so much...as to say that something is one kind of thing rather than another kind.

example.ex: I did not really object to Will's behaviour so much as his personality...
example.tran: 我与其说是反感威尔的行为，不如说是讨厌他的为人。

example.ex: A good birth depends not so much on who you are but where you are and how much you know.
example.tran: 好的出身与其说是取决于你的身份，还不如说是取决于你的生活环境和知识水平。

collins.def: You use or so when you are giving an approximate amount.

example.ex: Though rates are heading down, they still offer real returns of 8% or so...
example.tran: 尽管利率在下降，它们仍然能提供 8%左右的实际收益率。

example.ex: Matt got me a room there for a week or so when I first came here...
example.tran: 我初次来到这里的时候，马特找了个房间让我住了大约一个星期。

collins.def: Social means relating to society or to the way society is organized.

example.ex: ...the worst effects of unemployment, low pay and other social problems.
example.tran: 失业、低工资以及其他社会问题造成的最糟糕的影响

example.ex: ...long-term social change.
example.tran: 长期的社会变革

collins.tran: 同社会地位(或阶层)有关的
collins.def: Social means relating to the status or rank that someone has in society.

example.ex: Higher education is unequally distributed across social classes...
example.tran: 社会各个阶层享受高等教育的权利是不平等的。

example.ex: The guests came from all social backgrounds...
example.tran: 客人们来自各个社会阶层。

collins.def: Social means relating to leisure activities that involve meeting other people.

example.ex: We ought to organize more social events...
example.tran: 我们应当组织更多的社交活动。

example.ex: Social activities might include barbecues on the beach and walking tours of the Old Town.
example.tran: 社交活动可以包括沙滩上的烧烤和老城区的步行游览。

collins.tran: (为俱乐部或团体的会员组织的)晚会，舞会，非正式聚会，联欢会
collins.def: A social is a party, dance, or informal gathering that is organized for the members of a club or institution.

example.ex: ...church socials.
example.tran: 教堂里举办的聚会

collins.def: Social animals live in groups and do things together.

example.ex: These endangered gentle giants are highly social animals.
example.tran: 这些濒临灭绝的、性情温顺的大型动物属于高度群居的动物。

example.ex: ...social insects like bees and ants.
example.tran: 像蜜蜂和蚂蚁这样的群居昆虫

collins.tran: 社会(视作一个有组织的大群体)
collins.def: Society is people in general, thought of as a large organized group.

example.ex: This reflects attitudes and values prevailing in society...
example.tran: 这反映了社会上盛行的态度和价值观。

example.ex: He maintains Islam must adapt to modern society.
example.tran: 他坚持认为伊斯兰教必须适应现代社会。

collins.tran: 社会(指居住在某个国家或地区的人民、其组织及其生活方式)
collins.def: A society is the people who live in a country or region, their organizations, and their way of life.

example.ex: We live in a capitalist society.
example.tran: 我们生活在一个资本主义社会里。

example.ex: ...those responsible for destroying our African heritage and the fabric of our society.
example.tran: 那些毁掉了我们非洲的文化遗产、破坏了我们的社会结构的人

collins.def: A society is an organization for people who have the same interest or aim.

example.ex: ...the North of England Horticultural Society.
example.tran: 北英格兰园艺协会

example.ex: ...the historical society.
example.tran: 历史协会

collins.def: Society is the rich, fashionable people in a particular place who meet on social occasions.

example.ex: The couple quickly became a fixture of society pages.
example.tran: 夫妇俩很快便成为了报纸社交版上的常驻人物。

example.ex: ...the high season for society weddings.
example.tran: 上流社会举办婚礼的旺季

collins.tran: 一些，有些(表示不确切的数量或数目)
collins.def: You use some to refer to a quantity of something or to a number of people or things, when you are not stating the quantity or number precisely.

example.ex: Robin opened some champagne...
example.tran: 罗宾开了一些香槟。

example.ex: Heat a couple of tablespoons of olive oil, a chopped clove of garlic and some black pepper in a heavy saucepan...
example.tran: 将几勺橄榄油、一片切碎的蒜瓣和一些黑胡椒粉放入深平底锅里加热。

collins.tran: (表示数量或数目相当大)好些，大量
collins.def: You use some to emphasize that a quantity or number is fairly large. For example, if an activity takes some time, it takes quite a lot of time.

example.ex: The question of local government finance has been the subject of debate for some years...
example.tran: 地方政府的财政问题已经争论了好些年。

example.ex: I have discussed this topic in some detail...
example.tran: 我已经较为详细地探讨了这个话题。

collins.tran: (表示数量或数目相当小)有几分，有点儿
collins.def: You use some to emphasize that a quantity or number is fairly small. For example, if something happens to some extent, it happens a little.

example.ex: 'Isn't there some chance that William might lead a normal life?' asked Jill...
example.tran: 吉尔问：“威廉还有一线希望过上正常的生活吗？”

example.ex: All mothers share to some extent in the tension of a wedding...
example.tran: 从某种程度上说，所有的母亲在婚礼上多少都有点紧张。

collins.def: If you refer to some of the people or things in a group, you mean a few of them but not all of them. If you refer to some of a particular thing, you mean a part of it but not all of it.

example.ex: Some of the people already in work will lose their jobs...
example.tran: 一些已经工作的人将要失业。

example.ex: Remove the cover and spoon some of the sauce into a bowl...
example.tran: 打开盖子，用勺子盛些调味汁到碗里。

collins.def: If you refer to some person or thing, you are referring to that person or thing but in a vague way, without stating precisely which person or thing you mean.

example.ex: If you are worried about some aspect of your child's health, call us...
example.tran: 如果你担心孩子某方面的健康问题，请给我们打电话。

example.ex: Jim Partridge chucked himself off some bridge or other...
example.tran: 吉姆·帕特里奇从某座桥上跳了下去。

collins.def: You can use some in front of a number to indicate that it is approximate.

example.ex: I have kept birds for some 30 years...
example.tran: 我养鸟大约有 30 年了。

example.ex: He waited some 80 to 100 yards from the big pink villa...
example.tran: 他在距离那座粉红色的大别墅约 80 到 100 码的地方等候着。

collins.def: Some is used to mean to a small extent or degree.

example.ex: If Susanne is off somewhere, I'll kill time by looking around some...
example.tran: 如果苏珊不在，我就随便看看打发时间好了。

example.ex: 'I party some,' said Jed...
example.tran: 杰德说：“我有时会去参加聚会。”

collins.tran: (表示赞同或不赞同)也叫，也算；了不起的，好极的
collins.def: You can use some in front of a noun in order to express your approval or disapproval of the person or thing you are mentioning.

example.ex: She lived to be ninety-nine years old and only weighed eighty pounds but she'd raised eight kids. That was some tough woman!...
example.tran: 她活到了 99 岁的高龄，体重虽然只有 80 磅，却养了 8 个孩子。真是个了不得的女人！

example.ex: 'Some party!'—'Yep. One hell of a party.'
example.tran: “这算是哪门子的聚会！”——“就是，简直是一塌糊涂。”

means: 重要的事物[人]，有一定意义的事物
（表示不确切的描述或数量）大致，左右

collins.tran: 某物，某事(指事物、情况、事件、想法等)
collins.def: You use something to refer to a thing, situation, event, or idea, without saying exactly what it is.

example.ex: He realized right away that there was something wrong...
example.tran: 他马上意识到什么地方出了问题。

example.ex: There was something vaguely familiar about him...
example.tran: 他身上有着某种似曾相识的东西。

collins.tran: (描述、数量等)大概，大致，大约，左右
collins.def: You can use something to say that the description or amount that you are giving is not exact.

example.ex: He described the smell as something between a circus and a seaport...
example.tran: 他形容那种气味介于马戏团和海港的味道之间。

example.ex: Clive made a noise, something like a grunt...
example.tran: 克莱夫发出一种声响，像是咕哝了一句。

collins.def: If you say that a person or thing is something or is really something, you mean that you are very impressed by them.

example.ex: You're really something...
example.tran: 你真了不起。

example.ex: The doors here are really something, all made of good wood like mahogany...
example.tran: 这些门真是极品，全部由红木一类的优质木材加工而成。

collins.tran: 聊以自慰的事;还算幸运的事
collins.def: You can use something in expressions like 'that's something' when you think that a situation is not very good but is better that it might have been.

example.ex: Well, at least he was in town. That was something...
example.tran: 好啦，至少他在城里，还算幸运。

example.ex: Well, you're staying. That's something I suppose.
example.tran: 啊，你准备留下来了。我想这算是能够聊以自慰吧。

collins.def: If you say that a thing is something of a disappointment, you mean that it is quite disappointing. If you say that a person is something of an artist, you mean that they are quite good at art.

example.ex: The city proved to be something of a disappointment...
example.tran: 结果这座城市有点儿令人失望。

example.ex: She received something of a surprise when Robert said that he was coming to New York...
example.tran: 当罗伯特说他就要来纽约的时候，她有点吃惊。

collins.tran: (想法或建议)有道理，值得考虑
collins.def: If you say that there is something in an idea or suggestion, you mean that it is quite good and should be considered seriously.

example.ex: Christianity has stood the test of time, so there must be something in it...
example.tran: 基督教经受住了时间的考验，因此其中一定是有些道理的。

example.ex: There had been something in Des's first statement...
example.tran: 德斯最初的陈述有些道理。

collins.tran: (表示对说的话不能肯定)或别的什么，或诸如此类
collins.def: You use something in expressions such as 'or something' and 'or something like that' to indicate that you are referring to something similar to what you have just mentioned but you are not being exact.

example.ex: This guy, his name was Briarly or Beardly or something...
example.tran: 这个家伙叫布赖厄利、比尔德利或什么类似的名字。

example.ex: The air fare was about a hundred and ninety-nine pounds or something like that.
example.tran: 机票 199 英镑左右，大概是这个价钱。

collins.def: Someone's son is their male child.

example.ex: He shared a pizza with his son Laurence...
example.tran: 他和儿子劳伦斯分吃了一张比萨饼。

example.ex: Sam is the seven-year-old son of Eric Davies...
example.tran: 萨姆是埃里克·戴维斯 7 岁的儿子。

collins.tran: (某地)之子(籍贯为某地的人，尤指名人)
