collins.def: A man, especially a famous man, can be described as a son of the place he comes from.

example.ex: ...New Orleans's most famous son, Louis Armstrong.
example.tran: 新奥尔良最著名的人物——路易斯·阿姆斯特朗

example.ex: ...sons of Africa.
example.tran: 非洲之子

collins.tran: 年轻人，孩子(对男孩或比自己年轻的男子的昵称)
collins.def: Some people use son as a form of address when they are showing kindness or affection to a boy or a man who is younger than them.

example.ex: Don't be frightened by failure, son.
example.tran: 孩子，不要害怕失败。

collins.def: If something is going to happen soon, it will happen after a short time. If something happened soon after a particular time or event, it happened a short time after it.

example.ex: You'll be hearing from us very soon...
example.tran: 你很快就会收到我们的来信。

example.ex: This chance has come sooner than I expected...
example.tran: 这个机会来得比我预想的要快。

collins.def: If you say that something happens as soon as something else happens, you mean that it happens immediately after the other thing.

example.ex: As soon as relations improve they will be allowed to go...
example.tran: 一旦关系有所改善，他们就可以获准离开。

example.ex: You'll never guess what happened as soon as I left my room.
example.tran: 你怎么也猜不出我一离开房间就发生了什么事。

collins.def: If you say that you would just as soon do something or you'd just as soon do it, you mean that you would prefer to do it.

example.ex: These people could afford to retire to Florida but they'd just as soon stay put...
example.tran: 这些人有足够的钱可以去佛罗里达安度退休生活，可是他们却宁愿留在原来的地方。

example.ex: I'd just as soon not have to make this public...
example.tran: 我宁愿不必将此事公之于众。

collins.def: If you talk about a particular sort of something, you are talking about a class of things that have particular features in common and that belong to a larger group of related things.

example.ex: What sort of school did you go to?...
example.tran: 你上的是哪类学校？

example.ex: There are so many different sorts of mushrooms available these days...
example.tran: 现在可以买到许许多多不同种类的蘑菇。

collins.tran: 具有某种性格的人;某种人
collins.def: You describe someone as a particular sort when you are describing their character.

example.ex: He seemed to be just the right sort for the job...
example.tran: 他似乎正是干这个工作的合适人选。

example.ex: She was a very vigorous sort of person...
example.tran: 她是那种精力非常充沛的人。

collins.def: If you sort things, you separate them into different classes, groups, or places, for example so that you can do different things with them.

example.ex: He sorted the materials into their folders...
example.tran: 他把材料分门别类放进了文件夹。

example.ex: The students are sorted into three ability groups...
example.tran: 学生们被按照各自的能力分成了 3 个组。

collins.def: If you get a problem or the details of something sorted, you do what is necessary to solve the problem or organize the details.

example.ex: I'm trying to get my script sorted...
example.tran: 我正努力把手稿的内容理顺。

example.ex: These problems have now been sorted.
example.tran: 这些问题现在已经解决了。

collins.tran: 各种各样的;形形色色的
collins.def: All sorts of things or people means a large number of different things or people.

example.ex: There are all sorts of animals, including bears, pigs, kangaroos, and penguins...
example.tran: 有各种各样的动物，包括熊、猪、袋鼠和企鹅。

example.ex: It was used by all sorts of people...
example.tran: 各种各样的人都使用它。

collins.tran: 勉强称得上…的;低劣的;一般的;起码的
collins.def: If you describe something as a thing of sorts or as a thing of a sort, you are suggesting that the thing is of a rather poor quality or standard.

example.ex: He made a living of sorts selling pancakes from a van...
example.tran: 他靠用货车卖薄饼勉强度日。

example.ex: She even managed a grimacing smile of sorts...
example.tran: 她甚至做了个怪笑。

collins.tran: 有几分;近似;有那么点儿
collins.def: You use sort of when you want to say that your description of something is not very accurate.

example.ex: You could even order windows from a catalogue — a sort of mail order stained glass service...
example.tran: 你甚至可以根据目录订购窗户——可以说是一种邮购彩色玻璃的业务。

example.ex: In the end, she sort of pushed it...
example.tran: 最后，她几乎是用了推的。

collins.tran: 身体不适;心情不佳;烦恼
collins.def: If you are out of sorts, you feel slightly unwell, upset, or annoyed.
When you speak, you use your voice in order to say something.

example.ex: He tried to speak, but for once, his voice had left him...
example.tran: 他想说话，却一时语塞。

example.ex: He speaks with a lisp...
example.tran: 他说话口齿不清。

collins.def: When someone speaks to a group of people, they make a speech.

example.ex: When speaking to the seminar Mr Franklin spoke of his experience, gained on a recent visit to Trinidad...
example.tran: 在研讨会上发言的时候，富兰克林先生谈到了他最近游览特立尼达的经历。

example.ex: He's determined to speak at the Democratic Convention...
example.tran: 他决定在民主党全国代表大会上发言。

collins.tran: 代表…讲话;充当…的代言人
collins.def: If you speak for a group of people, you make their views and demands known, or represent them.

example.ex: He said it was the job of the Church to speak for the underprivileged...
example.tran: 他说，为贫困群体说话是教会的义务。

example.ex: I speak for all 7,000 members of our organization...
example.tran: 我代表本组织的 7,000 名成员发言。

collins.def: If you speak a foreign language, you know the language and are able to have a conversation in it.

example.ex: He doesn't speak English...
example.tran: 他不会讲英语。

example.ex: Many of them can speak two or three or more languages.
example.tran: 他们当中许多人都会说两三门语言，有的人甚至更多。

collins.def: People sometimes mention something that has been written by saying what the author speaks of .

example.ex: In the book she speaks of his  “social ineptitude” and says he verbally abused her...
example.tran: 她在书中提到他“缺乏社交技能”，并且说他曾经对她出言不逊。

example.ex: St Paul speaks of the body as the 'temple of the Holy Spirit'.
example.tran: 圣保罗把身体描述为“圣神的宫殿”。

collins.def: If two people are not speaking, they no longer talk to each other because they have quarrelled.

example.ex: He is not speaking to his mother because of her friendship with his ex-wife...
example.tran: 因为母亲和前妻仍旧保持着友好的关系，他便不再和母亲说话。

example.ex: The co-stars are still not speaking.
example.tran: 两位联袂主演的明星仍然互不理睬。

collins.def: If you say that something speaks to you of a quality, experience, or feeling, you mean that it is evidence of it or expresses it.

example.ex: His behaviour spoke of an early maturity...
example.tran: 他的举止流露出早熟的痕迹。

example.ex: The length of the car and the high polish of its fittings both spoke of money...
example.tran: 长车身和高档配置无不象征着财富。

collins.def: If you say that something speaks for itself, you mean that its meaning or quality is so obvious that it does not need explaining or pointing out.

example.ex: ...the figures speak for  themselves — low order books, bleak prospects at home and a worsening outlook for exports...
example.tran: 这些数字本身就说明了问题——订单订购量低，国内销售前景惨淡，出口形势日趋恶化。

example.ex: The results speak for themselves.
example.tran: 结局不言自明。

collins.tran: 你说的只是你的看法;这只是你的高见
collins.def: If you say 'Speak for yourself' when someone has said something, you mean that what they have said is only their opinion or applies only to them.

example.ex: 'We're not blaming you,' Kate said. 'Speak for yourself,' Boris muttered.
example.tran: “我们没有怪你，”凯特说。“也就是你这么想，”鲍里斯嘟囔道。

collins.tran: 已被预订;早已订购;已经许给别人
collins.def: If a person or thing is spoken for or has been spoken for, someone has claimed them or asked for them, so no-one else can have them.

example.ex: She'd probably drop some comment about her 'fiancé' into the conversation so that he'd think she was already spoken for...
example.tran: 她可能会在谈话的时候不着痕迹地对她的“未婚夫”作些评论，这样他便会认为她已经名花有主了。

example.ex: By December last year most of the resources had been spoken for.
example.tran: 去年 12 月之前，绝大多数的资源就被预订了。

collins.def: If you say that actions speak louder than words, you mean that people's actions show their real attitudes, rather than what they say. This expression is sometimes used to advise a person to do something positive.
Nothing to speak of means 'hardly anything' or 'only unimportant things'.

example.ex: They have no weaponry to speak of...
example.tran: 他们没有什么武器值得炫耀。

example.ex: 'Any fresh developments?' — 'Nothing to speak of.'
example.tran: “有什么新进展了吗？”——“谈不上什么新进展。”

collins.def: You can use not to speak of when adding something which your previous statement also applies to, or applies to even more than other things.

example.ex: This move caused consternation among universities and the government, not to speak of the students affected.
example.tran: 这个举措在大学和政府里造成了恐慌，更不用说受到影响的学生们了。

collins.tran: 说…的好话/坏话；称赞/批评
collins.def: If you speak well of someone or speak highly of someone, you say good things about them. If you speak ill of someone, you criticize them.

example.ex: Both spoke highly of the Russian president...
example.tran: 双方均盛赞俄罗斯总统。

example.ex: It seemed she found it difficult to speak ill of anyone.
example.tran: 她似乎觉得说别人的坏话很难。

collins.def: You use so to speak to draw attention to the fact that you are describing or referring to something in a way that may be amusing or unusual rather than completely accurate.

example.ex: I ought not to tell you but I will, since you're in the family, so to speak...
example.tran: 我本来不该告诉你的，但我还是要这么做，因为好歹你是家里的一员。

example.ex: The five countries have now all passed, so to speak, their entry test.
example.tran: 可以说，这5个国家现在都已经通过了入门考试。

collins.def: If you are on speaking terms with someone, you are quite friendly with them and often talk to them.

example.ex: For a long time her mother and her grandmother had hardly been on speaking terms.
example.tran: 很久以来，她的母亲和外婆两人之间几乎不怎么说话。

collins.def: Someone or something that is special is better or more important than other people or things.

example.ex: You're very special to me, darling...
example.tran: 亲爱的，你对我来说很重要。

example.ex: There are strong arguments for holidays at Easter and Christmas because these are special occasions...
example.tran: 支持复活节和圣诞节放假是有充分论据的，因为这些节日都是特殊的时刻。

collins.def: Special means different from normal.

example.ex: In special cases, a husband can deduct the travel expenses of his wife who accompanies him on a business trip...
example.tran: 在特殊情况下，丈夫可以扣除陪同出差的妻子的旅费。

example.ex: So you didn't notice anything special about him?...
example.tran: 这么说你并没有发现他有什么异常之处了？

collins.def: You use special to describe someone who is officially appointed or who has a particular position specially created for them.

example.ex: Due to his wife's  illness, he returned to the State Department as special adviser to the President...
example.tran: 由于妻子生病，他回到了国务院，出任总统的特别顾问。

example.ex: Frank Deford is a special correspondent for Newsweek magazine.
example.tran: 弗兰克·德福特是《新闻周刊》杂志的特派记者。

collins.tran: (为残疾人或有心理障碍者)特设的，专门的
collins.def: Special institutions are for people who have serious physical or mental problems.

example.ex: Police are still searching for a convicted rapist, who escaped from Broadmoor special hospital yesterday.
example.tran: 警方仍然在搜寻昨天从布罗德莫尔专科医院逃跑的一名强奸犯。

collins.def: You use special to describe something that relates to one particular person, group, or place.

example.ex: Every anxious person will have his or her own special problems or fears.
example.tran: 每一个焦虑的人都会有自己的问题或者担心。

example.ex: ...it requires a very special brand of courage to fight dictators.
example.tran: 与独裁者作斗争需要非同寻常的勇气。

collins.def: A special is a product, programme, or meal which is not normally available, or which is made for a particular purpose.

example.ex: ...complaints about the BBC's Hallowe'en special, 'Ghostwatch'...
example.tran: 对英国广播公司的万圣节特别节目《幽灵观察》的投诉

example.ex: Grocery stores have to offer enough specials to bring people into the store.
example.tran: 杂货店为了招揽顾客不得不推出多种特色产品。

means: （为某目的或某段时间内的）花销，花费，开销

collins.def: When you spend money, you pay money for things that you want.

example.ex: By the end of the holiday I had spent all my money...
example.tran: 到假期结束时，我已经花光了自己所有的钱。

example.ex: Businessmen spend enormous amounts advertising their products...
example.tran: 商人们花费巨额资金为自己的商品做广告。

collins.def: If you spend time or energy doing something, you use your time or effort doing it.

example.ex: Engineers spend much time and energy developing brilliant solutions...
example.tran: 工程师们花费很多时间和精力来开发完美的解决方案。

example.ex: This energy could be much better spent taking some positive action.
example.tran: 这些精力若用于采取某些积极行动的话，可能会更值得。

collins.def: If you spend a period of time in a place, you stay there for a period of time.

example.ex: We spent the night in a hotel.
example.tran: 我们在一家旅馆过夜。

collins.def: The spend on a particular thing is the amount of money that is spent on it, or will be spent.

example.ex: ...the marketing and advertising spend.
example.tran: 营销和广告开支

collins.tran: (一组织的)全体工作人员，全体，职员
collins.def: The staff of an organization are the people who work for it.

example.ex: The staff were very good...
example.tran: 职员都很出色。

example.ex: The outpatient program has a staff of six people...
example.tran: 门诊部有 6 名工作人员。

collins.tran: (全体工作人员中的)部分成员
collins.def: People who are part of a particular staff are often referred to as staff .

example.ex: 10 staff were allocated to the task...
example.tran: 10名员工被分配来完成这项任务。

example.ex: He had the complete support of hospital staff.
example.tran: 他得到了医院职工的全力支持。

collins.tran: 由…担任工作人员;由…供职
collins.def: If an organization is staffed by particular people, they are the people who work for it.

example.ex: They are staffed by volunteers...
example.tran: 它们的工作人员都是志愿者。

example.ex: The center is staffed with highly trained physicians...
example.tran: 该中心配备了训练有素的医生。

collins.def: A staff is a strong stick or pole.
A staff is the five lines that music is written on.

means: 适于上演，适合在舞台上演出

collins.tran: (活动、过程或时期的)阶段，部分
collins.def: A stage of an activity, process, or period is one part of it.

example.ex: The way children talk about or express their feelings depends on their age and stage of development...
example.tran: 儿童谈论或表达自己感情的方式取决于他们的年龄和所处的发育阶段。

example.ex: Mr Cook has arrived in Greece on the final stage of a tour which also included Egypt and Israel.
example.tran: 库克先生在行程的最后一站来到了希腊，他此行还包括了埃及和以色列。

collins.def: In a theatre, the stage is an area where actors or other entertainers perform.

example.ex: The road crew needed more than 24 hours to move and rebuild the stage after a concert...
example.tran: 一场音乐会结束后，巡回乐队管理组需要用一天多时间搬走和重新搭起舞台。

example.ex: I went on stage and did my show.
example.tran: 我上台作了表演。

collins.def: You can refer to acting and the production of plays in a theatre as the stage .

example.ex: Madge did not want to put her daughter on the stage...
example.tran: 玛奇不想让自己的女儿从事戏剧表演。

example.ex: He was the first comedian I ever saw on the stage.
example.tran: 他是我在舞台上看到过的第一位滑稽演员。

collins.def: If someone stages a play or other show, they organize and present a performance of it.

example.ex: Maya Angelou first staged the play 'And I Still Rise' in the late 1970s.
example.tran: 马娅·安杰卢在 20 世纪 70 年代后期第一次将戏剧《我还会站起来》搬上了舞台。

collins.def: If you stage an event or ceremony, you organize it and usually take part in it.

example.ex: Russian workers have staged a number of strikes in protest at the republic's declaration of independence...
example.tran: 俄罗斯工人已经举行了数次罢工，抗议该共和国宣布独立。

example.ex: At the middle of this year the government staged a huge military parade.
example.tran: 今年年中，政府举行了一次盛大的阅兵活动。

collins.def: You can refer to a particular area of activity as a particular stage, especially when you are talking about politics.

example.ex: He was finally forced off the political stage last year by the deterioration of his physical condition...
example.tran: 他最终因身体状况恶化被迫于去年离开了政治舞台。

example.ex: The EU thought it could resolve Europe's worst nightmare and boost its own credibility as a strong actor on the international stage.
example.tran: 欧盟认为它能够解决欧洲面临的最严重的困境，提升自己作为国际舞台上一个重要角色的声誉。

collins.def: When you are standing, your body is upright, your legs are straight, and your weight is supported by your feet.

example.ex: She was standing beside my bed staring down at me...
example.tran: 她站在我的床边低头盯着我。

example.ex: They told me to stand still and not to turn round...
example.tran: 他们叫我站着不动，不要转身。

collins.def: When someone who is sitting stands, they change their position so that they are upright and on their feet.

example.ex: Becker stood and shook hands with Ben.
example.tran: 贝克尔站起来和本握手。

collins.def: If you stand aside or stand back, you move a short distance sideways or backwards, so that you are standing in a different place.

example.ex: I stood aside to let her pass me...
example.tran: 我站到一边，让她从我身旁过去。

example.ex: The policemen stood back. Could it be a bomb?
example.tran: 警察们往后退了退。这会是个炸弹吗？

collins.def: If something such as a building or a piece of furniture stands somewhere, it is in that position, and is upright.

example.ex: The house stands alone on top of a small hill...
example.tran: 房子孤零零地坐落在一座小山顶上。

example.ex: I reached for the lamp, which stood in the middle of the table.
example.tran: 我伸手去够位于桌子中央的灯。

collins.tran: (建筑物在周围其他建筑物倒塌或被毁后)依然存在，矗立
collins.def: You can say that a building is standing when it remains after other buildings around it have fallen down or been destroyed.

example.ex: The palace, which was damaged by bombs in World War II, still stood...
example.tran: 二战中遭到轰炸的那座宫殿依然矗立着。

example.ex: There are very few buildings left standing.
example.tran: 几乎没有几个建筑物留存下来。

collins.def: If you stand something somewhere, you put it there in an upright position.

example.ex: Stand the plant in the open in a sunny, sheltered place.
example.tran: 把这株植物放在一个阳光充足、上方有遮盖物的开阔处。

collins.tran: (将食物或调拌物等)搁置不动
collins.def: If you leave food or a mixture of something to stand, you leave it without disturbing it for some time.

example.ex: The salad improves if made in advance and left to stand.
example.tran: 色拉如果能事先做好再搁置一会儿，味道会更好。

collins.def: If you take or make a stand, you do something or say something in order to make it clear what your attitude to a particular thing is.

example.ex: He felt the need to make a stand against racism in South Africa...
example.tran: 他感觉有必要表明自己对南非的种族主义持反对态度。

example.ex: They must take a stand and cast their votes...
example.tran: 他们必须表明立场并投票。

collins.def: If you ask someone where or how they stand on a particular issue, you are asking them what their attitude or view is.

example.ex: The amendment will force senators to show where they stand on the issue of sexual harassment...
example.tran: 修订案将迫使参议员们表明自己对性骚扰问题的立场。

example.ex: So far, the bishop hasn't said where he stands.
example.tran: 迄今为止，主教还没有表明自己的态度。

collins.def: If you do not know where you stand with someone, you do not know exactly what their attitude to you is.

example.ex: No-one knows where they stand with him; he is utterly unpredictable...
example.tran: 谁也不知道他怎样看待他们;他是个完全不可捉摸的人。

example.ex: All children need discipline, to know where they stand.
example.tran: 所有孩子都需要管教，让他们知道别人如何看待自己。

collins.def: You can use stand instead of 'be' when you are describing the present state or condition of something or someone.

example.ex: The alliance stands ready to do what is necessary...
example.tran: 联盟已准备好采取必要行动。

example.ex: He stands accused of destroying the party in pursuit of his presidential ambitions...
example.tran: 他被指责为实现自己当总统的野心而不惜毁灭该党。

collins.def: If a decision, law, or offer stands, it still exists and has not been changed or cancelled.

example.ex: Although exceptions could be made, the rule still stands...
example.tran: 虽然可能有例外，但该规定仍然有效。

example.ex: The Supreme Court says that the convictions can stand.
example.tran: 最高法院说判决结果依然有效。

collins.def: If something that can be measured stands at a particular level, it is at that level.

example.ex: The inflation rate now stands at 3.6 per cent...
example.tran: 通货膨胀率目前为 3.6%。

example.ex: Support for the two sides is standing at between 42 and 44 per cent.
example.tran: 双方的支持率在 42%和 44%之间。

collins.def: You can describe how tall or high someone or something is by saying that they stand a particular height.

example.ex: She stood five feet five inches tall and weighed 120 pounds...
example.tran: 她身高 5 英尺 5 英寸，体重 120 磅。

example.ex: The dam will stand 600 feet high...
example.tran: 大坝将高达 600 英尺。

collins.tran: 经得起，承受得住(困难、考验)
collins.def: If something can stand a situation or a test, it is good enough or strong enough to experience it without being damaged, harmed, or shown to be inadequate.

example.ex: These are the first machines that can stand the wear and tear of continuously crushing glass...
example.tran: 这些就是第一批能经受住不停碾碎玻璃所造成的磨损的机器。

example.ex: I think these books can stand comparison quite happily with works by Dickens...
example.tran: 我认为这些书能和狄更斯的作品相媲美。

collins.def: If you cannot stand something, you cannot bear it or tolerate it.

example.ex: I can't stand any more. I'm going to run away...
example.tran: 我再也受不了了。我要逃走。

example.ex: Stoddart can stand any amount of personal criticism...
example.tran: 不管有多少针对他的个人批评，斯托达特都可以忍受。

collins.def: If you cannot stand someone or something, you dislike them very strongly.

example.ex: I can't stand that man and his arrogance...
example.tran: 我讨厌那个男人和他的傲慢。

example.ex: He can't stand me smoking.
example.tran: 他受不了我抽烟。

collins.tran: 可能获得/ 可能失去
collins.def: If you stand to gain something, you are likely to gain it. If you stand to lose something, you are likely to lose it.

example.ex: The management group would stand to gain millions of dollars if the company were sold...
example.tran: 如果该公司被卖掉，管理层会获得几百万美元。

example.ex: As many as 30,000 workers at 22 nuclear weapons sites stand to lose their jobs.
example.tran: 在 22 个核武器制造点工作的多达 3 万名工人可能会失业。

collins.def: If you stand in an election, you are a candidate in it.

example.ex: He has not yet announced whether he will stand in the election...
example.tran: 他尚未宣布自己是否会参选。

example.ex: Some ardent supporters were urging him to stand...
example.tran: 一些热心支持者正在力劝他参选。

collins.def: If you stand someone a meal or a drink, you buy it for them.

example.ex: You can stand me a pint.
example.tran: 你可以请我喝一品脱啤酒。

collins.tran: (设在户外或大型公共建筑物内的)小店，售货摊
collins.def: A stand is a small shop or stall, outdoors or in a large public building.

example.ex: He ran a newspaper stand outside the American Express office...
example.tran: 他在美国运通公司办公大楼外经营一家报摊。

example.ex: She bought a hot dog from a stand on a street corner.
example.tran: 她从街角的小摊上买了个热狗。

collins.def: A stand at a sports ground is a large structure where people sit or stand to watch what is happening.
A stand is an object or piece of furniture that is designed for supporting or holding a particular kind of thing.

example.ex: The teapot came with a stand to catch the drips.
example.tran: 那把茶壶配有一个可以接滴水的茶托。

collins.tran: (出租车、公共汽车的)停车候客处
collins.def: A stand is an area where taxis or buses can wait to pick up passengers.

example.ex: Luckily there was a taxi stand nearby.
example.tran: 幸好附近就有一个出租车候客处。

collins.def: In a law court, the stand is the place where a witness stands to answer questions.

example.ex: When the father took the stand today, he contradicted his son's testimony...
example.tran: 那位父亲今天出庭作证时，驳斥了自己儿子的证词。

example.ex: The government has called nearly 50 witnesses to the stand.
example.tran: 政府已传招了近 50 名证人出庭。

collins.tran: 真实性取决于;成败在于
collins.def: If an idea, claim, or attempt stands or falls on something, its truth or success depends on that thing.

example.ex: Airlines should stand or fall on their ability to attract passengers.
example.tran: 航空公司的成败应该取决于它们吸引乘客的能力。

collins.def: You can describe someone's final attempt to defend themselves before they are defeated as their last stand .

example.ex: There they made their tragic and heroic last stand against the Roman legions.
example.tran: 他们在那里对罗马军团进行了最后的抵抗，场面英勇而悲壮。

collins.def: If you say it stands to reason that something is true or likely to happen, you mean that it is obvious.

example.ex: It stands to reason that if you are considerate and friendly to people you will get a lot more back...
example.tran: 显然，如果你通情达理，对人友善，那么你肯定会获得更多回报。

example.ex: Smith isn't his real name, that stands to reason.
example.tran: 很显然，史密斯不是他的真名。

collins.def: If you stand in the way of something or stand in a person's way, you prevent that thing from happening or prevent that person from doing something.

example.ex: The British government would not stand in the way of such a proposal...
example.tran: 英国政府不会阻止这样一项提议。

example.ex: It is his decision to go to America and who am I to stand in his way?
example.tran: 去美国是他的决定，我凭什么要阻拦他？

collins.def: A star is a large ball of burning gas in space. Stars appear to us as small points of light in the sky on clear nights.

example.ex: The night was dark, the stars hidden behind cloud.
example.tran: 夜很黑，星星都躲在云的后面。

collins.def: You can refer to a shape or an object as a star when it has four, five, or more points sticking out of it in a regular pattern.

example.ex: Children at school receive coloured stars for work well done.
example.tran: 学校里的孩子表现得好会得到彩色星星。

collins.def: You can say how many stars something such as a hotel or restaurant has as a way of talking about its quality, which is often indicated by a number of star-shaped symbols. The more stars something has, the better it is.

example.ex: ...five star hotels.
example.tran: 五星级宾馆

collins.def: Famous actors, musicians, and sports players are often referred to as stars .

example.ex: ...Gemma, 41, star of the TV series Pennies From Heaven...
example.tran: 杰玛，41 岁，电视连续剧《飞来横财》中的明星

example.ex: By now Murphy is Hollywood's top male comedy star...
example.tran: 墨菲现在已经是好莱坞的一线男喜剧明星了。

collins.tran: (在戏剧或电影中)担任主角，主演
collins.def: If an actor or actress stars in a play or film, he or she has one of the most important parts in it.

example.ex: The previous year Adolphson had starred in a play in which Ingrid had been an extra...
example.tran: 上一年，阿道夫森在一部戏剧里担任主角，当时英格丽在剧中还只是个临时演员。

example.ex: He's starred in dozens of films.
example.tran: 他主演过很多部影片。

collins.def: If a play or film stars a famous actor or actress, he or she has one of the most important parts in it.

example.ex: ...the BBC's new satirical show, That Was The Week That Was, which starred David Frost.
example.tran: 由戴维·弗罗斯特主持的英国广播公司新讽刺节目《那一周》

example.ex: ...a Hollywood film, The Secret of Santa Vittoria, directed by Stanley Kramer and starring Anthony Quinn.
example.tran: 由斯坦利·克雷默导演、安东尼·奎因主演的好莱坞影片《圣维多利亚的秘密》

collins.def: Predictions about people's lives which are based on astrology and appear regularly in a newspaper or magazine are sometimes referred to as the stars .

example.ex: There was nothing in my stars to say I'd have travel problems!
example.tran: 我的星象预测中没有说我会在旅行中遇到麻烦！

collins.def: If you say that someone should thank their lucky stars that something is the case, you mean that they should be very grateful that it is the case, because otherwise their situation would be a lot worse.

example.ex: Thank your lucky stars you're out of London.
example.tran: 你不在伦敦真是走运了。

collins.def: If you start to do something, you do something that you were not doing before and you continue doing it.

example.ex: John then unlocked the front door and I started to follow him up the stairs...
example.tran: 约翰接着打开前门，我开始跟他上楼。

example.ex: It was 1956 when Susanna started the work on the garden...
example.tran: 苏珊娜是从 1956 年开始修建这个花园的。

collins.def: When something starts, or if someone starts it, it takes place from a particular time.

example.ex: The fire is thought to have started in an upstairs room...
example.tran: 火灾被认为是从楼上的一个房间里开始燃起的。

example.ex: The Great War started in August of that year...
example.tran: 第一次世界大战于那年 8 月爆发。

collins.def: If you start by doing something, or if you start with something, you do that thing first in a series of actions.

example.ex: I started by asking how many day-care centers were located in the United States...
example.tran: 我一开始先问了问美国有多少所日托中心。

example.ex: He started with a good holiday in Key West, Florida.
example.tran: 他先去佛罗里达的基韦斯特岛度了个愉快的假期。

collins.def: You use start to say what someone's first job was. For example, if their first job was that of a factory worker, you can say that they started as a factory worker.

example.ex: Betty started as a shipping clerk at the clothes factory...
example.tran: 贝蒂的第一份工作是在服装厂里当运务员。

example.ex: Grace Robertson started as a photographer with Picture Post in 1947.
example.tran: 格雷斯·罗伯逊于 1947 年参加工作，做了《图片邮报》杂志的一名摄影师。

collins.def: When someone starts something such as a new business, they create it or cause it to begin.

example.ex: George Granger has started a health centre and I know he's looking for qualified staff...
example.tran: 乔治·格兰杰开办了一个保健中心，我知道他正在物色合格的职员。

example.ex: Now is probably as good a time as any to start a business.
example.tran: 目前可能正是创业的最佳时机。

collins.tran: 开动，发动(发动机、汽车、机器等)
collins.def: If you start an engine, car, or machine, or if it starts, it begins to work.

example.ex: He started the car, which hummed smoothly...
example.tran: 他发动了汽车，车发出平稳的嗡嗡声。

example.ex: We were just passing one of the parking bays when a car's engine started.
example.tran: 我们从一个停车区经过时，一辆车发动了引擎。

collins.def: If you start, your body suddenly moves slightly as a result of surprise or fear.

example.ex: She put the bottle on the table, banging it down hard. He started at the sound...
example.tran: 她砰的一声把瓶子放到了桌子上，把他吓了一跳。

example.ex: Rachel started forward on the sofa. — 'You mean you've arrested Pete?'
example.tran: 雷切尔从沙发上猛地往前一欠身子。——“你的意思是你已经抓到了皮特?”

collins.def: You use for a start or to start with to introduce the first of a number of things or reasons that you want to mention or could mention.

example.ex: You must get her name and address, and that can be a problem for a start...
example.tran: 你必须先打听到她的姓名和地址，而那可能就是第一个难题。

example.ex: It comes as a surprise to be reminded that he is 70. For a start, he doesn't look it...
example.tran: 有人提醒我他 70 岁了，这很令人惊讶。首先，他看上去不像。

collins.def: If you get off to a good start, you are successful in the early stages of doing something. If you get off to a bad start, you are not successful in the early stages of doing something.

example.ex: The new Prime Minister has got off to a good start, but he still has to demonstrate what manner of leader he is going to be...
example.tran: 新首相上任后开了个好头，但他仍得展现出自己的执政风格。

example.ex: England got off to a bad start in the Five Nations' Championship, losing 35-10 to France.
example.tran: 英格兰队在五国锦标赛中开局不利，以 10 比 35 输给了法国队。

collins.def: To start with means at the very first stage of an event or process.

example.ex: To start with, the pressure on her was very heavy, but it's eased off a bit now...
example.tran: 一开始，她的压力很大，但现在已经好些了。

example.ex: Success was assured and, at least to start with, the system operated smoothly.
example.tran: 成功有保证了，至少该系统一开始运行得挺顺利。

collins.tran: (尤用于讨论政治事务时)国家
collins.def: You can refer to countries as states, particularly when you are discussing politics.

example.ex: Mexico is a secular state and does not have diplomatic relations with the Vatican...
example.tran: 墨西哥是个世俗国家，和梵蒂冈没有外交关系。

example.ex: Some weeks ago I recommended to EU member states that we should have discussions with the Americans.
example.tran: 几周前，我曾向欧盟成员国提议我们应该和美国人进行磋商。

collins.def: Some large countries such as the USA are divided into smaller areas called states .

example.ex: Leaders of the Southern states are meeting in Louisville.
example.tran: 南部一些州的领导正在路易斯维尔开会。

collins.def: The USA is sometimes referred to as the States .
You can refer to the government of a country as the state .

example.ex: The state does not collect enough revenue to cover its expenditure...
example.tran: 该国政府入不敷出。

example.ex: Eastern Europe shows that worker-owned factories can be as inefficient as state-owned ones.
example.tran: 东欧的经验表明，工人所有的工厂可能和国有工厂一样效率低下。

collins.def: State industries or organizations are financed and organized by the government rather than private companies.

example.ex: ...reform of the state social-security system.
example.tran: 对国家社会保障制度的改革

collins.def: A state occasion is a formal one involving the head of a country.

example.ex: ...the Queen's three-day state visit to France.
example.tran: 女王对法国为期 3 天的国事访问

collins.def: When you talk about the state of someone or something, you are referring to the condition they are in or what they are like at a particular time.

example.ex: For the first few months after Daniel died, I was in a state of clinical depression...
example.tran: 丹尼尔去世后的最初几个月里，我一直处于临床抑郁症的状态。

example.ex: When we moved here the walls and ceiling were in an awful state...
example.tran: 我们刚搬到这里时，墙和房顶都破旧不堪。

collins.tran: (以口头或书面形式正式或明确地)声称，宣称，声明
collins.def: If you state something, you say or write it in a formal or definite way.

example.ex: Clearly state your address and telephone number...
example.tran: 清楚地报上你的地址和电话号码。

example.ex: The police report stated that he was arrested for allegedly assaulting his wife...
example.tran: 警方的报告称，他因涉嫌殴打妻子而被捕。

collins.tran: (因精神或健康状态不佳而)不适宜(做某事)
collins.def: If you say that someone is not in a fit state to do something, you mean that they are too upset or ill to do it.

example.ex: When you left our place, you weren't in a fit state to drive.
example.tran: 你离开我们家时已经开不了车了。

collins.def: If you are in a state or if you get into a state, you are very upset or nervous about something.

example.ex: I was in a terrible state because nobody could understand why I had this illness...
example.tran: 我极度焦虑不安，因为谁也不知道为什么我会得这个病。

example.ex: People will work themselves up into a state about anything.
example.tran: 人们总会沉不住气，为任何事感到担忧。

collins.tran: (重要人物的遗体)停放供瞻仰
collins.def: If the dead body of an important person lies in state, it is publicly displayed for a few days before it is buried.
If you stay where you are, you continue to be there and do not leave.

example.ex: 'Stay here,' Trish said. 'I'll bring the car down the drive to take you back.'...
example.tran: “呆这别动，”特里西说,“我会把车开过来送你回去。”

example.ex: In the old days the woman stayed at home and the man earned the money.
example.tran: 过去，女主内，男主外。

collins.tran: (在某城市、旅馆或别人家)暂住，逗留
collins.def: If you stay in a town, or hotel, or at someone's house, you live there for a short time.

example.ex: Gordon stayed at The Park Hotel, Milan...
example.tran: 戈登下榻在米兰的帕克饭店。

example.ex: He tried to stay a few months every year in Scotland.
example.tran: 他每年都会争取在苏格兰住几个月。

collins.def: If someone or something stays in a particular state or situation, they continue to be in it.

example.ex: The Republican candidate said he would 'work like crazy to stay ahead'.
example.tran: 共和党候选人说他将“拼命保持领先优势”。

example.ex: ...community care networks that offer classes on how to stay healthy...
example.tran: 开设养生课程的社区保健网络

collins.def: If you stay away from a place, you do not go there.

example.ex: Government employees and officers also stayed away from work during the strike...
example.tran: 政府雇员和官员在罢工期间也没去上班。

example.ex: Every single employee turned up at the meeting, even people who usually stayed away.
example.tran: 所有雇员一个个不落都参加了会议，甚至平常不去开会的人都去了。

collins.def: If you stay out of something, you do not get involved in it.

example.ex: In the past, the UN has stayed out of the internal affairs of countries unless invited in...
example.tran: 在过去，除非有国家提出请求,否则联合国不会干涉各国内政。

example.ex: After months of staying well out of the problem, Washington has expressed a willingness to help find a solution.
example.tran: 几个月以来都不曾介入该问题的华盛顿方面已表示愿意帮助寻求解决方案。

collins.def: If you say that something is here to stay, you mean that people have accepted it and it has become a part of everyday life.

example.ex: Satellite TV is here to stay...
example.tran: 卫星电视已被普遍接受。

example.ex: Nuclear weapons are here to stay because they have changed the way countries approach the idea of war.
example.tran: 核武器已被广泛接受，因为它们改变了各国处理战争的方法。

collins.def: If you stay put, you remain somewhere.

example.ex: He was forced by his condition to stay put and remain out of politics...
example.tran: 他的健康状况迫使他留在原处,置身于政坛之外。

example.ex: Nigel says for the moment he is very happy to stay put in Lyon.
example.tran: 奈杰尔说目前他很乐意留在里昂。

collins.def: If you stay the night in a place, you sleep there for one night.

example.ex: They had invited me to come to supper and stay the night.
example.tran: 他们邀请我去吃晚饭并住上一晚。

collins.def: If you take a step, you lift your foot and put it down in a different place, for example when you are walking.

example.ex: I took a step towards him...
example.tran: 我朝他迈了一步。

example.ex: She walked on a few steps...
example.tran: 她继续走了几步。

collins.def: If you step on something or step in a particular direction, you put your foot on the thing or move your foot in that direction.

example.ex: This was the moment when Neil Armstrong became the first man to step on the Moon...
example.tran: 就在此刻，内尔·阿姆斯特朗成了首位登上月球的人。

example.ex: She accidentally stepped on his foot on a crowded commuter train...
example.tran: 她在拥挤的通勤列车上不小心踩到了他的脚。

collins.def: Steps are a series of surfaces at increasing or decreasing heights, on which you put your feet in order to walk up or down to a different level.

example.ex: This little room was along a passage and down some steps...
example.tran: 这个小房间在沿着走廊再下几级台阶的地方。

example.ex: A flight of stone steps leads to the terrace.
example.tran: 一段石阶通向露台。

collins.def: A step is a raised flat surface in front of a door.

example.ex: A little girl was sitting on the step of the end house...
example.tran: 一个小女孩正坐在最顶头那幢房子门前的平台上。

example.ex: Leave empty milk bottles on the step.
example.tran: 将空奶瓶放在门阶上。

collins.def: A step is one of a series of actions that you take in order to achieve something.

example.ex: He greeted the agreement as the first step towards peace...
example.tran: 他称该协定是通向和平的第一步。

example.ex: She is not content with her present lot and wishes to take steps to improve it...
example.tran: 她对自己目前的生活并不满意，希望能采取措施改善它。

collins.def: A step in a process is one of a series of stages.

example.ex: The next step is to put the theory into practice...
example.tran: 下一步是要将理论付诸实践。

example.ex: Aristotle took the scientific approach a step further.
example.tran: 亚里士多德将该科学方法向前推进了一步。

collins.def: The steps of a dance are the sequences of foot movements which make it up.
Someone's step is the way they walk.

example.ex: He quickened his step...
example.tran: 他加快了步伐。

example.ex: There was a real spring in her step.
example.tran: 她的步子非常轻快。

collins.def: Steps are the same as a stepladder .
If you stay one step ahead of someone or something, you manage to achieve more than they do or avoid competition or danger from them.

example.ex: Successful travel is partly a matter of keeping one step ahead of the crowd...
example.tran: 成功的旅行在某种程度上就是要比人群先走一步。

example.ex: Businessmen cluster together to get ideas, tips, personal contacts anything to get a step ahead of the computer.
example.tran: 商人们聚集在一起寻求创意、建议、人际关系等，以便能比计算机领先一步。

collins.tran: 步伐整齐/步伐不整齐;合拍/不合拍
collins.def: If people who are walking or dancing are in step, they are moving their feet forward at exactly the same time as each other. If they are out of step, their feet are moving forward at different times.

example.ex: They were almost the same height and they moved perfectly in step...
example.tran: 他们几乎一样高，而且走路时步调完全一致。

example.ex: They jogged in silence a while, faces lowered, out of step...
example.tran: 他们低着头，一言不发地慢跑了一会儿，步伐也不一致。

collins.tran: (想法、意见等)与…一致/与…不一致
collins.def: If people are in step with each other, their ideas or opinions are the same. If they are out of step with each other, their ideas or opinions are different.

example.ex: Moscow is anxious to stay in step with Washington...
example.tran: 俄罗斯政府迫切希望和美国政府保持一致。

example.ex: The British Government is once more out of step with world opinion.
example.tran: 英国政府的观点再一次和世界舆论出现分歧。

collins.def: If you tell someone to step on it, you are telling them to go faster or hurry up.

example.ex: We've only got thirty-five minutes so step on it.
example.tran: 我们只有 35 分钟了，快点。

collins.def: If you do something step by step, you do it by progressing gradually from one stage to the next.

example.ex: I am not rushing things and I'm taking it step by step...
example.tran: 我不会仓促行事，我会一步一步地来。

example.ex: Follow our simple step-by-step instructions.
example.tran: 按照我们简单的说明，一步一步来。

collins.def: If someone tells you to watch your step, they are warning you to be careful about how you behave or what you say so that you do not get into trouble.
If you have been doing something and then you stop doing it, you no longer do it.

example.ex: Stop throwing those stones!...
example.tran: 不要再扔那些石头了！

example.ex: He can't stop thinking about it...
example.tran: 他没办法不再想这件事。

collins.def: If you stop something happening, you prevent it from happening or prevent it from continuing.

example.ex: He proposed a new diplomatic initiative to try to stop the war...
example.tran: 他提出了一项新的外交计划以尽力阻止这场战争。

example.ex: If the fire isn't stopped, it could spread to 25,000 acres...
example.tran: 如果大火不被扑灭，它可能会蔓延 2.5 万英亩。

collins.def: If an activity or process stops, it is no longer happening.

example.ex: The rain had stopped and a star or two was visible over the mountains...
example.tran: 雨停了，山顶上有一两颗星星在闪烁。

example.ex: The system overheated and filming had to stop...
example.tran: 系统过热，拍摄工作只好停了下来。

collins.tran: (机器等)停止运转;(使)停止工作
collins.def: If something such as machine stops or is stopped, it is no longer moving or working.

example.ex: The clock had stopped at 2.12 a.m...
example.tran: 钟在凌晨 2 点 12 分时停了。

example.ex: His heart stopped three times...
example.tran: 他的心脏曾 3 次停止跳动。

collins.tran: (使)(移动着的人或车)停下;把…拦住
collins.def: When a moving person or vehicle stops or is stopped, they no longer move and they remain in the same place.

example.ex: The car failed to stop at an army checkpoint...
example.tran: 那辆车没有在军方检查站停车。

example.ex: He stopped and let her catch up with him...
example.tran: 他停下来，好让她追上自己。

collins.def: If something that is moving comes to a stop or is brought to a stop, it slows down and no longer moves.

example.ex: People often wrongly open doors before the train has come to a stop...
example.tran: 人们经常在火车还尚未完全停好时就违规打开车门。

example.ex: He slowed the car almost to a stop.
example.tran: 他放慢车速，车几乎停住了。

collins.def: If someone does not stop to think or to explain, they continue with what they are doing without taking any time to think about or explain it.

example.ex: She doesn't stop to think about what she's saying...
example.tran: 她都没有停下来想一想自己在说些什么。

example.ex: There is something rather strange about all this if one stops to consider it...
example.tran: 如果停下来好好想想的话，就会发觉整件事情相当蹊跷。

collins.def: If you say that a quality or state stops somewhere, you mean that it exists or is true up to that point, but no further.

example.ex: The cafe owner has put up the required 'no smoking' signs, but thinks his responsibility stops there...
example.tran: 咖啡馆老板已经按规定贴上了“禁止吸烟”的标志，但是他认为自己的责任就止于此。

example.ex: The good news did not stop there...
example.tran: 好消息还不止这些。

collins.def: A stop is a place where buses or trains regularly stop so that people can get on and off.

example.ex: There was an Underground map above one of the windows and I counted the stops to West Hampstead...
example.tran: 其中一扇窗户上方有一张地铁线路图，我数了数到西汉普斯特德站共有几站。

example.ex: They waited at a bus stop.
example.tran: 他们在一个公共汽车站等车。

collins.def: If you stop somewhere on a journey, you stay there for a short while.

example.ex: He insisted we stop at a small restaurant just outside of Atlanta...
example.tran: 他坚持让我们在亚特兰大市外不远的一家小餐馆歇歇脚。

example.ex: It would be a crime to travel all the way to Australia and not stop in Sydney.
example.tran: 如果不远万里去了澳大利亚，却没在悉尼稍作停留，那真是一种罪过。

collins.def: A stop is a time or place at which you stop during a journey.

example.ex: The last stop in Mr Cook's lengthy tour was Paris...
example.tran: 库克先生漫长旅程中的最后一站是巴黎。

example.ex: Mack was driving down from Vermont, with a stop in Boston to pick Sarah up.
example.tran: 麦克正开车从佛蒙特向南行驶，中途经停波士顿接上萨拉。

collins.def: In music, organ stops are the knobs at the side of the organ, which you pull or push in order to control the type of sound that comes out of the pipes.
If you say that someone will stop at nothing to get something, you are emphasizing that they are willing to do things that are extreme, wrong, or dangerous in order to get it.

example.ex: Their motive is money, and they will stop at nothing to get it.
example.tran: 他们的动机是钱，为了钱他们会不择手段。

collins.def: If you pull out all the stops, you do everything you can to make something happen or succeed.

example.ex: New Zealand police vowed yesterday to pull out all the stops to find the killer.
example.tran: 新西兰警方昨天发誓要竭尽全力抓到杀人凶手。

collins.def: If you put a stop to something that you do not like or approve of, you prevent it from happening or continuing.

example.ex: His daughter should have stood up and put a stop to all these rumours.
example.tran: 他的女儿早该站出来平息所有这些谣言。

collins.tran: 做事很有分寸;懂得如何把持自己
collins.def: If you say that someone does not know when to stop, you mean that they do not control their own behaviour very well and so they often annoy or upset other people.

example.ex: Like many politicians before him, Mr Bentley did not know when to stop...
example.tran: 和过去的很多政客一样，本特利先生做事也没分寸。

example.ex: You should know when to stop asking questions.
example.tran: 你应该知道什么事不该问。

collins.def: A story is a description of imaginary people and events, which is written or told in order to entertain.

example.ex: The second story in the book is titled 'The Scholar'...
example.tran: 书中的第二个故事题为《学者》。

example.ex: I shall tell you a story about four little rabbits.
example.tran: 我要给你讲一个 4 只小兔子的故事。

collins.def: A story is a description of an event or something that happened to someone, especially a spoken description of it.

example.ex: The parents all shared interesting stories about their children...
example.tran: 父母之间都会分享自己孩子的一些趣事。

example.ex: Isak's story is typical of a child who has a specific learning disability.
example.tran: 伊萨克的故事就是一个具有某种学习障碍的孩子的典型故事。

collins.def: The story of something is a description of all the important things that have happened to it since it began.

example.ex: ...the story of the women's movement in Ireland.
example.tran: 爱尔兰妇女运动的记载

collins.def: If someone invents a story, they give a false explanation or account of something.

example.ex: He invented some story about a cousin.
example.tran: 他骗别人说自己有位堂兄。

collins.def: A news story is a piece of news in a newspaper or in a news broadcast.

example.ex: Those are some of the top stories in the news...
example.tran: 那些是报纸上的头条新闻。

example.ex: They'll do anything for a story.
example.tran: 他们为抢到新闻会不择手段。

collins.tran: 但那是另一回事了;那就不相干了
collins.def: You say 'but that's another story' when you have mentioned a subject that you are not going to talk about or explain in detail.

example.ex: I'd met him at a dance I'd gone to on my own. But that's another story.
example.tran: 我有一次独自去参加舞会时遇上了他。但那是题外话了。

collins.def: In British English, you use to cut a long story short to indicate that you are going to state the final result of an event and not give any more details. In American English, you say to make a long story short .

example.ex: To cut a long story short, I ended up as managing director.
example.tran: 长话短说，我最终当上了总经理。

collins.tran: 另一回事，不同情况(通常指不好的一面)
collins.def: You use a different story to refer to a situation, usually a bad one, which exists in one set of circumstances when you have mentioned that it does not exist in another set of circumstances.

example.ex: Where Marcella lives, the rents are fairly cheap, but a little further north it's a different story.
example.tran: 玛塞拉居住的地方，租金比较便宜，但稍稍再往北一点情况就不同了。

collins.tran: 又来了，又是老一套(表示不好的事情似乎总是重复发生)
collins.def: If you say it's the same old story or it's the old story, you mean that something unpleasant or undesirable seems to happen again and again.

example.ex: It's the same old story. They want one person to do three people's jobs.
example.tran: 又是老一套。他们想让 1 个人做 3 个人的工作。

collins.tran: 不是事情的全部;只是部分情况
collins.def: If you say that something is only part of the story or is not the whole story, you mean that the explanation or information given is not enough for a situation to be fully understood.

example.ex: This may be true but it is only part of the story...
example.tran: 这可能是真的，但它并不是事情的全部。

example.ex: Jane goes to great lengths to explain that this is not the whole story.
example.tran: 简竭力地解释说那不是事情的全貌。

collins.def: If someone tells you their side of the story, they tell you why they behaved in a particular way and why they think they were right, when other people think that person behaved wrongly.

example.ex: He had already made up his mind before even hearing her side of the story.
example.tran: 他没等听到她的解释就已经作出了决定。

collins.def: A street is a road in a city, town, or village, usually with houses along it.

example.ex: He lived at 66 Bingfield Street...
example.tran: 他住在宾菲尔德大街 66 号。

example.ex: Boppard is a small, quaint town with narrow streets.
example.tran: 博帕德是一个有着许多深巷窄道、古香古色的小镇。

collins.def: You can use street or streets when talking about activities that happen out of doors in a town rather than inside a building.

example.ex: Changing money on the street is illegal — always use a bank...
example.tran: 在街头兑换货币是违法的——无论何时都应该去银行。

example.ex: Their aim is to raise a million pounds to get the homeless off the streets.
example.tran: 他们的目标是筹集 100 万英镑，使那些无家可归者不再流浪街头。

collins.def: If someone is streets ahead of you, they are much better at something than you are.

example.ex: He was streets ahead of the other contestants.
example.tran: 他比其他参赛选手水平高出一大截。

collins.def: If you talk about the man in the street or the man or woman in the street, you mean ordinary people in general.

example.ex: The average man or woman in the street doesn't know very much about immune disorders.
example.tran: 普通人一般不是很了解何谓免疫机能紊乱。

collins.def: If a job or activity is up your street, it is the kind of job or activity that you are very interested in.

example.ex: She loved it, this was just up her street.
example.tran: 她喜欢这个，这正中她的意。

collins.tran: 强壮的;健壮的;力气大的
collins.def: Someone who is strong is healthy with good muscles and can move or carry heavy things, or do hard physical work.

example.ex: I'm not strong enough to carry him...
example.tran: 我力气不够大，抱不动他。

example.ex: I feared I wouldn't be able to control such a strong horse.
example.tran: 我怕我驾驭不了这么强壮的马。

collins.def: Someone who is strong is confident and determined, and is not easily influenced or worried by other people.

example.ex: He is sharp and manipulative with a strong personality...
example.tran: 他个性很强，为人精明且爱指使人。

example.ex: It's up to managers to be strong and do what they believe is right...
example.tran: 经理人应坚定立场，认准的事情就应该勇敢去做。

collins.tran: 不易损坏的;坚固的;结实的
collins.def: Strong objects or materials are not easily broken and can support a lot of weight or resist a lot of strain.

example.ex: The vacuum flask has a strong casing, which won't crack or chip...
example.tran: 这种热水瓶瓶身坚固，不易断裂破碎。

example.ex: Glue the mirror in with a strong adhesive...
example.tran: 用强力胶把镜子牢牢地粘上。

collins.tran: (风、水流等)强劲的，迅猛的，狂奔的
collins.def: A strong wind, current, or other force has a lot of power or speed, and can cause heavy things to move.

example.ex: Strong winds and torrential rain combined to make conditions terrible for golfers in the Scottish Open...
example.tran: 狂风暴雨一齐袭来，致使苏格兰高尔夫球公开赛的比赛条件变得异常糟糕。

example.ex: A fairly strong current seemed to be moving the whole boat...
example.tran: 一股湍急的水流好像要冲走整条船。

collins.def: A strong impression or influence has a great effect on someone.

example.ex: We're glad if our music makes a strong impression, even if it's a negative one...
example.tran: 如果我们的音乐能给人留下深刻的印象，哪怕是负面的印象，我们都会很高兴。

example.ex: There will be a strong incentive to enter into a process of negotiation...
example.tran: 将会出现迫切地想要进入谈判阶段的强烈动机。

collins.tran: (观点、措辞)坚定的，强烈的，不动摇的
collins.def: If you have strong opinions on something or express them using strong words, you have extreme or very definite opinions which you are willing to express or defend.

example.ex: She is known to hold strong views on Cuba...
example.tran: 她在古巴问题上的鲜明观点人人皆知。

example.ex: There has been strong criticism of the military regime...
example.tran: 该军事政权一直受到人们的强烈抨击。

collins.tran: (当权者的行为)坚定的，强硬的，严厉的，不动摇的
collins.def: If someone in authority takes strong action, they act firmly and severely.

example.ex: The government has said it will take strong action against any further strikes...
example.tran: 政府声称要采取严厉行动制止罢工进一步发展。

example.ex: He has also said he will have to become a strong President to put things right.
example.tran: 他还说为力挽狂澜他将不得不做一个强权总统。

collins.tran: (理由、论据)有说服力的，强有力的，充分的
collins.def: If there is a strong case or argument for something, it is supported by a lot of evidence.

example.ex: The testimony presented offered a strong case for acquitting her on grounds of self-defense...
example.tran: 当庭的证词为裁定她是正当防卫而无罪提供了强有力的证据。

example.ex: The evidence that such investment promotes growth is strong...
example.tran: 有充分的证据表明这种投资能够促进增长。

collins.def: If there is a strong possibility or chance that something is true or will happen, it is very likely to be true or to happen.

example.ex: There is a strong possibility that the cat contracted the condition by eating contaminated pet food.
example.tran: 猫很有可能是吃了受污染的宠物食品而染上这种疾病的。

collins.def: Your strong points are your best qualities or talents, or the things you are good at.

example.ex: Discretion is not Jeremy's strong point...
example.tran: 小心谨慎不是杰里米的强项。

example.ex: Exports may be the only strong point in the economy over the next six to 12 months...
example.tran: 在接下来的 6 到 12 个月中，出口也许是经济中的唯一亮点。

collins.tran: (竞争者、候选人、队伍)强大的，有望成功的，有实力的
collins.def: A strong competitor, candidate, or team is good or likely to succeed.

example.ex: She was a strong contender for Britain's Olympic team...
example.tran: 她是有望入选英国奥运代表团的有力竞争者。

example.ex: Some countries where English is becoming a strong competitor to French, such as Algeria and Senegal, may see an immediate halt to the council's work...
example.tran: 在一些国家里，比如阿尔及利亚和塞内加尔，英语正在成为法语强有力的竞争者，委员会在这些地方的工作可能会很快陷入停滞状态。

collins.def: If a relationship or link is strong, it is close and likely to last for a long time.

example.ex: He felt he had a relationship strong enough to talk frankly to Sarah...
example.tran: 他认为和萨拉的关系很紧密，足以推心置腹。

example.ex: This has tested our marriage, and we have come through it stronger than ever...
example.tran: 这是对我们婚姻的考验，我们经受住了考验而且关系比以往任何时候都更稳固了。

collins.tran: (货币)坚挺的;(经济)强劲的;(行业)景气的
collins.def: A strong currency, economy, or industry has a high value or is very successful.

example.ex: The US dollar continued its strong performance in Tokyo today...
example.tran: 美元今天在东京继续保持强劲的走势。

example.ex: The local economy is strong and the population is growing...
example.tran: 当地经济蓬勃发展，人口也在增长。

collins.tran: (因素、成分)重要的，占很大比例的
collins.def: If something is a strong element or part of something else, it is an important or large part of it.

example.ex: We are especially encouraged by the strong representation, this year, of women in information technology disciplines...
example.tran: 今年，女性在信息技术领域的突出表现尤其让我们备受鼓舞。

example.ex: There is a strong element of truth to each of these explanations.
example.tran: 这些解释每一个都很有道理。

collins.def: You can use strong when you are saying how many people there are in a group. For example, if a group is twenty strong, there are twenty people in it.

example.ex: Ukraine indicated that it would establish its own army, 400,000 strong.
example.tran: 乌克兰表示将自己建立一支40 多万人的军队。

example.ex: ...a 1,000-strong crowd.
example.tran: 有 1,000 多人的人群

collins.tran: (饮品、化学品、药物)含量高的，浓的，酽的
collins.def: A strong drink, chemical, or drug contains a lot of the particular substance which makes it effective.

example.ex: Strong coffee or tea late at night may cause sleeplessness...
example.tran: 深夜喝浓咖啡或浓茶可能会导致失眠。

example.ex: In strong concentrations it can cause nausea and vomiting.
example.tran: 浓度过高会导致恶心呕吐。

collins.tran: 醒目的;响亮的;浓烈的;强烈的
collins.def: A strong colour, flavour, smell, sound, or light is intense and easily noticed.

example.ex: As she went past there was a gust of strong perfume...
example.tran: 她走过时有一股浓烈的香水味。

example.ex: Strong colours would flatter her pale skin and dark hair...
example.tran: 亮颜色更能衬托她的白皮肤和黑头发。

collins.def: If someone has a strong accent, they speak in a distinctive way that shows very clearly what country or region they come from.

example.ex: 'Good, Mr Ryle,' he said in English with a strong French accent.
example.tran: “好的，赖尔先生，”他用带有浓重法国口音的英语说。

collins.def: You can say that someone has strong features or a strong face if their face has large, distinctive features.

example.ex: He had a strong Greek nose and olive-black eyes.
example.tran: 他有一个高挺的希腊式鼻子和一双墨橄榄绿色的眼睛。

collins.def: If someone comes on strong, they make their intentions or feelings clear in an excessive or aggressive way.

example.ex: 'I come on strong sometimes. Don't know why.' She was beginning to feel like a bully.
example.tran: “我有时言行很过分，不知道为什么。”她开始感觉自己像个恶霸。

collins.tran: 保持健康;依旧活跃;兴盛不衰
collins.def: If someone or something is still going strong, they are still alive, in good condition, or popular after a long time.

example.ex: The old machinery was still going strong.
example.tran: 这台旧机器依然运转良好。

collins.def: A student is a person who is studying at a university or college.

example.ex: Warren's eldest son is an art student, at St Martin's.
example.tran: 沃伦的大儿子是圣马丁学院艺术系的学生。

example.ex: ...a 23-year-old medical student.
example.tran: 23 岁的医科大学生

collins.def: A student is a child who is studying at a secondary school.
Someone who is a student of a particular subject is interested in the subject and spends time learning about it.

example.ex: ...a passionate student of nineteenth century history.
example.tran: 热衷于 19 世纪历史的研究者

collins.def: If you study, you spend time learning about a particular subject or subjects.

example.ex: ...a relaxed and happy atmosphere that will allow you to study to your full potential...
example.tran: 能让人充分发挥学习潜质的轻松愉快的环境

example.ex: He went to Hull University, where he studied History and Economics...
example.tran: 他去了赫尔大学学习历史和经济学。

collins.def: Study is the activity of studying.

example.ex: ...the use of maps and visual evidence in the study of local history...
example.tran: 利用地图和图像资料研究当地历史

example.ex: She gave up her studies to have Alexander.
example.tran: 为了生亚历山大，她放弃了学业。

collins.def: A study of a subject is a piece of research on it.

example.ex: Recent studies suggest that as many as 5 in 1000 new mothers are likely to have this problem.
example.tran: 最近的研究成果表明在 1000 个刚生产完的妈妈中，有 5 个可能存在这样的问题。

example.ex: ...the first study of English children's attitudes.
example.tran: 首个关于英国儿童观念的研究

collins.def: You can refer to educational subjects or courses that contain several elements as studies of a particular kind.

example.ex: ...a new centre for Islamic studies...
example.tran: 新的伊斯兰教研究中心

example.ex: She is currently doing a business studies course at Leeds.
example.tran: 她目前在利兹大学修读一门商科课程。

collins.def: If you study something, you look at it or watch it very carefully, in order to find something out.

example.ex: Debbie studied her friend's face for a moment.
example.tran: 黛比仔细端详了一会她朋友的脸。

collins.def: If you study something, you consider it or observe it carefully in order to be able to understand it fully.

example.ex: I know that you've been studying chimpanzees for thirty years now...
example.tran: 我知道你研究黑猩猩至今已有30年了。

example.ex: I invite every citizen to carefully study the document.
example.tran: 我请每位市民都仔细研读该文件。

collins.def: A study by an artist is a drawing which is done in preparation for a larger picture.
A study is a room in a house which is used for reading, writing, and studying.

collins.tran: 这样的;那样的;上述的;诸如此类的
collins.def: You use such to refer back to the thing or person that you have just mentioned, or a thing or person like the one that you have just mentioned. You use such as and such...as to introduce a reference to the person or thing that has just been mentioned.

example.ex: There have been previous attempts at coups. We regard such methods as entirely unacceptable...
example.tran: 以前也有人试图发动政变。我们绝对不能接受这种做法。

example.ex: You say you feel that you're being made to choose, and so you are. Such choices as this are a by-product of freedom...
example.tran: 你说自己感觉是在被迫作选择，确实如此，而这样的选择是自由的附带品。

collins.def: You use such...as to link something or someone with a clause in which you give a description of the kind of thing or person that you mean.

example.ex: Each member of the alliance agrees to take such action as it deems necessary, including the use of armed force...
example.tran: 该联盟的每一位成员国都同意采取其认为必要的行动，包括动用武力。

example.ex: Britain is not enjoying such prosperity as it was in the mid-1980s.
example.tran: 英国现在已经不像 20 世纪 80 年代中期那么繁荣昌盛。

collins.def: You use such...as to introduce one or more examples of the kind of thing or person that you have just mentioned.

example.ex: He was said to have written such books as The Day of Locusts and Miss Lonely Hearts.
example.tran: 据说他曾经写过《蝗虫之日》和《寂寞芳心小姐》之类的小说。

example.ex: ...such careers as teaching, nursing, hairdressing and catering.
example.tran: 教书、护理、美发和餐饮之类的工作

collins.tran: (用于名词词组前强调某事的程度或某事了不起)如此，这样，非常
collins.def: You use such before noun groups to emphasize the extent of something or to emphasize that something is remarkable.

example.ex: I think most of us don't want to read what's in the newspaper anyway in such detail...
example.tran: 我想我们大多数人无论如何都不想如此仔细地去读报纸。

example.ex: One will never be able to understand why these political issues can acquire such force...
example.tran: 人们永远也不会明白为什么这些政治问题会有如此大的影响力。

collins.tran: (用于强调程度)如此…，非常…(以至于…)
collins.def: You use such...that in order to emphasize the degree of something by mentioning the result or consequence of it.

example.ex: The weather has brought such a demand for beer that one brewery will operate over the weekend...
example.tran: 天气状况使得对啤酒的需求大增，一家啤酒厂周末要加班了。

example.ex: This is something where you can earn such a lot of money that there is not any risk that you will lose it...
example.tran: 这可以让你挣一大笔钱，而且没有任何赔钱的风险。

collins.def: You use such...that or such...as in order to say what the result or consequence of something that you have just mentioned is.

example.ex: The operation has uncovered such backstreet dealing in stolen property that police might now press for changes in the law.
example.tran: 这次行动破获了这样的地下销赃活动，现在警方可能会因此敦促修改法律。

collins.tran: (用于不想明确指出时)某，某个
collins.def: You use such and such to refer to a thing or person when you do not want to be exact or precise.

example.ex: I said, 'Well what time'll I get to Leeds?' and he said such and such a time but I missed my connection...
example.tran: 我说：“那么我什么时候才能到利兹?”他说了一个时间，但是我没赶上联运车。

example.ex: They're informed that we've got this money to spend and we will do such and such with it.
example.tran: 他们被告知我们已经拿到了这笔钱并将用它来做什么。

collins.tran: 就是这样;就是如此;就是这么回事儿
collins.def: You use such as it is or such as they are to suggest that the thing you have just mentioned is not very good, important, or useful.

example.ex: Well my toilet's all blocked up and I've got it all coming into my flat and it'll ruin my home, such as it is...
example.tran: 我的马桶堵死了，脏水全都涌到屋子里，家里脏得一塌糊涂，情况就是这样。

example.ex: The British Women's Movement, such as it is these days, came up with a programme of speeches at the House of Commons.
example.tran: 如今波澜不惊的英国妇女运动提出要在下议院发表演讲的计划。

collins.tran: (与否定词连用)严格来说，真正意义上
collins.def: You use as such with a negative to indicate that a word or expression is not a very accurate description of the actual situation.

example.ex: I am not a learner as such —I used to ride a bike years ago...
example.tran: 严格说来，我并不完全是一个初学者——几年前我经常骑自行车。

example.ex: Mark joined as an office boy at the age of fourteen with no academic qualifications as such at all...
example.tran: 马克在14岁的时候以勤杂员的身份进入公司，他当时根本就没有任何学历。

collins.def: You use as such after a noun to indicate that you are considering that thing on its own, separately from other things or factors.

example.ex: House prices are easily upset by factors which have nothing to do with property as such. The fall in prices in the South-East results largely from the high rate of interest on mortgages...
example.tran: 房价很容易受与地产本身无关的因素所影响。东南部房价的下跌很大程度上是由于抵押贷款利率的上涨所引起的。

example.ex: Mr Simon said he was not against taxes as such, 'but I do object when taxation is justified on spurious or dishonest grounds,' he says.
example.tran: 西蒙先生说他对税收本身并不反对，“但是我反对以虚假不实的理由巧立明目收税，”他说。

collins.def: If you suggest something, you put forward a plan or idea for someone to think about.

example.ex: He suggested a link between class size and test results of seven-year-olds...
example.tran: 他认为 7 岁大的学生的测试分数和班级的规模有关系。

example.ex: I suggest you ask him some specific questions about his past...
example.tran: 我建议你问他一些有关他的过去的具体问题。

collins.def: If you suggest the name of a person or place, you recommend them to someone.

example.ex: Could you suggest someone to advise me how to do this?...
example.tran: 这该怎么办？你能不能推荐一个人帮我出个主意？

example.ex: They can suggest where to buy one.
example.tran: 他们可以推荐去哪里购买。

collins.def: If you suggest that something is the case, you say something which you believe is the case.

example.ex: I'm not suggesting that is what is happening...
example.tran: 我没有说那就是事实。

example.ex: It is wrong to suggest that there are easy alternatives...
example.tran: 如果认为有更容易的选择，那就错了。

collins.def: If one thing suggests another, it implies it or makes you think that it might be the case.

example.ex: Earlier reports suggested that a meeting would take place on Sunday...
example.tran: 早先的报道暗示周日可能会召开会议。

example.ex: Its hairy body suggests a mammal.
example.tran: 它毛茸茸的身体表明它是哺乳动物。

collins.def: If one thing suggests another, it brings it to your mind through an association of ideas.

example.ex: This onomatopoeic word suggests to me the sound a mousetrap makes when it snaps shut.
example.tran: 这个拟声词让我想起捕鼠夹子突然合上时的声音。

collins.def: If you support someone or their ideas or aims, you agree with them, and perhaps help them because you want them to succeed.

example.ex: The vice president insisted that he supported the hard-working people of New York...
example.tran: 副总统坚称他支持辛勤工作的纽约人。

example.ex: The National Union of Mineworkers pressed the party to support a total ban on imported coal.
example.tran: 全国矿工工会向该政党施压，要求其同意全面禁止煤炭进口。

collins.def: If you give support to someone during a difficult or unhappy time, you are kind to them and help them.

example.ex: It was hard to come to terms with her death after all the support she gave to me and the family...
example.tran: 她曾经给予我和家人莫大的帮助，她的死讯令人难以接受。

example.ex: We hope to continue to have her close support and friendship.
example.tran: 我们希望她能继续大力支持，并能与她维持亲密友谊。

collins.def: Financial support is money provided to enable an organization to continue. This money is usually provided by the government.

example.ex: ...the government's proposal to cut agricultural support by only about 15%.
example.tran: 仅削减约 15%的农业拨款的政府提案

collins.def: If you support someone, you provide them with money or the things that they need.

example.ex: I have children to support, money to be earned, and a home to be maintained...
example.tran: 我要抚养孩子，挣钱养家。

example.ex: She sold everything she'd ever bought in order to support herself through art school.
example.tran: 为了供自己读完艺术学校，她把过去购置的所有东西都卖掉了。

collins.def: If a fact supports a statement or a theory, it helps to show that it is true or correct.

example.ex: The Freudian theory about daughters falling in love with their father has little evidence to support it.
example.tran: 弗洛伊德关于女儿恋父的理论缺乏依据。

collins.def: If something supports an object, it is underneath the object and holding it up.

example.ex: ...the thick wooden posts that supported the ceiling...
example.tran: 支撑天花板的粗木柱子

example.ex: Let your baby sit on the floor propped up with plenty of cushions to support him.
example.tran: 让宝宝坐在地板上，多放几个垫子让他倚靠。

collins.def: A support is a bar or other object that supports something.
If you support yourself, you prevent yourself from falling by holding onto something or by leaning on something.

example.ex: He supported himself by means of a nearby post.
example.tran: 他靠在旁边的柱子上。

collins.def: If you support a sports team, you always want them to win and perhaps go regularly to their games.

example.ex: Tim, 17, supports Manchester United.
example.tran: 17 岁的蒂姆支持曼联队。

collins.tran: (音乐会、演出的)助演演员，助演乐队
collins.def: At a concert or show, the support or the support act is a less well-known person or band who performs before the main person or band.

collins.tran: 确信的;确知的;肯定的;有把握的
collins.def: If you are sure that something is true, you are certain that it is true. If you are not sure about something, you do not know for certain what the true situation is.

example.ex: He'd never been in a class before and he was not even sure that he should have been teaching...
example.tran: 他以前从未教过课，甚至不确定自己该不该教课。

example.ex: The president has never been sure which direction he wanted to go in on this issue...
example.tran: 总统一直都不确定自己想从哪个方面来着手处理该问题。

collins.tran: 一定的;必定的;无疑的;确保的
collins.def: If someone is sure of getting something, they will definitely get it or they think they will definitely get it.

example.ex: A lot of people think that it's better to pay for their education so that they can be sure of getting quality...
example.tran: 许多人认为最好是接受付费教育，这样能确保教学质量。

example.ex: It is the self-assurance of the new generation which makes them sure of their success.
example.tran: 年轻一代的自信让他们对成功志在必得。

collins.def: If you say that something is sure to happen, you are emphasizing your belief that it will happen.

example.ex: With over 80 beaches to choose from, you are sure to find a place to lay your towel...
example.tran: 有 80 多个海滩可供选择，你一定能找到一处满意的。

example.ex: Anyone who goes food shopping without a list is sure to forget the things they really need.
example.tran: 任何人如果采购食物时没列清单的话，肯定会忘了真正需要的东西。

collins.tran: 不容置疑的;确切的;可靠的;保险的
collins.def: Sure is used to emphasize that something such as a sign or ability is reliable or accurate.

example.ex: Sharpe's leg and shoulder began to ache, a sure sign of rain...
example.tran: 夏普的腿和肩膀开始疼痛，这预示着肯定要下雨了。

example.ex: She has a sure grasp of social issues such as literacy, poverty and child care.
example.tran: 她对扫盲、贫穷和儿童保育等社会问题都有深切的认识。

collins.def: If you tell someone to be sure to do something, you mean that they must not forget to do it.

example.ex: Be sure to read about how mozzarella is made, on page 65...
example.tran: 务必看看莫泽雷勒干酪是怎么制成的，在第 65 页。

example.ex: Be sure you get your daily quota of calcium.
example.tran: 要确保每天的钙摄入量。

collins.def: Sure is an informal way of saying 'yes' or 'all right'.

example.ex: 'He rang you?' — 'Sure. Last night.'...
example.tran: “他给你打电话了？”——“没错。昨天晚上打的。”

example.ex: 'I'd like to be alone, O.K?' — 'Sure. O.K.'...
example.tran: “我想一个人呆会儿，好吗？”——“好的，没问题。”

collins.def: You can use sure in order to emphasize what you are saying.

example.ex: 'Has the whole world just gone crazy?' — 'Sure looks that way, doesn't it.'
example.tran: “整个世界难道都疯了吗？”——“看上去的确如此，不是吗。”

example.ex: It sure is hot, he thought.
example.tran: 天的确太热了，他想。

collins.tran: 果真，果然(尤用在讲故事时)
collins.def: You say sure enough, especially when telling a story, to confirm that something was really true or was actually happening.

example.ex: We found the English treacle pudding too good to resist. Sure enough, it was delicious...
example.tran: 我们觉得英国糖蜜布丁太好吃了，令人无法抗拒。的确非常美味。

example.ex: I was in a shop when I saw a lady looking carefully at me. She'd recognised me, and sure enough, she came across.
example.tran: 我正在逛商店，突然看到一位女士在仔细地打量我。她认出了我，果不其然，她走了过来。

collins.def: If you say that something is for sure or that you know it for sure, you mean that it is definitely true.

example.ex: One thing's for sure, Astbury's vocal style hasn't changed much over the years...
example.tran: 有一点可以肯定，阿斯特伯里的演唱风格多年来没怎么改变。

example.ex: Even to this day we don't know what happened for sure.
example.tran: 即使到现在我们也不确定究竟发生了什么。

collins.def: If you make sure that something is done, you take action so that it is done.

example.ex: Make sure that you follow the instructions carefully...
example.tran: 一定要认真按照操作指南来做。

example.ex: He wants to make sure that schools are committed to providing alternative education.
example.tran: 他想确保学校尽力提供新型教育。

collins.def: If you make sure that something is the way that you want or expect it to be, you check that it is that way.

example.ex: He looked in the bathroom to make sure that he was alone...
example.tran: 他往浴室里看了看，确定就他一个人。

example.ex: Before you cut the cloth, make sure that the pattern matches up on both edges.
example.tran: 在裁剪布料前要确保两个边缘的图案对称。

collins.def: If you say that something is a sure thing, you mean that you are certain that it will happen or be successful.

example.ex: This proposal is by no means a sure thing.
example.tran: 这个提议绝不会理所当然地获得通过。

collins.def: You say 'sure thing' to show that you agree with someone or will do as they say.

example.ex: 'Be careful!' — 'Sure thing, Dad. So long.'
example.tran: “要多加小心!”——“一定会的，爸爸。再见。”

collins.tran: (承认属实)诚然，固然，无可否认
collins.def: You use to be sure when you are admitting that something is true, although it seems to contradict a more general statement that you are making.

example.ex: Parents make the rules. To be sure, many of the rules are no longer appropriate today.
example.tran: 规矩由父母立下。诚然，其中有许多放在今天已不再合适了。

collins.def: If you are sure of yourself, you are very confident about your own abilities or opinions.

example.ex: I'd never seen him like this, so sure of himself, so in command.
example.tran: 我从来没见他如此自信满满、指挥自若。

collins.def: A system is a way of working, organizing, or doing something which follows a fixed plan or set of rules. You can use system to refer to an organization or institution that is organized in this way.

example.ex: The present system of funding for higher education is unsatisfactory.
example.tran: 目前高等教育的经费体制并不令人满意。

example.ex: ...a flexible and relatively efficient filing system.
example.tran: 灵活而相对高效的存档系统

collins.def: A system is a set of devices powered by electricity, for example a computer or an alarm.

example.ex: Viruses tend to be good at surviving when a computer system crashes.
example.tran: 计算机病毒在系统崩溃后往往依然存在。

collins.def: A system is a set of equipment or parts such as water pipes or electrical wiring, which is used to supply water, heat, or electricity.

example.ex: ...a central heating system.
example.tran: 中央供暖系统

collins.def: A system is a network of things that are linked together so that people or things can travel from one place to another or communicate.

example.ex: ...Australia's road and rail system.
example.tran: 澳大利亚的公路网和铁路网

example.ex: ...a news channel on a local cable system.
example.tran: 地方有线电视网的新闻频道

collins.def: Your system is your body's  organs and other parts that together perform particular functions.

example.ex: He had slept for over fourteen hours, and his system seemed to have recuperated admirably...
example.tran: 他已睡了超过 14 个小时了，他的身体恢复得很不错。

example.ex: These gases would seriously damage the patient's respiratory system.
example.tran: 这些毒气会严重损害患者的呼吸系统。

collins.tran: (尤指数学或科学中的)体系,体制
collins.def: A system is a particular set of rules, especially in mathematics or science, which is used to count or measure things.

example.ex: ...the decimal system of metric weights and measures.
example.tran: 公制度量衡的十进制

example.ex: ...Trachtenberg's system of simplified mathematics.
example.tran: 特拉赫滕贝格简化的数学体系

collins.tran: 政府;现行体制;公共行政
collins.def: People sometimes refer to the government or administration of a country as the system .

example.ex: These feelings are likely to make people attempt to overthrow the system...
example.tran: 这些情绪有可能促使人们想要推翻现行的体制。

example.ex: He wants to be the tough rebel who bucks the system.
example.tran: 他想成为现行体制的坚决反抗者。

collins.tran: 宣泄;排解;戒掉;让…淡出自己的生活
collins.def: If you get something out of your system, you take some action so that you no longer want to do it or no longer have strong feelings about it.

example.ex: I want to get boxing out of my system and settle down to enjoy family life.
example.tran: 我想结束拳击生涯，安定下来享受家庭生活。

collins.tran: （后接名词，用于描述动作或事件）
collins.def: You can use take followed by a noun to talk about an action or event, when it would also be possible to use the verb that is related to that noun. For example, you can say 'she took a shower' instead of 'she showered'.

example.ex: She was too tired to take a shower...
example.tran: 她累得连澡都懒得冲。

example.ex: Betty took a photograph of us...
example.tran: 贝蒂给我们照了张相。

collins.tran: （与一系列名词连用，代替意义更为具体的动词）
collins.def: In ordinary spoken or written English, people use take with a range of nouns instead of using a more specific verb. For example people often say 'he took control' or 'she took a positive attitude' instead of 'he assumed control' or 'she adopted a positive attitude'.

example.ex: The Patriotic Front took power after a three-month civil war...
example.tran: 经过 3 个月内战，爱国阵线夺取了政权。

example.ex: I felt it was important for women to join and take a leading role...
example.tran: 我觉得让女性参与其中，并担当领导角色对于女性而言意义重大。

collins.def: When you talk, you use spoken language to express your thoughts, ideas, or feelings.

example.ex: He was too distressed to talk...
example.tran: 他伤心得讲不出话来。

example.ex: A teacher reprimanded a girl for talking in class...
example.tran: 老师斥责了一个在课堂上说话的女生。

collins.def: If you talk to someone, you have a conversation with them. You can also say that two people talk .

example.ex: We talked and laughed a great deal...
example.tran: 我们说笑了很久。

example.ex: I talked to him yesterday...
example.tran: 昨天我和他谈过了。

collins.def: If you talk to someone, you tell them about the things that are worrying you. You can also say that two people talk .

example.ex: Your first step should be to talk to a teacher or school counselor...
example.tran: 你第一步应该是去找老师或学校辅导员谈谈。

example.ex: There's no one she can talk to, and she's on the verge of collapse...
example.tran: 她找不到一个可以倾诉的对象，快要崩溃了。

collins.def: If you talk on or about something, you make an informal speech telling people what you know or think about it.

example.ex: She will talk on the issues she cares passionately about including education and nursery care...
example.tran: 她将会谈一些自己十分感兴趣的话题，包括教育和幼儿护理。

example.ex: He intends to talk to young people about the dangers of AIDS.
example.tran: 他打算和青年人谈谈艾滋病的危害。

collins.tran: (通常指国家、劳资间为达成某种协定的)谈判，商谈
collins.def: Talks are formal discussions intended to produce an agreement, usually between different countries or between employers and employees.

example.ex: ...the next round of Middle East peace talks...
example.tran: 下一轮中东和平谈判

example.ex: Talks between striking railway workers and the Polish government have broken down...
example.tran: 罢工的铁路工人和波兰政府间举行的谈判已经破裂了。

collins.def: If one group of people talks to another, or if two groups talk, they have formal discussions in order to do a deal or produce an agreement.

example.ex: We're talking to some people about opening an office in London...
example.tran: 我们在和一些人讨论在伦敦设立办事处的事儿。

example.ex: The company talked with many potential investors...
example.tran: 公司和许多潜在的投资人举行了磋商。

collins.def: When different countries or different sides in a dispute talk, or talk to each other, they discuss their differences in order to try and settle the dispute.

example.ex: The Foreign Minister said he was ready to talk to any country that had no hostile intentions...
example.tran: 外交部长说他愿意和任何不怀敌意的国家举行会谈。

example.ex: They are collecting information in preparation for the day when the two sides sit down and talk...
example.tran: 他们正在收集情报，为双方坐下来谈判的那一天做准备。

collins.def: If people are talking about another person or are talking, they are discussing that person.

example.ex: Everyone is talking about him...
example.tran: 人人都在议论他。

example.ex: People will talk, but you have to get on with your life.
example.tran: 人们会有议论，但日子还得过下去。

collins.tran: (通常指不情愿地)供出，招认，招供
collins.def: If someone talks when they are being held by police or soldiers, they reveal important or secret information, usually unwillingly.

example.ex: They'll talk, they'll implicate me.
example.tran: 他们会招供的，他们会把我牵连进去的。
