collins.tran: 讲，说，操(某种语言或口音)
collins.def: If you talk a particular language or talk with a particular accent, you use that language or have that accent when you speak.

example.ex: You don't sound like a foreigner talking English...
example.tran: 听你讲英语，不像是外国人。

example.ex: They were amazed that I was talking in an Irish accent.
example.tran: 我说话带爱尔兰口音让他们感到很惊奇。

collins.def: If you talk something such as politics or sport, you discuss it.

example.ex: The guests were mostly middle-aged men talking business.
example.tran: 顾客多数是些谈正事的中年男子。

collins.def: You can use talk to say what you think of the ideas that someone is expressing. For example, if you say that someone is talking sense, you mean that you think the opinions they are expressing are sensible.

example.ex: You must admit George, you're talking absolute rubbish.
example.tran: 乔治，你得承认你说的全都是废话。

collins.def: You can say that you are talking a particular thing to draw attention to your topic or to point out a characteristic of what you are discussing.

example.ex: We're not talking a murder here; we're talking poker machines or gambling — things that are misdemeanors in most states...
example.tran: 我们现在讨论的不是谋杀，而是扑克机或赌博——这些在多数州只能算轻罪了。

example.ex: We're talking megabucks this time.
example.tran: 我们这次谈的可是上百万的买卖。

collins.def: If you say that something such as an idea or threat is just talk, or all talk, you mean that it does not mean or matter much, because people are exaggerating about it or do not really intend to do anything about it.

example.ex: Has much of this actually been tried here? Or is it just talk?...
example.tran: 这个多半已经真正尝试过了吗？还是仅仅说说而已？

example.ex: Conditions should be laid down. Otherwise it's all talk.
example.tran: 应该先定下条件，否则全是空谈。

collins.def: You can say talk about before mentioning a particular expression or situation, when you mean that something is a very striking or clear example of that expression or situation.

example.ex: Took us quite a while to get here, didn't it? Talk about Fate moving in a mysterious way!...
example.tran: 我们用了很长时间才走到今天这步，是吧？这就叫命运难测啊！

example.ex: She threw the cake I'd made on the floor and stood on it. Talk about being humiliated!
example.tran: 她把我做的蛋糕扔到地上，然后踩在了上面。真是欺人太甚！

collins.tran: 我说，说到，谈到(用于引出新话题)
collins.def: You can use the expression talking of to introduce a new topic that you want to discuss, and to link it to something that has already been mentioned.

example.ex: Belvoir Farms produce a delicious elderflower tea. Talking of elderflower, you might wish to try Elderflower Champagne.
example.tran: 贝尔沃农场生产一种非常好喝的接骨木花茶。说到接骨木花，你兴许想尝尝接骨木花香槟酒。

example.ex: As it says in the Bible, my cup is running over. Talking of which, I must get you a cup of tea.
example.tran: 正如《圣经》所说，给我恩赐太多了，我的杯子已经满满当当了。说到杯子，我得去给你倒杯茶来。

collins.def: Tax is an amount of money that you have to pay to the government so that it can pay for public services.

example.ex: No-one enjoys paying tax...
example.tran: 没人喜欢纳税。

example.ex: They are calling for large spending cuts and tax increases.
example.tran: 他们呼吁大幅度削减开支并提高税收。

collins.def: When a person or company is taxed, they have to pay a part of their income or profits to the government. When goods are taxed, a percentage of their price has to be paid to the government.

example.ex: Husband and wife are now taxed separately on their incomes...
example.tran: 现在夫妻双方分别按各自的收入纳税。

example.ex: ...the government's commitment to simplifying the way companies are taxed...
example.tran: 政府简化公司纳税手续的承诺

collins.tran: 使用尽，耗尽(力气、耐心、资源等)
collins.def: If something taxes your strength, your patience, or your resources, it uses nearly all of them, so that you have great difficulty in carrying out what you are trying to do.

example.ex: Overcrowding has taxed the city's ability to deal with waste...
example.tran: 人口过多使得城市的垃圾处理能力达到了极限。

example.ex: These dilemmas would tax the best of statesmen.
example.tran: 这些进退两难的局面对一流的政治家也是个考验。

collins.def: A team is a group of people who play a particular sport or game together against other similar groups of people.

example.ex: The team failed to qualify for the African Nations Cup finals...
example.tran: 该队未能闯入非洲国家杯决赛。

example.ex: He had lost his place in the England team.
example.tran: 他失去了在英格兰队的位置。

collins.def: You can refer to any group of people who work together as a team .

example.ex: Each specialist consultant has a team of doctors under him...
example.tran: 每位会诊专家手下都有一组医生。

example.ex: The governors were joined by Mr Hunter and his management team.
example.tran: 亨特先生及他率领的管理小组加入了州长们的队伍。

means: [考古学]（古代村落遗址堆积而成的）台形土墩

collins.def: If you tell someone something, you give them information.

example.ex: In the evening I returned to tell Phyllis our relationship was over...
example.tran: 晚上我回来告诉菲莉丝我们之间完了。

example.ex: I called Andie to tell her how spectacular the stuff looked...
example.tran: 我打电话告诉安迪，那东西看上去太棒了。

collins.tran: 说(笑话);讲(故事);讲述(个人经历)
collins.def: If you tell something such as a joke, a story, or your personal experiences, you communicate it to other people using speech.

example.ex: His friends say he was always quick to tell a joke...
example.tran: 他的朋友们说，以前他讲笑话总是张嘴就来。

example.ex: He told his story to The Sunday Times and produced photographs...
example.tran: 他把自己的经历讲述给了《星期日泰晤士报》的记者，还提供了照片。

collins.def: If you tell someone to do something, you order or advise them to do it.

example.ex: A passer-by told the driver to move his car so that it was not causing an obstruction...
example.tran: 一个过路人叫那个司机把他的车挪一挪，免得挡道。

example.ex: She told me on the telephone to come help clean the house.
example.tran: 她在电话里叫我过去帮忙打扫屋子。

collins.def: If you tell yourself something, you put it into words in your own mind because you need to encourage or persuade yourself about something.

example.ex: 'Come on', she told herself...
example.tran: “加油！”她在心里暗暗打气。

example.ex: I told myself I would be satisfied with whatever I could get.
example.tran: 我告诉自己，不管得到什么我都会心满意足的。

collins.def: If you can tell what is happening or what is true, you are able to judge correctly what is happening or what is true.

example.ex: It was already impossible to tell where the bullet had entered...
example.tran: 已经无法判断子弹是从哪里打进来的。

example.ex: I couldn't tell if he had been in a fight or had just fallen down...
example.tran: 我不知道他是和人家打架了，还是仅仅摔了一跤。

collins.def: If you can tell one thing from another, you are able to recognize the difference between it and other similar things.

example.ex: I can't really tell the difference between their policies and ours...
example.tran: 我真的看不出他们的政策和我们的有什么不同。

example.ex: How do you tell one from another?...
example.tran: 你怎么把他们区分开来？

collins.def: If you tell, you reveal or give away a secret.

example.ex: Many of the children know who they are but are not telling.
example.tran: 许多孩子知道他们是谁，可就是不说。

collins.def: If facts or events tell you something, they reveal certain information to you through ways other than speech.

example.ex: The facts tell us that this is not true...
example.tran: 事实告诉我们，这不是真的。

example.ex: I don't think the unemployment rate ever tells us much about the future...
example.tran: 我认为，从失业率上永远看不出未来的情况究竟如何。

collins.tran: (不快的或令人疲倦的经历)产生效果，产生影响
collins.def: If an unpleasant or tiring experience begins to tell, it begins to have a serious effect.

example.ex: The pressure began to tell as rain closed in after 20 laps...
example.tran: 跑完 20 圈以后，眼看就要下雨了，大家开始紧张起来。

example.ex: The strains of office are beginning to tell on the prime minister.
example.tran: 首相开始感到公务繁忙的压力了。

collins.def: You use as far as I can tell or so far as I could tell to indicate that what you are saying is based on the information you have, but that there may be things you do not know.

example.ex: As far as I can tell, Jason is basically a nice guy...
example.tran: 据我所知，贾森算得上是个好人。

example.ex: So far as anyone can tell, there's evidence that there was a Robin Hood...
example.tran: 众所周知，有证据表明确实有罗宾汉这么个人。

collins.tran: (用来强调所说的话)我可以肯定/我敢说/我没法形容
collins.def: You can say 'I tell you', 'I can tell you', or 'I can't tell you' to add emphasis to what you are saying.

example.ex: I tell you this, I will not rest until that day has come...
example.tran: 我可以肯定地说，不到那天我不会休息。

example.ex: This little letter gave us a few chuckles, I can tell you...
example.tran: 说真的，我们看了这封短信都笑了。

collins.def: If you say 'You never can tell', you mean that the future is always uncertain and it is never possible to know exactly what will happen.

example.ex: You never can tell what life is going to bring you.
example.tran: 你永远不知道人生会给你带来些什么。

collins.tran: 我早就告诉过你;我说的没错吧
collins.def: If someone disagrees with you or refuses to do what you suggest and you are eventually proved to be right, you can say 'I told you so'.

example.ex: Her parents did not approve of her decision and, if she failed, her mother would say, 'I told you so.'
example.tran: 她父母不赞同她的决定，要是她失败了，她妈妈就会说：“怎么样，我说对了吧？”

collins.tran: 我的建议是，听我说(用来引出建议或转换话题)
collins.def: You use I'll tell you what or I tell you what to introduce a suggestion or a new topic of conversation.

example.ex: I tell you what, I'll bring the water in a separate glass.
example.tran: 要不这样吧，我用另一个玻璃杯把水端过来。

collins.def: Ten is the number 10.

example.ex: Over the past ten years things have changed.
example.tran: 过去 10 年间，情况已发生了变化。

collins.tran: 在…方面;从…角度看;根据…来说
collins.def: If you talk about something in terms of something or in particular terms, you are specifying which aspect of it you are discussing or from what point of view you are considering it.

example.ex: Our goods compete in terms of product quality, reliability and above all variety...
example.tran: 我们的产品在质量、可靠性，尤其是品种方面颇具竞争力。

example.ex: Paris has played a dominant role in France, not just in political terms but also in economic power.
example.tran: 不仅仅在政治方面，而且在经济实力上巴黎在法国也都一直处于支配地位。

collins.def: If you say something in particular terms, you say it using a particular type or level of language or using language which clearly shows your attitude.

example.ex: The video explains in simple terms how the new tax works...
example.tran: 录像用简单易懂的语言解释了新税法。

example.ex: The document is expressed in terms that are readily understood and agreed.
example.tran: 文件用语浅显易懂，让人易于接受。

collins.def: A term is a word or expression with a specific meaning, especially one which is used in relation to a particular subject.

example.ex: Myocardial infarction is the medical term for a heart attack.
example.tran: 心肌梗死是心脏病的医学用语。

collins.def: If you say that something is termed a particular thing, you mean that that is what people call it or that is their opinion of it.

example.ex: He had been termed a temporary employee...
example.tran: 他被称作临时雇员。

example.ex: He termed the war a humanitarian nightmare.
example.tran: 他称这场战争是一场人道主义噩梦。

collins.def: A term is one of the periods of time that a school, college, or university divides the year into.

example.ex: ...the summer term.
example.tran: 夏季学期

example.ex: ...the last day of term.
example.tran: 学期最后一天

collins.def: A term is a period of time between two elections during which a particular party or government is in power.

example.ex: Felipe Gonzalez won a fourth term of office in Spain's election.
example.tran: 费利佩·冈萨雷斯在西班牙选举中获得第 4 次连任。

collins.def: A term is a period of time that someone spends doing a particular job or in a particular place.

example.ex: ...a 12 month term of service...
example.tran: 为期 12 个月的任职期

example.ex: Offenders will be liable to a seven-year prison term.
example.tran: 违犯者可判处 7 年监禁。

collins.def: A term is the period for which a legal contract or insurance policy is valid.

example.ex: Premiums are guaranteed throughout the term of the policy.
example.tran: 在保单有效期内，所缴纳的保险费是有保障的。

collins.def: The term of a woman's pregnancy is the nine month period that it lasts. Term is also used to refer to the end of the nine month period.

example.ex: That makes her the first TV presenter to work the full term of her pregnancy...
example.tran: 那样，她就成了首个怀孕期间一直上班的电视节目主持人。

example.ex: Women over 40 seem to be just as capable of carrying a baby to term as younger women.
example.tran: 年过 40 的女性好像和年轻女性一样能够怀孕到足月。

collins.def: The terms of an agreement, treaty, or other arrangement are the conditions that must be accepted by the people involved in it.

example.ex: ...the terms of the Helsinki agreement...
example.tran: 《赫尔辛基协议》的条款

example.ex: Mayor Rendell imposed the new contract terms.
example.tran: 伦德尔市长强加了新的合同条款。

collins.tran: 勉强接受;向…让步;对…妥协
collins.def: If you come to terms with something difficult or unpleasant, you learn to accept and deal with it.

example.ex: She had come to terms with the fact that her husband would always be crippled.
example.tran: 她只好接受了丈夫将终生残疾这个现实。

collins.tran: 在平等的条件下;在相同的基础上
collins.def: If two people or groups compete on equal terms or on the same terms, neither of them has an advantage over the other.

example.ex: I had at last found a sport where I could compete on equal terms with able-bodied people...
example.tran: 我终于发现了一个可以和体格健全的人平等竞争的体育项目。

example.ex: The focus was on women gaining access to work on the same terms as men.
example.tran: 核心问题在于女性应与男性享有平等的就业机会。

collins.def: If two people are on good terms or on friendly terms, they are friendly with each other.

example.ex: Madeleine is on good terms with Sarah...
example.tran: 马德琳和萨拉相处很好。

example.ex: We shook hands and parted on good terms.
example.tran: 我们握了握手，友好地告别。

collins.tran: 从长远来看/从短期来看/从中期来看
collins.def: You use the expressions in the long term ,in the short term, and in the medium term to talk about what will happen over a long period of time, over a short period of time, and over a medium period of time.

example.ex: The agreement should have very positive results in the long term...
example.tran: 从长远来看，这个协议将会产生非常积极的影响。

example.ex: In the short term, chemical sprays are clearly an effective way to control pests...
example.tran: 从短期来看，喷洒化学药品显然能有效控制虫害。

collins.tran: 按照…的条件;根据…的意见
collins.def: If you do something on your terms, you do it under conditions that you decide because you are in a position of power.

example.ex: They will sign the union treaty only on their terms.
example.tran: 只有同意他们的条件，他们才会在联盟条约上签字。

collins.tran: 正在考虑，正在打算(做某事)
collins.def: If you say that you are thinking in terms of doing a particular thing, you mean that you are considering it.

example.ex: United should be thinking in terms of winning the European Cup...
example.tran: 联队应该在考虑要赢得欧洲杯。

example.ex: She was thinking in terms of a career.
example.tran: 她在考虑干一番事业。

collins.def: When you test something, you try it, for example by touching it or using it for a short time, in order to find out what it is, what condition it is in, or how well it works.

example.ex: Either measure the temperature with a bath thermometer or test the water with your wrist...
example.tran: 要么用浴用温度计测量水温，要么用手腕试一下。

example.ex: Here the army has its ranges where Rapier missiles and other weaponry are tested...
example.tran: 军方在这儿有发射场，“长剑”导弹等武器都在这里进行试验。

collins.def: A test is a deliberate action or experiment to find out how well something works.

example.ex: ...the banning of nuclear tests.
example.tran: 禁止核试验

collins.def: If you test someone, you ask them questions or tell them to perform certain actions in order to find out how much they know about a subject or how well they are able to do something.

example.ex: There was a time when each teacher spent an hour, one day a week, testing pupils in every subject...
example.tran: 曾经，每个老师每周都有一天花上一小时对学生的每门功课进行测试。

example.ex: She decided to test herself with a training run in London.
example.tran: 她决定在伦敦对自己进行跑步训练的测试。

collins.def: A test is a series of questions that you must answer or actions that you must perform in order to show how much you know about a subject or how well you are able to do something.

example.ex: Out of a total of 2,602 pupils only 922 passed the test...
example.tran: 所有 2,602 名学生中，只有 922 名通过了测试。

example.ex: She had sold her bike, taken a driving test and bought a car.
example.tran: 她卖了自行车，考了驾照，并买了辆汽车。

collins.def: If you test someone, you deliberately make things difficult for them in order to see how they react.

example.ex: She may be testing her mother to see how much she can take before she throws her out.
example.tran: 她可能在试探她妈妈，看她能忍耐到什么程度才会把她撵出家门。

collins.def: If an event or situation is a test of a person or thing, it reveals their qualities or effectiveness.

example.ex: It is a commonplace fact that holidays are a major test of any relationship...
example.tran: 度假对任何恋爱关系都是重大考验，这是常识。

example.ex: The test of any civilised society is how it treats its minorities.
example.tran: 检验一个社会是否文明的办法就是看它怎样对待其少数群体。

collins.def: If you are tested for a particular disease or medical condition, you are examined or go through various procedures in order to find out whether you have that disease or condition.

example.ex: My doctor wants me to be tested for diabetes...
example.tran: 我的医生要我去做个检查，看是否患有糖尿病。

example.ex: Girls in an affected family can also be tested to see if they carry the defective gene.
example.tran: 染病家庭的女孩们也可以检查一下，看看是否携带这种缺陷基因。

collins.def: A medical test is an examination of a part of your body in order to check that you are healthy or to find out what is wrong with you.

example.ex: If necessary X-rays and blood tests will also be used to aid diagnosis...
example.tran: 如有必要，还要进行 X 光检查和验血以帮助诊断。

example.ex: The family doctor ordered numerous, expensive medical tests, which revealed no physical problem.
example.tran: 家庭医生安排了名目繁多、收费昂贵的检查，结果没有查出任何健康问题。

collins.tran: (常指板球、橄榄球的)国际锦标赛
collins.def: A test is a sports match between two international teams, usually in cricket, rugby union, or rugby league.

collins.tran: 使经受检验;对…进行试验
collins.def: If you put something to the test, you find out how useful or effective it is by using it.

example.ex: The Liverpool team are now putting their theory to the test...
example.tran: 利物浦队此时正在验证他们的理论。

example.ex: Arriving at the railway station, I put local knowledge to the test and ask a taxi driver.
example.tran: 到了火车站，为了检验自己对当地的了解程度，我请教了一个出租车司机。

collins.def: If new circumstances or events put something to the test, they put a strain on it and indicate how strong or stable it really is.

example.ex: Sooner or later, life will put the relationship to the test.
example.tran: 总有一天，生活会考验这种关系是否牢固。

collins.def: If you say that something will stand the test of time, you mean that it is strong or effective enough to last for a very long time.

example.ex: It says a lot for her culinary skills that so many of her recipes have stood the test of time.
example.tran: 她的许多食谱经受住了时间的考验，这充分证明了她的厨艺。

collins.tran: (用于形容词、副词的比较级之后，连接比较对象)比
collins.def: You use than after a comparative adjective or adverb in order to link two parts of a comparison.

example.ex: The radio only weighs a few ounces and is smaller than a cigarette packet...
example.tran: 这台收音机重量仅为几盎司，比香烟盒还小。

example.ex: Indian skins age far more slowly than American or Italian ones.
example.tran: 印度人的皮肤比美国人或意大利人的皮肤衰老得慢得多。

collins.tran: (数目、数量、价值等)比…(多、少、重要或次要等)
collins.def: You use than when you are stating a number, quantity, or value approximately by saying that it is above or below another number, quantity, or value.

example.ex: They talked on the phone for more than an hour.
example.tran: 他们在电话里谈了一个多小时。

example.ex: ...the three-match Test series in England, starting in less than two months time...
example.tran: 再过不到两个月就要在英格兰开始的三场制国际板球对抗赛

collins.tran: 与其说，而不是(连接对比的对象，以表示优先考虑等)
collins.def: You use than in order to link two parts of a contrast, for example in order to state a preference.

example.ex: The arrangement was more a formality than a genuine partnership of two nations...
example.tran: 这一协定与其说体现了两个国家之间真正的伙伴关系，还不如说是一种形式。

example.ex: I would rather stare at a clear, star-filled sky than a TV set...
example.tran: 我宁可凝视繁星满天的晴朗夜空也不愿盯着电视机。

collins.def: You use thank you or, in more informal English, thanks to express your gratitude when someone does something for you or gives you what you want.

example.ex: Thank you very much for your call...
example.tran: 非常感谢您的来电。

example.ex: Thanks for the information...
example.tran: 谢谢提供这个信息。

collins.tran: 谢谢你，多谢(用于有礼貌地接受或拒绝)
collins.def: You use thank you or, in more informal English, thanks to politely accept or refuse something that has just been offered to you.

example.ex: 'You'd like a cup as well, would you, Mr Secombe?' — 'Thank you, Jane, I'd love one.'...
example.tran: “塞科姆先生，你也想来一杯吧？”——“谢谢，简，我确实想来一杯。”

example.ex: 'Would you like a cigarette?' — 'No thank you.'...
example.tran: “要来支烟吗？”——“不了，谢谢。”

collins.tran: 谢谢你，多谢(尤用于礼貌地感谢对方的回答或所说的令人开心的话)
collins.def: You use thank you or, in more informal English, thanks to politely acknowledge what someone has said to you, especially when they have answered your question or said something nice to you.

example.ex: The policeman smiled at her. 'Pretty dog.' — 'Oh well, thank you.'...
example.tran: 警察冲她笑了笑，“这狗真漂亮。”——“哦，谢谢。”

example.ex: 'His eyes were glassy?' — 'And dilated. They were watery.' — 'Thank you.'...
example.tran: “他的眼神呆滞？”——“还双眼圆睁，泪汪汪的。”——“谢谢！”

collins.tran: 谢谢，非常感谢(用于坚决回绝别人的帮助或表示不喜欢别人的举动)
collins.def: You use thank you or thank you very much in order to say firmly that you do not want someone's help or to tell them that you do not like the way that they are behaving towards you.

example.ex: I can stir my own tea, thank you...
example.tran: 我的茶我自己会搅，谢谢。

example.ex: We know where we can get it, thank you very much.
example.tran: 我们知道在哪儿能买到，谢谢。

collins.def: When you thank someone for something, you express your gratitude to them for it.

example.ex: I thanked them for their long and loyal service...
example.tran: 我感谢他们长期以来忠诚的效力。

example.ex: When the decision was read out Mrs Gardner thanked the judges.
example.tran: 判决书宣读完，加德纳夫人向法官们表示感谢。

collins.def: When you express your thanks to someone, you express your gratitude to them for something.

example.ex: They accepted their certificates with words of thanks.
example.tran: 他们一边道谢，一边接过证书。

collins.def: When people give thanks, they thank God for something good that has happened.

example.ex: We give thanks for this food.
example.tran: 感谢上帝赐给我们食物。

collins.def: You say 'Thank God', 'Thank Goodness', or 'Thank heavens' when you are very relieved about something.

example.ex: I was wrong, thank God...
example.tran: 原来我错了，感谢上帝。

example.ex: Thank heavens we have you here.
example.tran: 谢天谢地，我们可等到你了。

collins.def: If you say that you have someone to thank for something, you mean that you are grateful to them because they caused it to happen.

example.ex: I have her to thank for my life...
example.tran: 我这条命多亏了她。

example.ex: For all this I have only you to thank.
example.tran: 这一切我都得感谢你才是。

collins.def: If you say that something happens thanks to a particular person or thing, you mean that they are responsible for it happening or caused it to happen.

example.ex: It is thanks to this committee that many new sponsors have come forward...
example.tran: 又有许多赞助商找上门来，这要归功于这个委员会。

example.ex: Thanks to recent research, effective treatments are available.
example.tran: 多亏近来的研究才有了有效的疗法。

collins.tran: 并非由于…才(发生);并不归功于
collins.def: If you say that something happens no thanks to a particular person or thing, you mean that they did not help it to happen, or that it happened in spite of them.

example.ex: It is no thanks to the Government that net assets did rise.
example.tran: 净资产的确增长了，但这与政府无关。

means: 用于某些动词、形容词和名词后，引出各种从句

collins.tran: 那，那个(指代前面句子里提到的)
collins.def: You use that to refer back to an idea or situation expressed in a previous sentence or sentences.

example.ex: They said you particularly wanted to talk to me. Why was that?...
example.tran: 他们说你特别想和我谈谈。为什么？

example.ex: 'Hey, is there anything the matter with my sisters?' — 'Is that why you're phoning?'...
example.tran: “喂，我的姐妹们没事儿吧？”——“你打电话就为这个？”

collins.tran: 那个人,那个(用来指代已经提到的人或物)
collins.def: You use that to refer to someone or something already mentioned.

example.ex: The Commissioners get between £50,000 and 60,000 a year in various allowances. But that amount can soar to 90,000 a year...
example.tran: 委员们每年领取的各种津贴在 5 万到 6 万英镑之间，但最高可达 9 万英镑。

example.ex: The biggest increase was on the cheapest model, the CRX-HF. That car had a 1990 base price of $9,145.
example.tran: 涨价最快的是最便宜的车型 CRX-HF，那款车 1990 年的基价是 9,145 美元。

collins.tran: 那，那个(指已经谈到过的特定时期)
collins.def: When you have been talking about a particular period of time, you use that to indicate that you are still referring to the same period. You use expressions such as that morning or that afternoon to indicate that you are referring to an earlier period of the same day.

example.ex: The story was published in a Sunday newspaper later that week...
example.tran: 这篇报道于那周晚些时候刊登在一份周日报纸上。

example.ex: That morning I had put on a pair of black slacks and a long-sleeved black blouse.
example.tran: 那天早上，我穿了一条宽松的黑裤子和一件长袖黑衬衫。

collins.tran: (用于 that of, that which 等短语中引出有关上文提到的某事物的更多信息，而避免重复相关名词)
collins.def: You use that in expressions such as that of and that which to introduce more information about something already mentioned, instead of repeating the noun which refers to it.

example.ex: A recession like that of 1973–1974 could put one in ten American companies into bankruptcy...
example.tran: 像 1973–1974 年间那样的经济衰退能让 1/10 的美国公司破产。

example.ex: Indoor pollution falls into two categories, that which we can see or smell, and pollution which is invisible and produces no odour.
example.tran: 室内污染分为两种：一种是我们能看得见或闻得着的，另一种是无色无味的。

collins.tran: 那个，那(用于对前述内容表示同意或作出应答的词和词组前)
collins.def: You use that in front of words or expressions which express agreement, responses, or reactions to what has just been said.

example.ex: 'She said she'd met you in England.' — 'That's  true.'...
example.tran: “她说她在英格兰见过你。”——“是的。”

example.ex: 'I've never been to Paris.' — 'That's a pity. You should go one day.'
example.tran: “我从没去过巴黎。”——“可惜了，你什么时候应该去一次。”

collins.tran: 那一个，那个(引出将要更加详细介绍的人或物)
collins.def: You use that to introduce a person or thing that you are going to give details or information about.

example.ex: In my case I chose that course which I considered right...
example.tran: 至于我呢，就选择了我认为正确的那条路线。

example.ex: That person who violates the law and discriminates should suffer in his career.
example.tran: 非法歧视他人的人在事业上应该受到惩戒。

collins.tran: 那个(指代在时间、空间上离自己稍远的人或物，尤用于指示;有两个以上的事物时，that 指较远的那个)
collins.def: You use that when you are referring to someone or something which is a distance away from you in position or time, especially when you indicate or point to them. When there are two or more things near you, that refers to the more distant one.

example.ex: Look at that guy. He's got red socks...
example.tran: 你看那边那个家伙，他穿着双红袜子。

example.ex: Where did you get that hat?...
example.tran: 你那顶帽子在哪儿买的？

collins.def: You use that when you are identifying someone or asking about their identity.

example.ex: That's my wife you were talking to...
example.tran: 刚才和你说话的人是我老婆。

example.ex: That's John Gibb, operations chief for New York Emergency Management...
example.tran: 那个人是约翰·吉布，纽约应急管理办公室的行动总指挥官。

collins.tran: (不需明确指出的情况下谈话对方即可能知道所指的人或物)那个
collins.def: You can use that when you expect the person you are talking to to know what or who you are referring to, without needing to identify the particular person or thing fully.

example.ex: I really thought I was something when I wore that hat and my patent leather shoes...
example.tran: 我头戴那顶帽子，脚蹬漆皮鞋，当时感觉挺像那么回事儿。

example.ex: Did you get that cheque I sent?...
example.tran: 你收到我寄给你的那张支票了吗？

collins.tran: 不太，不那么(坏、滑稽、昂贵等)
collins.def: If something is not that bad, funny, or expensive for example, it is not as bad, funny, or expensive as it might be or as has been suggested.

example.ex: Not even Gary, he said, was that stupid...
example.tran: 他说，就连加里也没有那么蠢。

example.ex: It isn't that funny...
example.tran: 没有那么好笑。

collins.tran: 那么，那样(用于强调感情或品质的程度之深)
collins.def: You can use that to emphasize the degree of a feeling or quality.

example.ex: I would have walked out, I was that angry...
example.tran: 我差点中途退席，我太生气了。

example.ex: Do I look that stupid?...
example.tran: 我看起来有那么蠢吗？

collins.def: You use and all that or and that to refer generally to everything else which is associated with what you have just mentioned.

example.ex: I hate to be nasty and all that...
example.tran: 我不想讲些难听的话什么的。

example.ex: I'm not a cook myself but I am interested in nutrition and that.
example.tran: 我本人不是厨师，但对营养之类的事很感兴趣。

collins.tran: 此外，而且(用于陈述之后，修饰或强调所说的话)
collins.def: You use at that after a statement which modifies or emphasizes what you have just said.

example.ex: Success never seems to come but through hard work, often physically demanding work at that...
example.tran: 不付出艰苦的努力似乎就不会取得成功，而且这一努力通常要劳其筋骨。

example.ex: The caféwas popular with locals, and not with the more respectable locals at that.
example.tran: 那家咖啡馆很受当地人欢迎，不过不包括当地那些更有身份的人。

collins.def: You use that is or that is to say to indicate that you are about to express the same idea more clearly or precisely.

example.ex: I am a disappointing, though generally dutiful, student. That is, I do as I'm told...
example.tran: 我虽然总的来说循规蹈矩，但依然是个令人失望的学生，就是说，叫我做什么我就做什么。

example.ex: Education Ministers ought to have placed the interests of consumers — that is to say pupils — first.
example.tran: 教育部长们应该把服务对象——也就是学生——的利益放在首位。

collins.tran: 就这样，好了(表示不必再做什么或目的已经达到)
collins.def: You use that's it to indicate that nothing more needs to be done or that the end has been reached.

example.ex: When he left the office, that was it, the workday was over.
example.tran: 他一离开办公室，就此打住，一天的工作就结束了。

collins.tran: 对，是这样(表示同意、赞许)
collins.def: You use that's it to express agreement with or approval of what has just been said or done.

example.ex: 'You got married, right?' — 'Yeah, that's it.'
example.tran: “你结婚了吧？”——“嗯，结了。”

collins.tran: 就那样(强调某事突然发生、立即做完或过程很简单，常指未加思考、讨论)
collins.def: You use just like that to emphasize that something happens or is done immediately or in a very simple way, often without much thought or discussion.

example.ex: Just like that, I was in love...
example.tran: 就那样，我恋爱了。

example.ex: You mean he sent you back just like that?
example.tran: 你是说他就那样把你打发回来啦？

collins.tran: 就这样，就这么定了(表示无能为力、无话可说)
collins.def: You use that's that to say there is nothing more you can do or say about a particular matter.

example.ex: 'Well, if that's the way you want it,' he replied, tears in his eyes, 'I guess that's that.'
example.tran: “好吧，如果那就是你想要的，”他两眼含泪说道，“我想那就这样吧。”

example.ex: 'I want you to go home.' — 'I'm  staying here, and that's that.'
example.tran: “我想让你回家。”——“我就待在这儿，就这么定了。”

means: 指说话人与听者已知的人（物）
用于独一无二的事物前
与形容词最高级和序数词连用

collins.tran: (用于名词短语之前，指代已经提及或指明的人或物)
collins.def: You use the at the beginning of noun groups to refer to someone or something that you have already mentioned or identified.

example.ex: A waiter came and hovered. John caught my look and we both got up and, ignoring the waiter, made our way to the buffet...
example.tran: 一个侍者走了过来，候在附近。约翰领会了我的眼神，我们两个都站了起来，没有理睬那个侍者，朝自助餐台走去。

example.ex: Six of the 38 people were Russian citizens.
example.tran: 38 个人中有 6 个是俄罗斯公民。

collins.tran: (当名词后接 of 短语或表明身份的从句时，该名词前用the)
collins.def: You use the at the beginning of a noun group when the first noun is followed by an 'of' phrase or a clause which identifies the person or thing.

example.ex: There has been a slight increase in the consumption of meat...
example.tran: 肉类消费量略有增长。

example.ex: Of the 9,660 cases processed last year, only 10 per cent were totally rejected.
example.tran: 去年受理的 9,660 宗案件中，只有 10% 被完全驳回。

collins.tran: (用于某些表示人们共有经历的名词前)
collins.def: You use the in front of some nouns that refer to something in our general experience of the world.

example.ex: It's always hard to speculate about the future...
example.tran: 未来一向很难预测。

example.ex: Amy sat outside in the sun...
example.tran: 埃米坐在外面太阳底下。

collins.tran: (用于和日常生活相关的人、物、服务、机构的名词前)
collins.def: You use the in front of nouns that refer to people, things, services, or institutions that are associated with everyday life.

example.ex: The doctor's on his way...
example.tran: 医生正在路上。

example.ex: Who was that on the phone?...
example.tran: 刚才打电话的是谁啊？

collins.tran: (用于代替所有格限定词，尤在谈论身体某一部分或家庭某一成员时)
collins.def: You use the instead of a possessive determiner, especially when you are talking about a part of someone's body or a member of their family.

example.ex: 'How's the family?' — 'Just fine, thank you.'...
example.tran: “家里人都好吧？”——“都好，谢谢。”

example.ex: I patted him on the head...
example.tran: 我拍了拍他的头。

collins.tran: (用于单数名词前，表示一类人或事物)
collins.def: You use the in front of a singular noun when you want to make a general statement about things or people of that type.

example.ex: An area in which the computer has made considerable strides in recent years is in playing chess...
example.tran: 近年来，计算机应用取得长足进步的一个领域是国际象棋。

example.ex: After dogs, the horse has had the closest relationship with man.
example.tran: 除了狗以外，就数马和人的关系最密切了。

collins.tran: (谈论是否会演奏乐器时，用于乐器名称前)
collins.def: You use the with the name of a musical instrument when you are talking about someone's ability to play the instrument.

example.ex: Did you play the piano as a child?...
example.tran: 你小时候弹过钢琴吗？

example.ex: She was trying to teach him to play the guitar.
example.tran: 她在试着教他弹吉他。

collins.tran: (用于表示国籍的形容词和名词以谈论一国全体国民)
collins.def: You use the with nationality adjectives and nouns to talk about the people who live in a country.

example.ex: The Japanese, Americans, and even the French and Germans, judge economic policies by results.
example.tran: 日本人、美国人，甚至法国人和德国人，都依据结果来评判经济政策的好坏。

collins.tran: (与 rich, poor, old, unemployed 等形容词连用，表示某一类人)
collins.def: You use the with words such as 'rich', 'poor', 'old', or 'unemployed' to refer to all people of a particular type.

example.ex: Conditions for the poor in Los Angeles have not improved.
example.tran: 洛杉矶穷人的境况仍未得到改善。

example.ex: ...care for the elderly and the disabled.
example.tran: 对老人和残疾人的照顾

collins.tran: (用于姓氏的复数前，表示一家人或夫妻)
collins.def: If you want to refer to a whole family or to a married couple, you can make their surname into a plural and use the in front of it.

example.ex: ...a 400 acre farm owned by the Allens...
example.tran: 艾伦家的一个面积为 400 英亩的农场

example.ex: The Taylors decided that they would employ an architect to do the work.
example.tran: 泰勒家决定雇个建筑师来干这个活。

collins.tran: (用于形容词前，表示其修饰的某个事物)
collins.def: You use the in front of an adjective when you are referring to a particular thing that is described by that adjective.

example.ex: He knows he's wishing for the impossible...
example.tran: 他清楚他在期盼一件不可能发生的事。

example.ex: I thought you might like to read the enclosed.
example.tran: 我想你或许想要读一下信封里的内容。

collins.tran: (表示拥有为某一特定目的所需的足够的某物)
collins.def: You use the to indicate that you have enough of the thing mentioned for a particular purpose.

example.ex: She may not have the money to maintain or restore her property...
example.tran: 她可能没有足够的钱来维护或修葺她的房产。

example.ex: We must have the patience to continue to work until we will find a peaceful solution...
example.tran: 我们一定要耐下心来继续努力，直到找出和平的解决方案为止。

collins.tran: (与某些称号、地名和其他名称连用)
collins.def: You use the with some titles, place names, and other names.

example.ex: The company was alleged to have leaked the news to the Daily Mail.
example.tran: 据称，那家公司将消息透露给了《每日邮报》。

example.ex: ...the Albert Hall...
example.tran: 艾伯特音乐厅

collins.def: You use the in front of numbers such as first, second, and third.

example.ex: The meeting should take place on the fifth of May...
example.tran: 会议将会于 5 月 5 日举行。

example.ex: Marco Polo is said to have sailed on the Pacific on his way to Java in the thirteenth century...
example.tran: 据说，13 世纪时，马可·波罗在去爪哇岛的途中在太平洋上航行过。

collins.def: You use the in front of numbers when they refer to decades.

example.ex: It's sometimes hard to imagine how bad things were in the thirties.
example.tran: 有时很难想象 30 年代的日子有多么困难。

collins.tran: (用于形容词和副词的最高级前)
collins.def: You use the in front of superlative adjectives and adverbs.

example.ex: Brisk daily walks are still the best exercise for young and old alike...
example.tran: 不管年轻人还是老人，每天快步行走仍是最好的锻炼方式。

example.ex: The Mayor of West Berlin described the Germans as the happiest people in the world...
example.tran: 西柏林市长称德国人是世界上最幸福的人。

collins.tran: 越…越…(用于两个比较级前，表示其中一个随另一个发生量或质的变化)
collins.def: You use the in front of each of two comparative adjectives or adverbs when you are describing how one amount or quality changes in relation to another.

example.ex: The longer you have been in shape in the past, the quicker you will regain fitness in future...
example.tran: 过去健美身形保持的时间越长，将来身材恢复得就越快。

example.ex: The more confidence you build up in yourself, the greater are your chances of success.
example.tran: 树立的自信心越强，成功的把握就越大。

collins.tran: 每，一(表示速度、价格、度量等)
collins.def: When you express rates, prices, and measurements, you can use the to say how many units apply to each of the items being measured.

example.ex: New Japanese cars averaged 13 km to the litre in 1981...
example.tran: 1981 年，新型的日产汽车平均每升汽油能跑 13 千米。

example.ex: Some analysts predicted that the exchange rate would soon be $2 to the pound.
example.tran: 一些分析人士预测，英镑对美元的汇率将很快达到1:2。

collins.tran: (表示某人或某物是同类中最有名、最重要或最好的。口语中 the 要重读；书面语中常加下划线或用大写、斜体)
collins.def: You use the to indicate that something or someone is the most famous, important, or best thing of its kind. In spoken English, you put more stress on it, and in written English, you often underline it or write it in capitals or italics.

example.ex: Camden Market is the place to be on a Saturday or Sunday...
example.tran: 卡姆登市场是周末的最佳去处。

example.ex: 'Olympia is in America, where K Records was founded.' — 'No! Surely you don't mean THE K Records?'
example.tran: “奥林匹亚在美国，K 唱片公司就是在那里创立的。”——“不可能！你不会指那个大名鼎鼎的 K 唱片公司吧？”

means: 在提及性别不详的人时，用以代替 him 或 her

collins.def: You use their to indicate that something belongs or relates to the group of people, animals, or things that you are talking about.

example.ex: Janis and Kurt have announced their engagement...
example.tran: 贾尼斯和库尔特已宣布订婚。

example.ex: Horses were poking their heads over their stall doors.
example.tran: 马儿们从马厩门上探出头来。

collins.tran: (代替 his or her，而不指明是男是女;有人认为这种用法不对)
collins.def: You use their instead of 'his or her' to indicate that something belongs or relates to a person without saying whether that person is a man or a woman. Some people think this use is incorrect.

example.ex: Every member will receive their own 'Welcome to Labour' brochure.
example.tran: 每个党员都将收到一本名为《欢迎加入工党》的小册子。

example.ex: But anyone looking for income from their investments is in a much worse state.
example.tran: 但是，那些指望靠投资获取收入的人境况更为糟糕。

collins.def: You use them to refer to a group of people, animals, or things.

example.ex: The Beatles — I never get tired of listening to them...
example.tran: 甲壳虫乐队——我是百听不厌。

example.ex: Kids these days have no one to tell them what's right and wrong...
example.tran: 如今的孩子没人告诉他们什么是对什么是错。

collins.tran: (代替 him or her，而不指明是男是女;有人认为这种用法不对)
collins.def: You use them instead of 'him or her' to refer to a person without saying whether that person is a man or a woman. Some people think this use is incorrect.

example.ex: It takes great courage to face your child and tell them the truth.
example.tran: 面对自己的孩子，告诉他们真相是需要很大勇气的。

collins.tran: 那些(不规范口语中代替those)
collins.def: In non-standard spoken English, them is sometimes used instead of 'those'.

example.ex: 'Our Billy doesn't eat them ones,' Helen said.
example.tran: “咱家比利不吃那些东西，”海伦说。

collins.tran: 他们自己;她们自己;它们自己
collins.def: You use themselves to refer to people, animals, or things when the object of a verb or preposition refers to the same people or things as the subject of the verb.

example.ex: They all seemed to be enjoying themselves...
example.tran: 他们好像玩得都很开心。

example.ex: The men talked amongst themselves...
example.tran: 那些男人一起聊着天。

collins.tran: 他们自己，她们自己，它们自己(强调所指的人或物，有时用作动词或介词宾语，代替 them)
collins.def: You use themselves to emphasize the people or things that you are referring to. Themselves is also sometimes used instead of 'them' as the object of a verb or preposition.

example.ex: Many mentally ill people are themselves unhappy about the idea of community care...
example.tran: 许多精神病患者本身不喜欢社区护理。

example.ex: Cities themselves are changing rapidly...
example.tran: 城市自身在日新月异地变化。

collins.tran: (用以代替himself or herself，指代句子的主语，而不指明是男是女;有人认为这种用法不对)
collins.def: You use themselves instead of 'himself or herself' to refer back to the person who is the subject of sentence without saying whether it is a man or a woman. Some people think this use is incorrect.

example.ex: What can a patient with emphysema do to help themselves?...
example.tran: 肺气肿病人能做些什么来帮助自己恢复健康？

example.ex: Nobody was prepared to commit themselves.
example.tran: 谁都不愿作出承诺。

collins.tran: (用以代替 himself or herself，强调所指代的人，但是不指明是男是女; themselves 有时也用作动词或介词的宾语;有人认为这种用法不对)
collins.def: You use themselves instead of 'himself or herself' to emphasize the person you are referring to without saying whether it is a man or a woman. Themselves is also sometimes used as the object of a verb or preposition. Some people think this use is incorrect.

example.ex: Each student makes only one item themselves...
example.tran: 每个学生自己只做一项。

example.ex: After all, what more can anyone be than themselves?
example.tran: 毕竟，人们除了做自己又能怎样呢？

collins.def: Then means at a particular time in the past or in the future.

example.ex: He wanted to have a source of income after his retirement; until then, he wouldn't require additional money...
example.tran: 他想退休后有份收入;在那以前，他并不需要额外的钱。

example.ex: The clinic opened for business last October and since then has treated more than 200 people.
example.tran: 该诊所去年 10 月开业，从那以后已经接诊 200 多人。

collins.def: Then is used when you refer to something which was true at a particular time in the past but is not true now.

example.ex: ...the Race Relations Act of 1976 (enacted by the then Labour Government)...
example.tran: 1976 年的《种族关系法》(由当时的工党政府颁布施行)

example.ex: He was known by many for his role in the then record-breaking robbery of the mail train from Glasgow to London in August 1963.
example.tran: 他曾因参与 1963 年 8 月那起发生在从格拉斯哥开往伦敦的邮政列车上的特大抢劫案而恶名昭著。

collins.def: You use then to say that one thing happens after another, or is after another on a list.

example.ex: Add the oil and then the scallops to the pan, leaving a little space for the garlic...
example.tran: 先在锅里放油，然后放入扇贝，留点地方搁蒜。

example.ex: I felt myself blush. Then I sniffed back a tear...
example.tran: 我觉得自己的脸红了，接着我吸吸鼻子,不让眼泪掉下来。

collins.def: You use then in conversation to indicate that what you are about to say follows logically in some way from what has just been said or implied.

example.ex: 'I wasn't a very good scholar at school.' — 'What did you like doing best then?'...
example.tran: “我在学校时成绩不大好。”——“那么你当时最喜欢做什么呢？”

example.ex: You're not gonna tell me, are you? Do I have to guess, then?...
example.tran: 你不打算告诉我，是吧？那么，我只好猜猜了？

collins.def: You use then at the end of a topic or at the end of a conversation.

example.ex: 'I can meet you after work. Six o'clock?'— 'Fine.' — 'Six o'clock, then?'...
example.tran: “我下班后可以和你碰面。6 点可以吗？”——“行啊。”——“那就定 6 点啦？”

example.ex: He stood up. 'That's settled then.'...
example.tran: 他站起身说，“就这么定了。”

collins.tran: (和 now，well，okay 等连用，引出新话题或新观点)
collins.def: You use then with words like 'now', 'well', and 'okay', to introduce a new topic or a new point of view.

example.ex: Now then, you say you walk on the fields out the back?
example.tran: 那么，你说你在后面的田地里散步？

example.ex: Well then, I'll put the kettle on and make us some tea...
example.tran: 好吧，我来烧壶水，我们沏点茶喝。

collins.tran: 也就是说，总之(引出总结或结论)
collins.def: You use then to introduce a summary of what you have said or the conclusions that you are drawing from it.

example.ex: This, then, was the music that appeared to dominate the world of serious concert music in the mid-1960s...
example.tran: 这就是 20 世纪 60 年代中期严肃的管弦乐中的主流音乐。

example.ex: By 1931, then, France alone in Europe was a country of massive immigration.
example.tran: 也就是说，到 1931 年的时候，法国是欧洲唯一一个拥有大量移民的国家。

collins.tran: 那么，则(引导if开头的句子的第二部分，第一部分描述可能的情况，第二部分引入结果)
collins.def: You use then to introduce the second part of a sentence which begins with 'if'. The first part of the sentence describes a possible situation, and then introduces the result of the situation.

example.ex: If the answer is 'yes', then we must decide on an appropriate course of action...
example.tran: 如果答案是肯定的，那么我们必须商定合适的行动方案。

collins.tran: 毕竟，话说回来，而且(用于句首，或用于 and，but 之后引出对之前所说话的评论或补充)
collins.def: You use then at the beginning of a sentence or after 'and' or 'but' to introduce a comment or an extra piece of information to what you have already said.

example.ex: We have to do quite a bit of reading, and then we have our ongoing work which would be an essay...
example.tran: 我们要进行大量阅读，而且手头有一篇论文要写。

example.ex: He sounded sincere, but then, he always did.
example.tran: 他听起来很真诚，可是话说回来，他向来如此。

means: 表示某物或某人的存在或某事的发生（常用作be, seem或appear的主语）
（表示满足、烦恼）你瞧，好啦，得啦

collins.tran: (作动词 be 的主语，表示存在与否或引起注意)
collins.def: There is used as the subject of the verb 'be' to say that something exists or does not exist, or to draw attention to it.

example.ex: There are roadworks between Camblesforth and Carlton...
example.tran: 坎布斯福斯和卡尔顿之间的道路在施工。

example.ex: Are there some countries that have been able to tackle these problems successfully?...
example.tran: 有没有哪些国家已经能成功解决这些问题了？

collins.tran: (用在某些动词前表示某事物存在、发展或可见，动词的单复数取决于其后的名词)
collins.def: You use there in front of certain verbs when you are saying that something exists, develops, or can be seen. Whether the verb is singular or plural depends on the noun which follows the verb.

example.ex: There remains considerable doubt over when the intended high-speed rail link will be complete...
example.tran: 人们对于拟建的高速铁路何时能竣工仍存有很大疑问。

example.ex: There appeared no imminent danger...
example.tran: 看不出有什么迫在眉睫的危险。

collins.tran: (用于 hello 或 hi 之后作为问候语)
collins.def: There is used after 'hello' or 'hi' when you are greeting someone.

example.ex: 'Hello there,' said the woman, smiling at them. — 'Hi!' they chorused...
example.tran: “嘿，你们好！”那个女人笑着对他们说。——“你好！”他们齐声说。

example.ex: Oh, hi there. You must be Sidney.
example.tran: 喂，你好。你一定是西德尼吧。

collins.tran: 存在地;现有地;可得到地
collins.def: If something is there, it exists or is available.

example.ex: The group of old buildings on the corner by the main road is still there today...
example.tran: 大路拐角处的古老建筑群如今还在。

example.ex: The book is there for people to read and make up their own mind...
example.tran: 书摆在那儿，供人们阅读后再作决定。

collins.tran: 那儿(指已经提及的地方)
collins.def: You use there to refer to a place which has already been mentioned.

example.ex: The next day we drove the 33 miles to Siena (the Villa Arceno is a great place to stay while you are there) for the Palio...
example.tran: 第二天，我们驱车 33 英里来到锡耶纳参加赛马节(此地的阿尔希诺山庄是个好地方，值得一去)。

example.ex: 'Come on over, if you want.' — 'How do I get there?'...
example.tran: “你要想来的话，就过来吧。”——“我怎么去那里？”

collins.tran: 那儿，那边(表示用手指向的或目视的地方)
collins.def: You use there to indicate a place that you are pointing to or looking at, in order to draw someone's attention to it.

example.ex: There it is, on the corner over there...
example.tran: 在那儿呢，在那边那个角上。

example.ex: There she is on the left up there...
example.tran: 她在那边，左边那儿。

collins.tran: (用于 there he was 或 there we were 等表达方式中，用以概括故事或为了制造特殊效果放慢故事的节奏)
collins.def: You use there in expressions such as 'there he was' or 'there we were' to sum up part of a story or to slow a story down for dramatic effect.

example.ex: So there we were with Amy and she was driving us crazy...
example.tran: 就这样，我们和埃米到了一起，而她快把我们逼疯了。

example.ex: I looked, and there he was, riding a horse, with a double barreled shotgun on his shoulder.
example.tran: 我看了看，发现他在那儿，骑着马，肩上扛着一把双筒猎枪。

collins.def: You use there when speaking on the telephone to ask if someone is available to speak to you.

example.ex: Hello, is Gordon there please?
example.tran: 喂，请问戈登在吗？

collins.tran: 在那一点上(指别人谈话中的某个观点)
collins.def: You use there to refer to a point that someone has made in a conversation.

example.ex: Death is terrible. I agree with you there...
example.tran: 死亡很可怕。这点我同意你的观点。

example.ex: I think you're right there John...
example.tran: 约翰，我觉得你这点说对了。

collins.tran: 那里，那儿(指活动、过程已经达到的阶段)
collins.def: You use there to refer to a stage that has been reached in an activity or process.

example.ex: We are making further investigations and will take the matter from there...
example.tran: 我们正在进一步调查，将从那儿入手。

example.ex: And there we end this edition of Science in Action...
example.tran: 本期《科学在行动》到这里就结束了。

collins.def: You use there to indicate that something has reached a point or level which is completely successful.

example.ex: We had hoped to fill the back page with extra news; we're not quite there yet...
example.tran: 我们本来希望补充一些新闻把最后一版填满，可是现在差得还很远。

example.ex: Life has not yet returned to normal but we are getting there.
example.tran: 生活还没有恢复正常，不过就快了。

collins.tran: 别无他法;无计可施;只能这样了
collins.def: You can use there in expressions such as there you go or there we are when accepting that an unsatisfactory situation cannot be changed.

example.ex: I'm the oldest and, according to all the books, should be the achiever, but there you go...
example.tran: 我岁数最大，无论怎么说，都应该有所成就了，可是你看看我这个样子。

example.ex: It's the wages that count. Not over-generous, but there you are...
example.tran: 重要的是工钱，不要过于慷慨，但也没办法。

collins.tran: 我讲的没错吧;我说对了吧
collins.def: You can use there in expressions such as there you go and there we are when emphasizing that something proves that you were right.

example.ex: You see? There you go. That's why I didn't mention it earlier. I knew you'd take it the wrong way...
example.tran: 你看，我说的没错吧？这就是为什么我早没提。我就知道你会误解。

example.ex: 'There you are, you see!' she exclaimed. 'I knew you'd say that!'...
example.tran: “你看看，我说对了吧！”她叫道，“我就知道你要那么说。”

collins.def: You use there again to introduce an extra piece of information which either contradicts what has been said or gives an alternative to it.

example.ex: At 18 stone, I can't run around the way I used to. There again, some people say I never did...
example.tran: 我现在体重18英石，不能像从前那样跑来跑去了;不过有人说我以前就跑不动。

example.ex: I mean small cars are the answer surely. Or there again a good system of public transport might do the same thing.
example.tran: 我是说小汽车肯定是解决之道，不过良好的公交系统或许也能解决问题。

collins.def: Phrases such as there you go again are used to show annoyance at someone who is repeating something that has annoyed you in the past.

example.ex: 'There you go again, upsetting the child!' said Shirley...
example.tran: “瞧，又来了不是？又惹孩子伤心！”雪莉说。

example.ex: 'There you go again, Dad, with your silly words.' — 'Sorry, son.'...
example.tran: “爸爸，又来了吧，又说傻话了。”——“对不起，儿子。”

collins.def: You can add 'so there' to what you are saying to show that you will not change your mind about a decision you have made, even though the person you are talking to disagrees with you.

example.ex: 'Take That' are the best group in the whole world. So there...
example.tran: “接招”乐队是世界上最好的组合，就是这样的。

example.ex: I think that's sweet, so there.
example.tran: 我看那样很好，就这么定了。

collins.def: If something happens there and then or then and there, it happens immediately.

example.ex: Many felt that he should have resigned there and then...
example.tran: 许多人觉得他应该当场辞职。

example.ex: There and then he made his decision...
example.tran: 他当时就做出了决定。

collins.tran: 好了，好了(用于安慰他人，尤其是儿童)
collins.def: You say 'there there' to someone who is very upset, especially a small child, in order to comfort them.

example.ex: 'There, there,' said Mum. 'You've been having a really bad dream.'
example.tran: “好了，好了，”妈妈说，“你只是做了一个很可怕的噩梦。”

collins.def: You say 'there you are' or 'there you go' when you are offering something to someone.

example.ex: Nora picked up the boy, and gave him a biscuit. 'There you are, Lennie, you take the nice biscuit.'
example.tran: 诺拉抱起那个男孩，给他一块饼干，说：“伦尼，给，拿着这块好吃的饼干。”

collins.def: If someone is there for you, they help and support you, especially when you have problems.

example.ex: Despite what happened in the past I want her to know I am there for her.
example.tran: 无论过去发生过什么，我希望她知道，我是支持她的。

collins.tran: （用于名词词组前，指代已提及的人或事物）这些
collins.def: You use these at the beginning of noun groups to refer to someone or something that you have already mentioned or identified.

example.ex: Switch to an interest-paying current account and stay in credit. Most banks and larger building societies now offer these accounts...
example.tran: 转成付息的活期存款账户，并保持账上有余额。多数银行和较大的购房互助会现在都能开立这种账户。

example.ex: A steering committee has been formed. These people can make decisions in ten minutes which would usually take us months.
example.tran: 已经成立了一个指导委员会。我们通常要几个月才能决定的事，这些人在 10 分钟内就能作出决定。

collins.tran: (引出将要提及的人或事物)这些
collins.def: You use these to introduce people or things that you are going to talk about.

example.ex: Your camcorder should have these basic features: autofocus, playback facility, zoom lens...
example.tran: 你的便携式摄像机应该具备以下基本功能：自动聚焦、回放功能、变焦镜头。

example.ex: If you're converting your loft, these addresses will be useful.
example.tran: 你要是打算改造阁楼，这些地址会派上用场。

collins.tran: (口语中用来引出故事中的人或物)一些
collins.def: In spoken English, people use these to introduce people or things into a story.

example.ex: I was on my own and these fellows came along towards me...
example.tran: 我正一个人走着，一些家伙朝我走过来。

example.ex: She used to make all these chocolate puddle puddings, you know, with the sauce underneath and all this sort of thing.
example.tran: 她过去喜欢做巧克力夹心布丁，你知道吧，就是里面有巧克力酱之类的东西的。

collins.tran: 这些，他们(用以说明或询问身份)
collins.def: You use these when you are identifying someone or asking about their identity.

example.ex: These are my children.
example.tran: 这些都是我的孩子。

collins.tran: 这些(指离自己近的人或物，尤指所触碰或指向的人或物)
collins.def: You use these to refer to people or things that are near you, especially when you touch them or point to them.

example.ex: What I try to do in putting these pictures up here is to show how varied children are in solving the problem...
example.tran: 我把这些图片挂在这儿的目的是想展示一下孩子们解决这个问题的方法是多么千差万别。

example.ex: These scissors are awfully heavy.
example.tran: 这把剪刀重得要命。

collins.tran: 这些(用于指代认为谈话对象了解具体所指的事物，或确认双方所想的是相同的人或物)
collins.def: You use these when you refer to something which you expect the person you are talking to to know about, or when you are checking that you are both thinking of the same person or thing.

example.ex: You know these last few months when we've been expecting it to warm up a little bit?...
example.tran: 你知道最近这几个月我们一直盼望着天能暖和一点吧？

example.ex: You know these funny cigarettes I smoke?
example.tran: 你了解我抽的这些味道怪异的香烟吧？

collins.def: You use these in the expression these days to mean 'at the present time'.

example.ex: Living in Bootham these days can be depressing...
example.tran: 如今住在布萨姆会让人心情抑郁。

example.ex: Trying to make it as a single parent raising your children would be the main concern to me these days.
example.tran: 我现在最关心的事情就是作为一个单亲家长，努力把自己的孩子抚养长大。

collins.def: You use they to refer to a group of people, animals, or things.

example.ex: The two men were far more alike than they would ever admit...
example.tran: 那两个人也许不承认，可他们非常相像。

example.ex: People matter because of what they are, not what they have...
example.tran: 人之所以重要，不在于他们拥有什么，而在于他们是什么样的人。

collins.tran: (用以代替he or she，而不指明是男是女;有人认为这种用法不对)
collins.def: You use they instead of 'he or she' to refer to a person without saying whether that person is a man or a woman. Some people think this use is incorrect.

example.ex: The teacher is not responsible for the student's success or failure. They are only there to help the student learn...
example.tran: 教师对学生的成败并不负有责任，其职责只是帮助学生学习。

example.ex: I never saw anyone go in to buy. Whether they ever did I don't know.
example.tran: 我从未见过有人进去买东西。到底有没有人进去过，我不知道。

collins.tran: (用于 they say，they call it 等表达中表示泛指)他们
collins.def: You use they in expressions such as 'they say' or 'they call it' to refer to people in general when you are making general statements about what people say, think, or do.

example.ex: They say there's plenty of opportunities out there, you just have to look carefully and you'll find them...
example.tran: 他们说，那里机会多的是，你只要仔细找就能发现。

example.ex: In Australia I believe that they call it animal magnetism.
example.tran: 我相信，在澳大利亚，他们称之为动物磁性。

collins.tran: (不能、不必、不愿指明的)东西，事物，特征，事情
collins.def: You can use thing to refer to any object, feature, or event when you cannot, need not, or do not want to refer to it more precisely.

example.ex: 'What's that thing in the middle of the fountain?' — 'Some kind of statue, I guess.'...
example.tran: “喷泉中间的那个是什么东西？”——“估计是塑像什么的吧。”

example.ex: She was in the middle of clearing the breakfast things...
example.tran: 她正在忙着收拾早饭后的那一摊子。

collins.def: Thing is used in lists and descriptions to give examples or to increase the range of what you are referring to.

example.ex: These are genetic disorders that only affect males normally. They are things like muscular dystrophy and haemophilia...
example.tran: 这些遗传病通常只发生在男性身上，如肌肉萎缩、血友病等。

example.ex: The Earth is made mainly of iron and silicon and things like that...
example.tran: 地球主要由铁、硅等物质构成。

collins.tran: (用于形容词后，与其一起表示该形容词的意思)
collins.def: Thing is often used after an adjective, where it would also be possible just to use the adjective. For example, you can say it's a different thing instead of it's different .

example.ex: Of course, literacy isn't the same thing as intelligence...
example.tran: 当然，识字和智力是两码事。

example.ex: To be a parent is a terribly difficult thing...
example.tran: 为人父母真难啊。

collins.def: Thing is often used instead of the pronouns 'anything,' or 'everything' in order to emphasize what you are saying.

example.ex: It isn't going to solve a single thing...
example.tran: 这什么问题也解决不了。

example.ex: Don't you worry about a thing...
example.tran: 你什么也不必担心。

collins.tran: (尤用于否定句中，强调恶劣或困难)这种事，这种东西
collins.def: Thing is used in expressions such as such a thing or things like that, especially in negative statements, in order to emphasize the bad or difficult situation you are referring back to.

example.ex: I don't believe he would tell Leo such a thing...
example.tran: 我不信他会告诉利奥这种事。

example.ex: 'Are you accusing me of being a thief?' — 'I have done no such thing, Tony.'...
example.tran: “你在指责我是小偷吗？”——“我没有做过这种事，托尼。”

collins.tran: (尤指不太重要的)情况,形势,活动,想法
collins.def: You can use thing to refer in a vague way to a situation, activity, or idea, especially when you want to suggest that it is not very important.

example.ex: I'm a bit unsettled tonight. This war thing's upsetting me...
example.tran: 我今晚有点心神不定，这场争斗让我不安。

example.ex: These folks clearly take this ballroom thing very seriously.
example.tran: 这些家伙显然很拿舞厅这事当回事。

collins.def: You can use thing when you are referring to something that you are uncertain or vague about, after mentioning something that it resembles or could possibly be.

example.ex: She'd actually taken it home and she put it in this jar thing...
example.tran: 她确实把它拿回了家，放在了一个罐子模样的东西里。

example.ex: The captain of the submarine has got this periscope thing.
example.tran: 那个潜艇艇长有个类似于潜望镜之类的东西。

collins.tran: (用来表示将要提及重要事情或特别想要对方知道的情况)
collins.def: You often use thing to indicate to the person you are addressing that you are about to mention something important, or something that you particularly want them to know.

example.ex: One thing I am sure of was that she was scared...
example.tran: 有一点我能肯定，那就是她当时被吓到了。

example.ex: The first thing parents want to know is: will the baby survive?...
example.tran: 父母亲最想知道的是：孩子能活下来吗？

collins.tran: (常用于指代刚提及的事，表示强调或提供更多信息)
collins.def: Thing is often used to refer back to something that has just been mentioned, either to emphasize it or to give more information about it.

example.ex: Getting drunk is a thing all young men do...
example.tran: 喝醉酒这种情况小伙子都会有。

example.ex: I never wanted to be normal. It was not a thing I ever thought desirable...
example.tran: 我从来也没有想要正常过。那不是我想做的事。

collins.def: A thing is a physical object that is considered as having no life of its own.

example.ex: It's not a thing, Beauchamp. It's a human being!
example.tran: 比彻姆，那不是一件东西，是一个人！

collins.tran: 东西，玩意儿(表示蔑视或愤怒)
collins.def: Thing is used to refer to something, especially a physical object, when you want to express contempt or anger towards it.

example.ex: This thing's virtually useless...
example.tran: 这玩意儿简直一点用也没有。

example.ex: They're armed with sub-machine-guns or machine-pistols or whatever you call those things...
example.tran: 他们持有轻机枪或者冲锋枪，还是什么玩意儿的。

collins.tran: 家伙，东西（用以提及人或动物的某一特点，通常表示喜爱之情)
collins.def: You can call a person or an animal a particular thing when you want to mention a particular quality that they have and express your feelings towards them, usually affectionate feelings.

example.ex: You really are quite a clever little thing...
example.tran: 你真是个聪明的小家伙。

example.ex: Oh you lucky thing!
example.tran: 你这个走运的家伙！

collins.def: Your things are your clothes or possessions.

example.ex: Sara told him to take all his things and not to return...
example.tran: 萨拉叫他带着他的全部家当离开，再也别回来。

example.ex: Is there anything you'd  like to borrow, before your own things are unpacked?
example.tran: 你在打开行李之前还要借什么东西吗？

collins.def: Things can refer to the situation or life in general and the way it is changing or affecting you.

example.ex: Everyone agrees things are getting better...
example.tran: 大家都认为，情况正在好转。

example.ex: A change of ownership might improve things...
example.tran: 改变所有权也许能使情况改善。

collins.def: Things can refer to a particular aspect of life, such as the physical or spiritual aspect.

example.ex: ...a movement away from the things of this world to the things of the spirit...
example.tran: 出世超凡

example.ex: I think I'm more aware now of some spiritual things and I do believe in good and evil.
example.tran: 我觉得我现在更加注重精神生活，而且我真的相信善恶报应。

collins.tran: (难以言表的)可怕的事情，怪事，恐怖的事情
collins.def: You can refer to something that is too frightening, strange, or horrible to describe clearly as a thing .

example.ex: ...John W. Campbell, author of 'The Thing From Another World.'
example.tran: 约翰·W.坎贝尔，《外星来客》的作者

collins.def: If you say that something is the thing, you mean that it is fashionable or popular.

example.ex: I feel under pressure to go out and get drunk because it's the thing to do...
example.tran: 我感觉不得不出去喝他个一醉方休，因为流行这样。

example.ex: They were obviously of the opinion that his taste was not quite the thing.
example.tran: 他们显然认为他的品味已不太流行。

collins.def: In all things means in every situation and at all times.

example.ex: Sara wished Franklin to follow family tradition, in this as in all things.
example.tran: 萨拉希望富兰克林在这件事上和所有其他事情一样，能遵循家庭传统。

example.ex: ...the old rule of health, which prescribes moderation in all things.
example.tran: 提倡凡事适可而止的传统养生之道

collins.def: If you say that someone or something is trying to be all things to all men or to all people, you are criticizing them because they are trying to behave in a way that will please everyone, and this is impossible.

example.ex: I realised I had a big problem. I wanted to be all things to all people...
example.tran: 我意识到我有个大毛病，我总想不得罪任何人。

example.ex: The film tries to be all things to all men — comedy, romance, fantasy, and satire.
example.tran: 这部电影试图面面俱到——既是喜剧、爱情剧、梦幻剧，还想是讽刺剧。

collins.def: If, for example, you do the right thing or do the decent thing in a situation, you do something which is considered correct or socially acceptable in that situation.

example.ex: People want to do the right thing and buy 'green'...
example.tran: 人们想要做正确的事，于是购买“绿色”产品。

example.ex: Carrington did the honourable thing and resigned...
example.tran: 卡林顿作出了令人敬佩的举动，辞了职。

collins.def: If you say that something is the done thing, you mean it is the most socially acceptable way to behave.

example.ex: It was not the done thing. In those days the man was supposed to be the provider.
example.tran: 那不符合社会习俗。在那个年代，养家的应该是男人。

collins.tran: 第一件事/最后一件事;一大早/临睡前
collins.def: If you do something first thing, you do it at the beginning of the day, before you do anything else. If you do it last thing, you do it at the end of the day, before you go to bed or go to sleep.

example.ex: I'll go see her, first thing...
example.tran: 我一早就去看她。

example.ex: Take the money to your office without fail, first thing in the morning...
example.tran: 早上第一件事是一定要把钱拿到办公室去。

collins.tran: 对…很反感;对…有特别的感觉
collins.def: If you have a thing about someone or something, you have very strong feelings about them.

example.ex: I had always had a thing about red hair...
example.tran: 我一直很讨厌红头发。

example.ex: He's got this thing about ties.
example.tran: 他对领带很在意。

collins.tran: 最好…，…较好(用来提出建议或评论)
collins.def: You say it is a good thing to do something to introduce a piece of advice or a comment on a situation or activity.

example.ex: Can you tell me whether it is a good thing to prune an apple tree?...
example.tran: 你能否告诉我该不该修剪苹果树？

example.ex: In a new democracy, it is no bad thing to master the art of compromise...
example.tran: 在新的民主国家，掌握妥协这门艺术不是件坏事。

collins.tran: 大肆渲染;小题大做;把事情闹大
collins.def: If you make a thing of something or make a thing about it, you talk about it or do it in an exaggerated way, so that it seems much more important than it really is.

example.ex: Gossips made a big thing about him going on shopping trips with her...
example.tran: 风言风语把他和她出去购物这件事闹得沸沸扬扬。

example.ex: I took his hand to make a big thing of introducing him to my mother...
example.tran: 我拉着他的手，郑重其事地把他介绍给了我母亲。

collins.tran: (用于对比两种想法、行动、局势，强调第二种更困难、重要或极端)…是一回事
collins.def: You can say that the first of two ideas, actions, or situations is one thing when you want to contrast it with a second idea, action, or situation and emphasize that the second one is much more difficult, important, or extreme.

example.ex: It was one thing to talk about leaving; it was another to physically walk out the door...
example.tran: 说走容易，真要抬腿跨出门可就难了。

example.ex: Borrowing $100,000 is one thing. Owing $425,000 is another!
example.tran: 借 10 万美元事儿小，欠 42.5 万美元这事可就大了。

collins.def: You can say for one thing when you are explaining a statement or answering a question, to suggest that you are not giving the whole explanation or answer, and that there are other points that you could add to it.

example.ex: She was a monster. For one thing, she really enjoyed cruelty...
example.tran: 她是个恶魔。一方面，她确实以残忍为乐。

example.ex: She was unable to sell it, because for one thing its size was awkward...
example.tran: 她卖不掉它，一来是由于尺寸用起来不方便。

collins.def: You can use the expression 'one thing and another' to suggest that there are several reasons for something or several items on a list, but you are not going to explain or mention them all.

example.ex: What with one thing and another, it was fairly late in the day when we returned to Shrewsbury...
example.tran: 忙完这个又忙那个，等到我们回到什鲁斯伯里的时候，天色已经很晚了。

example.ex: Everybody came in with their Christmas order for beer and spirits and port and one thing and another.
example.tran: 每位来客都要为圣诞节订购啤酒、烈酒、波尔图葡萄酒等这样那样的酒。

collins.tran: 没办法解释的事;赶巧发生
collins.def: If you say it is just one of those things you mean that you cannot explain something because it seems to happen by chance.

example.ex: 'I wonder why.' Mr. Dambar shrugged. 'It must be just one of those things, I guess.'
example.tran: “我也不知道为啥，”丹巴先生耸了耸肩，“我想可能是赶巧了吧。”

example.ex: It was simply one of those things, pure coincidence.
example.tran: 这是没办法的事，纯属巧合。

collins.def: You say one thing led to another when you are explaining how something happened, but you do not really want to give the details or you think people will be able to imagine the details.

example.ex: He came by on Saturday to see if she was lonely. One thing led to another and he stayed the night.
example.tran: 他星期六过来看看她是不是感到孤独。自然而然地，他就留下来过夜了。

collins.def: If you do your own thing, you live, act, or behave in the way you want to, without paying attention to convention or depending on other people.

example.ex: We accept the right of all men and women to do their own thing, however bizarre...
example.tran: 我们承认所有人——无论男女——都有权以自己的方式去生活，不管其方式有多么怪异离奇。

example.ex: She was allowed to do her own thing as long as she kept in touch by phone.
example.tran: 只要她保持电话联系，她就可以随心所欲地生活。

collins.tran: 不复存在的事物;过去的东西
collins.def: If something is a thing of the past, it no longer exists or happens, or is being replaced by something new.

example.ex: Painful typhoid injections are a thing of the past, thanks to the introduction of an oral vaccine...
example.tran: 自从发明了口服疫苗后，令人痛苦的伤寒疫苗注射就成为了过去。

example.ex: Cheap computers, faxes and phone calls will make commuting to work a thing of the past.
example.tran: 廉价的电脑、传真和电话通信将使每天坐车上下班成为历史。

collins.def: If you say that someone is seeing or hearing things, you mean that they believe they are seeing or hearing something that is not really there.

example.ex: Dr Payne led Lana back into the examination room and told her she was seeing things...
example.tran: 佩恩大夫把拉娜领回检查室，告诉她她有幻视。

example.ex: I thought I was hearing things yesterday. I thought I heard a cuckoo.
example.tran: 我想昨天我出现幻听了。我以为听到了布谷鸟叫。

collins.tran: 没有这回事;不可能的事
collins.def: You can say there is no such thing as something to emphasize that it does not exist or is not possible.

example.ex: There really is no such thing as a totally risk-free industry...
example.tran: 完全没有风险的行业是不存在的。

example.ex: 'I found a mermaid.' — 'Don't  be daft. There's no such thing.'
example.tran: “我发现了一条美人鱼。”——“别说傻话了。哪有那种东西。”

collins.def: You say the thing is to introduce an explanation, comment, or opinion, that relates to something that has just been said. The thing is is often used to identify a problem relating to what has just been said.

example.ex: 'What does your market research consist of?' — 'Well, the thing is, it depends on our target age group.'...
example.tran: “你的市场调查有哪些内容？”“嗯，这个嘛，要视我们的目标年龄群体而定。”

example.ex: I'm getting a grant for a speech therapy course. But the thing is, I don't know whether I want to do it any more.
example.tran: 我要弄到开设言语治疗课程的经费了。但问题是，我不知道自己是否还想做下去。

collins.tran: 正是所要的;正是所需的
collins.def: If you say that something is just the thing or is the very thing, you are emphasizing that it is exactly what is wanted or needed.

example.ex: Kiwi fruit are just the thing for a healthy snack...
example.tran: 猕猴桃正是健康的小点心。

example.ex: I know the very thing to cheer you up.
example.tran: 我知道什么能让你提起精神。

collins.def: If you say that a person knows a thing or two about something or could teach someone a thing or two about it, you mean that they know a lot about it or are good at it.

example.ex: Patricia Hewitt knows a thing or two about how to be well-organised...
example.tran: 帕特里夏·休伊特很了解如何做到有条不紊。

example.ex: They do agree Africa could teach America a thing or two about family values...
example.tran: 他们一致认为，在家庭价值方面，非洲可以教给美洲很多。

collins.def: If you think that something is the case, you have the opinion that it is the case.

example.ex: I certainly think there should be a ban on tobacco advertising...
example.tran: 我确实认为应该禁止香烟广告。

example.ex: Do you think I ought to seal the boxes up?...
example.tran: 你认为我应该把这些盒子封起来吗？

collins.def: If you say that you think that something is true or will happen, you mean that you have the impression that it is true or will happen, although you are not certain of the facts.

example.ex: Nora thought he was seventeen years old...
example.tran: 诺拉觉得他有 17 岁。

example.ex: Do you think she was embarrassed about it?...
example.tran: 你觉得她曾为此而难为情吗？

collins.def: If you think in a particular way, you have those general opinions or attitudes.

example.ex: You were probably brought up to think like that...
example.tran: 你可能从小就被教育那样考虑问题。

example.ex: He can keep matters under control by silencing the demonstrators and others who think like them...
example.tran: 他可以通过压制示威者和与他们观点相同的人来控制住事态。

collins.def: When you think about ideas or problems, you make a mental effort to consider them.

example.ex: She closed her eyes for a moment, trying to think...
example.tran: 她闭了一会儿眼睛，努力思考着。

example.ex: I have often thought about this problem...
example.tran: 我常考虑这个问题。

collins.def: If you think in a particular way, you consider things, solve problems, or make decisions in this way, for example because of your job or your background.

example.ex: To make the computer work at full capacity, the programmer has to think like the machine...
example.tran: 为了让计算机充分发挥作用，程序员就得像计算机一样思考。

example.ex: I meet many businessmen, and I see they think in terms of the overall picture...
example.tran: 我认识许多商人，我发觉他们考虑问题都是从全局出发的。

collins.def: If you think of something, it comes into your mind or you remember it.

example.ex: Nobody could think of anything to say...
example.tran: 谁也想不出什么话说。

example.ex: I can't think of any reason why he should do that...
example.tran: 我想不出来他为什么非要那样做。

collins.def: If you think of an idea, you make a mental effort and use your imagination and intelligence to create it or develop it.

example.ex: He thought of another way of getting out of the marriage...
example.tran: 他又想到一个摆脱那桩婚姻的点子。

example.ex: I don't know why I never thought of that.
example.tran: 我怎么就从未想到过那一点。

collins.def: If you are thinking something at a particular moment, you have words or ideas in your mind without saying them out loud.

example.ex: She must be ill, Tatiana thought...
example.tran: 她一定是病了，塔蒂亚娜心想。

example.ex: I remember thinking how lovely he looked...
example.tran: 我记得曾经在心里暗想他的样子多么可爱。

collins.tran: 认为，以为(人或物具有某特点或用途)
collins.def: If you think of someone or something as having a particular quality or purpose, you regard them as having this quality or purpose.

example.ex: We all thought of him as a father...
example.tran: 我们都视他为父亲。

example.ex: He thinks of it as his home...
example.tran: 他将那儿当作自己的家。

collins.def: If you think a lot of someone or something, you admire them very much or think they are very good.

example.ex: To tell the truth, I don't think much of psychiatrists...
example.tran: 说实话，我不太喜欢精神科医生。

example.ex: The Director thought a good deal of him...
example.tran: 主任对他评价很高。

collins.def: If you think of someone, you show consideration for them and pay attention to their needs.

example.ex: I'm only thinking of you...
example.tran: 我一心只为你着想。

example.ex: You never think of anyone but yourself...
example.tran: 你从来不考虑别人，就只顾你自己。

collins.def: If you are thinking of taking a particular course of action, you are considering it as a possible course of action.

example.ex: Martin was thinking of taking legal action against Zuckerman...
example.tran: 马丁在考虑对朱克曼提起诉讼。

example.ex: Have you ever thought of marrying?...
example.tran: 你有没有想过结婚？

collins.tran: (用来引出例子或进一步解释)考虑,想到(某方面、某主题)
collins.def: You can say that you are thinking of a particular aspect or subject, in order to introduce an example or explain more exactly what you are talking about.

example.ex: I'm primarily thinking of the first year...
example.tran: 我考虑的主要是第一年。

example.ex: There is a theme of tragedy that runs through it: I'm thinking in particular of the story of Tom Howard.
example.tran: 贯穿始终的是一个悲剧主题，特别是汤姆·霍华德的故事。

collins.tran: (用于问句，表示生气、震惊)认为，以为
collins.def: You use think in questions where you are expressing your anger or shock at someone's behaviour.

example.ex: Who does she think she is? Trying to make a fool of me like that...
example.tran: 她以为她是谁啊？竟敢那样取笑我。

example.ex: You can't do this! What do you think you're doing?...
example.tran: 你不能这样做！你以为自己在干些什么？

collins.tran: 想来，想想看(用于评论过去所做或经历过的事情现在看来不可思议、愚蠢或令人震惊)
collins.def: You use think when you are commenting on something which you did or experienced in the past and which now seems surprising, foolish, or shocking to you.

example.ex: To think I left you alone in a place with a madman at large!...
example.tran: 想想看，我竟然把你一个人抛在那儿，让你和一个无人看管的疯子呆在一起！

example.ex: When I think of how you've behaved and the trouble you've got into!
example.tran: 现在想想看，你都做了些什么，闯了多少祸！

collins.tran: 本来以为，原以为(用于批评别人该做某事而未做)
collins.def: You can use think in expressions such as you would think or I would have thought when you are criticizing someone because they ought to or could be expected to do something, but have not done it.

example.ex: You'd think you'd remember to wash your ears...
example.tran: 还以为你能记得洗耳朵呢。

example.ex: We would have thought he would have a more responsible attitude...
example.tran: 我们本以为他会采取更负责的态度。

collins.tran: 谁都会以为/你会认为(用于对他人的行为表示惊讶或不满)
collins.def: You can use think in expressions such as anyone would think and you would think to express your surprise or disapproval at the way someone is behaving.

example.ex: Anyone would think you were in love with the girl...
example.tran: 谁都会以为你和那个姑娘恋爱了。

example.ex: You'd think you had never seen a door before!
example.tran: 就好像你以前连门都见过一样！

collins.tran: (表示突然记起或意识到某事)想起来了，想想看
collins.def: You use expressions such as come to think of it ,when you think about it, or thinking about it, when you mention something that you have suddenly remembered or realized.

example.ex: He was her distant relative, as was everyone else on the island, come to think of it...
example.tran: 想起来了，他和岛上的其他人一样，都是她的远亲。

example.ex: When you think about it, he's probably right.
example.tran: 现在想想看，他很可能是对的。

collins.tran: 我想，我觉得(用于委婉地解释等)
collins.def: You use 'I think' as a way of being polite when you are explaining or suggesting to someone what you want to do, or when you are accepting or refusing an offer.

example.ex: I think I'll go home and have a shower...
example.tran: 我觉得我得回家冲个澡。

example.ex: We need a job, and I thought we could go around and ask if people need odd jobs done...
example.tran: 我们需要工作，我看我们可以四处打听打听，看有没有零活可做。

collins.tran: 我认为，我想(用于会话或讲话中，使语气稍显婉转)
collins.def: You use 'I think' in conversations or speeches to make your statements and opinions sound less forceful, rude, or direct.

example.ex: I think he means 'at' rather than 'to'...
example.tran: 我想，他是想说at，而不是to。

example.ex: Thanks, but I think I can handle it...
example.tran: 谢谢，不过我想我自己能应付。

collins.tran: 你想一想，想象一下(表示激动、着迷或震惊，同时希望谈话对方也有同感)
collins.def: You say just think when you feel excited, fascinated, or shocked by something, and you want the person to whom you are talking to feel the same.

example.ex: Just think; tomorrow we shall walk out of this place and leave it all behind us forever...
example.tran: 你想想看，明天我们就要走出这个地方，再也不回来了。

example.ex: Just think how snug and cosy we could be.
example.tran: 想象一下，我们可以多么温暖舒适呀。

collins.tran: 重新考虑，再三斟酌(常指最终改变主意)
collins.def: If you think again about an action or decision, you consider it very carefully, often with the result that you change your mind and decide to do things differently.

example.ex: It has forced politicians to think again about the wisdom of trying to evacuate refugees...
example.tran: 这迫使政治家们重新考虑疏散难民是否明智。

example.ex: He intends to ask the court to think again.
example.tran: 他打算请求法庭再重新审度。

collins.tran: 认为…没什么了不起;觉得…很容易;认为…无所谓
collins.def: If you think nothing of doing something that other people might consider difficult, strange, or wrong, you consider it to be easy or normal, and you do it often or would be quite willing to do it.

example.ex: I thought nothing of betting £1,000 on a horse.
example.tran: 我认为把 1,000 英镑押在一匹马身上没什么了不起。

collins.tran: 对…不在意;不觉得…奇怪(或重要)
collins.def: If something happens and you think nothing of it, you do not pay much attention to it or think of it as strange or important, although later you realize that it is.

example.ex: When she went off to see her parents for the weekend I thought nothing of it...
example.tran: 她周末去看她的父母，我当时没觉得有什么特别的。

example.ex: One of Tony's friends, David, kept coming to my house but I didn't think anything of it.
example.tran: 托尼的朋友戴维经常来我家，不过我当时并没多想。

collins.def: Thirteen is the number 13.
Thirty is the number 30.

collins.tran: 三十多，三十几(指 30 至 39 之间的数字)
collins.def: When you talk about the thirties, you are referring to numbers between 30 and 39. For example, if you are in your thirties, you are aged between 30 and 39. If the temperature is in the thirties, the temperature is between 30 and 39 degrees.

example.ex: Mozart clearly enjoyed good health throughout his twenties and early thirties.
