example.tran: 显然，莫扎特在二十几岁到三十刚出头时，身体非常好。

collins.tran: 三十年代(指 1930 年至 1939 年)
collins.def: The thirties is the decade between 1930 and 1939.

example.ex: She became quite a notable director in the thirties and forties.
example.tran: 她在三四十年代成了一位名导演。

collins.tran: (指代先前提及的人或物)这，这个
collins.def: You use this to refer back to a particular person or thing that has been mentioned or implied.

example.ex: When food comes out of any oven, it should stand a while. During this delay the centre carries on cooking...
example.tran: 食物出炉后都应该静置一会。在此期间，中心部分还在继续加热。

example.ex: On 1 October the US suspended a proposed $574 million aid package for 1991. Of this amount, $250 million is for military purchases.
example.tran: 10 月 1 号，美国暂停了拟议中的一项 1991 年度总计 5.74 亿美元的一揽子援助方案，这其中有 2.5 亿美元是用于军事采购的。

collins.tran: (引出将要谈论的人或物)下面(这个)，以下
collins.def: You use this to introduce someone or something that you are going to talk about.

example.ex: This is what I will do. I will telephone Anna and explain.
example.tran: 下面是我要做的：我要给安娜打电话解释清楚。

collins.tran: 这一点(指前一句或几句话中提到的观点或情况)
collins.def: You use this to refer back to an idea or situation expressed in a previous sentence or sentences.

example.ex: You feel that it's uneconomic to insist that people work together in groups. Why is this?...
example.tran: 你觉得要求大家分组工作不划算，这是为什么呢？

example.ex: A job is pretty much nine-to-five. Is this what you feel would make you happy?
example.tran: 工作时间多数是朝九晚五，你觉得这样会让你感觉愉快吗？

collins.tran: (叙述时引出新出现的人或物)这个，一个
collins.def: In spoken English, people use this to introduce a person or thing into a story.

example.ex: I came here by chance and was just watching what was going on, when this girl attacked me...
example.tran: 我碰巧来到这儿，正看着热闹，突然一个女孩袭击了我。

example.ex: So I just walked up the steps into this big, beautiful church.
example.tran: 于是我就拾级而上，走进了这座漂亮的大教堂。

collins.tran: 这个，这位(尤指所触碰或指向的离自己较近的人或物，有两个以上时，用于指最近的一个)
collins.def: You use this to refer to a person or thing that is near you, especially when you touch them or point to them. When there are two or more people or things near you, this refers to the nearest one.

example.ex: 'If you'd prefer something else I'll gladly have it changed for you.' — 'No, this is great.'...
example.tran: “您要是喜欢别的，我很乐意帮您调换一下。”——“不用了，这个挺好。”

example.ex: 'Is this what you were looking for?' Bradley produced the handkerchief...
example.tran: “你刚才找的是不是这个？”布拉德利掏出那块手绢。

collins.tran: 这个，这(指代正在发生或刚刚发生的与自己有关的一般情况、活动或事件)
collins.def: You use this when you refer to a general situation, activity, or event which is happening or has just happened and which you feel involved in.

example.ex: I thought, this is why I've travelled thousands of miles...
example.tran: 我想，这就是我为何不远千里赶来的原因。

example.ex: Tim, this is awful. I know what you must think, but it's not so...
example.tran: 蒂姆，这可糟了。我知道你心里在想什么，但实际情况不是这样的。

collins.tran: 这，该，此(指当前所处地点或时间)
collins.def: You use this when you refer to the place you are in now or to the present time.

example.ex: We've stopped transporting weapons to this country by train...
example.tran: 我们已停止用火车向该国运送武器。

example.ex: This place is run like a hotel ought to be run...
example.tran: 这个地方的经营方式就是旅馆应该有的样子。

collins.tran: 本，今，这个，下一个(指接下来将要发生某事的特定时间)
collins.def: You use this to refer to the next occurrence in the future of a particular day, month, season, or festival.

example.ex: ...this Sunday's 7.45 performance...
example.tran: 本周日 7 点 45 分的表演

example.ex: We're getting married this June...
example.tran: 我们准备今年 6 月结婚。

collins.tran: 这么，这样(用于用手比划大小、形状时)
collins.def: You use this when you are indicating the size or shape of something with your hands.

example.ex: They'd said the wound was only about this big you see and he showed me with his fingers.
example.tran: 他们说伤口只有这么一点大，他还用手指比划给我看。

collins.tran: 这么，这样(用于说明自己知道或能告知的内容)
collins.def: You use this when you are going to specify how much you know or how much you can tell someone.

example.ex: I am not going to reveal what my seven-year plan is, but I will tell you this much, if it works out, the next seven years will be very interesting.
example.tran: 我不想透露我的七年计划的具体内容，不过有一点可以告诉你，如果顺利实施，今后的七年将非常有意义。

collins.def: If you say this is it, you are agreeing with what someone else has just said.

example.ex: 'You know, people conveniently forget the things they say.' — 'Well this is it.'
example.tran: “你知道，人们会选择性地忘记自己说过的话。”——“嗯，是这样。”

collins.tran: (用于电话、广播或电视中，表明身份或所代表的机构)我是，这里是
collins.def: You use this in order to say who you are or what organization you are representing, when you are speaking on the telephone, radio, or television.

example.ex: Hello, this is John Thompson...
example.tran: 喂，我是约翰·汤普森。

example.ex: 'Hello, is this Raymond Brown?' — 'Yeah, who's this?'...
example.tran: “喂，是雷蒙德·布朗吗？”——“对，您是哪位？”

collins.tran: 这个(指说话、写作时的媒介)
collins.def: You use this to refer to the medium of communication that you are using at the time of speaking or writing.

example.ex: What I'm going to do in this lecture is focus on something very specific...
example.tran: 我在今天的讲座中将主要探讨一些非常具体的问题。

example.ex: What a book can do, and what this one will try to accomplish, is to present examples of how life can be made more enjoyable...
example.tran: 一本书能做到的，也是本书努力实现的，就是列举一些例子说明如何让生活变得更加愉快。

collins.tran: 各种各样的东西;这样那样
collins.def: If you say that you are doing or talking about this and that, or this, that, and the other you mean that you are doing or talking about a variety of things that you do not want to specify.

example.ex: 'And what are you doing now?' — 'Oh this and that.'
example.tran: “那你现在在做什么呢？”——“哦，瞎忙。”

example.ex: I want to make a point about all these charges going up, water rates and all this that and the other.
example.tran: 我想就水费及其他各种各样费用的上涨谈谈看法。

means: 那，那个( that的名词复数)
（指已提到过或已知的人或事物）那

collins.tran: (指代已经提及的人或物)那些
collins.def: You use those to refer to people or things which have already been mentioned.

example.ex: Theoretically he had control over more than $400 million in US accounts. But, in fact, it was the US Treasury and State Department who controlled those accounts...
example.tran: 从理论上说，他掌管着美国账户里的 4 亿美元。然而，事实上，是美国财政部和国务院在掌控那些账户。

example.ex: They have the aircraft capable of doing significant damage, because most of those aircraft are capable of launching anti-ship missiles.
example.tran: 他们拥有具有强大杀伤力的飞机，因为那些飞机多数都能发射反舰导弹。

collins.tran: 那些(尤用于指示或指向在时间、空间上离自己稍远的人或物)
collins.def: You use those when you are referring to people or things that are a distance away from you in position or time, especially when you indicate or point to them.

example.ex: What are those buildings?...
example.tran: 那些是什么建筑？

example.ex: Oh, those books! I meant to put them away before this afternoon.
example.tran: 哦，那些书！我本来要在下午之前收起来的。

collins.def: You use those to refer to someone or something when you are going to give details or information about them.

example.ex: Those people who took up weapons to defend themselves are political prisoners...
example.tran: 那些拿起武器自卫的人是些政治犯。

example.ex: The point of home bread-making is to avoid those additives used in much commercial baking.
example.tran: 自制面包就是为了避免吃到许多面包店使用的添加剂。

collins.tran: (用来对已经提及的事物作补充说明)
collins.def: You use those to introduce more information about something already mentioned, instead of repeating the noun which refers to it.

example.ex: The interests he is most likely to enjoy will be those which enable him to show off himself or his talents...
example.tran: 他最有可能感兴趣的就是那些能让他表现自己或炫耀才华的事情。

example.ex: The cells of the body, especially those of the brain, can live only minutes without circulating blood.
example.tran: 如果血液不循环，肌体细胞，尤其是脑细胞，只能存活几分钟。

collins.def: You use those to mean 'people'.

example.ex: A little selfish behaviour is unlikely to cause real damage to those around us...
example.tran: 稍许自私的行为不会对我们身边的人造成实质性伤害。

example.ex: A number of leading opposition figures were said to be among those arrested.
example.tran: 据说，许多反对派的重要人物也在被捕者之列。

collins.tran: (用于认为谈话对象知道所谈事物或确认双方所想为相同的人或事物时)
collins.def: You use those when you refer to things that you expect the person you are talking to to know about or when you are checking that you are both thinking of the same people or things.

example.ex: He did buy me those daffodils a week or so ago...
example.tran: 他确实在大约一个星期前给我买了那些水仙花。

example.ex: I have been putting pressure onto the Cleansing Services to replace those dustbin lids...
example.tran: 我一直在给保洁部门施加压力，要求他们更换那些垃圾箱的盖子。

collins.def: You use though to introduce a statement in a subordinate clause which contrasts with the statement in the main clause. You often use though to introduce a fact which you regard as less important than the fact in the main clause.

example.ex: Gaelic has been a dying language for many years, though children are nowadays taught it in school...
example.tran: 盖尔语多年来一直濒于消亡，尽管如今孩子们还在学校学习这门语言。

example.ex: After news of this new court case Ford broke down again, though he blamed the breakdown on his work...
example.tran: 福特听到这一场新官司的消息后再次精神崩溃，尽管他说自己是因为工作才这样的。

collins.def: You use though to introduce a subordinate clause which gives some information that is relevant to the main clause and weakens the force of what it is saying.

example.ex: I look back on it as the bloodiest (though not literally) winter of the war...
example.tran: 我现在回想起来，觉得那是战时最血腥的(但并非字面意义上的)一个冬天。

example.ex: The problem was finally, though not conclusively, identified as a severely pinched nerve...
example.tran: 问题终于被认定为是神经受到严重挤压，尽管这还不是最终结论。

collins.def: You use though to indicate that the information in a clause contrasts with or modifies information given in a previous sentence or sentences.

example.ex: I like him. Though he makes me angry sometimes...
example.tran: 我喜欢他，不过他有时惹我生气。

example.ex: I want to try my hand at politics, or go back to the law. I don't want to go to school for it, though...
example.tran: 我想进入政坛，或者重操律师旧业。不过我不想进学校去专门学习。

collins.def: You can say though I say so myself or even though I say it myself when you are praising yourself or something you have done, but do not want to sound too proud.

example.ex: I'm a good cook, though I say it myself...
example.tran: 我并非自夸，我的厨艺的确高超。

example.ex: Even though I do say it myself we've probably got the best little restaurant in town.
example.tran: 不是我吹牛，我们的小饭店可能是全城最好的。

means: 想( think的过去式和过去分词)

collins.def: Thought is the past tense and past participle of think .
A thought is an idea that you have in your mind.

example.ex: The thought of Nick made her throat tighten...
example.tran: 一想到尼克，她的喉咙就发紧。

example.ex: I tormented myself with the thought that life was just too comfortable...
example.tran: 一想到生活太过舒适了，我内心就很痛苦。

collins.def: A person's thoughts are their mind, or all the ideas in their mind when they are concentrating on one particular thing.

example.ex: I jumped to my feet so my thoughts wouldn't start to wander...
example.tran: 我跳起来，免得走神。

example.ex: Usually at this time our thoughts are on Christmas...
example.tran: 通常在这种时候，我们的心思全放在了圣诞节上。

collins.def: A person's thoughts are their opinions on a particular subject.

example.ex: Many of you have written to us to express your thoughts on the conflict...
example.tran: 你们中有许多人给我们来信，表达对冲突的看法。

example.ex: Mr Goodman, do you have any thoughts on that?
example.tran: 古德曼先生，那个问题你怎么看？

collins.def: Thought is the activity of thinking, especially deeply, carefully, or logically.

example.ex: Alice had been so deep in thought that she had walked past her car without even seeing it...
example.tran: 艾丽斯考虑问题入了神，连走过自己的车都没看见。

example.ex: He had given some thought to what she had told him...
example.tran: 他认真考虑了她对他说过的话。

collins.def: A thought is an intention, hope, or reason for doing something.

example.ex: Sarah's first thought was to run back and get Max...
example.tran: 萨拉首先想到的就是跑回去把马克斯叫来。

example.ex: They had no thought of surrender...
example.tran: 他们没有想过要投降。

collins.tran: 关心，善意，帮助(尤用于感谢或表达钦佩之情)
collins.def: A thought is an act of kindness or an offer of help; used especially when you are thanking someone, or expressing admiration of someone.

example.ex: 'Would you like to move into the ward?' — 'A kind thought, but no, thank you.'
example.tran: “你想不想挪到病房里来？”——“哦，您太好心了，不用了，谢谢。”

example.ex: 'She has given them this seven hundred pounds.' — 'What a lovely thought.'
example.tran: “她给了他们这 700 英镑。”——“太慷慨了。”

collins.tran: (宗教、哲学、科学、政党等的)思想体系，观念体系
collins.def: Thought is the group of ideas and beliefs which belongs, for example, to a particular religion, philosophy, science, or political party.

example.ex: Aristotle's scientific theories dominated Western thought for fifteen hundred years...
example.tran: 亚里士多德的科学理论统治了西方思想达 1,500 年。

example.ex: This school of thought argues that depression is best treated by drugs.
example.tran: 这一学派主张抑郁症最好用药物治疗。

collins.def: A thousand or one thousand is the number 1,000.

example.ex: ...five thousand acres...
Visitors can expect to pay about a thousand pounds a day.
example.tran: 游客每天大概要支付 1,000 英镑。

collins.def: If you refer to thousands of things or people, you are emphasizing that there are very many of them.

example.ex: Thousands of refugees are packed into overcrowded towns and villages...
example.tran: 成千上万的难民涌入拥挤不堪的城镇和村庄。

example.ex: I must have driven past that place thousands of times.
example.tran: 我得有上千次开车经过那里。

collins.def: Three is the number 3.

example.ex: We waited three months before going back to see the specialist.
example.tran: 我们等了 3 个月才回去见那位专家。

collins.tran: 穿过,通过(洞、口子、管道等);从…的一端到另一端
collins.def: To move through something such as a hole, opening, or pipe means to move directly from one side or end of it to the other.

example.ex: The theatre was evacuated when rain poured through the roof at the Liverpool Playhouse...
example.tran: 雨从利物浦剧院的屋顶倾泻而入，剧院的观众被疏散了。

example.ex: Go straight through that door under the EXIT sign...
example.tran: 从“安全出口”标志下的那道门直穿过去。

collins.def: To cut through something means to cut it in two pieces or to make a hole in it.

example.ex: Use a proper fish knife and fork if possible as they are designed to cut through the flesh but not the bones...
example.tran: 如果可能的话，选用正规的吃鱼刀叉，因为它们是专门设计来切开鱼肉而又不会切断鱼骨的。

example.ex: Rabbits still manage to find a way in. I am sure that some have even taken to gnawing through the metal.
example.tran: 兔子还是找到办法进去了。我敢断定，有些兔子甚至已经用上了咬断金属的办法。

collins.tran: 穿过，通过(城市、地区、国家);遍及
collins.def: To go through a town, area, or country means to travel across it or in it.

example.ex: Go up to Ramsgate, cross into France, go through Andorra and into Spain.
example.tran: 北行至拉姆斯盖特，然后横跨法国，穿过安多拉，进入西班牙。

example.ex: ...travelling through pathless woods...
example.tran: 在人迹罕至的树林中穿行

collins.def: If you move through a group of things or a mass of something, it is on either side of you or all around you.

example.ex: We made our way through the crowd to the river...
example.tran: 我们挤过人群，来到河边。

example.ex: Sybil's fingers ran through the water...
example.tran: 西比尔的手指在水中划来划去。

collins.def: To get through a barrier or obstacle means to get from one side of it to the other.

example.ex: Allow twenty-five minutes to get through Passport Control and Customs...
example.tran: 留出 25 分钟过护照检查处和海关。

example.ex: He was one of the last of the crowd to pass through the barrier...
example.tran: 他是那群人里最后一批跨越障碍的。

collins.def: If a driver goes through a red light, they keep driving even though they should stop.

example.ex: He was killed at a road junction by a van driver who went through a red light...
example.tran: 他在交叉路口被一辆闯红灯的小货车撞死了。

example.ex: We drove through red traffic lights, the horn blaring.
example.tran: 我们鸣着喇叭，闯过红灯。

collins.def: If something goes into an object and comes out of the other side, you can say that it passes through the object.

example.ex: The ends of the net pass through a wooden bar at each end...
example.tran: 网的两端各穿过一根木棒。

example.ex: Zita was herself unconventional, keeping a safety-pin stuck through her ear lobe.
example.tran: 齐塔自己就不守传统，在一只耳垂上穿了一根别针。

collins.def: To go through a system means to move around it or to pass from one end of it to the other.

example.ex: ...electric currents travelling through copper wires...
example.tran: 通过铜导线的电流

example.ex: What a lot of cards you've got through the post!
example.tran: 你们收到了多少寄来的贺卡啊！

collins.def: If you see, hear, or feel something through a particular thing, that thing is between you and the thing you can see, hear, or feel.

example.ex: Alice gazed pensively through the wet glass...
example.tran: 艾丽斯透过湿漉漉的玻璃神情忧郁地凝视着窗外。

example.ex: They could hear music pulsing through the walls of the house...
example.tran: 透过墙壁，他们能听到有节奏的音乐声。

collins.tran: (感觉、态度、品质)遍布，遍及，贯穿
collins.def: If something such as a feeling, attitude, or quality, happens through an area, organization, or a person's body, it happens everywhere in it or affects all of it.

example.ex: An atmosphere of anticipation vibrated through the crowd...
example.tran: 期待的心情在人群中弥漫开来。

example.ex: The melody that ran through his brain was composed of bad notes...
example.tran: 回荡在他脑海里的旋律都走调了。

collins.def: If something happens or exists through a period of time, it happens or exists from the beginning until the end.

example.ex: We're playing in New Zealand, Australia and Japan through November...
example.tran: 整个 11 月，我们都在新西兰、澳大利亚和日本巡回演出。

example.ex: Saga features trips for older people at home and abroad all through the year...
example.tran: “传奇”旅行社为老年人提供全年的国内外旅游服务。

collins.def: If something happens from a particular period of time through another, it starts at the first period and continues until the end of the second period.

example.ex: ...open Monday through Sunday from 7:00 am to 10:00 pm...
example.tran: 开放时间：周一到周日，每天早晨 7: 00 到晚上 10: 00

example.ex: During her busy season (March through June), she often completes as many as fifty paintings a week.
example.tran: 她忙的时候(从 3 月一直到 6 月)，常常一个星期完成多达 50 幅画作。

collins.def: If you go through a particular experience or event, you experience it, and if you behave in a particular way through it, you behave in that way while it is happening.

example.ex: Men go through a change of life emotionally just like women.
example.tran: 男人和女人一样，也要在情绪上经历更年期。

example.ex: ...a humorous woman who had lived through two world wars in Paris...
example.tran: 在巴黎经历过两次世界大战的幽默女人

collins.tran: 完成的;结束的;(与…)关系了结的
collins.def: If you are through with something or if it is through, you have finished doing it and will never do it again. If you are through with someone, you do not want to have anything to do with them again.

example.ex: I'm through with the explaining...
example.tran: 我不想再解释了。

example.ex: Training as a marriage counsellor would guarantee her some employment once her schooling was through...
example.tran: 她接受的婚姻指导师培训能保证她学业一结束就找到工作。

collins.def: You use through in expressions such as half-way through and all the way through to indicate to what extent an action or task is completed.

example.ex: A thirty-nine-year-old competitor collapsed half-way through the marathon and died shortly afterwards.
example.tran: 一名 39 岁的马拉松参赛者跑到一半时瘫倒在地，没过多久就死了。

collins.def: If something happens because of something else, you can say that it happens through it.

example.ex: They are understood to have retired through age or ill health...
example.tran: 据知他们是因年龄或健康问题而退休。

example.ex: The thought of someone suffering through a mistake of mine makes me shiver.
example.tran: 想到有人因为我犯的错误而吃苦头，我就不寒而栗。

collins.def: You use through when stating the means by which a particular thing is achieved.

example.ex: Those who seek to grab power through violence deserve punishment...
example.tran: 企图通过暴力夺权的人理应受到惩罚。

example.ex: You simply can't get a ticket through official channels.
example.tran: 通过官方渠道是压根儿搞不到票的。

collins.def: If you do something through someone else, they take the necessary action for you.

example.ex: Do I need to go through my doctor or can I make an appointment direct?...
example.tran: 我必须经过我的医生呢，还是可以直接预约？

example.ex: Speaking through an interpreter, he called for some new thinking from the West.
example.tran: 他通过译员发出呼吁，希望西方能采取一些新的思维。

collins.tran: (提议、观点)获得通过，得到批准
collins.def: If something such as a proposal or idea goes through, it is accepted by people in authority and is made legal or official.

example.ex: It is possible that the present Governor General will be made interim President, if the proposals go through...
example.tran: 如果提案获得通过，现任总督可能被任命为临时总统。

example.ex: The secretary of state during the Nixon-Ford transition did not wish to push the proposals through.
example.tran: 尼克松-福特过渡时期的国务卿不希望推动那些提案得到通过。

collins.tran: 通过(考试);(在比赛中)胜出
collins.def: If someone gets through an examination or a round of a competition, they succeed or win.

example.ex: She was bright, learned languages quickly, and sailed through her exams...
example.tran: 她头脑聪明，学语言学得快，各门考试都顺利地通过。

example.ex: All the seeded players got through the first round.
example.tran: 所有种子选手都闯过了第一轮比赛。

collins.def: When you get through while making a telephone call, the call is connected and you can speak to the person you are phoning.

example.ex: He may find the line cut on the telephone so that he can't get through...
example.tran: 他可能会发现电话线被切断了，所以打不通。

example.ex: Smith tried to get through to Frank at Warm Springs the next morning.
example.tran: 第二天早上，史密斯试图打电话给在沃姆斯普林斯的弗兰克。

collins.def: If you look or go through a lot of things, you look at them or deal with them one after the other.

example.ex: Let's go through the numbers together and see if a workable deal is possible...
example.tran: 我们一起把这些数目过一遍，看能不能找出个可行方案。

example.ex: When you have finished your list of personal preferences, go through it again...
example.tran: 等你列出个人喜好的单子后，从头到尾再看一遍。

collins.def: If you read through something, you read it from beginning to end.

example.ex: She read through pages and pages of the music I had brought her...
example.tran: 她一页一页地翻看我带给她的乐谱。

example.ex: I only had time to skim through the script before I flew over here.
example.tran: 我在乘飞机来这儿之前，只来得及把稿子浏览了一遍。

collins.def: A through train goes directly to a particular place, so that the people who want to go there do not have to change trains.

example.ex: ...Britain's longest through train journey, 685 miles.
example.tran: 英国行程最远的直达列车路线——685 英里

collins.def: If you say that someone or something is wet through, you are emphasizing how wet they are.

example.ex: I returned to the inn cold and wet, soaked through by the drizzling rain...
example.tran: 我回到小旅馆时身上被毛毛雨淋透了，感觉又冷又湿。

example.ex: She went on crying, and cried and cried until the pillow was wet through.
example.tran: 她还是哭，哭呀哭，一直哭到枕头都湿透了。

collins.def: Through and through means completely and to the greatest extent possible.

example.ex: I've gotten my feet thoroughly soaked and feel frozen through and through...
example.tran: 我双脚湿透，感觉都冻到骨头里了。

example.ex: People assume they know me through and through the moment we meet.
example.tran: 人们一见到我，就自以为对我了如指掌了。

means: [体育]时间到，（一场或一局等的）比赛时限，暂停

collins.def: Time is what we measure in minutes, hours, days, and years.

example.ex: ...a two-week period of time...
example.tran: 两周的时间

example.ex: Time passed, and still Ma did not appear...
example.tran: 时间一点点过去，马先生仍然没有出现。

collins.def: You use time to ask or talk about a specific point in the day, which can be stated in hours and minutes and is shown on clocks.

example.ex: 'What time is it?' — 'Eight o'clock.'...
example.tran: “几点钟了？”——“8点钟。”

example.ex: He asked me the time...
example.tran: 他问我几点了。

collins.def: The time when something happens is the point in the day when it happens or is supposed to happen.

example.ex: Departure times are 08:15 from St Quay, and 18:15 from St Helier.
example.tran: 从圣奎伊的出发时间是 8 点 15 分，从圣赫利尔的出发时间是 18 点 15 分。

collins.def: You use time to refer to the system of expressing time and counting hours that is used in a particular part of the world.

example.ex: The tidal predictions are expressed in Greenwich Mean Time. Add one hour for British Summer Time...
example.tran: 潮汐预报用的是格林尼治标准时间。英国夏令时要在标准时基础上加一小时。

example.ex: The incident happened just after ten o'clock local time.
example.tran: 事件发生在当地时间 10 点刚过。

collins.tran: (用来做某事或某事发生的)时间
collins.def: You use time to refer to the period that you spend doing something or when something has been happening.

example.ex: Adam spent a lot of time in his grandfather's office...
example.tran: 亚当经常呆在他祖父的办公室里。

example.ex: He wouldn't have the time or money to take care of me...
example.tran: 他既不会有时间也不会有钱来照顾我。

collins.def: If you say that something has been happening for a time, you mean that it has been happening for a fairly long period of time.

example.ex: He was also for a time the art critic of 'The Scotsman'...
example.tran: 有相当长的一段时间他为《苏格兰人》报撰写艺术评论。

example.ex: He stayed for quite a time...
example.tran: 他呆了相当长的一段时间。

collins.tran: (某事发生的)一段(或特定)时间
collins.def: You use time to refer to a period of time or a point in time, when you are describing what is happening then. For example, if something happened at a particular time, that is when it happened. If it happens at all times, it always happens.

example.ex: We were in the same college, which was male-only at that time...
example.tran: 我们那时在同一所学院，当时只招男生。

example.ex: By this time he was thirty...
example.tran: 到那时他 30 岁了。

collins.def: You use time or times to talk about a particular period in history or in your life.

example.ex: They were hard times and his parents had been struggling to raise their family...
example.tran: 那是段艰苦时期，他父母一直艰辛地养家糊口。

example.ex: We'll be alone together, quite like old times...
example.tran: 我们会单独在一起，就像过去那样。

collins.def: You can use the times to refer to the present time and to modern fashions, tastes, and developments. For example, if you say that someone keeps up with the times, you mean they are fashionable or aware of modern developments. If you say they are behind the times, you mean they are unfashionable or not aware of them.

example.ex: He is unafraid to move with the times...
example.tran: 他敢于与时俱进。

example.ex: This approach is now seriously out of step with the times...
example.tran: 这种方法如今与时代潮流严重脱节。

collins.def: When you describe the time that you had on a particular occasion or during a particular part of your life, you are describing the sort of experience that you had then.

example.ex: Sarah and I had a great time while the kids were away...
example.tran: 孩子们不在的时候，我和萨拉度过了一段美好时光。

example.ex: She's had a really tough time the last year and a half...
example.tran: 这一年半以来，她度过了一段非常艰难的时期。

collins.def: Your time is the amount of time that you have to live, or to do a particular thing.

example.ex: Now Martin has begun to suffer the effects of AIDS, and he says his time is running out...
example.tran: 现在马丁开始遭受艾滋病的折磨，他说他的生命就要走到尽头。

example.ex: Every administration has its time. And when your time is over, you leave...
example.tran: 每届政府都有其执政期限，任期届满时就得下台。

collins.def: If you say it is time for something, time to do something, or time you did something, you mean that this thing ought to happen or be done now.

example.ex: Opinion polls indicated a feeling among the public that it was time for a change...
example.tran: 民意测验表明，公众认为到了改革的时候了。

example.ex: It was time for him to go to work...
example.tran: 他该去上班了。

collins.def: When you talk about a time when something happens, you are referring to a specific occasion when it happens.

example.ex: Every time she travels on the bus it's delayed by at least three hours...
example.tran: 每次她乘公车出行都至少耽搁3个小时。

example.ex: The last time I saw her was about sixteen years ago...
example.tran: 我上次见她大约是 16 年前了。

collins.def: You use time after numbers to say how often something happens.

example.ex: It was her job to make tea three times a day...
example.tran: 她的差事就是每天沏3次茶。

example.ex: How many times has your mother told you never to talk to strangers?...
example.tran: 你母亲告诉你多少次了，绝不能和陌生人谈话？

collins.def: You use times after numbers when comparing one thing to another and saying, for example, how much bigger, smaller, better, or worse it is.

example.ex: Its profits are rising four times faster than the average company...
example.tran: 它的利润增长速度比一般公司快4倍。

example.ex: Young people were several times more likely to be out of work than older members of the workforce...
example.tran: 劳动人口中，年轻人失业的可能性是年长者的好几倍。

collins.def: You use times in arithmetic to link numbers or amounts that are multiplied together to reach a total.

example.ex: Four times six is 24.
example.tran: 4 乘以 6 等于 24。

collins.def: Someone's time in a race is the amount of time it takes them to finish the race.

example.ex: He was over a second faster than his previous best time...
example.tran: 他比自己以前的最好成绩快了 1 秒多。

example.ex: She recorded a time of two minutes 8.74 seconds.
example.tran: 她以两分 8 秒 74 的成绩创了纪录。

collins.def: The time of a piece of music is the number of beats that the piece has in each bar.

example.ex: A reel is in four-four time, and a jig is in six-eight time.
example.tran: 里尔舞曲是四四拍，吉格舞曲是六八拍。

collins.tran: 给…确定时间;为…安排时间
collins.def: If you time something for a particular time, you plan or decide to do it or cause it to happen at this time.

example.ex: He timed the election to coincide with new measures to boost the economy...
example.tran: 他把选举安排在振兴经济的新政策出台时。

example.ex: We had timed our visit for March 7...
example.tran: 我们把访问时间确定在3月7日。

collins.def: If you time an action or activity, you measure how long someone takes to do it or how long it lasts.

example.ex: He timed each performance with a stop-watch.
example.tran: 他用秒表测定每组动作所花的时间。

collins.def: If you say it is about time that something was done, you are saying in an emphatic way that it should happen or be done now, and really should have happened or been done sooner.

example.ex: It's about time a few movie makers with original ideas were given a chance...
example.tran: 该给为数不多的几个有创见的电影制作者一个机会了。

example.ex: 'Here she is.' — 'About time too.'
example.tran: “她来了。”——“也早该来了。”

collins.def: If you do something ahead of time, you do it before a particular event or before you need to, in order to be well prepared.

example.ex: Find out ahead of time what regulations apply to your situation.
example.tran: 提前搞清楚什么规章适用于你的情况。

collins.def: If someone is ahead of their time or before their time, they have new ideas a long time before other people start to think in the same way.

example.ex: My mother was ahead of her time. She surrounded me with culture and art.
example.tran: 我母亲思想前卫，给予了我文化和艺术的熏陶。

example.ex: His only fundamental mistake, he insists, is that he was 20 years before his time.
example.tran: 他坚持认为，他仅有的根本性错误是他比时代超前了20年。

collins.def: If something happens or is done all the time, it happens or is done continually.

example.ex: We can't be together all the time...
example.tran: 我们不能始终在一起。

example.ex: I get the two of them mixed up all the time, they're so similar.
example.tran: 我一直把他们俩弄混，他俩太像了。

collins.def: You say at a time after an amount to say how many things or how much of something is involved in one action, place, or group.

example.ex: Beat in the eggs, one at a time...
example.tran: 打入鸡蛋，一次一个。

example.ex: She ran for the staircase and down the steps, taking them two at a time...
example.tran: 她跑向楼梯，一步两级地奔下台阶。

collins.def: If something could happen at any time, it is possible that it will happen very soon, though nobody can predict exactly when.

example.ex: Conditions are still very tense and the fighting could escalate at any time.
example.tran: 局势仍然非常紧张，战斗随时可能升级。

collins.def: You say at the best of times when you are making a negative or critical comment to emphasize that it is true even when the circumstances are as favourable as possible.

example.ex: A trade war would be bad at the best of times, but in the current economic climate, it would be a disaster.
example.tran: 即使在情况最好的时候贸易战都是有害无利的，而在当前这种经济形势下只会是一场灾难。

collins.def: If you say that something was the case at one time, you mean that it was the case during a particular period in the past.

example.ex: At one time 400 men, women and children lived in the village.
example.tran: 曾经有 400 个男人、女人和孩子居住在村子里。

example.ex: ...enormous glaciers, which at one time covered vast areas of the northern hemisphere.
example.tran: 一度覆盖了北半球辽阔区域的巨大冰川

collins.def: If two or more things exist, happen, or are true at the same time, they exist, happen, or are true together although they seem to contradict each other.

example.ex: I was afraid of her, but at the same time I really liked her...
example.tran: 我害怕她，但同时也确实喜欢她。

example.ex: She was somehow able to look sad and cheerful at the same time.
example.tran: 她能够做出又悲又喜的神情。

collins.def: At the same time is used to introduce a statement that slightly changes or contradicts the previous statement.

example.ex: I don't think I set out to come up with a different sound for each album. At the same time, I do have a sense of what is right for the moment.
example.tran: 我不觉得我一开始就特意为每张专辑设定了不同的曲风。然而，我确实知道当时想要的是什么感觉。

collins.def: You use at times to say that something happens or is true on some occasions or at some moments.

example.ex: The debate was highly emotional at times...
example.tran: 辩论有时变得异常情绪化。

example.ex: At times she had an overwhelming desire to see him...
example.tran: 她有时会特别想见他。

collins.tran: 在…出生以前；在…有记忆前
collins.def: If you say that something was before your time, you mean that it happened or existed before you were born or before you were able to know about it or remember it.

example.ex: 'You've never seen the Marilyn Monroe film?' — 'No, I think it was a bit before my time.'
example.tran: “你从来没看过玛丽莲·梦露演的电影？”——“是的，她拍电影时我还不记事呢。”

collins.def: If someone has reached a particular stage in life before their time, they have reached it at a younger age than is normal.

example.ex: The small print has forced me, years before my time, to buy spectacles...
example.tran: 印刷文字过小迫使我早早就要买眼镜戴。

example.ex: There is nothing like a college town to make you feel old before your time.
example.tran: 没有哪个地方能像大学城那样让你感到未老先衰。

collins.def: If you say not before time after a statement has been made about something that has been done, you are saying in an emphatic way that you think it should have been done sooner.

example.ex: The virus is getting more and more attention, and not before time...
example.tran: 这种病毒正受到越来越多的关注，其实早该如此。

example.ex: Not before time, that is about to change.
example.tran: 那一切总算要变了。

collins.def: If you call time on something, you end it.

example.ex: Scott Hastings has called time on his international career by cutting short his contract.
example.tran: 斯科特·黑斯廷斯中止合同，结束了他的国际比赛生涯。

collins.def: Someone who is doing time is in prison.

example.ex: He is serving 11 years for robbery, and did time for a similar offence before that.
example.tran: 他因犯抢劫罪正在服11年的刑期，此前他也曾因类似罪行蹲过监狱。

collins.def: If you say that something will be the case for all time, you mean that it will always be the case.

example.ex: The desperate condition of the world is that madness has always been here, and that it will remain so for all time.
example.tran: 这个世界令人绝望的是，疯狂之事一直存在，而且将永远存在下去。

collins.def: If something is the case or will happen for the time being, it is the case or will happen now, but only until something else becomes possible or happens.

example.ex: For the time being, however, immunotherapy is still in its experimental stages...
example.tran: 但免疫疗法目前仍处于实验阶段。

example.ex: The situation is calm for the time being.
example.tran: 局势暂时稳定。

collins.def: If you do something from time to time, you do it occasionally but not regularly.

example.ex: Her daughters visited him from time to time when he was ill.
example.tran: 他生病的时候她的女儿们时常去探望他。

collins.def: If you say that something is the case half the time you mean that it often is the case.

example.ex: Half the time, I don't have the slightest idea what he's talking about.
example.tran: 我经常一点儿都听不懂他在说什么。

collins.tran: 不喜欢/喜欢;不赞成/赞成
collins.def: If you say that you have no time for a person or thing, you mean you do not like them or approve of them, and if you say that you have a lot of time for a person or thing, you mean you like them or approve of them very much.

example.ex: When I think of what he's done to my mother and me, I've just got no time for him...
example.tran: 想到他对母亲和我所做的一切，我就很讨厌他。

example.ex: I have got a lot of time for people who are prepared to put the welfare of their party above their own vanity.
example.tran: 我很钦佩那些不计个人名利，以政党的利益为重的人。

collins.def: If you say that it is high time that something happened or was done, you are saying in an emphatic way that it should happen or be done now, and really should have happened or been done sooner.

example.ex: It is high time the Government displayed a more humanitarian approach towards victims of the recession...
example.tran: 政府早该对受到经济衰退影响的人们采取更加人性化的救助措施。

example.ex: It is high time to consider the problem on a global scale.
example.tran: 早该从全球视角考虑问题了。

collins.def: If you are in time for a particular event, you are not too late for it.

example.ex: I arrived just in time for my flight to London...
example.tran: 我及时赶上了飞往伦敦的航班。

example.ex: She set the alarm so she'd wake up in time to give her two sons their medication.
example.tran: 她定了闹钟，以便及时醒来给两个儿子服药。

collins.def: If you say that something will happen in time or given time, you mean that it will happen eventually, when a lot of time has passed.

example.ex: He would sort out his own problems, in time...
example.tran: 他早晚会解决自己的问题。

example.ex: Tina believed that, given time, her business would become profitable.
example.tran: 蒂娜相信假以时日，她的生意一定会盈利。

collins.def: If you are playing, singing, or dancing in time with a piece of music, you are following the rhythm and speed of the music correctly. If you are out of time with it, you are not following the rhythm and speed of the music correctly.

example.ex: Her body swayed in time with the music...
example.tran: 她的身体随着音乐节拍摆动。

example.ex: We were standing onstage playing completely out of time.
example.tran: 我们站在舞台上，演奏得完全不合节拍。

collins.def: If you say that something will happen, for example, in a week's time or in two years' time, you mean that it will happen a week from now or two years from now.

example.ex: Presidential elections are due to be held in ten days' time...
example.tran: 总统竞选将在10天后如期举行。

example.ex: In a year's time we will all be laughing about it.
example.tran: 一年以后我们都会对此一笑置之。

collins.def: If you arrive somewhere in good time, you arrive early so that there is time to spare before a particular event.

example.ex: If we're out, we always make sure we're home in good time for the programme.
example.tran: 如果外出，我们总是确保在节目开始之前赶回家。

collins.def: If you tell someone that something will happen in good time or all in good time, you are telling them to be patient because it will happen eventually.

example.ex: There will be many advanced exercises that you won't be able to do at first. You will get to them in good time...
example.tran: 有许多难度较大的动作你起初不会做，但慢慢就会了。

example.ex: 'I can't wait to be grown up.' — 'All in good time.'
example.tran: “我等不及要长大了。”——“别急，你总会长大的。”

collins.def: If something happens in no time or in next to no time, it happens almost immediately or very quickly.

example.ex: He's going to be just fine. At his age he'll heal in no time...
example.tran: 他会好起来的。以他的年纪，他很快就会痊愈。

example.ex: He expects to be out of prison in next to no time.
example.tran: 他期盼着立即出狱。

collins.def: If you do something in your own time, you do it at the speed that you choose, rather than allowing anyone to hurry you.

example.ex: Now, in your own time, tell me what happened.
example.tran: 现在慢慢告诉我发生了什么事。

collins.tran: 在业余时间;在空闲时间
collins.def: If you do something such as work in your own time in British English, or on your own time in American English, you do it in your free time rather than, for example, at work or school.

example.ex: If I choose to work on other projects in my own time, then I say that is my business.
example.tran: 如果我选择在业余时间做其他项目，我认为那是我自己的事情。

collins.def: If you keep time when playing or singing music, you follow or play the beat, without going too fast or too slowly.

example.ex: As he sang he kept time on a small drum.
example.tran: 他边唱边和着节拍敲一个小鼓。

collins.def: When you talk about how well a watch or clock keeps time, you are talking about how accurately it measures time.

example.ex: Some pulsars keep time better than the earth's most accurate clocks.
example.tran: 某些脉冲星发送脉冲比地球上最精确的时钟都准时。

collins.def: If you make time for a particular activity or person, you arrange to have some free time so that you can do the activity or spend time with the person.

example.ex: Before leaving the city, be sure to make time for a shopping trip...
example.tran: 离开城市之前，一定要留出时间去买些东西。

example.ex: She had made time for me in the midst of her busy schedule...
example.tran: 她在百忙中为我腾出了时间。

collins.def: If you say that you made good time on a journey, you mean it did not take you very long compared to the length of time you expected it to take.

example.ex: They had left early in the morning, on quiet roads, and made good time.
example.tran: 他们一大早出发，一路上人车稀少，走得比预期快多了。

collins.def: If someone is making up for lost time, they are doing something actively and with enthusiasm because they have not had the opportunity to do it before or when they were younger.

example.ex: Five years older than the majority of officers of his same rank, he was determined to make up for lost time.
example.tran: 他比同一级别的大多数军官年长 5 岁，因此他决心积极努力来弥补过去损失的时间。

collins.def: If you are marking time, you are doing something that is not particularly useful or interesting while you wait for something more important or interesting to happen.

example.ex: He's really just marking time until he's old enough to leave.
example.tran: 他其实只是在消磨时光，等年龄一到就退休。

collins.def: If you say that something happens or is the case nine times out of ten or ninety-nine times out of a hundred, you mean that it happens on nearly every occasion or is almost always the case.

example.ex: When they want something, nine times out of ten they get it...
example.tran: 他们想要什么，十之八九都会得到。

example.ex: Ninety-nine times out of a hundred when parents say to their children 'I know how you feel', they are lying.
example.tran: 当父母对孩子们说“我知道你的感受”时，他们十有八九在撒谎。

collins.tran: 有史以来最…的;前所未有的;空前的
collins.def: If you say that someone or something is, for example, the best writer of all time, or the most successful film of all time, you mean that they are the best or most successful that there has ever been.

example.ex: 'Monopoly' is one of the best-selling games of all time...
example.tran: “大富翁”是有史以来最畅销的游戏之一。

example.ex: This is my favourite song of all time.
example.tran: 这是我有史以来最喜爱的一首歌。

collins.def: If you are on time, you are not late.

example.ex: Don't worry, she'll be on time...
example.tran: 别急，她会准时到的。

example.ex: Their planes usually arrive on time.
example.tran: 他们的飞机通常都会准时抵达。

collins.tran: 迟早的事;只是时间问题
collins.def: If you say that it is only a matter of time or only a question of time before something happens, you mean that it cannot be avoided and will definitely happen at some future date.

example.ex: It now seems only a matter of time before they resign...
example.tran: 现在看来，他们辞职是早晚的事。

example.ex: The doctors are confident he'll make a full recovery. It's just a question of time.
example.tran: 医生们确信他会完全康复。这只是个时间问题。

collins.def: When you refer to our time or our times you are referring to the present period in the history of the world.

example.ex: It would be wrong to say that the Church doesn't enter the great moral debates of our time.
example.tran: 要说教会问题不是当代社会道德争论的一大议题，那就错了。

collins.def: If you do something to pass the time you do it because you have some time available and not because you really want to do it.

example.ex: Without particular interest and just to pass the time, I read a story...
example.tran: 我读了一篇故事，并非有什么特别的兴趣，仅仅为了消遣。

example.ex: During a lunch break, he and the buyer passed the time with some chitchat.
example.tran: 午饭休息时间，他与顾客谈天闲聊以消磨时间。

collins.def: If you pass the time of day with someone, you have a short friendly conversation with them.

example.ex: One or two people went up and passed the time of day with her...
example.tran: 一两个人走过去和她打了招呼。

example.ex: They can't even say 'good morning' or pass the time of day.
example.tran: 他们甚至不会说“早上好”或打声招呼。

collins.def: If you play for time, you try to make something happen more slowly, because you do not want it to happen or because you need time to think about what to do if it happens.

example.ex: The president's decision is being seen as an attempt to play for time.
example.tran: 总统的决定被视为试图争取时间而故意拖延。

collins.def: If you say that something will take time, you mean that it will take a long time.

example.ex: Change will come, but it will take time...
example.tran: 会有变化的，但这需要时间。

example.ex: It takes time to build up intimacy.
example.tran: 建立亲密关系是需要时间的。

collins.def: If you take your time doing something, you do it quite slowly and do not hurry.

example.ex: 'Take your time,' Cross told him. 'I'm in no hurry.'
example.tran: “慢慢来，”克罗斯对他说，“我一点都不急。”

example.ex: He took his time answering, knowing that he must select his words with great care.
example.tran: 他意识到自己必须言辞谨慎，于是不慌不忙地回答着问题。

collins.def: If a child can tell the time, they are able to find out what the time is by looking at a clock or watch.

example.ex: My four-year-old daughter cannot quite tell the time.
example.tran: 我4岁大的女儿还不大会看表。

collins.def: If something happens time after time, it happens in a similar way on many occasions.

example.ex: Burns had escaped from jail time after time...
example.tran: 伯恩斯屡次越狱。

example.ex: Time after time, I hear these stories of missing children on the news.
example.tran: 我不断从新闻节目中听到这些关于孩子失踪的报道。

collins.def: If you say that time flies, you mean that it seems to pass very quickly.

example.ex: Time flies when you're having fun.
example.tran: 开心的时光总是飞逝而去。

collins.def: If you have the time of your life, you enjoy yourself very much indeed.

example.ex: We're taking our little grandchild away with us. We'll make sure he has the time of his life...
example.tran: 我们会把小孙子带走。我们一定会让他过得开心。

example.ex: For some it was awful, for others, particularly the young, it was the time of their lives.
example.tran: 对某些人来说，那糟透了;而对其他人，特别是年轻人来说，那是他们无比开心的日子。

collins.def: If you say there is no time to lose or no time to be lost, you mean you must hurry as fast as you can to do something.

example.ex: He rushed home, realising there was no time to lose.
example.tran: 他意识到时间紧迫，于是急速赶回家。

collins.def: If you say that time will tell whether something is true or correct, you mean that it will not be known until some time in the future whether it is true or correct.

example.ex: Only time will tell whether Broughton's optimism is justified...
example.tran: 只有时间会验证布劳顿的乐观是否合理。

example.ex: I can't see any problems, but time will tell.
example.tran: 我发现不了任何问题，但时间会验证一切。

collins.def: If you waste no time in doing something, you take the opportunity to do it immediately or quickly.

example.ex: Tom wasted no time in telling me why he had come.
example.tran: 汤姆马上告诉了我他来的原因。

collins.def: You use to when indicating the place that someone or something visits, moves towards, or points at.

example.ex: Two friends and I drove to Florida during college spring break...
example.tran: 我和两个朋友在大学春假期间开车去了佛罗里达。

example.ex: Ramsay made a second visit to Italy.
example.tran: 拉姆齐第二次访问意大利。

collins.def: If you go to an event, you go where it is taking place.

example.ex: We went to a party at the leisure centre...
example.tran: 我们去休闲活动中心参加了一个聚会。

example.ex: He came to dinner...
example.tran: 他来赴晚宴了。

collins.def: If something is attached to something larger or fixed to it, the two things are joined together.

example.ex: There was a piece of cloth tied to the dog's collar...
example.tran: 狗项圈上系着一条布。

example.ex: Many patients prefer hand-held shower heads rather than those fixed to the wall…
example.tran: 很多病人更喜欢手握式的淋浴喷头而不是固定在墙上的那种。

collins.def: You use to when indicating the position of something. For example, if something is to your left, it is nearer your left side than your right side.

example.ex: Hemingway's studio is to the right...
example.tran: 海明威的工作室在右面。

example.ex: You will see the chapel on the hill to your left…
example.tran: 你会看见那座小教堂在你左侧的山上。

collins.def: When you give something to someone, they receive it.

example.ex: He picked up the knife and gave it to me...
example.tran: 他捡起刀子递给我。

example.ex: Firms should be allowed to offer jobs to the long-term unemployed at a lower wage.
example.tran: 公司应获许以较低的工资给长期失业的人提供岗位。

collins.tran: (表示动作或情感的对象)对，于
collins.def: You use to to indicate who or what an action or a feeling is directed towards.

example.ex: Marcus has been most unkind to me today...
example.tran: 马库斯今天对我非常无礼。

example.ex: …troops loyal to the government.
example.tran: 忠于政府的军队

collins.tran: (与某些名词、形容词连用，表示关联)对于，关于
collins.def: You use to with certain nouns and adjectives to show that a following noun is related to them.

example.ex: He is a witty man, and an inspiration to all of us...
example.tran: 他机智风趣，鼓舞激励着我们所有人。

example.ex: Marriage is not the answer to everything...
example.tran: 婚姻并不能解决一切问题。

collins.def: If you say something to someone, you want that person to listen and understand what you are saying.

example.ex: I'm going to have to explain to them that I can't pay them.
example.tran: 我将不得不向他们解释我不能付钱给他们。

collins.def: You use to when indicating someone's reaction to something or their feelings about a situation or event. For example, if you say that something happens to someone's surprise you mean that they are surprised when it happens.

example.ex: To his surprise, the bedroom door was locked…
example.tran: 令他吃惊的是，卧室门锁上了。

example.ex: He survived, to the amazement of surgeons.
example.tran: 令外科医生惊讶的是，他竟活下来了。

collins.def: You use to when indicating the person whose opinion you are stating.

example.ex: It was clear to me that he respected his boss...
example.tran: 在我看来他显然很尊重他的上司。

example.ex: Everyone seemed to her to be amazingly kind.
example.tran: 每个人对她来说都善良得不可思议。

collins.def: You use to when indicating what something or someone is becoming, or the state or situation that they are progressing towards.

example.ex: The shouts changed to screams of terror.
example.tran: 喊叫声变成了惊恐的尖叫声。

example.ex: ...an old ranch house that has been converted to a nature centre.
example.tran: 被改建成自然中心的旧农场主住宅

collins.def: To can be used as a way of introducing the person or organization you are employed by, when you perform some service for them.

example.ex: Rickman worked as a dresser to Nigel Hawthorne...
example.tran: 里克曼曾是奈杰尔·霍索恩的服装师。

example.ex: He was an official interpreter to the government of Nepal.
example.tran: 他曾是尼泊尔政府的官方译员。

collins.def: You use to to indicate that something happens until the time or amount mentioned is reached.

example.ex: Every vehicle was banned from coming into Mexico City one day a week from Monday to Friday…
example.tran: 每周一到周五期间都会有一天禁止所有车辆进入墨西哥城。

example.ex: From 1977 to 1985 the United States gross national product grew 21 percent...
example.tran: 从1977到1985年，美国的国民生产总值增长了 21%。

collins.def: You use to when indicating the last thing in a range of things, usually when you are giving two extreme examples of something.

example.ex: I read everything from fiction to history.
example.tran: 从小说到历史，我什么书都读。

example.ex: …mechanical toys and gadgets, from typewriters to toy cars.
example.tran: 从打字机到玩具汽车这样的机械玩具和小巧装置

collins.def: If someone goes from place to place or from job to job, they go to several places, or work in several jobs, and spend only a short time in each one.

example.ex: Larry and Andy had drifted from place to place, worked at this and that.
example.tran: 拉里和安迪从一处漂泊到另一处，干点这个又干点那个。

collins.def: If someone moves to and fro, they move repeatedly from one place to another and back again, or from side to side.

example.ex: She stood up and began to pace to and fro...
example.tran: 她站起身，开始来回踱步。

example.ex: The boat was rocking gently to and fro in the water.
example.tran: 小船在水中轻轻地来回摇荡。

collins.def: You use to when you are stating a time which is less than thirty minutes before an hour. For example, if it is 'five to eight', it is five minutes before eight o'clock.

example.ex: At twenty to six I was waiting by the entrance to the station...
example.tran: 5 点 40 分我正在车站入口处等着。

example.ex: At exactly five minutes to nine, Ann left her car and entered the building.
example.tran: 安在刚好8点55分时下车进了楼。

collins.def: You use to when giving ratios and rates.

example.ex: ...engines that can run at 60 miles to the gallon.
example.tran: 每加仑油跑 60 英里的发动机

example.ex: …a mixture of one part milk to two parts water.
example.tran: 由一份牛奶和两份水兑成的混合物

collins.def: You use to when indicating that two things happen at the same time. For example, if something is done to music, it is done at the same time as music is being played.

example.ex: Romeo left the stage, to enthusiastic applause...
example.tran: 罗密欧在热烈的掌声中离开了舞台。

example.ex: Amy woke up to the sound of her doorbell ringing...
example.tran: 随着门铃叮当作响，埃米醒来了。

collins.def: If you say 'There's nothing to it', 'There's not much to it', or 'That's  all there is to it', you are emphasizing how simple you think something is.

example.ex: Once they have tried growing orchids, they will see there is really nothing to it.
example.tran: 一旦他们试着种植兰花，就会发现那并不是什么难事。

example.ex: She's going through a difficult time. That's all there is to it.
example.tran: 她正经历一个困难时期。就这么简单。

collins.def: If you push or shut a door to, you close it but may not shut it completely.

example.ex: He slipped out, pulling the door to.
example.tran: 他溜了出去，虚掩上门。

collins.def: You use today to refer to the day on which you are speaking or writing.

example.ex: How are you feeling today?...
example.tran: 你今天感觉怎么样？

example.ex: I wanted him to come with us today, but he couldn't.
example.tran: 我想让他今天和我们一起来，但他来不了。

collins.def: You can refer to the present period of history as today .

example.ex: The United States is in a serious recession today…
example.tran: 当今美国正处于严重的衰退时期。

example.ex: He thinks pop music today is as exciting as it's ever been.
example.tran: 他认为现今的流行音乐与以往一样令人兴奋。

collins.def: If people do something together, they do it with each other.

example.ex: We went on long bicycle rides together...
example.tran: 我们一起骑自行车长途旅行。

example.ex: He and I worked together on a book…
example.tran: 我和他合写了一本书。

collins.def: If things are joined together, they are joined with each other so that they touch or form one whole.

example.ex: Mix the ingredients together thoroughly...
example.tran: 把配料充分混合。

example.ex: She clasped her hands together on her lap...
example.tran: 她十指紧扣，放在膝上。

collins.def: If things or people are situated together, they are in the same place and very near to each other.

example.ex: The trees grew close together...
example.tran: 树木密密地长在一起。

example.ex: Ginette and I gathered our things together...
example.tran: 我和吉内特把东西收拢好。

collins.def: If a group of people are held or kept together, they are united with each other in some way.

example.ex: He has done enough to pull the party together...
example.tran: 他为使政党内部团结一致已经做得够多了。

example.ex: I want us all to be a happy family together…
example.tran: 我希望我们大家都能在一起，成为一个幸福的家庭。

collins.tran: (两人)结婚的，有性关系(或恋爱关系)的
collins.def: If two people are together, they are married or having a sexual relationship with each other.

example.ex: We were together for five years...
example.tran: 我们共同生活了 5 年。

example.ex: Towards the end of our time together he was impossible…
example.tran: 到我们在一起的最后那段时间，他简直令人难以忍受。

collins.def: If two things happen or are done together, they happen or are done at the same time.

example.ex: Three horses crossed the finish line together...
example.tran: 3 匹马同时越过终点线。

example.ex: 'Yes,' they said together.
example.tran: “是的，”他们齐声说。

collins.def: You use together when you are adding two or more amounts or things to each other in order to consider a total amount or effect.

example.ex: The two main right-wing opposition parties together won 29.8 per cent…
example.tran: 两大右翼反对党合计赢得 29.8% 的选票。

example.ex: The companies have together spent £300 million…
example.tran: 这些公司总计支出 3 亿英镑。

collins.def: If you say that two things go together, or that one thing goes together with another, you mean that they go well with each other or cannot be separated from each other.

example.ex: I can see that some colours go together and some don't...
example.tran: 我看得出有些颜色很相配，有些就不行。

example.ex: Winckelmann declared that art and freedom went together…
example.tran: 温克尔曼宣称艺术与自由不可分割。

collins.def: If you describe someone as together, you admire them because they are very confident, organized, and know what they want.

example.ex: She was very headstrong, and very together...
example.tran: 她非常倔强，又非常精干。

example.ex: I know on the surface I appear to be quite a together person…
example.tran: 我知道表面上我似乎自信能干。

collins.def: You use together with to mention someone or something else that is also involved in an action or situation.

example.ex: Every month we'll deliver the very best articles, together with the latest fashion and beauty news...
example.tran: 每个月我们都登载最好的文章，还有最新的时尚美容资讯。

example.ex: A famine started which, together with the war, carried away millions of lives…
example.tran: 一场饥荒开始了，再加上战争，夺走了几百万条生命。

collins.def: You use too after mentioning another person, thing, or aspect that a previous statement applies to or includes.

example.ex: 'Nice to talk to you.' — 'Nice to talk to you too.'...
example.tran: “和你谈话很高兴。”——“我也一样。”

example.ex: 'I've got a great feeling about it.'  — 'Me too.'...
example.tran: “我感觉这次一定没问题。”——“我也是。”

collins.tran: (用于补充性信息或评论之后，表示强调)而且，还
collins.def: You use too after adding a piece of information or a comment to a statement, in order to emphasize that it is surprising or important.

example.ex: We did learn to read, and quickly too...
example.tran: 我们确实学会了阅读，而且学得很快。

example.ex: People usually think of it as a 'boys' book', which of course it is, and a very good one too.
example.tran: 人们通常把它看作“男孩读物”，它当然是，而且还是本很不错的男孩读物。

collins.def: You use too at the end of a sentence to emphasize an opinion that you have added after a statement made by you or by another person.

example.ex: 'That money's mine.' — 'Of course it is, and quite right too.'...
example.tran: “那笔钱是我的。”——“当然是你的，而且也理应如此。”

example.ex: 'Oh excuse me.' — 'I should think so too.'...
example.tran: “哦，请原谅。”——“你确实应该感到抱歉。”

collins.tran: (幽默或孩子气地坚持己见)确实地，无可否认地
collins.def: You use too in order to emphasize in a humorous or childish way that you disagree with what someone else has said or that you refuse to obey them.

example.ex: 'I'm getting a bike for my birthday.' — 'You are not.' – 'I am too.'
example.tran: “我过生日想要一辆自行车。”——“不行。”——“我就要。”

collins.def: The top of something is its highest point or part.

example.ex: I waited at the top of the stairs.
example.tran: 我在楼梯顶端等着。

example.ex: ...the picture at the top of the page...
example.tran: 书页天头的图片

collins.tran: 最高的;最上面的;最上层的
collins.def: The top thing or layer in a series of things or layers is the highest one.

example.ex: I can't reach the top shelf...
example.tran: 我够不着最上面的架子。

example.ex: Our new flat was on the top floor...
example.tran: 我们的新公寓在顶层。

collins.def: The top of something such as a bottle, jar, or tube is a cap, lid, or other device that fits or screws onto one end of it.

example.ex: ...the plastic tops from aerosol containers.
example.tran: 喷雾剂容器的塑料盖子

example.ex: ...a bottle top.
example.tran: 瓶塞

collins.def: The top of a street, garden, bed, or table is the end of it that is farthest away from where you usually enter it or from where you are.

example.ex: ...a little shop at the top of the street...
example.tran: 在街道那头的小店

example.ex: He moved to the empty chair at the top of the table.
example.tran: 他挪到桌子另一端的空椅子上坐下。

collins.def: A top is a piece of clothing that you wear on the upper half of your body, for example a blouse or shirt.

example.ex: Look at my new top.
example.tran: 看看我的新上衣。

collins.def: You can use top to indicate that something or someone is at the highest level of a scale or measurement.

example.ex: The vehicles have a top speed of 80 kilometres per hour.
example.tran: 这些车辆最高时速为 80 公里。

example.ex: ...a top-ranking Saudi officer.
example.tran: 最高级别的沙特阿拉伯军官

collins.def: You can use top to say that you think something is excellent.

example.ex: For $50, the guests got three courses of top nosh, fizz, wine, and beer.
example.tran: 花 50 美元，客人们就尝到了三道美味菜肴，还有汽水、葡萄酒和啤酒。

collins.tran: 最高层;最高地位(或职位)
collins.def: The top of an organization or career structure is the highest level in it.

example.ex: We started from the bottom and we had to work our way up to the top.
example.tran: 我们从最底层开始，是一步一步奋斗到最高层的。

example.ex: ...his dramatic rise to the top of the military hierarchy.
example.tran: 他戏剧性地晋升至最高军阶

collins.def: You can use top to describe the most important or famous people or things in a particular area of work or activity.

example.ex: So you want to be a top model…
example.tran: 这么说，你想成为超级名模喽。

example.ex: The President met this afternoon with his top military advisers...
example.tran: 总统今天下午会见了他最得力的军事顾问。

collins.def: If someone is at the top of a table or league or is the top of the table or league, their performance is better than that of all the other people involved.

example.ex: The United States will be at the top of the medal table...
example.tran: 美国将在奖牌榜上位列第一。

example.ex: Labour was top of the poll with forty-six percent.
example.tran: 工党以 46% 的得票数高居首位。

collins.def: You can use top to indicate that something is the first thing you are going to do, because you consider it to be the most important.

example.ex: Cleaning up the water supply is their top priority...
example.tran: 清洁供水系统是他们的当务之急。

example.ex: On arrival, a six-course meal was top of the agenda.
example.tran: 他们到达之后要做的第一件事是吃一顿六道菜的大餐。

collins.def: You can use top to indicate that someone does a particular thing more times than anyone else or that something is chosen more times than anything else.

example.ex: He was Italy's top scorer during the World Cup matches...
example.tran: 他是世界杯比赛期间意大利队进球最多的球员。

example.ex: Management consultancy was the top choice of career among 11,500 students in a survey this year…
example.tran: 在今年一项对 11,500 名学生进行的调查中，管理顾问是首选职业。

collins.def: To top a list means to be mentioned or chosen more times than anyone or anything else.

example.ex: It was the first time a Japanese manufacturer had topped the list for imported vehicles...
example.tran: 这是日本制造商初次占据进口车排行的首位。

example.ex: So what happens if the Socialists top the poll but fall short of an absolute majority?
example.tran: 那么如果社会党人得票居首却达不到绝对多数会怎么样？

collins.def: If something tops a particular amount, it is larger than that amount.

example.ex: Imports topped £10 billion last month...
example.tran: 上个月进口总额超过了 100 亿英镑。

example.ex: These five schools are in the state's top 5% in achievement scores, one school topping the score for the whole state.
example.tran: 这 5 所学校的成绩在该州居前 5%，其中一所的成绩高于全州所有其他学校。

collins.def: If something is topped with something, it has that thing as its highest part.

example.ex: The holiest of their chapels are topped with gilded roofs...
example.tran: 他们最神圣的教堂屋顶镀了金。

example.ex: To serve, top the fish with the cooked leeks.
example.tran: 上菜时，把炒好的韭葱覆在鱼上。

collins.def: If you top a story, remark, or action, you follow it with a better or more impressive one.

example.ex: How are you going to top that?
example.tran: 你怎样超过那个？

collins.def: You can use tops after mentioning a quantity, to say that it is the maximum possible.

example.ex: The publisher expected the book to sell 1,500 copies, tops...
example.tran: 出版商预计该书至多能卖出 1,500 本。

example.ex: Be here in half an hour, tops.
example.tran: 最晚半个小时以后到这里。

collins.def: If you say that something is tops or is the tops, you mean that it is better or more successful than anything else.

example.ex: Majorca and Ibiza are tops for holiday bargain-hunters in June…
example.tran: 对于实惠型度假者来说，马略卡岛与伊维萨岛是 6 月份的绝好选择。

example.ex: The United States was tops in finance and services…
example.tran: 美国在金融业与服务业方面无可匹敌。

collins.def: If someone blows their top, they become very angry about something.

example.ex: He blew his top after airport officials refused to let him on a plane.
example.tran: 机场工作人员拒绝让他登机之后，他勃然大怒。

collins.tran: 出人头地;拔得头筹;占得上风
collins.def: If a person, organization, or country comes out on top, they are more successful than the others that they have been competing with.

example.ex: The only way to come out on top is to adopt a different approach.
example.tran: 脱颖而出的唯一途径就是采用一种不同的方法。

collins.def: If someone pays top dollar for something, they pay the highest possible price for it.

example.ex: People will always pay top dollar for something exclusive.
example.tran: 人们总是会为绝无仅有的东西付出高价。

example.ex: …a club frequented by top-dollar models and their movie star companions.
example.tran: 身价最高的模特与她们的影星同伴经常光顾的俱乐部

collins.def: If you say that you clean, tidy, or examine something from top to bottom, you are emphasizing that you do it completely and thoroughly.

example.ex: She would clean the house from top to bottom.
example.tran: 她会把房子彻底打扫一下。

collins.def: You can use from top to toe to emphasize that the whole of someone's body is covered or dressed in a particular thing or type of clothing.

example.ex: They were sensibly dressed from top to toe in rain gear.
example.tran: 他们从头到脚都用雨具捂得严严实实，非常明智。

collins.def: When something gets on top of you, it makes you feel unhappy or depressed because it is very difficult or worrying, or because it involves more work than you can manage.

example.ex: Things have been getting on top of me lately.
example.tran: 最近事情太多，压得我透不过气来。

collins.tran: 不加思索地;来不及思索地
collins.def: If you say something off the top of your head, you say it without thinking about it much before you speak, especially because you do not have enough time.

example.ex: It was the best I could think of off the top of my head.
example.tran: 这是我一时所能想到的最好的办法。

collins.def: If one thing is on top of another, it is placed over it or on its highest part.

example.ex: ...the vacuum flask that was resting on top of the stove.
example.tran: 放在炉子上的保温瓶

example.ex: …the fairy on top of the Christmas tree…
example.tran: 圣诞树顶上的仙子

collins.def: You can use on top or on top of to indicate that a particular problem exists in addition to a number of other problems.

example.ex: A stepfamily faces all the problems that a normal family has, with a set of additional problems on top…
example.tran: 再婚家庭会面临正常家庭的所有问题，外加一堆额外难题。

example.ex: An extra 700 jobs are being cut on top of the 2,000 that were lost last year.
example.tran: 除了去年被裁掉的 2,000 个职位，还有700个岗位在裁撤中。

collins.def: You say that someone is on top when they have reached the most important position in an organization or business.

example.ex: How does he stay on top, 17 years after becoming foreign minister?
example.tran: 他是怎样在成为外交大臣以后的17年间保住最高职位的？

collins.def: If you are on top of or get on top of something that you are doing, you are dealing with it successfully.

example.ex: ...the government's inability to get on top of the situation.
example.tran: 政府无力掌控局势

collins.def: If you say that you feel on top of the world, you are emphasizing that you feel extremely happy and healthy.

example.ex: Two months before she gave birth to Jason she left work feeling on top of the world.
example.tran: 生贾森前的两个月，她辞工回家，感觉无比幸福。

collins.def: If one thing is over the top of another, it is placed over it so that it is completely covering it.

example.ex: I have overcome this problem by placing a sheet of polythene over the top of the container...
example.tran: 我在容器上盖了一片聚乙烯塑料薄膜，解决了这个问题。

example.ex: Stir the sauce and pour it over the top.
example.tran: 搅拌调味汁，把它浇在上面。

collins.def: You describe something as over the top when you think that it is exaggerated, and therefore unacceptable.

example.ex: The special effects are a bit over the top but I enjoyed it.
example.tran: 特效有点夸张，但是我喜欢。

collins.def: If you top and tail fruit or vegetables such as French beans, you cut off the tops and the bottoms of them when you are preparing them to be eaten.

collins.tran: (某行业中的)最高地位;事业的最高峰
collins.def: If you say that someone is at the top of the tree, you mean that they have reached the highest level in their career or profession.

example.ex: He sees himself going right to the top of the tree.
example.tran: 他预见自己在同行中将无人可及。

collins.def: If you say something at the top of your voice, you say it very loudly.

example.ex: 'Stephen!' shouted Marcia at the top of her voice.
example.tran: “斯蒂芬！”马西娅放声大喊。

collins.def: A total is the number that you get when you add several numbers together or when you count how many things there are in a group.

example.ex: The companies have a total of 1,776 employees.
example.tran: 这些公司总计有 1,776 名员工。

collins.def: The total number or cost of something is the number or cost that you get when you add together or count all the parts in it.

example.ex: They said that the total number of cows dying from BSE would be twenty thousand…
example.tran: 他们说患疯牛病死亡的牛的总数将达 2 万头。

example.ex: The total cost of the project would be more than $240 million.
example.tran: 该项目的总成本会超过 2.4 亿美元。

collins.def: If there are a number of things in total, there are that number when you count or add them all together.

example.ex: I was with my husband for eight years in total...
example.tran: 我和丈夫在一起的时间总共有 8 年。

example.ex: In total, 45 per cent of adults in Britain are exposed to tobacco smoke at home.
example.tran: 英国总计有 45% 的成人在家里遭受到烟草烟雾的侵害。

collins.def: If several numbers or things total a certain figure, that figure is the total of all the numbers or all the things.

example.ex: The unit's exports will total $85 million this year...
example.tran: 该部门今年的出口总额将达 8,500 万美元。

example.ex: They will compete for prizes totalling nearly £3,000.
example.tran: 他们将为总额近 3,000 英镑的奖金展开争夺。

collins.def: When you total a set of numbers or objects, you add them all together.

example.ex: They haven't totalled the exact figures.
example.tran: 他们还没有对确切数据进行总计。

collins.def: You can use total to emphasize that something is as great in extent, degree, or amount as it possibly can be.

example.ex: You were a total failure if you hadn't married by the time you were about twenty-three…
example.tran: 如果到了 23 岁左右还没结婚，你就是个彻底的失败者。

example.ex: There was an almost total lack of management control…
example.tran: 管理控制几乎是完全缺失的。

collins.def: If you move, look, or point towards something or someone, you move, look, or point in their direction.

example.ex: Caroline leant across the table towards him...
example.tran: 卡罗琳隔着桌子俯身向他靠过来。

example.ex: Anne left Artie and walked down the corridor towards the foyer...
example.tran: 安妮离开阿蒂，沿着走廊朝休息室走去。

collins.def: If things develop towards a particular situation, that situation becomes nearer in time or more likely to happen.

example.ex: The talks made little evident progress towards agreement...
example.tran: 会谈在达成一致方面几乎没有取得明显进展。

example.ex: She also began moving toward a different lifestyle.
example.tran: 她也开始转向一种不同的生活方式。

collins.def: If you have a particular attitude towards something or someone, you have that attitude when you think about them or deal with them.

example.ex: It's the business of the individual to determine his own attitude towards religion...
example.tran: 对宗教持何种态度是个人的事情。

example.ex: Not everyone in the world will be kind and caring towards you...
example.tran: 并非世上每个人都会对你友善关心。

collins.def: If something happens towards a particular time, it happens just before that time.

example.ex: The Channel tunnel was due to open towards the end of 1993...
example.tran: 海峡隧道预计 1993 年年底前开通。

example.ex: There was a forecast of cooler weather toward the end of the week.
example.tran: 预报称这周末天气会凉下来。

collins.def: If something is towards part of a place or thing, it is near that part.

example.ex: The home of the Morgan family was up Gloucester Road, towards the top of the hill...
example.tran: 摩根家族的住宅在格洛斯特路接近山顶的地方。

example.ex: The most popular items are located toward the back of the store.
example.tran: 最受欢迎的产品放在靠近商店最里面的地方。

collins.def: If you give money towards something, you give it to help pay for that thing.

example.ex: He gave them £50,000 towards a house...
example.tran: 他给了他们 5 万英镑用于买房子。

example.ex: 71 percent of the entire budget went towards the military…
example.tran: 整个预算的 71% 用于了军备。

collins.def: A town is a place with many streets and buildings, where people live and work. Towns are larger than villages and smaller than cities. Many places that are called towns in Britain would be called cities in the United States.

example.ex: ...Saturday night in the small town of Braintree, Essex...
example.tran: 埃塞克斯郡布伦特里小镇的周六之夜

example.ex: Parking can be tricky in the town centre.
example.tran: 在市镇中心停车可能会挺费事。

collins.def: You use town in order to refer to the town where you live.

example.ex: He admits he doesn't even know when his brother is in town...
example.tran: 他承认自己甚至不知道弟弟什么时候来了本市。

example.ex: She left town.
example.tran: 她离开了自己生活的城镇。

collins.tran: 市中心;(城镇的)商业中心；闹市区
collins.def: You use town in order to refer to the central area of a town where most of the shops and offices are.

example.ex: I walked around town...
example.tran: 我在市中心逛了逛。

example.ex: I caught a bus into town.
example.tran: 我赶上辆公交车去了市中心。

collins.def: If you refer to the town, you are referring to town and city areas in general, as opposed to country areas.

example.ex: More people are going to want to escape from the town into the country…
example.tran: 更多的人将会想要逃离城市到乡村去。

example.ex: It had the advantages of town and country combined.
example.tran: 它兼具都市与乡村的优势。

collins.tran: 满腔热情地干;拼命地干
collins.def: If you say that someone goes to town on something, you mean that they deal with it with a lot of enthusiasm or intensity.

example.ex: We really went to town on it, turning it into a full, three-day show...
example.tran: 我们下了真功夫，把它办成了一场内容丰富、为时三天的展览。

example.ex: The papers got hold of it and went to town on it…
example.tran: 报纸抓住这件事大做文章。

collins.tran: 社交忙人;花花公子/时髦女郎
collins.def: If you describe someone as a man about town or a woman about town, you mean that they are sophisticated, like to go out and spend money, and have a busy social life.

example.ex: He was known as a tall, handsome man about town…
example.tran: 他以高大英俊的花花公子形象为人所知。

example.ex: He is an old flame of Sarah's, from her days as a single girl about town.
example.tran: 他是萨拉的旧情人，是她作为单身时髦女郎时的旧爱。

collins.def: If you go out on the town or go for a night on the town, you enjoy yourself by going to a town centre in the evening and spending a long time there visiting several places of entertainment.

example.ex: My idea of luxury used to be going out on the town and coming back in the early hours of the morning...
example.tran: 我过去对奢侈的概念是夜晚在闹市通宵玩乐到清晨才回来。

example.ex: Last Saturday, I was out on the town with my mate…
example.tran: 上个星期六我和老友晚上去闹市玩乐了。

collins.def: Trade is the activity of buying, selling, or exchanging goods or services between people, firms, or countries.

example.ex: The ministry had direct control over every aspect of foreign trade.
example.tran: 该政府部门直接掌控着外贸的各个方面。

example.ex: ...negotiations on a new international trade agreement...
example.tran: 有关新国际贸易协定的谈判

collins.tran: 做买卖;做生意;从事贸易
collins.def: When people, firms, or countries trade, they buy, sell, or exchange goods or services between themselves.

example.ex: They may refuse to trade, even when offered attractive prices...
example.tran: 即便对方的报价很有吸引力,他们也有可能拒绝进行交易。

example.ex: They had years of experience of trading with the West...
example.tran: 他们有多年与西方贸易往来的经验。

collins.def: A trade is a particular area of business or industry.

example.ex: They've completely ruined the tourist trade for the next few years.
example.tran: 他们把今后几年的旅游业完全给毁了。

example.ex: ...the arms trade.
example.tran: 军火贸易

collins.def: Someone's trade is the kind of work that they do, especially when they have been trained to do it over a period of time.

example.ex: He learnt his trade as a diver in the North Sea...
example.tran: 他在北海学会了潜水员这一行的本事。

example.ex: Allyn was a jeweller by trade...
example.tran: 阿林是珠宝匠。

collins.def: If someone trades one thing for another or if two people trade things, they agree to exchange one thing for the other thing.

example.ex: They traded land for goods and money...
example.tran: 他们用土地换取了货物与金钱。

example.ex: He still claims the arms weren't traded for hostages…
example.tran: 他仍然声称军火没有被用来交换人质。

collins.def: If you trade places with someone or if the two of you trade places, you move into the other person's position or situation, and they move into yours.

example.ex: Mike asked George to trade places with him so he could ride with Tod...
example.tran: 迈克要求乔治和他交换位置，让他和托德同坐一辆车。

example.ex: Kennedy mischievously suggested that professors ought to trade jobs for a time with janitors…
example.tran: 肯尼迪调皮地建议教授和看门人互换一段时间工作。

collins.tran: 使(足球、棒球等职业运动员)转会
collins.def: In professional sports, for example football or baseball, if a player is traded from one team to another, they leave one team and begin playing for another.

example.ex: He was traded from the Giants to the Yankees...
example.tran: 他从巨人队转会到扬基队。

example.ex: The A's have not won a game since they traded him.
example.tran: 奥克兰运动家队自从他转会后还没有赢过一场比赛。

collins.def: If two people or groups trade something such as blows, insults, or jokes, they hit each other, insult each other, or tell each other jokes.

example.ex: Children would settle disputes by trading punches or insults in the schoolyard...
example.tran: 儿童会通过在操场上对打或互骂的方式解决争端。

example.ex: They traded artillery fire with government forces inside the city.
example.tran: 他们与城内的政府军互相开炮。

means: [橄]触球，（因触球获得的）向球门踢球的权利

collins.def: If you try to do something, you want to do it, and you take action which you hope will help you to do it.

example.ex: He secretly tried to block her advancement in the Party...
example.tran: 他暗地里设法阻挠她在党内的晋升。

example.ex: Try to make the effort to work your way through all of your tasks one at a time…
example.tran: 争取努力把你所有的任务一次完成一项。

collins.def: To try and do something means to try to do it.

example.ex: He has started a privatisation programme to try and win support from the business community…
example.tran: 他启动了一套私有化方案，以设法赢得商界的支持。

example.ex: I must try and see him.
example.tran: 我必须设法见到他。

collins.def: If you try for something, you make an effort to get it or achieve it.

example.ex: My partner and I have been trying for a baby for two years...
example.tran: 我和爱人两年来一直想要个孩子。

example.ex: He said he was going to try for first place next year.
example.tran: 他说他明年会争取夺得第一名。

collins.def: If you try something new or different, you use it, do it, or experience it in order to discover its qualities or effects.

example.ex: It's best not to try a new recipe for the first time on such an important occasion...
example.tran: 在这么重要的场合最好不要尝试以前从未做过的新菜谱。

example.ex: I've tried everything from herbal cigarettes to chewing gum…
example.tran: 中草药香烟、口香糖之类的我统统都试过了。

collins.tran: 到(某处)试试;找(某人)试试
collins.def: If you try a particular place or person, you go to that place or person because you think that they may be able to provide you with what you want.

example.ex: Have you tried the local music shops?
example.tran: 你到当地的音像店找过了吗？

collins.def: If you try a door or window, you try to open it.

example.ex: Bob tried the door. To his surprise it opened.
example.tran: 鲍勃试着推了推门。令他吃惊的是，门竟然开了。

collins.def: When a person is tried, he or she has to appear in a law court and is found innocent or guilty after the judge and jury have heard the evidence. When a legal case is tried, it is considered in a court of law.

example.ex: He suggested that those responsible should be tried for crimes against humanity...
example.tran: 他建议那些责任人应该以反人类罪受到审判。

example.ex: Whether he is innocent or guilty is a decision that will be made when the case is tried in court...
example.tran: 他有罪与否，等案件在法庭受审后就会作出判决。

collins.tran: (橄榄球的)达阵得分(在对方球门线内带球触地得分)
collins.def: In the game of rugby, a try is the action of scoring by putting the ball down behind the goal line of the opposing team.
