example.ex: The French, who led 21-3 at half time, scored eight tries.
example.tran: 上半场以 21:3 领先的法国队有 8 个达阵得分。

collins.tran: 没努力尝试;没竭尽全力
collins.def: If you say that something fails but not for want of trying or not for lack of trying, you mean that everything possible was done to make it succeed.

example.ex: Not all is perfect, but it isn't for want of trying.
example.tran: 一切并非无可挑剔，但已经竭尽全力了。

collins.def: When you turn or when you turn part of your body, you move your body or part of your body so that it is facing in a different or opposite direction.

example.ex: He turned abruptly and walked away...
example.tran: 他突然转身走了。

example.ex: He turned to his publicist and jokingly asked, 'What's next?'…
example.tran: 他转向他的宣传员开玩笑地问道：“下一个是什么？”

collins.tran: 转动;使转向;使改变方向
collins.def: When you turn something, you move it so that it is facing in a different or opposite direction, or is in a very different position.

example.ex: They turned their telescopes towards other nearby galaxies...
example.tran: 他们把望远镜转向附近其他星系。

example.ex: Turn the cake the right way up on to a wire rack…
example.tran: 把蛋糕翻到合适的方向对准金属丝架上。

collins.def: When something such as a wheel turns, or when you turn it, it continually moves around in a particular direction.

example.ex: As the wheel turned, the potter shaped the clay...
example.tran: 轮子一边转动，制陶工人一边拉坯。

example.ex: The engine turned a propeller.
example.tran: 发动机使螺旋桨旋转起来。

collins.tran: 转动，旋动(钥匙、把手、开关等)
collins.def: When you turn something such as a key, knob, or switch, or when it turns, you hold it and twist your hand, in order to open something or make it start working.

example.ex: Turn a special key, press the brake pedal, and your car's brakes lock...
example.tran: 转动一把特制的钥匙，踩下刹车踏板，这样你的汽车刹车就锁住了。

example.ex: Turn the heat to very low and cook for 20 minutes...
example.tran: 把温度调到很低，煮 20 分钟。

collins.def: When you turn in a particular direction or turn a corner, you change the direction in which you are moving or travelling.

example.ex: He turned into the narrow terraced street where he lived…
example.tran: 他转向自己居住的那条夹在排房间的狭窄街道。

example.ex: Now turn right to follow West Ferry Road...
example.tran: 现在向右拐沿西渡路往前走。

collins.def: The point where a road, path, or river turns, is the point where it has a bend or curve in it.

example.ex: ...the corner where Tenterfield Road turned into the main road.
example.tran: 滕特菲尔德路拐向主道的岔路口

collins.def: When the tide turns, it starts coming in or going out.

example.ex: There was not much time before the tide turned.
example.tran: 不久就要涨潮了。

collins.def: When someone turns a cartwheel or a somersault, they do a cartwheel or somersault.

example.ex: They were still doing wild acrobatics in the yard, turning somersaults and cartwheels.
example.tran: 他们还在院子里一通杂耍，翻着跟头，玩着侧手翻。

collins.def: When you turn a page of a book or magazine, you move it so that is flat against the previous page, and you can read the next page.

example.ex: He turned the pages of a file in front of him.
example.tran: 他翻阅面前的文件。

collins.def: If you turn a weapon or an aggressive feeling on someone, you point it at them or direct it at them.

example.ex: He tried to turn the gun on me...
example.tran: 他企图把枪对准我。

example.ex: The crowd then turned their anger on Prime Minister James Mitchell.
example.tran: 然后人群把怒火都撒向詹姆斯·米切尔总理。

collins.def: If you turn to a particular page in a book or magazine, you open it at that page.

example.ex: To order, turn to page 236.
example.tran: 如需订购，参见 236 页。

collins.tran: 开始思考;开始讨论;把(注意力等)转向
collins.def: If you turn your attention or thoughts to a particular subject or if you turn to it, you start thinking about it or discussing it.

example.ex: We turned our attention to the practical matters relating to forming a company...
example.tran: 我们开始考虑有关成立公司的具体事宜。

example.ex: We turn now to the British news.
example.tran: 我们现在来关注英国新闻。

collins.def: If you turn to someone, you ask for their help or advice.

example.ex: For assistance, they turned to one of the city's most innovative museums...
example.tran: 他们求助于该市最具创新风格的一家博物馆。

example.ex: There was no one to turn to, no one to tell.
example.tran: 没人可以求助，没人可以诉说。

collins.def: If you turn to a particular activity, job, or way of doing something, you start doing or using it.

example.ex: These communities are now turning to recycling in large numbers...
example.tran: 这些团体现在正转而致力于大规模的回收利用工作。

example.ex: The Superpowers turned to the harder task of cutting their nuclear arsenals…
example.tran: 超级大国开始着手削减核武器库这项更为艰难的工作。

collins.def: To turn or be turned into something means to become that thing.

example.ex: A prince turns into a frog in this cartoon fairytale...
example.tran: 在这个卡通童话里王子变成了一只青蛙。

example.ex: Their grief turned to hysteria when the funeral procession arrived at the cemetery…
example.tran: 当送葬队走到墓地时，他们更加悲恸欲绝。

collins.def: You can use turn before an adjective to indicate that something or someone changes by acquiring the quality described by the adjective.

example.ex: If the bailiff thinks that things could turn nasty he will enlist the help of the police...
example.tran: 如果法警认为事情变得不可收拾，他就会寻求警方的帮助。

example.ex: She announced that she was going to turn professional.
example.tran: 她宣布自己即将成为职业选手。

collins.def: If something turns a particular colour or if something turns it a particular colour, it becomes that colour.

example.ex: The sea would turn pale pink and the sky blood red...
example.tran: 大海会变成浅粉色，天空则变成血红色。

example.ex: Her contact lenses turned her eyes green.
example.tran: 隐形眼镜把她的眼睛变成了绿色。

collins.def: You can use turn to indicate that there is a change to a particular kind of weather. For example, if it turns cold, the weather starts being cold.

example.ex: If it turns cold, cover plants...
example.tran: 如果天气变冷，就把植物盖起来。

example.ex: The weather had turned warm and thundery overnight.
example.tran: 天气一夜之间就转暖，而且雷声阵阵。

collins.tran: (时局或趋势的)逆转，转变，变化
collins.def: If a situation or trend takes a particular kind of turn, it changes so that it starts developing in a different or opposite way.

example.ex: The scandal took a new turn over the weekend.
example.tran: 周末时丑闻有了新的发展。

example.ex: …the latest turn in the fighting…
example.tran: 战斗的最新进展

collins.def: In sports, if a game turns, or is turned, something significant happens which changes the way the game is developing.

example.ex: The game turned in the 56th minute.
example.tran: 比赛在第 56 分钟时发生了扭转。

example.ex: …the Gareth Edwards try which turned the game between France and Wales in Paris in 1971.
example.tran: 加雷思·爱德华兹于 1971 年法国队与威尔士队在巴黎的比赛中贡献的一记扭转赛事的触地得分

collins.def: If a business turns a profit, it earns more money than it spends.

example.ex: The firm will be able to service debt and still turn a modest profit...
example.tran: 那家公司将有能力支付债务，而且还会赚得一笔可观的利润。

example.ex: He says the fares are just too low to turn profits.
example.tran: 他说票价太低，根本无利可图。

collins.def: When someone turns a particular age, they pass that age. When it turns a particular time, it passes that time.

example.ex: It was his ambition to accumulate a million dollars before he turned thirty...
example.tran: 他立志要在而立之年以前攒够 100 万美元。

example.ex: It had just turned twelve o'clock.
example.tran: 刚过 12 点。

collins.def: Turn is used in expressions such as the turn of the century and the turn of the year to refer to a period of time when one century or year is ending and the next one is beginning.

example.ex: They fled to South America around the turn of the century.
example.tran: 他们在世纪之交逃到了南美洲。

collins.def: When someone turns a wooden or metal object that they are making, they shape it using a special tool.

example.ex: ...the joys of making a living from turning wood.
example.tran: 靠车削木材谋生的乐趣

example.ex: …finely-turned metal.
example.tran: 精心车削的金属

collins.tran: (依次轮流时的)轮班，次序，轮番
collins.def: If it is your turn to do something, you now have the duty, chance, or right to do it, when other people have done it before you or will do it after you.

example.ex: Tonight it's my turn to cook...
example.tran: 今晚该我做饭了。

example.ex: Let each child have a turn at fishing...
example.tran: 让每个孩子轮流钓鱼。

collins.def: If you say that someone is having a turn, you mean they feel suddenly very unwell for a short period of time.

example.ex: He is having one of his turns…
example.tran: 他又犯病了。

example.ex: He gets funny turns, you know. It's his age.
example.tran: 他总是感觉不舒服。也是，他都这个岁数了。

collins.tran: （表示两种感情或品质的交替）时而，间或
collins.def: You can use by turns to indicate that someone has two particular emotions or qualities, one after the other.

example.ex: His tone was by turns angry and aggrieved.
example.tran: 他的语气时而透着愤怒，时而流露出哀怨。

collins.def: If there is a particular turn of events, a particular series of things happen.

example.ex: They were horrified at this unexpected turn of events.
example.tran: 这种出乎意料的形势变化让他们无比震惊。

collins.def: If you say that something happens at every turn, you are emphasizing that it happens frequently or all the time, usually so that it prevents you from achieving what you want.

example.ex: Its operations were hampered at every turn by inadequate numbers of trained staff...
example.tran: 因为缺乏训练有素的员工，其生产经营总是遇到各种障碍。

example.ex: At every turn smoke and flame stopped efforts to get into the living quarters.
example.tran: 到处是烟雾和火焰，根本无法进入住处。

collins.def: If you do someone a good turn, you do something that helps or benefits them.

example.ex: He did you a good turn by resigning...
example.tran: 他辞职对你有利。

example.ex: One good turn deserves another.
example.tran: 善有善报。

collins.tran: 彻底搜查;把…翻个底朝天
collins.def: If someone turns a place inside out or upside down, they search it very thoroughly and usually make it very untidy.

example.ex: They hadn't found a scrap of evidence though they had turned his flat inside out.
example.tran: 他们虽然把他的公寓翻了个底朝天，却没有找到一丝证据。

collins.tran: 彻底改变，完全搅乱（体制或生活方式）
collins.def: If something such as a system or way of life is turned inside out or upside down, it is changed completely, making people confused or upset.

example.ex: He felt too shocked to move. His world had been turned upside down.
example.tran: 他惊呆了。他的世界已经完全被打乱了。

collins.def: You use in turn to refer to actions or events that are in a sequence one after the other, for example because one causes the other.

example.ex: One of the members of the surgical team leaked the story to a fellow physician who, in turn, confided in a reporter.
example.tran: 手术小组的一名成员把这个消息泄露给了在一起工作的一个内科医生，后者又透露给了一位记者。

collins.def: If each person in a group does something in turn, they do it one after the other in a fixed or agreed order.

example.ex: There were cheers for each of the women as they spoke in turn.
example.tran: 当这些女人们逐一发言时，她们每个人都赢得了喝彩声。

collins.def: If someone is of a particular turn of mind, they have that kind of mind or character.

example.ex: She was of a rational turn of mind.
example.tran: 她是个理性的人。

collins.def: If you speak out of turn or talk out of turn, you say something that you do not have the right or authority to say.

example.ex: I hope I haven't spoken out of turn.
example.tran: 希望我没有多嘴。

collins.def: If a person, animal, or vehicle has a good turn of speed, they have the ability to move fast.
If two or more people take turns to do something, or in British English take it in turns to do something, they do it one after the other several times, rather than doing it together.

example.ex: We took turns to drive the car...
example.tran: 我们轮流开车。

example.ex: Ted and I took it in turns to go into hospital and sit with Emma.
example.tran: 我和特德轮流去医院陪护埃玛。

collins.def: If a situation takes a turn for the worse, it suddenly becomes worse. If a situation takes a turn for the better, it suddenly becomes better.

example.ex: Her condition took a sharp turn for the worse.
example.tran: 她的病情突然急剧恶化。

collins.def: Twelve is the number 12.
Twenty is the number 20.

collins.tran: (20 至 29 之间的数字)二十几
collins.def: When you talk about the twenties, you are referring to numbers between 20 and 29. For example, if you are in your twenties, you are aged between 20 and 29. If the temperature is in the twenties, the temperature is between 20 and 29 degrees.

example.ex: They're both in their twenties and both married with children of their own.
example.tran: 他们俩都二十几岁，都已经结婚生子了。

collins.tran: 二十世纪二十年代(1920 至 1929 年间)
collins.def: The twenties is the decade between 1920 and 1929.

example.ex: It was written in the Twenties, but it still really stands out.
example.tran: 它写于20世纪20年代，但直到今天仍然备受瞩目。

collins.def: If something happens twice, there are two actions or events of the same kind.

example.ex: He visited me twice that fall and called me on the telephone often...
example.tran: 那年秋天他来看过我两次，而且经常给我打电话。

example.ex: The government has twice declined to back the scheme…
example.tran: 政府已两次拒绝支持该方案。

collins.tran: (表示频率)每天两次/一周两次
collins.def: You use twice in expressions such as twice a day and twice a week to indicate that two events or actions of the same kind happen in each day or week.

example.ex: I phoned twice a day, leaving messages with his wife...
example.tran: 我每天打两次电话，托他妻子捎口信。

example.ex: This famous horse race has taken place here twice a year since 1310.
example.tran: 这一著名的赛马比赛自 1310 年以来每年在这里举行两次。

collins.def: If one thing is, for example, twice as big or old as another, the first thing is two times as big or old as the second. People sometimes say that one thing is twice as good or hard as another when they want to emphasize that the first thing is much better or harder than the second.

example.ex: The figure of seventy-million pounds was twice as big as expected.
example.tran: 7,000 万英镑的金额是预期的两倍。

example.ex: …a report claiming that teachers could be twice as effective if they returned to traditional classroom methods.
example.tran: 声称教师若重新采用传统课堂讲授方法，授课效果会事半功倍的报告

collins.tran: 重新考虑;慎重考虑;思忖再三
collins.def: If you think twice about doing something, you consider it again and decide not to do it, or decide to do it differently.

example.ex: She'd better shut her mouth and from now on think twice before saying stupid things.
example.tran: 她最好闭上嘴巴，而且今后在说出蠢话之前先过过脑子。

collins.def: Two is the number 2.

collins.tran: 一个巴掌拍不响;双方都有责任
collins.def: If you say it takes two or it takes two to tango, you mean that a situation or argument involves two people and they are both therefore responsible for it.

example.ex: Divorce is never the fault of one partner; it takes two...
example.tran: 离婚从来都不是一方的错误：双方都有责任。

example.ex: It takes two to tango and so far our relationship has been one-sided.
example.tran: 双方都应该努力，可迄今为止我们的关系只是一厢情愿。

collins.def: If you put two and two together, you work out the truth about something for yourself, by using the information that is available to you.

example.ex: Putting two and two together, I assume that this was the car he used.
example.tran: 根据我的了解，我猜想这是他曾开过的车子。

means: 在…的假定表面或掩饰下

collins.def: If a person or thing is under something, they are at a lower level than that thing, and may be covered or hidden by it.

example.ex: They found a labyrinth of tunnels under the ground.
example.tran: 他们发现了一处迷宫似的地道。

example.ex: ...swimming in the pool or lying under an umbrella...
example.tran: 在泳池里游泳或躺在阳伞底下

collins.def: In a place such as a sea, river, or swimming pool, if someone or something is under the water, they are fully in the water and covered by it.

example.ex: They said he'd been held under the water and drowned...
example.tran: 他们说他被按到水里淹死了。

example.ex: Goldfish were swimming lazily in a group just under the surface.
example.tran: 金鱼聚在一起贴着水面懒洋洋地游着。

collins.def: If you go under something, you move from one side to the other of something that is at a higher level than you.

example.ex: He went under a brick arch...
example.tran: 他穿过一个砖砌的拱门。

example.ex: A river boat passed under the bridge.
example.tran: 一条内河船从桥下经过。

collins.tran: 在（尤指一层衣服）的里面（或底下)
collins.def: Something that is under a layer of something, especially clothing, is covered by that layer.

example.ex: I was wearing two sweaters under the green army jacket...
example.tran: 我在绿军装里套了两件毛线衫。

example.ex: He had no shirt on under his thin jumper...
example.tran: 他在薄套头衫里面没有穿衬衣。

collins.def: You can use under before a noun to indicate that a person or thing is being affected by something or is going through a particular process.

example.ex: ...fishermen whose livelihoods are under threat...
example.tran: 生计受到威胁的渔夫

example.ex: I'm rarely under pressure and my co-workers are always nice to me...
example.tran: 我很少感受到压力，同事们一直对我很好。

collins.def: If something happens under particular circumstances or conditions, it happens when those circumstances or conditions exist.

example.ex: His best friend was killed by police under extremely questionable circumstances...
example.tran: 他最好的朋友在极其可疑的情况下被警察打死了。

example.ex: Under normal conditions, only about 20 to 40 per cent of vitamin E is absorbed...
example.tran: 正常情况下，仅有20%到40%的维生素E会被吸收。

collins.tran: 根据，按照，依照（法律、协定、制度等）
collins.def: If something happens under a law, agreement, or system, it happens because that law, agreement, or system says that it should happen.

example.ex: Under law, your employer has the right to hire a temporary worker to replace you...
example.tran: 根据法律规定，你的雇主有权雇用一名临时工来代替你。

example.ex: We believe an offence was committed under EU regulations...
example.tran: 我们认为根据欧盟有关规定已经构成了犯罪。

collins.tran: 在（…领导）下；在（…当政）期间；在（…统治）之下
collins.def: If something happens under a particular person or government, it happens when that person or government is in power.

example.ex: There would be no new taxes under his leadership.
example.tran: 在他主政期间不会增加新税种。

example.ex: ...the realities of life under a brutal dictatorship...
example.tran: 残暴的独裁统治下的生活现实

collins.tran: 在…指导下(学习)；在…手下(工作)
collins.def: If you study or work under a particular person, that person teaches you or tells you what to do.

example.ex: Kiefer was just one of the artists who had studied under Beuys in the early Sixties...
example.tran: 基弗只是60年代早期师从博伊斯的艺术家之一。

example.ex: General Lewis Hyde had served under General 'Billy' Mitchell...
example.tran: 刘易斯·海德将军曾是“比利”·米切尔将军的部下。

collins.tran: 用（…之名）；以（…的名义）；假借（…之名）
collins.def: If you do something under a particular name, you use that name instead of your real name.

example.ex: Were any of your books published under the name Amanda Fairchild?...
example.tran: 你们所出版的书里有署名为阿曼达·费尔柴尔德的吗？

example.ex: The patient was registered under a false name.
example.tran: 那位患者挂号时用了假名。

collins.def: You use under to say which section of a list, book, or system something is in.

example.ex: This study is described under 'General Diseases of the Eye'...
example.tran: “普通眼科疾病”这一部分里对该项研究作了描述。

example.ex: ...a parental rights order under section 4 of the Family Law Reform Act...
example.tran: 《家庭法改革法案》第4款中有关父母权利的规定

collins.tran: （年龄或数量）不足，低于，在…以下
collins.def: If something or someone is under a particular age or amount, they are less than that age or amount.

example.ex: ...jobs for those under 65...
example.tran: 适合65岁以下人群从事的工作

example.ex: Nearly half of mothers with children under five have a job...
example.tran: 孩子不满5岁的妈妈中近一半有工作。

collins.def: If you understand someone or understand what they are saying, you know what they mean.

example.ex: I think you heard and also understand me...
example.tran: 我想你听到了我的话，也明白我的意思。

example.ex: Rusty nodded as though she understood the old woman...
example.tran: 拉斯蒂点点头，好像听懂了那位老妇人的话似的。

collins.def: If you understand a language, you know what someone is saying when they are speaking that language.

example.ex: I couldn't read or understand a word of Yiddish, so I asked him to translate.
example.tran: 我根本不懂意第绪语，所以请他来翻译。

collins.def: To understand someone means to know how they feel and why they behave in the way that they do.

example.ex: It would be nice to have someone who really understood me, a friend...
example.tran: 要是有个真正理解我的人、有个朋友就好了。

example.ex: Trish had not exactly understood his feelings...
example.tran: 特里希并没有完全理解他的感受。

collins.tran: 知道，明白，了解（所发生的事及其原因）
collins.def: You say that you understand something when you know why or how it happens.

example.ex: They are too young to understand what is going on...
example.tran: 他们还太小，不明白发生了什么事。

example.ex: She didn't understand why the TV was kept out of reach of the patients...
example.tran: 她不明白为什么病人不能看电视。

collins.def: If you understand that something is the case, you think it is true because you have heard or read that it is. You can say that something is understood to be the case to mean that people generally think it is true.

example.ex: We understand that she's in the studio recording her second album...
example.tran: 我们听说她正在录音棚录制她的第二张专辑。

example.ex: I understand you've heard about David...
example.tran: 我知道你们已经听说了戴维的事了。

collins.def: If someone is given to understand that something is the case, it is communicated to them that it is the case, usually without them being told directly.

example.ex: I am given to understand that he was swearing throughout the game at our fans.
example.tran: 我得知整场比赛中他一直冲着我方球迷骂个不停。

collins.def: You can use understand in expressions like do you understand? or is that understood? after you have told someone what you want, to make sure that they have understood you and will obey you.

example.ex: You do not hit my grandchildren, do you understand?...
example.tran: 你不准打我的孙子孙女，明白吗？

example.ex: I don't need it, understand?...
example.tran: 我不需要，懂吗？

collins.def: A union is a workers' organization which represents its members and which aims to improve things such as their working conditions and pay.

example.ex: I feel that women in all types of employment can benefit from joining a union.
example.tran: 我认为女性无论从事什么工作，加入工会都是有好处的。

example.ex: ...union officials.
example.tran: 工会官员

collins.def: When the union of two or more things occurs, they are joined together and become one thing.

example.ex: In 1918 the Romanian majority in this former tsarist province voted for union with Romania.
example.tran: 1918年，这个前沙皇统治的省份中占了多数的罗马尼亚人投票赞成与罗马尼亚合并。

collins.def: When two or more things, for example countries or organizations, have been joined together to form one thing, you can refer to them as a union .

example.ex: Tanzania is a union of the states of Tanganyika and Zanzibar.
example.tran: 坦桑尼亚是坦噶尼喀和桑给巴尔两个政体组成的联合国家。

example.ex: ...the question of which countries should join the currency union.
example.tran: 关于哪些国家应该加入货币联盟的问题

collins.def: The marriage of two people is sometimes referred to as a union .

example.ex: Even Louis began to think their union was not blessed in the eyes of God.
example.tran: 就连路易斯都开始认为他们的婚姻并没有受到上帝的祝福。

collins.tran: （用于名称中）俱乐部，协会，联合会
collins.def: Union is used in the name of some clubs, societies, and organizations.

example.ex: The naming of stars is at the discretion of the International Astronomical Union.
example.tran: 给星体命名是由国际天文学联合会决定的。

example.ex: ...the Mothers' Union.
example.tran: 母亲联合会

collins.def: A university is an institution where students study for degrees and where academic research is done.

example.ex: Patrick is now at London University...
example.tran: 帕特里克现在就读于伦敦大学。

example.ex: They want their daughter to go to university, but they are also keen that she get a summer job...
example.tran: 他们想要女儿上大学，但也希望她能打一份暑期工。

collins.def: If something happens until a particular time, it happens during the period before that time and stops at that time.

example.ex: Until 1982 he was senior lecturer in botany at Durham University.
example.tran: 1982年以前他一直是达勒姆大学生物系的高级讲师。

example.ex: ...consumers who have waited until after the Christmas holiday to do that holiday shopping.
example.tran: 等到过完圣诞节才进行节日采购的顾客

collins.tran: （与否定词连用）直到…之前，直到…为止，除非
collins.def: You use until with a negative to emphasize the moment in time after which the rest of your statement becomes true, or the condition which would make it true.

example.ex: The traffic laws don't take effect until the end of the year...
example.tran: 交通法要到年底才生效。

example.ex: It was not until 1911 that the first of the vitamins was identified.
example.tran: 直到1911年才发现了第一种维生素。

collins.def: The value of something such as a quality, attitude, or method is its importance or usefulness. If you place a particular value on something, that is the importance or usefulness you think it has.

example.ex: The value of this work experience should not be underestimated...
example.tran: 这种工作经验的重要性不应该被低估。

example.ex: Further studies will be needed to see if these therapies have any value...
example.tran: 这些治疗是否有效需要进行进一步的研究。

collins.def: If you value something or someone, you think that they are important and you appreciate them.

example.ex: I've done business with Mr Weston before. I value the work he gives me...
example.tran: 我以前和韦斯顿先生有过业务往来，我很重视他给我的业务。

example.ex: If you value your health then you'll start being a little kinder to yourself.
example.tran: 如果你重视自己的健康，你就要开始对自己好一点。

collins.def: The value of something is how much money it is worth.

example.ex: The value of his investment has risen by more than $50,000...
example.tran: 他投入的资本已经增值了5万多美元。

example.ex: The company's market value rose to $5.5 billion...
example.tran: 该公司的市值涨到了55亿美元。

collins.def: When experts value something, they decide how much money it is worth.

example.ex: Your lender will then send their own surveyor to value the property...
example.tran: 然后贷款方会派他们自己的评估员来对房产进行估价。

example.ex: I asked him if he would have my jewellery valued for insurance purposes...
example.tran: 我问他能否给我的珠宝进行保险估价。

collins.def: You use value in certain expressions to say whether something is worth the money that it costs. For example, if something is or gives good value, it is worth the money that it costs.

example.ex: The restaurant is informal, stylish and extremely good value...
example.tran: 这家餐厅氛围轻松，装修雅致，而且价格非常公道。

example.ex: Both offer excellent value at around £90 for a double room...
example.tran: 两家的双人客房都报出了大约90英镑的超值价格。

collins.def: The values of a person or group are the moral principles and beliefs that they think are important.

example.ex: The countries of South Asia also share many common values...
example.tran: 南亚各国也有许多相同的价值观。

example.ex: The Health Secretary called for a return to traditional family values.
example.tran: 卫生部部长呼吁传统家庭价值观的回归。

collins.tran: 重要特点，显著特点（用于其他名词后）
collins.def: Value is used after another noun when mentioning an important or noticeable feature about something.

example.ex: The script has lost all of its shock value over the intervening 24 years...
example.tran: 时隔24年后，这个剧本已经完全失去了震撼力。

example.ex: Having a mid-morning party certainly adds novelty value.
example.tran: 在上午10点左右开派对一定会增加新鲜感。

collins.def: A value is a particular number or quantity that can replace a symbol such as 'x' or 'y' in a mathematical expression.

collins.tran: 很，非常（用于修饰形容词或副词，表示强调）
collins.def: Very is used to give emphasis to an adjective or adverb.

example.ex: The problem and the answer are very simple...
example.tran: 问题和答案都非常简单。

example.ex: It is very, very strong evidence indeed...
example.tran: 这的确是非常非常有力的证据。

collins.def: Not very is used with an adjective or adverb to say that something is not at all true, or that it is true only to a small degree.

example.ex: She's not very impressed with them...
example.tran: 她对他们没什么印象。

example.ex: I'm not very good at explaining myself...
example.tran: 我不太善于为自己辩解。

collins.def: You use very to give emphasis to an adjective that is not usually graded, when you want to say that a quality is very obvious.

example.ex: Janet looked very pregnant...
example.tran: 珍妮特看上去显然是怀孕了。

example.ex: His taste strikes the English as very French...
example.tran: 他的品位让英国人觉得他是个地道的法国人。

collins.tran: 完全，最（用于修饰形容词或副词最高级,表示强调）
collins.def: You use very to give emphasis to a superlative adjective or adverb. For example, if you say that something is the very best, you are emphasizing that it is the best.

example.ex: They will be helped by the very latest in navigation aids...
example.tran: 他们将会受益于最新的导航系统。

example.ex: I am feeling in the very best of spirits...
example.tran: 我感觉自己的精神状态绝佳。

collins.tran: （与某些名词连用，以确指最远的某一位置或时点）极端的
collins.def: You use very with certain nouns in order to specify an extreme position or extreme point in time.

example.ex: At the very back of the yard, several feet from Lenny, was a wooden shack...
example.tran: 在院子的最后面离伦尼几英尺远的地方有一个小木屋。

example.ex: I turned to the very end of the book, to read the final words...
example.tran: 我翻到书的最后一页去读最后的文字。

collins.def: You use very with nouns to emphasize that something is exactly the right one or exactly the same one.

example.ex: Everybody says he is the very man for the case...
example.tran: 每个人都说他是接手这个案子的最佳人选。

example.ex: She died in this very house...
example.tran: 她正是在这间屋子里死去的。

collins.tran: （与名词连用，强调重要性或严重性）仅仅的，唯独的，甚至于，就连
collins.def: You use very with nouns to emphasize the importance or seriousness of what you are saying.

example.ex: At one stage his very life was in danger...
example.tran: 他的生命都曾一度处于危险之中。

example.ex: The very basis of Indian politics has been transformed...
example.tran: 甚至于印度的政治基础都被改变了。

collins.tran: 好的，是（用于表示对上级的指示或命令遵照执行）
collins.def: Very good is used to tell someone in authority that you agree to carry out a suggestion or order.

example.ex: 'Now give me some account of your voyage.' — 'Very good, sir.'
example.tran: “现在给我讲述一下你的航程吧。”——“非常乐意，先生。”

collins.def: The expression very much so is an emphatic way of answering 'yes' to something or saying that it is true or correct.

example.ex: 'Are you enjoying your holiday?' — 'Very much so.'
example.tran: “你的假期过得愉快吗？”——“非常愉快。”

collins.tran: 那好吧，行（用于表示同意或接受，即使不是完全满意）
collins.def: Very well is used to say that you agree to do something or you accept someone's answer, even though you might not be completely satisfied with it.

example.ex: 'We need proof, sir.' Another pause. Then, 'Very well.'...
example.tran: “我们需要证据，先生。”又是一个短暂停顿。然后，“那好吧。”

example.ex: Very well, please yourself.
example.tran: 好的，你自己随意。

collins.def: If you say that you cannot very well do something, you mean that it would not be right or possible to do it.

example.ex: He couldn't very well go to her office and force her to write a check...
example.tran: 他不能去她的办公室强迫她开支票。

example.ex: I said yes. I can't very well say no.
example.tran: 我答应了。我没法拒绝。

collins.def: Your views on something are the beliefs or opinions that you have about it, for example whether you think it is good, bad, right, or wrong.

example.ex: Washington and Moscow are believed to have similar views on Kashmir...
example.tran: 据信华盛顿和莫斯科在克什米尔问题上的看法相似。

example.ex: I take the view that she should be stopped as soon as possible...
example.tran: 我认为应该尽快阻止她。

collins.tran: （对某一问题的）看法，考虑，思量
collins.def: Your view of a particular subject is the way that you understand and think about it.

example.ex: The drama takes an idealistic, even a naive view of the subject...
example.tran: 这部戏在对待这一主题上有些理想化，甚至是天真。

example.ex: The whole point was to get away from a Christian-centred view of religion...
example.tran: 其主旨就是要抛开以基督教为中心的宗教观。

collins.def: If you view something in a particular way, you think of it in that way.

example.ex: First-generation Americans view the United States as a land of golden opportunity...
example.tran: 第一代美国人认为美国是一个充满了机遇的国度。

example.ex: Abigail's mother Linda views her daughter's talent with a mixture of pride and worry...
example.tran: 阿比盖尔的母亲琳达带着一种又骄傲又担忧的复杂情绪看待女儿的才华。

collins.tran: 景观;景色;风景;(尤指）美景
collins.def: The view from a window or high place is everything which can be seen from that place, especially when it is considered to be beautiful.

example.ex: The view from our window was one of beautiful green countryside...
example.tran: 从我们的窗口能看见一片美丽的绿色田园风光。

example.ex: Each of the rooms has a superb view of Pissouri Bay.
example.tran: 每个房间都能将皮苏里湾的美景尽收眼底。

collins.def: If you have a view of something, you can see it.

example.ex: He stood up to get a better view of the blackboard...
example.tran: 为了更清楚地看到黑板上的内容，他站了起来。

example.ex: He stopped in the doorway, blocking her view.
example.tran: 他站在门口，挡住了她的视线。

collins.tran: 在能看得见的地方/在（所有人）视线内
collins.def: You use view in expressions to do with being able to see something. For example, if something is in view, you can see it. If something is in full view of everyone, everyone can see it.

example.ex: She was lying there in full view of anyone who walked by...
example.tran: 她躺在那里，过往的人都能看见她。

example.ex: A group of riders came into view on the dirt road...
example.tran: 一群骑车的人出现在那条土路上。

collins.def: If you view something, you look at it for a particular purpose.

example.ex: They came back to view the house again...
example.tran: 他们又回来查看了一遍房子。

example.ex: Twenty-five thousand mourners passed to view the body.
example.tran: 2.5万名送葬者前来瞻仰死者遗容。

collins.def: If you view a television programme, video, or film, you watch it.

example.ex: We have viewed the video recording of the incident...
example.tran: 我们看过了该事件的录像。

example.ex: 'Elizabeth R', a TV portrait of the Queen, had record viewing figures.
example.tran: 关于女王的电视专题片《伊丽莎白女王》创下了收视纪录。

collins.tran: （文本或图表在计算机屏幕上的）显示方式
collins.def: View refers to the way in which a piece of text or graphics is displayed on a computer screen.

example.ex: To see the current document in full-page view, click the Page Zoom Full button.
example.tran: 要完整显示当前文件，请按“全屏显示”按钮。	PRHASES

collins.tran: 对…评价不高;对…持否定看法
collins.def: If you take a dim view or a poor view of someone or something, you disapprove of them or have a low opinion of them.

example.ex: They took a dim view of local trade unionists...
example.tran: 他们对当地的工会会员们评价很低。

example.ex: The judge took a dim view and I spent six years in prison.
example.tran: 法官对此并不赞成，我因此蹲了6年的监狱。

collins.def: You use in my view when you want to indicate that you are stating a personal opinion, which other people might not agree with.

example.ex: In my view things won't change...
example.tran: 依我看，事情不会改变。

example.ex: There is, in my view, a simple explanation...
example.tran: 在我看来，有一个简单的解释。

collins.def: You use in view of when you are taking into consideration facts that have just been mentioned or are just about to be mentioned.

example.ex: In view of the fact that Hobson was not a trained economist his achievements were remarkable...
example.tran: 考虑到霍布森不是科班出身的经济学家，他可谓是成就非凡。

example.ex: In view of this, the decision may not be easy.
example.tran: 考虑到这点，可能很难作出决定。

collins.def: If you have something in view, you are aware of it and your actions are aimed towards it.

example.ex: They have very clear career aims in view...
example.tran: 他们有非常明确的职业目标。

example.ex: Ackroyd worked out this whole plot with one objective in view.
example.tran: 阿克罗伊德制订出这一整套秘密计划就是为了达到一个目的。

collins.tran: 从长远来看;作长远打算
collins.def: If you take the long view, you consider what is likely to happen in the future over a long period, rather than thinking only about things that are going to happen soon.

example.ex: Some investors are taking the long view...
example.tran: 一些投资者是从长远角度考虑的。

example.ex: Taking a long view of the project, I began to think in terms of the rehearsal schedules required.
example.tran: 为了对这个项目作长远打算，我开始根据要求的排练计划考虑问题。

collins.def: If something such as a work of art is on view, it is shown in public for people to look at.

example.ex: A significant exhibition of contemporary sculpture will be on view at the Portland Gallery.
example.tran: 一场关于当代雕塑的重要展览即将在波特兰美术馆开展。

collins.def: If you do something with a view to doing something else, you do it because you hope it will result in that other thing being done.

example.ex: He has called a meeting of all parties tomorrow, with a view to forming a national reconciliation government.
example.tran: 为了组建一个协调各方利益的全国性联合政府，他已召集所有党派参加明天的会议。

collins.def: If you visit someone, you go to see them and spend time with them.

example.ex: He wanted to visit his brother in Worcester...
example.tran: 他想去看望住在伍斯特的哥哥。

example.ex: He was visited by an old friend from Iraq...
example.tran: 一位来自伊拉克的老朋友来看望他。

collins.def: If you visit a place, you go there for a short time.

example.ex: He'll be visiting four cities including Cagliari in Sardinia...
example.tran: 他将要访问4个城市，包括萨迪尼亚的卡利亚里。

example.ex: Caroline visited all the big stores.
example.tran: 卡罗琳光顾了所有的大型商店。

collins.def: If you visit a website, you look at it.

example.ex: For details visit our website at www.cobuild.collins.co.uk.
example.tran: 欲知详情，请访问我们的网站www.cobuild.collins.co.uk。

collins.tran: 上门咨询（专业人士）;（专业人士）上门服务
collins.def: If you visit a professional person such as a doctor or lawyer, you go and see them in order to get professional advice. If they visit you, they come to see you in order to give you professional advice.

example.ex: If necessary the patient can then visit his doctor for further advice...
example.tran: 如有必要，病人可以上门咨询自己的医生以得到更多的建议。

example.ex: A doctor will visit you in your apartment.
example.tran: 会有医生到您的住所出诊。

collins.def: If something very unpleasant is visited upon you, it happens to you.

example.ex: Violence is visited upon us every day...
example.tran: 暴力事件每天都会降临在我们身上。

example.ex: Death and suffering had been visited on thousands of innocents.
example.tran: 死亡和苦难降临在了数千名无辜的人身上。

collins.def: A vote is a choice made by a particular person or group in a meeting or an election.

example.ex: He walked to the local polling centre to cast his vote...
example.tran: 他走到当地的投票中心投了票。

example.ex: The government got a massive majority — well over 400 votes...
example.tran: 政府获得了远远超过400票赞成的绝大多数票。

collins.def: A vote is an occasion when a group of people make a decision by each person indicating his or her choice. The choice that most people support is accepted by the group.

example.ex: Why do you think we should have a vote on that?...
example.tran: 为什么你认为我们应该对那件事进行表决？

example.ex: They took a vote and decided not to do it.
example.tran: 他们进行了表决，决定放弃。

collins.def: The vote is the total number of votes or voters in an election, or the number of votes received or cast by a particular group.

example.ex: Opposition parties won about fifty-five per cent of the vote...
example.tran: 反对党大约赢得了55％的选票。

example.ex: The vote was overwhelmingly in favour of the Democratic Party.
example.tran: 压倒多数的选票投给了民主党。

collins.def: If you have the vote in an election, or have a vote in a meeting, you have the legal right to indicate your choice.

example.ex: And of course we didn't even have the vote, did we?...
example.tran: 当然了，我们连投票权都没有，不是吗？

example.ex: Before that, women did not have a vote at all...
example.tran: 在那之前，妇女连选举权都没有。

collins.def: When you vote, you indicate your choice officially at a meeting or in an election, for example by raising your hand or writing on a piece of paper.

example.ex: Two-thirds of the national electorate had the chance to vote in these elections...
example.tran: 全国选民的2/3有机会在这些选举中投票。

example.ex: It seems many people would vote for the government, at a general election, if there was a new leader...
example.tran: 如果有一个新领导人的话，大选时似乎许多人都会投票支持政府。

collins.tran: 投…的票；投（赞成或反对）票
collins.def: If you vote a particular political party or leader, or vote yes or no, you make that choice with the vote that you have.

example.ex: 52.5% of those questioned said they'd vote Labour...
example.tran: 52.5％的受访者表示他们会投工党的票。

example.ex: I probably would have voted that way anyway...
example.tran: 无论如何我可能都会那样投票。

collins.tran: （通过投票）决定给予（资助），同意提供（款项）
collins.def: If a government or other organization votes money for something or to do something, they decide to spend the money in that way.

example.ex: The General Court had voted $2,500 for a monument to be erected to his memory...
example.tran: 州议会投票决定拨款2,500美元为他建一座纪念碑。

example.ex: The Parliament voted more funds to help maintain American forces.
example.tran: 国会投票同意拨出更多资金来维持美国军队的开支。

collins.def: If people vote someone a particular title, they choose that person to have that title.

example.ex: His class voted him the man 'who had done the most for Yale.'...
example.tran: 他被班里评选为“为耶鲁作出最大贡献”的人。

example.ex: Michael has been voted Player of the Year.
example.tran: 迈克尔被评为“年度最佳球员”。

collins.tran: 以退席（或退出组织）表示反对
collins.def: If you vote with your feet, you show that you do not support something by leaving the place where it is happening or leaving the organization that is supporting it.

example.ex: Thousands of citizens are already voting with their feet, and leaving the country...
example.tran: 成千上万的公民正准备离开这个国家，以这一举动表示反对。

example.ex: Authors still have power to vote with their feet by leaving to join smaller companies.
example.tran: 作者依然可以通过退出并加盟规模小些的公司来表明他们的反对立场。

collins.def: If you say 'vote that' a particular thing should happen, you are suggesting that this is what should happen.

example.ex: I vote that we all go to Holland immediately...
example.tran: 我建议我们全都立刻前往荷兰。

example.ex: I vote that you try to pick out the trail for us.
example.tran: 我提议由你来选我们该走哪条小路。

collins.def: One man one vote or one person one vote is a system of voting in which every person in a group or country has the right to cast their vote, and in which each individual's  vote is counted and has equal value.

example.ex: Mr Gould called for a move towards 'one man one vote'...
example.tran: 古尔德先生号召采取“一人一票制”。

example.ex: The African National Congress insists on a one-man, one-vote system.
example.tran: 非洲国民大会坚持实行一人一票的制度。

collins.def: When you wait for something or someone, you spend some time doing very little, because you cannot act until that thing happens or that person arrives.

example.ex: I walk to a street corner and wait for the school bus...
example.tran: 我走到街角等校车。

example.ex: Stop waiting for things to happen. Make them happen...
example.tran: 不要坐等事情发生。要创造条件让它们发生。

collins.def: A wait is a period of time in which you do very little, before something happens or before you can do something.

example.ex: ...the four-hour wait for the organizers to declare the result.
example.tran: 组织者宣布结果之前长达4小时的等待

collins.tran: 准备妥当;可获得;可使用
collins.def: If something is waiting for you, it is ready for you to use, have, or do.

example.ex: There'll be a car waiting for you...
example.tran: 会有辆汽车等你。

example.ex: When we came home we had a meal waiting for us...
example.tran: 我们到家时，有一顿美餐正等着我们享用。

collins.def: If you say that something can wait, you mean that it is not important or urgent and so you will deal with it or do it later.

example.ex: I want to talk to you, but it can wait...
example.tran: 我想和你谈谈，但可以晚点再说。

example.ex: Any changes will have to wait until sponsors can be found.
example.tran: 任何改变都要等找到赞助商之后再作决定。

collins.def: You can use wait when you are trying to make someone feel excited, or to encourage or threaten them.

example.ex: If you think this all sounds very exciting, just wait until you read the book...
example.tran: 如果你觉得所有这些听起来令人兴奋，那就等着去读这本书吧。

example.ex: As soon as you get some food inside you, you'll feel more cheerful. Just you wait.
example.tran: 吃点儿东西你就会打起精神的。等着瞧吧。

collins.def: Wait is used in expressions such as wait a minute ,wait a second, and wait a moment to interrupt someone when they are speaking, for example because you object to what they are saying or because you want them to repeat something.

example.ex: 'Wait a minute!' he broke in. 'This is not giving her a fair hearing!'
example.tran: “等一下，”他插嘴说，“这没有给她一个公平的解释机会！”

collins.def: If an employee waits on you, for example in a restaurant or hotel, they take orders from you and bring you what you want.

example.ex: There were plenty of servants to wait on her...
example.tran: 有很多仆人服侍她。

example.ex: Each student is expected to wait at table for one week each semester.
example.tran: 每学期每个学生都要在餐厅服务一周。

collins.def: If you say that you can't wait to do something or can hardly wait to do it, you are emphasizing that you are very excited about it and eager to do it.

example.ex: We can't wait to get started...
example.tran: 我们迫不及待地想开始。

example.ex: It's gonna be great. I can hardly wait...
example.tran: 那一定很棒。我都等不及了。

collins.tran: (让人在命令下达前勿提前做某事)等一等
collins.def: You say 'wait for it' to stop someone from doing something too soon because you have not yet given them the command to do it.

example.ex: Arms bend. Arms upward. Wait for it. Stretch.
example.tran: 手臂弯曲。手臂上举。保持一下。伸展。

collins.tran: (表示接下来要说的内容非常有趣或令人惊奇)注意了，听好了
collins.def: You can use 'wait for it' to indicate that you are about to say something that is amusing or surprising.

example.ex: A cool $500,000 is to be spent on obtaining genuine 17th-century air from the inside of, wait for it, an occupied lead coffin.
example.tran: 将花费整整50万美元获取货真价实的17世纪的空气，注意了，是从一个内有尸体的铅制棺材里获得。

collins.def: If you tell someone to wait and see, you tell them that they must be patient or that they must not worry about what is going to happen in the future because they have no control over it.

example.ex: We'll have to wait and see what happens.
example.tran: 我们只好等等看将会发生什么。

example.ex: ...a wait-and-see attitude.
example.tran: 观望态度

collins.def: If you say to someone 'What are you waiting for?' you are telling them to hurry up and do something.

example.ex: Well, what are you waiting for? Do I have to ask you for a kiss?
example.tran: 那你还等什么呢？难道要我求你吻我吗？

collins.def: When you walk, you move forward by putting one foot in front of the other in a regular way.

example.ex: Rosanna and Forbes walked in silence for some while...
example.tran: 罗莎娜和福布斯默不作声地走了一会儿。

example.ex: We walked into the foyer...
example.tran: 我们走进门厅。

collins.def: A walk is a journey that you make by walking, usually for pleasure.

example.ex: I went for a walk...
example.tran: 我去散步了。

example.ex: He often took long walks in the hills.
example.tran: 他经常在山中久久漫步。

collins.def: A walk of a particular distance is the distance which a person has to walk to get somewhere.

example.ex: It was only a three-mile walk to Kabul from there...
example.tran: 从那里到喀布尔只需走上3英里。

example.ex: The church is a short walk from Piazza Dante.
example.tran: 教堂离但丁广场只有几步之遥。

collins.tran: 步行小径;(适宜散步的)小径，道路
collins.def: A walk is a route suitable for walking along for pleasure.

example.ex: There is a 2 mile coastal walk from Craster to Newton.
example.tran: 从克拉斯特到牛顿有一条两英里的海滨小径。

collins.def: A walk is the action of walking rather than running.

example.ex: She slowed to a steady walk.
example.tran: 她放慢脚步，徐徐而行。

collins.def: Someone's walk is the way that they walk.

example.ex: George, despite his great height and gangling walk, was a keen dancer.
example.tran: 乔治尽管长得过高，走路姿势难看，但却热衷于跳舞。

collins.def: If you walk someone somewhere, you walk there with them in order to show politeness or to make sure that they get there safely.

example.ex: She walked me to my car...
example.tran: 她陪我走到我的车旁。

example.ex: 'What a nice gentleman you are, to walk Hilary home,' her mother said.
example.tran: “您能送希拉里走回家，真是一位绅士，”她的母亲说道。

collins.def: If you walk your dog, you take it for a walk in order to keep it healthy.

example.ex: I walk my dog each evening around my local streets.
example.tran: 我每晚在家附近的街道上遛狗。

collins.def: A wall is one of the vertical sides of a building or room.

example.ex: Kathryn leaned against the wall of the church...
example.tran: 凯瑟琳倚靠在教堂的墙上。

example.ex: The bedroom walls would be painted light blue...
example.tran: 卧室的墙壁会被漆成浅蓝色。

collins.def: A wall is a long narrow vertical structure made of stone or brick that surrounds or divides an area of land.

example.ex: He sat on the wall in the sun...
example.tran: 他坐在墙上晒太阳。

example.ex: The well is surrounded by a wall only 12 inches high.
example.tran: 井台只有12英寸高。

collins.def: The wall of something that is hollow is its side.

example.ex: He ran his fingers along the inside walls of the box.
example.tran: 他用手指摸了摸盒子的内壁。

collins.tran: 屏障;堆成墙的大量物品
collins.def: A wall of something is a large amount of it forming a high vertical barrier.

example.ex: She gazed at the wall of books...
example.tran: 她目不转睛地盯着书墙。

example.ex: I was just hit by a wall of water.
example.tran: 我刚撞上了一堵水墙。

collins.def: You can describe something as a wall of a particular kind when it acts as a barrier and prevents people from understanding something.

example.ex: The police say they met the usual wall of silence...
example.tran: 警方称他们像往常一样碰了壁，没人吭气。

example.ex: Despite its prevalence, schizophrenia has existed behind a wall of secrecy for years.
example.tran: 尽管精神分裂症患者为数众多，但多年来这种病一直被捂着掩着。

collins.def: If you say that you are banging your head against a wall, you are emphasizing that you are frustrated because someone is stopping you from making progress in something.

example.ex: I appealed for help but felt I was always banging my head against a wall...
example.tran: 我寻求帮助，却发现自己处处碰壁。

example.ex: I wondered if I was banging my head against a brick wall.
example.tran: 我怀疑自己是不是在把鸡蛋往石头上碰，徒劳无益。

collins.tran: 处于困境（或绝境);走投无路
collins.def: If you have your back to the wall, you are in a very difficult situation and can see no way out of it.

example.ex: Their threat to hire replacement workers has the union with its back to the wall.
example.tran: 他们威胁说要雇用替工，这使工会陷入了困境。

collins.def: If you say that you are climbing the walls, you are emphasizing that you feel very frustrated, nervous, or anxious.

example.ex: Sitting at home would only have had him climbing the walls with frustration.
example.tran: 呆在家里只会让他沮丧得抓狂。

collins.tran: 把…逼得发疯；逼得…受不了
collins.def: If you say that something or someone is driving you up the wall, you are emphasizing that they annoy and irritate you.

example.ex: The heat is driving me up the wall...
example.tran: 炎热快把我逼疯了。

example.ex: I sang in the bath and drove my parents up the wall.
example.tran: 我在浴室里唱歌，我父母快受不了了。

collins.def: If a person or company goes to the wall, they lose all their money and their business fails.

example.ex: Even quite big companies are going to the wall these days.
example.tran: 现如今甚至有些大公司也濒临破产。

collins.def: If you want something, you feel a desire or a need for it.

example.ex: I want a drink...
example.tran: 我想喝点什么。

example.ex: Ian knows exactly what he wants in life...
example.tran: 伊恩很清楚他需要什么样的生活。

collins.def: You can say that you want to say something to indicate that you are about to say it.

example.ex: I want to say how really delighted I am that you're having a baby...
example.tran: 我想说你怀孕了我有多高兴。

example.ex: Look, I wanted to apologize for today. I think I was a little hard on you.
example.tran: 听我说，我想就今天的事向你道歉。我觉得我对你有点过于苛刻了。

collins.tran: (用于疑问句中表示提议或邀请)想要，需要
collins.def: You use want in questions as a way of making an offer or inviting someone to do something.

example.ex: Do you want another cup of coffee?...
example.tran: 你想再来一杯咖啡吗？

example.ex: Do you want to leave your bike here?
example.tran: 你想把自行车停在这里吗？

collins.def: If you say to someone that you want something, or ask them if they want to do it, you are firmly telling them what you want or what you want them to do.

example.ex: I want an explanation from you, Jeremy...
example.tran: 杰里米，我需要你解释一下。

example.ex: If you have a problem with that, I want you to tell me right now...
example.tran: 如果你有异议，我要你马上告诉我。

collins.def: If you say that something wants doing, you think that it needs to be done.

example.ex: The windows wanted cleaning...
example.tran: 窗户该擦了。

example.ex: Her hair wants cutting.
example.tran: 她该剪头发了。

collins.def: If you tell someone that they want to do a particular thing, you are advising them to do it.

example.ex: You want to be very careful not to have a man like Crevecoeur for an enemy...
example.tran: 你应当格外小心，别与克雷弗克这样的人为敌。

example.ex: You want to look where you're going, mate.
example.tran: 伙计，你应当看看你要去哪里。

collins.def: If someone is wanted by the police, the police are searching for them because they are thought to have committed a crime.

example.ex: They were wanted by the police...
example.tran: 他们被警方通缉。

example.ex: He has killed many in his time, and is wanted in at least three countries...
example.tran: 他那个时候杀了很多人，现在至少有3个国家在通缉他。

collins.def: If you want someone, you have a great desire to have sex with them.

example.ex: Come on, darling. I want you.
example.tran: 亲爱的，过来。我想要你。

collins.def: If a child is wanted, its mother or another person loves it and is willing to look after it.

example.ex: Children should be wanted and planned...
example.tran: 应当好好照看孩子，并为他们规划一生。

example.ex: I want this baby very much, because it certainly will be the last.
example.tran: 我很爱这个小宝贝，因为它肯定是我最后一个孩子了。

collins.def: If someone wants you in a particular place or role, they desire you to be in that place or role.

example.ex: Albie wants you in his office...
example.tran: 阿尔比要你去他办公室。

example.ex: They didn't want her as attorney general...
example.tran: 他们不想要她做司法部长。

collins.def: A want of something is a lack of it.

example.ex: ...a want of manners and charm...
example.tran: 缺乏风度和魅力

example.ex: The men were daily becoming weaker from want of rest.
example.tran: 由于缺乏休息，这些男人日渐虚弱。

collins.def: Want is the state of being extremely poor.

example.ex: He said they were fighting for freedom of speech, freedom of worship, and freedom from want.
example.tran: 他说他们在为言论自由而战，为信仰自由而战，为远离贫困而战。

collins.def: Your wants are the things that you want.

example.ex: She couldn't lift a spoon without a servant anticipating her wants and getting it for her...
example.tran: 要是没有仆人事先想她所想并为她准备妥当，她连汤匙也举不起来。

example.ex: Supermarkets often claim that they are responding to the wants of consumers by providing packaged foods.
example.tran: 超市经常声称他们根据消费者的需要提供包装食品。

collins.def: If you do something for want of something else, you do it because the other thing is not available or not possible.

example.ex: Many of them had gone into teaching for want of anything better to do...
example.tran: 因为没有更好的工作，他们当中很多人做了教师。

example.ex: There was another emotion, and for want of a better word he called it grief.
example.tran: 还有一种情感，由于找不到更好的字眼来描绘，他称它为悲痛。

collins.def: You say if you want when you are making or agreeing to an offer or suggestion in a casual way.

example.ex: Mary says you're welcome to stay the night if you want...
example.tran: 玛丽说如果你愿意，可以在这儿呆一宿。

example.ex: 'Do you want to go through it all?' — 'Yeah, if you want.'
example.tran: “你想把它都看完吗？”——“是的，如果你愿意的话。”

collins.def: People sometimes say 'I don't want to be rude', for example, or 'without wanting to be rude' as a way of apologizing or warning you when they are going to say something which might upset, annoy, or worry you.

example.ex: 'I don't want to appear big-headed,' explains Loubet, 'but I would say there is a 95% chance of success.'...
example.tran: “我并不想显得自大，”劳伯特解释说，“但我有95%的成功把握。”

example.ex: Without wanting to sound mean about it, these things all have to come from a budget.
example.tran: 我并不想显得小气，但所有这些东西都必须从预算中开支。

collins.tran: (粗暴或生气地问)你想干什么？
collins.def: If you say to someone 'what do you want?', you are asking them in a rather rude or angry way why they have come to the place where you are or why they want to speak to you.

example.ex: 'What do you want!' she whispered savagely. 'Get out.'...
example.tran: “你想干什么！”她粗野地低语道，“滚开。”

example.ex: 'Bernie's been on the phone.' — 'What does he want?'
example.tran: “伯尼来过电话。”——“他想干什么？”

collins.def: A war is a period of fighting or conflict between countries or states.

example.ex: He spent part of the war in the National Guard...
example.tran: 战争期间，他在国民警卫队呆过一段时间。

example.ex: ...matters of war and peace...
example.tran: 战争与和平的问题

collins.tran: (国家或组织之间的)经济竞争
collins.def: War is intense economic competition between countries or organizations.

example.ex: The most important thing is to reach an agreement and to avoid a trade war.
example.tran: 最重要的是达成协议，避免贸易战。

collins.def: If you make war on someone or something that you are opposed to, you do things to stop them succeeding.

example.ex: She has been involved in the war against organised crime.
example.tran: 她参与了打击有组织犯罪的斗争。

example.ex: ...if the United States is to be successful in its war on drugs.
example.tran: 如果美国想在反毒斗争中获得胜利…

collins.def: If someone has been in the wars, they have been injured, for example in a fight or in an accident.

example.ex: Ben has also been in the wars. He is still in plaster after breaking a leg.
example.tran: 本也受了伤。他摔断了一条腿，现在还打着石膏。

collins.def: If a country goes to war, it starts fighting a war.

example.ex: Do you think this crisis can be settled without going to war?
example.tran: 你认为这场危机能和平解决吗？

collins.def: If two people, countries, or organizations have a war of words, they criticize each other because they strongly disagree about something.

example.ex: Animal rights activists have been engaged in an increasingly bitter war of words with many of the nation's zoos.
example.tran: 动物权利保护者和该国多家动物园展开了越来越激烈的论战。

collins.def: Water is a clear thin liquid that has no colour or taste when it is pure. It falls from clouds as rain and enters rivers and seas. All animals and people need water in order to live.

example.ex: Get me a glass of water.
example.tran: 给我杯水。

example.ex: ...the sound of water hammering on the metal roof.
example.tran: 雨水敲打金属屋顶发出的声响

collins.def: You use waters to refer to a large area of sea, especially the area of sea which is near to a country and which is regarded as belonging to it.

example.ex: The ship will remain outside Chinese territorial waters.
example.tran: 这艘船将继续呆在中国领海之外。

example.ex: ...the open waters of the Arctic Ocean.
example.tran: 北冰洋的公共海域

collins.def: You sometimes use waters to refer to a situation which is very complex or difficult.

example.ex: ...the man brought in to guide him through troubled waters...
example.tran: 被请来帮助他渡过难关的人

example.ex: The British Government may be in stormy economic waters.
example.tran: 英国政府可能陷入了动荡的经济困境中。

collins.def: If you water plants, you pour water over them in order to help them to grow.

example.ex: He went out to water the plants.
example.tran: 他出去给植物浇水。

collins.def: If your eyes water, tears build up in them because they are hurting or because you are upset.

example.ex: His eyes watered from cigarette smoke.
example.tran: 他的眼睛被香烟熏得直流泪。

collins.def: If you say that your mouth is watering, you mean that you can smell or see some nice food and you might mean that your mouth is producing a liquid.

example.ex: ...cookies to make your mouth water.
example.tran: 令人垂涎的饼干

collins.tran: （孕妇）羊水破裂;（医生或接生员）给（孕妇）破羊水
collins.def: When a pregnant woman's waters break, the fluid in her womb that surrounds the baby passes out of her body, showing that the baby is ready to be born. A doctor or midwife can break a woman's waters so that the birth can begin.

example.ex: My waters broke at six in the morning and within four hours Jamie was born.
example.tran: 我是凌晨6点破水的，不到4个小时杰米就出生了。

collins.tran: 泼出之水;不可改变的既成事实;无法挽回的过去
collins.def: If you say that an event or incident is water under the bridge, you mean that it has happened and cannot now be changed, so there is no point in worrying about it any more.

example.ex: He was relieved his time in jail was over and regarded it as water under the bridge.
example.tran: 他为服刑期满而感到如释重负，而且觉得既已无可更改，过去的就让它过去吧。

collins.def: If you are in deep water, you are in a difficult or awkward situation.

example.ex: You certainly seem to be in deep water...
example.tran: 你看起来无疑是陷入了困境。

example.ex: I could tell that we were getting off the subject and into deep water.
example.tran: 我觉得我们在跑题并已陷入尴尬境地。

collins.tran: (论点或理论)符合逻辑，站得住脚，经得起考验
collins.def: If an argument or theory does not hold water, it does not seem to be reasonable or be in accordance with the facts.

example.ex: This argument simply cannot hold water in Europe.
example.tran: 这个论点在欧洲根本就站不住脚。

collins.def: If you are in hot water, you are in trouble.

example.ex: The company has already been in hot water over high prices this year.
example.tran: 这家公司今年由于价格过高已经陷入困境。

collins.def: If you pour cold water on an idea or suggestion, you show that you have a low opinion of it.

example.ex: City economists pour cold water on the idea that the economic recovery has begun.
example.tran: 伦敦金融城的经济学家给经济开始复苏的说法泼了冷水。

collins.def: If you test the water or test the waters, you try to find out what reaction an action or idea will get before you do it or tell it to people.

example.ex: You should be cautious when getting involved and test the water before committing yourself.
example.tran: 参与其中时一定要小心谨慎，表态之前最好试探一下。

collins.def: If you refer to a way of doing something, you are referring to how you can do it, for example the action you can take or the method you can use to achieve it.

example.ex: Freezing isn't a bad way of preserving food...
example.tran: 冷冻不失为一种保存食物的好方法。

example.ex: Another way of making new friends is to go to an evening class...
example.tran: 另一种交友的办法就是去上夜校。

collins.def: If you talk about the way someone does something, you are talking about the qualities their action has.

example.ex: She smiled in a friendly way...
example.tran: 她友好地笑了笑。

example.ex: He had a strange way of talking...
example.tran: 他说话的方式怪怪的。

collins.def: If a general statement or description is true in a particular way, this is the form of it that is true in a particular case.

example.ex: Computerized reservation systems help airline profits in several ways...
example.tran: 电子订票系统通过多种方式帮助航空公司获利。

example.ex: She was afraid in a way that was quite new to her...
example.tran: 她感到从未有过的害怕。

collins.def: You use way in expressions such as in some ways ,in many ways, and in every way to indicate the degree or extent to which a statement is true.

example.ex: In some ways, the official opening is a formality...
example.tran: 从某些方面来说，正式的开幕仪式只不过是走个形式。

example.ex: She described her lover as 'perfect in every way'.
example.tran: 她形容她的爱人“各方面完美至极”。

collins.def: The ways of a particular person or group of people are their customs or their usual behaviour.

example.ex: He denounces people who urge him to alter his ways...
example.tran: 他指责那些督促他改变习惯的人。

example.ex: I think you've been too long in Cornwall. You've forgotten the ways of the city...
example.tran: 我认为你们在康沃尔呆的太久了，已经忘记了城市的生活方式。

collins.def: If you refer to someone's way, you are referring to their usual or preferred type of behaviour.

example.ex: She is now divorced and, in her usual resourceful way, has started her own business...
example.tran: 如今她离了婚。一贯足智多谋的她已开始自己创业。

example.ex: Direct confrontation was not his way.
example.tran: 正面冲突不是他的风格。

collins.def: You use way to refer to one particular opinion or interpretation of something, when others are possible.

example.ex: I suppose that's one way of looking at it...
example.tran: 我想那是其中的一种看法。

example.ex: With most of Dylan's lyrics, however, there are other ways of interpreting the words...
example.tran: 但是，迪伦的大多数歌词都有其他的解读方式。

collins.tran: 可能的后果;可能作出的决定
collins.def: You use way when mentioning one of a number of possible, alternative results or decisions.

example.ex: There is no indication which way the vote could go...
example.tran: 没有迹象表明投票结果会怎样。

example.ex: The judge could have decided either way.
example.tran: 两种结果法官怎样判都有可能。

collins.def: The way you feel about something is your attitude to it or your opinion about it.

example.ex: I'm terribly sorry — I had no idea you felt that way.
example.tran: 我非常抱歉——没有想到你是那样想的。

collins.def: If you mention the way that something happens, you are mentioning the fact that it happens.

example.ex: I hate the way he manipulates people...
example.tran: 我讨厌他摆布别人。

example.ex: You may remember the way each scene ended with someone looking pensive or significant.
example.tran: 你或许还记得，每一场的结尾要么是某人作沉思状，要么是某人故作深沉。

collins.def: You use way in expressions such as push your way ,work your way, or eat your way, followed by a prepositional phrase or adverb, in order to indicate movement, progress, or force as well as the action described by the verb.

example.ex: She thrust her way into the crowd...
example.tran: 她挤进了人群。

example.ex: He thought we were trying to buy our way into his company...
example.tran: 他以为我们是想通过贿赂进入他的公司。

collins.def: The way somewhere consists of the different places that you go through or the route that you take in order to get there.

example.ex: Does anybody know the way to the bathroom?...
example.tran: 有谁知道洗手间在哪里吗？

example.ex: I'm afraid I can't remember the way...
example.tran: 我恐怕不记得路了。

collins.def: If you go or look a particular way, you go or look in that direction.

example.ex: As he strode into the kitchen, he passed Pop coming the other way...
example.tran: 他大步走进厨房，与迎面而来的爸爸擦身而过。

example.ex: They paused at the top of the stairs, doubtful as to which way to go next...
example.tran: 他们在楼梯顶部停住了，不知道接下来该往哪边走。

collins.def: You can refer to the direction you are travelling in as your way .

example.ex: It's not very far out of his way...
example.tran: 就在他走的路上不远处。

example.ex: She would say she was going my way and offer me a lift.
example.tran: 她会说和我同路，可以载我一程。

collins.def: If you lose your way, you take a wrong or unfamiliar route, so that you do not know how to get to the place that you want to go to. If you find your way, you manage to get to the place that you want to go to.

example.ex: The men lost their way in a sandstorm and crossed the border by mistake...
example.tran: 那些人在沙尘暴中迷了路，不小心穿越了边境。

example.ex: They've changed a lot of the old street names, and people can't find their way anymore.
example.tran: 许多老的街道名都被改了，人们再也找不到原来的路了。

collins.def: You talk about people going their different ways in order to say that their lives develop differently and they have less contact with each other.

example.ex: It wasn't until we each went our separate ways that I began to learn how to do things for myself...
example.tran: 直到大家各奔东西，我才开始学着自力更生。

example.ex: You go your way and I'll go mine.
example.tran: 你走你的阳关道，我过我的独木桥。

collins.def: If something comes your way, you get it or receive it.

example.ex: Take advantage of the opportunities coming your way in a couple of months...
example.tran: 把握住这几个月之内你可能获得的机会。

example.ex: If I run into anything that might interest you, I'll send it your way.
example.tran: 如果我碰上你可能感兴趣的东西，我就给你寄过去。

collins.def: If someone or something is in the way, they prevent you from moving forward or seeing clearly.

example.ex: 'You're standing in the way,' she said. 'Would you mind moving aside'...
example.tran: “你挡着道了，”她说，“麻烦你让一下。”

example.ex: Get out of my way!
example.tran: 滚开！

collins.def: Way is used in the names of some roads, and also in the names of some long paths for walkers in the countryside.

example.ex: Silvertown Way, was that the road?
example.tran: 锡尔弗敦路，是这条路么？

example.ex: ...the well-trodden 250-mile Pennine Way.
example.tran: 长250英里、人来人往的奔宁路

collins.tran: （某人居住地的）周边；特定的地区
collins.def: You can use way to refer to the area near where someone lives or near a specified place.

example.ex: If you speak standard English anywhere round our way, people tend to view you with suspicion.
example.tran: 如果你在我们这里说标准英语，大家就会对你产生怀疑。

example.ex: ...somebody from Newcastle way.
example.tran: 从纽卡斯尔那边来的人

collins.def: You use way in expressions such as the right way up and the other way around to refer to one of two or more possible positions or arrangements that something can have.

example.ex: The flag was held the wrong way up by some spectators...
example.tran: 一些观众把旗子拿倒了。

example.ex: It's important to fit it the right way round.
example.tran: 将它安到正确位置上很重要。

collins.def: You can use way to emphasize, for example, that something is a great distance away or is very much below or above a particular level or amount.

example.ex: Way down in the valley to the west is the town of Freiburg...
example.tran: 从这里往西远远的山谷中是弗赖堡镇。

example.ex: These exam results are way above average...
example.tran: 这些考试成绩远高于平均水平。

collins.def: If you split something a number of ways, you divide it into a number of different parts or quantities, usually fairly equal in size.

example.ex: The region was split three ways, between Greece, Serbia and Bulgaria...
example.tran: 这一地区被希腊、塞尔维亚和保加利亚分成了3部分。

example.ex: Splitting the price six ways had still cost them each a bundle.
example.tran: 即使把价钱平摊成6份，每人也还是要花一大笔钱。

collins.def: Way is used in expressions such as a long way ,a little way, and quite a way, to say how far away something is or how far you have travelled.

example.ex: Some of them live in places quite a long way from here...
example.tran: 他们中有些人住的地方离这里很远。

example.ex: A little way further down the lane we passed the driveway to a house...
example.tran: 顺着巷子再走过去一点，我们经过车道来到一幢房子前。

collins.def: Way is used in expressions such as a long way ,a little way, and quite a way, to say how far away in time something is.

example.ex: Success is still a long way off...
example.tran: 离成功还远着呢。

example.ex: August is still an awfully long way away.
example.tran: 离8月还早着呢。

collins.tran: (表示动作完成的程度)全部/多半/一半
collins.def: You use way in expressions such as all the way ,most of the way and half the way to refer to the extent to which an action has been completed.

example.ex: He had unscrewed the caps most of the way...
example.tran: 他已经快把螺丝帽拧下来了。

example.ex: When was the last time you listened to an album all the way through?
example.tran: 你上一次完整地听完一张专辑是什么时候？

collins.def: If something is across the way, it is nearby on the opposite side of a road or area.

example.ex: ...the big gabled house across the way.
example.tran: 街对面那座带三角屋顶的大房子

collins.def: You use all the way to emphasize how long a distance is.

example.ex: He had to walk all the way home...
example.tran: 他不得不一路步行回家。

example.ex: That dress came all the way from New York.
example.tran: 那条裙子是大老远从纽约送来的。

collins.def: You can use all the way to emphasize that your remark applies to every part of a situation, activity, or period of time.

example.ex: Having started a revolution we must go all the way...
example.tran: 既然已经发动了革命，我们就一定要进行到底。

example.ex: I'll support him all the way.
example.tran: 我自始至终都会支持他。

collins.def: You can use as is the way to say that a particular situation or example of behaviour is typical and you would not expect it to be different.

example.ex: As is the way with these gatherings, the declarations were largely drafted before the delegations arrived.
example.tran: 就像通常的这种集会一样，宣言内容在代表团到达之前就差不多拟好了。

collins.def: If you say that someone is in a bad way, you mean that they are very ill or unhealthy.

example.ex: He's in a bad way, but able to talk.
example.tran: 他病得很重，但还能说话。

collins.def: If you say that something exists, happens, or develops in a big way, you are emphasizing its great extent or importance.

example.ex: The man who took over a few weeks later has also helped further her career in a big way...
example.tran: 几周后上台的那个人也帮助她把事业推进了一大步。

example.ex: Soccer in the States has never taken off in a big way.
example.tran: 足球在美国从来就没获得过大发展。

collins.def: If someone says that you can't have it both ways, they are telling you that you have to choose between two things and cannot do or have them both.

example.ex: Countries cannot have it both ways: the cost of a cleaner environment may sometimes be fewer jobs in dirty industries...
example.tran: 各国不可能两全其美：环境更清洁的代价有时可能就是污染企业就业岗位的减少。

example.ex: Make up your mind, you can't have it both ways.
example.tran: 你决定吧，反正鱼与熊掌不可兼得。

collins.def: You say by the way when you add something to what you are saying, especially something that you have just thought of.

example.ex: The name Latifah, by the way, means 'delicate'...
example.tran: 顺便说一句，Latifah 这个名字意思是“娇嫩”。

example.ex: By the way, how did your seminar go?
example.tran: 对了，你的研讨会进行得怎样？

collins.def: You use by way of when you are explaining the purpose of something that you have said or are about to say. For example, if you say something by way of an introduction, you say it as an introduction.

example.ex: By way of contrast, Manchester United will travel slightly more than 1,200 miles...
example.tran: 相比而言，曼联队的行程将略多于1,200英里。

example.ex: 'I get very superstitious about things like that,' she said by way of explanation.
example.tran: “在那种事儿上我会很迷信，”她解释道。

collins.def: If you do something by way of a particular method, you use that method to do it.

example.ex: I teach psychology by way of a range of traditional lectures, practicals and tutorials.
example.tran: 我采用传统授课与实践和指导相结合的方式教授心理学。

collins.def: If you go somewhere by way of a particular place, you go through that place in order to get to where you want.

example.ex: The path goes under the river by way of the tunnel.
example.tran: 这条通道经隧道从河下经过。

collins.def: If someone changes their ways or mends their ways, they permanently improve their behaviour or their way of doing something.

example.ex: What can be done to encourage convicted offenders to change their ways?
example.tran: 怎样才能激励这些罪犯洗心革面呢？

collins.def: If you clear the way ,open the way, or prepare the way for something, you create an opportunity for it to happen.

example.ex: The talks are meant to clear the way for formal negotiations on a new constitution...
example.tran: 会谈旨在为新宪法的正式商讨扫清道路。

example.ex: The decision could open the way for other children to sue their parents.
example.tran: 这项判决可能会为其他孩子起诉他们的父母开辟一条通道。

collins.tran: (采取)最容易的办法，最省事的做法(以回避困难或尴尬处境)
collins.def: If you say that someone takes the easy way out, you disapprove of them because they do what is easiest for them in a difficult situation, rather than dealing with it properly.

example.ex: As soon as things got difficult he took the easy way out...
example.tran: 事情刚变得有点棘手他就急忙脱身。

example.ex: It is the easy way out to blame others for our failure.
example.tran: 把我们的失败归罪到别人头上倒是省事。

collins.tran: (两种情况中)不论发生哪一种情况
collins.def: You use either way in order to introduce a statement which is true in each of the two possible or alternative cases that you have just mentioned.

example.ex: The sea may rise or the land may fall; either way the sand dunes will be gone in a short time.
example.tran: 可能会出现海平面上升或陆地下沉:不论发生哪种情况，沙丘都会在短时间内消失。

collins.def: If you say that a particular type of action or development is the way forward, you approve of it because it is likely to lead to success.

example.ex: ...people who genuinely believe that anarchy is the way forward...
example.tran: 真的相信无政府主义才是未来出路的人

example.ex: Young players have got to be the way forward for every club.
example.tran: 培养年轻球员应该是所有俱乐部谋求发展之道。

collins.tran: 想怎样就怎样;随心所欲
collins.def: If someone gets their way or has their way, nobody stops them doing what they want to do. You can also say that someone gets their own way or has their own way .

example.ex: She is very good at using her charm to get her way.
example.tran: 她非常善于利用自己的魅力随心所欲。

collins.def: If one thing gives way to another, the first thing is replaced by the second.

example.ex: First he had been numb. Then the numbness gave way to anger...
example.tran: 起初他只是麻木，接着转为了愤怒。

example.ex: The last houses give way to soybean fields.
example.tran: 最后一批房子也被拆掉用作了大豆地。

collins.def: If an object that is supporting something gives way, it breaks or collapses, so that it can no longer support that thing.

example.ex: The hook in the ceiling had given way and the lamp had fallen blazing on to the table.
example.tran: 天花板上的钩子断了，灯落下来砸到桌子上燃起了火。

collins.def: If you give way to someone or something that you have been resisting, you stop resisting and allow yourself to be persuaded or controlled by them.

example.ex: It seems the President has given way to pressure from the hardliners...
example.tran: 总统似乎已迫于强硬派的压力而妥协了。

example.ex: He finally gave way to an impulse and pulled her toward him.
example.tran: 他最终还是没能抑制住冲动，把她拉向了自己。

collins.tran: 让路;让其他人(或车辆)先行
collins.def: If a moving person, a vehicle, or its driver gives way, they slow down or stop in order to allow other people or vehicles to pass in front of them.

example.ex: Give way to traffic coming from the left.
example.tran: 让从左边来的车先行。

collins.def: If you say that someone or something has a way of doing a particular thing, you mean that they often do it.

example.ex: Bosses have a way of always finding out about such things.
example.tran: 老板总喜欢把这类事情搞清楚。

collins.tran: 善于与(某人或某事物)打交道
collins.def: If you say hat a person has a way with something or someone, you mean that that person seems to have a natural skill or instinct for dealing with them.

example.ex: Constance doesn't have a way with words like you do...
example.tran: 康斯坦丝没有你这么健谈。

example.ex: He seems to have had a way with foreigners.
example.tran: 他似乎天生就善于和外国人交往。

collins.def: If you say have it your way or have it your own way, you are telling someone in an annoyed way that you will agree with or accept their suggestion even though you do not think they are right.

example.ex: All right then, have it your way. Be like that.
example.tran: 那好吧，随你的便。就那样吧。

collins.def: You use in no way or not in any way to emphasize that a statement is not at all true.

example.ex: In no way am I going to adopt any of his methods...
example.tran: 我绝对不会采纳他的任何方法。

example.ex: A spokesman insisted the two events were 'in no way related'...
example.tran: 一位发言人坚称这两起事件“绝无关联”。

collins.tran: (用于缓和语气)在某种程度上，在某些方面
collins.def: If you say that something is true in a way, you mean that although it is not completely true, it is true to a limited extent or in certain respects. You use in a way to reduce the force of a statement.

example.ex: In a way, I suppose I'm frightened of failing...
example.tran: 我想我有点惧怕失败。

example.ex: It made things very unpleasant in a way.
example.tran: 这把事情弄得有点不大愉快。

collins.def: If you say that someone does something in a small way, you mean that although they do not do very much, their actions are useful or important.

example.ex: ...demonstrations against corruption, which began in a small way last week...
example.tran: 上周开始的小规模的反腐示威游行

example.ex: By doing this you will, in a small way, help win the victory.
example.tran: 这样做你就会为获胜贡献一份小小的力量。

collins.def: If you say that someone gets in the way or is in the way, you are annoyed because their presence or their actions stop you doing something properly.

example.ex: 'We wouldn't get in the way,' Suzanne promised. 'We'd just stand quietly in a corner.'
example.tran: “我们不会妨碍你的，”苏珊娜保证道，“我们就在角落里安安静静地站着。”

collins.def: To get in the way of something means to make it difficult for it to happen, continue, or be appreciated properly.

example.ex: She had a job which never got in the way of her leisure interests.
example.tran: 她有一份从来不会影响她的业余爱好的工作。

collins.def: If you know your way around a particular subject, system, or job, or if you know your way about it, you know all the procedures and facts about it.

example.ex: He knows his way around the intricate maze of European law...
example.tran: 他通晓错综复杂的欧洲律法。

example.ex: He knows his way about the system better than do most ministers.
example.tran: 他比大多数部长都更熟悉这套体系。

collins.tran: 赚钱容易；轻轻松松赚大钱
collins.def: If you say that someone is laughing all the way to the bank, you mean that they are making a lot of money very easily.

example.ex: The lucrative contract with television means that England's wealthy football clubs will now be laughing all the way to the bank.
example.tran: 与电视台签订的这项大合同会让富有的英格兰足球俱乐部财源滚滚。

collins.def: If you lead the way along a particular route, you go along it in front of someone in order to show them where to go.

example.ex: She grabbed his suitcase and led the way.
example.tran: 她拿过他的箱子在前面带路。

collins.def: If a person or group leads the way in a particular activity, they are the first person or group to do it or they make the most new developments in it.

example.ex: Sony has also led the way in shrinking the size of compact-disc players.
example.tran: 索尼公司在缩小CD播放机的体积方面也处于领先地位。

collins.tran: 取得巨大进展;取得很多成就
collins.def: If you say that someone or something has come a long way, you mean that they have developed, progressed, or become very successful.

example.ex: He has come a long way since the days he could only afford one meal a day.
example.tran: 那种一天只吃得起一顿饭的日子已经离他很遥远了。

collins.def: You can use by a long way to emphasize that something is, for example, much better, worse, or bigger than any other thing of that kind.

example.ex: It was, by a long way, the worst meeting I have ever attended...
example.tran: 这绝对是我参加过的最差劲的会议。

example.ex: Our favourite by a long way was the supermarkets' own brand.
example.tran: 我们的最爱绝对是超市的自产品牌。

collins.def: If you say that something is a long way from being true, you are emphasizing that it is definitely not true.
