example.ex: She is a long way from being the richest person in Britain...
example.tran: 比起英国首富，她还差得远呢。

example.ex: That's a long way from the truth.
example.tran: 这与事实相差甚远。

collins.def: If you say that something goes a long way towards doing a particular thing, you mean that it is an important factor in achieving that thing.

example.ex: Although by no means a cure, it goes a long way towards making the patient's life more tolerable.
example.tran: 虽然并不能根治，但它对减轻病人的痛苦大有帮助。

collins.def: If you say that someone has lost their way, you are criticizing them because they do not have any good ideas any more, or seem to have become unsure about what to do.

example.ex: Why has the White House lost its way on tax and budget policy?
example.tran: 为什么白宫在税收和预算政策问题上束手无策呢？

collins.def: When you make your way somewhere, you walk or travel there.

example.ex: He made his way to the marketplace, as he had been instructed to do...
example.tran: 他按照指示去了市场。

example.ex: He made his way home at last.
example.tran: 他终于到家了。

collins.def: If one person or thing makes way for another, the first is replaced by the second.

example.ex: He said he was prepared to make way for younger people in the party...
example.tran: 他说他已准备好让位于党内的年轻一代。

example.ex: A number of houses would have to be demolished to make way for the new building.
example.tran: 建这幢新大楼将不得不推倒一些房子。

collins.def: If you say there's no way that something will happen, you are emphasizing that you think it will definitely not happen.

example.ex: There was absolutely no way that we were going to be able to retrieve it.
example.tran: 我们绝对不可能把它找回来。

collins.def: You can say no way as an emphatic way of saying no.

example.ex: Mike, no way am I playing cards with you for money...
example.tran: 迈克，我是决不会和你玩牌赌钱的。

example.ex: That was not the life Jack Hewitt planned to live. No way!
example.tran: 那不是杰克·休伊特想要的生活，绝对不是！

collins.def: You use in the way of or by way of in order to specify the kind of thing you are talking about.

example.ex: Latvia is a country without much in the way of natural resources...
example.tran: 拉脱维亚并不是一个自然资源丰富的国家。

example.ex: Meetings held today produced little in the way of an agreement...
example.tran: 今天举行的会议没有达成什么协议。

collins.def: If you are on your way, you have started your journey somewhere.

example.ex: He has been allowed to leave the country and is on his way to Britain...
example.tran: 他已获准离境，正在去往英国的路上。

example.ex: By sunrise tomorrow we'll be on our way.
example.tran: 明天天亮前我们就将赶路。

collins.def: If you go on your way, you continue with your journey.

example.ex: She picked up her bag, and went on her way.
example.tran: 她提起包继续赶路。

collins.def: If something happens on the way or along the way, it happens during the course of a particular event or process.

example.ex: You may have to learn a few new skills along the way.
example.tran: 在这个过程中你可能还得新学几招。

collins.def: If you are on your way or well on your way to something, you have made so much progress that you are almost certain to achieve that thing.

example.ex: I am now out of hospital and well on the way to recovery.
example.tran: 我现在已经出院，快康复了。

collins.def: If something is on the way, it will arrive soon.

example.ex: The forecasters say more snow is on the way...
example.tran: 天气预报员说不久还将有降雪。

example.ex: She is married with twin sons and a third child on the way.
example.tran: 她已经结婚，有一对双胞胎儿子，第三个宝宝也即将出世。

collins.tran: (表示某事一定发生)无论如何，不管怎样
collins.def: You can use one way or another or one way or the other when you want to say that something definitely happens, but without giving any details about how it happens.

example.ex: ...those who had entered Germany one way or another during the war...
example.tran: 那些在战争时期以各种方式进入德国的人

example.ex: You know pretty well everyone here, one way or the other.
example.tran: 无论如何，这里的每个人你肯定都很了解。

collins.tran: (指之前提到的两个可能的决定或结论)无论哪个
collins.def: You use one way or the other or one way or another to refer to two possible decisions or conclusions that have previously been mentioned, without stating which one is reached or preferred.

example.ex: We've got to make our decision one way or the other...
example.tran: 不是这样就是那样，我们无论如何都得作出决定了。

example.ex: I didn't really care one way or another.
example.tran: 管它怎样，我真的不在乎。

collins.tran: 不止一种意义;不单是这样
collins.def: You say in more ways than one to indicate that what you have said is intended to have more than one meaning.

example.ex: These local elections may prove a turning point in more ways than one.
example.tran: 这些地方选举从许多方面来说都是一个转折点。

collins.def: You use the other way around or the other way round to refer to the opposite of what you have just said.

example.ex: You'd think you were the one who did me the favor, and not the other way around.
example.tran: 应该是你帮了我，而不是我帮了你。

collins.def: If something or someone is on the way out or on their way out, they are likely to disappear or to be replaced very soon.

example.ex: There are encouraging signs that cold war attitudes are on the way out...
example.tran: 有令人欣慰的迹象表明冷战思维即将成为历史。

example.ex: The ban on Sunday shopping could be on its way out before Christmas...
example.tran: 周末购物的禁令可能会在圣诞节前被取消。

collins.tran: 特地;不怕麻烦;格外努力
collins.def: If you go out of your way to do something, for example to help someone, you make a special effort to do it.

example.ex: He was very kind to me and seemed to go out of his way to help me.
example.tran: 他对我非常友善，似乎是特意帮我的忙。

collins.def: If you keep out of someone's way or stay out of their way, you avoid them or do not get involved with them.

example.ex: I'd kept out of his way as much as I could...
example.tran: 我一直尽量躲着他。

example.ex: He warned the army to stay out of the way of the relief effort.
example.tran: 他警告军队不要介入救援工作。

collins.tran: 结束;被处理好;得到解决
collins.def: When something is out of the way, it has finished or you have dealt with it, so that it is no longer a problem or needs no more time spent on it.

example.ex: The plan has to remain confidential at least until the local elections are out of the way...
example.tran: 此项计划至少在地方选举结束之前都得保密。

example.ex: It would have been better to have got it out of the way earlier.
example.tran: 如果当时能早点结束就更好了。

collins.def: If you go your own way, you do what you want rather than what everyone else does or expects.

example.ex: In school I was a loner. I went my own way.
example.tran: 在学校里我独来独往，我行我素。

collins.def: You use in the same way to introduce a situation that you are comparing with one that you have just mentioned, because there is a strong similarity between them.

example.ex: There is no reason why a gifted aircraft designer should also be a capable pilot. In the same way, a brilliant pilot can be a menace behind the wheel of a car.
example.tran: 杰出的飞机设计师没有理由一定也是个出色的飞行员。同样，一个优秀的飞行员或许会是个糟糕的司机。

collins.def: If you say that someone is set in their ways, you mean that they have been behaving in the same way for many years and do not want to change.

example.ex: He was too set in his ways to make any real changes.
example.tran: 他已经积习成性，不肯作任何真正的改变。

collins.tran: （用于指刚才说过的话）那样，这样
collins.def: You can use that way and this way to refer to a statement or comment that you have just made.

example.ex: Some of us have habits few people know about and we keep it this way...
example.tran: 我们中的一些人有些不为人知的习惯，我们也不想改变这一状况。

example.ex: We have a beautiful city and we pray it stays that way...
example.tran: 我们的城市很美丽，但愿它能保持下去。

collins.def: You can use that way or this way to refer to an action or situation that you have just mentioned, when you go on to mention the likely consequence or effect of it.

example.ex: Keep the soil moist. That way, the seedling will flourish...
example.tran: 保持土壤湿润，那样幼苗就能茁壮成长。

example.ex: I know it's unfair that I am left holding the baby; but at least this way I know that she's being well looked after.
example.tran: 我知道把我留下来看孩子很不公平，但这样至少我知道孩子受到了很好的看护。

collins.tran: 从目前事情发展的情况看
collins.def: You can use the way things are going to indicate that you expect something to happen because of the way the present situation is developing.

example.ex: The way things are going, perhaps he won't come at all.
example.tran: 现在看来他是不会来了。

collins.def: You add to my way of thinking to a statement in order to indicate that you are giving your opinion.

example.ex: To my way of thinking, it didn't seem as if it ought to be so terribly complicated.
example.tran: 我觉得，事情好像没必要这么复杂。

collins.def: If you say that there are no two ways about it, you are emphasizing that there is no doubt at all about a particular situation or about how it should be interpreted.

example.ex: You stay here, you die. No two ways about it.
example.tran: 你若留在这里，必死无疑。

collins.def: If an activity or plan is under way, it has begun and is now taking place.

example.ex: A full-scale security operation is now under way...
example.tran: 一项全面的安全行动正在进行中…

example.ex: The court case got under way last autumn.
example.tran: 这个案子从去年秋天起开始审理。

collins.tran: 以各种方式；采用各种方式
collins.def: Every which way and any which way are used to emphasize that something happens, or might happen, in a lot of different ways, or using a lot of different methods.

example.ex: He re-ran the experiment every which way he could...
example.tran: 他用尽所有可能的方法重复做这个实验。

example.ex: They are just happy to sell their inventory any which way they can.
example.tran: 只要存货能脱手，无论采取什么方式他们都愿意。

collins.tran: (强调位置和方向的混乱)向四面八方，杂乱地
collins.def: Every which way is used to emphasize that things move in a lot of different directions or are arranged in a lot of different positions.

example.ex: ...cars parked every which way.
example.tran: 横七竖八停着的车辆

collins.tran: (包括说话者或笔者在内的)我们
collins.def: A speaker or writer uses we to refer both to himself or herself and to one or more other people as a group. You can use we before a noun to make it clear which group of people you are referring to.

example.ex: We both swore we'd be friends ever after...
example.tran: 我俩都发誓从此以后永远是朋友。

example.ex: We ordered another bottle of champagne...
example.tran: 我们又点了一瓶香槟。

collins.def: We is sometimes used to refer to people in general.

example.ex: We need to take care of our bodies.
example.tran: 我们需要注意身体。

example.ex: ...the withdrawal symptoms that we all experience at the end of a long, close relationship.
example.tran: 在一段长期的亲密感情结束时大家都会体会到的难以割舍的痛苦

collins.tran: (不仅指自己也指听者或读者)我们
collins.def: A speaker or writer may use we instead of 'I' in order to include the audience or reader in what they are saying, especially when discussing how a talk or book is organized.

example.ex: We will now consider the raw materials from which the body derives energy.
example.tran: 现在我们来细想一下为身体提供能量的原料。

means: 工作周（一个星期中的工作时间）

collins.def: A week is a period of seven days. Some people consider that a week starts on Monday and ends on Sunday.

example.ex: I had a letter from my mother last week...
example.tran: 上周我收到了母亲的一封信。

example.ex: This has been on my mind all week...
example.tran: 我整个星期都在想这件事。

collins.tran: 一周时间;七天左右的时间
collins.def: A week is a period of about seven days.

example.ex: Her mother stayed for another two weeks...
example.tran: 她母亲又呆了两个星期。

example.ex: Only 12 weeks ago he underwent major heart transplant surgery...
example.tran: 12个星期前他才刚刚接受了风险很高的心脏移植手术。

collins.tran: 工作周(指一周的工作时间)
collins.def: Your working week is the hours that you spend at work during a week.

example.ex: It is not unusual for women to work a 40-hour week.
example.tran: 女性一周工作40小时并不少见。

example.ex: ...workers on a three-day week.
example.tran: 一周只工作3天的工人

collins.tran: (除去星期六和星期日的)星期，周，礼拜
collins.def: The week is the part of the week that does not include Saturday and Sunday.

example.ex: ...the hard work of looking after the children during the week...
example.tran: 除周末外每天都要照看孩子的辛苦

example.ex: They arrived at the weekend and gave three concerts in the week.
example.tran: 他们周末抵达，从周一到周五举办了3场音乐会。

collins.def: You use week in expressions such as 'a week on Monday', 'a week next Tuesday', and 'tomorrow week' to mean exactly one week after the day that you mention.

example.ex: The deadline to publish the document is a week tomorrow...
example.tran: 一周后的明天是公布这份文件的最后期限。

example.ex: The 800 metre final is on Monday week.
example.tran: 800米决赛在下周一进行。

collins.def: You use week in expressions such as 'a week last Monday', 'a week ago this Tuesday', and 'a week ago yesterday' to mean exactly one week before the day that you mention.

example.ex: 'That's the time you weren't well, wasn't it?' — 'Yes, that's right, that was a week ago yesterday.'
example.tran: “就是那个时候你不舒服，没错吧？”——“是的，没错，就是一周前的昨天。”

collins.tran: 一周又一周；接连好几个星期
collins.def: If you say that something happens week in week out, you do not like it because it happens all the time, and never seems to change.

example.ex: ...stars who appear on television week in week out.
example.tran: 接连好几个星期都在电视上露脸的明星。

means: （用以询问某人或某事物的词）什么，多少
（用以表示未听清楚对方说的话）

collins.tran: (用于疑问句中询问所不知道的信息)什么
collins.def: You use what in questions when you ask for specific information about something that you do not know.

example.ex: What do you want?...
example.tran: 你想要什么？

example.ex: What did she tell you, anyway?...
example.tran: 总之，她告诉了你什么？

collins.tran: （尤用于动词和形容词后以引导关系从句）
collins.def: You use what after certain words, especially verbs and adjectives, when you are referring to a situation that is unknown or has not been specified.

example.ex: You can imagine what it would be like driving a car into a brick wall at 30 miles an hour...
example.tran: 你可以想象汽车以每小时30英里的速度撞向一堵砖墙结果会怎样。

example.ex: I want to know what happened to Norman...
example.tran: 我想知道诺曼怎么了。

collins.tran: (用在强调句型的句首)所…的(是…)
collins.def: You use what at the beginning of a clause in structures where you are changing the order of the information to give special emphasis to something.

example.ex: What precisely triggered off yesterday's riot is still unclear...
example.tran: 究竟是什么引发了昨天的骚乱还不清楚。

example.ex: What I wanted, more than anything, was a few days' rest...
example.tran: 我最想要的就是能休息几天。

collins.def: You use what in expressions such as what is called and what amounts to when you are giving a description of something.

example.ex: She had been in what doctors described as an irreversible vegetative state for five years...
example.tran: 她处于医生所说的不可逆性植物人状态已经5年了。

example.ex: Meanwhile, most young people in the West are expected to leave what could be life's most momentous decision—marriage—almost entirely up to luck.
example.tran: 同时，人们认为西方的大多数年轻人把婚姻这一可能是人生最重要的决定几乎完全交由命运来安排。

collins.def: You use what to indicate that you are talking about the whole of an amount that is available to you.

example.ex: He drinks what is left in his glass as if it were water...
example.tran: 他把杯子里剩下的东西当水一样全喝了下去。

example.ex: He moved carefully over what remained of partition walls.
example.tran: 他小心翼翼地跨过残余的隔墙。

collins.tran: (表示已经听到对方的话，并请其继续说)什么事
collins.def: You say 'What?' to tell someone who has indicated that they want to speak to you that you have heard them and are inviting them to continue.

example.ex: 'Dad?' — 'What?' — 'Can I have the car tonight?'
example.tran: “爸爸？”——“什么事？”——“我今晚能用车吗？”

collins.tran: (用于没有听清或听懂时，请求他人再重复一遍刚说的话;不如 pardon，excuse me 等正式和礼貌)什么
collins.def: You say 'What?' when you ask someone to repeat the thing that they have just said because you did not hear or understand it properly. 'What?' is more informal and less polite than expressions such as 'Pardon?' and 'Excuse me?'.

example.ex: 'They could paint this place,' she said. 'What?' he asked.
example.tran: “他们可以粉刷这个地方，”她说。“什么？”他问。

collins.def: You say 'What' to express surprise.

example.ex: 'Adolphus Kelling, I arrest you on a charge of trafficking in narcotics.'—'What?'
example.tran: “阿道弗斯·克林，我以贩毒的罪名逮捕你。”——“什么？”

example.ex: 'We've got the car that killed Myra Moss.' — 'What!'
example.tran: “我们已经找到撞死迈拉·莫斯的车了。”——“真的！”

collins.tran: (用在感叹句中强调某种意见或反应)多么
collins.def: You use what in exclamations to emphasize an opinion or reaction.

example.ex: What a horrible thing to do...
example.tran: 做这样的事简直太可怕了！

example.ex: What a busy day.
example.tran: 多么忙碌的一天啊。

collins.def: You use what to indicate that you are making a guess about something such as an amount or value.

example.ex: It's, what, eleven years or more since he's seen him...
example.tran: 打从他上次见他，已有，嗯，11年甚至更久了。

example.ex: This piece is, what, about a half an hour long?
example.tran: 这首曲子有，嗯，大约半个小时那么长，对吗？

collins.tran: 你猜怎么着，你知道吗(表示接下来的信息令人惊讶，很少有人知道或者需要强调 )
collins.def: You say guess what or do you know what to introduce a piece of information which is surprising, which is not generally known, or which you want to emphasize.

example.ex: Guess what? I'm going to dinner at Mrs. Combley's tonight...
example.tran: 你猜怎么着？今晚我要去康伯利夫人家里赴宴。

example.ex: Do you know what? I'm going to the circus this afternoon.
example.tran: 你知道吗？我下午要去看马戏。

collins.tran: (用于疑问句后，表示语气强烈地陈述观点，并希望他人赞同)难道不是吗，是不是啊
collins.def: In conversation, you say or what? after a question as a way of stating an opinion forcefully and showing that you expect other people to agree.

example.ex: Look at that moon. Is that beautiful or what?...
example.tran: 看看那月亮，它真漂亮，不是吗？

example.ex: Am I wasting my time here, or what?
example.tran: 我是在这儿浪费时间吗，是不是啊？

collins.tran: (用来暗指之前的话不重要、无趣或与己无关)那又怎样，那又如何
collins.def: You say so what? or what of it? to indicate that the previous remark seems unimportant, uninteresting, or irrelevant to you.

example.ex: 'I skipped off school today,' — 'So what? What's so special about that?'...
example.tran: “我今天逃学了。”——“那又怎样？有什么特别的吗？”

example.ex: 'This is Hollywood, U.S.A., where they make all the movies, remember.' — 'What of it?'...
example.tran: “记住，这是美国的好莱坞，所有那些影片都是在这里制作的。”——“那又如何？”

collins.tran: (用于提出建议)我有个主意，你听我说
collins.def: You say 'Tell you what' to introduce a suggestion or offer.

example.ex: Tell you what, let's stay here another day.
example.tran: 我想，我们可以在这里再呆一天。

collins.tran: (用于问句句首，表示提出建议或请求)…怎么样
collins.def: You use what about at the beginning of a question when you make a suggestion, offer, or request.

example.ex: What about going out with me tomorrow?...
example.tran: 明天和我一起出去怎么样？

example.ex: 'What about Sunday evening at Frank's?' — 'Sure. What time?'...
example.tran: “周日晚上在弗兰克家怎么样？”——“好啊，几点？”

collins.tran: (用于引出与之前内容相关的新的话题或观点)那么…怎么样
collins.def: You use what about or what of when you introduce a new topic or a point which seems relevant to a previous remark.

example.ex: Now you've talked about work on daffodils, what about other commercially important flowers, like roses?...
example.tran: 既然你们已谈到了种植水仙花，那么其他具有重要商业价值的花卉呢，比如玫瑰？

example.ex: And what about when you were in the fifth year, did people give you careers advice on coming to college?...
example.tran: 那么在你五年级时，有人就上大学给过你择业方面的建议吗？

collins.tran: (用于请某人解释原因)…怎么了
collins.def: You say what about a particular person or thing when you ask someone to explain why they have asked you about that person or thing.

example.ex: 'This thing with the Corbett woman.'—'Oh, yeah. What about her?'
example.tran: “是跟那个科比特家的女人有关的事。”——“哦，是吗，她怎么了？”

collins.def: You say what have you at the end of a list in order to refer generally to other things of the same kind.

example.ex: So many things are unsafe these days—milk, cranberry sauce, what have you...
example.tran: 现如今很多食品都不安全——牛奶、蓝莓酱等等。

example.ex: My great-grandfather made horseshoes and nails and what have you.
example.tran: 我曾祖父打制马掌、铁钉等诸如此类的东西。

collins.tran: (用于疑问句句首，尤用于询问不希望看到的事发生时的结果)如果…怎么办
collins.def: You say what if at the beginning of a question when you ask about the consequences of something happening, especially something undesirable.

example.ex: What if this doesn't work out?...
example.tran: 如果这个不行怎么办？

example.ex: What if he was going to die!...
example.tran: 如果他快要死了该怎么办？

collins.def: If you know what's what, you know the important things that need to be known about a situation.

example.ex: You have to know what's what and when to draw the line...
example.tran: 你必须搞清状况以及自己的底线。

example.ex: You should come across the river with us. Then you will really see what's what.
example.tran: 你应该和我们一起过河，那时你就会了解实情了。

collins.tran: (尤指不想看到的情况的发生)由于，因为
collins.def: You say what with in order to introduce the reasons for a particular situation, especially an undesirable one.

example.ex: Maybe they are tired, what with all the sleep they're losing staying up night after night...
example.tran: 也许他们是太累了，考虑到他们成宿成宿地熬夜。

example.ex: What with one thing and another, it was fairly late in the day when we returned to Shrewsbury.
example.tran: 由于这事那事，那天我们返回什鲁斯伯里时已经很晚了。

collins.tran: (表示不相信或不能接受某人刚说的话，或没有听清或完全理解)你说什么？
collins.def: People say 'you what?' to indicate that they do not believe or accept the remark that someone has just made, or that they have not heard or understood it properly.

example.ex: 'I'm going to have problems sleeping tonight.' — 'You what?'...
example.tran: “今晚我可能睡不着。”——“不会吧？”

example.ex: 'What are you doing here?' — 'Oh I work here now.' — 'You what?'
example.tran: “你在这儿干什么呢？”——“哦，我现在在这里工作。”——“你说什么？”

means: （用于时间的表达方式之后）在那时

collins.def: You use when to ask questions about the time at which things happen.

example.ex: When are you going home?...
example.tran: 你什么时候回家？

example.ex: When did you get married?...
example.tran: 你什么时候结的婚？

collins.tran: (表示两事同时发生)在…时，当…时
collins.def: If something happens when something else is happening, the two things are happening at the same time.

example.ex: When eating a whole cooked fish, you should never turn it over to get at the flesh on the other side...
example.tran: 吃一整条鱼时，切忌把它翻过来去吃另一面的肉。

example.ex: Mustard is grown in the field when weeds are there, rather than when the growing crops are there.
example.tran: 芥菜要在地里长杂草而不是长庄稼时种植。

collins.tran: (引导从句，表示某事发生于另一活动、事件或情形期间)在…的过程中
collins.def: You use when to introduce a clause in which you mention something which happens at some point during an activity, event, or situation.

example.ex: When I met the Gills, I had been gardening for nearly ten years.
example.tran: 遇到吉尔一家时我已经做了近10年的园艺工作。

collins.tran: (引导从句，说明主句动作已经发生或将要发生时的情况)其时
collins.def: You use when to introduce a clause where you mention the circumstances under which the event in the main clause happened or will happen.

example.ex: When he brought Imelda her drink she gave him a genuine, sweet smile of thanks...
example.tran: 当他把饮料拿给艾梅尔达时，她真诚而甜美地向他微笑以示感谢。

example.ex: I'll start to think about it when I have to write my report.
example.tran: 我要写报告时会对此予以考虑的。

collins.tran: (尤用于动词和形容词后引导从句，表示某事发生的时间)什么时候,何时
collins.def: You use when after certain words, especially verbs and adjectives, to introduce a clause where you mention the time at which something happens.

example.ex: I asked him when he'd be back to pick me up...
example.tran: 我问他什么时候回来接我。

example.ex: I don't know when the decision was made...
example.tran: 我不知道决定是什么时候作出的。

collins.tran: (用于引导从句，限定或指示某事发生的时间)…的时候
collins.def: You use when to introduce a clause which specifies or refers to the time at which something happens.

example.ex: He could remember a time when he had worked like that himself...
example.tran: 他还能记得自己一度工作起来也是那个样子。

example.ex: She remembered clearly that day when she'd gone exploring the rockpools...
example.tran: 她清楚地记得她去岩石区潮水潭探险的那天。

collins.tran: (用于引出某个观点、评论或问题的原因)既然，考虑到
collins.def: You use when to introduce the reason for an opinion, comment, or question.

example.ex: How can I love myself when I look like this?...
example.tran: 我这个样子，怎么能对自己满意呢？

example.ex: Emerald starlings are fairly small when compared with other such birds.
example.tran: 与同类的其他鸟相比，翠辉椋鸟要小很多。

collins.tran: (用于引出使句子的其他部分显得让人吃惊或不大可能的事实或评论)虽然，然而,可是
collins.def: You use when in order to introduce a fact or comment which makes the other part of the sentence rather surprising or unlikely.

example.ex: Our mothers sat us down to read and paint, when all we really wanted to do was to make a mess...
example.tran: 我们的母亲让我们坐下来读书和画画，而我们真正想做的却是打打闹闹。

example.ex: The temperature sensor is making the computer think the engine is cold when, in fact, it's hot.
example.tran: 温度传感器发给计算机的信息为发动机是冷却的，可实际上它的温度很高。

collins.tran: （用于疑问句）在哪里，从哪里，到哪里
collins.def: You use where to ask questions about the place something is in, or is coming from or going to.

example.ex: Where did you meet him?...
example.tran: 你在哪里见过他？

example.ex: Where's Anna?...
example.tran: 安娜在哪里？

collins.tran: (尤用于动词和形容词后引导从句，表示某物所在或某事发生的地点)那里，那儿
collins.def: You use where after certain words, especially verbs and adjectives, to introduce a clause in which you mention the place in which something is situated or happens.

example.ex: People began looking across to see where the noise was coming from...
example.tran: 人们开始四下察看，想弄清楚那声响来自何处。

example.ex: He knew where Henry Carter had gone...
example.tran: 他知道亨利·卡特去了哪里。

collins.tran: (用于疑问句)在哪一地点,在哪一阶段，在哪方面
collins.def: You use where to ask questions about a situation, a stage in something, or an aspect of something.

example.ex: Where will it all end?...
example.tran: 它会在哪儿全部结束？

example.ex: If they get their way, where will it stop?...
example.tran: 如果他们找到路，那路的尽头又会在哪里？

collins.tran: (尤用于某些动词和形容词后，引导表示地点、某事物所处状态、阶段等的从句)在哪儿，从哪儿
collins.def: You use where after certain words, especially verbs and adjectives, to introduce a clause in which you mention a situation, a stage in something, or an aspect of something.

example.ex: It's not hard to see where she got her feelings about herself...
example.tran: 不难看出她从何处获得的这种自我感觉。

example.ex: She had a feeling she already knew where this conversation was going to lead...
example.tran: 她觉得自己已经知道这次谈话寓意何在。

collins.tran: (用于引导从句进行对比)然而
collins.def: You use where to introduce a clause that contrasts with the other parts of the sentence.

example.ex: Where some people learned to play the accordion for dances in their community, others took music lessons...
example.tran: 一些人学习弹手风琴，为他们社区里的舞蹈表演进行伴奏，而其他人则上音乐课。

example.ex: Sometimes a teacher will be listened to, where a parent might not.
example.tran: 有时教师的话会听，而父母的话可能就不听。

collins.tran: (表示选择或怀疑)是否，是不是
collins.def: You use whether when you are talking about a choice or doubt between two or more alternatives.

example.ex: To this day, it's unclear whether he shot himself or was murdered...
example.tran: 至今尚不清楚他究竟是饮弹自杀还是被谋杀。

example.ex: Whether it turns out to be a good idea or a bad idea, we'll find out...
example.tran: 它到底是个好主意还是坏主意我们很快会见分晓。

collins.def: You use whether to say that something is true in any of the circumstances that you mention.

example.ex: This happens whether the children are in two-parent or one-parent families...
example.tran: 不管孩子是生活在双亲还是单亲家庭，这种情况都会发生。

example.ex: Whether they say it aloud or not, most men expect their wives to be faithful.
example.tran: 大多数男人还是希望他们的妻子对自己忠诚，不管他们有没有将这一想法大声说出来。

collins.def: You use which in questions when there are two or more possible answers or alternatives.

example.ex: Which do they want me to do? declare war or surrender?...
example.tran: 他们想让我做什么,宣战还是投降？

example.ex: Which are the ones you really like?...
example.tran: 哪些是你们真正喜欢的？

collins.tran: (用于指明在两个或多个答案或选项中所作出的选择)哪个，哪些
collins.def: You use which to refer to a choice between two or more possible answers or alternatives.

example.ex: I wanted to know which school it was you went to...
example.tran: 我想知道你上的是哪所学校。

example.ex: I can't remember which teachers I had...
example.tran: 我记不清哪些老师教过我。

collins.tran: (用于关系从句句首，具体说明所谈论的事物或提供关于它的更多信息)
collins.def: You use which at the beginning of a relative clause when specifying the thing that you are talking about or when giving more information about it.

example.ex: Soldiers opened fire on a car which failed to stop at an army checkpoint...
example.tran: 士兵向那辆拒绝在军事检查站停车检查的汽车开了火。

example.ex: He's based in Banja Luka, which is the largest city in northern Bosnia...
example.tran: 他驻扎在波斯尼亚北部的最大城市巴尼亚卢卡。

collins.tran: (用来回指前面句子表达的观点或状况)这，那
collins.def: You use which to refer back to an idea or situation expressed in a previous sentence or sentences, especially when you want to give your opinion about it.

example.ex: They ran out of drink. Which actually didn't bother me because I wasn't drinking...
example.tran: 他们把酒喝完了。但实际上这对我来说无所谓，因为我不喝酒。

example.ex: Since we started in September we have raised fifty thousand pounds, which is pretty good going...
example.tran: 我们自从9月份开始以来，已经募集到5万英镑，进展相当顺利。

collins.tran: 哪个是哪个(用于表示无法区分)
collins.def: If you cannot tell the difference between two things, you can say that you do not know which is which .

example.ex: They all look so alike to me that I'm never sure which is which...
example.tran: 对我来说他们看起来全都非常相似，我永远搞不清哪个是哪个。

example.ex: It's essential to know which is which as treatments will be quite different.
example.tran: 由于治疗的方法将会全然不同，因此弄清楚哪个是哪个很重要。

collins.def: Something that is white is the colour of snow or milk.

example.ex: He had nice square white teeth...
example.tran: 他的牙齿洁白而整齐，十分好看。

example.ex: Issa's white beach hat gleamed in the harsh lights...
example.tran: 伊萨的白色沙滩帽在刺眼的阳光下闪闪发亮。

collins.def: A white person has a pale skin and belongs to a race which is of European origin.

example.ex: Working with white people hasn't been a problem for me or for them...
example.tran: 和白人共事对我、对他们来说都不是个问题。

example.ex: He was white, with brown shoulder-length hair and a moustache.
example.tran: 他是个白人，留着棕色的齐肩发并蓄着小胡子。

collins.tran: (因情绪变化或生病等)脸色苍白的
collins.def: If someone goes white, the skin on their face becomes very pale, for example because of fear, shock, anger, or illness.

example.ex: Richard had gone very white, but he stood his ground...
example.tran: 理查德脸都白了，但还是坚持自己的立场。

example.ex: He turned white and began to stammer...
example.tran: 他脸色发白，说话开始结巴。

collins.def: White wine is pale yellow in colour.

example.ex: Gregory poured another glass of white wine and went back to his bedroom.
example.tran: 格雷戈里又倒了一杯白葡萄酒后回到了卧室。

collins.def: White coffee has had milk or cream added to it.

example.ex: Wayne has a large white coffee in front of him.
example.tran: 韦恩面前摆着一大杯加了牛奶的咖啡。

collins.def: White blood cells are the cells in your blood which your body uses to fight infection.
People who believe in white magic believe it is possible to use magic to do good things.

example.ex: ...practitioners of white magic...
example.tran: 施善意法术的人

example.ex: They claim to be white witches.
example.tran: 她们自称是善良的女巫。

collins.def: The white of an egg is the transparent liquid that surrounds the yellow part called the yolk.
The white of someone's eye is the white part that surrounds the coloured part called the iris.
Whites are white clothes that you wear for playing some sports, for example tennis or cricket.

example.ex: There was a Frenchman sitting at the next table, immaculate in tennis whites.
example.tran: 邻桌坐着位法国人，穿着非常整洁的白色网球服。

collins.tran: (用于疑问句，询问人的姓名或身份)谁
collins.def: You use who in questions when you ask about the name or identity of a person or group of people.

example.ex: Who's there?...
example.tran: 谁在哪儿？

example.ex: Who is the least popular man around here?...
example.tran: 这里谁最不受欢迎？

collins.tran: (尤用在动词和形容词后引导从句，说明人的身份)谁
collins.def: You use who after certain words, especially verbs and adjectives, to introduce a clause where you talk about the identity of a person or a group of people.

example.ex: Police have not been able to find out who was responsible for the forgeries...
example.tran: 警方还未能查明谁是这些造假案的元凶。

example.ex: I went over to start up a conversation, asking her who she knew at the party...
example.tran: 我凑过去搭讪，问她这个聚会上都认识谁。

collins.tran: (用于进行限定说明或提供更多信息的关系从句的句首)
collins.def: You use who at the beginning of a relative clause when specifying the person or group of people you are talking about or when giving more information about them.

example.ex: There are those who eat out for a special occasion, or treat themselves...
example.tran: 有些人会在特殊的日子或犒劳自己时出去吃饭。

example.ex: The woman, who needs constant attention, is cared for by relatives...
example.tran: 那个需要长期照料的女人由亲戚们照看着。

collins.def: If you refer to the whole of something, you mean all of it.

example.ex: He has said he will make an apology to the whole of Asia for his country's past behaviour...
example.tran: 他已表示要为自己国家过去的行径向全亚洲道歉。

example.ex: I was cold throughout the whole of my body.
example.tran: 我浑身上下都觉得冷。

collins.def: A whole is a single thing which contains several different parts.

example.ex: An atom itself is a complete whole, with its electrons, protons and neutrons and other elements...
example.tran: 一个原子本身就是一个完整的整体，包括电子、质子、中子及其他元素。

example.ex: Taken as a percentage of the whole, the mouth has to be a fairly minor body part.
example.tran: 和全身比起来，嘴可算是身体中较小的一部分。

collins.def: If something is whole, it is in one piece and is not broken or damaged.

example.ex: Much of the temple was ruined, but the front was whole, as well as a large hall behind it...
example.tran: 庙宇的大部分都被毁坏了，但其正面及后面的大厅还保存完好。

example.ex: I struck the glass with my fist with all my might; yet it remained whole...
example.tran: 我用拳头拼命砸向玻璃，可它还是完好无损。

collins.def: You use whole to emphasize what you are saying.

example.ex: It was like seeing a whole different side of somebody...
example.tran: 这就像是看到一个人完全不同的一面。

example.ex: His father had helped invent a whole new way of doing business.
example.tran: 他父亲帮助创造了一套全新的生意经。

collins.def: If you refer to something as a whole, you are referring to it generally and as a single unit.

example.ex: He described the move as a victory for the people of South Africa as a whole...
example.tran: 他把这一举动描述成整个南非人民的胜利。

example.ex: As a whole we do not eat enough fibre in Britain.
example.tran: 总体上我们英国人没有摄入足够的膳食纤维。

collins.def: You use on the whole to indicate that what you are saying is true in general but may not be true in every case, or that you are giving a general opinion or summary of something.

example.ex: On the whole, people miss the opportunity to enjoy leisure...
example.tran: 总的来说，人们渴望享受闲暇的时光。

example.ex: The wine towns encountered are, on the whole, quiet and modest.
example.tran: 所到的酒镇总的来说都是宁静祥和的。

collins.tran: (用于关系从句的句首，表示与前句所提到的人或事物有所属关系或相关联）
collins.def: You use whose at the beginning of a relative clause where you mention something that belongs to or is associated with the person or thing mentioned in the previous clause.

example.ex: I saw a man shouting at a driver whose car was blocking the street.
example.tran: 我看见一个男人正朝一个司机叫嚷，他的车把街道堵塞了。

example.ex: ...a speedboat, whose fifteen-strong crew claimed to belong to the Italian navy.
example.tran: 一艘快艇，其上船员15人，声称自己属于意大利海军

collins.tran: (用于疑问句中，询问某物所属或其与何人何事有关)谁的
collins.def: You use whose in questions to ask about the person or thing that something belongs to or is associated with.

example.ex: Whose was the better performance?...
example.tran: 谁表演得更好?

example.ex: 'Whose is this?' — 'It's mine.'...
example.tran: “这是谁的？”——“是我的。”

collins.tran: (尤用在动词或形容词等后面，引导谈论某物所属或与何人何事相关的从句)谁的
collins.def: You use whose after certain words, especially verbs and adjectives, to introduce a clause where you talk about the person or thing that something belongs to or is associated with.

example.ex: I'm wondering whose mother she is then...
example.tran: 我很纳闷，那么她是谁的母亲呢？

example.ex: I can't remember whose idea it was for us to meet again.
example.tran: 我记不清我们再次会面是谁的主意了。

collins.def: You use why in questions when you ask about the reasons for something.

example.ex: Why hasn't he brought the whisky?...
example.tran: 他为什么没把威士忌拿来？

example.ex: Why didn't he stop me?...
example.tran: 为什么他没阻止我？

collins.def: You use why at the beginning of a clause in which you talk about the reasons for something.

example.ex: He still could not throw any further light on why the elevator could have become jammed...
example.tran: 对于电梯为什么会卡住他仍旧给不出更多的解释。

example.ex: Experts wonder why the US government is not taking similarly strong actions against AIDS in this country...
example.tran: 专家们对为什么美国政府没在这个国家采取类似的强硬措施来对抗艾滋病而感到疑惑。

collins.def: You use why to introduce a relative clause after the word 'reason'.

example.ex: There's a reason why women don't read this stuff; it's not funny...
example.tran: 女人不读这种东西是有原因的，它并不好笑。

example.ex: Unless you're ill, there's no reason why you can't get those 15 minutes of walking in daily.
example.tran: 除非你病了，否则你没有理由每天连走15分钟都做不到的。

collins.tran: (问句中与 not 连用表示建议)为什么(不)
collins.def: You use why with 'not' in questions in order to introduce a suggestion.

example.ex: Why not give Claire a call?...
example.tran: 为什么不给克莱尔打个电话？

example.ex: Why don't you come home with me until you sort things out?...
example.tran: 你何不先和我一起回家，等事情解决了再走？

collins.tran: (问句中与 not 连用表示恼怒或气愤)为什么(不)
collins.def: You use why with 'not' in questions in order to express your annoyance or anger.

example.ex: Why don't you look where you're going?...
example.tran: 走路怎么不看着点儿道呢？

example.ex: Why don't they just leave it alone?
example.tran: 他们就不能别管了吗？

collins.tran: (表示同意别人的建议)为什么不呢，好，行
collins.def: You say why not in order to agree with what someone has suggested.

example.ex: 'Want to spend the afternoon with me?' — 'Why not?'...
example.tran: “想和我共度这个下午吗？”——“好啊！”

example.ex: 'Shall I tell them about poor Mrs Blair?'—'Why not?'
example.tran: “我应该告诉他们可怜的布莱尔太太的情况吗？”——“为什么不呢？”

collins.tran: (用于句首表示惊讶、震惊或生气)哎呀，哟，嗨
collins.def: People say 'Why!' at the beginning of a sentence when they are surprised, shocked, or angry.

example.ex: Why hello, Tom...
example.tran: 哎呀，你好，汤姆。

example.ex: Why, this is nothing but common vegetable soup...
example.tran: 啊，这只不过是普通的蔬菜汤而已。

collins.def: Something that is wide measures a large distance from one side or edge to the other.

example.ex: All worktops should be wide enough to allow plenty of space for food preparation.
example.tran: 所有的厨房操作台都应该足够宽大，为制作食物提供足够的空间。

example.ex: ...a wide-brimmed sunhat.
example.tran: 宽檐遮阳帽

collins.def: A wide smile is one in which your mouth is stretched because you are very pleased or amused.

example.ex: It brought a wide smile to his face and laughter to his eyes...
example.tran: 这让他眉开眼笑。

example.ex: His face broke into a wide grin.
example.tran: 他脸上绽放出灿烂的笑容。

collins.tran: 张开很大的;完全张开的
collins.def: If you open or spread something wide, you open or spread it as far as possible or to the fullest extent.

example.ex: Open your mouth wide...
example.tran: 张大你的嘴。

example.ex: 'It was huge,' he announced, spreading his arms wide...
example.tran: “它很大很大”，他边说边伸开手臂比划着。

collins.def: You use wide to talk or ask about how much something measures from one side or edge to the other.

example.ex: ...a corridor of land 10 kilometres wide...
example.tran: 10公里宽的陆地走廊

example.ex: The road is only one track wide.
example.tran: 这条路只有一个车道那么宽。

collins.tran: 范围广的;包容的;广泛的
collins.def: You use wide to describe something that includes a large number of different things or people.

example.ex: The brochure offers a wide choice of hotels, apartments and holiday homes...
example.tran: 这本小册子提供了很多宾馆、公寓、度假屋供选择。

example.ex: The proposed constitution gives him much wider powers than his predecessor.
example.tran: 宪法提案赋予他比前任大得多的权力。

collins.tran: 广泛的;广为流传的;广为人知的
collins.def: You use wide to say that something is found, believed, known, or supported by many people or throughout a large area.

example.ex: The case has attracted wide publicity...
example.tran: 这个案子吸引了广泛的关注。

example.ex: I suspect this book will have the widest appeal of all...
example.tran: 我猜想这本书会引起大家最广泛的兴趣。

collins.def: A wide difference or gap between two things, ideas, or qualities is a large difference or gap.

example.ex: Research shows a wide difference in tastes around the country...
example.tran: 研究表明全国各地的口味大有不同。

example.ex: There are wide variations caused by different academic programme structures.
example.tran: 不同的教学项目结构造成了巨大的差异。

collins.tran: 更大的;更多的;更广泛的
collins.def: Wider is used to describe something which relates to the most important or general parts of a situation, rather than to the smaller parts or to details.

example.ex: He emphasised the wider issue of superpower cooperation...
example.tran: 他强调了超级大国合作这一更重要的议题。

example.ex: Oakley locates housework in the wider context of economic, social and political structures.
example.tran: 奥克利把家务置于更广泛的经济、社会和政治结构背景中。

collins.tran: 未击中目标的;未打中的
collins.def: If something such as a shot or punch is wide, it does not hit its target but lands to the right or left of it.

example.ex: The shot was wide anyway...
example.tran: 不管怎样，这枪没打中。

example.ex: Nearly half the missiles landed wide.
example.tran: 有近一半的导弹落点出现偏差。

collins.def: A man's wife is the woman he is married to.

example.ex: He married his wife Jane 37 years ago...
example.tran: 他37年前娶了妻子简。

example.ex: The woman was the wife of a film director.
example.tran: 这个女人是一个电影导演的妻子。

collins.def: If you win something such as a competition, battle, or argument, you defeat those people you are competing or fighting against, or you do better than everyone else involved.

example.ex: He does not have any realistic chance of winning the election...
example.tran: 他没有一点儿赢得选举的现实机会。

example.ex: The NCAA basketball championship was won by North Carolina.
example.tran: 北卡罗来纳大学在美国大学篮球联赛中夺魁。

collins.def: If something wins you something such as an election, competition, battle, or argument, it causes you to defeat the people competing with you or fighting you, or to do better than everyone else involved.

example.ex: That sort of gain for Labour is nothing like good enough to win them the general election...
example.tran: 工党那点斩获远不足以让他们赢得大选。

example.ex: Graham is more determined than ever to win the club its third Championship under his command.
example.tran: 格雷厄姆比任何时候都更有决心指挥队伍为俱乐部赢得第3个冠军。

collins.def: If you win something such as a prize or medal, you get it because you have defeated everyone else in something such as an election, competition, battle, or argument, or have done very well in it.

example.ex: The first correct entry wins the prize...
example.tran: 第一个答对者将获得奖品。

example.ex: She won bronze for Great Britain in the European Championships.
example.tran: 她在欧洲锦标赛上为英国队赢得铜牌。

collins.tran: 获得，赢得(想要或需要之物)
collins.def: If you win something that you want or need, you succeed in getting it.

example.ex: ...moves to win the support of the poor...
example.tran: 赢得穷人支持的举措

example.ex: British Aerospace has won an order worth 340 million dollars.
example.tran: 英国宇航公司已经赢得了3.4亿美元的订单。

collins.def: If something wins you a prize or wins you something else that you want, it causes you to get it.

example.ex: The feat won them a prize of £85,000...
example.tran: 这一业绩为他们赢得了85,000英镑的奖金。

example.ex: Good weather leading to good grain harvests should win the country relief from food shortages.
example.tran: 能带来粮食丰收的好天气应该可以让该国的缺粮状况得到缓解。

collins.tran: 注定失败;怎么做都不好
collins.def: If you say that someone can't win in a particular situation, you mean that they are certain to fail or to suffer whatever they do.

example.ex: If you're too assertive they regard you as an aggressive hysterical woman. I mean, you can't win!
example.tran: 如果你太坚定自信，他们就会把你看作是咄咄逼人、歇斯底里的女人。我是说，你怎么做都不对。

collins.tran: (与人稍稍争论后，虽然不情愿，但同意按对方说的做，或接受其建议)听你的，按你说的做
collins.def: You say 'you win' when you have been having a slight argument with someone and you are indicating that you agree to do what they want or that you accept their suggestion, even though you do not really want to.

example.ex: 'All right', I said. 'You win'.
example.tran: “好吧，”我说道，“听你的。”

collins.def: If one person is with another, they are together in one place.

example.ex: With her were her son and daughter-in-law...
example.tran: 和她在一起的是她的儿子和儿媳。

example.ex: She is currently staying with her father at his home.
example.tran: 她现在陪父亲呆在家里。

collins.def: If something is put with or is with something else, they are used at the same time.

example.ex: Serve hot, with pasta or rice and French beans...
example.tran: 趁热和意大利面或米饭以及四季豆一起端上桌。

example.ex: Cookies are just the thing to serve with tall glasses of real lemonade.
example.tran: 曲奇就应该搭配高脚杯的天然柠檬汁一起享用。

collins.def: If you do something with someone else, you both do it together or are both involved in it.

example.ex: Parents will be able to discuss their child's progress with their teacher...
example.tran: 家长将可以和老师交流谈论子女的进步情况。

example.ex: He walked with her to the front door.
example.tran: 他陪她走到前门。

collins.tran: 和，与，同(…打斗、争论或竞争)
collins.def: If you fight, argue, or compete with someone, you oppose them.

example.ex: About a thousand students fought with riot police in the capital...
example.tran: 大约1,000名学生在首都与防暴警察发生了冲突。

example.ex: He was in an argument with his landlord downstairs.
example.tran: 他与楼下的房东发生了争执。

collins.tran: 用，使用(某种工具、物品或材料)
collins.def: If you do something with a particular tool, object, or substance, you do it using that tool, object, or substance.

example.ex: Remove the meat with a fork and divide it among four plates...
example.tran: 用餐叉把肉叉走，分到4个盘里。

example.ex: Pack the fruits and nuts into the jars and cover with brandy...
example.tran: 把水果和坚果放进罐子里，用白兰地酒浸泡。

collins.def: If someone stands or goes somewhere with something, they are carrying it.

example.ex: A man came round with a tray of chocolates...
example.tran: 一名男子端着一托盘巧克力走过来。

example.ex: A young woman came in with a cup of coffee.
example.tran: 一名年轻女子端着一杯咖啡走进来。

collins.tran: 有，拥有(某种特征或所有物)
collins.def: Someone or something with a particular feature or possession has that feature or possession.

example.ex: He was in his early forties, tall and blond with bright blue eyes...
example.tran: 他40出头儿，高高的个子，金黄头发，一双天蓝色眼睛。

example.ex: Someone with an income of $34,895 can afford this loan.
example.tran: 一个收入为34,895美元的人能负担得起这笔贷款。

collins.def: Someone with an illness has that illness.

example.ex: I spent a week in bed with flu.
example.tran: 我得了流感，一星期都卧病在床。

collins.def: If something is filled or covered with a substance or with things, it has that substance or those things in it or on it.

example.ex: His legs were caked with dried mud...
example.tran: 他腿上结着干泥巴。

example.ex: They sat at a Formica table cluttered with dirty tea cups.
example.tran: 他们坐在铺有福米加塑料贴面的餐桌前，桌上凌乱地堆着用过的茶杯。

collins.def: If you are, for example, pleased or annoyed with someone or something, you have that feeling towards them.

example.ex: He was still a little angry with her...
example.tran: 他还有点儿生她的气。

example.ex: After sixteen years of marriage they have grown bored with each other...
example.tran: 结婚16年后，他们已经渐渐彼此厌倦了。

collins.def: You use with to indicate what a state, quality, or action relates to, involves, or affects.

example.ex: Our aim is to allow student teachers to become familiar with the classroom...
example.tran: 我们的目标就是让实习教师熟悉课堂。

example.ex: He still has a serious problem with money...
example.tran: 他手头儿还是很紧。

collins.tran: 用(某种方式)；带着(某种感情)
collins.def: You use with when indicating the way that something is done or the feeling that a person has when they do something.

example.ex: ...teaching her to read music with skill and sensitivity...
example.tran: 教她熟练而敏锐地识乐谱

example.ex: He agreed, but with reluctance.
example.tran: 他同意了，但很勉强。

collins.tran: 伴着(声音或手势);带着(表情)
collins.def: You use with when indicating a sound or gesture that is made when something is done, or an expression that a person has on their face when they do something.

example.ex: With a sigh, she leant back and closed her eyes...
example.tran: 她叹了口气，身体向后倚靠，闭上了眼睛。

example.ex: The front door closed with a crash behind him...
example.tran: 前门在他身后砰的一声关上了。

collins.tran: 由于，因为(某种感情而使某人有某种表现或行为)
collins.def: You use with to indicate the feeling that makes someone have a particular appearance or type of behaviour.

example.ex: Gil was white and trembling with anger...
example.tran: 吉尔气得脸色煞白，浑身发抖。

example.ex: I felt sick to my stomach with sadness for them...
example.tran: 我为他们感到十分痛心。

collins.tran: （表示以某姿势、外表或伴随某事件做某事）与…同时，随着
collins.def: You use with when mentioning the position or appearance of a person or thing at the time that they do something, or what someone else is doing at that time.

example.ex: Joanne stood with her hands on the sink, staring out the window...
example.tran: 乔安妮站着，两手放在水槽上，眼睛定定地望着窗外。

example.ex: Michelle had fallen asleep with her head against his shoulder...
example.tran: 米歇尔睡着了，头靠在他的肩上。

collins.def: You use with to introduce a current situation that is a factor affecting another situation.

example.ex: With all the night school courses available, there is no excuse for not getting some sort of training...
example.tran: 夜校课程一应俱全，没理由不去接受一些培训。

example.ex: With the win, the US reclaimed the cup for the first time since 1985.
example.tran: 这次胜利使美国队自1985年后第一次重获此杯。

collins.def: You use with when making a comparison or contrast between the situations of different people or things.

example.ex: We're not like them. It's different with us...
example.tran: 我们和他们不一样,我们不那么做。

example.ex: Sometimes I'm busy and sometimes I'm not. It's the same with most jobs.
example.tran: 我时忙时闲，大多数工作都是如此。

collins.tran: 随着，跟着(…的变化而变化)
collins.def: If something increases or decreases with a particular factor, it changes as that factor changes.

example.ex: The risk of developing heart disease increases with the number of cigarettes smoked...
example.tran: 吸食香烟的数量越多，患心脏病的风险就越大。

example.ex: Blood pressure decreases with exercise.
example.tran: 血压随着锻炼而降低。

collins.tran: 与(风、水流等)方向一致；顺着…
collins.def: If something moves with a wind or current, it moves in the same direction as the wind or current.

example.ex: ...a piece of driftwood carried down with the current...
example.tran: 顺流而下的一块浮木

example.ex: We left him there to float off with the tide, and told him to follow the coast.
example.tran: 我们把他放在那里，让他随波漂流，并且告诉他要沿着海岸线走。

collins.def: If someone says that they are with you, they mean that they understand what you are saying.

example.ex: Yes, I know who you mean. Yes, now I'm with you...
example.tran: 是的，我知道你说的是谁。是的，我现在明白你的意思了。

example.ex: I'm not with you. Tell me what you mean.
example.tran: 我不明白你说的话，告诉我你是什么意思。

collins.def: If someone says that they are with you, they mean that they support or approve of what you are doing.

example.ex: 'I'm with you all the way.'  — 'Thank you.'
example.tran: “我会一直支持你。”——“谢谢！”

collins.def: If something is within a place, area, or object, it is inside it or surrounded by it.

example.ex: Clients are entertained within private dining rooms...
example.tran: 在私人餐室内款待客户。

example.ex: An olive-coloured tent stood within a thicket of trees.
example.tran: 一顶橄榄色帐篷扎在树丛当中。

collins.tran: 在(社会、组织或体系)中(发生或存在)
collins.def: Something that happens or exists within a society, organization, or system, happens or exists inside it.

example.ex: The motives that attract people to work within a social service are variable.
example.tran: 吸引人们到社会福利部门工作的动机各不相同。

example.ex: ...the spirit of self-sacrifice within an army...
example.tran: 军队中的自我牺牲精神

collins.def: If you experience a particular feeling, you can say that it is within you.

example.ex: He's coping much better within himself...
example.tran: 他心里好受多了。

example.ex: You've got to identify these inadequacies within yourself.
example.tran: 你必须认识到自身的这些不足。

collins.tran: 在(某种限度或规则)之内
collins.def: If something is within a particular limit or set of rules, it does not go beyond it or is not more than what is allowed.

example.ex: Troops have agreed to stay within specific boundaries to avoid confrontations...
example.tran: 军队同意驻扎在特定地界内，以避免冲突。

example.ex: Exercise within your comfortable limit...
example.tran: 要进行适度锻炼。

collins.tran: 在(某一距离)之内;不超出(某一距离)
collins.def: If you are within a particular distance of a place, you are less than that distance from it.

example.ex: The man was within a few feet of him...
example.tran: 这个男子离他只有几英尺。

example.ex: It was within easy walking distance of the hotel...
example.tran: 它离旅馆仅几步之遥。

collins.tran: 在(某段时间)内;不超出(某段时间)
collins.def: Within a particular length of time means before that length of time has passed.

example.ex: About 40% of all students entering as freshmen graduate within 4 years...
example.tran: 所有入学新生中约有40%在4年内毕业。

example.ex: Within 24 hours the deal was completed.
example.tran: 交易在24小时内完成。

collins.def: If something is within sight ,within earshot, or within reach, you can see it, hear it, or reach it.

example.ex: His twenty-five-foot boat was moored within sight of West Church.
example.tran: 他那条25英尺长的小船停泊在看得见西教堂的地方。

example.ex: ...her heels clicking on the tiled floor, probably an irritating noise to other people within earshot...
example.tran: 她的鞋跟踩在瓷砖地板上咯噔咯噔响，这声音可能会让听见的人觉得心烦

collins.def: You use without to indicate that someone or something does not have or use the thing mentioned.

example.ex: I don't like myself without a beard...
example.tran: 我不喜欢自己没胡子的样子。

example.ex: She wore a brown shirt pressed without a wrinkle.
example.tran: 她穿着一件熨烫得没有一点儿褶儿的棕色衬衫。

collins.tran: 在没有(发生或做某事)的情况下
collins.def: If one thing happens without another thing, or if you do something without doing something else, the second thing does not happen or occur.

example.ex: He was offered a generous pension provided he left without a fuss...
example.tran: 他如果一声不吭地离开，就会获得一笔丰厚的养老金。

example.ex: They worked without a break until about eight in the evening...
example.tran: 他们一刻不停地干到晚上8点钟左右。

collins.def: If you do something without a particular feeling, you do not have that feeling when you do it.

example.ex: Janet Magnusson watched his approach without enthusiasm...
example.tran: 珍妮特·马格努森冷冷地看着他走过来。

example.ex: 'Hello, Swanson,' he said without surprise.
example.tran: “你好，斯旺森。”他说话的时候并未显得惊讶。

collins.def: If you do something without someone else, they are not in the same place as you are or are not involved in the same action as you.

example.ex: I told Franklin he would have to start dinner without me...
example.tran: 我告诉富兰克林吃晚饭不必等我。

example.ex: How can I rebuild my life without my husband?...
example.tran: 失去丈夫后我怎么才能重新开始生活？

collins.def: A woman is an adult female human being.

example.ex: ...a young Lithuanian woman named Dayva.
example.tran: 名叫戴娃的立陶宛年轻女子

example.ex: ...men and women over 75 years old.
example.tran: 75岁以上的男女

collins.def: You can refer to women in general as woman .

example.ex: ...the oppression of woman.
example.tran: 对妇女的压迫

collins.tran: 爱好…的女人;喜欢做…的女子
collins.def: If you say that a woman is, for example, a gambling woman or an outdoors woman, you mean that she likes gambling or outdoor activities.

example.ex: She is an avid outdoors woman...
example.tran: 她酷爱户外运动。

example.ex: I'm too old to have a dog now. I'm a cat woman.
example.tran: 我太老了，养不了狗。我喜欢养猫。

collins.tran: 来自…的女人;在…上大学的女子
collins.def: If you say that a woman is, for example, a London woman or an Oxford woman, you mean that she comes from London or Oxford, or went to university there.

example.ex: ...a 38-year-old London woman...
example.tran: 38岁的伦敦女子

example.ex: The headmistress was an Oxford woman.
example.tran: 女校长毕业于牛津大学。

collins.def: Some people refer to a man's wife, lover, or girlfriend as his woman .

example.ex: I know my woman will never leave me.
example.tran: 我知道我的女人永远不会离开我。

collins.tran: (公司或组织的)女代表，女代理人
collins.def: You can refer to a female representative of a company or organization as that company or organization's woman .

example.ex: Yet another successful Labour woman took her seat...
example.tran: 又有一位成功的工党女代表就任议员。

example.ex: That's Judith Croft, the CND woman.
example.tran: 那个就是朱迪丝·克罗夫特, 核裁军运动女代表。

collins.tran: (命令性的或生气、不耐烦时的称呼)婆娘，娘儿们
collins.def: People sometimes address a woman as woman when they are ordering her to do something or when they are angry or impatient with her. This use could cause offence.

example.ex: Do you realize, woman, the scandal and publicity that will be involved?
example.tran: 臭婆娘，你知不知道这会恶名远扬？

collins.def: If you say that a woman is her own woman, you approve of the fact that she makes her plans and decisions herself, and does not depend on other people.

example.ex: She knew she had made the right decision. She was her own woman again.
example.tran: 她知道她作了一个正确的决定。她又独立自主了。

collins.def: A word is a single unit of language that can be represented in writing or speech. In English, a word has a space on either side of it when it is written.

example.ex: The words stood out clearly on the page...
example.tran: 那些字赫然写在纸上。

example.ex: The word 'ginseng' comes from the Chinese word 'ren-shen'.
example.tran: ginseng 这个词来自汉语的“人参”。

collins.def: Someone's words are what they say or write.

example.ex: I was devastated when her words came true...
example.tran: 她的话应验了，我伤心欲绝。

example.ex: The words of the young woman doctor echoed in his ears...
example.tran: 那位年轻女医生的话在他耳畔回响。

collins.def: The words of a song consist of the text that is sung, in contrast to the music that is played.

example.ex: Can you hear the words on the album?
example.tran: 你听得清这张专辑中的歌词吗？

collins.tran: 短时间的谈话;短暂的聊天
collins.def: If you have a word with someone, you have a short conversation with them.

example.ex: I think it's time you had a word with him...
example.tran: 我觉得你该跟他谈谈了。

example.ex: James, could I have a quiet word?...
example.tran: 詹姆斯，我能和你私下说几句吗？

collins.def: If you offer someone a word of something such as warning, advice, or praise, you warn, advise, or praise them.

example.ex: A word of warning. Don't stick too precisely to what it says in the book...
example.tran: 提醒一句：不要过于迷信书上的话。

example.ex: May I also say a word of thanks to all the people who sent letters.
example.tran: 请允许我也向所有来信的人表示感谢。

collins.tran: 一句话，一个字(也没有听到、明白或说)
collins.def: If you say that someone does not hear, understand, or say a word, you are emphasizing that they hear, understand, or say nothing at all.

example.ex: I can't understand a word she says...
example.tran: 她说的我一点儿也不懂。

example.ex: I bet he doesn't remember a single word...
example.tran: 我敢说他一个字都不记得。

collins.def: If there is word of something, people receive news or information about it.

example.ex: There is no word from the authorities on the reported attack...
example.tran: 所报道的袭击事件没有得到当局的证实。

example.ex: Word has been spreading fast of the incidents on the streets...
example.tran: 有关街头骚乱的消息迅速传播开来。

collins.def: If you give your word, you make a sincere promise to someone.

example.ex: ...an adult who gave his word the boy would be supervised...
example.tran: 一位承诺监护这个男孩的成年男子

example.ex: He simply cannot be trusted to keep his word.
example.tran: 根本不能相信他会信守诺言。

collins.def: If someone gives the word to do something, they give an order to do it.

example.ex: I want nothing said about this until I give the word.
example.tran: 没有我的命令，不准议论这件事。

collins.def: To word something in a particular way means to choose or use particular words to express it.

example.ex: If I had written the letter, I might have worded it differently.
example.tran: 如果换作我写这封信，我或许会用不同的措辞。

collins.def: If you say that people consider something to be a dirty word, you mean that they disapprove of it.

example.ex: So many people think feminism is a dirty word.
example.tran: 这么多人都认为女权主义是个龌龊的字眼。

collins.tran: 收回前言，承认说错了话(尤指此举令说话人显得愚蠢时)
collins.def: If you say that someone has to eat their words, you mean that they have to admit that they were wrong about something they said in the past, especially when this makes them look foolish.

example.ex: He has had to eat his words about the company being recession-proof.
example.tran: 他不得不收回他说过的公司能免受经济衰退影响的话。

collins.tran: 沉默寡言的，少言寡语的，话不多的(尤指不谈及自己的意见和感情)
collins.def: A person of few words says very little, especially about their opinions or feelings.

example.ex: He's a man of few words, very polite and unassuming.
example.tran: 他是个沉默寡言的人，彬彬有礼，待人谦和。

collins.def: If you do something from the word go, you do it from the very beginning of a period of time or situation.

example.ex: It's essential you make the right decisions from the word go.
example.tran: 关键是从一开始就作出正确的决定。

collins.tran: (因为仰慕或尊敬而)仔细倾听，一字不落地认真听
collins.def: If you hang on someone's every word, you listen very carefully to what they are saying, because you admire or respect them.

example.ex: Melina was hanging on his every word, fascinated.
example.tran: 梅利娜凝神细听着他的每句话，被深深吸引住了。

collins.tran: 从来没一句好话／从来没一句坏话
collins.def: You can use expressions such as never have a good word to say or never have a bad word to say to emphasize that a person always criticizes someone or something, or that they never criticize them.

example.ex: The press never has a good word to say about them...
example.tran: 新闻界从来没说过他们的好话。

example.ex: She doesn't have a kind word for anyone.
example.tran: 她对谁都是冷言冷语。

collins.tran: (尤指因为一方抱怨了另一方的行为)与…争论,与…严肃讨论
collins.def: If one person has words with another, or if two or more people have words, they have a serious discussion or argument, especially because one has complained about the other's behaviour.

example.ex: We had words and she stormed out...
example.tran: 我们争执了起来，她夺门而出。

example.ex: I shall have words with these stupid friends of mine!
example.tran: 我真应该跟我这些愚蠢的朋友理论理论！

collins.tran: 用…的话说;引用…的原话说
collins.def: You can use in their words or in their own words to indicate that you are reporting what someone said using the exact words that they used.

example.ex: Even the Assistant Secretary of State had to admit that previous policy did not, in his words, produce results.
example.tran: 就连助理国务卿也不得不承认之前的政策并没有，用他的话说，收到成效。

collins.tran: 总而言之;简言之;一句话
collins.def: You use in a word to indicate that you are giving a summary of what you have just been saying, or are giving a reply, in as brief a way as possible.

example.ex: Victor, in a word, got increasingly fed up...
example.tran: 总而言之，维克多越来越厌倦了。

example.ex: 'Shouldn't he be given the leading role?' — 'In a word — No.'
example.tran: “难道不该让他当主角吗？”——“一句话——不行。”

collins.tran: (讨论、争论、分歧中的)最终决定权
collins.def: If someone has the last word or the final word in a discussion, argument, or disagreement, they are the one who wins it or who makes the final decision.

example.ex: She does like to have the last word in any discussion...
example.tran: 她确实喜欢商量什么事都最终自己说了算。

example.ex: The final word will still come from the Secretary of State.
example.tran: 最后仍然要由国务卿来定夺。

collins.def: If you say that something is the last word in luxury, comfort, or some other quality, you are emphasizing that it has a great deal of this quality.

example.ex: The spa is the last word in luxury and efficiency.
example.tran: 这家矿泉疗养浴场极尽奢华，功效极高。

collins.tran: (尤指因非常吃惊而)说不出话来，无以言表
collins.def: If someone is lost for words, they cannot think of anything to say, especially because they are very surprised by something.

example.ex: I'm lost for words — it's fantastic...
example.tran: 我无以言表——太精彩了。

example.ex: She was gaping at it, lost for words.
example.tran: 她目瞪口呆地看着这场面，一时语塞。

collins.tran: 没有直接说;拐弯抹角地说
collins.def: If you say that someone has said something, but not in so many words, you mean that they said it or expressed it, but in a very indirect way.

example.ex: 'And has she agreed to go with you?' — 'Not in so many words. But I read her thoughts'.
example.tran: “她同意跟你一起去了吗？”——“没有直接说，但我知道她是怎么想的。”

collins.tran: (用于强调刚刚警告对方的话很可能成真，尤其是认为对方应改变态度或行为予以避免时)你听着，记住我的话
collins.def: If you say 'mark my words' to someone, you are emphasizing that something you have just warned them about is very likely to happen, especially when you think they should change their attitude or behaviour to prevent it.

example.ex: That's what you'll end up with, you mark my words.
example.tran: 那就是将来你的下场，记住我的话。

collins.def: If news or information passes by word of mouth, people tell it to each other rather than it being printed in written form.

example.ex: The story has been passed down by word of mouth.
example.tran: 这个故事是口头流传下来的。

collins.def: If you say that someone is putting words into your mouth or is putting words in your mouth, you mean that they are suggesting that you mean one thing when you really mean something different.

collins.tran: 说话算数的人;一诺千金的人
collins.def: If you refer to someone as a man of his word or a woman of her word, you mean that they always keep their promises and can be relied on.

collins.tran: 换言之;换句话说;也就是说
collins.def: You say in other words in order to introduce a different, and usually simpler, explanation or interpretation of something that has just been said.

example.ex: The mobile library services have been reorganised — in other words, they visit fewer places.
example.tran: 流动图书馆服务重新作了安排——换句话说，他们去的地方减少了。

collins.def: If you say something in your own words, you express it in your own way, without copying or repeating someone else's description.

example.ex: Now tell us in your own words about the events of Saturday.
example.tran: 现在你来给我们讲讲星期六的活动吧。

collins.def: If you pass the word, you tell someone something that another person has told you.

example.ex: Friends passed the word that the miners wanted to see him.
example.tran: 朋友们传话说矿工们想见他。

collins.tran: 发话，下令(示意某事应该开始)
collins.def: If someone says the word, they give their approval as a sign that something should start to happen.

example.ex: When I say the word, follow me down.
example.tran: 我一发话，就跟着我下来。

collins.def: If you spread the word, you tell people about something.

example.ex: The community reacted quickly and spread the word about safe sex.
example.tran: 社区迅速作出反应，宣传安全性行为。

collins.def: If you take someone at their word, you believe what they say, when they did not really mean it or when they meant something slightly different.

example.ex: They're willing to take him at his word when he says, 'Oh, I made mistakes and now I'll change.'
example.tran: 只要他说“哦，我错了，现在我要改过自新”，他们就愿意当真。

collins.def: If you say to someone 'take my word for it', you mean that they should believe you because you are telling the truth.

example.ex: You'll buy nothing but trouble if you buy that house, take my word for it.
example.tran: 你要是买那栋房子只会买来麻烦，我说的都是真的。

collins.tran: 极其愚蠢/荒唐得让人无语
collins.def: You can use expressions such as too silly for words and too ridiculous for words to emphasize that someone or something is extremely silly or ridiculous.

example.ex: It's too stupid for words not having the machines switched on when they're most needed...
example.tran: 最需要这些机器时却不打开，真是愚蠢至极。

example.ex: I feel simply too devastated for words.
example.tran: 我惊愕万分，不知说什么好。

collins.tran: 信守诺言;说话算话;说到做到
collins.def: If you are true to your word or as good as your word, you do what you say you will do.

example.ex: How do I know that he will be true to his word?...
example.tran: 我怎么知道他会信守诺言呢？

example.ex: They were as good as their word and stayed away.
example.tran: 他们信守诺言，离得远远的。

collins.def: If you repeat something word for word, you repeat it exactly as it was originally said or written.

example.ex: I don't try to memorize speeches word for word.
example.tran: 我不会试图一字不落地记住讲话要说的内容。

collins.def: People who work have a job, usually one which they are paid to do.

example.ex: Weiner works for the US Department of Transport...
example.tran: 韦纳就职于美国交通部。

example.ex: I started working in a recording studio...
example.tran: 我开始在一个录音棚工作。

collins.def: People who have work or who are in work have a job, usually one which they are paid to do.

example.ex: Fewer and fewer people are in work...
example.tran: 就业人数越来越少。

example.ex: I was out of work at the time...
example.tran: 那时我失业了。

collins.def: When you work, you do the things that you are paid or required to do in your job.

example.ex: I can't talk to you right now—I'm working...
example.tran: 这会儿我不能跟你说话——我在干活儿。

example.ex: He was working at his desk...
example.tran: 他正在桌前用功。

collins.def: Your work consists of the things you are paid or required to do in your job.

example.ex: We're supposed to be running a business here. I've got work to do...
example.tran: 我们在这里应该是要经营公司。我有一堆的事情要做。

example.ex: I used to take work home, but I don't do it any more...
example.tran: 我过去常把活儿带回家干，不过我如今再也不这么做了。

collins.def: When you work, you spend time and effort doing a task that needs to be done or trying to achieve something.

example.ex: Linda spends all her time working on the garden...
example.tran: 琳达把所有时间都花在打理花园上。

example.ex: While I was working on my letter the telephone rang...
example.tran: 我正在写信，电话铃响了。

collins.def: Work is the place where you do your job.

example.ex: Many people travel to work by car...
example.tran: 很多人开车去上班。

example.ex: She told her friends at work that she was trying to lose weight.
example.tran: 她跟单位的朋友说她在努力减肥。

collins.def: Work is something which you produce as a result of an activity or as a result of doing your job.

example.ex: It can help to have an impartial third party look over your work...
example.tran: 让客观公正的第三方看一下你的成果会有助益。

example.ex: Tidiness in the workshop is really essential for producing good work...
example.tran: 工作间干净整洁对于生产出好的产品非常重要。

collins.tran: (艺术家、作家、作曲家等的)作品；著作
collins.def: A work is something such as a painting, book, or piece of music produced by an artist, writer, or composer.

example.ex: In my opinion, this is Rembrandt's greatest work...
example.tran: 我认为这是伦勃朗最伟大的作品。

example.ex: Under his arm, there was a book which looked like the complete works of Shakespeare...
example.tran: 他胳膊底下夹着一本书，看上去就像是夹了《莎士比亚全集》。

collins.def: If someone is working on a particular subject or question, they are studying or researching it.

example.ex: Professor Bonnet has been working for many years on molecules of this type.
example.tran: 邦尼特教授多年来一直在从事这种分子的研究工作。

collins.def: If you work with a person or a group of people, you spend time and effort trying to help them in some way.

example.ex: She spent a period of time working with people dying of cancer...
example.tran: 她有一段时间曾帮助垂危的癌症患者。

example.ex: He knew then that he wanted to work among the poor.
example.tran: 他那时明白了自己想帮助穷人。

collins.def: If a machine or piece of equipment works, it operates and performs a particular function.

example.ex: The pump doesn't work and we have no running water...
example.tran: 水泵坏了，我们没有自来水了。

example.ex: Is the telephone working today?...
example.tran: 电话今天能用吗？

collins.def: If an idea, system, or way of doing something works, it is successful, effective, or satisfactory.

example.ex: 95 per cent of these diets do not work...
example.tran: 这些节食方法95%都不起作用。

example.ex: If lust is all there is to hold you together, the relationship will never work...
example.tran: 如果肉欲是你们在一起的唯一理由，这种关系是不会持久的。

collins.def: If a drug or medicine works, it produces a particular physical effect.

example.ex: I wake at 6 am as the sleeping pill doesn't work for more than nine hours...
example.tran: 安眠药的药效不会超过9个小时，所以我清晨6点就醒了。

example.ex: The drug works by increasing levels of serotonin in the brain.
example.tran: 这种药物通过提高大脑中血清素的含量来产生疗效。

collins.tran: 产生(有利或不利的)影响
collins.def: If something works in your favour, it helps you in some way. If something works to your disadvantage, it causes problems for you in some way.

example.ex: One factor thought to have worked in his favour is his working class image...
example.tran: 据认为，一个帮上了他的因素就是他的工人阶级形象。

example.ex: This obviously works against the interests of the child.
example.tran: 这显然会对孩子不利。

collins.tran: 对…产生(神奇的影响);使…深受（魅力感染）
collins.def: If something or someone works their magic or works their charms on a person, they have a powerful positive effect on them.

example.ex: Nevertheless, she is always optimistic about the possibilities and can work her charm on the disenchanted...
example.tran: 虽然如此，她总是乐观地抱持希望，并能深深地感染那些心灰意冷的人。

example.ex: Our spirits rallied as the bitter-sweet alcohol worked its magic.
example.tran: 苦中带甜的酒发挥了奇效，我们的精神随之振奋起来。

collins.def: If your mind or brain is working, you are thinking about something or trying to solve a problem.

example.ex: My mind was working frantically, running over the events of the evening.
example.tran: 我的大脑疯狂地运转，把那晚发生的事情飞快地一幕幕重演。

collins.tran: 以(某种假定或思想)为基础(或前提)
collins.def: If you work on an assumption or idea, you act as if it were true or base other ideas on it, until you have more information.

example.ex: We are working on the assumption that it was a gas explosion.
example.tran: 我们假设这是一场燃气爆炸事故。

collins.tran: 在(某地或某类场所)工作;在…奔波
collins.def: If you work a particular area or type of place, you travel around that area or work in those places as part of your job, for example trying to sell something there.

example.ex: Brand has been working the clubs and the pubs since 1986, developing her comedy act...
example.tran: 布兰德自1986年以来一直在俱乐部和酒吧表演，提高她的喜剧演技。

example.ex: This is the seventh year that he has worked the streets of Manhattan.
example.tran: 这是他在曼哈顿街头献艺的第7个年头。

collins.def: If you work someone, you make them spend time and effort doing a particular activity or job.

example.ex: They're working me too hard. I'm too old for this...
example.tran: 他们把我用得太狠了，我老了，干不了这种活儿啦。

example.ex: They didn't take my father away, but kept him in the village and worked him to death.
example.tran: 他们没有把我爸爸带走，而是一直让他在村里干活，把他活活累死了。

collins.tran: (常指政客或艺人)博得，赢得(众人的支持或欢心)
collins.def: If someone, often a politician or entertainer, works a crowd, they create a good relationship with the people in the crowd and get their support or interest.

example.ex: The Prime Minister has an ability to work a crowd — some might even suggest it is a kind of charm...
example.tran: 首相有种感召人群的本事——有些人甚至认为这是一种魅力。

example.ex: He worked the room like a politician, gripping hands, and slapping backs.
example.tran: 他又是握手，又是拍背，像个政客一样把一屋子的人都笼络了一番。

collins.def: When people work the land, they do all the tasks involved in growing crops.

example.ex: Farmers worked the fertile valleys.
example.tran: 农民们在肥沃的山谷里耕种。

collins.def: When a mine is worked, minerals such as coal or gold are removed from it.

example.ex: The mines had first been worked in 1849, when gold was discovered in California...
example.tran: 1849年加利福尼亚发现金矿时，这些矿第一次被开采。

example.ex: Only an agreed number of men was allowed to work any given seam at any given time.
example.tran: 只有少数得到批准的人可以在特定时间开采特定的矿层。

collins.def: If you work a machine or piece of equipment, you use or control it.

example.ex: Many adults still depend on their children to work the video.
example.tran: 很多成年人仍然要靠孩子来操作录像机。

collins.def: If something works into a particular state or condition, it gradually moves so that it is in that state or condition.

example.ex: A screw had worked loose from my glasses.
example.tran: 我眼镜上有一个螺丝松了。

collins.def: If you work a substance such as dough or clay, you keep pressing it to make it have a particular texture.

example.ex: Work the dough with the palm of your hand until it is very smooth...
example.tran: 用手掌将面团揉至光滑为止。

example.ex: Remove rind from the cheese and work it to a firm paste, with a fork.
example.tran: 将奶酪的外皮去掉，用叉子将其压成硬硬的膏状。

collins.def: If you work a material such as metal, leather, or stone, you cut, sew, or shape it in order to make something or to create a design.

example.ex: ...the machines needed to extract and work the raw stone.
example.tran: 开采加工原石的机器

example.ex: ...a long, cool tunnel of worked stone.
example.tran: 一条跨度长且阴凉的石凿隧道

collins.tran: 使用，采用(某种材料或物质)
collins.def: If you work with a particular substance or material, you use it in order to make something or to create a design.

example.ex: He studied sculpture because he enjoyed working with clay.
example.tran: 他学习雕塑是因为他喜欢玩黏土。

collins.def: If you work a part of your body, or if it works, you move it.

example.ex: Each position will work the muscles in a different way...
example.tran: 每种姿势都会以不同方式活动肌肉。

example.ex: Her mouth was working in her sleep.
example.tran: 她睡着的时候嘴巴还在动。

collins.def: A works is a place where something is manufactured or where an industrial process is carried out. Works is used to refer to one or to more than one of these places.

example.ex: The steel works could be seen for miles.
example.tran: 这个钢厂几英里外都能看见。

example.ex: ...a recycling works.
example.tran: 回收工厂

collins.def: Works are activities such as digging the ground or building on a large scale.

example.ex: ...six years of disruptive building works, road construction and urban development.
example.tran: 6年间进行的破坏性的建筑工程、道路修筑和城市扩建

collins.tran: (某种类型的)全部物件，全套物品
collins.def: You can say the works after listing things such as someone's possessions or requirements, to emphasize that they possess or require everything you can think of in a particular category.

example.ex: Amazing place he's got there—squash courts, swimming pool, jacuzzi, the works.
example.tran: 他的那个地方真是太棒了——壁球场、游泳池、按摩浴池，一应俱全。

collins.tran: 干活儿;做工作;忙着做事
collins.def: If someone is at work they are doing their job or are busy doing a particular activity.

example.ex: The salvage teams are already hard at work trying to deal with the spilled oil...
example.tran: 救援队已经在紧张地设法处理溢出的石油。

example.ex: He is currently at work on a novel...
example.tran: 他这会儿正忙着写一篇小说。

collins.def: If a force or process is at work, it is having a particular influence or effect.

example.ex: The report suggested that the same trend was at work in politics...
example.tran: 这份报告表明，同一趋势也在影响着政治。

example.ex: It is important to understand the powerful economic and social forces at work behind our own actions.
example.tran: 重要的是，要理解在我们自身行动背后起作用的强大的经济和社会力量。

collins.def: If you say that you will have your work cut out to do something, you mean that it will be a very difficult task.

example.ex: The new administration has its work cut out for it. Creating jobs in this kind of environment is not going to be easy...
example.tran: 新一届政府面临重重困难。在这种环境下创造就业机会绝非易事。

example.ex: He will have his work cut out to get into the team.
example.tran: 他要进入该队困难重重。

collins.def: If something is in the works, it has already been planned or begun.

example.ex: He said there were dozens of economic plans in the works...
example.tran: 他说有几十项经济计划已经开始实施。

example.ex: Nobody should be surprised by this. It's been in the works for some time.
example.tran: 不应该有人对此感到惊奇，这事已经张罗了有一阵子了。

collins.def: You can use work to talk about how easily or quickly a particular task is done. For example, if a person or thing makes short work of doing something or makes light work of it, they do it quickly and easily.

example.ex: An aerosol spray will make short work of painting awkward objects...
example.tran: 用喷罐来喷涂，不好对付的物品也能轻松搞定。

example.ex: This horse made light work of the cross-country course...
example.tran: 这匹马轻松地跑完了越野赛程。

collins.def: If you describe someone as a nasty piece of work, you think they are very unpleasant or cruel.

example.ex: Underneath I think he's actually a rather nasty piece of work.
example.tran: 内心里我觉得他是个非常讨厌的家伙。

collins.def: If you put someone to work or set them to work, you give them a job or task to do.

example.ex: By stimulating the economy, we're going to put people to work...
example.tran: 我们将通过刺激经济让人们实现就业。

example.ex: Instead of sending them to prison, we have set them to work helping the lemon growers.
example.tran: 我们没有把他们送进监狱，而是让他们帮种柠檬的果农干活儿。

collins.def: If you get to work ,go to work, or set to work on a job, task, or problem, you start doing it or dealing with it.

example.ex: He promised to get to work on the state's massive deficit...
example.tran: 他承诺着手解决国家庞大的财政赤字问题。

example.ex: He returned to America where he set to work on a new novel.
example.tran: 他返回美国，开始写一部新小说。

collins.tran: 艰难地移动；缓慢地取得进展
collins.def: If you work your way somewhere, you move or progress there slowly, and with a lot of effort or work.

example.ex: Rescuers were still working their way towards the trapped men...
example.tran: 营救人员仍在艰难地向被困者靠拢。

example.ex: Many personnel managers started as secretaries or personnel assistants and worked their way up.
example.tran: 很多人事经理最初是从秘书或人事助理做起，然后慢慢升上去的。

collins.def: You can say to someone 'nice work' or 'good work' in order to thank or praise them for doing something well or quickly.

example.ex: Nice work, Matthew. I knew you could do it.
example.tran: 干得好，马修。我知道你能行。

collins.def: A particular kind of worker does the kind of work mentioned.

example.ex: ...office workers...
example.tran: 办公室职员

example.ex: The society was looking for a capable research worker.
example.tran: 该协会在物色一位有能力的研究人员。

collins.def: Workers are people who are employed in industry or business and who are not managers.

example.ex: Wages have been frozen and workers laid off.
example.tran: 工资被冻结，工人下岗。

example.ex: ...a call for the workers of the world to unite...
example.tran: 呼吁全世界工人团结起来的号召

collins.def: You can use worker to say how well or badly someone works.
