example.ex: He is a hard worker and a skilled gardener...
example.tran: 他工作很努力，对园艺很在行。

example.ex: A first-class worker, she operated the difficult Jacquard looms.
example.tran: 她技艺高超，操作着复杂的提花织布机。

collins.def: Working people have jobs which they are paid to do.

example.ex: Like working women anywhere, Asian women are buying convenience foods.
example.tran: 像其他地方的职业女性一样，亚洲女性也购买方便食品。

collins.def: Working people are ordinary people who do not have professional or very highly paid jobs.

example.ex: The needs and opinions of ordinary working people were ignored...
example.tran: 普通劳动者的需求和意见遭到忽视。

example.ex: One or two, in blue suits, might have been bank officials. Others were clearly working men.
example.tran: 有一两个穿蓝色西装的人可能是银行职员，其他的显然都是普通工人。

collins.tran: 上班时间的;工作时间的
collins.def: A working day or week is the amount of time during a normal day or week which you spend doing your job.

example.ex: For doctors the working day often has no end...
example.tran: 医生常常没有下班的时候。

example.ex: Automation would bring a shorter, more flexible working week.
example.tran: 自动化会使工作周缩短，也更为灵活。

collins.def: A working day is a day on which people go to work.

example.ex: The full effect will not be apparent until Tuesday, the first working day after the three day holiday weekend.
example.tran: 周二是周末3天假期后的第一个工作日，到那时效果才会完全显现出来。

collins.tran: （人生阶段）工作的，处于就业年龄的
collins.def: Your working life is the period of your life in which you have a job or are of a suitable age to have a job.

example.ex: He started his working life as a truck driver.
example.tran: 他的工作生涯是从当卡车司机开始的。

collins.tran: (某一地区的人口)就业的，处于就业年龄的
collins.def: The working population of an area consists of all the people in that area who have a job or who are of a suitable age to have a job.

example.ex: Almost 13 per cent of the working population is already unemployed.
example.tran: 就业人口中有将近13%已失业。

collins.tran: （条件或常规做法）工作的，工作上的
collins.def: Working conditions or practices are ones which you have in your job.

example.ex: The strikers are demanding higher pay and better working conditions.
example.tran: 罢工者要求加薪并改善工作环境。

collins.def: Working clothes are designed for doing work in, and are intended to be practical rather than attractive.
A working relationship is the relationship you have with someone when you work with them.

example.ex: A working relationship turned into a very close friendship...
example.tran: 同事关系变成了非常亲密的友谊。

example.ex: The vice-president seems to have a good working relationship with the president.
example.tran: 副总统似乎与总统有着良好的工作关系。

collins.tran: (农场或企业)经营性的，营利性的
collins.def: A working farm or business exists to do normal work and make a profit, and not only for tourists or as someone's hobby.

collins.tran: (机器零部件)能运转的，用于操作的
collins.def: The working parts of a machine are the parts which move and operate the machine, in contrast to the outer case or container in which they are enclosed.
A working model is one that has parts that move.
A working knowledge or majority is not very great, but is enough to be useful.

example.ex: This book was designed in order to provide a working knowledge of finance and accounts...
example.tran: 本书旨在提供金融和会计方面的实用知识。

example.ex: Neither candidate won a working majority.
example.tran: 两位候选人都没有赢得有效的多数票。

collins.def: A working title or definition is one which you use when starting to make or do something, but which you are likely to change or improve.

example.ex: His working title for the script was 'Trust the People'.
example.tran: 他给这个剧本暂定的标题是《相信人民》。

collins.tran: (设备、组织或系统的)工作方式，运行方式
collins.def: The workings of a piece of equipment, an organization, or a system are the ways in which it operates and the processes which are involved in it.

example.ex: Neural networks are computer systems which mimic the workings of the brain...
example.tran: 神经网络是模拟大脑工作方式的计算机系统。

example.ex: The bill would give people the right to much more information about the workings of government.
example.tran: 该法案将赋予人们了解更多有关政府运作方面信息的权利。

collins.def: You can use workings to refer to deep tunnels or holes which have been dug in the ground in order to remove coal, metal, or stone.

example.ex: ...housing which was built above old mine workings.
example.tran: 修建在老矿坑上的房屋

collins.def: The world is the planet that we live on.

example.ex: It's a beautiful part of the world...
example.tran: 这是世界上很美的一个地区。

example.ex: More than anything, I'd like to drive around the world...
example.tran: 我最想做的事是开车周游世界。

collins.def: The world refers to all the people who live on this planet, and our societies, institutions, and ways of life.

example.ex: The world was, and remains, shocked...
example.tran: 世人当时感到震惊，现在仍然如此。

example.ex: He wants to show the world that anyone can learn to be an ambassador.
example.tran: 他想向世人表明任何人都能通过学习而成为一名大使。

collins.tran: 世界上最重要的;举世瞩目的
collins.def: You can use world to describe someone or something that is one of the most important or significant of its kind on earth.

example.ex: Abroad, Mr Bush was seen as a world statesman...
example.tran: 在国外，布什先生被看作一位国际上举足轻重的政治家。

example.ex: China has once again emerged as a world power...
example.tran: 中国又一次以世界强国的姿态崛起。

collins.tran: (指某一群国家或历史时期)世界，国家，时代
collins.def: You can use world in expressions such as the Arab world ,the western world, and the ancient world to refer to a particular group of countries or a particular period in history.

example.ex: Athens had strong ties to the Arab world.
example.tran: 雅典与阿拉伯世界关系密切。

example.ex: ...the developing world...
example.tran: 发展中国家

collins.def: Someone's world is the life they lead, the people they have contact with, and the things they experience.

example.ex: His world seemed so different from mine...
example.tran: 他的生活圈子和我的似乎有天壤之别。

example.ex: I lost my job and it was like my world collapsed...
example.tran: 我丢了工作，我的世界好像都垮掉了。

collins.def: You can use world to refer to a particular field of activity, and the people involved in it.

example.ex: The publishing world had certainly never seen an event quite like this.
example.tran: 出版界以前确实没有遇见过类似这样的事。

example.ex: ...the latest news from the world of finance.
example.tran: 来自金融界的最新消息

collins.tran: （有某种特色的）地方，环境；（某种生活的）世界，境况
collins.def: You can use world to refer to a place or way of life by describing its strongest features.

example.ex: ...a golf course set in a hidden world of parkland, forest and lakes...
example.tran: 位于一处有公共绿地、森林和湖泊的隐秘之地的高尔夫球场

example.ex: The patient must re-enter a world full of problems and stresses.
example.tran: 患者必须再次进入充满问题和压力的世界。

collins.def: You can use world in expressions such as this world ,the next world, and the world to come to refer to the state of being alive or a state of existence after death.

example.ex: Good fortune will follow you, both in this world and the next.
example.tran: 无论今世还是来生，好运都会伴随你。

collins.def: You can use world to refer to a particular group of living things, for example the animal world ,the plant world, and the insect world.
A world is a planet.

example.ex: He looked like something from another world...
example.tran: 他看上去像是从另一个星球来的。

example.ex: Man was drawing closer to the stars, opening new worlds.
example.tran: 人类在接近各个星球，探索新的天体。

collins.def: If you say that two people or things are worlds apart, you are emphasizing that they are very different from each other.

example.ex: Intellectually, this man and I are worlds apart...
example.tran: 在智力上，我和这个男子有天壤之别。

example.ex: The novel is worlds apart from his academic writings.
example.tran: 这本小说和他的学术著作截然不同。

collins.def: If you say that someone has the best of both worlds, you mean that they have only the benefits of two things and none of the disadvantages.

example.ex: Her living room provides the best of both worlds, with an office at one end and comfortable sofas at the other.
example.tran: 她家客厅一头是办公处，一头是舒适的沙发，真是两全其美。

collins.def: If a woman brings a child into the world, she gives birth to it.

example.ex: I never felt I achieved a great deal in my life, apart from bringing my children into the world.
example.tran: 除了生了几个孩子，我从未觉得自己这辈子取得了很大成就。

collins.def: If you say that there is a world of difference between one thing and another, you are emphasizing that they are very different from each other.

example.ex: There's a world of difference between an amateur video and a slick Hollywood production.
example.tran: 业余制作的录像短片与好莱坞制作精湛的电影作品有天壤之别。

collins.def: If you say that you would not do something for the world, you are emphasizing that you definitely would not do it.

example.ex: I wouldn't have missed this for the world.
example.tran: 我决不会错过这个。

collins.tran: 让…感觉好很多；对…大有好处
collins.def: If you say that something has done someone the world of good or a world of good, you mean that it has made them feel better or improved their life.

example.ex: A sleep will do you the world of good.
example.tran: 睡一觉你就会感觉舒服多了。

example.ex: ...a mature performance which must have done his career prospects a world of good.
example.tran: 肯定为他的事业打开了一片坦途的成熟表演

collins.def: You use in the world to emphasize a statement that you are making.

example.ex: The saddest thing in the world is a little baby nobody wants...
example.tran: 世上最让人难受的莫过于小婴儿遭到遗弃。

example.ex: He had no one in the world but her.
example.tran: 除了她，他再也没有任何亲人。

collins.tran: (尤用于强调惊讶或愤怒)究竟，到底
collins.def: You can use in the world in expressions such as what in the world and who in the world to emphasize a question, especially when expressing surprise or anger.

example.ex: What in the world is he doing?...
example.tran: 他究竟在干什么？

example.ex: Where in the world were you when I was struggling for my life?
example.tran: 我挣扎求生的时候，你究竟在哪儿？

collins.tran: 在理想（或完美）的世界中；在理想状况下
collins.def: You can use in an ideal world or in a perfect world when you are talking about things that you would like to happen, although you realize that they are not likely to happen.

example.ex: In an ideal world Karen Stevens says she would love to stay at home with her two-and-half-year old son...
example.tran: 卡伦·史蒂文斯说在理想的生活中，她非常愿意呆在家里照料两岁半的儿子。

example.ex: In a perfect world, there would be the facilities and money to treat every sick person.
example.tran: 理想的状况是有足够的设备和财力治疗每一位病人。

collins.tran: 认为（自己）生来就该享福
collins.def: If you say that someone thinks that the world owes them a living, you are criticizing them because they think it is their right to have a comfortable life without having to make any effort at all.

example.ex: All young people must face up to reality and not kid themselves that the world owes them a living.
example.tran: 所有的年轻人都必须接受现实，不要自欺欺人，觉得生来就该享清福。

collins.tran: 阅历丰富的人;见过世面的人；老成稳重的人
collins.def: If you say that someone is a man of the world or a woman of the world, you mean that they are experienced and know about the practical or social aspects of life, and are not easily shocked by immoral or dishonest actions.

example.ex: Look, we are both men of the world, would anyone really mind?
example.tran: 听着，我们都是见过世面的人，真有人会介意吗？

example.ex: ...an elegant, clever and tough woman of the world.
example.tran: 优雅、聪明、顽强并且阅历丰富的女人

collins.tran: 极好的;一流的；非常棒的
collins.def: If you say that something is out of this world, you are emphasizing that it is extremely good or impressive.

example.ex: These new trains are out of this world.
example.tran: 这些新火车太棒了。

collins.def: You can use the outside world to refer to all the people who do not live in a particular place or who are not involved in a particular situation.

example.ex: For many, the post office is the only link with the outside world...
example.tran: 对很多人来说，这个邮局是与外界联系的唯一纽带。

example.ex: This, at least, was the situation as it appeared to the outside world.
example.tran: 至少在外界看来情况是这样的。

collins.def: If you say that something happens or exists the world over, you mean that it happens or exists in every part of the world.

example.ex: Some problems are the same the world over...
example.tran: 有些问题在全世界都一样。

example.ex: Governments the world over should do something about it.
example.tran: 世界各国政府应该对此采取行动。

collins.tran: 在自己的世界里;在自己的小天地里
collins.def: If you say that someone is in a world of their own, you mean that they seem not to notice other people or the things going on around them.

example.ex: When I'm swimming I'm in a world of my own...
example.tran: 游泳的时候，我沉浸在自己的世界里。

example.ex: Sarah was nine years old and until that moment she had been locked in a world of her own.
example.tran: 萨拉当时9岁，之前她一直封闭在自己的世界里。

collins.def: If you think the world of someone, you like them or care about them very much.

example.ex: I think the world of him, but something tells me it's not love...
example.tran: 我很在乎他，但是某种感觉告诉我这不是爱。

example.ex: We were really close. We thought the world of each other.
example.tran: 我们的确很亲近，非常在乎对方。

collins.tran: 发迹/落魄;飞黄腾达/潦倒
collins.def: If you say that someone has gone up in the world, you mean they have become richer or have a higher social status than before. If you say they have come down in the world, you mean they have become poorer or have a lower social status.

example.ex: When they started to go up in the world, they moved to a flat in London.
example.tran: 他们开始发家的时候，搬进了伦敦的一所公寓。

example.ex: ...young women of middle class families which had come down in the world.
example.tran: 出身于落魄的中产阶级家庭的年轻女子

collins.tran: (表示曾经相信、希望或期待)将，将会
collins.def: You use would when you are saying what someone believed, hoped, or expected to happen or be the case.

example.ex: No one believed he would actually kill himself...
example.tran: 没有人相信他真的会自杀。

example.ex: Would he always be like this?…
example.tran: 他会一直是这个样子吗？

collins.def: You use would when saying what someone intended to do.

example.ex: The statement added that although there were a number of differing views, these would be discussed by both sides...
example.tran: 这项声明还称，虽然双方观点存在若干分歧，但将就这些分歧展开讨论。

example.ex: George decided it was such a rare car that he would only use it for a few shows...
example.tran: 乔治认为这辆车非常稀罕，所以他只会拿它展示很少的几次。

collins.tran: (表示可能出现的情况的结果或影响)会，将会
collins.def: You use would when you are referring to the result or effect of a possible situation.

example.ex: Ordinarily it would be fun to be taken to fabulous restaurants...
example.tran: 一般来说，跟别人去豪华餐馆吃饭会是件乐事。

example.ex: It would be wrong to suggest that police officers were not annoyed by acts of indecency...
example.tran: 要是认为警官对粗鄙行为不气不恼，那可就错了。

collins.tran: (would 或 would have 与过去分词连用，表示有充分理由认为或猜测是某种情况)肯定，一定，应该
collins.def: You use would, or would have with a past participle, to indicate that you are assuming or guessing that something is true, because you have good reasons for thinking it.

example.ex: You wouldn't know him...
example.tran: 你肯定不认识他。

example.ex: His fans would already be familiar with Caroline...
example.tran: 他的崇拜者们肯定已经很熟悉卡罗琳了。

collins.tran: (用于if，unless等引导的条件状语从句的主句，表示认为某事不大可能发生)就，该
collins.def: You use would in the main clause of some 'if' and 'unless' sentences to indicate something you consider to be fairly unlikely to happen.

example.ex: If only I could get some sleep, I would be able to cope...
example.tran: 要是我能睡会儿，我就能够应付。

example.ex: I think if I went to look at more gardens, I would be better on planning and designing them...
example.tran: 我觉得如果我更多地去看一些花园,就有可能更好地规划和设计它们。

collins.def: You use would to say that someone was willing to do something. You use would not to indicate that they refused to do something.

example.ex: They said they would give the police their full cooperation...
example.tran: 他们说他们愿意与警方通力合作。

example.ex: She indicated that she would help her husband...
example.tran: 她表示愿意帮助她丈夫。

collins.tran: (表示尽管付出很大努力却没有发生)就(不)，偏(不)
collins.def: You use would not to indicate that something did not happen, often in spite of a lot of effort.

example.ex: He kicked, pushed, and hurled his shoulder at the door. It wouldn't open...
example.tran: 他冲着门又踢又推，还用肩膀撞，但门就是打不开。

example.ex: He kept trying to start the car and the battery got flatter and flatter, until it wouldn't turn the engine at all...
example.tran: 他反复试着发动车子，但电池的电越来越少，最后根本就打不着火了。

collins.tran: (尤与like, love 和 wish 连用，表示想做某事或拥有某物，或希望某事发生)要，会
collins.def: You use would, especially with 'like', 'love', and 'wish', when saying that someone wants to do or have a particular thing or wants a particular thing to happen.

example.ex: She asked me what I would like to do and mentioned a particular job...
example.tran: 她问我想干什么，然后提到了一份工作。

example.ex: Right now, your mom would like a cup of coffee...
example.tran: 你妈妈现在想喝一杯咖啡。

collins.tran: (用于带if从句的疑问句中，表示请求许可做某事)会
collins.def: You use would with 'if' clauses in questions when you are asking for permission to do something.

example.ex: Do you think it would be all right if I smoked?...
example.tran: 我可以抽烟吗？

example.ex: Mr. Cutler, would you mind if I asked a question?
example.tran: 卡特勒先生，我可以问您个问题吗？

collins.tran: (通常在疑问句中与 like 连用，表示礼貌地给予或邀请)
collins.def: You use would, usually in questions with 'like', when you are making a polite offer or invitation.

example.ex: Would you like a drink?...
example.tran: 想喝一杯吗?

example.ex: Would you like to stay?...
example.tran: 您愿意留下来吗?

collins.tran: (通常用于疑问句中，表示礼貌地请求某人做某事)请
collins.def: You use would, usually in questions, when you are politely asking someone to do something.

example.ex: Would you do me a favour and get rid of this letter I've just received?...
example.tran: 请帮个忙把我刚刚收到的这封信处理掉行吗?

example.ex: Would you come in here a moment, please?...
example.tran: 请进来一下好吗?

collins.tran: (用于批评，表示对某人做某事并不感到意外，此时 would 须重读)
collins.def: You say that someone would do something when it is typical of them and you are critical of it. You emphasize the word would when you use it in this way.

example.ex: Well, you would say that: you're a man...
example.tran: 呵，你当然会这样说的，因为你是个男的。

example.ex: 'Well, then Francesca turned round and said, That's a stupid question.' — 'She would, wouldn't she.'
example.tran: “嗯，接着弗朗西丝卡转过身说，这个问题问得真蠢。”——“她肯定会这么说，不是吗？”

collins.tran: (would 或 would have 与过去分词连用，表示发表看法或了解他人是否赞同自己的看法，尤用于对自己的话没有把握时)
collins.def: You use would, or sometimes would have with a past participle, when you are expressing your opinion about something or seeing if people agree with you, especially when you are uncertain about what you are saying.

example.ex: I think you'd agree he's a very respected columnist...
example.tran: 我想你得承认他是个备受尊敬的专栏作家。

example.ex: I would have thought it a proper job for the Army to fight rebellion...
example.tran: 我会认为派军队去平叛是恰当之举。

collins.tran: (用于以随便的口气向人提出建议)我(就)会
collins.def: You use I would when you are giving someone advice in an informal way.

example.ex: If I were you I would simply ring your friend's bell and ask for your bike back...
example.tran: 如果我是你,我就会直接去按你朋友的门铃, 把自行车要回来。

example.ex: I would not, if I were you, be inclined to discuss private business with the landlady...
example.tran: 我要是你，就不会跟房东太太谈私事。

collins.tran: (用于否定句，与 guess, know 等动词连用，表示某事不明显，尤用于某事令人吃惊时)
collins.def: You use you would in negative sentences with verbs such as 'guess' and 'know' when you want to say that something is not obvious, especially something surprising.

example.ex: Chris is so full of artistic temperament you'd never think she was the daughter of a banker...
example.tran: 克丽丝极富艺术气质，你根本想不到她是银行家的女儿。

example.ex: Inside, he admits, his emotions may be churning, but you would never guess it.
example.tran: 他承认，内心里他可能心潮起伏，但你根本不会猜到。

collins.tran: (表示某事过去惯常发生, 而现在不再发生了)就，会
collins.def: You use would to talk about something which happened regularly in the past but which no longer happens.

example.ex: Sunday mornings my mother would bake. I'd stand by the fridge and help...
example.tran: 星期天早晨，妈妈会烤面包，我就站在冰箱旁帮忙。

example.ex: 'Beauty is only skin deep,' my mother would say.
example.tran: “美是肤浅的。”妈妈会说。

collins.tran: (would have 与过去分词连用，表示某个时间前可能发生的事情)就，会
collins.def: You use would have with a past participle when you are saying what was likely to have happened by a particular time.

example.ex: Within ten weeks of the introduction, 34 million people would have been reached by our television commercials.
example.tran: 在推出10周之内，可能会有3,400万人看到我们的电视广告。

collins.tran: (would have 与过去分词连用，表示过去可能发生的事情的结果或影响)就，会
collins.def: You use would have with a past participle when you are referring to the result or effect of a possible event in the past.

example.ex: My daughter would have been 17 this week if she had lived...
example.tran: 我女儿要是还活着的话，这周就17岁了。

example.ex: If I had known how he felt, I would never have let him adopt those children...
example.tran: 我要是知道他的想法，我是决不会让他领养那些孩子的。

collins.def: If you say that someone would have liked or preferred something, you mean that they wanted to do it or have it but were unable to.

example.ex: I would have liked a life in politics...
example.tran: 我本想从政的。

example.ex: She would have liked to ask questions, but he had moved on to another topic...
example.tran: 她本想问问题，但他又继续谈另一个话题去了。

collins.tran: (通常用于否定句，批评某人所为，表示不满)（不）会
collins.def: You use would, usually in negative sentences, to criticize something that someone has done and to express your disapproval of it.

example.ex: I would never have done what they did.
example.tran: 他们做的事情我是决不会做的。

collins.def: If you say 'would that' something were the case, you are saying that you wish it were the case.

example.ex: Would that he could have listened to his father.
example.tran: 他要是听了他父亲的话就好了。

collins.def: When you write something on a surface, you use something such as a pen or pencil to produce words, letters, or numbers on the surface.

example.ex: If you'd like one, simply write your name and address on a postcard and send it to us...
example.tran: 如果你想要一个的话，只要把姓名、住址写在一张明信片上寄给我们就行。

example.ex: They were still trying to teach her to read and write...
example.tran: 他们还在试图教她读书写字。

collins.def: If you write something such as a book, a poem, or a piece of music, you create it and record it on paper or perhaps on a computer.

example.ex: I had written quite a lot of orchestral music in my student days...
example.tran: 我在学生时代创作过很多管弦乐作品。

example.ex: Finding a volunteer to write the computer program isn't a problem...
example.tran: 找个志愿者编这个计算机程序不成问题。

collins.tran: 写作，著述（通常以出版为目的）
collins.def: Someone who writes creates books, stories, or articles, usually for publication.

example.ex: Jay wanted to write...
example.tran: 杰伊想要写作。

example.ex: She writes for many papers, including the Sunday Times...
example.tran: 她给包括《星期日泰晤士报》在内的很多报纸撰稿。

collins.tran: 写(信);给…写信(美国英语亦可用 write someone)
collins.def: When you write to someone or write them a letter, you give them information, ask them something, or express your feelings in a letter. In American English, you can also write someone.

example.ex: Many people have written to me on this subject...
example.tran: 很多人给我写信探讨这个问题。

example.ex: She had written him a note a couple of weeks earlier...
example.tran: 她几周前给他写过一个便条。

collins.def: If someone writes that something is the case, they say it in a letter, book, or article.

example.ex: 'Some six months later,' Freud writes, 'Hans had got over his jealousy.'...
example.tran: “大约6个月后，”弗洛伊德写道，“汉斯克服了他的嫉妒心理。”

example.ex: A few days later he wrote that he had hopes of a staff job.
example.tran: 几天后，他写信说他有望得到一份行政工作。

collins.def: When someone writes something such as a cheque, receipt, or prescription, they put the necessary information on it and usually sign it.

example.ex: Snape wrote a receipt with a gold fountain pen...
example.tran: 斯内普用金笔开了一张收据。

example.ex: I'll write you a cheque in a moment.
example.tran: 我过会儿给你开张支票。

collins.def: If you write to a computer or a disk, you record data on it.

example.ex: You should write-protect all disks that you do not usually need to write to.
example.tran: 你应该对你通常不需要写入内容的磁盘进行写保护。

means: （用于表示对后说的话不相信）

collins.def: Yeah means yes.

example.ex: 'Bring us something to drink.' — 'Yeah, yeah.'
example.tran: “给我们拿点喝的。” ——“好的，好的。”

collins.def: A year is a period of twelve months or 365 or 366 days, beginning on the first of January and ending on the thirty-first of December.

example.ex: The year was 1840...
We had an election last year.
example.tran: 去年我们进行了一次选举。

collins.def: A year is any period of twelve months.

example.ex: The museums attract more than two and a half million visitors a year...
example.tran: 这些博物馆一年能吸引逾250万名参观者。

example.ex: She's  done quite a bit of work this past year...
example.tran: 过去的一年里她做了不少工作。

collins.def: Year is used to refer to the age of a person. For example, if someone or something is twenty years old or twenty years of age, they have lived or existed for twenty years.

example.ex: He's 58 years old...
example.tran: 他58岁。

example.ex: I've  been in trouble since I was eleven years of age...
example.tran: 我从11岁起就麻烦不断。

collins.tran: 学年（英国和美国的学年从9月开始）
collins.def: A school year or academic year is the period of time in each twelve months when schools or universities are open and students are studying there. In Britain and the United States, the school year starts in September.

example.ex: ...the 1990/91 academic year...
The twins didn't have to repeat their second year at school.
example.tran: 这对双胞胎不需要重读二年级。

collins.def: You can refer to someone who is, for example, in their first year at school or university as a first year.

example.ex: The first years and second years got a choice of French, German and Spanish.
example.tran: 一年级和二年级学生可以在法语、德语和西班牙语中选一门。

collins.def: A financial or business year is an exact period of twelve months which businesses or institutions use as a basis for organizing their finances.

example.ex: He announced big tax increases for the next two financial years...
example.tran: 他宣布在接下来的两个财年里将大幅提高税收。

example.ex: The company admits it will make a loss for the year ending September.
example.tran: 公司承认到9月本财年结束时将会出现亏损。

collins.def: You can use years to emphasize that you are referring to a long time.

example.ex: I haven' laughed so much in years...
example.tran: 我很久没这么畅快地笑过了。

example.ex: It took me years to fully recover...
example.tran: 我过了很久才完全康复。

collins.tran: （在某地或做某事的）年头，时期
collins.def: You can refer to the time you spend in a place or doing an activity as your years there or your years of doing that activity.

example.ex: The joy turned to tragedy during his years in Cyprus.
example.tran: 他在塞浦路斯的那段日子里，生活由喜转悲。

example.ex: ...his years as Director of the Manchester City Art Gallery.
example.tran: 他担任曼彻斯特城市艺术馆馆长的那些年

collins.def: If something happens year after year, it happens regularly every year.

example.ex: Regulars return year after year...
example.tran: 老主顾每年都会再来。

example.ex: You keep on amazing me, year after year, the same old ways.
example.tran: 你不断地给我同样的惊喜，年年如此。

collins.def: If something changes year by year, it changes gradually each year.

example.ex: This problem has increased year by year...
example.tran: 这个问题一年比一年严重。

example.ex: The department has been shrinking year by year because of budget cuts.
example.tran: 这个部门因为预算削减而逐年萎缩。

collins.def: If something happens year in ,year out, it happens every year without changing and is often boring.

example.ex: Year in, year out, nothing changes...
example.tran: 年复一年，一切照旧。

example.ex: With stockbroking it was the same thing, year in year out.
example.tran: 证券经纪工作每年都重复着一成不变的内容。

collins.tran: 他那样年纪的男子/她那样年纪的女子
collins.def: You can say a man of his years or a woman of her years to refer to that person's age in relation to something else you are talking about.

example.ex: He was moving with surprising speed for a man of his years...
example.tran: 他的行动速度对于他那个年纪的人来说很是惊人。

example.ex: A young man of his years needed to have a separate room.
example.tran: 他那个年纪的年轻人需要有个单独的房间。

collins.tran: （经历或衣着）使显得年老，使觉得老迈
collins.def: If you say that something such as an experience or a way of dressing has put years on someone, you mean that it has made them look or feel much older.

example.ex: I always turn adversity and defeat into victories, but it's probably put ten years on me.
example.tran: 我总是能够扭转逆境，反败为胜，但这可能让我显得老成了10岁。

collins.def: If you say something happens all year round or all the year round, it happens continually throughout the year.

example.ex: Town gardens are ideal because they produce flowers nearly all year round...
example.tran: 城市公园是理想去处，那里几乎一年四季鲜花盛开。

example.ex: Drinking and driving is a problem all the year round.
example.tran: 酒后驾车是个常年存在的问题。

collins.tran: （经历或衣着）使显得年轻，使觉得年轻
collins.def: If you say that something such as an experience or a way of dressing has taken years off someone, you mean that it has made them look or feel much younger.

example.ex: Changing your hairstyle can take ten years off you.
example.tran: 换换发型能让你年轻10岁。

collins.def: Something that is yellow is the colour of lemons, butter, or the middle part of an egg.

example.ex: The walls have been painted bright yellow...
example.tran: 墙壁漆成了亮黄色。

example.ex: Kim opted for cooler blues and yellows in the master bedroom.
example.tran: 金为主卧室挑选了偏冷色调的蓝色和黄色。

collins.def: If something yellows, it becomes yellow in colour, often because it is old.

example.ex: The flesh of his cheeks seemed to have yellowed...
example.tran: 他似乎有些面色发黄。

example.ex: She sat scanning the yellowing pages.
example.tran: 她坐着浏览发黄的书页。

means: （表示不相信某人所言）真的吗

collins.def: You use yes to give a positive response to a question.

example.ex: 'Are you a friend of Nick's?' — 'Yes.'...
example.tran: “你是尼克的朋友吗？”——“是的。”

example.ex: 'You actually wrote it down, didn't you?' — 'Yes.'...
example.tran: “你的确把它写下来了，对吗？”——“是的。”

collins.tran: （用于接受提议或请求，或表示许可）可以，好的
collins.def: You use yes to accept an offer or request, or to give permission.

example.ex: 'More wine?' — 'Yes please.'...
example.tran: “再来点酒？”——“好的。”

example.ex: 'Will you take me there?' — 'Yes, I will.'...
example.tran: “你可以带我去那儿吗？”——“可以。”

collins.tran: （用于告诉对方其所说的话正确）对，是的
collins.def: You use yes to tell someone that what they have said is correct.

example.ex: 'Well I suppose it is based on the old lunar months isn't it.' — 'Yes that's right.'...
example.tran: “噢，我想这是按照旧制阴历来算的，是吧？”——“对，是的。”

example.ex: 'That's a type of whitefly, is it?' — 'Yes, it is a whitefly.'
example.tran: “那是一种粉虱，对吗？”——“是的，是粉虱。”

collins.tran: （用于表示准备或愿意作出应答）什么事，来啦
collins.def: You use yes to show that you are ready or willing to speak to the person who wants to speak to you, for example when you are answering a telephone or a knock at your door.

example.ex: He pushed a button on the intercom. 'Yes?' came a voice...
example.tran: 他按了内部对讲机上的一个按钮。“有什么事吗？”一个声音问道。

example.ex: Yes, can I help you?
example.tran: 您好，我能为您效劳吗？

collins.tran: （用于表示同意、接受或理解前一讲话者的话）是这样，确实如此
collins.def: You use yes to indicate that you agree with, accept, or understand what the previous speaker has said.

example.ex: 'A lot of people find it very difficult indeed to give up smoking.' —'Oh yes. I used to smoke nearly sixty a day.'...
example.tran: “很多人觉得戒烟真的非常困难。”——“确实如此，我以前每天抽将近60根香烟。”

example.ex: 'It's a fabulous opportunity.' — 'Yeah. I know.'
example.tran: “这是一次非常棒的机会。”——“是，我知道。”

collins.tran: （用于鼓励某人继续讲）往下说，接着呢
collins.def: You use yes to encourage someone to continue speaking.

example.ex: 'I remembered something funny today.' — 'Yeah?'
example.tran: “我记得今天有件特别有趣的事。”——“什么事？”

collins.tran: （常接but，用于礼貌地引出与前一讲话者意见不同的话）
collins.def: You use yes, usually followed by 'but', as a polite way of introducing what you want to say when you disagree with something the previous speaker has just said.

example.ex: 'She is entitled to her personal allowance which is three thousand pounds of income.' — 'Yes, but she doesn't earn any money.'...
example.tran: “她享有的个人所得免税额是3,000英镑。”——“是的，但是她一分钱都不挣。”

example.ex: Ah yes, but think of all the family life they're missing.
example.tran: 是这样，不过别忘了他们错过了多少天伦之乐。

collins.tran: （用于表示前一讲话者的否定陈述或问题是错误的）不是，不对
collins.def: You use yes to say that a negative statement or question that the previous speaker has made is wrong or untrue.

example.ex: 'That is not possible,' she said. 'Oh, yes, it is!' Mrs Gruen insisted...
example.tran: “那不可能，”她说。“不，有可能！”格伦太太坚持道。

example.ex: 'I don't  know what you're talking about.' — 'Yes, you do.'
example.tran: “我不知道你在说什么。”——“不，你知道。”

collins.tran: （用于暗示不赞成或不同意前面讲话者的话，尤用于表示厌烦）真的吗，行啦
collins.def: You can use yes to suggest that you do not believe or agree with what the previous speaker has said, especially when you want to express your annoyance about it.

example.ex: 'There was no way to stop it.' — 'Oh yes? Well, here's something else you won't be able to stop.'
example.tran: “没法阻止它。”——“是吗？哼，那这还有些别的事也是你没法阻止的。”

collins.tran: （用于表示刚刚想起忘记的事情）对了
collins.def: You use yes to indicate that you had forgotten something and have just remembered it.

example.ex: What was I going to say. Oh yeah, we've finally got our second computer.
example.tran: 我刚想说什么来着。噢，对了，我们终于有了第二台电脑。

collins.tran: （用于强调并确认自己的陈述）对，一点没错
collins.def: You use yes to emphasize and confirm a statement that you are making.

example.ex: He collected the £10,000 first prize. Yes, £10,000.
example.tran: 他领取了1万英镑的头奖。对，是1万英镑。

collins.def: You say yes and no in reply to a question when you cannot give a definite answer, because in some ways the answer is yes and in other ways the answer is no.

example.ex: 'Was it strange for you, going back after such a long absence?' — 'Yes and no.'
example.tran: “那么长时间不在，然后又回来，你会觉得陌生吗？”——“既陌生又不陌生。”

collins.def: A yes is a person who has answered 'yes' to a question or who has voted in favour of something, or the answer or vote they have made.

example.ex: The no-votes are leading the yeses...
example.tran: 反对票领先于赞成票。

example.ex: The noes have 50 percent, the yeses 35 percent and the rest are undecided.
example.tran: 反对者占50%，赞成者占35%，其余人尚未决定。

collins.def: You use yesterday to refer to the day before today.

example.ex: She left yesterday...
example.tran: 她昨天走了。

example.ex: Yesterday she announced that she is quitting her job.
example.tran: 昨天她宣布打算辞职。

collins.tran: 过去；（尤指）不久前，近日，日前
collins.def: You can refer to the past, especially the recent past, as yesterday .

example.ex: The worker of today is different from the worker of yesterday.
example.tran: 如今的工人和以往的不同了。

example.ex: ...a world without yesterdays or tomorrows.
example.tran: 没有过去和未来的世界

collins.tran: （用于否定句中表示某事尚未发生但有可能发生，在疑问句中用来询问某事是否已发生。英国英语中，表示此义时通常不与一般过去时连用）尚（未），还，仍
collins.def: You use yet in negative statements to indicate that something has not happened up to the present time, although it probably will happen. You can also use yet in questions to ask if something has happened up to the present time. In British English the simple past tense is not normally used with this meaning of 'yet'.

example.ex: They haven't finished yet...
example.tran: 他们还没有完成。

example.ex: No decision has yet been made...
example.tran: 尚未作出决定。

collins.tran: （与谈论过去的否定句连用，表示当时并非如此）还，尚（未）
collins.def: You use yet with a negative statement when you are talking about the past, to report something that was not the case then, although it became the case later.

example.ex: There was so much that Sam didn't know yet...
example.tran: 还有很多是萨姆当时不知道的。

example.ex: He had asked around and learned that Billy was not yet here.
example.tran: 他四处询问，得知比利还没到这儿。

collins.tran: （用于否定句，表示某事以后会做但现在不该或不能做）还，尚
collins.def: If you say that something should not or cannot be done yet, you mean that it should not or cannot be done now, although it will have to be done at a later time.

example.ex: Don't get up yet...
example.tran: 先不要起床。

example.ex: The hostages cannot go home just yet...
example.tran: 人质目前还不能回家。

collins.tran: （用于最高级后，表示到目前为止最差或最好）迄今为止，到目前为止
collins.def: You use yet after a superlative to indicate, for example, that something is the worst or the best of its kind up to the present time.

example.ex: This is the BBC's worst idea yet...
example.tran: 这是到目前为止英国广播公司的最糟糕的点子。

example.ex: Her latest novel is her best yet.
example.tran: 她的最新小说是她迄今为止最好的一部。

collins.tran: （用于表示仍有可能）还是，仍然
collins.def: You can use yet to say that there is still a possibility that something will happen.

example.ex: Like the best stories, this one  may yet have a happy end...
example.tran: 就像最精彩的故事那样，这个故事也许仍会有个美好的结局。

example.ex: A negotiated settlement might yet be possible.
example.tran: 也许仍有可能通过磋商达成协议。

collins.tran: （用于表示一段时间的表达后，表示时间的延续）还要，还
collins.def: You can use yet after expressions which refer to a period of time, when you want to say how much longer a situation will continue for.

example.ex: Unemployment will go on rising for some time yet...
example.tran: 失业人数在一段时间内还将上升。

example.ex: Nothing will happen for a few years yet...
example.tran: 几年内还不会有什么事发生。

collins.tran: （表示从未做过某事，尤指惊人的事或坏事）还未，尚未
collins.def: If you say that you have yet to do something, you mean that you have never done it, especially when this is surprising or bad.

example.ex: She has yet to spend a Christmas with her husband...
example.tran: 她还从没和她的丈夫一起过过圣诞节。

example.ex: He has been nominated three times for the Oscar but has yet to win.
example.tran: 他已经3次获奥斯卡提名，但从未获奖。

collins.tran: （用于引出颇令人惊讶的事实）可是却，却又
collins.def: You can use yet to introduce a fact which is rather surprising after the previous fact you have just mentioned.

example.ex: I don't eat much, yet I am a size 16...
example.tran: 我吃得并不多，但是却穿16码的衣服。

example.ex: They were terrified James would die — yet there were moments when they almost wished he would...
example.tran: 他们很害怕詹姆斯会死——然而，有那么几个瞬间，他们几乎是希望他会死。

collins.tran: （用于强调，尤指相对于以前同类事物更为极端等）还要，甚至，更
collins.def: You can use yet to emphasize a word, especially when you are saying that something is surprising because it is more extreme than previous things of its kind, or a further case of them.

example.ex: Yet bigger satellites will be sent up into orbit...
example.tran: 更为大型的卫星将被送入轨道。

example.ex: I saw yet another doctor...
example.tran: 我又看了一个医生。

collins.tran: （用于否定句）迄今为止，目前为止
collins.def: You use as yet with negative statements to describe a situation that has existed up until the present time.

example.ex: As yet it is not known whether the crash was the result of an accident...
example.tran: 目前尚不清楚撞车是否是由事故引起的。

example.ex: We have not as yet received a response.
example.tran: 我们还未收到回复。

collins.tran: 你,您,你们（可用于名词前指定谈话对象）
collins.def: A speaker or writer uses you to refer to the person or people that they are talking or writing to. It is possible to use you before a noun to make it clear which group of people you are talking to.

example.ex: When I saw you across the room I knew I'd met you before...
example.tran: 看到你穿过房间时，我就知道我以前曾经见过你。

example.ex: You two seem very different to me...
example.tran: 你们两个似乎与我大不一样。

collins.tran: （用于口语和非正式书面语中表示泛指）你，任何人
collins.def: In spoken English and informal written English, you is sometimes used to refer to people in general.

example.ex: Getting good results gives you confidence...
example.tran: 取得好的结果会给人以信心。

example.ex: In those days you did what you were told.
example.tran: 那时候，你只能听命于人。

collins.tran: （某些方言中指两个或多个人时有时用yous代替you）你们
collins.def: In some dialects of English, yous is sometimes used instead of 'you' when talking to two or more people.

example.ex: 'Yous two are no 'gettin' paid,' he said. 'Ye're too lazy!'
example.tran: “你们两个别指望拿到工钱，”他说。“你们太懒了！”

collins.tran: 年幼的;幼小的;未成熟的
collins.def: A young person, animal, or plant has not lived or existed for very long and is not yet mature.

example.ex: In Scotland, young people can marry at 16...
example.tran: 在苏格兰，年轻人16岁就可以结婚。

example.ex: You weren't so very young when she died; you were old enough to remember.
example.tran: 她去世的时候你不算太年幼，已经能记事了。

collins.def: You use young to describe  a time when a person or thing was young.

example.ex: In her younger days my mother had been a successful fashionwear saleswoman.
example.tran: 我妈妈年轻时曾经是个成功的时装销售员。

collins.tran: （显得）年轻的;（显得）岁数不大的
collins.def: Someone who is young in appearance or behaviour looks or behaves as if they are young.

example.ex: I was twenty-three, I suppose, and young for my age...
example.tran: 我当时23岁，我想，看上去比实际年龄小。

example.ex: He seemed to me very young and very lonely.
example.tran: 我觉得他似乎非常年轻，非常孤独。

collins.def: The young of an animal are its babies.

example.ex: The hen may not be able to feed its young.
example.tran: 雌鸟可能无法给幼鸟喂食。

collins.def: A speaker or writer uses your to indicate that something belongs or relates to the person or people that they are talking or writing to.

example.ex: Emma, I trust your opinion a great deal...
example.tran: 埃玛，我非常相信你的看法。

example.ex: I left all of your messages on your desk...
example.tran: 我把所有给你的便条都放在你书桌上了。

collins.tran: （有时用于口语和非正式书面语中表示泛指）你的，任何人的
collins.def: In spoken English and informal written English, your is sometimes used to indicate that something belongs to or relates to people in general.

example.ex: Painkillers are very useful in small amounts to bring your temperature down...
example.tran: 小剂量的止痛药对于降低体温非常有用。

example.ex: I then realized how possible it was to overcome your limitations.
example.tran: 那时我才意识到，人克服自身局限的可能性到底有多大。

collins.tran: （口语中有时用于typical, normal等形容词前表示典型）
collins.def: In spoken English, a speaker sometimes uses your before an adjective such as 'typical' or 'normal' to indicate that the thing referred to is a typical example of its type.

example.ex: Stan Reilly is not really one of your typical Brighton Boys...
example.tran: 斯坦·赖利其实并不是那种典型的布赖顿男孩。

example.ex: It's just your average wooden door.
example.tran: 它就是那种平常的木门。

collins.def: Zero is the number 0.

example.ex: Visibility at the city's airport came down to zero, bringing air traffic to a standstill.
example.tran: 该市机场的能见度降为零，空中交通陷入了停顿。

example.ex: ...a scale ranging from zero to seven.
example.tran: 从0到7的范围

collins.def: Zero is a temperature of 0˚. It is freezing point on the Centigrade and Celsius scales, and 32˚  below freezing point on the Fahrenheit scale.

example.ex: It's a sunny late winter day, just a few degrees above zero...
example.tran: 那是晚冬阳光明媚的一天，温度只有零上几度。

example.ex: That night the mercury fell to thirty degrees below zero.
example.tran: 那天晚上温度计显示气温降到了零下30度。

collins.def: You can use zero to say that there is none at all of the thing mentioned.

example.ex: This new ministry was being created with zero assets and zero liabilities.
example.tran: 这个新部委正在筹建，既无资产也无负债。

example.ex: ...zero inflation...
example.tran: 零通货膨胀率
